hebrew_text: חֲמֵשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה נָשִׁים פּוֹטְרוֹת צָרוֹתֵיהֶן וְצָרוֹת צָרוֹתֵיהֶן מִן הַחֲלִיצָה וּמִן הַיִּיבּוּם עַד סוֹף הָעוֹלָם.
human_translation: Fifteen women exempt their rival wives and the rival wives of their rival wives from ḥalitza and from levirate marriage forever,
llm_translation: Fifteen women exempt their co-wives and the co-wives of their co-wives from halitzah and from yibbum until the end of the world.

hebrew_text: וְאֵלּוּ הֵן: בִּתּוֹ, וּבַת בִּתּוֹ, וּבַת בְּנוֹ, בַּת אִשְׁתּוֹ,
human_translation: And these are: The daughter And the daughter of daughter of or the daughter of his son, the daughter of wife.
llm_translation: And these are they: his daughter, and his granddaughter, and his great-granddaughter, the daughter of his wife,

hebrew_text: וּבַת בְּנָהּ, וּבַת בִּתָּהּ, חֲמוֹתוֹ, וְאֵם חֲמוֹתוֹ, וְאֵם חָמִיו,
human_translation: And the daughter of son or the daughter of daughter, or mother-in-law or his mother-in-law’s mother, or his father-in-law’s mother,
llm_translation: And daughter-in-law, and granddaughter, his mother-in-law, and mother-in-law of his mother-in-law, and mother of his father-in-law,

hebrew_text: אֲחוֹתוֹ מֵאִמּוֹ, וַאֲחוֹת אִמּוֹ, וַאֲחוֹת אִשְׁתּוֹ, וְאֵשֶׁת אָחִיו מֵאִמּוֹ,
human_translation: maternal sister or sister of his mother, or his wife’s sister, Or the wife of his maternal brother,
llm_translation: His sister from his mother, and the sister of his mother, and the sister of his wife, and the wife of his brother from his mother,

hebrew_text: וְאֵשֶׁת אָחִיו שֶׁלֹּא הָיָה בְּעוֹלָמוֹ, וְכַלָּתוֹ. הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ פּוֹטְרוֹת צָרוֹתֵיהֶן וְצָרוֹת צָרוֹתֵיהֶן מִן הַחֲלִיצָה וּמִן הַיִּיבּוּם עַד סוֹף הָעוֹלָם.
human_translation: And wife of a brother with whom he did not coexist, And his daughter-in-law, These exempt their rival wives and the rival wives of their rival wives from ḥalitza and levirate marriage forever.
llm_translation: And the wife of his brother who was not in his world, and his daughter-in-law. These exempt their co-wives and the co-wives of their co-wives from halitzah and from levirate marriage until the end of the world.

hebrew_text: וְכוּלָּן אִם מֵתוּ אוֹ מֵיאֲנוּ,
human_translation: And all of these if they died or they refused
llm_translation: And all of them, if they died or refused,

hebrew_text: אוֹ נִתְגָּרְשׁוּ אוֹ שֶׁנִּמְצְאוּ אַיְלוֹנִית — צָרוֹתֵיהֶן מוּתָּרוֹת.
human_translation: Or were divorced or were found to be a sexually underdeveloped woman [ aylonit ], their rival wives are permitted,
llm_translation: Or if they were divorced or if they were found to be Aylonit - their rival wives are permitted.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אַתָּה יָכוֹל לוֹמַר בַּחֲמוֹתוֹ וּבְאֵם חֲמוֹתוֹ וּבְאֵם חָמִיו שֶׁנִּמְצְאוּ אַיְלוֹנִית אוֹ שֶׁמֵּיאֲנוּ.
human_translation: And you cannot say with regard to his mother-in-law and with regard to his mother-in-law’s mother and with regard to his father-in-law’s mother that they were found to be an aylonit , Nor Or refused,
llm_translation: And if you cannot say regarding his mother-in-law, and his father-in-law, and his mother-in-law's mother, that they were found to be Ilonit or Samaritan.

hebrew_text: כֵּיצַד פּוֹטְרוֹת צָרוֹתֵיהֶן: הָיְתָה בִּתּוֹ אוֹ אַחַת מִכׇּל הָעֲרָיוֹת הָאֵלּוּ נְשׂוּאוֹת לְאָחִיו, וְלוֹ אִשָּׁה אַחֶרֶת, וָמֵת — כְּשֵׁם שֶׁבִּתּוֹ פְּטוּרָה, כָּךְ צָרָתָהּ פְּטוּרָה. הָלְכָה צָרַת בִּתּוֹ וְנִשֵּׂאת לְאָחִיו הַשֵּׁנִי, וְלוֹ אִשָּׁה אַחֶרֶת, וָמֵת — כְּשֵׁם שֶׁצָּרַת בִּתּוֹ פְּטוּרָה, כָּךְ צָרַת צָרָתָהּ פְּטוּרָה.
human_translation: How do exempt their rival wives? his daughter or any one of those with whom relations are forbidden was married to his brother and had another wife, and died, just as his daughter is exempt so too her rival wife is exempt. his daughter’s rival wife went and married his second brother, and he had another wife, and he died just as his daughter’s rival wife is exempt, so too the rival wife of her rival wife is exempt.
llm_translation: How are their co-wives exempted? If his daughter or one of all these cities were married to his brother, and he has another wife, and he dies - just as his daughter is exempt, so too her co-wife is exempt. The halacha is that if his daughter's co-wife is married to his second brother, and he has another wife, and he dies - just as his daughter's co-wife is exempt, so too her co-wife is exempt.

hebrew_text: אֲפִילּוּ הֵן מֵאָה.
human_translation: Even if they are one hundred
llm_translation: Even they are one hundred.

hebrew_text: כֵּיצַד אִם מֵתוּ צָרוֹתֵיהֶן מוּתָּרוֹת: הָיְתָה בִּתּוֹ אוֹ אַחַת מִכׇּל הָעֲרָיוֹת הָאֵלּוּ נְשׂוּאוֹת לְאָחִיו, וְלוֹ אִשָּׁה אַחֶרֶת, מֵתָה בִּתּוֹ אוֹ נִתְגָּרְשָׁה, וְאַחַר כָּךְ מֵת אָחִיו — צָרָתָהּ מוּתֶּרֶת.
human_translation: How so? if they died their rival wives are permitted? one’s daughter or any one of those with whom relations are forbidden was married to his brother, and had another wife, his daughter died or was divorced and afterward his brother died, her rival wife is permitted
llm_translation: How if their rivals died, they are permitted: If his daughter or one of all these cities married to his brother, and he has another wife, his daughter died or was divorced, and afterwards his brother died - his rival is permitted.

hebrew_text: וְכׇל הַיְּכוֹלָה לְמָאֵן וְלֹא מֵיאֲנָה — צָרָתָהּ חוֹלֶצֶת וְלֹא מִתְיַיבֶּמֶת.
human_translation: And any who could refuse she did not refuse, her rival wife performs ḥalitza and does not enter into levirate marriage.
llm_translation: And all who are able to refuse and do not refuse - her affliction departs and she does not perform levirate marriage.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מִכְּדִי כּוּלְּהוּ מֵאֲחוֹת אִשָּׁה יָלְפִינַן, לִיתְנֵי אֲחוֹת אִשָּׁה בְּרֵישָׁא!
human_translation: Now, all these is derived from a wife’s sister, let teach a wife’s sister first
llm_translation: Gemara: "G'ma mik'di kullehu me'achot isha yalfinan, litnei achot isha b'reisha!"

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא: תַּנָּא חוּמְרֵי חוּמְרֵי נָקֵט, וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן הִיא, דְּאָמַר שְׂרֵיפָה חֲמוּרָה.
human_translation: And if you would say the tanna cited severity, it is in accordance with Rabbi Shimon, who says burning is more severe
llm_translation: And if you will say: It was taught: severe stringencies were taken, and Rabbi Shimon is it, for he said burning is severe.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, לִיתְנֵי חֲמוֹתוֹ בְּרֵישָׁא, דְּעִיקַּר שְׂרֵיפָה בַּחֲמוֹתוֹ כְּתִיבָא! וְעוֹד: בָּתַר חֲמוֹתוֹ לִיתְנֵי כַּלָּתוֹ, דְּבָתַר שְׂרֵיפָה סְקִילָה חֲמוּרָה!
human_translation: If so, let him teach one’s mother-in-law first, as the main burning is written with regard to his mother-in-law, And furthermore, after his mother-in-law let him teach his daughter-in-law, as after burning, stoning is the most severe
llm_translation: If so, should it not have taught his mother-in-law first, for the primary burning is with his mother-in-law as it is written! And furthermore: after his mother-in-law, should it not have taught his daughter-in-law, for after burning comes severe stoning!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: בִּתּוֹ, כֵּיוָן דְּאָתְיָא מִדְּרָשָׁא, חַבִּיבָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rather, his daughter, since derived from a homiletical interpretation it is dear
llm_translation: Rather: his daughter, since she came from the study hall, he cherished her.

hebrew_text: כּוּלְּהוּ נָמֵי מִדְּרָשָׁא אָתוּ! נְהִי דִּלְעִנְיַן יִיבּוּם אָתְיָין מִדְּרָשָׁא — עִיקָּר אִיסּוּרַיְיהוּ בְּהֶדְיָא כְּתִיב בְּהוּ. בִּתּוֹ, עִיקָּר אִיסּוּרָא מִדְּרָשָׁא.
human_translation: All are also derived from a homiletical interpretation. Although the matter of levirate marriage is derived from a homiletical interpretation, the main of their prohibition is explicitly written. his daughter the main of prohibition is by homiletical interpretation,
llm_translation: All the students from the study hall came! Regarding the matter of yibum, they came from the study hall - the main prohibitions are written in them. His daughter, the main prohibition is from the study hall.

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר רָבָא: אֲמַר לִי רַב יִצְחָק בַּר אַבְדִּימִי: אָתְיָא ״הֵנָּה״ ״הֵנָּה״,
human_translation: As Rava said: Rav Yitzḥak bar Avdimi said to me: derived hena , hena
llm_translation: Rava said: Rav Yitzchak bar Avdimi said to me: "Hinei, hinei."

hebrew_text: אָתְיָא ״זִמָּה״ ״זִמָּה״.
human_translation: derived “wickedness” “wickedness”
llm_translation: It is taught: "Zimah" "Zimah."

hebrew_text: הַשְׁתָּא דְּאָמְרַתְּ כׇּל מִלְּתָא דְּאָתְיָא מִדְּרָשָׁא חַבִּיבָא לֵיהּ, לִיתְנֵי לַאֲחוֹת אִשָּׁה לְבַסּוֹף! אַיְּידֵי דְּאַיְירִי בְּאִיסּוּר אַחְווֹתָא, תְּנָא אֲחוֹת אִשְׁתּוֹ.
human_translation: Now that you said all matters that are derived from a homiletical interpretation are dear to let him teach a wife’s sister last, Since was dealing with the prohibition to sisters, he taught his wife’s sister.
llm_translation: The matter that you said, every matter that comes from the study is beloved to him, let him give to his wife's sister at the end! Since he is engaging in a forbidden relationship, a Mishna teaches: his wife's sister.

hebrew_text: וְלִיתְנְיֵיהּ לְהַאי בָּבָא לְבַסּוֹף! אֶלָּא: תַּנָּא קוּרְבֵי קוּרְבֵי נָקֵט: תְּנָא בִּתּוֹ וּבַת בִּתּוֹ וּבַת בְּנוֹ, דִּקְרוֹבֵי עַצְמוֹ,
human_translation: But let him teach this section at the end, Rather, The tanna cited closeness, taught one’s daughter, and the daughter of his daughter, and the daughter of his son, who are his own relatives.
llm_translation: And let him marry this father's daughter-in-law! Rather, it was taught: Close relatives of close relatives are excluded. It was taught: His daughter, and his daughter's daughter, and his son's daughter, as they are close relatives.

hebrew_text: וְאַיְּידֵי דִּתְנָא שְׁלֹשָׁה דּוֹרוֹת לְמַטָּה דִּידֵיהּ, תְּנָא נָמֵי שְׁלֹשָׁה דּוֹרוֹת לְמַטָּה דִּידַהּ. וְאַיְּידֵי דִּתְנָא שְׁלֹשָׁה דּוֹרוֹת לְמַטָּה דִּידַהּ, תְּנָא שְׁלֹשָׁה דּוֹרוֹת לְמַעְלָה דִּידַהּ.
human_translation: And since he taught three generations of one’s below, also taught three generations of below, And since he taught three generations of below, he taught three generations of her above,
llm_translation: And the reason that a Tanna taught three generations downwards from himself, another Tanna taught three generations downwards from himself. And the reason that a Tanna taught three generations downwards from himself, another Tanna taught three generations upwards from himself.

hebrew_text: וּתְנָא אֲחוֹתוֹ וַאֲחוֹת אִמּוֹ דִּקְרוֹבֵי עַצְמוֹ. וְאַיְּידֵי דְּאַיְירִי בְּאִיסּוּר אַחְוָה, תְּנָא אֲחוֹת אִשְׁתּוֹ. וּבְדִין הוּא דְּלַיקְדְּמַהּ לְכַלָּתוֹ מִקַּמֵּי אֵשֶׁת אָחִיו שֶׁלֹּא הָיָה בְּעוֹלָמוֹ, דְּלָא מִשּׁוּם קוּרְבָּא הוּא דַּאֲסִירָא. אֶלָּא, אַיְּידֵי דְּאַיְירִי בְּאִיסּוּר אַחְוָה, תְּנָא אֵשֶׁת אָחִיו שֶׁלֹּא הָיָה בְּעוֹלָמוֹ, וַהֲדַר תְּנָא כַּלָּתוֹ.
human_translation: And he taught his sister and his mother’s sister, who are his own relatives And since he was dealing with the prohibition to sisters, he taught his wife’s sister. And by right preceded his daughter-in-law before a wife of a brother with whom he did not coexist, as it is not due to their relationship that she is prohibited However, since he was dealing with the prohibition to siblings, he taught a wife of a brother with whom he did not coexist, And then taught his daughter-in-law.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "And it was taught: His sister and the sister of his mother are considered close relatives. And since it was stated in the context of the prohibition of marrying one's sister, it was taught: His sister is his wife. And this is the law regarding one who married his daughter-in-law before marrying the wife of his brother, who did not exist in his world, as it is not due to closeness that it is prohibited. Rather, since it was stated in the context of the prohibition of marrying one's sister, it was taught: The wife of his brother who did not exist in his world, and then it was taught his daughter-in-law."

hebrew_text: וּמַאי אִירְיָא דִּתְנָא ״פּוֹטְרוֹת״? לִיתְנֵי ״אוֹסְרוֹת״! אִי תְּנָא ״אוֹסְרוֹת״, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא אָסוּר לְיַיבֵּם, אֲבָל מִיחְלָץ — חָלְצָה, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: And why does specifically teach: They exempt Let him teach: They prohibit if taught: They prohibit I would say it is prohibited to enter into levirate marriage, but she must perform ḥalitza . it teaches us
llm_translation: And what is the reason that the Tanna teaches "Potrot"? Let him teach "Otsrot"! If he had taught "Otsrot," I would have said it is forbidden for yibum, but for chalitzah - she performs chalitzah, this is what is implied to us.

hebrew_text: וְלִיתְנֵי ״אֲסוּרָה לַחְלוֹץ״! מַאי קָעָבֵיד? אַלְּמָה לֹא, אִם אַתָּה אוֹמֵר ״חוֹלֶצֶת״, מִתְיַיבֶּמֶת!
human_translation: let him teach: She is prohibited from performing ḥalitza . what has he done? Why not? If you say she performs ḥalitza , she may enter into levirate marriage
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "And it should have taught 'it is forbidden to untie'! What is the reason? No, if you say 'untying,' it contradicts!"

hebrew_text: כֵּיוָן דְּבִמְקוֹם מִצְוָה הוּא דַּאֲסִירָה צָרָה, וְשֶׁלֹּא בִּמְקוֹם מִצְוָה שַׁרְיָא, מִשּׁוּם הָכִי תָּנֵי ״פּוֹטְרוֹת״.
human_translation: Since in cases where the mitzva applies that the rival wife is forbidden and where no mitzva applies she is permitted, due to that he taught: They exempt They prohibit
llm_translation: Since it is in a place of a commandment that it is prohibited, and not in a place that is permitted, therefore it teaches "potteries."

hebrew_text: וּמַאי אִירְיָא דְּתָנֵי ״מִן הַחֲלִיצָה וּמִן הַיִּיבּוּם״? לִיתְנֵי ״מִן הַיִּיבּוּם״ לְחוֹדֵיהּ! אִי תְּנָא ״מִן הַיִּיבּוּם״ הֲוָה אָמֵינָא מִיחְלָץ — חָלְצָה, יַבּוֹמֵי — לָא מְיַיבְּמָה, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן כׇּל הָעוֹלֶה לְיִיבּוּם — עוֹלֶה לַחֲלִיצָה, וְכֹל שֶׁאֵינוֹ עוֹלֶה לַיִּיבּוּם — אֵינוֹ עוֹלֶה לַחֲלִיצָה.
human_translation: And why does specifically teach: from ḥalitza and from levirate marriage? Let him teach: from levirate marriage, alone. If teach: From levirate marriage, I would say she must perform ḥalitza she must not enter into levirate marriage. teaches us every who is eligible for levirate marriage is eligible for ḥalitza , and anyone who is ineligible for levirate marriage is ineligible for ḥalitza ,
llm_translation: And what is the meaning of the teaching "from halitzah and from yibum"? It should have taught "from yibum" by itself! If a teaching were to say "from yibum," I would have thought: she performs halitzah, the yavam does not perform yibum. It teaches us: anyone who is eligible for yibum is also eligible for halitzah, and anyone who is not eligible for yibum is not eligible for halitzah.

hebrew_text: וְלִיתְנֵי ״מִן הַיִּיבּוּם וּמִן הַחֲלִיצָה״, אִי נָמֵי ״מִן הַחֲלִיצָה״ לְחוֹדַהּ? אַבָּא שָׁאוּל הִיא, דְּאָמַר: מִצְוֹת חֲלִיצָה קוֹדֶמֶת לְמִצְוֹת יַיבּוּם.
human_translation: And let him teach: From levirate marriage and from ḥalitza , Alternatively, From ḥalitza , alone, This is Abba Shaul, who said: The mitzva of ḥalitza takes precedence over the mitzva of levirate marriage,
llm_translation: And it should have taught "from yibum and from chalitzah," if it specifically taught "from chalitzah" for its own purpose? It is Abba Shaul who said: The commandments of chalitzah take precedence over the commandments of yibum.

hebrew_text: מִנְיָנָא דְּרֵישָׁא לְמַעוֹטֵי מַאי, וּמִנְיָנָא דְּסֵיפָא לְמַעוֹטֵי מַאי?
human_translation: The enumeration of the first clause to exclude what? And the enumeration of the latter clause, to exclude what?
llm_translation: The count of the beginning for what, and the count of the end for what?

hebrew_text: לְמַעוֹטֵי דְּרַב וּדְרַב אַסִּי. לְרַב וּלְרַב אַסִּי לְמַעוֹטֵי מַאי?
human_translation: to exclude of Rav and of Rav Asi. And according to Rav and according to Rav Asi, to exclude what?
llm_translation: For the exclusions of Rav and Rav Assi. For Rav and for Rav Assi, for the exclusions what?

hebrew_text: אִי סְבִירָא לְהוּ דַּהֲדָדֵי — חֲדָא לְמַעוֹטֵי צָרַת מְמָאֶנֶת, וַחֲדָא לְמַעוֹטֵי צָרַת מַחֲזִיר גְּרוּשָׁתוֹ.
human_translation: If each maintains of the other, one to exclude the rival wife of a wife who performed refusal. And one comes to exclude the rival wife of one who remarries his divorcée,
llm_translation: If one thinks that they are equal - one for the purpose of avoiding marital strife, and one for the purpose of returning his divorced wife.

hebrew_text: וְאִי לָא סְבִירָא לְהוּ דַּהֲדָדֵי — חֲדָא לְמַעוֹטֵי דְּחַבְרֵיהּ, וַחֲדָא לְמַעוֹטֵי אוֹ צָרַת מְמָאֶנֶת, אוֹ צָרַת מַחֲזִיר גְּרוּשָׁתוֹ.
human_translation: And if do not maintain of the other, one to exclude of the other, and one to exclude either the rival wife of who performed refusal or the rival wife of one who remarries his divorcée.
llm_translation: If it is not reasonable for them to agree with each other - one for the sake of his friends, and one for the sake of a wife who refuses, or a wife who causes his divorce.

hebrew_text: לְרַב וּלְרַב אַסִּי, לִיתְנִינְהוּ?
human_translation: according to Rav and according to Rav Asi, let teach these
llm_translation: To Rav and to Rav Assi, should we teach them?

hebrew_text: לְפִי שֶׁאֵינָהּ בְּצָרַת צָרָה.
human_translation: because they do not of a rival wife of a rival wife.
llm_translation: According to that which it is not in a time of distress.

hebrew_text: מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי — דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״אִשָּׁה אֶל אֲחוֹתָהּ לֹא תִקָּח לִצְרוֹר לְגַלּוֹת עֶרְוָתָהּ עָלֶיהָ בְּחַיֶּיהָ״. ״עָלֶיהָ״, מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר?
human_translation: From where are these matters, as the Sages taught “And you shall not take a woman to her sister, to be a rival to her, to uncover her nakedness, with her in her lifetime” What the verse states “With her”?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Mena hanei milei - d'tanu rabanan: 'Isha el achotah lo tikach litzror legalot ervatah aleha bechayeha'. 'Aleha', mah talmud lomar?" English translation: "From where are these matters? - For the Rabbis taught: 'A woman to her sister you shall not take, to expose her nakedness upon her during her lifetime.' 'Upon her', what is the teaching to say?"

hebrew_text: לְפִי שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״יְבָמָהּ יָבֹא עָלֶיהָ״, שׁוֹמֵעַ אֲנִי אֲפִילּוּ בְּאַחַת מִכׇּל עֲרָיוֹת הָאֲמוּרוֹת בַּתּוֹרָה הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר, נֶאֱמַר כָּאן ״עָלֶיהָ״ וְנֶאֱמַר לְהַלָּן ״עָלֶיהָ״,
human_translation: Since it is stated “Her brother-in-law will have intercourse with her” I derive the verse speaks of even any one of those with whom relations are forbidden, mentioned in the Torah. It is stated here, “With her,” and it is stated there, “With her.”
llm_translation: According to what is stated: "Her yavam shall come upon her," I hear that even with one of all the forbidden relationships mentioned in the Torah that it speaks of, it is stated here "upon her" and it is stated there "upon her,"

hebrew_text: מָה לְהַלָּן בִּמְקוֹם מִצְוָה, אַף כָּאן בִּמְקוֹם מִצְוָה, וְאָמַר רַחֲמָנָא: ״לֹא תִקָּח״.
human_translation: Just as there, the performance of a mitzva, so too, here, the performance of a mitzva, and the Merciful One states “You shall not take.”
llm_translation: What is there, in a place of commandment, so too here, in a place of commandment, and the Merciful One said: "You shall not take."

hebrew_text: וְאֵין לִי אֶלָּא הִיא, צָרָתָהּ מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״לִצְרוֹר״. וְאֵין לִי אֶלָּא צָרָתָהּ, צָרַת צָרָתָהּ מִנַּיִין? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״לִצְרוֹר״, וְלֹא ״לָצוֹר״.
human_translation: And I have only she, from where her rival wife The verse states: “To be a rival And I have only her rival wife; from where the rival wife of her rival wife The verse states: “To be a rival [ litzror ],” and not latzor ;
llm_translation: "And I have nothing except it, where is its affliction from? Scripture says: 'to bind.' And I have nothing except its affliction, where is the affliction of its affliction from? Scripture says: 'to bind,' and not 'to form.'"

hebrew_text: וְאֵין לִי אֶלָּא אֲחוֹת אִשָּׁה, שְׁאָר עֲרָיוֹת מִנַּיִין? אָמַרְתָּ: מָה אֲחוֹת אִשָּׁה מְיוּחֶדֶת — שֶׁהִיא עֶרְוָה, וְחַיָּיבִין עַל זְדוֹנָהּ כָּרֵת וְעַל שִׁגְגָתָהּ חַטָּאת, וַאֲסוּרָה לַיָּבָם; אַף כֹּל שֶׁהִיא עֶרְוָה, וְחַיָּיבִין עַל זְדוֹנָהּ כָּרֵת וְעַל שִׁגְגָתָהּ חַטָּאת — אֲסוּרָה לַיָּבָם.
human_translation: And I have only a wife’s sister. From where the other with whom relations are forbidden? You say Just as a wife’s sister is specific that she is a forbidden relative, and for whose intentional one is liable to karet , and for whose unwitting a sin-offering, and prohibited to the yavam so too, all with whom relations are forbidden for whose intentional one is liable to karet and for whose unwitting a sin-offering, prohibited to the yavam
llm_translation: "And I have only a sister of a woman, how about other forbidden relationships? You said: What is a sister of a woman that is unique - that she is forbidden, and one is liable for intentional relations with her to receive karet, and for unintentional relations with her to bring a sin offering, and she is forbidden to the levir; so too, any forbidden relationship that is forbidden, one is liable for intentional relations with her to receive karet, and for unintentional relations with her to bring a sin offering - she is forbidden to the levir."

hebrew_text: וְאֵין לִי אֶלָּא הֵן, צָרוֹתֵיהֶן מִנַּיִין? אָמַרְתָּ: מָה אֲחוֹת אִשָּׁה מְיוּחֶדֶת — שֶׁהִיא עֶרְוָה וְחַיָּיבִין עַל זְדוֹנָהּ כָּרֵת וְעַל שִׁגְגָתָהּ חַטָּאת, וַאֲסוּרָה לַיָּבָם, וְצָרָתָהּ אֲסוּרָה; אַף כֹּל שֶׁהִיא עֶרְוָה, וְחַיָּיבִין עַל זְדוֹנָהּ כָּרֵת וְעַל שִׁגְגָתָהּ חַטָּאת, וַאֲסוּרָה לַיָּבָם — צָרָתָהּ אֲסוּרָה. מִכָּאן אָמְרוּ חֲכָמִים: חֲמֵשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה נָשִׁים פּוֹטְרוֹת צָרוֹתֵיהֶן וְצָרוֹת צָרוֹתֵיהֶן מִן הַחֲלִיצָה וּמִן הַיִּיבּוּם עַד סוֹף הָעוֹלָם.
human_translation: And I have only those from where their rival wives You say Just as a wife’s sister is specific that she is a forbidden relative and for whose intentional one is liable to karet , and for whose unwitting a sin-offering, prohibited to the yavam and her rival wife is prohibited; so too, any with whom relations are forbidden and for whose intentional one is liable to karet , and for whose unwitting a sin-offering, and who is forbidden to the yavam , her rival wife is forbidden. From here the Sages stated fifteen women exempt their rival wives and the rival wives of their rival wives from ḥalitza and from levirate marriage forever.
llm_translation: "And I have only 'hen,' their troubles from where? You said: What is the sister of a woman who is married - that she is forbidden, and one is liable for her intentional sin to receive karet, and for her unintentional sin to bring a sin offering, and she is forbidden to the yavam, and her rival is forbidden; so too, any woman who is forbidden, and one is liable for her intentional sin to receive karet, and for her unintentional sin to bring a sin offering, and she is forbidden to the yavam - her rival is forbidden. From here the sages said: Fifteen women exempt their rivals and the rivals of their rivals from halitzah and from yibum until the end of the world."

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל שֶׁאֲנִי מְרַבֶּה אַף שֵׁשׁ עֲרָיוֹת חֲמוּרוֹת מֵאֵלּוּ, שֶׁיְּהוּ צָרוֹתֵיהֶם אֲסוּרוֹת?
human_translation: might that I include even the six with whom relations are forbidden that are more severe than these, that their rival wives should be prohibited
llm_translation: I am able to increase even six severe forbidden relationships from these, that their co-wives are forbidden?

hebrew_text: אָמַרְתָּ: מָה אֲחוֹת אִשְׁתּוֹ מְיוּחֶדֶת שֶׁהִיא עֶרְוָה, וְחַיָּיבִין עַל זְדוֹנָהּ כָּרֵת וְעַל שִׁגְגָתָהּ חַטָּאת, וְאֶפְשָׁר לִינָּשֵׂא לָאַחִים, וַאֲסוּרָה לַיָּבָם, וְצָרָתָהּ אֲסוּרָה; אַף כֹּל שֶׁהִיא עֶרְוָה, וְחַיָּיבִין עַל זְדוֹנָהּ כָּרֵת וְעַל שִׁגְגָתָהּ חַטָּאת, וְאֶפְשָׁר לִינָּשֵׂא לָאַחִים, וַאֲסוּרָה לַיָּבָם — צָרָתָהּ אֲסוּרָה.
human_translation: you say: Just as a wife’s sister is specific that she is a forbidden relative and for whose intentional one is liable to karet and for whose unwitting a sin-offering, and permitted to marry brothers but prohibited to the yavam and her rival wife is prohibited so too, any with whom relations are forbidden and for whose intentional one is liable to karet and for whose unwitting a sin-offering, and permitted to marry brothers but prohibited to the yavam her rival wife is prohibited
llm_translation: You said: What sister of his wife is forbidden, and one is liable for intentional relations with her to receive the punishment of excision, and for unintentional relations with her to bring a sin-offering, and it is possible for her to be married to brothers, and she is forbidden to the levir, and her rival is forbidden; likewise, all who are forbidden, and one is liable for intentional relations with her to receive the punishment of excision, and for unintentional relations with her to bring a sin-offering, and it is possible for her to be married to brothers, and she is forbidden to the levir — her rival is forbidden.

hebrew_text: יָצְאוּ שֵׁשׁ עֲרָיוֹת חֲמוּרוֹת מֵאֵלּוּ, הוֹאִיל דְּאִי אֶפְשָׁר לִינָּשֵׂא לָאַחִים — צָרוֹתֵיהֶן מוּתָּרוֹת, שֶׁאֵין צָרָה אֶלָּא מֵאָח.
human_translation: This excludes six with whom relations are forbidden a more severe than those, since they may not marry the brothers, their rival wives are permitted, as a rival wife applies only to the brother.
llm_translation: Six cities of refuge are exempt from the laws of ritual impurity, since it is possible for them to marry their brothers - their afflictions are permitted, for affliction only comes from a brother.

hebrew_text: אַזְהָרָה שָׁמַעְנוּ, עוֹנֶשׁ מִנַּיִין? אָמַר קְרָא: ״כִּי כׇּל (אִישׁ) אֲשֶׁר יַעֲשֶׂה מִכֹּל הַתּוֹעֵבוֹת וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: We have learned the warning From where the punishment The verse states: “For whoever shall do any abominations,
llm_translation: Warning, we have heard, punishment from where? Scripture says: "For every (man) who does any of all the abominations, etc."

hebrew_text: טַעְמָא דִּכְתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״עָלֶיהָ״, הָא לָאו הָכִי, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא אֲחוֹת אִשָּׁה מִיַּיבְּמָה, מַאי טַעְמָא? דְּאָמְרִינַן: אָתֵי עֲשֵׂה וְדָחֵי לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה?!
human_translation: The reason that the Merciful One writes “with her,” if that was not so, I would say a wife’s sister enters into levirate marriage What is the reason as we say, a positive comes and overrides a prohibition.
llm_translation: Reason of the Merciful One wrote "on her," this is not so, I would have said the sister of a woman from yibum, what is the reason? As we say: "He shall come to do and push away not to do?!"

hebrew_text: אֵימַר דְּאָמְרִינַן אָתֵי עֲשֵׂה וְדָחֵי לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה — לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה גְּרֵידָא, לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ כָּרֵת מִי דָּחֵי? וְתוּ: לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה גְּרֵידָא מְנָלַן דְּדָחֵי —
human_translation: say that we said a positive comes and overrides a prohibition a prohibition alone. a prohibition that includes karet , does override And furthermore, a prohibition alone, from where do we that overrides
llm_translation: Saying that we say, "Come and do and push away, do not do" - do not do a negative commandment, do not do that which has the punishment of excision, who pushes it away? And where do we derive that it pushes it away?

hebrew_text: דִּכְתִיב: ״לֹא תִלְבַּשׁ שַׁעַטְנֵז״, ״גְּדִלִים תַּעֲשֶׂה לָּךְ״.
human_translation: As it is written: “You shall not wear diverse kinds You shall make for yourself twisted fringes
llm_translation: It is written: "Do not wear sha'atnez," "You shall make tassels for yourself."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: סְמוּכִים מִן הַתּוֹרָה מִנַּיִן, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״סְמוּכִים לָעַד לְעוֹלָם עֲשׂוּיִם בֶּאֱמֶת וְיָשָׁר״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Elazar said: From where juxtaposition As it is stated: Juxtaposed forever and ever, made in truth and uprightness”
llm_translation: And Rabbi Elazar said: "Derived from the Torah, how do we know the concept of 's'muchim'? As it is stated: 'S'muchim for eternity, made in truth and uprightness.'"

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה: מִנַּיִן לִיבָמָה שֶׁנָּפְלָה לִפְנֵי מוּכֵּה שְׁחִין שֶׁאֵין חוֹסְמִין אוֹתָהּ — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לֹא תַחְסוֹם שׁוֹר בְּדִישׁוֹ״, וּסְמִיךְ לֵיהּ: ״כִּי יֵשְׁבוּ אַחִים יַחְדָּיו״.
human_translation: And Rav Sheshet said Rabbi Elazar said in the name of Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya: From where to a yevama who came before afflicted with boils that one may not muzzle her, As it is stated: “You shall not muzzle an ox while it treads out the corn” and, juxtaposed to it, “If brothers dwell together”
llm_translation: And Rav Sheshet said, Rabbi Elazar said in the name of Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah: From where do we derive the halacha concerning a yevamah who fell before a leper who cannot be healed? - Because it is stated: "You shall not muzzle an ox while it is threshing," and it is juxtaposed with: "When brothers dwell together."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: אֲפִילּוּ לְמַאן דְּלָא דָּרֵישׁ סְמוּכִים בְּעָלְמָא, בְּמִשְׁנֵה תוֹרָה דָּרֵישׁ. דְּהָא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בְּעָלְמָא לָא דָּרֵישׁ, וּבְמִשְׁנֵה תוֹרָה דָּרֵישׁ.
human_translation: And Rav Yosef said: Even according to the one who does not generally derive homiletic interpretations from juxtaposed derive from Deuteronomy, as Rabbi Yehuda does not generally derive homiletic interpretations and he does derive from Deuteronomy.
llm_translation: And Rav Yosef said: Even according to one who does not expound on adjacent verses in general, he expounds in the Mishnah. For Rabbi Yehuda does not expound in general, but he expounds in the Mishnah.

hebrew_text: וּבְעָלְמָא מְנָלַן דְּלָא דָּרֵישׁ? דְּתַנְיָא: בֶּן עַזַּאי אוֹמֵר, נֶאֱמַר: ״מְכַשֵּׁפָה לֹא תְחַיֶּה״, וְנֶאֱמַר: ״כׇּל שׁוֹכֵב עִם בְּהֵמָה מוֹת יוּמָת״, סְמָכוֹ עִנְיָן לוֹ: מָה שׁוֹכֵב עִם בְּהֵמָה בִּסְקִילָה — אַף מְכַשֵּׁפָה בִּסְקִילָה.
human_translation: And from where do we generally does not derive homiletic interpretations As it is taught ben Azzai says it is stated: “You shall not allow a sorceress to live” and it is stated: “Whoever lies with a beast shall surely be put to death” juxtaposed this matter to that Just as one who lies with a beast by stoning so too, a sorceress by stoning.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And in the world, from where do we derive that one should not seek? For it was taught: Ben Azzai says, it is stated: "You shall not allow a sorceress to live," and it is stated: "Whoever lies with an animal shall surely be put to death." He juxtaposed the matter: just as one who lies with an animal is punished by stoning — so too, a sorceress is punished by stoning.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: וְכִי מִפְּנֵי שֶׁסְּמָכוֹ עִנְיָן לוֹ, נוֹצִיא זֶה לִסְקִילָה?
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda said to And due to that juxtaposed this matter to that shall we take this out to be stoned?
llm_translation: He said to him Rabbi Yehuda: And because he relied on this matter, shall we bring him out for stoning?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: אוֹב וְיִדְּעוֹנִי בִּכְלַל מְכַשְּׁפִים הָיוּ, וְלָמָּה יָצְאוּ? לְהַקִּישׁ לָהֶם וְלוֹמַר לָךְ: מָה אוֹב וְיִדְּעוֹנִי בִּסְקִילָה — אַף מְכַשֵּׁפָה בִּסְקִילָה.
human_translation: Rather, Mediums and wizards were included among all sorcerers. And why were they singled out draw an analogy to them and say to you: Just as a medium and a wizard by stoning, so too, a sorceress by stoning.
llm_translation: Rather: Ov and Yid'oni are included in the category of sorcerers, and why did they go out? To juxtapose them and to say to you: Just as Ov and Yid'oni are punished by stoning — so too a sorceress is punished by stoning.

hebrew_text: וּבְמִשְׁנֵה תוֹרָה מְנָלַן דְּדָרֵישׁ? דִּתְנַן: נוֹשֵׂא אָדָם אֲנוּסַת אָבִיו וּמְפוּתַּת אָבִיו, אֲנוּסַת בְּנוֹ וּמְפוּתַּת בְּנוֹ. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹסֵר בַּאֲנוּסַת אָבִיו וּמְפוּתַּת אָבִיו.
human_translation: And from where do we that does derive in Deuteronomy? As we learned A person may wed raped by his father and seduced by his father, raped by his and seduced by his son. And Rabbi Yehuda prohibits a woman raped by his father and a woman seduced by his father.
llm_translation: In the Mishnah, from where do we derive that one must expound? For it was taught: A person may marry the wife of his father who was violated and the wife of his father who was seduced, the daughter of his son who was violated and the daughter of his son who was seduced. Rabbi Yehuda prohibits marrying the wife of his father who was violated and the wife of his father who was seduced.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב גִּידֵּל אָמַר רַב: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״לֹא יִקַּח אִישׁ אֶת אֵשֶׁת אָבִיו וְלֹא יְגַלֶּה כְּנַף אָבִיו״, כָּנָף שֶׁרָאָה אָבִיו — לֹא יְגַלֶּה.
human_translation: And Rav Giddel said Rav said: What is the reason for Rabbi Yehuda’s As it is written: “A man shall not take his father’s wife, and shall not uncover his father’s skirt” a skirt that has been seen by his father, may not be uncovered
llm_translation: And Rav Giddel said in the name of Rav: What is the reason for Rabbi Yehuda's opinion, as it is written: "A man shall not take his father's wife and shall not uncover his father's wing," the wing that his father saw - he shall not uncover.

hebrew_text: וּמִמַּאי דְּבַאֲנוּסָה כְּתִיב — מֵעִילָּוֵיהּ דִּקְרָא, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְנָתַן הָאִישׁ הַשּׁוֹכֵב עִמָּהּ לַאֲבִי הַנַּעֲרָה חֲמִשִּׁים כָּסֶף״, וּסְמִיךְ לֵיהּ: ״לֹא יִקַּח אִישׁ וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: And from where that is written with regard to a woman raped by his father? from the previous as it is written: “And the man who lay with her must give the maiden’s father fifty shekels of silver” and juxtaposed to it “A man shall not take his father’s wife
llm_translation: From where is it derived that in a case of rape it is written — from the garment of the Scripture, as it is written: "And the man who lies with her shall give to the father of the young woman fifty silver shekels," and adjacent to it: "A man shall not take..."

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן: אִי הֲוָה סְמִיךְ לֵיהּ, כִּדְקָאָמְרַתְּ. הַשְׁתָּא דְּלָא סְמִיךְ לֵיהּ (דִּכְתִיב ״לֹא יִקַּח אִישׁ אֶת אֵשֶׁת אָבִיו״ בֵּנְתַיִם) —
human_translation: And the Rabbis, If juxtaposed, as you said. now it is not juxtaposed, as it is written: “A man shall not take his father’s wife,” in between
llm_translation: The sages said: If it was adjacent to it, as you said. Now, when it is not adjacent to it (for it is written, "A man shall not take his father's wife" - two cases) —

hebrew_text: בְּשׁוֹמֶרֶת יָבָם הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר, וְלַעֲבוֹר עָלָיו בִּשְׁנֵי לָאוִין.
human_translation: verse is speaking of a woman waiting for her yavam , he violates two prohibitions.
llm_translation: In the matter of the levirate wife, the Scripture speaks, and to transgress upon it with two prohibitions.

hebrew_text: וּבְמִשְׁנֵה תוֹרָה מַאי טַעְמָא דְּדָרֵישׁ? אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא — מִשּׁוּם דְּמוֹכַח, וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא — מִשּׁוּם דְּמוּפְנֵי.
human_translation: But what is the reason that he derives in Deuteronomy? If you wish, say because is evident and if you wish, say because free
llm_translation: In the Mishnah, what is the reason for expounding? If you wish, say it is because it is logical, and if you wish, say it is because it is turned.

hebrew_text: אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא מִשּׁוּם דְּמוֹכַח — דְּאִם כֵּן לִכְתְּבֵיהּ רַחֲמָנָא גַּבֵּי עֲרָיוֹת. וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא מִשּׁוּם דְּמוּפְנֵי — דְּאִם כֵּן לִכְתּוֹב רַחֲמָנָא: ״לֹא יִקַּח אִישׁ אֶת אֵשֶׁת אָבִיו״, ״לֹא יְגַלֶּה כְּנַף אָבִיו״ לְמָה לִי?
human_translation: If you wish, say because is evident; as, if so let the Merciful One write alongside with whom relations are forbidden, And if you wish, say because free, as, if so let the Merciful One write “A man shall not take his father’s wife.” Why do I “And shall not uncover his father’s skirt”?
llm_translation: If you will say, because it is logical - that if so, the Merciful One should have written it regarding forbidden relationships. And if you will say, because it is a repetition - that if so, the Merciful One should have written: "A man shall not take his father's wife," "He shall not uncover his father's nakedness," why do I need them?

hebrew_text: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ לְאַפְנוֹיֵי. וְגַבֵּי צִיצִית נָמֵי, אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא — מִשּׁוּם דְּמוֹכַח, וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא — מִשּׁוּם דְּמוּפְנֶה.
human_translation: Learn from this that free And with regard to ritual fringes as well, If you wish, say because is evident and if you wish, say because free
llm_translation: Listen, infer from it for the sake of clarification. And regarding the tzitzit, it was asked: I might say — because it is proven, and I might say — because it is turned away.

hebrew_text: אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא מִשּׁוּם דְּמוֹכַח — דְּאִם כֵּן לִכְתְּבֵיהּ רַחֲמָנָא גַּבֵּי פָּרָשַׁת צִיצִית, לְמַאי הִלְכְתָא כַּתְבֵיהּ הָכָא? וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא מִשּׁוּם דְּמוּפְנֶה — מִכְּדִי כְּתַב: ״וּבֶגֶד כִּלְאַיִם שַׁעַטְנֵז לֹא יַעֲלֶה עָלֶיךָ״, ״לֹא תִלְבַּשׁ שַׁעַטְנֵז״ לְמָה לִי? שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ לְאַפְנוֹיֵי.
human_translation: If you wish, say because is evident; as, if so let the Merciful One write by the portion of ritual fringes to what halakha write it here? And if you wish, say because free, since written: “Neither shall there come upon you a garment of diverse kinds mingled together” Why, do I “You shall not wear diverse kinds, Learn from this that free
llm_translation: If you ask, say it is because it is logical - for if so, why did the Merciful One write it regarding the laws of tzitzit, what is the halacha that He wrote here? And if you ask, say it is because it is turned away - since it is written: "A garment of a mixture of wool and linen shall not come upon you," "Do not wear a garment of a mixture of wool and linen," why do I need it? Learn from it for exclusion.

hebrew_text: הָנֵי מִצְרָךְ צְרִיכִי, דְּאִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״לֹא יַעֲלֶה עָלֶיךָ״, הָוֵה אָמֵינָא: כׇּל דֶּרֶךְ הַעֲלָאָה אֲסַר רַחֲמָנָא, וַאֲפִילּוּ מוֹכְרֵי כְסוּת, כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״לֹא תִלְבַּשׁ שַׁעַטְנֵז״, דּוּמְיָא דִלְבִישָׁה, דְּאִית בֵּיהּ הֲנָאָה.
human_translation: these are necessary, as, had the Merciful One written “Neither shall there come upon you,” I would say the Merciful One prohibits every manner by comes upon and even sellers of coverings, the Merciful One writes: “You shall not wear diverse kinds,” similar to wearing, which provides benefit
llm_translation: These are the garments that require tzitzit, for if the Merciful One had written "it shall not come upon you," I would have said: any garment that is worn is prohibited by the Merciful One, even sellers of fine linen garments, for the Merciful One wrote "you shall not wear sha'atnez," which is similar to wearing, as it contains benefit.

hebrew_text: וְאִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״לֹא תִלְבַּשׁ״, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: דַּוְקָא לְבִישָׁה, דִּנְפִישׁ הֲנָיָיתַהּ, אֲבָל הַעֲלָאָה — לָא, כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״לֹא יַעֲלֶה עָלֶיךָ״.
human_translation: And had the Merciful One written “You shall not wear,” I would say specifically wearing, which significant benefit, but placing not the Merciful One writes: “Neither shall there come upon you.”
llm_translation: If the Merciful One wrote "do not wear," I would say: specifically wearing, that is where the prohibition applies, but lifting up - no, the Merciful One wrote "do not come upon you."

hebrew_text: אִם כֵּן, לִכְתּוֹב רַחֲמָנָא ״לֹא תִלְבַּשׁ שַׁעַטְנֵז״, ״צֶמֶר וּפִשְׁתִּים״ לְמָה לִי?
human_translation: if so, let the Merciful One write “You shall not wear diverse kinds.” Why do I “wool and linen”?
llm_translation: If so, to write the Merciful One "Do not wear sha'atnez," "wool and linen" why do I need?

hebrew_text: מִכְּדִי כְּתַב ״וּבֶגֶד כִּלְאַיִם שַׁעַטְנֵז לֹא יַעֲלֶה עָלֶיךָ״, וְתָנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: הוֹאִיל וְנֶאֶמְרוּ בַּתּוֹרָה סְתָם ״בְּגָדִים״, וּפָרַט לְךָ הַכָּתוּב בְּאֶחָד מֵהֶן צֶמֶר וּפִשְׁתִּים — אַף כֹּל צֶמֶר וּפִשְׁתִּים, ״צֶמֶר וּפִשְׁתִּים״ דִּכְתַב רַחֲמָנָא לְמָה לִי? שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ לְאַפְנוֹיֵי.
human_translation: Since it is written: “Neither shall there come upon you a garment of diverse kinds mingled together” and the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: Since garments is stated in the Torah unmodified, and the verse specified in one of “A woolen garment or a linen garment” so too, all wool or linen. why do I “Wool and linen” that the Merciful One wrote Learn from this that free.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "In order that it is written 'And a garment of mixed fabrics, wool and linen together, shall not come upon you,' and it was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael: Since the Torah spoke generally of 'garments,' and then specified for you one of them as wool and linen - just as all wool and linen, 'wool and linen,' why did the Merciful One write it? Learn from it for distinctions."

hebrew_text: וְאַכַּתִּי אִיצְטְרִיךְ, סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: הַעֲלָאָה הִיא דְּלָא נְפִישׁ הֲנָאָתַהּ, אֲבָל לְבִישָׁה דִּנְפִישׁ הֲנָיָיתַהּ — כֹּל תְּרֵי מִינֵי אֲסַר רַחֲמָנָא, כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״צֶמֶר וּפִשְׁתִּים״!
human_translation: But still necessary, enter your mind to say is placing which does not great benefit; however, wearing which great benefit, the Merciful One prohibits any two types the Merciful One writes “wool and linen”
llm_translation: And once I needed, I found that your opinion is correct: The ascending is not as beneficial as the descending, but the descending is more beneficial — all two types of linen the Merciful One prohibited, the Merciful One wrote "wool and linen"!

hebrew_text: אִם כֵּן, לִשְׁתּוֹק קְרָא מִינֵּיהּ, וְתֵיתֵי ״שַׁעַטְנֵז״ ״שַׁעַטְנֵז״ מֵהַעֲלָאָה.
human_translation: If so, let the verse be silent from and be derived “diverse kinds” “diverse kinds” placing
llm_translation: If so, to be silent, the verse excludes it, and it is derived from "sha'atnez" "sha'atnez" from the higher level.

hebrew_text: וְתַנָּא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: טַעְמָא דִּכְתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״צֶמֶר וּפִשְׁתִּים״, הָא לָאו הָכִי, כִּלְאַיִם בְּצִיצִית הֲוָה אָמֵינָא דַּאֲסַר רַחֲמָנָא? וְהָכְתִיב: ״וְעָשׂוּ לָהֶם צִיצִית עַל כַּנְפֵי בִגְדֵיהֶם״,
human_translation: And the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught, the reason that the Merciful One writes wool and linen. that if that were not so, I would say that the Merciful One prohibits diverse kinds in ritual fringes. But isn’t it written: “That they make themselves fringes on the corners of their garments”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael: The reason why the Merciful One wrote "wool and linen," is it not so? I would have thought that the Merciful One prohibited kilayim in tzitzit? But it is written: "And they shall make for themselves tzitzit on the corners of their garments,"

hebrew_text: וְתַנָּא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: כָּל בְּגָדִים צֶמֶר וּפִשְׁתִּים הֵם, וְאָמַר רַחֲמָנָא עֲבֵיד לֵיהּ תְּכֵלֶת, וּתְכֵלֶת עַמְרָא הוּא. וּמִמַּאי דִּתְכֵלֶת עַמְרָא הוּא? מִדְּשֵׁשׁ — כִּיתָּנָא, תְּכֵלֶת — עַמְרָא הוּא.
human_translation: And the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: All garments are wool or linen, and the Merciful One says, Prepare it a sky-blue and a sky-blue thread is wool. And from where that the sky-blue is wool? From of shesh , linen, sky-blue are wool.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael: All garments, wool and linen they are, and the Merciful One said to make for it tekhelet, and tekhelet is like the sea. And from where do we know that tekhelet is like the sea? From the word "shesh" - linen, tekhelet is like the sea.

hebrew_text: אִיצְטְרִיךְ, סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא כִּדְרָבָא, דְּרָבָא רָמֵי: כְּתִיב ״הַכָּנָף״ — מִין כָּנָף, וּכְתִיב ״צֶמֶר וּפִשְׁתִּים״!
human_translation: is necessary, enter your mind to state in accordance with Rava. As Rava raised a contradiction It is written: “the corners” type corner, And it is written: “Wool and linen”
llm_translation: It is necessary, as your mind desires, I say like Ravah, for Ravah raised an objection: It is written "the wing" - a type of wing, and it is written "wool and linen"!

hebrew_text: הָא כֵּיצַד? צֶמֶר וּפִשְׁתִּים פּוֹטְרִין בֵּין בְּמִינָן, בֵּין שֶׁלֹּא בְּמִינָן. שְׁאָר מִינִין, בְּמִינָן פּוֹטְרִין, שֶׁלֹּא בְּמִינָן אֵין פּוֹטְרִין.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, לְעוֹלָם
human_translation: Rather, Actually,

hebrew_text: וְאַכַּתִּי מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ: לְתוֹכֵף שְׁתֵּי תְכִיפוֹת — חִיבּוּר, וּתְכִיפָה אַחַת — אֵינוֹ חִיבּוּר! אִם כֵּן, לִכְתּוֹב רַחֲמָנָא ״לֹא תִלְבַּשׁ צֶמֶר וּפִשְׁתִּים יַחְדָּו״, ״שַׁעַטְנֵז״ לְמָה לִי? שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ לְאַפְנוֹיֵי.

If so, why did the Merciful One write "You shall not wear a garment of wool and linen mixed together," "Shaatnez" - what do I need it for? Learn from it for distinctions.

hebrew_text: וְאַכַּתִּי מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ, עַד שֶׁיְּהֵא שׁוּעַ טָווּי, וְנוּז! אֶלָּא: כּוּלַּהּ מִ״שַּׁעַטְנֵז״ נָפְקָא.
