llm_translation: And once he brings it, until the oath is properly administered, and he flees! Rather, the entire matter is derived from "Shatnez."

hebrew_text: אַשְׁכְּחַן דְּאָתֵי עֲשֵׂה וְדָחֵי לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה גְּרֵידָא, לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ כָּרֵת — הֵיכָא אַשְׁכְּחַן דְּדָחֵי דְּאִיצְטְרִיךְ ״עָלֶיהָ״ לְמֵיסְרַהּ?
human_translation: We have found that a positive mitzva overrides a regular prohibition. where do we find that overrides a prohibition that includes karet , as “with her” is necessary to prohibit her?
llm_translation: I found that when it comes to a positive commandment that pushes aside a negative commandment, it is not considered a "graida," a negative commandment that carries the punishment of karet. Where do we find that a negative commandment that requires the addition of "upon it" to make it binding?

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא נֵילַף מִמִּילָּה: מָה לְמִילָה, שֶׁכֵּן נִכְרְתוּ עָלֶיהָ שְׁלֹשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה בְּרִיתוֹת!
human_translation: And if you say: Let us derive from circumcision, What that circumcision as thirteen covenants were established over it?
llm_translation: And if you will say, let us derive the law of circumcision from circumcision itself: What is the law regarding circumcision, that thirteen covenants were made upon it!

hebrew_text: מִפֶּסַח: מָה לְפֶסַח שֶׁכֵּן כָּרֵת!
human_translation: from the the Paschal lamb, What that the Paschal lamb karet
llm_translation: From Pesach: What for Pesach that so is karet!

hebrew_text: מִתָּמִיד: מָה לְתָמִיד שֶׁכֵּן תָּדִיר!
human_translation: from the daily offering, What that the daily offering that it is frequent?
llm_translation: Continual: What for continual that so frequent!

hebrew_text: מֵחֲדָא לָא אָתְיָא, תֵּיתֵי מִתַּרְתֵּי: מֵהֵי תֵּיתֵי? מִמִּילָה וּפֶסַח — שֶׁכֵּן כָּרֵת! מִפֶּסַח וְתָמִיד — שֶׁכֵּן צוֹרֶךְ גָּבוֹהַּ.
human_translation: cannot be derived from one let it be derived from two From which it be derived? from circumcision and the Paschal lamb, as karet . from the Paschal lamb and the daily offering, as a requirement of the Temple,
llm_translation: From here it does not come, give from the two: from where to give? From circumcision and Passover - for thus it is cut! From Passover and the daily offering - for thus it is necessary for the High One.

hebrew_text: מִמִּילָה וְתָמִיד — שֶׁכֵּן יֶשְׁנוֹ לִפְנֵי הַדִּבּוּר, וְאַלִּיבָּא דְּמַאן דְּאָמַר עוֹלָה שֶׁהִקְרִיבוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל בַּמִּדְבָּר — עוֹלַת תָּמִיד הֲוָה. וּמִכּוּלְּהוּ נָמֵי, שֶׁכֵּן יֶשְׁנָן לִפְנֵי הַדִּבּוּר!
human_translation: from circumcision and the daily offering, were before the word And according to the one who said the burnt-offering brought by the Jewish people in the desert was the daily offering. And from all of these also as these were before the word
llm_translation: From circumcision and the daily offering - so it is established before the utterance, and according to the opinion of the one who said, "the burnt offering that the Israelites offered in the wilderness" - it was a continual burnt offering. And from all of them, so too they are established before the utterance!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, אִיצְטְרִיךְ. סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא תֵּיתֵי מִכִּבּוּד אָב וָאֵם.
human_translation: Rather, is necessary, enter your mind to say is derived from honoring one’s father and mother.
llm_translation: Rather, it is necessary. As your mind may suggest, I would say, "One should honor father and mother."

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: יָכוֹל יְהֵא כִּבּוּד אָב וָאֵם דּוֹחֶה שַׁבָּת — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אִישׁ אִמּוֹ וְאָבִיו תִּירָאוּ וְאֶת שַׁבְּתוֹתַי תִּשְׁמוֹרוּ״, כּוּלְּכֶם חַיָּיבִין בִּכְבוֹדִי.
human_translation: As it is taught might that honoring one’s father and mother overrides Shabbat; the verse states: “You shall fear every man his mother and his father and you shall keep My Shabbatot , All of you, are obligated in My honor,
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: One might have thought that honoring one's father and mother overrides the Sabbath. Therefore, the Torah teaches: "Every one of you shall revere his mother and his father, and you shall keep My Sabbaths" - all of you are obligated in My honor.

hebrew_text: מַאי לָאו דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ: שְׁחוֹט לִי, בַּשֵּׁל לִי, וְטַעְמָא דִּכְתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״אֶת שַׁבְּתוֹתַי תִּשְׁמוֹרוּ״, הָא לָאו הָכִי — דָּחֵי? לָא —
human_translation: What, is it not where said to him: Slaughter for me, cook for me, And the reason the Merciful One writes: “Keep My Shabbatot ,” if that was not so, override No,
llm_translation: What is the reason he did not say to him: slaughter for me, cook for me, and the reason that the Merciful One wrote "You shall observe My Sabbaths," is it not so that he should rest? No - not so.

hebrew_text: לָאו דִּמְחַמֵּר, וַאֲפִילּוּ הָכִי לָא דָּחֵי.
human_translation: prohibition against driving animal. And even so, not override
llm_translation: Not like a donkey, and even so, it does not push away.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא דְּקַיְימָא לַן דְּאָתֵי עֲשֵׂה וְדָחֵי לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה, לִיגְמַר מֵהָכָא דְּלָא לִידְחֵי!
human_translation: rather which we maintain that a positive mitzva comes and overrides a prohibition, let us derive from here that it does not override
llm_translation: Instead, we establish that when a positive commandment conflicts with a negative commandment, the positive commandment takes precedence over the negative commandment, in order to learn from here that it should not be pushed aside!

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא, שָׁאנֵי לָאוֵי דְּשַׁבָּת דַּחֲמִירִי — וְהָא תַּנָּא בְּעָלְמָא קָאֵי, וְלָא קָפָרֵיךְ!
human_translation: And if you say prohibitions of Shabbat are different that they are serious, as the tanna speaks generally and he does not raise any difficulty
llm_translation: And if you will say, perhaps it is different with the prohibition of Shabbat, for it is stringent - but behold, a Mishnah stands on its own, and does not require atonement!

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא, יָכוֹל אָמַר לוֹ אָבִיו: הִיטַּמֵּא, אוֹ שֶׁאָמַר לוֹ: אַל תַּחְזִיר, יָכוֹל יִשְׁמַע לוֹ? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אִישׁ אִמּוֹ וְאָבִיו תִּירָאוּ וְאֶת שַׁבְּתוֹתַי תִּשְׁמוֹרוּ״, כּוּלְּכֶם חַיָּיבִין בִּכְבוֹדִי.
human_translation: As it is taught might that if one’s father said to Be rendered ritually impure or if he said to him: Do not return might should obey him. the verse states: “You shall fear every man his mother and his father and you shall keep My Shabbatot , All of you are obligated in My honor.
llm_translation: It was taught: Could he say to him, his father: become impure, or that he said to him: do not return, could he listen to him? The Torah teaches: "Each of you shall revere his mother and his father, and you shall keep My Sabbaths," all of you are obligated in My honor.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, מִשּׁוּם דְּאִיכָּא לְמִיפְרַךְ:
human_translation: Rather, because there is room to refute
llm_translation: Rather, because there is room for distinction:

hebrew_text: מָה לְהָנָךְ שֶׁכֵּן הֶכְשֵׁר מִצְוָה.
human_translation: What that these as preparation for the mitzva
llm_translation: What is the pleasure that is so great in the fulfillment of a mitzvah.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: תֵּיתֵי מִבִּנְיַן בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ. דְּתַנְיָא: יָכוֹל יְהֵא בִּנְיַן בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ דּוֹחֶה שַׁבָּת — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אֶת שַׁבְּתוֹתַי תִּשְׁמוֹרוּ וּמִקְדָּשִׁי תִּירָאוּ״ — כּוּלְּכֶם חַיָּיבִין בִּכְבוֹדִי.
human_translation: Rather, enter your mind to say: derived from the building of the Temple. As it is taught might the building of the Temple should override Shabbat; the verse states: “You shall keep My Shabbatot and revere My Sanctuary, all of you are obligated in My honor.
llm_translation: Rather, the conclusion of your reasoning I say: let the construction of the Temple override Shabbat. For it was taught: One might have thought that the construction of the Temple overrides Shabbat — therefore the Torah states: "You shall keep My Sabbaths and revere My sanctuary" — all of you are obligated in My honor.

hebrew_text: מַאי לָאו, בְּבוֹנֶה וְסוֹתֵר, וְטַעְמָא דִּכְתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״אֶת שַׁבְּתוֹתַי תִּשְׁמוֹרוּ״, הָא לָאו הָכִי — דָּחֵי!
human_translation: What, is it not to building and demolishing? And the reason the Merciful One writes: “Keep My Shabbatot ,” if that were not so, would override
llm_translation: What is the reason why one may not build and demolish? And the reason that the Merciful One wrote, "You shall observe My Sabbaths," is it not so that one should desist!

hebrew_text: לָא, לָאו דִּמְחַמֵּר, וַאֲפִילּוּ הָכִי לָא דָּחֵי. וְאֶלָּא דְּקַיְימָא לַן דְּאָתֵי עֲשֵׂה וְדָחֵי לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה, לִיגְמַר מֵהָכָא דְּלָא דָּחֵי!
human_translation: No, prohibition against driving animal, and even so not override rather which we maintain that a positive mitzva comes and overrides a prohibition, let us derive from here that it does not override
llm_translation: No, it is not the case that it is a donkey, and even so, it is not pushed aside. Rather, it is established for us that when a positive commandment conflicts with a negative commandment, we conclude from here that it is not pushed aside!

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא, שָׁאנֵי לָאוֵי דְּשַׁבָּת דַּחֲמִירִי — וְהָא תַּנָּא בְּעָלְמָא קָאֵי, וְלָא קָא פָרֵיךְ! דְּתַנְיָא, יָכוֹל אָמַר לוֹ אָבִיו: הִיטַּמֵּא, אוֹ שֶׁאָמַר לוֹ: אַל תַּחְזִיר, יָכוֹל יִשְׁמַע לוֹ — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אִישׁ אִמּוֹ וְאָבִיו תִּירָאוּ וְגוֹ׳״ — כּוּלְּכֶם חַיָּיבִים בִּכְבוֹדִי.
human_translation: And if you say that prohibitions of Shabbat are different that they are severe, as the tanna speaks generally and he does not raise any difficulty as it is taught might that if one’s father said to Be rendered ritually impure, or if he said to him: Do not return might should obey him. the verse states: “You shall fear every man his mother and his father All of you are obligated in My honor.
llm_translation: And if you will say, perhaps it is different when it comes to the prohibition of Shabbat, for it is more stringent - but the Mishnah is speaking generally, and not specifically! As it was taught: If he could say to him, "Become impure," or if he could say to him, "Do not return," he could listen to him - the Torah says: "Each of you shall revere his mother and his father" - all of you are obligated in my honor.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, מִשּׁוּם דְּאִיכָּא לְמִיפְרַךְ: מָה לְהָנָךְ שֶׁכֵּן הֶכְשֵׁר מִצְוָה. הֶכְשֵׁר מִצְוָה תִּיפּוֹק לִי מֵהָתָם?
human_translation: Rather, because there is room to refute What that these a preparation for mitzva Let preparation for a mitzva be derived from there,
llm_translation: Rather, because there is room to refute: What is the benefit of this? So too, the validity of a mitzvah. The validity of a mitzvah should be derived for me from there?

hebrew_text: אִין הָכִי נָמֵי. וְ״אֶת שַׁבְּתוֹתַי תִּשְׁמוֹרוּ וּמִקְדָּשִׁי תִּירָאוּ״ לְמָה לִי? מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ, לְכִדְתַנְיָא: יָכוֹל יִתְיָירֵא אָדָם מִמִּקְדָּשׁ, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אֶת שַׁבְּתוֹתַי תִּשְׁמוֹרוּ וְאֶת מִקְדָּשִׁי תִּירָאוּ״. נֶאֶמְרָה שְׁמִירָה בַּשַּׁבָּת, וְנֶאֶמְרָה מוֹרָא בַּמִּקְדָּשׁ. מָה שְׁמִירָה הָאֲמוּרָה בַּשַּׁבָּת —
human_translation: Yes, it is indeed so. why do I “You shall keep My Shabbatot , and revere My Sanctuary” It is necessary to that which is taught might a person should be in reverence of the Temple the verse states: “You shall keep My Shabbatot , and revere My Sanctuary.” keeping is stated to Shabbat, and reverence is stated to the Temple. Just as keeping stated to Shabbat,
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "אִין הָכִי נָמֵי. וְ״אֶת שַׁבְּתוֹתַי תִּשְׁמוֹרוּ וּמִקְדָּשִׁי תִּירָאוּ״ לְמָה לִי? מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ, לְכִדְתַנְיָא: יָכוֹל יִתְיָירֵא אָדָם מִמִּקְדָּשׁ, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אֶת שַׁבְּתוֹתַי תִּשְׁמוֹרוּ וְאֶת מִקְדָּשִׁי תִּירָאוּ״. נֶאֶמְרָה שְׁמִירָה בַּשַּׁבָּת, וְנֶאֶמְרָה מוֹרָא בַּמִּקְדָּשׁ. מָה שְׁמִירָה הָאֲמוּרָה בַּשַּׁבָּת —"

hebrew_text: לֹא מִשַּׁבָּת אַתָּה מִתְיָירֵא, אֶלָּא מִמִּי שֶׁהִזְהִיר עַל הַשַּׁבָּת, אַף מוֹרָא הָאֲמוּרָה בַּמִּקְדָּשׁ — לֹא מִמִּקְדָּשׁ אַתָּה מִתְיָירֵא, אֶלָּא מִמִּי שֶׁהִזְהִיר עַל הַמִּקְדָּשׁ.
human_translation: you do not revere Shabbat rather, He Who warned about Shabbat, so too, the reverence stated to the Temple: You do not revere the Temple but He Who warned about the Temple.
llm_translation: You are not afraid of the Sabbath, but of the One who warned about the Sabbath; similarly, the awe mentioned in connection with the Temple – you are not afraid of the Temple, but of the One who warned about the Temple.

hebrew_text: וְאֵי זוֹ הִיא מוֹרָא מִקְדָּשׁ? לֹא יִכָּנֵס אָדָם בְּהַר הַבַּיִת בְּמַקְלוֹ, בְּמִנְעָלוֹ, בְּפוּנְדָּתוֹ, וּבְאָבָק שֶׁעַל גַּבֵּי רַגְלָיו, וְלֹא יַעֲשֶׂנּוּ קַפַּנְדַּרְיָא. וּרְקִיקָה מִקַּל וָחוֹמֶר.
human_translation: And what is the reverence of the Temple? a person may not enter the Temple Mount with his staff, his shoes, his money belt [ punda ], or the dust on his feet. One may not make a shortcut [ kappendarya ] and through an a fortiori one may not spit
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And what is the awe of the Temple? A person should not enter the Temple Mount with his staff, with his shoes, with his money belt, and with dust on his feet, and he should not make it a shortcut. And a thin cloth of wool and linen.

hebrew_text: וְאֵין לִי אֶלָּא בִּזְמַן שֶׁבֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ קַיָּים, בִּזְמַן שֶׁאֵין בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ קַיָּים — מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אֶת שַׁבְּתוֹתַי תִּשְׁמוֹרוּ וּמִקְדָּשִׁי תִּירָאוּ״. מָה שְׁמִירָה הָאֲמוּרָה בְּשַׁבָּת — לְעוֹלָם, אַף מוֹרָא הָאֲמוּרָה בַּמִּקְדָּשׁ — לְעוֹלָם.
human_translation: And I have only when the Temple is standing. From where when the Temple is not standing, The verse states: “You shall keep My Shabbatot , and revere My Sanctuary” Just as the keeping stated to Shabbat forever, so too, the reverence stated to the Temple is forever.
llm_translation: "And I have only when the Temple is standing, when the Temple is not standing - from where? The Torah teaches: 'You shall observe My Sabbaths and revere My Sanctuary.' Just as the observance mentioned regarding the Sabbath - forever, so too the reverence mentioned regarding the Sanctuary - forever."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: תֵּיתֵי מֵהַבְעָרָה. דְּתָנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: ״לֹא תְבַעֲרוּ אֵשׁ בְּכֹל מוֹשְׁבוֹתֵיכֶם״, מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר?
human_translation: Rather, enter your mind to say be derived from kindling, as the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught “You shall kindle no fire throughout your habitations What the verse states
llm_translation: Rather, the inclination of your mind I say: place from the burning. As it was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael: "Do not kindle a fire in all your dwellings," what is the teaching to say?

hebrew_text: מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר?! אִי לְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי — לְלָאו. אִי לְרַבִּי נָתָן — לְחַלֵּק.
human_translation: What the verse states If of Rabbi Yosei, that prohibition, If of Rabbi Natan, to divide
llm_translation: What is the Talmud saying?! If it is regarding Rabbi Yosei - to the negative. If it is regarding Rabbi Natan - to divide.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: הַבְעָרָה לְלָאו יָצָתָה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי. רַבִּי נָתָן אוֹמֵר: לְחַלֵּק.
human_translation: As it is taught kindling was out as prohibition, the statement of Rabbi Yosei. Rabbi Natan says: it was to divide.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: It was taught in a Baraita: If the fire emerged on its own, these are the words of Rabbi Yosei. Rabbi Natan says: to divide.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רָבָא: תַּנָּא ״מוֹשָׁבוֹת״ קָא קַשְׁיָא לֵיהּ: ״מוֹשָׁבוֹת״ מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר?
human_translation: And Rava said tanna , “habitations” a difficulty with regard to What the verse states “habitations”?
llm_translation: And Rava said: It was taught: "Moshavot" is difficult for him. What does the Talmud mean to say by "moshavot"?

hebrew_text: מִכְּדֵי שַׁבָּת חוֹבַת הַגּוּף הִיא, וְחוֹבַת הַגּוּף נוֹהֶגֶת בֵּין בָּאָרֶץ בֵּין בְּחוּץ לָאָרֶץ, ״מוֹשָׁבוֹת״ דִּכְתַב רַחֲמָנָא בְּשַׁבָּת — לְמָה לִּי?
human_translation: Since Shabbat is an obligation to the body, and obligations of the body apply both in Eretz and outside Eretz why do I “habitations” that the Merciful One writes to Shabbat?
llm_translation: From the perspective of Shabbat, it is an obligation of the body, and the obligation of the body applies whether on the land or outside the land. "His dwellings" as the Merciful One wrote regarding Shabbat - what is it to me?

hebrew_text: מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל אָמַר תַּלְמִיד אֶחָד, לְפִי שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְכִי יִהְיֶה בְאִישׁ חֵטְא מִשְׁפַּט מָוֶת וְהוּמָת״, שׁוֹמֵעַ אֲנִי בֵּין בַּחוֹל בֵּין בַּשַּׁבָּת. וּמָה אֲנִי מְקַיֵּים ״מְחַלְּלֶיהָ מוֹת יוּמָת״ — בִּשְׁאָר מְלָאכוֹת, חוּץ מִמִּיתַת בֵּית דִּין. אוֹ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ מִיתַת בֵּית דִּין, וּמָה אֲנִי מְקַיֵּים ״וְהוּמָת״ — בַּחוֹל וְלֹא בַּשַּׁבָּת.
human_translation: A student said in the name of Rabbi Yishmael since it is stated: “And if a man has committed a sin worthy of death, and he is put to death” I derive whether on a weekday on a Shabbat. And how do I establish every one who profanes it shall surely be put to death” to other labors, except for court-imposed capital punishment, Or it is only even court-imposed capital punishment How, do I establish “And he is put to death”? to a weekday and not to Shabbat.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: On account of Rabbi Yishmael, one disciple said, as it is stated: "And if there shall be in a man a sin, the judgment of death, and he shall die," I hear this verse whether on a weekday or on Shabbat. And how do I fulfill "they shall surely be put to death" — for all other labors, except for the execution by the court. Or perhaps even the execution by the court, and how do I fulfill "and he shall die" — on a weekday and not on Shabbat.

hebrew_text: אוֹ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ בַּשַּׁבָּת, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״לֹא תְבַעֲרוּ אֵשׁ בְּכֹל מוֹשְׁבוֹתֵיכֶם״, וּלְהַלָּן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״וְהָיוּ אֵלֶּה לָכֶם לְחֻקַּת מִשְׁפָּט לְדוֹרוֹתֵיכֶם בְּכֹל מוֹשְׁבוֹתֵיכֶם״,
human_translation: Or it is only even on Shabbat? the verse states “You shall kindle no fire throughout your habitations and below it says, “And these things shall be for you a statute of judgment to you throughout your generations in all your habitations”
llm_translation: Or if not, even on Shabbat, the Talmud teaches him: "Do not kindle a fire in all your dwellings." And further on it says: "And these shall be to you a statute of judgment for your generations in all your dwellings."

hebrew_text: מָה מוֹשָׁבוֹת הָאֲמוּרִים לְהַלָּן — בְּבֵית דִּין, אַף מוֹשָׁבוֹת הָאֲמוּרִים כָּאן — בְּבֵית דִּין, וְאָמַר רַחֲמָנָא: ״לֹא תְבַעֲרוּ״.
human_translation: Just as “habitations” stated below, in the court, so too, “habitations” stated here in the court, And the Merciful One states “You shall kindle no
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "What are the dwellings mentioned there - in the court, so too the dwellings mentioned here - in the court, and the Merciful One said: 'Do not kindle.'"

hebrew_text: מַאי לָאו: רַבִּי נָתָן הִיא, דְּאָמַר: לְחַלֵּק יָצָתָה. וְטַעְמָא דִּכְתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״לֹא תְבַעֲרוּ״, הָא לָאו הָכִי — דָּחֵי?
human_translation: What, is it not Rabbi Natan, who said was out to divide, And the reason that the Merciful One writes: “You shall kindle no if it were not so, would override
llm_translation: What is the reason? Rabbi Natan said: To divide she went out. And the reason that the Merciful One wrote "do not kindle," is it not so — that it is rejected?

hebrew_text: לָא, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי. וְתִיהְוֵי נָמֵי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי, אֵימַר דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: הַבְעָרָה לְלָאו יָצָתָה — הַבְעָרָה גְּרֵידְתָּא,
human_translation: No, Rabbi Yosei And let it even be Rabbi Yosei. You say that Rabbi Yosei said kindling was out as a prohibition, kindling alone,
llm_translation: Not so, Rabbi Yosei. And it should be stated as "Rabbi Yosei said": If the burning was for its own sake, it is a proper burning.

hebrew_text: הַבְעָרָה דְּבֵית דִּין — בִּישּׁוּל פְּתִילָה הוּא!
human_translation: kindling by the court is cooking of wick.
llm_translation: The burning of the court - it is the extinguishing of the wick!

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: מָה לִי בִּישּׁוּל פְּתִילָה, מָה לִי בִּישּׁוּל סַמָּנִין.
human_translation: And Rav Sheshet said What is to me cooking a wick, what is to me cooking of herbs
llm_translation: And Rav Sheshet said: What do I have to do with the soaking of the wick, what do I have to do with the soaking of the spices.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שִׁימִי בַּר אָשֵׁי: הַאי תַּנָּא לָא מִשּׁוּם דְּאָתֵי עֲשֵׂה וְדָחֵי לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה, אֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם דְּמַיְיתֵי מִקַּל וָחוֹמֶר. וְהָכִי קָאָמַר: מָה אֲנִי מְקַיֵּים ״מְחַלְּלֶיהָ מוֹת יוּמָת״ — בִּשְׁאָר מְלָאכוֹת, חוּץ מִמִּיתַת בֵּית דִּין. אֲבָל מִיתַת בֵּית דִּין — דָּחֲיָא שַׁבָּת מִקַּל וָחוֹמֶר,
human_translation: Rav Shimi bar Ashi said: This tanna not because a positive mitzva comes and overrides a prohibition. Rather, because he learns this by an a fortiori and this is what is saying: How do I establish “Every one who profanes it shall surely be put to death” to other labors, except for court-imposed capital punishment. However, court-imposed capital punishment overrides Shabbat, by an a fortiori
llm_translation: Rav Shimi bar Ashei said: This Mishnah does not come to teach the principle of "positive commandment overrides negative commandment," but rather because it is a logical inference. And this is what he is saying: How do I fulfill the verse "He shall surely be put to death" - in all other types of labor, except for the execution carried out by the court. But the court's execution - it overrides the Sabbath through a logical inference.

hebrew_text: וּמָה עֲבוֹדָה, שֶׁהִיא חֲמוּרָה וְדוֹחָה שַׁבָּת — רְצִיחָה דּוֹחָה אוֹתָהּ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״מֵעִם מִזְבְּחִי תִּקָּחֶנּוּ לָמוּת״, שַׁבָּת, שֶׁנִּדְחֵת מִפְּנֵי עֲבוֹדָה — אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁתְּהֵא רְצִיחָה דּוֹחָה אוֹתָהּ?
human_translation: If service, is severe that it overrides Shabbat, murder overrides it, as it is stated “You shall take him from My altar, that he may die” Shabbat, which is overridden by service, is it not right that murder should
llm_translation: And what service, that is stringent and overrides the Sabbath - murder overrides it, as it is stated: "From my altar you shall take him to die." Sabbath, which is pushed aside because of service - is it not logical that murder should push it aside?

hebrew_text: וּמַאי ״אוֹ אֵינוֹ״ דְּקָאָמַר — הָכִי קָאָמַר: קְבוּרַת מֵת מִצְוָה תּוֹכִיחַ, שֶׁדּוֹחָה אֶת הָעֲבוֹדָה, וְאֵין דּוֹחָה אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת. הֲדַר אָמַר: קְבוּרַת מֵת מִצְוָה תִּדְחֶה שַׁבָּת מִקַּל וָחוֹמֶר: וּמָה עֲבוֹדָה שֶׁהִיא דּוֹחָה שַׁבָּת — קְבוּרַת מֵת מִצְוָה דּוֹחָה אוֹתָהּ,
human_translation: And what Or it is only which stated this is what is saying: to bury a corpse with no one to bury it [ met mitzva ] can prove as overrides service, and it does not override Shabbat. then said the burial of a met mitzva overrides Shabbat by a fortiori If service overrides Shabbat, the burial of a met mitzva overrides
llm_translation: And what is the meaning of "or not" that he is saying? - This is what he is saying: The burial of a deceased is a mitzvah that overrides the Temple service, but it does not override the Sabbath. He further said: The burial of a deceased is a mitzvah that overrides the Sabbath from a fortiori reasoning: Just as the Temple service, which is overridden by the Sabbath, the burial of a deceased, which is a mitzvah, should override it.

hebrew_text: מִ״וּלְאַחוֹתוֹ״, שַׁבָּת שֶׁנִּדְחֵת מִפְּנֵי עֲבוֹדָה — אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁתְּהֵא קְבוּרַת מֵת מִצְוָה דּוֹחָה אוֹתָהּ? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״לֹא תְבַעֲרוּ״.
human_translation: from “or for his sister” Shabbat is overridden by service, is it not right that the burial of a met mitzva should override it? the verse states: “You shall kindle no
llm_translation: From "his sister," a Shabbat that was postponed due to work - is it not the law that the burial of the dead overrides it? The Scripture says: "Do not kindle."

hebrew_text: וּלְמַאי דִּסְלֵיק אַדַּעְתֵּיהּ מֵעִיקָּרָא דְּאָתֵי עֲשֵׂה וְדָחֵי לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה, מַאי ״אוֹ אֵינוֹ״ דְּקָאָמַר?
human_translation: And according to that which entered his mind at the outset, that a positive mitzva comes and overrides a prohibition, what Or it is only that said?
llm_translation: And for what does his knowledge emerge from the outset that comes to do and push away "do not do," what is the "or not" that he is saying?

hebrew_text: הָכִי קָאָמַר: מָה אֲנִי מְקַיֵּים ״מְחַלְּלֶיהָ מוֹת יוּמָת״ — בִּשְׁאָר מְלָאכוֹת חוּץ מִמִּיתַת בֵּית דִּין. אֲבָל מִיתַת בֵּית דִּין דָּחֵי שַׁבָּת, דְּאָתֵי עֲשֵׂה וְדָחֵי לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה.
human_translation: this is what is saying: How do I establish “Every one who profanes it shall surely be put to death” to other labors, except for court-imposed capital punishment. However, court-imposed capital punishment overrides Shabbat, as a positive mitzva comes and overrides a prohibition.
llm_translation: So it is stated: How do I fulfill "one who desecrates it shall surely be put to death" - in all other labors except for the execution of the court. But the execution of the court overrides the Sabbath, for it involves a positive commandment and overrides a negative commandment.

hebrew_text: הֲדַר אָמַר: אֵימַר דְּאָמְרִינַן דְּאָתֵי עֲשֵׂה וְדָחֵי לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה — לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה גְּרֵידָא, לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ כָּרֵת מִי שָׁמְעַתְּ לֵיהּ דְּדָחֵי? הֲדַר אָמַר: אַטּוּ ״עֲשֵׂה דּוֹחֶה אֶת לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה״, לָאו לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה חָמוּר מִינֵּיהּ, וְקָאָתֵי עֲשֵׂה וְדָחֵי לֵיהּ?
human_translation: then said: say that we stated that a positive mitzva comes and overrides a prohibition, prohibition alone. did you hear that it overrides a prohibition that includes karet ? then said, Is that not to say, a positive mitzva overrides a prohibition, the prohibition is more stringent than And the positive mitzva comes and overrides it.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates as follows: "Hadar said: What is the reason that we say that when a positive commandment conflicts with a negative commandment - the negative commandment takes precedence? It is because of a case like the prohibition of gireida (a mixture of wool and linen), a negative commandment that carries the penalty of karet. Who heard that it takes precedence? Hadar said: Now, if the positive commandment overrides the negative commandment, is it not more stringent than the negative commandment itself? And it comes to say that the positive commandment pushes aside the negative commandment."

hebrew_text: מָה לִי חוּמְרָא זוּטָא וּמָה לִי חוּמְרָא רַבָּה, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״לֹא תְבַעֲרוּ״.
human_translation: what difference to me a minor stringency and what difference to me a major stringency? the verse states: “You shall not kindle.”
llm_translation: What to me is this small stringency, and what to me is this great stringency, the Torah says: "Do not kindle."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא [אִיצְטְרִיךְ], סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: תִּיהְוֵי הַאי אֵשֶׁת אָח דָּבָר שֶׁהָיָה בַּכְּלָל וְיָצָא מִן הַכְּלָל לְלַמֵּד — לֹא לְלַמֵּד עַל עַצְמוֹ יָצָא, אֶלָּא לְלַמֵּד עַל הַכְּלָל כּוּלּוֹ יָצָא.
human_translation: Rather, is necessary enter your mind to say: Let this a brother’s wife, be A matter that was included in a generalization, but emerged to teach, emerged to teach not just about itself but to teach about the entire generalization.
llm_translation: Rather it is necessary, according to your reasoning, I say: Let this sister-in-law be a case that was included and then excluded from the general rule to teach - not to teach about itself it was excluded, but to teach about the entire general rule it was excluded.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: דָּבָר שֶׁהָיָה בַּכְּלָל וְיָצָא מִן הַכְּלָל וְכוּ׳, כֵּיצַד?
human_translation: As it is taught A matter that was included in a generalization, but emerged How so?
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: a matter that was included in the general principle and then departed from the general principle, etc. How so?

hebrew_text: ״וְהַנֶּפֶשׁ אֲשֶׁר תֹּאכַל בָּשָׂר מִזֶּבַח הַשְּׁלָמִים וְטוּמְאָתוֹ עָלָיו״, וַהֲלֹא שְׁלָמִים בִּכְלָל קֳדָשִׁים הָיוּ, וְלָמָּה יָצְאוּ — לְהַקִּישׁ אֲלֵיהֶן, וְלוֹמַר לָךְ: מָה שְׁלָמִים מְיוּחָדִים קׇדְשֵׁי מִזְבֵּחַ — אַף כֹּל קׇדְשֵׁי מִזְבֵּחַ. יָצְאוּ קׇדְשֵׁי בֶּדֶק הַבַּיִת.
human_translation: “But the soul that eats of the flesh of the sacrifice of peace-offerings with his ritual impurity upon him, But aren’t peace- included in of consecrated offerings? And why were they singled out To draw an analogy between them and to say to you: Just as peace- are unique consecrated for the altar, so too, all consecrated for the altar, excludes consecrated for the Temple maintenance.
llm_translation: "And the soul that will eat flesh from the sacrifice of the peace-offerings, and its impurity upon him." But aren't peace-offerings included in the category of holy offerings, so why were they singled out? - To compare them and say to you: Just as peace-offerings are designated holy offerings of the altar, so too all holy offerings of the altar. They singled out the holy offerings of the Temple courtyard.

hebrew_text: הָכָא נָמֵי: הָא אֵשֶׁת אָח בִּכְלַל כׇּל הָעֲרָיוֹת הָיְתָה, וְלָמָּה יָצְתָה — לְהַקִּישׁ אֵלֶיהָ, וְלוֹמַר לָךְ: מָה אֵשֶׁת אָח שַׁרְיָא — אַף כׇּל עֲרָיוֹת נָמֵי שַׁרְיָין.
human_translation: Here too, This a brother’s wife was included in all with whom relations are forbidden, and why was she singled out? To compare to her and say to you: Just as brother’s wife is permitted, so too, all with whom relations are forbidden are likewise permitted.
llm_translation: Here it is stated: If a man's wife was included in all the forbidden relationships, and why did she go out? — to compare her, and to say to you: Just as a man's wife is permitted, so too all forbidden relationships are permitted.

hebrew_text: מִי דָּמֵי? הָתָם: כְּלָל בְּאִיסּוּר, וּפְרָט בְּאִיסּוּר. הָכָא: כְּלָל בְּאִיסּוּר, וּפְרָט בְּהֶיתֵּר.
human_translation: Is comparable? There, the generalization, in the prohibition and the detailed in the prohibition. here, the generalization in the prohibition and the detailed case is permitted.
llm_translation: Who is similar? There: general in prohibition, and specific in prohibition. Here: general in prohibition, and specific in permission.

hebrew_text: הָא לָא דָּמֵי אֶלָּא לְדָבָר שֶׁהָיָה בַּכְּלָל, וְיָצָא לִידּוֹן בְּדָבָר הֶחָדָשׁ — שֶׁאִי אַתָּה יָכוֹל לְהַחֲזִירוֹ לִכְלָלוֹ, עַד שֶׁיַּחְזִירֶנּוּ לְךָ הַכָּתוּב בְּפֵירוּשׁ. דְּתַנְיָא: דָּבָר שֶׁהָיָה בַּכְּלָל, וְיָצָא לִידּוֹן בְּדָבָר הֶחָדָשׁ — אִי אַתָּה רַשַּׁאי לְהַחְזִירוֹ לִכְלָלוֹ, עַד שֶׁיַּחְזִירֶנּוּ לְךָ הַכָּתוּב בְּפֵירוּשׁ.
human_translation: is comparable only to a matter that was included in a generalization but emerged to discuss a new matter. then you cannot return it to its generalization until the Torah explicitly returns it As it is taught a matter that was included in a generalization but emerged to discuss a new matter, you may not return it to its generalization until the Torah explicitly returns it
llm_translation: Here is the word-for-word English translation of the Talmudic text: "This is not similar except for a matter that was included, and went out to be judged in a new matter - that you cannot return it to its original state until the Scripture returns it to you explicitly. As it was taught: a matter that was included, and went out to be judged in a new matter - you are not permitted to return it to its original state until the Scripture returns it to you explicitly."

hebrew_text: כֵּיצַד? ״וְשָׁחַט אֶת הַכֶּבֶשׂ בִּמְקוֹם אֲשֶׁר יִשְׁחַט אֶת הַחַטָּאת וְאֶת הָעוֹלָה בִּמְקוֹם הַקֹּדֶשׁ כִּי כַּחַטָּאת הָאָשָׁם הוּא לַכֹּהֵן״, שֶׁאֵין תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״כַּחַטָּאת הָאָשָׁם״, וּמָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״כַּחַטָּאת הָאָשָׁם״?
human_translation: How so? “And he shall slaughter the sheep in the place where they slaughter the sin-offering and the burnt-offering, in the place of the Sanctuary; for as the sin-offering is the priest’s, so is the guilt-offering” As no the verse to state: “As the sin-offering so is the guilt-offering,” what the verse states: “As the sin-offering so is the guilt-offering”?
llm_translation: How so? "And he shall slaughter the lamb in the place where he slaughters the sin offering and the burnt offering in the holy place, for it is like the sin offering; it is for the priest." There is no need for the verse to say, "like the sin offering," so why does the verse say, "like the sin offering"?

hebrew_text: לְפִי שֶׁיָּצָא אֲשַׁם מְצוֹרָע לִידּוֹן בְּדָבָר הֶחָדָשׁ, בְּבֹהֶן יָד וּבֹהֶן רֶגֶל הַיְמָנִית. יָכוֹל לֹא יְהֵא טָעוּן מַתַּן דָּמִים וְאֵימוּרִים לְגַבֵּי מִזְבֵּחַ —
human_translation: Since the guilt-offering of a leper was specified to discuss a new matter, the thumb and the big toe of the right foot might does not require placement of the blood and sacrificial parts on the altar,
llm_translation: Due to the fact that a guilt offering has emerged for the judgment of a new matter, with the thumb of the right hand and the big toe of the right foot. One might think that it does not require the offering of blood and verbal confessions upon the altar—

hebrew_text: תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״כִּי כַּחַטָּאת הָאָשָׁם הוּא״. מָה חַטָּאת טְעוּנָה מַתַּן דָּמִים וְאֵימוּרִים לְגַבֵּי מִזְבֵּחַ — אַף אָשָׁם טָעוּן מַתַּן דָּמִים וְאֵימוּרִים לְגַבֵּי מִזְבֵּחַ.
human_translation: the verse states: “As the sin-offering so is the guilt-offering” just as the sin-offering requires placement of the blood and sacrificial parts on the altar, so too, the guilt-offering requires placement of the blood and sacrificial parts on the altar.
llm_translation: The Talmud teaches: "For it is like the sin offering, it is a guilt offering." Just as a sin offering requires the giving of blood and verbal confessions at the altar, so too a guilt offering requires the giving of blood and verbal confessions at the altar.

hebrew_text: וְאִי לָא אַהְדְּרֵיהּ קְרָא — הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: לְמַאי דִּנְפַק — נְפַק, וּלְמַאי דְּלָא נְפַק — לָא נְפַק. הָכָא נָמֵי, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: אֵשֶׁת אָח דְּאִישְׁתְּרַא[י] — אִישְׁתְּרַאי, שְׁאָר עֲרָיוֹת — לָא.
human_translation: And had the verse not restored this I would say: With regard to that which was excluded excluded, and with regard to that which was not excluded, not excluded, and Here, too, I would say: A brother’s wife who was permitted permitted, other with whom relations are forbidden not
llm_translation: "And if not, he repeats the verse - I would say: for what it comes out - it comes out, and for what it does not come out - it does not come out. Here, I would say: the wife of a brother of a man - his brother's wife, other forbidden relationships - no."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: תֵּיתֵי בְּ״מָה מָצִינוּ״ מֵאֵשֶׁת אָח. מָה אֵשֶׁת אָח מִיַּיבְּמָה — אַף אֲחוֹת אִשָּׁה תִּתְיַיבֵּם.
human_translation: Rather, enter your mind to say: Let be derived by What do we find from a brother’s wife: Just as a brother’s wife enters levirate marriage, so too, a wife’s sister should enter into levirate marriage.
llm_translation: Rather, the inclination of your mind I say: "Give with 'from the wife of a brother' from the wife of a brother. Just as the wife of a brother establishes yibum - so too, the sister of a wife establishes yibum."

hebrew_text: מִי דָּמֵי? הָתָם חַד אִיסּוּרָא — הָכָא תְּרֵי אִיסּוּרֵי! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: הוֹאִיל וְאִישְׁתְּרִי — אִישְׁתְּרִי.
human_translation: Is it comparable? There, one prohibition here, two prohibitions, lest you say: Since it is permitted, it is permitted.
llm_translation: Who is similar? There, one prohibition - here, two prohibitions! What might you say? Since she is permitted - she is permitted.

hebrew_text: וּמְנָא תֵּימְרָא דְּאָמְרִינַן הוֹאִיל וְאִישְׁתְּרִי אִישְׁתְּרִי — דְּתַנְיָא: מְצוֹרָע שֶׁחָל שְׁמִינִי שֶׁלּוֹ בָּעֶרֶב הַפֶּסַח, וְרָאָה קֶרִי בּוֹ בַּיּוֹם, וְטָבַל, אָמְרוּ חֲכָמִים: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין טְבוּל יוֹם אַחֵר נִכְנָס, זֶה — נִכְנָס.
human_translation: And from where do you say that we state Since it is permitted, it is permitted? As it is taught a leper whose eighth occurs on the eve of Passover, and he experienced a seminal emission on that day and immersed the Sages said: Although any other who immersed himself that day may not enter this may enter
llm_translation: And count you shall say that we say since and Ishtri Ishtri — as it was taught: A leper who had his eighth day fall on the eve of Passover, and he experienced a seminal emission during the day, and he immersed, the sages said: Even though a tevul yom does not enter, this one enters.

hebrew_text: מוּטָב שֶׁיָּבֹא עֲשֵׂה שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ כָּרֵת וְיִדְחֶה עֲשֵׂה שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ כָּרֵת. וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: דְּבַר תּוֹרָה אֲפִילּוּ עֲשֵׂה לֵית בֵּיהּ,
human_translation: better that a positive mitzva that includes karet , comes and overrides a positive mitzva that does not include karet , And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: By Torah law there is not even a positive mitzva in this
llm_translation: It is better that one should perform a positive commandment that incurs the penalty of excision and set aside a positive commandment that does not incur the penalty of excision. And Rabbi Yochanan said: A matter of Torah, even if it is a positive commandment, does not contain within it the penalty of excision.

hebrew_text: שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיַּעֲמוֹד יְהוֹשָׁפָט בִּקְהַל יְהוּדָה לִפְנֵי הֶחָצֵר הַחֲדָשָׁה״. מַאי ״חָצֵר הַחֲדָשָׁה״? אָמַר (רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן): שֶׁחִדְּשׁוּ בָּהּ דְּבָרִים, וְאָמְרוּ: טְבוּל יוֹם לֹא יִכָּנֵס לְמַחֲנֵה לְוִיָּה.
human_translation: As it is stated: “And Jehoshaphat stood in the congregation of Judah before the new courtyard” What is “the new courtyard”? Rabbi Yoḥanan said: where they issued new matters and said one who immersed himself that day may not enter the camp of the Levites,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: As it is stated: "And Jehoshaphat stood in the congregation of Judah and Jerusalem, in the house of the Lord, before the new court." What is the "new court"? Rabbi Yochanan said: They renewed matters in it, and they said: A tevul yom may not enter the camp of Levi.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר עוּלָּא: מַה טַּעַם? הוֹאִיל וְהוּתַּר לְצָרַעְתּוֹ — הוּתַּר לְקִרְויוֹ. מִי דָּמֵי לִדְעוּלָּא?
human_translation: And Ulla said: What is the reason Since it is permitted for his leprosy, it is permitted with regard to his seminal emission Is comparable to Ulla?
llm_translation: And Ula said: What is the reason? Since he was permitted for his tzara'at, he is permitted for his baldness. Who is comparable to De'ulah?

hebrew_text: תִּינַח הֵיכָא דְּנָשָׂא מֵת וְאַחַר כָּךְ נָשָׂא חַי. דְּמִגּוֹ דְּאִישְׁתְּרִי אִיסּוּר אֵשֶׁת אָח — אִישְׁתְּרִי נָמֵי אִיסּוּר אֲחוֹת אִשָּׁה.
human_translation: well when the deceased married and afterward the living married As since prohibition a brother’s wife was permitted the prohibition a wife’s sister was also permitted.
llm_translation: The case is where one married a woman and then married another woman. Since the prohibition of a brother's wife is like the prohibition of a sister of a wife.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא נָשָׂא חַי, וְאַחַר כָּךְ נָשָׂא מֵת — אִיסּוּר אֲחוֹת אִשָּׁה קָדֵים.
human_translation: However, living married and afterward the deceased married the prohibition a wife’s sister precedes
llm_translation: Rather, he married a living woman, and only afterwards married a deceased one - the prohibition of a woman's sister precedes.

hebrew_text: וַאֲפִילּוּ נָשָׂא מֵת נָמֵי, תִּינַח הֵיכָא דְּנָשָׂא מֵת, וּמֵת, וְאַחַר כָּךְ נָשָׂא חַי — דְּחַזְיָא לֵיהּ דְּבֵינֵי בֵּינֵי. אֶלָּא נָשָׂא מֵת, וְלֹא מֵת, וְאַחַר כָּךְ נָשָׂא חַי — לָא אִיחַזְיָא לֵיהּ כְּלָל.
human_translation: And even the deceased married it well when the deceased married and died, and afterward the surviving married that was fit for him in between, However, the deceased married and did not die and afterward, the living married she was not fit for him at all,
llm_translation: And even if one carried a dead body in front of him, let him place it where he carried the dead body, and he died, and afterwards he carried a live body - for he will see that there is a distinction between them. Rather, if he carried a dead body, and he did not die, and afterwards he carried a live body - he will not see him at all.

hebrew_text: מִי לָא מוֹדֵי עוּלָּא שֶׁאִם רָאָה קֶרִי בְּלֵיל שְׁמִינִי, שֶׁאֵין מַכְנִיס יָדָיו לַבְּהוֹנוֹת, שֶׁלֹּא יָצָא בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁהִיא רְאוּיָה לְהָבִיא בָּהּ קׇרְבָּן.
human_translation: Doesn’t Ulla agree that if experienced a seminal emission on the night of the eighth, that he may not insert his hands to the thumb and big toe that he not emerged at a time that is fitting to bring an offering,
llm_translation: Who does not admit the principle that if one sees a seminal emission on the night of the eighth day, he should not insert his hands into the containers, so that he does not leave at a time when it is fitting to bring a sacrifice.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: כִּי אִיצְטְרִיךְ ״עָלֶיהָ״ — הֵיכָא דְּנָשָׂא מֵת, וּמֵת, וְאַחַר כָּךְ נָשָׂא חַי.
human_translation: Rather, “with her,” is necessary where the deceased married and died, and afterward the living married
llm_translation: Rather: when it is needed "upon it" - in a case where one carried a dead body, and then carried another dead body, and only afterwards carried a living person.

hebrew_text: וְאִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא: אָתְיָא בְּהֶיקֵּישָׁא מִדְּרַבִּי יוֹנָה. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹנָה, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ, אָמַר קְרָא: ״כִּי כׇּל אֲשֶׁר יַעֲשֶׂה מִכֹּל הַתּוֹעֵבוֹת הָאֵלֶּה וְנִכְרְתוּ״, הוּקְשׁוּ כׇּל הָעֲרָיוֹת כּוּלָּן לְאֵשֶׁת אָח: מָה אֵשֶׁת אָח — שַׁרְיָא, אַף כׇּל עֲרָיוֹת — נָמֵי שַׁרְיָין, כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״עָלֶיהָ״.
human_translation: And if you wish, say is derived from the juxtaposition of Rabbi Yona. As Rabbi Yona said, and some say Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua: The verse states: “For whoever shall do any of these abominations, shall be cut off all of with whom relations are forbidden are juxtaposed with a brother’s wife. just as a brother’s wife is permitted so too, all with whom relations are forbidden are likewise permitted. the Merciful One writes: “With her,”
llm_translation: If you wish, say: It was taught in a baraita from Rabbi Yonah, for Rabbi Yonah said, and it was also taught by Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, who said: "For whoever commits any of these abominations shall be cut off," all the forbidden relationships are connected to a sister of a brother. Just as a sister of a brother is permitted, so too all forbidden relationships are also permitted. The Merciful One wrote concerning her.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַחָא מִדִּפְתִּי לְרָבִינָא: מִכְּדִי כֹּל עֲרָיוֹת, אִיכָּא לְאַקּוֹשִׁינְהוּ לְאֵשֶׁת אָח, וְאִיכָּא לְאַקּוֹשִׁינְהוּ לַאֲחוֹת אִשָּׁה. מַאי חָזֵית דְּאַקֵּשְׁתְּ לַאֲחוֹת אִשָּׁה? אַקְּשִׁינְהוּ לְאֵשֶׁת אָח!
human_translation: Rav Aḥa of Difti said to Ravina: Since all with whom relations are forbidden can be juxtaposed with a brother’s wife and can be juxtaposed with a wife’s sister, what did you see that you juxtaposed them with a wife’s sister? Juxtapose them with a brother’s wife.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Acha, from Difti to Ravina: Since all forbidden relationships, there is to prohibit him to the wife of his brother, and there is to prohibit him to the sister of a woman. What did you see that you sought to the sister of a woman? Seek to the wife of his brother!

hebrew_text: אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: לְקוּלָּא וְחוּמְרָא — לְחוּמְרָא מַקְּשִׁינַן. אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: הָכָא תְּרֵי אִיסּוּרֵי, וְהָכָא תְּרֵי אִיסּוּרֵי — וּתְרֵי מִתְּרֵי יָלְפִינַן. אֲבָל הָכָא חֲדָא אִיסּוּרָא — וּתְרֵי מֵחֲדָא לָא יָלְפִינַן.
human_translation: If you wish, say to a lenient and a stringent we juxtapose to the stringent ruling, If you wish, say Here, two prohibitions, and there, two prohibitions. And one derive two from two However, here, one prohibition and one may not derive two from one.
llm_translation: If you wish, say: In leniency and stringency - in stringency we ask. If you wish, say: Here we have two prohibitions, and here we have two prohibitions - and two from two we derive. But here, one prohibition - and two from one we do not derive.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: עֶרְוָה לָא צְרִיכָא קְרָא, דְּאֵין עֲשֵׂה דּוֹחֶה לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ כָּרֵת. כִּי אִיצְטְרִיךְ קְרָא לְמֵיסַר צָרָה.
human_translation: Rava said a forbidden relation not necessary a verse as a positive mitzva does not override a prohibition that includes karet . the verse is necessary to prohibit a rival wife,
llm_translation: Rava said: Nakedness not needed verse, for positive command does not override negative command that carries with it the penalty of excision. For a verse was necessary to permit a difficulty.

hebrew_text: וְעֶרְוָה לָא צְרִיכָא קְרָא? וְהָא תַּנְיָא: אֵין לִי אֶלָּא הִיא!
human_translation: And a forbidden relation not necessary a verse But isn’t it taught I have nothing other this
llm_translation: "And nakedness not need a verse? And this teaches: I have only it!"

hebrew_text: מִשּׁוּם צָרָתָהּ.
human_translation: due to her rival wife,
llm_translation: Because of her distress.

hebrew_text: וְהָא קָתָנֵי: אֵין לִי אֶלָּא הֵן! מִשּׁוּם צָרוֹתֵיהֶן.
human_translation: But it is taught I have nothing other these due to their rival wives.
llm_translation: And it was taught: I have nothing except "yes"! Because of their troubles.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: ״וְלָקַח״ ״וּלְקָחָהּ״, ״וְיִבֵּם״ ״וְיִבְּמָהּ״ — לֶאֱסוֹר צָרוֹת וַעֲרָיוֹת.
human_translation: Come hear Rabbi says Have intercourse, “Have intercourse with her,” And consummate the levirate marriage, “And consummate the levirate marriage with her.” to prohibit rival wives and with whom relations are forbidden.
llm_translation: Come and hear: Rabbi says, "And he shall take" and "and she shall be taken," "and he shall marry" and "and she shall be married" — to prohibit rival wives and forbidden relationships.

hebrew_text: אֵימָא: לֶאֱסוֹר צָרוֹת שֶׁל עֲרָיוֹת. וְהָא תְּרֵי קְרָאֵי קָנָסֵיב לֵיהּ, מַאי לָאו: חַד לְעֶרְוָה וְחַד לְצָרָה?
human_translation: say: To prohibit rival wives of with whom relations are forbidden, But he brought two verse, What, is it not one of with whom relations are forbidden and one for a rival wife?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Eima: Le'esor tzarot shel arayot. Veha teirei keraei kanaseiv lei, mai lav: Chad le'erva ve'chad le'tzara?" English translation: "Say: To prohibit the pains of forbidden relationships. And there are two verses that establish it, what is it not: One for nakedness and one for distress?"

hebrew_text: לָא, אִידִי וְאִידִי לְצָרָה: חַד לְמֵיסַר צָרָה בִּמְקוֹם מִצְוָה, וְחַד לְמִישְׁרֵי צָרָה שֶׁלֹּא בִּמְקוֹם מִצְוָה.
human_translation: No, this and that are for a rival wife, One to prohibit a rival wife in a place where the mitzva and one to permit a rival wife in a place where the mitzva not
llm_translation: Not so, both this and that for distress: one for a distress that occurs in a place of commandment, and one for a distress that does not occur in a place of commandment.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא — ״וְיִבֵּם״ ״וְיִבְּמָהּ״: בִּמְקוֹם יִיבּוּם הוּא דַּאֲסִירָא צָרָה, שֶׁלֹּא בִּמְקוֹם יִיבּוּם — שַׁרְיָא צָרָה.
human_translation: What is the reason And consummate the levirate marriage, “And consummate the levirate marriage with her.” It is in a place where levirate marriage that a rival wife is prohibited; in a place where the levirate marriage not a rival wife is permitted.
llm_translation: What is the reason? "And he shall marry" "and she shall be married": In the place where levirate marriage is prohibited, the co-wife is prohibited; in the place where levirate marriage is permitted, the co-wife is permitted.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: מַתְנִיתִין נָמֵי דַּיְקָא, דְּקָתָנֵי: חֲמֵשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה נָשִׁים פּוֹטְרוֹת צָרוֹתֵיהֶן. וְאִילּוּ ״פְּטוּרוֹת וּפוֹטְרוֹת״ לָא קָתָנֵי. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: The mishna is also precisely as it teaches: Fifteen women exempt their rival wives, whereas Are exempt and exempt is not taught. Conclude from this
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said: The Mishnah also supports this, as it teaches: Fifteen women exempt their co-wives. But if it had said "exempt and exempt," it would not have been taught. Learn from this.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי שְׁנָא עֶרְוָה דְּלָא צְרִיכָא קְרָא — דְּאֵין עֲשֵׂה דּוֹחֶה לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ כָּרֵת? צָרָה נָמֵי לָא תִּיבְּעֵי קְרָא — מִשּׁוּם דְּאֵין עֲשֵׂה דּוֹחֶה לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ כָּרֵת!
human_translation: And what is different a forbidden relation that verse is not necessary that a positive mitzva does not override a prohibition that entails karet . a rival wife also not require an verse, due to a positive mitzva does not override a prohibition that entails karet .
llm_translation: And what is the difference regarding ervah that the verse is not necessary? Because a positive commandment does not override a negative commandment that carries the punishment of karet? Similarly, regarding tzara, the verse is also not needed - because a positive commandment does not override a negative commandment that carries the punishment of karet!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַחָא בַּר בִּיבִי מָר לְרָבִינָא: הָכִי קָאָמְרִינַן מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרָבָא: צָרָה נָמֵי לָא אִיצְטְרִיךְ קְרָא. כִּי אִיצְטְרִיךְ קְרָא
human_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Beivai Mar, said to Ravina this is what we say in the name of Rava: a rival wife too, a verse is not necessary, The verse is necessary
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Acha bar Bivi said to Ravina: This is what we say in the name of Rava: A verse is not necessary for a difficulty. When a difficulty arises, a verse is necessary.

hebrew_text: לְמִישְׁרֵי צָרָה שֶׁלֹּא בִּמְקוֹם מִצְוָה. מַאי טַעְמָא — אָמַר קָרָא ״עָלֶיהָ״: בִּמְקוֹם ״עָלֶיהָ״ הוּא דַּאֲסִירָא, שֶׁלֹּא בִּמְקוֹם עָלֶיהָ — שַׁרְיָא.
human_translation: to permit a rival wife in a place where the mitzva not What is the reason, The verse states: “With her.” it is in a place with her” is that prohibited, in a place with her” is not permitted.
llm_translation: Regarding a straight path of distress that is not in a place of commandment. What is the reason? - The verse says "upon it": in a place "upon it" it is prohibited, not in a place not "upon it" - it is permitted.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָמֵי בַּר חָמָא לְרָבָא: אֵימָא עֶרְוָה גּוּפֵיהּ שֶׁלֹּא בִּמְקוֹם מִצְוָה תִּישְׁתְּרֵי! וְלָאו קַל וָחוֹמֶר הוּא? בִּמְקוֹם מִצְוָה אֲסִירָא — שֶׁלֹּא בִּמְקוֹם מִצְוָה שַׁרְיָא?!
human_translation: Rami bar Ḥama said to Rava: say a forbidden relative herself should be permitted in a place mitzva not And is it not an a fortiori prohibited in a place a mitzva, permitted in a place no mitzva?
llm_translation: He said to him, Ramei bar Ḥama to Rava: "Say, is nakedness itself not permitted except in a place of commandment? Is it not a fortiori? In a place of commandment it is prohibited - so in a place that is not a commandment, is it permitted?!"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: צָרָה תּוֹכִיחַ, דְּבִמְקוֹם מִצְוָה אֲסִירָא וְשֶׁלֹּא בִּמְקוֹם מִצְוָה שַׁרְיָא! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: עָלֶיךָ אָמַר קְרָא ״בְּחַיֶּיהָ״ — כֹּל שֶׁבְּחַיֶּיהָ.
human_translation: said to a rival wife can prove as in a place a mitzva she is prohibited and in a place no mitzva she is permitted. said to With regard to your the verse states: in her lifetime” all is in the lifetime
llm_translation: He said to him: Distress will prove it, for in a place of command it is forbidden, but in a place not of command it is permitted! He said to him: Upon you the verse said "in her life" - everything that is in her life.

hebrew_text: הַאי ״בְּחַיֶּיהָ״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְמַעוֹטֵי לְאַחַר מִיתָה! הָהִיא מִ״וְאִשָּׁה אֶל אֲחוֹתָהּ״ נָפְקָא.
human_translation: This “in her lifetime” is necessary, to exclude the time after death, That is derived from a woman to her sister”
llm_translation: This "in her lifetime" he requires it to exclude after death! That one "from a woman to her sister" is derived.

hebrew_text: אִי מִ״וְאִשָּׁה אֶל אֲחוֹתָהּ״, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: נִתְגָּרְשָׁה — שַׁרְיָא, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״בְּחַיֶּיהָ״ — כֹּל שֶׁבְּחַיֶּיהָ, דְּאַף עַל גַּב דְּנִתְגָּרְשָׁה לֹא!
human_translation: If from “a woman to her sister,” I would say if she were divorced, is permitted. the verse states: “In her lifetime,” all that in her lifetime. This that although she is divorced, not
llm_translation: "If 'and a woman to her sister,' I would say: she was divorced - permitted, the Talmud teaches: 'in her lifetime' - all that is in her lifetime, even though she was divorced, no!"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב הוּנָא בַּר תַּחְלִיפָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרָבָא: תְּרֵי קְרָאֵי כְּתִיבִי. כְּתִיב: ״אִשָּׁה אֶל אֲחוֹתָהּ לֹא תִקָּח לִצְרוֹר״, וּכְתִיב: ״לְגַלּוֹת עֶרְוָתָהּ״, דַּחֲדָא מַשְׁמַע. הָא כֵּיצַד? בִּמְקוֹם מִצְוָה — שְׁתֵּיהֶן אֲסוּרוֹת, שֶׁלֹּא בִּמְקוֹם מִצְוָה — הִיא אֲסוּרָה וְצָרָתָהּ מוּתֶּרֶת.
human_translation: Rather, Rav Huna bar Taḥlifa said in the name of Rava: Two verses are written, It is written: “And you shall not take a woman to her sister, to be a rival [ litzror ],” And it is written: “To uncover her nakedness” which means one How is it In a place a mitzva both are prohibited. In a place no mitzva is prohibited but her rival wife is permitted.
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Huna, son of Tachlifa, said in the name of Rava: Two verses are written. It is written: "A woman to her sister you shall not take, to be a rival," and it is written: "To uncover her nakedness," indicating one exclusion. How so? In a place of commandment - both are forbidden, but not in a place of commandment - she is forbidden, and her rival is permitted.

hebrew_text: אֵיפוֹךְ אֲנָא: בִּמְקוֹם מִצְוָה — הִיא אֲסוּרָה וְצָרָתָהּ מוּתֶּרֶת, וְשֶׁלֹּא בִּמְקוֹם מִצְוָה — שְׁתֵּיהֶן אֲסוּרוֹת. אִם כֵּן, לֹא יֵאָמֵר ״עָלֶיהָ״.
human_translation: I reverse this In a place a mitzva, is prohibited and her rival wife is permitted, and in a place no mitzva, both of them are prohibited. If so, let not say “with her,”
llm_translation: Opposite I: In a place of commandment — it is forbidden and its need is permitted, and not in a place of commandment — both are forbidden. If so, it should not be said "upon it."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אָשֵׁי לְרַב כָּהֲנָא: מִמַּאי דְּהַאי ״עָלֶיהָ״ לְאִיסּוּרָא, דִּלְמָא לְהֶתֵּירָא, וְהָכִי קָאָמַר רַחֲמָנָא: ״אִשָּׁה אֶל אֲחוֹתָהּ לֹא תִקָּח לִצְרוֹר״, לֹא הִיא וְלֹא צָרָתָהּ — שֶׁלֹּא בִּמְקוֹם ״עָלֶיהָ״, אֲבָל בִּמְקוֹם ״עָלֶיהָ״ — שְׁתֵּיהֶן מוּתָּרוֹת.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said to Rav Kahana: From where that this “with her,” to prohibit, Perhaps to permit, and this is what the Merciful One is saying: “You shall not take a woman to her sister, to be a rival” neither her nor her rival wife. in a place where with her” not However, in a place where “with her” does apply both of them are permitted.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Ashe to Rav Kahana: From what is derived this "upon her" in the verse? For prohibition, perhaps it is derived, or for permission? And thus says the Merciful One: "A woman to her sister you shall not take to be a rival wife," neither she nor her rival — not in the place of "upon her," but in the place of "upon her" — both of them are permitted.

hebrew_text: אִם כֵּן, ״לְגַלּוֹת עֶרְוָה״ דַּחֲדָא הֵיכִי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ? אִי בִּמְקוֹם מִצְוָה — שְׁתֵּיהֶן מוּתָּרוֹת, אִי שֶׁלֹּא בִּמְקוֹם מִצְוָה — שְׁתֵּיהֶן אֲסוּרוֹת?!
human_translation: If so, “to uncover her nakedness” to one what circumstances you find If in a place a mitzva, they are both permitted; if in a place no mitzva, they are both forbidden.
llm_translation: If so, "to uncover nakedness" of one, how does she find it? If in a place of commandment - both are permitted, if not in a place of commandment - both are forbidden?!

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא. רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: ״וְלָקַח״ ״וּלְקָחָהּ״, ״וְיִבֵּם״ ״וְיִבְּמָהּ״, לֶאֱסוֹר צָרוֹת וַעֲרָיוֹת. מִידֵי ״צָרוֹת״ כְּתִיבָא הָכָא? וְעוֹד: צָרוֹת מִ״לִּצְרוֹר״ נָפְקָא!
human_translation: the itself. Rabbi says: have intercourse, “have intercourse with her.” and consummate the levirate marriage, “and consummate the levirate marriage with her.” to prohibit rival wives and with whom relations are forbidden. Are rival wives written here? And furthermore: rival wives is derived “To be a rival wife [ litzror ],”
llm_translation: Body. Rabbi says: "and he shall take" "and he shall take her", "and he shall marry" "and he shall marry her", to prohibit rival wives and forbidden relationships. From the word "rival wives" is it written here? And furthermore: rival wives come from the word "to bind"!

hebrew_text: ״לִצְרוֹר״ מַפֵּיק לֵיהּ רַבִּי לְכִדְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן.
human_translation: Rabbi derives from “to be a rival wife,” in accordance with that of Rabbi Shimon.
llm_translation: "To bind" Rabbi extracted it to Rabbi Shimon.

hebrew_text: צָרָה הָכָא כְּתִיב? הָכִי קָאָמַר: אִם כֵּן, לֵימָא קְרָא ״וְלָקַח״, מַאי ״וּלְקָחָהּ״ — כֹּל הֵיכָא דְּאִיכָּא תְּרֵי לִקּוּחִין, דְּאִי בָּעֵי נָסֵיב הַאי וְאִי בָּעֵי נָסֵיב הַאי — שַׁרְיָא. וְאִי לָא — תַּרְוַיְיהוּ אֲסִירִין.
human_translation: Are rival wives written here? this is what he is saying: If so, let the verse state Have intercourse. What is “have intercourse with her”? Anywhere that there are two having intercourse, that if he wants he may marry this one, and if he wants he may marry that one, permitted. And if not they are both prohibited,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Is it written "tzarah" here? This is what he is saying: If so, let us say the verse "and he shall take," what is "and he shall take her" - wherever there are two acquisitions, whether he wants this one or he wants that one - it is permitted. And if not - they are both forbidden.

hebrew_text: ״וְיִבְּמָהּ״ — בִּמְקוֹם יִיבּוּם הוּא דַּאֲסִירָא צָרָה, שֶׁלֹּא בִּמְקוֹם יִיבּוּם — שַׁרְיָא צָרָה. וְרַבָּנַן, הַאי ״וּלְקָחָהּ״ — מַאי עָבְדִי לֵיהּ?
human_translation: “And consummate the levirate marriage with her,” It is in a place levirate marriage that a rival wife is prohibited, in a place levirate marriage not a rival wife is permitted. And the Rabbis, what do they do with this “have intercourse with her”?
llm_translation: "and yibmah" - in the place of yibum it is forbidden for the co-wife, not in the place of yibum - permitted for the co-wife. And the Rabbis, this "and he shall take her" - what does it do for him?

hebrew_text: מִיבְּעֵי לְהוּ לְכִדְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר חֲנִינָא. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר חֲנִינָא: ״וּלְקָחָהּ״ — מְלַמֵּד שֶׁמְּגָרְשָׁה בְּגֵט וּמַחְזִירָהּ. ״וְיִבְּמָהּ״ — עַל כׇּרְחָהּ.
human_translation: They need this for that which Rabbi Yosei bar Ḥanina as Rabbi Yosei bar Ḥanina said: “And have intercourse with her” teaches that he divorces her with a bill of divorce and he remarry her “and consummate the levirate marriage with her,” against her will.
llm_translation: They asked according to Rabbi Yosei bar Hanina. For Rabbi Yosei bar Hanina said: "And he shall take her" - teaches that he divorces her with a bill of divorce and returns her. "And he shall marry her" - against her will.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי? דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר חֲנִינָא — מִ״לְּאִשָּׁה״ נָפְקָא, עַל כׇּרְחָהּ — מִ״יְּבָמָה יָבֹא עָלֶיהָ״ נָפְקָא.
human_translation: And Rabbi That Rabbi Yosei bar Ḥanina, is derived from to be his wife” against her will is derived from “her brother-in-law will have intercourse with her,”
llm_translation: And Rabbi? Of Rabbi Yosei bar Chanina — from "a woman" it emerges, against her will — "he shall come upon her" it emerges.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי, הַאי ״עָלֶיהָ״ מַאי עָבֵיד לֵיהּ? מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְכִדְתַנְיָא: אֵין חַיָּיבִין בֵּית דִּין אֶלָּא עַל דָּבָר שֶׁזְּדוֹנוֹ כָּרֵת וְשִׁגְגָתוֹ חַטָּאת. וְכֵן הַמָּשִׁיחַ.
human_translation: And what does Rabbi do with this “with her”? He needs it for that which is taught The court is obligated only for a matter whose intentional karet and whose unwitting a sin-offering. And similarly, the anointed
llm_translation: Rabbi, this "upon it," what does he do with it? He should bring it according to what is taught: The court is only liable for a matter that its intentional transgression is punishable by excision and its unintentional transgression is atonable. And so too the anointed one.

hebrew_text: וְלֹא בַּעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה, אֶלָּא עַל דָּבָר שֶׁחַיָּיבִין עַל זְדוֹנוֹ כָּרֵת וְשִׁגְגָתוֹ חַטָּאת. וּתְנַן נָמֵי: כׇּל מִצְוָה שֶׁבַּתּוֹרָה שֶׁחַיָּיבִין עַל זְדוֹנוֹ כָּרֵת וְעַל שִׁגְגָתוֹ חַטָּאת, יָחִיד — מֵבִיא כִּשְׂבָּה אוֹ שְׂעִירָה, נָשִׂיא — מֵבִיא שָׂעִיר, מָשִׁיחַ וּבֵית דִּין — מְבִיאִין פַּר.
human_translation: And for idolatrous worship only a matter that for its intentional one is liable to karet and for its unwitting a sin-offering. And we also learned any mitzva in the Torah for whose intentional one is liable to karet and for its unwitting a sin-offering, individual brings a ewe or a she-goat. a Nasi , he brings a goat an anointed or the court, they bring a bull.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And not with foreign worship, rather regarding a matter for which one is liable for intentional transgression - excision, and for unintentional transgression - sin-offering. And we learned in a Mishnah: Every commandment in the Torah for which one is liable for intentional transgression - excision, and for unintentional transgression - sin-offering, an individual - brings a female goat or a female sheep, a leader - brings a male goat, the anointed priest and the court - bring a bull.

hebrew_text: וּבַעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה, יָחִיד נָשִׂיא וּמָשִׁיחַ — מְבִיאִין שְׂעִירָה, צִבּוּר — מְבִיאִים פַּר וְשָׂעִיר, פַּר לְעוֹלָה וְשָׂעִיר לְחַטָּאת. מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי?
human_translation: And involving idolatrous worship, individual, a Nasi , and an anointed bring a she-goat, a community brings a bull and a goat, bull as a burnt-offering and goat as a sin-offering. From where are these matters,
llm_translation: In the service of idolatry, an individual, a prince, and a messiah - they bring a he-goat; the community - they bring a bull and a he-goat, a bull for a burnt offering and a he-goat for a sin offering. From where are these matters derived?

hebrew_text: דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״וְנוֹדְעָה הַחַטָּאת אֲשֶׁר חָטְאוּ עָלֶיהָ״, רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: נֶאֱמַר כָּאן ״עָלֶיהָ״, וְנֶאֱמַר לְהַלָּן ״עָלֶיהָ״. מָה לְהַלָּן דָּבָר שֶׁחַיָּיבִים עַל זְדוֹנוֹ כָּרֵת וְעַל שִׁגְגָתוֹ חַטָּאת, אַף כָּאן דָּבָר שֶׁחַיָּיבִין עַל זְדוֹנוֹ כָּרֵת וְעַל שִׁגְגָתוֹ חַטָּאת.
human_translation: As the Sages taught “And the sin by which they have sinned is known” Rabbi says: It is stated here, “By which [ aleha ],” and it is stated there, “Unto [ aleha ].” Just as there, a matter that for its intentional one is liable to karet and for its unwitting a sin-offering, so too here, a matter that for its intentional one is liable to karet and for its unwitting a sin-offering.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: "And the sin of which they have sinned against it shall be known," Rabbi says: It is stated here "against it," and it is stated elsewhere "against it." Just as there, a matter for which one is liable for intentional transgression is excision, and for unintentional transgression, a sin-offering, so too here, a matter for which one is liable for intentional transgression is excision, and for unintentional transgression, a sin-offering.

hebrew_text: אַשְׁכְּחַן צִבּוּר, מָשִׁיחַ מְנָלַן? דִּכְתִיב בְּמָשִׁיחַ: ״לְאַשְׁמַת הָעָם״, הֲרֵי מָשִׁיחַ כְּצִבּוּר.
human_translation: We found from where do we an anointed As it is written to an anointed so as to bring guilt on the people” an anointed like the community.
llm_translation: We find the congregation, where is the Messiah from? As it is written regarding the Messiah: "For the transgression of my people," behold the Messiah is like the congregation.

hebrew_text: יָחִיד וְנָשִׂיא — אָתְיָא ״מִצְוֹת״ ״מִצְוֹת״.
human_translation: individual and a Nasi This is derived “mitzvot” “mitzvot”
llm_translation: Individual and leader - it was taught: "mitzvot" "mitzvot."

human_translation: And your mnemonic Died, was born, entered into levirate marriage, died, was born, entered into levirate marriage. died, was born, and entered into levirate marriage died was born, and entered into levirate marriage
llm_translation: And your mnemonic is: death, born, and yibum. Death, born, and yibum.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְרַבִּי הָנֵי כְּלָלֵי לֵית לֵיהּ. רַב אַדָּא קַרְחִינָא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב כָּהֲנָא אָמַר מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרָבָא: לְעוֹלָם אִית לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי הָנֵי כְּלָלֵי, וְהָכִי קָאָמַר לֵיהּ: אִמּוֹ אֲנוּסַת אָבִיו — בַּחֲדָא מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ, בְּתַרְתֵּי לָא קָמַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ.
human_translation: Rather, Rabbi does not hold these general statements Rav Adda Karḥina, before Rav Kahana, said in the name of Rava: Actually, Rabbi does hold these general statements And this is what said his mother raped by his father, you find this with one you cannot find it with two.
llm_translation: Rather, for Rabbi Hanei, general principles are not applicable. Rav Adda Karḥina stood before Rav Kahana and said in the name of Rava: "Indeed, for Rabbi Hanei, general principles are applicable, and thus he said to him: 'If his mother was raped by his father - in one case, she is forgotten, in two cases, she is not forgotten.'"

hebrew_text: אִי יַעֲקֹב שְׁתֵּי אֲחָיוֹת אָנַס, אֲחוֹתָהּ שֶׁהִיא יְבִמְתָּהּ — מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ, הָאֲסוּרָה לָזֶה מוּתֶּרֶת לָזֶה — לָא מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ.
human_translation: If Ya’akov, raped two sisters you find her sister who is her sister-in-law, you cannot find She who is forbidden to this one is permitted to that one.
llm_translation: Jacob, two sisters, he raped, her sister who is her yevamah — forgets her, the forbidden to this one permitted to this one — not forgets her.

hebrew_text: וְאִי שְׁתֵּי נׇכְרִיּוֹת אָנַס, הָאֲסוּרָה לָזֶה מוּתֶּרֶת לָזֶה — מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ, אֲחוֹתָהּ שֶׁהִיא יְבִמְתָּהּ — לָא מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ.
human_translation: And if raped two unrelated women, you find She who is forbidden to this one is permitted to that one, you do not find Her sister who is her sister-in-law.
llm_translation: And if two non-Jewish women were raped, one forbidden to this one is permitted to this one - she forgets her, her sister who is her yevamah - she does not forget her.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: לְעוֹלָם לֵית לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי הָנֵי כְּלָלֵי, וּבִפְלוּגְתָּא קָמַיְירֵי, וּמַאי ״כִּמְדוּמֶּה אֲנִי שֶׁאֵין לוֹ מוֹחַ בְּקׇדְקֳדוֹ״ דְּקָאָמַר לֵיהּ —
human_translation: Rav Ashi stated Actually, Rabbi does not hold these general statements and does deal with dispute. what is It seems to me that he has no brain in his head, that said to
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: Always there is not to him to Rabbi Hanei general principles, and in a dispute they argue, and what is "like a mute person who has no teeth in his mouth" that he says to him —

hebrew_text: הָכִי קָאָמַר לֵיהּ: מַאי טַעְמָא לָא דָּיְיקַתְּ מַתְנִיתִין? דְּמַתְנִיתִין רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הִיא [דְּאָסַר בַּאֲנוּסַת אָבִיו].
human_translation: this is what said What is the reason you were not precise the mishna? As the mishna is Rabbi Yehuda, who prohibited of a woman raped by one’s father.
llm_translation: So he said to him: What is the reason that you did not reconcile the Mishnah? Because the Mishnah is that of Rabbi Yehuda who prohibits with the rape of his father's betrothed.

hebrew_text: דְּקָתָנֵי: שֵׁשׁ עֲרָיוֹת חֲמוּרוֹת מֵאֵלּוּ, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהֵן נְשׂוּאוֹת לַאֲחֵרִים צָרוֹתֵיהֶן מוּתָּרוֹת: אִמּוֹ, וְאֵשֶׁת אָבִיו, וַאֲחוֹת אָבִיו. מַאי אִמּוֹ? אִילֵּימָא נְשׂוּאַת אָבִיו — הַיְינוּ אֵשֶׁת אָבִיו!
human_translation: As it teaches Six with whom relations are forbidden are more severe than these because they marry others their rival wives are permitted. His mother, his father’s wife, and his father’s sister. What is His mother? If we say married to his father, this is the same His father’s wife,
llm_translation: It was taught: Six women are more stringent than these, because they are married to others, their rivals are permitted: his mother, his father's wife, and his paternal aunt. What is meant by "his mother"? If you say his father's wife - that is his mother!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לָאו — אֲנוּסַת אָבִיו. וְקָתָנֵי: מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהֵן נְשׂוּאוֹת לַאֲחֵרִים: לַאֲחֵרִים אִין, לָאַחִין לָא. מַאן שָׁמְעַתְּ לֵיהּ דְּאִית לֵיהּ הַאי סְבָרָא — רַבִּי יְהוּדָה, דְּאָסַר בַּאֲנוּסַת אָבִיו. מִשּׁוּם הָכִי לָא תָּנֵי לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rather, is it not a woman raped by his father? And it is taught because they may marry others, Others, yes; the brothers, no. Who did you hear who holds this conclusion Rabbi Yehuda who prohibits a woman raped by his father. Due to that was not taught
llm_translation: Rather, no — it is the rape of her father. And it was taught: because they are married to others: to others no, to brothers no. Who heard this opinion — Rabbi Yehuda, who prohibited the rape of her father. Therefore, it does not teach it to him.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבִינָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה נָמֵי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ — דְּאִי עֲבַר וּנְסֵיב? ״דְּאִי״ לָא קָתָנֵי.
human_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: Even according to Rabbi Yehuda you find this What if one transgressed and married does not teach what if,
llm_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: To Rabbi Yehuda Nami, you find for her - that if he transgressed and married her? "If" is not taught.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אָשֵׁי לְרַב כָּהֲנָא, בְּלָא ״דְּאִי״ נָמֵי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ: יַעֲקֹב אָנַס כַּלָּתוֹ וְהוֹלִיד מִמֶּנָּה בֵּן, וּמֵת [רְאוּבֵן] בְּלֹא בָּנִים. וּנְפַלָה לַהּ קַמֵּי בְּרַהּ, וּמִיגּוֹ דְּאִיהִי אֲסִירָה — צָרָתָהּ נָמֵי אֲסִירָה.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said to Rav Kahana: Even without What if, you find Ya’akov, raped his daughter-in-law, from whom he fathered a son. And Reuven, died childless. And would come before her son And since she is forbidden, her rival wife is also forbidden.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Ashi to Rav Kahana, without the word "if" also you find: Jacob forced his daughter-in-law and begot a son from her, and Reuben died without children. And she fell before him in his house, and from the place where she was captive - her distress was also captive.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בְּאַחְוָתָה דְּהֶתֵּירָא קָמַיְירֵי, בְּאַחְוָתָה דְּאִיסּוּרָא לָא קָמַיְירֵי. וְאַף עַל פִּי כֵן, בַּדְקַהּ לֵוִי בְּמַתְנִיתֵיהּ.
human_translation: said to deals with legitimate brothers, it does not deal with cases of illegitimate brothers. Nevertheless, Levi established this in his mishnayot .
llm_translation: He said to him: In the sisterhood of permissibility they are lenient, in the sisterhood of prohibition they are not lenient. Nevertheless, Levi checked in his Mishnah.

hebrew_text: דְּתָנֵי לֵוִי: אִמּוֹ, פְּעָמִים פּוֹטֶרֶת צָרָתָהּ, וּפְעָמִים אֵינָהּ פּוֹטֶרֶת צָרָתָהּ. כֵּיצַד? הָיְתָה אִמּוֹ נְשׂוּאַת אָבִיו, וְנִשֵּׂאת לְאָחִיו מֵאָבִיו, וּמֵת — זוֹ הִיא אִמּוֹ שֶׁאֵין פּוֹטֶרֶת צָרָתָהּ.
human_translation: As Levi taught his mother, at times she exempts her rival wife, and at times she does not exempt her rival wife How so? his mother was married to his father and married paternal brother, who died, this is His mother who does not exempt her rival wife.
llm_translation: Levi taught: His mother, sometimes she exempts her from her obligation of tzara'at, and sometimes she does not exempt her from her obligation of tzara'at. How so? If his mother was married to his father, and then married his brother from his father, and then the father dies — this is his mother who does not exempt her from her obligation of tzara'at.

hebrew_text: הָיְתָה אִמּוֹ אֲנוּסַת אָבִיו, וְנִשֵּׂאת לְאָחִיו מֵאָבִיו, וּמֵת — זוֹ הִיא אִמּוֹ שֶׁפּוֹטֶרֶת צָרָתָהּ.
human_translation: his mother was a woman raped by his father and married his paternal brother, and died, this is his mother who exempts her rival wife.
llm_translation: If his mother was forced by his father, and she marries his brother from his father, and the father dies - this is his mother who is exempt from her rival.

hebrew_text: וְאַף עַל פִּי שֶׁשָּׁנוּ חֲכָמִים בְּמִשְׁנָתֵנוּ ״חֲמֵשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה״, יֵשׁ לָנוּ לְהוֹסִיף שֵׁשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה כְּגוֹן זוֹ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: לְלֵוִי דַּאֲמַר ״דְּאִי״ נָמֵי קָתָנֵי — לִתְנֵי: הַחוֹלֵץ לִיבִמְתּוֹ וְחָזַר וְקִדְּשָׁהּ, וּמֵת בְּלֹא בָּנִים, דְּמִגּוֹ דְּאִיהִי אֲסוּרָה — צָרָתָהּ נָמֵי אֲסִירָא!
human_translation: And although the Sages taught in the mishna: Fifteen we must add a sixteenth for example, Reish Lakish said to Rabbi Yoḥanan: According to Levi, who said teaches even What if, let teach one who performs ḥalitza with his yevama and went back and betrothed her, and died childless. As, since she is forbidden her rival wife is also forbidden.
llm_translation: And even though the sages in our Mishnah have changed it to "fifteen," we should add another six, such as this one. Reish Lakish said to Rabbi Yochanan: According to Levi who said, "If he also taught it," let him teach: If a man performs chalitzah with his yevamah and then goes back and marries her, and he dies childless, since she is forbidden to him - her tzarah is also forbidden!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לְפִי שֶׁאֵינָהּ בְּצָרַת צָרָה.
human_translation: said to because does not of a rival wife of a rival wife.
llm_translation: He said to him: Because she is not in a time of distress.

hebrew_text: וְלֵימָא לֵיהּ: חַיָּיבֵי לָאוִין הִיא, וְחַיָּיבֵי לָאוִין בְּנֵי חֲלִיצָה וְיִבּוּם נִינְהוּ.
human_translation: And let say to it is liable for prohibition, and those liable for a prohibition are in ḥalitza and levirate marriage.
llm_translation: And say to him: It is obligations of prohibitions, and obligations of prohibitions are the sons of halitzah and yibum they are.

hebrew_text: לִדְבָרָיו קָאָמַר לֵיהּ: לְדִידִי — חַיָּיבֵי לָאוִין הֵם, וְחַיָּיבֵי לָאוִין בְּנֵי חֲלִיצָה וְיִבּוּם נִינְהוּ. אֶלָּא לְדִידָךְ — חַיָּיבֵי כָּרֵיתוֹת נִינְהוּ. לְפִי שֶׁאֵינָן בְּצָרַת צָרָה.
human_translation: is speaking in accordance with the statement of to my they are liable for a prohibition, and those liable for a prohibition are in ḥalitza and levirate marriage. However, to your those are liable to karet , because does not of a rival wife of a rival wife.
llm_translation: He said to him: According to my opinion - they are liable for negative commandments, and they are liable for negative commandments in the cases of halitzah and levirate marriage. But according to your opinion - they are liable for karet punishments. Because they are not in a situation of distress.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר: הַחוֹלֵץ לִיבִמְתּוֹ וְחָזַר וְקִדְּשָׁהּ, אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: הוּא — אֵין חַיָּיב עַל הַחֲלוּצָה כָּרֵת,
human_translation: It was stated: one who performs ḥalitza with his yevama and went back and betrothed her, Reish Lakish said: is not liable to karet for the yevama who performed ḥalitza [ ḥalutza ].
llm_translation: It was stated: one who performs chalitzah with his yevamah and then goes back and betroths her, Reish Lakish said: he — is not liable for chalitzah as a penalty.

hebrew_text: וְהָאַחִין — חַיָּיבִין עַל הַחֲלוּצָה כָּרֵת. עַל הַצָּרָה, בֵּין הוּא וּבֵין הָאַחִים — חַיָּיבִין עַל הַצָּרָה כָּרֵת.
human_translation: And the brothers are liable to karet for a ḥalutza . With regard to the rival wife both and the brothers are liable to karet for the rival wife,
llm_translation: The brothers - liable for removal - excision. For distress, whether he and the brothers - liable for distress - excision.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: בֵּין הוּא וּבֵין הָאַחִין אֵינָן חַיָּיבִין לֹא עַל הַחֲלוּצָה כָּרֵת, וְלֹא עַל הַצָּרָה כָּרֵת. מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ? אָמַר קְרָא: ״אֲשֶׁר לֹא יִבְנֶה״, כֵּיוָן שֶׁלֹּא בָּנָה — שׁוּב לֹא יִבְנֶה.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Neither he nor the brothers are liable to karet , neither for the ḥalutza nor for the rival wife. What is the rationale of Reish Lakish? The verse states “Who does not build up since he did not build he shall never build again.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: Between he and the brothers are not obligated neither for the release excision, nor for the distress excision. What is the reason for Reish Lakish? He said a verse: "Which shall not be built," since he did not build — he shall not build again.

hebrew_text: אִיהוּ הוּא דְּקָאֵי בְּ״לֹא יִבְנֶה״, אֲבָל אֶחָיו — כִּדְקָיְימִי קָיְימִי.
human_translation: it is who stands to Does not build up, However, brothers, where they stood they stand
llm_translation: He is the one who stands by "Lo Yivneh," but his brothers - as they stand, they stand.

hebrew_text: וַעֲלֵהּ דִּידַהּ, הוּא דְּקָאֵי בְּ״לֹא יִבְנֶה״, הָא צָרָה — כִּדְקָיְימָא קָיְימָא.
human_translation: And with regard to her, does he stand for: Does not build up, the rival wife, where stood they stand
llm_translation: And the one who says, "Do not build," he is standing on "Lo Yivneh," the distress - as it is established, it is established.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מִי אִיכָּא מִידֵּי דְּמֵעִיקָּרָא אִי בָּעֵי הַאי — חָלֵיץ, וְאִי בָּעֵי הַאי — חָלֵיץ, וְאִי בָּעֵי — לְהַאי חָלֵיץ, וְאִי בָּעֵי — לְהַאי חָלֵיץ, וְהַשְׁתָּא קָאֵי עֲלַהּ בְּכָרֵת?
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan Is there anything at the outset, if this wanted perform ḥalitza , and if that wanted perform ḥalitza , and if he wanted perform ḥalitza with this and if he wanted perform ḥalitza with that And now, they stand to karet for her?
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan: Is there a case where he requires this one - he redeems, and if he requires this one - he redeems, and if he requires - for this one he redeems, and if he requires - for this one he redeems, and now he stands on it with a question mark?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, אִיהוּ שְׁלִיחוּתָא דְאַחִים קָעָבֵיד, אִיהִי שְׁלִיחוּתָא דְצָרָה קָעָבְדָה.
human_translation: Rather, he performs the agency of the brothers, she performs the agency of the rival wife,
llm_translation: Rather, it is the agency of brothers that is honored, and the agency of a stranger is not honored.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן לְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: הַחוֹלֵץ לִיבִמְתּוֹ, וְחָזַר וְקִדְּשָׁהּ, וּמֵת — צְרִיכָה חֲלִיצָה מִן הָאַחִין. בִּשְׁלָמָא לְדִידִי, דְּאָמֵינָא חַיָּיבֵי לָאוִין נִינְהוּ, הַיְינוּ דִּצְרִיכָה חֲלִיצָה מִן הָאַחִין.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan raised an objection to Reish Lakish one who performs ḥalitza with his yevama and went back and betrothed her, and died, she requires ḥalitza from the brothers. Granted, to my as I say are liable for a prohibition, that is she requires ḥalitza from the brothers.
llm_translation: He raised an objection to Reish Lakish: If one performs chalitzah with his yevamah, then goes back and betroths her, and then he dies - she requires chalitzah from the brothers. According to my reasoning, for I say they are not obligated, that is why she requires chalitzah from the brothers.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְדִידָךְ, אַמַּאי צְרִיכָה חֲלִיצָה?
human_translation: However, to your why does she require ḥalitza
llm_translation: Rather, according to our view, why does she need halitzah?

hebrew_text: וּלְטַעְמָיךְ, אֵימָא סֵיפָא: עָמַד אֶחָד מִן הָאַחִין וְקִדְּשָׁהּ, אֵין לָהּ עָלָיו כְּלוּם. וְאִי חַיָּיבֵי לָאוִין נִינְהוּ, אַמַּאי אֵין לָהּ עָלָיו כְּלוּם?
human_translation: And according to your reasoning, state the latter clause one of the brothers arose and betrothed her, she has no claims on him, But if are liable for a prohibition, why does she have no claim on him?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And according to your reasoning, let us say the latter case: If one of the brothers stood up and sanctified her, she has nothing upon him. And if they are liable for a negative commandment, why does she have nothing upon him?
