hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: סֵיפָא אֲתָאן לְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, דְּאָמַר: אֵין קִידּוּשִׁין תּוֹפְסִין בְּחַיָּיבֵי לָאוִין. וְלִיתְנֵי: לְדִבְרֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אֵין לוֹ עָלָיו כְּלוּם!
human_translation: Rav Sheshet said latter clause we have come to Rabbi Akiva, who said: Betrothal with those liable for a prohibition is not valid. But let teach According to the statement of Rabbi Akiva she has no claims on him,
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet said: The latter part comes to Rabbi Akiva, who said: Betrothals do not take effect with those who are obligated in negative commandments. And it should be taught: According to the words of Rabbi Akiva, it is as if he has nothing upon him!

hebrew_text: קַשְׁיָא. רַב אָשֵׁי סָבַר לַהּ כְּרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ, וּמְתָרֵץ לַהּ כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן. רָבִינָא סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, וּמְתָרֵץ כְּרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: is difficult. Rav Ashi holds in accordance with Reish Lakish and resolves in accordance with Rabbi Shimon. Ravina, holds in accordance with Rabbi Yoḥanan and resolves in accordance with the Rabbis.
llm_translation: Kashya. Rav Ashei savar la k'Reish Lakish, u'metareitz la k'Rabbi Shimon. Ravina savar la k'Rabbi Yochanan, u'metareitz k'Rabanan.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי סָבַר לַהּ כְּרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ וּמְתָרֵץ לַהּ כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: הַחוֹלֵץ לִיבִמְתּוֹ וְחָזַר וְקִדְּשָׁהּ — צְרִיכָה חֲלִיצָה מִן הָאַחִין. מַאן אַחִין —
human_translation: Rav Ashi holds in accordance with Reish Lakish and resolves in accordance with Rabbi Shimon. one who performs ḥalitza with his yevama and went back and betrothed her, she requires ḥalitza from the brothers. Who are brothers
llm_translation: Rav Ashi thought like Reish Lakish and he resolved it like Rabbi Shimon: If one performs chalitzah with his yevamah and then goes back and betroths her - she requires chalitzah from the brothers. Who are the brothers -

hebrew_text: אַחִין הַיִּלּוֹדִים. כְּמַאן — כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן.
human_translation: newborn brothers, In accordance with whose in accordance with Rabbi Shimon,
llm_translation: Brothers who are born. According to whom? According to Rabbi Shimon.

hebrew_text: עָמַד אֶחָד מִן הַנּוֹלָדִים וְקִדְּשָׁהּ — אֵין לָהּ עָלָיו כְּלוּם, כְּמַאן — כְּרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ.
human_translation: one of the born arose and betrothed her, she has no claims on him. In accordance with whose in accordance with Reish Lakish,
llm_translation: One of the newborns stood up and consecrated her - she has nothing on him, as who? - as Reish Lakish.

hebrew_text: רָבִינָא סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, וּמְתָרֵץ לַהּ אַלִּיבָּא דְרַבָּנַן: הַחוֹלֵץ לִיבִמְתּוֹ וְחָזַר וְקִדְּשָׁהּ — צְרִיכָה חֲלִיצָה מִן הָאַחִין. מַאן אַחִין — אַחִין הַנּוֹלָדִים, כְּמַאן — כְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן.
human_translation: Ravina holds in accordance with Rabbi Yoḥanan and resolves in accordance with the Rabbis. one who performs ḥalitza with his yevama and went back and betrothed her she requires ḥalitza from the brothers. Who are brothers? brothers born In accordance with whose in accordance with Rabbi Yoḥanan,
llm_translation: Ravina thought like Rabbi Yochanan, and he answered her according to the view of the Sages: If one performs chalitzah with his yevamah and then remarries her, she requires chalitzah from the brothers. Who are the brothers? The brothers who were born, like Rabbi Yochanan.

hebrew_text: עָמַד אֶחָד מִן הַיִּלּוֹדִים וְקִדְּשָׁהּ — אֵין לָהּ עָלָיו כְּלוּם, כְּמַאן — כְּרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: one of the newborn arose and betrothed her, she has no claim on him. In accordance with whose in accordance with the Rabbis,
llm_translation: One of the Yelodim stood up and sanctified her - she has nothing upon him, as who? - as the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר: הַבָּא עַל יְבָמָה, וּבָא אֶחָד מִן הָאַחִין עַל צָרָתָהּ, פְּלִיגִי בַּהּ רַב אַחָא וְרָבִינָא. חַד אָמַר: בְּכָרֵת. וְחַד אָמַר: בַּעֲשֵׂה.
human_translation: It was stated one had relations with yevama and one of the brothers had relations with her rival wife. Rav Aḥa and Ravina disagree One said: to karet . And one said of a positive mitzva.
llm_translation: It was stated: If one comes to perform the levirate marriage with a yevamah, and one of the brothers comes to marry her co-wife, Rav Acha and Ravina dispute it. One says: The punishment is karet. And one says: The obligation is positive.

hebrew_text: מַאן דְּאָמַר בְּכָרֵת — כְּרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ, וּמַאן דְּאָמַר בַּעֲשֵׂה — כְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן.
human_translation: The one who said that he to karet in accordance with Reish Lakish, And the one who said of a positive mitzva in accordance with Rabbi Yoḥanan.
llm_translation: One who says regarding karet - like Reish Lakish, and one who says regarding a positive commandment - like Rabbi Yochanan.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: צָרַת סוֹטָה אֲסוּרָה.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Rav said: The rival wife of a sota is forbidden.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: The affliction of a Sotah is forbidden.

hebrew_text: טוּמְאָה כְּתִיב בָּהּ, כָּעֲרָיוֹת.
human_translation: defilement is written in that as those with whom relations are forbidden
llm_translation: Impurity is written in it, like nakedness.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַב חִסְדָּא, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: בִּיאָתָהּ אוֹ חֲלִיצָתָהּ מֵאָחִיו שֶׁל רִאשׁוֹן — פּוֹטֶרֶת צָרָתָהּ.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda raised an objection Rabbi Shimon says: Her relations or ḥalitza from the brother of the first exempts her rival wife.
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: Rav Ḥisda raises a contradiction. Rabbi Shimon says: If her intercourse or her halitzah was from the brother of the first husband, she is exempt from the rival-wife declaration.

hebrew_text: [אָמַר לְךָ רַב:] אָמֵינָא לָךְ אֲנָא סוֹטָה דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא, וְאַתְּ אָמְרַתְּ לִי סוֹטָה דְּרַבָּנַן?!
human_translation: Rav said to you I spoke to you a sota by Torah and you speak to me a sota by rabbinic
llm_translation: He said to you, Rav: I say to you, I am a Sotah of the Torah, and you say to me a Sotah of the Rabbis?!

hebrew_text: וּדְקָאָרֵי לַהּ מַאי קָאָרֵי לַהּ? קָסָבַר כׇּל דְּתַקּוּן רַבָּנַן — כְּעֵין דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא תַּקּוּן.
human_translation: And he who asked it, why did he ask it? He held that all that the Sages instituted, they instituted parallel to Torah
llm_translation: And they are reading to it, what is it reading to it? He holds, all that the sages established - like the Torah's establishment.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַב אָשֵׁי: נִכְנְסָה עִמּוֹ לְסֵתֶר, וְשָׁהֲתָה עִמּוֹ כְּדֵי טוּמְאָה — אֲסוּרָה לְבֵיתָהּ, וַאֲסוּרָה לֶאֱכוֹל בִּתְרוּמָה. וְאִם מֵת, חוֹלֶצֶת
human_translation: Rav Ashi raised an objection entered with him in private, and remained with him to be defiled, is forbidden to her house, And she is prohibited from partaking of teruma , And if he dies, she performs ḥalitza
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: Rav Ashi asks: If she entered with him into seclusion, and she remained with him for the time it takes to become ritually impure - she is forbidden to her husband, and forbidden to eat terumah. And if he dies, she must perform chalitzah.

hebrew_text: וְלֹא מִתְיַיבֶּמֶת. [אָמַר לְךָ רַב:] אָמֵינָא לָךְ אֲנָא סוֹטָה וַדַּאי, וְאָמְרַתְּ לִי אַתְּ סוֹטָה סָפֵק! וּמַאי שְׁנָא סוֹטָה וַדַּאי (מַאי טַעְמָא) — מִשּׁוּם דִּכְתִיב בָּהּ טוּמְאָה,
human_translation: and may not enter into levirate marriage. Rav said to you: I spoke to you a sota definite, and you speak to me an uncertain sota . And what is different a definite sota ? because defilement is written to her?
llm_translation: "And she does not perform the rite of yibum. Rav said to you: I say to you, I am a definite sotah, and you say to me, 'You are a doubtful sotah!' And what is the difference between a definite sotah and a doubtful one (what is the reason)? — Because it is written about her, 'she is impure.'"

hebrew_text: סוֹטָה סָפֵק נָמֵי טוּמְאָה כְּתִיבָא בַּהּ! דְּתַנְיָא: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בֶּן כִּיפָּר אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: הַמַּחְזִיר גְּרוּשָׁתוֹ מִן הַנִּישּׂוּאִין — אֲסוּרָה, מִן הָאֵירוּסִין — מוּתֶּרֶת, מִשּׁוּם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אַחֲרֵי אֲשֶׁר הֻטַּמָּאָה״.
human_translation: an uncertain sota , defilement is written as well. As it is taught Rabbi Yosei ben Keifar said in the name of Rabbi Elazar: one who remarries his divorcée following marriage she is forbidden following betrothal she is permitted, because it is stated: after she was defiled”
llm_translation: Tractate Sotah: A doubt regarding impurity is written in it! For it was taught: Rabbi Yosei ben Kippar says in the name of Rabbi Elazar: One who takes back his divorced wife from the marriage is forbidden, from the betrothal she is permitted, as it is stated: "After she has been defiled."

hebrew_text: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אַחַת זוֹ וְאַחַת זוֹ — אֲסוּרָה, אֶלָּא מָה אֲנִי מְקַיֵּים ״אַחֲרֵי [אֲשֶׁר] הֻטַּמָּאָה״ — לְרַבּוֹת סוֹטָה שֶׁנִּסְתְּרָה.
human_translation: And the Rabbis say: this one and that one, she is forbidden Rather, how do I establish “After she was defiled”? to include a sota who secluded herself
llm_translation: The sages say: "One this and one this - forbidden." Rather, how do I fulfill "after she has been defiled" - to include a Sotah who was hidden.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי ״נִסְתְּרָה״ — נִבְעֲלָה. וְאַמַּאי קָרֵי לֵיהּ נִסְתְּרָה — לִישָּׁנָא מְעַלְּיָא נָקֵט. נִבְעֲלָה, טוּמְאָה בְּהֶדְיָא כְּתִיב בַּהּ, ״וְנִסְתְּרָה וְהִיא נִטְמָאָה״?
human_translation: And what does: Secluded herself, engaged in relations. And why call this: Secluded herself, employed a euphemistic expression, engaged in relations, defilement explicitly written to her, “She being defiled secretly”
llm_translation: "And what is 'nis'tera' - she was married. And why is it called 'nistara' - because it is hidden above. She was married, it is written about her in the Torah as impure, 'and she was hidden and she became impure' (Leviticus 13:6)."

hebrew_text: לְמֵיקַם עֲלַהּ בְּלָאו. וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בֶּן כִּיפָּר — לָאו בְּסוֹטָה לֵית לֵיהּ, וַאֲפִילּוּ זַנַּאי נָמֵי.
human_translation: establishes upon her a prohibition. And Rabbi Yosei ben Keifar does not hold a prohibition of a sota , and the same even if she fornicated
llm_translation: To establish it without a witness. And Rabbi Yosei ben Kippar - there is no case of sotah without it, and even if he is a known adulterer.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא — הֲוָיָה וְאִישׁוּת כְּתִיב בַּהּ.
human_translation: What is the rationale becoming, and matrimony are written in this
llm_translation: What is the reason? - "And they shall become one flesh" is written in it.

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ רַב יְהוּדָה מֵרַב שֵׁשֶׁת: הַמַּחְזִיר גְּרוּשָׁתוֹ מִשֶּׁנִּיסֵּת, וּמֵת, צָרָתָהּ מַהוּ? אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בֶּן כִּיפָּר לָא תִּיבְּעֵי לָךְ, כֵּיוָן דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בֶּן כִּיפָּר טוּמְאָה בְּמַחֲזִיר גְּרוּשָׁתוֹ הוּא דִּכְתִיבָא — צָרָתָהּ כְּמוֹתָהּ.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda raised a dilemma before Rav Sheshet: one who remarries his divorcée after she had married and dies what is her rival wife? According to Rabbi Yosei ben Keifar, do not raise the dilemma, since Rabbi Yosei ben Keifar said it is to one who remarries his divorcée defilement is written, her rival wife is the same as hers.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah asked Rav Sheshet: If one takes back his divorced wife after she has remarried, and he dies, what is the status of his wife? According to the opinion of Rabbi Yosei ben Kippar, you need not ask, for since Rabbi Yosei ben Kippar said that a woman who is taken back after divorce is considered impure, as it is written: "Her affliction is like her death."

hebrew_text: וְאִי מִשּׁוּם דִּכְתִיב בָּהּ ״תּוֹעֵבָה הִיא״, הִיא תּוֹעֵבָה וְאֵין בָּנֶיהָ תּוֹעֲבִין — הָא צָרָתָהּ תּוֹעֵבָה.
human_translation: And if because it is written: “That is an abomination” She is an abomination, but her children are not abominations. her rival wife is an abomination
llm_translation: And if because it is written in it "it is an abomination," it is an abomination and its children are not abominations - behold, its affliction is an abomination.

hebrew_text: כִּי תִּיבְּעֵי לָךְ אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבָּנַן: אַף עַל גַּב דַּאֲמוּר רַבָּנַן טוּמְאָה בְּסוֹטָה הוּא דִּכְתִיב — אֵין מִקְרָא יוֹצֵא מִידֵי פְּשׁוּטוֹ,
human_translation: let the dilemma be raised according to the Rabbis. Although the Rabbis said it is to a sota that defilement is written, a verse does not depart from its literal meaning.
llm_translation: When you come to argue with the words of the Sages: Even though the Sages said that she is impure in the case of the Sotah, as it is written - "No verse departs from its simple meaning,"

hebrew_text: אוֹ דִלְמָא כֵּיוָן דְּאִיעֲקַר — אִיעֲקַר. אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבָּנַן לָא תִּיבְּעֵי לָךְ, כֵּיוָן דְּאִיתְעֲקַר — אִיעֲקַר.
human_translation: Or perhaps once is uprooted it is uprooted There are who say According to the Rabbis, do not raise the dilemma, once is uprooted it is uprooted.
llm_translation: Or perhaps since it was uprooted - it was uprooted. There are those who say: In the opinion of the sages, it does not require your attention, since it was already uprooted - it was uprooted.

hebrew_text: כִּי תִּיבְּעֵי לָךְ — אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בֶּן כִּיפָּר, מַאי? אַף עַל גַּב דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בֶּן כִּיפָּר טוּמְאָה בְּמַחֲזִיר גְּרוּשָׁתוֹ הוּא דִּכְתִיבָא — מִיעֵט רַחֲמָנָא הִיא תּוֹעֵבָה וְאֵין צָרָתָהּ תּוֹעֵבָה, אוֹ דִלְמָא: הִיא תּוֹעֵבָה וְאֵין בָּנֶיהָ תּוֹעֲבִין, הָא צָרָתָהּ — תּוֹעֵבָה?
human_translation: let the dilemma be raised according to Rabbi Yosei ben Keifar. What is Although Rabbi Yosei ben Keifar said it is to one who remarries his divorcée defilement is written, the Merciful One limit “that is an abomination,” And her rival wife is not an abomination? Or perhaps she is an abomination but her children are not abominations, her rival wife is an abomination.
llm_translation: When you will inquire for yourself — according to the opinion of Rabbi Yosei ben Kippar, what? Even though Rabbi Yosei ben Kippar said that a woman who remarries her divorced husband is impure, as it is written: "For the Lord detests an abomination, and there is no trouble with it," or perhaps: "She is an abomination and her children are not abominable, her trouble — is it an abomination?"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ, תְּנֵיתוּהָ: הָיְתָה אַחַת כְּשֵׁרָה וְאַחַת פְּסוּלָה, אִם הָיָה חוֹלֵץ — חוֹלֵץ לַפְּסוּלָה, וְאִם הָיָה מְיַיבֵּם — מְיַיבֵּם לַכְּשֵׁרָה.
human_translation: said to him: You learned it one was fit and the other disqualified, if he would perform ḥalitza he performs ḥalitza with the disqualified and if he would enter into levirate marriage he enters into levirate marriage with the fit
llm_translation: He said to him, "You should give it to her: if there was one that was valid and one that was invalid, if he performs chalitzah - he performs chalitzah for the invalid one, and if he performs yibum - he performs yibum for the valid one."

hebrew_text: מַאי ״כְּשֵׁרָה״ וּמַאי ״פְּסוּלָה״? אִילֵּימָא ״כְּשֵׁרָה״ — כְּשֵׁרָה לְעָלְמָא, ״פְּסוּלָה״ — פְּסוּלָה לְעָלְמָא. כֵּיוָן דִּלְדִידֵיהּ חַזְיָא — מַאי נָפְקָא לֵיהּ מִינַּהּ?
human_translation: What is fit, and what is disqualified? If we say fit fit for all disqualified disqualified in general, since for him she is suitable, what difference does it make for him
llm_translation: What is "kosher" and what is "non-kosher"? If you say "kosher" - kosher for eternity, "non-kosher" - non-kosher for eternity. Since according to his view he sees - what benefit does he derive from it?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לָאו: ״כְּשֵׁרָה״ — כְּשֵׁרָה לֵיהּ, ״פְּסוּלָה״ — פְּסוּלָה לֵיהּ, וּמַאי נִיהוּ — מַחֲזִיר גְּרוּשָׁתוֹ, וְקָתָנֵי: וְאִם הָיָה מְיַיבֵּם — מְיַיבֵּם לַכְּשֵׁרָה!
human_translation: Rather, is it not fit fit for him, disqualified disqualified for him? And what is that one who remarries his divorcée. And it is taught if he would enter into levirate marriage, he enter into levirate marriage with the fit
llm_translation: Rather, no: "kosher" - it is kosher for him, "invalid" - it is invalid for him, and what is the difference? He returns his divorced wife, and it is taught: "And if he was performing levirate marriage - he performs levirate marriage for the kosher one!"

hebrew_text: לָא, לְעוֹלָם ״כְּשֵׁרָה״ — כְּשֵׁרָה לְעָלְמָא, ״פְּסוּלָה״ — פְּסוּלָה לְעָלְמָא. וּדְקָאָמְרַתְּ: כֵּיוָן דִּלְדִידֵיהּ חַזְיָא, מַאי נָפְקָא לֵיהּ מִינַּהּ — מִשּׁוּם דְּרַב יוֹסֵף.
human_translation: No; actually, fit fit to all disqualified disqualified in general, And that which you said: Since for him she is suitable what difference does it make for him, because of of Rav Yosef.
llm_translation: Not, forever "kosher" - kosher forever, "pasulah" - pasulah forever. And she said: Since he saw his vision, what does he benefit from it? - Because of Rav Yosef.

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: כָּאן שָׁנָה רַבִּי: לֹא יִשְׁפּוֹךְ אָדָם מֵי בוֹרוֹ, וַאֲחֵרִים צְרִיכִים לָהֶם.
human_translation: As Rav Yosef said: Here Rabbi taught a person should not pour the water from his well when others are in need of it.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "D'amar Rav Yosef: Kan shanah Rabbi: Lo yishpoch adam mei boroh, va'acherim tzerichim lahem." English translation: "Rav Yosef said: Here Rabbi taught: A person should not pour out the water from his well, and others need it."

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: הַמַּחְזִיר גְּרוּשָׁתוֹ מִשֶּׁנִּשֵּׂאת — הִיא וְצָרָתָהּ חוֹלֶצֶת. הִיא וְצָרָתָהּ סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ? [אֶלָּא] אֵימָא: אוֹ הִיא, אוֹ צָרָתָהּ.
human_translation: Come hear one who remarries his divorcée after she had married another, she and her rival wife perform ḥalitza . enter your mind she and her rival wife Rather, say: Either she or her rival wife.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Ta shma: hamachzir gerushato mishenisa'at - hi v'tzaratah choltzet. Hi v'tzaratah sakla datakh? Ela eima: o hi, o tzaratah." English translation: "Come and hear: one who remarries his divorced wife - she and her rival are exempt. She and her rival, is it according to your opinion? Rather say: either she, or her rival."

hebrew_text: וְלָאו תָּרוֹצֵי קָמְתָרְצַתְּ לַהּ?! תָּרֵיץ הָכִי: הִיא — חוֹלֶצֶת, צָרָתָהּ — אוֹ חוֹלֶצֶת אוֹ מִתְיַיבֶּמֶת.
human_translation: And did you not resolve in answer as follows: She performs ḥalitza , her rival wife either performs ḥalitza or enters into levirate marriage.
llm_translation: And not? You want to satisfy her?! Satisfy her thus: She - she removes, her rival - either removes or performs levirate marriage.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא, רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בָּעֵי: הַמַּחְזִיר גְּרוּשָׁתוֹ מִשֶּׁנִּיסֵּת, צָרָתָהּ מַהוּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי אַמֵּי: וְתִיבְּעֵי לָךְ הִיא גּוּפַהּ? הִיא גּוּפַהּ לָא קָמִיבַּעְיָא לִי,
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said Rabbi Yoḥanan raised a dilemma: one who remarries his divorcée after she had been married to another, what is her rival wife? Rabbi Ami said to him: And raise the dilemma herself. herself is not a dilemma for me,
llm_translation: Rabbi Hiyya bar Abba said, Rabbi Yohanan inquired: If one remarries his divorced wife after she has remarried, what is her status? Rabbi Ammi said to him: Does she need to plead her own case? She does not need to plead her own case to me.

hebrew_text: דְּאָמְרִינַן קַל וָחוֹמֶר: בַּמּוּתָּר לָהּ — אֲסוּרָה, בָּאָסוּר לָהּ — לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן?! כִּי קָא מִיבַּעְיָא לִי: צָרָתָהּ, מַאי? מִי אַלִּים קַל וָחוֹמֶר לְמִידְחֵי צָרָה, אוֹ לָא?
human_translation: As we state an a fortiori she is forbidden to one who permitted to her, to one who was forbidden to her, not all the more so Where I raise the dilemma her rival wife. What is Is a fortiori strong to invalidate her rival wife or not?
llm_translation: We say: a fortiori: if it is permitted to her - it is forbidden, if it is forbidden to her - all the more so?! For it is asking me: her distress, what? Who is more stringent, a fortiori to push away distress, or not?

hebrew_text: רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק מַתְנֵי הָכִי: אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא, בָּעֵי רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הַמַּחְזִיר גְּרוּשָׁתוֹ מִשֶּׁנִּיסֵּת, מַהוּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי אַמֵּי: וְתִיבְּעֵי לָךְ צָרָתָהּ? צָרָתָהּ לָא קָמִיבַּעְיָא לִי, דְּלָא אַלִּים קַל וָחוֹמֶר לְמִידְחֵי צָרָה. אֶלָּא כִּי קָמִיבַּעְיָא לִי, הִיא גּוּפַהּ מַאי: מִי אַלִּים קַל וָחוֹמֶר בִּמְקוֹם מִצְוָה, אוֹ לָא?
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak teach as follows: Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said Rabbi Yoḥanan raised a dilemma: one who remarries his divorcée after she had been married to another, what is Rabbi Ami said to him: And raise the dilemma her rival wife her rival wife is not a dilemma for me, as the a fortiori is not strong to invalidate a rival wife. Rather, where I raise the dilemma herself. What is Is the a fortiori strong in place of a mitzva or not?
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak teaches thus: Rabbi Hiyya bar Abba said, Rabbi Yochanan inquired: If one takes back his divorced wife after she has remarried, what is the law? Rabbi Ammi said to him: And do you require her distress? Her distress is not a reason for me, for we do not apply a fortiori reasoning to distress. Rather, if her distress is a reason for me, what is the law regarding her herself: Do we apply a fortiori reasoning in a place of commandment, or not?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ, תְּנֵיתוּהָ: הָיְתָה אַחַת כְּשֵׁרָה וְאַחַת פְּסוּלָה, אִם הָיָה חוֹלֵץ — חוֹלֵץ לַפְּסוּלָה, וְאִם הָיָה מְיַיבֵּם — מְיַיבֵּם לַכְּשֵׁרָה. מַאי ״כְּשֵׁרָה״ וּמַאי ״פְּסוּלָה״? אִילֵּימָא ״כְּשֵׁרָה״ — כְּשֵׁרָה לְעָלְמָא, ״פְּסוּלָה״ — פְּסוּלָה לְעָלְמָא, כֵּיוָן דִּלְדִידֵיהּ חַזְיָא — מַאי נָפְקָא לֵיהּ מִינַּהּ?
human_translation: said to We learned it one was fit and the other disqualified, if he would perform ḥalitza he performs ḥalitza with the disqualified and if he would enter into levirate marriage, he enters into levirate marriage with the fit What is fit and what is disqualified? If we say fit fit to all disqualified disqualified to all since for him she is suitable, what difference does it make for him
llm_translation: He said to him, "You should teach it: If there was one valid and one invalid, if he performs chalitzah - he performs chalitzah for the invalid one, and if he performs yibum - he performs yibum for the valid one. What is 'valid' and what is 'invalid'? If you say 'valid' - valid for eternity, 'invalid' - invalid for eternity. Since in his view he sees it - what difference does it make to him from her?"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לָאו: ״כְּשֵׁרָה״ — כְּשֵׁרָה לֵיהּ, ״פְּסוּלָה״ — פְּסוּלָה לֵיהּ. וּמַאי נִיהוּ — מַחֲזִיר גְּרוּשָׁתוֹ. וְקָתָנֵי: אִם הָיָה מְיַיבֵּם — מְיַיבֵּם לַכְּשֵׁרָה.
human_translation: Rather, is it not fit fit for him, disqualified disqualified for him? And what is that one who remarries his divorcée. And it is taught if he would enter into levirate marriage, he enters into levirate marriage with the fit
llm_translation: Rather, no: "kosher" - it is kosher for him, "invalid" - it is invalid for him. And what is the difference? - He returns his divorced wife. And it teaches: If he was performing levirate marriage - he performs levirate marriage for the kosher one.

hebrew_text: לָא: כְּשֵׁרָה לְעָלְמָא, פְּסוּלָה לְעָלְמָא. וּדְקָאָמְרַתְּ, כֵּיוָן דִּלְדִידֵיהּ חַזְיָא, מַאי נָפְקָא לֵיהּ מִינַּהּ — מִשּׁוּם דְּרַב יוֹסֵף. דְּאָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: כָּאן שָׁנָה רַבִּי לֹא יִשְׁפּוֹךְ אָדָם מֵי בוֹרוֹ וַאֲחֵרִים צְרִיכִים לָהֶם.
human_translation: No; actually, fit fit to all disqualified disqualified in general, And that which you said: Since for him she is suitable, what difference does it make for him, because of of Rav Yosef. As Rav Yosef said: Here Rabbi taught a person should not pour the water from his well when others are in need of it.
llm_translation: Chapter One: If it is valid for the world, it is invalid for the world. And what she is saying is, since he sees it as fitting for himself, what difference does it make to him from it - because of what Rav Yosef said. For Rav Yosef said: Here Rabbi changed the teaching that a person should not pour water from his well, and others need it.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: הַמַּחְזִיר גְּרוּשָׁתוֹ מִשֶּׁנִּיסֵּת — הִיא וְצָרָתָהּ חוֹלֶצֶת. הִיא וְצָרָתָהּ סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ? אֶלָּא אֵימָא: אוֹ הִיא אוֹ צָרָתָהּ! וְלָאו תָּרוֹצֵי קָא מְתָרְצַתְּ לַהּ? תָּרֵיץ הָכִי: הִיא — חוֹלֶצֶת, צָרָתָהּ — אוֹ חוֹלֶצֶת אוֹ מִתְיַיבֶּמֶת.
human_translation: Come hear one who remarries his divorcée after she had married another, she and her rival wife must perform ḥalitza . enter your mind she and her rival wife Rather, say: Either she or her rival wife. And did you not resolve in answer as follows: She performs ḥalitza , her rival wife either performs ḥalitza or enters into levirate marriage.
llm_translation: Come and hear: One who remarries his divorced wife after she has married another — she and her rival both perform ḥaliẓah. Is it your intention to say that she and her rival both perform levirate marriage? Rather say: Either she or her rival! And are you not satisfied with this answer? Resolve it thus: She performs ḥaliẓah, her rival either performs ḥaliẓah or performs levirate marriage.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב לֵילֵי בַּר מֶמֶל, אָמַר מָר עוּקְבָא, אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: צָרַת מְמָאֶנֶת אֲסוּרָה. לְמַאן? אִילֵימָא לָאַחִים: הַשְׁתָּא הִיא גּוּפַהּ שַׁרְיָא, דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: מֵיאֲנָה בָּזֶה מוּתֶּרֶת בָּזֶה — צָרָתָהּ מִיבַּעְיָא?
human_translation: Rav Lili bar Memel said Mar Ukva said Shmuel said: rival wife of who performed refusal is forbidden. To whom If we say to brothers, now she herself, is permitted as Shmuel said: refused this is permitted to that is necessary her rival wife
llm_translation: Rav Leilei bar Melel said, Mar Ukva said, Shmuel said: A tzarat that prevents is forbidden. According to whom? If you say it is for siblings: now, its body is permitted, as Shmuel said: if it prevents in one way and permits in another way - does its tzara require examination?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְדִידֵיהּ, וּמַאי שְׁנָא מְמָאֶנֶת דְּשַׁרְיָא לְאַחִין — דְּלָא עָבְדָא בְּהוּ מַעֲשֶׂה? צָרָה נָמֵי לָא עָבְדָא בְּהוּ מַעֲשֶׂה!
human_translation: Rather, to him, And what is different from one who performed refusal, who is permitted to the brothers? that she did not perform any act with them her rival wife did not perform any act with them either,
llm_translation: Rather, according to his opinion, and what is the difference that it permits for brothers - that it did not involve a physical act? Similarly, it did not involve a physical act for the wife either!

hebrew_text: גְּזֵירָה מִשּׁוּם צָרַת בִּתּוֹ מְמָאֶנֶת. וְצָרַת בִּתּוֹ מְמָאֶנֶת מִי אֲסִירָא? וְהָתְנַן: וְכוּלָּן אִם מֵתוּ אוֹ מֵיאֲנוּ — צָרוֹתֵיהֶן מוּתָּרוֹת!
human_translation: decree due to a rival wife of one’s daughter who performed refusal. And is the rival wife of a daughter who performed refusal forbidden? But didn’t we learn And all of these if they died or performed refusal their rival wives are permitted.
llm_translation: Decree because of the suffering of his daughter refuses. And the suffering of his daughter refuses who is liable? And we learned: And all of them, if they died or refused - their sufferings are permitted!

hebrew_text: דְּמֵיאֲנָה בְּמַאן? אִילֵימָא דְּמֵיאֲנָה בְּבַעַל, הַיְינוּ גְּרוּשָׁה! אֶלָּא לָאו — בְּיָבָם.
human_translation: Whom did refuse? If we say that she refused the husband, this is a divorcée, Rather, is it not the yavam ?
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates as follows: "Who is the one who refuses? If you say it is the husband, that is a divorce! Rather, it is not so - it is in the case of levirate marriage."

hebrew_text: לָא: לְעוֹלָם בְּבַעַל, וּתְרֵי גַּוְונֵי גֵּירוּשִׁין. וּמַאי שְׁנָא כִּי מֵיאֲנָה בְּבַעַל — דַּעֲקַרְ[תִּ]ינְהוּ לְנִשּׂוּאִין,
human_translation: No; actually, that the husband, and two types of divorce And what is different when she refuses her husband that she uproots the marriage,
llm_translation: Not: Always in Baal, and two types of divorces. And what is the difference when she refuses with Baal - for I have uprooted them for marriage.

hebrew_text: כִּי מֵיאֲנָה בְּיָבָם נָמֵי — נִשּׂוּאִין קַמָּאֵי קָא עָקְרָא!
human_translation: when she refuses the yavam , also she uproots the first marriage.
llm_translation: When she refuses the levir, she is called a rebellious wife!

hebrew_text: מִשּׁוּם דְּתָנֵי רָמֵי בַּר יְחֶזְקֵאל. דְּתָנֵי רָמֵי בַּר יְחֶזְקֵאל: מֵיאֲנָה בַּבַּעַל — מוּתֶּרֶת לְאָבִיו, בַּיָּבָם — אֲסוּרָה לְאָבִיו.
human_translation: due to that Rami bar Yeḥezkel taught as Rami bar Yeḥezkel taught: refused her husband, she is permitted to his father, the yavam , she is forbidden to his father.
llm_translation: From the fact that Ramei, son of Yehezkel, taught: Ramei, son of Yehezkel, taught: If she refuses levirate marriage with the husband - she is permitted to her father; with the brother-in-law - she is forbidden to her father.

hebrew_text: אַלְמָא, מִשְּׁעַת נְפִילָה נִרְאֵית כְּכַלָּתוֹ.
human_translation: Apparently, from when she came before she appears to be daughter-in-law.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "Alma, mi'sha'at n'filah nir'eit k'chalato." English translation: "Verily, from the moment of its fall, it appears like its original state."

hebrew_text: הָכָא נָמֵי, מִשְּׁעַת נְפִילָה נִרְאֵית כְּצָרַת בִּתּוֹ.
human_translation: Here, too, From when came before she appears to be the rival wife of daughter.
llm_translation: Here it is stated: From the time of her fall, she appeared like the daughter of a serpent.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אַסִּי: צָרַת אַיְלוֹנִית אֲסוּרָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְהָיָה הַבְּכוֹר אֲשֶׁר תֵּלֵד״ — פְּרָט לָאַיְלוֹנִית שֶׁאֵינָהּ יוֹלֶדֶת.
human_translation: Rav Asi said: The rival wife of a sexually underdeveloped woman [ aylonit ] is forbidden. As it is stated “The firstborn that she bears” to exclude an aylonit , who cannot give birth.
llm_translation: Rav Assi said: The tzarat of ayalonit is forbidden, as it is stated: "And it shall be that the firstborn which she bears" - excluding the ayalonit that does not give birth.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: שְׁלֹשָׁה אַחִין נְשׂוּאִין שָׁלֹשׁ נָשִׁים נׇכְרִיּוֹת, וּמֵת אֶחָד מֵהֶם, וְעָשָׂה בָּהּ שֵׁנִי מַאֲמָר,
human_translation: Rav Sheshet raised an objection Three brothers are married to three unrelated women, and one of died, and a second performed levirate betrothal with
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: Rav Sheshet raised a contradiction: Three brothers married three non-Jewish women, and one of them died, and the other brother performed the levirate marriage with her.

hebrew_text: וּמֵת — הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ חוֹלְצוֹת וְלֹא מִתְיַיבְּמוֹת, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּמֵת אֶחָד מֵהֶם יְבָמָהּ יָבֹא עָלֶיהָ״, מִי שֶׁעָלֶיהָ זִיקַת יָבָם אֶחָד, וְלֹא זִיקַת שְׁנֵי יְבָמִין.
human_translation: And died these, perform ḥalitza and may not enter into levirate marriage. As it is stated: “And one of them dies her brother-in-law will have intercourse with her” one who is subject to bond of one yavam , and not bond of two yevamin .
llm_translation: "And she shall die" — behold, these are halutzot and not yevamot, as it is stated: "And if one of them die, the wife of the deceased shall not marry outside to a stranger; her husband's brother shall go in unto her," referring to a case where there is the bond of one yavam, but not the bond of two yevamim.

hebrew_text: וְקָתָנֵי עֲלַהּ, אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: זוֹ הִיא צָרַת אֵשֶׁת אָח מֵאָב, שֶׁאִיסּוּר נְפִילָה גָּרַם לָהּ. שֶׁלֹּא מָצִינוּ בְּכׇל הַתּוֹרָה כּוּלָּהּ כְּגוֹן זֹאת.
human_translation: And it is taught with regard to this Rav Yosef said: This is a rival wife of a paternal brother’s wife, for whom coming before caused her to be forbidden. We have not found in the entire Torah an example this,
llm_translation: "And it was taught in a Mishnah: Rav Yosef said: This is the case of the wife of a brother from the father, that the prohibition of miscarriage caused her. For we did not find in the entire Torah a case like this."

hebrew_text: ״זוֹ הִיא״ — לְמַעוֹטֵי מַאי? לָאו לְמַעוֹטֵי צָרַת אַיְלוֹנִית, דְּשַׁרְיָא?!
human_translation: This is, to exclude what? Doesn’t to exclude the rival wife of an aylonit , that is permitted?
llm_translation: "This is it" - to exclude what? Not to exclude the distress of the ilean cedar, which is permitted?!

hebrew_text: לָא, לְמַעוֹטֵי צָרַת אַיְלוֹנִית, דַּאֲסִירָא. וּמַאי ״זוֹ הִיא״ — זוֹ הִיא, דְּאִיסּוּר נְפִילָה גָּרַם לָהּ — צָרָתַהּ בָּעֲיָא חֲלִיצָה, אַיְלוֹנִית — אֲפִילּוּ חֲלִיצָה לָא בָּעֲיָא. מַאי טַעְמָא: הָא דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא, הָא דְּרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: No, to exclude the rival wife of an aylonit , that is forbidden. And what is This is? this is the one for whom coming before caused her to be forbidden, her rival wife requires ḥalitza aylonit , not even require ḥalitza . What is the reason This by Torah this one, by rabbinic
llm_translation: Not for the sake of the narrowness of the alleyway of the terebinth tree, is it prohibited. And what is "this is it" - this is it, that the prohibition of miscarriage caused it - her narrowness requires halitzah, of the terebinth tree - even if halitzah is not required. What is the reason: that which is from the Torah, that which is from the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: וְכוּלָּן אִם מֵתוּ אוֹ מֵיאֲנוּ אוֹ נִתְגָּרְשׁוּ אוֹ שֶׁנִּמְצְאוּ אַיְלוֹנִית — צָרוֹתֵיהֶן מוּתָּרוֹת. לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן שֶׁהִכִּיר בָּהּ,
human_translation: We learned And all of these if they died, or they refused or were divorced, or were found to be aylonit , their rival wives are permitted not difficult. Here, which knew she
llm_translation: We learned in the Mishnah: And all of them, if they died, or refused, or were divorced, or were found to be aylonit - their rival wives are permitted. It is not difficult: here, where he recognized her,

hebrew_text: כָּאן שֶׁלֹּא הִכִּיר בָּהּ.
human_translation: There, where he did not know she
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Here he did not recognize her.

hebrew_text: דַּיְקָא נָמֵי, דְּקָתָנֵי ״שֶׁנִּמְצְאוּ״, וְלָא קָתָנֵי ״שֶׁהָיוּ״, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ. אָמַר רָבָא,
human_translation: is also precise, as it teaches: Were found to be and it does not teach: Were Conclude from this Rava said:
llm_translation: It is precise, for it teaches "that they were found," and does not teach "that they were." Learn from it. Rava said,

hebrew_text: הִלְכְתָא: צָרַת אַיְלוֹנִית מוּתֶּרֶת, וַאֲפִילּוּ הִכִּיר בָּהּ. וַאֲפִילּוּ צָרַת בִּתּוֹ אַיְלוֹנִית.
human_translation: And halakha is rival wife of an aylonit is permitted, and even if knew her And even the rival wife of his aylonit daughter
llm_translation: Mishnah: Tsarat aylonit muteret, va'afilu hikir bah. Va'afilu tsarat bito aylonit.

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא הָא דְּקָתָנֵי ״שֶׁנִּמְצְאוּ״ — תְּנִי ״שֶׁהָיוּ״. כִּי אֲתָא רָבִין, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אַחַת צָרַת מְמָאֶנֶת, וְאַחַת צָרַת אַיְלוֹנִית, וְאַחַת צָרַת מַחֲזִיר גְּרוּשָׁתוֹ — כּוּלָּן מוּתָּרוֹת.
human_translation: However, that which teaches: Were found to be, teach That were, When Ravin came he said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: one rival wife of a girl who refused the rival wife of an aylonit , and also rival wife of one who remarries his divorcée: They are all permitted.
llm_translation: The one that it teaches "that they were found" - it should teach "that they were." When Ravin came, Rabbi Yochanan said: One is a menstruating woman, one is a woman who is pregnant, and one is a woman who returns her divorce - all of them are permitted.

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי רַב בִּיבִי קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן, שָׁלֹשׁ נָשִׁים מְשַׁמְּשׁוֹת בְּמוֹךְ: קְטַנָּה, מְעוּבֶּרֶת, וּמְנִיקָה. קְטַנָּה — שֶׁמָּא תִּתְעַבֵּר וְשֶׁמָּא תָּמוּת. מְעוּבֶּרֶת — שֶׁמָּא תַּעֲשֶׂה עוּבָּרָהּ סַנְדָּל. מְנִיקָה — שֶׁמָּא תִּגְמוֹל בְּנָהּ וְיָמוּת.
human_translation: Rav Beivai taught before Rav Naḥman: Three women engage in relations with resorbent, A minor, pregnant, and a nursing woman. A minor lest she become pregnant and perhaps die; a pregnant woman, lest her fetus becomes a sandal a nursing woman, lest she will wean her son and he will die.
llm_translation: It was taught: Rav Beivi presented before Rav Nachman, three women who serve as midwives: a minor, a pregnant woman, and a nursing mother. A minor - lest she become pregnant and lest she die. A pregnant woman - lest she induce her labor prematurely. A nursing mother - lest she wean her child and he die.

hebrew_text: וְאֵיזוֹ הִיא קְטַנָּה — מִבַּת אַחַת עֶשְׂרֵה שָׁנָה וְיוֹם אֶחָד עַד שְׁתֵּים עֶשְׂרֵה שָׁנָה וְיוֹם אֶחָד. פָּחוֹת מִכֵּאן וְיָתֵר עַל כֵּן — מְשַׁמֶּשֶׁת כְּדַרְכָּהּ וְהוֹלֶכֶת, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אַחַת זוֹ וְאַחַת זוֹ מְשַׁמֶּשֶׁת כְּדַרְכָּהּ וְהוֹלֶכֶת, וּמִן הַשָּׁמַיִם יְרַחֲמוּ, מִשּׁוּם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״שׁוֹמֵר פְּתָאִים ה׳״.
human_translation: And Who is a minor? from the age of eleven years and one day until twelve years and one day. younger than this or older than this, she may go ahead and engage in relations in her usual manner. the statement of Rabbi Meir. And the Rabbis say: Both this and that may go ahead and engage in relations in her usual manner, and Heaven will have mercy since it is stated: “The Lord preserves the simple”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And which is the age of a minor? — From the age of one day less than twelve years until the age of twelve years and one day. Less than this and more than this — she serves according to her way and goes, the words of Rabbi Meir. And the sages say: One this way and one that way she serves according to her way and goes, and mercy will be shown from Heaven, as it is stated: "The Lord preserves the simple."

hebrew_text: מִדְּקָאָמַר שֶׁמָּא תִּתְעַבֵּר וְשֶׁמָּא תָּמוּת, מִכְּלָל דְּאִיכָּא קְטַנָּה דְּמִיעַבְּרָא וְלָא מֵתָה. אִם כֵּן, מָצִינוּ חֲמוֹתוֹ מְמָאֶנֶת.
human_translation: From states: Lest she become pregnant and perhaps die, by inference that there is a minor who can become pregnant and will not die, If so, we find one’s mother-in-law who refused
llm_translation: From where he said, perhaps she will miscarry and perhaps she will die, from the inference that there is a fetus that miscarries and does not die. If so, we find his mother-in-law refusing.

hebrew_text: וּתְנַן: אִי אַתָּה יָכוֹל לוֹמַר בַּחֲמוֹתוֹ וְאֵם חֲמוֹתוֹ וְאֵם חָמִיו שֶׁנִּמְצְאוּ אַיְלוֹנִית אוֹ שֶׁמֵּיאֲנוּ! אֵימָא: שֶׁמָּא תִּתְעַבֵּר וְתָמוּת.
human_translation: And we learned You cannot say, of his mother-in-law, his mother-in-law’s mother, and his father-in-law’s mother, that they were found to be an aylonit or performed refusal, say: Lest she become pregnant and die.
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: If one is able to say regarding his mother-in-law, his mother-in-law, and his father-in-law who were found hanging or were strangled, one should say: Perhaps she became pregnant and died.

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר רַבָּה בַּר לֵיוַאי: גְּבוּל יֵשׁ לָהּ, קוֹדֶם הַזְּמַן הַזֶּה — אֵינָהּ מִתְעַבֶּרֶת כׇּל עִיקָּר, תּוֹךְ הַזְּמַן הַזֶּה — הִיא מֵתָה וְעוּבָּרָהּ מֵת, לְאַחַר זְמַן הַזֶּה — הִיא חַיָּה וְעוּבָּרָהּ חַי.
human_translation: As Rabba bar Livai said: There is a limit with regard to her Before this time, she cannot be impregnated at all. During this time, she dies and her fetus dies. After this time, she lives and her fetus lives.
llm_translation: Rabba bar Levy said: It has a boundary, before this time - it does not miscarry at all, during this time - it is dead and its fetus is dead, after this time - it is alive and its fetus is alive.

hebrew_text: אִינִי? וְהָא תָּנֵי רַבָּה בַּר שְׁמוּאֵל: אִי אַתָּה יָכוֹל לוֹמַר בַּחֲמוֹתוֹ וְאֵם חֲמוֹתוֹ וְאֵם חָמִיו שֶׁנִּמְצְאוּ אַיְלוֹנִית אוֹ שֶׁמֵּיאֲנוּ — שֶׁכְּבָר יָלְדוּ. אֶלָּא לְעוֹלָם: שֶׁמָּא תִּתְעַבֵּר וְשֶׁמָּא תָּמוּת. וְאֶלָּא קַשְׁיָא הָךְ!
human_translation: Is that so? But didn’t Rabba bar Shmuel teach: You cannot say of his mother-in-law, and his mother-in-law’s mother, and his father-in-law’s mother that they were found to be an aylonit or performed refusal, as they already gave birth. Rather, actually, Lest she become pregnant and perhaps die. But this difficult
llm_translation: I? But didn't Rabba bar Shmuel teach: If one could say regarding his father-in-law and his mother-in-law or his father-in-law and his mother-in-law that they were found to be pregnant or that they gave birth, rather, forever: perhaps she will conceive and perhaps she will die. But rather, this is a difficulty!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב סָפְרָא: בָּנִים הֲרֵי הֵם כְּסִימָנִים. וְאִית דְּאָמְרִי: בָּנִים עֲדִיפִי מִסִּימָנִים. לְמַאי נָפְקָא מִינַּהּ? דַּאֲפִילּוּ לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה דְּאָמַר עַד שֶׁיִּרְבֶּה הַשָּׁחוֹר, בְּבָנִים מוֹדֶה.
human_translation: Rav Safra said: Children are equivalent to signs And some say: Children are preferable to signs What is the practical difference that even according to Rabbi Yehuda, who said until the black are more plentiful of children he concedes
llm_translation: Rav Safra said: Sons, behold they are like signs. And there are those who say: Sons are preferable to signs. What is the practical difference? That even according to Rabbi Yehuda who said, "Until the blackness increases," he concedes regarding sons.

hebrew_text: וְרַב זְבִיד אָמַר: אֵין בָּנִים בְּלֹא סִימָנִים. וְנִבְדּוֹק! חָיְישִׁינַן שֶׁמָּא נָשְׁרוּ. הָנִיחָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר חוֹשְׁשִׁין.
human_translation: And Rav Zevid said: There are no children without signs But let us examine We are concerned lest have fallen off. This well according to the one who said we are concerned
llm_translation: Rav Zevid said: There are no children without signs. And let us examine! We are concerned that they may have been switched. It is preferable to follow the opinion of the one who said we should be cautious.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר אֵין חוֹשְׁשִׁין — מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? אֲפִילּוּ לְמַאן דְּאָמַר אֵין חוֹשְׁשִׁין — מִשּׁוּם צַעַר לֵידָה חָיְישִׁינַן.
human_translation: However, according to the one who said we are not concerned what is there to say? Even according to the one who said we are not concerned due to the pain of childbirth we are concerned
llm_translation: Rather, according to the one who says we are not concerned - what is there to say? Even according to the one who says we are not concerned, we are cautious due to the pain of childbirth.

hebrew_text: כֵּיצַד פּוֹטְרוֹת צָרוֹתֵיהֶן וְכוּ׳. מְנָהָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה, דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״לִצְרוֹר״ — הַתּוֹרָה רִיבְּתָה צָרוֹת הַרְבֵּה.
human_translation: How do they exempt their rival wives From where are these matters, derived? Rav Yehuda said as the verse states: to be a rival [ litzror ] the Torah amplified many rival wives.
llm_translation: How do they exempt their creditors, etc.? What are the words of the matter? Rav Yehudah said, as the verse says: "to bind" - the Torah has multiplied their creditors.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר, סְבָרָא הִיא: צָרָה מַאי טַעְמָא אֲסִירָא — דְּבִמְקוֹם עֶרְוָה קָיְימָא, צָרַת צָרָה נָמֵי — בִּמְקוֹם עֶרְוָה קַיְימָא.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: It is a logical inference, What is the reason a rival wife is prohibited? that she stands in place of a forbidden relative. the rival wife of a rival wife also stands in place of a forbidden relative,
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said, it is a logical reasoning: What is the reason that a tsara is forbidden? - Because in a place where ervah is established, the tsara of the tsara is also established - in a place where ervah is established.

hebrew_text: כֵּיצַד אִם מֵתוּ הֵן כּוּ׳. וַאֲפִילּוּ כָּנַס וּלְבַסּוֹף גֵּירַשׁ.
human_translation: How so? If died, and even married and ultimately divorced
llm_translation: How if they died, etc. And even if he gathered and ultimately divorced.

hebrew_text: וּרְמִינְהוּ: שְׁלֹשָׁה אַחִים, שְׁנַיִם מֵהֶן נְשׂוּאִים שְׁתֵּי אֲחָיוֹת, וְאֶחָד נָשׂוּי נׇכְרִית, גֵּירַשׁ אֶחָד מִבַּעֲלֵי אֲחָיוֹת אִשְׁתּוֹ, וּמֵת הַנָּשׂוּי נׇכְרִית וּכְנָסָהּ הַמְגָרֵשׁ, וָמֵת, זוֹ הִיא שֶׁאָמְרוּ: שֶׁאִם מֵתוּ אוֹ נִתְגָּרְשׁוּ — צָרוֹתֵיהֶן מוּתָּרוֹת.
human_translation: And raises a contradiction three brothers, two of whom are married to two sisters and one is married to an unrelated woman. One of the husbands of the sisters divorced his wife, and the one who was married to the unrelated woman died, and the one who divorced married and died It is with this that they said that if they died or were divorced their rival wives are permitted.
llm_translation: And they asked: Three brothers, two of them are married to two sisters, and one is married to a non-Jewish woman. One of the brothers divorced his wife, and the non-Jewish wife died, and the divorced woman entered into a relationship with the widower, and he died. This is what they said: If they died or were divorced - their rivals are permitted.

hebrew_text: טַעְמָא דְּגֵירַשׁ וְאַחַר כָּךְ כָּנַס, אֲבָל כָּנַס וְאַחַר כָּךְ גֵּירַשׁ — לָא!
human_translation: The reason that divorced and afterward married However, married and afterward divorced not
llm_translation: Reason of Gerush and afterwards he married, but he married and afterwards he divorced - no!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה: תַּבְרָא, מִי שֶׁשָּׁנָה זוֹ לֹא שָׁנָה זוֹ. הַאי תַּנָּא סָבַר — מִיתָה מַפֶּלֶת,
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya said: disjointed, who taught this did not teach that this tanna , maintains death causes come before
llm_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya said: "Tabra, one who repeats this year did not repeat that year." This Tanna holds - death is a stumbling block.

hebrew_text: וְהַאי תַּנָּא סָבַר — נִשּׂוּאִין הָרִאשׁוֹנִים מַפִּילִים.
human_translation: And that tanna maintains the first marriage causes come before
llm_translation: And this Tanna holds - the first ones who were married cause to miscarry.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: לְעוֹלָם חַד תַּנָּא הוּא, וְזוֹ וְאֵין צָרִיךְ לוֹמַר זוֹ קָתָנֵי.
human_translation: Rava said: Actually, a single tanna , but he teaches This and it is unnecessary to say that.
llm_translation: Rava said: Always one Tanna he is, and this and no need to say this he is teaching.

hebrew_text: וְכֹל שֶׁיְּכוֹלָה לְמָאֵן. וּתְמָאֵן הַשְׁתָּא, וְתִתְיַיבֵּם! לֵימָא מְסַיְּיעָא לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא.
human_translation: And any who could refuse And let perform refusal now, and let her enter into levirate marriage. let us say that it supports of Rabbi Oshaya.
llm_translation: "And all that she is able to refuse. And she refuses now, and they will sit! Let us say, 'It is a help for Rabbi Oshaya.'"

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא: מְמָאֶנֶת לְמַאֲמָרוֹ, וְאֵינָהּ מְמָאֶנֶת לְזִיקָּתוֹ.
human_translation: As Rabbi Oshaya said: refuse the levirate betrothal of But she cannot refuse his bond.
llm_translation: As Rabbi Oshaia said: She refuses his statement, but she does not refuse his injury.

hebrew_text: לָא, צָרַת עֶרְוָה שָׁאנֵי. דְּתָנֵי רָמֵי בַּר יְחֶזְקֵאל: מֵיאֲנָה בַּבַּעַל — מוּתֶּרֶת לְאָבִיו. מֵיאֲנָה בְּיָבָם — אֲסוּרָה לְאָבִיו.
human_translation: No; the rival wife of a forbidden relative is different, As Rami bar Yeḥezkel taught she refused the husband, she is permitted to his father, she refused the yavam , she is forbidden to his father.
llm_translation: Not, the trouble of nakedness two. For it was taught: Ramei son of Yehezkel raises an objection: If she refuses to perform the levirate marriage with the brother-in-law — she is permitted to her father. If she refuses with the levir — she is forbidden to her father.

hebrew_text: אַלְמָא: מִשְּׁעַת נְפִילָה נִרְאֵית כְּכַלָּתוֹ. הָכָא נָמֵי: מִשְּׁעַת נְפִילָה נִרְאֵית כְּצָרַת בִּתּוֹ.
human_translation: Apparently, at the moment coming before she had the appearance of his daughter-in-law. Here, too, at the moment coming before she had the appearance of his daughter’s rival wife.
llm_translation: The Gemara asks: Is it not logical that from the moment of its descent, it appears like its mother's womb? Here it is taught: From the moment of its descent, it appears like the narrowness of its daughter.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ שֵׁשׁ עֲרָיוֹת חֲמוּרוֹת מֵאֵלּוּ, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁנְּשׂוּאוֹת לַאֲחֵרִים — צָרוֹתֵיהֶן מוּתָּרוֹת:
human_translation: Six with whom relations are forbidden are more severe than those because they may be married to others their rival wives are permitted.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: Six severe prohibitions are more stringent than these, because their afflictions are permitted to others.

hebrew_text: אִמּוֹ, וְאֵשֶׁת אָבִיו, וַאֲחוֹת אָבִיו, אֲחוֹתוֹ מֵאָבִיו, וְאֵשֶׁת אֲחִי אָבִיו, וְאֵשֶׁת אָחִיו מֵאָבִיו.
human_translation: His mother, and his father’s wife, and his father’s sister, and his paternal sister, and the wife of his father’s brother, and the wife of his paternal brother.
llm_translation: His mother, and the wife of his father, and the sister of his father, the sister of his father from his father, and the wife of his father's brother from his father.

hebrew_text: בֵּית שַׁמַּאי מַתִּירִין הַצָּרוֹת לָאַחִים, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹסְרִים.
human_translation: Beit Shammai permit the rival wives to the brothers, And Beit Hillel forbid
llm_translation: House of Shammai permit the sisters-in-law, and House of Hillel prohibit.

hebrew_text: חָלְצוּ — בֵּית שַׁמַּאי פּוֹסְלִין מִן הַכְּהוּנָּה, וּבֵית הִלֵּל מַכְשִׁירִין. נִתְיַיבְּמוּ — בֵּית שַׁמַּאי מַכְשִׁירִין, וּבֵית הִלֵּל פּוֹסְלִין.
human_translation: performed ḥalitza , Beit Shammai disqualify from the priesthood, And Beit Hillel deem fit, they entered into levirate marriage, Beit Shammai deem fit And Beit Hillel disqualify them,
llm_translation: They argued - Beit Shammai disqualify from the priesthood, and Beit Hillel validate. They intermarried - Beit Shammai validate, and Beit Hillel disqualify.

hebrew_text: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵלּוּ אוֹסְרִים וְאֵלּוּ מַתִּירִין, אֵלּוּ פּוֹסְלִין וְאֵלּוּ מַכְשִׁירִין — לֹא נִמְנְעוּ בֵּית שַׁמַּאי מִלִּישָּׂא נָשִׁים מִבֵּית הִלֵּל, וְלָא בֵּית הִלֵּל מִבֵּית שַׁמַּאי. כָּל הַטְּהָרוֹת וְהַטְּמָאוֹת שֶׁהָיוּ אֵלּוּ מְטַהֲרִים וְאֵלּוּ מְטַמְּאִין — לֹא נִמְנְעוּ עוֹשִׂין טְהָרוֹת אֵלּוּ עַל גַּבֵּי אֵלּוּ.
human_translation: Although prohibit and permit these disqualify and those deem fit, Beit Shammai did not refrain from marrying women from Beit Hillel, nor did Beit Hillel from Beit Shammai. all of the ritual purity and impurity, where these ritually pure and those ritually impure, they did not refrain from handling ritually pure each with the other,
llm_translation: Even though these permit and these prohibit, these disqualify and these validate - the House of Shammai did not refrain from marrying women from the House of Hillel, nor did the House of Hillel refrain from marrying women from the House of Shammai. All the purifications and impurities that these declare pure and these declare impure - they did not refrain from performing purifications of these upon those.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן פַּזִּי: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּבֵית שַׁמַּאי, דִּכְתִיב: ״לֹא תִהְיֶה אֵשֶׁת הַמֵּת הַחוּצָה לְאִישׁ זָר״. ״חוּצָה״ — מִכְּלָל דְּאִיכָּא פְּנִימִית, וְאָמַר רַחֲמָנָא: ״לֹא תִהְיֶה״.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Pazi said: What is the reason of Beit Shammai? As it is written: “The wife of the dead man shall not be married outside of the family to one not of his kin” “outside” by inference that there is inside, And the Merciful One states: “Shall not be
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara, Rabbi Shimon ben Pazi said: What is the reason for the opinion of Beit Shammai, as it is written: "A wife of a deceased outside to a stranger shall not be." "Outside" - from the general principle that there is an internal wife, and the Merciful One said: "Shall not be."

hebrew_text: וּבֵית הִלֵּל — מִיבְּעֵי לְהוּ לְכִדְרַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב. דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: מִנַּיִן שֶׁאֵין קִידּוּשִׁין תּוֹפְסִין בִּיבָמָה — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לֹא תִהְיֶה אֵשֶׁת הַמֵּת הַחוּצָה לְאִישׁ זָר״. לֹא תִּהְיֶה בָּהּ הֲוָיָה לְזָר.
human_translation: And Beit Hillel They require these for that which Rav Yehuda said Rav said, as Rav Yehuda said Rav said: From where that betrothal is not effective of a yevama as it is stated: The wife of the dead man shall not be married outside of the family to one not of his kin” there shall not be in her the becoming to not of his kin.
llm_translation: House of Hillel — they ask according to Rav Yehudah who said Rav. For Rav Yehudah said Rav: From where do we derive that betrothals do not take effect with a yevamah? As it is stated: "The wife of the deceased shall not be married to a stranger; her kinsman shall come to her and take her as his wife."

hebrew_text: וּבֵית שַׁמַּאי — מִי כְּתִיב ״לַחוּץ״? ״חוּצָה״ כְּתִיב. וּבֵית הִלֵּל — כֵּיוָן דִּכְתִיב ״חוּצָה״, כְּמַאן דִּכְתִיב ״לַחוּץ״ דָּמֵי.
human_translation: And Beit Shammai Is it written: To the outside [ laḥutz ], It is written “outside [ ḥutza ],” And Beit Hillel, since it is written “outside,” it is considered as though it is written: To the outside.
llm_translation: House of Shammai - who is it written "outside"? "Outside" is written. And House of Hillel - since it is written "outside," it is like one who is written "to the outside."

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה אוֹמֵר: כׇּל תֵּיבָה שֶׁצְּרִיכָה לָמֶד בִּתְחִלָּתָהּ — הֵטִיל לָהּ הַכָּתוּב הֵא בְּסוֹפָהּ. וְתָנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: כְּגוֹן ״אֵלִים״ — ״אֵלִימָה״, ״מַחֲנַיִם״ — ״מַחֲנָיְמָה״, ״מִצְרַיִם״ — ״מִצְרַיְמָה״, ״דִּבְלָתָיְמָה״, ״יְרוּשָׁלַיְמָה״, ״מִדְבָּרָה״.
human_translation: As it is taught Rabbi Neḥemya says any word that requires lamed at its beginning, the verse placed heh at its end, And the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: For example, “Elim” “ Elima ” “Maḥanaim” “ Maḥanaima ” “ Mitzraim ” “ Mitzraima ” “ Divlataima ” “ Yerushalaima ” “ midbara ”
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Neḥemya says: Any word that requires a prefix at its beginning, the Scripture added it at its end. And it was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael: For example, "Eilim" becomes "Eilimah," "Machanayim" becomes "Machanaymah," "Mitzrayim" becomes "Mitzraymah," "Diblataymah," "Yerushalaymah," "Midbarah."

hebrew_text: וּבֵית שַׁמַּאי, דְּרַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב מְנָא לְהוּ? מִ״לְּאִישׁ זָר״ נָפְקָא.
human_translation: And Beit Shammai, from where do they that Rav Yehuda Rav said? derive from “To one not of his kin”
llm_translation: House of Shammai, as Rav Yehudah said Rav Menah to them? "From 'a foreign man' it is derived."

hebrew_text: וּבֵית הִלֵּל נָמֵי, תִּיפּוֹק לְהוּ מִ״לְּאִישׁ זָר״? אִין הָכִי נָמֵי. ״חוּצָה״ לְמָה לִי — לְרַבּוֹת הָאֲרוּסָה.
human_translation: But let Beit Hillel, too, derive this from: “To one not of his kin.” Yes, it is indeed so. why do I “outside”? to include a betrothed woman.
llm_translation: House of Hillel also, come out to him from "foreign man"? Not so said. "Outside" why to me — to include the betrothed.

hebrew_text: וְאִידַּךְ: מֵ״חוּצָה״ — ״הַחוּצָה״. וְאִידַּךְ: ״חוּצָה״ ״הַחוּצָה״ — לָא מַשְׁמַע לְהוּ.
human_translation: And the other from ḥutza haḥutza . And the other do not derive ḥutza and haḥutza ,
llm_translation: And the other opinion: "From 'chutzah'" - "the chutzah." And the other opinion: "chutzah" "the chutzah" - does not establish for them.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: טַעְמַיְיהוּ דְּבֵית שַׁמַּאי דְּאֵין אִיסּוּר חָל עַל אִיסּוּר.
human_translation: Rava said: The rationale of Beit Shammai that a prohibition does not take effect another prohibition
llm_translation: Rava said: Their reasons of Beit Shammai are that one prohibition does not take effect upon another prohibition.

hebrew_text: תִּינַח הֵיכָא דְּנָשָׂא מֵת, וְאַחַר כָּךְ נָשָׂא חַי — לָא אָתֵי אִיסּוּר אֲחוֹת אִשָּׁה וְחָיֵיל אַאִיסּוּר אֵשֶׁת אָח. אֶלָּא נָשָׂא חַי וְאַחַר כָּךְ נָשָׂא מֵת, אֲחוֹת אִשָּׁה קָדֵים!
human_translation: well where the deceased married and afterward the surviving married prohibition of a wife’s sister does not come and apply to the prohibition of a brother’s wife. However, the surviving married and afterward deceased married a wife’s sister precedes
llm_translation: The case where one married a dead woman, and afterwards married a living one - there does not come a prohibition of a sister-in-law and a prohibition of a brother's wife. Rather, he married a living one and afterwards married a dead one, the sister-in-law comes first!

hebrew_text: כֵּיוָן דְּלָא אָתֵי אִיסּוּר אֵשֶׁת אָח וְחָיֵיל אַאִיסּוּר אֲחוֹת אִשָּׁה, הָוְיָא לַהּ צָרַת עֶרְוָה שֶׁלֹּא בִּמְקוֹם מִצְוָה, וְשָׁרְיָא.
human_translation: Since the prohibition of a brother’s wife does not come and apply to the prohibition of a wife’s sister, is a rival wife of a forbidden relative where no mitzva applies, and she is permitted.
llm_translation: Since the prohibition of a brother's wife does not come, and the prohibition of a sister-in-law does come, it constitutes a case of forbidden sexual relations that is not in a place of commandment, and it is permitted.

hebrew_text: חָלְצוּ בֵּית שַׁמַּאי פּוֹסְלִים וְכוּ׳. פְּשִׁיטָא!
human_translation: performed ḥalitza , Beit Shammai disqualify is obvious
llm_translation: The House of Shammai disqualifies, etc. Obviously!

hebrew_text: לְאַפּוֹקֵי דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן נוּרִי, דְּאָמַר: בּוֹאוּ וּנְתַקֵּן לָהֶם לַצָּרוֹת שֶׁיְּהוּ חוֹלְצוֹת וְלֹא מִתְיַיבְּמוֹת. קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּבֵית הִלֵּל מַכְשִׁירִים.
human_translation: to exclude Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Nuri, who said: Come and let us institute for rival wives that they should perform ḥalitza and not enter into levirate marriage. teaches us that Beit Hillel deem fit
llm_translation: To the emissaries of Rabbi Yochanan ben Nuri, who said: "Come and we will fix for them remedies so that they will be divorced and not subject to levirate marriage." It is heard to us that the House of Hillel deems them permissible.

hebrew_text: נִתְיַיבְּמוּ, בֵּית הִלֵּל פּוֹסְלִין כּוּ׳. הָא תּוּ לְמָה לִי! אַיְּידֵי דִּתְנָא חָלְצוּ, תְּנָא נָמֵי נִתְיַיבְּמוּ.
human_translation: they entered into levirate marriage, Beit Hillel disqualify them. Why do I need this as well, since taught: Performed ḥalitza , it also taught Entered into levirate marriage,
llm_translation: They engaged in levirate marriage, Beit Hillel disqualify them. Why do I need it? Since a Tanna taught, they have performed chalitzah, let another Tanna engage in levirate marriage.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן הָתָם: מְגִילָּה נִקְרֵאת בְּאַחַד עָשָׂר, וּבִשְׁנֵים עָשָׂר, וּבִשְׁלֹשָׁה עָשָׂר, וּבְאַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר, וּבַחֲמִשָּׁה עָשָׂר, לֹא פָּחוֹת וְלֹא יוֹתֵר.
human_translation: We learned there, The Megilla, is read on the eleventh on the twelfth, on the thirteenth, on the fourteenth, or on the fifteenth, no earlier and no later
llm_translation: We learned there: A Megillah is read on the eleventh, and on the twelfth, and on the thirteenth, and on the fourteenth, and on the fifteenth, not less and not more.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אִיקְּרִי כָּאן ״לֹא תִתְגּוֹדְדוּ״, לֹא תֵּעָשׂוּ אֲגוּדּוֹת אֲגוּדּוֹת? הַאי ״לֹא תִתְגּוֹדְדוּ״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְגוּפֵיהּ, דְּאָמַר רַחֲמָנָא: לֹא תַּעֲשׂוּ חַבּוּרָה עַל מֵת!
human_translation: Reish Lakish said to Rabbi Yoḥanan: I read here “You shall not cut yourselves [ titgodedu ]” Do not become numerous factions [ agudot ]. This “You shall not cut yourselves,” is required for the matter itself, as the Merciful One is saying: Do not cut yourselves over the dead.
llm_translation: He said to him Resh Lakish to Rabbi Yochanan: It is written here "Do not commit acts of violence," should you not make bundles upon bundles? This "Do not commit acts of violence" is needed for itself, as the Merciful One said: Do not make a bundle on a dead body!

hebrew_text: אִם כֵּן, לֵימָא קְרָא ״לֹא תְגוֹדְדוּ״. מַאי ״תִתְגּוֹדְדוּ״ — שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ לְהָכִי הוּא דַּאֲתָא. וְאֵימָא כּוּלֵּיהּ לְהָכִי הוּא דַּאֲתָא! אִם כֵּן, לֵימָא קְרָא ״לֹא תָגוֹדּוּ״. מַאי ״לֹא תִתְגּוֹדְדוּ״ — שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ תַּרְתֵּי.
human_translation: If so, let the verse state You shall not cut. What “You shall not cut yourselves”? Learn from this it comes for this But say the entire comes this If so, let the verse state: Lo tagodu , You shall not cut. What “ Lo titgodedu ”? Conclude two from it:
llm_translation: If so, let us say the verse "Do not cut yourselves." What is "cut yourselves" - infer from it thus it comes. And say, perhaps all of it comes thus! If so, let us say the verse "Do not cut." What is "do not cut" - infer from it two.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: עַד כָּאן לֹא שָׁנִיתָ מָקוֹם שֶׁנָּהֲגוּ לַעֲשׂוֹת מְלָאכָה בְּעַרְבֵי פְּסָחִים עַד חֲצוֹת — עוֹשִׂין, מָקוֹם שֶׁנָּהֲגוּ שֶׁלֹּא לַעֲשׂוֹת — אֵין עוֹשִׂין!
human_translation: said to him: you not taught until now: a place where accustomed to perform labor on Passover eve until midday, one may do a place where accustomed not to perform one may not do
llm_translation: He said to him: Until here you did not change, a place where they were accustomed to work on the eve of Passover until midnight - they do, a place where they were not accustomed to work - they do not!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אָמֵינָא לָךְ אֲנָא אִיסּוּרָא, דְּאָמַר רַב שֶׁמֶן בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: ״לְקַיֵּים אֵת יְמֵי הַפּוּרִים בִּזְמַנֵּיהֶם״ — זְמַנִּים הַרְבֵּה תִּיקְּנוּ לָהֶם חֲכָמִים, וְאַתְּ אָמְרַתְּ לִי מִנְהָגָא?!
human_translation: said to I speak to you a prohibition, as Rav Shemen bar Abba said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: “to confirm days of Purim in their appointed times” the Sages instituted many times for their And you speak to me a custom
llm_translation: He said to him: I believe you, I am a prohibition, as Rav Shemen bar Abba said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: "To fulfill the days of Purim in their times" - the Sages established many times for them, and you say to me a custom?!

hebrew_text: וְהָתָם לָאו אִיסּוּרָא הוּיא? וְהָתְנַן: (בַּלַּיְלָה) בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹסְרִין, וּבֵית הִלֵּל מַתִּירִין.
human_translation: And there, there no prohibition But didn’t we learn On the night Beit Shammai prohibit and Beit Hillel permit it.
llm_translation: And there, is it not a prohibition? And we learned: (At night) Beit Shammai prohibit, and Beit Hillel permit.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָתָם, הָרוֹאֶה אוֹמֵר: מְלָאכָה הוּא דְּלֵית לֵיהּ. וְהָא בֵּית שַׁמַּאי מַתִּירִין הַצָּרוֹת לָאַחִים, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹסְרִים?
human_translation: said to him: there, one who sees says: It is he has no labor But Beit Shammai permit rival wives to the brothers, and Beit Hillel prohibit
llm_translation: He said to him: There, one who sees says: it is a forbidden labor. But Beit Shammai permit carrying on the Sabbath for brothers, and Beit Hillel prohibit?

hebrew_text: מִי סָבְרַתְּ עָשׂוּ בֵּית שַׁמַּאי כְּדִבְרֵיהֶם? לֹא עָשׂוּ בֵּית שַׁמַּאי כְּדִבְרֵיהֶם. וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: עָשׂוּ וְעָשׂוּ. וּבִפְלוּגְתָּא [דְּרַב וּשְׁמוּאֵל]. דְּרַב אוֹמֵר: לֹא עָשׂוּ בֵּית שַׁמַּאי כְּדִבְרֵיהֶם, וּשְׁמוּאֵל אֹמֵר: עָשׂוּ וְעָשׂוּ.
human_translation: Do you hold Beit Shammai acted in accordance with their statement? Beit Shammai did not act in accordance with their statement, And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: certainly did act And in the dispute between Rav and Shmuel, as Rav says: Beit Shammai did not act in accordance with their statement, and Shmuel said: They certainly did act
llm_translation: Who holds that Beit Shammai acted according to their words? Beit Shammai did not act according to their words. And Rabbi Yochanan said: They did act and they did act. And in the dispute of Rav and Shmuel. Rav says: Beit Shammai did not act according to their words, and Shmuel says: They did act and they did act.

hebrew_text: אֵימַת? אִילֵּימָא קוֹדֶם בַּת קוֹל — מַאי טַעְמָא דְּמַאן דְּאָמַר לֹא עָשׂוּ? וְאֶלָּא לְאַחַר בַּת קוֹל — מַאי טַעְמָא דְּמַאן דְּאָמַר עָשׂוּ?
human_translation: When If we say prior to Divine Voice what is the rationale of the one who said that did not act But rather, after Divine Voice, what is the reason for the one who said they did act
llm_translation: Talmudic text: When? If you say before the heavenly voice - what is the reason of the one who says they did not do? Rather, after the heavenly voice - what is the reason of the one who says they did do?

hebrew_text: אִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא קוֹדֶם בַּת קוֹל, וְאִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא לְאַחַר בַּת קוֹל. אִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא קוֹדֶם בַּת קוֹל, וּכְגוֹן דְּבֵית הִלֵּל רוּבָּא, לְמַאן דְּאָמַר לֹא עָשׂוּ — דְּהָא בֵּית הִלֵּל רוּבָּא.
human_translation: If you wish, say prior to Divine Voice, and if you wish, say after Divine Voice. If you wish, say prior to Divine Voice, and when Beit Hillel the majority according to the one who said did not act that Beit Hillel the majority,
llm_translation: If you want, say before the voice, and if you want, say after the voice. If you want, say before the voice, and for example, the House of Hillel the majority, to the one who says they did not do — for the House of Hillel is the majority.

hebrew_text: וּמַאן דְּאָמַר עָשׂוּ, כִּי אָזְלִינַן בָּתַר רוּבָּא — הֵיכָא דְּכִי הֲדָדֵי נִינְהוּ. הָכָא, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי מְחַדְּדִי טְפֵי.
human_translation: And the one who said they did act when do we follow the majority? where are equal to one another. Here, Beit Shammai are sharper
llm_translation: And one who says they did, when we go after the majority - where they are like Hadadezer. Here, Beit Shammai are stringent in their opinion.

hebrew_text: וְאִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא לְאַחַר בַּת קוֹל, מַאן דְּאָמַר לֹא עָשׂוּ — דְּהָא נְפַקָא בַּת קוֹל, וּמַאן דַּאֲמַר עָשׂוּ — רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ הִיא, דְּאָמַר: אֵין מַשְׁגִּיחִין בְּבַת קוֹל.
human_translation: And if you wish, say after Divine Voice. The one who said did not act that pronouncement Divine Voice. And the one who said they did do so, this is Rabbi Yehoshua, who said, one disregards a Heavenly Voice.
llm_translation: "And if you wish, say it was after a heavenly voice. Whoever says they did not do it - for a heavenly voice came out. And whoever says they did do it - it was Rabbi Yehoshua, who said: We do not pay attention to a heavenly voice."

hebrew_text: וּמַאן דַּאֲמַר עָשׂוּ, קָרֵינַן כָּאן ״לֹא תִתְגּוֹדְדוּ״ — לֹא תֵּעָשׂוּ אֲגוּדּוֹת אֲגוּדּוֹת! אֲמַר אַבָּיֵי: כִּי אָמְרִינַן ״לֹא תִתְגּוֹדְדוּ״ — כְּגוֹן שְׁתֵּי בָּתֵּי דִינִים בְּעִיר אַחַת, הַלָּלוּ מוֹרִים כְּדִבְרֵי בֵּית שַׁמַּאי, וְהַלָּלוּ מוֹרִים כְּדִבְרֵי בֵּית הִלֵּל. אֲבָל שְׁתֵּי בָּתֵּי דִינִים בִּשְׁתֵּי עֲיָירוֹת — לֵית לַן בַּהּ.
human_translation: And the one who said acted we read here: “You shall not cut yourselves” Do not become numerous factions. Abaye said: When we say “You shall not cut yourselves” where two courts in one city, these rule in accordance with the statement of Beit Shammai and those rule in accordance with the statement of Beit Hillel. However, two courts in two cities, we have no with it.
llm_translation: The one who says they made, we read here "Do not cut yourselves" - do not make bundles upon bundles! Abaye said: When we say "Do not cut yourselves" - for example, two courts in one city, these ruling according to the words of Beit Shammai, and these ruling according to the words of Beit Hillel. But two courts in two different cities - we do not have a concern with them.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא: וְהָא בֵּית שַׁמַּאי וּבֵית הִלֵּל כִּשְׁתֵּי בָּתֵּי דִינִים בְּעִיר אַחַת דָּמֵי! אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: כִּי אָמְרִינַן ״לֹא תִתְגּוֹדְדוּ״ — כְּגוֹן בֵּית דִּין בְּעִיר אַחַת, פְּלַג מוֹרִין כְּדִבְרֵי בֵּית שַׁמַּאי, וּפְלַג מוֹרִין כְּדִבְרֵי בֵּית הִלֵּל. אֲבָל שְׁתֵּי בָּתֵּי דִינִין בְּעִיר אַחַת — לֵית לַן בַּהּ.
human_translation: Rava said to him: But Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel is considered like two courts in one city, Rather, Rava said: When we say “You shall not cut yourselves” where a court in one city, a section rules in accordance with the statement of Beit Shammai and section rules in accordance with the statement of Beit Hillel. However, two courts in one city, we have no with it.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rava: But the House of Shammai and the House of Hillel, like two courts in one city, are they not considered as one? Rather, Rava said: When we say "Do not make factions," for example, a court in one city, half rule according to the words of the House of Shammai, and half rule according to the words of the House of Hillel. But two courts in one city, we do not have in it.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: בִּמְקוֹמוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר הָיוּ כּוֹרְתִים עֵצִים לַעֲשׂוֹת פֶּחָמִים בְּשַׁבָּת לַעֲשׂוֹת בַּרְזֶל. בִּמְקוֹמוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי הָיוּ אוֹכְלִים בְּשַׂר עוֹף בְּחָלָב.
human_translation: Come hear: In the locale of Rabbi Eliezer, they would cut down trees to prepare charcoal to fashion iron on Shabbat. In the locale of Rabbi Yosei HaGelili they would eat poultry meat in milk,
llm_translation: Come and hear: In the place of Rabbi Eliezer they would cut wood to make charcoal on Shabbat to make iron. In the place of Rabbi Yosei the Galilean they would eat poultry with milk.

hebrew_text: בִּמְקוֹמוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר — אִין, בִּמְקוֹמוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא — לָא. דְּתַנְיָא, כְּלָל אָמַר רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: כׇּל מְלָאכָה שֶׁאֶפְשָׁר לַעֲשׂוֹתָהּ מֵעֶרֶב שַׁבָּת — אֵין דּוֹחָה אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת.
human_translation: In the locale of Rabbi Eliezer, yes, in the locale of Rabbi Akiva, no, as it is taught a principle was stated by Rabbi Akiva: Any prohibited labor that can be performed on Shabbat eve does not override Shabbat
llm_translation: In the place of Rabbi Eliezer - no, in the place of Rabbi Akiva - yes. As it was taught: Rabbi Akiva said in general: Any work that one can perform from Friday evening, does not override the Sabbath.

hebrew_text: וְהַאי מַאי תְּיוּבְתָּא? מְקוֹמוֹת מְקוֹמוֹת שָׁאנֵי! וּדְקָאָרֵי לַהּ — מַאי קָאָרֵי לַהּ?!
human_translation: And what is this refutation? it is different with numerous places, He who asked it, why did he ask it,
llm_translation: And this, what is its meaning? Places, places differ! And it is called to it - what is it called to it?!

hebrew_text: סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא מִשּׁוּם חוּמְרָא דְשַׁבָּת — כְּמָקוֹם אֶחָד דָּמֵי, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: enter your mind to say due to the severity of Shabbat, it, is considered like a single locale. teaches us
llm_translation: I would say based on the stringency of Shabbat - it is considered as one place, it is implied to us.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּרַבִּי אֲבָהוּ כִּי אִיקְּלַע לְאַתְרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי הֲוָה מְטַלְטֵל שְׁרָגָא. וְכִי אִיקְּלַע לְאַתְרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, לָא הֲוָה מְטַלְטֵל שְׁרָגָא.
human_translation: Come hear that Rabbi Abbahu, when he happened to the place of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, would move lamp [ sheraga ] But when he happened to the place of Rabbi Yoḥanan, he would not move lamp.
llm_translation: Come and hear, for Rabbi Avahu, when he arrived at the place of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, was moving a bench. And when he arrived at the place of Rabbi Yochanan, he was not moving a bench.

hebrew_text: וְהַאי מַאי קוּשְׁיָא? וְלָא אָמְרִינַן מְקוֹמוֹת שָׁאנֵי? אֲנַן הָכִי קָאָמְרִינַן: רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ, הֵיכִי עָבֵיד הָכָא הָכִי, וְהֵיכִי עָבֵיד הָכָא הָכִי?
human_translation: And what is this difficulty? Didn’t we say it is different with numerous places? this is what we are saying: Rabbi Abbahu how could he act in this manner here and how could he act in that manner there?
llm_translation: The text in question: And what is the difficulty? Did we not say, "Different places have different customs"? We thus say: Rabbi Abbahu, how did he act here? Like this. And how did he act here? Like this.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ כְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי סְבִירָא לֵיהּ, וְכִי מִקְּלַע לְאַתְרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן לָא הֲוָה מְטַלְטֵל מִשּׁוּם כְּבוֹדוֹ דְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן. וְהָאִיכָּא שַׁמָּעָא! דְּמוֹדַע לֵיהּ לְשַׁמָּעָא.
human_translation: Rabbi Abbahu holds in accordance with Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi And when he happened to the place of Rabbi Yoḥanan he would not carry it, in deference to Rabbi Yoḥanan, But there was a servant that he would inform the servant
llm_translation: Rabbi Avahu, like Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, holds it probable, and when he would come to the place of Rabbi Yochanan, he would not move out of respect for Rabbi Yochanan. And there is a proof! That is known to him as a proof.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵלּוּ אוֹסְרִים וְאֵלּוּ מַתִּירִים — לֹא נִמְנְעוּ בֵּית שַׁמַּאי מִלִּישָּׂא נָשִׁים מִבֵּית הִלֵּל, וְלֹא בֵּית הִלֵּל מִבֵּית שַׁמַּאי. אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא לֹא עָשׂוּ, מִשּׁוּם הָכִי לֹא נִמְנְעוּ. אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ עָשׂוּ, אַמַּאי לֹא נִמְנְעוּ?
human_translation: Come hear Although prohibit and permit, Beit Shammai did not refrain from marrying women from Beit Hillel, nor did Beit Hillel from Beit Shammai. Granted, if you say did not act due to that they did not refrain However, if you say they did act why didn’t they refrain
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Come and hear: Even though these prohibit and these permit — Beit Shammai did not refrain from marrying women from Beit Hillel, and Beit Hillel did not refrain from marrying women from Beit Shammai. If you say they did not do so, that is why they did not refrain. But if you say they did so, why did they not refrain?

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא בֵּית שַׁמַּאי מִבֵּית הִלֵּל לֹא נִמְנְעוּ, דִּבְנֵי חַיָּיבֵי לָאוִין נִינְהוּ.
human_translation: Granted, Beit Shammai did not refrain Beit Hillel, children are liable by prohibition:
llm_translation: In truth, Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel did not disagree, for they are considered like the children of the same father.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא בֵּית הִלֵּל מִבֵּית שַׁמַּאי אַמַּאי לֹא נִמְנְעוּ? בְּנֵי חַיָּיבֵי כָּרֵיתוֹת — מַמְזֵרִים נִינְהוּ?
human_translation: However, why did Beit Hillel not refrain Beit Shammai? children liable to karet , are mamzerim .
llm_translation: House of Hillel from House of Shammai why not were they withheld? Sons of those liable for excision — mamzerim are they?

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא קָסָבְרִי בֵּית הִלֵּל דְּאֵין מַמְזֵר מֵחַיָּיבֵי כָּרֵיתוֹת — וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁנֶּחְלְקוּ בֵּית שַׁמַּאי וּבֵית הִלֵּל בְּצָרוֹת, מוֹדִים שֶׁאֵין מַמְזֵר אֶלָּא מִמִּי שֶׁאִיסּוּרוֹ אִיסּוּר עֶרְוָה וְעָנוּשׁ כָּרֵת! אֶלָּא לָאו שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ, לֹא עָשׂוּ!
human_translation: And if you would say Beit Hillel maintain that liable to karet is not a mamzer , didn’t Rabbi Elazar say: Although Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel disagreed to rival wives, they concede that a mamzer is only from whose prohibition a prohibition of forbidden relations punishable by karet ? Rather, isn’t it conclude from did not act
llm_translation: And if you will say: Do the House of Hillel hold that a mamzer is not liable for karet? But did not Rabbi Eliezer say: Even though Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel disagreed in cases of tzara'at, they agree that a mamzer is only liable for karet when his prohibition is a prohibition of ervah and the punishment is karet! Rather, do not infer from it, they did not do so!

hebrew_text: לָא, לְעוֹלָם עָשׂוּ, דְּמוֹדְעִי לְהוּ וּפָרְשִׁי.
human_translation: No; actually, did act that they would inform and withdraw
llm_translation: No, they did, for it is known to them and they explained.

hebrew_text: וְהָכִי נָמֵי מִסְתַּבְּרָא, דְּקָתָנֵי סֵיפָא: כָּל הַטְּהָרוֹת וְכׇל הַטְּמָאוֹת שֶׁהָיוּ אֵלּוּ מְטַהֲרִין וְאֵלּוּ מְטַמְּאִין — לֹא נִמְנְעוּ עוֹשִׂים טְהָרוֹת אֵלּוּ עַל גַּבֵּי אֵלּוּ.
human_translation: And so too, it is reasonable as teaches the latter clause: all of the ritual purity and impurity, where those, ritually pure and these, ritually impure, they did not refrain from handling ritually pure each with the other.
llm_translation: And thus it is fitting to explain, as it is taught in the latter part: All the pure and all the impure, those that render pure and those that render impure - these do not prevent these from performing purifications upon those.

hebrew_text: אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא דְּמוֹדְעִי לְהוּ — מִשּׁוּם הָכִי לֹא נִמְנְעוּ, אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ דְּלָא מוֹדְעִי לְהוּ, בִּשְׁלָמָא בֵּית שַׁמַּאי מִבֵּית הִלֵּל לֹא נִמְנְעוּ — דִּטְמָאוֹת דְּבֵית הִלֵּל, לְבֵית שַׁמַּאי טְהָרוֹת נִינְהוּ.
human_translation: Granted, if you say that they notified them, due to that they did not refrain However, if you say they did not notify them, granted, Beit Shammai did not refrain from Beit Hillel, as ritually impure for Beit Hillel are ritually pure for Beit Shammai,
llm_translation: If you say it is because they are familiar with it, that is why they were not prevented. But if you say it is because they are not familiar with it, then Beit Shammai were not prevented from Beit Hillel because the impure things of Beit Hillel are considered pure by Beit Shammai.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא בֵּית הִלֵּל מִבֵּית שַׁמַּאי לָמָּה לֹא נִמְנְעוּ? טְהָרוֹת דְּבֵית שַׁמַּאי, לְבֵית הִלֵּל טְמָאוֹת נִינְהוּ! אֶלָּא לָאו דְּמוֹדְעִי לְהוּ, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: However, why didn’t Beit Hillel refrain from Beit Shammai? ritually pure for Beit Shammai are ritually impure for Beit Hillel. Rather, is it not notified Conclude from
llm_translation: Rather, Beit Hillel from Beit Shammai why not they were prevented? Pure of Beit Shammai, to Beit Hillel impure they are! Rather, not that they are aware of it, infer from it.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי אוּלְמֵיהּ דְּהָךְ מֵהָךְ? מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא צָרָה קָלָא אִית לַהּ, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: In what is this stronger than that Lest you say a rival wife publicity teaches us
llm_translation: And what is the case of this one from that one? What if you say it has a minor distress, it is implied to us.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא, אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁנֶּחְלְקוּ בֵּית שַׁמַּאי וּבֵית הִלֵּל בְּצָרוֹת, מוֹדִים שֶׁאֵין מַמְזֵר אֶלָּא מִמִּי שֶׁאִיסּוּרוֹ אִיסּוּר עֶרְוָה וְעָנוּשׁ כָּרֵת. מַאן מוֹדִים? אִילֵּימָא בֵּית שַׁמַּאי לְבֵית הִלֵּל — פְּשִׁיטָא! בְּנֵי חַיָּיבֵי לָאוִין, כְּשֵׁרִים נִינְהוּ!
human_translation: the itself. Rabbi Elazar said: Although Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel disagreed to rival wives, they concede that a mamzer is only from whose prohibition a prohibition of forbidden relations punishable by karet . Who concedes If we say Beit Shammai to Beit Hillel, obvious, are liable for prohibition, children are fit
llm_translation: The body, Rabbi Elazar said: Even though Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel disagreed in matters of tzara'at, they agree that a mamzer is only from one whose prohibition is a prohibition of incest and the punishment is karet. Who agrees? If you say Beit Shammai to Beit Hillel - it is obvious! They are not the sons of violators, they are kosher!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא בֵּית הִלֵּל לְבֵית שַׁמַּאי — הִיא גּוּפַהּ חַיָּיבֵי כָּרֵיתוֹת הִיא!
human_translation: Rather, Beit Hillel to Beit Shammai. she herself, is liable to karet
llm_translation: Rather, Beit Hillel compared to Beit Shammai — it is its essence that liable for the cutting off of limbs!

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם בֵּית שַׁמַּאי לְבֵית הִלֵּל, וּלְאַפּוֹקֵי מִדְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, דְּאָמַר: יֵשׁ מַמְזֵר מֵחַיָּיבֵי לָאוִין, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּאֵין מַמְזֵר מֵחַיָּיבֵי לָאוִין.
human_translation: Actually, Beit Shammai to Beit Hillel, to exclude of Rabbi Akiva, who said: from liable for a prohibition is a mamzer . teaches us from liable for a prohibition is not a mamzer ;
llm_translation: Always Beit Shammai to Beit Hillel, and to oppose from Rabbi Akiva, who said: There is a mamzer from those liable for negative commandments, it is heard to us that a mamzer is not liable for negative commandments.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁנֶּחְלְקוּ בֵּית שַׁמַּאי וּבֵית הִלֵּל בְּצָרוֹת וּבַאֲחָיוֹת,
human_translation: Come hear: Although Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel disagreed to rival wives, and sisters,
llm_translation: Come and hear: Even though Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel disagreed in matters of tzarot and ahayot,

hebrew_text: בְּגֵט יָשָׁן, וּבִסְפֵק אֵשֶׁת אִישׁ, וּבִמְגָרֵשׁ אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ וְלָנָה עִמּוֹ בְּפוּנְדָּק,
