human_translation: to an outdated bill of divorce And disagreed to an uncertain married woman, And disagreed to one who divorces his wife and she lodged with him at an inn,
llm_translation: In a get old, and in a doubt of a man's wife, and in divorcing his wife and she is with him in a tavern,

hebrew_text: בְּכֶסֶף וּבְשָׁוֶה כֶּסֶף, בִּפְרוּטָה וּבְשָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה —
human_translation: by money and with value of money, by a peruta or with value of a peruta .
llm_translation: With silver and with silver equivalent, with a specific item and with the equivalent of that specific item—

hebrew_text: לֹא נִמְנְעוּ בֵּית שַׁמַּאי מִלִּישָּׂא נָשִׁים מִבֵּית הִלֵּל, וְלֹא בֵּית הִלֵּל מִבֵּית שַׁמַּאי. לְלַמֶּדְךָ שֶׁחִיבָּה וְרֵיעוּת נוֹהֲגִים זֶה בָּזֶה, לְקַיֵּים מַה שֶּׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הָאֱמֶת וְהַשָּׁלוֹם אֱהָבוּ״. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: נִמְנְעוּ הֵן מִן הַוַּדַּאי, וְלֹא נִמְנְעוּ מִן הַסָּפֵק.
human_translation: Beit Shammai did not refrain from marrying women from Beit Hillel, nor did Beit Hillel from Beit Shammai. to teach you that practiced affection and camaraderie between them, to fulfill that which is stated: “Love truth and peace” Rabbi Shimon says: They did refrain in the certain but they did not refrain in the uncertain
llm_translation: The House of Shammai did not refrain from marrying women from the House of Hillel, and the House of Hillel did not refrain from marrying women from the House of Shammai. To teach you that affection and friendship are customary between them, to fulfill what is said: "Love truth and peace." Rabbi Shimon says: They refrained from certainty, but did not refrain from doubt.

hebrew_text: אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא עָשׂוּ — מִשּׁוּם הָכִי נִמְנְעוּ. אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ לֹא עָשׂוּ, אַמַּאי נִמְנְעוּ? וְתִסְבְּרָא? נְהִי נָמֵי דְּעָשׂוּ, בִּשְׁלָמָא בֵּית הִלֵּל — נִמְנְעוּ מִבֵּית שַׁמַּאי, דְּחַיָּיבֵי כָּרֵיתוֹת נִינְהוּ, וּמַמְזֵרִים הֵם לְבֵית הִלֵּל.
human_translation: Granted, if you say did act due to that they refrained However, if you say they did not act why did they refrain And you understand Even if they acted granted Beit Hillel refrained from Beit Shammai, those are liable to karet and are mamzerim according to Beit Hillel.
llm_translation: If you say they did - it is because of this that they were prevented. But if you say they did not do, why were they prevented? And should you suggest? Even though they did, it is because the House of Hillel - they were prevented from the House of Shammai, for they are liable for karet, and they are mamzerim for the House of Hillel.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא בֵּית שַׁמַּאי — אַמַּאי נִמְנְעוּ מִבֵּית הִלֵּל? בְּנֵי חַיָּיבֵי לָאוִין נִינְהוּ, וּכְשֵׁרִים נִינְהוּ! כִּדְאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: לֹא נִצְרְכָה אֶלָּא לַצָּרָה עַצְמָהּ, הָכָא נָמֵי: לָא נִצְרְכָה אֶלָּא לַצָּרָה עַצְמָהּ.
human_translation: However, why did Beit Shammai refrain from Beit Hillel? liable for prohibition, and are fit. as Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said This was necessary only for the rival wife herself. Here too, it was necessary only for the rival wife herself.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rather, Beit Shammai - why were they excluded from Beit Hillel? They are the strict ones, and they are valid! As Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: It was only necessary for its own distress, here too: It was only necessary for its own distress.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי שְׁנָא מִן הַוַּדַּאי — דְּאִיסּוּרָא הוּא, סָפֵק נָמֵי אִיסּוּרָא הוּא!
human_translation: And in what different from the certain that prohibited uncertain are also prohibited.
llm_translation: And what is the difference from the case of the Vadai (certain prohibition)? - For it is a prohibition, a doubtful prohibition is like a certain prohibition!

hebrew_text: לָא תֵּימָא: מִן הַסָּפֵק, אֶלָּא אֵימָא: מִן הַסְּתָם, דְּמוֹדְעִי לְהוּ וּפָרְשִׁי.
human_translation: Do not say: In the uncertain Rather, say: From the unspecified that would notify and refrain
llm_translation: Do not say: from doubt, rather say: from certainty, for it is known to Him and revealed.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן, דְּאַהֲבָה וְרֵיעוּת נוֹהֲגִים זֶה בָּזֶה? הַיְינוּ רֵישָׁא! הָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּכוּלַּהּ רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן הִיא.
human_translation: But what this teach us? that relations of affection and camaraderie between them, This is first clause teach us that the entire is Rabbi Shimon.
llm_translation: And what does it teach us, that love and friendship are customary with one another? That is the beginning! This teaches us that Rabbi Shimon is entirely consistent.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן נוּרִי: הֵיאַךְ הֲלָכָה זוֹ רוֹוַחַת בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל? נַעֲשֶׂה כְּדִבְרֵי בֵּית שַׁמַּאי — הַוָּלָד מַמְזֵר לְדִבְרֵי בֵּית הִלֵּל, נַעֲשֶׂה כְּדִבְרֵי בֵּית הִלֵּל — הַוָּלָד פָּגוּם לְדִבְרֵי בֵּית שַׁמַּאי. בּוֹאוּ וּנְתַקֵּן לָהֶן לַצָּרוֹת,
human_translation: Come hear, as Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Nuri said: How should this halakha become widespread among the Jewish people? we act in accordance with the statement of Beit Shammai the offspring a mamzer according to the statement of Beit Hillel. we act in accordance with the statement of Beit Hillel the offspring will flawed according to Beit Shammai, let us enact for rival wives
llm_translation: Come and hear, as Rabbi Yochanan ben Nuri said: How does this halakha settle among the people of Israel? If we follow the words of Beit Shammai — the child is a mamzer according to the words of Beit Hillel; if we follow the words of Beit Hillel — the child is a blemished one according to the words of Beit Shammai. Come and let us find a solution for them in their distress.

hebrew_text: שֶׁיְּהוּ חוֹלְצוֹת וְלֹא מִתְיַיבְּמוֹת. לֹא הִסְפִּיקוּ לִגְמוֹר אֶת הַדָּבָר עַד שֶׁנִּטְרְפָה הַשָּׁעָה.
human_translation: should perform ḥalitza and not enter into levirate marriage. They were unable to finalize the matter before times of trouble
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "That they should be divorced and not be levirate married. They did not have enough time to complete the matter until the moment was interrupted."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל: מָה נַעֲשֶׂה לָהֶם לַצָּרוֹת הָרִאשׁוֹנוֹת מֵעַתָּה?
human_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel said to What shall we do with those earlier rival wives from now
llm_translation: He said to him, Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel: What shall be done for the earlier troubles from now on?

hebrew_text: אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא עָשׂוּ — הַיְינוּ דְּקָאָמַר מָה נַעֲשֶׂה. אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ לֹא עָשׂוּ, מַאי מָה נַעֲשֶׂה?
human_translation: Granted, if you say did act this is what said: What shall we do? However, if you say they did not act what is What shall we do?
llm_translation: If you say they did - that is what it means by saying, "What shall we do?" But if you say they did not do, what then shall we do?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: לֹא נִצְרְכָה אֶלָּא לְצָרָה עַצְמָהּ, ״וּמָה נַעֲשֶׂה״ הָכִי קָאָמַר: הָנָךְ צָרוֹת דְּבֵית הִלֵּל, לְבֵית שַׁמַּאי הֵיכִי נַעֲבֵיד לְהוּ?
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: necessary, rather, only for the rival wife herself. What shall we do, this is what is saying: those rival wives to Beit Hillel, what we do with them to Beit Shammai,
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: It was necessary only for its own distress, "And what shall be done" thus he said: There are the troubles of Beit Hillel, how shall we act towards Beit Shammai?

hebrew_text: לִיחְלְצוּ — מִימַּאֲסִי אַגַּבְרַיְיהוּ. וְכִי תֵּימָא לִימַּאֲסָן — ״דְּרָכֶיהָ דַרְכֵי נוֹעַם וְכׇל נְתִיבוֹתֶיהָ שָׁלוֹם״.
human_translation: let them perform ḥalitza , they will be repulsive to their husbands, And if you would say, let them be repulsive “Her ways are ways of pleasantness, and all her paths are peace”
llm_translation: They should be redeemed - from the water due to their masters. And if you say they should be despised - "Her ways are ways of pleasantness, and all her paths are peace."

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן: תְּאֵבַנִי, מָתַי תָּבֹא צָרַת הַבַּת לְיָדִי וְאֶשָּׂאֶנָּה! אֵימָא וְאַשִּׂיאֶנָּה.
human_translation: Come hear as Rabbi Tarfon said: I yearn When shall my daughter’s rival wife come before me and I will marry her? Say: And I will marry her off,
llm_translation: Come and hear, for Rabbi Tarfon said: "I desire, when will the affliction of the daughter come into my hand that I may remove it!" Perhaps I will remove it.

hebrew_text: וְהָא תְּאֵבַנִי קָאָמַר! לְאַפּוֹקֵי מִדְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן נוּרִי.
human_translation: But he said: I yearn, to exclude Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Nuri,
llm_translation: And this is what Tevani said! To go out from Rabbi Yochanan ben Nuri.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּבִתּוֹ שֶׁל רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל שֶׁהָיְתָה נְשׂוּאָה לְאַבָּא אָחִיו, וּמֵת בְּלֹא בָּנִים, וְיִיבֵּם רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אֶת צָרָתָהּ. וְתִסְבְּרָא, רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל מִתַּלְמִידֵי בֵּית שַׁמַּאי הוּא?
human_translation: Come hear an incident involving Rabban Gamliel’s daughter, who was married to Abba, his brother, and died childless, and Rabban Gamliel entered into levirate marriage with her rival wife. And you understand it Rabban Gamliel among the disciples of Beit Shammai?
llm_translation: Come and hear: There was an incident involving the daughter of Rabban Gamliel who was married to his brother, and he died childless, and Rabban Gamliel performed the levirate marriage with her. And she thought, is Rabban Gamliel a disciple of Beit Shammai?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא שָׁאנֵי בִּתּוֹ שֶׁל רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, דְּאַיְלוֹנִית הֲוַאי. הָא מִדְּקָתָנֵי סֵיפָא: אֲחֵרִים אוֹמְרִים בִּתּוֹ שֶׁל רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אַיְלוֹנִית הָיְתָה, מִכְּלָל דְּתַנָּא קַמָּא סָבַר לָאו אַיְלוֹנִית הָיְתָה!
human_translation: Rather, Rabban Gamliel’s daughter is different, as she was a sexually underdeveloped woman [ aylonit ], from that it is taught the latter clause Others say Rabban Gamliel’s daughter was an aylonit , by inference that the first tanna holds she was not an aylonit .
llm_translation: Rather, the daughter of Rabban Gamliel was a palm tree. This is evident from the latter part: Others say, the daughter of Rabban Gamliel was a palm tree, which implies that according to the first Tanna, she was not a palm tree!

hebrew_text: הִכִּיר בָּהּ וְלֹא הִכִּיר בָּהּ, אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: between them he knew she but he did not know about her
llm_translation: He recognized her and did not recognize her, there is a difference between them.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: כָּנַס וּלְבַסּוֹף גֵּירַשׁ אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: And if you wish, say between them married and ultimately divorced.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: He gathered and in the end he divorced, there is a distinction between them.

hebrew_text: אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: יֵשׁ תְּנַאי בְּבִיאָה אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: And if you wish, say between them there is a condition in sexual relations.
llm_translation: If you will say: Are there disputes in matters of sexual intercourse? There is a distinction between them.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַב מְשַׁרְשְׁיָא: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא שֶׁלִּיקֵּט אֶתְרוֹג בְּאֶחָד בִּשְׁבָט, וְנָהַג בּוֹ שְׁנֵי עִשּׂוּרִין.
human_translation: Rav Mesharshiyya raised an objection an incident involving Rabbi Akiva, who collected an etrog on the first of Shevat and performed with it two tenths.
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: Rav Mesharshya raised a contradiction: There was an incident with Rabbi Akiva that he picked an etrog on the first of Shevat, and he used it for two weeks.

hebrew_text: אֶחָד כְּדִבְרֵי בֵּית שַׁמַּאי, וְאֶחָד כְּדִבְרֵי בֵּית הִלֵּל. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ עָשׂוּ!
human_translation: One in accordance with the statement of Beit Shammai, And one in accordance with the statement of Beit Hillel, Conclude from here did act
llm_translation: One like the words of Beit Shammai, and one like the words of Beit Hillel. Listen to the conclusion!

hebrew_text: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא גְּמָרֵיהּ אִסְתַּפַּק לֵיהּ, וְלָא יְדַע אִי בֵּית הִלֵּל בְּאֶחָד בִּשְׁבָט אֲמוּר, אוֹ בַּחֲמִשָּׁה עָשָׂר בִּשְׁבָט אֲמוּר.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva was uncertain as to his tradition, and he did not know if Beit Hillel said on the first of Shevat or if they said on the fifteenth of Shevat.
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva completed it, he was in doubt, and he did not know whether Beit Hillel said on the first of Shevat, or on the fifteenth of Shevat.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב מָר זוּטְרָא: מַעֲשֶׂה וְיָלְדָה כַּלָּתוֹ שֶׁל שַׁמַּאי הַזָּקֵן, וּפִיחֵת אֶת הַמַּעֲזִיבָה, וְסִיכֵּךְ עַל גַּבֵּי מִטָּה בִּשְׁבִיל קָטָן. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ עָשׂוּ! הָתָם, הָרוֹאֶה אוֹמֵר לְאַפּוֹשֵׁי אֲוִיר קָעָבֵיד.
human_translation: Mar Zutra raised an objection an incident in which the daughter-in-law of Shammai the Elder gave birth and he removed the mortar [ ma’aziva ] and he placed covering over the bed for the minor. Conclude from here did act there, watching say he did it to increase air.
llm_translation: The Master Zutra raises an objection: There was an incident where the daughter-in-law of Shammai the Elder gave birth, and she blew out the lamp, and covered it with a bed for the sake of the infant. Learn from this case! There, the one who sees says to those who are in the dark, "Bring a lamp."

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב מָר זוּטְרָא: מַעֲשֵׂה בְּשׁוֹקֶת יֵהוּא שֶׁהָיְתָה בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם, וְהָיְתָה נְקוּבָה לַמִּקְוֶה, וְכׇל טְהָרוֹת שֶׁהָיוּ בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם נַעֲשִׂים עַל גַּבָּהּ. וְשָׁלְחוּ בֵּית שַׁמַּאי וְהִרְחִיבוּהָ, שֶׁבֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: עַד שֶׁתִּיפָּחֵת בְּרוּבָּהּ,
human_translation: Mar Zutra raised objection: an incident involving the Yehu water trough in Jerusalem, which had a hole to a ritual bath, and all the ritual purifications in Jerusalem were performed in it, And Beit Shammai sent and they widened as Beit Shammai say: unless the majority of it is opened.
llm_translation: The Master Zutra raised an objection: There was an incident in the Shukat Yehudah in Jerusalem, which was a pit connected to a mikveh, and all the purifications of Jerusalem were performed on its account. Beit Shammai sent and enlarged it, for Beit Shammai say: Until it is equal in size to a pit.

hebrew_text: וּתְנַן: עֵירוּב מִקְוָאוֹת, כִּשְׁפוֹפֶרֶת הַנּוֹד בְּעוֹבְיָיהּ וּבַחֲלָלָהּ, כִּשְׁתֵּי אֶצְבָּעוֹת חוֹזְרוֹת לִמְקוֹמָן. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ עָשׂוּ! הָתָם
human_translation: And we learned a joining of ritual baths width of the tube of a wineskin, and in its space about two fingers that can return to their place. conclude from this did act There,
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: The joining of courtyards, like the circumference of a pot, in its thickness and in its cavity, like two fingers returning to their place. Learn from it! There, in that case...

hebrew_text: הָרוֹאֶה אוֹמֵר: לְאַפּוֹשֵׁי מַיָּא הוּא דְּקָא עָבֵיד.
human_translation: watching say he did to increase the water
llm_translation: The one who sees says: "It is for the sake of the water carriers that he is doing this."

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בַּר צָדוֹק: כְּשֶׁהָיִיתִי לוֹמֵד תּוֹרָה אֵצֶל רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן הַחוֹרָנִי, רָאִיתִי שֶׁהָיָה אוֹכֵל פַּת חֲרֵיבָה בְּמֶלַח בִּשְׁנֵי בַצּוֹרֶת. בָּאתִי וְהוֹדַעְתִּי אֶת אַבָּא, אָמַר לִי: הוֹלֵךְ לוֹ זֵיתִים, וְהוֹלַכְתִּי לוֹ. רָאָה אוֹתָן שֶׁהֵן לַחִין, אָמַר לִי: אֵין אֲנִי אוֹכֵל זֵיתִים.
human_translation: Come hear, as Rabbi Elazar bar Tzadok said: When I studied Torah with Rabbi Yoḥanan the Ḥorani, I saw that he would eat dry bread in salt in years of drought. I went and informed father he said to me: Take olives him, and I took him saw that they were moist he said to me: I do not eat olives.
llm_translation: Come and hear, for Rabbi Elazar son of Tzadok said: When I was studying Torah with Rabbi Yochanan the Horanite, I saw that he would eat stale bread with salt in the shape of a beitza. I came and informed my father, he said to me: Go to him olives, and I went to him. He saw that they were spoiled, he said to me: I do not eat olives.

hebrew_text: בָּאתִי וְהוֹדַעְתִּי אֶת אַבָּא. אָמַר לִי: לֵךְ וֶאֱמוֹר לוֹ, חָבִית נְקוּבָה הָיְתָה אֶלָּא שֶׁסְּתָמוּהָ שְׁמָרִים. וּתְנַן: חָבִית שֶׁל זֵיתִים מְגוּלְגָּלִים, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: אֵין צְרִיכָה לִנָּקֵב.
human_translation: I went and informed father. He said to me: Go and say to him barrel was perforated, but it was clogged by sediments And we learned a barrel of preserved olives, Beit Shammai say it does not need to be perforated,
llm_translation: I came and informed Abba. He said to me: Go and tell him, it was a perforated barrel, but they sealed it. And we learned: A barrel of olives that were rolled, Beit Shammai says: It does not need to be perforated.

hebrew_text: וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: צְרִיכָה לִנָּקֵב. וּמוֹדִים שֶׁאִם נִיקְּבָה וּסְתָמוּהָ שְׁמָרִים — שֶׁהִיא טְהוֹרָה.
human_translation: And Beit Hillel say it does need to be perforated, And concede that if was perforated and clogged by sediments it is ritually pure,
llm_translation: House of Hillel says: it needs to be pierced. And they agree that if it was pierced and its opening was sealed - it remains pure.

hebrew_text: וְאַף עַל פִּי שֶׁתַּלְמִיד שַׁמַּאי הָיָה, כׇּל מַעֲשָׂיו לֹא עָשָׂה אֶלָּא כְּדִבְרֵי בֵּית הִלֵּל. אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא עָשׂוּ — הַיְינוּ רְבוּתֵיהּ. אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ לֹא עָשׂוּ — מַאי רְבוּתֵיהּ?!
human_translation: And although was a disciple of Shammai, he always acted only in accordance with the statements of Beit Hillel. Granted, if you say acted this is greatness, However, if you say did not act what is the greatness of
llm_translation: And even though Shammai was his disciple, all his actions he did only according to the words of Hillel. If you say they did the actions - that is his greatness. But if you say they did not do the actions - what is his greatness?!

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: שָׁאֲלוּ אֶת רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ, צָרַת הַבַּת מַהוּ? אָמַר לָהֶם: מַחְלוֹקֶת בֵּית שַׁמַּאי וּבֵית הִלֵּל. וַהֲלָכָה כְּדִבְרֵי מִי? אָמַר לָהֶם: מִפְּנֵי מָה אַתֶּם מַכְנִיסִין רֹאשִׁי בֵּין שְׁנֵי הָרִים גְּדוֹלִים, בֵּין שְׁתֵּי מַחְלוֹקוֹת גְּדוֹלוֹת, בֵּין בֵּית שַׁמַּאי וּבֵין בֵּית הִלֵּל. מִתְיָירֵא אֲנִי שֶׁמָּא יָרוֹצּוּ גֻּלְגׇּלְתִּי.
human_translation: Come hear They asked Rabbi Yehoshua: What is rival wife of a daughter? He said to them: dispute between Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel. And in accordance with whose statement is the halakha ? He said to them: Why are you inserting my head between two great mountains, between two great disputing between Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel? I fear lest break my skull.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Ta shema: sha'alu et Rabbi Yehoshua, tzarat habat mahu? Amar lahem: machloket Beit Shammai u'Beit Hillel. Vehalakha ke'divrei mi? Amar lahem: mipnei mah atem makhnisin roshi bein shnei harim gedolim, bein shtei machlokot gedolot, bein Beit Shammai u'Beit Hillel. Mit'yarei ani shema yarotzu gulglati." English translation: "Come and hear: They asked Rabbi Yehoshua, what is the affliction of the daughter? He said to them: It is the dispute between Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel. And the halakha follows whose words? He said to them: Why do you bring my head between two great mountains, between two great disputes, between Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel? I am afraid lest my skull roll away."

hebrew_text: אֲבָל אֲנִי מֵעִיד לָכֶם עַל שְׁתֵּי מִשְׁפָּחוֹת גְּדוֹלוֹת שֶׁהָיוּ בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם, מִשְׁפַּחַת בֵּית צְבוֹעִים מִבֶּן עַכְמַאי, וּמִשְׁפַּחַת בֵּית קוֹפַאי מִבֶּן מְקוֹשֵׁשׁ, שֶׁהֵם בְּנֵי צָרוֹת, וּמֵהֶם כֹּהֲנִים גְּדוֹלִים, וְשִׁמְּשׁוּ עַל גַּבֵּי הַמִּזְבֵּחַ.
human_translation: However, I shall testify to you about two great families that were in Jerusalem, the Beit Tzevo’im family from Ben Akhmai, and the Beit Kofai family from Ben Mekoshesh: They were the descendants of rival wives and from them High Priests who served on the altar.
llm_translation: But I testify to you about two prominent families that were in Jerusalem, the family of Beit Tzvo'aim from the descendants of Akhmamai, and the family of Beit Kofa'aim from the descendants of Meqoshesh, who were of the lineage of scribes, and some of them were high priests, and they served upon the altar.

hebrew_text: אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא עָשׂוּ — הַיְינוּ דְּקָאָמַר מִתְיָירֵא אֲנִי. אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ לֹא עָשׂוּ, אַמַּאי קָאָמַר מִתְיָירֵא אֲנִי? וּנְהִי נָמֵי דְּעָשׂוּ, מַאי מִתְיָירֵא אֲנִי?
human_translation: Granted, if you say acted this is why said: I fear, However, if you say they did not act why did he say: I fear? And even did act what is I fear?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: If you say they did - that is what he means by saying, "I am afraid." But if you say they did not do it, why does he say, "I am afraid"? And even if they did do it, why should he be afraid?

hebrew_text: הָא אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: אֵין מַמְזֵר אֶלָּא מֵחַיָּיבֵי מִיתוֹת בֵּית דִּין! נְהִי נָמֵי דְּמַמְזֵר לָא הָוֵי, פָּגוּם מִיהָא הָוֵי.
human_translation: Didn’t Rabbi Yehoshua say a mamzer is only from of those liable to the court-imposed capital punishments, Even if not be a mamzer , nevertheless be flawed
llm_translation: הָא - This אָמַר - said רַבִּי - Rabbi יְהוֹשֻׁעַ - Yehoshua אֵין - There is no מַמְזֵר - mamzer אֶלָּא - except מֵחַיָּיבֵי - from those liable מִיתוֹת - to death בֵּית - of the house דִּין - of judgment נְהִי - Granted נָמֵי - it is true דְּמַמְזֵר - that a mamzer לָא - not הָוֵי - is פָּגוּם - blemished מִיהָא - from there הָוֵי - is

hebrew_text: מִקַּל וָחוֹמֶר מֵאַלְמָנָה: מָה אַלְמָנָה, שֶׁאֵין אִיסּוּרָהּ נוֹהֵג בַּכֹּל — בְּנָהּ פָּגוּם, זוֹ, שֶׁאִיסּוּרָהּ שָׁוֶה בַּכֹּל כּוּ׳.
human_translation: by an a fortiori from a widow: Just as a widow, whose prohibition does not apply to all, and her son is flawed, this her prohibition applies equally to all,
llm_translation: From a fortiori reasoning from a widow: Just as a widow, whose prohibition does not apply to everyone - her son, who is blemished, this one, whose prohibition applies to everyone, as it is stated.

hebrew_text: קָבְעוּ מִינֵּיהּ צָרוֹת, וְקָפָשֵׁיט לֵיהּ בְּנֵי צָרוֹת! תַּרְתֵּי קָא בָּעֵי מִינֵּיהּ: צָרוֹת מַאי? וְאִם תִּמְצֵי לוֹמַר צָרוֹת כְּבֵית הִלֵּל, בְּנֵי צָרוֹת דְּבֵית הִלֵּל — לְבֵית שַׁמַּאי מַהוּ?
human_translation: They asked rival wives, and he answered them the children of rival wives. They asked him two what is rival wives? And if you say rival wives in accordance with Beit Hillel what is according to Beit Shammai the children of rival wives Beit Hillel,
llm_translation: They established heresy, and the sons of heresy surrounded it! Two things are required from it: What is heresy? And if you want to say heresy like Beit Hillel, the sons of heresy of Beit Hillel - what is the ruling of Beit Shammai?

hebrew_text: לְמַאי נָפְקָא מִינַּהּ? לְמִיפְשַׁט וְלַד מַחֲזִיר גְּרוּשָׁתוֹ לְבֵית הִלֵּל.
human_translation: What difference to resolve child of one who remarries his divorcée according to Beit Hillel.
llm_translation: For what does it come out? To clarify and to return a divorcee to the school of Hillel.

hebrew_text: מִי קָאָמְרִינַן קַל וָחוֹמֶר: וּמָה אַלְמָנָה לְכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל שֶׁאֵין אִיסּוּרָהּ שָׁוֶה בַּכֹּל — בְּנָהּ פָּגוּם. זוֹ, שֶׁאִיסּוּרָהּ שָׁוֶה בַּכֹּל — אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁבְּנָהּ פָּגוּם?
human_translation: Do we say an a fortiori And just as a widow to a High Priest, whose prohibition does not apply to all, and her son is flawed this whose prohibition applies equally to all is it not right that her son flawed
llm_translation: Who said "kal vachomer": And what an almanah for a Kohen Gadol whose prohibition is not equal in all - her son is disqualified. This, whose prohibition is equal in all - is it not the law that her son is disqualified?

hebrew_text: אוֹ דִלְמָא אִיכָּא לְמִיפְרַךְ: מָה לְאַלְמָנָה שֶׁהִיא עַצְמָהּ מִתְחַלֶּלֶת. וַאֲמַר לְהוּ: צָרוֹת מִתְיָירֵא אֲנִי,
human_translation: Or perhaps can be refuted: What that a widow as she herself is disqualified And said to them: I fear rival wives
llm_translation: Or perhaps there is room to argue: What about a widow who defiles herself? And he said to them: I am afraid of marital troubles.

hebrew_text: בְּנֵי צָרוֹת אֲנִי מֵעִיד לָכֶם.
human_translation: children of rival wives, I testify to you
llm_translation: Sons of Tsarot, I testify to you.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: בִּימֵי רַבִּי דּוֹסָא בֶּן הַרְכִּינָס הוּתְּרָה צָרַת הַבַּת לָאַחִין. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ עָשׂוּ: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Come hear In the time of Rabbi Dosa ben Harkinas, the rival wife of a daughter was permitted to the brothers. Conclude from this did act conclude from
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Ta shma: bimei Rabbi Dosa ben Harkinas hutra tzarat habat la'achin. Shma minah asu: shma minah." English translation: "Come and hear: In the days of Rabbi Dosa ben Harkinas, the impurity of a daughter was permitted to her brothers. They heard from it: they heard from it."

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא. בִּימֵי רַבִּי דּוֹסָא בֶּן הַרְכִּינָס הִתִּירוּ צָרַת הַבַּת לָאַחִין, וְהָיָה הַדָּבָר קָשֶׁה לַחֲכָמִים, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁחָכָם גָּדוֹל הָיָה, וְעֵינָיו קָמוּ מִלָּבֹא לְבֵית הַמִּדְרָשׁ.
human_translation: the itself. In the time of Rabbi Dosa ben Harkinas permitted the rival wife of a daughter to the brothers. And this matter was difficult the Rabbis because he was a great Sage and his eyes had dimmed of coming to the study hall.
llm_translation: Body. In the days of Rabbi Dosa ben Harkinas, they permitted the daughter's affliction to her brothers, and the matter was difficult for the sages, because he was a great sage, and his eyes rose from entering the study hall.

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ: וּמִי יֵלֵךְ וְיוֹדִיעוֹ? אָמַר לָהֶן רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: אֲנִי אֵלֵךְ. וְאַחֲרָיו מִי — רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה. וְאַחֲרָיו מִי — רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא. הָלְכוּ וְעָמְדוּ עַל פֶּתַח בֵּיתוֹ. נִכְנְסָה שִׁפְחָתוֹ, אָמְרָה לוֹ: רַבִּי, חַכְמֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל בָּאִין אֶצְלְךָ, אָמַר לָהּ: יִכָּנְסוּ, וְנִכְנְסוּ.
human_translation: said: And who will go and notify him Rabbi Yehoshua said to them: I will go. And who after him? Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya, And who after him? Rabbi Akiva. They went and stood at the entrance of house. His maidservant entered said to him: Rabbi, the Sages of Israel have come to you. He said to her: Let them enter, and they entered.
llm_translation: They said: "Who will go and inform him?" Rabbi Yehoshua said to them: "I will go." And after him, who? Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah. And after him, who? Rabbi Akiva. They went and stood at the entrance of his house. His maidservant entered, she said to him: "Rabbi, the sages of Israel are coming to you." He said to her: "Let them enter, and they entered."

hebrew_text: תְּפָסוֹ לְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ, וְהוֹשִׁיבָהוּ עַל מִטָּה שֶׁל זָהָב. אָמַר לוֹ: רַבִּי, אֱמוֹר לְתַלְמִידְךָ אַחֵר וְיֵשֵׁב. אָמַר לוֹ: מִי הוּא? רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה. אָמַר: וְיֵשׁ לוֹ בֵּן לַעֲזַרְיָה חֲבֵירֵנוּ?
human_translation: grabbed Rabbi Yehoshua, and sat him on a bed of gold, said to him: Rabbi, call your other disciple that he may sit. He said to him: Who is it? Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya. said: And does our colleague Azarya have a son?
llm_translation: They caught Rabbi Yehoshua, and they seated him on a golden bed. He said to him: Rabbi, tell another student of yours to sit. He said to him: Who is it? Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah. He said: Does Azariah have a son, our colleague?

hebrew_text: קָרָא עָלָיו הַמִּקְרָא הַזֶּה: ״נַעַר הָיִיתִי גַּם זָקַנְתִּי וְלֹא רָאִיתִי צַדִּיק נֶעֱזָב וְזַרְעוֹ מְבַקֶּשׁ לָחֶם״. תְּפָסוֹ וְהוֹשִׁיבוֹ עַל מִטָּה שֶׁל זָהָב. אָמַר לוֹ: רַבִּי, אֱמוֹר לְתַלְמִידְךָ אַחֵר וְיֵשֵׁב. אָמַר לוֹ: וּמִי הוּא? עֲקִיבָא בֶּן יוֹסֵף. אָמַר לוֹ: אַתָּה הוּא עֲקִיבָא בֶּן יוֹסֵף שֶׁשִּׁמְךָ הוֹלֵךְ מִסּוֹף הָעוֹלָם וְעַד סוֹפוֹ?! שֵׁב בְּנִי, שֵׁב, כְּמוֹתְךָ יִרְבּוּ בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל.
human_translation: recited this verse about “I have been young, and now am old; yet I have not seen the righteous forsaken, nor his seed begging bread” He grabbed him and sat him on a bed of gold. said to him: Rabbi, call your other disciple that he may sit. He said to him: Who is that? Akiva ben Yosef. said to him: You are Akiva ben Yosef, whose name has spread from one end of the world to the other? Sit, my son, sit. May the likes of you multiply in Israel.
llm_translation: The verse called out concerning him: "I was a youth, also I have grown old, yet I have not seen a righteous one forsaken, nor his seed begging for bread." They seized him and sat him on a golden couch. He said to him: Rabbi, say to another one of your disciples to sit. He said to him: And who is he? Akiva ben Yosef. He said to him: Are you Akiva ben Yosef, whose name goes from one end of the world to the other?! Sit, my son, sit, for in your days the number of Israel will increase.

hebrew_text: הִתְחִילוּ מְסַבְּבִים אוֹתוֹ בַּהֲלָכוֹת, עַד שֶׁהִגִּיעוּ לְצָרַת הַבַּת. אֲמַרוּ לוֹ: צָרַת הַבַּת מַהוּ? אָמַר לָהֶן: מַחְלוֹקֶת בֵּית שַׁמַּאי וּבֵית הִלֵּל. הֲלָכָה כְּדִבְרֵי מִי? אָמַר לָהֶן: הֲלָכָה כְּבֵית הִלֵּל. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: וַהֲלֹא מִשִּׁמְךָ אָמְרוּ הֲלָכָה כְּבֵית שַׁמַּאי!
human_translation: they began to encircle him with halakhot , until they came to rival wife of a daughter. They said to him: What is rival wife of a daughter? He said dispute between Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel. According to whose statement is the halakha ? He said to them: The halakha is in accordance with Beit Hillel. They said to him: But didn’t they say in your name that the halakha is in accordance with Beit Shammai?
llm_translation: They began surrounding him with halakhot, until they reached the Zarath HaBat. They said to him: What is the Zarath HaBat? He said to them: A dispute between Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel. Whose words is the halakha like? He said to them: The halakha is like Beit Hillel. They said to him: But didn't they say the halakha is like Beit Shammai from your name!

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָהֶם: דּוֹסָא שְׁמַעְתֶּם, אוֹ בֶּן הַרְכִּינָס שְׁמַעְתֶּם? אֲמַרוּ לוֹ: חַיֵּי רַבִּי, סְתָם שָׁמַעְנוּ. אָמַר לָהֶם: אָח קָטָן יֵשׁ לִי, בְּכוֹר שָׂטָן הוּא, וְיוֹנָתָן שְׁמוֹ, וְהוּא מִתַּלְמִידֵי שַׁמַּאי.
human_translation: He said to them: Did you hear Dosa or did you hear ben Harkinas? They said to him: On your life, Rabbi, we heard simply He said to them: I have a younger brother who is the firstborn of the Satan, And his name is Yonatan, and he is among the disciples of Shammai.
llm_translation: He said to them: Did you hear of Dosa, or did you hear of Ben Harkinas? They said to him: By the life of our master, we heard only in general terms. He said to them: I have a younger brother, who is a firstborn Satan, and his name is Yonatan, and he is a disciple of the school of Shammai.

hebrew_text: וְהִזָּהֲרוּ שֶׁלֹּא יְקַפֵּחַ אֶתְכֶם בַּהֲלָכוֹת, לְפִי שֶׁיֵּשׁ עִמּוֹ שְׁלֹשׁ מֵאוֹת תְּשׁוּבוֹת בְּצָרַת הַבַּת שֶׁהִיא מוּתֶּרֶת. אֲבָל מֵעִיד אֲנִי עָלַי שָׁמַיִם וָאָרֶץ, שֶׁעַל מְדוֹכָה זוֹ יָשַׁב חַגַּי הַנָּבִיא, וְאָמַר שְׁלֹשָׁה דְּבָרִים: צָרַת הַבַּת אֲסוּרָה,
human_translation: And beware that he not batter you with halakhot as he has with him three hundred proofs with regard to rival wife of a daughter that she is permitted. However, I call as witnesses before me the heavens and the earth that on this mortar, Haggai the prophet sat, and he said three matters rival wife of a daughter is forbidden.
llm_translation: Be cautious not to anger you with the laws, for there are with him three hundred answers in the distress of the daughter who is permitted. But I testify about myself, heaven and earth, that Hagai the prophet sat on this bench, and said three things: the distress of the daughter is forbidden.

hebrew_text: עַמּוֹן וּמוֹאָב מְעַשְּׂרִין מַעְשַׂר עָנִי בַּשְּׁבִיעִית, וּמְקַבְּלִים גֵּרִים מִן הַקַּרְדּוֹיִין וּמִן הַתַּרְמוֹדִים.
human_translation: Ammon and Moab tithe the poor man’s tithe in the Sabbatical Year. And one accepts converts from the Karduyin and the Tarmodim,
llm_translation: Ammon and Moab tithe the poor man's tithe in the seventh year, and accept converts from the Kardeans and from the Thermudites.

hebrew_text: תַּנָּא: כְּשֶׁנִּכְנְסוּ — נִכְנְסוּ בְּפֶתַח אֶחָד, כְּשֶׁיָּצְאוּ — יָצְאוּ בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה פְּתָחִים. פָּגַע בּוֹ בְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, אַקְשִׁי לֵיהּ וְאוֹקְמֵיהּ.
human_translation: taught: When they entered, they entered through one entrance. When they left, they left through three entrances, Rabbi Akiva encountered him. raised against him objections and he withstood him,
llm_translation: Mishnah: When they entered - they entered through one entrance, when they exited - they exited through three entrances. Rabbi Akiva encountered him, he was harsh with him and rebuked him.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ: אַתָּה הוּא עֲקִיבָא שֶׁשִּׁמְךָ הוֹלֵךְ מִסּוֹף הָעוֹלָם וְעַד סוֹפוֹ? אַשְׁרֶיךָ שֶׁזָּכִיתָ לְשֵׁם, וַעֲדַיִין לֹא הִגַּעְתָּ לְרוֹעֵי בָקָר. אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: וַאֲפִילּוּ לְרוֹעֵי צֹאן.
human_translation: said to him: You are Akiva ben Yosef, whose name has spread from one end of the world to the other? Be happy that you have merited a name, and you have not yet reached of cattle herders. Rabbi Akiva said to him And even of shepherds,
llm_translation: He said to him: "Are you Akiva, whose name goes from one end of the world to the other?" "Fortunate are you that you have merited a name, and yet you have not reached the level of the cattle herders." Rabbi Akiva said to him: "Even to the cattle herders."

hebrew_text: עַמּוֹן וּמוֹאָב מְעַשְּׂרִין מַעְשַׂר עָנִי בַּשְּׁבִיעִית. דְּאָמַר מָר: הַרְבֵּה כְּרַכִּים כָּבְשׁוּ עוֹלֵי מִצְרַיִם וְלֹא כָּבְשׁוּ עוֹלֵי בָבֶל, וּקְדוּשָּׁה רִאשׁוֹנָה — קִדְּשָׁה לִשְׁעָתָהּ, וְלֹא קִדְּשָׁה לֶעָתִיד לָבֹא.
human_translation: Ammon and Moab tithe the poor man’s tithe in the Sabbatical Year, as the Master said: Many cities were conquered by those who returned from Egypt, and were not conquered by those who returned from Babylonia And the initial consecration sanctified it for its time and did not sanctify it forever,
llm_translation: Ammon and Moab tithe the tithe of the poor in the seventh year. As Mar said: The Israelites conquered many cities of Egypt and did not conquer the cities of Babylon, and the first sanctification - it was sanctified for its time, and it was not sanctified for the future.

hebrew_text: וְהִנִּיחוּם, כְּדֵי שֶׁיִּסְמְכוּ עֲלֵיהֶן עֲנִיִּים בַּשְּׁבִיעִית.
human_translation: And left those so that the poor could rely upon them. in the Sabbatical Year
llm_translation: And they shall leave them, so that the poor may rely on them in the seventh year.

hebrew_text: וּמְקַבְּלִים גֵּרִים מִן הַקַּרְדּוֹיִים וְהַתַּרְמוֹדִים. אִינִי?! וְהָא תָּנֵי רָמֵי בַּר יְחֶזְקֵאל: אֵין מְקַבְּלִים גֵּרִים מִן הַקַּרְדּוֹיִים! אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: קַרְתּוֹיִים אִתְּמַר. כִּדְאָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי: קַרְתּוֹיִים פְּסוּלִים.
human_translation: And one accepts converts from the Karduyim and the Tarmodim. Is that so? But didn’t Rami bar Yeḥezkel teach One does not accept converts from the Karduyim? Rav Ashi said: Kartuyim, was stated As people say The Kartuyim are unfit.
llm_translation: Accepting converts from the Cardoyim and Thermudim. Is it not so?! But didn't Ramei bar Yehezkel teach: Converts are not accepted from the Cardoyim! Rav Ashe said: It should be read as Kartoyim. As people say: Kartoyim are disqualified.

hebrew_text: וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי, תָּנֵי רָמֵי בַּר יְחֶזְקֵאל: אֵין מְקַבְּלִים גֵּרִים מִן הַקַּרְתּוֹיִים. מַאי לָאו: הַיְינוּ קַרְתּוֹיִים הַיְינוּ קַרְדּוֹיִים! אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: לָא, קַרְתּוֹיֵי לְחוֹד וְקַרְדּוֹיֵי לְחוֹד, כִּדְאָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי: קַרְתּוֹיֵי פְּסִילִי.
human_translation: And there are who say Rami bar Yeḥezkel taught: One does not accept converts from the Kartuyim. What, is it not Kartuyim is Karduyim? Rav Ashi said: No; the Kartuyim are discrete and the Karduyim are discrete as people say: Kartuyim are unfit.
llm_translation: There are those who say, Ramai son of Yehezkel taught: We do not accept converts from the Karthoyim. What is the reason? Are the Karthoyim the same as the Kardoyim! Rav Ashe said: No, the Karthoyim are one thing and the Kardoyim are another thing, as people say: The Karthoyim are idolaters.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן וְסָבַיָּא דְּאָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ: אֵין מְקַבְּלִים גֵּרִים מִן הַתַּרְמוֹדִים. וּמִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן הָכִי? וְהָתְנַן: כׇּל הַכְּתָמִים הַבָּאִים מִן הָרְקָם — טְהוֹרִים.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan and the Elders both say: One does not accept converts from the Tarmodim. And did Rabbi Yoḥanan say this, But didn’t we learn All stains that come from the Rekem are ritually pure,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan and Sabayya both said: We do not accept converts from the Tarmodians. Did Rabbi Yochanan really say this? But we learned: All cutaneous disorders that come from the skin are pure.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה מְטַמֵּא, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהֵם גֵּרִים וְטוֹעִים. מִבֵּין הַגּוֹיִם — טְהוֹרִים. וְהָוֵינַן בַּהּ:
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda deems ritually impure because those are converts and are in error. from among the gentiles, are ritually pure. And we discussed
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda declares impure, because they are converts and err. Among the nations - pure. And we are in it.

hebrew_text: קָפָסֵיק וְתָנֵי: מִבֵּין הַגּוֹיִם, וַאֲפִילּוּ מִן תַּרְמוֹד. וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: זֹאת אוֹמֶרֶת מְקַבְּלִין גֵּרִים מִתַּרְמוֹד.
human_translation: concluded and taught: among the gentiles And even from Tarmod. And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: That is to say, one accepts converts from Tarmod
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Kafsik and taught: From among the nations, and even from Tarmod. And Rabbi Yochanan said: This means we accept converts from Tarmod.

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא ״זֹאת״, וְלָא סְבִירָא לֵיהּ — וְהָא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הֲלָכָה כִּסְתַם מִשְׁנָה! אָמוֹרָאֵי נִינְהוּ, וְאַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן.
human_translation: And if you would say That and he does not hold this but didn’t Rabbi Yoḥanan state halakha is in accordance with an unattributed mishna, They are amora’im , and in accordance with Rabbi Yoḥanan.
llm_translation: And if you say, "this," and it does not seem to him - but Rabbi Yochanan said: The halacha follows the anonymous Mishnah! They are the words of the Amoraim, and not according to Rabbi Yochanan.

hebrew_text: מִתַּרְמוֹד מַאי טַעְמָא לָא? פְּלִיגִי בַּהּ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן וְסָבַיָּא, חַד אָמַר: מִשּׁוּם עַבְדֵי שְׁלֹמֹה, וְחַד אָמַר: מִשּׁוּם בְּנוֹת יְרוּשָׁלַיִם.
human_translation: And what is the reason not from Tarmod? Rabbi Yoḥanan and the Elders disagree this One said due to the servants of Solomon. And one said due to the daughters of Jerusalem,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: What is the reason for permitting it? Rabbi Yochanan and Sabiya disagree about it. One says: Because of the servants of Solomon, and one says: Because of the daughters of Jerusalem.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר מִשּׁוּם עַבְדֵי שְׁלֹמֹה, קָסָבַר: גּוֹי וְעֶבֶד הַבָּא עַל בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל — הַוָּלָד מַמְזֵר. אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר מִשּׁוּם בְּנוֹת יְרוּשָׁלַיִם, מַאי הִיא? פְּלִיגִי בַּהּ רַב יוֹסֵף וְרַבָּנַן, וְתַרְוַיְיהוּ מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה.
human_translation: Granted, according to the one who said due to the servants of Solomon, he holds a gentile or a slave who had intercourse with a Jewish woman, the offspring is a mamzer . However, according to the one who said due to the daughters of Jerusalem, what is Rav Yosef and the Rabbis disagree this and both in the name of Rabba bar bar Ḥana.
llm_translation: In truth, according to the one who says in the name of the servants of Solomon, he holds: A non-Jew and a slave who cohabits with a daughter of Israel — the offspring is a mamzer. But according to the one who says in the name of the daughters of Jerusalem, what is it? Rav Yosef and the Rabbis dispute it, and both of them in the name of Rabba bar bar Ḥana.

hebrew_text: חַד אָמַר: תְּרֵיסַר אַלְפֵי גַּבְרֵי וְשִׁיתָּא אַלְפֵי קַשְׁתּוֹיֵי, וְחַד אָמַר: תְּרֵיסַר אַלְפֵי גַּבְרֵי, וּמִנַּיְיהוּ שִׁיתָּא אַלְפֵי קַשְׁתּוֹיֵי, בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁנִּכְנְסוּ גּוֹיִם לַהֵיכָל, הַכֹּל נִפְנוּ עַל כֶּסֶף וְזָהָב, וְהֵם נִפְנוּ עַל בְּנוֹת יְרוּשָׁלַיִם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״נָשִׁים בְּצִיּוֹן עִנּוּ בְּתוּלוֹת בְּעָרֵי יְהוּדָה״.
human_translation: One said twelve thousand men and six thousand archers and one said twelve thousand men, of whom six thousand archers. When the gentiles entered the Sanctuary all turned to silver and the gold but turned to the daughters of Jerusalem, as it is stated: “They have ravished the women in Zion, the maidens in the cities of Judah”
llm_translation: One said: Twelve thousand men and six thousand archers, and one said: Twelve thousand men, and from them six thousand archers, when the Gentiles entered the Temple, everything was turned into silver and gold, and they turned their attention to the daughters of Jerusalem, as it is said: "The women in Zion were humiliated, the virgins in the cities of Judah."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן, פָּסוּק זֶה שַׂר הָעוֹלָם אֲמָרוֹ: ״נַעַר הָיִיתִי גַּם זָקַנְתִּי״. מַאן אַמְרֵיהּ? אִילֵּימָא קוּדְשָׁא בְּרִיךְ הוּא — מִי אִיכָּא זִקְנָה קַמֵּיהּ? וְאֶלָּא דָּוִד אַמְרֵיהּ — מִי קַשִּׁישׁ כּוּלֵּי הַאי? אֶלָּא שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ שַׂר הָעוֹלָם אֲמָרוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani said Rabbi Yonatan said: This verse was stated by the ministering angel the world: “I have been young, and now am old; Who said this? If we say the Holy One, Blessed be He, is there old age before Him? And rather, David said it, was he indeed so old? Rather, conclude from this the ministering angel the world said it,
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said Rabbi Yonatan, this verse the ruler of the world said: "I was young and now I am old." Who said it? If you say the Holy One, blessed be He - is there old age before Him? Rather, David said it - is there anyone older than he? Rather, understand from it that the ruler of the world said.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״יָדוֹ פָּרַשׂ צָר עַל כׇּל מַחֲמַדֶּיהָ״ — זֶה עַמּוֹן וּמוֹאָב. בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁנִּכְנְסוּ גּוֹיִם לַהֵיכָל, הַכֹּל נִפְנוּ עַל כֶּסֶף וְזָהָב, וְהֵם נִפְנוּ עַל סִפְרֵי תוֹרָה, אָמְרוּ: זֶה שֶׁכָּתוּב בּוֹ ״לֹא יָבֹא עַמּוֹנִי וּמוֹאָבִי בִּקְהַל ה׳״ — יִשָּׂרֵף בָּאֵשׁ!
human_translation: And Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani said Rabbi Yonatan said: What is which is written: “The adversary has spread out his hand upon all her treasures; This Ammon and Moab. When the gentiles entered the Sanctuary, all turned to the silver and the gold, and turned to the scrolls of Torah They said: this in which it is written: “An Ammonite and a Moabite shall not enter into the assembly of the Lord” Let it be burnt by fire.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said in the name of Rabbi Yonatan, what is the meaning of what is written: "His hand has spread out upon all her treasures" - this refers to Ammon and Moab. When the nations entered the Temple, everything was turned to silver and gold, and they turned to the Torah scrolls. They said: This is what is written about them, "An Ammonite or Moabite shall not enter into the congregation of the Lord" - he shall be burned with fire!

hebrew_text: ״צִוָּה ה׳ לְיַעֲקֹב סְבִיבָיו צָרָיו״, אָמַר רַב: כְּגוֹן הוּמַנְיָא לְפוּם נַהֲרָא.
human_translation: “The Lord has commanded against Jacob that they who are round about him should be his adversaries” Rav said: For an example Homanya to Pum Nahara,
llm_translation: "The Lord commanded concerning Jacob, 'His adversaries surround him.'" Rav said: For example, like the fish in the river.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב אַסִּי: גּוֹי שֶׁקִּידֵּשׁ בִּזְמַן הַזֶּה — חוֹשְׁשִׁין לְקִדּוּשִׁין, שֶׁמָּא מֵעֲשֶׂרֶת הַשְּׁבָטִים הוּא. וְהָא כֹּל דְּפָרֵישׁ — מֵרוּבָּא פָּרֵישׁ!
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Rav Asi said: a gentile who betrothed nowadays, we are concerned that the betrothal lest he be from the ten tribes But any separated, separated from the majority.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav Assi: A non-Jew who sanctified a woman in our time - we are concerned for the sanctity, perhaps he is from the tribe of Asher. But anyone who separates - he separates from the majority!

hebrew_text: בְּדוּכְתָּא דִּקְבִיעִי. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא בַּר כָּהֲנָא: ״וַיַּנְחֵם בַּחְלַח וּבְחָבוֹר נְהַר גּוֹזָן וְעָרֵי מָדָי״, חֲלַח — זֶה חִלָּזוֹן, וְחָבוֹר —
human_translation: the permanent places As Rabbi Abba bar Kahana said “And he put them in Halah, and in Habor, on the river of Gozan, and in the cities of the Medes” Halah; this is Ḥalzon. And Habor;
llm_translation: In the vicinity of the established. As Rabbi Abba bar Kahana said: "And he comforted in Halach and in the river Gozan and the cities of Media," Halach - this is Halhul, and Chavor -

hebrew_text: זוֹ חַדְיָיב, ״נְהַר גּוֹזָן״ — זוֹ גִּינְזַק, ״וְעָרֵי מָדַי״ — זוֹ חַמְדָּן וְחַבְרוֹתֶיהָ, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ: זוֹ נִיהַר וְחַבְרוֹתֶיהָ. חַבְרוֹתֶיהָ מַאן? אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: כְּרַךְ, מוּשְׁכֵּי, חִידְקֵי וְדוּמְקֵי. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: וְכוּלָּן לִפְסוּל.
human_translation: this is Ḥadyab. The river of Gozan; this is Ginzak. And the cities of the Medes; this is Ḥamadan and its surroundings. And some say: This is Nihar and its surroundings. Which are its surroundings? Shmuel said: Kerakh, Mushkhei, Ḥidkei, and Domakya Rabbi Yoḥanan said: And all of them are for disqualification.
llm_translation: This is Hadayav, "the river Gozan" - this is Ginzak, "and the cities of Media" - this is Hamdan and its surrounding areas, and they said about it: this is the river and its surrounding areas. Who are its surrounding areas? Shmuel said: Karach, Mushkei, Chidkei, and Dumkei. Rabbi Yochanan said: And all of them are invalid.

hebrew_text: כִּי אַמְרִיתַהּ קַמֵּיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל, אֲמַר לִי: בִּנְךָ הַבָּא מִן יִשְׂרְאֵלִית קָרוּי בִּנְךָ, וְאֵין בִּנְךָ הַבָּא מִן הַגּוֹיָה קָרוּי בִּנְךָ, אֶלָּא בְּנָהּ.
human_translation: When I said this before Shmuel, he said to me: your son from a Jewish woman is called your son, and your son from a gentile woman is not called your son, rather her son.
llm_translation: When she said before Samuel, he said to me: "Your son born from an Israelite woman is called your son, and your son born from a non-Jewish woman is not called your son, but rather her son."

hebrew_text: וְהָאִיכָּא בָּנוֹת, וְאָמַר רָבִינָא: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ, בֶּן בִּתְּךָ הַבָּא מִן הַגּוֹי קָרוּי בִּנְךָ! גְּמִירִי דִּבְנָתָא דְּהָהוּא דָּרָא אִיצְטְרוֹיֵי אִצְטְרוֹ.
human_translation: Aren’t there girls And Ravina said: Learn from this the son of your daughter from a gentile is called your son. is learned that the girls of that generation became barren
llm_translation: And there are daughters, and Rabinah said: infer from it, a son of your daughter who comes from a gentile is called your son! It is learned that the daughters of that one who lived are intertwined.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: כִּי אַמְרִיתַהּ קַמֵּיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל, אָמַר לִי: לֹא זָזוּ מִשָּׁם, עַד שֶׁעֲשָׂאוּם גּוֹיִם גְּמוּרִים, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בַּה׳ בָּגָדוּ כִּי בָנִים זָרִים יָלָדוּ״.
human_translation: There are who say When I said this before Shmuel, he said to me: They did not move from there, until they rendered them, full-fledged gentiles. as it is stated: “They have dealt treacherously against the Lord, for they have begotten strange children”
llm_translation: There are some who say: When she said it before Shmuel, he said to me: They did not move from there until complete non-Jews made them, as it is said: "They have dealt treacherously against the Lord, for they have begotten strange children."

hebrew_text: יָתֵיב רַב יוֹסֵף אֲחוֹרֵיהּ דְּרַב כָּהֲנָא, וְיָתֵיב רַב כָּהֲנָא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב יְהוּדָה וְיָתֵיב וְקָאָמַר: עֲתִידִין יִשְׂרָאֵל דְּעָבְדִי יוֹמָא טָבָא כִּי חָרְבָה תַּרְמוֹד. וְהָא חֲרִיב! הַהִיא תָּמוֹד הֲוַאי. רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: הַיְינוּ תַּרְמוֹד הַיְינוּ תָּמוֹד, אִכְּפוֹלֵי הוּא דְּמִכַּפְלָ[א]: חֲרִיב מֵהַאי גִּיסָא — אִיתִּיב מֵהַאי גִּיסָא, (וְאִי) חֲרִיב מֵהַאי גִּיסָא — אִיתִּיב מֵהַאי גִּיסָא.
human_translation: Rav Yosef sat behind Rav Kahana, and Rav Kahana sat before Rav Yehuda, and he sat and he said In the future, the Jews will establish a Festival day when Tarmod is destroyed. But it has been destroyed. That was Tamud, Rav Ashi said: Tarmod is Tamud. is doubled. is destroyed from this side it is settled on that side, and is destroyed from that side it is settled on this side.
llm_translation: Rav Yosef sat behind Rav Kahana, and Rav Kahana sat in front of Rav Yehuda, and he sat and said: "The Israelites are destined to observe a good day when the wormwood will be destroyed." But has it not already been destroyed? That wormwood was different. Rav Ashi said: This is the same wormwood, this is the same wormwood, it is a repetition of the one that was repeated. If it was destroyed from this angle - it was answered from this angle, and if it was destroyed from this angle - it was answered from this angle.

hebrew_text: יָתֵיב רַב הַמְנוּנָא קַמֵּיהּ דְּעוּלָּא וְקָא הָוֵי בִּשְׁמַעְתָּא, אָמַר: מָה גַּבְרָא וּמָה גַּבְרָא! אִי לָאו דְּהַרְפַּנְיָא מָאתֵיהּ! אִכְּסִיף, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: כְּסַף גֻּלְגֻּלְתָּא, לְהֵיכָא יָהֲבַתְּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ לְפוּם נַהֲרָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִם כֵּן, מִפּוּם נַהֲרָא אַתְּ.
human_translation: Rav Hamnuna sat before Ulla and was engaged in halakha . said What a man; what a man. If only Harpanya were not his city, was ashamed. said to him: Where do you give the money for poll He said to him: to Pum Nahara, He said to him: If so, you are from Pum Nahara,
llm_translation: Sitting Rav Hamnuna before Ulah and he was in Shemata, said: What man and what man! If not that the Harpanya killed him! He became angry, said to him: A silver skull, to where did you give it? He said to him: To the mouth of the river. He said to him: If so, from the mouth of the river you are.

hebrew_text: מַאי הַרְפַּנְיָא? אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: הַר שֶׁהַכֹּל פּוֹנִין בּוֹ. בְּמַתְנִיתָא תָּנָא: כׇּל שֶׁאֵין מַכִּיר מִשְׁפַּחְתּוֹ וְשִׁבְטוֹ נִפְנֶה לְשָׁם. אָמַר רָבָא: וְהִיא עֲמוּקָּה מִשְּׁאוֹל, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״מִיַּד שְׁאוֹל אֶפְדֵּם מִמָּוֶת אֶגְאָלֵם״, וְאִילּוּ פְּסוּל דִּידְהוּ לֵית לְהוּ תַּקַּנְתָּא.
human_translation: What is Harpanya? Rabbi Zeira said: the mountain to which all turn [ har shehakol ponin bo ]. It is taught in a baraita : All those who do not know their family or tribe turn there. Rava said: This is deeper than the netherworld, as is stated: “Shall I ransom them from the power of the netherworld? Shall I redeem them from death?” whereas their disqualification cannot be rectified.
llm_translation: What is Harpanya? Rabbi Zeira said: a mountain that everyone turns to. In the Mishnah it was taught: anyone who does not recognize his family and tribe is exiled there. Rava said: and it is deeper than Sheol, as it is said: "Shall I ransom them from the power of Sheol? Shall I redeem them from Death? O Death, where are your plagues? O Sheol, where is your sting?" And if it were not for their disqualification, there would be no remedy for them.

hebrew_text: פְּסוּלֵי דְהַרְפַּנְיָא מִשּׁוּם פְּסוּלֵי דְּמֵישׁוֹן, וּפְסוּלֵי דְּמֵישׁוֹן מִשּׁוּם פְּסוּלֵי דְתַרְמוֹד, פְּסוּלֵי דְתַרְמוֹד מִשּׁוּם עַבְדֵי שְׁלֹמֹה.
human_translation: Those disqualified from Harpanya due to the disqualification of Meishon, Those disqualified from Meishon due to those disqualified from Tarmod, and those disqualified from Tarmod due to the servants of Solomon.
llm_translation: Invalidations of Harpanya due to invalidations of Meshon, and invalidations of Meshon due to invalidations of Tarmod, invalidations of Tarmod due to the servants of Shlomo.

hebrew_text: וְהַיְינוּ דְּאָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי: קַבָּא רַבָּא וְקַבָּא זוּטָא, מִיגַּנְדַּר וְאָזֵיל לִשְׁאוֹל, וּמִשְּׁאוֹל לְתַרְמוֹד, וּמִתַּרְמוֹד לְמֵישָׁן, וּמִמֵּישָׁן לְהַרְפַּנְיָא.
human_translation: And this that people say A large ephah and a small ephah, roll onward to the netherworld, and from the netherworld to Tarmod, and from Tarmod to Meishon, and from Meishon to Harpanya.
llm_translation: And this is what people say: "A large kab and a small kab, from Gander to Azil to Sheol, and from Sheol to Tarmod, and from Tarmod to Meshan, and from Meshan to Harpanya."

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ חֲמֵשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה נָשִׁים
llm_translation: We will return to you with fifteen women.

hebrew_text: כֵּיצַד אֵשֶׁת אָחִיו שֶׁלֹּא הָיָה בְּעוֹלָמוֹ? שְׁנֵי אַחִים, וּמֵת אֶחָד מֵהֶן, וְנוֹלַד לָהֶן אָח, וְאַחַר כָּךְ יִיבֵּם הַשֵּׁנִי אֶת אֵשֶׁת אָחִיו, וּמֵת. הָרִאשׁוֹנָה יוֹצְאָה מִשּׁוּם אֵשֶׁת אָחִיו שֶׁלֹּא הָיָה בְּעוֹלָמוֹ, וְהַשְּׁנִיָּה מִשּׁוּם צָרָתָהּ.
human_translation: What the wife of a brother with whom he did not coexist? two brothers, and one of them died and a brother of theirs was born, after which the second brother, took his brother’s wife in levirate marriage, and died The first goes out since the wife of a brother with whom he did not coexist. The second due to her rival wife.
llm_translation: How is the wife of his brother who was not in his world? Two brothers, and one of them dies, and a brother is born to them, and afterwards the second one performs levirate marriage with the wife of his brother, and he dies. The first one she is exempt because the wife of his brother who was not in his world, and the second one because of her distress.

hebrew_text: עָשָׂה בָּהּ מַאֲמָר וּמֵת, שְׁנִיָּה — חוֹלֶצֶת וְלֹא מִתְיַיבֶּמֶת.
human_translation: performed levirate betrothal with her, and died, The second, she performs ḥalitza and may not enter into levirate marriage.
llm_translation: He made in her statement and died, her second — she performs ḥalitzah and does not perform levirate marriage.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: מַאן דְּתָנֵי רִאשׁוֹנָה לָא מִשְׁתַּבַּשׁ, מַאן דְּתָנֵי שְׁנִיָּה לָא מִשְׁתַּבַּשׁ. מַאן דְּתָנֵי
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said: He who taught The first is not mistaken he who taught The second is not mistaken he who taught:
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara, Amar Rav Nachman: Man de'tanei rishona la mishtabash, man de'tanei shniya la mishtabash. Man de'tanei English translation: Gemara, Rav Nachman said: One who teaches the first time does not become established, one who teaches the second time does not become established. One who teaches

hebrew_text: רִאשׁוֹנָה לָא מִשְׁתַּבַּשׁ: מַאי רִאשׁוֹנָה — רִאשׁוֹנָה לִנְפִילָה, וּמַאן דְּתָנֵי שְׁנִיָּה לָא מִשְׁתַּבַּשׁ: מַאי שְׁנִיָּה — שְׁנִיָּה לְנִשּׂוּאִין. מִי לָא עָסְקִינַן דְּיִבֵּם וְאַחַר כָּךְ כָּנַס? אֶלָּא מַאי שְׁנִיָּה — שְׁנִיָּה בְּנִשּׂוּאִין.
human_translation: The first, is not mistaken, what is first? the first to fall And he who taught the second is not mistaken what is second? the second to enter marriage. Are we not dealing with in which took in levirate marriage and then later took Rather, what is the second? she who had been married for a second time.
llm_translation: Firstly, she did not immerse. What is meant by "firstly"? - Firstly for falling. And one who teaches that a second one did not immerse: What is meant by "secondly"? - Secondly for marriage. Do we not deal with a case where she engaged in intercourse and then immersed? Rather, what is meant by "secondly"? - Secondly in marriage.

hebrew_text: אֵשֶׁת אָחִיו שֶׁלֹּא הָיָה בְּעוֹלָמוֹ הֵיכָא כְּתִיבָא? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב, אָמַר קְרָא: ״כִּי יֵשְׁבוּ אַחִים יַחְדָּו״, שֶׁהָיְתָה לָהֶם יְשִׁיבָה אַחַת בָּעוֹלָם, פְּרָט לְאֵשֶׁת אָחִיו שֶׁלֹּא הָיָה בְּעוֹלָמוֹ. ״יַחְדָּו״ — מְיוּחָדִים בַּנַּחֲלָה, פְּרָט לְאָחִיו מִן הָאֵם.
human_translation: Where is it written the wife of a brother with whom he did not coexist? Rav Yehuda said Rav said: The verse states “If brothers dwell together that they had a common dwelling in the world. excludes the wife of a brother with whom he did not coexist. “Together” united in an inheritance; excludes his maternal brother,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Where is it written that the wife of one's brother who was not in his world? Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav, the verse says: "When brothers dwell together," indicating that they had one dwelling in the world, excluding the wife of one's brother who was not in his world. "Together" - they are united in inheritance, excluding his brother from the mother.

hebrew_text: רַבָּה אָמַר: אַחִין מִן הָאָב יָלֵיף ״אַחְוָה״ ״אַחְוָה״ מִבְּנֵי יַעֲקֹב: מַה לְהַלָּן — מִן הָאָב וְלֹא מִן הָאֵם, אַף כָּאן — מִן הָאָב וְלֹא מִן הָאֵם.
human_translation: Rabba said: One learns brothers from the father brotherhood brotherhood from the children of Jacob. Just as there, from the father and not from the mother, so too, here, from the father and not from the mother.
llm_translation: Rabba said: A brother from the father's side shall be preferred over a brother from the mother's side. "Brother" from the sons of Jacob: Just as there — from the father and not from the mother, so too here — from the father and not from the mother.

hebrew_text: וְלֵילַף ״אַחְוָה״ ״אַחְוָה״ מֵעֲרָיוֹת! דָּנִין ״אַחִים״ מֵ״אַחִים״, וְאֵין דָּנִין ״אַחִים״ מֵ״אָחִיךָ״.
human_translation: Let it derive brotherhood brotherhood from those with whom relations are forbidden. we infer “brothers” from “brothers.” whereas one cannot make an inference to “brothers” from “your brother.”
llm_translation: And Leilaf: "brotherhood," "brotherhood" from cities! We judge "brothers" from "brothers," and we do not judge "brothers" from "your brother."

hebrew_text: מַאי נָפְקָא מִינַּהּ, הָא תָּנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: ״וְשָׁב הַכֹּהֵן״, ״וּבָא הַכֹּהֵן״, זוֹ הִיא שִׁיבָה זוֹ הִיא בִּיאָה! הָנֵי מִילֵּי הֵיכָא דְּלֵיכָּא מִידֵּי דְּדָמֵי לֵיהּ, אֲבָל הֵיכָא דְּאִיכָּא מִידֵּי דְּדָמֵי לֵיהּ — מִדְּדָמֵי לֵיהּ יָלְפִינַן.
human_translation: What difference does it make As the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught “and the priest shall return [ veshav ]” “and the priest shall come [ uva ]” this is returning, this is coming, This applies when nothing was similar, but where there is something similar we infer from that which is more similar.
llm_translation: What is derived from it? This is what was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael: "And the priest shall return," "and the priest shall come," this is returning, this is coming! Those matters where there is no bloodshed involved, we can derive from them, but those matters where there is bloodshed involved, we do not derive from them.

hebrew_text: וְלֵילַף ״אַחְוָה״ ״אַחְוָה״ מִלּוֹט, דִּכְתִיב: ״כִּי אֲנָשִׁים אַחִים אֲנָחְנוּ״! מִסְתַּבְּרָא מִבְּנֵי יַעֲקֹב הֲוָה לֵיהּ לְמֵילַף, מִשּׁוּם דְּמַפְנֵי: מִדַּהֲוָה לֵיהּ לְמִכְתַּב ״שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר עֲבָדֶיךָ בְּנֵי אָבִינוּ״, וּכְתִיב ״אַחִים״ — שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ לְאַפְנוֹיֵי.
human_translation: Let derive brotherhood brotherhood from Lot, as it is written “For we are brothers” It is reasonable to derive from the children of Jacob, due to is free Since it could have written: We your servants are twelve children of our father, writes: brothers, learn from here to render free
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And Lelaf "brother" "brother" from Lot, as it is written: "For we are brothers"! It is logical that from the sons of Jacob he would be to him for Lelaf, because of: from the measure he would be to him for the writing "twelve of your servants, the sons of our father", and it is written "brothers" - infer from it for exclusion.

hebrew_text: וְאִיצְטְרִיךְ לְמִכְתַּב ״אַחִים״, וְאִיצְטְרִיךְ לְמִכְתַּב ״יַחְדָּו״. דְּאִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״אַחִים״, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: לֵילַף ״אַחְוָה״ ״אַחְוָה״ מִלּוֹט, וְכִי תֵּימָא לָא מַפְנֵי — לָאיֵי, אַפְנוֹיֵי מַפְנֵי, מִדַּהֲוָה לֵיהּ לְמִכְתַּב ״רֵעִים״, וּכְתִיב ״אַחִים״, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ לְאַפְנוֹיֵי — כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא: ״יַחְדָּו״, הַמְיוּחָדִים בַּנַּחֲלָה.
human_translation: And it was necessary to write “brothers” and it was necessary to write “together” as, if the Merciful One had written “brothers,” I would say that one should infer “brothers” “brothers” from Lot. And if you would say it is not free not so; it is free. it could have written: Friends, and “brothers” is written. learn from that this is free the Torah wrote “together” those united in an inheritance.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "And it was necessary to write 'brothers,' and it was necessary to write 'together.' For if the Merciful One had written 'brothers,' I would have said: to exclude 'sister,' 'sister' from inheritance. And if you would say that it is not due to exclusion - it is due to inclusion, for He should have written 'friends' to include, and yet it is written 'brothers.' Learn from this that it is for inclusion - the Merciful One wrote: 'together,' those who are united in inheritance."

hebrew_text: וְאִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״יַחְדָּו״ — הֲוָה אָמֵינָא דִּמְיַיחֲדִי בְּאַבָּא וּבְאִמָּא, צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: And if the Merciful One had written “together” I would say that have the same father and mother together, it necessary
llm_translation: "And if the Merciful One wrote 'together' - I would have thought that they must be united in both father and mother, necessary."

hebrew_text: וְהָא מֵהֵיכָא תֵּיתֵי? יִבּוּם בַּנַּחֲלָה תְּלָא רַחְמָנָא, וְנַחֲלָה מִן הָאָב וְלֹא מִן הָאֵם הִיא! אִיצְטְרִיךְ, סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: הוֹאִיל וְחִידּוּשׁ הוּא דְּקָמִשְׁתְּרֵי עֶרְוָה גַּבֵּיהּ, אֵימָא עַד דִּמְיַיחֲדִי בְּאַבָּא וּבְאִמָּא, צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: But from where would it be derived the Merciful One make levirate marriage dependent upon inheritance? and inheritance from the father and not from the mother. was necessary, it could enter your mind to say that since this is a novelty that forbidden relation to him is rendered permitted, say only to with the same father and same mother together. necessary.
llm_translation: The Gemara asks: And from where do we derive this? The Torah imposes the obligation of yibum in the case of inheritance, and inheritance is from the father and not from the mother! It was necessary for you to say: Since it is a novel idea that two nakednesses join together, I might say that it is only until he unites with his father and mother, it is necessary.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב: שׁוֹמֶרֶת יָבָם שֶׁמֵּתָה — מוּתָּר בְּאִמָּהּ, אַלְמָא קָסָבַר אֵין זִיקָה. וְלֵימָא: הֲלָכָה כְּדִבְרֵי הָאוֹמֵר אֵין זִיקָה!
human_translation: Rav Huna said Rav said: a widow waiting for her yavam who died is permitted to her mother. Apparently, holds the bond [ zikka ] is not substantial. Then let him say halakha is in accordance with the statement of he who says the bond is not substantial,
llm_translation: Rav Huna said in the name of Rav: "A yevamah who dies - her yavam is permitted to marry her mother." This implies that he holds there is no zikah. And let us say: The halacha follows the opinion of one who says there is no zikah!

hebrew_text: אִי הֲוָה אָמַר הָכִי, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: הָנֵי מִילֵּי בִּתְרֵי, אֲבָל בְּחַד — יֵשׁ זִיקָה.
human_translation: If he had said that, I would say: This applies to two But in one the bond is substantial.
llm_translation: If he said thus, I would say: those matters in two, but in one - there is liability.

hebrew_text: וְלֵימָא: הֲלָכָה כְּדִבְרֵי הָאוֹמֵר אֵין זִיקָה אֲפִילּוּ בְּחַד! אִי אָמַר הָכִי, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: אֲפִילּוּ מֵחַיִּים — קָמַשְׁמַע לַן לְאַחַר מִיתָה אִין, מֵחַיִּים לָא — מִשּׁוּם דְּאָסוּר לְבַטֵּל מִצְוַת יְבָמִין.
human_translation: Then let him say: halakha is in accordance with the statement of the one who says the bond is not substantial, even in one If he had said that, I would say: Even alive this comes to teach us after death, yes, he is while alive, not. because it is prohibited to nullify the mitzva of levirate marriage.
llm_translation: And say: Is the halakha according to the words of the one who says there is no connection even with one? If he said so, I would say: even from the living — we learn that after death there is no connection, but from the living — no, because it is forbidden to nullify the mitzvah of levirate marriage.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: יְבִמְתּוֹ שֶׁמֵּתָה — מוּתָּר בַּאֲחוֹתָהּ. בַּאֲחוֹתָהּ אִין, בְּאִמָּהּ לָא.
human_translation: We learned his yevama dies, he is permitted to her sister. her sister, yes, her mother, no,
llm_translation: We learned in the Mishnah: His yevamah who died — he is permitted to marry her sister. To her sister, no; to her mother, no.

hebrew_text: הוּא הַדִּין דַּאֲפִילּוּ בְּאִמָּהּ, וְאַיְּידֵי דִּתְנָא רֵישָׁא: אִשְׁתּוֹ שֶׁמֵּתָה — מוּתָּר בַּאֲחוֹתָהּ, בַּאֲחוֹתָהּ אִין, אֲבָל בְּאִמָּהּ לָא, דְּהָוְיָא לַהּ אִיסּוּרָא דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא — תְּנָא נָמֵי סֵיפָא מוּתָּר בַּאֲחוֹתָהּ.
human_translation: the same is true even for her mother, But since it taught in the first clause his wife dies he is permitted to take her sister, Her sister, yes, but her mother, no, as she is forbidden by Torah he taught the latter clause he is permitted to her sister.
llm_translation: The same law applies even with her mother, and as it was taught in the beginning: if his wife dies — he is permitted to her sister, but not to her mother, for that would involve a biblical prohibition — as it was taught in the end, he is permitted to her sister.

hebrew_text: וְרַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר: שׁוֹמֶרֶת יָבָם שֶׁמֵּתָה — אָסוּר בְּאִמָּהּ. אַלְמָא קָסָבַר יֵשׁ זִיקָה. וְלֵימָא: הֲלָכָה כְּדִבְרֵי הָאוֹמֵר יֵשׁ זִיקָה!
human_translation: And Rav Yehuda said: a widow who dies waiting for her brother-in-law he is prohibited from her mother. Apparently holds the levirate bond is substantial; But Let say: halakha is in accordance with the statement of the one who says that the bond is substantial.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said: A yevamah who dies - is forbidden to her mother. This implies that he holds there is a connection. And let us say: The halakha is in accordance with the one who says there is a connection!

hebrew_text: אִי הֲוָה אָמַר הָכִי, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: הָנֵי מִילֵּי בְּחַד, אֲבָל בִּתְרֵי — אֵין זִיקָה. וְהָא כִּי פְּלִיגִי — בִּתְרֵי פְּלִיגִי? אֶלָּא: אִי אָמַר הָכִי,
human_translation: If he would have said that, I would say that this applies in one but two the bond is not substantial. But when disagree, disagree in two Rather, If he were to say that
llm_translation: If he said thus, I would say: these matters are in one, but in two - there is no connection. And when they dispute - do they dispute in two? Rather, if he said thus,

hebrew_text: הֲוָה אָמֵינָא מֵחַיִּים, אֲבָל לְאַחַר מִיתָה — פָּקְעָה לַהּ זִיקָה, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּזִיקָה בִּכְדִי לָא פָּקְעָה. לֵימָא מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ: יְבִמְתּוֹ שֶׁמֵּתָה — מוּתָּר בַּאֲחוֹתָהּ. בַּאֲחוֹתָהּ אִין, בְּאִמָּהּ לָא!
human_translation: I would say is alive but after death the bond was terminated. This comes to teach us that the bond is not terminated without cause Let us say that it supports his yevama dies, he is permitted to her sister. Her sister, yes; her mother, no,
llm_translation: I would say from life, but after death - the claim is void, it is heard for us that a claim without the necessary proof is not valid. Let him say that he helps him: his deceased wife - he is permitted to marry her sister. Not her sister, not her mother!

hebrew_text: הוּא הַדִּין דַּאֲפִילּוּ בְּאִמָּהּ, וְאַיְּידֵי דִּתְנָא רֵישָׁא: אִשְׁתּוֹ שֶׁמֵּתָה — מוּתָּר בַּאֲחוֹתָהּ, דַּוְקָא בַּאֲחוֹתָהּ, אֲבָל בְּאִמָּהּ לָא, דְּהָוְיָא לַהּ אִיסּוּרָא דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא — תְּנָא נָמֵי סֵיפָא מוּתָּר בַּאֲחוֹתָהּ.
human_translation: The same is true, that even her mother And since he taught in the first clause his wife dies he is permitted to take her sister; specifically her sister but not her mother, as she is forbidden by Torah he also taught in the latter clause he is permitted to her sister.
llm_translation: He is the same law that even with her mother, and since the first part of the Mishnah teaches: his wife who died - permitted to her sister, specifically to her sister, but not to her mother, because it would be a biblical prohibition for her - the latter part teaches permitted to her sister.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַב הוּנָא בַּר חִיָּיא: עָשָׂה בָּהּ מַאֲמָר וּמֵת — שְׁנִיָּה חוֹלֶצֶת וְלֹא מִתְיַיבֶּמֶת. טַעְמָא דַּעֲבַד בַּהּ מַאֲמָר, הָא לָא עֲבַד בַּהּ מַאֲמָר — שְׁנִיָּה נָמֵי יַבּוֹמֵי מְיַיבְּמָה, וְאִי אָמְרַתְּ יֵשׁ זִיקָה, הָוְיָא לַהּ צָרַת אֵשֶׁת אָחִיו שֶׁלֹּא הָיָה בְּעוֹלָמוֹ בְּזִיקָה!
human_translation: Rav Huna bar Ḥiyya raised an objection he performed levirate betrothal with her and died, the second performs ḥalitza and may not enter into levirate marriage. the reason is that he performed levirate betrothal with her. Had not performed levirate betrothal with her, the second would also enter into levirate marriage. And if you say that the bond is substantial, a rival wife of the wife of a brother with whom did not coexist by that bond.
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: Rav Huna the son of Hiyya raised an objection: If one performed chalitzah with her and then she died - she does not perform yibum. The reason is that if he performed chalitzah with her, then he did not perform yibum; if he did not perform chalitzah with her, then the yavam will perform yibum with her. And if you say there is a connection, he would be causing his brother's wife distress without any connection in his world!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה: הוּא הַדִּין דְּאַף עַל גַּב דְּלָא עֲבַד בַּהּ מַאֲמָר — שְׁנִיָּה מִחְלָץ חָלְצָה, יַבּוֹמֵי לָא מִיַּיבְּמָה.
human_translation: Rabba said: the same is true even if did not perform levirate betrothal; the second must perform ḥalitza but may not enter into levirate marriage,
llm_translation: Rabba said: The same law applies even though he did not perform the act of acquisition with it - a second one may redeem, but yavamim do not perform yibum.

hebrew_text: וְהָא דְּקָתָנֵי מַאֲמָר, לְאַפּוֹקֵי מִבֵּית שַׁמַּאי, דְּאָמְרִי: מַאֲמָר קוֹנֶה קִנְיָן גָּמוּר — קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: And that teaches levirate betrothal in order to exclude Beit Shammai, who said: levirate betrothal is a full-fledged acquisition, it comes to teach us:
llm_translation: And this that it teaches a saying, to exclude from Beit Shammai, who say: A saying acquires complete ownership - it implies to us.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: שְׁנֵי אַחִין בְּעוֹלָם אֶחָד, וָמֵת אֶחָד מֵהֶן בְּלֹא וָלָד, וְעָמַד הַשֵּׁנִי הַזֶּה לַעֲשׂוֹת מַאֲמָר בִּיבִמְתּוֹ, וְלֹא הִסְפִּיק לַעֲשׂוֹת בָּהּ מַאֲמָר עַד שֶׁנּוֹלַד לוֹ אָח, וּמֵת. הָרִאשׁוֹנָה — יוֹצְאָה מִשּׁוּם אֵשֶׁת אָחִיו שֶׁלֹּא הָיָה בְּעוֹלָמוֹ, וּשְׁנִיָּה — אוֹ חוֹלֶצֶת אוֹ מִתְיַיבֶּמֶת. וְאִי אָמְרַתְּ יֵשׁ זִיקָה, הָוְיָא לַהּ צָרַת אֵשֶׁת אָחִיו שֶׁלֹּא הָיָה בְּעוֹלָמוֹ בְּזִיקָה!
human_translation: Abaye raised an objection to two brothers who coexisted, and one died childless and the second arose to perform levirate betrothal with his yevama but did not manage to perform levirate betrothal before brother was born, and died, the first goes out because the wife of his brother with whom he did not coexist, and the second either performs ḥalitza or enters into levirate marriage. But if you say that the bond is substantial, would be rendered a rival wife of the wife of a brother with whom he did not coexist bond.
llm_translation: He raised an objection to him, Abaye: Two brothers in the world, one, and one of them died childless, and the second one stood to perform the act of levirate marriage with his widow, and he did not manage to perform the act of levirate marriage with her until he had a brother born to him, and he died. The first one - she is exempt because she was the wife of his brother who was not in the world, and the second one - either she performs halitzah or she performs levirate marriage. And if you say there is a connection, she would be subject to the rival wife of his brother who was not in the world through connection!

hebrew_text: הָא מַנִּי — רַבִּי מֵאִיר הִיא, דְּאָמַר: אֵין זִיקָה. וּמִי סְבִירָא לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר אֵין זִיקָה? וְהָתְנַן: אַרְבָּעָה אַחִים, שְׁנַיִם מֵהֶן נְשׂוּאִים שְׁתֵּי אֲחָיוֹת, וּמֵתוּ הַנְּשׂוּאִין הָאֲחָיוֹת — הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ חוֹלְצוֹת וְלֹא מִתְיַיבְּמוֹת.
human_translation: whose is this? It is Rabbi Meir, who said: The bond is not substantial. Does Rabbi Meir hold that the bond is not substantial? didn’t we learn four brothers, two of whom are married to two sisters, those married to the sisters died, then those must perform ḥalitza and may not enter into levirate marriage.
llm_translation: The text reads: "Ha mani - Rabbi Meir hi, de'amar: ein zika. Umi sevira lei leRabbi Meir ein zika? Ve'hatnan: arba'ah achim, shnayim mehen nesu'im shtei achayot, umeitu hanesu'im haachayot - harei elu choltzot velo mityabemot." Translation: "This is the teaching of Rabbi Meir, who said: there is no zika. And who would argue with Rabbi Meir that there is no zika? And we learned in a Mishnah: Four brothers, two of them married two sisters, and the married brothers died without children - these sisters are exempt from levirate marriage."

hebrew_text: וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ סָבַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר אֵין זִיקָה, הָנֵי מִתְּרֵי בָּתֵּי קָאָתְיָין, הַאי לְיַיבֵּם חֲדָא וְהַאי לְיַיבֵּם חֲדָא!
human_translation: And if it enters your mind to say Rabbi Meir held that the bond is not substantial, these come from two houses, one should take one in levirate marriage and the other should take one in levirate marriage.
llm_translation: "And if it enters your mind that Rabbi Meir holds there is no connection, these two houses of Kaatyin come in, this one for one yavam and this one for one yavam!"

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם אֵין זִיקָה. מִשּׁוּם דְּקָסָבַר אָסוּר לְבַטֵּל מִצְוַת יְבָמִין — דְּדִלְמָא אַדִּמְיַיבֵּם חַד, מָיֵית אִידַּךְ, וְקָא בָּטְלָת מִצְוַת יְבָמִין.
human_translation: Actually, the bond is not substantial. because he held that it is prohibited to nullify the mitzva of levirate marriage. perhaps as one performs levirate marriage the other dies you nullify the mitzva of levirate marriage
llm_translation: Forever there is no connection. Because he thought it is forbidden to annul the mitzvah of yibum - for perhaps he will come to marry one of them, and you will have annulled the mitzvah of yibum.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אֵין זִיקָה — תִּיבְטַל! דְּהָא רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אָמַר: אֵין זִיקָה, וּמוּתָּר לְבַטֵּל מִצְוַת יְבָמִין.
human_translation: But if the bond is not substantial, let be nullified. As Rabban Gamliel said: The bond is not substantial, and it is permitted to nullify the mitzva of levirate marriage.
llm_translation: If there is no connection - it shall be annulled! For Rabban Gamliel said: There is no connection, and it is permitted to annul the mitzvah of yibum.

hebrew_text: דִּתְנַן, רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: אִם מֵאֲנָה — מֵאֲנָה, וְאִם לֹא מֵאֲנָה — תַּמְתִּין עַד שֶׁתַּגְדִּיל, וְתֵצֵא הַלֵּזוּ, מִשּׁוּם אֲחוֹת אִשָּׁה.
human_translation: As we learned Rabban Gamliel said: If refused then she refused, but if she did not refuse, let her wait until she reaches maturity, and that other will be exempt due to wife’s sister.
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: Rabban Gamliel says: If she refuses—she refuses, but if she does not refuse—wait until she grows older and develops, and then she will leave this marriage due to the sisterhood of a woman.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: דְּרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אַדְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר קָרָמֵית?! לָא, הָכִי קָאָמְרִינַן: רַבִּי מֵאִיר חָיֵישׁ אֲפִילּוּ לִסְפֵיקָא, רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אֲפִילּוּ לְוַדַּאי לָא חָיֵישׁ! דִּלְמָא מַאן דְּלָא חָיֵישׁ — אֲפִילּוּ לְוַדַּאי לָא חָיֵישׁ, וּמַאן דְּחָיֵישׁ — אֲפִילּוּ לִסְפֵיקָא חָיֵישׁ.
human_translation: said to raise a contradiction between Rabban Gamliel and Rabbi Meir? No, this is what we meant to say: Rabbi Meir is concerned even when it is uncertain Rabban Gamliel is not concerned even when it is certain? Perhaps the one who is not concerned is not concerned even if certain, and the one who is concerned is concerned even if is uncertain.
llm_translation: He said to him: Is Rabban Gamliel greater than Rabbi Meir the vineyard keeper?! No, this is what we say: Rabbi Meir is cautious even in a doubtful case, Rabban Gamliel is not cautious even in a certain case! Perhaps someone who is not cautious — even in a certain case is not cautious, and someone who is cautious — even in a doubtful case is cautious.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי לְרַב יוֹסֵף: הָא דְּרַב יְהוּדָה — דִּשְׁמוּאֵל הִיא. דִּתְנַן:
human_translation: Abaye said to Rav Yosef: This by Rav Yehuda, is Shmuel that we learned
llm_translation: Abbaye said to Rav Yosef: This that Rav Yehudah said - it is Shmuel. As we learned:

hebrew_text: שׁוֹמֶרֶת יָבָם שֶׁקִּדֵּשׁ אָחִיו אֶת אֲחוֹתָהּ, מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בְּתִירָה אָמְרוּ: אוֹמְרִים לוֹ: הַמְתֵּן עַד שֶׁיַּעֲשֶׂה אָחִיךָ מַעֲשֶׂה. וְאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בְּתִירָה.
human_translation: a widow waiting for her yavam his brother betrothed her sister they said in the name of Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira: They say to Wait until your brother performs action, And Shmuel said: halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira.
llm_translation: The guardian of a yavam who betroths his sister, in the name of Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira they said to him: "Wait until your brother performs the act." And Shmuel said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: דְּאִי דְּרַב מַאי? (אֲמַר לֵיהּ:) קַשְׁיָא דְּרַב אַדְּרַב! דִּלְמָא אָמוֹרָאֵי נִינְהוּ, וְאַלִּיבָּא דְּרַב. כֵּיוָן דְּאִיתְּמַר מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל בְּהֶדְיָא, וּמִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב כְּאָמוֹרָאֵי — לָא שָׁבְקִינַן מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל בְּהֶדְיָא וּמוֹקְמִינַן כְּאָמוֹרָאֵי וְאַלִּיבָּא דְּרַב.
human_translation: said to him: And if of Rav, what said to him: It difficult of Rav of Rav, Perhaps they are amora’im and in accordance with Rav, Since that which was stated in the name of Shmuel was explicit, while that in the name of Rav as an amoraic we will not leave explicitly in the name of Shmuel and explain it as an amoraic according to Rav.
llm_translation: He said to him: What is the opinion of Rav? He said to him: The difficulty of Rav is difficult! Perhaps they are the words of the Amoraim, and not the opinion of Rav. Once it was established in the name of Shmuel with certainty, and in the name of Rav as the Amoraim say — we do not remove the name of Shmuel and establish as the Amoraim, but in the opinion of Rav.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא: אַמְרִיתַהּ לִשְׁמַעְתָּא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב זְבִיד מִנְּהַרְדְּעָא, אָמַר: אַתּוּן, הָכִי מַתְנִיתוּ לַהּ! אֲנַן, בְּהֶדְיָא מַתְנֵינַן. אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: שׁוֹמֶרֶת יָבָם שֶׁמֵּתָה — אָסוּר בְּאִמָּהּ. אַלְמָא קָסָבַר יֵשׁ זִיקָה. וְאַזְדָּא שְׁמוּאֵל לְטַעְמֵיהּ, דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בְּתִירָה.
human_translation: Rav Kahana said: I reported this discussion before Rav Zevid of Neharde’a. He said: That is how you teach this, We learn explicitly: Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: a widow waiting for her yavam who died he is prohibited from her mother. Apparently holds the bond is substantial. And Shmuel to his reasoning, as Shmuel said: halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira.
llm_translation: Rav Kahana said: I said it to be heard before Rav Zevid from Nehardea, he said: You, thus you teach it to her! We, indeed, teach it explicitly. Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: A yevamah who died - her yavam is forbidden to her mother. This implies that he holds there is a connection. And Shmuel was strengthened in his reasoning, as Shmuel said: The halakha is according to Rabbi Yehudah ben Beteira.
