hebrew_text: וּצְרִיכִי, דְּאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן יֵשׁ זִיקָה, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: הָנֵי מִילֵּי בְּחַד, אֲבָל בִּתְרֵי — לָא, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן. וְאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בְּתִירָה, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: הָנֵי מִילֵּי מֵחַיִּים, אֲבָל לְאַחַר מִיתָה — פָּקְעָה לַהּ זִיקָה, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּזִיקָה בִּכְדִי לָא פָּקְעָה.
human_translation: are necessary as, if he were to teach us the bond is substantial, I would say this applies to one but not to two This comes to teach us And if he were to teach us halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira, I would say that this applies where is living, but after her death the bond is terminated This comes to teach us that the bond is not terminated without cause
llm_translation: And it is necessary, for if we were to hear that there is damage, I would say: these matters in one, but in two - no, it does not seem to us. And if we were to hear the halakha according to Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira, I would say: these matters are from the living, but after death - the damage is nullified, it seems to us that damage that is not nullified is necessary.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ שְׁנֵי אַחִים, וּמֵת אֶחָד מֵהֶן, וְיִבֵּם הַשֵּׁנִי אֶת אֵשֶׁת אָחִיו, וְאַחַר כָּךְ נוֹלַד לָהֶן אָח, וּמֵת, הָרִאשׁוֹנָה יוֹצְאָה מִשּׁוּם אֵשֶׁת אָחִיו שֶׁלֹּא הָיָה בְּעוֹלָמוֹ, וְהַשְּׁנִיָּה — מִשּׁוּם צָרָתָהּ. עָשָׂה בָּהּ מַאֲמָר וּמֵת — הַשְּׁנִיָּה חוֹלֶצֶת וְלֹא מִתְיַיבֶּמֶת.
human_translation: two brothers, and one died, and the second entered into levirate marriage with his brother’s wife and subsequently brother was born to them, and died, the first woman, is exempt due to the wife of a brother with whom did not coexist, and the second due to her rival wife. performed levirate betrothal with her and died the second performs ḥalitza and may not enter into levirate marriage,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: Two brothers, and one of them dies. The second brother performs levirate marriage with his brother's wife, and afterwards a brother is born to them. If this second brother then dies, the first brother's wife is exempt from levirate marriage because she was not in his world. The second brother's wife, however, is exempt due to her rival wife status. If he performed chalitzah with her and then died, the second brother's wife is exempt and not subject to levirate marriage.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: מְיַיבֵּם לְאֵיזוֹ מֵהֶן שֶׁיִּרְצֶה, אוֹ חוֹלֵץ לְאֵיזוֹ מֵהֶן שֶׁיִּרְצֶה.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says enters into levirate marriage with whichever one he wishes, or he performs ḥalitza with whichever one he wishes.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: He may cohabit with whichever of them he desires, or he may divorce whichever of them he desires.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַב אוֹשַׁעְיָא: חָלוּק הָיָה רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אַף בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה. מִמַּאי — מִדְּקָתָנֵי מִשְׁנָה יַתִּירָה.
human_translation: Rav Oshaya said: Rabbi Shimon’s opinion differed even on the first From where from that it teaches a superfluous mishna.
llm_translation: Gemara: Rav Oshaya said: Rabbi Shimon also had a disagreement from the outset. From what? From the fact that he is more stringent than the Mishnah.

hebrew_text: בָּבָא דְרֵישָׁא לְמַאן קָתָנֵי לַהּ? אִילֵּימָא לְרַבָּנַן, הַשְׁתָּא יִבֵּם וּלְבַסּוֹף נוֹלַד, דְּכִי אַשְׁכְּחַהּ — בְּהֶתֵּירָא אַשְׁכְּחַהּ, אָסְרִי רַבָּנַן, נוֹלַד וְאַחַר כָּךְ יִבֵּם, מִיבַּעְיָא? אֶלָּא לָאו, לְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אִיצְטְרִיךְ,
human_translation: In accordance with whose is it teaching the section of the first clause, If we say the Rabbis, Now entered into levirate marriage and afterward was born, when he found her, permitted the Rabbis prohibit Is necessary, born and subsequently entered into levirate marriage Rather, is it not was necessary for Rabbi Shimon?
llm_translation: The first clause, according to whom is it taught? If you say it is according to the Rabbis, now, if she becomes pregnant and ultimately gives birth, for when I find her — when I find her permissible, the Rabbis prohibit her, she gives birth, and afterwards she becomes pregnant, is it necessary? Rather, it is not so, it is necessary for Rabbi Shimon.

hebrew_text: וּתְנָא רֵישָׁא לְהוֹדִיעֲךָ כֹּחוֹ דְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, וּתְנָא סֵיפָא לְהוֹדִיעֲךָ כֹּחָן דְּרַבָּנַן. וּבְדִין הוּא דְּנִפְלוֹג רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בְּרֵישָׁא, אֶלָּא נָטַר לְהוּ לְרַבָּנַן עַד דִּמְסַיְּימִי לְמִילְּתַיְיהוּ, וַהֲדַר פְּלִיג עֲלַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: The first was taught in order to convey to you the far-reaching nature Rabbi Shimon, and the latter clause, was taught to convey the far-reaching nature the Rabbis, And by right it that Rabbi Shimon disagrees in the first but waited until the Rabbis finished their words, and then he went back disagreed with them.
llm_translation: The beginning Mishnah is to inform you of the strength of Rabbi Shimon, and the end Mishnah is to inform you of the strength of the Rabbis. And in the case where Rabbi Shimon disagreed in the beginning, he nevertheless waited for the Rabbis until they finished their words, and then he argued with them.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אֵשֶׁת אָחִיו שֶׁלֹּא הָיָה בְּעוֹלָמוֹ לְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן הֵיכִי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ? בְּחַד אַחָא, וּמִית, וְנוֹלַד לוֹ אָח. אִי נָמֵי: בִּתְרֵי, וְלָא יִבֵּם, וְלָא מִית.
human_translation: But according to Rabbi Shimon, how can you find the wife of a brother with whom he did not coexist? a single brother who died and brother was born to him. Alternatively, two and did not take in levirate marriage, and did not die,
llm_translation: Rather, the wife of his brother who was not in his world for Rabbi Shimon, how does she forget him? With one brother, and he dies, and a brother is born to him. Alternatively: with two brothers, and she does not perform levirate marriage, and she does not die.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא יִבֵּם וְאַחַר כָּךְ נוֹלַד, כִּי אַשְׁכְּחַהּ — בְּהֶתֵּירָא אַשְׁכְּחַהּ. אֶלָּא נוֹלַד וְאַחַר כָּךְ יִבֵּם — מַאי טַעְמָא? קָסָבַר: יֵשׁ זִיקָה, וְזִיקָה כִּכְנוּסָה דָּמְיָא.
human_translation: Granted, performed levirate marriage subsequently was born, that when found her, he found her in a permitted But he was born and subsequently performed levirate marriage, what is the reason holds that the bond is substantial, bond is considered like a married woman.
llm_translation: In peace, he should marry her, and afterwards she is born, for if he finds her — when he permits her, he finds her. Rather, she is born and afterwards he marries her — what is the reason? He holds: there is a connection, and a connection is like the gathering of blood.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב יוֹסֵף: הַשְׁתָּא זִיקָה וּמַאֲמָר מְסַפְּקָא לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אִי כִּכְנוּסָה דָּמְיָא אִי לָאו כִּכְנוּסָה דָּמְיָא, זִיקָה לְחוֹדַהּ מִיבַּעְיָא?
human_translation: Rav Yosef strongly objects to this: Now bond and a levirate betrothal Rabbi Shimon is uncertain as to whether she is similar to a married woman or an unmarried woman, is it necessary bond alone
llm_translation: Rav Yosef objects to her: Is the damage and the statement doubtful to Rabbi Shimon, whether it is like a gathering of blood or not like a gathering of blood, does he require a separate damage?

hebrew_text: מַאי הִיא — דִּתְנַן: שְׁלֹשָׁה אַחִין נְשׂוּאִין שָׁלֹשׁ נָשִׁים נׇכְרִיּוֹת, וּמֵת אֶחָד מֵהֶם, וְעָשָׂה בָּהּ שֵׁנִי מַאֲמָר, וּמֵת — הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ חוֹלְצוֹת וְלֹא מִתְיַיבְּמוֹת.
human_translation: What As we learned three brothers married to three unrelated women, and one of died, and the second performed levirate betrothal and died, then these must perform ḥalitza and may not enter into levirate marriage
llm_translation: What is it? — As we learned in a Mishnah: Three brothers who were married to three non-Jewish women, and one of them died. The surviving brother performed chalitzah with her, and then he died — these women are exempt from levirate marriage and are not subject to levirate marriage.

hebrew_text: שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּמֵת אֶחָד מֵהֶם ... יְבָמָהּ יָבֹא עָלֶיהָ״, מִי שֶׁעָלֶיהָ זִיקַת יָבָם אֶחָד, וְלֹא שֶׁעָלֶיהָ זִיקַת שְׁנֵי יְבָמִין.
human_translation: As it is stated: “And one of them dies…her brother-in-law will have intercourse with her She who is subject to bond with a single yavam and not she who is subject to bond with two yevamin .
llm_translation: Talmudic text: As it is stated: "And if one of them dies... his wife's brother shall go in unto her," Deuteronomy 25:5 indicating that the obligation of yibum applies to her from one yavam, and not that the obligation of yibum applies to her from two yevamim.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: מְיַיבֵּם לְאֵיזֶהוּ מֵהֶן שֶׁיִּרְצֶה, וְחוֹלֵץ לַשְּׁנִיָּה. יַבּוֹמֵי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ לָא — דְּדִלְמָא יֵשׁ זִיקָה, וְהָווּ שְׁתֵּי יְבָמוֹת הַבָּאוֹת
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: Let him enter into levirate marriage whichever he wishes and perform ḥalitza with the second. not take both in levirate marriage. Perhaps the bond is substantial, and these would be two yevamot who come
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: He should perform yibum with whichever of them he desires, and then perform chalitzah with the other. If both yevamot are not eligible for yibum, it is because perhaps there is a connection, and there were two yevamot who came.

hebrew_text: מִבַּיִת אֶחָד. יַבּוֹמֵי חֲדָא וְאִיפְּטוֹרֵ[י] אִידַּךְ — לָא, דְּדִלְמָא אֵין זִיקָה כִּכְנוּסָה, וְהָווּ לְהוּ שְׁתֵּי יְבָמוֹת הַבָּאוֹת מִשְּׁנֵי בָתִּים. אַלְמָא מְסַפְּקָא לֵיהּ!
human_translation: from a single household, take one in levirate marriage and exempt the other not as perhaps bond is not substantial like a married woman they would be two yevamot who come from two households. apparently is uncertain
llm_translation: From one house. The yevamot of one and the iphtorei of the other - no, perhaps there is no connection like a gathering, and they will be two yevamot who come from two houses. This is a doubt for him!

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא: מִדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא הָכִי נָמֵי דְּמִיַּיבְּמָא חֲדָא וּמִפַּטְרָא חֲדָא, וּמִדְּרַבָּנַן הוּא דְּאָסוּר, גְּזֵירָה מִשּׁוּם שֶׁמָּא יֹאמְרוּ שְׁתֵּי יְבָמוֹת הַבָּאוֹת מִשְּׁנֵי בָתִּים — חֲדָא מִיַּיבְּמָא, וְאִידַּךְ מִיפַּטְרָא בִּוְּלֹא כְּלוּם,
human_translation: And if you would say by Torah indeed, one may be taken in levirate marriage and exempt the other, this was prohibited by rabbinic law, decree due to lest those say two yevamot come from two households one is taken in levirate marriage and the other is exempt without anything.
llm_translation: And if you will say: Since it is from the Torah, it is the same whether it is one yevamah and one patra, and it is from the Rabbis that it is forbidden, a decree due to the concern lest they say that two yevamot came from two different houses - one is a yevamah, and the other is a patra without blemish.

hebrew_text: וְהָא טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, מִשּׁוּם מַאֲמָר וְלָאו מַאֲמָר הוּא. דְּתַנְיָא, אָמַר לָהֶם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן לַחֲכָמִים: אִם מַאֲמָרוֹ שֶׁל שֵׁנִי מַאֲמָר — אֵשֶׁת שֵׁנִי הוּא בּוֹעֵל.
human_translation: But as Rabbi Shimon’s reason is due to levirate betrothal or not levirate betrothal. As it is taught Rabbi Shimon said to the Rabbis If the levirate betrothal of the second is indeed levirate betrothal and is engaging in relations with the wife of the second
llm_translation: And the reason of Rabbi Shimon is, because of a statement and not a statement it is. As it was taught: Rabbi Shimon said to the sages: If his statement is like a statement - he is married to the second woman.

hebrew_text: וְאִם מַאֲמָרוֹ שֶׁל שֵׁנִי אֵינוֹ מַאֲמָר — אֵשֶׁת רִאשׁוֹן הוּא בּוֹעֵל.
human_translation: But if the levirate betrothal of the second is not levirate betrothal, of he would be engaging in relations with the wife of the first
llm_translation: And if his statement that of the second is not a statement - the wife of the first one is the one who engages in intercourse.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: וְלָא שָׁנֵי לָךְ בֵּין זִיקַת יָבָם אֶחָד לְזִיקַת שְׁנֵי יְבָמִים? דִּלְמָא כִּי אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן זִיקָה כִּכְנוּסָה דָּמְיָא — בְּיָבָם אֶחָד, אֲבָל בִּשְׁנֵי יְבָמִין — לָא.
human_translation: Abaye said to him: Is there no difference to you between bond to a single yavam and a bond to two yevamim ? Perhaps when Rabbi Shimon said bond like a married woman, when a single yavam . But two yevamin , no,
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: And did you not differentiate between the bond of one yavam to the bond of two yevamim? Perhaps when Rabbi Shimon said, "A bond is like a marriage," it is applicable to one yavam, but not to two yevamim.

hebrew_text: וּמִי שָׁנֵי לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן? וְהָתַנְיָא, כְּלָל אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: כׇּל שֶׁהַלֵּידָה קוֹדֶמֶת לַנִּשּׂוּאִין — לֹא חוֹלֶצֶת וְלֹא מִתְיַיבֶּמֶת, נִשּׂוּאִין (קודם) [קוֹדְמִין] לַלֵּידָה — אוֹ חוֹלֶצֶת אוֹ מִתְיַיבֶּמֶת.
human_translation: Does Rabbi Shimon differentiate But it is taught Rabbi Shimon stated a principle: Whenever the birth precedes the marriage she does not perform ḥalitza and she does not enter into levirate marriage. the marriage preceded his birth, she either performs ḥalitza or enters into levirate marriage.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And who repeated it to Rabbi Shimon? And it was taught: Rabbi Shimon said a general principle: Anyone whose birth precedes marriage - she neither performs chalitzah nor undergoes levirate marriage; marriage precedes birth - either she performs chalitzah or undergoes levirate marriage."

hebrew_text: מַאי לָאו בְּיָבָם אֶחָד, וְקָתָנֵי: לֹא חוֹלֶצֶת וְלֹא מִתְיַיבֶּמֶת. לָא, בִּשְׁנֵי יְבָמִים.
human_translation: What, is it not a single yavam , and it is taught She does not perform ḥalitza and she does not enter into levirate marriage. No. two yevamin .
llm_translation: What is the reason why not with one yavam, and it teaches: she does not perform chalitzah nor does she perform yibum. No, with two yevamim.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל בְּיָבָם אֶחָד מַאי — הָכִי נָמֵי אוֹ חוֹלֶצֶת אוֹ מִתְיַיבֶּמֶת? אִי הָכִי, אַדְּתָנֵי: נִשּׂוּאִין קוֹדְמִין לַלֵּידָה — אוֹ חוֹלֶצֶת אוֹ מִתְיַיבֶּמֶת, לִיפְלוֹג וְלִיתְנֵי בְּדִידַהּ: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — בִּשְׁנֵי יְבָמִים, אֲבָל בְּיָבָם אֶחָד — אוֹ חוֹלֶצֶת אוֹ מִתְיַיבֶּמֶת.
human_translation: But what, a single yavam ? So too, she either performs ḥalitza or enters into levirate marriage, If so, rather than teaching the marriage precedes the birth she either performs ḥalitza or enters into levirate marriage, let distinguish and teach within itself In what is this statement said? When two yevamin . But one yavam , she either performs ḥalitza or enters into levirate marriage.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: But with one yavam, what is the law? Thus it was stated: Does she perform halitzah or does she perform yibum? If so, it was taught: Married women take precedence for childbirth — whether she performs halitzah or she performs yibum, to distinguish and to establish it in its own right: In what case are these matters said? — In the case of two yevamim, but with one yavam — either halitzah or yibum.

hebrew_text: כּוּלָּהּ בִּשְׁנֵי יְבָמִין קָמַיְירֵי. וְאֶלָּא מַאי כְּלָלָא?!
human_translation: the entire is in reference to two yevamin Rather, what is the principle
llm_translation: The entirety of it is before two yavamins. But what is the general principle?!

hebrew_text: וְעוֹד, מֵתִיב רַב אוֹשַׁעְיָא: שְׁלֹשָׁה אַחִין, שְׁנַיִם מֵהֶן נְשׂוּאִין שְׁתֵּי אֲחָיוֹת, אוֹ אִשָּׁה וּבִתָּהּ, אוֹ אִשָּׁה וּבַת בִּתָּהּ, אוֹ אִשָּׁה וּבַת בְּנָהּ — הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ חוֹלְצוֹת וְלֹא מִתְיַיבְּמוֹת. וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן פּוֹטֵר.
human_translation: Moreover, Rav Oshaya raised an objection three brothers, two of whom were married to two sisters, or to a woman and her daughter, or a woman and her daughter’s daughter, or a woman and her son’s daughter, then those must perform ḥalitza and may not enter into levirate marriage. And Rabbi Shimon exempts
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: And furthermore, Rav Oshaya raises an objection: Three brothers, two of them married two sisters, or a woman and her daughter, or a woman and her granddaughter, or a woman and her great-granddaughter — these are cases of halitzah and not of levirate marriage. And Rabbi Shimon exempts them.

hebrew_text: וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ קָסָבַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן זִיקָה כִּכְנוּסָה דָּמְיָא — לְיַיבֵּם לְקַמַּיְיתָא, וְתִיפְּטַר אִידַּךְ!
human_translation: And if it enters your mind that Rabbi Shimon held that bond is substantial like a married woman, let consummate the levirate marriage to the first and let the other be exempt
llm_translation: If your opinion is that Rabbi Shimon holds that a legal relationship is like a gathering of water - bring a yavam for yibum, and the other one will be exempt!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב עַמְרָם: מַאי פּוֹטֵר, נָמֵי פּוֹטֵר בַּשְּׁנִיָּה. וְהָתַנְיָא: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן פּוֹטֵר בִּשְׁתֵּיהֶן!
human_translation: Rav Amram said: What really exempt the second is exempt. But it is taught Rabbi Shimon exempts both.
llm_translation: Rav Amram said: What is the exemption? Indeed, he exempts in the second one. And it was taught: Rabbi Shimon exempts in both!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: שְׁנִיָּה שֶׁבְּזוּג זֶה, וְהַשְּׁנִיָּה שֶׁבְּזוּג זֶה.
human_translation: Rava said: the second from this pair and the second from that pair.
llm_translation: Rava said: The first one in this pair, and the second one in this pair.

hebrew_text: קָא טָעֵי רָבָא בְּאַרְבְּעָה זוּגֵי: חֲדָא, דְּ״אוֹ״ ״אוֹ״ קָתָנֵי. וְעוֹד, ״רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן פּוֹטֵר בְּאַרְבַּעְתָּן״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rava was mistaken about four pairs. One is that teaches Or, or. And further, should have said: Rabbi Shimon exempts all four of them,
llm_translation: Rava was mistaken in four pairs: one, that "or" is written, and another, "or" is taught. And furthermore, "Rabbi Shimon exempts in all four" is what he wanted to say to him.

hebrew_text: וְעוֹד תַּנְיָא: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן פּוֹטֵר בִּשְׁתֵּיהֶן מִן הַחֲלִיצָה וּמִן הַיִּיבּוּם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְאִשָּׁה אֶל אֲחוֹתָהּ לֹא תִקָּח לִצְרוֹר״, בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁנַּעֲשׂוּ צָרוֹת זוֹ לָזוֹ — לֹא יְהֵא לְךָ לִיקּוּחִין אֲפִילּוּ בְּאַחַת מֵהֶן!
human_translation: And further, it is taught Rabbi Shimon exempts both of them from ḥalitza and levirate marriage, as it is stated: “And you shall not take a woman to her sister, to be a rival to her” when become rival wives one to the other, you do not have taking even one of them.
llm_translation: And furthermore it was taught: Rabbi Shimon exempts in both cases, from halitzah and from yibum, as it is stated: "And a woman to her sister you shall not take to be a rival" (Leviticus 18:18). At the time when they become rivals to one another, you should not take wives even from one of them!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: אִי דִּנְפוּל בְּזֶה אַחַר זֶה — הָכִי נָמֵי, הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן — דִּנְפוּל בְּבַת אַחַת, וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי, דְּאָמַר: אֶפְשָׁר לְצַמְצֵם.
human_translation: Rather, Rav Ashi said If happened one after the other, indeed it is so here we are dealing with happened at once. And Rabbi Shimon holds in accordance with Rabbi Yosei HaGelili, who said: It is possible to be precise.
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Ashe said: If they fell one after the other - this is what is said, here what are we dealing with - if they fell at the same time, and Rabbi Shimon holds like Rabbi Yosei the Galilean, who said: It is possible to narrow down.

hebrew_text: רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר: בְּיִיבֵּם וְאַחַר כָּךְ נוֹלַד — פְּלִיג רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, בְּנוֹלַד וְאַחַר כָּךְ יִיבֵּם — לָא פְּלִיג.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: Rabbi Shimon disagreed performed levirate marriage and after that was born; where was born and after that performed levirate marriage did not disagree.
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: In the case of yibum followed by a birth - Rabbi Shimon disagrees, but in the case of a birth followed by yibum - he does not disagree.

hebrew_text: וְתַרְוַויְיהוּ לְרַבָּנַן אִיצְטְרִיךְ, וְלֹא זוֹ אַף זוֹ קָתָנֵי.
human_translation: both were necessary for the Rabbis teaches Not this also that.
llm_translation: And they desired the Rabbis, it is necessary, and not this and not this is taught.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַב פָּפָּא, וּתְיוּבְתָּא דְּרַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא. שְׁנֵי אַחִים בְּעוֹלָם אֶחָד, וּמֵת אֶחָד מֵהֶם בְּלֹא וָלָד, וְעָמַד הַשֵּׁנִי הַזֶּה לַעֲשׂוֹת מַאֲמָר בִּיבִמְתּוֹ, וְלֹא הִסְפִּיק לַעֲשׂוֹת בָּהּ מַאֲמָר עַד שֶׁנּוֹלַד לוֹ אָח, וּמֵת — הָרִאשׁוֹנָה יוֹצְאָה מִשּׁוּם אֵשֶׁת אָחִיו שֶׁלֹּא הָיָה בְּעוֹלָמוֹ, וּשְׁנִיָּה — אוֹ חוֹלֶצֶת אוֹ מִתְיַיבֶּמֶת.
human_translation: It is taught in accordance with of Rav Pappa, and this is a conclusive refutation of Rabbi Oshaya: two coexisting brothers, and one died childless, and the second was about to perform levirate betrothal with his yevama but did not manage to perform levirate betrothal before his brother was born, and died, the first goes out due to she was the wife of a brother with whom did not coexist, and the second either performs ḥalitza or enters into levirate marriage.
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Rav Papa, and the academy of Rabbi Oshaya: Two brothers in the world, one of them died childless, and the second one arose to perform the levirate marriage with his sister-in-law, but he did not manage to perform the levirate marriage with her until a brother was born to him, and then he died - the first one is exempt because she was the wife of his brother who did not exist in his world, and the second one either performs halitzah or performs the levirate marriage.

hebrew_text: עָשָׂה בָּהּ מַאֲמָר, וְאַחַר כָּךְ נוֹלַד אָח, אוֹ שֶׁנּוֹלַד לוֹ אָח וְאַחַר כָּךְ עָשָׂה בָּהּ מַאֲמָר, וּמֵת — הָרִאשׁוֹנָה יוֹצְאָה מִשּׁוּם אֵשֶׁת אָחִיו שֶׁלֹּא הָיָה בְּעוֹלָמוֹ, וּשְׁנִיָּה — חוֹלֶצֶת וְלֹא מִתְיַיבֶּמֶת.
human_translation: performed levirate betrothal with her and afterward his brother was born, or if his brother was born and then he performed the levirate betrothal, and then he died, the first goes out as the wife of a brother with whom he did not coexist, and the second, must perform ḥalitza and may not enter into levirate marriage.
llm_translation: He made a statement about her, and afterwards a brother was born, or if a brother was born to him and afterwards he made a statement about her, and he dies - the first one leaves due to being the wife of his brother who was not in the world, and the second one - she performs chalitzah and does not undergo levirate marriage.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: בִּיאָתָהּ אוֹ חֲלִיצָתָהּ שֶׁל אַחַת מֵהֶם פּוֹטֶרֶת צָרָתָהּ, חָלַץ לְבַעֲלַת מַאֲמָר — לֹא נִפְטְרָה צָרָה. כְּנָסָהּ וָמֵת, וְאַחַר כָּךְ נוֹלַד לוֹ אָח, אוֹ שֶׁנּוֹלַד לוֹ אָח וְאַחַר כָּךְ כְּנָסָהּ, וָמֵת — שְׁתֵּיהֶן פְּטוּרוֹת מִן הַחֲלִיצָה וּמִן הַיִּיבּוּם.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: Intercourse or ḥalitza with one of them, exempts her rival wife he performed ḥalitza with who received the levirate betrothal, then rival wife is not exempt, married and died and afterward a brother was born, or if a brother was born and then he married her and died, are both exempt from ḥalitza and levirate marriage.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: If one of them had intercourse with her or performed halitzah with her, her rival is exempt from halitzah. If he performed halitzah with the one who has the right to marry him, the rival is not exempt. If he married her and then died, and afterwards a brother was born to him, or a brother was born to him and then he married her, and he died - both of them are exempt from halitzah and from levirate marriage.

hebrew_text: כְּנָסָהּ וְנוֹלַד לוֹ אָח, וְאַחַר כָּךְ מֵת — שְׁתֵּיהֶן פְּטוּרוֹת מִן הַחֲלִיצָה וּמִן הַיִּיבּוּם, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: הוֹאִיל וּבָא וּמְצָאָהּ בְּהֶיתֵּר, וְלֹא עָמְדָה עָלָיו שָׁעָה אַחַת בְּאִיסּוּר — מְיַיבֵּם לְאֵיזוֹ מֵהֶן שֶׁיִּרְצֶה, אוֹ חוֹלֵץ לְאֵיזוֹ מֵהֶן שֶׁיִּרְצֶה.
human_translation: married and a brother was born, and then he died, both are exempt from ḥalitza and levirate marriage; the statement of Rabbi Meir. And Rabbi Shimon says: Since came and found her in a permitted state, and she was never for a moment prohibited to him, he takes whichever he wishes in levirate marriage, or performs ḥalitza with whichever he wishes.
llm_translation: When his wife entered and bore him a brother, and afterwards he died - both of them are exempt from halitzah and from levirate marriage, the words of Rabbi Meir. And Rabbi Shimon says: Since he came and found her in a state of permission, and she did not stand in a state of prohibition upon him for even one moment - he may either perform levirate marriage with whichever of them he wishes, or release whichever of them he wishes.

hebrew_text: הָא בָּבָא דְסֵיפָא לְמַאן קָתָנֵי לַהּ? אִילֵּימָא לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר קָתָנֵי לַהּ — מִכְּדִי לָא שָׁנֵי לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר בֵּין יִיבֵּם וְאַחַר כָּךְ נוֹלַד בֵּין נוֹלַד וְאַחַר כָּךְ יִיבֵּם?! לְעָרְבִינְהוּ וְלִתְנִינְהוּ!
human_translation: The section of the latter clause according to whom is it taught? If we say it is taught for Rabbi Meir, since it makes no difference to Rabbi Meir whether the levirate marriage preceded the birth or the birth preceded the levirate marriage. it should have combined and taught them
llm_translation: The Gemara asks: To whom does the latter clause attribute this ruling? If you say it attributes it to Rabbi Meir, does Rabbi Meir indeed teach it? For he does not differentiate between a yavam and then a child is born, and between a child being born and then a yavam! Let us mix them together and teach them!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לָאו רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן. וּבְיִיבֵּם וְאַחַר כָּךְ נוֹלַד — פְּלִיג, בְּנוֹלַד וְאַחַר כָּךְ יִיבֵּם — לָא פְּלִיג. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Rather, is it not Rabbi Shimon, And disagrees in performed levirate marriage and afterward was born, does not disagree in was born and afterward levirate marriage. Conclude from this
llm_translation: Rather, it is not the opinion of Rabbi Shimon. And in the case of Yibum where the child is born afterwards - he disputes, if the child is born and then Yibum is performed - he does not dispute. Learn from it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: עָמַד הַשֵּׁנִי לַעֲשׂוֹת מַאֲמָר בִּיבִמְתּוֹ, וְלֹא הִסְפִּיק לַעֲשׂוֹת מַאֲמָר בִּיבִמְתּוֹ עַד שֶׁנּוֹלַד לוֹ אָח, וָמֵת — רִאשׁוֹנָה יוֹצְאָה מִשּׁוּם אֵשֶׁת אָחִיו שֶׁלֹּא הָיָה בְּעוֹלָמוֹ, וּשְׁנִיָּה — אוֹ חוֹלֶצֶת אוֹ מִתְיַיבֶּמֶת. מַאי ״עָמַד״, וּמַאי ״לֹא הִסְפִּיק״? אִי עֲבַד — עֲבַד, וְאִי לָא עֲבַד — לָא עֲבַד!
human_translation: The Master said: The second was about to perform levirate betrothal with his yevama , but did not manage to perform levirate betrothal with his yevama before his brother was born, and died. The first goes out due to she was the wife of a brother with whom did not coexist, and the second performs ḥalitza or enters into levirate marriage. What is Was about to, and what is Did not manage If he did it, he did it; and if he did not do it, he did not do it.
llm_translation: Master said: The second one stood to perform the act of levirate marriage with his brother's widow, and he did not manage to perform the act of levirate marriage with his brother's widow until a brother was born to him, and he died - the first one goes out due to the wife of his brother who was not in his world, and the second one - either she performs ḥalitza or she does levirate marriage. What is the meaning of "stood," and what is the meaning of "did not manage"? If he did - he did, and if he did not - he did not!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: ״עָמַד״ — מִדַּעְתָּהּ, וְ״לֹא הִסְפִּיק״ — מִדַּעְתָּהּ, אֶלָּא בְּעַל כׇּרְחָהּ, וּדְלָא כְּרַבִּי. דְּתַנְיָא: הָעוֹשֶׂה מַאֲמָר בִּיבִמְתּוֹ שֶׁלֹּא מִדַּעְתָּהּ, רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: קָנָה, וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: לֹא קָנָה.
human_translation: Rather, Was about to with her consent. Did not manage with her consent, but instead against her will. is not in accordance with Rabbi as it is taught one who performs levirate betrothal with his yevama without her consent, Rabbi says: He acquired and the Rabbis say: He did not acquire
llm_translation: Rather: "stood" — from her own knowledge, and "did not suffice" — from her own knowledge, but against her will, and not like Rabbi. As it was taught: One who makes a statement with his yevamah without her knowledge, Rabbi says: he has acquired her, and the Sages say: he has not acquired her.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי — גָּמַר מִבִּיאָה דִיבָמָה: מָה בִּיאָה דִיבָמָה — בְּעַל כׇּרְחָהּ, אַף קִדּוּשִׁין דִּיבָמָה — בְּעַל כׇּרְחָהּ. וְרַבָּנַן גָּמְרִי מִקִּדּוּשִׁין דְּעָלְמָא: מָה קִדּוּשִׁין דְּעָלְמָא — מִדַּעְתָּהּ, אַף קִדּוּשִׁין דִּיבָמָה — מִדַּעְתָּהּ.
human_translation: What is the reason Rabbi He learned from intercourse with a yevama . Just as non-consensual intercourse with the yevama so too, betrothal of a yevama non-consensual. the Rabbis learned from betrothal in general; just as betrothal in general requires consent so too, betrothal of a yevama requires consent.
llm_translation: What is the reason for Rabbi's opinion? — He learns it from the bringing of the yevamah. What is the bringing of the yevamah? — Marital relations by her will. Just as the betrothal of the yevamah is by her will, so too the marriage of the yevamah is by her will. And the Rabbis learn it from the general betrothals: Just as general betrothals are based on her knowledge, so too the betrothal of the yevamah is based on her knowledge.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי קָמִיפַּלְגִי? מָר סָבַר מִילֵּי דִיבָמָה מִמִּילֵּי דִיבָמָה הֲוָה לֵיהּ לְמֵילַף, וּמָר סָבַר: מִילֵּי דְקִדּוּשִׁין מִמִּילֵּי דְקִדּוּשִׁין הֲוָה לֵיהּ לְמֵילַף.
human_translation: With regard to what disagree? One Sage, holds matters concerning yevamot must be inferred from matters concerning yevamot And one Sage, holds matters concerning betrothal must be inferred from matters concerning betrothal.
llm_translation: With what do they disagree? One Master holds that matters of levirate marriage are compared to matters of levirate marriage, so he would derive the law from a case of levirate marriage, and the other Master holds that matters of betrothal are compared to matters of betrothal, so he would derive the law from a case of betrothal.

hebrew_text: עָשָׂה בָּהּ מַאֲמָר וְאַחַר כָּךְ נוֹלַד לוֹ אָח, אוֹ שֶׁנּוֹלַד לוֹ אָח וְאַחַר כָּךְ עָשָׂה בָּהּ מַאֲמָר, וָמֵת — רִאשׁוֹנָה יוֹצְאָה מִשּׁוּם אֵשֶׁת אָחִיו שֶׁלֹּא הָיָה בְּעוֹלָמוֹ, וּשְׁנִיָּה — חוֹלֶצֶת וְלֹא מִתְיַיבֶּמֶת. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: בִּיאָתָהּ אוֹ חֲלִיצָתָהּ שֶׁל אַחַת מֵהֶן פּוֹטֶרֶת צָרָתָהּ.
human_translation: performed levirate betrothal with her, and afterward his brother was born, or if his brother was born and then he performed levirate betrothal and died, the first goes out because the wife of a brother with whom he did not coexist, and the second, performs ḥalitza but does not enter into levirate marriage. Rabbi Shimon says: Intercourse or ḥalitza with one of them exempts her rival wife.
llm_translation: He made a statement regarding her, and afterwards a brother was born to him, or if a brother was born to him and afterwards he made a statement regarding her, and he died - the first one leaves due to the fact that she was the wife of his brother who was not in the world, and the second one - she performs ḥalitzah and does not perform levirate marriage. Rabbi Shimon says: Her coming or her ḥalitzah with one of them exempts her co-wife.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אַהֵיָיא קָאֵי? אִילֵּימָא אַנּוֹלַד לוֹ אָח וְאַחַר כָּךְ עָשָׂה בָּהּ מַאֲמָר — הָא אָמְרַתְּ בְּנוֹלַד וּלְבַסּוֹף יִיבֵּם לָא פְּלִיג רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן. אֶלָּא אַעָשָׂה בָּהּ מַאֲמָר וְאַחַר כָּךְ נוֹלַד לוֹ אָח.
human_translation: To which Rabbi Shimon referring? If we say his brother was born and then he performed levirate betrothal with her, didn’t you say Rabbi Shimon did not dispute was born and then ultimately he performed a levirate marriage, Rather, he performed levirate betrothal with her and afterward his brother was born.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon Aḥaiya is standing? If you say that he had a brother born to him, and afterwards he made a statement about her - did you not say that if he had a brother born to him and ultimately he performs levirate marriage, Rabbi Shimon does not disagree? Rather, he should make a statement about her, and afterwards a brother is born to him.

hebrew_text: חָלַץ לְבַעֲלַת מַאֲמָר לֹא נִפְטְרָה צָרָה. מַאי טַעְמָא — מִשּׁוּם דַּהֲוַאי צָרָה וַדַּאי, וּבַעֲלַת מַאֲמָר סָפֵק, וְאֵין סָפֵק מוֹצִיא מִידֵי וַדַּאי.
human_translation: performed ḥalitza with to whom performed levirate betrothal, her rival wife is not exempt. What is the reason because the rival wife definite whereas with whom performed levirate betrothal an uncertain And an uncertainty does not override a certainty.
llm_translation: He removed for the owner of the statement, the rival was not exempt. What is the reason? Because the rival was definite, and the owner of the statement was uncertain, and uncertainty does not exempt from what is definite.

hebrew_text: יָתֵיב רַב מְנַשֶּׁה בַּר זְבִיד קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב הוּנָא וְיָתֵיב וְקָאָמַר: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן? מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן?! כִּדְאָמַר טַעְמָא: הוֹאִיל וּבָא וּמְצָאָהּ בְּהֶיתֵּר, וְלֹא עָמְדָה עָלָיו שָׁעָה אַחַת בְּאִיסּוּר!
human_translation: Rav Menashe bar Zevid sat before Rav Huna. He sat and said: What is the reason that Rabbi Shimon What is Rabbi Shimon’s reason? The reason as he stated Since came and found her in a permitted state, and she was never for a moment prohibited to him
llm_translation: Rav Menasheh bar Zavid sat before Rav Huna, and he sat and said: What is the reason of Rabbi Shimon? What is the reason of Rabbi Shimon?! As the reason is said: Since he came and found it in a state of permissibility, and it did not stand forbidden upon him for even a moment!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבָּנַן? אָמַר קְרָא: ״וּלְקָחָהּ לוֹ לְאִשָּׁה וְיִבְּמָהּ״, עֲדַיִין יִבּוּמִים הָרִאשׁוֹנִים עָלֶיהָ. אֶלָּא הָא דִּתְנַן: כְּנָסָהּ — הֲרֵי הִיא כְּאִשְׁתּוֹ לְכׇל דָּבָר. וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר חֲנִינָא: מְלַמֵּד
human_translation: Rather, What is the reason for the Rabbis’ the verse states: take her to him to be his wife and consummate the levirate marriage [ veyibbema ]” the first levirate bond is still upon her. But that which we learn he took in marriage then her that of his wife in every sense; and Rabbi Yosei bar Ḥanina said: teaches
llm_translation: Rather: What is the reason of the Rabbis? The verse says, "And he shall take her to himself as a wife and perform the duty of a husband's brother to her," the original levirate husbands are still upon her. Rather, as we learned: If he has married her, she is considered his wife in all matters. And Rabbi Yosei bar Hanina said: it teaches.

hebrew_text: שֶׁמְּגָרְשָׁה בְּגֵט, וּמַחְזִירָהּ. הָתָם נָמֵי, לֵימָא ״וְיִבְּמָהּ״ — עֲדַיִין יִבּוּמִין הָרִאשׁוֹנִים עָלֶיהָ, וְתִיבְעֵי חֲלִיצָה!
human_translation: that he must divorce with a bill of divorce And he may remarry her, There, too, let say “And consummate the levirate marriage [ veyibbema ],” the first levirate bond is still upon her and she should require ḥalitza .
llm_translation: She who was divorced with a get, and he returns her. There, let us say, "and he shall take her as his wife" - the first yibumin are still upon her, and she requires chalitzah!

hebrew_text: שָׁאנֵי הָתָם דְּאָמַר קְרָא ״וּלְקָחָהּ לוֹ לְאִשָּׁה״, כֵּיוָן שֶׁלְּקָחָהּ — נַעֲשֵׂית כְּאִשְׁתּוֹ לְכׇל דָּבָר. אִי הָכִי הָכָא נָמֵי! הָא כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״וְיִבְּמָהּ״.
human_translation: It is different there, as the verse states: “And take her to him to be his wife” once he has taken her, that of his wife in every sense. If so, here too, The Merciful One states: “And consummate the levirate marriage [ veyibbema ],”
llm_translation: The difference there is that the verse says, "and he shall take her for himself as a wife," once he has taken her - she becomes like his wife in every respect. If so, here too it is similar! The Merciful One wrote, "and he shall cohabit with her."

hebrew_text: וּמָה רָאִיתָ? מִסְתַּבְּרָא שְׁדִי הֶיתֵּירָא אַהֶיתֵּירָא, וּשְׁדִי אִיסּוּרָא אַאִיסּוּרָא.
human_translation: What did you see It stands to reason Toss that which is permitted on that which is permitted, and toss that which is prohibited on that which is prohibited.
llm_translation: And what did you see? The Almighty permitted, He permitted, and the Almighty prohibited, He prohibited.

hebrew_text: וּלְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, דְּאָמַר: הוֹאִיל וּבָא וּמְצָאָהּ בְּהֶיתֵּר וְלֹא עָמְדָה עָלָיו שָׁעָה אַחַת בְּאִיסּוּר, אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, אֲחוֹתוֹ מֵאִמּוֹ שֶׁנְּשָׂאָהּ אָחִיו מֵאָבִיו, וְאַחַר כָּךְ נוֹלַד אָח, וָמֵת — תִּתְיַיבֵּם, הוֹאִיל וּבָא וּמְצָאָהּ בְּהֶיתֵּר!
human_translation: But according to Rabbi Shimon, who said since he came and found her in a permitted state since she was never for a single moment prohibited to him; however, if so, one’s maternal sister, married his paternal brother; And then his brother was born and died; let enter into levirate marriage since he came and found her in a permitted state,
llm_translation: And for Rabbi Shimon, who said: Since he came and found her in a permitted state and did not stand with her for even one moment in a forbidden state, but from now on, his sister from his mother whom his brother married from his father, and afterwards a brother was born, and he died - they may perform levirate marriage, since he came and found her in a permitted state!

hebrew_text: אִיסּוּר אֲחוֹתוֹ לְהֵיכָן אֲזַל?! הָכָא נָמֵי: אִיסּוּר אָחִיו שֶׁלֹּא הָיָה בָּעוֹלָם לְהֵיכָן אֲזַל? הַאי אִיסּוּרָא דְּלֵית לֵיהּ הֶיתֵּירָא, הַאי אִיסּוּרָא דְּאִית לֵיהּ הֶיתֵּירָא.
human_translation: the prohibition against his sister, to where did it go? here too, the prohibition a brother with whom one did not coexist, to where did it go? This prohibition has no permitted that prohibition has permitted,
llm_translation: Prohibition his sister to where went?! Here also: Prohibition his brother that not was in the world to where went? This prohibition that does not have permission, this prohibition that has permission.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ כְּלָל אָמְרוּ בִּיבָמָה: כֹּל שֶׁהִיא אִיסּוּר עֶרְוָה — לֹא חוֹלֶצֶת וְלֹא מִתְיַיבֶּמֶת. אִיסּוּר מִצְוָה וְאִיסּוּר קְדוּשָּׁה — חוֹלֶצֶת וְלֹא מִתְיַיבֶּמֶת.
human_translation: stated a principle about a yevama : Whoever is by a prohibition of forbidden relations neither performs ḥalitza nor enters into levirate marriage a prohibition a mitzva a prohibition sanctity, she performs ḥalitza and she does not enter into levirate marriage.
llm_translation: They taught: In general, they said regarding yibum (levirate marriage): Any case that involves a prohibition of incest - she does not perform chalitzah (the ceremony releasing her from the obligation of yibum) and does not perform yibum. A prohibition that is a positive commandment or a prohibition of sanctity - she performs chalitzah and does not perform yibum.

hebrew_text: אֲחוֹתָהּ שֶׁהִיא יְבִמְתָּהּ — חוֹלֶצֶת אוֹ מִתְיַיבֶּמֶת.
human_translation: her sister who is her yevama , performs ḥalitza or enters into levirate marriage.
llm_translation: Her sister who is her yevamah - she performs chalitzah or she does yibum.

hebrew_text: אִיסּוּר מִצְוָה — שְׁנִיּוֹת מִדִּבְרֵי סוֹפְרִים. אִיסּוּר קְדוּשָּׁה — אַלְמָנָה לְכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל, גְּרוּשָׁה וַחֲלוּצָה לְכֹהֵן הֶדְיוֹט, מַמְזֶרֶת וּנְתִינָה לְיִשְׂרָאֵל, וּבַת יִשְׂרָאֵל לְנָתִין וּמַמְזֵר.
human_translation: A prohibition a mitzva secondary relationships, by rabbinic law. A prohibition sanctity a widow to a High Priest, a divorcée or a woman who has performed ḥalitza [ ḥalutza ] to a common priest, a daughter born from an incestuous or adulterous relationship [ mamzeret ] Gibeonite woman to an Israelite, and an Israelite woman to a Gibeonite or a son born from an incestuous or adulterous relationship [ mamzer ].
llm_translation: Prohibition of a commandment — two types from the words of the Sages. Prohibition of sanctity — a widow for a High Priest, a divorced or halutzah woman for an ordinary priest, a mamzeret and a natin for an Israelite, and a daughter of Israel for a natin and a mamzer.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ כְּלָל — לְאֵתוֹיֵי מַאי? אָמַר רַפְרָם בַּר פָּפָּא: לְאֵתוֹיֵי צָרַת אַיְלוֹנִית, וְכִדְרַב אַסִּי.
human_translation: principle what add? Rafram bar Pappa said: It comes to include the rival wife of a sexually underdeveloped woman [ aylonit ], And like of Rav Asi,
llm_translation: Gemara: What is the meaning of "גְּמָ׳ כְּלָל"? Raphram bar Papa said: To include the pain of a miscarriage, as Rav Assi.

hebrew_text: וְאִיכָּא דְאָמְרִי: כׇּל שֶׁאִיסּוּרָהּ אִיסּוּר עֶרְוָה, הוּא דַּאֲסִירָא צָרָתַהּ, הָא לָא אִיסּוּרָהּ אִיסּוּר עֶרְוָה — צָרָתַהּ לָא אֲסִירָא, לְמַעוֹטֵי מַאי — אָמַר רַפְרָם: לְמַעוֹטֵי צָרַת אַיְלוֹנִית, וּדְלָא כְּרַב אַסִּי.
human_translation: And there are who say Whoever is forbidden by a prohibition of forbidden relations it is that her rival wife is forbidden. But is not forbidden by a prohibition of forbidden relations her rival wife is not forbidden. to exclude what? Rafram said: It excludes the rival wife of an aylonit , And not in accordance with Rav Asi.
llm_translation: There are those who say: Any prohibition that its prohibition is a prohibition of nakedness, that which its prohibition is due to its prohibition of nakedness, this one, its prohibition is due to its prohibition of nakedness; but that which its prohibition is not a prohibition of nakedness, its prohibition is not due to its prohibition of nakedness - for what purpose? - Raphram said: For the purpose of excluding the prohibition of the tree of the vine, and not like the opinion of Rabbi Assi.

hebrew_text: אֲחוֹתָהּ שֶׁהִיא יְבִמְתָּהּ. אֲחוֹתָהּ דְּמַאן? אִילֵימָא דְּאִיסּוּר מִצְוָה, כֵּיוָן דְּמִדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא רַמְיָא קַמֵּיהּ, פָּגַע בַּאֲחוֹת זְקוּקָתוֹ! אֶלָּא אֲחוֹתָהּ דְּאִיסּוּר עֶרְוָה.
human_translation: Her sister who is her yevama Whose sister? If we say who is a prohibition a mitzva, since by Torah she is cast before him he encounters the sister of the woman with whom he has bond; but Rather, the sister of prohibition of forbidden relations,
llm_translation: Her sister who is her yevamah. Her sister, who is she? If you say it is due to the prohibition of mitzvah, since he is raising a biblical prohibition, he encounters his sister who is his dependent! Rather, her sister due to the prohibition of ervah.

hebrew_text: אִיסּוּר מִצְוָה — שְׁנִיּוֹת. אַמַּאי קָרֵי לֵיהּ אִיסּוּר מִצְוָה? אֲמַר אַבָּיֵי: מִצְוָה לִשְׁמוֹעַ דִּבְרֵי חֲכָמִים.
human_translation: a prohibition a mitzva secondary relationships, Why is this called a prohibition a mitzva? Abaye said: it is a mitzva to listen to the words of the Sages.
llm_translation: Prohibition of a commandment — two. Why is it called prohibition of a commandment? Abaye said: It is a commandment to listen to the words of the sages.

hebrew_text: אִיסּוּר קְדוּשָּׁה — אַלְמָנָה לְכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל, גְּרוּשָׁה וַחֲלוּצָה לְכֹהֵן הֶדְיוֹט. וְאַמַּאי קָרֵי לְהוּ אִיסּוּר קְדוּשָּׁה — דִּכְתִיב: ״קְדוֹשִׁים יִהְיוּ לֵאלֹהֵיהֶם״.
human_translation: A prohibition sanctity a widow to a High Priest, a divorcée or a ḥalutza to a common priest. Why are these called a prohibition sanctity? As it is written “They shall be sacred to their God…
llm_translation: Prohibition of Holiness - A widow for a High Priest, a divorcee and a halutzah for an ordinary priest. And why are they called Prohibition of Holiness? Because it is written: "They shall be holy to their God."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה מַחְלִיף: אִיסּוּר מִצְוָה — אַלְמָנָה לְכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל, גְּרוּשָׁה וַחֲלוּצָה לְכֹהֵן הֶדְיוֹט. וְאַמַּאי קָרֵי לֵיהּ אִיסּוּר מִצְוָה — דִּכְתִיב: ״אֵלֶּה הַמִּצְוֹת״.
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Yehuda switches A prohibition a mitzva a widow to the High Priest, a divorcée or a ḥalutza to a common priest. And why is this called a prohibition a mitzva? As it is written “These are the mitzvot
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Yehuda says: A prohibition of a commandment - a widow to a High Priest, a divorcee and a halutzah to an ordinary priest. And why is it called a prohibition of a commandment? Because it is written: "These are the commandments."

hebrew_text: אִיסּוּר קְדוּשָּׁה — שְׁנִיּוֹת מִדִּבְרֵי סוֹפְרִים, וְאַמַּאי קָרֵי לֵיהּ אִיסּוּר קְדוּשָּׁה? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: כׇּל הַמְקַיֵּים דִּבְרֵי חֲכָמִים נִקְרָא קָדוֹשׁ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא: וְכֹל שֶׁאֵינוֹ מְקַיֵּים דִּבְרֵי חֲכָמִים, קָדוֹשׁ הוּא דְּלָא מִיקְּרֵי, רָשָׁע נָמֵי לָא מִיקְּרֵי! אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: קַדֵּשׁ עַצְמְךָ בַּמּוּתָּר לָךְ.
human_translation: A prohibition sanctity secondary relationships by rabbinic law. And why is this called a prohibition sanctity? Abaye said: Whoever fulfills the words of the Sages is called sacred. Rava said to him: whoever does not fulfill the words of the Sages is not called sacred, he is also not called wicked. Rather, Rava said you must sanctify yourself which is permitted to you
llm_translation: Prohibition of Holiness - secondary prohibitions from the words of the Scribes, and why is it called Prohibition of Holiness? Abaye said: Anyone who upholds the words of the Sages is called holy. Rava said to him: And anyone who does not uphold the words of the Sages, is he holy that he is not called wicked either! Rather, Rava said: Sanctify yourself with what is permitted to you.

hebrew_text: אַלְמָנָה לְכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל. קָפָסֵיק וְתָנֵי, לָא שְׁנָא מִן הַנִּשּׂוּאִין וְלָא שְׁנָא מִן הָאֵירוּסִין.
human_translation: a widow to a High Priest taught categorically, It is no different from marriage or from betrothal
llm_translation: Widow to High Priest. Kapasik and teaches, not different from the offerings and not different from the betrothals.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא מִן הַנִּשּׂוּאִין — עֲשֵׂה וְלֹא תַעֲשֶׂה, וְאֵין עֲשֵׂה דּוֹחֶה לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה וַעֲשֵׂה. אֶלָּא מִן הָאֵירוּסִין — לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה גְּרֵידָא הוּא, יָבֹא עֲשֵׂה וְיִדְחֶה לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה!
human_translation: Granted, from marriage, positive mitzva and prohibition And a positive mitzva, does not override a prohibition, and a positive mitzva, However, from betrothal, there is only a prohibition, the positive mitzva come and override the prohibition
llm_translation: In truth, from the offerings - do and do not do, and a positive commandment does not override a negative commandment. Rather, from the betrothed - it is a prohibition to do, let a positive commandment come and push aside the negative commandment!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב גִּידֵּל אָמַר רַב, אָמַר קְרָא: ״וְעָלְתָה יְבִמְתּוֹ הַשַּׁעְרָה״, שֶׁאֵין תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״יְבִמְתּוֹ״, מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״יְבִמְתּוֹ״ — יֵשׁ לְךָ יְבָמָה אַחַת שֶׁעוֹלָה לַחֲלִיצָה וְאֵינָהּ עוֹלָה לְיִיבּוּם, וְאֵיזוֹ זוֹ חַיָּיבֵי לָאוִין.
human_translation: Rav Giddel said Rav said The verse states: “His yevama shall ascend to the gate As no the verse to state: “His yevama ,” what the verse states: “His yevama ”? there is one yevama who ascends for ḥalitza but may not ascend for levirate marriage, Who is this? This is liable a prohibition,
llm_translation: Rav Giddel said in the name of Rav, the verse says: "And his brother's wife shall go up to him," as the Torah does not need to say "his brother's wife," what does the Torah need to say "his brother's wife" for? You have one yevamah who is eligible for halitzah but not for yibum, and who is this? Those who are liable for negative commandments.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא חַיָּיבֵי כָּרֵיתוֹת! אָמַר קְרָא: ״וְאִם לֹא יַחְפּוֹץ הָאִישׁ לָקַחַת״, הָא חָפֵץ — מְיַיבֵּם. כׇּל הָעוֹלֶה לְיִיבּוּם — עוֹלֶה לַחֲלִיצָה, וְכֹל שֶׁאֵין עוֹלֶה לְיִיבּוּם — אֵינוֹ עוֹלֶה לַחֲלִיצָה.
human_translation: Say those liable karet The verse states: “And if the man does not wish to take implies he wishes, he takes her in levirate marriage; one who is eligible for levirate marriage is eligible for ḥalitza . And one who is ineligible for levirate marriage is ineligible for ḥalitza
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And why are they liable for karet? The verse says: 'But if the man does not wish to take,' if he wishes - he performs levirate marriage. Anyone who is eligible for levirate marriage - is eligible for halitzah, and anyone who is not eligible for levirate marriage - is not eligible for halitzah."

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, חַיָּיבֵי לָאוִין נָמֵי! הָא רַבִּי רַחֲמָנָא ״יְבִמְתּוֹ״. וּמָה רָאִיתָ?
human_translation: If so, those liable a prohibition But the Merciful One included “His yevama .” And what did you see
llm_translation: So it is, the non-Jews are also liable! For Rabbi Rachamana says, "His sister-in-law." And what did you see?

hebrew_text: מִסְתַּבְּרָא: חַיָּיבֵי לָאוִין — תָּפְסִי בְּהוּ קִדּוּשִׁין. חַיָּיבֵי כָּרֵיתוֹת — לָא תָּפְסִי בְּהוּ קִדּוּשִׁין.
human_translation: stands to reason, betrothal takes effect liable a prohibition. betrothal does not take effect those liable karet ,
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Mistabera: hayyavei lavin - tafsi b'hu kiddushin. Hayyavei kareitot - lo tafsi b'hu kiddushin." Translation: "It is logical: those liable for negative commandments - acquire a woman with betrothal. Those liable for excision - do not acquire a woman with betrothal."

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רָבָא: אִיסּוּר מִצְוָה וְאִיסּוּר קְדוּשָּׁה, בָּא עָלֶיהָ אוֹ חָלַץ לָהּ — נִפְטְרָה צָרָתָהּ. וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ חַיָּיבֵי לָאוִין מִדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא לַחֲלִיצָה רַמְיָא, לְיִיבּוּם לָא רַמְיָא, כִּי בָּא עָלֶיהָ — אַמַּאי נִפְטְרָה צָרָתָהּ?
human_translation: Rava raised an objection a prohibition a mitzva and a prohibition sanctity he engages in intercourse with or performs ḥalitza with her, her rival wife is exempt, If it enters your mind liable a prohibition, require ḥalitza by Torah but do not require levirate marriage, when he engages in intercourse with why is her rival wife exempt?
llm_translation: Rava raises an objection: Prohibition of a mitzvah and prohibition of sanctity, if one engaged with it or removed it - her rival is exempt. And if you were to say that those liable for a negative commandment from the Torah hint at halitzah, they do not hint at yibum, for if one engaged with it - why is her rival exempt?

hebrew_text: הוּא מוֹתֵיב לַהּ וְהוּא מְפָרֵק לַהּ: לִצְדָדִין קָתָנֵי. בָּא עָלֶיהָ — אַאִיסּוּר מִצְוָה. חָלַץ לָהּ — אַאִיסּוּר קְדוּשָּׁה.
human_translation: raised the objection and he resolved it: teaches it disjunctively; Engages in intercourse with her, to a prohibition a mitzva. Performs ḥalitza with her, is referring to a prohibition sanctity,
llm_translation: He sets her aside and he divorces her: the small side. He comes upon her - a prohibition of commandment. He removes her - a prohibition of sanctity.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רָבָא: פְּצוּעַ דַּכָּא, וּכְרוּת שׇׁפְכָה, סְרִיס אָדָם, וְהַזָּקֵן — אוֹ חוֹלְצִין אוֹ מְיַיבְּמִין. כֵּיצַד? מֵתוּ, וְלָהֶם אַחִים וְלָהֶם נָשִׁים, וְעָמְדוּ אַחִין וְעָשׂוּ מַאֲמָר בִּנְשׁוֹתֵיהֶן, וְנָתְנוּ גֵּט, וְחָלְצוּ — מַה שֶּׁעָשׂוּ עָשׂוּ. וְאִם בָּעֲלוּ — קָנוּ.
human_translation: Rava raised an objection A man with crushed testicles or one whose penis has been severed, one who is a eunuch by man an elderly man, one either performs ḥalitza or levirate marriage. How so? died, and they had brothers and they had wives, and the brothers proceeded to perform levirate betrothal with their wives, or gave them a bill of divorce, or performed ḥalitza , whatever they did is done; And if engaged in intercourse acquired
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: One who is wounded in the testicles, or one whose penis is severed, a eunuch, or an elderly man — do we either perform halitzah or allow for levirate marriage with them? How so? If their brothers are alive and they have wives, and the brothers stand up and perform chalitzah with their wives, give them a bill of divorce, and then perform halitzah — whatever they did, they did. But if they were married — they acquire them.

hebrew_text: מֵתוּ אַחִים, וְעָמְדוּ הֵם, וְעָשׂוּ מַאֲמָר בִּנְשׁוֹתֵיהֶן, וְנָתְנוּ גֵּט אוֹ שֶׁחָלְצוּ — מַה שֶּׁעָשׂוּ עָשׂוּ. וְאִם בָּעֲלוּ — קָנוּ, וְאָסוּר לְקַיְּימָן, מִשּׁוּם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לֹא יָבֹא פְצוּעַ דַּכָּא״. וְאִי סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ חַיָּיבֵי לָאוִין מִדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא לַחֲלִיצָה רַמְיָא, לְיִיבּוּם לָא רַמְיָא, אִם בָּעֲלוּ — אַמַּאי קָנוּ?
human_translation: the brothers died and proceeded to perform levirate betrothal with their wives, gave a bill of divorce, or performed ḥalitza , whatever they did is done And if they engaged in intercourse they acquired it is forbidden to maintain them, because it is stated: “One with crushed testicles And if it enters your mind liable a prohibition, require ḥalitza by Torah but do not require levirate marriage, then if they engaged in intercourse why are they acquired
llm_translation: The brothers died, and their wives stood, and they made a statement, and they gave a bill of divorce or performed halitzah - what they did, they did. And if they married - they acquired, and it is forbidden to fulfill the levirate marriage, because it is stated: "A crushed or severed one shall not enter." And if you think that they are obligated by a negative commandment from the Torah for halitzah, it implies for levirate marriage they are not obligated, so if they married - why did they acquire?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: אַלְמָנָה מִן הָאֵירוּסִין נָמֵי, עֲשֵׂה וְלֹא תַעֲשֶׂה הוּא — דִּכְתִיב: ״קְדוֹשִׁים יִהְיוּ לֵאלֹהֵיהֶם״.
human_translation: Rather, Rava said a widow from betrothal also a positive mitzva and a prohibition As it is written: “They shall be sacred to their God”
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said: A widow from the betrothed is indeed considered as married, it is a positive commandment and a negative commandment — as it is written: "They shall be holy to their God."

hebrew_text: מַמְזֶרֶת וּנְתִינָה — מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? כְּתִיב: ״וְהִתְקַדִּשְׁתֶּם״.
human_translation: what is there to say a daughter born from an incestuous or adulterous relationship [ mamzeret ] or a Gibeonite woman, It is written “Sanctify yourselves,
llm_translation: Illegitimate child and slave woman - what is there to say? It is written: "And you shall sanctify yourselves."

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, כׇּל הַתּוֹרָה כּוּלָּהּ נָמֵי עֲשֵׂה וְלֹא תַעֲשֶׂה הוּא, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְהִתְקַדִּשְׁתֶּם״! אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: גְּזֵירָה אַלְמָנָה מִן הָאֵירוּסִין אַטּוּ אַלְמָנָה מִן הַנִּשּׂוּאִין.
human_translation: If so, the entire Torah a positive mitzva and a prohibition, as it is written: “Sanctify yourselves” Rather, Rava stated a widow from betrothal by decree, due to a widow from marriage.
llm_translation: If so, the entire Torah is only "do" and not "do not," as it is written: "And you shall sanctify yourselves"! Rather, Rava said: A decree against a widow from betrothals leads to a decree against a widow from marriages.

hebrew_text: מַמְזֶרֶת וּנְתִינָה מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר! גְּזֵירָה בִּמְקוֹם מִצְוָה אַטּוּ שֶׁלֹּא בִּמְקוֹם מִצְוָה.
human_translation: What is there to say a mamzeret or a Gibeonite woman? when the mitzva applies decree due to when the mitzva does not apply.
llm_translation: Illegitimate child and slave woman, what is there to say? A decree in a place of command, but not in a place of command.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, אֵשֶׁת אָחִיו מֵאָבִיו לֹא תִּתְיַיבֵּם, גְּזֵירָה מִשּׁוּם אֵשֶׁת אָחִיו מֵאִמּוֹ! יִיבּוּם בְּנַחֲלָה תְּלָא רַחְמָנָא, מִידָּע יְדִיעַ.
human_translation: However, if so, the wife of a paternal brother should not enter into levirate marriage; rabbinic decree due to the wife of a maternal brother, The Merciful One made levirate marriage dependent upon inheritance, is well known
llm_translation: Rather from now, wife of his brother from his father not shall be levirate marriage, decree from because wife of his brother from his mother! Levirate marriage with inheritance hangs mercy, from knowledge knowledge.

hebrew_text: אִשָּׁה שֶׁאֵין לָהּ בָּנִים לֹא תִּתְיַיבֵּם, גְּזֵירָה מִשּׁוּם אִשָּׁה שֶׁיֵּשׁ לָהּ בָּנִים! בְּבָנִים תְּלָא רַחְמָנָא, מִידָּע יְדִיעַ.
human_translation: a childless woman should not enter into levirate marriage decree due to a woman who has children. The Merciful One made levirate marriage dependent upon children; is well known
llm_translation: A woman who has no children should not marry, a decree because of a woman who has children! With children, mercy is suspended, as it is known.

hebrew_text: אֵשֶׁת אָחִיו שֶׁהָיָה בְּעוֹלָמוֹ לֹא תִּתְיַיבֵּם, גְּזֵרָה מִשּׁוּם אֵשֶׁת אָחִיו שֶׁלֹּא הָיָה בְּעוֹלָמוֹ! בִּישִׁיבָה תְּלָא רַחְמָנָא, מִידָּע יְדִיעַ.
human_translation: The wife of a brother with whom one did coexist should not enter into levirate marriage; decree due to the wife of a brother with whom he did not coexist. The Merciful One made levirate marriage dependent upon dwelling is well known
llm_translation: The wife of his brother who was in his world shall not perform levirate marriage, a decree due to the wife of his brother who was not in his world! In a sitting place, may the Merciful One have mercy, from knowledge to knowledge.

hebrew_text: כׇּל הַנָּשִׁים לֹא תִּתְיַיבֵּמְנָה, גְּזֵרָה מִשּׁוּם אַיְלוֹנִית! לָא שְׁכִיחָא. מַמְזֶרֶת וּנְתִינָה נָמֵי לָא שְׁכִיחָא!
human_translation: No woman should enter into levirate marriage; decree due to an aylonit . not commonplace, neither a mamzeret nor a Gibeonite woman is commonplace either.
llm_translation: All women not shall be subject to levirate marriage, decree from concern of promiscuity! Not common. Mamzeret and Netinah also not common!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: גְּזֵרָה בִּיאָה רִאשׁוֹנָה אַטּוּ בִּיאָה שְׁנִיָּה.
human_translation: Rather, Rava said The first intercourse decree due to a second intercourse.
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said: The decree of the first intercourse, then the second intercourse.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: אִם בָּעֲלוּ — קָנוּ בְּבִיאָה רִאשׁוֹנָה, וְאָסוּר לְקַיְּימָן בְּבִיאָה שְׁנִיָּה.
human_translation: This is also taught If engaged in intercourse he acquired with the first intercourse; however, it is prohibited to retain for a second act of intercourse.
llm_translation: It was taught in a baraita in the school of the house of Hillel: If they had marital relations - they acquired the woman through the first intercourse, and it is forbidden to fulfill the marriage through a second intercourse.

hebrew_text: הֲדַר אָמַר רָבָא, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַב אָשֵׁי: לָאו מִילְּתָא הִיא דַּאֲמַרִי, דְּאָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁאַתָּה מוֹצֵא עֲשֵׂה וְלֹא תַעֲשֶׂה, אִם אַתָּה יָכוֹל לְקַיֵּים שְׁנֵיהֶם — מוּטָב, וְאִם לָאו, יָבֹא עֲשֵׂה וְיִדְחֶה אֶת לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה. הָכָא נָמֵי אֶפְשָׁר בַּחֲלִיצָה, דִּמְקַיֵּים עֲשֵׂה וְלֹא תַעֲשֶׂה.
human_translation: Rava then said, and some say Rav Ashi That which I said, is not correct, As Reish Lakish said In every place that you find a positive mitzva and a prohibition if you can fulfill both of them this is best, And if not let the positive mitzva come and override the prohibition. Here, too, it is possible, by way of ḥalitza , to fulfill the positive mitzva and the prohibition
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: Hadr amar Rava, ve'itma Rav Ashe: Lav milta hi da'amari, de'amar Reish Lakish: Kol makom she'ata motze aseh ve'lo ta'aseh, im atah yachol lekayem shneihem — mutav, ve'im lav, yavo aseh ve'yidcheh et lo ta'aseh. Hacha namei efshar bachalitza, dimkayem aseh ve'lo ta'aseh. English translation: Hadr said Rava, and it was stated by Rav Ashe: It is not a matter that they said, as Reish Lakish said: In every place that you find "do" and "do not do," if you can fulfill both — it is better, and if not, let the positive commandment come and override the negative commandment. Here too, it is possible in the case of halitzah, where the positive commandment is fulfilled and the negative commandment is not.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: וְאִם בָּעֲלוּ קָנוּ. תְּיוּבְתָּא.
human_translation: raises an objection And if engaged in intercourse, he acquired a conclusive refutation,
llm_translation: Challenger: And if they acquired it, it is better.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר: בִּיאַת כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל בְּאַלְמָנָה. רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, חַד אָמַר: אֵינָהּ פּוֹטֶרֶת צָרָתָהּ, וְחַד אָמַר: פּוֹטֶרֶת צָרָתָהּ.
human_translation: it was stated a High Priest who engaged in intercourse with a widow Rabbi Yoḥanan and Rabbi Elazar One said does not exempt her rival wife and one said exempt her rival wife
llm_translation: It was stated: The entry of the High Priest to a widow. Rabbi Yochanan and Rabbi Elazar, one said: She does not exempt her affliction, and one said: She exempts her affliction.

hebrew_text: בְּאַלְמָנָה מִן הַנִּשּׂוּאִין — כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דְּלָא פָּטְרָה, דְּאֵין עֲשֵׂה דּוֹחֶה לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה וַעֲשֵׂה. כִּי פְּלִיגִי בְּאַלְמָנָה מִן הָאֵרוּסִין. מַאן דְּאָמַר פּוֹטֶרֶת — אָתֵי עֲשֵׂה וְדָחֵי אֶת לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה. וּמַאן דְּאָמַר אֵינָהּ פּוֹטֶרֶת — לָא אָתֵי עֲשֵׂה וְדָחֵי אֶת לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה, כֵּיוָן דְּאֶפְשָׁר בַּחֲלִיצָה.
human_translation: a widow from marriage, everyone agrees that this does not exempt as a positive mitzva does not override a prohibition and a positive mitzva When they disagree, is in a widow from betrothal. The one who said that it exempts the positive mitzva comes and overrides prohibition And the one who said that it does not exempt a positive mitzva does not come and override a prohibition, since it is possible ḥalitza .
llm_translation: In the case of a widow from those who are exempt - everyone agrees that she is not exempt, for a positive commandment does not override both a negative commandment and a positive commandment. When they argue regarding a widow from those who are betrothed. Whoever says she is exempt - he comes to say that the positive commandment overrides the negative commandment. And whoever says she is not exempt - he comes to say that the positive commandment does not override the negative commandment, since it is possible with halitzah.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: וְאִם בָּעֲלוּ קָנוּ! תְּיוּבְתָּא.
human_translation: raises an objection If engaged in intercourse, he acquired This is a conclusive refutation,
llm_translation: Challenger: And if they acquired it! Response: A rebuttal.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא תִּיהְוֵי נָמֵי תְּיוּבְתָּא דְּרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ?! אָמַר לָךְ רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: כִּי אָמֵינָא אֲנָא — הֵיכָא דִּמְקַיְּימִי מִצְוָה, אֲבָל הָכָא, חֲלִיצָה בִּמְקוֹם יִיבּוּם — לָאו מִצְוָה הִיא.
human_translation: Shall we say that also a conclusive refutation Reish Lakish Reish Lakish said to you: When I say when the mitzva is fulfilled but here, ḥalitza in place of levirate marriage is not mitzva.
llm_translation: Let it be said, should it be the case that Reish Lakish is present?! He said to you, Reish Lakish: "For I say — where fulfilling a commandment is at stake, it is a mitzvah, but here, with halitzah in place of yibum — it is not a mitzvah."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: רֶמֶז לִשְׁנִיּוֹת מִן הַתּוֹרָה מִנַּיִן — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי אֶת כׇּל הַתּוֹעֵבוֹת הָאֵל עָשׂוּ אַנְשֵׁי הָאָרֶץ״, ״הָאֵל״ — קָשׁוֹת, מִכְּלָל דְּאִיכָּא רַכּוֹת, וּמַאי נִינְהוּ — שְׁנִיּוֹת.
human_translation: Rava said: Where secondary relationships hinted at in the Torah? As it is stated “For all these abominations have the men of the land done” “These” the harsh ones, by inference that there are soft ones. And what are those secondary relationships.
llm_translation: Rava said: A hint for two types from the Torah, from where? — As it is stated: "For all the abominations that these do, the men of the land," "these" — harsh, from the inclusive category of "soft," and what are they? — two types.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי מַשְׁמַע דְּ״הָאֵל״ לִישָּׁנָא דְקָשֶׁה הוּא — דִּכְתִיב: ״וְאֶת אֵילֵי הָאָרֶץ לָקָח״.
human_translation: From where be inferred “these” [ ha’el ] is an expression harsh? As it is written: “And the mighty [ eilei ] of the land he took away”
llm_translation: And what is implied by the word "ha'el" in the difficult matter - as it is written: "And he took the rams of the flock."

hebrew_text: לֵימָא פְּלִיגָא דְּרַבִּי לֵוִי, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי לֵוִי: קָשֶׁה עוֹנְשָׁן שֶׁל מִדּוֹת יוֹתֵר מֵעוֹנְשָׁן שֶׁל עֲרָיוֹת, שֶׁזֶּה נֶאֱמַר בָּהֶן ״אֵל״, וְזֶה נֶאֱמַר בָּהֶן ״אֵלֶּה״! ״אֵל״ קָשֶׁה, וְ״אֵלֶּה״ קָשֶׁה מֵ״אֵל״.
human_translation: Shall we say contradicts Rabbi Levi? As Rabbi Levi said: The harshness of the punishment for measures is more than the punishment for forbidden relationships, as this, is stated “These [ el ],” whereas that, is stated: “These [ eleh ]” el harsh, but eleh harsher than el .
llm_translation: Let us say the dispute of Rabbi Levi, for Rabbi Levi said: Their punishment is more severe than the punishment of forbidden relationships, as this is stated regarding them "God," and this is stated regarding them "these"! "God" is severe, and "these" is more severe than "God."

hebrew_text: גַּבֵּי עֲרָיוֹת נָמֵי הָא כְּתִיב ״אֵלֶּה״! הָהוּא לְמַעוֹטֵי מִדּוֹת מִכָּרֵת.
human_translation: With regard to forbidden relationships eleh is also written: That to exclude measures from karet .
llm_translation: Regarding matters of forbidden relationships, it is stated: "These"! That is to exclude those who are subject to the punishment of karet.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מַאי חוּמְרַיְיהוּ? הָנֵי — אֶפְשָׁר בִּתְשׁוּבָה, הָנֵי — לָא אֶפְשָׁר בִּתְשׁוּבָה.
human_translation: Rather, what severe Those possibility of repentance. those it is not possible to repent
llm_translation: Rather, what is the difference between them? These — it is possible with repentance, those — it is not possible with repentance.

hebrew_text: רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר מֵהָכָא: ״וְאִזֵּן וְחִקֵּר תִּקֵּן מְשָׁלִים הַרְבֵּה״, וְאָמַר עוּלָּא אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: קוֹדֶם שֶׁבָּא שְׁלֹמֹה, הָיְתָה תּוֹרָה דּוֹמָה לִכְפִיפָה שֶׁאֵין לָהּ אׇזְנַיִם, עַד שֶׁבָּא שְׁלֹמֹה וְעָשָׂה לָהּ אׇזְנַיִם.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said from here: “He weighed [ izzen ] and sought out, and set in order many proverbs” and Ulla said Rabbi Elazar said: Before Solomon came, the Torah was like a basket [ kefifa ] without handles [ oznayim ], until Solomon came and made handles for it.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said from here: "Incline your ear and hear the words of the wise, and apply your heart to my knowledge" (Proverbs 22:17). And Ulah said Rabbi Elazar said: Before Solomon came, the Torah was like a rolled-up scroll that had no ears, until Solomon came and gave it ears.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא אָמַר מֵהָכָא: ״פְּרָעֵהוּ אַל תַּעֲבׇר בּוֹ שְׂטֵה מֵעָלָיו וַעֲבוֹר״.
human_translation: Rabbi Oshaya said from here: “Avoid it, pass not by it; turn from it, and pass on”
llm_translation: Rabbi Oshaya said from here: "Do not pass over him, turn aside from him and pass."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: מָשָׁל דְּרַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא לְמָה הַדָּבָר דּוֹמֶה — לְאָדָם מְשַׁמֵּר פַּרְדֵּס, מְשַׁמְּרוֹ מִבַּחוּץ — כּוּלּוֹ מִשְׁתַּמֵּר. מְשַׁמְּרוֹ מִבִּפְנִים, שֶׁלְּפָנָיו — מִשְׁתַּמֵּר, שֶׁלְּאַחֲרָיו — אֵינוֹ מִשְׁתַּמֵּר. וְהָא דְּרַב אָשֵׁי בְּדוּתָא הִיא. הָתָם, שֶׁלְּפָנָיו מִיהָא מִשְׁתַּמֵּר. הָכָא, אִי לָאו שְׁנִיּוֹת, פָּגַע בְּעֶרְוָה גּוּפַהּ.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said a parable: To what is this matter, of Rabbi Oshaya, comparable? to a man guarding an orchard; guards it from the outside, all of it is guarded. he guards it from the inside, that which is in front of him is guarded, that which is behind him is unguarded. And this of Rav Ashi is a mistake [ beduta ] There, that which is in front of him at least is guarded; here, were it not for secondary relationships one would encounter the forbidden relationship itself.
llm_translation: Rav Ashei said: The parable of Rabbi Oshaya, to what is the matter similar? To a person who guards a garden, if he guards it from the outside - it is all guarded. If he guards it from within, that which is in front of him is guarded, but that which is behind him is not guarded. And this is the statement of Rav Ashei in its simplicity. There, that which is in front of him is guarded by itself. Here, if it is not two separate entities, he has come into contact with her nakedness.

hebrew_text: רַב כָּהֲנָא אָמַר מֵהָכָא: ״וּשְׁמַרְתֶּם אֶת מִשְׁמַרְתִּי״ — עֲשׂוּ מִשְׁמֶרֶת לְמִשְׁמַרְתִּי.
human_translation: Rav Kahana said from here, “Therefore shall you protect [ ushmartem ] My prized possession [ mishmarti ], Establish a safeguard [ mishmeret ] for My prized possession.
llm_translation: Rav Kahana said from here: "And you shall guard My charge" - make a charge for My charge.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי לְרַב יוֹסֵף: הָא דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא הִיא! דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא, וּפֵירְשׁוּ רַבָּנַן. כׇּל הַתּוֹרָה נָמֵי פֵּירְשׁוּ רַבָּנַן! אֶלָּא: מִדְּרַבָּנַן, וּקְרָא אַסְמַכְתָּא בְּעָלְמָא.
human_translation: Abaye said to Rav Yosef: then it would be by Torah by Torah and the Sages interpreted all of the Torah also interpreted by the Sages Rather, by rabbinic and the verse is a mere support
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye to Rav Yosef: This that is from the Torah! From the Torah, and the Rabbis interpreted. All the Torah also the Rabbis interpreted! Rather: From the Rabbis, and a mere support from the verse.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן, מָה הֵם שְׁנִיּוֹת: אֵם אִמּוֹ, וְאֵם אָבִיו, וְאֵשֶׁת אֲבִי אָבִיו, וְאֵשֶׁת אֲבִי אִמּוֹ, וְאֵשֶׁת אֲחִי הָאָב מִן הָאֵם, וְאֵשֶׁת אֲחִי הָאֵם מִן הָאָב, וְכַלַּת בְּנוֹ, וְכַלַּת בִּתּוֹ. וּמוּתָּר אָדָם בְּאֵשֶׁת חָמִיו וּבְאֵשֶׁת חוֹרְגוֹ, וְאָסוּר בְּבַת חוֹרְגוֹ. וְחוֹרְגוֹ מוּתָּר בְּאִשְׁתּוֹ וּבִתּוֹ.
human_translation: The Sages taught What are the secondary relationships His mother’s mother, and his father’s mother, and his father’s father’s wife, and his mother’s father’s wife, and the wife of his father’s maternal brother, and the wife of his mother’s paternal brother, and his son’s daughter-in-law, and his daughter’s daughter-in-law. A man is permitted to take his father-in-law’s wife, and his stepson’s wife, And he is prohibited from the daughter of his stepson. And it is permitted for one’s stepson wife or daughter.
llm_translation: The sages taught: What are the cases of shniyot (forbidden relationships)? His mother, and his father's mother, and the wife of his father's father, and the wife of his mother's father, and the wife of his father's brother from the mother, and the wife of his mother's brother from the father, and his son's daughter-in-law, and his daughter's daughter-in-law. A man is permitted with his father-in-law's wife and his brother-in-law's wife, but forbidden with his brother-in-law's daughter. And a brother-in-law is permitted with his wife and his daughter.

hebrew_text: וְאֵשֶׁת חוֹרְגוֹ אוֹמֶרֶת לוֹ: אֲנִי מוּתֶּרֶת לְךָ, וּבִתִּי אֲסוּרָה לָךְ.
human_translation: And his stepson’s wife says to I am permitted to you, but my daughter is forbidden to you,
llm_translation: And the wife of the weaver says to him: "I am permitted to you, and my daughter is forbidden to you."

hebrew_text: בַּת חוֹרְגוֹ דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא הִיא, דִּכְתִיב: ״אֶת בַּת בְּנָהּ וְאֶת בַּת בִּתָּהּ״! מִשּׁוּם דְּקָבָעֵי לְמִיתְנֵי סֵיפָא: אֵשֶׁת חוֹרְגוֹ אוֹמֶרֶת לוֹ: ״אֲנִי מוּתֶּרֶת לְךָ וּבִתִּי אֲסוּרָה לְךָ״, וְאַף עַל גַּב דְּבִתִּי אֲסוּרָה לְךָ מִדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא, בְּדִידִי לָא גְּזוּר בִּיה רַבָּנַן — תְּנָא רֵישָׁא נָמֵי בַּת חוֹרְגוֹ.
human_translation: His stepson’s daughter She is by Torah as it is written: her son’s daughter or her daughter’s daughter” because wanted to teach the latter clause, His stepson’s wife says to him: I am permitted to you, but my daughter is forbidden to you. And although my daughter is forbidden to you by Torah the Sages did not issue a decree me. his stepson’s daughter was also taught in the first clause,
llm_translation: Daughter of a weaver is of biblical origin, as it is written: "The daughter of her son and the daughter of her daughter"! Because they established to teach the conclusion: The wife of a weaver says to him: "I am permitted to you, but my daughter is forbidden to you." And even though my daughter is forbidden to you from the Torah, I will not decree upon it like the Rabbis did — the first Tanna also says daughter of a weaver.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, אֵשֶׁת חָמִיו נָמֵי תֵּימָא: אֲנִי מוּתֶּרֶת לְךָ וּבִתִּי אֲסוּרָה לָךְ, דְּהָוְיָא אֲחוֹת אִשְׁתּוֹ! הָא פְּסִיקָא לֵיהּ, הָא לָא פְּסִיקָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: If so, His father-in-law’s wife also says: I am permitted to you and my daughter is forbidden to you, as she is his wife’s sister. This is conclusive for him. this is not conclusive for him.
llm_translation: If so, his brother's wife is permitted to you, and my daughter is forbidden to you, for she would be his wife's sister! Here it is interrupted for him, here it is not interrupted for him.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב, אַרְבַּע נָשִׁים יֵשׁ לָהֶן הֶפְסֵק. נָקֵיט רַב בִּידֵיהּ תְּלָת: אֵשֶׁת אֲחִי הָאֵם מִן הָאָב, וְאֵשֶׁת אֲחִי הָאָב מִן הָאֵם, וְכַלָּתוֹ. וּזְעֵירִי מוֹסִיף אַף אֵשֶׁת אֲבִי אִמּוֹ. אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק, וְסִימָנָיךְ: דְּעִילַּאי, דְּרַב.
human_translation: Rav said four women have a conclusion; Rav held three in his hand; The wife of his mother’s paternal brother, and the wife of his father’s maternal brother, and his daughter-in-law. And Ze’eiri adds: Also the wife of his mother’s father. Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: And your mnemonic on top of Rav,
llm_translation: Rav said, four women have a share. Rav took hold of three in his hand: the wife of one's father from the mother, and the wife of one's father from the mother, and his daughter-in-law. And Zeiri adds also the wife of one's father's mother. Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said, and your mnemonic: for the sake of Rav.

hebrew_text: וְרַב מַאי טַעְמָא לָא חָשֵׁיב לֵיהּ? מִיחַלְּפָא לֵיהּ בְּאֵשֶׁת אֲבִי אָבִיו.
human_translation: And what is the reason Rav did not reckon this switched with the wife of his father’s father,
llm_translation: And Rav, what is the reason that he does not consider it? Because he interchanged it with the wife of his grandfather.

hebrew_text: וּזְעֵירִי? לְהָתָם שְׁכִיחַ וְאָזֵיל, לְהָכָא לָא שְׁכִיחַ וְאָזֵיל.
human_translation: And Ze’eiri He is found there, and goes here, he is not commonly found to go.
llm_translation: And Z'eiri? To there common and go, to here not common and go.

hebrew_text: כַּלָּתוֹ
human_translation: his daughter-in-law.
llm_translation: His daughter-in-law.

hebrew_text: דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא הִיא, דִּכְתִיב: ״עֶרְוַת כַּלָּתְךָ לֹא תְגַלֵּה״! אֵימָא כַּלַּת בְּנוֹ. וְכַלַּת בְּנוֹ יֵשׁ לָהּ הֶפְסֵק? וְהָא תַּנְיָא: כַּלָּתוֹ עֶרְוָה, כַּלַּת בְּנוֹ שְׁנִיָּה, וְכֵן אַתָּה אוֹמֵר בִּבְנוֹ וּבֶן בְּנוֹ עַד סוֹף כׇּל הַדּוֹרוֹת. אֶלָּא אֵימָא: כַּלַּת בִּתּוֹ.
human_translation: by Torah law? As it is written: “You shall not uncover the nakedness of your daughter-in-law” Say his son’s daughter-in-law. And does his son’s daughter-in-law indeed have a conclusion? Isn’t it taught His daughter-in-law is a forbidden relation his son’s daughter-in-law is a secondary relation, and similarly, you say his son and his son’s son until the end of all generations Rather, say his daughter’s daughter-in-law.
llm_translation: It is from the Torah, as it is written: "The nakedness of your daughter-in-law you shall not uncover"! Say, his son's wife. And does his son's wife have a separation? But it was taught: His daughter-in-law is nakedness, his son's wife is a second level of nakedness, and so you say regarding his son and his grandson until the end of all generations. Rather say: his daughter's daughter-in-law.

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: הָא מִילְּתָא מִגַּבְרָא רַבָּה שְׁמִיעַ לִי, וּמַנּוּ — רַבִּי אַמֵּי: לֹא אָסְרוּ כַּלָּה אֶלָּא מִפְּנֵי כַּלָּה. וַאֲמַרוּ לִי כַּלְדָּאֵי: מַלְּפָנָא הָוֵית.
human_translation: As Rav Ḥisda said: I heard this matter from a great man, and who was that Rabbi Ami, They prohibited a daughter-in-law only due to daughter-in-law. The Chaldean said to me: You will be a teacher.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "D'amar Rav Ḥisda: Ha milta migavra rabbah shemi'a li, u'manu — Rabbi Ammi: Lo asru kallah ella m'pnei kallah. Va'amaru li kaldaei: Mal'fana havait." English translation: "Rav Ḥisda said: This matter, a great man told me, and who is it? — Rabbi Ammi: They only prohibited the bride because of the bride. And the townspeople told me: I was in front."

hebrew_text: אָמֵינָא: אִי גַּבְרָא רַבָּה הָוֵינָא — אֶסְבְּרַא מִדַּעְתַּי, אִי מַקְרֵי דַרְדְּקֵי הָוֵינָא — אֱשַׁיְּילַהּ מֵרַבָּנַן דְּאָתוּ לְבֵי כְנִישְׁתָּא. הַשְׁתָּא סְבַרְתַּהּ מִדַּעְתַּי: לֹא אָסְרוּ כַּלַּת בִּתּוֹ אֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם כַּלַּת בְּנוֹ.
human_translation: I said If I will become a great man I will reason with my knowledge. If I will become the teacher of children, I will ask it of the Sages who come to the synagogue Now I understand on my own. They prohibited his daughter’s daughter-in-law only due to his son’s daughter-in-law,
llm_translation: I say: If I were a great man — I would have reasoned from my own knowledge; if I were a small man — I would have asked it from the scholars who come to the synagogue. Now, she reasoned from her own knowledge: They only prohibited a daughter-in-law to her father-in-law because of a daughter-in-law to her son.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי לְרָבָא, אַסְבְּרַהּ לָךְ: כְּגוֹן כַּלָּתֵהּ דְּבֵי בַּר צֵיתַאי. רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר: כְּגוֹן כַּלָּתֵהּ דְּבֵי רַב פָּפָּא בַּר אַבָּא. רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: כְּגוֹן כַּלָּתֵהּ דְּבֵי מָרִי בַּר אִיסַק.
human_translation: Abaye said to Rava: I will explain to you For example, the daughter-in-law of the house of bar Tzitai, Rav Pappa said: For example, the daughter-in-law of the house of Rav Pappa bar Abba. Rav Ashi said: For example, the daughter-in-law of the house of Mari bar Isak.
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye to Rava, "You have reasoned: such as his daughter-in-law from the house of Bar Zeita." Rav Papa said: such as his daughter-in-law from the house of Rav Papa bar Abba. Rav Ashe said: such as his daughter-in-law from the house of Mari bar Isak.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: אֵשֶׁת אֲחִי הָאֵם מִן הָאֵם, מַהוּ? אֵשֶׁת אֲחִי הָאָב מִן הָאֵם וְאֵשֶׁת אֲחִי הָאֵם מִן הָאָב, דְּאִיכָּא צַד אָב — הוּא דִּגְזַרוּ רַבָּנַן, אֲבָל הֵיכָא דְּלֵיכָּא צַד אָב — לָא גְּזַרוּ בְּהוּ רַבָּנַן, אוֹ דִלְמָא לָא שְׁנָא?
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before What is the wife of mother’s maternal brother? the wife of father’s maternal brother and the wife of mother’s paternal brother contain aspect of a father, and this the Sages enacted But where there is no aspect of a father the Sages did not make a decree? Or perhaps is no different?
llm_translation: He asked them: The wife of the brother of the mother from the mother, what is the law? The wife of the brother of the father from the mother, and the wife of the brother of the mother from the father, where there is a paternal side - that is where the Rabbis decreed, but where there is no paternal side - the Rabbis did not decree upon them, or perhaps it is not different?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב סָפְרָא: הִיא גּוּפַהּ גְּזֵירָה, וַאֲנַן נֵיקוּם וְנִגְזוֹר גְּזֵירָה לִגְזֵירָה?! אָמַר רָבָא: אַטּוּ כּוּלְּהוּ לָאו גְּזֵירָה לִגְזֵירָה נִינְהוּ? אִמּוֹ — עֶרְוָה, אֵם אִמּוֹ — שְׁנִיָּה, וּגְזַרוּ עַל אֵם אָבִיו מִשּׁוּם אֵם אִמּוֹ. וְטַעְמָא מַאי — כּוּלְּהוּ ״דְּבֵי אִימָּא רַבָּתִי״ קָרוּ לַיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Safra said: She herself, is by rabbinic decree, will we proceed to issue a decree to a decree? Rava said: Is that to say that all of these are not decrees a decree? his mother a forbidden relation his mother’s mother is a secondary relationship. And they decreed his father’s mother due to his mother’s mother. And what is the reason? They are all called the house of the grandmother,
