llm_translation: Rav Safra said: Is it her body that is forbidden, and we are to take revenge and decree one decree after another decree?! Rava said: Are all of them not considered one decree after another decree? His mother is considered an ervah, his mother's mother is considered a shniyah, and they decreed regarding one's father's mother because of his mother. And the reason is that all of them are called "the house of his mother's father."

hebrew_text: אֵשֶׁת אָבִיו — עֶרְוָה, אֵשֶׁת אֲבִי אָבִיו — שְׁנִיָּה, וּגְזַרוּ עַל אֵשֶׁת אֲבִי אִמּוֹ מִשּׁוּם אֵשֶׁת אֲבִי אָבִיו. וְטַעְמָא מַאי — כּוּלְּהוּ ״דְּבֵי אַבָּא רַבָּה״ קָרוּ לֵיהּ.
human_translation: his father’s wife is a forbidden relation his father’s father’s wife is a secondary relationship. And they decreed his mother’s father’s wife due to his father’s father’s wife. And what is the reason? They are all called the house of the grandfather.
llm_translation: The wife of his father - forbidden, the wife of his father's father - a second prohibition, and they decreed regarding the wife of his father's mother because of the wife of his father's father. And the reason is what? - all of them are called "the household of the great-grandfather."

hebrew_text: אֵשֶׁת אֲחִי הָאָב מִן הָאָב — עֶרְוָה, אֵשֶׁת אֲחִי הָאָב מִן הָאֵם — שְׁנִיָּה, וְגָזְרוּ עַל אֵשֶׁת אֲחִי הָאֵם מִן הָאָב מִשּׁוּם אֵשֶׁת אֲחִי הָאָב מִן הָאֵם. וְטַעְמָא מַאי — מִשּׁוּם דְּכוּלְּהוּ ״דְּבֵי דוֹדֵי״ קָרֵי לְהוּ.
human_translation: the wife of his father’s paternal brother, is a forbidden relation the wife of his father’s maternal brother is a secondary relationship. And they decreed the wife of his mother’s paternal brother due to the wife of his father’s maternal brother. And what is the reason? because they are all called the house of the uncle;
llm_translation: The wife of the father's brother from the father — forbidden, the wife of the father's brother from the mother — permitted, and they decreed regarding the wife of the father's brother from the mother from the father because of the wife of the father's brother from the mother. And the reason is what? Because they are all called "relatives of the uncle."

hebrew_text: מַאי? תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּכִי אֲתָא רַב יְהוּדָה בַּר שֵׁילָא, אֲמַר: אָמְרִי בְּמַעְרְבָא: כֹּל שֶׁבִּנְקֵבָה עֶרְוָה, בְּזָכָר גָּזְרוּ עַל אִשְׁתּוֹ מִשּׁוּם שְׁנִיָּה.
human_translation: what is Come hear: As when Rav Yehuda bar Sheila came he said: In the West, they say every female a forbidden relation decreed on the wife of male due to a secondary relationship.
llm_translation: What? Come and hear, for when Rav Yehudah bar Sheilah came, he said: They say in the West: Any female who is naked, with a male they decreed upon his wife due to suspicion of adultery.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רָבָא: וּכְלָלָא הוּא? חֲמוֹתוֹ עֶרְוָה, אֵשֶׁת חָמִיו מוּתֶּרֶת. בַּת חֲמוֹתוֹ עֶרְוָה, אֵשֶׁת בֶּן חֲמוֹתוֹ מוּתֶּרֶת. בַּת חָמִיו עֶרְוָה, אֵשֶׁת בֶּן חָמִיו מוּתֶּרֶת. חוֹרַגְתּוֹ עֶרְוָה, אֵשֶׁת חוֹרְגוֹ מוּתֶּרֶת. בַּת חוֹרַגְתּוֹ עֶרְוָה, אֵשֶׁת בֶּן חוֹרְגוֹ מוּתֶּרֶת!
human_translation: And Rava said: Is principle? his mother-in-law a forbidden relation his father-in-law’s wife is permitted? his mother-in-law’s daughter is a forbidden relation his mother-in-law’s son’s wife is permitted. His father-in-law’s daughter is a forbidden relation the wife of his father-in-law’s son is permitted. His stepdaughter is a forbidden relation his stepson’s wife is permitted. His stepdaughter’s daughter, is a forbidden relation, the wife of his stepson’s son is permitted.
llm_translation: And Rava said: Is this a general principle? His mother-in-law is forbidden, his wife's mother is permitted. His sister-in-law is forbidden, his brother's wife is permitted. His daughter-in-law is forbidden, his son's wife is permitted. His weaver is forbidden, his weaver's wife is permitted. His weaver's daughter is forbidden, his weaver's son's wife is permitted!

hebrew_text: וְהָא דְּרַב יְהוּדָה בַּר שֵׁילָא לְאֵיתוֹיֵי מַאי? לָאו לְאֵיתוֹיֵי אֵשֶׁת אֲחִי הָאֵם מִן הָאֵם, דְּכֹל שֶׁבִּנְקֵבָה עֶרְוָה, בְּזָכָר גָּזְרוּ אִשְׁתּוֹ מִשּׁוּם שְׁנִיָּה?
human_translation: what did that Rav Yehuda bar Sheila come to include? Does it not come to include the wife of mother’s maternal brother, since every female who is a forbidden relation decreed on the wife of male due to a secondary relation.
llm_translation: And this that Rav Yehudah bar Sheilah raised a question: What is the law? Is it not the law that the wife of one's brother from the mother is forbidden, for any female is considered nakedness, but with a male, his wife was decreed forbidden due to the issue of "sheniya"?

hebrew_text: מַאי שְׁנָא הָנֵי, וּמַאי שְׁנָא הָא? הָא — בְּחַד קִידּוּשִׁין מְקָרֵב לַהּ, הָנֵי — עַד דְּאִיכָּא תְּרֵי קִידּוּשִׁין לָא מְקָרֵב לְהוּ.
human_translation: What is different these and this This, is related by a single act of betrothal. these are related when there are two acts of betrothal.
llm_translation: What is the difference between this one and that one? This one - with one Kiddushin he brings her close, those - until there are two Kiddushin he does not bring them close.

hebrew_text: שְׁלַח לֵיהּ רַב מְשַׁרְשְׁיָא מִתּוֹסַנְיָיא לְרַב פַּפֵּי: יְלַמְּדֵנוּ רַבֵּינוּ, אֵשֶׁת אֲחִי אֲבִי הָאָב, וַאֲחוֹת אֲבִי הָאָב, מַהוּ? מִדִּלְמַטָּה עֶרְוָה — לְמַעְלָה נָמֵי גְּזַרוּ בֵּיהּ, אוֹ דִלְמָא, הָא אִיתְפְּלִיג דָּרָתָא.
human_translation: Rav Mesharshiyya from Tusneya sent to Rav Pappi: Let our Master teach us: What is the wife of a father’s father’s brother and the sister of a father’s father? below is a forbidden relation, also decreed above. Or, perhaps the generations are separate
llm_translation: Send to him Rav Mesharshaya from Tosanaya to Rav Pappai: "Let our master teach us, the wife of the father of the father, and the sister of the father of the father, what is the law? If from below there is nakedness, is it also decreed from above, or perhaps, this is a dispute of the earlier generations."

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע ״מָה הֵן שְׁנִיּוֹת״, וְלָא קָחָשֵׁיב לְהוּ בַּהֲדַיְיהוּ!
human_translation: Come hear What are secondary relationships And these were not reckoned among them.
llm_translation: Come and hear: "What are teeth?" and it is not considered significant to them!

hebrew_text: תְּנָא וְשַׁיַּיר. מַאי שַׁיֵּיר דְּהַאי שַׁיַּיר? שַׁיַּיר שְׁנִיּוֹת דְּבֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא.
human_translation: taught and omitted What did he omit that he omitted this? He omitted secondary relationships the school of Rabbi Ḥiyya,
llm_translation: Tanna and Shaiyr. What is Shaiyr? Shaiyr, the two attendants of the house of Rabbi Chiyya.

hebrew_text: אַמֵּימָר אַכְשַׁר בְּאֵשֶׁת אֲחִי אֲבִי אָבִיו וּבַאֲחוֹת אֲבִי אָבִיו. אָמַר לֵיהּ רַב הִלֵּל לְרַב אָשֵׁי: לְדִידִי חַזְיָא לִי שְׁנִיּוֹת מָר בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבְנָא, וּכְתִיבָן שִׁיתַּסְרֵי לְאִיסּוּרָא. מַאי לָאו: תַּמְנֵי דְּמַתְנִיתָא, וְשֵׁית דְּבֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא, וְהָנָךְ תַּרְתֵּי — הָא שִׁיתַּסְרֵי.
human_translation: Ameimar permitted the wife of one’s father’s father’s brother and the sister of one’s father’s father. Rav Hillel said to Rav Ashi, I myself saw secondary relationships Mar, son of Rabbana, and it was written sixteen were forbidden. What, is it not eight in the baraita , and six from the school of Rabbi Ḥiyya, and these two this sixteen?
llm_translation: Ammemar permitted marriage with the wife of the paternal grandfather and with the sister of the paternal grandfather. Rav Hillel said to Rav Ashe: According to my view, there are two types of bitter herbs in the house of the son of Rabbanah, and they are written as six types, thus rendering them forbidden. What is the reason for this prohibition? Because there are eight types in the Mishnah, and six in the house of Rabbi Chiya, and there are two left — these are the ones that are forbidden.

hebrew_text: וּלְטַעְמָיךְ: שִׁיבְסְרֵי הָוְיָין, דְּהָא אִיכָּא אֵשֶׁת אֲחִי הָאֵם מִן הָאֵם, דְּפָשְׁטִינַן לְאִיסּוּרָא! הָא לָא קַשְׁיָא,
human_translation: And according to your reasoning, there are seventeen as there is the wife of a mother’s maternal brother, whose was resolved that she is forbidden. This not difficult.
llm_translation: And according to your reasoning: for the daughters of sisters are considered like the mother's sister, for there is the wife of one's maternal uncle from the mother, for we have established it for prohibition! This is not difficult.

hebrew_text: הָנָךְ תַּרְתֵּי דְּדָמְיָין לַהֲדָדֵי כַּחֲדָא חָשֵׁיב לְהוּ, וְהָא שִׁיתַּסְרֵי. וְהָא מִכׇּל מָקוֹם לְדִידִי חַזְיָין לַן דִּכְתִיבָן לְאִיסּוּרָא! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: וְלִיטַעְמָיךְ, אִי הֲוָה כְּתִיב לְהֶיתֵּירָא, מִי הֲוֵות סָמְכַתְּ עֲלַיְיהוּ? דְּמָר בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבְנָא מִי חֲתִים עֲלַיְיהוּ? הַשְׁתָּא נָמֵי דִּכְתִיב לְאִיסּוּרָא — לָאו מָר בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבְנָא חֲתִים עֲלַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: Those two, are similar to each other are counted as a single and there are sixteen. But in any case I myself saw them written as prohibited. said to And according to your reasoning, if it was written that they were permitted, would you have relied on that? Mar, son of Rabbana, signed on it? Now too, that it is written that they are prohibited, Mar, son of Rabbana, is not signed on it,
llm_translation: Here are two that are similar to Hadadei, considered as one, and here are two that are different. Nevertheless, in any case, according to my opinion, we see that they are written for prohibition! He said to him: And for your taste, if it had been written for permission, would you have relied on them? Did Mar, son of Ravna, sign on them? Now, since they are written for prohibition, is it not the case that Mar, son of Ravna, did not sign on them.

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי דְּבֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא: שְׁלִישִׁי שֶׁבִּבְנוֹ וְשֶׁבְּבִתּוֹ וְשֶׁבְּבֶן אִשְׁתּוֹ וְשֶׁבְּבַת אִשְׁתּוֹ — שְׁנִיָּה. רְבִיעִי שֶׁבְּחָמִיו וְשֶׁבַּחֲמוֹתוֹ — שְׁנִיָּה.
human_translation: of the school of Rabbi Ḥiyya taught: The third from one’s son and one’s daughter, and from his wife’s son and his wife’s daughter, secondary relationships. the fourth from his father-in-law and from his mother-in-law, secondary relationships.
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Rabbi Chiya: The third generation in his son, and in his daughter, and in the son of his wife, and in the daughter of his wife - they are considered second degree relatives. The fourth generation in his son's wife, and in his daughter-in-law - they are considered second degree relatives.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבִינָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: מַאי שְׁנָא לְמַעְלָה דְּקָחָשֵׁיב לָהּ לְאִשְׁתּוֹ, וּמַאי שְׁנָא לְמַטָּה דְּלָא קָחָשֵׁיב לָהּ לְאִשְׁתּוֹ? לְמַעְלָה, דְאִיסּוּרָא מִכֹּחַ אִשְׁתּוֹ קָא אָתֵי — חָשֵׁיב לַהּ, לְמַטָּה, דְאִיסּוּרָא לָאו מִכֹּחַ אִשְׁתּוֹ קָאָתֵי — לָא קָחָשֵׁיב לַהּ.
human_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: What is different between above, that counts his wife and what is different below, that he did not count his wife above, the prohibition stems from his wife, she is counted. below, the prohibition does not stem from his wife, and so she was not counted.
llm_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: What is the difference above, where it is considered for his wife, and what is the difference below, where it is not considered for his wife? Above, where the prohibition comes from his wife's power - it is considered for her; below, where the prohibition does not come from his wife's power - it is not considered for her.

hebrew_text: וְהָא בֶּן אִשְׁתּוֹ וּבַת אִשְׁתּוֹ, דְּאִיסּוּרָא מִכֹּחַ אִשְׁתּוֹ קָאָתֵי, וְלָא חָשֵׁיב לַהּ! אַיְּידֵי דִּתְנָא שְׁלֹשָׁה דּוֹרוֹת לְמַטָּה דִּידֵיהּ וְלָא חַשְּׁבַהּ, תְּנָא נָמֵי שְׁלֹשָׁה דּוֹרוֹת לְמַטָּה דִּידַהּ וְלָא חַשְּׁבַהּ.
human_translation: But his wife’s son and his wife’s daughter forbidden due to his wife, yet he does not count her Since he taught three generations below himself, and he did not count he taught three generations below and did not count her.
llm_translation: The Gemara asks: But with regard to his son and his daughter, since the prohibition is due to the power of his wife, it should not be considered a valid relationship! The Gemara answers: It is because a Tanna taught that three generations below oneself are considered relatives, but she did not consider it. Another Tanna also taught that three generations below herself are considered relatives, but she did not consider it.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אָשֵׁי לְרַב כָּהֲנָא: שְׁנִיּוֹת דְּבֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא, יֵשׁ לָהֶן הֶפְסֵק אוֹ אֵין לָהֶם הֶפְסֵק?
human_translation: Rav Ashi said to Rav Kahana: secondary relationships of the school of Rabbi Ḥiyya have a conclusion, or do they not have a conclusion?
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Ashi to Rav Kahana: The second-hand clothes of the house of Rabbi Chiya, do they have a separation or do they not have a separation?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּאָמַר רַב: אַרְבַּע נָשִׁים יֵשׁ לָהֶם הֶפְסֵק, וְתוּ לָא. דִּלְמָא כִּי קָאָמַר רַב — לְהַהִיא מַתְנִיתָא. תָּא שְׁמַע: שְׁלִישִׁי וּרְבִיעִי. שְׁלִישִׁי וּרְבִיעִי — אִין, טְפֵי — לָא! דִּלְמָא מִשְּׁלִישִׁי וְאֵילָךְ, מֵרְבִיעִי וְאֵילָךְ.
human_translation: Come hear which Rav said: Four women have a conclusion. and no more. Perhaps when Rav said this he was referring to the baraita Come hear The third and the fourth the third and the fourth yes, more no. Perhaps from the third onward and from the fourth onward.
llm_translation: Come and hear, for Rav said: Four women have a separation, and if not. Perhaps when Rav said this, he was referring to that Mishnah. Come and hear: The third and fourth. The third and fourth - no, the opposite - yes! Perhaps from the third and onwards, from the fourth and onwards.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא לְרַב נַחְמָן: חֲזִי מָר הַאי מֵרַבָּנַן דַּאֲתָא מִמַּעְרְבָא וְאָמַר, בְּעוֹ בְּמַעְרְבָא: גָּזְרוּ שְׁנִיּוֹת בְּגֵרִים, אוֹ לֹא גָּזְרוּ שְׁנִיּוֹת בְּגֵרִים?
human_translation: Rava said to Rav Naḥman: Did the Master see this one of the Sages who came from the West, who said: In the West they asked issued a decree secondary relationships for converts, or they did not issue a decree secondary relationships for converts?
llm_translation: He said to him, Rava said to Rav Nachman: See, master, this scholar who came from the West said, "Come to the West: Did they decree two measures for converts, or did they not decree two measures for converts?"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הַשְׁתָּא וּמָה עֶרְוָה גּוּפַהּ, אִי לָאו ״שֶׁלֹּא יֹאמְרוּ בָּאִין מִקְּדוּשָּׁה חֲמוּרָה לִקְדוּשָּׁה קַלָּה״, לָא גְּזַרוּ בְּהוּ רַבָּנַן — שְׁנִיּוֹת מִיבַּעְיָא?!
human_translation: said to him: Now, with regard to forbidden relationships themselves, were it not would say a state of more stringent sanctity to a state of lesser sanctity then the Sages would not have decreed Is it necessary secondary relationships?
llm_translation: He said to him: "Now, what is 'nakedness of her body'? If not, 'that they not say, "They have come from a severe sanctity to a light sanctity,"' did the Rabbis not decree upon it - two questions arise?!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: גֵּרִים, הוֹאִיל וַאֲתוֹ לְיָדָן, נֵימָא בְּהוּ מִלְּתָא: אַחִין מִן הָאֵם — לֹא יָעִידוּ, וְאִם הֵעִידוּ עֵדוּתָן עֵדוּת. אַחִין מִן הָאָב — מְעִידִין לְכַתְּחִלָּה. אַמֵּימָר אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ אַחִין מִן הָאֵם נָמֵי מְעִידִין לְכַתְּחִלָּה.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said: Since converts has come to hand let us say a matter Maternal brothers may not testify but if they did testify, their testimony is valid. Paternal brothers may testify ab initio , Ameimar said: Even maternal brothers may also testify ab initio .
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said: Converts, since they have come into our midst, let us say regarding them a matter: Brothers from the mother - they may not testify, but if they did testify, their testimony is valid. Brothers from the father - they may testify initially. Ameimar said: Even brothers from the mother, they too may testify initially.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי שְׁנָא מֵעֲרָיוֹת? עֶרְוָה — לַכֹּל מְסוּרָה, עֵדוּת — לְבֵית דִּין מְסוּרָה, וְגֵר שֶׁנִּתְגַּיֵּיר כְּקָטָן שֶׁנּוֹלַד דָּמֵי.
human_translation: what is different from forbidden relations, forbidden relations are handed over to all, testimony is handed over to the court, And a convert who converted like a child born,
llm_translation: And what is the difference between 'ervah' and 'edut'? 'Erva' - applies to all, 'edut' - is entrusted to the court, and a convert is like a newborn in terms of blood.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מִי שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ אָח מִכׇּל מָקוֹם — זוֹקֵק אֶת אֵשֶׁת אָחִיו לְיִבּוּם, וְאָחִיו הוּא לְכׇל דָּבָר, חוּץ מִמִּי שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ אָח מִן הַשִּׁפְחָה וּמִן הַגּוֹיָה. מִי שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ בֵּן מִכׇּל מָקוֹם — פּוֹטֵר אֵשֶׁת אָבִיו מִן הַיִּבּוּם, וְחַיָּיב עַל מַכָּתוֹ וְעַל קִלְלָתוֹ, וּבְנוֹ לְכׇל דָּבָר, חוּץ מִמִּי שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ בֵּן מִן הַשִּׁפְחָה וּמִן הַגּוֹיָה.
human_translation: anyone who has a brother of any kind, creates a levirate bond yevama to perform levirate marriage And he is his brother in all respects, except for one who has a brother from maidservant or from a gentile woman, anyone who has a child of any kind, exempts his father’s wife from levirate marriage, And is liable if he strikes or curses him. And he is his child in all respects, except for whoever has a child from maidservant or from a gentile woman,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who has a brother from any place—this one performs the levirate marriage with his brother's wife, and he is considered a brother in all matters, except for one who has a brother from a maidservant or a non-Jewish woman. One who has a son from any place—this one exempts his father's wife from levirate marriage, and he is liable for his punishment and disgrace, and his son is considered in all matters, except for one who has a son from a maidservant or a non-Jewish woman.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מִכׇּל מָקוֹם לְאֵתוֹיֵי מַאי? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: לְאֵתוֹיֵי מַמְזֵר. פְּשִׁיטָא, אָחִיו הוּא! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא, לֵילַף אַחְוָה אַחְוָה מִבְּנֵי יַעֲקֹב: מָה לְהַלָּן — כְּשֵׁרִין וְלֹא פְּסוּלִין, אַף כָּאן — כְּשֵׁרִין וְלֹא פְּסוּלִין, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: of any kind what to add? Rav Yehuda said: This adds a mamzer , isn’t obvious? He is his brother. lest you say: Let us derive “brother” “brother” the children of Jacob. Just as there, are unflawed and not flawed so too here, unflawed and not flawed this teaches us
llm_translation: Gemara: From every place to bring what? Rav Yehudah said: To bring mamzer. It is obvious, he is his brother! What might you say, to separate brother from brother from the sons of Jacob: Just as there — they are legitimate and not illegitimate, so too here — they are legitimate and not illegitimate, this is what he teaches us.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא הָכִי נָמֵי? כֵּיוָן דִּלְעִנְיַן יִבּוּם מִיפְטַר נִפְטָר,
human_translation: And say that indeed Since with regard to levirate marriage, exempt
llm_translation: And why not say so? Since regarding yibum, he is exempt, he is exempt.

hebrew_text: מִיזְקָק נָמֵי זָקֵיק.
human_translation: also causes a levirate bond
llm_translation: From the Talmudic text: "מִיזְקָק נָמֵי זָקֵיק." Translation: "Mizkaq namei zakeik."

hebrew_text: וְאָחִיו הוּא לְכׇל דָּבָר. לְמַאי הִלְכְתָא? לְיוֹרְשׁוֹ וְלִיטָּמֵא לוֹ.
human_translation: he is his brother in all respects. With regard to what halakha To inherit him, and to become ritually impure for him
llm_translation: And his brother he is for all matters. For what halakha? For inheriting him and becoming impure for him.

hebrew_text: פְּשִׁיטָא, אָחִיו הוּא! סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: הוֹאִיל וּכְתִיב: ״כִּי אִם לִשְׁאֵרוֹ הַקָּרוֹב אֵלָיו״, וְאָמַר מָר: ״שְׁאֵרוֹ״ — זוֹ אִשְׁתּוֹ, וּכְתִיב: ״לֹא יִטַּמָּא בַּעַל בְּעַמָּיו לְהֵחַלּוֹ״, יֵשׁ בַּעַל שֶׁמִּטַּמֵּא וְיֵשׁ בַּעַל שֶׁאֵין מִטַּמֵּא, הָא כֵּיצַד? מִטַּמֵּא הוּא לְאִשְׁתּוֹ כְּשֵׁרָה, וְאֵין מִטַּמֵּא לְאִשְׁתּוֹ פְּסוּלָה,
human_translation: Isn’t obvious, he is his brother? enter your mind to say since it is written except for his kin, that is near unto him” and the Master said “his kin”; this is his wife, But it is written: “He shall not defile himself, being a husband among his people, to profane himself” There is a husband who does become impure and there is a husband who does not become impure. How so? He becomes impure for his wife if she was fit but he does not become impure for his wife unfit
llm_translation: The straightforward conclusion is: he is her brother! Based on your reasoning, I would say: since it is written, "But for his kin, who is near to him," and the Master said: "his kin" - this refers to his wife. And it is written, "He shall not defile himself among his kin by marriage," there is a husband who defiles and there is a husband who does not defile, how so? He defiles for his wife who is valid, and he does not defile for his wife who is invalid.

hebrew_text: הָכִי נָמֵי: מִטַּמֵּא הוּא לְאָח כָּשֵׁר, וְאֵין מִטַּמֵּא לְאָח פְּסוּל — קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן. וְאֵימָא הָכִי נָמֵי? הָתָם לְאַפּוֹקֵי קָיְימָא, הָכָא אָחִיו הוּא.
human_translation: So too, becomes impure for a brother who is unflawed but he does not become impure for a brother flawed this comes to teach us Say this also, there, she stands to be dismissed, Here, he is his brother.
llm_translation: So it was stated: If he becomes impure for his brother, he is fit, but if he becomes impure for his brother-in-law, he is disqualified — this is what we hear. And why not say it like this: There, he is establishing lineage, but here, he is his brother.

hebrew_text: חוּץ מִמִּי שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ אָח מִן הַשִּׁפְחָה וּמִן הַגּוֹיָה. מַאי טַעְמָא? אָמַר קְרָא: ״הָאִשָּׁה וִילָדֶיהָ תִּהְיֶה לַאדוֹנֶיהָ״.
human_translation: Except for whoever has a brother from a maidservant or from a gentile woman, What is the reason The verse states “The wife and her children shall be her master’s”
llm_translation: Outside of one who has a brother from the maidservant and from the gentile woman. What is the reason? The verse says: "The woman and her children shall belong to her master."

hebrew_text: מִי שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ בֵּן מִכׇּל מָקוֹם פּוֹטֵר וְכוּ׳. ״מִכׇּל מָקוֹם״ לְאֵתוֹיֵי מַאי? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: לְאֵיתוֹיֵי מַמְזֵר. מַאי טַעְמָא — דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״וּבֵן אֵין לוֹ״ — עַיֵּין עָלָיו.
human_translation: anyone who has a son of any kind, exempts What is added Of any kind? Rav Yehuda said: It adds a mamzer . What is the reason As the verse states “And he has no [ ain lo ] child” investigate him.
llm_translation: One who has a son from any place is exempt, etc. "From any place" - to include what? Rav Yehudah said: to include a mamzer. What is the reason? - As the verse says: "But he has no son" - it is upon him.

hebrew_text: וְחַיָּיב עַל מַכָּתוֹ. אַמַּאי? קְרִי כָּאן: ״וְנָשִׂיא בְעַמְּךָ לֹא תָאוֹר״, בְּעוֹשֶׂה מַעֲשֵׂה עַמְּךָ!
human_translation: is liable if he strikes Why Read here “You shall not curse a ruler of your people” to one who acts according to the deeds of your people.
llm_translation: "And liable for his wound. Why? It is written here: 'And a prince among your people you shall not curse,' concerning one who acts as a leader among your people!"

hebrew_text: כִּדְאָמַר רַב פִּנְחָס מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב פָּפָּא: בְּעוֹשֶׂה תְּשׁוּבָה, הָכָא נָמֵי כְּשֶׁעָשָׂה תְּשׁוּבָה.
human_translation: As Rav Pineḥas said in the name of Rav Pappa one who performs repentance. Here too, one who performed repentance
llm_translation: As Rav Pinchas said in the name of Rav Papa: "Regarding one who repents, here too it is said as he repents."

hebrew_text: וְהַאי בַּר תְּשׁוּבָה הוּא? וְהָתְנַן: שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן מְנַסְיָא אוֹמֵר: אֵיזֶהוּ ״מְעֻוָּות לֹא יוּכַל לִתְקוֹן״ — זֶה הַבָּא עַל הָעֶרְוָה וְהוֹלִיד מִמֶּנָּה מַמְזֵר! הַשְׁתָּא מִיהָא עוֹשֶׂה מַעֲשֵׂה עַמְּךָ הוּא.
human_translation: Is he in fact able to repent Didn’t we learn Shimon ben Menasya says: Which is: “That which is crooked cannot be made straight” This one who engaged in intercourse with a relative forbidden and fathered a mamzer with her. At least now, he acts according to the deeds of your people.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates as follows: "And is this Bar Teshuvah? But we learned in a Mishnah: Shimon ben Menasya says: 'Who is "unable to rectify blemishes"? This refers to one who engages in forbidden relations and begets a mamzer from it!' Now, he is doing the deed of your people."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הַבָּא עַל אֲחוֹתוֹ, וְהִיא בַּת אֵשֶׁת אָבִיו — חַיָּיב מִשּׁוּם אֲחוֹתוֹ וּמִשּׁוּם בַּת אֵשֶׁת אָבִיו. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בֶּן יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב אֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם אֲחוֹתוֹ בִּלְבַד, וְלֹא מִפְּנֵי בַּת אֵשֶׁת אָבִיו.
human_translation: The Sages taught: He who engages in sexual relations with his sister, who is the daughter of his father’s wife, is liable because his sister because the daughter of his father’s wife, Rabbi Yosei ben Yehuda says: He is liable only because his sister alone, and not because the daughter of his father’s wife.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: One who engages in relations with his sister, who is the daughter of his father's wife, is liable both on account of his sister and on account of the daughter of his father's wife. Rabbi Yosei ben Yehuda says: He is only liable on account of his sister alone, and not on account of the daughter of his father's wife.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמַיְיהוּ דְּרַבָּנַן? אָמְרִי, מִכְּדֵי כְּתִיב: ״עֶרְוַת אֲחוֹתְךָ בַת אָבִיךָ אוֹ בַת אִמֶּךָ״, ״עֶרְוַת בַּת אֵשֶׁת אָבִיךָ מוֹלֶדֶת אָבִיךָ אֲחוֹתְךָ הִיא״ לְמָה לִי? שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ לְחַיְּיבוֹ מִשּׁוּם אֲחוֹתוֹ וּמִשּׁוּם בַּת אֵשֶׁת אָבִיו.
human_translation: What is the reason of Rabbis, They said: Since it is written “The nakedness of your sister, the daughter of your father, or the daughter of your mother why do I “The nakedness of your father’s wife’s daughter, begotten of your father, she is your sister Conclude from this to make him liable due to his sister and due to his father’s wife’s daughter.
llm_translation: What is the reason of the Rabbis? They say, from where is it written: "The nakedness of your sister, the daughter of your father, or the daughter of your mother," "The nakedness of the daughter of your father's wife, begotten of your father, she is your sister." Why do I need it? Learn from it that he is liable on account of his sister and on account of the daughter of his father's wife.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, אָמַר קְרָא: ״אֲחוֹתְךָ הִיא״. מִשּׁוּם אֲחוֹתוֹ אַתָּה מְחַיְּיבוֹ, וְאִי אַתָּה מְחַיְּיבוֹ מִשּׁוּם בַּת אֵשֶׁת אָבִיו.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, The verse states: “She is your sister,” you hold him liable due to his sister but you do not hold him liable due to his father’s wife’s daughter.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, said: The verse states, "She is your sister." Because of his sister, you are obligated to him, but if you do not obligate him because of his sister, you obligate him because of his father's wife's daughter.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן, הַאי ״אֲחוֹתְךָ הִיא״ מַאי עָבְדִי לֵיהּ? מִיבְּעֵי לְהוּ לְחַיְּיבוֹ עַל אֲחוֹתוֹ בַּת אָבִיו וּבַת אִמּוֹ, לוֹמַר שֶׁאֵין מַזְהִירִין מִן הַדִּין.
human_translation: And what do the Rabbis do with this “She is your sister”? They require it in order to hold him liable for his sister the daughter of his father and the daughter of his mother, to say that do not prohibition by way of a logical derivation,
llm_translation: The sages, this "she is your sister," what does it do to him? He wants to obligate him for his sister, the daughter of his father and the daughter of his mother, to say that they are not careful from the law.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה: אִם כֵּן, לִכְתּוֹב רַחֲמָנָא ״אֲחוֹתְךָ״, ״הִיא״ לְמָה לִי? מִשּׁוּם ״אֲחוֹתְךָ״ אַתָּה מְחַיְּיבוֹ, וְאִי אַתָּה מְחַיְּיבוֹ מִשּׁוּם ״בַּת אֵשֶׁת אָבִיו״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, If so, then the Merciful One should have written only: Your sister. Why do I “she is”? you hold him liable because his sister; you do not hold him liable because his father’s wife’s daughter.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei son of Rabbi Yehuda: If so, to write "your sister," "she" why do I need? Because of "your sister" you obligate him, and if you do not obligate him because of "his father's wife."

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן: אַף עַל גַּב דִּכְתִיב ״אֲחוֹתְךָ״, אִיצְטְרִיךְ לְמִכְתַּב ״הִיא״, שֶׁלֹּא תֹּאמַר בְּעָלְמָא מַזְהִירִין מִן הַדִּין,
human_translation: And the Rabbis Although “your sister” is written, it was necessary to write “she is” so that you not say generally prohibitions by way of a logical derivation,
llm_translation: The sages: Even though it is written "your sister," it was necessary to write "she" so that one does not say in the world they are more careful than the law.

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא: ״אֲחוֹתְךָ״ דִּכְתַב רַחֲמָנָא לְמָה לִי? מִילְּתָא דְּאָתְיָא בְּקַל וְחוֹמֶר, טָרַח וְכָתַב לַהּ קְרָא — כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״הִיא״.
human_translation: As, if you would say: Why do I “your sister” that the Merciful One writes a matter that be derived by a fortiori inference, the verse unnecessarily wrote it The Merciful One writes “she is”
llm_translation: And if you will say: "Your sister" that the Merciful One wrote, why do I need it? The matter that comes with a lenient and stringent inference, the Merciful One exerted and wrote in the verse - the Merciful One wrote "she."

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה: אִם כֵּן, לִיכְתְּבֵיהּ רַחֲמָנָא לַ״אֲחוֹתְךָ הִיא״ בְּאִידַּךְ קְרָא.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, If then let the Merciful One write: She is your sister, in the other verse,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei son of Rabbi Yehuda: If so, let the Merciful One write for you "she is your sister" in your hand, as the verse states.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, הַאי ״בַּת אֵשֶׁת אָבִיךָ״ מַאי עָבֵיד לֵיהּ? מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ: מִי שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ אִישׁוּת לְאָבִיךָ בָּהּ, פְּרָט לַאֲחוֹתוֹ מִשִּׁפְחָה וְגוֹיָה, שֶׁאֵין אִישׁוּת לְאָבִיךָ בָּהּ.
human_translation: And what does Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, do with this “The daughter of your father’s wife” He requires it someone with whom there is marital with your father, to exclude his sister from maidservant or a gentile woman, with whom your father cannot have marital
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, this "the daughter of your father's wife," what does he do with it? He answers: One who has a relationship with your father through her, excluding his sister from the same family and nation, as there is no relationship with your father through her.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא: פְּרָט לַאֲחוֹתוֹ מֵאֲנוּסָה? הַהִיא לָא מָצֵית אָמְרַתְּ מִדְּרָבָא,
human_translation: So say: excluding from his sister from a woman who had been raped. You cannot say that due to Rava.
llm_translation: And why not: to exclude his sister from being violated? That one did not find, she said, from Rava,

hebrew_text: דְּרָבָא רָמֵי, כְּתִיב: ״עֶרְוַת בַּת בִּנְךָ אוֹ בַת בִּתְּךָ לֹא תְגַלֶּה״, הָא בַּת בְּנָהּ דִּידַהּ וּבַת בִּתָּהּ דִּידַהּ שְׁרֵי, וּכְתִיב: ״עֶרְוַת אִשָּׁה וּבִתָּהּ לֹא תְגַלֵּה אֶת בַּת בְּנָהּ וְאֶת בַּת בִּתָּהּ״, הָא כֵּיצַד?
human_translation: As Rava raised a contradiction: it is written: “The nakedness of your son’s daughter, or of your daughter’s daughter, you shall not uncover” consequently, son’s daughter or her daughter’s daughter is permitted. And it is written “You shall not uncover the nakedness of a woman and her daughter; you shall not take her son’s daughter or her daughter’s daughter” How these
llm_translation: Rava raises a contradiction. It is written: "The nakedness of your son's daughter or your daughter's daughter, you shall not uncover." Now, the daughter of his son is permitted, and the daughter of his daughter is permitted. And it is written: "The nakedness of a woman and her daughter you shall not uncover; it is your son's daughter or your daughter's daughter's nakedness that you shall not uncover." How so?

hebrew_text: כָּאן בָּאוֹנָסִין, כָּאן בְּנִשּׂוּאִין.
human_translation: Here, raped, There, married,
llm_translation: Here come the ones who are compelled, here come the ones who are willing.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא: פְּרָט לְחַיָּיבֵי לָאוִין! אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: חַיָּיבֵי לָאוִין תָּפְשִׂי בְּהוּ קִדּוּשִׁין,
human_translation: And say exclude liable prohibitions Rav Pappa said: Betrothal comes into effect with liable prohibitions
llm_translation: And why? Exclude those liable for negative commandments! Rav Papa said: Those liable for negative commandments, you should take with them betrothals.

hebrew_text: דִּכְתִיב: ״כִּי תִהְיֶיןָ לְאִישׁ שְׁתֵּי נָשִׁים הָאַחַת אֲהוּבָה וְהָאַחַת שְׂנוּאָה״, וְכִי יֵשׁ אֲהוּבָה לִפְנֵי הַמָּקוֹם וְיֵשׁ שְׂנוּאָה לִפְנֵי הַמָּקוֹם? אֶלָּא: ״אֲהוּבָה״ — אֲהוּבָה בְּנִישּׂוּאֶיהָ, ״שְׂנוּאָה״ — שְׂנוּאָה בְּנִישּׂוּאֶיהָ, וְאָמַר רַחֲמָנָא: ״כִּי תִּהְיֶיןָ״.
human_translation: which it is written: “If a man has two wives, the one beloved, and the other hated” Is there one loved by the Omnipresent and one hated by the Omnipresent? Rather, “beloved” her marriage is beloved, “hated” her marriage is hated And the Merciful One states: “If has
llm_translation: Talmudic text: As it is written: "If a man has two wives, one loved and the other hated," is there then love before the Omnipresent and hatred before the Omnipresent? Rather, "loved" - loved in her marriage, "hated" - hated in her marriage. And the Merciful One said: "If a man has two wives." English translation:

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא: פְּרָט לְחַיָּיבֵי כָּרֵיתוֹת! אָמַר רָבָא, אָמַר קְרָא: ״עֶרְוַת אֲחוֹתְךָ בַת אָבִיךָ אוֹ בַת אִמֶּךָ מוֹלֶדֶת בַּיִת אוֹ מוֹלֶדֶת חוּץ״, בֵּין שֶׁאוֹמְרִים לוֹ לְאָבִיךָ קַיֵּים, בֵּין שֶׁאוֹמְרִים לוֹ לְאָבִיךָ הוֹצֵא, וְאָמַר רַחֲמָנָא: ״אֲחוֹתְךָ הִיא״.
human_translation: Say exclude liable karet , Rava said the verse states: “The nakedness of your sister, the daughter of your father, or the daughter of your mother, whether born at home or born outside” whether for whom tell your father: Maintain whether tell your father Send her out And the Merciful One states “She is your sister.”
llm_translation: And why? Exclude those liable for karet! Rava said, Scripture says: "The nakedness of your sister, the daughter of your father, or the daughter of your mother, born at home or born outside," whether they say to him, "Your father," it is fulfilled, or whether they say to him, "Your father," he is exempt. And the Merciful One said: "She is your sister."

hebrew_text: אֵימָא: בֵּין שֶׁאוֹמֵר לוֹ אָבִיךָ קַיֵּים, בֵּין שֶׁאוֹמֵר לוֹ אָבִיךָ הוֹצֵא, וְאָמַר רַחֲמָנָא: ״אֲחוֹתְךָ הִיא״, לְרַבּוֹת אֲחוֹתוֹ מִשִּׁפְחָה וְגוֹיָה! אָמַר קְרָא: ״בַּת אֵשֶׁת אָבִיךָ״ — מִי שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ אִישׁוּת לְאָבִיךָ בָּהּ, פְּרָט לַאֲחוֹתוֹ מִשִּׁפְחָה וְגוֹיָה.
human_translation: Say that whether say father: Maintain or whether say Send her out, and the Merciful One states “she is your sister,” to include his sister from maidservant or a gentile woman. The verse states: “The daughter of your father’s wife,” whoever can enter a marriage bond with your father. excludes his sister from maidservant or gentile woman,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Eima: Bein she'omer lo avicha kayem, bein she'omer lo avicha hotzei, ve'amar rachamana: 'Achotcha hi,' lerabot achoto mishpacha vegoyah! Amar kra: 'Bat eishet avicha' — mi sheyesh lo ishut le'avicha bah, perat la'achoto mishpacha vegoyah." English translation: "Say: Whether he says to him 'Your father is valid,' or whether he says to him 'Your father is a stranger,' and the Merciful One said: 'She is your sister,' to include his sister from the same family and nation! The verse states: 'The daughter of your father's wife' — one who has a relationship to your father through her, excluding his sister from the same family and nation."

hebrew_text: וּמָה רָאִיתָ? מִסְתַּבְּרָא חַיָּיבֵי כָּרֵיתוֹת הֲוָה לֵיהּ לְרַבּוֹת, שֶׁכֵּן תָּפְסִי בָּהֶן קִדּוּשִׁין לְעָלְמָא.
human_translation: what did you see It stands to reason liable karet should be included, since in general betrothal can come into effect with them.
llm_translation: And what did you see? The ones liable for excision were included to extend, for thus you have grasped in them sanctifications for eternity.

hebrew_text: אַדְּרַבָּה: שִׁפְחָה וְגוֹיָה הֲוָה לֵיהּ לְרַבּוֹת, דְּאִי מִגַּיְּירָה לְדִידֵיהּ נָמֵי, תָּפְסִי בַּהּ קִדּוּשִׁין! לְכִי מִגַּיְּירָה — גּוּפָא אַחֲרִינָא הִיא.
human_translation: On the contrary, it should include maidservant or a gentile woman, as, if she converts, betrothal can come into effect with himself. When she converts, she is a different body,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Ad'rabbah: shifchah v'goyah hava lei l'rabbot, d'ei miggayirah l'didei namei, tafsi bah kiddushin! L'chi miggayirah — gupha acharina hi. English translation: Ad'rabbah: If a maidservant or a gentile woman was to him to include, for if she converts for his sake also, he acquires her for marriage! But if she converts — she is considered as a different body.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן, לְמַעוֹטֵי שִׁפְחָה וְגוֹיָה מְנָא לְהוּ? נָפְקָא לְהוּ מֵ״הָאִשָּׁה וִילָדֶיהָ תִּהְיֶה לַאדוֹנֶיהָ״.
human_translation: And the Rabbis, from where do they to exclude maidservant or gentile woman? They derive it “The wife and her children shall be her master’s”
llm_translation: The sages, to exclude a maidservant and a non-Jewish maidservant, how do they derive it? It is derived for them from "the woman and her children shall belong to her master."

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה? חַד בְּשִׁפְחָה, וְחַד בְּגוֹיָה. וּצְרִיכִי, דְּאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן שִׁפְחָה: מִשּׁוּם דְּאֵין לָהּ חַיִיס, אֲבָל גּוֹיָה דְּאִית לַהּ חַיִיס — אֵימָא לָא.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, One maidservant, and one a gentile woman. And are necessary, as, if taught us maidservant, because she does not have a pedigree, but a gentile woman who does have a pedigree, say no.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda? One with a maidservant, and one with a non-Jewish woman. And it is necessary, for if we were to hear maidservant: because she does not have a dowry, but a non-Jewish woman who has a dowry — I might say no.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן גּוֹיָה — מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא שָׁיְיכָא בְּמִצְוֹת. אֲבָל שִׁפְחָה, דְּשָׁיְיכָא בְּמִצְוֹת — אֵימָא לָא, צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: if it would teach us a gentile woman, because she does not have any connection with the mitzvot But maidservant connection with the mitzvot, say no, is necessary.
llm_translation: And if we were to hear that a Gentile - because it is not relevant to the observance of commandments. But a maidservant, who is relevant to the observance of commandments - I might say no, it is necessary.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן, אַשְׁכְּחַן שִׁפְחָה, גּוֹיָה מְנָא לְהוּ? וְכִי תֵּימָא: נֵילַף מִשִּׁפְחָה — הָנְהוּ מִצְרָךְ צְרִיכִי!
human_translation: And the Rabbis, we found maidservant from where a gentile woman And if you say: Let us derive from maidservant, these are necessary,
llm_translation: The sages, they found a maidservant, a non-Jewess, what is their ruling regarding her? And if you say: Let her be separated from the maidservant - these are necessary for your needs!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַי, אָמַר קְרָא: ״כִּי יָסִיר אֶת בִּנְךָ מֵאַחֲרַי״, בִּנְךָ מִיִּשְׂרְאֵלִית קָרוּי בִּנְךָ, וְאֵין בִּנְךָ הַבָּא מִן הַגּוֹיָה קָרוּי בִּנְךָ, אֶלָּא בְּנָהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai: verse states: for he will turn away your son from following Me” your son from a Jewish woman is called your son, but your son from a gentile woman is not called your son, but her son.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai, the verse says: "When he takes your son away from following Me," your son refers to an Israelite, and your son who comes from a non-Jewish woman is not called your son, but rather her son.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבִינָא, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: בֶּן בִּתְּךָ הַבָּא מִן הַגּוֹי קָרוּי בִּנְךָ. לֵימָא קָסָבַר רָבִינָא גּוֹי וְעֶבֶד הַבָּא עַל בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל הַוָּלָד כָּשֵׁר? נְהִי דְּמַמְזֵר לָא הָוֵי — כָּשֵׁר נָמֵי לָא הָוֵי, יִשְׂרָאֵל פָּסוּל מִיקְּרֵי.
human_translation: Ravina said: Conclude from here the son of your daughter by a gentile is called your son, Shall we say that Ravina holds that a gentile or slave engaged in intercourse with a Jewish woman, the offspring is unflawed granted, she is not a mamzer , she is still not unflawed she is called a Jew who is unfit
llm_translation: Ravina said, hear from it: the son of your daughter who comes from a gentile is called your son. Let us say, does Ravina hold that a gentile or a slave who comes upon a Jewish woman and the child born is valid? Certainly, a mamzer is not valid - but a true Israelite is not valid, he is called disqualified.

hebrew_text: הַאי בְּשִׁבְעָה גּוֹיִם כְּתִיב? ״כִּי יָסִיר״ — לְרַבּוֹת כׇּל הַמְּסִירִים.
human_translation: this written in the seven nations “He will turn away” comes to include all those who would turn away
llm_translation: This is written in seven nations? "When he removes" - to include all who remove.

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, דְּדָרֵישׁ טַעְמָא דִּקְרָא, אֶלָּא לְרַבָּנַן מְנָא לְהוּ? מַאן תַּנָּא דִּפְלִיג עֲלֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה — רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן הִיא.
human_translation: This works out well for Rabbi Shimon, who interprets the rationale in the verse However, according to the the Rabbis, from where this Who is the tanna who disagrees with Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda? It is Rabbi Shimon,
llm_translation: The Gemara left it for Rabbi Shimon, who expounds the reason of the verse, but for the Rabbis, what is their reasoning? Who is the Tanna who disputes with Rabbi Yosei, the son of Rabbi Yehuda? It is Rabbi Shimon.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מִי שֶׁקִּידֵּשׁ אַחַת מִשְׁתֵּי אֲחָיוֹת, וְאֵין יוֹדֵעַ אֵי זֹה מֵהֶן קִידֵּשׁ — נוֹתֵן גֵּט לָזוֹ וְגֵט לָזוֹ. מֵת וְלוֹ אָח אֶחָד — חוֹלֵץ לִשְׁתֵּיהֶן.
human_translation: one who betrothed one of two sisters and does not know which of them he betrothed, gives a bill of divorce to this one and a bill of divorce to that one died and he had one brother, performs ḥalitza with both of them,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who betroths one of two sisters, and does not know which one he betrothed - he gives a bill of divorce to this one and a bill of divorce to that one. If he dies and he has one brother - he performs the rite of levirate marriage with both of them.

hebrew_text: הָיוּ לוֹ שְׁנַיִם — אֶחָד חוֹלֵץ וְאֶחָד מְיַיבֵּם. קָדְמוּ וְכָנְסוּ — אֵין מוֹצִיאִין מִיָּדָם.
human_translation: had two one performs ḥalitza And one takes in levirate marriage married before remove them
llm_translation: If he had two - one performs chalitzah and one performs yibum. They came forward and entered - we do not remove from their hands.

hebrew_text: שְׁנַיִם שֶׁקִּדְּשׁוּ שְׁתֵּי אֲחָיוֹת, זֶה אֵינוֹ יוֹדֵעַ אֵי זוֹ קִידֵּשׁ, וְזֶה אֵינוֹ יוֹדֵעַ אֵיזוֹ קִידֵּשׁ — זֶה נוֹתֵן שְׁנֵי גִיטִּין, וְזֶה נוֹתֵן שְׁנֵי גִיטִּין. מֵתוּ, לָזֶה אָח וְלָזֶה אָח — זֶה חוֹלֵץ לִשְׁתֵּיהֶן, וְזֶה חוֹלֵץ לִשְׁתֵּיהֶן.
human_translation: two who betrothed two sisters: this one does not know which he betrothed and that one does not know which he betrothed, this one gives two bills of divorce, and that one gives two bills of divorce. died this one had a brother and that one had a brother, this performs ḥalitza with both of them, and that performs ḥalitza with both of them.
llm_translation: Two who consecrated two sisters, this one does not know which one he consecrated, and this one does not know which one he consecrated - this one gives two bills of divorce, and this one gives two bills of divorce. If they die, one brother for this one and one brother for this one - this one performs chalitzah for both, and this one performs chalitzah for both.

hebrew_text: לָזֶה אֶחָד וְלָזֶה שְׁנַיִם — הַיָּחִיד חוֹלֵץ לִשְׁתֵּיהֶן, וְהַשְּׁנַיִם — אֶחָד חוֹלֵץ, וְאֶחָד מְיַיבֵּם. קָדְמוּ וְכָנְסוּ, אֵין מוֹצִיאִין מִיָּדָם. לָזֶה שְׁנַיִם וְלָזֶה שְׁנַיִם — אָחִיו שֶׁל זֶה חוֹלֵץ לְאַחַת, וְאָחִיו שֶׁל זֶה חוֹלֵץ לְאַחַת. אָחִיו שֶׁל זֶה מְיַיבֵּם חֲלוּצָתוֹ שֶׁל זֶה, וְאָחִיו שֶׁל זֶה מְיַיבֵּם חֲלוּצָתוֹ שֶׁל זֶה.
human_translation: this one had one and that one had two the single performs ḥalitza with both of them, and the two one performs ḥalitza and one performs levirate marriage they married before does not remove them this one had two and that one had two the brother of this one performs ḥalitza with one and the brother of that one performs ḥalitza with one The brother of this may take the woman who performed ḥalitza [ ḥalutza ] of that in levirate marriage, and the brother of that may take the ḥalutza of that in levirate marriage.
llm_translation: One for this and two for that - the individual performs chalitzah for both of them, and the two - one performs chalitzah, and one performs yibum. If they came forward and entered, we do not remove them immediately. Two for this and two for that - the brother of this one performs chalitzah for one, and the brother of that one performs chalitzah for one. The brother of this one performs yibum for the chalitzah of that one, and the brother of that one performs yibum for the chalitzah of this one.

hebrew_text: קָדְמוּ שְׁנַיִם וְחָלְצוּ — לֹא יְיַבְּמוּ הַשְּׁנַיִם, אֶלָּא אֶחָד חוֹלֵץ וְאֶחָד מְיַיבֵּם. קָדְמוּ וְכָנְסוּ — אֵין מוֹצִיאִין מִיָּדָם.
human_translation: performed ḥalitza before the may not take in levirate marriage Rather, one performs ḥalitza and one performs levirate marriage they married before does not remove them
llm_translation: They both approached and withdrew - the two shall not perform levirate marriage, rather one performs chalitzah and one performs yibum. They both approached and entered - they do not remove the shoe from their hand.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: קִדּוּשִׁין שֶׁאֵין מְסוּרִין לְבִיאָה — הָווּ קִדּוּשִׁין!
human_translation: Learn from here betrothals that cannot lead to consummation are nevertheless betrothals.
llm_translation: The text reads: "Gemara, hear from it: Kiddushin that are not designated for marital relations - they are Kiddushin!"

hebrew_text: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן — כְּשֶׁהוּכְּרוּ וּלְבַסּוֹף נִתְעָרְבוּ. דַּיְקָא נָמֵי, דְּקָתָנֵי: ״וְאֵינוֹ יוֹדֵעַ״, וְלָא קָתָנֵי: ״וְאֵינוֹ יָדוּעַ״. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: With what are we dealing here? when were recognized But later were mixed up is also precise, as it teaches: And he does not know but it does not teach: It is unknown Conclude from
llm_translation: Here we are dealing with what? - When they were familiar and in the end they mixed. Specifically it is stated, as it is taught: "And he does not know," and it does not state: "And it is not known." Learn from it.

hebrew_text: מַאי קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן? סֵיפָא אִיצְטְרִיכָא לֵיהּ: מֵת וְלוֹ אָח אֶחָד — חוֹלֵץ לִשְׁתֵּיהֶן, הָיוּ לוֹ שְׁנַיִם — אֶחָד חוֹלֵץ וְאֶחָד מְיַיבֵּם. דַּוְקָא מִיחְלָץ וַהֲדַר יַבּוֹמֵי, אֲבָל יַבּוֹמֵי בְּרֵישָׁא — לָא, דְּקָא פָּגַע בַּאֲחוֹת זְקוּקָתוֹ.
human_translation: what is teaching us It was necessary the last clause he died and he had one brother, performs ḥalitza with both of them; he had two one performs ḥalitza and one enters into levirate marriage Specifically, ḥalitza and only subsequently levirate marriage. But may not enter levirate marriage first, as he encounter the sister of a woman with whom he has a levirate bond.
llm_translation: What is it teaching us? The conclusion is necessary for it: If a man dies leaving one brother — he performs chalitzah with both of them; if he had two brothers — one performs chalitzah and one performs yibum. Specifically, he first performs chalitzah and then performs yibum, but initially performing yibum — no, because he has encountered his levirate sister.

hebrew_text: שְׁנַיִם שֶׁקִּדְּשׁוּ שְׁתֵּי אֲחָיוֹת וְכוּ׳. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: קִדּוּשִׁין שֶׁאֵין מְסוּרִין לְבִיאָה — הָווּ קִדּוּשִׁין! הָכָא נָמֵי, כְּשֶׁהוּכְּרוּ וּלְבַסּוֹף נִתְעָרְבוּ. דַּיְקָא נָמֵי, דְּקָתָנֵי: ״וְאֵין יוֹדֵעַ״, וְלָא קָתָנֵי ״וְאֵין יָדוּעַ״. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: two who betrothed two sisters: Learn from here betrothals that cannot lead to consummation are betrothals. Here too, where they were recognized and later mixed up. is also precise, as it teaches: And he does not know, and it does not teach: It is unknown. conclude this from here
llm_translation: Two who consecrated two sisters, etc. Hear from it: consecrations that are not designated for cohabitation - they are valid consecrations! Here, they were known and ultimately became mixed up. Specifically, it was taught: "And he does not know," and it did not teach "And it is not known." Hear from it.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן? סֵיפָא אִיצְטְרִיכָא לֵיהּ: מֵתוּ, לָזֶה אֶחָד וְלָזֶה שְׁנַיִם — הַיָּחִיד חוֹלֵץ לִשְׁתֵּיהֶן, וְהַשְּׁנַיִם — אֶחָד חוֹלֵץ וְאֶחָד מְיַיבֵּם.
human_translation: what does it come to teach us It was necessary the last clause, they died this one had one and this one had two, the single performs ḥalitza with both of them. And the two, one performs ḥalitza and one enters levirate marriage
llm_translation: And what does it teach us? The latter part is necessary: If they died, whether one or two - the individual performs chalitzah for both of them, and the two - one performs chalitzah and one performs levirate marriage.

hebrew_text: פְּשִׁיטָא, הַיְינוּ רֵישָׁא! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: לִיגְזוֹר תְּרֵי אַטּוּ חַד, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: That is obvious, this is the first clause lest you say issue a decree two due to one This comes to teach us
llm_translation: The straightforward conclusion, that is the beginning! What might you say: to cut two and leave one, this is implied to us.

hebrew_text: וְדַוְקָא מִיחְלָץ וַהֲדַר יַבּוֹמֵי, אֲבָל יַבּוֹמֵי בְּרֵישָׁא — לָא, דְּקָא פָּגַע בִּיבָמָה לַשּׁוּק.
human_translation: And this is specifically if performs ḥalitza and subsequently consummates the levirate marriage, but if he consummated the levirate marriage first, then no, be encountering a yevama to public.
llm_translation: And specifically, he performs chalitzah and then the yavam, but the yavam initially - no, for he encountered the yevamah in the marketplace.

hebrew_text: לָזֶה שְׁנַיִם וְלָזֶה שְׁנַיִם וְכוּ׳. הָא תּוּ לְמָה לִי? הַיְינוּ הָךְ! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: לִיגְזוֹר דִּלְמָא מְיַיבֵּם בְּלֹא חֲלִיצָה, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: this one had two and that one had two Why do I need this as well? This is identical that lest you say: Let issue a decree lest he consummate the levirate marriage without performing ḥalitza This comes to teach us
llm_translation: "To this one two and to this one two and so on. This, what do I need it for? That is it! What might you say: to decree lest one perform yibum without chalitzah, it teaches us."

hebrew_text: מַאי שְׁנָא מֵהָא דִּתְנַן: אַרְבָּעָה אַחִין, שְׁנַיִם מֵהֶן נְשׂוּאִין שְׁתֵּי אֲחָיוֹת, וּמֵתוּ הַנְּשׂוּאִין אֶת הָאֲחָיוֹת — הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ חוֹלְצוֹת וְלֹא מִתְיַיבְּמוֹת?
human_translation: what is different from that which we learned four brothers, two of them were married to two sisters, and those married to the sisters died, then those perform ḥalitza but may not enter into levirate marriage
llm_translation: What is different from what we learned: Four brothers, two of them married two sisters, and the married ones died without children - are these not exempt from levirate marriage?

hebrew_text: הָכִי הַשְׁתָּא?!
human_translation: How can be compared?
llm_translation: So now, what is this?!

hebrew_text: הָתָם, אִי לְמַאן דְּאָמַר יֵשׁ זִיקָה — יֵשׁ זִיקָה, וְאִי לְמַאן דְּאָמַר אָסוּר לְבַטֵּל מִצְוַת יְבָמִין — אָסוּר לְבַטֵּל מִצְוַת יְבָמִין. הָכָא — כׇּל חַד וְחַד אֵימוֹר דִּידֵיהּ קָא מִתְרַמְיָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: There, if according to the one who said bond is substantial, there is a bond And if according to the one who said that it is prohibited to nullify the levirate mitzva it is prohibited to nullify the levirate mitzva here, each one say that encountered his own
llm_translation: There, if according to the one who says there is a claim - there is a claim, and if according to the one who says it is forbidden to annul the obligation of levirate marriage - it is forbidden to annul the obligation of levirate marriage. Here - each and every statement, he is trying to support his own view.

hebrew_text: קָדְמוּ וְכָנְסוּ אֵין מוֹצִיאִין כּוּ׳. תָּנֵי שֵׁילָא: וַאֲפִילּוּ שְׁנֵיהֶם כֹּהֲנִים. מַאי טַעְמָא — חֲלוּצָה דְּרַבָּנַן הִיא, וְסָפֵק חֲלוּצָה לָא גְּזַרוּ בְּהוּ רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: they married before court does not remove them Sheila teaches And even both of priests. What is the reason A ḥalutza is rabbinic law And uncertainty ḥalutza , the Sages did not issue a decree.
llm_translation: They preceded and entered, they do not fulfill. It was taught in the name of Sheilah: Even if both of them are priests. What is the reason? — It is a Rabbinic enactment of removing the shoe, and the Rabbis did not decree in a case of doubtful removal of the shoe.

hebrew_text: וַחֲלוּצָה דְּרַבָּנַן הִיא? וְהָתַנְיָא: ״גְּרוּשָׁה״, אֵין לִי אֶלָּא גְּרוּשָׁה, חֲלוּצָה מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְאִשָּׁה״! מִדְּרַבָּנַן הוּא, וּקְרָא אַסְמַכְתָּא בְּעָלְמָא הוּא.
human_translation: And is ḥalutza by rabbinic ? But isn’t it taught divorced I have only a divorcée; from where a ḥalutza ? The verse states: a woman.” This is by rabbinic and the verse is a mere support.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And is it the halitzah of the Rabbis? And it was taught: 'divorced woman,' I have only 'divorced woman,' from where is halitzah? The Talmud teaches: 'and a woman'! It is from the Rabbis, and the verse is merely a support."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מִצְוָה בַּגָּדוֹל לְיַיבֵּם, וְאִם קָדַם הַקָּטָן — זָכָה.
human_translation: It is a mitzva for the eldest to consummate the levirate marriage, But if the younger first, he acquires
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: The commandment is incumbent upon the elder to perform levirate marriage, and if the younger brother preceded him — he has acquired the right.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״וְהָיָה הַבְּכוֹר״ — מִיכָּן שֶׁמִּצְוָה בַּגָּדוֹל לְיַיבֵּם. ״אֲשֶׁר תֵּלֵד״ — פְּרָט לְאַיְלוֹנִית, שֶׁאֵין יוֹלֶדֶת. ״יָקוּם עַל שֵׁם אָחִיו״ — לְנַחֲלָה.
human_translation: The Sages taught “And it shall be that the firstborn From here that the mitzva to consummate the levirate marriage is upon the eldest. “That she bears,” to exclude an aylonit , who cannot bear children. “Shall be established in the name of his dead brother,” to inheritance,
llm_translation: The sages taught: "And the firstborn" - from here it is a mitzvah for the older brother to perform yibum. "Whom she will bear" - this excludes a woman who cannot bear children. "That his name may not be blotted out" - for inheritance.

hebrew_text: אַתָּה אוֹמֵר לְנַחֲלָה, אוֹ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא לְשֵׁם: יוֹסֵף — קוֹרִין אוֹתוֹ יוֹסֵף, יוֹחָנָן — קוֹרִין אוֹתוֹ יוֹחָנָן. נֶאֱמַר כָּאן ״יָקוּם עַל שֵׁם אָחִיו״, וְנֶאֱמַר לְהַלָּן: ״עַל שֵׁם אֲחֵיהֶם יִקָּרְאוּ בְּנַחֲלָתָם״, מָה שֵׁם הָאָמוּר לְהַלָּן — נַחֲלָה, אַף שֵׁם הָאָמוּר כָּאן — לְנַחֲלָה.
human_translation: you say for inheritance, or it is only to his name? Yosef, they call Yosef, Yoḥanan, they call him Yoḥanan. It is stated here: “He shall succeed in the name of his brother,” and it is stated there: “They shall be called after the name of their brothers in their inheritance” Just as “name” stated there inheritance, so too, “name” stated here to inheritance.
llm_translation: You say for inheritance, or it is only for name: Yosef - they read him Yosef, Yochanan - they read him Yochanan. It is stated here "he shall rise in place of his brother," and it is stated there: "they shall be called by the name of their brothers in their inheritance," just as the name mentioned there is inheritance, so too the name mentioned here is for inheritance.

hebrew_text: ״וְלֹא יִמָּחֶה שְׁמוֹ״ — פְּרָט לְסָרִיס שֶׁשְּׁמוֹ מָחוּי.
human_translation: “And his name will not be blotted out excludes a eunuch, as his name is blotted out,
llm_translation: "And his name shall not be blotted out" - this excludes a eunuch whose name is blotted out.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: אַף עַל גַּב דִּבְכׇל הַתּוֹרָה כּוּלָּהּ אֵין מִקְרָא יוֹצֵא מִידֵי פְשׁוּטוֹ — הָכָא אֲתַאי גְּזֵרָה שָׁוָה אַפֵּיקְתֵּיהּ מִפְּשָׁטֵיהּ לִגְמָרֵי.
human_translation: Rava said: Even though in the entire Torah a verse does not depart from its literal meaning, here the verbal analogy comes to remove from its literal meaning altogether.
llm_translation: Rava said: Even though throughout the entire Torah, no verse departs from its simple meaning, here a similar decree comes and diverts it completely from its simplicity.

hebrew_text: וְאִי לָאו גְּזֵרָה שָׁוָה, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא ״שֵׁם״ — שֵׁם מַמָּשׁ? לְמַאן קָמַזְהַר רַחֲמָנָא? לְיָבָם — ״יָקוּם עַל שֵׁם אָחִיךָ״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ! אִי לְבֵי דִינָא — ״יָקוּם עַל שֵׁם אֲחִי אָבִיו״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ!
human_translation: Were it not for the verbal analogy, would I have said “name” is the actual name? Whom is the Merciful One instructing to the yavam , He should have Shall succeed in the name of your dead brother. And if the court it should have Shall succeed in the name of his father’s brother.
llm_translation: If it is not a decree, is it similar? I would say "name" — an actual name? For whom did the Merciful One warn? For the levir — "he shall establish a name for his brother." If for the court — "he shall establish a name for his father's brother" is required!

hebrew_text: וְדִלְמָא הָכִי קָאָמַר לְהוּ רַחֲמָנָא לְבֵית דִּין: אֱמַרוּ לֵיהּ לְיָבָם ״יָקוּם עַל שֵׁם אָחִיו״. אֶלָּא אֲתַאי גְּזֵרָה שָׁוָה אַפֵּיקְתֵּיהּ לִגְמָרֵי.
human_translation: And perhaps this is what the Merciful One is saying to court: Say to the yavam shall be established in the name of his brother. Rather, the verbal analogy comes to remove it altogether.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: Perhaps this is what the Merciful One meant to say to the court: They said to him, to the yavam, "He shall establish the name of his brother." Rather, a similar decree came and completely removed it.

hebrew_text: הַשְׁתָּא דְּאָמְרַתְּ קְרָא בְּגָדוֹל כְּתִיב, אֵימָא: בְּכוֹר — לְיַיבֵּם, פָּשׁוּט — לָא לְיַיבֵּם!
human_translation: Now that you say that the verse: is written the eldest say the firstborn consummates the levirate marriage an ordinary may not consummate the levirate marriage,
llm_translation: The question that you asked: "The verse is written with 'big,' I say: 'Firstborn' — for yibum, 'plain' — not for yibum!"

hebrew_text: אִם כֵּן, אֵשֶׁת אָחִיו שֶׁלֹּא הָיָה בְּעוֹלָמוֹ דְּמִיעֵט רַחֲמָנָא — לְמָה לִי?
human_translation: If so a wife of a brother with whom he did not coexist, the Merciful One excluded why do I
llm_translation: If so, the wife of his brother who did not exist in his world, why do I need her?

hebrew_text: פָּרֵיךְ רַב אַחָא: וְאֵימָא לְמַעוֹטֵי בּוּכְרָא דְאִמָּא! הָהוּא לָא מָצֵית אָמְרַתְּ — דְּיִבּוּם בְּנַחֲלָה תְּלָה רַחֲמָנָא, וְנַחֲלָה מִן הָאָב וְלֹא מִן הָאֵם.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa refutes But say that to exclude the firstborn of the mother, You cannot say that, as the Merciful One made levirate marriage dependent upon inheritance, and inheritance from the father and not from the mother.
llm_translation: Rav Acha posed a question: And why not say it is to exclude the firstborn of a paternal uncle! That one you did not find mentioned. — That levirate marriage is dependent on inheritance, the Merciful One has stated, and inheritance is from the father and not from the mother.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא: כִּי אִיכָּא בְּכוֹר תִּתְקַיֵּים מִצְוַת יִבּוּם, כִּי לֵיכָּא בְּכוֹר לֹא תִּתְקַיֵּים מִצְוַת יִבּוּם! אָמַר קְרָא: ״וּמֵת אַחַד מֵהֶם״, מִי לָא עָסְקִינַן דְּמִית בְּכוֹר, וְאָמַר רַחֲמָנָא: לְיַיבֵּם קָטָן.
human_translation: Then say when there is a firstborn the mitzva of levirate marriage can be fulfilled but that when there is no firstborn, the mitzva of levirate marriage may not be fulfilled The verse states: “And one of them dies” Are we not dealing with where the firstborn died, and the Merciful One states the younger should consummate the levirate marriage?
llm_translation: And why? If there is a firstborn, the mitzvah of yibum is fulfilled, for if there is no firstborn, the mitzvah of yibum is not fulfilled! The verse says, "And one of them dies," are we not dealing with a firstborn? And the Merciful One says: Let a minor perform yibum.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא דְּמִית קָטָן, וְאָמַר רַחֲמָנָא לְיַיבֵּם בְּכוֹר? הָא מִיעֵט רַחֲמָנָא אֵשֶׁת אָחִיו שֶׁלֹּא הָיָה בְּעוֹלָמוֹ.
human_translation: Say that the younger died, and the Merciful One states that the firstborn must consummate the levirate marriage. Didn’t the Merciful One exclude the wife of a brother with whom he did not coexist,
llm_translation: And why did the Merciful One say to perform yibum with a minor who died? This is to limit the Merciful One's decree to the wife of his brother who was not in his world.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא: כִּי לֵיכָּא בְּכוֹר, קְדַם קָטָן — זְכָה. וְאִי אִיכָּא בְּכוֹר, קְדַם קָטָן — לָא זְכָה! אָמַר קְרָא: ״כִּי יֵשְׁבוּ אַחִים יַחְדָּו״ — הוּקְּשָׁה יְשִׁיבַת אַחִים זֶה לָזֶה.
human_translation: Say when there is no firstborn a younger went ahead he acquires But if there is a firstborn, the younger went ahead he does not acquire The verse states: “If brothers dwell together” the brothers’ dwellings were equated one with the other,
llm_translation: And why? If there is a firstborn, the younger one precedes - he merits. And if there is no firstborn, the younger one precedes - he does not merit! The verse says: "When brothers dwell together" - the dwelling of brothers is difficult for one another.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא: כִּי אִיכָּא בְּכוֹר — לֶיהְדַּר אַגָּדוֹל. כִּי לֵיכָּא בְּכוֹר — אֵין חוֹזְרִין אֵצֶל גָּדוֹל! אַלְּמָה תָּנֵי אַבָּיֵי קַשִּׁישָׁא: מִצְוָה בַּגָּדוֹל לְיַיבֵּם, לֹא רָצָה — הוֹלְכִים אֵצֶל אָחִיו הַקָּטָן, לֹא רָצָה — חוֹזְרִין אֵצֶל גָּדוֹל!
human_translation: Then say: When there is a firstborn, let return to the eldest when there is no firstborn, does not return to the eldest, Why did Abaye the Elder teach: It is a mitzva for the eldest to consummate the levirate marriage? If did not wish goes to his younger brother. he did not wish returns to the eldest.
llm_translation: And why? If there is a firstborn — he should be honored. If there is no firstborn — we do not return to the elder! Why did Abaye teach an old adage: A mitzvah with the elder to perform levirate marriage, if he does not want — they go to his younger brother, if he does not want — they return to the elder!

hebrew_text: כִּבְכוֹר: מָה בְּכוֹר — בְּכוֹרָתוֹ גָּרְמָה לוֹ, אַף גָּדוֹל — גְּדוּלָּתוֹ גָּרְמָה לוֹ.
human_translation: just as his status as firstborn causes him so too, the eldest, his status as eldest causes him
llm_translation: Firstborn: What is "firstborn" - his firstborn status caused it for him, so too "great" - his greatness caused it for him.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא: כִּי מְיַיבֵּם בְּכוֹר — לִישְׁקוֹל נַחֲלָה, כִּי מְיַיבֵּם פָּשׁוּט — לָא לִישְׁקוֹל נַחֲלָה. אָמַר קְרָא: ״יָקוּם עַל שֵׁם אָחִיו״, וַהֲרֵי קָם.
human_translation: Then say if the firstborn consummates the levirate marriage he receives inheritance, if an ordinary brother consummates the levirate marriage he does not receive the inheritance. the verse states: shall be established in the name of his brother” and established
llm_translation: And why? When he redeems the firstborn — to take the inheritance, when he redeems outright — not to take the inheritance. The verse says: "Let his name be called in Israel after his brother," and so it was done.

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא ״בְּכוֹר״ דְּקַרְיֵיהּ רַחֲמָנָא,
human_translation: But the Merciful One call firstborn?
llm_translation: And rather "bekhor" that the Merciful One calls it,

hebrew_text: לְמַאי הִלְכְתָא? לִגְרִיעוּתָא: מָה בְּכוֹר אֵינוֹ נוֹטֵל בָּרָאוּי כִּבְמוּחְזָק — אַף הַאי אֵינוֹ נוֹטֵל בָּרָאוּי כִּבְמוּחְזָק.
human_translation: With regard to what halakha This is in order to limit Just as a firstborn does not take due as possessed, so too, this does not take due as possessed.
llm_translation: Regarding what halakha? For exclusion: Just as the firstborn does not take in what is prepared like in what is strengthened - so too this one does not take in what is prepared like in what is strengthened.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַנִּטְעָן עַל הַשִּׁפְחָה וְנִשְׁתַּחְרְרָה, אוֹ עַל הַגּוֹיָה וְנִתְגַּיְּירָה — הֲרֵי זֶה לֹא יִכְנוֹס. וְאִם כָּנַס — אֵין מוֹצִיאִין מִיָּדוֹ. הַנִּטְעָן עַל אֵשֶׁת אִישׁ וְהוֹצִיאוּהָ מִתַּחַת יָדוֹ, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁכָּנַס — יוֹצִיא.
human_translation: One suspected with a maidservant and she was set free, or with a gentile woman and she converted, may not marry But if he did marry her, they, do not remove from him, one who is suspected of a married woman and they, removed her from even if married he must divorce
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who marries a maidservant and she is freed, or marries a gentile woman and she converts - he may not bring her into his home. And if he did bring her in, they do not remove her from his possession. If one marries a married woman and then divorces her, even though he brought her in, he must divorce her.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ הָא גִּיּוֹרֶת מִיהָא הָוְיָא. וּרְמִינְהִי: אֶחָד אִישׁ שֶׁנִּתְגַּיֵּיר לְשׁוּם אִשָּׁה, וְאֶחָד אִשָּׁה שֶׁנִּתְגַּיְּירָה לְשׁוּם אִישׁ, וְכֵן מִי שֶׁנִּתְגַּיֵּיר לְשׁוּם שׁוּלְחַן מְלָכִים, לְשׁוּם עַבְדֵי שְׁלֹמֹה — אֵינָן גֵּרִים, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה.
human_translation: This she is, however, a convert, raises a contradiction Both a man who converted for the sake of a woman and a woman who converted for the sake of a man, and similarly, one who converted for the sake of the king’s table, for the sake of Solomon’s servants, they are not converts; the statement of Rabbi Neḥemya.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemara: This one who converts from her, he is a convert. And they raised a dilemma: One, a man who converted for the sake of a woman, and one, a woman who converted for the sake of a man, and similarly, one who converted for the sake of the table of kings, for the sake of the servants of Solomon — they are not converts, these are the words of Rabbi Nechemiah."

hebrew_text: שֶׁהָיָה רַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה אוֹמֵר: אֶחָד גֵּירֵי אֲרָיוֹת, וְאֶחָד גֵּירֵי חֲלוֹמוֹת, וְאֶחָד גֵּירֵי מׇרְדֳּכַי וְאֶסְתֵּר — אֵינָן גֵּרִים עַד שֶׁיִּתְגַּיְּירוּ בַּזְּמַן הַזֶּה.
human_translation: As Rabbi Neḥemya would say: converts lions, and converts dreams; and converts of Mordecai and Esther are not converts until they are converted at this time.
llm_translation: The text reads: "Rabbi Nechemiah used to say: One who converts for the sake of lions, or for the sake of dreams, or for the sake of Mordecai and Esther - they are not converts until they convert for the sake of the present time."

hebrew_text: בַּזְּמַן הַזֶּה סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ?! אֶלָּא אֵימָא: כְּבַזְּמַן הַזֶּה.
human_translation: enter your mind at this time? Rather, say: Like at this time,
llm_translation: In this time, has your mind risen?! Rather say: like in this time.

hebrew_text: הָא אִיתְּמַר עֲלַהּ, אָמַר רַב יִצְחָק בַּר שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר מָרְתָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב: הֲלָכָה כְּדִבְרֵי הָאוֹמֵר כּוּלָּם גֵּרִים הֵם.
human_translation: wasn’t it stated with regard to Rav Yitzḥak bar Shmuel bar Marta said in the name of Rav: halakha is the statement of the one who says that they are all converts.
llm_translation: Here is the translation of the Talmudic text into English: Talmudic text: If it was said about him, Rav Yitzchak bar Shmuel bar Marta said in the name of Rav: The halakha is in accordance with the words of the one who says, "They are all converts."

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, לְכַתְּחִלָּה נָמֵי! מִשּׁוּם דְּרַב אַסִּי. דְּאָמַר רַב אַסִּי: ״הָסֵר מִמְּךָ עִקְּשׁוּת פֶּה וּלְזוּת שְׂפָתַיִם וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: If so, ab initio as well? due to of Rav Asi. As Rav Asi said “Put away from yourself a twisted mouth, and perverse lips
llm_translation: So it is, to begin with! Because Rav Assi said: "Remove from yourself crookedness of mouth and perversity of lips, etc."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֵין מְקַבְּלִין גֵּרִים לִימוֹת הַמָּשִׁיחַ. כַּיּוֹצֵא בּוֹ, לֹא קִבְּלוּ גֵּרִים לֹא בִּימֵי דָוִד וְלֹא בִּימֵי שְׁלֹמֹה. אָמַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, מַאי קְרָא: ״הֵן גּוֹר יָגוּר אֶפֶס מֵאוֹתִי מִי גָר אִתָּךְ עָלַיִךְ יִפּוֹל״, אֲבָל אִידַּךְ לָא.
human_translation: The Sages taught: Converts are not accepted in the days of the Messiah. Similarly, they did not accept converts in the days of David or in the days of Solomon. Rabbi Eliezer said: What is the verse “Behold, they may gather together [ gor yagur ], but without Me; whosoever shall gather together [ gar ] with you shall fall on yours” But another not
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: We do not accept converts in the days of the Messiah. For example, they did not accept converts neither in the days of David nor in the days of Solomon. Rabbi Eliezer said, what is the verse: "Behold, the nation shall dwell alone, and shall not be reckoned among the nations" (Numbers 23:9) - but not otherwise.

hebrew_text: הַנִּטְעָן עַל אֵשֶׁת אִישׁ וְכוּ׳. אָמַר רַב: וּבְעֵדִים.
human_translation: one who was suspected of a married woman Rav said: This is witnesses
llm_translation: The one who plants on the wife of a man, etc. Rav said: And with witnesses.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: אָמֵינָא, כִּי נָיֵים וְשָׁכֵיב רַב אָמַר לְהַאי שְׁמַעְתָּתָא. דְּתַנְיָא: הַנִּטְעָן עַל אֵשֶׁת אִישׁ וְהוֹצִיאוּהָ עַל יָדוֹ, וְנִתְגָּרְשָׁה מִתַּחַת יְדֵי אַחֵר, אִם כָּנַס — לֹא יוֹצִיא.
human_translation: Rav Sheshet said: I say when Rav was dozing or sleeping he said that halakha , As it is taught one who was suspected of a married woman and divorce her, and was then divorced by this other, if married he need not divorce
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet said: I said, when he is asleep and lying down, Rav said regarding this teaching. As it was taught: If one loads his wife onto another man and he divorces her, if he cohabited, he may not divorce her.

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָּמֵי: אִי דְּאִיכָּא עֵדִים, כִּי אֲתָא אַחֵר וְאַפְסְקֵיהּ לְקָלָא מַאי הָוֵי? אֶלָּא לָאו דְּלֵיכָּא עֵדִים, וְטַעְמָא דַּאֲתָא אַחֵר וְאַפְסְקֵיהּ לְקָלָא, הָא לָאו הָכִי, מַפְּקִינַן!
human_translation: What are the circumstances If there are witnesses when another came and put an end to the rumor what of it? Rather, is it not where there were no witnesses and the reason because another came put an end to the rumor? This were it not so, would have removed
llm_translation: How are the circumstances? If there are witnesses, when another comes and interrupts them, what is the ruling? Rather, if there are no witnesses, and the reason another comes and interrupts them is to invalidate, this is not the case, we reject it!

hebrew_text: אָמַר לְךָ רַב: הוּא הַדִּין דְּאַף עַל גַּב דְּלָא אֲתָא אַחֵר וְאַפְסְקֵיהּ לְקָלָא, אִי אִיכָּא עֵדִים — מַפְּקִינַן, אִי לֵיכָּא עֵדִים — לָא מַפְּקִינַן, וְהָכִי קָאָמַר: דְּאַף עַל גַּב דַּאֲתָא אַחֵר וְאַפְסְקֵיהּ לְקָלָא, לְכַתְּחִלָּה לֹא יִכְנוֹס.
human_translation: Rav said to you the same is true even if another did not come and put an end to the rumor If there were witnesses removes her if there were no witnesses, does not remove her. And this is what is saying: that even though another came and put an end to the rumor not marry her ab initio
llm_translation: He said to you, Rav: The same applies even though another one does not come and interrupt it, if there are witnesses - we remove it, if there are no witnesses - we do not remove it, and this is what he is saying: even though another one comes and interrupts it, in the first place it should not enter.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — כְּשֶׁאֵין לָהּ בָּנִים, אֲבָל יֵשׁ לָהּ בָּנִים — לֹא תֵּצֵא. וְאִם בָּאוּ עֵדֵי טוּמְאָה, אֲפִילּוּ יֵשׁ לָהּ כַּמָּה בָּנִים — תֵּצֵא.
human_translation: raises an objection In what is this statement, said? when she has no children But if she has children she is not divorced However, if witnesses to impurity, came even if she has several children she is divorced.
llm_translation: The question was raised: In what case are these words said? — When she has no children. But if she has children, she does not leave. And if witnesses of impurity came, even if she has many children, she leaves.

hebrew_text: רַב מוֹקֵי לַהּ לְמַתְנִיתִין בְּיֵשׁ לָהּ בָּנִים וְיֵשׁ לָהּ עֵדִים. וּמַאי דּוּחְקֵיהּ דְּרַב לְאוֹקֹמֵי לְמַתְנִיתִין בְּיֵשׁ לָהּ בָּנִים וְיֵשׁ לָהּ עֵדִים, וְטַעְמָא דְּאִיכָּא עֵדִים מַפְּקִינַן, וְאִי לֵיכָּא עֵדִים לָא מַפְּקִינַן? לוֹקְמַהּ בְּשֶׁאֵין לָהּ בָּנִים, אַף עַל גַּב דְּלֵיכָּא עֵדִים!
human_translation: Rav establishes the mishna where she has children and there are witnesses What forced Rav to establish the mishna where she has children and there are witnesses the reason that removes her is because there were witnesses, but that if there were no witnesses they do not remove her? establish where there were no children even if there were no witnesses?
llm_translation: Rav Moqei said to her: according to the Mishnah, if she has sons and she has witnesses. And what is the difficulty that Rav has in establishing the Mishnah according to the case where she has sons and she has witnesses? The reason is that when there are witnesses, we can establish it, but if there are no witnesses, we do not establish it? Establish it in a case where she has no sons, even though there are no witnesses!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: מַתְנִיתִין קְשִׁיתֵיהּ. מַאי אִירְיָא דְּתָנֵי ״הוֹצִיאוּהָ״? לִיתְנֵי ״הוֹצִיאָהּ״! אֶלָּא: כֹּל ״הוֹצִיאוּהָ״ — בְּבֵית דִּין, וּבֵית דִּין בְּעֵדִים הוּא דְּמַפְּקִי.
human_translation: Rava said: the mishna difficult for him; Why does specifically teach: They remove her [ hotziuha ]? Let it teach: He divorces her [ hotziah ] Rather, every time They remove her, to court. And a court removes if there were witnesses,
llm_translation: Rava said: The Mishnah is difficult. What is the meaning of the fact that it teaches "hutziiha"? It should have taught "hutzi'ah"! Rather, all "hutziiha" - in the court, and the court requires witnesses.

hebrew_text: וְאִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא: הָנֵי מַתְנְיָיתָא — רַבִּי הִיא. דְּתַנְיָא: רוֹכֵל יוֹצֵא, וְאִשָּׁה חוֹגֶרֶת בְּסִינָר, אָמַר רַבִּי: הוֹאִיל וּמְכוֹעָר הַדָּבָר — תֵּצֵא. רוֹק לְמַעְלָה מִן הַכִּילָה, אָמַר רַבִּי: הוֹאִיל וּמְכוֹעָר הַדָּבָר — תֵּצֵא.
human_translation: If you wish, say Those baraitot Rabbi As it is taught a peddler leaving and wife retying her smock [ sinar ], Rabbi said: Since this is a distasteful matter she divorced saliva above the netting of the bed, Rabbi said: Since this is a distasteful matter, she divorced.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates as follows: "If you wish, say: These teachings are the words of Rabbi. As it was taught: If a peddler is leaving, and a woman is girding herself with a sash, Rabbi said: Since the matter is unseemly, she should leave. If one spits above the bed, Rabbi said: Since the matter is unseemly, she should leave."

hebrew_text: מִנְעָלִים הֲפוּכִים תַּחַת הַמִּטָּה, אָמַר רַבִּי: הוֹאִיל וּמְכוֹעָר הַדָּבָר — תֵּצֵא. מִנְעָלִים הֲפוּכִים? לִיחְזֵי דְּמַאן נִינְהוּ! אֶלָּא: מְקוֹם מִנְעָלִים הֲפוּכִים (תַּחַת הַמִּטָּה, אָמַר רַבִּי: הוֹאִיל וּמְכוֹעָר הַדָּבָר — תֵּצֵא).
human_translation: the shoes reversed under the bed, Rabbi said: Since this is a distasteful matter, she divorced. Shoes turned around? Let him see whose they are Rather, place of the shoes, reversed under the bed Rabbi said: Since this is a distasteful matter, she divorced.
llm_translation: Sandals upside down under the bed, Rabbi said: Since it is disgraceful, it should be removed. Sandals upside down? Let us see who they belong to! Rather, the place of sandals upside down (under the bed, Rabbi said: Since it is disgraceful, it should be removed).

hebrew_text: וְהִלְכְתָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַב, וְהִלְכְתָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי. קַשְׁיָא הִלְכְתָא אַהִלְכְתָא: לָא קַשְׁיָא, הָא — בְּקָלָא דְּפָסֵיק, הָא — בְּקָלָא דְלָא פָּסֵיק. קָלָא דְלָא פָּסֵיק וְלֵיכָּא עֵדִים — כְּרַבִּי. קָלָא דְּפָסֵיק וְאִיכָּא עֵדִים — כְּרַב.
human_translation: The halakha is in accordance with of Rav, and the halakha is in accordance with Rabbi halakha difficult, the halakha . not difficult. This one where the rumor ceases that one where the rumor does not cease, a rumor that does not cease, there are no witnesses in accordance with Rabbi the rumor ceases and there are witnesses, in accordance with Rav,
llm_translation: The halacha follows the opinion of Rav, and the halacha follows the opinion of Rabbi. The difficulty of the halacha is not a difficulty; this one - in a case where it is interrupted, that one - in a case where it is not interrupted. In a case where it is not interrupted and there are no witnesses - it is like Rabbi. In a case where it is interrupted and there are witnesses - it is like Rav.

hebrew_text: וְקָלָא דְּלָא פָּסֵיק עַד כַּמָּה? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, אֲמַרָה לִי אֵם: דּוֹמֵי דְמָתָא יוֹמָא וּפַלְגָא. וְלָא אֲמַרַן, אֶלָּא דְּלָא פְּסַק בֵּינֵי וּבֵינֵי, אֲבָל פְּסַק בֵּינֵי וּבֵינֵי — הָא פְּסַק. וְלָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא דְּלָא פְּסַק מֵחֲמַת יִרְאָה, אֲבָל פְּסַק מֵחֲמַת יִרְאָה — מֵחֲמַת יִרְאָה הוּא. וְלָא אֲמַרַן אֶלָּא דְּלֵיכָּא אוֹיְבִים, אֲבָל אִיכָּא אוֹיְבִים — אוֹיְבִים הוּא דְּאַפִּקוּ לֵיהּ לְקָלָא.
human_translation: At what point a persistent rumor? Abaye said: mother told me: A rumor in the city a day and a half. We said only did not cease in the meantime. But did cease in the meantime, this is has ceased And we said only ceased not due to fear But if it ceased due to fear, it is due to fear And we said only does not have any enemies, but he has enemies it is the enemies who put out the rumor
llm_translation: The voice that does not cease until when? Abaye said, his mother told him: "It is like the appearance of the morning and the evening." And we did not say, except that it did not cease between them, but if it ceased between them — that is considered a cessation. And we did not say except that it did not cease due to fear, but if it ceased due to fear — it is due to fear. And we did not say except that there are no enemies, but if there are enemies — they are enemies who have caused him distress.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן הָתָם: הַמּוֹצִיא אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ מִשּׁוּם שֵׁם רָע — לֹא יַחְזִיר. מִשּׁוּם נֶדֶר — לֹא יַחְזִיר. שְׁלַח לֵיהּ רַבָּה בַּר הוּנָא לְרַבָּה בַּר רַב נַחְמָן, יְלַמְּדֵנוּ רַבֵּינוּ: כָּנַס, מַהוּ שֶׁיּוֹצִיא?
human_translation: We learned there who divorces his wife due to bad reputation may not take back due to a vow he may not take back Rabba bar Huna sent to Rabba bar Rav Naḥman: Our teacher, instruct us. remarried what is Must divorce
llm_translation: We learned there: One who divorces his wife due to a bad name - he shall not return. Due to a vow - he shall not return. Rabba bar Huna sent to Rabbah bar Rav Nachman: Let our master teach us: When he gathers, what is the law regarding his divorce?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: תְּנֵינָא, הַנִּטְעָן עַל אֵשֶׁת אִישׁ וְהוֹצִיאָהּ מִתַּחַת יָדוֹ, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁכָּנַס — יוֹצִיא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִי דָּמֵי? הָתָם ״הוֹצִיאוּהָ״ וְהָכָא ״הוֹצִיאָהּ״. וְרַבָּה בַּר רַב נַחְמָן, מַתְנִיתִין נָמֵי ״הוֹצִיאָהּ״ תְּנַן.
