human_translation: said to him: We learned one who is suspected of a married woman, and he, divorced her, even if he remarried he must divorce said to him: Is this comparable There, They, remove her whereas here He divorced her And Rabba bar Rav Naḥman, the mishna also He divorced her,
llm_translation: He said to him: We have learned in a Mishnah, one who plants it on the wife of a man and she removes it from under his hand, even though he inserted it - he is considered to have removed it. He said to him: What is the comparison? There it says "remove it" and here it says "she removes it." And Rabba bar Rav Nachman, we also learned in a Mishnah "she removes it."

hebrew_text: וְאַכַּתִּי מִי דָּמֵי? הָכָא בַּעַל, וְהָתָם בּוֹעֵל! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: שַׁפִּיר דָּמֵי אַהֲדָדֵי. הָכָא אֲמוּר רַבָּנַן: לָא יִכְנוֹס, וְאִם כָּנַס — יוֹצִיא. הָכִי נָמֵי: אָמְרִי רַבָּנַן, לֹא יַחְזִיר, וְאִם כָּנַס — יוֹצִיא.
human_translation: Still, is this comparable? Here, the husband but there, the man adultery He said to him: They are certainly comparable to each other: Here, the Sages said that he may not marry and if he did marry he must divorce So too, the Sages said that he may not take back, and if he does remarry he must divorce
llm_translation: "And who is the one who pays? Here it is the husband, and there it is the seducer! He said to him: The blood of Ahadadai is beautiful. Here the Sages say: He should not retract, and if he does retract — he must pay. This is what they say: The Sages say, he should not return, and if he does return — he must pay."

hebrew_text: וְלָא הִיא. הָתָם: אַלּוֹמֵי אַלְּמֵיהּ לְקָלָא, הָכָא: אָמְרִינַן קָם בֵּיהּ בְּקָלָא וְלֵיתֵיהּ.
human_translation: That is not so, there, he thereby strengthens the rumor Here, we say that he, established the rumor was not so
llm_translation: "And not this. There: 'Alwai Almeih to Kala,' here: we say, 'He arose with a voice and did not leave it.'"

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַמֵּבִיא גֵּט מִמְּדִינַת הַיָּם, וְאָמַר: ״בְּפָנַי נִכְתַּב וּבְפָנַי נֶחְתַּם״ — לֹא יִשָּׂא אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ. ״מֵת״, ״הֲרַגְתִּיו״, ״הֲרַגְנוּהוּ״ — לֹא יִשָּׂא אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: ״הֲרַגְתִּיו״ — לֹא תִּנָּשֵׂא אִשְׁתּוֹ, ״הֲרַגְנוּהוּ״ — תִּנָּשֵׂא אִשְׁתּוֹ.
human_translation: who brought a bill of divorce from a country overseas and said: It was written in my presence and it was signed in my presence, may not marry wife, died, I killed him, We killed him, may not marry wife. Rabbi Yehuda says: I killed him, his wife may not be married We killed him, his wife may be married
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who brings a bill of divorce from overseas and says, "It was written and signed in my presence," may not marry his wife. If he says, "He died," "I killed him," or "They killed him," he may not marry his wife. Rabbi Yehuda says: If he says, "I killed him," he may not marry his wife; if he says, "They killed him," he may marry his wife.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ טַעְמָא דְּמִמְּדִינַת הַיָּם, דַּעֲלֵיהּ קָסָמְכִינַן. אֲבָל מֵאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל, דְּלָאו עֲלֵיהּ קָסָמְכִינַן — יִשָּׂא אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ.
human_translation: The reason that from a country overseas, as we, rely upon his But from Eretz Yisrael since we, do not rely upon his he may marry his wife,
llm_translation: The taste of fish from the sea, we rely on it. But from the land of Israel, where we do not rely on it - he may marry his wife.

hebrew_text: וְהָא מֵת, דְּלָאו עֲלֵיהּ קָסָמְכִינַן, דְּאָמַר מָר: אִשָּׁה דַּיְיקָא וּמִינַּסְבָא, וְקָתָנֵי: לֹא יִשָּׂא אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ!
human_translation: But died, we, do not rely upon As the Master said: A woman is exacting marries Yet it is taught that he may not marry his wife.
llm_translation: And the deceased, for we do not rely upon him, as the Master said: A woman who is precise and marries, and it is taught: He shall not take his wife!

hebrew_text: הָתָם לֵיכָּא כְּתָבָא, הָכָא אִיכָּא כְּתָבָא. דִּתְנַן: מָה בֵּין גֵּט לְמִיתָה — שֶׁהַכְּתָב מוֹכִיחַ.
human_translation: there, there is not anything written here, there is written As we learned What is the difference between a bill of divorce and death? that the writing proves
llm_translation: There, there is a document, here, there is a document. As we learned: What is the difference between a divorce document and a death sentence? The document proves.

hebrew_text: ״מֵת״, ״הֲרַגְתִּיו״, ״הֲרַגְנוּהוּ״ — לֹא יִשָּׂא אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ. הוּא נִיהוּ דְּלֹא יִשָּׂא אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ, הָא לְאַחֵר תִּנָּשֵׂא.
human_translation: he died, I killed him, We killed him, he may not marry wife he, himself, may not marry wife; this to another she may be married
llm_translation: "Dead," "I killed him," "they killed him" — he shall not marry his wife. This is specifically regarding not marrying his wife; but for another, she shall be married.

hebrew_text: וְהָאָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: ״פְּלוֹנִי רְבָעַנִי לְאוֹנְסִי״ — הוּא וְאַחֵר מִצְטָרְפִין לְהׇרְגוֹ. ״לִרְצוֹנִי״ — רָשָׁע הוּא, וְהַתּוֹרָה אָמְרָה: ״אַל תָּשֶׁת יָדְךָ עִם רָשָׁע לִהְיוֹת עֵד חָמָס״?
human_translation: Didn’t Rav Yosef say: so-and-so sodomized me against my will, he and another combine to put to death willingly he is wicked And the Torah said: “Put not your hand with the wicked to be a corrupt witness”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And Rav Yosef said: "So-and-so, a fourth generation to my coercion" — he and another join together to kill him. "To my consent" — he is wicked, and the Torah said: "Do not be a hand with a wicked person to be a false witness."

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא: שָׁאנֵי עֵדוּת אִשָּׁה דַּאֲקִילּוּ בַּהּ רַבָּנַן — וְהָאָמַר רַב מְנַשֶּׁה:
human_translation: And if you would say testimony a woman’s is different, as the Sages ruled leniently didn’t Rav Menashe say:
llm_translation: And if you will say: The testimony of a woman is different, for the Rabbis were lenient with it - and Rav Menasheh said:

hebrew_text: גַּזְלָן דְּדִבְרֵיהֶם — כָּשֵׁר לְעֵדוּת אִשָּׁה, גַּזְלָן דְּדִבְרֵי תוֹרָה — פָּסוּל לְעֵדוּת אִשָּׁה. נֵימָא רַב מְנַשֶּׁה דְּאָמַר כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה!
human_translation: a robber according to the words he is fit for testimony a woman’s A robber according to Torah law is unfit for testimony a woman’s Should we say that Rav Menashe said in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda?
llm_translation: The robber of their words — valid for the testimony of a woman, the robber of Torah words — invalid for the testimony of a woman. It was stated: Rav Menashe said in the name of Rabbi Yehuda!

hebrew_text: אָמַר לְךָ רַב מְנַשֶּׁה: אֲנָא דַּאֲמַרִי אֲפִילּוּ לְרַבָּנַן — וְטַעְמָא דְּרַבָּנַן הָכָא כִּדְרָבָא, דְּאָמַר רָבָא: אָדָם קָרוֹב אֵצֶל עַצְמוֹ, וְאֵין אָדָם מֵשִׂים עַצְמוֹ רָשָׁע.
human_translation: Rav Menashe said to you: I am speaking even according to the Rabbis. And the rationale of the Rabbis here is in accordance with Rava, as Rava said: a person is his own relative. And a person does not make himself wicked.
llm_translation: He said to you, Rav Menashe: I, who say even to the Rabbis - and the reason of the Rabbis here is like that of Rava, for Rava said: A person is close to himself, and a person does not consider himself wicked.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא רַב יוֹסֵף דְּאָמַר כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה? אָמַר לְךָ רַב יוֹסֵף: אֲנָא דַּאֲמַרִי אֲפִילּוּ לְרַבָּנַן, וְשָׁאנֵי עֵדוּת אִשָּׁה, דַּאֲקִילּוּ בַּהּ רַבָּנַן. וְרַב מְנַשֶּׁה דְּאָמַר כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: Shall we say that Rav Yosef spoke is in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda? Rav Yosef said to you: I am speaking even according to the Rabbis, as testimony a woman is different in that the Rabbis ruled more leniently Rav Menashe, who spoke in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda,
llm_translation: Let us say, Rav Yosef, who says like Rabbi Yehuda? He said to you, Rav Yosef: I who say even to the Rabbis, and the difference is the testimony of a woman, for the Rabbis were lenient with it. And Rav Menashe who says like Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: הֲרַגְתִּיו כּוּ׳ הֲרַגְנוּהוּ תִּנָּשֵׂא כּוּ׳. מַאי שְׁנָא ״הֲרַגְתִּיו״ וּמַאי שְׁנָא ״הֲרַגְנוּהוּ״? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה, בְּאוֹמֵר: אֲנִי הָיִיתִי עִם הוֹרְגָיו.
human_translation: I killed him, We killed him, may be married What is different between: I killed him, and: We killed him? Rav Yehuda said: where he said: I was with his murderers,
llm_translation: I have killed him, as it says "I have killed him"; we have killed him, as it says "you shall bear him". What is the difference between "I have killed him" and "we have killed him"? Rav Yehudah said, by saying: I was with his killers.

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא: אָמְרוּ לוֹ לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, מַעֲשֶׂה בְּלִסְטִים אֶחָד שֶׁיָּצָא לֵיהָרֵג בִּמְגִיזַת קַפּוֹטְקְיָא, וְאָמַר לָהֶם: ״לְכוּ אִמְרוּ לָהּ לְאֵשֶׁת שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן כֹּהֵן: ׳אֲנִי הָרַגְתִּי אֶת בַּעְלָהּ בִּכְנִיסָתִי לְלוֹד׳״, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ: ׳בִּכְנִיסָתוֹ לְלוֹד׳, וְהִשִּׂיאוּ אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ! אָמַר לָהֶם: מִשָּׁם רְאָיָה?! בְּאוֹמֵר: ״אֲנִי הָיִיתִי עִם הוֹרְגָיו״.
human_translation: And it is taught They told Rabbi Yehuda: an incident involving an armed bandit [ listim ] who was taken out to be executed in passage [ megizat ] of Cappadocia, and he said to Go and tell the wife of Shimon the Priest I killed her husband as I entered Lod. And some say As he entered Lod. And they married off his wife said to them: proof from there? that he said: I was with his murderers,
llm_translation: And it was taught in a Baraita: They said to Rabbi Yehuda, there was an incident with a certain bandit who went out to kill in the town of Megizat Kapotkaya, and he said to them: "Go tell the wife of Shimon ben Kohan: 'I killed her husband when I entered Lut.'" And they said to her: "When he entered Lut," and they brought his wife. He said to them: "Is there any proof from there?!" And he said: "I was with his killers."

hebrew_text: וְהָא ״לִסְטִים״ קָתָנֵי! שֶׁנִּתְפַּס עַל יְדֵי לִסְטִיּוּת. וְהָא ״יָצָא״ לֵיהָרֵג קָתָנֵי! בֵּי דִינָא דְּגוֹיִם, דְּלָא דָּיְיקִי וְקָטְלִי.
human_translation: But it is taught an armed bandit. He was captured for armed banditry. But it is taught that he was taken out to be executed, a gentile court, and they execute without being precise.
llm_translation: The text states: "And this is regarding 'listim' that it is taught! That he was caught through banditry. And this is regarding 'yatzah' to be killed that it is taught! In the court of the nations, where they do not investigate thoroughly and kill."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הֶחָכָם שֶׁאָסַר אֶת הָאִשָּׁה בְּנֶדֶר עַל בַּעְלָהּ — הֲרֵי זֶה לֹא יִשָּׂאֶנָּה. מֵיאֲנָה, אוֹ שֶׁחָלְצָה בְּפָנָיו — יִשָּׂאֶנָּה, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא בֵּית דִּין.
human_translation: Sage who rendered the wife forbidden to her husband by vow, may not marry her, performed refusal or before whom performed ḥalitza , may marry her because the court,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "If a wise man forbids his wife through a vow upon her husband - behold, he shall not marry her. If he annuls it, or if she is released before him - he shall marry her, because he is like a court."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ הָא הִתִּירָה — יִשָּׂאֶנָּה. בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן? אִילֵימָא בְּחַד — חַד מִי מָצֵי מַתִּיר? וְהָאָמַר (רַב אָמַר) רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אָבִין אָמַר רַב עַמְרָם, תָּנָא: הַתָּרַת נְדָרִים בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה!
human_translation: This he her permitted he may marry her. With what are we dealing? If we say a single can a single dissolve But didn’t Rav say Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Avin said Rav Amram said: It is taught Dissolution of vows three
llm_translation: Gemara: If she permitted it - he may marry her. With what are we dealing? If you say with one - can one person permit? But didn't Rav say, Rabbi Hiyya bar Avin said Rav Amram said, it was taught: The annulment of vows requires three!

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא, בִּתְלָתָא. מִי חֲשִׁידִי? וְהָתְנַן: מֵיאֲנָה אוֹ שֶׁחָלְצָה בְּפָנָיו — יִשָּׂאֶנָּה, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא בֵּית דִּין.
human_translation: Rather, of three would they be suspect But didn’t we learn she performed refusal or performed ḥalitza before him, he may marry her because he a court
llm_translation: And rather, in three. Who is the suspect? And it was taught: If she refuses or she removes it in his presence - he should divorce her, because he is a court.

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם בְּחַד, וְכִדְאָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: בְּיָחִיד מוּמְחֶה, הָכָא נָמֵי: בְּיָחִיד מוּמְחֶה.
human_translation: Actually, that of a single and as Rav Ḥisda said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: by a single expert, Here too, a single expert
llm_translation: Always in one, as Rav Ḥisdah said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: In a unique case of blemish, here too it is stated: in a unique case of blemish.

hebrew_text: מֵיאֲנָה אוֹ שֶׁחָלְצָה וְכוּ׳. טַעְמָא דְּבֵית דִּין, הָא בִּתְרֵי — לָא,
human_translation: performed refusal or performed ḥalitza The reason is the court Then, if there were two he would not
llm_translation: From where she refuses or she withdraws, etc. The reason of the court, but in the case of two - no.

hebrew_text: מַאי שְׁנָא מֵהָא דִּתְנַן: עֵדִים הַחֲתוּמִים עַל שְׂדֵה מִקָּח, וְעַל גֵּט אִשָּׁה לֹא חָשׁוּ חֲכָמִים לְדָבָר זֶה? הִיא גּוּפַהּ קָמַשְׁמַע לַן, לְאַפּוֹקֵי מִמַּאן דְּאָמַר מֵיאוּן בִּפְנֵי שְׁנַיִם, קָמַשְׁמַע לַן מֵיאוּן בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה.
human_translation: what is different from that which we learned witnesses signed on the sale of a field or on a woman’s bill of divorce, the Sages were not concerned about this matter this itself to teach us to exclude the one who said that refusal may be performed before two. This teaches us refusal three
llm_translation: What is different about this that we learned: Witnesses who sign on a land transaction, and on a bill of divorce, the sages did not pay attention to this matter? It is the essence itself that informs us, to exclude the opinion of one who says "a matter is established by the testimony of two," the essence itself informs us "a matter is established by the testimony of three."

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: כָּנַס, מַהוּ שֶׁיּוֹצִיא? רַב כָּהֲנָא אָמַר: כָּנַס — מוֹצִיא. רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: כָּנַס — אֵינוֹ מוֹצִיא. תָּנֵי לְהוּ רַב זוּטֵי דְּבֵי רַב פַּפֵּי כְּדִבְרֵי הָאוֹמֵר כָּנַס אֵינוֹ מוֹצִיא.
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before married what is he must divorce Rav Kahana said: he married he must divorce Rav Ashi said: he married he need not divorce Rav Zuti from the school of Rav Pappi taught in accordance with the statement of the said that he married he need not divorce
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: He asked them: When one gathers produce, what is the law regarding separating tithes? Rav Kahana said: When one gathers — he separates. Rav Ashei said: When one gathers — he does not separate. Rav Zutei of the school of Rav Pappai taught them in accordance with the opinion of the one who says that when one gathers, he does not separate.

hebrew_text: אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ רַבָּנַן לְרַב אָשֵׁי: גְּמָרָא, אוֹ סְבָרָא? אֲמַר לְהוּ, מַתְנִיתִין הִיא: הַנִּטְעָן מִשִּׁפְחָה וְנִשְׁתַּחְרְרָה, מִגּוֹיָה וְנִתְגַּיְּירָה — הֲרֵי זֶה לֹא יִכְנוֹס, וְאִם כָּנַס — אֵין מוֹצִיא. אַלְמָא
human_translation: The Rabbis said to Rav Ashi: tradition or conclusion? He said to them: It is the mishna. one suspected with maidservant and she set free, or with a gentile woman and she converted may not marry But if he did marry her, they, do not remove Apparently,
llm_translation: The sages said to Rav Ashi: Is it a conclusion or a logical deduction? He said to them, it is a Mishnah: If one planted from a maidservant and she was freed, from a gentile woman and she converted - this one should not enter, and if he entered - he does not fulfill his obligation. This implies...

hebrew_text: בִּרְנָנָה — לָא מַפְּקִינַן, הָכָא נָמֵי — בִּרְנָנָה לָא מַפְּקִינַן.
human_translation: we do not remove her due to rumor Here too, we do not remove her due to a rumor.
llm_translation: "Birnanah - we do not remove, here it is stated - Birnanah we do not remove."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ וְכוּלָּם שֶׁהָיוּ לָהֶם נָשִׁים וּמֵתוּ — מוּתָּרוֹת לִינָּשֵׂא לָהֶם.
human_translation: And all of these they had wives and died are permitted to be married to them.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: "And all of them who had wives and died - their wives are permitted to marry them."

hebrew_text: וְכוּלָּן שֶׁנִּישְּׂאוּ לַאֲחֵרִים, וְנִתְגָּרְשׁוּ אוֹ שֶׁנִּתְאַלְמְנוּ — מוּתָּרוֹת לִינָּשֵׂא לָהֶם. וְכוּלָּן מוּתָּרוֹת לִבְנֵיהֶם אוֹ לַאֲחֵיהֶם.
human_translation: And all of these they were married to others and were divorced or widowed they are permitted to be married to them, And all of these are permitted to the sons or to the brothers
llm_translation: And all of them who were married to others, and were divorced or widowed — permitted to marry them. And all of them permitted to their sons or brothers.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מֵתוּ — אִין, נִתְגָּרְשׁוּ — לָא.
human_translation: If died, yes, were divorced, no,
llm_translation: "Gema' metu - ein, nitgarshu - la."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב הִלֵּל לְרַב אָשֵׁי, וְהָתַנְיָא: אֲפִילּוּ נִתְגָּרְשׁוּ! לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא דַּהֲוַאי קְטָטָה, הָא דְּלָא הֲוַאי קְטָטָה.
human_translation: Rav Hillel said to Rav Ashi: Yet it is taught Even if they were divorced This not difficult: This when there was a quarrel That was when there was no quarrel
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Hillel to Rav Ashi, and it was taught: Even if they were divorced! Not difficult: this one that was a quarrel, this one that was not a quarrel.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: הָא וְהָא דְּלָא הֲוַאי קְטָטָה, וְלָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא דְּאַרְגֵּיל הוּא, הָא דְּאַרְגִּילָה הִיא.
human_translation: And if you wish, say: Both this and that when there was no quarrel And this not difficult: This was when he started himself, And that was when started
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: This and this, that it was not a stumbling block, and it is not difficult: this one that is accustomed, this one that is accustomed.

hebrew_text: וְכוּלָּן שֶׁנִּישְּׂאוּ וְכוּ׳. קָא סָלְקָא דַּעְתִּין מִיתָה אַמִּיתָה, וְגֵירוּשִׁין אַגֵּירוּשִׁין.
human_translation: And all of these if they were married It enters our mind to say death after death, and divorce following divorce
llm_translation: And all of them that married, etc. The mind has emerged death I will kill, and divorces I will divorce.

hebrew_text: נֵימָא מַתְנִיתִין דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי, דְּאִי כְּרַבִּי, הָאָמַר: בִּתְרֵי זִימְנֵי הָוְיָא חֲזָקָה!
human_translation: should we say that the mishna, is not in accordance with Rabbi As, if it is in accordance with Rabbi didn’t say: After two times presumptive status
llm_translation: Text of the Talmud: "Neima matnitin d'lo k'Rabbi, d'i k'Rabbi, ha'amar: b'trei zimnei havya chazaka!" English translation: "It was stated in a Baraita not like Rabbi, for if it were like Rabbi, he said: 'In two instances it shall be established!'"

hebrew_text: לָא: מִיתָה אַגֵּירוּשִׁין, וְגֵירוּשִׁין אַמִּיתָה.
human_translation: No death after divorce or divorce after death.
llm_translation: Not: death agirushin, and agirushin amitah.

hebrew_text: וְכוּלָּן מוּתָּרוֹת לִבְנֵיהֶם אוֹ לַאֲחֵיהֶם. מַאי שְׁנָא מֵהָא דִּתְנַן: הַנִּטְעָן מִן הָאִשָּׁה, אָסוּר בְּאִמָּהּ וּבְבִתָּהּ וּבַאֲחוֹתָהּ.
human_translation: And all of these are permitted to the sons or to the brothers what is different from that which we learned one suspected with woman is prohibited from her mother, and her daughter, and her sister.
llm_translation: And all of them permitted to their sons or to their brothers. What is the difference from that which we learned: One who marries a woman, is forbidden to his mother, and to his daughter, and to her sister.

hebrew_text: נְשֵׁי לְגַבֵּי נְשֵׁי שְׁכִיחָן דְּאָזְלָן. גַּבְרֵי לְגַבֵּי גַבְרֵי לָא שְׁכִיחָן.
human_translation: it is common for women at women it is not common for men at men,
llm_translation: The women regarding women frequent to go. The men regarding men not frequent.

hebrew_text: אִי נָמֵי: נְשֵׁי דְּלָא אָסְרָן שְׁכִיבָתָן אַהֲדָדֵי, לָא קָפְדִי אַהֲדָדֵי. גַּבְרֵי דְּאָסְרָן שְׁכִיבָתָן אַהֲדָדֵי, קָפְדִי אַהֲדָדֵי.
human_translation: Alternatively, Women are not so strict with one another, as lying with them does not render them mutually forbidden. men are strict with one another, as lying with them does render them, mutually forbidden.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Iy namei: n'shei d'lo as'ran shechivatan ahadadei, la kafdi ahadadei. Gavrei d'as'ran shechivatan ahadadei, kafdi ahadadei." English translation: "If they (women) who were not forbidden their lying with each other, do not care for each other. Men who were forbidden their lying with each other, care for each other."

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, אָבִיו נָמֵי? לָא מִיבַּעְיָא קָאָמַר: לָא מִיבַּעְיָא אָבִיו, דִּבְזִיז בְּנֵיהּ מִינֵּיהּ, אֲבָל בְּנוֹ, דְּלָא בְּזִיז אָבִיו מִינֵּיהּ — אֵימָא לָא, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: If so, one’s father as well. is speaking It is not necessary. It is not necessary his father as his son is embarrassed [ baziz ] before him But I might say that the father is not embarrassed before his son, may not this comes to teach us
llm_translation: If so, his father is indeed? Not is asking saying: not is asking his father, for he disgraces his sons from him, but his son, who does not disgrace his father from him — say not, he is teaching us.

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ כֵּיצַד אֵשֶׁת אָחִיו
llm_translation: We will return to you: How is the case of the wife of one's brother.

hebrew_text: אַרְבָּעָה אַחִין , שְׁנַיִם מֵהֶם נְשׂוּאִים שְׁתֵּי אֲחָיוֹת, וּמֵתוּ הַנְּשׂוּאִים אֶת הָאֲחָיוֹת — הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ חוֹלְצוֹת וְלֹא מִתְיַיבְּמוֹת. וְאִם קָדְמוּ וְכָנְסוּ — יוֹצִיאוּ. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: יְקַיֵּים, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: יוֹצִיאוּ.
human_translation: four brothers, two of whom were married to two sisters, and the ones married to the sisters died, then those perform ḥalitza and may not enter into levirate marriage. And if they married before they should divorce Rabbi Eliezer says Beit Shammai say: He may maintain while Beit Hillel say: They divorce
llm_translation: Four brothers, two of them married two sisters, and the married ones died without children — these are halutzot and not yevamot. And if they preceded and entered — they should be removed. Rabbi Eliezer says, Beit Shammai says: they should fulfill, and Beit Hillel says: they should be removed.

hebrew_text: הָיְתָה אַחַת מֵהֶן אֲסוּרָה עַל הָאֶחָד אִיסּוּר עֶרְוָה — אָסוּר בָּהּ, וּמוּתָּר בַּאֲחוֹתָהּ. וְהַשֵּׁנִי — אָסוּר בִּשְׁתֵּיהֶן.
human_translation: one of was forbidden to one a prohibition against forbidden relations he is forbidden to her but permitted to her sister. the second is forbidden to both of them.
llm_translation: One of them was forbidden to marry one man due to a prohibition of incest - she is forbidden to him, but permitted to her sister. And the second - he is forbidden to both.

hebrew_text: אִיסּוּר מִצְוָה וְאִיסּוּר קְדוּשָּׁה — חוֹלֶצֶת וְלֹא מִתְיַיבֶּמֶת.
human_translation: a prohibition a mitzva a prohibition sanctity perform ḥalitza and may not enter into levirate marriage,
llm_translation: Prohibition of a commandment and prohibition of sanctity - she performs chalitzah but does not perform yibum.

hebrew_text: הָיְתָה אַחַת מֵהֶן אֲסוּרָה עַל זֶה אִיסּוּר עֶרְוָה, וְהַשְּׁנִיָּה אֲסוּרָה עַל זֶה אִיסּוּר עֶרְוָה — הָאֲסוּרָה לָזֶה מוּתֶּרֶת לָזֶה, וְהָאֲסוּרָה לָזֶה מוּתֶּרֶת לָזֶה.
human_translation: one of those was forbidden to this a prohibition against forbidden relations and the second was forbidden to that a prohibition against forbidden relations, she who is forbidden to this is permitted to that and she who is forbidden to that is permitted to this
llm_translation: One of them was forbidden to this one with the prohibition of incest, and the second was forbidden to this one with the prohibition of incest - the one forbidden to this one is permitted to this one, and the one forbidden to this one is permitted to this one.

hebrew_text: וְזוֹ הִיא שֶׁאָמְרוּ: אֲחוֹתָהּ כְּשֶׁהִיא יְבִמְתָּהּ — אוֹ חוֹלֶצֶת אוֹ מִתְיַיבֶּמֶת.
human_translation: And this is they said: When her sister is her yevama , she either performs ḥalitza or enters into levirate marriage.
llm_translation: And this is what they said: Her sister, when she is her yevamah - either performs chalitzah or performs yibum.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: יֵשׁ זִיקָה. דְּאִי אֵין זִיקָה, מִכְּדִי הָנֵי מִתְּרֵי בָתֵּי קָאָתְיָין — הַאי לְיַיבֵּם חֲדָא וְהַאי לְיַיבֵּם חֲדָא?
human_translation: Conclude from here levirate bond is substantial. For if the levirate bond were not substantial, After all, these come from two households, Let this consummate the levirate marriage with one and let that consummate the levirate marriage with other
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemara, shema minah: yesh zika. Dei ein zika, mikdei hanei mitrei battei ka'ateiyan - hai leyabem chada ve'hai leyabem chada?" English translation: "The Gemara raises a question: Is there a legal connection? For if there is no legal connection, then these two houses of Ka'ateiyan are both for one levirate marriage, and these two for one levirate marriage?"

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם אֵימָא לָךְ אֵין זִיקָה, וּמִשּׁוּם דְּקָסָבַר אָסוּר לְבַטֵּל מִצְוַת יְבָמִין. דִּלְמָא אַדִּמְיַיבֵּם חַד — מָיֵית אִידַּךְ, וְקָמְבַטֵּל מִצְוַת יְבָמִין.
human_translation: Actually, I say to you the levirate bond is not substantial, because holds that it is prohibited to negate the mitzva of levirate marriage. Perhaps before one consummates the levirate marriage, the other dies, and he would negate the mitzva of levirate marriage
llm_translation: Forever say to you no damage, and because he thought forbidden to nullify commandment of levirate marriage. Perhaps he will come to marry one — you will be his wife, and he will nullify the commandment of levirate marriage.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, תְּלָתָא נָמֵי?
human_translation: If so, three as well.
llm_translation: If so, three things are stated?

hebrew_text: לָא מִיבַּעְיָא קָאָמְרִינַן: לָא מִיבַּעְיָא תְּלָתָא, דְּוַדַּאי בָּטְלָה מִצְוַת יְבָמִין. אֲבָל אַרְבְּעָה, לְמִיתָה לָא חָיְישִׁינַן — קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: is speaking It is not necessary. It is not necessary three as certainly the mitzva of levirate marriage is negated But four we are not concerned over the death teaches us
llm_translation: We do not say "three are not required," for indeed if the obligation of yibum is annulled. But with four, we are not concerned for death - this is evident to us.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי —
human_translation: If so,
llm_translation: If so—

hebrew_text: חַמְשָׁה נָמֵי! לְמִיתָה דִּתְרֵי לָא חָיְישִׁינַן.
human_translation: also five We are not concerned over the death of two
llm_translation: Five types of sleep! Regarding death, two we are not concerned.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא בַּר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב: שָׁלֹשׁ אֲחָיוֹת יְבָמוֹת שֶׁנָּפְלוּ לִפְנֵי שְׁנֵי אַחִין יְבָמִין — זֶה חוֹלֵץ לְאַחַת וְזֶה חוֹלֵץ לְאַחַת, וְאֶמְצָעִית צְרִיכָה חֲלִיצָה מִשְּׁנֵיהֶם.
human_translation: Rava bar Rav Huna said Rav said: three sisters yevamot happened before two brothers yevamin this performs ḥalitza with one and that performs ḥalitza with one And the middle, requires ḥalitza with both of
llm_translation: Rava son of Rav Huna said in the name of Rav: Three sisters-in-law who fell before two brothers-in-law - this one performs chalitzah with one, and this one performs chalitzah with one, and the middle one requires chalitzah from both of them.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבָּה: מִדְּקָאָמְרַתְּ אֶמְצָעִית צְרִיכָה חֲלִיצָה מִשְּׁנֵיהֶם, קָסָבְרַתְּ יֵשׁ זִיקָה, וְהָוְיָא לַהּ חֲלִיצָה פְּסוּלָה — וַחֲלִיצָה פְּסוּלָה צָרִיךְ לַחֲזוֹר עַל כׇּל הָאַחִין,
human_translation: Rabba said to them: From that you say the middle one requires ḥalitza with both of you hold the levirate bond is substantial and this is invalid ḥalitza . And invalid ḥalitza must be repeated by all of the brothers;
llm_translation: He said to him, Rabba: From when you say the middle one needs chalitzah from both of them, you hold there is a connection, and it will be for her an invalid chalitzah - and an invalid chalitzah requires to go back to all the brothers.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, קַמַּיְיתָא נָמֵי!
human_translation: If that is so, the first also
llm_translation: If so, before the Kamaita Nami!

hebrew_text: אִי דִּנְפוּל בְּבַת אַחַת — הָכִי נָמֵי. לָא צְרִיכָא: דִּנְפוּל בְּזוֹ אַחַר זוֹ.
human_translation: If that they, happened simultaneously, it is indeed so necessary only where they happened one after the other.
llm_translation: If they fell at the same time - it is thus. It is unnecessary: if they fell one after the other.

hebrew_text: נְפַלָה חֲדָא — חָלֵץ לַהּ רְאוּבֵן, נְפַלָה אִידַּךְ — חָלֵץ לַהּ שִׁמְעוֹן,
human_translation: One happened Reuven, performed ḥalitza with her. Another happened Shimon performed ḥalitza with her.
llm_translation: One fell - Reuben redeems her, the other fell - Simeon redeems her.

hebrew_text: נְפַלָה אִידַּךְ, חָלֵץ לַהּ הַאי — מַפְקַע זִיקָתוֹ, חָלֵץ לַהּ הַאי — מַפְקַע זִיקָתוֹ.
human_translation: Another happened this performs ḥalitza with her, he terminates his levirate bond, and this performs ḥalitza with her, he terminates his levirate bond.
llm_translation: The other one fell, he must remove it - he removes its damage; the other one fell, he must remove it - he removes its damage.

hebrew_text: וְהָאָמַר רַב: אֵין זִיקָה! לְדִבְרֵי הָאוֹמֵר יֵשׁ זִיקָה קָאָמַר.
human_translation: But didn’t Rav say: The levirate bond is not substantial. states in accordance with the statement of the one who says that the levirate bond is substantial,
llm_translation: And he said, Rav: There is no damage! According to the one who says there is damage, he is speaking.

hebrew_text: וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: אֶחָד חוֹלֵץ לְכוּלָּן. מִכְּדִי שָׁמְעִינַן לֵיהּ לִשְׁמוּאֵל דְּאָמַר: חֲלִיצָה מְעַלְּיָא בְּעֵינַן, דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל:
human_translation: And Shmuel said one performs ḥalitza with each But since we have heard that Shmuel said: We require a full-fledged ḥalitza , as Shmuel said:
llm_translation: Samuel said: One may untie them all. As we have heard from Samuel who said: We require a higher level of untying, as Samuel said:

hebrew_text: חָלַץ לַאֲחָיוֹת — לֹא נִפְטְרוּ צָרוֹת. הֵיכָא דְּקָיְימָא חֲלִיצָה דְּשִׁמְעוֹן חֲלִיצָה כְּשֵׁרָה, חָלֵיץ לַהּ רְאוּבֵן חֲלִיצָה פְּסוּלָה?
human_translation: performed ḥalitza with the sisters the rival wives are not exempt. when there exists Shimon’s ḥalitza , a valid ḥalitza , Reuven, to perform invalid ḥalitza with
llm_translation: He removed for his sisters - they were not exempt from the rival wives. Where the halitzah of Shimon is established, if Shimon performed halitzah it is valid, if Reuven performed halitzah for her, is the halitzah invalid?

hebrew_text: מַאי ״אֶחָד חוֹלֵץ לְכוּלָּן״ נָמֵי דְּקָאָמַר — אַאֶמְצָעִית. וְהָא ״כּוּלָּן״ קָאָמַר! כֵּיוָן דְּרוּבָּה גַּבֵּיהּ, קָרֵי לֵיהּ ״כּוּלָּן״. וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: כִּי קָאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל חֲלִיצָה מְעַלְּיָא בְּעֵינַן — הָנֵי מִילֵּי לְמִיפְטַר צָרָתָהּ, אֲבָל מִפְטַרא נַפְשַׁהּ — פָּטְרָה.
human_translation: What that it says: One performs ḥalitza with each of them, that stated? says that with regard to the middle one, But didn’t he say: Each of them, Since most are with him, and this is called: each of them. And if you wish, say When Shmuel said we require a full-fledged ḥalitza , this applies only to exempt her rival wife But to exempt herself, exempt.
llm_translation: What is "one who removes for all of them"? Also, what he is saying is - the middle. But he said "all of them"! Once the majority of it is removed, he calls it "all of them." And if you wish, say: When Shmuel said, we require removal from above - those words are to exempt her from her obligation, but to exempt her life - she is exempt.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא. אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: חָלַץ לַאֲחָיוֹת — לֹא נִפְטְרוּ צָרוֹת, לְצָרוֹת — נִפְטְרוּ אֲחָיוֹת. חָלַץ לְבַעֲלַת הַגֵּט — לֹא נִפְטְרָה צָרָה, לְצָרָה — נִפְטְרָה בַּעֲלַת הַגֵּט.
human_translation: the itself. Shmuel said: performed ḥalitza with the sisters, the rival wives are not exempt. with the rival wives, the sisters are exempt. performed ḥalitza with the woman who received a bill of divorce, the rival wife is not exempt. with the rival wife, the woman who received a bill of divorce is exempt.
llm_translation: Body. Samuel said: If he divorced his wives - his troubles were not resolved, if he divorced his troubles - his wives were resolved. If he divorced the holder of the divorce document - his rival was not resolved, if he divorced his rival - the holder of the divorce document was resolved.

hebrew_text: חָלַץ לְבַעֲלַת הַמַּאֲמָר — לֹא נִפְטְרָה צָרָה. לְצָרָה — נִפְטְרָה בַּעֲלַת מַאֲמָר.
human_translation: he performed ḥalitza with who received levirate betrothal the rival wife is not exempt. with the rival wife, she who received levirate betrothal is exempt
llm_translation: He removed for the wife of the statement - the trouble did not depart. For the trouble - the wife of the statement departed.

hebrew_text: מַאי שְׁנָא לַאֲחָיוֹת דְּלֹא נִפְטְרוּ צָרוֹת — דְּהָוְיָא (לוֹ) [לַהּ] אֲחוֹת אִשָּׁה בְּזִיקָה? חָלַץ לְצָרוֹת נָמֵי, לָא לִיפַּטְרוּ אֲחָיוֹת — דְּהָוְיָא לְהוּ צָרוֹת אֲחוֹת אִשָּׁה בְּזִיקָה! קָסָבַר שְׁמוּאֵל: אֵין זִיקָה.
human_translation: What is different with the sisters, are the rival wives not exempt? is to him the sister of a woman with whom he has a levirate bond. he performed ḥalitza with the rival wives, the sisters should not be exempt either, as the are to him as rival wives of the sister of a woman with whom he has a levirate bond. Shmuel holds the levirate bond is not substantial,
llm_translation: What is different about sisters who have not been released from their rivalries? Because it is for her sister a wife in a rivalrous relationship? He should have removed the rivalries, not to release the sisters - because it would be for him rivalries of a sister, a wife in a rivalrous relationship! Samuel holds: there is no rivalrous relationship.

hebrew_text: וְהָא אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל יֵשׁ זִיקָה! לְדִבְרֵי הָאוֹמֵר אֵין זִיקָה קָאָמַר.
human_translation: But didn’t Shmuel say the levirate bond is substantial? He stated in accordance with the statement of those who say that the levirate bond is not substantial,
llm_translation: And this, Samuel said, there is damage! According to the one who says there is no damage, he is saying.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, חָלַץ לָאֲחָיוֹת, אַמַּאי לֹא נִפְטְרוּ צָרוֹת? בִּשְׁלָמָא צָרָה דְרָחֵל לָא תִּיפְּטַר, דְּכֵיוָן דְּחָלֵץ לַהּ לְלֵאָה, וַהֲדַר חָלֵץ לְרָחֵל, הָוְיָא לַהּ חֲלִיצָה דְּרָחֵל חֲלִיצָה פְּסוּלָה. אֶלָּא צָרָה דְלֵאָה תִּיפְּטַר!
human_translation: If that is so, performed ḥalitza with the sisters, why were rival wives not exempt? Granted, Rachel’s rival wife, would not be exempt, for once he performed ḥalitza with Leah, and then performed ḥalitza with Rachel, Rachel’s ḥalitza was invalid ḥalitza , However, the rival wife of Leah should be exempt
llm_translation: If so, he divorced his wives, why were they not exempt from rival wives? Granted, the rival of Rachel would not be exempt, for since he divorced her for Leah, and then divorced Leah, the rival of Rachel would have an invalid divorce. Rather, the rival of Leah would be exempt!

hebrew_text: מַאי ״לֹא נִפְטְרוּ צָרוֹת״ נָמֵי דְּקָאָמַר — אַצָּרָה דְרָחֵל. וְהָא ״צָרוֹת״ קָאָמַר! צָרוֹת דְּעָלְמָא.
human_translation: What that it says: The rival wives are not exempt, that stated? to the rival wife of Rachel, But he said rival wives rival wives in general.
llm_translation: What is "they did not depart, sorrows"? Indeed, it means - the sorrow of Rachel. But it says "sorrows"! Sorrows of the world.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי: ״חָלַץ לְצָרוֹת נִפְטְרוּ אֲחָיוֹת״, וְאַצָּרַת רָחֵל מִי מִיפַּטְרָא? וְהָא תְּנַן: אָסוּר אָדָם בְּצָרַת קְרוֹבַת חֲלוּצָתוֹ!
human_translation: If that is so, he performed ḥalitza with the rival wives, the sisters are exempt. But would Rachel exempt with her rival wife? But didn’t we learn A man is forbidden to the rival wife of a close relative of his ḥalutza ?
llm_translation: So it is: "He removed for the troubles, his brothers were exempt," and Rachel's trouble, who is exempt from it? But didn't we learn: A person is prohibited from removing his close relative's trouble!

hebrew_text: שְׁמוּאֵל נָמֵי, הִתְחִיל וְלֹא הִתְחִיל קָאָמַר: הִתְחִיל בַּאֲחָיוֹת — לֹא יִגְמוֹר בְּצָרוֹת, דִּתְנַן: אָסוּר אָדָם בְּצָרַת קְרוֹבַת חֲלוּצָתוֹ. הִתְחִיל בְּצָרוֹת — יִגְמוֹר אַף בַּאֲחָיוֹת. דִּתְנַן: מוּתָּר אָדָם בִּקְרוֹבַת צָרַת חֲלוּצָתוֹ.
human_translation: Shmuel also he began and he did not begin. he began with the sisters, he may not finish by with the rival wives, as we learned A man is forbidden the rival wife of a close relative of his ḥalutza . he began with the rival wives he may finish with the sisters as well as we learned A man is permitted to the close relative of the rival wife of his ḥalutza .
llm_translation: Samuel indeed, began and did not begin, for he said: If one begins with his sisters - he should not finish with his troubles, as we learned: A person is forbidden in the troubles of his close relatives. If one begins with his troubles - he should also finish with his sisters, as we learned: A person is permitted in the troubles of his close relatives.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: לְעוֹלָם כִּדְקָאָמְרַתְּ, וּמִשּׁוּם דְּלָא אַלִּימָא זִיקָה לְשַׁוּוֹיֵי לְצָרָה כְּעֶרְוָה.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: Actually, as you said, is because the levirate bond is not strong as to render the a rival wife like forbidden relative.
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: Always as you said, and because not to say harm to compare to trouble like nakedness.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַב אָשֵׁי: חָלַץ לָאֲחָיוֹת — לֹא נִפְטְרוּ צָרוֹת. הָא לְצָרוֹת — נִפְטְרוּ אֲחָיוֹת. מַאי טַעְמָא — לָאו מִשּׁוּם דְּקָסָבַר יֵשׁ זִיקָה, וְלָא אַלִּימָא זִיקָה לְשַׁוּוֹיַיהּ לְצָרָה כְּעֶרְוָה?
human_translation: is taught in accordance with of Rav Ashi: he performed ḥalitza with the sisters, the rival wives are not exempt Consequently, with the rival wives, the sisters are exempt. What is the reason Is it not because held the levirate bond is substantial, but the levirate bond is not strong as to render the rival wife equivalent to a forbidden relative?
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Rav Ashi: If one divorces his sisters-in-law - the co-wives are not exempt from the rival wives. But if he divorces the rival wives - the sisters-in-law are exempt. What is the reason? Not because he holds that there is a connection, but rather that the connection is not comparable to the rival wife as it is to a forbidden relationship.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא בַּר מֶמֶל: הָא מַנִּי — בֵּית שַׁמַּאי הִיא. דִּתְנַן: בֵּית שַׁמַּאי מַתִּירִין הַצָּרוֹת לָאַחִין. אִי הָכִי, יַבּוֹמֵי נָמֵי תִּתְיַיבֵּם?
human_translation: Rabbi Abba bar Memel said: whose is this It is Beit Shammai, as we learned Beit Shammai permitted the rival wives to the brothers; If that is so, should enter into levirate marriage as well.
llm_translation: Rabbi Abba bar Memel said: This is the opinion of Beit Shammai. As we learned: Beit Shammai permit the sisters-in-law to the brothers. If so, will the levirate widows also be married?

hebrew_text: כְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן נוּרִי, דְּאָמַר: בּוֹאוּ וּנְתַקֵּן לָהֶן לַצָּרוֹת שֶׁיְּהוּ חוֹלְצוֹת וְלֹא מִתְיַיבְּמוֹת. וְהָאָמַר מָר: לָא הִסְפִּיקוּ לִגְמוֹר אֶת הַדָּבָר עַד שֶׁנִּטְרְפָה הַשָּׁעָה! אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: אַחֲרָיו חָזְרוּ וְתִקְּנוּ.
human_translation: in accordance with Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Nuri, who said: Come and let us establish that the rival wives must perform ḥalitza and may not enter into levirate marriage, But didn’t the Master say they did not succeed in finalizing the matter before the times of trouble came Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: After his returned established
llm_translation: As Rabbi Yochanan ben Nuri said: "Come and let us fix for them remedies so that they will be exempt and not require levirate marriage." But didn't Mar say: "They did not have enough time to finish the matter before the hour was up!" Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: "They reconsidered and fixed it afterward."

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ:
human_translation: a dilemma was raised before
llm_translation: The question was asked before them:

hebrew_text: בַּעֲלַת הַגֵּט וּבַעֲלַת מַאֲמָר, אֵיזוֹ מֵהֶן קוֹדֶמֶת? בַּעֲלַת הַגֵּט עֲדִיפָא, מִשּׁוּם דְּאַתְחֵיל בַּהּ בַּחֲלִיצָה, אוֹ דִלְמָא: בַּעֲלַת מַאֲמָר עֲדִיפָא, מִשּׁוּם דִּקְרוֹבָה לְבִיאָה.
human_translation: a woman who received a bill of divorce and a woman who received levirate betrothal, which has precedence Is the woman who received a bill of divorce preferred because he began the ḥalitza with her, Or perhaps the woman who received levirate betrothal is preferred, because she is closest to sexual intercourse.
llm_translation: The owner of the divorce document and the owner of the declaration, which one of them takes precedence? The owner of the divorce document is preferable, because it initiates with it in halitzah, or perhaps: the owner of the declaration is preferable, because she is closer to levirate marriage.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי, תָּא שְׁמַע: וּמוֹדֶה רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל שֶׁיֵּשׁ גֵּט אַחַר מַאֲמָר, וּמַאֲמַר אַחֵר גֵּט.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: Come hear: And Rabban Gamliel concedes that a bill of divorce is effective after levirate betrothal. levirate betrothal after a bill of divorce is effective.
llm_translation: Rav Ashei said, come and hear: Rabban Gamliel concedes that there is a divorce document after a statement, and a statement after a divorce document.

hebrew_text: אִי גֵּט עֲדִיף — לָא לַיהֲנֵי מַאֲמָר אַבָּתְרֵיהּ, וְאִי מַאֲמָר עֲדִיף — לָא לַיהֲנֵי גֵּט אַבָּתְרֵיהּ, אֶלָּא לָאו שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: כִּי הֲדָדֵי נִינְהוּ, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: If the bill of divorce is preferred levirate betrothal afterward should not be effective. And if levirate betrothal is preferred, a bill of divorce afterward should not be effective. Rather, not conclude from that the two are equivalent to each other? conclude from
llm_translation: If a get is preferable - not for the benefit of the statement of his father, and if the statement is preferable - not for the benefit of the get of his father, rather it is not a valid conclusion: for they are Hadadei, not a valid conclusion.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב: שְׁתֵּי אֲחָיוֹת יְבָמוֹת שֶׁנָּפְלוּ לִפְנֵי יָבָם אֶחָד, חָלַץ לָרִאשׁוֹנָה — הוּתְּרָה, חָלַץ לַשְּׁנִיָּיה — הוּתְּרָה.
human_translation: Rav Huna said Rav said: two sisters yevamot , who happened before one yavam he performed ḥalitza with the first she is permitted he performed ḥalitza with the second she is permitted
llm_translation: Rav Huna said in the name of Rav: Two yevamot sisters who fell before one yavam, if he performed chalitzah with the first one - she is permitted, if he performed chalitzah with the second one - she is permitted.

hebrew_text: מֵתָה רִאשׁוֹנָה — מוּתָּר בַּשְּׁנִיָּיה. וְאֵין צָרִיךְ לוֹמַר מֵתָה שְׁנִיָּיה שֶׁמּוּתָּר בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה, מִשּׁוּם דְּהָוְיָא יְבָמָה שֶׁהוּתְּרָה וְנֶאֶסְרָה וְחָזְרָה וְהוּתְּרָה — תַּחְזוֹר לְהֶיתֵּירָהּ הָרִאשׁוֹן.
human_translation: the first died is permitted to the second And needless to say, the second died, then he is permitted to the first because she would be a yevama who was permitted and forbidden and subsequently became permitted she can return to her original permitted status.
llm_translation: The first one died — permitted in the second. And needless to say, if the second one died, she is permitted in the first, because she becomes like a yevamah who was permitted, then forbidden, then permitted again — she reverts to her original permissibility.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: מֵתָה שְׁנִיָּיה — מוּתָּר בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה, אֲבָל מֵתָה רִאשׁוֹנָה — אָסוּר בַּשְּׁנִיָּיה. מַאי טַעְמָא? שֶׁכׇּל יְבָמָה שֶׁאֵין אֲנִי קוֹרֵא בָּהּ בִּשְׁעַת נְפִילָה ״יְבָמָהּ יָבֹא עָלֶיהָ״ — הֲרֵי זוֹ כְּאֵשֶׁת אָח שֶׁיֵּשׁ לָהּ בָּנִים, וַאֲסוּרָה.
human_translation: However, Rabbi Yoḥanan said: the second dies, he is permitted to the first. But if the first dies, he is prohibited from the second What is the reason that any yevama to whom the verse “her brother-in-law will have intercourse with her” cannot be applied at the time that she happens is then like the wife of a brother who has children, and she is forbidden
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: If the second one died - the first one is permitted, but if the first one died - the second one is forbidden. What is the reason? Because any yevamah that I do not read in it at the time of her fall "her yavam shall come upon her" - this is like the wife of a brother who has children, and she is forbidden.

hebrew_text: וְרַב לֵית לֵיהּ הַאי סְבָרָא? וְהָאָמַר רַב: כׇּל אִשָּׁה שֶׁאֵין אֲנִי קוֹרֵא בָּהּ בִּשְׁעַת נְפִילָה ״יְבָמָהּ יָבֹא עָלֶיהָ״ — הֲרֵי הִיא כְּאֵשֶׁת אָח שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ בָּנִים, וַאֲסוּרָה! הָנֵי מִילֵּי הֵיכָא דְּקָאֵי בְּאַפַּהּ אִיסּוּר אֲחוֹת אִשָּׁה דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא, אֲבָל הָכָא — זִיקָּה דְּרַבָּנַן הִיא.
human_translation: And does Rav not accept that reason? Didn’t Rav say Any woman to whom the verse “her brother-in-law will have intercourse with her” cannot be applied at the time that she happens is then like the wife of a brother who has children, and she is forbidden This applies only when that stands before her is the prohibition against marrying the sister of one’s wife, which is prohibited by Torah But here a levirate bond. by rabbinic
llm_translation: And Rav does not hold this opinion? But Rav said: Any woman that I do not read in her at the time of her fall "her brother-in-law shall come upon her" - she is like the wife of a brother who has children, and she is forbidden! These matters apply where there is a prohibition of a sister-in-law from the Torah, but here - it is a rabbinic enactment.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר חֲנִינָא לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אַרְבָּעָה אַחִין, שְׁנַיִם מֵהֶם נְשׂוּאִים שְׁתֵּי אֲחָיוֹת, וּמֵתוּ הַנְּשׂוּאִין אֶת הָאֲחָיוֹת — הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ חוֹלְצוֹת וְלֹא מִתְיַיבְּמוֹת. וְאַמַּאי? לֵיקוּ חַד מִינַּיְיהוּ, לַחְלוֹץ לָהּ לִשְׁנִיָּיה, וְתִיהְוֵי רִאשׁוֹנָה לְגַבֵּי אִידַּךְ כִּיבָמָה שֶׁהוּתְּרָה וְנֶאֶסְרָה וְחָזְרָה וְהוּתְּרָה — תַּחְזוֹר לְהֶיתֵּירָהּ הָרִאשׁוֹן!
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei bar Ḥanina raised an objection to Rabbi Yoḥanan four brothers, two of whom were married to two sisters, and those married to the sisters died, then those must perform ḥalitza and may not enter into levirate marriage. And why Let one of rise and perform ḥalitza with the second the first would be like a yevama who was permitted forbidden and subsequently became permitted insofar as the other is concerned. she should return to her original permitted status.
llm_translation: He raised an objection to him, Rabbi Yosei bar Hanina raised an objection to Rabbi Yohanan: Four brothers, two of them married two sisters, and the married ones died without children - these are exempt and not subject to levirate marriage. And why? Let one of them remove his obligation to the other, and the first one will be like the second in terms of levirate marriage, which was permitted, prohibited, permitted again, and then prohibited - it should return to its original state of being permitted!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֲחָיוֹת אֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ מִי שְׁנָאָן. וְלֵימָא לֵיהּ: מַאי ״חוֹלְצוֹת״ נָמֵי דְּקָתָנֵי — חוֹלֶצֶת חֲדָא! ״חוֹלְצוֹת״ קָתָנֵי.
human_translation: said to him: I do not know who taught: Sisters. Let him say to him, What is perform ḥalitza , which teaches? one performs ḥalitza . teaches Perform ḥalitza ,
llm_translation: He said to him: I do not know who changed them. And let him say to him: What is "choltsot" also that it is taught - a single choltsah! It is taught "choltsot."

hebrew_text: וְלֵימָא לֵיהּ: מַאי ״חוֹלְצוֹת״ — חוֹלְצוֹת דְּעָלְמָא! ״הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ״ קָתָנֵי. וְלֵימָא: דַּחֲלֵיץ לַיהּ לְרִאשׁוֹנָה בְּרֵישָׁא! ״חוֹלְצוֹת״
human_translation: And let say to him: What is perform ḥalitza ? They perform ḥalitza in general. teaches: Then those And let him say where performed ḥalitza with the first first. Perform ḥalitza ,
llm_translation: And let him say to him: What is "choltsot" - choltsot of the world! "Here are they" it teaches. And let him say: that he should remove it to the first one at the beginning! "Choltsot"

hebrew_text: לְכַתְּחִלָּה קָתָנֵי. וְלֵימָא לֵיהּ: גְּזֵירָה דִּלְמָא קְדֵים וַחֲלֵיץ לְרִאשׁוֹנָה בְּרֵישָׁא! ״וְלֹא מִתְיַיבְּמוֹת״ קָתָנֵי, דְּלֵיכָּא דִּין יִבּוּם הָכָא כְּלָל.
human_translation: teaches ab initio . let him say to him decree lest he proceed and perform the ḥalitza with the first first, It teaches: They may not enter into levirate marriage. the halakha of levirate marriage does not apply here at all.
llm_translation: At the outset, it is taught. And let us say to him: Perhaps it is a decree, lest one precede and exempt the first one at the beginning! "And they shall not be taken as wives" it is taught, for there is no law of levirate marriage here as a general principle.

hebrew_text: וְלֵימָא לֵיהּ: גְּזֵירָה שֶׁמָּא יָמוּת, וְאָסוּר לְבַטֵּל מִצְוַת יְבָמִין! רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן לְמִיתָה לָא חָיֵישׁ.
human_translation: And let him say to him decree lest die, and it is prohibited to negate the mitzva of levirate marriage. Rabbi Yoḥanan was not concerned over death
llm_translation: And say to him: A decree lest he die, and it is forbidden to annul the mitzvah of yibum! Rabbi Yochanan is not concerned for death.

hebrew_text: וְלֵימָא לֵיהּ: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר הִיא, דְּאָמַר: כֵּיוָן שֶׁעָמְדָה עָלָיו שָׁעָה אַחַת בְּאִיסּוּר — נֶאֶסְרָה עָלָיו עוֹלָמִית. מִדְּסֵיפָא רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, רֵישָׁא לָאו רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר.
human_translation: And let say to him is Rabbi Elazar, who said: Once stood before him at one time as forbidden, she remains forbidden to him forever. Since Rabbi Elazar in the latter clause the first clause is not Rabbi Elazar.
llm_translation: And say to him: Rabbi Elazar it is, who said: Once she stood over him for one moment in prohibition - she is prohibited to him forever. From the end of the statement, Rabbi Elazar, the beginning is not Rabbi Elazar.

hebrew_text: וְנֵימָא לְהוּ: דִּנְפוּל בְּבַת אַחַת, וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי הִיא, דְּאָמַר: אֶפְשָׁר לְצַמְצֵם! לָא סְתַם לַן תַּנָּא כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי.
human_translation: And let him say to him where happened before at the same time. And is Rabbi Yosei HaGelili, who says: It is possible to be precise. The tanna did not teach an unattributed in accordance with Rabbi Yosei HaGelili.
llm_translation: And it was said to them: that he fell in one pit, and Rabbi Yosei the Galilean it is, as he said: it is possible to narrow down! We did not learn a Mishnah like Rabbi Yosei the Galilean.

hebrew_text: וְלֵימָא לֵיהּ: דְּלָא יָדְעִינַן הֵי נְפוּל בְּרֵישָׁא.
human_translation: And let him say to him we do not know which happened first.
llm_translation: And say to him: for we do not know if he fell at the beginning.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי — הַיְינוּ דְּקָתָנֵי קָדְמוּ וְכָנְסוּ יוֹצִיאוּ? בִּשְׁלָמָא רִאשׁוֹנָה, אָמְרִינַן לֵיהּ: מַאן שְׁרָא לָךְ? אֶלָּא שְׁנִיָּה, אָמַר: חַבְרַאי שְׁנִיָּה יַיבֵּם, אֲנָא רִאשׁוֹנָה מְיַיבֵּם.
human_translation: If so, that which teaches And if they married before they should divorce them, Granted, the first we say to him: Who permitted her to you? However, the second could say: My fellow consummated the levirate marriage with the second I am consummating the levirate marriage with the first
llm_translation: So is this the case — that which was taught: They went in and then they came out, they fulfill their obligation? Regarding the first case, we say to him: Who allows you? Rather, in the second case, he said: My colleague will perform the levirate marriage, and I will perform the levirate marriage in the first case.

hebrew_text: הַיְינוּ דְּקָאָמַר לֵיהּ: אֲחָיוֹת אֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ מִי שְׁנָאָן.
human_translation: this is what said to I do not know who taught: Sisters,
llm_translation: That is to say, he said to him: "I do not know who changed them."

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: הָיְתָה אַחַת מֵהֶן אֲסוּרָה עַל הָאֶחָד אִיסּוּר עֶרְוָה — אָסוּר בָּהּ וּמוּתָּר בַּאֲחוֹתָהּ, וְהַשֵּׁנִי אָסוּר בִּשְׁתֵּיהֶן. סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ דִּנְפַלָה חֲמוֹתוֹ תְּחִלָּה.
human_translation: We learned one of was forbidden to one prohibition against forbidden relatives he is prohibited from her but permitted to her sister. the second is prohibited from both of them. It enters your mind that his mother-in-law, happened first.
llm_translation: We learned: If one of them was forbidden to marry one due to a prohibition of incest - he is forbidden to her and permitted to her sister, and the second is forbidden to both. Is it conceivable in your opinion that his mother-in-law fell first.

hebrew_text: וְאַמַּאי? לֵיקוּ חָתָן לְיַיבֵּם הָךְ דְּאֵינָהּ חֲמוֹתוֹ בְּרֵישָׁא, וְתֶהֱוֵי חֲמוֹתוֹ לְגַבֵּי אִידַּךְ כִּיבָמָה שֶׁהוּתְּרָה וְנֶאֶסְרָה וְחָזְרָה וְהוּתְּרָה, תַּחְזוֹר לְהֶיתֵּרָהּ הָרִאשׁוֹן!
human_translation: And why Let the son-in-law rise and consummate the levirate marriage with who is not his mother-in-law first. Consequently, with regard to the other his mother-in-law would be a yevama who was permitted and then forbidden and then subsequently became permitted should return to her original permitted status
llm_translation: And why? To establish the brother-in-law for the yavam, that she is not his mother-in-law initially, and she will be his mother-in-law to the other, like yibum that was permitted and prohibited and permitted and prohibited, she shall return to her initial permission!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: כְּגוֹן דִּנְפַלָה הָךְ דְּאֵינָהּ חֲמוֹתוֹ בְּרֵישָׁא.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: where who was not his mother-in-law happened first,
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: For example, if this one fell, and his mother-in-law with him at the beginning.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים וְכוּ׳. תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: יְקַיְּימוּ, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: יוֹצִיאוּ. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: יְקַיְּימוּ. אַבָּא שָׁאוּל אוֹמֵר: קַל הָיָה לָהֶם לְבֵית הִלֵּל בְּדָבָר זֶה, שֶׁבֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: יוֹצִיאוּ, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: יְקַיְּימוּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says Beit Shammai say: is taught Rabbi Eliezer says Beit Shammai say: They may maintain them and Beit Hillel say: They should divorce them. Rabbi Shimon says: They may maintain them Abba Shaul says: This was a matter of leniency for Beit Hillel. as Beit Shammai say: They should divorce them, and Beit Hillel say: They may maintain
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: Beit Shammai say, etc. It was taught: Rabbi Eliezer says, Beit Shammai say: uphold, and Beit Hillel say: exempt. Rabbi Shimon says: uphold. Abba Shaul says: It was easy for Beit Hillel in this matter, for Beit Shammai say: exempt, and Beit Hillel say: uphold.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן כְּמַאן? אִי כְּבֵית שַׁמַּאי — הַיְינוּ רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר. אִי כְּבֵית הִלֵּל — הַיְינוּ אַבָּא שָׁאוּל! הָכִי קָאָמַר: לֹא נֶחְלְקוּ בֵּית שַׁמַּאי וּבֵית הִלֵּל בְּדָבָר זֶה.
human_translation: In accordance with whose is Rabbi Shimon? if in accordance with Beit Shammai, that is Rabbi Eliezer. If, in accordance with Beit Hillel, that is Abba Shaul. This is what he is saying: Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel did not dispute this matter;
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon, according to whom? If according to Beit Shammai — that is Rabbi Eliezer. If according to Beit Hillel — that is Abba Sha'ul! This is what he is saying: Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel did not dispute in this matter.

hebrew_text: הָיְתָה אַחַת מֵהֶם כּוּ׳. הָא תְּנֵינָא חֲדָא זִימְנָא: אֲחוֹתָהּ כְּשֶׁהִיא יְבִמְתָּהּ — אוֹ חוֹלֶצֶת אוֹ מִתְיַיבֶּמֶת!
human_translation: one of was We learned on one occasion: When her sister, is her yevama she either performs ḥalitza or enters into levirate marriage.
llm_translation: One of them was like so. Is it not taught: One time: her sister when she is her yevamah - either she performs chalitzah or she does yibum!

hebrew_text: צְרִיכָא, דְּאִי אַשְׁמְועִינַן הָתָם: מִשּׁוּם דְּלֵיכָּא לְמִיגְזַר מִשּׁוּם שֵׁנִי, אֲבָל הָכָא, דְּאִיכָּא לְמִיגְזַר מִשּׁוּם שֵׁנִי — אֵימָא לָא.
human_translation: necessary for if it taught us there because there is no to issue decree due to a second Here, however, where there is to issue decree due to the second I would say not
llm_translation: The matter is, for if we were to hear there: because it is not similar to cut off because of a second, but here, where it is similar to cut off because of a second — say no.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אַשְׁמוּעִינַן הָכָא: מִשּׁוּם דְּאִיכָּא שֵׁנִי דְּקָא מוֹכַח, אֲבָל הָתָם, דְּלֵיכָּא שֵׁנִי — אֵימָא לָא. צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: And if had taught us here, because there is indicates, However, there, is not a second I would say no, necessary
llm_translation: And if you will say we hear here: because there are two, it is evident, but there, where there are not two - say no. Necessary.

hebrew_text: אִיסּוּר מִצְוָה כּוּ׳. הָא נָמֵי תְּנֵינָא:
human_translation: a prohibition a mitzva We learned this as well:
llm_translation: Prohibition of a positive commandment, like. The Gemara asks: Is that so? We learned in a Mishnah:

hebrew_text: אִיסּוּר מִצְוָה וְאִיסּוּר קְדוּשָּׁה — חוֹלֶצֶת וְלֹא מִתְיַיבֶּמֶת! הָתָם, אִיסּוּר מִצְוָה לְחוֹדַהּ, הָכָא, אִיסּוּר מִצְוָה, וַאֲחוֹתָהּ.
human_translation: a prohibition a mitzva a prohibition sanctity perform ḥalitza and she may not enter into levirate marriage. There, a prohibition due to a mitzva alone. Here, a prohibition a mitzva and, her sister
llm_translation: Prohibition of a commandment and prohibition of sanctity - she performs halitzah but does not perform levirate marriage! There, it is a prohibition of a commandment to make her single, here, it is a prohibition of a commandment, and her sister.

hebrew_text: סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: לֵיקוּם אִיסּוּר מִצְוָה בִּמְקוֹם אִיסּוּר עֶרְוָה — וְתִתְיַיבֵּם, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: It might enter your mind to say: Let the prohibition a mitzva stand in place, as the prohibition against forbidden relatives. and Let enter into levirate marriage. this comes to teach us
llm_translation: I will ascend to your opinion: to establish a prohibition of a commandment in the place of a prohibition of forbidden relationships — and it was stated, this implies to us.

hebrew_text: וְתִתְיַיבֵּם? כֵּיוָן דְּמִדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא רַמְיָא קַמֵּיהּ, קָא פָגַע בַּאֲחוֹת זְקוּקָתוֹ. סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: מִשּׁוּם מִצְוָה עֲבוּד רַבָּנַן, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: And does enter into levirate marriage? because by Torah is set before he would be encountering the sister of the woman with whom he has It might enter your mind to say due to the mitzva the Sages did as they did teaches us
llm_translation: And should he marry them? Since he raises a contradiction from the Torah, he encounters his sister-in-law. Do you think I would say: Because of the Rabbinic commandment, he is teaching us.

hebrew_text: הָיְתָה אַחַת מֵהֶן כּוּ׳. הָא תּוּ לְמָה לִי, הַיְינוּ הָךְ: מָה לִי לְחַד מָה לִי לִתְרֵי?!
human_translation: one of those Why do I need this as well, for this is that what is the to me one or two
llm_translation: One of them was like so. This one: Why do I need it? That is: What do I need one for? What do I need two for?

hebrew_text: צְרִיכָא: דְּאִי אַשְׁמְועִינַן הָתָם, מִשּׁוּם דְּאִיכָּא שֵׁנִי דְּמוֹכַח, אֲבָל הָכָא, דְּלֵיכָּא שֵׁנִי דְּקָא מוֹכַח, אֵימָא לָא.
human_translation: necessary for if it taught us there, This is because there is a second who indicates However, here, is not a second who indicates I would say no;
llm_translation: Issue: because if we would hear there, because there is a second one that is evident, but here, because there is no second one that is evident, say no.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אַשְׁמְועִינַן הָכָא: אַדְּרַבָּה, תַּרְוַויְיהוּ מוֹכְחִי אַהֲדָדֵי, אֲבָל אִידַּךְ — לָא, צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: And If it taught us here, On the contrary, they both indicate each other’s But in the other no, necessary
llm_translation: And if we were to hear here: AdRabba, both of them are proven to each other, but the other - no, it is necessary.

hebrew_text: זוֹ הִיא שֶׁאָמְרוּ וְכוּ׳. ״זוֹ הִיא״ לְמַעוֹטֵי מַאי? לְמַעוֹטֵי אִיסּוּר מִצְוָה לָזֶה וְאִיסּוּר מִצְוָה לָזֶה.
human_translation: And this is they said: What does This is, exclude? It excludes a prohibition a mitzva for this and a prohibition a mitzva for that
llm_translation: This is what they said, etc. "This is" to exclude what? To exclude prohibitions of one mitzvah to another and prohibitions of one mitzvah to another.

hebrew_text: הָא תּוּ לְמָה לִי, הַיְינוּ הָךְ: מָה לִי לְחַד, מָה לִי לִתְרֵי?!
human_translation: Why do I need this as well? This is that What is to me one or two?
llm_translation: This, what to me, this is it: What to me for one, what to me for two?!

hebrew_text: מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: כִּי לָא אָמְרִינַן אוֹקֵי אִיסּוּר מִצְוָה בִּמְקוֹם אִיסּוּר עֶרְוָה — הֵיכָא דְּאִיכָּא לְמִיגְזַר מִשּׁוּם שֵׁנִי, אֲבָל הֵיכָא דְּלֵיכָּא לְמִיגְזַר מִשּׁוּם שֵׁנִי, אֵימָא: לְהַאי אוֹקֵימְנָא אִיסּוּר מִצְוָה בִּמְקוֹם אִיסּוּר עֶרְוָה, וּלְהַאי [אוֹקֵימְנָא] אִיסּוּר מִצְוָה בִּמְקוֹם אִיסּוּר עֶרְוָה, וְלִיַּיבְּמוּ, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: Lest you say: when we do not say: Let the prohibition a mitzva stand in place, as a prohibition against forbidden relatives. where it is to issue decree due to the second But where it is not to issue decree due to the second say: For this let us stand the prohibition a mitzva in place as a prohibition against forbidden relatives, and for this let us stand the prohibition a mitzva in place as a prohibition against forbidden relatives, and consummate the levirate marriage. it teaches us
llm_translation: What is the reasoning? Since we do not say that a prohibition of a commandment in a place of a prohibition of forbidden relationships - where there is a concern for a second transgression, but where there is no concern for a second transgression, say: We establish a prohibition of a commandment in a place of a prohibition of forbidden relationships, and we establish a prohibition of a commandment in a place of a prohibition of forbidden relationships, and they perform levirate marriage, this is what we can infer.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב, וְכֵן תָּנֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא: בְּכוּלָּן אֲנִי קוֹרֵא בָּהֶן, הָאֲסוּרָה לָזֶה מוּתֶּרֶת לָזֶה, וַאֲחוֹתָהּ כְּשֶׁהִיא יְבִמְתָּהּ — אוֹ חוֹלֶצֶת אוֹ מִתְיַיבֶּמֶת.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said that Rav said, and similarly Rabbi Ḥiyya teaches With regard to all of those I could apply she who is forbidden to this is permitted to that as well as when her sister is also her yevama she may either perform ḥalitza or enter into levirate marriage.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav, and similarly Rabbi Chiya taught: In all of them I read, the one forbidden to this one is permitted to that one, and her sister when she is her yevamah - either she performs chalitzah or she does yibum.

hebrew_text: וְרַב יְהוּדָה מְתַרְגֵּם מֵחֲמוֹתוֹ וְאֵילָךְ, אֲבָל שִׁיתָּא בָּבֵי דְרֵישָׁא — לָא.
human_translation: But Rav Yehuda interprets from mother-in-law of and onward, but not to the six cases at the beginning,
llm_translation: And Rav Yehudah translates from his mother-in-law and onwards, but six in the house of Reishah - no.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא — כֵּיוָן דְּבִתּוֹ בְּאוּנְסִין הוּא דְּמַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ, בְּנִשּׂוּאִין לָא מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ.
human_translation: What is the reason This is because you find through rape, but you cannot find it through marriage.
llm_translation: What is the reason? Since he is under duress, he forgets it; but in normal circumstances, he does not forget it.

hebrew_text: בְּנִשּׂוּאִין קָמַיְירֵי, בְּאוּנְסִין לָא קָא מַיְירֵי.
human_translation: deals with marriage but does not deal with rape,
llm_translation: In matters of marriage, consent is effective; in matters of coercion, consent is not effective.

hebrew_text: וְאַבָּיֵי מְתַרְגֵּם אַף בִּתּוֹ (בָּאָה) מֵאֲנוּסָתוֹ, כֵּיוָן דְּאַשְׁכּוֹחֵי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ, אִי בָּעֲיָא — בְּאוּנְסִין תֶּיהְוֵי, אִי בָּעֲיָא — בְּנִשּׂוּאִין תִּהְוֵי. אֲבָל אֵשֶׁת אָחִיו שֶׁלֹּא הָיָה בְּעוֹלָמוֹ — לָא. כֵּיוָן דְּאַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן הוּא דְּמַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ, אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבָּנַן לָא מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ — בִּפְלוּגְתָּא לָא קָמַיְירֵי.
human_translation: And Abaye interprets even to his daughter from a woman he raped. Since you find this if wants rape, let it; if it wants marriage, let it. However, it cannot the wife of a brother with whom he did not coexist. since you can find according to Rabbi Shimon, while cannot be found according to the Rabbis. does not deal with dispute.
llm_translation: And Abbaye translates even his daughter (who comes) from her captor, since he is accustomed to her, if he wants - it will be considered as coercion, if he wants - it will be considered as marriage. But the wife of his brother who was not in his world - no. Since in the presence of Rabbi Shimon, he forgets her, in the presence of the Rabbis, he does not forget her - they do not argue.

hebrew_text: וְרַב סָפְרָא מְתַרְגֵּם אַף אֵשֶׁת אָחִיו שֶׁלֹּא הָיָה בְּעוֹלָמוֹ, וּמַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ בְּשִׁיתָּא אַחֵי וְאַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן. וְסִימָנָיךְ: מֵת נוֹלַד וְיִיבֵּם, מֵת נוֹלַד וְיִיבֵּם.
human_translation: And Rav Safra interprets wife of a brother with whom he did not coexist, and you find this in the case six brothers and according to Rabbi Shimon. And your mnemonic is Died, born, consummated the levirate marriage; died, born, consummated the levirate marriage.
llm_translation: Rav Safra translates even the wife of his brother who was not in his world, and she forgets him in the sixth year of the brothers, and in the presence of Rabbi Shimon. And your mnemonic: If a dead man is born a son, he shall perform yibum; if a dead man is born a son, he shall perform yibum.

hebrew_text: רְאוּבֵן וְשִׁמְעוֹן נְשׂוּאִין שְׁתֵּי אֲחָיוֹת, לֵוִי וִיהוּדָה נְשׂוּאִין שְׁתֵּי נׇכְרִיּוֹת. מֵת רְאוּבֵן, נוֹלַד יִשָּׂשכָר, וְיִיבֵּם לֵוִי. מֵת שִׁמְעוֹן, נוֹלַד זְבוּלֻן, וְיִיבֵּם יְהוּדָה. מֵתוּ לֵוִי וִיהוּדָה בְּלֹא בָּנִים, וְנָפְלוּ לְהוּ קַמֵּי יִשָּׂשכָר וּזְבוּלֻן.
human_translation: Reuven and Shimon, married two sisters. Levi and Yehuda, married two unrelated women. Reuven died, Yissakhar was born, and Levi consummated the levirate marriage Shimon died, Zevulun was born, and Yehuda consummated the levirate marriage Levi and Yehuda died childless and happened before Yissakhar and Zevulun for levirate marriage.
llm_translation: Reuven and Shimon married two sisters, Levi and Yehuda married two non-Jewish women. Reuven died, Yissachar was born, and he shall perform yibum for Levi. Shimon died, Zevulun was born, and he shall perform yibum for Yehuda. Levi and Yehuda died childless, and they fell to be before Yissachar and Zevulun.

hebrew_text: הָאֲסוּרָה לָזֶה — מוּתֶּרֶת לָזֶה. וְהָאֲסוּרָה לָזֶה — מוּתֶּרֶת לָזֶה. וַאֲחוֹתָהּ שֶׁהִיא יְבִמְתָּהּ.
human_translation: is forbidden to this she is permitted to this she who is forbidden to this is permitted to that her sister who is her yevama ,
llm_translation: The one forbidden to this one — permitted to this one. And the one forbidden to this one — permitted to this one. And her sister who is her yevamah.

hebrew_text: לְמָה לִי יִיבֵּם יְהוּדָה? בְּלָא יִיבֵּם יְהוּדָה נָמֵי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ!
human_translation: Why do I Yehuda consummated the levirate marriage? You can find this in Yehuda did not consummate the levirate marriage as well.
llm_translation: "Why should Judah perform levirate marriage? Without Judah performing levirate marriage, she is also forgotten!"

hebrew_text: מִשּׁוּם צָרָה. הָא תִּינַח צָרָה, צָרָה דְצָרָה מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר?
human_translation: due to the rival wife. This works out well a rival wife what can be said the rival wife of a rival wife?
llm_translation: Because of a difficulty. Here, let the difficulty be placed, what is the difficulty of a difficulty?

hebrew_text: כְּגוֹן דַּהֲדַר וְיַבְּמִינְהוּ נָמֵי גָּד וְאָשֵׁר.
human_translation: where Gad and Asher subsequently consummated the levirate marriage as well.
llm_translation: For example, when Hadar and Yabeminhu are like Gad and Asher.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ שְׁלֹשָׁה אַחִין, שְׁנַיִם מֵהֶן נְשׂוּאִין שְׁתֵּי אֲחָיוֹת, אוֹ אִשָּׁה וּבִתָּהּ, אוֹ אִשָּׁה וּבַת בִּתָּהּ, אוֹ אִשָּׁה וּבַת בְּנָהּ — הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ חוֹלְצוֹת וְלֹא מִתְיַיבְּמוֹת. וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן פּוֹטֵר.
human_translation: three brothers, two of whom were married to two sisters; or a woman and her daughter; or a woman and her daughter’s daughter; or a woman and her son’s daughter, then these perform ḥalitza and may not enter into levirate marriage, And Rabbi Shimon exempts
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: Three brothers, two of them are married to two sisters, or a woman and her daughter, or a woman and her granddaughter, or a woman and her great-granddaughter — these are cases of halitzah and not of levirate marriage. Rabbi Shimon exempts them.

hebrew_text: הָיְתָה אַחַת מֵהֶן אֲסוּרָה עָלָיו אִיסּוּר עֶרְוָה — אָסוּר בָּהּ, וּמוּתָּר בַּאֲחוֹתָהּ. אִיסּוּר מִצְוָה אוֹ אִיסּוּר קְדוּשָּׁה — חוֹלְצוֹת וְלֹא מִתְיַיבְּמוֹת.
human_translation: one of them was forbidden to him, a prohibition against forbidden relatives, he is prohibited from her but is permitted to her sister. a prohibition a mitzva or a prohibition sanctity, they perform ḥalitza and may not enter into levirate marriage.
llm_translation: If one of them was forbidden to him due to a prohibition of incest - he is forbidden in her, but permitted in her sister. Whether it is a prohibition of a positive commandment or a prohibition of sanctity - they perform halitzah and do not engage in levirate marriage.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תַּנְיָא: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן פּוֹטֵר בִּשְׁתֵּיהֶן מִן הַחֲלִיצָה וּמִן הַיִּיבּוּם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְאִשָּׁה אֶל אֲחוֹתָהּ לֹא תִקָּח לִצְרוֹר״. בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁנַּעֲשׂוּ צָרוֹת זוֹ לָזוֹ — לֹא יְהֵא לְךָ לִיקּוּחִין אֲפִילּוּ בְּאַחַת מֵהֶן.
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Shimon exempts both of them from ḥalitza and from levirate marriage, as it is stated: “And you shall not take a woman to her sister, to be a rival to her” at the time that they are to become rival wives to each other, you shall not have to take even one of them
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemara: Rabbi Shimon exempts from both halitzah and yibum, as it is stated: 'A woman to her sister you shall not take to be a rival wife.' When these rivals are to each other - you should not take them even one of them." English translation:

hebrew_text: הָיְתָה אַחַת מֵהֶן כּוּ׳. הָא תּוּ לְמָה לִי, הַיְינוּ הָךְ!
human_translation: one of them was Why do I need this as well? This is that
llm_translation: One of them was like so. Why do I need it? That's it!

hebrew_text: לְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אִיצְטְרִיךְ, סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: הוֹאִיל וְאָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן שְׁתֵּי אֲחָיוֹת לֹא חוֹלְצוֹת וְלֹא מִתְיַיבְּמוֹת, לִגְזוֹר מִשּׁוּם שְׁתֵּי אֲחָיוֹת דְּעָלְמָא, קָמַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: It was necessary according to Rabbi Shimon. It might enter your mind to say: Since Rabbi Shimon said two sisters may not perform ḥalitza and may not enter into levirate marriage, we should issue decree due to two sisters in general This teaches us
llm_translation: To Rabbi Shimon it is necessary, as your mind says: Since Rabbi Shimon said, two sisters do not perform ḥalitzah nor do they perform levirate marriage, to decree due to two sisters in general, it is heard for us.

hebrew_text: אִיסּוּר מִצְוָה כּוּ׳.
human_translation: a prohibition a mitzva
llm_translation: Prohibition of a commandment like so.

hebrew_text: וְהָא אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: שְׁתֵּי אֲחָיוֹת לֹא חוֹלְצוֹת וְלֹא מִתְיַיבְּמוֹת!
human_translation: But didn’t Rabbi Shimon say: Two sisters neither perform ḥalitza nor enter into levirate marriage?
llm_translation: And this, Rabbi Shimon said: Two sisters do not perform chalitzah and do not engage in levirate marriage!

hebrew_text: גְּזֵירָה מִשּׁוּם אִיסּוּר מִצְוָה דְּעָלְמָא.
human_translation: a rabbinic decree due to the general case of a prohibition a mitzva.
llm_translation: A decree because of the prohibition of a positive commandment of the world.

hebrew_text: הָא תִּינַח אִיהִי, אֲחוֹתָהּ מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? גְּזֵירָה אֲחוֹתָהּ מִשּׁוּם לַתָּא דִּידַהּ.
human_translation: This works out well she her sister, what is there to say? a rabbinic decree her sister due to her.
llm_translation: Here is the translation of the Talmudic text you provided: Talmudic text: "Ha tinach ihi, achotah mai ikka le'meimar? Gezeirah achotah mishum lata didah." English translation: "This one, her sister, what is there to say? A decree regarding her sister because of her own case."

hebrew_text: וְהָא גַּבֵּי עֶרְוָה לָא גָּזְרִינַן? שָׁאנֵי עֶרְוָה דְּמִגְמָר גְּמִירִי לַהּ אִינָשֵׁי, וְקָלָא אִית לַהּ.
human_translation: But, with regard to a forbidden relative we do not issue a decree Forbidden relatives are different, as people learn them and has publicity.
llm_translation: And this regarding nakedness, do we not decree? It is different with nakedness, for people are accustomed to it, and it is easy for them.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ שְׁלֹשָׁה אַחִין, שְׁנַיִם נְשׂוּאִים שְׁתֵּי אֲחָיוֹת וְאֶחָד מוּפְנֶה. מֵת אֶחָד מִבַּעֲלֵי אֲחָיוֹת, וְעָשָׂה בָּהּ מוּפְנֶה מַאֲמָר. וְאַחַר כָּךְ מֵת אָחִיו הַשֵּׁנִי —
human_translation: three brothers, two were married to two sisters, and one who was single, The husband of one of the sisters died and the single performed levirate betrothal [ ma’amar ] Afterward, the second brother died,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: Three brothers, two of whom are married to two sisters, and one is unmarried. If one of the husbands of the sisters dies, and the unmarried brother performs chalitzah with her, and then the second brother dies —

hebrew_text: בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: אִשְׁתּוֹ עִמּוֹ, וְהַלֵּזוּ תֵּצֵא מִשּׁוּם אֲחוֹת אִשָּׁה. וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: מוֹצִיא אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ בְּגֵט וּבַחֲלִיצָה, וְאֵשֶׁת אָחִיו בַּחֲלִיצָה. זוֹ הִיא שֶׁאָמְרוּ: אוֹי לוֹ עַל אִשְׁתּוֹ, וְאוֹי לוֹ עַל אֵשֶׁת אָחִיו.
human_translation: Beit Shammai say: His wife remains with him. And this other leaves as the sister of a wife. Beit Hillel say: he divorces his wife, with a bill of divorce, and by ḥalitza , And, the wife of his brother with ḥalitza This is that said: Woe unto him for his wife and woe unto him for the wife of his brother.
llm_translation: House of Shammai say: His wife with him, and this one will go out because of sister of wife. And House of Hillel say: He divorces his wife with a bill of divorce and with levirate marriage, and the wife of his brother with levirate marriage. This is what they said: Woe to him for his wife, and woe to him for the wife of his brother.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ ״זוֹ הִיא״ לְמַעוֹטֵי מַאי? לְמַעוֹטֵי הָךְ דְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ, דְּלָא עָבְדִינַן כְּווֹתֵיהּ. אֶלָּא אִי כְּרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, אִי כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר.
human_translation: What This is, to exclude? It excludes that of Rabbi Yehoshua that we do not act in accordance with his Rather, either in accordance with Rabban Gamliel or in accordance with Rabbi Elazar.
llm_translation: Gemara: "This is to exclude what? To exclude the opinion of Rabbi Yehoshua, for we do not follow his view. Rather, either like Rabban Gamliel or like Rabbi Elazar."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: לָא תֵּימָא מַאֲמָר לְבֵית שַׁמַּאי קוֹנֶה קִנְיָן גָּמוּר, דְּאִי בָּעֵי לְאַפּוֹקֵי סַגִּי לַהּ בְּגִיטָּא, אֶלָּא מַאֲמָר לְבֵית שַׁמַּאי אֵינוֹ קוֹנֶה אֶלָּא לִדְחוֹת בַּצָּרָה בִּלְבָד.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: Do not say levirate betrothal acquires as a full-fledged acquisition according to Beit Shammai, that if he wants to divorce a bill of divorce would suffice Rather, for Beit Shammai, levirate betrothal acquires only as it precludes a rival wife
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: Do not say that the statement to Beit Shammai constitutes a complete acquisition, for if he wants to go out with her using a divorce document, rather say that the statement to Beit Shammai is only to push away the rival in a case of distress alone.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אָבִין: אַף אֲנַן נָמֵי תְּנֵינָא, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: יְקַיְּימוּ. יְקַיְּימוּ אִין — לְכַתְּחִלָּה לָא.
human_translation: Rabbi Avin said: We, too, learn Beit Shammai say: They may maintain them yes, they may maintain them. ab initio , no,
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Avin: We also learned, Beit Shammai say: They should establish. They should establish - no, not initially.

hebrew_text: וְאִי סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ מַאֲמָר לְבֵית שַׁמַּאי קוֹנֶה קִנְיָן גָּמוּר: זֶה יַעֲשֶׂה מַאֲמָר וְיִקְנֶה, וְזֶה יַעֲשֶׂה מַאֲמָר וְיִקְנֶה.
human_translation: And if it enters your mind according to Beit Shammai levirate betrothal acquires as a full-fledged acquisition, This should perform levirate betrothal and acquire and that should perform levirate betrothal and acquire
llm_translation: "And if according to your opinion, the statement of Beit Shammai acquires complete ownership: this one shall make a statement and acquire, and this one shall make a statement and acquire."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מַאי? דּוֹחֶה דְּחִיָּיה גְּמוּרָה — זֶה יַעֲשֶׂה מַאֲמָר וְיִדְחֶה, וְזֶה יַעֲשֶׂה מַאֲמָר וְיִדְחֶה.
human_translation: Rather, what precludes a complete preclusion. This one should perform levirate betrothal and preclude and that one should perform levirate and preclude
llm_translation: Rather what? That it pushes away its complete existence - this one will say a statement and push away, and this one will say a statement and push away.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מַאי אִית לָךְ לְמֵימַר: מַאֲמָר דְּהֶתֵּירָא — דָּחֵי, דְּאִיסּוּרָא — לָא דָּחֵי, הָכִי נָמֵי מַאֲמָר, אֲפִילּוּ לְמַאן דְּאָמַר מַאֲמָר קוֹנֶה קִנְיָן גָּמוּר: מַאֲמָר דְּהֶתֵּירָא קָנֵי, דְּאִיסּוּרָא לָא קָנֵי.
human_translation: Rather, what have you to say? levirate betrothal in permitted precludes in forbidden does not preclude So too levirate betrothal Even according to the one who said that levirate betrothal acquires as a full-fledged acquisition, Levirate betrothal under permitted acquires under forbidden circumstances does not acquire
llm_translation: Rather, what do you have to say? The statement of permission — it is effective, the statement of prohibition — it is not effective. So too, the statement: even according to the one who says that a statement acquires complete ownership, the statement of permission acquires, but the statement of prohibition does not acquire.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי מַתְנֵי הָכִי, אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: לָא תֵּימָא מַאֲמָר לְבֵית שַׁמַּאי דָּחֵי דְּחִיָּיה גְּמוּרָה, וְצָרָתָהּ חֲלִיצָה נָמֵי לָא בָּעֲיָא, אֶלָּא דּוֹחֶה וּמְשַׁיֵּיר הוּא.
human_translation: Rav Ashi teaches this Rabbi Elazar said: Do not say according to Beit Shammai levirate betrothal precludes a complete preclusion, the rival wife does not require even ḥalitza . Rather, it precludes and leaves a remnant
llm_translation: Rav Ashei taught thus: Rabbi Elazar said: Do not say that the statement of Beit Shammai completely rejects her, and her rival does not require halitzah, rather, he pushes her away and leaves her.
