hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אָבִין, אַף אֲנַן נָמֵי תְּנֵינָא: בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים יְקַיְּימוּ. יְקַיְּימוּ — אִין, לְכַתְּחִלָּה — לָא. וְאִי סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ מַאֲמָר לְבֵית שַׁמַּאי דּוֹחֶה דְּחִיָּיה גְּמוּרָה, זֶה יַעֲשֶׂה מַאֲמָר וְיִדְחֶה, וְזֶה יַעֲשֶׂה מַאֲמָר וְיִדְחֶה! וְאֶלָּא הָא קָתָנֵי בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: אִשְׁתּוֹ עִמּוֹ, וְהַלֵּזוּ תֵּצֵא מִשּׁוּם אֲחוֹת אִשָּׁה.
human_translation: Rabbi Avin said: We, learn Beit Shammai say: They may maintain them Yes, they may maintain them no, ab initio . And if it enters your mind according to Beit Shammai, levirate betrothal precludes entering a complete preclusion, this should perform levirate betrothal and preclude and that should perform levirate betrothal and preclude But didn’t teach Beit Shammai say: His wife remains with him, and this other is sent away due to as a sister of his wife?
llm_translation: Rabbi Avin said, "We also learned: Beit Shammai say 'they should fulfill.' 'They should fulfill' - no, initially - no. And if it should enter your mind that the statement of Beit Shammai completely rejects the other, this one will make a statement and reject, and that one will make a statement and reject! Rather, this is what Beit Shammai teaches: 'His wife should be with him, and he should divorce her because of his wife's sister.'"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: יְבָמָה דְּחַזְיָא לְכוּלְּהוּ — חַזְיָא לְמִקְצָתה, יְבָמָה דְּלָא חַזְיָא לְכוּלְּהוּ — לָא חַזְיָא לְמִקְצָתה.
human_translation: Rather, a yevama who is suitable for all of is suitable for part of it. a yevama who is not suitable for all of the is not suitable for a part of it.
llm_translation: Rather: A yevamah who is fit for all of them - she is fit for some of them; a yevamah who is not fit for all of them - she is not fit for some of them.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רַבָּה: מַאֲמָר לְבֵית שַׁמַּאי, נִישּׂוּאִין עוֹשֶׂה, אוֹ אֵירוּסִין עוֹשֶׂה? אָמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: לְמַאי הִלְכְתָא?
human_translation: Rabba asks: Does levirate betrothal, according to Beit Shammai, create marriage Or, does it create betrothal, Abaye said to him: With regard to what halakha
llm_translation: Ba'ei Ravva: Ma'amar le'beit Shammai, nissu'in oseh, o eirusin oseh? Amar lei Abaye: Lemai hilcheta?

hebrew_text: אִילֵּימָא לְיוֹרְשָׁהּ וְלִיטַמֵּא לָהּ וּלְהָפֵר נְדָרֶיהָ, הַשְׁתָּא אֲרוּסָה בְּעָלְמָא תָּנֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא: אִשְׁתּוֹ אֲרוּסָה לֹא אוֹנֵן וְלֹא מִטַּמֵּא לַהּ, וְכֵן הִיא לֹא אוֹנֶנֶת וְלֹא מִטַּמֵּאת לוֹ, מֵתָה — אֵינוֹ יוֹרְשָׁהּ, מֵת הוּא — גּוֹבָה כְּתוּבָּתָהּ, עֲבַד בַּהּ מַאֲמָר מִיבַּעְיָא?
human_translation: If we say to inheriting her and to becoming ritually impure for her and to nullifying her vows, Now, a betrothed woman in general, Rabbi Ḥiyya teaches One does not enter acute mourning his betrothed wife, nor can he become ritually impure for her Similarly, she does not enter acute mourning for him and not to become ritually impure for him. she dies, he does not inherit from her; he dies, she collects her marriage contract, he performed levirate betrothal with her, is it necessary to say
llm_translation: Firstly, regarding her heirship, and regarding her becoming impure, and regarding the annulment of her vows, now, with regard to a betrothed woman, Rabbi Chiya taught: A betrothed woman neither mourns nor becomes impure for him, and likewise, he neither mourns nor becomes impure for her. If she dies - he does not inherit her; if he dies - her marriage contract is collected. Does the matter require further clarification?

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא לְעִנְיַן מְסִירָה לְחוּפָּה, מַאי? נִישּׂוּאִין עוֹשֶׂה — וְלָא בָּעֲיָא מְסִירָה לְחוּפָּה, אוֹ דִלְמָא אֵירוּסִין עוֹשֶׂה — וּבָעֲיָא מְסִירָה לְחוּפָּה?
human_translation: Rather, to the matter of delivery to a wedding canopy. What is create marriage would not require delivery to a wedding canopy? Or, does perhaps create betrothal, she would require delivery to a wedding canopy?
llm_translation: And rather for the matter of removing for the purpose of a courtyard, what? marriage makes — and does not require removing for the purpose of a courtyard, or perhaps betrothal makes — and requires removing for the purpose of a courtyard?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הַשְׁתָּא לָא עֲבַד בַּהּ מַאֲמָר, כְּתִיב: ״יְבָמָהּ יָבֹא עָלֶיהָ״ — בְּעַל כׇּרְחָהּ, עֲבַד בַּהּ מַאֲמָר מִיבַּעְיָא?
human_translation: said to him Now, he did not perform levirate betrothal with her it is written: “Her brother-in-law will have intercourse with her” against her will. Is necessary that he performed levirate betrothal with her,
llm_translation: He said to him: "Now he did not perform with her the act of levirate marriage, as it is written: 'Her yavam shall come upon her' - against her will, did he perform with her the act of levirate marriage?"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ, שֶׁאֲנִי אוֹמֵר: כׇּל הָעוֹשֶׂה מַאֲמָר בִּיבִמְתּוֹ פָּרְחָה מִמֶּנּוּ זִיקַּת יְבָמִין, וְחָלָה עָלָיו זִיקַּת אֵירוּסִין. מַאי?
human_translation: said to him: I say anyone who performs levirate betrothal with his yevama causes the levirate bond to be removed from him, bond of betrothal applies to him. What
llm_translation: He said to him, "I say: Anyone who performs the act of levirate marriage with his yevamah, the obligation of yibum is removed from him, and the obligation of halitzah falls upon him. What is the reason?"

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: שׁוֹמֶרֶת יָבָם, בֵּין יָבָם אֶחָד בֵּין שְׁנֵי יְבָמִין — רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: יָפֵר. רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: לְאֶחָד וְלֹא לִשְׁנַיִם. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: לֹא לְאֶחָד וְלֹא לִשְׁנַיִם.
human_translation: Come hear a widow waiting for her yavam , whether a single yavam or two yevamin ? Rabbi Eliezer says: Let him nullify Rabbi Yehoshua says: a single yavam , but not two. Rabbi Akiva says: not to one nor to two
llm_translation: Come and hear: A woman who is awaiting the levirate marriage, whether for one yavam or for two yevamim - Rabbi Eliezer says: She may perform halitzah. Rabbi Yehoshua says: For one and not for two. Rabbi Akiva says: Neither for one nor for two.

hebrew_text: וְהָוֵינַן בַּהּ: בִּשְׁלָמָא, רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא סָבַר: אֵין זִיקָּה אֲפִילּוּ לְחַד. לְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: לְחַד יֵשׁ זִיקָּה, לִתְרֵי אֵין זִיקָּה. אֶלָּא לְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, נְהִי נָמֵי דְּקָסָבַר יֵשׁ זִיקָּה, בִּשְׁלָמָא לְחַד מֵיפֵר, אֶלָּא לִתְרֵי אַמַּאי?
human_translation: And we discussed this Granted, Rabbi Akiva holds that the levirate bond is not substantial, even in one to Rabbi Yehoshua, the levirate bond with one is substantial. But with two the levirate bond is not substantial, However, Rabbi Eliezer, if indeed holds that the levirate bond is substantial, Granted, one he can nullify but two,
llm_translation: We were in it: In Shlama, Rabbi Akiva holds: There is no liability even for one. According to Rabbi Yehoshua: There is liability for one, but not for two. But according to Rabbi Eliezer, granted that he holds there is liability, why for two?

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי אַמֵּי (בַּר אַהֲבָה): הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן — כְּגוֹן דַּעֲבַד בַּהּ מַאֲמָר, וּבֵית שַׁמַּאי הִיא, דְּאָמַר: מַאֲמָר קוֹנֶה קִנְיָן גָּמוּר.
human_translation: And Rabbi Ami bar Ahava said: With what are we dealing here? where performed levirate betrothal with her, and is the opinion of Beit Shammai, who say: Levirate betrothal acquires as a full-fledged acquisition.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Ammi (son of Ahava) said: Here, with what are we dealing? For example, he engaged in it with a statement, and it is the school of Shammai, which says: A statement acquires complete ownership.

hebrew_text: אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא נִישּׂוּאִין עוֹשֶׂה — מִשּׁוּם הָכִי מֵיפֵר. אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ אֵירוּסִין עוֹשֶׂה — הֵיכִי מָצֵי מֵיפֵר, וְהָתְנַן: נַעֲרָה הַמְאוֹרָסָה — אָבִיהָ וּבַעְלָהּ מְפִירִים נְדָרֶיהָ! אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: מַאי מֵיפֵר — מֵיפֵר בְּשׁוּתָּפוּת.
human_translation: Granted, if you say creates marriage, it is due to that can nullify However, if you say creates betrothal, how can he nullify for didn’t we learn a betrothed young woman, her father and her husband nullify her vows? Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said What is nullifies? That he nullifies in conjunction
llm_translation: If you say that betrothal (nissu'in) is what makes the marriage, then why does he annul the vow? But if you say that engagement (erusin) is what makes the marriage, how does he annul the vow? And we learned in a Mishnah: "A betrothed maiden - her father and husband annul her vows!" Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: What is "mefar" - he annuls through partnership.

hebrew_text: וּלְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, דְּאָמַר: מַאֲמָר לְבֵית שַׁמַּאי אֵינוֹ קוֹנֶה אֶלָּא לִדְחוֹת לַצָּרָה בִּלְבַד, אַמַּאי מֵיפֵר בְּשׁוּתָּפוּת? אָמַר לָךְ רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: אֵימַר דַּאֲמַרִי אֲנָא אֵינוֹ קוֹנֶה אֶלָּא לִדְחוֹת לַצָּרָה בִּלְבַד, דְּלָא סַגִּי לַהּ בְּגִיטָּא אֶלָּא בָּעֵי נָמֵי חֲלִיצָה, לְהָפֵר נְדָרֶיהָ מִי אָמְרִינַן?
human_translation: And according to Rabbi Elazar, who said for Beit Shammai levirate betrothal acquires only as it precludes a rival wife why should nullify in conjunction Rabbi Eliezer said to you: say that I said acquires only as it precludes the rival wife that a bill of divorce would not suffice for her, but rather she also requires ḥalitza . to nullifying her vows, do we say
llm_translation: To Rabbi Elazar, who said: The statement to the House of Shammai does not acquire except to push away the trouble alone, why does he nullify with partnership? Rabbi Elazar said to you: Say that I only acquire to push away the trouble alone, for it is not sufficient for her with a divorce, but she requires halitzah, to annul her vows, do we say?

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא, אָמַר לָךְ רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: וּלְרַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק מִי נִיחָא? מִי קָתָנֵי ״יָפֵרוּ״? ״יָפֵר״ קָתָנֵי. אֶלָּא, הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן — שֶׁעָמְדָה בַּדִּין, וּפָסְקוּ לָהּ מְזוֹנוֹת מִשֶּׁלּוֹ,
human_translation: And if you wish, say Rabbi Elazar said to you: And as for Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak, does this work out well? Did the teach they nullify It teaches he nullify Rather, With what are we dealing here? stood in court and it ruled that he her sustenance.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say, Rabbi Elazar said to you: And for Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak, who is suitable? Who taught "they shall be fruitful"? "They shall be fruitful" he taught. Rather, here we are dealing with what? — that she stood in judgment, and they awarded her maintenance from his property.

hebrew_text: וְכִדְרַב פִּנְחָס מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרָבָא, דְּאָמַר רַב פִּנְחָס מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרָבָא: כׇּל הַנּוֹדֶרֶת — עַל דַּעַת בַּעְלָהּ הִיא נוֹדֶרֶת.
human_translation: And Rav Pineḥas in the name of Rava, as Rav Pineḥas said in the name of Rava: Any woman who makes a vow, makes her vow with the consent of her husband.
llm_translation: As in the case of Rav Pinchas, whose name is Rava, for Rav Pinchas in the name of Rava said: "Every vow is made with the knowledge of her husband."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ שְׁלֹשָׁה אַחִין, שְׁנַיִם מֵהֶם נְשׂוּאִים שְׁתֵּי אֲחָיוֹת, וְאֶחָד נָשׂוּי נׇכְרִית. מֵת אֶחָד מִבַּעֲלֵי אֲחָיוֹת, וְכָנַס נְשׂוּי נׇכְרִית אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ וּמֵת — הָרִאשׁוֹנָה יוֹצְאָה מִשּׁוּם אֲחוֹת אִשָּׁה, וּשְׁנִיָּה מִשּׁוּם צָרָתָהּ. עָשָׂה בָּהּ מַאֲמָר וּמֵת — נׇכְרִית חוֹלֶצֶת וְלֹא מִתְיַיבֶּמֶת.
human_translation: three brothers, two of whom were married to two sisters and one who was married to an unrelated woman, The husband of one of the sisters died and who was married to the unrelated woman married, wife and died The first is dismissed due to the sister of one’s wife, and the second due to rival wife. performed levirate betrothal, and he died, the unrelated woman, perform ḥalitza and may not enter into levirate marriage.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: Three brothers, two of them are married to two sisters, and one is married to a non-Jewish woman. If one of the husbands of the sisters dies, and the husband of the non-Jewish woman takes his wife and then dies - the first sister is exempt from the levirate marriage due to the relationship of sister-in-law, and the second sister is exempt due to her rival status. If he performs chalitzah with her and then dies - the non-Jewish woman performs chalitzah and is not subject to levirate marriage.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ טַעְמָא דַּעֲבַד בַּהּ מַאֲמָר, הָא לָא עֲבַד בַּהּ מַאֲמָר — נׇכְרִית יַבּוֹמֵי נָמֵי מְיַיבְּמָה. אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: זֹאת אוֹמֶרֶת אֵין זִיקָה, וַאֲפִילּוּ בְּחַד אַחָא.
human_translation: The reason because he, performed levirate betrothal with Consequently, had he not performed levirate betrothal with her, the unrelated woman enter into levirate marriage as well. Rav Naḥman said: That is to say, the bond is not substantial; And even with a single brother,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemara: Ta'ama da'avad bah ma'amar, ha lo avad bah ma'amar - nokhrit yabomei namei meyaibmaha. Amar Rav Nachman: Zos omeres ein zika, va'afilu bechad achah." English translation: "The reason for which he performed the act, if he did not perform the act for that reason - a foreigner may perform the levirate marriage. Rav Nachman said: This means there is no connection, even with one brother."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ שְׁלֹשָׁה אַחִים, שְׁנַיִם מֵהֶם נְשׂוּאִים שְׁתֵּי אֲחָיוֹת, וְאֶחָד נָשׂוּי נׇכְרִית. מֵת הַנָּשׂוּי נׇכְרִית, וְכָנַס אֶחָד מִבַּעֲלֵי אֲחָיוֹת אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ וּמֵת — הָרִאשׁוֹנָה יוֹצֵאת מִשּׁוּם אֲחוֹת אִשָּׁה, וּשְׁנִיָּה — מִשּׁוּם צָרָתָהּ. עָשָׂה בָּהּ מַאֲמָר וּמֵת — נׇכְרִית חוֹלֶצֶת וְלֹא מִתְיַיבֶּמֶת.
human_translation: three brothers, two of whom were married to two sisters and one who was married to an unrelated woman, He who was married to the unrelated woman died, and one of the husbands of the sisters married his wife, and died The first is dismissed due to the sister of his wife. And the second as her rival wife. he performed levirate betrothal and died, unrelated woman perform ḥalitza and may not enter into levirate marriage,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: Three brothers, two of them are married to two sisters, and one is married to a non-Jewish woman. If the one married to the non-Jewish woman dies, and one of the husbands of the sisters takes his wife and then dies - the first wife is exempt from levirate marriage due to the relationship of sister-in-law, and the second wife is exempt due to her rival status. If he performs chalitzah with her and then dies - the non-Jewish woman performs chalitzah and is not subject to levirate marriage.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ הָא תּוּ לְמָה לִי? הַיְינוּ הָךְ! הַשְׁתָּא: וּמָה הָתָם דַּאֲחוֹת אִשָּׁה הָוְיָא צָרָה לְנׇכְרִית — אָמְרַתְּ נׇכְרִית אֲסוּרָה, הָכָא דְּנׇכְרִית הָוְיָא צָרָה לַאֲחוֹת אִשָּׁה — לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן!
human_translation: Why do I need this as well? This is identical Now, just as there, when wife’s sister became rival wife of the unrelated woman you say the unrelated woman is forbidden here, where the unrelated woman became the rival wife of wife’s sister not all the more so
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Why do I need this? That's it! Now: And what is the case there that a sister of a wife is considered a rival to a non-Jewish woman - you said a non-Jewish woman is forbidden, here where a non-Jewish woman is considered a rival to a sister of a wife - all the more so!"

hebrew_text: תַּנָּא, הָךְ תְּנָא בְּרֵישָׁא וְהָךְ חַזְיַא לְהֶתֵּירָא וְשַׁרְיַא, וַהֲדַר חַזְיַא לְאִיסּוּרָא.
human_translation: The tanna taught this at first, and that saw it permitted, and he permitted And then saw it to forbidden.
llm_translation: We have learned: this one taught at the beginning, and that one saw to permit and allow, and then he saw to prohibit.

hebrew_text: וְאַיְּידֵי דְּחַבִּיבָה לֵיהּ אַקְדְּמַהּ, וּמִשְׁנָה לֹא זָזָה מִמְּקוֹמָהּ.
human_translation: And since it was beloved to him and he taught it earlier. However, a mishna does not move from its place.
llm_translation: And because she was precious to him, I will precede her, and she did not move from her place.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ שְׁלֹשָׁה אַחִין, שְׁנַיִם מֵהֶם נְשׂוּאִים שְׁתֵּי אֲחָיוֹת, וְאֶחָד נָשׂוּי נׇכְרִית. מֵת אֶחָד מִבַּעֲלֵי אֲחָיוֹת, וְכָנַס נְשׂוּי נׇכְרִית אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ, וּמֵתָה אִשְׁתּוֹ שֶׁל שֵׁנִי, וְאַחַר כָּךְ מֵת נְשׂוּי נׇכְרִית — הֲרֵי זוֹ אֲסוּרָה עָלָיו עוֹלָמִית, הוֹאִיל וְנֶאֶסְרָה עָלָיו שָׁעָה אַחַת.
human_translation: three brothers, two of whom were married to two sisters and one who was married to an unrelated woman, One of the husbands of the sisters died, and he who was married to the unrelated woman married wife, and the wife of the second died. Afterward, who was married to the unrelated woman died, is forbidden to him forever. since she was forbidden to him at one time,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: Three brothers, two of them are married to two sisters, and one is married to a non-Jewish woman. If one of the husbands of the sisters dies, and the husband married to the non-Jewish woman takes the wife of the deceased, and then the wife of the second brother dies, and afterwards the husband married to the non-Jewish woman dies — she is forever forbidden to him, since she was forbidden to him for even one moment.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: כׇּל יְבָמָה שֶׁאֵין אֲנִי קוֹרֵא בָּהּ בִּשְׁעַת נְפִילָה ״יְבָמָהּ יָבֹא עָלֶיהָ״ — הֲרֵי הִיא כְּאֵשֶׁת אָח שֶׁיֵּשׁ לָהּ בָּנִים, וַאֲסוּרָה. מַאי קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן? תְּנֵינָא: הֲרֵי זוֹ אֲסוּרָה עָלָיו עוֹלָמִית, הוֹאִיל וְנֶאֶסְרָה עָלָיו שָׁעָה אַחַת!
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Rav said Any yevama to whom the verse “Her brother-in-law will have intercourse with her” cannot be applied at the time that she happens is then like the wife of a brother she has children, and she is forbidden What is teaching us We learned She is forbidden to him forever, since she was forbidden to him at one time.
llm_translation: Gemara: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: Any yevamah that I do not perform chalitzah with at the time of chalitzah, "her yavam shall come upon her" - she is like the wife of a brother who has children, and she is forbidden. What does this teach us? We learned in a Mishnah: She is forever forbidden to him, since she was forbidden to him for even one moment!

hebrew_text: מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: הָנֵי מִילֵּי הֵיכָא דְּלָא אִיחַזְיָא לַהּ בִּנְפִילָה רִאשׁוֹנָה, אֲבָל הֵיכָא דְּאִיחַזְיָא לַהּ בִּנְפִילָה רִאשׁוֹנָה — אֵימָא תִּישְׁתְּרֵי, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: lest you say that this applies where she was not eligible during first happened But where she was eligible during first happened say she would be permitted. teaches us
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates to: "What is the reasoning? Those words, where they do not apply to it in the first fall, but where they do apply to it in the first fall - say it should be removed, this is what we hear."

hebrew_text: הָא נָמֵי תְּנֵינָא: שְׁנֵי אַחִין נְשׂוּאִין שְׁתֵּי אֲחָיוֹת, מֵת אֶחָד מֵהֶם, וְאַחַר כָּךְ מֵתָה אִשְׁתּוֹ שֶׁל שֵׁנִי — הֲרֵי זוֹ אֲסוּרָה עָלָיו עוֹלָמִית, הוֹאִיל וְנֶאֶסְרָה עָלָיו שָׁעָה אַחַת!
human_translation: We learned as well, two brothers who were married to two sisters, one of them, died and afterward the wife of the second died, then she, is forbidden to him, forever, since she was forbidden to him at one time.
llm_translation: Here is the translation of the Talmudic text into English: Talmudic text: "Here is a case: Two brothers married two sisters, one of them dies, and afterwards the wife of the other brother dies - she is forbidden to him forever, since she was forbidden to him for a moment!"

hebrew_text: מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: הָתָם הוּא דְּאִידְּחַי לַהּ מֵהַאי בֵּיתָא לִגְמָרֵי, אֲבָל הָכָא דְּלָא אִידְּחַי לַהּ מֵהַאי בֵּיתָא לִגְמָרֵי, אֵימָא: מִיגּוֹ דְּחַזְיָא לְהַאי נְשׂוּי נׇכְרִית, חַזְיָא נָמֵי לְהַאי — קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: Lest you say that there she was precluded from this household completely, here, however, where she was not completely precluded from this household say: Since she is eligible to this who was married to the unrelated woman, she is eligible for this as well, teaches us
llm_translation: What is the reason? There, it is because he was distracted from this house completely, but here, since he was not distracted from this house completely, say: because he saw a non-Jewish woman, let him see this one as well — he is listening to us.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ שְׁלֹשָׁה אַחִים, שְׁנַיִם מֵהֶם נְשׂוּאִין שְׁתֵּי אֲחָיוֹת, וְאֶחָד נָשׂוּי נׇכְרִית. גֵּירַשׁ אֶחָד מִבַּעֲלֵי אֲחָיוֹת אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ, וּמֵת נְשׂוּי נׇכְרִית, וּכְנָסָהּ הַמְגָרֵשׁ וָמֵת — זוֹ הִיא שֶׁאָמְרוּ: וְכוּלָּן שֶׁמֵּתוּ אוֹ נִתְגָּרְשׁוּ — צָרוֹתֵיהֶן מוּתָּרוֹת.
human_translation: three brothers, two of whom were married to two sisters and one who was married to an unrelated woman, the husband of one of the sisters, divorced his wife, and who was married to the unrelated woman, died, and the man who divorced married, her, And died, This is they said: And all those who died or were divorced, their rival wives are permitted
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: Three brothers, two of them married two sisters, and one married a non-Jewish woman. If one of the brothers divorces his wife, and the non-Jewish wife dies, and the divorced woman enters and dies - this is what they said: "And all of them who died or were divorced - their rivals are permitted."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ טַעְמָא דְּגֵירַשׁ וְאַחַר כָּךְ מֵת, אֲבָל מֵת וְאַחַר כָּךְ גֵּירַשׁ — אֲסוּרָה. אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: זֹאת אוֹמֶרֶת: יֵשׁ זִיקָה, אֲפִילּוּ בִּתְרֵי אַחֵי.
human_translation: the reason that divorced and after that died But died and later divorced forbidden Rav Ashi said: That is to say, the bond is substantial, even with two brothers.
llm_translation: The taste of divorce and afterwards he died, but he died and afterwards divorced - forbidden. Rav Ashe said: This means: there is a connection, even between two brothers.

hebrew_text: וּלְרַב אָשֵׁי קַשְׁיָא דְּרַב נַחְמָן! אָמַר לָךְ רַב אָשֵׁי: הוּא הַדִּין דְּאַף עַל גַּב דְּלָא עֲבַד בַּהּ מַאֲמָר — נׇכְרִית מִיחְלָץ חָלְצָה, יַבּוֹמֵי לָא מִיַּיבְּמָה. וְהָא דְּקָתָנֵי מַאֲמָר — לְאַפּוֹקֵי בֵּית שַׁמַּאי, דְּאָמְרִי: מַאֲמָר קוֹנֶה
human_translation: And according to Rav Ashi, Rav Naḥman difficult, Rav Ashi said to you: the same is true even where he did not perform levirate betrothal with her. the unrelated woman must perform ḥalitza and may not enter into levirate marriage And that it teaches levirate betrothal to exclude Beit Shammai, who say levirate betrothal acquires
llm_translation: To Rav Ashei, a difficulty of Rav Nachman! Rav Ashei said to you: The same law that even though he did not engage in intercourse with her — a foreign woman is released from yibum, but a yevamah is not released. And that which the statement teaches — to follow the opinion of Beit Shammai, who say: a statement acquires.

hebrew_text: קִנְיָן גָּמוּר, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּלָא כְּבֵית שַׁמַּאי.
human_translation: a full-fledged acquisition. teaches us that is not in accordance with Beit Shammai.
llm_translation: Acquisition complete, it is heard to us that it is not like Beit Shammai.

hebrew_text: וּלְרַב נַחְמָן — קַשְׁיָא דְּרַב אָשֵׁי! וְכִי תֵּימָא: הוּא הַדִּין דַּאֲפִילּוּ מֵת וְאַחַר כָּךְ גֵּירַשׁ — צָרָתָהּ מוּתֶּרֶת, אֶלָּא ״זוֹ הִיא״ לְמַעוֹטֵי מַאי? לְמַעוֹטֵי כָּנַס וְאַחַר כָּךְ גֵּירַשׁ.
human_translation: And according to Rav Naḥman, of Rav Ashi difficult. And if you would say: rival wife, is permitted, the same is true even if died and afterward divorced what does this is, to exclude? It excludes married and afterward divorced
llm_translation: To Rav Nachman - a difficulty of Rav Ashe! And if you will say: Is it the same if he died and then divorced - her affliction is permitted, rather "this is" to exclude what? To exclude one who married and then divorced.

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא אִי סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יִרְמְיָה, דְּאָמַר: תַּבְרָא, מִי שֶׁשָּׁנָה זוֹ לֹא שָׁנָה זוֹ.
human_translation: This works out well if he holds in accordance with Rabbi Yirmeya, who said disjointed; he who taught this did not teach that
llm_translation: The text reads: "Hanicha, if he thinks like Rabbi Yirmiyah, who said: 'It will be created, one who changes this day does not change this day.'"

hebrew_text: וְהַאי תַּנָּא סָבַר מִיתָה מַפֶּלֶת, וְהַאי תַּנָּא סָבַר נִישּׂוּאִין הָרִאשׁוֹנִים מַפִּילִים.
human_translation: This tanna holds that death determines she happens And this tanna holds that the original marriage determines she happens
llm_translation: This Tanna holds that miscarriage results in death, and that Tanna holds that the first marriages result in miscarriage.

hebrew_text: ״זוֹ הִיא״ לְמַעוֹטֵי כָּנַס וּלְבַסּוֹף גֵּירַשׁ. אֶלָּא אִי סָבַר לַהּ כְּרָבָא, דְּאָמַר: לְעוֹלָם חַד תַּנָּא הוּא, וְ״זוֹ וְאֵין צָרִיךְ לוֹמַר זוֹ״ קָתָנֵי, ״זוֹ הִיא״ לְמַעוֹטֵי מַאי? עַל כׇּרְחָךְ כְּרַבִּי יִרְמְיָה סְבִירָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: this is to exclude he married and ultimately divorced However, if he holds in accordance with Rava, who said: Actually, this a single tanna , and he teaches This, and it is unnecessary to say that, what this is to exclude? Perforce holds in accordance with Rabbi Yirmeya
llm_translation: "This is" to exclude the cases of acquisition and final divorce. Rather, if he holds like Rava, who said: 'It is always one Tanna, and "this" and there is no need to say "this" are taught,' "This is" to exclude what? Certainly, according to Rabbi Yirmeya, he holds this way.

hebrew_text: וּלְרָבָא, הָנִיחָא אִי סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַב אָשֵׁי — ״זוֹ הִיא״ לְמַעוֹטֵי מֵת בְּלֹא גֵּירֵשׁ. אֶלָּא אִי סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַב נַחְמָן, ״זוֹ הִיא״ לְמַעוֹטֵי מַאי? עַל כׇּרְחָךְ כְּרַב אָשֵׁי סְבִירָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: And according to Rava, this works out well if he holds in accordance of Rav Ashi this is to exclude he died without divorcing his wife. If, however, he holds in accordance Rav Naḥman what this is to exclude? Perforce holds in accordance with Rav Ashi.
llm_translation: To Rava, leave it. If he thinks like Rav Ashe, "This is" to exclude one who dies without divorce. But if he thinks like Rav Nachman, "This is" to exclude what? Certainly, according to Rav Ashe, he agrees.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ וְכוּלָּן שֶׁהָיוּ בָּהֶן קִדּוּשִׁין אוֹ גֵרוּשִׁין בְּסָפֵק — הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ הַצָּרוֹת חוֹלְצוֹת וְלֹא מִתְיַיבְּמוֹת. כֵּיצַד סְפֵק קִדּוּשִׁין? זָרַק לָהּ קִדּוּשִׁין, סָפֵק קָרוֹב לוֹ סָפֵק קָרוֹב לָהּ — זֶהוּ סְפֵק קִדּוּשִׁין.
human_translation: And any of these had undergone a betrothal or divorce is uncertain then those rival wives perform ḥalitza and may not enter into levirate marriage How uncertainty betrothal? he threw her betrothal was possibly closer to him possibly closer to her, this is uncertainty betrothal.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: And all those in whom there were doubts of betrothal or divorce — these are the rival wives who must perform halitzah and are not permitted to undergo levirate marriage. How so is a doubt of betrothal? If a man threw betrothal to her, and it is uncertain whether it is closer to him or closer to her — this is a doubt of betrothal.

hebrew_text: סְפֵק גֵּרוּשִׁין — כָּתַב בִּכְתַב יָדוֹ וְאֵין עָלָיו עֵדִים, יֵשׁ עָלָיו עֵדִים וְאֵין בּוֹ זְמַן, יֵשׁ בּוֹ זְמַן וְאֵין בּוֹ אֶלָּא עֵד אֶחָד, זֶהוּ סְפֵק גֵּרוּשִׁין.
human_translation: Uncertainty divorce he wrote a in his handwriting but there are no witnesses on there are witnesses but there is no date in it, the date is in it but there is only a single witness. this is uncertainty divorce.
llm_translation: Doubt of divorce - he wrote with his own hand and there are no witnesses on it, there are witnesses on it and there is no time in it, there is a time in it and there is only one witness in it, this is a doubt of divorce.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וְאִילּוּ בְּגֵרוּשִׁין, סָפֵק קָרוֹב לוֹ סָפֵק קָרוֹב לָהּ לָא קָתָנֵי.
human_translation: But yet when divorce, it does not teach uncertain is closer to him, and uncertain if it is closer to her.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates as follows: "Gemara: And if they are divorced, if there is doubt whether he is close to her or she is close to him, it is not taught."

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא? אָמַר רַבָּה: אִשָּׁה זוֹ בְּחֶזְקַת הֶיתֵּר לַשּׁוּק עוֹמֶדֶת, וּמִסָּפֵק אַתָּה בָּא לְאוֹסְרָהּ — אַל תַּאַסְרֶנָּה מִסָּפֵק.
human_translation: What is the reason Rabba said: this woman, has the presumptive status of being permitted from the public. And due to an uncertainty would you render her forbidden Do not render her forbidden due to an uncertainty.
llm_translation: What is the reason? Rabah said: This woman is standing in a presumptive state of permission to go to the market, and if you come to prohibit her due to doubt — do not prohibit her due to doubt.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: אִי הָכִי, בְּקִדּוּשִׁין נָמֵי נֵימָא: אִשָּׁה זוֹ בְּחֶזְקַת הֶיתֵּר לַיָּבָם עוֹמֶדֶת, וּמִסָּפֵק אַתָּה בָּא לְאוֹסְרָהּ — אַל תַּאַסְרֶנָּה מִסָּפֵק!
human_translation: Abaye said to him: If that is so, let us say betrothal as well this woman, has the presumptive status of being permitted to the yavam and due to the uncertainty would you come and render her forbidden? Do not render her forbidden due to an uncertainty.
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: If so, in betrothal it should be said: This woman is standing in a presumptive state of permissibility for the levirate marriage, and from a doubt you come to prohibit her - do not prohibit her from a doubt!

hebrew_text: הָתָם, לְחוּמְרָא.
human_translation: There, the stringent ruling,
llm_translation: There, for stringency.

hebrew_text: הַאי — חוּמְרָא דְּאָתֵי לִידֵי קוּלָּא הוּא. זִימְנִין דְּאָזֵיל הוּא, וּמְקַדֵּשׁ לַהּ לַאֲחוֹתַהּ קִדּוּשֵׁי וַדַּאי.
human_translation: this is a stringency that might bring about a leniency Sometimes go and betroth her sister a betrothal certain.
llm_translation: This — matter that leads to leniency it is. Sometimes it goes, and sanctifies for her her sister betrothals certainly.

hebrew_text: וְאִי נָמֵי, זִימְנִין דְּאָתֵא אַחֵר וּמְקַדֵּשׁ לַהּ לְדִידַהּ קִדּוּשֵׁי וַדַּאי, וְכֵיוָן דְּאָסַר לַהּ מָר לְצָרָה לְיַיבּוֹמֵי, אָמְרִי: דְּקַמָּא — קִדּוּשִׁין, וּדְבָתְרָא — לָאו קִדּוּשִׁין!
human_translation: Alternatively, sometimes another man might come and betroth herself a betrothal certain, and since the Master prohibited the rival wife to enter into levirate marriage, say of the first betrothal, and of the latter was not betrothal.
llm_translation: And if you say, sometimes another one comes and sanctifies her for himself, her sanctifications are certainly valid. And once her master prohibited her to his rival for the purpose of yibum, they said: The first one - the sanctifications, and the latter - are not sanctifications!

hebrew_text: כֵּיוָן דְּקָא מַצְרְכַתְּ חֲלִיצָה — מִידָּע יָדְעִי דְּחוּמְרָא בְּעָלְמָא הוּא. אִי הָכִי, גֵּירוּשִׁין נָמֵי לִיתְנֵי, וְלַיצְרְכַהּ חֲלִיצָה, וּמִידַּע יָדְעִי דְּחוּמְרָא בְּעָלְמָא הוּא!
human_translation: Since you require ḥalitza know that this is merely a stringency If so, let teach divorce, and that she requires ḥalitza . And they would know that this is merely a stringency
llm_translation: Since she requires halitzah - immediately I know that it is a stringent matter in general. If so, even in the case of divorce, it should not be given, and for the purpose of halitzah, and immediately I know that it is a stringent matter in general!

hebrew_text: אִם אַתָּה אוֹמֵר חוֹלֶצֶת, מִתְיַיבֶּמֶת. הָכָא נָמֵי, אִם אַתָּה אוֹמֵר חוֹלֶצֶת, מִתְיַיבֶּמֶת! וְתִתְיַיבֵּם, וְאֵין בְּכָךְ כְּלוּם — אַחֲזָקָה קָא קָיְימָא.
human_translation: if you say that she perform ḥalitza she enter into levirate marriage. Here too, if you say that she performs ḥalitza she enter into levirate marriage. So let her enter into levirate marriage, and no with that. she remains with presumptive status
llm_translation: If you say "chalitzah," she performs yibum. Here too, if you say "chalitzah," she performs yibum! And she performs yibum, and there is no disgrace in this - the presumption is established.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: נָפַל הַבַּיִת עָלָיו וְעַל בַּת אָחִיו, וְאֵין יָדוּעַ אֵיזֶה מֵהֶם מֵת רִאשׁוֹן, צָרָתָהּ חוֹלֶצֶת וְלֹא מִתְיַיבֶּמֶת.
human_translation: Abaye raised an objection to A house fell on him, and on his brother’s daughter and it is unknown which of them died first. her rival wife perform ḥalitza but may not enter into levirate marriage.
llm_translation: He raised an objection to him: Abaye said: If the house fell on him and on the daughter of his brother, and it is not known which of them died first, his wife may perform ḥalitza but may not engage in levirate marriage.

hebrew_text: אַמַּאי? הָכָא נָמֵי, נֵימָא: אִשָּׁה זוֹ בְּחֶזְקַת הֶיתֵּר לַשּׁוּק עוֹמֶדֶת, וּמִסָּפֵק אַתָּה בָּא לְאוֹסְרָהּ — אַל תַּאַסְרֶנָּה מִסָּפֵק!
human_translation: why Here too, let us say: This woman, has the presumptive status of permitted from the public. And due to the uncertainty you come to render her forbidden Do not render her forbidden due to an uncertainty.
llm_translation: "Why? Here it is stated, say: 'This woman is in a presumptive state of permissibility standing in the marketplace, and due to doubt you come to prohibit her - do not prohibit her due to doubt!"

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא: הָכָא נָמֵי לְחוּמְרָא — חוּמְרָא דְּאָתֵי לִידֵי קוּלָּא הוּא: שֶׁאִם אַתָּה אוֹמֵר חוֹלֶצֶת, מִתְיַיבֶּמֶת! גֵּירוּשִׁין דִּשְׁכִיחִי — גְּזַרוּ בְּהוּ רַבָּנַן, מַפּוֹלֹת דְּלָא שְׁכִיחִי — לָא גְּזַרוּ בְּהוּ רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: And if you would say: Here too, more stringently this would be a stringency that brings about a leniency, for if you say that she perform ḥalitza , she may enter into levirate marriage. divorce, which are common, the Sages issued a rabbinic decree collapse, which are not common, the Sages did not issue a rabbinic decree,
llm_translation: And if you will say: here it is necessary for stringency - it is a stringency that leads to leniency: for if you say "chalitzah," she will perform yibum! Divorces that are common - the Rabbis decreed concerning them; falls that are not common - the Rabbis did not decree concerning them.

hebrew_text: אִי נָמֵי: גֵּירוּשִׁין דְּקָיְימָא עֶרְוָה דְּקָא מוֹכְחָ[א], וְצָרָתָהּ קָמַצְרְכַתְּ לַהּ חֲלִיצָה, אָמְרִי: קָמוּ בֵּיהּ רַבָּנַן בְּגִיטָּא דְּגִיטָּא מְעַלְּיָא הוּא, וְאָתוּ לְיַיבּוֹמֵי לְצָרָה. מַפּוֹלֶת, מִי קָמוּ בְּהוּ רַבָּנַן בְּמַפּוֹלֶת?
human_translation: Alternatively, divorce where there is a forbidden relative who indicates and you require that her rival wife perform ḥalitza , will say: The Sages determined that this bill of divorce is a full-fledged bill of divorce. and may come to consummate the levirate marriage with the rival wife collapse, could the Sages have determined in the collapse?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: If it is so: Divorces that are based on a matter of forbidden sexual relations that is proven, and her rival requires her to perform halitzah, the Rabbis said: The divorce is effective in terms of divorce, but they come to perform levirate marriage with regard to the rival. Regarding a fallen woman, who are the Rabbis coming to address in the case of a fallen woman? English translation:

hebrew_text: וְגַבֵּי גֵירוּשִׁין מִי לָא תְּנַן? וְהָתְנַן: הָיְתָה עוֹמֶדֶת בִּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים וּזְרָקוֹ לָהּ, קָרוֹב לָהּ — מְגוֹרֶשֶׁת, קָרוֹב לוֹ — אֵינָהּ מְגוֹרֶשֶׁת. מֶחֱצָה עַל מֶחֱצָה — מְגוֹרֶשֶׁת וְאֵינָהּ מְגוֹרֶשֶׁת.
human_translation: But did we not learn with regard to divorce And didn’t we learn was standing in the public domain and he threw her closer to her, she is divorced. closer to him, she is not divorced. half and half, she is divorced or she is not divorced.
llm_translation: Regarding the matter of divorce, who did we not learn about? And we learned: If she was standing in a public domain and he threw it to her, if it is close to her - she is divorced, if it is close to him - she is not divorced. If it is halfway between them - she is divorced and she is not divorced.

hebrew_text: וְאָמְרִינַן: לְמַאי הִלְכְתָא? דְּאִי כֹּהֵן הוּא — אֲסִורָה לֵיהּ, וְאִי עֶרְוָה הִיא — צָרָתָהּ בָּעֲיָא חֲלִיצָה. וְלָא אָמְרִינַן: שֶׁאִם אַתָּה אוֹמֵר חוֹלֶצֶת, מִתְיַיבֶּמֶת!
human_translation: And we say: With regard to what halakha that if is a priest, is forbidden to him if was a forbidden relative her rival wife would require ḥalitza . we do not say that if you say she perform ḥalitza , enter into levirate marriage.
llm_translation: And we say: For what case? For if he is a Kohen - it is forbidden for him, and if it is a case of ervah - she requires chalitzah. And we do not say: that if you say chalitzah, she performs yibum!

hebrew_text: הָא אִיתְּמַר עֲלַהּ, רַבָּה וְרַב יוֹסֵף דְּאָמְרִי תַּרְוַויְיהוּ: הָכָא בִּשְׁתֵּי כִּיתֵּי עֵדִים עָסְקִינַן, אַחַת אוֹמֶרֶת: קָרוֹב לָהּ, וְאַחַת אוֹמֶרֶת: קָרוֹב לוֹ, דְּהָוֵה לֵיהּ סְפֵיקָא דְאוֹרָיְיתָא. וּמַתְנִיתִין דְּהָכָא בְּכַת אַחַת, דְּהָוֵה לֵיהּ סְפֵיקָא דְרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: But wasn’t it stated with regard to Rabba and Rav Yosef who both say: Here, we are dealing with two sets of witnesses, one says closer to her, and one says closer to him. This, is an uncertainty of Torah But the mishna here is referring to one set This is uncertainty of rabbinic
llm_translation: Here it was stated: Rabba and Rav Yosef both said: We are dealing here with two groups of witnesses, one group saying: it is closer to her, and the other group saying: it is closer to him, creating a doubt of biblical law. And the Mishnah here is dealing with one group, creating a doubt of rabbinic law.

hebrew_text: וּמִמַּאי דְּמַתְנִיתִין דְּהָכָא בְּכַת אַחַת? דּוּמְיָא דְּקִדּוּשִׁין: מָה קִדּוּשִׁין בְּכַת אַחַת, אַף גֵּרוּשִׁין בְּכַת אַחַת. וְקִדּוּשִׁין גּוּפַיְיהוּ, מִמַּאי דִּבְכַת אַחַת? דִּלְמָא בִּשְׁתֵּי כִּיתֵּי עֵדִים? אִי בִּשְׁתֵּי כִּיתֵּי עֵדִים — תִּתְיַיבֵּם, וְאֵין בְּכָךְ כְּלוּם.
human_translation: And from where that the mishna here with one set It is similar to that of betrothal. Just as betrothal with one set of witnesses, so too, divorce of one set And betrothal itself, from where that one set Perhaps of two sets If of two sets of witnesses let her enter into levirate marriage, and no with that,
llm_translation: From what do we derive that here in the case of a woman who was married to two men simultaneously with one document of marriage the law is that the second husband is not required to divorce her? It is similar to the laws of sanctity: Just as sanctities can be annulled with one document, so too divorces can be annulled with one document. And regarding the sanctities themselves, from what do we derive that they can be annulled with one document? Perhaps it is with two groups of witnesses? If it is with two groups of witnesses — let them sit in judgment, and there is no disgrace in that.

hebrew_text: קָיְימִי עֵדִים וְקָאָמְרִי קָרוֹב לָהּ, וְאַתְּ אָמְרַתְּ תִּתְיַיבֵּם וְאֵין בְּכָךְ כְּלוּם?! וְתוּ — בִּשְׁתֵּי כִּיתֵּי עֵדִים נָמֵי, סְפֵיקָא דְרַבָּנַן הִיא, דְּאָמְרִינַן: אוֹקֵי תְּרֵי לְבַהֲדֵי תְּרֵי, וְאִשָּׁה אוֹקְמַהּ אַחֲזָקָה!
human_translation: there are witnesses who are standing and saying closer to her. And you say to let her enter into levirate marriage and no with that? And furthermore, of two pairs of witnesses is also uncertainty rabbinic we say: Place two against two let the woman remain in her original presumptive status.
llm_translation: The witnesses are standing and saying, "He is close to her," and you say, "Let her perform levirate marriage, and there is nothing in that?!" But rather - in the case where two groups of witnesses are standing, it is a Rabbinic doubt, for we say: "We establish two matters simultaneously," and a woman establishes a presumption!

hebrew_text: מִידֵּי דְּהָוֵה אַנִּכְסֵי דְּבַר שָׁטְיָא. דְּבַר שָׁטְיָא זַבֵּין נִכְסֵי. אֲתוֹ בֵּי תְרֵי וְאָמְרִי: כְּשֶׁהוּא חָלִים זַבֵּין, וְאָתוּ בֵּי תְרֵי וַאֲמַרוּ: כְּשֶׁהוּא שׁוֹטֶה זַבֵּין. וְאָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: אוֹקֵי תְּרֵי לַהֲדֵי תְּרֵי,
human_translation: just as it is in concerning the property of Bar Shatya, Bar Shatya sold property. Two came and said that he sold when healthy And two came and said that he sold when insane, Rav Ashi said Place two against two
llm_translation: From the time that he becomes a "devar shatya." A "devar shatya" is one who squanders his property. Two people came and said: When he is sick, he squanders, and two people came and said: When he is foolish, he squanders. And Rav Ashi said: Two are necessary for two.

hebrew_text: וְאַרְעָא אוֹקְמַהּ בְּחֶזְקַת בַּר שָׁטְיָא!
human_translation: let the land remain in the possession of Bar Shatya.
llm_translation: And the land was established in the possession of Bar Shatya!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: ״יַגִּיד עָלָיו רֵיעוֹ״. תְּנָא בְּקִידּוּשִׁין, וְהוּא הַדִּין לְגֵירוּשִׁין. תְּנָא בְּגֵירוּשִׁין, וְהוּא הַדִּין לְקִידּוּשִׁין.
human_translation: Rather, Abaye said: “His fellow speaks of him” teaches with regard to betrothal, and the same is true with regard to divorce teaches with regard to divorce, and the same is true with regard to betrothal.
llm_translation: Rather, Abaye said: "His friend should inform him." This is taught in the context of marriage, and the same applies to divorce. This is taught in the context of divorce, and the same applies to marriage.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא: אִי ״יַגִּיד עָלָיו רֵיעוֹ״, מַאי ״זֶהוּ״ דְּקָתָנֵי?
human_translation: Rava said to him: If His fellow speaks of him, what is This is, that teaches?
llm_translation: Rava said to him: If "his friend shall declare concerning him," what is the meaning of "this" that it teaches?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: כֹּל שֶׁיֵּשׁ בְּקִידּוּשִׁין יֵשׁ בְּגֵירוּשִׁין, וְיֵשׁ בְּגֵירוּשִׁין מַה שֶּׁאֵין בְּקִידּוּשִׁין, וְ״זֶהוּ״ דְּגֵירוּשִׁין לָאו דַּוְקָא. אֶלָּא, מִשּׁוּם דִּתְנָא ״זֶהוּ״ בְּקִידּוּשִׁין, תְּנָא נָמֵי ״זֶהוּ״ בְּגֵירוּשִׁין. וְ״זֶהוּ״ דְּקִידּוּשִׁין לְמַעוֹטֵי מַאי? לְמַעוֹטֵי זְמַן, דְּלֵיכָּא בְּקִידּוּשִׁין.
human_translation: Rather, Rava said: All that exist with regard to betrothal exist in of divorce there are with regard to divorce that do not exist with regard to betrothal, This is, with regard to divorce, is not specific Rather, because teaches This is, with regard to betrothal, it teaches This is, with regard to divorce as well. And what does This is, with regard to betrothal, to exclude? It to exclude the date, which is not with regard to betrothal,
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said: Anything that has in betrothal has in divorce, and there is in divorce that which is not in betrothal, and "this" of divorce is not specifically. Rather, because a Tanna taught "this" in betrothal, he also taught "this" in divorce. And "this" of betrothal - to exclude what? To exclude time, which is not in betrothal.

hebrew_text: וּמִפְּנֵי מָה לֹא תִּקְּנוּ זְמַן בְּקִידּוּשִׁין? הָנִיחָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר מִשּׁוּם פֵּירֵי — אֲרוּסָה לֵית לַהּ פֵּירֵי.
human_translation: And for what did they not institute the date in the betrothal This works out well according to the one who says is due to the profits. and there are no profits from a betrothed woman.
llm_translation: And because of what reason do they not establish a time for betrothals? It is preferable according to the one who says due to produce - an engaged woman does not have produce.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, לְמַאן דְּאָמַר מִשּׁוּם בַּת אֲחוֹתוֹ — לִיתַקֵּין זְמַן!
human_translation: However, according to the one who says due to the daughter of his sister, they should institute the date
llm_translation: Rather, according to the one who says it is because of his sister — the time is shortened!

hebrew_text: מִשּׁוּם דְּאִיכָּא דִּמְקַדֵּשׁ בְּכַסְפָּא וְאִיכָּא דִּמְקַדֵּשׁ בִּשְׁטָרָא, לָא תַּקּוּן רַבָּנַן זְמַן.
human_translation: Because there are those who betroth by means of money and those who betroth by means of a deed, the Sages did not institute the date
llm_translation: On account of that there are some who sanctify with silver and there are some who sanctify with a document, the Rabbis did not establish a fixed time.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יוֹסֵף לְרַב אָשֵׁי: וְהָא עַבְדָּא, דְּאִיכָּא דְּקָנֵי בְּכַסְפָּא וְאִיכָּא בִּשְׁטָרָא, וְתַקּוּן רַבָּנַן זְמַן! הָתָם רוּבָּא בִּשְׁטָרָא, הָכָא רוּבָּא בְּכַסְפָּא.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rav Yosef, said to Rav Ashi: But a slave, where there are who acquire with money and there are with a deed, the Sages instituted the date There, the majority by means of a deed. Here, the majority by means of money.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Acha, son of Rav Yosef, said to Rav Ashi: But there is a case where some acquire with money and some with a document, and the Rabbis established a time! There, the majority acquire with a document, here the majority acquire with money.

hebrew_text: אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא, מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא אֶפְשָׁר. הֵיכִי לֶיעְבֵּיד? לַינְּחֵהּ גַּבֵּי דִידַהּ — מָחֲקָה לֵיהּ. לַינְּחֵהּ גַּבֵּי דִידֵיהּ — זִמְנִין דְּבַת אֲחוֹתוֹ הִיא וּמְחַפֵּה עֲלַהּ.
human_translation: If you wish, say due to it is not possible How would we do we leave with her, she will erase we leave with him, there are times when she is his sister’s daughter and he might cover for her
llm_translation: If you ask, say, because it is not possible. How should he act? To place it on his own (property) - he has acquired it. To place it on her (property) - sometimes she is his sister and he covers for her.

hebrew_text: לַינְּחֵהּ גַּבֵּי עֵדִים — אִי דִּזְכִיִרִי לַיְתוֹ לַיסְהוּד. וְאִי לָא — זִמְנִין דְּחָזוּ מִכְּתָבָא וְאָתוּ מַסְהֲדִי, וְרַחֲמָנָא אָמַר: ״מִפִּיהֶם״, וְלֹא מִפִּי כְתָבָם.
human_translation: we leave it with the witnesses if they remember let them come forth and testify And if not there are times when they see that is written and come forth to testify And the Merciful One states: From their mouths, and not from their writings,
llm_translation: To place it before witnesses - if they remember, let them testify. And if not - at times they may see it in writing and come to testify, and the Merciful One said: "From their mouths," and not from the mouths of their writing.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, בְּגֵירוּשִׁין נָמֵי נֵימָא הָכִי! הָתָם — לְהַצָּלָה דִּידַהּ קָאָתֵי, הָכָא — לְחוֹבָה דִּידַהּ קָאָתֵי.
human_translation: If that is so, let us say that with regard to divorce as well. There, comes to save her, Here, comes to her disadvantage,
llm_translation: Thus, in the case of divorce, it is stated as follows: "There, it is for our own benefit that she is coming," whereas here, it is for her own obligation that she is coming.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ שְׁלֹשָׁה אַחִין נְשׂוּאִין שָׁלֹשׁ נׇכְרִיּוֹת, וּמֵת אֶחָד מֵהֶן, וְעָשָׂה בָּהּ הַשֵּׁנִי מַאֲמָר, וּמֵת — הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ חוֹלְצוֹת וְלֹא מִתְיַיבְּמוֹת.
human_translation: three brothers were married to three unrelated women, and one of died, The second performed levirate betrothal with and he died Then those perform ḥalitza and may not enter into levirate marriage.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: Three brothers who were married to three non-Jewish women, and one of them dies. The second brother performs chalitzah with her, and then he dies - these women are considered halutzot and not eligible for levirate marriage.

hebrew_text: שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּמֵת אֶחָד מֵהֶן... יְבָמָהּ יָבֹא עָלֶיהָ״ — שֶׁעָלֶיהָ זִיקַת יָבָם אֶחָד, וְלֹא שֶׁעָלֶיהָ זִיקַת שְׁנֵי יְבָמִין. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: מְיַיבֵּם לְאֵיזוֹ שֶׁיִּרְצֶה, וְחוֹלֵץ לַשְּׁנִיָּה.
human_translation: As it is stated: and one of them dies her brother-in-law will have intercourse with her” who has one levirate relationship and not one who has a double levirate relationship. Rabbi Shimon says: He consummate the levirate marriage with whichever he wishes and perform ḥalitza with the second.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: As it is stated: "And if one of them dies... her yevamah shall come upon him" — that her yevamah comes upon her due to the connection of one yavam, and not due to the connection of two yevamim. Rabbi Shimon says: He may perform yibum with whichever one he desires, and he must perform chalitzah with the other.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וְאִי זִיקַת שְׁנֵי יְבָמִין דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא, חֲלִיצָה נָמֵי לָא תִּיבְעֵי! אֶלָּא מִדְּרַבָּנַן, וּגְזֵירָה שֶׁמָּא יֹאמְרוּ שְׁתֵּי יְבָמוֹת הַבָּאוֹת מִבַּיִת אֶחָד מִתְיַיבְּמוֹת.
human_translation: If a double levirate relationship by Torah she should not require ḥalitza as well, Rather, by rabbinic decree lest say two yevamot who come from a single household can enter into levirate marriage.
llm_translation: Gemara: And if the connection of two yevamim is from the Torah, halitzah is not required! Rather, it is from the Rabbis, as a decree lest people say that two yevamot who come from one household will perform yibum.

hebrew_text: וּנְיַיבֵּם לַחֲדָא וְנִיחְלוֹץ לַחֲדָא! גְּזֵירָה שֶׁמָּא יֹאמְרוּ: בַּיִת אֶחָד, מִקְצָתוֹ בָּנוּי
human_translation: So let him consummate the levirate marriage with one and perform ḥalitza with one, decree lest they say: a single household, part of it be built
llm_translation: And they will contribute to one and divide for one! A decree lest they say: one house, part of it is built.

hebrew_text: וּמִקְצָתוֹ חָלוּץ.
human_translation: and part of it be released by ḥalitza .
llm_translation: And some of it is peeled.

hebrew_text: וְיֹאמְרוּ! אִי דִּמְיַיבֵּם וַהֲדַר חָלֵיץ — הָכִי נָמֵי.
human_translation: So let them say If he were to consummate the levirate marriage proceed to perform ḥalitza indeed
llm_translation: And they shall say! If he brings them and then retracts - so it is true.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא גְּזֵירָה דִּילְמָא חָלֵיץ בְּרֵישָׁא וַהֲדַר מְיַיבֵּם, וְקָם לֵיהּ בַּ״אֲשֶׁר לֹא יִבְנֶה״, וְרַחֲמָנָא אָמַר: כֵּיוָן שֶׁלֹּא בָּנָה — שׁוּב לֹא יִבְנֶה.
human_translation: Rather, decree lest he first perform ḥalitza and subsequently consummate the levirate marriage he is subject to who does not build the Merciful One states once he did not build he may not proceed to build
llm_translation: Rather, a decree, perhaps he will divorce initially and then remarry them, and then he will come to "that which shall not be built," and the Merciful One said: Once he has not built, he shall not build again.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: נָתַן גֵּט לְמַאֲמָרוֹ — הוּתְּרָה צָרָתָהּ. אֲבָל הִיא אֲסוּרָה, דְּמִחַלְּפָה בְּבַעֲלַת גֵּט.
human_translation: Rava said: gave a bill of divorce his levirate betrothal her rival wife is rendered permitted However, is forbidden She might be confused with who receives a bill of divorce.
llm_translation: Rava said: If he gave a bill of divorce according to his statement — her rival is permitted. But if she is forbidden, because she has exchanged with the wife of the bill of divorce.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי, אָמַר רָבָא: נָתַן גֵּט לְמַאֲמָרוֹ — הוּתְּרָה אֲפִילּוּ הִיא. מַאי טַעְמָא? מַאי דַּעֲבַד בַּהּ — שַׁקְלֵיהּ.
human_translation: There are who say Rava said: gave a bill of divorce his levirate betrothal even she is permitted What is the reason That which he performed with her, he removed.
llm_translation: There is one who says, Rava said: If he gave a bill of divorce according to his statement - she is divorced even if she is a minor. What is the reason? What did he do with it - he took it.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ שְׁנֵי אַחִין נְשׂוּאִין שְׁתֵּי אֲחָיוֹת, וּמֵת אֶחָד מֵהֶן, וְאַחַר כָּךְ מֵתָה אִשְׁתּוֹ שֶׁל שֵׁנִי — הֲרֵי זוֹ אֲסוּרָה עָלָיו עוֹלָמִית, הוֹאִיל וְנֶאֶסְרָה עָלָיו שָׁעָה אַחַת.
human_translation: two brothers were married to two sisters, and one of died, And afterward the wife of the second died. this is nevertheless forbidden to him forever, since she had been forbidden to him at one time.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: Two brothers married two sisters, and one of them dies, and afterwards the wife of the other brother dies - she is forever forbidden to him, since she was forbidden to him for even one moment.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ פְּשִׁיטָא! הַשְׁתָּא, וּמָה הָתָם דְּלָא מִידַּחְיָא מֵהַאי בֵּיתָא לִגְמָרֵי — אָמְרַתְּ לָא, הָכָא דְּקָא מִידַּחְיָא מֵהַאי בֵּיתָא לִגְמָרֵי — לָא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן! תַּנָּא — הָא תְּנָא בְּרֵישָׁא, וְהָךְ חַזְיַאּ לְהֶיתֵּירָא וְשַׁרְיַאּ, וַהֲדַר חַזְיַאּ לְאִיסּוּרָא. וְאַיְּידֵי דְּחַבִּיבָה לֵיהּ אַקְדְּמַהּ, וּמִשְׁנָה לֹא זָזָה מִמְּקוֹמָהּ.
human_translation: Isn’t obvious? Now, just as there, was not disassociated from this household completely, you said she may not here, where she is disassociated from this household completely, not all the more so The tanna taught this at first, he saw it those permitted, and permitted them. And then he saw it they are forbidden. And since it was beloved to him, he taught it earlier. the mishna does not move from its place.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemara, peshita! Hashta, u'mah hatam d'la midachya mehai beita ligmarei — amart la, hacha d'ka midachya mehai beita ligmarei — la kol sheken! Tanna — ha tana b'reisha, v'hach chazya leheiteira v'sharya, v'hadar chazya le'isura. V'ayidei d'chabivah leih akdemeih, u'mishnah lo zazah m'mekomah." English translation:

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: בָּא עָלֶיהָ — חַיָּיב עָלֶיהָ מִשּׁוּם אֵשֶׁת אָח, וּמִשּׁוּם אֲחוֹת אִשָּׁה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב אֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם אֵשֶׁת אָח בִּלְבַד. וְהָא תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב אֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם אֲחוֹת אִשָּׁה בִּלְבָד!
human_translation: The Sages taught: he engaged in sexual intercourse he is liable for a brother’s wife, and for a wife’s sister; the statement of Rabbi Yosei. Rabbi Shimon says: He is liable only for a brother’s wife. But isn’t it taught Rabbi Shimon says: He is liable only due to a wife’s sister?
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: If one engages in relations with her - he is liable for relations with his brother's wife, and for relations with his wife's sister, the words of Rabbi Yosei. Rabbi Shimon says: He is only liable for relations with his brother's wife alone. But isn't it taught: Rabbi Shimon says: He is only liable for relations with his wife's sister alone!

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן שֶׁנָּשָׂא חַי, וְאַחַר כָּךְ נָשָׂא מֵת. כָּאן שֶׁנָּשָׂא מֵת, וְאַחַר כָּךְ נָשָׂא חַי.
human_translation: not difficult. Here, where the living married and afterward the deceased There, where the deceased married and afterward the living married
llm_translation: Not difficult: here where he lifted up the living, and afterwards he lifted up the dead. Here where he lifted up the dead, and afterwards he lifted up the living.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, הֵיכָא דְּנָשָׂא מֵת וְאַחַר כָּךְ נָשָׂא חַי, כֵּיוָן דְּאִיסּוּר אֲחוֹת אִשָּׁה לָא חָיֵיל — תִּתְיַיבֵּם יַבּוֹמֵי!
human_translation: And Rabbi Shimon, where the deceased married and afterward the living married since the prohibition a wife’s sister never took effect, she should enter into levirate marriage.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon, where one married a deceased and then married a living, since the prohibition of a sister-in-law does not take effect - let the levirate marriage be established!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: אִיסּוּר אֲחוֹת אִשָּׁה מִיתְלָא תְּלֵי וְקָאֵי, אִי פָּקַע אִיסּוּר אֵשֶׁת אָח — אָתֵי אִיסּוּר אֲחוֹת אִשָּׁה וְחָיֵיל, וְהִילְכָּךְ לָא פָּקַע.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: The prohibition a wife’s sister remains suspended. If the prohibition a brother’s wife is terminated, the prohibition a wife’s sister comes and takes effect. Therefore, is not terminated.
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said: The prohibition of a woman's sister hangs and stands dependent. If the prohibition of a brother's wife is breached, the prohibition of a woman's sister comes and takes effect, and thus it is not breached.

hebrew_text: וְסָבַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אִיסּוּר חָל עַל אִיסּוּר? וְהָא תַּנְיָא: עָבַר עֲבֵירָה שֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהּ שְׁתֵּי מִיתוֹת — נִידּוֹן בַּחֲמוּרָה. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: נִידּוֹן בַּזִּיקָּה הָרִאשׁוֹנָה הַבָּאָה עָלָיו.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yosei hold a prohibition takes effect prohibition But isn’t it taught One who committed a transgression deserving of two death penalties is sentenced to the harsher Rabbi Yosei says: He is sentenced according to the first relationship that applied to him
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And Rabbi Yosei thought, is one prohibition liable upon another prohibition? But isn't it taught: If one transgresses a sin that incurs two death penalties - he is judged with the more severe one. Rabbi Yosei says: He is judged with the first inflicted punishment that comes upon him.

hebrew_text: וְתַנְיָא: כֵּיצַד אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי נִידּוֹן בַּזִּיקָּה הָרִאשׁוֹנָה הַבָּאָה עָלָיו? חֲמוֹתוֹ וְנַעֲשֵׂית אֵשֶׁת אִישׁ — נִידּוֹן בַּחֲמוֹתוֹ. אֵשֶׁת אִישׁ וְנַעֲשֵׂית חֲמוֹתוֹ — נִידּוֹן בְּאֵשֶׁת אִישׁ.
human_translation: And it is taught In what case did Rabbi Yosei say that he is sentenced according to the first relationship that applied to him? his mother-in-law and became a married woman he is sentenced for his mother-in-law, a married woman became his mother-in-law, he is sentenced for a married woman.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it was taught: How did Rabbi Yosei say one is judged in the first lawsuit that comes upon him? If his mother-in-law becomes his wife, he is judged regarding his mother-in-law. If his wife becomes his mother-in-law, he is judged regarding his wife.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: מוֹדֶה רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּאִיסּוּר מוֹסִיף.
human_translation: Rabbi Abbahu said: Rabbi Yosei concedes when it is an expanded prohibition.
llm_translation: Rabbi Avahu said: Rabbi Yosei concedes in the case of prohibition, he adds.

hebrew_text: תִּינַח הֵיכָא דְּנָשָׂא חַי וְאַחַר כָּךְ נָשָׂא מֵת — מִגּוֹ דְּאִתּוֹסַף אִיסּוּר לְגַבֵּי אַחִים, אִתּוֹסַף אִיסּוּר לְגַבֵּי דִידֵיהּ.
human_translation: works out well where the living married and then afterward the deceased married Since a prohibition was added for the brothers, a prohibition was added for
llm_translation: Here is the place where he married a living woman and afterwards married a dead one - because the prohibition against brothers was added in his case, the prohibition against his own relatives was added in her case.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא הֵיכָא דְּנָשָׂא מֵת וְאַחַר כָּךְ נָשָׂא חַי, מַאי אִיסּוּר מוֹסִיף אִיכָּא?
human_translation: However, where deceased married afterward living married in what way is there a prohibition that adds?
llm_translation: Rather, here where one marries a deceased woman and afterwards marries a living woman, what additional prohibition is there?

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא מִגּוֹ דְּאִיתְּסַר בְּכוּלְּהוּ אַחְווֹתָא — הַאי אִיסּוּר כּוֹלֵל הוּא.
human_translation: And if you would say: Since he became prohibited to all of the other sisters, it is a more inclusive prohibition.
llm_translation: And if you will say, from where do we know that when it is prohibited in all of them, it includes the sister - this prohibition is all-encompassing.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: מַעֲלֶה אֲנִי עָלָיו כְּאִילּוּ עָשָׂה שְׁתַּיִם, וְאֵינוֹ חַיָּיב אֶלָּא אַחַת. וְכֵן כִּי אֲתָא רָבִין, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מַעֲלֶה אֲנִי עָלָיו כְּאִילּוּ עָשָׂה שְׁתַּיִם, וְאֵינוֹ חַיָּיב אֶלָּא אַחַת. מַאי נָפְקָא מִינַּהּ? לְקׇבְרוֹ בֵּין רְשָׁעִים גְּמוּרִים.
human_translation: Rather, Rava said I ascribe to him as though he transgressed twice, yet he is liable on only one And likewise, when Ravin came Rabbi Yoḥanan said: I ascribe to him as though he transgressed twice, yet he is liable on only one What difference does it make to bury him among the completely wicked.
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said: I maintain regarding it as if he performed two, yet he is liable only for one. And similarly, when Ravin came, Rabbi Yochanan said: I maintain regarding it as if he performed two, yet he is liable only for one. What practical difference does it make? To bury him among the completely wicked.

hebrew_text: וּבִפְלוּגְתָּא. דְּאִיתְּמַר: זָר שֶׁשִּׁימֵּשׁ בְּשַׁבָּת, רַבִּי חִיָּיא אוֹמֵר: חַיָּיב שְׁתַּיִם. בַּר קַפָּרָא אוֹמֵר: אֵין חַיָּיב אֶלָּא אַחַת. קָפַץ רַבִּי חִיָּיא וְנִשְׁבַּע: הָעֲבוֹדָה! כָּךְ שָׁמַעְתִּי מֵרַבִּי: שְׁתַּיִם. קָפַץ בַּר קַפָּרָא וְנִשְׁבַּע: הָעֲבוֹדָה! כָּךְ שָׁמַעְתִּי מֵרַבִּי: אַחַת.
human_translation: in the dispute where it was stated: a non-priest who served on Shabbat, Rabbi Ḥiyya says: He is liable two Bar Kappara says: He is liable only one Rabbi Ḥiyya jumped up and swore: by the Temple service this I heard from Rabbi two Bar Kappara jumped up and swore: by the Temple service this I heard from Rabbi one
llm_translation: In the dispute where it was stated: A non-Jew who kindled a fire on Shabbat, Rabbi Chiya says: He is liable for two sacrifices. Bar Kappara says: He is liable for only one. Rabbi Chiya jumped up and swore: By the Temple service! Thus I heard from my teacher: Two sacrifices. Bar Kappara jumped up and swore: By the Temple service! Thus I heard from my teacher: One sacrifice.

hebrew_text: הִתְחִיל רַבִּי חִיָּיא לָדוּן: שַׁבָּת לַכֹּל נֶאֶסְרָה, כְּשֶׁהוּתְּרָה בַּמִּקְדָּשׁ — אֵצֶל כֹּהֲנִים הוּתְּרָה. לְכֹהֲנִים הוּתְּרָה, וְלֹא לְזָרִים. יֵשׁ כָּאן מִשּׁוּם זָרוּת, וְיֵשׁ כָּאן מִשּׁוּם שַׁבָּת. הִתְחִיל בַּר קַפָּרָא לָדוּן: שַׁבָּת לַכֹּל נֶאֶסְרָה, כְּשֶׁהוּתְּרָה בַּמִּקְדָּשׁ — הוּתְּרָה. אֵין כָּאן אֶלָּא זָרוּת.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya began to deliberate Shabbat was prohibited to all. When was permitted in the Temple it was permitted for priests. it was permitted for priests and not for non-priests. there is here due to a non-priest and there is here due to Shabbat. Bar Kappara began to deliberate Shabbat was prohibited to all. When it was permitted it was permitted in the Temple, there is here only a non-priest,
llm_translation: Rabbi Chiya began to discuss: Shabbat is prohibited for everyone; when it was permitted in the Temple, it was permitted for the Kohanim. It was permitted for the Kohanim, but not for non-priests. There is here a matter of exclusion due to being a non-priest, and there is here a matter of Shabbat. Bar Kappara began to discuss: Shabbat is prohibited for everyone; when it was permitted in the Temple, it was permitted. There is here only exclusion.

hebrew_text: בַּעַל מוּם שֶׁשִּׁימֵּשׁ בְּטוּמְאָה. רַבִּי חִיָּיא אוֹמֵר: חַיָּיב שְׁתַּיִם. בַּר קַפָּרָא אוֹמֵר: אֵין חַיָּיב אֶלָּא אַחַת. קָפַץ רַבִּי חִיָּיא וְנִשְׁבַּע: הָעֲבוֹדָה! כָּךְ שָׁמַעְתִּי מֵרַבִּי: שְׁתַּיִם. קָפַץ בַּר קַפָּרָא וְנִשְׁבַּע: הָעֲבוֹדָה! כָּךְ שָׁמַעְתִּי מֵרַבִּי: אַחַת.
human_translation: with a blemish who served while ritually impure. Rabbi Ḥiyya says: He is liable on two Bar Kappara says: He is liable on only one Rabbi Ḥiyya jumped up and swore: by the Temple service this I heard from Rabbi two Bar Kappara jumped up and swore: by the Temple service this I heard from Rabbi one
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "A blemished animal that was used for mating. Rabbi Chiya says: liable twice. Bar Kappara says: liable only once. Rabbi Chiya jumped up and swore: the service! That is what I heard from Rabbi: twice. Bar Kappara jumped up and swore: the service! That is what I heard from Rabbi: once."

hebrew_text: הִתְחִיל רַבִּי חִיָּיא לָדוּן: טוּמְאָה לַכֹּל נֶאֶסְרָה, כְּשֶׁהוּתְּרָה בַּמִּקְדָּשׁ — אֵצֶל כֹּהֲנִים תְּמִימִים הוּתְּרָה. לְכֹהֲנִים תְּמִימִים הוּתְּרָה, וְלֹא לְבַעֲלֵי מוּמִין. יֵשׁ כָּאן מִשּׁוּם בַּעֲלֵי מוּמִין, וְיֵשׁ כָּאן מִשּׁוּם טוּמְאָה. הִתְחִיל בַּר קַפָּרָא לָדוּן: טוּמְאָה לַכֹּל נֶאֶסְרָה, כְּשֶׁהוּתְּרָה בַּמִּקְדָּשׁ — הוּתְּרָה, אֵין כָּאן אֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם בַּעַל מוּם.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya began to deliberate. Ritual impurity was prohibited to all, When it was permitted in the Temple it was permitted for unblemished priests. it was permitted for unblemished priests and not for with blemishes. there is here due to a blemished and there is here due to ritual impurity. Bar Kappara began to deliberate Ritual impurity was prohibited to all. When it was permitted in the Temple, it was permitted there is here only due to a blemished
llm_translation: Rabbi Chiya began to discuss: "Impurity is prohibited for everyone, when it was permitted in the Temple - it was permitted for the unblemished priests. It was permitted for the unblemished priests, but not for those with blemishes. Here there is a case of those with blemishes, and here there is a case of impurity." Bar Kappara began to discuss: "Impurity is prohibited for everyone, when it was permitted in the Temple - it was permitted, there is only a case here of someone with a blemish."

hebrew_text: זָר שֶׁאָכַל מְלִיקָה, רַבִּי חִיָּיא אוֹמֵר: חַיָּיב שְׁתַּיִם. בַּר קַפָּרָא אוֹמֵר: אֵין חַיָּיב אֶלָּא אַחַת. קָפַץ רַבִּי חִיָּיא וְנִשְׁבַּע: הָעֲבוֹדָה! כָּךְ שָׁמַעְתִּי מֵרַבִּי: שְׁתַּיִם. קָפַץ בַּר קַפָּרָא וְנִשְׁבַּע: הָעֲבוֹדָה! כָּךְ שָׁמַעְתִּי מֵרַבִּי: אַחַת.
human_translation: a non-priest who ate a pinching Rabbi Ḥiyya says: He is liable on two Bar Kappara says: He is liable on only one Rabbi Ḥiyya jumped up and swore: by the Temple service this I heard from Rabbi two Bar Kappara jumped up and swore: by the Temple service this I heard from Rabbi one
llm_translation: Foreigner who ate from the offering, Rabbi Chiya says: liable two. Bar Kappara says: liable only one. Rabbi Chiya jumped and swore: the service! Thus I heard from Rabbi: two. Bar Kappara jumped and swore: the service! Thus I heard from Rabbi: one.

hebrew_text: הִתְחִיל רַבִּי חִיָּיא לָדוּן: נְבֵלָה לַכֹּל נֶאֶסְרָה. כְּשֶׁהוּתְּרָה בַּמִּקְדָּשׁ — אֵצֶל כֹּהֲנִים הוּתְּרָה. לְכֹהֲנִים הוּתְּרָה, וְלֹא לְזָרִים. יֵשׁ כָּאן מִשּׁוּם זָרוּת, וְיֵשׁ כָּאן מִשּׁוּם מְלִיקָה. הִתְחִיל בַּר קַפָּרָא לָדוּן: נְבֵלָה לַכֹּל נֶאֶסְרָה, כְּשֶׁהוּתְּרָה בַּמִּקְדָּשׁ — הוּתְּרָה, אֵין כָּאן אֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם זָרוּת.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya began to deliberate. An unslaughtered animal carcass was prohibited to all. When it was permitted in the Temple, it was permitted to priests it was permitted to priests and not to non-priests, there is here due to status as a non-priest and there is a here due to pinching. Bar Kappara began to deliberate: An unslaughtered animal carcass was prohibited to all. When it was permitted in the Temple, it was permitted there is here only for being a non-priest,
llm_translation: Rabbi Chiya began to discuss: A nevelah is forbidden to everyone. When it was permitted in the Temple — it was permitted for the priests. It was permitted for the priests, but not for non-priests. There is here a matter of being a non-priest, and there is here a matter of being unfit. Bar Kappara began to discuss: A nevelah is forbidden to everyone, when it was permitted in the Temple — it was permitted, there is here only a matter of being a non-priest.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי קָמִיפַּלְגִי — בְּאִיסּוּר כּוֹלֵל, וְאַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי. רַבִּי חִיָּיא סָבַר: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּאִיסּוּר כּוֹלֵל מִיחַיַּיב תַּרְתֵּי, בַּר קַפָּרָא סָבַר: לָא מִיחַיַּיב אֶלָּא חֲדָא.
human_translation: With regard to what do they disagree? a more inclusive prohibition, and according to Rabbi Yosei. Rabbi Ḥiyya holds that Rabbi Yosei in a more inclusive prohibition, one is liable on two Bar Kappara holds one is liable only on one
llm_translation: With what do they argue? — With regard to a comprehensive prohibition, and the opinion of Rabbi Yosei. Rabbi Chiya holds: Rabbi Yosei deems one liable for a comprehensive prohibition twice, while Bar Kappara holds: One is only liable once.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי אִיסּוּר כּוֹלֵל אִיכָּא הָכָא? בִּשְׁלָמָא זָר: מֵעִיקָּרָא שְׁרֵי בִּמְלָאכָה וְאָסוּר בַּעֲבוֹדָה. אָתְיָא לַהּ שַׁבָּת, מִגּוֹ דְּקָא מִיתְּסַר בִּמְלָאכָה — מִיתְּסַר נָמֵי בַּעֲבוֹדָה.
human_translation: And what more inclusive prohibition is there here Granted, a non-priest initially he was permitted to perform labor and was prohibited from the service. Shabbat came, since he is prohibited from prohibited labor he is also prohibited from service
llm_translation: And what is the prohibition that includes everything here? Regarding a non-Jew: Initially permitted for work and prohibited for worship. When it comes to Shabbat, since he is refraining from work - he is also refraining from worship.

hebrew_text: בַּעַל מוּם: מֵעִיקָּרָא שְׁרֵי בַּאֲכִילָה, וְאָסוּר בַּעֲבוֹדָה. אִיטַּמִּי לֵיהּ, מִגּוֹ דְּקָא מִיתְּסַר בַּאֲכִילָה — מִיתְּסַר נָמֵי בַּעֲבוֹדָה. אֶלָּא מְלִיקָה — בְּבַת אַחַת הִיא דְּמַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ, בְּאִיסּוּר כּוֹלֵל לָא מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ.
human_translation: a blemished priest Initially, he was allowed to eat but was prohibited from the service, he was rendered ritually impure, since he is prohibited from eating he is also prohibited from service However, pinching, you find simultaneously. You do not, find a more inclusive prohibition
llm_translation: Ba'al Mum: Initially permitted in eating, and forbidden in work. If you seal it, from where it is being withheld in eating - it is being withheld indeed in work. Rather, licking - in one stroke it is forgotten, in a total prohibition it is not forgotten.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, קָמִיפַּלְגִי בְּאִיסּוּר בְּבַת אַחַת, וְאַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי. רַבִּי חִיָּיא סָבַר: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּאִיסּוּר בַּת אַחַת מִיחַיַּיב תַּרְתֵּי, וּבַר קַפָּרָא סָבַר: לָא מִיחַיַּיב אֶלָּא חֲדָא.
human_translation: Rather, they disagree with regard to prohibition simultaneously, and according to Rabbi Yosei. Rabbi Ḥiyya holds that Rabbi Yosei one is liable on two prohibitions simultaneously. And bar Kappara holds one is liable only on a single
llm_translation: Rather, he divided in prohibition in one daughter, and according to the opinion of Rabbi Yosei. Rabbi Chiya holds: Rabbi Yosei in prohibition in one daughter obligates two, and Bar Kappara holds: he only obligates one.

hebrew_text: וְהָכָא, מַאי אִיסּוּר בַּת אַחַת אִיכָּא הָכָא? זָר שֶׁשִּׁימֵּשׁ בְּשַׁבָּת — כְּגוֹן דְּאַיְיתִי שְׁתֵּי שְׂעָרוֹת בְּשַׁבָּת, דְּהָוְיָא לְהוּ זָרוּת וְשַׁבָּת בַּהֲדֵי הֲדָדֵי.
human_translation: But here, what simultaneous prohibitions is there here? the non-priest who served on Shabbat, this would be in a case where grew two hairs, on Shabbat. this is a non-priest and Shabbat together.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And here, what is the prohibition of one daughter here? A non-Jewess who bathed on Shabbat - for example, if she brought two hairs on Shabbat, it would be considered mingling and Shabbat together. English translation:

hebrew_text: בַּעַל מוּם נָמֵי — כְּגוֹן דְּאַיְיתִי שְׁתֵּי שְׂעָרוֹת וְאִיטַּמִּי לֵיהּ, דְּהָוְיָא לֵיהּ בַּעַל מוּם וְטוּמְאָה בַּהֲדֵי הֲדָדֵי. אִי נָמֵי, שֶׁחָתַךְ אֶצְבָּעוֹ בְּסַכִּין טְמֵאָה.
human_translation: one who was blemished, as well: where grew two hairs and was rendered ritually impure. This is a blemished and ritual impurity together. Alternatively, where he cut his finger with a ritually impure knife.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Ba'al mum namei — kegon de'ayiti shtei se'arot ve'itami lei, dehavaya lei ba'al mum ve'tum'ah bahadei hadadei. Iy namei, shechatak etzba'o besakin teme'ah." The English translation is: "A blemished animal is considered — for example, if one plucks out two hairs and seals them, it becomes a blemished and impure animal in each other's presence. If it is blemished, if he cut off its finger with a ritually impure knife."

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַבִּי חִיָּיא, כִּי אַתְנְיֵיהּ לְדִידֵיהּ — אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי, כִּי אַתְנְיֵיהּ לְבַר קַפָּרָא — אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן. אֶלָּא לְבַר קַפָּרָא, רַבִּי חִיָּיא שַׁקּוֹרֵי קָא מְשַׁקֵּר?
human_translation: Granted, according to Rabbi Ḥiyya, When Rabbi taught according to Rabbi Yosei, when taught bar Kappara, according to Rabbi Shimon According to bar Kappara, however, was Rabbi Ḥiyya then telling a falsehood?
llm_translation: In peace to Rabbi Chiya, when he teaches it to his own - according to the opinion of Rabbi Yosei, when he teaches it to Bar Kappara - according to the opinion of Rabbi Shimon. Rather, to Bar Kappara, is Rabbi Chiya considered a liar?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: קָמִיפַּלְגִי בְּאִיסּוּר בַּת אַחַת, וְאַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַבִּי חִיָּיא, קָא מִישְׁתְּבַע לְאַפּוֹקֵי לְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן מֵחֶזְקֵיהּ. אֶלָּא לְבַר קַפָּרָא — לְמָה לֵיהּ לְאִשְׁתְּבוֹעֵי? קַשְׁיָא.
human_translation: Rather, disagree prohibitions simultaneously, and according to Rabbi Shimon. Granted, according to Rabbi Ḥiyya he was swearing. to exclude Rabbi Shimon’s his presumed However, according to bar Kappara, why was it necessary to swear? difficult.
llm_translation: Rather: he argues in the prohibition of one daughter, and according to the opinion of Rabbi Shimon: Granted for Rabbi Chiya, he is seeking to exempt Rabbi Shimon from his presumption. But for Bar Kappara - why should he seek to exempt him? It is difficult.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְבַר קַפָּרָא, כִּי אַתְנְיֵיהּ רַבִּי לְדִידֵיהּ — אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, כִּי אַתְנְיֵיהּ לְרַבִּי חִיָּיא — אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי. אֶלָּא לְרַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר קַפָּרָא, שַׁקּוֹרֵי קָא מְשַׁקֵּר?
human_translation: Granted, according to bar Kappara, when Rabbi taught him, according to Rabbi Shimon, when he taught to Rabbi Ḥiyya according to Rabbi Yosei. However, according to Rabbi Ḥiyya, bar Kappara lying?
llm_translation: In truth, regarding Bar Kappara, when Rabbi taught it to his own students - according to the opinion of Rabbi Shimon, when he taught it to Rabbi Chiya - according to the opinion of Rabbi Yosei. Rather, this applies to Rabbi Chiya Bar Kappara, are the readers deceiving themselves?

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָךְ רַבִּי חִיָּיא: כִּי אַתְנְיֵיהּ רַבִּי לְדִידֵיהּ, תַּרְתֵּי לִפְטוּר אַתְנְיֵיהּ,
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya said to you When Rabbi taught him, he taught him two exemptions,
llm_translation: Rabbi Chiya said to you: When Rabbi taught it to his own satisfaction, he taught two versions.

hebrew_text: וְאִיסּוּר כּוֹלֵל אַתְנְיֵיהּ, וְאַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן. וְחַזְיַאּ (לְ)בַּר קַפָּרָא לְזָר שֶׁאָכַל מְלִיקָה, וְאַיְּידֵי דְּדָמְיָא לַהּ — עָרְבַהּ בַּהֲדַיְיהוּ, וְעַיֵּין בַּהּ, וְלָא אַשְׁכַּח אֶלָּא בְּבַת אַחַת.
human_translation: And he taught him a more inclusive prohibition, and in accordance with Rabbi Shimon. And bar Kappara saw a non-priest who ate pinching, and since it was similar he mixed them together. but he examined this he found only simultaneously.
llm_translation: The prohibition includes its handle, according to the opinion of Rabbi Shimon. And Bar Kappara saw a non-Jew who ate a limb from a living animal, and since its blood was still in it, he mixed it with milk, and he examined it, and he found nothing except in one daughter.

hebrew_text: וְסָבַר: מִדְּהָא בְּבַת אַחַת, הָא נָמֵי בְּבַת אַחַת. וּמִדְּהָנָךְ לִפְטוּר, הָנָךְ נָמֵי לִפְטוּר.
human_translation: And he concluded since simultaneously, simultaneous as well. And since to exempt those cases, these cases to exempt as well.
llm_translation: He reasoned: Since in one case, it is indeed in one case. And from the other, to exempt, from the other it is indeed to exempt.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: זָר שֶׁשִּׁימֵּשׁ בְּשַׁבָּת, וּבַעַל מוּם שֶׁשִּׁימֵּשׁ בְּטוּמְאָה — יֵשׁ כָּאן מִשּׁוּם זָרוּת, וּמִשּׁוּם שַׁבָּת, וּמִשּׁוּם בַּעַל מוּם, וּמִשּׁוּם טוּמְאָה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: אֵין כָּאן אֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם זָרוּת וּבַעַל מוּם בִּלְבַד. וְאִילּוּ מְלִיקָה שַׁיְּירַהּ.
human_translation: raises an objection a non-priest who served on Shabbat and a blemished priest who served while ritually impure, there is here, due to a non-priest; and due to Shabbat; and due to a blemished priest; and due to ritual impurity. the statement of Rabbi Yosei. Rabbi Shimon says: There is here only due to a non-priest and due to a blemished priest. And yet pinching was left out
llm_translation: Challenger: A non-priest who performed a service on Shabbat, and a blemished priest who performed a service in a state of impurity - here there is a concern of foreign service, and a concern of Shabbat, and a concern of blemish, and a concern of impurity, the words of Rabbi Yosei. Rabbi Shimon says: There is only a concern of foreign service and blemish alone. And if it was a case of salting, it should be left.

hebrew_text: לְמַאן שַׁיְּירַהּ? אִילֵימָא לְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי, הַשְׁתָּא רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּאִיסּוּר כּוֹלֵל מִיחַיַּיב שְׁתַּיִם — בְּאִיסּוּר בַּת אַחַת מִיבַּעְיָא? אֶלָּא לָאו לְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן. וּבְאִיסּוּר כּוֹלֵל הוּא דְּפָטַר, אֲבָל בְּאִיסּוּר בְּבַת אַחַת — מִיחַיַּיב. תְּיוּבְתָּא דָּבָר קַפָּרָא תְּיוּבְתָּא.
human_translation: According to whom was this left out? If we say according to Rabbi Yosei, Now Rabbi Yosei in a more inclusive prohibition, that one is liable on two is necessary where the prohibition simultaneously Rather, is it not according to Rabbi Shimon exempts more inclusive prohibitions, but in simultaneous prohibitions deem liable The refutation of bar Kappara is a conclusive refutation,
llm_translation: To whom does it remain? If you say it remains for Rabbi Yosei, now Rabbi Yosei in a general prohibition includes two - in a prohibition where one is included, does he require two? Rather, it is not for Rabbi Shimon. And in a general prohibition, he is exempt, but in a prohibition with one included - he is liable. The redundancy of the matter is the redundancy.

hebrew_text: זָר שֶׁשִּׁימֵּשׁ בְּשַׁבָּת, בְּמַאי? אִי בִּשְׁחִיטָה — שְׁחִיטָה בְּזָר כְּשֵׁרָה. וְאִי בְּקַבָּלָה וְהוֹלָכָה — טִלְטוּל בְּעָלְמָא הוּא.
human_translation: a non-priest who served on Shabbat. In what If the slaughtering slaughtering by a non-priest is valid. And if receiving and carrying this is a case only of moving,
llm_translation: Stranger who handled on Shabbat, with what? If with slaughter — slaughter by a stranger is valid. And if with receiving and walking — it is merely handling.

hebrew_text: אִי בְּהַקְטָרָה — וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַבְעָרָה לְלָאו יָצָאתָה.
human_translation: If by burning but didn’t Rabbi Yosei say kindling on Shabbat was out a prohibition?
llm_translation: If it was done through burning incense - but didn't Rabbi Yosei say: "Through burning it, you have not fulfilled the obligation."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב: בִּשְׁחִיטַת פָּרוֹ שֶׁל כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל, וּכְדִבְרֵי הָאוֹמֵר שְׁחִיטַת פָּרוֹ שֶׁל כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל בְּזָר פְּסוּלָה. אִי הָכִי, מַאי אִירְיָא זָר? אֲפִילּוּ כֹּהֵן הֶדְיוֹט נָמֵי! שֶׁזָּר אֶצְלוֹ קָאָמַר.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa bar Yaakov said: in the slaughtering of the High Priest’s bull and this is in accordance with the statement of the one who says the slaughtering of the High Priest’s bull is disqualified by a non-priest, If so, why specifically a non-priest? The same would hold true even a common priest as well. This is referring to one who is as a non-priest in relation to
llm_translation: Rav Acha bar Yaakov said: In the slaughtering of the bull of the High Priest, and according to the words of the one who says the slaughtering of the bull of the High Priest by a non-priest is invalid. If so, what is the relevance of a non-priest? Even a regular priest as well! For he is saying a non-priest in comparison to him.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב אָשֵׁי: מִידֵּי חַטָּאוֹת קָתָנֵי, אוֹ לָאוֵי קָתָנֵי?! אֶלָּא אִיסּוּרֵי בְּעָלְמָא קָא חָשֵׁיב. לְמַאי נָפְקָא מִינַּהּ? לְקוֹבְרוֹ בֵּין רְשָׁעִים גְּמוּרִים.
human_translation: Rav Ashi strongly objects to this: Is teaching sin-offerings or is he teaching negative mitzvot Rather, he merely the prohibitions What practical difference does it make to bury him among the completely wicked.
llm_translation: Challenges to him Rav Ashe: From the hands of sin-offerings it teaches, or from the hands of guilt-offerings it teaches?! Rather, general prohibitions it deems. What is derived from it? To bury him among the completely wicked.
