hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ שְׁנַיִם שֶׁקִּידְּשׁוּ שְׁתֵּי נָשִׁים, וּבִשְׁעַת כְּנִיסָתָן לַחוּפָּה הֶחְלִיפוּ אֶת שֶׁל זֶה לָזֶה וְאֶת שֶׁל זֶה לָזֶה — הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ חַיָּיבִין מִשּׁוּם אֵשֶׁת אִישׁ. וְאִם הָיוּ אַחִין — מִשּׁוּם אֵשֶׁת אָח. וְאִם הָיוּ אֲחָיוֹת — מִשּׁוּם ״אִשָּׁה אֶל אֲחוֹתָהּ״. וְאִם הָיוּ נִדּוֹת — מִשּׁוּם נִדָּה.
human_translation: two who betrothed two women, and at the time that they entered the wedding canopy, switched this with that and that with this then these are liable for a married woman, And if they were brothers, for a brother’s wife. And if were sisters, for a wife and her sister And if they were menstruating women, for a menstruating woman
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If two men betrothed two women, and at the time of their entry to the wedding canopy, they exchanged one man's betrothal contract for the other's, and one woman's betrothal contract for the other's, these women are considered married due to the prohibition of adultery. If they were brothers, they are considered married due to the prohibition of marrying one's brother's wife. If they were sisters, they are considered married due to the prohibition of marrying one's sister-in-law. If they were menstruating women, they are considered married due to the prohibition of engaging in sexual relations with a menstruating woman.

hebrew_text: וּמַפְרִישִׁין אוֹתָן שְׁלֹשָׁה חֳדָשִׁים, שֶׁמָּא מְעוּבָּרוֹת הֵן. וְאִם הָיוּ קְטַנּוֹת שֶׁאֵינָן רְאוּיוֹת לֵילֵד — מַחֲזִירִים אוֹתָן מִיָּד. וְאִם הָיוּ כֹּהֲנוֹת, נִפְסְלוּ מִן הַתְּרוּמָה.
human_translation: And we separate for three months, lest they were impregnated And if they were female minors and unable to bear children, then we immediately return them And if they were daughters of priests, they are disqualified from eating of teruma .
llm_translation: And we separate them for three months, lest they are already impregnated. And if they were small and not fit for childbirth - they return them immediately. And if they were Kohanim, they become disqualified from partaking of the priestly gifts.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ הֶחְלִיפוּ. מִידֵּי בְּרַשִּׁיעֵי עָסְקִינַן?! וְתוּ, הָא דְתָנֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא: הֲרֵי כָּאן שֵׁשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה חַטָּאוֹת — אִי בְּמֵזִיד מִי אִיכָּא קׇרְבָּן? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: תְּנִי ״הוּחְלְפוּ״.
human_translation: They switched Are we dealing with wicked individuals And furthermore, that which Rabbi Ḥiyya taught There are sixteen sin-offerings here, if intentionally would there be an offering? Rav Yehuda said: Teach they were switched,
llm_translation: Theft they exchanged. Immediately by the wicked ones we are dealing with?! And furthermore, this that Rabbi Chiya taught: Behold here sixteen sins — if intentionally, is there a sacrifice? Rav Yehudah said: Teach "they exchanged."

hebrew_text: הָכִי נָמֵי מִסְתַּבְּרָא, דְּקָתָנֵי סֵיפָא: אִם הָיוּ קְטַנּוֹת שֶׁאֵינָן רְאוּיוֹת לֵילֵד — מַחֲזִירִין אוֹתָן מִיָּד. וְאִי בְּמֵזִיד, מִי שַׁרְיָא? הָא לָא קַשְׁיָא: פִּיתּוּי קְטַנָּה אוֹנֶס נִינְהוּ, וְאוֹנֶס בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל מִישְׁרָא שְׁרֵי.
human_translation: This, too, stands to reason from the fact that the latter clause teaches: If they were female minors and unable to bear children, then we immediately return them. And if intentionally, would it be permitted This not difficult seduction of a minor girl is rape, and rape is permitted to an Israelite
llm_translation: Thus it was explained, as it is taught in the latter part: If they were small animals that are not fit for giving birth - they return them immediately. And if it was done intentionally, is it permitted? This is not difficult: If it was a small opening, it is considered accidental, and an accident in Israel is considered intentional.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא דְּקָתָנֵי: מַפְרִישִׁין אוֹתָן שְׁלֹשָׁה חֳדָשִׁים שֶׁמָּא מְעוּבָּרוֹת הֵן. הָא לָאו מְעוּבָּרוֹת — שַׁרְיָין, וְאִי בְּמֵזִיד מִי שְׁרֵי? אֶלָּא לָאו, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ הוּחְלְפוּ. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: However, that teaches: We separate for three months, perhaps they pregnant. Were they are not pregnant, they are permitted And if intentionally, would this be permitted? Rather, not conclude from here they were switched conclude from here
llm_translation: Rather, it is taught: They separate them for three months lest they be pregnant. But if they are not pregnant, they are permitted. And if it was intentional, is it permitted? Rather, no, assume that they have changed. Assume that they have changed.

hebrew_text: וּמַאן הַאי תַּנָּא דְּאִית לֵיהּ אִיסּוּר כּוֹלֵל וְאִיסּוּר מוֹסִיף וְאִיסּוּר בַּת אַחַת?
human_translation: who is this tanna who holds a more inclusive prohibition, an expanded prohibition, and a simultaneous prohibition?
llm_translation: And who is this Tanna that holds that a prohibition includes and adds another prohibition, and a prohibition in one instance?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: רַבִּי מֵאִיר הִיא. דְּתַנְיָא: יֵשׁ אוֹכֵל אֲכִילָה אַחַת וְחַיָּיב עָלֶיהָ אַרְבַּע חַטָּאוֹת וְאָשָׁם אֶחָד.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said that Rav said: This is Rabbi Meir, as it is taught There is eating and he is liable to bring four sin-offerings and one guilt-offering.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: It is Rabbi Meir. As it was taught: There is one who eats one portion and is liable for four sin-offerings and one guilt-offering.

hebrew_text: טָמֵא שֶׁאָכַל חֵלֶב, וְהוּא נוֹתָר מִן מוּקְדָּשִׁין, בְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים.
human_translation: ritually impure who ate fat notar from a consecrated offering, on Yom Kippur.
llm_translation: Impure that ate fat, and it remained from offerings, on day of atonements.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: אִם הָיְתָה שַׁבָּת וְהוֹצִיאוֹ בְּפִיו — חַיָּיב. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: אֵינוֹ מִן הַשֵּׁם.
human_translation: Rabbi Meir says: If it was Shabbat and he carried in his mouth, he is liable said to is not from of the type
llm_translation: Rabbi Meir says: If it was Shabbat and he carried it out in his mouth - liable. They said to him: It is not from the name.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי מֵאִיר אַלִּיבָּא דְּמַאן? אִי אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ, הָאָמַר: טָעָה בִּדְבַר מִצְוָה — פָּטוּר. אֶלָּא אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר.
human_translation: And in accordance with whose opinion is Rabbi Meir? If it is in accordance Rabbi Yehoshua, Didn’t say that one who erred with regard to a mitzva is exempt Rather, in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer,
llm_translation: Rabbi Meir according to whose opinion? If according to the opinion of Rabbi Yehoshua, who said: If one made a mistake in a matter of a commandment - he is exempt. Rather, according to the opinion of Rabbi Eliezer.

hebrew_text: אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: לְעוֹלָם אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ, כִּי קָאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ טָעָה בִּדְבַר מִצְוָה פָּטוּר, הָנֵי מִילֵּי גַּבֵּי תִּינוֹקוֹת — דִּזְמַנּוֹ בָּהוּל, אֲבָל הַאי, כֵּיוָן דְּאֵין זְמַנּוֹ בָּהוּל — לָא.
human_translation: If you wish, say: Actually, according to Rabbi Yehoshua. When Rabbi Yehoshua says that one who erred with regard to a mitzva is exempt, this applies to babies since pressed for time. In this however, since not pressed for time not
llm_translation: If you wish, say: Always follow the opinion of Rabbi Yehoshua, for when Rabbi Yehoshua says one who errs in a matter of a commandment is exempt, he is referring to matters concerning young children - whose time is in confusion. But this one, since his time is not in confusion - no.

hebrew_text: וַהֲרֵי תְּרוּמָה, דְּאֵין זְמַנּוֹ בָּהוּל, וְקָפָטַר! דִּתְנַן: הָיָה אוֹכֵל בִּתְרוּמָה, וְנוֹדַע שֶׁהוּא בֶּן גְּרוּשָׁה אוֹ בֶּן חֲלוּצָה, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר מְחַיֵּיב קֶרֶן וָחוֹמֶשׁ, וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ פּוֹטֵר.
human_translation: And yet teruma , where one is not pressed for time and exempts as we learned was partaking of teruma and it became known that he was the son of a divorced woman or the son of a ḥalutza Rabbi Eliezer deems liable the principal and fifth, Rabbi Yehoshua exempts
llm_translation: Behold, regarding Terumah, whose time is not yet, and he exempted! For it was taught: If one was eating Terumah, and it became known that he is a son of a divorced woman or a halutzah, Rabbi Eliezer obligates principal and a fifth, and Rabbi Yehoshua exempts.

hebrew_text: הָא אִיתְּמַר עֲלַהּ, אָמַר רַב בִּיבִי בַּר אַבָּיֵי: הָכָא בִּתְרוּמָה בְּעֶרֶב הַפֶּסַח עָסְקִינַן — דִּזְמַנָּהּ בָּהוּל.
human_translation: But wasn’t it stated with regard to Rav Beivai bar Abaye said: Here we are dealing with teruma on the eve of Passover, for he is pressed for time.
llm_translation: Here is the translation of the Talmudic text you provided: Talmudic text: If it was said regarding it, Rav Bibi son of Abbaye said: Here we are dealing with Terumah on the eve of Passover - its time is in a state of confusion.

hebrew_text: וְאִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא: בְּאִיסּוּר בַּת אַחַת, וְאַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן.
human_translation: And if you wish, say of simultaneous prohibitions, and in accordance with Rabbi Shimon.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: in the prohibition of one daughter, in accordance with the opinion of Rabbi Shimon.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא כּוּלְּהוּ מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לְהוּ: דְּשַׁוִּינְהוּ שָׁלִיחַ, וְשַׁוּוֹ אִינְהוּ שָׁלִיחַ, וּפְגַע שָׁלִיחַ בְּשָׁלִיחַ. אֶלָּא נִדּוּת הֵיכִי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ?
human_translation: Granted, all of you can find that they where appointed agent and appointed an agent and agent encounters agent. However, menstruating women, how can you find
llm_translation: In truth, all of them find for him: that they appointed him as a messenger, and they appointed him not as a messenger, and one messenger encountered another messenger. Rather, how do we find for him the case of a vow?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב עַמְרָם אָמַר רַב: בְּשׁוֹפְעוֹת מִתּוֹךְ שְׁלֹשָׁה עָשָׂר לְאַחַר שְׁלֹשָׁה עָשָׂר — לְאִחַיּוֹבֵי אִינְהוּ, מִתּוֹךְ שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר לְאַחַר שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר — לְחַיּוֹבֵי אִינְהִי.
human_translation: Rav Amram said that Rav said: where continuously discharge from within the thirteenth until after thirteen, to deem liable from within the twelfth until after twelve, in order to deem liable
llm_translation: Rav Amram said in the name of Rav: With regard to Shofe'ot, from the thirteenth onward after the thirteenth - they are for his brothers, from the twelfth onward after the twelfth - they are for his sisters.

hebrew_text: מַפְרִישִׁים אוֹתָן. וְהָא אֵין אִשָּׁה מִתְעַבֶּרֶת בְּבִיאָה רִאשׁוֹנָה! אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ: שֶׁבָּעֲלוּ וְשָׁנוּ. וְאֶלָּא הָא דְּתָנֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא: הֲרֵי כָּאן שֵׁשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה חַטָּאוֹת, תְּלָתִין וְתַרְתֵּין הָוְיָין!
human_translation: we separate But isn’t woman does not become pregnant from her first sexual act? Rav Naḥman said that Rabba bar Avuh said: where they engaged in intercourse and then repeated But that which Rabbi Ḥiyya teaches: Here, then, are sixteen sin-offerings? there be thirty-two
llm_translation: Separate them. But isn't a woman embarrassed in her first intercourse! Rav Nachman said, Rabba bar Avuh said: They married and repeated. But rather, as Rabbi Chiya taught: Here are sixteen sins, thirty-two they become!

hebrew_text: וְלִיטַעְמָיךְ — לְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, דִּמְחַיֵּיב עַל כׇּל כֹּחַ וָכֹחַ — טוּבָא הָוְיָין. אֶלָּא דִּבְכֹחַ רִאשׁוֹן קָחָשֵׁיב, הָכִי נָמֵי, דְּבִיאָה רִאשׁוֹנָה קָחָשֵׁיב.
human_translation: And according to your reasoning, that according to Rabbi Eliezer, who deems one liable for each and every thrusting be many Rather, is enumerating the first thrusting in the intercourse. And so too, he is enumerating the first act of intercourse.
llm_translation: "And to your taste" — to Rabbi Eliezer, who obligates with all his might and strength — it is considered good. Rather, in the case of the first strength, it is considered, yes, that the first intercourse is considered."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא לְרַב נַחְמָן:
human_translation: Rava said to Rav Naḥman:
llm_translation: Rava said to Rav Nachman:

hebrew_text: וְהָא תָּמָר בְּבִיאָה רִאשׁוֹנָה אִיעַבַּרָא! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: תָּמָר בְּאֶצְבַּע מִעֲכָה. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: כׇּל מוֹעֹכוֹת שֶׁל בֵּית רַבִּי — תָּמָר שְׁמָן, וְלָמָּה נִקְרָא שְׁמָן תָּמָר — עַל שֵׁם תָּמָר שֶׁמִּעֲכָה בְּאֶצְבָּעָהּ. וְהָא הֲווֹ עֵר וְאוֹנָן! עֵר וְאוֹנָן שִׁמְּשׁוּ שֶׁלֹּא כְּדַרְכָּן.
human_translation: But didn’t Tamar become pregnant from the first act of intercourse, said: Tamar broke with her finger as Rabbi Yitzḥak said: All of those from the household of Rabbi who break are named Tamar And why are they named Tamar? on account of Tamar, who broke with her finger. But weren’t there Er and Onan, Er and Onan engaged in sexual intercourse in an atypical manner,
llm_translation: The Gemara in the first intercourse, "Iyabara"! He said to him: "A date with a finger from Ma'acha." As Rabbi Yitzchak said: All the oil presses of the house of Rabbi - date oil. And why is it called date oil? After the date that Ma'acha crushed with her finger. But they were blind and foolish! Blind and foolish served not in their usual manner.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: כׇּל עֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבָּעָה חֹדֶשׁ דָּשׁ מִבִּפְנִים וְזוֹרֶה מִבַּחוּץ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: הַלָּלוּ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא כְּמַעֲשֵׂה עֵר וְאוֹנָן!
human_translation: raises an objection penetrates inside and spills outside the entire twenty-four months the statement of Rabbi Eliezer. They said to him: These are nothing other similar to those of Er and Onan,
llm_translation: Challenger: All twenty-four months thresh from within and winnow from without, the words of Rabbi Eliezer. They said to him: These are nothing but like the actions of Er and Onan!

hebrew_text: כְּמַעֲשֵׂה עֵר וְאוֹנָן, וְלֹא כְּמַעֲשֵׂה עֵר וְאוֹנָן. כְּמַעֲשֵׂה עֵר וְאוֹנָן, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְהָיָה אִם בָּא אֶל אֵשֶׁת אָחִיו וְשִׁחֵת אַרְצָה״. וְלֹא כְּמַעֲשֵׂה עֵר וְאוֹנָן, דְּאִילּוּ הָתָם שֶׁלֹּא כְּדַרְכָּהּ, וְהָכָא כְּדַרְכָּהּ.
human_translation: similar to the act of Er and Onan not similar to the act of Er and Onan It was similar to the act of Er and Onan as it is written: “And it came to pass when he had intercourse with his brother’s wife, that he spilled it on the ground” not similar to the act of Er and Onan, as there an atypical manner, while here in a typical manner.
llm_translation: Like the incident of Er and Onan, and not like the incident of Er and Onan. Like the incident of Er and Onan, as it is written: "And it shall be, if he comes to his brother's wife, that he shall spill on the ground." And not like the incident of Er and Onan, for there it was not in the usual manner, but here it was in the usual manner.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא אוֹנָן, דִּכְתִיב בֵּיהּ ״וְשִׁחֵת אַרְצָה״, אֶלָּא עֵר מְנָלַן? אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: דִּכְתִיב ״וַיָּמֶת גַּם אוֹתוֹ״, אַף הוּא בְּאוֹתָהּ מִיתָה מֵת. בִּשְׁלָמָא אוֹנָן, מִשּׁוּם ״לֹּא לוֹ יִהְיֶה הַזָּרַע״, אֶלָּא עֵר מַאי טַעְמָא עֲבַד הָכִי? כְּדֵי שֶׁלֹּא תִּתְעַבֵּר וְיַכְחִישׁ יָפְיָהּ.
human_translation: Granted, Onan as it is written with regard to his “That he spilled it on the ground” However, from where do we Er Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: As it is written “And He slew him also” he, too, died the same death Granted, Onan as the seed would not be his” However, Er, what is the reason he acted this that she not become pregnant and become less beautiful
llm_translation: In truth, Onan, as it is written in it "and he spilled on the ground," rather Er from where? Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: as it is written "and he also died," he too died the same death. In truth, Onan, because of "it will not be his," rather Er, what is the reason he did so? In order that she not conceive and her beauty diminish.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״אוֹתָהּ״, פְּרָט לְכַלָּה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: פְּרָט לְשֶׁלֹּא כְּדַרְכָּהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ הוּן בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן לְרַב נַחְמָן: לֵימָא קָא סָבַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הַתּוֹרָה חָסָה עַל תַּכְשִׁיטֵי כַלָּה? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לְפִי שֶׁאֵין אִשָּׁה מִתְעַבֶּרֶת מִבִּיאָה רִאשׁוֹנָה.
human_translation: The Sages taught: with whom “with whom” to exclude a bride the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. And the Rabbis say: It excludes in an atypical manner. Hon, son of Rav Naḥman, said to Rav Naḥman: Shall we say that Rabbi Yehuda holds: The Torah spared a bride’s adornments, said to him: it is because a woman does not become pregnant from the first act of intercourse.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: "it", excluding the bride, are the words of Rabbi Yehuda. And the Sages say: excluding as is her custom. Hun, son of Rav Nachman, said to Rav Nachman: Let him say, does Rabbi Yehuda hold that the Torah is concerned with the adornments of the bride? He said to him: Because a woman does not become haughty from bringing her first.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי קָמִיפַּלְגִי — רַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: ״שִׁכְבַת זָרַע״, פְּרָט לְהַעֲרָאָה. ״אוֹתָהּ״, פְּרָט לְשֶׁלֹּא כְּדַרְכָּהּ. וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה סָבַר: שֶׁלֹּא כְּדַרְכָּהּ וְהַעֲרָאָה מִ״שִּׁכְבַת זָרַע״ נָפְקָא. ״אוֹתָהּ״ — פְּרָט לְכַלָּה.
human_translation: With regard to what do disagree? The Rabbis hold “giving seed” excludes the initial stage of intercourse, “with whom” excludes intercourse that is performed in an atypical way. Rabbi Yehuda, holds that atypical and the initial stage of intercourse were derived from “giving seed,” “with whom” excludes a bride.
llm_translation: With what do they disagree? The sages hold: "lying with seed," excluding a hint. "That," excluding not in its usual manner. And Rabbi Yehuda holds: not in its usual manner and a hint is derived from "lying with seed." "That" - excluding a bride.

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא רָבִין אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כׇּל שֶׁשָּׁהֲתָה אַחַר בַּעֲלָהּ עֶשֶׂר שָׁנִים וְנִשֵּׂאת — שׁוּב אֵינָהּ יוֹלֶדֶת. אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא שֶׁאֵין דַּעְתָּהּ לְהִנָּשֵׂא, אֲבָל דַּעְתָּהּ לְהִנָּשֵׂא — מִתְעַבֶּרֶת. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא לְבַת רַב חִסְדָּא: קָא מְרַנְּנִי רַבָּנַן אַבָּתְרִיךָ! אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: אֲנָא דַּעְתַּאי עֲלָךְ הֲוַאי.
human_translation: When Ravin came Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Any waits after her husband ten years and is then married can no longer bear children. Rav Naḥman said: They taught only where she did not intend to get married but she intended to get married she can become pregnant Rava said to daughter of Rav Ḥisda: The Sages are gossiping about you. She said to him: My mind was on you.
llm_translation: When Ravin came, Rabbi Yochanan said: Anyone who waited after her husband for ten years and married - she will no longer give birth. Rav Nachman said: They only taught this when her intention was not to marry, but if her intention was to marry - she will conceive. Rava said to the daughter of Rav Chisda: The rabbis are murmuring about you! She said to him: My mind is on you, be at ease.

hebrew_text: הָהִיא דַּאֲתַאי לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב יוֹסֵף, אָמְרָה לוֹ: רַבִּי, (אֲנָא) [אֲנִי] שָׁהִיתִי אַחַר בַּעְלִי עֶשֶׂר שָׁנִים וְיָלַדְתִּי! אֲמַר לַהּ: בִּתִּי, אַל תּוֹצִיאִי לַעַז עַל דִּבְרֵי חֲכָמִים! אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: לְגוֹי נִבְעַלְתִּי.
human_translation: A certain who came before Rav Yosef said to him: My teacher, I waited after my husband’s ten years, and I gave birth. He said to her: My daughter, do not cast aspersions on the statement of the Sages. She said to him I had sexual intercourse with a gentile
llm_translation: That one who came before Rav Yosef, she said to him: "Rabbi, I was with my husband for ten years and I gave birth!" He said to her: "My daughter, do not be hasty in matters of Torah scholars!" She said to him: "I was married to a non-Jew."

hebrew_text: אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: וְכוּלָּן — צְרִיכוֹת לְהַמְתִּין שְׁלֹשָׁה חֳדָשִׁים, חוּץ מִגִּיּוֹרֶת וּמְשׁוּחְרֶרֶת קְטַנָּה. אֲבָל קְטַנָּה בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל צְרִיכָה לְהַמְתִּין שְׁלֹשָׁה חֳדָשִׁים.
human_translation: Shmuel said: And all of those must wait three months except for a female convert and a female released slave who is a minor. However, a female Israelite who was a minor must wait three months
llm_translation: Samuel said: And all of them — require to wait three months, except for a minor convert and a minor freed slave. But a minor daughter of Israel requires to wait three months.

hebrew_text: וּבְמַאי? אִי בְּמֵיאוּן, וְהָאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל דְּלָא בָּעֲיָא, וְאִי בְּגֵט — הָאַמְרַהּ שְׁמוּאֵל חֲדָא זִימְנָא? דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: מֵיאֲנָה בּוֹ — אֵינָהּ צְרִיכָה לְהַמְתִּין שְׁלֹשָׁה חֳדָשִׁים, נָתַן לָהּ גֵּט — צְרִיכָה לְהַמְתִּין שְׁלֹשָׁה חֳדָשִׁים! אֶלָּא בִּזְנוּת,
human_translation: And with regard to what If it is by refusal, but didn’t Shmuel say that she is not required And if a bill of divorce didn’t Shmuel state one time? as Shmuel said: A female minor who refused need not wait three months he gave her a bill of divorce, she must wait three months, Rather, licentious sexual intercourse.
llm_translation: And with what? If with water, but Shmuel said it is not necessary. And if with a divorce document - but Shmuel said once? For Shmuel said: If she refuses him - she does not need to wait three months, if he gives her a divorce document - she needs to wait three months! Rather, with promiscuity,

hebrew_text: וּגְזַרוּ רַבָּנַן קְטַנָּה מִשּׁוּם גְּדוֹלָה.
human_translation: And, the Sages issued decree for a female minor due to a female adult
llm_translation: And the Rabbis decreed a minor punishment due to a major offense.

hebrew_text: וּמִי גָּזְרִינַן קְטַנָּה מִשּׁוּם גְּדוֹלָה? וְהָתְנַן: אִם הָיוּ קְטַנּוֹת שֶׁאֵינָן רְאוּיוֹת לֵילֵד — מַחְזִירִין אוֹתָן מִיָּד. אָמַר רַב גִּידֵּל אָמַר רַב: הוֹרָאַת שָׁעָה הָיְתָה. מִכְּלָל דַּהֲוַאי? אֶלָּא: כְּהוֹרָאַת שָׁעָה הָיְתָה. וְחִילּוּף לָא שְׁכִיחַ.
human_translation: And do we issue a decree a female minor due to a female adult? But didn’t we learn If they were female minors who could not bear children, we return them immediately Rav Giddel said Rav said: This was a provisional edict by inference that there was Rather, like a provisional edict in that switching is uncommon,
llm_translation: And who decreed a minor due to a major? And we learned: If they were small and not fit to give birth - they return them immediately. Rav Giddel said in the name of Rav: It was a temporary teaching. Is it from this principle? Rather, it was like a temporary teaching. And the reversal is not common.

hebrew_text: לִישָּׁנָא אַחֲרִינָא, אָמְרִי לַהּ אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: כּוּלָּן צְרִיכוֹת לְהַמְתִּין שְׁלֹשָׁה חֳדָשִׁים, חוּץ מִגִּיּוֹרֶת וּמְשׁוּחְרֶרֶת גְּדוֹלָה. [אֲבָל] קְטַנָּה בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל אֵינָהּ צְרִיכָה לְהַמְתִּין שְׁלֹשָׁה חֳדָשִׁים. בְּמַאי? אִי בְּמֵיאוּן — הָאַמְרַהּ שְׁמוּאֵל חֲדָא זִימְנָא. אִי בְּגֵט — הָא קָאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל דְּבָעֲיָא! דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: מֵיאֲנָה בּוֹ — אֵינָהּ צְרִיכָה לְהַמְתִּין שְׁלֹשָׁה חֳדָשִׁים! נָתַן לָהּ גֵּט — צְרִיכָה לְהַמְתִּין שְׁלֹשָׁה חֳדָשִׁים! אֶלָּא בִּזְנוּת, וּזְנוּת בִּקְטַנָּה לָא שְׁכִיחַ.
human_translation: Some say another version Shmuel said: All must wait three months, except for a female convert and a freed maidservant who is an adult; However, an Israelite female minor need not wait three months With regard to what If by refusal, as didn’t Shmuel state this one time? by a bill of divorce, didn’t Shmuel say that she is required as Shmuel said: she refused him she need not wait three months, if he gave her a bill of divorce, she must wait three months? Rather, promiscuous sexual intercourse, and promiscuous sexual intercourse with female minors is uncommon,
llm_translation: The other scholars said to her, Shmuel said: All of them require waiting three months, except for a convert and a freed slave. But a minor daughter of Israel does not need to wait three months. With what? If with menstruation — Shmuel said it once. If with a divorce document — this is what Shmuel meant: if she refuses him, she does not need to wait three months! If he gives her a divorce document — she needs to wait three months! Rather, with promiscuity, and promiscuity with a minor is not common.

hebrew_text: גִּיּוֹרֶת וּמְשׁוּחְרֶרֶת דִּשְׁכִיחַ בְּהוּ זְנוּת, לִיגְזוֹר! הוּא דְּאָמַר כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי. דְּתַנְיָא: הַגִּיּוֹרֶת וְהַשְּׁבוּיָה וְהַשִּׁפְחָה שֶׁנִּפְדּוּ וְשֶׁנִּתְגַּיְּירוּ וְשֶׁנִּשְׁתַּחְרְרוּ — צְרִיכוֹת לְהַמְתִּין שְׁלֹשָׁה חֳדָשִׁים, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי מַתִּיר לֵיאָרֵס וְלִינָּשֵׂא מִיָּד. אָמַר רַבָּה: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי — קָסָבַר אִשָּׁה מְזַנָּה מְשַׁמֶּשֶׁת בְּמוֹךְ כְּדֵי שֶׁלֹּא תִּתְעַבֵּר.
human_translation: Let issue a decree a female convert and a released maidservant as promiscuous sexual intercourse was common for them. stated in accordance with Rabbi Yosei, as it is taught the female convert; and the captured woman, and the maidservant, who were redeemed or who were converted or who were released, must wait three months the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Yosei allows to be betrothed and married immediately. Rabba said: What is the reasoning of Rabbi Yosei? He holds that a woman who engages in promiscuous sexual intercourse uses resorbent so as not to become impregnated.
llm_translation: The convert and the freed slave who are commonly involved in promiscuity, let one be cautious! This is what Rabbi Yosei said. As it was taught: A convert, a freed captive, and a maidservant who were redeemed, converted, and freed - they require waiting for three months, the words of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Yosei permits engagement and marriage immediately. Rabbah said: What is the reason for Rabbi Yosei's opinion? He holds that a promiscuous woman uses contraception so as not to conceive.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: בִּשְׁלָמָא גִּיּוֹרֶת, כֵּיוָן דְּדַעְתַּהּ לְאִיגַּיּוֹרֵי, מְנַטְּרָה נַפְשַׁהּ, כְּדֵי לְהַבְחִין בֵּין זֶרַע שֶׁנִּזְרַע בִּקְדוּשָּׁה, וּבֵין זֶרַע שֶׁנִּזְרַע שֶׁלֹּא בִּקְדוּשָּׁה. שְׁבוּיָה וְשִׁפְחָה נָמֵי, דְּשָׁמְעִי מִמָּרַיְיהוּ, וּמְנַטְּרִי נַפְשַׁיְיהוּ. אֶלָּא יוֹצֵאת בְּשֵׁן וָעַיִן הֵיכִי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ?
human_translation: Abaye said to him: Granted, a female convert Since she is determined to convert, she guards herself in order to distinguish between children conceived in sanctity, and children conceived out of sanctity. A captured woman and a maidservant also they hear from their masters and they guard themselves However, is released due to a tooth or an eye, how can you find
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: Granted, a convert, since her intention is for conversion, she guards herself, in order to distinguish between the seed that was sown in holiness, and the seed that was sown not in holiness. A captive and a maidservant, they are similar, for they listen to their masters, and guard themselves. But how can she forget the shame and disgrace?

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא: כֹּל דְּמִמֵּילָא מוֹדֶה רַבִּי יוֹסֵי — וְהָתְנַן: אֲנוּסָה וּמְפוּתָּה צְרִיכָה לְהַמְתִּין שְׁלֹשָׁה חֳדָשִׁים, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי מַתִּיר לֵיאָרֵס וְלִינָּשֵׂא מִיָּד.
human_translation: And if you would say any where by itself, Rabbi Yosei concedes But didn’t we learn A woman who was raped and a woman who was seduced must wait three months the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Yosei permits her to be betrothed and to be married immediately.
llm_translation: And if you will say: Anyone who is silent, Rabbi Yosei agrees - And we learned in a Mishnah: A woman who was raped or seduced must wait three months, the words of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Yosei permits engagement and marriage immediately.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: אִשָּׁה מְזַנָּה, מִתְהַפֶּכֶת שֶׁלֹּא תִּתְעַבֵּר. וְאִידַּךְ? חָיְישִׁינַן שֶׁמָּא לֹא נִתְהַפְּכָה יָפֶה יָפֶה.
human_translation: Rather, Abaye said: A woman who engages in promiscuous sexual intercourse turns over not to become pregnant. the other We are concerned perhaps she did not turn over well enough
llm_translation: Rather, Abaye said: A woman who is promiscuous, should take care not to become pregnant. And the other opinion? We are concerned that perhaps she will become very beautiful.

hebrew_text: וְאִם הָיוּ כֹּהֲנוֹת כּוּ׳. כֹּהֲנוֹת — אִין, יִשְׂרְאֵלִיּוֹת — לָא! אֵימָא: אִם הָיוּ נְשֵׁי כֹהֲנִים. נְשֵׁי כֹהֲנִים — אִין, נְשֵׁי יִשְׂרְאֵלִים — לָא.
human_translation: And if they were daughters of priests, daughters of priests, yes, the daughter of an Israelite, no, say: If they were the wives of priests wives of priests, yes, wives of Israelites, no,
llm_translation: "If they were Kohanim, Kohanim - yes, Yisraeliyot - no! I would say: If they were wives of Kohanim. Wives of Kohanim - yes, wives of Yisraelim - no."

hebrew_text: וְהָאָמַר רַב עַמְרָם: הָא מִילְּתָא אֲמַר לַן רַב שֵׁשֶׁת, וְאַנְהֲרִינְהוּ לְעַיְינִין מִמַּתְנִיתִין: אֵשֶׁת יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁנֶּאֶנְסָה, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁמּוּתֶּרֶת לְבַעְלָהּ — פְּסוּלָה לַכְּהוּנָּה.
human_translation: But didn’t Rav Amram say: Rav Sheshet said this matter to us, and he lit our eyes from what was the mishna The wife of an Israelite who was raped, even though she is permitted to her husband, she is disqualified from the priesthood.
llm_translation: And he said, Rav Amram: This matter Rav Sheshet told us, and we investigated it from the Mishnah: A Jewish woman who was raped, even though she is permitted to her husband — she is disqualified for the priesthood.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא, הָכִי קָאָמַר: אִם הָיוּ כֹּהֲנוֹת נְשׂוּאוֹת לְיִשְׂרָאֵל — נִפְסְלוּ מִן הַתְּרוּמָה דְּבֵי נָשַׁיְיהוּ.
human_translation: Rava said: This is what is saying If they were daughters of priests were married to an Israelite, they are disqualified from the teruma that is from the household of their fathers,
llm_translation: Rava said, thus he said: If the priestesses were married to Israelites - they are disqualified from partaking of the priestly gifts in their husbands' homes.

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ אַרְבָּעָה אַחִין
llm_translation: We will return to you, four brothers.

hebrew_text: הַחוֹלֵץ לִיבִמְתּוֹ וְנִמְצֵאת מְעוּבֶּרֶת וְיָלְדָה, בִּזְמַן שֶׁהַוָּלָד שֶׁל קַיָּימָא — הוּא מוּתָּר בִּקְרוֹבוֹתֶיהָ, וְהִיא מוּתֶּרֶת בִּקְרוֹבָיו, וְלֹא פְּסָלָהּ מִן הַכְּהוּנָּה.
human_translation: one who performs ḥalitza with his yevama and she is found pregnant and she gave birth, in the event that the offspring is viable, he permitted to her relatives and she permitted to his relatives. does not disqualify her from the priesthood.
llm_translation: The one who performs chalitzah with his yevamah and she is found to be pregnant and gives birth, when the child belongs to the yavam - he is permitted to marry her relatives, and she is permitted to marry his relatives, and she does not disqualify him from the priesthood.

hebrew_text: אֵין הַוָּלָד שֶׁל קַיָּימָא — הוּא אָסוּר בִּקְרוֹבוֹתֶיהָ, וְהִיא אֲסוּרָה בִּקְרוֹבָיו, וּפְסָלָהּ מִן הַכְּהוּנָּה.
human_translation: the offspring is not viable, he is forbidden with her relatives and she is forbidden with his relatives, and disqualifies her from the priesthood,
llm_translation: The offspring of a forbidden union is prohibited to its relatives, and they are prohibited to it, and it disqualifies from the priesthood.

hebrew_text: הַכּוֹנֵס אֶת יְבִמְתּוֹ וְנִמְצֵאת מְעוּבֶּרֶת וְיָלְדָה, בִּזְמַן שֶׁהַוָּלָד שֶׁל קַיָּימָא — יוֹצִיא, וְחַיָּיבִין בְּקׇרְבָּן.
human_translation: one who consummates his yevama , and she is found to pregnant and she gave birth, in the event that the offspring is viable must send out, and they are obligated offering,
llm_translation: Gathering his yevamah and she is found pregnant and gave birth, at a time when the child of the first husband is alive - he shall perform chalitzah, and they are obligated in the korban.

hebrew_text: וְאִם אֵין וָלָד שֶׁל קַיָּימָא — יְקַיֵּים.
human_translation: And if the offspring is not viable, he may maintain
llm_translation: And if there is no valid offspring - he shall establish.

hebrew_text: סָפֵק בֶּן תִּשְׁעָה לָרִאשׁוֹן, סָפֵק בֶּן שִׁבְעָה לָאַחֲרוֹן — יוֹצִיא, וְהַוָּלָד כָּשֵׁר. וְחַיָּיבִין בְּאָשָׁם תָּלוּי.
human_translation: uncertainty whether is nine old, of the first whether seven old of the latter he must send out. the child is unflawed, they are obligated to bring a guilt- uncertainty,
llm_translation: Doubtful if he is nine years old for the first born, doubtful if he is seven years old for the last born — he the father may perform the redemption of the firstborn, and the offspring is valid. And they are obligated in a hanging guilt-offering.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אִיתְּמַר: הַחוֹלֵץ לִמְעוּבֶּרֶת וְהִפִּילָה, רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: אֵינָהּ צְרִיכָה חֲלִיצָה מִן הָאַחִין. רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר: צְרִיכָה חֲלִיצָה מִן הָאַחִין.
human_translation: was stated one who performs ḥalitza with a pregnant woman and she miscarried. Rabbi Yoḥanan said: She does not require ḥalitza from the brothers. Reish Lakish said: She requires ḥalitza from the brothers.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara: Haḥoletz li'm'uberet v'hipilah, Rabbi Yochanan amar: Einah tzerichah chalitzah min ha'achin. Reish Lakish amar: Tzerichah chalitzah min ha'achin. English translation: Gemara: If one performs chalitzah with a pregnant woman and she miscarries, Rabbi Yochanan said: She does not require chalitzah from the brothers. Reish Lakish said: She does require chalitzah from the brothers.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: אֵינָהּ צְרִיכָה חֲלִיצָה מִן הָאַחִין, חֲלִיצַת מְעוּבֶּרֶת — שְׁמָהּ חֲלִיצָה, וּבִיאַת מְעוּבֶּרֶת — שְׁמָהּ בִּיאָה. וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר: צְרִיכָה חֲלִיצָה מִן הָאַחִין, חֲלִיצַת מְעוּבֶּרֶת — לֹא שְׁמָהּ חֲלִיצָה, וּבִיאַת מְעוּבֶּרֶת — לֹא שְׁמָהּ בִּיאָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said she does not require ḥalitza from the brothers Ḥalitza with a pregnant woman is considered ḥalitza And intercourse with a pregnant woman is considered intercourse, And Reish Lakish said she requires ḥalitza from the brothers Ḥalitza with a pregnant woman is not considered ḥalitza , and intercourse with a pregnant woman is not considered intercourse.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: It does not require halitzah from the brothers, if the halitzah is performed in a transgressed manner - its name is halitzah, and if the yibum is performed in a transgressed manner - its name is yibum. And Reish Lakish said: It requires halitzah from the brothers, if the halitzah is performed in a transgressed manner - its name is not halitzah, and if the yibum is performed in a transgressed manner - its name is not yibum.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי קָמִפַּלְגִי? אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא קְרָא, וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא סְבָרָא.
human_translation: With regard to what do they disagree? If you wish, say a verse. And if you wish, say logical reasoning.
llm_translation: With what do they argue? If you wish, say it is due to a verse, and if you wish, say it is due to reasoning.

hebrew_text: אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא סְבָרָא, רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן סָבַר: אִם יָבֹא אֵלִיָּהוּ וְיֹאמַר דְּהָא דְּאִיעַבַּרָא אַפּוֹלֵי מַפְּלָה, מִי לָאו בַּת חֲלִיצָה וְיִבּוּם הִיא? הַשְׁתָּא נָמֵי תִּגַּלֵּי מִילְּתָא לְמַפְרֵעַ.
human_translation: If you wish, say logical reasoning Rabbi Yoḥanan holds: If Elijah were to come and say that this who is pregnant will miscarry, is she not eligible for ḥalitza or levirate marriage, Now, too, the matter will be revealed retroactively,
llm_translation: If you wish, say the reasoning: Rabbi Yochanan holds: If Elijah comes and says, "This one who fell, fell due to a miscarriage," is she not a halutzah and subject to yibum? Now, let the matter be revealed for resolution.

hebrew_text: וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר: תִּגַּלֵּי מִילְּתָא לְמַפְרֵעַ לָא אָמְרִינַן.
human_translation: And Reish Lakish said: We do not say the matter will be revealed retroactively
llm_translation: Reish Lakish said: "Reveal the matter for the one who transgresses, we do not say."

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא קְרָא, רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן סָבַר: ״וּבֵן אֵין לוֹ״ אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא, וְהָא לֵית לֵיהּ. וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ סָבַר: ״וּבֵן אֵין לוֹ״ — עַיֵּין עָלָיו.
human_translation: And if you wish, say a verse Rabbi Yoḥanan holds: The Merciful One states and he has no child” And this does not have And Reish Lakish holds: “and he has no [ ein ] child” inspect [ ayein ] him
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: let us look at the verse, Rabbi Yochanan holds: "and a son he does not have" - the Merciful One said, but he does not have. And Resh Lakish holds: "and a son he does not have" - inquire about him.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן לְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: אֵין הַוָּלָד שֶׁל קַיָּימָא — הוּא אָסוּר בִּקְרוֹבוֹתֶיהָ, וְהִיא אֲסוּרָה בִּקְרוֹבָיו, וּפְסָלָהּ מִן הַכְּהוּנָּה. בִּשְׁלָמָא לְדִידִי, דְּאָמֵינָא חֲלִיצַת מְעוּבֶּרֶת שְׁמָהּ חֲלִיצָה — מִשּׁוּם הָכִי פָּסְלָה, אֶלָּא לְדִידָךְ, דְּאָמְרַתְּ חֲלִיצַת מְעוּבֶּרֶת לֹא שְׁמָהּ חֲלִיצָה, אַמַּאי פָּסְלָה מִן הַכְּהוּנָּה?
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan raised an objection to Reish Lakish the offspring is not viable, he is forbidden to her relatives and she is forbidden to his relatives, and disqualifies her from the priesthood. Granted, according to my as I say ḥalitza with a pregnant woman is considered ḥalitza , it is due to that disqualifies her However, according to your as you say that ḥalitza with a pregnant woman is not considered ḥalitza , why disqualify her from the priesthood?
llm_translation: He raised an objection to Reish Lakish: The offspring of a forbidden union is forbidden to its relatives, and they are forbidden to its relatives, and it disqualifies her from the priesthood. Granted, according to my opinion, since I hold that the offspring of a forbidden union retains its status as a forbidden union, that is why it disqualifies her. But according to your opinion, since you hold that the offspring of a forbidden union does not retain its status as a forbidden union, why does it disqualify her from the priesthood?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִדְּרַבָּנַן, וּלְחוּמְרָא בְּעָלְמָא.
human_translation: said to by rabbinic and is merely a stringency
llm_translation: He said to him: From the Rabbanan, and for the stringency in general.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אֵין הַוָּלָד שֶׁל קַיָּימָא — הוּא אָסוּר בִּקְרוֹבוֹתֶיהָ, וְהִיא אֲסוּרָה בִּקְרוֹבָיו, וּפְסָלָהּ מִן הַכְּהוּנָּה. בִּשְׁלָמָא לְדִידִי, דְּאָמֵינָא חֲלִיצַת מְעוּבֶּרֶת לֹא שְׁמָהּ חֲלִיצָה, הַיְינוּ דְּקָתָנֵי ״פְּסָלָהּ מִן הַכְּהוּנָּה״ — לְחוּמְרָא, וְלָא קָתָנֵי ״אֵינָהּ צְרִיכָה חֲלִיצָה מִן הָאַחִין״.
human_translation: There are who say Reish Lakish raised an objection to Rabbi Yoḥanan the offspring is not viable, he is forbidden to her relatives and she is forbidden to his relatives, and disqualifies her from the priesthood. Granted, according to my as I say that ḥalitza with a pregnant woman is not considered ḥalitza , this is that which is taught disqualifies her from the priesthood, as stringency, and does not teach: She does not require ḥalitza from the brothers,
llm_translation: There are those who say: Reish Lakish raised an objection to Rabbi Yochanan: A child born from an illicit union is forbidden to its relatives, and they are forbidden to it, and it disqualifies her from the priesthood. According to my opinion, since I hold that the offspring of a forbidden union is not considered offspring, that is why it is taught "it disqualifies her from the priesthood" - to be stringent, and it does not teach "she does not require halitzah from her brothers."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְדִידָךְ, ״אֵינָהּ צְרִיכָה חֲלִיצָה מִן הָאַחִין״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִין הָכִי נָמֵי. וְאַיְּידֵי דִּתְנָא רֵישָׁא ״לֹא פְּסָלָהּ״ — תְּנָא [נָמֵי] סֵיפָא ״פְּסָלָהּ״.
human_translation: However, according to your should have she does not require ḥalitza from the brothers said to Yes, it is indeed so but since the first clause taught: does not disqualify her the latter clause taught: disqualifies her
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rather, according to our view, "it does not require chalitzah from the brothers," how does he respond to this? He said to him: It is indeed so. And since the first part was taught, "it does not disqualify her" — the latter part also teaches, "it disqualifies her." English translation:

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן לְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: אֵין הַוָּלָד שֶׁל קַיָּימָא — יְקַיֵּים. בִּשְׁלָמָא לְדִידִי, דְּאָמֵינָא חֲלִיצַת מְעוּבֶּרֶת — שְׁמָהּ חֲלִיצָה, וּבִיאַת מְעוּבֶּרֶת — שְׁמָהּ בִּיאָה, מִשּׁוּם הָכִי קָתָנֵי ״יְקַיֵּים״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan raised an objection to Reish Lakish the offspring is not viable, he may maintain Granted, according to my as I say ḥalitza with a pregnant woman is considered ḥalitza , and intercourse with a pregnant woman is considered intercourse, due to that teaches: He may maintain
llm_translation: He raised an objection to Reish Lakish: A fetus of a viable age - it will survive. Granted according to my opinion, for I hold that a halitzah with a fetus in utero is considered a valid halitzah, and a levirate marriage with a fetus in utero is considered a valid levirate marriage, therefore it teaches "it will survive."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְדִידָךְ, דְּאָמְרַתְּ חֲלִיצַת מְעוּבֶּרֶת — לֹא שְׁמָהּ חֲלִיצָה, וּבִיאַת מְעוּבֶּרֶת — לֹא שְׁמָהּ בִּיאָה, ״יַחְזוֹר וְיִבְעוֹל וִיקַיֵּים״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ! מַאי ״יְקַיֵּים״ — יַחְזוֹר וְיִבְעוֹל וִיקַיֵּים, דְּלָא סַגִּי.
human_translation: However, according to your as you said ḥalitza with a pregnant woman is not considered ḥalitza , and intercourse with a pregnant woman is not considered intercourse, should have he should proceed to engage in intercourse and may he maintain What is He may maintain he should proceed to engage in intercourse and he may maintain as is insufficient
llm_translation: Rather, according to your opinion, since you say that if the redemption is from a transgressor, it is not called redemption, and if the betrothal is from a transgressor, it is not called betrothal, "he shall return and marry her and establish" - what does "establish" mean? He shall return and marry her and establish, for it is not sufficient.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אֵין הַוָּלָד שֶׁל קַיָּימָא — יְקַיֵּים. בִּשְׁלָמָא לְדִידִי, דְּאָמֵינָא חֲלִיצַת מְעוּבֶּרֶת — לֹא שְׁמָהּ חֲלִיצָה, וּבִיאַת מְעוּבֶּרֶת — לֹא שְׁמָהּ בִּיאָה, הַיְינוּ דְּקָתָנֵי ״יְקַיֵּים״, ״יַחְזוֹר וְיִבְעוֹל וִיקַיֵּים״, דְּלָא סַגִּי בְּלָאו הָכִי,
human_translation: There are who say Reish Lakish raised an objection to Rabbi Yoḥanan the offspring is not viable, he may maintain Granted, according to my as I say ḥalitza with a pregnant woman is not considered ḥalitza , and intercourse with a pregnant woman is not considered intercourse, this is that which is taught He may maintain he should proceed to engage in intercourse and he may maintain as is insufficient without this
llm_translation: There are those who say: Reish Lakish raised an objection to Rabbi Yochanan: A fetus of a non-viable pregnancy - it will survive. Granted according to my opinion, for I say that a fetus of a transgressed betrothal is not considered a betrothal, and the act of transgressed betrothal is not considered an act of betrothal, that is why it teaches "it will survive," "he shall return and cohabit and it will survive," for it is not sufficient without this.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְדִידָךְ — ״רָצָה יוֹצִיא, רָצָה יְקַיֵּים״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ! אִין הָכִי נָמֵי, אַיְּידֵי דִּתְנָא רֵישָׁא ״יוֹצִיא״, תְּנָא נָמֵי סֵיפָא ״יְקַיֵּים״.
human_translation: However, according to your should have If he wishes he may send out, if he wishes he may maintain Yes, it is indeed so, but since the first clause taught: He should send out, the latter clause taught: He may maintain
llm_translation: Rather, according to our view - "He who wants to bring out, he who wants to uphold" - who is it needed for? It is indeed so, for it is taught: in the beginning it says "to bring out," and at the end it says "to uphold."

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: הַכּוֹנֵס אֶת יְבִמְתּוֹ וְנִמְצֵאת מְעוּבֶּרֶת — הֲרֵי זוֹ לֹא תִּנָּשֵׂא צָרָתָהּ, שֶׁמָּא יְהֵא וְלָד בֶּן קַיָּימָא. אַדְּרַבָּה, כִּי הָוֵי הַוָּלָד בֶּן קַיָּימָא, מִיפַּטְרָה צָרָתָהּ! אֶלָּא אֵימָא: שֶׁמָּא לֹא יְהֵא הַוָּלָד בֶּן קַיָּימָא.
human_translation: raises an objection one who consummates his yevama , and she is found to pregnant a rival wife of this may not marry, lest the offspring be viable. On the contrary, when the offspring is viable, her rival wife to be released Rather, say: Lest the offspring not be viable.
llm_translation: Challenger: If one gathers his yevamah and she is found to be pregnant - she shall not marry her co-wife, lest a viable child be born. On the contrary, for if the child is viable, her co-wife is exempt! Rather say: lest the child not be viable.

hebrew_text: וְאִי סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ בִּיאַת מְעוּבֶּרֶת שְׁמָהּ בִּיאָה, אַמַּאי לֹא תִּנָּשֵׂא צָרָתָהּ? תִּיפְּטַר בְּבִיאָה שֶׁל חֲבֶירְתָּהּ!
human_translation: And if it enters your mind intercourse with a pregnant woman is considered intercourse, why should her rival wife not marry? should be released by of the intercourse of her fellow
llm_translation: And if it comes to your mind that her entrance is repulsive, why not overlook her distress? She should be exempted by the entrance of her friend!

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: בְּבִיאָה כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דְּלָא פָּטְרָה, כִּי פְּלִיגִי בַּחֲלִיצָה.
human_translation: Abaye said with regard to intercourse everyone agrees that it does not release when they disagree with regard to ḥalitza
llm_translation: Abaye said: In the case of intercourse, everyone agrees that she is not exempt, as they disagree in the case of halitzah.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן סָבַר: חֲלִיצַת מְעוּבֶּרֶת — שְׁמָהּ חֲלִיצָה, בִּיאַת מְעוּבֶּרֶת — לֹא שְׁמָהּ בִּיאָה. רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ סָבַר: בִּיאַת מְעוּבֶּרֶת לֹא שְׁמָהּ בִּיאָה, וַחֲלִיצַת מְעוּבֶּרֶת לֹא שְׁמָהּ חֲלִיצָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan holds ḥalitza with a pregnant woman is considered ḥalitza , intercourse with a pregnant woman is not considered intercourse Reish Lakish holds intercourse with a pregnant woman is not considered intercourse, and ḥalitza with a pregnant woman is not considered ḥalitza .
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan holds: If the halitzah is performed with a fetus in utero, it is called halitzah; if the intercourse is with a fetus in utero, it is not called intercourse. Reish Lakish holds: If the intercourse is with a fetus in utero, it is not called intercourse, and if the halitzah is performed with a fetus in utero, it is not called halitzah.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא, מָה נַפְשָׁךְ: אִי בִּיאַת מְעוּבֶּרֶת שְׁמָהּ בִּיאָה — חֲלִיצַת מְעוּבֶּרֶת שְׁמָהּ חֲלִיצָה. וְאִי בִּיאַת מְעוּבֶּרֶת לֹא שְׁמָהּ בִּיאָה — חֲלִיצַת מְעוּבֶּרֶת נָמֵי לֹא שְׁמָהּ חֲלִיצָה. דְּהָא קַיְימָא לַן,
human_translation: Rava said to him: Whichever way you If intercourse with a pregnant woman is considered intercourse ḥalitza with a pregnant woman be considered ḥalitza . And if intercourse with a pregnant woman is not considered intercourse ḥalitza with a pregnant woman not be considered ḥalitza . As we maintain
llm_translation: He said to him, Rava, what is your opinion: if the intercourse is with a fetus, its name is intercourse - the halitzah of a fetus, its name is halitzah. And if the intercourse is not with a fetus, its name is not intercourse - the halitzah of a fetus, its name is also not halitzah. For we have a support,

hebrew_text: דְּכׇל הָעוֹלֶה לְיִבּוּם — עוֹלֶה לַחֲלִיצָה, וְכֹל שֶׁאֵין עוֹלֶה לְיִבּוּם — אֵינוֹ עוֹלֶה לַחֲלִיצָה.
human_translation: that anyone who is eligible for levirate marriage is eligible for ḥalitza and anyone who is not eligible for levirate marriage is not eligible for ḥalitza .
llm_translation: The one who is obligated for levirate marriage - goes up for halitzah, and anyone who is not obligated for levirate marriage - does not go up for halitzah.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא, הָכִי קָאָמַר: הַכּוֹנֵס יְבִמְתּוֹ וְנִמְצֵאת מְעוּבֶּרֶת — הֲרֵי זוֹ לֹא תִּנָּשֵׂא צָרָתָהּ, שֶׁמָּא יְהֵא וָלָד בֶּן קַיָּימָא. וּבִיאַת מְעוּבֶּרֶת לֹא שְׁמָהּ בִּיאָה, וַחֲלִיצַת מְעוּבֶּרֶת לֹא שְׁמָהּ חֲלִיצָה. וְהַוָּלָד אֵינוֹ פּוֹטֵר עַד שֶׁיֵּצֵא לַאֲוִיר הָעוֹלָם.
human_translation: Rather, Rava said this is what is saying: one who consummates with his yevama and she is found to pregnant a rival wife of this may not marry lest the offspring be viable, and intercourse with a woman pregnant is not considered intercourse, and ḥalitza of a woman pregnant is not considered ḥalitza . And the offspring does not release until it comes into the air of the world,
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said, thus he said: If one gathers his yevamah and she is found to be pregnant - she should not be married to his co-wife, lest a viable child be born. The arrival of a pregnant woman is not considered an arrival, and the halitzah of a pregnant woman is not considered a halitzah. And the child is not exempt until he exits into the open air of the world.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרָבָא: הַכּוֹנֵס יְבִמְתּוֹ וְנִמְצֵאת מְעוּבֶּרֶת — הֲרֵי זוֹ לֹא תִּנָּשֵׂא צָרָתָהּ, שֶׁמָּא יְהֵא וָלָד בֶּן קַיָּימָא, וְאֵין בִּיאָה וַחֲלִיצָה פּוֹטֶרֶת, אֶלָּא וָלָד פּוֹטֵר. וְהַוָּלָד אֵין פּוֹטְרָהּ עַד שֶׁיֵּצֵא לַאֲוִיר הָעוֹלָם.
human_translation: It is taught in accordance with Rava: one who consummates his yevama , and she is found to pregnant a rival wife of this may not marry lest the offspring be viable. intercourse or ḥalitza does not release rather, offspring releases And the offspring does not release her until it comes into the air of the world.
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Rava: If one marries his yevamah and she is found to be pregnant - she should not be married to her co-wife, lest a viable child be born, and intercourse and halitzah would exempt her, but a child exempts her. And the child does not exempt her until it emerges into the open air of the world.

hebrew_text: טַעְמָא דְּשֶׁמָּא יְהֵא וָלָד בֶּן קַיָּימָא הוּא, הָא לָא הָוֵי וָלָד בֶּן קַיָּימָא מִיפַּטְרָא צָרָתָהּ, לֵימָא תֶּיהְוֵי תְּיוּבְתָּא דְּרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ!
human_translation: the reason is as Lest the offspring be viable. were the offspring not viable, her rival wife would be released let us say that is a conclusive refutation Reish Lakish.
llm_translation: Reason of that perhaps will be and son of established he, this not will be and son of established from exempt her, say will be benefit of Reish Lakish!

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָךְ רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ, הָכִי קָתָנֵי: הַכּוֹנֵס יְבִמְתּוֹ וְנִמְצֵאת מְעוּבֶּרֶת — הֲרֵי זוֹ לֹא תִּנָּשֵׂא צָרָתָהּ, שֶׁמָּא לֹא יְהֵא הַוָּלָד בֶּן קַיָּימָא, וַחֲלִיצַת מְעוּבֶּרֶת לֹא שְׁמָהּ חֲלִיצָה, וּבִיאַת מְעוּבֶּרֶת לֹא שְׁמָהּ בִּיאָה.
human_translation: Reish Lakish said to you: This is what is teaching: one who consummates his yevama , and she was found to pregnant a rival wife of this may not marry lest the offspring not be viable, And ḥalitza with a pregnant woman is not considered ḥalitza , and intercourse with a pregnant woman is not considered intercourse.
llm_translation: He said to you Reish Lakish, thus it is taught: If one gathers his yevamah and she is found to be pregnant - she shall not marry her rival, lest the child not be viable, and the halitzah of a pregnant woman is not considered halitzah, and the intercourse with a pregnant woman is not considered intercourse.

hebrew_text: וְאִם תֹּאמַר: הַלֵּךְ אַחַר רוֹב נָשִׁים, וְרוֹב נָשִׁים וָלָד מְעַלְּיָא יָלְדָן, וָלָד אֵין פּוֹטֵר עַד שֶׁיֵּצֵא לַאֲוִיר הָעוֹלָם.
human_translation: And if you say: follow majority of women, and majority of women give birth to a full-fledged, offspring, offspring does not release until it comes into the air of the world.
llm_translation: And if you will say: Go after the majority of women, and the majority of women give birth above, and a child does not exempt until he goes out to the air of the world.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: אֶפְשָׁר אִיתָא לְהָא דְּרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ וְלָא תְּנַן לָהּ בְּמַתְנִיתִין? נְפַק, דַּק וְאַשְׁכַּח, דִּתְנַן: הָאִשָּׁה שֶׁהָלַךְ בַּעְלָהּ וְצָרָתָהּ לִמְדִינַת הַיָּם, וּבָאוּ וְאָמְרוּ לָהּ ״מֵת בַּעְלִיךְ״ — הֲרֵי זוֹ לֹא תִּנָּשֵׂא וְלֹא תִּתְיַיבֵּם עַד שֶׁתֵּדַע שֶׁמָּא מְעוּבֶּרֶת הִיא צָרָתָהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: possible there is of this of Reish Lakish and it was not taught in the Mishna? He went out checked and found as we learned a woman whose husband and rival wife went overseas, and came and said to her: Your husband died, this may neither marry nor may she enter into levirate marriage until she knows perhaps her rival wife is pregnant.
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: Is it possible that Reish Lakish said this and we did not teach it to him in the Mishnah? Go out, check, and you will find that we taught: A woman whose husband went overseas and her co-wives said to her, "Your husband has died" — she should not marry or perform levirate marriage until she knows whether she is pregnant from her husband.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא יַבּוֹמֵי לָא — שֶׁמָּא יְהֵא וָלָד בֶּן קַיָּימָא, וְיִפְגַּע בְּאִיסּוּר אֵשֶׁת אָח דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא, אֶלָּא: לֹא תַּחְלוֹץ, אַמַּאי? בִּשְׁלָמָא תַּחְלוֹץ בְּתוֹךְ תִּשְׁעָה וְתִנָּשֵׂא בְּתוֹךְ תִּשְׁעָה — לָא, הַיְינוּ סָפֵק.
human_translation: Granted, she may not enter levirate marriage perhaps offspring will be viable, and encounter the Torah prohibition against brother’s wife. But why may she not perform ḥalitza ? Granted, she may not perform ḥalitza during the nine and marry during nine this is uncertainty
llm_translation: In peace, the Yabomei are not - lest there be a viable child, and he encounters the prohibition of his brother's wife from the Torah, rather: do not perform chalitzah, why? In peace, perform chalitzah within nine and marry within nine - no, that is a doubt.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא תַּחְלוֹץ בְּתוֹךְ תִּשְׁעָה, וְתִנָּשֵׂא לְאַחַר תִּשְׁעָה.
human_translation: But let her perform ḥalitza during the nine and marry after nine
llm_translation: Rather, one should investigate within nine days, and then bring the issue to a court after nine days.

hebrew_text: וּלְטַעְמָיךְ: תַּחְלוֹץ וְתִנָּשֵׂא לְאַחַר תִּשְׁעָה!
human_translation: But according to your reasoning Let her perform ḥalitza and marry, after nine
llm_translation: And according to your reasoning: "You shall break camp and advance after nine!"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, בַּר מִינַּהּ דְּהַהִיא. דְּאַבָּיֵי בַּר אַבָּא וְרַב חִינָּנָא בַּר אַבָּיֵי דְּאָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ: שֶׁמָּא יְהֵא וָלָד בֶּן קַיָּימָא, וְנִמְצָא אַתָּה מַצְרִיכָהּ כָּרוֹז לַכְּהוּנָּה.
human_translation: Rather, apart from that as Abaye bar Abba and Rav Ḥinnana bar Abaye who both say perhaps offspring will be viable, And it would emerge you will require a public announcement for her to priesthood.
llm_translation: Rather, in the case of the son of that heretic. For Abbaye son of Abba and Rav Hinnana son of Abbaye both said: Perhaps a child will be established, and you will find yourself in need of a herald for the priesthood.

hebrew_text: וְלַצְרְכַהּ! דִּלְמָא אִיכָּא אִינִישׁ דְּהָוֵי בַּחֲלִיצָה וְלָא הָוֵי בְּהַכְרָזָה, וְאָתֵי לְמֵימַר: קָשָׁרֵי חֲלוּצָה לְכֹהֵן.
human_translation: But require for her? Perhaps there were people who were at the ḥalitza and were not at public announcement, and they might come to say they are permitting a ḥalutza a priest.
llm_translation: "For its need! Perhaps there is a person who is involved in 'chalitzah' but not in 'halitzah,' and he comes to say: The bonds of 'chalitzah' are for the Kohen."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: מִידֵּי ״לֹא תַּחְלוֹץ וְלֹא תִּתְיַיבֵּם״ קָתָנֵי? ״לֹא תִּנָּשֵׂא וְלֹא תִּתְיַיבֵּם״ קָתָנֵי, בְּלֹא חֲלִיצָה, אֲבָל אִי חָלֵיץ לַהּ — הָכִי נָמֵי דְּשַׁרְיָא.
human_translation: Abaye said to does teach she may neither perform ḥalitza nor enter into levirate marriage? teaches she may neither be married nor enter into levirate marriage, without ḥalitza , but if performs ḥalitza with her, she would indeed be permitted
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: From the words "you shall not perform chalitzah nor yibum" is it taught? "You shall not perform yibum nor chalitzah" is taught, without chalitzah, but if he performed chalitzah for her - it is thus stated that it is permitted.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: הַחוֹלֵץ לִמְעוּבֶּרֶת וְהִפִּילָה — צְרִיכָה חֲלִיצָה מִן הָאַחִין.
human_translation: it is taught in accordance with of Reish Lakish: one who performs ḥalitza with a pregnant woman and she miscarries, she requires ḥalitza with the brothers
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Reish Lakish: One who removes a fetus from a slaughtered animal and it falls — it requires removal from the siblings.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: הִלְכְתָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ בְּהָנֵי תְּלָת: חֲדָא — הָא דַּאֲמַרַן. אִידַּךְ, דִּתְנַן: הַמְחַלֵּק נְכָסָיו עַל פִּיו, רִיבָּה לְאֶחָד וּמִיעֵט לְאֶחָד, וְהִשְׁוָה לָהֶם אֶת הַבְּכוֹר — דְּבָרָיו קַיָּימִין.
human_translation: Rava said: The halakha is in accordance with of Reish Lakish in these three One, this that we stated The other which we learned one who verbally divides up his possessions he increases to one or decreases to one or he equally between them the firstborn, his words are binding.
llm_translation: Rava said: The halakha is in accordance with the opinion of Reish Lakish in three matters: One - that which we said. The other, as we learned in a Mishnah: One who divides his estate according to his own discretion, increases the share of one and diminishes the share of another, and makes them equal in the portion of the firstborn - his words are upheld.

hebrew_text: וְאִם אָמַר מִשּׁוּם יְרוּשָּׁה — לֹא אָמַר כְּלוּם. כָּתַב, בֵּין בַּתְּחִלָּה בֵּין בַּסּוֹף בֵּין בָּאֶמְצַע, מִשּׁוּם מַתָּנָה — דְּבָרָיו קַיָּימִין.
human_translation: But if he said as an inheritance, he said is nothing, he wrote, whether at the beginning, whether at the end, or whether in the middle, as a gift, his words are binding.
llm_translation: "If he said it is due to inheritance - he said nothing. He wrote, whether at the beginning, or at the end, or in the middle, due to a gift - his words stand."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ — לְעוֹלָם לֹא קָנָה עַד שֶׁיֹּאמַר ״פְּלוֹנִי וּפְלוֹנִי יִרְשׁוּ שָׂדֶה פְּלוֹנִית וּפְלוֹנִית שֶׁנְּתַתִּים לָהֶם בְּמַתָּנָה וְיִרָשׁוּם״.
human_translation: And Reish Lakish said: will only ever acquire once he says: So-and-so and so-and-so shall inherit such and such a field and such and such that I have given to them as a gift, and they shall inherit them,
llm_translation: And Reish Lakish said - Always one does not acquire until he says, "So-and-so and so-and-so shall inherit a field of such-and-such, which I have given to them as a gift, and they shall inherit it."

hebrew_text: וְאִידַּךְ, דִּתְנַן: הַכּוֹתֵב כׇּל נְכָסָיו לִבְנוֹ לְאַחַר מוֹתוֹ, הָאָב אֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לִמְכּוֹר — מִפְּנֵי שֶׁנְּתָנָן לַבֵּן, וְהַבֵּן אֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לִמְכּוֹר — מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהֵן בִּרְשׁוּת הָאָב. מָכַר הָאָב — מְכוּרִין עַד שֶׁיָּמוּת הוּא, מָכַר הַבֵּן — אֵין לַלּוֹקֵחַ כְּלוּם עַד שֶׁיָּמוּת הָאָב.
human_translation: And the other which we learned one who writes all of his possessions to his son after his death, the father is unable to sell due to that he gave them to the son, and the son is unable to sell due to that they are in the father’s possession. the father sold they are sold until dies. the son sold the purchaser does not any until the father dies.
llm_translation: And the other opinion, for it was taught: One who writes all his possessions to his son after his death, the father cannot sell - because he gave them to the son, and the son cannot sell - because they are in the possession of the father. If the father sold them, they are sold until he dies; if the son sold them, the buyer gets nothing until the father dies.

hebrew_text: וְאִיתְּמַר: מָכַר הַבֵּן בְּחַיֵּי הָאָב, וּמֵת הַבֵּן בְּחַיֵּי הָאָב. רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: לֹא קָנָה לוֹקֵחַ, וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר: קָנָה לוֹקֵחַ.
human_translation: And was stated the son sold during the father’s lifetime, and the son died during the father’s lifetime, Rabbi Yoḥanan said: The purchaser does not acquire and Reish Lakish said: The purchaser does acquire
llm_translation: And Itmar: If the son sold during the lifetime of the father, and the son died during the lifetime of the father. Rabbi Yohanan said: The buyer did not acquire, and Resh Lakish said: The buyer acquired.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר לֹא קָנָה לוֹקֵחַ — קִנְיַן פֵּירוֹת כְּקִנְיַן הַגּוּף דָּמֵי.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said the purchaser does not acquire ownership of produce is tantamount to ownership of the item itself,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: "One who does not acquire (a field) does not acquire (the rights to) its produce - the acquisition of the produce is like the acquisition of the body (of the field)."

hebrew_text: וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר קָנָה לוֹקֵחַ — קִנְיַן פֵּירוֹת לָאו כְּקִנְיַן הַגּוּף דָּמֵי.
human_translation: And Reish Lakish said: The purchaser does acquire ownership of produce is not tantamount to ownership of the item itself,
llm_translation: Reish Lakish said: "Acquiring produce is not like acquiring the body itself."

hebrew_text: אֵין הַוָּלָד שֶׁל קַיָּימָא כּוּ׳. תָּנָא: מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אָמְרוּ — יוֹצִיא בְּגֵט.
human_translation: the offspring is not viable is taught In the name of Rabbi Eliezer they said: He must send her out with a bill of divorce.
llm_translation: The offspring of a valid marriage is like him. It was taught: In the name of Rabbi Eliezer they said - he may divorce with a bill of divorce.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: רַבִּי מֵאִיר וְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אָמְרוּ דָּבָר אֶחָד: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר הָא דַּאֲמַרַן.
human_translation: Rava said: Rabbi Meir and Rabbi Eliezer said the same thing, Rabbi Eliezer’s this we have stated.
llm_translation: Rava said: Rabbi Meir and Rabbi Eliezer said one thing: Rabbi Eliezer, what we have said.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי מֵאִיר דְּתַנְיָא: לֹא יִשָּׂא אָדָם מְעוּבֶּרֶת חֲבֵירוֹ, וּמֵינֶקֶת חֲבֵירוֹ. וְאִם נָשָׂא — יוֹצִיא וְלֹא יַחְזִיר עוֹלָמִית, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: יוֹצִיא, וְלִכְשֶׁיַּגִּיעַ זְמַנּוֹ לִכְנוֹס — יִכְנוֹס.
human_translation: Rabbi Meir’s As it is taught A man may not marry a woman who is pregnant of another nor a woman who is nursing of another And if he married he must divorce and he may never take back; the statement of Rabbi Meir. And the Rabbis say: He must send out, and when the time comes to marry he may marry
llm_translation: Rabbi Meir teaches: One may not carry out his fellow's excrement, nor his fellow's nursing child. And if he did carry it out, he should not return it permanently, these are the words of Rabbi Meir. But the Sages say: He should carry it out, and when its time comes to be brought back in, it should be brought back in.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: מִמַּאי? דִּלְמָא לָא הִיא, עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר הָכָא, אֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם דְּקָפָגֵע בְּאִיסּוּר אֵשֶׁת אָח דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא, אֲבָל הָתָם דְּרַבָּנַן — כְּרַבָּנַן סְבִירָא לֵיהּ!
human_translation: Abaye said to him: From where Perhaps that is not so, Rabbi Eliezer states only here, due to which he encounters the Torah prohibition against brother’s wife. However, there, which is a rabbinic he holds in accordance with Rabbis
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: From what? Perhaps it is not so, until here Rabbi Eliezer did not say here, but because he transgressed the prohibition of marrying one's brother's wife from the Torah, but there with the Rabbis - like the Rabbis he holds!

hebrew_text: אִי נָמֵי: עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר הָתָם, אֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם דְּרַבָּנַן, וַחֲכָמִים עָשׂוּ חִיזּוּק לְדִבְרֵיהֶם יוֹתֵר מִשֶּׁל תּוֹרָה, אֲבָל הָכָא מִדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא — מִפְרָשׁ פָּרְשִׁי מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Alternatively, Rabbi Meir states only there, due to that rabbinic the Sages reinforced their pronouncements with greater than Torah law However, here, in the Torah, distance themselves from
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Iy namei: ad kan lo ka'amar Rabbi Meir hataam, ela mishum deRabbana, vachachamim asu chizuk ledivreihem yoter mishel Torah, aval hacha mid'Oraita - mifrash parshi minah." English translation: "If you say: until here Rabbi Meir did not say there, rather because of the Rabbis, and the Sages made their words stronger than that of the Torah, but here from the Torah - he explains its details."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא, וּלְדִבְרֵי חֲכָמִים: יוֹצִיאָהּ בְּגֵט. אָמַר מָר זוּטְרָא: דַּיְקָא נָמֵי, דְּקָתָנֵי: ״יוֹצִיא״, וְלָא קָתָנֵי: ״יַפְרִישׁ״. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Rava said: According to the statement of the Rabbis he must send her out with a bill of divorce Mar Zutra said: is also precise, as teach: He must send out, and do not teach: He must separate Conclude from here
llm_translation: Rava said, and according to the words of the sages: she may be divorced with a bill of divorce. Mar Zutra said: It is indeed precise, for it is taught: "he shall send her out," and it does not teach: "he shall separate." Learn from it.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אָשֵׁי לְרַב הוֹשַׁעְיָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִידִי: הָתָם תְּנַן, רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: כׇּל שֶׁשָּׁהָא בְּאָדָם שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם — אֵינוֹ נֵפֶל. הָא לָא שְׁהָא — סְפֵיקָא הָוֵי.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said to Rav Hoshaya, son of Rav Idi: We learned there Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Any human that survives for thirty days is not a stillbirth. But, were it not to survive there would be uncertainty
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Ashei to Rav Hoshaya the son of Rav Idi: There we learned, Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Anyone who has a discharge in a man for thirty days - he is not considered impure. If it is not thirty days - it is a doubt.

hebrew_text: וְאִיתְּמַר: מֵת בְּתוֹךְ שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם, וְעָמְדָה וְנִתְקַדְּשָׁה,
human_translation: And was stated died during thirty days and arose and was betrothed.
llm_translation: And Itmar: dies within thirty days, and she stood up and became sanctified,

hebrew_text: רָבִינָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרָבָא אָמַר: אִם אֵשֶׁת יִשְׂרָאֵל הִיא — חוֹלֶצֶת, וְאִם אֵשֶׁת כֹּהֵן הִיא — אֵינָהּ חוֹלֶצֶת.
human_translation: Ravina said in the name of Rava: If she wife of an Israelite, she performs ḥalitza But if she wife of a priest, she does not perform ḥalitza
llm_translation: Ravinah from the name of Rava said: If she is a Jewish woman - she may perform chalitzah, and if she is a Kohen's wife - she may not perform chalitzah.

hebrew_text: רַב מְשַׁרְשְׁיָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרָבָא אָמַר: אַחַת זוֹ וְאַחַת זוֹ — חוֹלֶצֶת.
human_translation: Rav Mesharshiyya said in the name of Rava: Both this and that perform ḥalitza ,
llm_translation: Rav Mesharshaya from the name of Rava said: "One this and one this - she removes."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבִינָא לְרַב מְשַׁרְשְׁיָא:
human_translation: Ravina said to Rav Mesharshiyya:
llm_translation: Ravina said to Rav Mesharshaya:

hebrew_text: בְּאוּרְתָּא אֲמַר רָבָא הָכִי, וּבְצַפְרָא הֲדַר בֵּיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: שְׁרִיתוּהָ? יְהֵא רַעֲוָא דְּתִשְׁ(תְּ)רוֹ אַף תַּרְבָּא.
human_translation: In the evening Rava stated this but in the morning he retracted said to him: Do you permit May it be will that you will even permit fats [ tarba ]
llm_translation: In the city of Urta, Rava said thus, and in the town of Safra, he expounded it. He said to him: Have you untied it? Let the healing that you seek come quickly.

hebrew_text: הָכָא גַּבֵּי מְעוּבֶּרֶת חֲבֵירוֹ וּמֵינֶקֶת חֲבֵירוֹ הַנְּשׂוּאָה לְכֹהֵן, מַאי? מִי עֲבוּד רַבָּנַן תַּקַּנְתָּא לְכֹהֵן, אוֹ לָא.
human_translation: Here, with regard to a woman who is pregnant of another or a woman who is nursing of another who is married to a priest, what Did the Sages enact an ordinance for a priest or not?
llm_translation: Here regarding the case of the fetus of his fellow and the nursing of his fellow's wife who is married to a Kohen, what? Who did the Rabbis establish the remedy for, the Kohen or not.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָכִי הַשְׁתָּא? בִּשְׁלָמָא הָתָם, כֵּיוָן דְּאִיכָּא רַבָּנַן דִּפְלִיגִי עֲלֵיהּ דְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, דְּאָמְרִי: אַף עַל גַּב דְּלָא שְׁהָא וָלָד מְעַלְּיָא הָוֵי, גַּבֵּי אֵשֶׁת כֹּהֵן כֵּיוָן דְּלָא אֶפְשָׁר — עָבְדִינַן כְּרַבָּנַן,
human_translation: He said to him: How can be compared? Granted, there, since there are the Rabbis who disagree with Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel concerning it, as they say although did not survive it is a full-fledged, offspring, with regard to wife of a priest, since it is not possible we act in accordance with of the Rabbis.
llm_translation: He said to him: Is it so now? Granted there, since there are Rabbis who disagree with Rabbi Shimon ben Gamliel, who say: Even though a child is not yet born, it is considered as if it is born, in the case of the wife of a Kohen, since it is not possible — we act in accordance with the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל הָכָא, כְּמַאן נַעֲבֵיד? אִי כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר, הָא אָמַר: יוֹצִיא וְלֹא יַחְזִיר עוֹלָמִית, וְאִי כְּרַבָּנַן — הָאָמְרִי בְּגֵט.
human_translation: However, here, in accordance with whose should we act? If in accordance with Rabbi Meir, said he must divorce and may never take back. And if in accordance with the Rabbis, they say with a bill of divorce
llm_translation: Talmudic text: But here, according to whom are we acting? If according to Rabbi Meir, he said: "He may divorce and not remarry eternally," and if according to the Rabbis - they said in a bill of divorce.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר: קִדְּשָׁהּ בְּתוֹךְ שְׁלֹשָׁה וּבָרַח, פְּלִיגִי בַּהּ רַב אַחָא וְרַפְרָם, חַד אָמַר: מְשַׁמְּתִינַן לֵיהּ, וְחַד אָמַר: עֵירוּקֵיהּ מִסָּתְיֵיהּ. הֲוָה עוֹבָדָא וַאֲמַר לְהוּ רַפְרָם: עֵירוּקֵיהּ מִסָּתְיֵיהּ.
human_translation: was stated: betrothed during three months and he fled, Rav Aḥa and Rafram disagree over One said: We excommunicate him And one said: His flight is sufficient for him, There was an incident and Rafram said to those His flight is sufficient for him.
llm_translation: It was stated: She sanctified it within three and ran away, Rav Acha and Rafhram disagree about it, one said: we appoint it for her, and one said: her departure is from her. There was an incident and Rafhram said to them: her departure is from her.

hebrew_text: סָפֵק בֶּן תֵּשַׁע וְכוּ׳. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא לְרַב נַחְמָן: לֵימָא הַלֵּךְ אַחַר רוֹב נָשִׁים, וְרוֹב נָשִׁים לְתִשְׁעָה יָלְדָן!
human_translation: an uncertainty whether is nine old, Rava said to Rav Naḥman: Let us say: Follow majority of women, and majority of women give birth after nine
llm_translation: Doubt regarding a child of nine and so forth. Rava said to Rav Nachman: Let him follow the majority of women, and the majority of women give birth at nine!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: נְשֵׁי דִּידַן, לְשִׁבְעָה יָלְדָן. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: נְשֵׁי דִּידְכוּ הָווּ רוּבָּא דְּעָלְמָא?
human_translation: said to him: women of our give birth after seven said to him: Do women of your constitute the majority of the world?
llm_translation: He said to him: Our women give birth to seven. He said to him: Are the women of your place the majority of the world?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ, הָכִי קָאָמֵינָא: רוֹב נָשִׁים יָלְדָן לְתִשְׁעָה, וּמִיעוּט לְשִׁבְעָה, וְכׇל הַיּוֹלֶדֶת לְתִשְׁעָה, עוּבָּרָהּ נִיכָּר לִשְׁלִישׁ יָמֶיהָ. וְזוֹ, הוֹאִיל וְלֹא הוּכַּר עוּבָּרָהּ לִשְׁלִישׁ יָמֶיהָ — אִיתְּרַע לֵיהּ רוּבָּא.
human_translation: said to him: This is what I am saying: majority of women give birth after nine and a minority after seven, every who gives birth after nine her fetus is recognizable after a third of her days, this since her fetus was not recognizable after a third of her days, majority is compromised,
llm_translation: He said to him, thus I am saying: Most women give birth at nine, and few at seven, and every woman who gives birth at nine, her pregnancy is recognizable after three days. And this, since her pregnancy was not recognizable after three days - it is harmful to her.

hebrew_text: אִי כׇּל הַיּוֹלֶדֶת לְתִשְׁעָה עוּבָּרָהּ נִיכָּר לִשְׁלִישׁ יָמֶיהָ, הָא מִדְּלֹא הוּכַּר לִשְׁלִישׁ יָמֶיהָ, עוּבָּרָהּ וַדַּאי בַּר שִׁבְעָה לְבָתְרָאָה הוּא! אֶלָּא אֵימָא: רוֹב הַיּוֹלֶדֶת לְתִשְׁעָה — עוּבָּרָהּ נִיכָּר לִשְׁלִישׁ יָמֶיהָ, וְהַאי מִדְּלֹא הוּכַּר לִשְׁלִישׁ יָמֶיהָ — אִיתְּרַע לֵיהּ רוּבָּא.
human_translation: If every who gives birth after nine her fetus is recognizable after a third of her days, this from was not recognized after a third her fetus was certainly seven old of the latter Rather, say: majority who gives birth after nine her fetus is recognizable after a third of her days, and this from was not recognized after a third majority is compromised.
llm_translation: If all the woman giving birth to a nine-month fetus, its recognition is on the third day, but if it was not recognized on the third day, her fetus is certainly a seven-month one! Rather say: Most women giving birth to a nine-month fetus - its recognition is on the third day, and this one that was not recognized on the third day - most likely it is harmful to it.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: רִאשׁוֹן רָאוּי לִהְיוֹת כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל, וְשֵׁנִי מַמְזֵר מִסָּפֵק. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב אוֹמֵר: אֵין מַמְזֵר מִסָּפֵק.
human_translation: the Sages taught first is fit to become a High Priest. second mamzer due to an uncertainty Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov says: One is not a mamzer due to uncertainty.
llm_translation: The sages taught: The first is fitting to be a high priest, and the second is of uncertain lineage. Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov says: A person of uncertain lineage is of uncertain lineage.

hebrew_text: מַאי קָאָמַר? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, הָכִי קָאָמַר: רִאשׁוֹן רָאוּי לִהְיוֹת כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל, וְשֵׁנִי סְפֵק מַמְזֵר, וְאָסוּר בְּמַמְזֶרֶת. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: אֵינוֹ סְפֵק מַמְזֵר, אֶלָּא וַדַּאי מַמְזֵר, וּמוּתָּר בְּמַמְזֶרֶת.
human_translation: What is saying? Abaye said: This is what it is saying: first is fit to become a High Priest. And a second a mamzer uncertain and and he is prohibited from a mamzeret , Rabbi Eliezer says: He is not a mamzer uncertain; rather, he is definitely a mamzer , and he is permitted to a mamzeret .
llm_translation: What is he saying? Abaye said, thus he is saying: The first one is fitting to be a High Priest, and the second one is a doubt of being a mamzer, and is forbidden in mamzeret. Rabbi Eliezer says: He is not a doubt of being a mamzer, rather he is definitely a mamzer, and is permitted in mamzeret.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר, הָכִי קָאָמַר: רִאשׁוֹן רָאוּי לִהְיוֹת כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל, וְשֵׁנִי מַמְזֵר וַדַּאי מִסָּפֵק וּמוּתָּר בְּמַמְזֶרֶת. וְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב אוֹמֵר: אֵין וַדַּאי מַמְזֵר מִסָּפֵק. אֶלָּא סְפֵק מַמְזֵר, וְאָסוּר בְּמַמְזֶרֶת.
human_translation: Rava said: This is what is saying: first is fit to become a High Priest. And a second is definitely a mamzer due to uncertainty and he is permitted to mamzeret , And Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov says: He not definitely a mamzer due to an uncertainty rather, a mamzer uncertain and and he is prohibited from a mamzeret
llm_translation: Rava said, thus he said: The first is fitting to be a high priest, and the second is definitely a mamzer and permitted in mamzeret. And Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov says: A definite mamzer is not in doubt. Rather, a doubtful mamzer is forbidden in mamzeret.

hebrew_text: וְקָמִיפַּלְגִי בִּדְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר. דִּתְנַן, רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: וַדָּאָן בְּוַדָּאָן — מוּתָּר, וַדָּאָן בִּסְפֵקָן, וּסְפֵקָן בְּוַדָּאָן, וּסְפֵקָן בִּסְפֵקָן — אָסוּר.
human_translation: And disagree with regard to Rabbi Elazar. As we learned Rabbi Elazar said: those certain to those certain is permitted, those certain to those uncertain, and those uncertain to those certain, and those uncertain to those uncertain, is prohibited.
llm_translation: And he argued with Rabbi Elazar. For it was taught: Rabbi Elazar says: "When it is certain with certainty - it is permitted, when it is certain with doubt, and doubt with certainty, and doubt with doubt - it is forbidden."

hebrew_text: וְאֵלּוּ הֵן סְפֵקָן: שְׁתוּקִי וַאֲסוּפִי וְכוּתִי.
human_translation: And these are those uncertain A child of unknown paternity shetuki and a foundling and a Samaritan [ Kuti ],
llm_translation: And these are the doubtful cases: Shetuki, Va'asufi, and Kutti.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר. כִּי אַמְרִיתַהּ קַמֵּיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל, אֲמַר לִי: הִלֵּל שָׁנָה — עֲשָׂרָה יוּחֲסִין עָלוּ מִבָּבֶל: כָּהֲנֵי, לְוִיֵּי, וְיִשְׂרְאֵלֵי, חֲלָלֵי, גֵּירֵי, חֲרוֹרֵי, מַמְזֵרֵי, נְתִינֵי, שְׁתוּקֵי וַאֲסוּפֵי. וְכוּלָּן מוּתָּרִין לָבֹא זֶה בָּזֶה.
human_translation: And Rav Yehuda said Rav said: halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Elazar. when I said this in presence of Shmuel, he said to me: Hillel taught ten lineage came up from Babylon Priests; Levites; and Israelites; priests disqualified due to flawed lineage [ ḥalallim ]; converts; freed slaves; mamzerim ; Gibeonites; shetukei ; and foundlings. And it is permitted all to marry one another,
llm_translation: And Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: The halakha is according to Rabbi Elazar. For when I said it before Shmuel, he said to me: Hillel the Elder enumerated ten genealogical categories that ascended from Babylon: Kohanim, Leviim, and Yisraelim, Challalim, converts, freed slaves, bastards, Netinim, shetukim, and asufim. And all of them are permitted to intermarry with one another.

hebrew_text: וְאַתְּ אָמְרַתְּ הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר!
human_translation: and you, said halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Elazar,
llm_translation: And you said, "The halakha is according to Rabbi Elazar!"

hebrew_text: אַבָּיֵי סָבַר לַהּ כִּשְׁמוּאֵל, דְּאָמַר: הֲלָכָה כְּהִלֵּל, וּמוֹקֵי לַהּ רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב אַלִּיבָּא דְהִלְכְתָא, כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלָא תִּקְשֵׁי הִלְכְתָא אַהִלְכְתָא.
human_translation: Abaye holds in accordance with Shmuel, who said halakha is in accordance with Hillel establishes that Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov in accordance with halakha , in order that there should not be a contradiction between halakha , and halakha ,
llm_translation: Abaye thought according to Shmuel, who said: the halakha is like Hillel, and Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov contradicts her in matters of halakha, so that the halakha does not become like halakha.

hebrew_text: רָבָא סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַב, דְּאָמַר: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר. וּמוֹקֵי לַהּ לִדְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב אַלִּיבָּא דְּהִלְכְתָא, כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלָא תִּקְשֵׁי
human_translation: Rava, holds in accordance with Rav, who said: halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Elazar establishes that of Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov in accordance with halakha , so that there should not be a contradiction
llm_translation: Rava holds like Rav, who said: the halakha follows Rabbi Eliezer. And he argues with him regarding Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov in the matter of the halakha, so that it should not be difficult.

hebrew_text: הִלְכְתָא אַהִלְכְתָא.
human_translation: halakha , and halakha ,
llm_translation: The law is as the law.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: מְנָא אָמֵינָא לַהּ דְּכֹל סְפֵיקָא לְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב — כְּוַדַּאי מְשַׁוֵּי לֵיהּ,
human_translation: Abaye said: From where do I say that anyone uncertain, according to Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov are treated equivalently to definitely
llm_translation: Abaye said: From where do I say to her that every doubt to Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov - certainly he will answer her.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב אוֹמֵר: הֲרֵי שֶׁבָּא עַל נָשִׁים הַרְבֵּה וְאֵין יוֹדֵעַ עַל אֵיזוֹ מֵהֶן בָּא, וְכֵן הִיא שֶׁבָּאוּ עָלֶיהָ אֲנָשִׁים הַרְבֵּה, וְאֵינָהּ יוֹדַעַת מֵאֵיזֶה מֵהֶן קִבְּלָה — נִמְצָא אָב נוֹשֵׂא אֶת בִּתּוֹ, וְאָח נוֹשֵׂא אֶת אֲחוֹתוֹ, וְנִתְמַלֵּא כָּל הָעוֹלָם כּוּלּוֹ מַמְזֵרִין. וְעַל זֶה נֶאֱמַר: ״וּמָלְאָה הָאָרֶץ זִמָּה״.
