human_translation: As it is taught Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov says: who engaged in intercourse with many women, but he does not know with which he had intercourse, and similarly, many men had intercourse with her but she does not know from which she received it could emerge a father marries his daughter, and a brother marries his sister. And the entire world could become filled with mamzerim . And concerning this, it is stated: “And lest the land become full of lewdness”
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov says: If a man has relations with many women and does not know upon which one he had relations, and similarly a woman upon whom many men had relations and she does not know from which one she conceived - it is found that a father marries his daughter, a brother marries his sister, and the entire world becomes full of mamzerim. And regarding this it is said: "And the land is filled with immorality."

hebrew_text: וְרָבָא אָמַר לָךְ, הָכִי קָאָמַר: ״זוֹ מָה הִיא״.
human_translation: And Rava said to you: This is what is saying: What is this.
llm_translation: And Rava said to you, thus he said: "What is this?"

hebrew_text: יָתֵר עַל כֵּן, אָמַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב: לֹא יִשָּׂא אָדָם אִשָּׁה בִּמְדִינָה זוֹ וְיֵלֵךְ וְיִשָּׂא אִשָּׁה בִּמְדִינָה אַחֶרֶת, שֶׁמָּא יִזְדַּוְּוגוּ זֶה לָזֶה, וְנִמְצָא אָח נוֹשֵׂא אֶת אֲחוֹתוֹ.
human_translation: Furthermore, Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov said a man should not marry a woman in this country and go and marry woman in a different country, lest unite with one another, and it could emerge a brother marries his sister,
llm_translation: "Moreover, Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov said: A man should not marry a woman in this town and then go and marry a woman in another town, lest they intermingle with one another, and it will be found that a brother is marrying his sister."

hebrew_text: אִינִי? וְהָא רַב כִּי אִיקְּלַע לְדַרְדְּשִׁיר, [מַכְרֵיז] וְאָמַר: מַאן הָוְיָא לְיוֹמָא. וְרַב נַחְמָן כִּי אִיקְּלַע לְשַׁכְנְצִיב, [מַכְרֵיז] וְאָמַר: מַאן הָוְיָא לְיוֹמָא!
human_translation: Is that so; But didn’t Rav, when he happened to Dardeshir, make a public announcement saying: Which will be for the day, And Rav Naḥman, when he happened to Shakhnetziv, made a public announcement saying: Which will be for the day?
llm_translation: I am? But didn't Rav, when he arrived in Dardeshir, proclaim and say: "Who will be for the day?" And Rav Nachman, when he arrived in Shachneziv, proclaimed and said: "Who will be for the day!"

hebrew_text: שָׁאנֵי רַבָּנַן, דִּפְקִיעַ שְׁמַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: Sages are different, as their names are renowned,
llm_translation: The sages differ, for they have split the heavens.

hebrew_text: וְהָאָמַר רָבָא: תְּבָעוּהָ לִינָּשֵׂא וְנִתְפַּיְּיסָה — צְרִיכָה לֵישֵׁב שִׁבְעָה נְקִיִּים?
human_translation: But didn’t Rava say: who had an offer of marriage and accepted, she needs to wait seven clean
llm_translation: And Rava said: If she demanded to be married and she was appeased - does she need to wait seven clean days?

hebrew_text: רַבָּנַן שְׁלוּחַיְיהוּ הֲווֹ מְשַׁדְּרִי וּמוֹדְעִי לְהוּ. וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: לְרַבָּנַן, יַחוֹדֵי בְּעָלְמָא הוּא דִּמְיַיחֲדִי לְהוּ, דְּאָמַר מָר: אֵינוֹ דּוֹמֶה מִי שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ פַּת בְּסַלּוֹ לְמִי שֶׁאֵין לוֹ פַּת בְּסַלּוֹ.
human_translation: Sages would send messengers they inform And if you wish, say the Sages’ were merely to be in seclusion [ meyaḥadi ] with as the Master said: One who has bread in his basket is incomparable to one who does not have bread in his basket,
llm_translation: The sages, their messengers, would send and inform them. And if you wish, say: To the sages, it is a unique connection in the world that unites them, as the Master said: One who has bread in his basket is not comparable to one who does not have bread in his basket.

hebrew_text: תָּנָא, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב אוֹמֵר: לֹא יִשָּׂא אָדָם אִשְׁתּוֹ וְדַעְתּוֹ לְגָרְשָׁהּ, מִשּׁוּם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אַל תַּחֲרֹשׁ עַל רֵעֲךָ רָעָה וְהוּא יוֹשֵׁב לָבֶטַח אִתָּךְ״.
human_translation: taught Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov says: A man should not marry his wife his intention is to divorce her, because it is stated: “Do not devise evil against your neighbor, as he dwells securely with you”
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov says: A man should not divorce his wife against her will, as it is stated: "Do not devise evil against your neighbor, while he dwells securely beside you."

hebrew_text: סָפֵק וְיָבָם שֶׁבָּאוּ לַחֲלוֹק בְּנִכְסֵי מִיתָנָא,
human_translation: uncertain, and a yavam who came to divide up possessions of the deceased
llm_translation: Doubt and yavam who came to divide in the property of mitzvah,

hebrew_text: סָפֵק אָמַר: אֲנָא בַּר מִיתָנָא הוּא, וְנִכְסֵי דִּידִי (הוּא) [נִינְהוּ]. וְיָבָם אָמַר: אַתְּ בְּרַאי דִּידִי אַתְּ, וְלֵית לָךְ וְלָא מִידֵּי בְּנִכְסֵי. הָוֵי מָמוֹן הַמּוּטָּל בְּסָפֵק, וּמָמוֹן הַמּוּטָּל בְּסָפֵק — חוֹלְקִין.
human_translation: uncertain said: I am the son of the deceased, and possessions are mine. And the yavam said You are my son, and you have absolutely no to possessions; is property of uncertain ownership, property of uncertain ownership divide up
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Safek said: I am the son of Mitana, and my properties are included in them. And Yavam said: You are my brother, and you have no share in the properties. The money that is dependent on a doubt, and the money that is dependent on a doubt - they divide."

hebrew_text: סָפֵק וּבְנֵי יָבָם שֶׁבָּאוּ לַחֲלוֹק בְּנִכְסֵי מִיתָנָא, סָפֵק אָמַר: הָהוּא גַּבְרָא בַּר מִיתָנָא הוּא, וְנִכְסֵי דִּידִי (הוּא) [נִינְהוּ]. בְּנֵי יָבָם אָמְרִי: אַתְּ (אַחֵינוּ) [אֲחוּנָא] אַתְּ, וּמְנָתָא הוּא דְּאִית לָךְ בַּהֲדַן.
human_translation: uncertainty and the sons of yavam , who came to divide up possessions of the deceased, uncertain said: That man, is the son of the deceased, and possessions are mine. sons of the yavam said You are our brother, and you have a portion together with us.
llm_translation: Doubt and the sons of yavam who came to divide in the estate of mitzvah, doubt said: that man son of mitzvah he is, and the estate of mine (he) they are. The sons of yavam said: you (our brother) our sister you are, and the portion is what you have in the judgment.

hebrew_text: סְבוּר רַבָּנַן קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב מְשַׁרְשְׁיָא לְמֵימַר: מַתְנִיתִין הִיא, דִּתְנַן: הוּא אֵינוֹ יוֹרֵשׁ אוֹתָם, וְהֵם יוֹרְשִׁין אוֹתוֹ.
human_translation: The Rabbis before Rav Mesharshiyya thought to say: is a mishna, as we learned he, does not inherit them However, they, will inherit him.
llm_translation: The sages thought before Rav Mesharshaya to say: It is a Mishnah, as we learned: "He does not inherit them, but they inherit him."

hebrew_text: וְהָכָא אִיפְּכָא. הָתָם אָמְרִי לֵיהּ: אַיְיתִי רְאָיָה וּשְׁקוֹל,
human_translation: But here, in reverse, There, they, say to him, Bring proof and take
llm_translation: Here is the English translation: Talmudic text: And here is the opposite. There, they said to him: Bring proof and weigh it.

hebrew_text: הָכָא אֲמַר לְהוּ: אַיְיתוֹ רְאָיָה וּשְׁקוּלוּ.
human_translation: here, he, say to them: Bring proof and take
llm_translation: Here he said to them: Bring a proof and weigh it.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהוּ רַב מְשַׁרְשְׁיָא: מִי דָּמֵי? הָתָם, אִינְהוּ וַדַּאי וְאִיהוּ סָפֵק. הָכָא, אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי סָפֵק.
human_translation: Rav Mesharshiyya said to them: Is comparable? There, they, definite and he, uncertain here, each uncertain
llm_translation: He said to them, Rav Mesharshaya: Who is similar? There, they are certain and he is doubtful. Here, both are doubtful.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, אִי דָּמְיָא לְמַתְנִיתִין — [לְהָא] דָּמְיָא: לְסָפֵק וּבְנֵי יָבָם שֶׁבָּאוּ לַחְלוֹק בְּנִכְסֵי יָבָם גּוּפֵיהּ, דְּהָתָם אָמְרִי לֵיהּ: אַיְיתִי רְאָיָה דַּאֲחוּנָא אַתְּ וּשְׁקוֹל.
human_translation: Rather, if is analogous to the mishna, to this analogous: to uncertain and sons of the yavam come to divide up possessions of the yavam himself. As there, they say to him, Bring proof that you are our brother and take
llm_translation: Rather, if it is similar to the Mishnah - to what is it similar? To a case of doubt and the brothers of the yavam who came to divide the estate of the yavam himself, for there they say to him: Bring proof that you are a brother-in-law and take your share.

hebrew_text: סָפֵק וּבְנֵי יָבָם שֶׁבָּאוּ לַחְלוֹק בְּנִכְסֵי יָבָם, לְבָתַר דִּפְלַג יָבָם בְּנִכְסֵי מִיתָנָא,
human_translation: uncertainty and sons of the yavam , who came to divide up possessions of the yavam after the yavam had divided up possessions of the deceased
llm_translation: Doubt and sons of yavam who came to divide in properties of yavam, after that divided yavam in properties of gift.

hebrew_text: בְּנֵי יָבָם אָמְרִי: אַיְיתִי רְאָיָה דַּאֲחוּנָא אַתְּ וּשְׁקוֹל. אָמַר לְהוּ סָפֵק: מָה נַפְשַׁיְיכוּ, אִי אֲחוּכוֹן אֲנָא — הַבוּ לִי מְנָתָא בַּהֲדַיְיכוּ, וְאִי בַּר מִיתָנָא אֲנָא — הַבוּ לִי פַּלְגָא דִּפְלַג אֲבוּכוֹן בַּהֲדַאי.
human_translation: The sons of the yavam say Bring proof that you are our brother, and take uncertain said to them: Whichever way you If I am your brother, give me a portion together with you, and if I am the son of the deceased, give me the half that your father divided up with me
llm_translation: The sons of the yavam said: "Bring proof that you are pregnant and we will accept it." He said to them: "It is a doubt, what are your intentions, if I am pregnant - give me my portion among you, and if I am not pregnant - give me half of my yavam's portion."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אַבָּא אָמַר רַב: קָם דִּינָא. רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה אָמַר: הָדַר דִּינָא.
human_translation: Rabbi Abba said Rav The verdict stands, Rabbi Yirmeya said: The verdict is reconsidered
llm_translation: Rabbi Abba said, Rav: The judgment arose. Rabbi Yirmeya said: The judgment returned.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא בִּפְלוּגְתָּא דְּאַדְמוֹן וְרַבָּנַן קָמִיפַּלְגִי, דִּתְנַן: מִי שֶׁהָלַךְ לִמְדִינַת הַיָּם וְאָבְדָה לוֹ דֶּרֶךְ שָׂדֵהוּ — אַדְמוֹן אָמַר: יֵלֵךְ בִּקְצָרָה. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: יִקַּח לוֹ דֶּרֶךְ בְּמֵאָה מָנֶה, אוֹ יִפְרַח בָּאֲוִיר.
human_translation: Let us say that disagree over the dispute between Admon and the Rabbis. As we learned one he traveled to a country overseas, and path to his field was lost, Admon says: He may go on the shortest The Rabbis say: He must purchase for himself path for one hundred dinars, or he will fly through the air
llm_translation: Let us say in the dispute of Admon and the Rabbis, for it was taught: "One who went to the sea country and lost his way in his field - Admon says: Let him go by way of the shortcut. And the sages say: Let him take a path for a hundred mana, or let him travel by air."

hebrew_text: וְהָוֵינַן בַּהּ: לְרַבָּנַן שַׁפִּיר קָאָמַר אַדְמוֹן? וְאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן — כְּגוֹן שֶׁהִקִּיפוּהָ אַרְבָּעָה בְּנֵי אָדָם מֵאַרְבַּע רוּחוֹת.
human_translation: And we discussed for the Rabbis Admon is saying well, And Rav Yehuda said Rav said: With what are we dealing here? where surrounded by four individuals on four sides.
llm_translation: We were learning in it: The Rabbis beautifully said, "Is Adam red?" And Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: What are we dealing with here? For example, when four people surrounded her from the four directions.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, מַאי טַעְמָא דְּאַדְמוֹן? וְאָמַר רָבָא: בְּאַרְבְּעָה דְּאָתוּ מִכֹּחַ אַרְבְּעָה, וְאַרְבְּעָה דְּאָתוּ מִכֹּחַ חַד — כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דְּמָצוּ מְדַחֵי לֵיהּ.
human_translation: If so, what is Admon’s rationale And Rava said: With regard to four who came on the basis of four and four who came on the basis of one everyone agrees that are able to deflect him
llm_translation: So it is, what is the reason for Admon? And Rava said: With four that come from the strength of four, and four that come from the strength of one - the entire world does not dispute that they push it away.

hebrew_text: כִּי פְּלִיגִי, בְּחַד דְּאָתֵי מִכֹּחַ אַרְבְּעָה. אַדְמוֹן סָבַר, מָצֵי אָמַר לֵיהּ: מִכׇּל מָקוֹם דַּרְכַּי גַּבָּךְ הוּא. וְרַבָּנַן סָבְרִי דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִי שָׁתְקַתְּ — שָׁתְקַתְּ, וְאִי לָא, מַהְדַּרְנָא שְׁטָרָא לְמָרַיְיהוּ, וְלָא מָצֵית לְאִשְׁתַּעוֹיֵי דִּינָא בַּהֲדַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: When they disagree, in which one who came on the basis of four Admon holds can say to Whichever way my path with you And the Rabbis hold he can say to him: If you are silent, be silent, But if not, I will return the bills to their owners, and you will not be able to engage in a legal dispute with them,
llm_translation: When they disputed, in one place, four came. Admon thought, "From every place, my ways are upright." And the Rabbis thought that he said to them, "If you are silent, be silent, and if not, I will return the document to their masters, and you will not find a way to evade the judgment against them."

hebrew_text: לֵימָא רַבִּי אַבָּא דְּאָמַר כְּרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: Let us say Rabbi Abba, who said is in accordance with the Rabbis.
llm_translation: Let us say, Rabbi Abba said like the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יִרְמְיָה דְּאָמַר כְּאַדְמוֹן.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yirmeya, who said is in accordance with Admon.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yirmeya said, "like Admon."

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָךְ רַבִּי אַבָּא: אֲנָא דַּאֲמַרִי אֲפִילּוּ כְּאַדְמוֹן, עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמַר אַדְמוֹן הָתָם, אֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם דְּאָמַר לֵיהּ: מִמָּה נַפְשָׁךְ
human_translation: Rabbi Abba said to you: When I stated even in accordance with Admon. Admon states only there, because said to Whichever way you
llm_translation: He said to you, Rabbi Abba: I, who said even like Adamon, until here did not say Adamon there, but because he said to him: "From what is your soul?"

hebrew_text: דַּרְכַּי (חַד גַּבָּךְ) [גַּבֵּי חַד] הוּא. אֲבָל הָכָא, מִי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר הָכִי?
human_translation: my one path is with you However, here, is able to state this?
llm_translation: The ways (one of them) one of them is. But here, who is there to say so?

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יִרְמְיָה אָמַר לָךְ: אֲנָא דַּאֲמַרִי אֲפִילּוּ לְרַבָּנַן, עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמְרִי רַבָּנַן הָתָם, אֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם דְּאָמַר לֵיהּ: אִי שָׁתְקַתְּ — שָׁתְקַתְּ. וְאִי לָא, מַהְדַּרְנָא שְׁטָרָא לְמָרַיְיהוּ וְלָא מָצֵית לְאִשְׁתַּעוֹיֵי דִּינָא בַּהֲדַיְיהוּ, אֲבָל הָכָא — מִי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר הָכִי?
human_translation: And Rabbi Yirmeya said to you: I stated even in accordance with the Rabbis, the Rabbis state only there, because said to If you are silent, be silent but if not, I will return the bills to their owners and you will not be able to engage in a legal dispute with them. However, here, are able to state this?
llm_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya said to you: I, who say even to the Rabbis, until here the Rabbis did not say there, but because he said to him: If you are silent - be silent. And if not, I will return the document to their masters and not find a reason to argue with them, but here - what can be said like this?

hebrew_text: סָפֵק וְיָבָם שֶׁבָּאוּ לַחֲלוֹק בְּנִכְסֵי סָבָא. סָפֵק אָמַר: הַאי גַּבְרָא בַּר מִיתָנָא הוּא, וּפַלְגָא דִּידִי הוּא. יָבָם אָמַר: אַתְּ, בְּרַאי דִּידִי אַתְּ, וְלֵית לָךְ וְלָא מִידֵּי.
human_translation: uncertain and yavam who came to divide up possessions of the grandfather, uncertain said: That man, is the son of the deceased, and half are mine The yavam said You are my son, and you have absolutely no
llm_translation: Doubt and yavam who came to divide in the property of the grandfather. Doubt said: This man is a son of Mitana, and a portion of mine. Yavam said: You, in my eyes you are, and you have nothing of your own.

hebrew_text: הָוֵי יָבָם וַדַּאי, וְסָפֵק סָפֵק, וְאֵין סָפֵק מוֹצִיא מִידֵי וַדַּאי.
human_translation: the yavam has a definite and uncertain an uncertain an uncertain claim cannot extract from a definite
llm_translation: Be a yavam and definite, and a doubt is a doubt, and a doubt does not exempt from the definite.

hebrew_text: סָפֵק וּבְנֵי יָבָם שֶׁבָּאוּ לַחֲלוֹק בְּנִכְסֵי סָבָא. סָפֵק אָמַר: הָהוּא גַּבְרָא בַּר מִיתָנָא הוּא, וּפַלְגָא דִּידִי הוּא. וּבְנֵי יָבָם אָמְרִי: אֲחוּנָא אַתְּ וּמְנָתָא אִית לָךְ בַּהֲדַן.
human_translation: uncertain and the sons of the yavam who came to divide up possessions of the grandfather, uncertain said: That man, is the son of the deceased, and half are mine And the sons of the yavam said: You are our brother, and you receive a portion together with us.
llm_translation: Doubt and the sons of yavam who came to divide the estate of the grandfather. Doubt said: that man is a son of Mitana, and the portion is mine. And the sons of yavam said: you are our sister, and you have a portion in Hadan.

hebrew_text: פַּלְגָא דְּקָמוֹדֵי לְהוּ — שָׁקְלִי. תִּילְתָּא דְּקָא מוֹדוּ לֵיהּ — שָׁקֵל. פָּשׁ לְהוּ דַּנְקָא — הָוֵי מָמוֹן הַמּוּטָּל בְּסָפֵק וְחוֹלְקִין.
human_translation: The half that concedes to them, they take The third that concede to him, he takes leaves them one-sixth [ danka ] is property of uncertain ownership, and they divide up
llm_translation: The half of the standing ones - take. The third of those who admit to him - take. If it is clear to them - it is considered money that is deposited in doubt, and they divide.

hebrew_text: סָבָא וְיָבָם בְּנִכְסֵי סָפֵק. אוֹ סָבָא וְסָפֵק בְּנִכְסֵי יָבָם —
human_translation: the grandfather and the yavam possessions of the uncertain Or, the grandfather and the uncertain possessions of the yavam .
llm_translation: Grandfather and yavam in doubtful property. Or grandfather and doubtful property in yavam's property —

hebrew_text: הָוֵי מָמוֹן הַמּוּטָּל בְּסָפֵק וְחוֹלְקִין.
human_translation: is property of uncertain ownership, and they divide up
llm_translation: Be money that is deposited in doubt and they divide.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ שׁוֹמֶרֶת יָבָם שֶׁנָּפְלוּ לָהּ נְכָסִים — מוֹדִים בֵּית שַׁמַּאי וּבֵית הִלֵּל שֶׁמּוֹכֶרֶת וְנוֹתֶנֶת, וְקַיָּים.
human_translation: a widow waiting for her yavam to whom property was bequeathed: Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel agree that she may sell or give and is valid.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: A yevamah who inherited assets — Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel agree that she may sell and transfer them, and the transaction is valid.

hebrew_text: מֵתָה, מָה יַעֲשֶׂה בִּכְתוּבָּתָהּ, וּבִנְכָסִים הַנִּכְנָסִים וְיוֹצְאִין עִמָּהּ? בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: יַחְלוֹקוּ יוֹרְשֵׁי הַבַּעַל עִם יוֹרְשֵׁי הָאָב. וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: נְכָסִים בְּחֶזְקָתָן. כְּתוּבָּה — בְּחֶזְקַת יוֹרְשֵׁי הַבַּעַל, נְכָסִים הַנִּכְנָסִים וְיוֹצְאִין עִמָּהּ — בְּחֶזְקַת יוֹרְשֵׁי הָאָב.
human_translation: died, what should be done with her marriage contract and with property that enters and leaves with her, Beit Shammai say: The husband’s heirs, should divide up together with father’s heirs, And Beit Hillel say: property its status. marriage contract in the possession of the husband’s heirs. property that enters and leaves with her in the possession of the father’s heirs.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: If she dies, what should be done with her marriage contract and with the assets that came in with her and those that went out with her? Beit Shammai says: The heirs of the husband should divide with the heirs of the father. And Beit Hillel says: The assets remain in their possession. The marriage contract is in the possession of the heirs of the husband, and the assets that came in and went out with her are in the possession of the heirs of the father.

hebrew_text: כְּנָסָהּ — הֲרֵי הִיא כְּאִשְׁתּוֹ לְכׇל דָּבָר. וּבִלְבַד שֶׁתְּהֵא כְּתוּבָּ[תָ]הּ עַל נִכְסֵי בַּעְלָהּ הָרִאשׁוֹן.
human_translation: consummated the levirate marriage with her, then that of his wife in every sense, And only that marriage contract will be from the property of her first husband
llm_translation: "Kenasah - behold she is like his wife in all matters. And only that her document should be written on the properties of her first husband."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי שְׁנָא רֵישָׁא דְּלָא פְּלִיגִי, וּמַאי שְׁנָא סֵיפָא דִּפְלִיגִי?
human_translation: What is different the first clause, that do not disagree and what is different the latter clause that disagree
llm_translation: Gemara: What is different about the beginning that they do not argue, and what is different about the end that they do argue?

hebrew_text: אָמַר עוּלָּא: רֵישָׁא דְּנָפְלָה כְּשֶׁהִיא אֲרוּסָה, וְסֵיפָא דְּנָפְלָה כְּשֶׁהִיא נְשׂוּאָה.
human_translation: Ulla said: The first clause where she happened when she was a betrothed woman And the latter clause where she happened when she was a married woman.
llm_translation: Ula said: The beginning when she falls while she is engaged, and the end when she falls while she is married.

hebrew_text: וְקָסָבַר עוּלָּא: זִיקַּת אֲרוּסָה עוֹשָׂה סְפֵק אֲרוּסָה,
human_translation: And Ulla holds bond with a betrothed woman affords a woman uncertainty betrothed,
llm_translation: And Ula wrote: The injury of an engaged woman creates a doubtful status of engagement.

hebrew_text: זִיקַּת נְשׂוּאָה עוֹשָׂה סְפֵק נְשׂוּאָה.
human_translation: bond with a married woman affords a woman uncertainty married,
llm_translation: The discharge of marriage makes a doubtful marriage.

hebrew_text: זִיקַּת אֲרוּסָה עוֹשָׂה סְפֵק אֲרוּסָה — דְּאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ וַדַּאי אֲרוּסָה, מוֹדִים בֵּית הִלֵּל שֶׁמּוֹכֶרֶת וְנוֹתֶנֶת וְקַיָּים?
human_translation: bond with a betrothed woman affords a woman uncertainty betrothed, because if it enters your mind a definitely betrothed woman, would Beit Hillel concede that she may sell or give and that is valid?
llm_translation: The injury of a betrothed woman creates a doubt of betrothal - for if your mind is in doubt whether she is betrothed or not, do the House of Hillel agree that she can sell and receive and be valid?

hebrew_text: וְהָתְנַן: נָפְלוּ לָהּ נְכָסִים מִשֶּׁנִּתְאָרְסָה, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: תִּמְכּוֹר, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: לֹא תִּמְכּוֹר. אֵלּוּ וְאֵלּוּ מוֹדִים שֶׁאִם מָכְרָה וְנָתְנָה — קַיָּים. אֶלָּא שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: זִיקַּת אֲרוּסָה עוֹשָׂה סְפֵק אֲרוּסָה.
human_translation: But didn’t we learn property was bequeathed to after she was betrothed, Beit Shammai say: She may sell and Beit Hillel say: She may not sell both agree that if she sold or gave away, is valid. Rather, conclude from here, bond with a betrothed woman affords a woman uncertainty betrothed.
llm_translation: And we learned in a Mishnah: If assets fell to her after she was betrothed, Beit Shammai say: she should sell them, and Beit Hillel say: she should not sell them. Both these and those agree that if she sold them and gave them, it is valid. But listen to her reasoning: the connection of betrothal creates a doubt of betrothal.

hebrew_text: זִיקַּת נְשׂוּאָה עוֹשָׂה סְפֵק נְשׂוּאָה. דְּאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ וַדַּאי נְשׂוּאָה, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים יַחְלוֹקוּ יוֹרְשֵׁי הַבַּעַל עִם יוֹרְשֵׁי הָאָב?
human_translation: bond with a married woman affords a woman uncertainty married, because if it enters your mind a definitely married woman, Beit Shammai say the husband’s heirs should divide up together with the father’s heirs?
llm_translation: The dispute of marriage makes a doubt of marriage. For if your mind is in doubt and certainly in marriage, Beit Shammai says: Shall the heirs of the husband divide with the heirs of the father?

hebrew_text: וְהָתְנַן: נָפְלוּ לָהּ נְכָסִים מִשֶּׁנִּישֵּׂאת, אֵלּוּ וָאֵלּוּ מוֹדִים שֶׁאִם מָכְרָה וְנָתְנָה — שֶׁהַבַּעַל מוֹצִיא מִיַּד הַלָּקוֹחוֹת. אֶלָּא שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: זִיקַּת נְשׂוּאָה עוֹשָׂה סְפֵק נְשׂוּאָה.
human_translation: But didn’t we learn property was bequeathed to after she was married, both agree that if she sold or gave away, the husband repossesses from the purchasers. Rather, conclude from here, bond with a married woman affords a woman uncertainty married.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And we learned in a Mishnah: If assets fell to her after she was married, both these and those agree that if she sold and gave, the husband takes from the hands of the buyers. Rather, learn from it: The connection of marriage creates a doubt in marriage. English translation: And it was taught in a Mishnah: If assets fell to her after she was married, both these and those agree that if she sold and gave, the husband takes from the hands of the buyers. Rather, learn from it: The connection of marriage creates a doubt in marriage.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבָּה: אַדְּמִפַּלְגִי בְּגוּפַהּ וּלְאַחַר מִיתָה, לִפַּלְגוּ בְּחַיֶּיהָ וּלְפֵירוֹת!
human_translation: Rabba said to him: instead of disagreeing itself, after death, let disagree with regard to when she is alive and to produce
llm_translation: Rabba said to him: If she miscarried in her body and then died, divide her in her lifetime and in her fruits!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַבָּה: אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי דְּנָפְלָה כְּשֶׁהִיא נְשׂוּאָה, וְזִיקַּת נְשׂוּאָה עוֹשָׂה סְפֵק נְשׂוּאָה. רֵישָׁא דְּאִיהִי קָיְימָא — הָוְיָא לַהּ אִיהִי וַדַּאי וְאִינְהוּ סָפֵק, וְאֵין סָפֵק מוֹצִיא מִידֵי וַדַּאי.
human_translation: Rather, Rabba said this and that which she happened once she was a married woman, and bond with a married woman affords a woman uncertainty married. first clause, where she is alive, she has a certain while they, an uncertain claim And an uncertain claim cannot extract from a definite
llm_translation: Rather, Rabah said: Both this and that, when it falls while it is being carried, and the damage of the one carrying it causes a doubt of the one being carried. The beginning, when it is standing — it is certain for it and certainly they are doubtful, and doubt does not remove from certainty.

hebrew_text: סֵיפָא דְּמֵתָה, הַלָּלוּ בָּאִין לִירַשׁ, וְהַלָּלוּ בָּאִין לִירַשׁ — וְיַחְלוֹקוּ.
human_translation: the latter clause, where she died, these come to inherit, and those come to inherit, and they should divide up
llm_translation: The latter case, if she dies, these come to inherit, and these come to inherit - and they shall divide.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: וּלְבֵית שַׁמַּאי אֵין סָפֵק מוֹצִיא מִידֵי וַדַּאי? וְהָתְנַן: נָפַל הַבַּיִת עָלָיו וְעַל אָבִיו, עָלָיו וְעַל מוֹרִישָׁיו, וְהָיוּ עָלָיו כְּתוּבַּת אִשָּׁה וּבַעַל חוֹב.
human_translation: Abaye raised an objection to But according to Beit Shammai, an uncertain claim cannot extract from a definite Didn’t we learn a house collapsed upon and upon his father, upon him and upon those whom he stood to inherit, and there were against wife’s marriage contract and a creditor,
llm_translation: He raised an objection to him, Abaye: And according to Beit Shammai, is there no doubt that one is liable for surety? But we learned: If a house fell upon him and his father, upon him and his heirs, and there were upon him a marriage contract and a creditor.

hebrew_text: יוֹרְשֵׁי הָאָב אוֹמְרִים: הַבֵּן מֵת רִאשׁוֹן, וְאַחַר כָּךְ מֵת הָאָב, וּבַעַל חוֹב אוֹמֵר: הָאָב מֵת רִאשׁוֹן, וְאַחַר כָּךְ מֵת הַבֵּן —
human_translation: The father’s heirs say: The son died first and afterward the father died. And the creditor says: The father died first and afterward the son died.
llm_translation: Heirs of the father say: the son died first, and afterwards the father died, and the creditor says: the father died first, and afterwards the son died —

hebrew_text: בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: יַחְלוֹקוּ, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: נְכָסִים בְּחֶזְקָתָן.
human_translation: Beit Shammai say: They should divide up And Beit Hillel say: property its status,
llm_translation: Beit Shammai say: they shall divide, and Beit Hillel say: assets remain in their possession.

hebrew_text: וְהָא הָכָא, יוֹרְשֵׁי הָאָב וַדַּאי, וּבַעַל חוֹב סָפֵק, וְקָאָתֵי סָפֵק וּמוֹצִיא מִידֵי וַדַּאי!
human_translation: Isn’t here the father’s heirs definite and the creditor an uncertain an uncertain claim can extract from a definite
llm_translation: And here, the case is as follows: the heirs of the father are definite, and the creditor is doubtful, and he collects from the doubtful and removes from the definite!

hebrew_text: קָסָבְרִי בֵּית שַׁמַּאי: שְׁטָר הָעוֹמֵד לִגְבּוֹת כְּגָבוּי דָּמֵי.
human_translation: Beit Shammai hold: a bill that is awaiting collection is as though it was already collected
llm_translation: The House of Shammai holds: A document that is standing to collect is like collecting actual money.

hebrew_text: וּמְנָא תֵּימְרָא, דִּתְנַן: מֵתוּ בַּעֲלֵיהֶן עַד שֶׁלֹּא שָׁתוּ — בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: נוֹטְלוֹת כְּתוּבָּתָן וְאֵינָן שׁוֹתוֹת. וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: אוֹ שׁוֹתוֹת אוֹ לֹא נוֹטְלוֹת כְּתוּבָּתָן.
human_translation: And from where do you say As we learned their husbands died before they drank Beit Shammai say: They collect their marriage contracts and do not drink And Beit Hillel say: Either they drink, or they cannot collect their marriage contracts,
llm_translation: And who will say? For it was taught: "If their husbands died before they drank" - Beit Shammai say: They take their ketubah and do not drink. And Beit Hillel say: Either they drink or they do not take their ketubah.

hebrew_text: אוֹ שׁוֹתוֹת?! ״וְהֵבִיא הָאִישׁ אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ״ אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא, וְלֵיכָּא! אֶלָּא: מִתּוֹךְ שֶׁלֹּא שׁוֹתוֹת לֹא נוֹטְלוֹת כְּתוּבָּתָן.
human_translation: Either they drink, the Merciful One state: “And the man shall bring his wife” and there is no Rather, since do not drink, they cannot collect their marriage contracts.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Or shototh?! 'And the man brought his wife,' the Merciful One said, but it is not so! Rather, because they did not drink, their script is not taken." English translation: "Or drinks?! 'And the man brought his wife,' the Merciful One said, but it is not so! Rather, because they did not drink, their script is not taken."

hebrew_text: וְהָא הָכָא, דְּסָפֵק הוּא: סָפֵק זַנַּאי סָפֵק לָא זַנַּאי, וְקָאָתֵי סָפֵק וּמוֹצִיא מִידֵי וַדַּאי! אֶלָּא שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: שְׁטָר הָעוֹמֵד לִגְבּוֹת כְּגָבוּי דָּמֵי.
human_translation: Isn’t here that is uncertain uncertainty whether she was unfaithful or whether she was not unfaithful, and an uncertain is coming and undermining definite Rather, conclude from a bill that is awaiting collection is as though it were already collected
llm_translation: Here is the English translation of the Talmudic text: "And here, where it is a doubt: a doubt if she is a prostitute or not a prostitute, and he comes and brings a doubt and definitely removes her from her status! Rather, learn from it: a document that stands to collect as if it were collecting money."

hebrew_text: וְאַבָּיֵי, לוֹתְבֵיהּ מֵהָא! דִּלְמָא כְּתוּבַּת אִשָּׁה שָׁאנֵי, מִשּׁוּם חִינָּא.
human_translation: And Abaye Let him object to based on this perhaps a woman’s marriage contract is different due to desirability
llm_translation: And Abbaye, let him write it from this one! Perhaps the writing of a woman is different, due to grace.

hebrew_text: וְלוֹתְבֵיהּ כְּתוּבָּה דְמַתְנִיתִין!
human_translation: Let him object to based on marriage contract in the mishna
llm_translation: And to him was written as it is taught!

hebrew_text: לָא פְּלִיגִי. וְלָא?! וְהָא קָתָנֵי: מֵתָה, מָה יַעֲשֶׂה בִּכְתוּבָּתָהּ וּבִנְכָסִים הַנִּכְנָסִים וְיוֹצְאִין עִמָּהּ — בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: יַחְלוֹקוּ יוֹרְשֵׁי הַבַּעַל עִם יוֹרְשֵׁי הָאָב, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: נְכָסִים בְּחֶזְקָתָן.
human_translation: do not disagree not But it is taught died, what should be done with her marriage contract, and with property that enters and leaves with her? Beit Shammai say: The husband’s heirs should divide up together with the father’s heirs. And Beit Hillel say: property its status.
llm_translation: They do not argue. And not?! And it teaches: "If she dies, what should be done with her marriage contract and with the properties that entered and left with her? Beit Shammai says: The heirs of the husband shall divide with the heirs of the father, and Beit Hillel says: The properties remain in their possession."

hebrew_text: הָכִי קָאָמַר: מֵתָה, מָה יַעֲשֶׂה בִּכְתוּבָּתָהּ, וְשַׁבְקַהּ. נְכָסִים הַנִּכְנָסִים וְהַיּוֹצְאִים עִמָּהּ — בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: יַחְלוֹקוּ יוֹרְשֵׁי הַבַּעַל עִם יוֹרְשֵׁי הָאָב, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: נְכָסִים בְּחֶזְקָתָן.
human_translation: This is what is saying: died, what should be done with her marriage contract? And left property that enters and leaves with her? Beit Shammai say: The husband’s heirs should divide up together with the father’s heirs. And Beit Hillel say: property its status.
llm_translation: Thus he said: If she dies, what should be done with her written document? It should be left. The assets that enter and leave with her— Beit Shammai says: The heirs of the husband should divide with the heirs of the father, and Beit Hillel says: The assets remain in their possession.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: מַתְנִיתִין נָמֵי דַּיְקָא — דְּקָתָנֵי: יַחְלוֹקוּ יוֹרְשֵׁי הַבַּעַל עִם יוֹרְשֵׁי הָאָב. וְלָא קָתָנֵי: יוֹרְשֵׁי הָאָב עִם יוֹרְשֵׁי הַבַּעַל. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: the mishna is also precise as it teaches: the husband’s heirs should divide up together with the father’s heirs, And does not teach the father’s heirs should divide up together with the husband’s heirs, Conclude from here
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said: The Mishnah also supports this, as it teaches: The heirs of the husband shall divide with the heirs of the father. And it does not teach: The heirs of the father with the heirs of the husband. Learn from it.

hebrew_text: אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: רֵישָׁא דְּנָפְלוּ לָהּ כְּשֶׁהִיא שׁוֹמֶרֶת יָבָם, סֵיפָא דְּנָפְלוּ לָהּ כְּשֶׁהִיא תַּחְתָּיו דְּבַעַל.
human_translation: Abaye said: The first clause which was bequeathed to her when she was a widow waiting for her yavam the latter clause which was bequeathed to her when she was under, her husband,
llm_translation: Abaye said: the beginning when they fell to her while she is observing yibum, the end when they fell to her while she is beneath him in marriage.

hebrew_text: וְקָסָבַר אַבָּיֵי יָדוֹ כְּיָדָהּ.
human_translation: And Abaye holds his hand is like her hand,
llm_translation: And Abaye holds: His hand is like her hand.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא: אִי דְּנָפְלִי לָהּ כְּשֶׁהִיא תַּחְתָּיו דְּבַעַל — דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דְּיָדוֹ עֲדִיפָא מִיָּדָהּ.
human_translation: Rava said to him: if was bequeathed to her when she was under the husband, everyone, agrees that his hand is stronger than her hand,
llm_translation: He said to him Rava: If she falls beneath him during intercourse - the whole world agrees that his hand is preferable to hers.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי דְּנָפְלוּ לָהּ כְּשֶׁהִיא שׁוֹמֶרֶת יָבָם. רֵישָׁא דְּלָא עֲבַד בַּהּ מַאֲמָר, סֵיפָא דַּעֲבַד בַּהּ מַאֲמָר.
human_translation: Rather, both this and that which was bequeathed to her when she was a widow waiting for her yavam . The first clause which had not performed a levirate betrothal with her, the latter clause which he had performed a levirate betrothal with her.
llm_translation: Rather, both of them fell to her when she is observing yibum. The beginning, where he did not perform chalitzah with her, the end, where he did perform chalitzah with her.

hebrew_text: וְקָסָבַר רָבָא מַאֲמָר לְבֵית שַׁמַּאי עוֹשֶׂה וַדַּאי אֲרוּסָה וּסְפֵק נְשׂוּאָה. וַדַּאי אֲרוּסָה — לִדְחוֹת בַּצָּרָה, וּסְפֵק נְשׂוּאָה — לַחְלוֹק בַּנְּכָסִים.
human_translation: And Rava holds according to Beit Shammai a levirate betrothal affords definitely betrothed and uncertainty married. definitely betrothed to nullifying her rival wife, And uncertainty married to divide up the property
llm_translation: And Rava holds: A saying to the House of Shammai, "Certainly betrothed and possibly married." "Certainly betrothed" - to push away in a time of distress, and "possibly married" - to divide the property.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרָבָא, וְאִיתְּמַר מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּאַבָּיֵי.
human_translation: was stated in the name of Rabbi Elazar in accordance with of Rava. And was stated in the name of Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina in accordance with of Abaye.
llm_translation: It was said in the name of Rabbi Elazar, the son of Rava, and it was said in the name of Rabbi Yosei, the son of Rabbi Chanina, the son of Abbaye.

hebrew_text: וּמִי אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר הָכִי? וְהָא אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: מַאֲמָר לְבֵית שַׁמַּאי אֵינוֹ קוֹנֶה אֶלָּא לִדְחוֹת בַּצָּרָה בִּלְבָד!
human_translation: And did Rabbi Elazar state this But didn’t Rabbi Elazar say: According to Beit Shammai a levirate betrothal acquires only to nullifying a rival wife
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And who said Rabbi Elazar the Kehati? But didn't Rabbi Elazar say: A statement to Beit Shammai does not acquire except to push away in distress alone!"

hebrew_text: אֵיפוֹךְ. וְאִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא: לְעוֹלָם לָא תֵּיפוֹךְ — אָמַר לָךְ רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: כִּי אֲמַרִי אֲנָא, דְּלָא סַגִּי לַהּ בְּגֵט אֶלָּא דְּבָעֵי נָמֵי חֲלִיצָה. לַחְלוֹק בַּנְּכָסִים דְּלָא קָנֵי — מִי אֲמַרִי?
human_translation: Reverse And if you wish, say Actually, do not reverse Rabbi Elazar said to you: When I said that a bill of divorce insufficient for her rather, she also needs ḥalitza . that he does not acquire to dividing up property did I say that?
llm_translation: Opposite. And if you wish, say: "Always do not opposite" - Rabbi Elazar said to you: For I say, that I did not suffice for her with a bill of divorce except that she requires halitzah. To divide the property that he did not acquire - who says?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: דִּיּוּקָא דְּמַתְנִיתִין כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּאַבָּיֵי, וְאַף עַל גַּב דְּקַשְׁיָא ״מֵתָה״.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: The precise formulation of the mishna is in accordance with Abaye, even though it is difficult she died.
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: In accordance with the opinion of Abaye, even though it is difficult, "she died."

hebrew_text: דְּקָתָנֵי: נְכָסִים הַנִּכְנָסִים וְיוֹצְאִים עִמָּהּ, מַאי ״נִכְנָסִין״ וּמַאי ״יוֹצְאִין״? לָאו ״נִכְנָסִין״ — לִרְשׁוּת הַבַּעַל, וְ״יוֹצְאִים״ — מֵרְשׁוּת הַבַּעַל לִרְשׁוּת הָאָב,
human_translation: as it teaches: property that enters and leaves with her. What That enters, and what That leaves? Is it not: That enters into the domain of the husband and leaves the domain of the husband into the domain of the father?
llm_translation: The text states: "Regarding assets that enter and exit with her, what is meant by 'entering' and what is meant by 'exiting'? 'Entering' - not to the husband's domain, and 'exiting' - from the husband's domain to the father's domain."

hebrew_text: וְאַף עַל גַּב דְּקַשְׁיָא ״מֵתָה״, אַדְּמִפַּלְגִי בְּגוּפַהּ וּלְאַחַר מִיתָה, לִפַּלְגוּ בְּחַיֶּיהָ וּלְפֵירוֹת.
human_translation: Even though it is difficult she died, Instead of disputing itself, after death, let dispute when she is alive and produce
llm_translation: And even though it is difficult "to die," she miscarries in her body and after death, they divide in her lifetime and in fruits.

hebrew_text: וְתוּ לָא מִידֵּי.
human_translation: And there is nothing more
llm_translation: And come not from his hand.

hebrew_text: כְּנָסָהּ הֲרֵי הִיא כּוּ׳. לְמַאי הִלְכְתָא? אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר חֲנִינָא: לוֹמַר שֶׁמְּגָרְשָׁה בְּגֵט וּמַחְזִירָהּ.
human_translation: consummated the levirate marriage with her, then With regard to what halakha Rabbi Yosei bar Ḥanina said: to say that he divorces her with a bill of divorce, and take her back
llm_translation: When she enters, she is like a wall. What is the halakha? Rabbi Yosei bar Hanina said: To say that he divorces her with a bill of divorce and takes her back.

hebrew_text: מְגָרְשָׁה בְּגֵט, פְּשִׁיטָא? סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא, הוֹאִיל וּכְתִיב: ״וּלְקָחָהּ לוֹ לְאִשָּׁה וְיִבְּמָהּ״ — אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא: וַעֲדַיִין יִבּוּמֵי הָרִאשׁוֹן עָלֶיהָ, בַּחֲלִיצָה — אִין, בְּגֵט — לָא, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: Isn’t obvious he divorces her with a bill of divorce? it could enter your mind to say since it is written: “And take her to him to be his wife and consummate the levirate marriage with her” the Merciful One is saying original levirate continues to be upon her, with ḥalitza , yes, with a bill of divorce, no, teaches us
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Megarshah begget, peshita? Sakla datach ameina, hoil uktiv: 'ulikachah lo le'ishah veyibemah' — amar rachamana: va'adayin yibumei harishon aleha, bachalitzah — ein, begget — la, ka mashma lan." Translation: "Her being designated with a get, is it obvious? Your mind should answer, since it is written: 'And he shall take her to himself for a wife, and perform the duty of a levirate marriage' — the Merciful One said: And yet the levirs of the first husband are upon her, in the case of halitzah — no, in the case of a get — yes, this is what is implied to us."

hebrew_text: מַחְזִירָהּ. פְּשִׁיטָא? סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא, מִצְוָה דְּרַמְיָא רַחֲמָנָא עֲלֵיהּ — עַבְדַּהּ, הַשְׁתָּא תֵּיקוּם עֲלֵיהּ בְּאִיסּוּר אֵשֶׁת אָח, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: Isn’t obvious take her back it could enter your mind to say mitzva that the Merciful One imposes upon him, he has performed, now she should be established to him by the prohibition brother’s wife. teaches us
llm_translation: Returning it. Obviously? Your mind has come to say, a commandment that the Merciful One has stated regarding it - she should return it, now it will be established upon her with the prohibition of a brother's wife, it is heard for us.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא הָכִי נָמֵי? אָמַר קְרָא: ״וּלְקָחָהּ לוֹ לְאִשָּׁה״, כֵּיוָן שֶׁלְּקָחָהּ — הֲרֵי הִיא כְּאִשְׁתּוֹ לְכׇל דָּבָר.
human_translation: But say is indeed so, The verse states: “And take her to him to be his wife” once he has taken her, that of his wife in every sense.
llm_translation: And why not say so? The verse says: "And he shall take her to himself as a wife," once he has taken her - she is like his wife in every respect.

hebrew_text: וּבִלְבַד שֶׁתְּהֵא כְּתוּבָּתָהּ כּוּ׳. מַאי טַעְמָא — אִשָּׁה הִקְנוּ לוֹ מִן הַשָּׁמַיִם.
human_translation: only that marriage contract will be What is the reason A wife was acquired to him by Heaven,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And only that its writing should be like this. What is the reason? — A woman acquired it from heaven. English translation:

hebrew_text: וְאִי לֵית לַהּ מִן הָרִאשׁוֹן — תַּקִּינוּ לַהּ מִשֵּׁנִי, כְּדֵי שֶׁלֹּא תְּהֵא קַלָּה בְּעֵינָיו לְהוֹצִיאָהּ.
human_translation: And if she has no from the first instituted an ordinance for her from second so that she will not be demeaned in his eyes such that divorce her,
llm_translation: And if she does not have a child from the first husband - they establish for her from the second, so that it should not be light in his eyes to divorce her.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מִצְוָה בְּגָדוֹל לְיַיבֵּם. לֹא רָצָה — מְהַלְּכִין עַל כׇּל הָאַחִין. לֹא רָצוּ — חוֹזְרִין אֵצֶל גָּדוֹל וְאוֹמְרִים לוֹ, עָלֶיךָ מִצְוָה: אוֹ חֲלוֹץ, אוֹ יַיבֵּם.
human_translation: mitzva is for the eldest to consummate the levirate marriage. does not want goes to each of the brothers If they do not want returns to eldest and says to him: mitzva is upon you; either perform ḥalitza or consummate the levirate marriage.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: It is a mitzvah for the adult brother to perform yibum. If he does not wish to, we proceed with halitzah with all the brothers. If they do not wish to, they return to the adult brother and say to him, "The obligation is upon you: either perform halitzah or do yibum."

hebrew_text: תָּלָה בְּקָטָן עַד שֶׁיַּגְדִּיל, אוֹ בַּגָּדוֹל עַד שֶׁיָּבֹא מִמְּדִינַת הַיָּם, אוֹ חֵרֵשׁ אוֹ שׁוֹטֶה — אֵין שׁוֹמְעִין לוֹ, אֶלָּא אוֹמְרִים לוֹ: עָלֶיךָ מִצְוָה, אוֹ חֲלוֹץ אוֹ יַיבֵּם.
human_translation: made dependent upon a minor, until he matures, or upon eldest brother, until he comes from overseas, or a deaf-mute or an imbecile, does not listen to him; rather, say to him: mitzva is upon you; either perform ḥalitza or consummate the levirate marriage.
llm_translation: Hung on a minor until he grows, or on an adult until he comes from the sea province, or a deaf-mute or a fool - we do not listen to him, but we say to him: "It is incumbent upon you a commandment, or release or levirate marriage."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אִיתְּמַר: בִּיאַת קָטָן, וַחֲלִיצַת גָּדוֹל — פְּלִיגִי בַּהּ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי, חַד אָמַר: בִּיאַת קָטָן עֲדִיפָא, וְחַד אָמַר: חֲלִיצַת גָּדוֹל עֲדִיפָא.
human_translation: was stated: Rabbi Yoḥanan and Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi disagree with regard to consummation of a younger [ katan ] or ḥalitza by eldest One said: consummation of a younger is preferable, and one said: Ḥalitza eldest is preferable.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara: Bi'at katan, vachalitzat gadol - peligi bah Rabbi Yochanan verabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, chad amar: Bi'at katan adifa, vechad amar: chalitzat gadol adifa. English translation: Gemara: Regarding the marriage of a minor and the levirate marriage of an adult - Rabbi Yochanan and Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi disagree about it, one said: The marriage of a minor is preferable, and one said: The levirate marriage of an adult is preferable.

hebrew_text: מַאן דְּאָמַר בִּיאַת קָטָן עֲדִיפָא — דְּהָא מִצְוָה בְּיִיבּוּם. וּמַאן דְּאָמַר חֲלִיצַת גָּדוֹל עֲדִיפָא: בִּמְקוֹם גָּדוֹל — בִּיאַת קָטָן לָאו כְּלוּם הִיא.
human_translation: the one who said consummation of a younger is preferable, that mitzva is through consummation of the levirate marriage, And the one who said ḥalitza by eldest is preferable, in the presence of eldest consummation of a younger is nothing.
llm_translation: The one who says that the coming of a minor is preferable - for there is a mitzvah of levirate marriage. And the one who says that the release of an adult is preferable: in a place of an adult - the coming of a minor is not at all.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: לֹא רָצָה — מַחְזִירִין עַל כׇּל הָאַחִין. מַאי לָאו: לֹא רָצָה לְיַיבֵּם אֶלָּא לַחְלוֹץ, וְקָתָנֵי: מְהַלְּכִין אֵצֶל הָאַחִין, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ בִּיאַת קָטָן עֲדִיפָא!
human_translation: We learned does not want goes to each of the brothers What, is it not he does not want to consummate the levirate marriage but to perform ḥalitza ? And teaches: goes to each of the brothers conclude from here consummation of a younger is preferable.
llm_translation: We learned: If he does not desire - they return to all the brothers. What is the reason? He does not desire for yibum, only for chalitzah. And it teaches: They walk with the brothers, perhaps the arrival of a minor is preferable!

hebrew_text: לָא, לֹא רָצָה לַחְלוֹץ וְלֹא לְיַיבֵּם, דִּכְווֹתַהּ גַּבֵּי הָאַחִין: לֹא רָצוּ לֹא לַחְלוֹץ וְלֹא לְיַיבֵּם. אַמַּאי חוֹזְרִים אֵצֶל הַגָּדוֹל? לְמִיכְפְּיֵיהּ (לִכְפְּיֵיהּ) [לִיכְפִּינְהוּ] לְדִידְהוּ! כֵּיוָן דְּמִצְוָה עֲלֵיהּ דִּידֵיהּ רַמְיָא — לְדִידֵיהּ כָּיְיפִינַן.
human_translation: No, does not want to perform ḥalitza or to consummate the levirate marriage, in the corresponding situation the brothers do not want to perform ḥalitza or to consummate the levirate marriage. why should return to the eldest to force him Let force Since mitzva is incumbent upon it is he who is forced.
llm_translation: Not, did not want to release and not to perform levirate marriage, for they were sisters-in-law: they did not want neither to release nor to perform levirate marriage. Why do they go back to the elder? To fulfill his desire! Since it is a commandment upon him, we fulfill his desire.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: תָּלָה בְּקָטָן עַד שֶׁיַּגְדִּיל אֵין שׁוֹמְעִין לוֹ. וְאִי בִּיאַת קָטָן עֲדִיפָא, אַמַּאי אֵין שׁוֹמְעִין לוֹ? נִינְטַר דִּלְמָא גָּדֵיל וּמְיַיבֵּם!
human_translation: We learned dependent upon a minor, does not listen to him. And if consummation of a minor is preferable, why shouldn’t listen to him? Let wait, perhaps he will mature and consummate the levirate marriage.
llm_translation: We learned: One may hang a small vessel until it grows larger, but one does not listen to him. And if bringing a vessel is preferable, why do they not listen to him? It is lest perhaps it grows larger and he brings it!

hebrew_text: וְלִיטַעְמָיךְ, וּבְגָדוֹל עַד שֶׁיָּבֹא מִמְּדִינַת הַיָּם אֵין שׁוֹמְעִין לוֹ, אַמַּאי? נִינְטַר דִּלְמָא אָתֵי וְחָלֵיץ? אֶלָּא כֹּל שַׁהוֹיֵי מִצְוָה לָא מְשַׁהֵינַן.
human_translation: But according to your reasoning until the eldest brother comes from overseas? They do not listen to him; why shouldn’t Let wait, perhaps he will come and perform ḥalitza . Rather, we do not delay the performance of any mitzva;
llm_translation: And to Litaimakh, and in a large vessel until he comes from the land of the sea, they do not listen to him. Why? Perhaps he will come and withdraw? Rather, anything that is a mitzvah, we do not delay.

hebrew_text: אִית דְּאָמְרִי: בְּבִיאָה, כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דְּבִיאַת קָטָן עֲדִיפָא. כִּי פְּלִיגִי בַּחֲלִיצַת קָטָן.
human_translation: There are who say When consummating everyone agrees that consummation of a younger is preferable When they disagree with regard to the ḥalitza of a younger
llm_translation: There are those who say: In the case of intercourse, everyone agrees that the intercourse of a minor is preferable. They disagree in the case of the redemption of a minor.

hebrew_text: וְהָכִי אִיתְּמַר: חֲלִיצַת קָטָן וַחֲלִיצַת גָּדוֹל, פְּלִיגִי בַּהּ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי. חַד אָמַר: חֲלִיצַת גָּדוֹל עֲדִיפָא, וְחַד אָמַר: כִּי הֲדָדֵי נִינְהוּ.
human_translation: And this was stated: Rabbi Yoḥanan and Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi disagree with regard to ḥalitza of a younger or ḥalitza of eldest One said: ḥalitza of eldest is preferable. And one said: are equivalent.
llm_translation: And thus it was stated: The redemption of a minor and the redemption of an adult, Rabbi Yochanan and Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi disagree about it. One said: The redemption of an adult is preferable, and one said: They are both equal.

hebrew_text: מַאן דְּאָמַר חֲלִיצַת גָּדוֹל עֲדִיפָא — דְּהָא מִצְוָה בַּגָּדוֹל. וְאִידַּךְ — כִּי אָמְרִינַן מִצְוָה בַּגָּדוֹל לְעִנְיַן יִבּוּם, אֲבָל לְעִנְיַן חֲלִיצָה — כַּהֲדָדֵי נִינְהוּ.
human_translation: the one who said ḥalitza of eldest is preferable, that mitzva is upon eldest And the other when we say mitzva is upon eldest with regard to levirate marriage; however, with regard to ḥalitza , are equivalent.
llm_translation: The one who says redemption of the firstborn is preferable - because it is a mitzvah for the firstborn. And the other opinion - for we say it is a mitzvah for the firstborn regarding levirate marriage, but for redemption - they are equal.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: לֹא רָצוּ — חוֹזְרִין אֵצֶל גָּדוֹל. מַאי לָאו: לֹא רָצוּ לְיַיבֵּם, אֶלָּא לַחְלוֹץ. וְקָתָנֵי: חוֹזְרִין אֵצֶל גָּדוֹל, וּשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ חֲלִיצַת גָּדוֹל עֲדִיפָא!
human_translation: We learned do not want returns to eldest What, is it not did not want to consummate the levirate marriage but to perform ḥalitza ? And teaches: returns to eldest conclude from here ḥalitza of eldest is preferable.
llm_translation: We learned in the Mishnah: "They did not desire" - they return to the elder. What is the reason? They did not desire for yibum, but for chalitzah. And it teaches: they return to the elder, and we hear from it that the chalitzah of the elder is preferable!

hebrew_text: לָא, לֹא רָצוּ לֹא לַחְלוֹץ וְלָא לְיַיבֵּם, דִּכְווֹתֵיהּ גַּבֵּי גָּדוֹל: לֹא רָצָה לֹא לַחְלוֹץ וְלֹא לְיַיבֵּם. אֶלָּא אַמַּאי חוֹזְרִין אֵצֶל גָּדוֹל? לְמִכְפְּיֵיהּ (לִכְפְּיֻיהוּ) [נִכְפִּינְהוּ] לְדִידְהוּ! כֵּיוָן דְּמִצְוָה עֲלֵיהּ דִּידֵיהּ רַמְיָא — לְדִידֵיהּ כָּיְיפִינַן.
human_translation: No, did not want to perform ḥalitza or to consummate the levirate marriage, in the corresponding eldest does not want to perform ḥalitza or to consummate the levirate marriage. But why should return to eldest to force him Let force them, Since the mitzva is incumbent upon it is he who is forced.
llm_translation: Not, not wanted not to divorce and not to perform levirate marriage, for they hit him in the presence of a prominent person: he did not want neither to divorce nor to perform levirate marriage. Rather, why do they return to the prominent person? To appease him for their own sake! Since a commandment is upon him, we appease him for his own sake.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: תָּלָה בַּגָּדוֹל עַד שֶׁיָּבֹא מִמְּדִינַת הַיָּם — אֵין שׁוֹמְעִין לוֹ. וְאִי סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ חֲלִיצַת גָּדוֹל עֲדִיפָא, אַמַּאי אֵין שׁוֹמְעִין לוֹ? נִינְטַר דִּלְמָא אָתֵי וְחָלֵיץ!
human_translation: Come hear dependent upon eldest brother, until he comes from overseas, does not listen to him. And if it enters your mind ḥalitza of eldest is preferable, why doesn’t listen to him? Let wait, perhaps he will come and perform ḥalitza .
llm_translation: "Come and hear: One may delay the recitation of the Shema until the great sages arrive from the overseas province — they do not heed him. And if it enters your mind that the redemption of the great sages is preferable, why do they not heed him? Perhaps he will come and redeem!"

hebrew_text: וּלְטַעְמָיךְ, בְּקָטָן עַד שֶׁיַּגְדִּיל, אֵין שׁוֹמְעִין לוֹ — אַמַּאי? נִינְטַר דִּלְמָא גָּדֵיל וּמְיַיבֵּם. (אִי נָמֵי אָתֵי אִיהוּ וּמְיַיבְּמַהּ.) אֶלָּא: כֹּל שַׁהוֹיֵי מִצְוָה לָא מְשַׁהֵינַן.
human_translation: But according to your reasoning, until a minor will mature? does not listen to him; why shouldn’t listen to him? Let wait, perhaps he will come and consummate the levirate marriage. Alternatively, he will come and consummate the levirate marriage with her. Rather, we do not delay the performance of a mitzva.
llm_translation: And according to your reasoning, with a minor until he grows up, we do not listen to him — why? Perhaps he will grow up and perform levirate marriage. (Or perhaps he will come and perform levirate marriage with her.) Rather, any case where there is a mitzvah, we do not delay.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן הָתָם: מִצְוַת יִבּוּם קוֹדֶמֶת לְמִצְוַת חֲלִיצָה. בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה, שֶׁהָיוּ מִתְכַּוְּונִין לְשֵׁם מִצְוָה. עַכְשָׁו שֶׁאֵין מִתְכַּוְּונִין לְשֵׁם מִצְוָה, אָמְרוּ: מִצְוַת חֲלִיצָה קוֹדֶמֶת לְמִצְוַת יִבּוּם.
human_translation: We learned there mitzva of levirate marriage takes precedence over mitzva of ḥalitza ; initially, when would have intent for the sake of the mitzva. Now, that they do not have intent for the sake of the mitzva, say: mitzva of ḥalitza takes precedence over mitzva of levirate marriage.
llm_translation: We learned there: the mitzvah of yibum takes precedence over the mitzvah of chalitzah. Initially, when they were intending for the sake of the mitzvah. Now that they are not intending for the sake of the mitzvah, they said: the mitzvah of chalitzah takes precedence over the mitzvah of yibum.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב: אֵין כּוֹפִין. כִּי אֲתוֹ לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב, אֲמַר לְהוּ: אִי בָּעֵית — חֲלוֹץ, אִי בָּעֵית — יַיבֵּם. בְּדִידָךְ תְּלָא רַחֲמָנָא: ״וְאִם לֹא יַחְפּוֹץ הָאִישׁ״, הָא אִם חָפֵץ, אִי בָּעֵי — חָלֵיץ, אִי בָּעֵי — יְיַבֵּם.
human_translation: Rav said: does not force When would come before Rav, he would say to them: If you want, perform ḥalitza , if you want, consummate the levirate marriage, as the Merciful One makes dependent upon your “And if the man does not wish but if he wishes if he wants, he performs ḥalitza , if he wants, he consummates the levirate marriage.
llm_translation: Rav said: One does not compel. When they came before Rav, he said to them: If you desire - perform chalitzah, if you desire - perform yibum. The Merciful One is dependent on you: "And if the man does not wish," so if he wishes, if he desires - he performs chalitzah, if he desires - he performs yibum.

hebrew_text: וְאַף רַב יְהוּדָה סָבַר אֵין כּוֹפִין. מִדְּאַתְקֵין רַב יְהוּדָה בְּגִיטָּא דַחֲלִיצָה: אֵיךְ פְּלוֹנִית בַּת פְּלוֹנִי אַקְרִבַת יָת פְּלוֹנִי יְבָמַהּ קֳדָמַנָא לְבֵי דִינָא, וְאִשְׁתְּמוֹדְעִינְהוּ דַּאֲחוּהּ דְמִיתָנָא מֵאַבָּא נִיהוּ, וְאָמְרִי לֵיהּ: אִי צָבֵית לְיַבֵּם — יַבֵּם, וְאִי לָא — אַיטְלַע לַהּ רִגְלָיךְ דְּיַמִּינָא.
human_translation: And even Rav Yehuda holds does not force from that Rav Yehuda enacted in the bill of ḥalitza : That so-and-so, daughter of so-and-so, brought so-and-so, her yavam , before the court; and we identified him, that he was the paternal brother of the deceased, and we said to him: If you desire to consummate the levirate marriage, consummate the levirate marriage, and if not, extend your right foot toward
llm_translation: And even Rav Yehudah holds that we do not force a woman to undergo halitzah. Since Rav Yehudah is stringent in the matter of a get of halitzah: How does one perform halitzah? Ploni's daughter, Ploni, should approach Ploni's yavam first to the court, and they should make known that she is the sister of the one who was taught from her father, and they say to him: If you desire to perform yibum - perform yibum, and if not - remove your right shoe.

hebrew_text: וְאַיטְלַע לַהּ רִגְלָא דְיַמִּינָא, וּשְׁרָת סֵינֵיהּ מַעַל רַגְלוֹהִי, וִירַקַת בְּאַנְפּוֹהִי רוּקָּא דְּמִתְחַזְיָא לְבֵי דִינָא עַל אַרְעָא.
human_translation: And he extended [ itla ] his right foot toward her and she removed his shoe from upon his foot and she spat toward his face spittle, which was visible to the court, upon the ground.
llm_translation: And he threw her the foot of his right, and his teeth served her above his feet, and the spittle in his mustache dripped onto the ground in front of the court.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַוְיָא מְסַיֵּים בַּהּ מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוּדָה: וְאַקְרִינְהוּ מָה דִּכְתִיב בִּסְפַר אוֹרָיְיתָא דְמֹשֶׁה.
human_translation: And Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Avya in the name of Rav Yehuda would conclude And we dictated to that which is written in the book of the Torah of Moses,
llm_translation: Rabbi Chiya bar Avya concludes in it in the name of Rav Yehuda: And I will read what is written in the Book of the Torah of Moses.

hebrew_text: אִשְׁתְּמוֹדְעִינְהוּ, פְּלִיגִי בַּהּ רַב אַחָא וְרָבִינָא, חַד אָמַר: בְּעֵדִים, וְחַד אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ קָרוֹב, אֲפִילּוּ אִשָּׁה. וְהִלְכְתָא: גַּלּוֹיֵי מִילְּתָא בְעָלְמָא הוּא, וַאֲפִילּוּ קָרוֹב וַאֲפִילּוּ אִשָּׁה.
human_translation: And we identified him Rav Aḥa and Ravina disagree concerning One said through witnesses, and one said even a relative even a woman And the halakha is merely revealing the matter, even a relative and even a woman
llm_translation: They were familiar with him, Rav Acha and Ravina disputed it: one said: with witnesses, and one said: even with a relative, even with a woman. And the law is: the matter is revealed in general, even with a relative, even with a woman.

hebrew_text: בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה, שֶׁהָיוּ מִתְכַּוְּונִין לְשֵׁם מִצְוָה — מִצְוַת יִבּוּם קוֹדֶמֶת לְמִצְוַת חֲלִיצָה. וְעַכְשָׁיו שֶׁאֵין מִתְכַּוְּונִין לְשֵׁם מִצְוָה, אָמְרוּ: מִצְוַת חֲלִיצָה קוֹדֶמֶת לְמִצְוַת יִבּוּם.
human_translation: Initially, when would have intent for the sake of the mitzva the mitzva of levirate marriage took precedence over the mitzva of ḥalitza . And now that they do not have intent for the sake of the mitzva, say: The mitzva of ḥalitza takes precedence over the mitzva of levirate marriage.
llm_translation: In the first instance, when they intended for the sake of the mitzvah - the mitzvah of yibum takes precedence over the mitzvah of chalitzah. But now that they do not intend for the sake of the mitzvah, they said: the mitzvah of chalitzah takes precedence over the mitzvah of yibum.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָמֵי בַּר חָמָא אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: חָזְרוּ לוֹמַר מִצְוַת יִבּוּם קוֹדֶמֶת לְמִצְוַת חֲלִיצָה. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: אִכַּשּׁוּר דָּרֵי?
human_translation: Rami bar Ḥama said Rabbi Yitzḥak said: they went back to saying the mitzva of levirate marriage takes precedence over the mitzva of ḥalitza . Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said to him the generations improved
llm_translation: Ramei son of Hama said Rabbi Yitzchak said: They returned to say the mitzvah of yibum precedes the mitzvah of chalitzah. Rav Nachman son of Yitzchak said to him: Is this a proper logical deduction?

hebrew_text: מֵעִיקָּרָא סָבְרִי לַהּ כְּאַבָּא שָׁאוּל, וּלְבַסּוֹף סָבְרִי לַהּ כְּרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: initially they held in accordance with Abba Shaul, and in the end they held in accordance with the Rabbis,
llm_translation: From the beginning, they thought like Abba Saul, but in the end, they thought like the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא, אַבָּא שָׁאוּל אוֹמֵר: הַכּוֹנֵס אֶת יְבִמְתּוֹ לְשֵׁם נוֹי, וּלְשׁוּם אִישׁוּת, וּלְשׁוּם דָּבָר אַחֵר — כְּאִילּוּ פּוֹגֵעַ בְּעֶרְוָה. וְקָרוֹב אֲנִי בְּעֵינַי לִהְיוֹת הַוָּלָד מַמְזֵר. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: ״יְבָמָהּ יָבֹא עָלֶיהָ״, מִכׇּל מָקוֹם.
human_translation: As it is taught Abba Shaul says one who consummates with his yevama for the sake of beauty, or for the sake of marital relations, or for the sake of another matter, it is as though he encountered a forbidden relation, and I am inclined to view the offspring as a mamzer . The Rabbis say: “Her brother-in-law will have intercourse with her” in any case,
llm_translation: It was taught: Abba Shaul says: One who gathers his yevamah for the sake of beauty, or for the sake of marriage, or for any other reason — it is as if he has engaged in forbidden relations. And I am inclined to think that the offspring is a mamzer. But the Sages say: "Her yavam shall perform chalitzah with her," in any case.

hebrew_text: מַאן תְּנָא לְהָא דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״יְבָמָהּ יָבֹא עָלֶיהָ״ — מִצְוָה! שֶׁבַּתְּחִלָּה הָיְתָה עָלָיו בִּכְלַל הֶיתֵּר. נֶאֶסְרָה, וְחָזְרָה וְהוּתְּרָה, יָכוֹל תַּחְזוֹר לְהֶתֵּירָהּ הָרִאשׁוֹן — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״יְבָמָהּ יָבֹא עָלֶיהָ״, מִצְוָה.
human_translation: Who taught that the Sages taught: “Her brother-in-law will have intercourse with her” a mitzva, as initially, she was among permitted to him, she became forbidden and she reverted and became permitted to him. might she would revert to her original permitted status; the verse states: “Her brother-in-law will have intercourse with her” a mitzva
llm_translation: Who is the Tanna that taught this that the Rabbis taught: "Her yavam shall perform chalitzah upon her" - it is a mitzvah! Initially, she was included in the prohibition. If she became forbidden, then permitted, one might think that the original permission can be reinstated - the Torah teaches: "Her yavam shall perform chalitzah upon her," it is a mitzvah.

hebrew_text: מַאן תַּנָּא? אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק בַּר אַבְדִּימִי: אַבָּא שָׁאוּל הִיא. וְהָכִי קָאָמַר: ״יְבָמָהּ יָבֹא עָלֶיהָ״, מִצְוָה. שֶׁבַּתְּחִלָּה הָיְתָה עָלָיו בִּכְלַל הֶיתֵּר. רָצָה לְשֵׁם נוֹי — כּוֹנְסָהּ, רָצָה לְשׁוּם אִישׁוּת — כּוֹנְסָהּ.
human_translation: Who who taught Rav Yitzḥak bar Avdimi said: It is Abba Shaul, and this is what is saying: “Her brother-in-law will have intercourse with her” a mitzva, as initially, she among permitted to him, he wished, for the sake of beauty he marry her, or he wished, for the sake of marital relations he marry her.
llm_translation: Who taught it? Rabbi Yitzchak bar Avdimi said: It is Abba Shaul. And thus he said: "Her yavam shall come upon her," a commandment. Initially, she was included in the prohibition. If he wanted for the sake of beauty - he should gather her, if he wanted for the sake of marriage - he should gather her.

hebrew_text: נֶאֶסְרָה, חָזְרָה וְהוּתְּרָה. יָכוֹל תַּחְזוֹר לְהֶתֵּירָהּ הָרִאשׁוֹן — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״יְבָמָהּ יָבֹא עָלֶיהָ״, לְמִצְוָה.
human_translation: she became forbidden she reverted and became permitted to him. might she would revert to her original permitted status; the verse states: “Her brother-in-law will have intercourse with her” for the mitzva.
llm_translation: The text reads: "If she became forbidden, then permitted, she may return and become forbidden again. One might think she can return to her initial state of permissibility - the Talmud teaches: 'Her yavam shall perform the duty of levirate marriage with her,' as a commandment."

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבָּנַן, וְהָכִי קָאָמַר: ״יְבָמָהּ יָבֹא עָלֶיהָ״, מִצְוָה. שֶׁבַּתְּחִלָּה הָיְתָה בִּכְלַל הֶיתֵּר. רָצָה כּוֹנְסָהּ, רָצָה אֵינוֹ כּוֹנְסָהּ.
human_translation: Rava said: You even say the Rabbis, and this is what is saying: “Her brother-in-law will have intercourse with her” a mitzva as initially, she was among permitted to him, he wished, he marry her, or he wished, he not to marry her.
llm_translation: Rava said: Even if you say it is the opinion of the Rabbis, and thus he said: "Her yavam shall perform yibum with her," it is a commandment. Initially, she was included in the general permission. If he wants, he may gather her; if he does not want, he may not gather her.

hebrew_text: נֶאֶסְרָה, חָזְרָה וְהוּתְּרָה. יָכוֹל תַּחְזוֹר לְהֶתֵּירָהּ הָרִאשׁוֹן, רָצָה — כּוֹנְסָהּ, רָצָה — אֵינוֹ כּוֹנְסָהּ. רָצָה אֵינוֹ כּוֹנְסָהּ?
human_translation: she became forbidden she reverted and became permitted to him. might she would revert to her original permitted status, he wishes, he may marry her, or he wishes, he may not to marry her.
llm_translation: She became forbidden, she returned, and she became permitted. Can she return to her original permission? If he desires - he may gather her, if he desires - he may not gather her. If he desires, may he not gather her?

hebrew_text: הָא אֲגִידָה בֵּיהּ, בִּכְדִי תִּיפּוֹק? אֶלָּא אֵימָא: רָצָה — כּוֹנְסָהּ, רָצָה — חוֹלֵץ לָהּ, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״יְבָמָהּ יָבֹא עָלֶיהָ״, מִצְוָה.
human_translation: Isn’t she bound to him she will be released without anything? Rather, say: he wishes, he may marry her, or he wishes he performs ḥalitza with her. the verse states: “Her brother-in-law will have intercourse with her,” a mitzva
llm_translation: Here is the English translation of the Talmudic text: "Here, should I tell you, in order to resolve it? Rather say: If he desires - he may gather her, if he desires - he may release her, as the Talmud says: 'Her yavam shall perform the duty of a husband's brother to her,' it is a commandment."

hebrew_text: אֵימָא רֵישָׁא: ״מַצּוֹת תֵּאָכֵל בְּמָקוֹם קָדוֹשׁ״ — מִצְוָה.
human_translation: Say the first clause “It shall be eaten unleavened in a sacred place” a mitzva,
llm_translation: The beginning: "Matzot shall be eaten in a holy place" - a commandment.

hebrew_text: שֶׁבַּתְּחִלָּה הָיְתָה עָלָיו בִּכְלַל הֶיתֵּר. נֶאֶסְרָה, וְחָזְרָה וְהוּתְּרָה, יָכוֹל תַּחְזוֹר לְהֶיתֵּירָהּ הָרִאשׁוֹן — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״מַצּוֹת תֵּאָכֵל בְּמָקוֹם קָדוֹשׁ״ — מִצְוָה.
human_translation: as initially, it was among permitted to him, it became forbidden and it reverted and became permitted to him. might it would revert to its original permitted status; the verse states: “It shall be eaten unleavened in a sacred place” a mitzva
llm_translation: At the outset, it was included in the general permission. If it became prohibited, then reverted and was permitted again, one may return to its original permission. The Talmud teaches: "You shall eat unleavened bread in a holy place" - a commandment.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרָבָא דְּאָמַר הָא מַנִּי רַבָּנַן הִיא — הָכָא, הָכִי קָאָמַר: ״מַצּוֹת תֵּאָכֵל בְּמָקוֹם קָדוֹשׁ״ — מִצְוָה. שֶׁבַּתְּחִלָּה הָיְתָה עָלָיו בִּכְלַל הֶיתֵּר, רָצָה — אוֹכְלָהּ, רָצָה — אֵינוֹ אוֹכְלָהּ (נֶאֶסְרָה, חָזְרָה וְהוּתְּרָה, יָכוֹל תַּחְזוֹר לְהֶיתֵּירָהּ הָרִאשׁוֹן), רָצָה — אוֹכְלָהּ, רָצָה — אֵינוֹ אוֹכְלָהּ.
human_translation: Granted, according to Rava, who said: whose is this It is the Rabbis; here, this is what is saying: “It shall be eaten unleavened in a sacred place” a mitzva As, initially, it was among permitted to him: he wishes, he may eat it, and if he wishes, he may not eat it. it became forbidden and it reverted and became permitted to him. might it would revert to its original permitted status, he wishes, he may eat it, and he wishes, he may not eat it.
llm_translation: In truth, according to Rava who said, "This is the opinion of the sages," here, this is what he means: "Matzot shall be eaten in a holy place" - it is a commandment. Initially, it was included in the permission, if one wants - he may eat it, if one wants - he may not eat it (if it became prohibited, then permitted again, one can return to the initial permission), if one wants - he may eat it, if one wants - he may not eat it.

hebrew_text: רָצָה אֵינוֹ אוֹכְלָהּ?! וְהָכְתִיב: ״וְאָכְלוּ אֹתָם אֲשֶׁר כֻּפַּר בָּהֶם״, מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהַכֹּהֲנִים אוֹכְלִים וּבְעָלִים מִתְכַּפְּרִין!
human_translation: he wishes, he may not eat it? But isn’t it written: “And they shall eat those things through which atonement is attained” teaches that the priests eat and the owners attain atonement?
llm_translation: He wants, does not eat it?! And it is written: "And they shall eat those things wherewith atonement was made for them," teaching that the priests eat and the owners are atoned for!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: רָצָה — הוּא אוֹכְלָהּ, רָצָה — כֹּהֵן אַחֵר אוֹכְלָהּ, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״מַצּוֹת תֵּאָכֵל בְּמָקוֹם קָדוֹשׁ״ — מִצְוָה.
human_translation: Rather, he wishes, he may eat it, and if he wishes, another priest may eat it; the verse states: “It shall be eaten unleavened in a sacred place” a mitzva
llm_translation: Rather: he wants — he may eat it, he wants — another priest may eat it, Scripture teaches: "Matzot shall be eaten in a holy place" — it is a commandment.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְרַב יִצְחָק בַּר אַבְדִּימִי, דְּאָמַר אַבָּא שָׁאוּל הִיא, הָכָא מַאי תְּרֵי גַוְונֵי אִיכָּא?
human_translation: However, according to Rav Yitzḥak bar Avdimi, who said is Abba Shaul here, what two manners are there
llm_translation: To Rabbi Yitzchak bar Avdimi, for Abba said: it is Shaul's. Here, what are the two types that exist?

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא: רָצָה — לְתֵאָבוֹן אוֹכְלָהּ, רָצָה — אֲכִילָה גַּסָּה אוֹכְלָהּ, אֲכִילָה גַּסָּה מִי שְׁמָהּ אֲכִילָה? וְהָאָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: הָאוֹכֵל אֲכִילָה גַּסָּה בְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים פָּטוּר מִ״לֹּא תְעֻנֶּה״!
human_translation: And if you would say he wishes he may eat it with an appetite, and if he wishes he may eat it excessive eating, excessive eating have the status of eating? Didn’t Reish Lakish say: One who eats excessive eating on Yom Kippur is exempt from shall not be afflicted
llm_translation: And if you say: "He desired" - for appetite she ate, "He desired" - eating greedily she ate, eating greedily, who is called eating? And Reish Lakish said: One who eats greedily on Yom Kippur is exempt from "You shall afflict yourselves"!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: רָצָה — מַצָּה אוֹכְלָהּ, רָצָה — חָמֵץ אוֹכְלָהּ.
human_translation: Rather, he wishes he may eat it unleavened, he wishes he may eat it leavened.
llm_translation: Rather: wants — matzah eats, wants — chametz eats.

hebrew_text: וְהָכְתִיב: ״לֹא תֵאָפֶה חָמֵץ חֶלְקָם״, וְאָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: וַאֲפִילּוּ חֶלְקָם לֹא תֵאָפֶה חָמֵץ! אֶלָּא: רָצָה — מַצָּה אוֹכְלָהּ, רָצָה — חָלוּט אוֹכְלָהּ.
human_translation: But isn’t it written: “Their portion shall not be baked leavened” and Reish Lakish said and even the portion shall not be baked leavened? Rather, he wishes he may eat it unleavened, he wishes he may eat it boiled.
llm_translation: The text states: "And it is written: 'Do not bake leavened bread as their portion,' and Reish Lakish said: Even their portion, do not bake leavened bread! Rather, if one wishes - they may eat matzah, if one wishes - they may eat unleavened bread."

hebrew_text: הַאי חָלוּט הֵיכִי דָּמֵי? אִי מַצָּה הִיא — הָא מַצָּה הִיא, וְאִי לָא מַצָּה הִיא — ״מַצּוֹת״ אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא!
human_translation: this boiled, what are the circumstances, If it is unleavened then it is unleavened and if it is not unleavened the Merciful One states “unleavened”
llm_translation: This roasted grain, how is it considered? If it is matzah - this is matzah, and if it is not matzah - "matzot," said the Merciful One!

hebrew_text: לָא, לְעוֹלָם אֵימָא לָךְ מַצָּה הִיא, וּלְהָכִי תְּנָא בֵּיהּ קְרָא — לְעַכֵּב.
human_translation: No; actually, I say to you is unleavened, and for this the verse repeated to invalidate
llm_translation: No, indeed I will say to you: it is unleavened bread, and therefore the verse states regarding it: to delay.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא חָלוּט מַצָּה הִיא דְּקָאָמְרִינַן, לְמַאי הִלְכְתָא? לוֹמַר שֶׁאָדָם יוֹצֵא בָּהּ יְדֵי חוֹבָתוֹ בְּפֶסַח, אַף עַל פִּי דְּחַלְטֵיהּ מֵעִיקָּרָא, כֵּיוָן דַּהֲדַר אַפְיֵיהּ בְּתַנּוּר — ״לֶחֶם עוֹנִי״ קָרֵינָא בֵּיהּ, וְאָדָם יוֹצֵא בָּהּ יְדֵי חוֹבָתוֹ בַּפֶּסַח.
human_translation: But that we said boiled is unleavened, for what halakha to say that a person fulfills his obligation with it on Passover. even though he initially boiled it, since he subsequently baked it in an oven, it is called “bread of affliction” and a person fulfills his obligation with it on Passover.
llm_translation: Rather, it is a baked matzah that we are saying, for what halakha? To say that a person fulfills his obligation with it on Passover, even though it was initially kneaded, since he subsequently baked it in an oven — we call it "bread of affliction," and a person fulfills his obligation with it on Passover.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַחוֹלֵץ לִיבִמְתּוֹ — הֲרֵי הוּא כְּאֶחָד מִן הָאַחִין לַנַּחֲלָה. וְאִם יֵשׁ שָׁם אָב — נְכָסִים שֶׁל אָב. הַכּוֹנֵס אֶת יְבִמְתּוֹ — זָכָה בִּנְכָסִים שֶׁל אָחִיו. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: בֵּין כָּךְ וּבֵין כָּךְ, אִם יֵשׁ שָׁם אָב — נְכָסִים שֶׁל אָב.
human_translation: One who performs ḥalitza with his yevama is like one of the brothers with respect to inheritance And if there is a father the property belongs to the father. One who consummates his yevama acquires his brother’s property Rabbi Yehuda says: In either if there is a father the property belongs to the father.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "One who performs chalitzah with his yevamah - he is like one of the brothers in regard to inheritance. And if there is a father there - it is the father's property. One who marries his yevamah - he acquires his brother's property." Rabbi Yehuda says: "In either case, if there is a father there - it is the father's property."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ פְּשִׁיטָא! סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא חֲלִיצָה בִּמְקוֹם יִבּוּם קָיְימָא, וְנִשְׁקוֹל כּוּלְּהוּ נִכְסֵי, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: is obvious; It could enter your mind to say ḥalitza takes the place of the levirate marriage and should take all the property teaches us
llm_translation: Theft! The mind's conclusion: I say, halitzah in place of yibum is established, and all the estates are taken, it is heard for us.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, הֲרֵי הוּא כְּאֶחָד מִן הָאַחִים — אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא כְּאֶחָד מִן הָאַחִים מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ!
human_translation: If so, He is like one of the brothers, It should have He is only like one of the brothers,
llm_translation: If so, behold he is like one of the brothers - he is only like one of the brothers, he requires it!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: הוֹאִיל וְאַפְסְדַהּ מִיִּבּוּם, לִקְנְסֵיהּ, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: Rather, it could enter your mind to say since he caused her to forfeit levirate marriage, he should be penalized teaches us
llm_translation: Rather, the inclination of your mind I say: Since she has incurred a penalty from yibum, we infer it.

hebrew_text: אִם יֵשׁ שָׁם אָב. דְּאָמַר מָר: אָב קוֹדֵם לְכׇל יוֹצְאֵי יְרֵכוֹ.
human_translation: If there is a father As the Master said A father takes precedence over all descendants.
llm_translation: If there is a father there. As Mar said: A father precedes all those who go out of his thigh.

hebrew_text: הַכּוֹנֵס אֶת יְבִמְתּוֹ וְכוּ׳. מַאי טַעְמָא — ״יָקוּם עַל שֵׁם אָחִיו״ אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא, וַהֲרֵי קָם.
human_translation: One who consummates What is the reason The Merciful One states “He shall succeed in the name of his brother” and he has succeeded
llm_translation: The one who gathers his yevamah and so forth. What is the reason? "He shall rise up in the name of his brother," said the Merciful One, and indeed he rose up.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר וְכוּ׳. אָמַר עוּלָּא: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה. וְכֵן אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק נַפָּחָא: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: Ulla said: halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda. And similarly, Rabbi Yitzḥak Nappaḥa said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says, etc. Ulla said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda. And so said Rabbi Yitzchak Nafcha: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר עוּלָּא, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַבִּי יִצְחָק נַפָּחָא: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְהָיָה הַבְּכוֹר אֲשֶׁר תֵּלֵד״ — כִּבְכוֹר, מָה בְּכוֹר אֵין לוֹ בְּחַיֵּי הָאָב — אַף הַאי נָמֵי אֵין לוֹ בְּחַיֵּי הָאָב.
human_translation: And Ulla said, and some say Rabbi Yitzḥak Nappaḥa What is the reason of Rabbi Yehuda? As it is written: “And it shall be that the firstborn that she bears like a firstborn Just as a firstborn has no during the lifetime of the father, so too, this as well has no during the lifetime of the father.
llm_translation: And Ula said, and it was stated by Rabbi Yitzchak Nappacha: What is the reason for Rabbi Yehuda, as it is written: "And it shall be that the firstborn whom she bears" - like a firstborn, just as a firstborn does not have a share in the father's lifetime, so too this one does not have a share in the father's lifetime.

hebrew_text: אִי: מָה בְּכוֹר נוֹטֵל פִּי שְׁנַיִם לְאַחַר מִיתַת הָאָב, אַף הַאי נוֹטֵל פִּי שְׁנַיִם לְאַחַר מִיתַת הָאָב!
human_translation: If just as the firstborn takes a double portion after the death of the father, so too, this should take a double portion after the father’s death,
llm_translation: If: what firstborn takes double after death of the father, also this one takes double after death of the father!

hebrew_text: מִידֵּי ״יָקוּם עַל שֵׁם אָבִיו״ כְּתִיב? ״יָקוּם עַל שֵׁם אָחִיו״ כְּתִיב, וְלֹא ״עַל שֵׁם אָבִיו״.
human_translation: Is it written He shall succeed in the name of his father? it is written: “He shall succeed in the name of his dead brother,” but not in the name of his father,
llm_translation: From where is it written, "he shall rise up in honor of his father"? It is written, "he shall rise up in honor of his brother," and not "in honor of his father."

hebrew_text: אֵימָא: הֵיכָא דְּלֵיכָּא אָב דְּלִשְׁקוֹל נַחֲלָה — תִּתְקַיֵּים מִצְוַת יִבּוּם, הֵיכָא דְּאִיכָּא אָב [דְּלָא] שָׁקֵיל נַחֲלָה — לֹא תִּתְקַיֵּים מִצְוַת יִבּוּם.
human_translation: say: When there is no father that takes the inheritance, should the mitzva of levirate marriage apply, when there is a father that does not take the inheritance, the mitzva of levirate marriage should not apply.
llm_translation: Mother: where there is a father to take the inheritance - the mitzvah of yibum is fulfilled, where there is no father to take the inheritance - the mitzvah of yibum is not fulfilled.

hebrew_text: מִידֵּי יִבּוּם בְּנַחֲלָה תְּלָה רַחֲמָנָא? יַבּוֹמֵי מְיַבְּמִי, וְאִי אִיכָּא נַחֲלָה — שָׁקֵיל, וְאִי לָא — לָא שָׁקֵיל.
human_translation: Does the Merciful One make levirate marriage dependent upon inheritance? should consummate the levirate marriage, and if there is an inheritance he takes and if not, he does not take
llm_translation: From the hand of yibum in inheritance does the Merciful One depend? If there are yevamim to perform yibum, and if there is inheritance - he takes, and if not - he does not take.

hebrew_text: יְתֵיב רַבִּי חֲנִינָא קָרָא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יַנַּאי, וְיָתֵיב וְקָאָמַר: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: פּוֹק קְרִי קְרָיָיךְ לְבָרָא, אֵין הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina Kara, was sitting before Rabbi Yannai, and he was sitting and saying: halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda. said to him: Leave and recite your verses outside, halakha is not in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda.
