llm_translation: Rabbi Chanina sat before Rabbi Yannai, and he sat and said: The halacha is according to Rabbi Yehuda. He said to him: Go out and recite your verses in the Creator's presence, the halacha is not according to Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי תַּנָּא, קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן: אֵין הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֶלָּא כְּמַאן, כְּרַבָּנַן? פְּשִׁיטָא, יָחִיד וְרַבִּים הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּים!
human_translation: a tanna taught before Rav Naḥman: halakha is not in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda. Rav Naḥman said to him: But in accordance with whose the Rabbis. is obvious, one and many halakha the many.
llm_translation: The Tanna taught before Rav Nachman: The halakha does not follow Rabbi Yehuda. He said to him: Rather, whose opinion does it follow, the Rabbis? It is obvious, in a case of an individual against the majority, the halakha follows the majority!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֶסְמְיַיהּ?! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא. אַתְּ — הֲלָכָה אַתְנְיֻיךְ, וּמִקְשָׁא הוּא דְּאִקְּשִׁי לָךְ, וַאֲפַכְתְּ. וּלְמַאי דַּאֲפַכְתְּ, שַׁפִּיר אֲפַכְתְּ.
human_translation: said to him: I should remove that said to him: No, you were taught halakha that was difficult for you and you reversed And which you reversed it, you reversed it well,
llm_translation: He said to him: "Did you hear his name?!" He said to him: "No." You — you are a wise scholar, and it is difficult for you, and you turned it around. And for what reason did you turn it around? You turned it around well.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַחוֹלֵץ לִיבִמְתּוֹ — הוּא אָסוּר בִּקְרוֹבוֹתֶיהָ, וְהִיא אֲסוּרָה בִּקְרוֹבָיו.
human_translation: one who performs ḥalitza with his yevama , he is forbidden with her relatives and she is forbidden with his relatives.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "One who performs chalitzah with his yevamah - he is forbidden to her relatives, and she is forbidden to his relatives."

hebrew_text: הוּא אָסוּר בְּאִמָּהּ, וּבְאֵם אִמָּהּ, וּבְאֵם אָבִיהָ, וּבְבִתָּהּ, וּבְבַת בִּתָּהּ, וּבְבַת בְּנָהּ, וּבַאֲחוֹתָהּ בִּזְמַן שֶׁהִיא קַיֶּימֶת. וְהָאַחִין מוּתָּרִין.
human_translation: he is forbidden with her mother, and with her mother’s mother, and with her father’s mother, and with her daughter, and with her daughter’s daughter, and with her son’s daughter, and with her sister while is alive. the brothers are permitted
llm_translation: He is forbidden in his mother, and in the mother of his mother, and in the mother of his father, and in his daughter, and in the daughter of his daughter, and in the daughter of his son, and in his sister at a time when she is standing. And brothers are permitted.

hebrew_text: וְהִיא אֲסוּרָה בְּאָבִיו, וּבַאֲבִי אָבִיו, וּבִבְנוֹ, וּבְבֶן בְּנוֹ, בְּאָחִיו, וּבְבֶן אָחִיו.
human_translation: And she is forbidden with his father, and with his father’s father, and with his son, and with his son’s son, and with his brother, and with his brother’s son.
llm_translation: And she is forbidden to her father, and to her grandfather, and to her son, and to her grandson, to her brother, and to her nephew.

hebrew_text: מוּתָּר אָדָם בִּקְרוֹבַת צָרַת חֲלוּצָתוֹ. וְאָסוּר בְּצָרַת קְרוֹבַת חֲלוּצָתוֹ.
human_translation: A man is permitted with a relative of a rival wife of his ḥalutza , he is forbidden with a rival wife of a relative of his ḥalutza ,
llm_translation: Permitted is a person in the proximity of the release of his wife. And forbidden is in the proximity of the binding of his wife.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: גָּזְרוּ שְׁנִיּוֹת בַּחֲלוּצָה, אוֹ לֹא?
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before they decree secondary relationships in a ḥalutza , or not?
llm_translation: The Gemara inquires of them: Did they decree two garments for removal, or not?

hebrew_text: בְּעֶרְוָה דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא — גְּזַרוּ בְּהוּ רַבָּנַן שְׁנִיּוֹת, בַּחֲלוּצָה — לָא גְּזַרוּ רַבָּנַן שְׁנִיּוֹת, אוֹ דִלְמָא לָא שְׁנָא.
human_translation: the Sages decree secondary relationships in relations forbidden by Torah in ḥalutza , they did not decree secondary relationships? Or perhaps ḥalutza is no different,
llm_translation: In a case of a biblical prohibition - the Rabbis decreed with it two lashes, in a case of a Rabbinic prohibition - the Rabbis did not decree with it two lashes, or perhaps it is not so.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: הוּא אָסוּר בְּאִמָּהּ וּבְאֵם אִמָּהּ, וְאִילּוּ ״אֵם אֵם אִמָּהּ״ — לָא קָתָנֵי!
human_translation: Come hear is prohibited with mother of and with her mother’s mother. However, does not teach her mother’s mother’s mother,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Ta shema: hu asur be'imah uve'em imah, ve'ilu 'em em imah' - la katanei!" English translation: "Come and hear: He is forbidden to his mother and to the mother of his mother, but if it is 'the mother of the mother of his mother' - it is not taught!"

hebrew_text: דִּלְמָא הַיְינוּ טַעְמָא דְּלָא תָּנֵי, מִשּׁוּם דְּקָבָעֵי לְמִיתְנֵי סֵיפָא ״וְהָאַחִין מוּתָּרִין״, וְאִי תָּנָא ״אֵם אֵם אִמָּהּ״, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: הָאַחִין מוּתָּרִין דַּוְקָא בְּאֵם אֵם אִמָּהּ, אֲבָל בְּאֵם אִמָּהּ וּבְאִמָּהּ — לֹא.
human_translation: Perhaps this is the reason that does not teach because it needs to teach in the latter clause: the brothers are permitted And if it taught her mother’s mother’s mother I would say the brothers are permitted specifically to her mother’s mother’s mother, but not to her mother’s mother.
llm_translation: Perhaps this is the reason why it does not teach, because they established to teach the latter part "and the brothers are permitted," and if it had taught "a mother's mother," I would have said: the brothers are permitted specifically with a mother's mother, but with a mother's mother and with her mother - no.

hebrew_text: וְלִיתְנֵי ״אֵם אֵם אִמָּהּ״, וְלִיתְנֵי ״הָאַחִין מוּתָּרִין בְּכוּלָּן״! קַשְׁיָא.
human_translation: But let it teach: Her mother’s mother’s mother and let it teach: The brothers are permitted to all of them, difficult,
llm_translation: And it was taught: "If a mother, her mother," and it was taught: "The brothers are all permitted!" This is difficult.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: הִיא אֲסוּרָה בְּאָבִיו וּבַאֲבִי אָבִיו. קָתָנֵי מִיהָא אֲבִי אָבִיו, מַאי לָאו, מִשּׁוּם חוֹלֵץ דְּהָוְיָא לַהּ כַּלַּת בְּנוֹ!
human_translation: Come hear She is prohibited with his father, and with his father’s father. In any case, teaches his father’s father. What, is it not due to the one who performed ḥalitza she is considered to be son’s daughter-in-law,
llm_translation: Come and hear: She is forbidden to her father and to her father's father. The Mishnah teaches from her father's father, what is it? Because of the rival wife, who becomes to him like his son's daughter!

hebrew_text: לָא, מִשּׁוּם מִיתָנָא, דְּהָוְיָא לַהּ כַּלַּת בְּנוֹ.
human_translation: No, due to the deceased, that she is considered son’s daughter-in-law.
llm_translation: Not it is because of a gift, that was to her like a daughter-in-law.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: וּבְבֶן בְּנוֹ. מַאי לָאו, מִשּׁוּם חוֹלֵץ, דְּהָוְיָא לַהּ (מִשּׁוּם) אֵשֶׁת אֲבִי אָבִיו!
human_translation: Come hear And with his son’s son. What, is it not due to the one who performed ḥalitza she is she is considered to be the wife father’s father,
llm_translation: Come and hear: And with the son of his son. What is the reason? Because of the levir, for he would be to her (because of) the wife of his father's father!

hebrew_text: לָא, מִשּׁוּם מִיתָנָא, וְהָוְיָא לַהּ אֵשֶׁת אֲחִי אֲבִי אָבִיו.
human_translation: No, due to the deceased, she is considered to be the wife of a brother of father’s father,
llm_translation: Not it is because of a gift, and it would be to him as the wife of the brother of his grandfather.

hebrew_text: הָא אַמֵּימָר מַכְשַׁר בְּאֵשֶׁת אֲחִי אֲבִי אָבִיו!
human_translation: But Ameimar rules permissible to the wife of a brother of father’s father.
llm_translation: This is the translation of the Talmudic text: "Ammemar permits the marriage with the wife of the brother of one's grandfather!"

hebrew_text: אַמֵּימָר מוֹקֵי לַהּ בְּבַר בְּרָא דְּסָבָא.
human_translation: Ameimar establish with a son of a son of the grandfather.
llm_translation: Ammemar strikes her with a piece of a broken pot.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, הַיְינוּ אָחִיו וּבֶן אָחִיו? תְּנָא אָחִיו מִן הָאָב, וְקָתָנֵי אָחִיו מִן הָאֵם.
human_translation: if so, these are his brother and the son of his brother, teaches his paternal brother and teaches his maternal brother
llm_translation: If so, is that his brother and his nephew? A Tanna teaches: His brother from the father, and it is taught: his nephew from the mother.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּתָנֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא: אַרְבַּע מִדִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה, וְאַרְבַּע מִדִּבְרֵי סוֹפְרִים: אָב וּבְנוֹ, אָחִיו, וּבֶן אָחִיו — מִדִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה. אֲבִי אָבִיו, וַאֲבִי אִמּוֹ, בֶּן בְּנוֹ, וּבֶן בִּתּוֹ — מִדִּבְרֵי סוֹפְרִים
human_translation: Come hear that Rabbi Ḥiyya taught: four by Torah law and four by rabbinic law, The father and his son, his brother, and his brother’s son by Torah law; his father’s father, and his mother’s father, his son’s son, and his daughter’s son by rabbinic law.
llm_translation: Come and hear, as Rabbi Hiyya teaches: Four relationships from the words of the Torah, and four from the words of the Scribes: Father and his son, his brother, and his nephew — from the words of the Torah. His grandfather, his paternal grandfather, his grandson, and his granddaughter — from the words of the Scribes.

hebrew_text: קָתָנֵי מִיהָא אֲבִי אָבִיו. מַאי לָאו, מִשּׁוּם חוֹלֵץ, וְהָוְיָא לַהּ כַּלַּת בְּנוֹ!
human_translation: In any case, teaches his father’s father. What, is it not due to the one who performed ḥalitza she is considered to be son’s daughter-in-law,
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates as follows: "It was taught from the house of his father's father. What is the reason? Because of the levir, and it would be to her like her son's wife!"

hebrew_text: לָא, מִשּׁוּם מִיתָנָא, דְּהָוְיָא לַהּ כַּלַּת בְּנוֹ.
human_translation: No, due to the deceased, she is considered son’s daughter-in-law.
llm_translation: Not it is because of a gift, that was to her like a daughter-in-law.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: אֲבִי אִמּוֹ. מַאי לָאו, מִשּׁוּם חוֹלֵץ, דְּהָוְיָא לַהּ כַּלַּת בִּתּוֹ!
human_translation: Come hear his mother’s father. What, is it not due to the one who performed ḥalitza she is considered to be daughter’s daughter-in-law,
llm_translation: Come and hear: "His father's sister." What is the reason that it is not permissible? Because of the prohibition of "chalitzah," for she would be like his daughter-in-law!

hebrew_text: לָא, מִשּׁוּם מִיתָנָא, דְּהָוְיָא לַהּ כַּלַּת בִּתּוֹ.
human_translation: No, due to the deceased, she is considered daughter’s daughter-in-law.
llm_translation: Not, because of the teaching, that she was like his daughter-in-law.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: וּבֶן בְּנוֹ. מַאי לָאו, מִשּׁוּם חוֹלֵץ, דְּהָוְיָא לַהּ אֵשֶׁת אֲבִי אָבִיו!
human_translation: Come hear And his son’s son. What, is it not due to the one who performed ḥalitza she is considered to be the wife father’s father,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Ta shema: uven beno. Mai lav, mishum choleitz, dehavaya la ishet aviv aviv!" English translation: "Come and hear: 'And the son of his son.' What is the reason that it is not considered because of chalitzah? Because she was originally his father's father's wife!"

hebrew_text: לָא, מִשּׁוּם מִיתָנָא, וְהָוְיָא לַהּ אֵשֶׁת אֲחִי אֲבִי אָבִיו.
human_translation: No, due to the deceased, she is considered to be the wife of a brother of father’s father,
llm_translation: Not it is from a gift, and it will be to him as the wife of the brother of his father's father.

hebrew_text: וְהָא אַמֵּימָר מַכְשִׁיר בְּאֵשֶׁת אֲחִי אֲבִי אָבִיו! אַמֵּימָר מוֹקֵים לַהּ מִשּׁוּם חוֹלֵץ, וְקָסָבַר גָּזְרוּ שְׁנִיּוֹת בַּחֲלוּצָה.
human_translation: But didn’t Ameimar rule permissible with the wife of a brother of his father’s father? Ameimar establish as due to the one who performed ḥalitza and he holds decreed secondary relationships in a ḥalutza .
llm_translation: And behold, Amemar permits with the wife of the brother of his grandfather! Amemar establishes her status due to the law of levirate marriage, and he holds that two decrees were enacted regarding levirate marriage.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: וּבְבֶן בִּתּוֹ. מַאי לָאו, מִשּׁוּם חוֹלֵץ, דְּהָוְיָא לַהּ אֵשֶׁת אֲבִי אִמּוֹ!
human_translation: Come hear And his daughter’s son. What, is it not due to one who performed ḥalitza she is she is considered to be the wife mother’s father,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Ta shema: uveben bito. Mai lav, mishum cholitz, dehavaya la ishet avi immo!" English translation: "Come and hear: And with his daughter's son. What is the reason? Because of the levirate marriage, for he would be to her like the wife of his father's brother!"

hebrew_text: לָא, מִשּׁוּם מִיתָנָא, דְּהָוְיָא לַהּ אֵשֶׁת אֲחִי אֲבִי אִמּוֹ. וְהָא גַּבֵּי שְׁנִיּוֹת דְּעֶרְוָה לֹא גָּזְרוּ!
human_translation: No, due to the deceased, she is considered to be the wife of a brother of mother’s father. But not decree among secondary relationships.
llm_translation: Not, because of the teaching, that she was the wife of the brother of her father's mother. And regarding two sisters, they did not decree regarding nakedness!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לָאו, מִשּׁוּם חוֹלֵץ, וּשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ גָּזְרוּ שְׁנִיּוֹת בַּחֲלוּצָה? שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Rather, is it not, due to the one who performed ḥalitza and conclude from decreed secondary relationships in a ḥalutza ? conclude from it
llm_translation: Rather, no, for the sake of removing, and hear from it, they decreed two separations in chalitza? Hear from it.

hebrew_text: מוּתָּר אָדָם וְכוּ׳. אָמַר רַב טוֹבִי בַּר קִיסְנָא אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הַבָּא עַל צָרַת חֲלוּצָה — הַוָּלָד מַמְזֵר. מַאי טַעְמָא? בְּאִיסּוּרַהּ קָיְימָא.
human_translation: A man is permitted Rav Tovi bar Kisna said Shmuel said: one who engages in intercourse with a rival wife of ḥalutza , the offspring is a mamzer . What is the reason she remains in her prohibition.
llm_translation: Permitted a person etc. Said Rav Tovi son of Kisna said Shmuel: One who has relations with a woman during her menstrual impurity - the offspring is a mamzer. What is the reason? He fulfilled her prohibition.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף, אַף אֲנַן נָמֵי תְּנֵינָא: מוּתָּר אָדָם בִּקְרוֹבַת צָרַת חֲלוּצָתוֹ. אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא צָרָה אַבָּרַאי, מִשּׁוּם הָכִי מוּתָּר בַּאֲחוֹתָהּ.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: We, too, learned A man is permitted with a relative of a rival wife of his ḥalutza . Granted, if you say a rival wife is outside, due to that he is permitted with her sister
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said, "We also learned: A person is permitted in the proximity of his garment's removal. If you say it is a matter of modesty, it is because of this that he is permitted in her sister."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ צָרָה כַּחֲלוּצָה דָּמְיָא, אַמַּאי מוּתָּר?
human_translation: However, if you say a rival wife is similar to the ḥalutza why is he permitted
llm_translation: Rather if you say, "A tzara is like a chalutza in terms of its monetary value," why is it permitted?

hebrew_text: לֵימָא תֶּיהְוֵי תְּיוּבְתָּא דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, דְּאָמַר: בֵּין הוּא, בֵּין אַחִין — אֵין חַיָּיבִין לֹא עַל הַחֲלוּצָה כָּרֵת, וְלֹא עַל צָרָתָהּ כָּרֵת.
human_translation: Shall we say, is a conclusive refutation of Rabbi Yoḥanan? As said: Neither he nor his brothers are liable to karet ; neither karet on account of the ḥalutza , nor karet on account of her rival wife.
llm_translation: Let it be the preference of Rabbi Yochanan, for he said: Whether it is he himself, or his brothers - they are not liable neither for the removal of the leper's garments with karet, nor for its distress with karet.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָךְ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: וְתִסְבְּרַאּ אֲחוֹת חֲלוּצָה דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא? וְהָאָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: כָּאן שָׁנָה רַבִּי אָחוֹת גְּרוּשָׁה מִדִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה, אֲחוֹת חֲלוּצָה מִדִּבְרֵי סוֹפְרִים.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said to you: But you understand a sister of ḥalutza by Torah ? Didn’t Reish Lakish say Here, Rabbi taught: a sister of divorcée by Torah law, a sister of ḥalutza is by rabbinic law.
llm_translation: He said to you, Rabbi Yochanan: And do you think that the sister of a divorcee is from the Torah? But didn't Reish Lakish say: Here Rabbi changed, a sister of a divorcee from the words of the Torah, a sister of a chalutza from the words of the Scribes.

hebrew_text: מַאי שְׁנָא הַאי, וּמַאי שְׁנָא הַאי?
human_translation: What is different this and what is different that
llm_translation: What is the difference between this one, and what is the difference between that one?

hebrew_text: הָךְ דְּאָזְלָא בַּהֲדַהּ לְבֵי דִינָא, גְּזַרוּ בְּהוּ רַבָּנַן. הַאי דְּלָא אָזְלָא בַּהֲדַהּ לְבֵי דִּינָא, לָא גְּזַרוּ בְּהוּ רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: that who goes together with to court, the Sages decreed with regard to her this who does not go together with to court, the Sages did not decree with regard to her
llm_translation: The one who went to the house of judgment, the Rabbis decreed upon him. This one who did not go to the house of judgment, the Rabbis did not decree upon him.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַחוֹלֵץ לִיבִמְתּוֹ, וְנָשָׂא אָחִיו אֶת אֲחוֹתָהּ, וָמֵת — חוֹלֶצֶת וְלֹא מִתְיַבֶּמֶת. וְכֵן הַמְגָרֵשׁ אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ, וְנָשָׂא אָחִיו אֶת אֲחוֹתָהּ, וָמֵת — הֲרֵי זוֹ פְּטוּרָה.
human_translation: who performed ḥalitza with his yevama and his brother married her sister and died, performs ḥalitza but she may not enter into levirate marriage And similarly, one who divorced his wife and his brother married her sister and died, then that is exempt
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If a man performs chalitzah with his yevamah, and then his brother marries her, and he dies - she performs chalitzah but does not engage in levirate marriage. Similarly, if a man divorces his wife, and then his brother marries her, and he dies - she is exempt.

hebrew_text: שׁוֹמֶרֶת יָבָם שֶׁקִּידֵּשׁ אָחִיו אֶת אֲחוֹתָהּ — מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בְּתִירָא אָמְרוּ, אוֹמְרִים לוֹ: הַמְתֵּן עַד שֶׁיַּעֲשֶׂה אָחִיךָ מַעֲשֶׂה.
human_translation: a widow waiting for her yavam brother of betrothed her sister, they said in the name of Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira: They say to Wait until your brother performs an act,
llm_translation: Guardian of the yavam who betrothed her brother's sister — in the name of Rabbi Yehuda ben Betera they said, they say to him: Wait until your brother performs the act.

hebrew_text: חָלַץ לָהּ אָחִיו אוֹ כְּנָסָהּ — יִכְנוֹס אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ. מֵתָה הַיְּבָמָה — יִכְנוֹס אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ. מֵת יָבָם — יוֹצִיא אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ בְּגֵט, וְאֵשֶׁת אָחִיו בַּחֲלִיצָה.
human_translation: a brother of performed ḥalitza with or consummated a levirate marriage with her, he may enter into marriage his wife, the yevama died, he may enter into marriage his wife. yavam died he must divorce his wife with a bill of divorce, and his brother’s wife with ḥalitza ,
llm_translation: He removed for her her brother or he married her - he shall marry his wife. If the yevamah died - he shall marry his wife. If the yavam died - he shall divorce his wife with a bill of divorce, and the wife of his brother with halitzah.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי ״וְכֵן״? אֵימָא: ״אֲבָל הַמְגָרֵשׁ״.
human_translation: What is And similarly? say: However, one who divorces.
llm_translation: Gemara: What is the meaning of "vechein"? Say: "But the one who divorces."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ, כָּאן שָׁנָה רַבִּי: אֲחוֹת גְּרוּשָׁה מִדִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה, אֲחוֹת חֲלוּצָה מִדִּבְרֵי סוֹפְרִים.
human_translation: Reish Lakish said: Here, Rabbi taught a sister of divorcée by Torah law, a sister of a ḥalutza by rabbinic law,
llm_translation: Reish Lakish said, here Rabbi changed: the sister of a divorced woman from matters of Torah, the sister of a halutzah from matters of the Scribes.

hebrew_text: שׁוֹמֶרֶת יָבָם שֶׁקִּידֵּשׁ וְכוּ׳. אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הֲלָכָה כְּדִבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בְּתֵירָא.
human_translation: a widow waiting for her yavam betrothed Shmuel said: halakha is in accordance with the statement of Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira.
llm_translation: Guardian of the yavam who violated and so on. Samuel said: The halakha is in accordance with the words of Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: מֵתָה אִשְׁתּוֹ, מַהוּ בִּיבִמְתּוֹ? רַב וְרַבִּי חֲנִינָא דְּאָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ: מֵתָה אִשְׁתּוֹ — מוּתָּר בִּיבִמְתּוֹ. שְׁמוּאֵל וְרַב אַסִּי דְאָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ: מֵתָה אִשְׁתּוֹ — אָסוּר בִּיבִמְתּוֹ.
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before his wife died, what is with regard to his yevama ; Rav and Rabbi Ḥanina who both say: his wife died, he is permitted to his yevama . Shmuel and Rav Asi, who both say: his wife died, he is forbidden to his yevama .
llm_translation: The question was asked: if his wife died, what is the law regarding yibum? Rav and Rabbi Chanina both said: if his wife died, he is permitted to perform yibum. Shmuel and Rav Assi both said: if his wife died, he is forbidden to perform yibum.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַב — מִשּׁוּם דַּהֲוַאי יְבָמָה שֶׁהוּתְּרָה וְנֶאֶסְרָה, וְחָזְרָה וְהוּתְּרָה, תַּחְזוֹר לְהֶיתֵּירָהּ הָרִאשׁוֹן.
human_translation: Rava said: What is Rav’s reasoning? due to she is a yevama who, was permitted and she became forbidden and then reverted and was permitted she should revert to her original permitted status
llm_translation: Rava said: What is the reason for Rav's ruling? Because she was a yevamah who was permitted and then prohibited, and then permitted again, she reverts to her original state of permissibility.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַב הַמְנוּנָא: שְׁלֹשָׁה אַחִין, שְׁנַיִם נְשׂוּאִין שְׁתֵּי אֲחָיוֹת, וְאֶחָד מוּפְנֶה. מֵת אֶחָד מִבַּעֲלֵי אֲחָיוֹת, וְעָשָׂה בָּהּ מוּפְנֶה מַאֲמָר, וְאַחַר כָּךְ מֵת אָחִיו הַשֵּׁנִי,
human_translation: Rav Hamnuna raised an objection three brothers, two are married to two sisters and one is a bachelor, one of the sisters’ husbands died and the bachelor performed levirate betrothal and afterward the second brother died,
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: Rav Hamnuna asks: Three brothers, two of whom are married, and one is single. One of the married brothers dies, and the other brother performs the rite of chalitzah with the widow, and afterwards the second brother dies.

hebrew_text: וְאַחַר כָּךְ מֵתָה אִשְׁתּוֹ אַחֲרָיו — אוֹתָהּ יְבָמָה חוֹלֶצֶת וְלֹא מִתְיַבֶּמֶת.
human_translation: And afterward the wife died after him, that yevama , performs ḥalitza but may not enter into levirate marriage.
llm_translation: And after that his wife died after him - that yevamah performs chalitzah and does not perform yibum.

hebrew_text: וְאַמַּאי? תֶּיהְוֵי כִּיבָמָה שֶׁהוּתְּרָה וְנֶאֶסְרָה וְחָזְרָה וְהוּתְּרָה, תַּחְזוֹר לְהֶיתֵּירָהּ הָרִאשׁוֹן!
human_translation: But why She should be like a yevama who was permitted and became forbidden and then reverted and was permitted, and so she should revert to her original permitted status
llm_translation: And why? Shall it be like levirate marriage that was permitted and then prohibited and then permitted again, it shall return to its initial state of being permitted!

hebrew_text: אִישְׁתִּיק. לְבָתַר דִּנְפַק אֲמַר: אַמַּאי לָא אֲמַרְתְּ לֵיהּ, רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר הִיא, דְּאָמַר: כֵּיוָן שֶׁעָמְדָה עָלָיו שָׁעָה אַחַת בְּאִסּוּר — נֶאֶסְרָה עָלָיו עוֹלָמִית?
human_translation: was silent, After left said Why did you not say to him it is Rabbi Elazar, who said once has stood in a forbidden state, for a single moment, she forbidden to him forever,
llm_translation: The man remained silent. After he left, he said: Why did you not tell him, it is Rabbi Elazar, who said: Once she stood over him for one moment in prohibition - she is forbidden to him forever?

hebrew_text: הֲדַר אֲמַר: אֵימוֹר דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר — הֵיכָא דְּלָא חַזְיָא בִּשְׁעַת נְפִילָה, אֲבָל הֵיכָא דְּחַזְיָא בִּשְׁעַת נְפִילָה, מִי אָמַר?
human_translation: He then said say that Rabbi Elazar said where she was not suitable the time happening However, where she was suitable at the time of happening did he say
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates to: "Hadar said: The statement that Rabbi Elazar said - where one does not see at the time of the fall, but where one does see at the time of the fall, who said?"

hebrew_text: הֲדַר אֲמַר: אִין, וְהָתַנְיָא, רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: מֵתָה יְבִמְתּוֹ — מוּתָּר בְּאִשְׁתּוֹ, מֵתָה אִשְׁתּוֹ — אוֹתָהּ יְבָמָה חוֹלֶצֶת וְלֹא מִתְיַבֶּמֶת.
human_translation: He then said: Yes, and it is taught Rabbi Elazar says: his yevama dies, he is permitted to his wife. his wife dies, that yevama performs ḥalitza but may not enter into levirate marriage
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates as follows: "Hadar said: No, and it was taught, Rabbi Elazar says: If his yevamah died - he is permitted to marry his wife, if his wife died - that yevamah performs chalitzah but does not perform yibum."

hebrew_text: לֵימָא שְׁמוּאֵל וְרַב אַסִּי דְּאָמְרִי כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר?
human_translation: Shall we say Shmuel and Rav Asi, who say in accordance with Rabbi Elazar?
llm_translation: Let us say: Shmuel and Rav Assi who say like Rabbi Elazar?

hebrew_text: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא כְּרַבָּנַן, עַד כָּאן לָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי רַבָּנַן עֲלֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, אֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם דְּמִנְּפִילָה וְאֵילָךְ לָא מִיתְּסַר עֲלַיְיהוּ, אֲבָל הָכָא דְּאִיתְּסַר — אֲפִילּוּ רַבָּנַן מוֹדוּ.
human_translation: You even say in accordance with the Rabbis, the Rabbis disagree with Rabbi Elazar only due to that from happening and onward she was not forbidden to them, However, here, she became forbidden even the Rabbis agree
llm_translation: Even if you say like the Rabbanan, until here the Rabbanan did not argue on Rabbi Elazar, rather because of the falling and onwards they did not agree with him, but here where they agreed - even the Rabbanan concede.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַיְּבָמָה לֹא תַּחֲלוֹץ וְלֹא תִּתְיַיבֵּם עַד שֶׁיֵּשׁ לָהּ שְׁלֹשָׁה חֳדָשִׁים. וְכֵן כׇּל שְׁאָר הַנָּשִׁים לֹא יִתְאָרְסוּ וְלֹא יִנָּשְׂאוּ עַד שֶׁיְּהוּ לָהֶן שְׁלֹשָׁה חֳדָשִׁים: אֶחָד בְּתוּלוֹת וְאֶחָד בְּעוּלוֹת, אֶחָד גְּרוּשׁוֹת וְאֶחָד אַלְמָנוֹת, אֶחָד נְשׂוּאוֹת וְאֶחָד אֲרוּסוֹת.
human_translation: A yevama may neither perform ḥalitza nor enter into levirate marriage until she has three months And similarly, all other women may not be betrothed and may not marry until they have three months both to virgins and non-virgins, both to divorcées and widows, both to women married and women betrothed.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: A yevamah may not perform chalitzah or undergo yibum until she has three months elapsed. Similarly, all other women may not become engaged or married until they have three months elapsed: one for virgins, one for those who were previously married, one for divorcees, and one for widows, one for those who are married, and one for those who are engaged.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: הַנְּשׂוּאוֹת — יִתְאָרְסוּ, וְהָאֲרוּסוֹת — יִנָּשְׂאוּ. חוּץ מִן הָאֲרוּסוֹת שֶׁבִּיהוּדָה, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁלִּבּוֹ גַּס בָּהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: The women married may be betrothed, and the women betrothed may marry except for the betrothed women that are in Judea, due to that is familiar with her.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: The married women - should be engaged, and the engaged women - should be married. Except for the engaged women of Judah, because his heart is arrogant towards her.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: כׇּל הַנָּשִׁים יִתְאָרְסוּ, חוּץ מִן הָאַלְמָנָה,
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: All of the women may be betrothed except for a widow,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: All women may marry, except for the widow.

hebrew_text: מִפְּנֵי הָאִיבּוּל.
human_translation: due to the mourning
llm_translation: Because of the enemy.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ בִּשְׁלָמָא לֹא תִּתְיַיבֵּם: שֶׁמָּא יִהְיֶה הַוָּלָד בֶּן קַיָּימָא, וְקָא פָגַע בְּאִיסּוּר אֵשֶׁת אָח דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא. אֶלָּא לֹא תַּחְלוֹץ, אַמַּאי?
human_translation: Granted, she should not enter into levirate marriage, perhaps the baby will be viable. and he will have encountered the Torah prohibition against brother’s wife. However, why should she not perform ḥalitza ?
llm_translation: Gemara: Indeed, do not perform chalitzah. Perhaps the child will be legitimate, and he will encounter the prohibition of marrying the wife of one's brother from the Torah. Rather, do not perform chalitzah. Why?

hebrew_text: לֵימָא תֶּיהְוֵי תְּיוּבְתָּא דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, דְּאָמַר: חֲלִיצַת מְעוּבֶּרֶת שְׁמָהּ חֲלִיצָה. וְלָאו מִי אוֹתְבִינֵּיהּ לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן חֲדָא זִימְנָא?! לֵימָא מֵהָא נָמֵי תֶּיהְוֵי תְּיוּבְתָּא!
human_translation: Let us say is a conclusive refutation of Rabbi Yoḥanan, who said a ḥalitza with a pregnant woman is considered ḥalitza . But didn’t they conclusively refute Rabbi Yoḥanan one time Let us say from this as well there is a conclusive refutation
llm_translation: Let it be the preference of Rabbi Yochanan, for he said: A halitzah performed with a fetus is called halitzah. But did anyone ever present this to Rabbi Yochanan even once?! Let it be the preference of those who say this!

hebrew_text: לָא, הָכָא הַיְינוּ טַעְמָא: שֶׁמָּא יְהֵא וָלָד בֶּן קַיָּימָא, וְנִמְצֵאתָ אַתָּה מַצְרִיכָהּ כָּרוֹז לַכְּהוּנָּה.
human_translation: No, here, this is the reason Perhaps offspring will be viable, It would emerge you will require a public announcement for her into the priesthood.
llm_translation: Not here, this is the reason: lest there be a child of uncertain lineage, and you will find yourself in need of proclaiming for the priesthood.

hebrew_text: וְנַצְרְכַהּ! דִּלְמָא אִיכָּא דְּהָוֵאי בַּחֲלִיצָה וְלָא הָוֵי בְּהַכְרָזָה, וּמַפְסְלוּהָ מִן הַכְּהוּנָּה.
human_translation: But require for her? Perhaps there will be some who are at the ḥalitza but were not at the public announcement, and will disqualify her from the priesthood.
llm_translation: And it is necessary! Perhaps there is a case where it was in a partition and not in a proclamation, and they disqualified it from the priesthood.

hebrew_text: תִּינַח אַלְמָנָה. גְּרוּשָׁה — מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? מִשּׁוּם דְּמַפְסֵיד לַהּ מְזוֹנוֹת.
human_translation: works out well a widow a divorcée, what is there to say; because she will forfeit the sustenance payments
llm_translation: The widow will be comforted. A divorced woman - what is there to say? Because he causes her to lose her sustenance.

hebrew_text: תִּינַח נְשׂוּאָה. אֲרוּסָה גְּרוּשָׁה — מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר?
human_translation: works out well woman married a divorcée who betrothed what is there to say?
llm_translation: "Let the married woman be taken. What is the case of a betrothed woman who is divorced?"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי, דְּתַנְיָא: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּאָדָם אֶחָד שֶׁבָּא לִפְנֵי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי. אָמַר לוֹ: מַהוּ לַחְלוֹץ בְּתוֹךְ שְׁלֹשָׁה? אָמַר לוֹ: לֹא תַּחְלוֹץ. וְתַחְלוֹץ, וּמָה בְּכָךְ?
human_translation: Rather, due to that Rabbi Yosei as it is taught an incident involving a certain man who came before Rabbi Yosei. said to him: What is to performing ḥalitza within three He said to him: She may not perform ḥalitza . Let her perform ḥalitza ; what with that?
llm_translation: Rather, because of Rabbi Yosei, as it was taught: There was an incident involving a certain man who came before Rabbi Yosei. He said to him: Is it permitted to untie within three days? He said to him: You shall not untie. And he untied. What is the significance of this?

hebrew_text: קָרָא עָלָיו מִקְרָא זֶה: ״וְאִם לֹא יַחְפֹּץ״, הָא אִם חָפֵץ — יִבֵּם. כׇּל הָעוֹלֶה לְיִבּוּם — עוֹלֶה לַחֲלִיצָה כּוּ׳.
human_translation: recited this verse about him: “And if the man does not wish if he wishes he may consummate the levirate marriage. one who is eligible for levirate marriage is eligible for ḥalitza ,
llm_translation: He called upon him this verse: "And if he does not wish," now if he wishes - he shall perform levirate marriage. Anyone who is obligated to perform levirate marriage - is also obligated to perform halitzah, as stated.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַב חִינָּנָא: הַסְּפֵקוֹת חוֹלְצוֹת וְלֹא מִתְיַבְּמוֹת.
human_translation: Rav Ḥinnana raised an objection Those women is uncertain perform ḥalitza but may not enter into levirate marriage.
llm_translation: Rav Chinana raises an objection: "Doubtful cases permit the removal of the sotah's garments, but they do not permit her to marry."

hebrew_text: מַאי סְפֵקוֹת? אִילֵּימָא סְפֵק קִדּוּשִׁין — אַמַּאי לָא מִתְיַבְּמוֹת? תִּתְיַיבֵּם, וְאֵין בְּכָךְ כְּלוּם.
human_translation: What is women is uncertain? If we say betrothal is uncertain, why does she not enter into levirate marriage? Let her enter into levirate marriage, and no with that,
llm_translation: What are doubtful cases? Perhaps cases of doubtful betrothals - why don't they engage in levirate marriage? They should engage in levirate marriage, and there is no disgrace in that.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לָאו, סָפֵק שֶׁקִּידֵּשׁ אַחַת מִשְׁתֵּי אֲחָיוֹת, וְאֵינוֹ יוֹדֵעַ אֵיזוֹ מֵהֶן קִידֵּשׁ. וְקָתָנֵי: חוֹלֶצֶת!
human_translation: Rather, is it not uncertainty which betrothed one of two sisters and he does not know which of them he betrothed? and teaches she performs ḥalitza ,
llm_translation: Rather, no, a doubt that he betrothed one of two sisters, and he does not know which one he betrothed. And it is taught: She must perform ḥalitza!

hebrew_text: הָכִי הַשְׁתָּא?! הָתָם, אִם יָבֹא אֵלִיָּהוּ וְיֹאמַר דְּהָא קִידֵּשׁ — בַּת חֲלִיצָה וְיִיבּוּם הִיא,
human_translation: How can be compared? There, if Elijah were to come and say that betrothed this one she would be eligible for ḥalitza and levirate marriage.
llm_translation: So now?! There, if Elijah should come and say that he has sanctified it - it is a case of a woman who requires Halitzah and Yibum.

hebrew_text: הָכָא, אִם יָבֹא אֵלִיָּהוּ וְיֹאמַר דְּהָא לָא אִיעַבַּרָה — מִי מַשְׁגְּחִ[ינַן] בֵּיהּ, וּ[מְ]יַבְּמִינַן לַהּ? הָא קְטַנָּה דְּלָאו בַּת אִיעַבּוֹרֵי הִיא, וַאֲפִילּוּ הָכִי צְרִיכָה לְהַמְתִּין שְׁלֹשָׁה חֳדָשִׁים.
human_translation: here, if Elijah were to come and say that this is not pregnant, would one pay heed to him and would we allow to consummate levirate marriage? as a minor girl, who cannot become pregnant, must wait three months.
llm_translation: Here, if Elijah should come and say, "This one has not menstruated," who would supervise her, and who would permit her? This is a minor who is not of age for menstruation, yet even so, she must wait three months.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: יְבָמָה, שְׁלֹשָׁה חֳדָשִׁים הָרִאשׁוֹנִים נִזּוֹנֶת מִשֶּׁל בַּעַל. מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ, אֵינָהּ נִזּוֹנֶת לֹא מִשֶּׁל בַּעַל וְלֹא מִשֶּׁל יָבָם.
human_translation: The Sages taught: A yevama the first three months receives sustenance from the husband’s From this forward, she does not receive sustenance neither from the husband’s nor from the yavam ,
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: A yevamah, for the first three months, is sustained from the property of the husband. From then on, she is not sustained either from the property of the husband or from the property of the yavam.

hebrew_text: עָמַד בַּדִּין וּבָרַח — נִזּוֹנֶת מָשָׁל יָבָם.
human_translation: was brought to judgment and he ran away she receives sustenance from of the yavam ,
llm_translation: Stood in judgment and fled - a parable is said: "Yavam shall be nourished."

hebrew_text: נָפְלָה לִפְנֵי יָבָם קָטָן (מַאי)? מִיָּבָם לֵית לַהּ. מִבַּעַל מַאי?
human_translation: she happened before yavam a minor what is From the yavam she does not have from husband’s what
llm_translation: She fell before the yavam minor (what)? From yavam she does not have. From ba'al what?

hebrew_text: פְּלִיגִי בַּהּ רַב אַחָא וְרָבִינָא, חַד אָמַר: אִית לַהּ, וְחַד אֲמַר: לֵית לַהּ, וְהִלְכְתָא: לֵית לַהּ, מִשְּׁמַיָּא קַנְסוּהּ.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa and Ravina disagree with regard to One said she does have and one said she does not have And the halakha she does not have she was penalized by Heaven.
llm_translation: They disputed it, Rav Acha and Ravina, one said: it has, and one said: it does not have, and the halakha is: it does not have, they acquired it from heaven.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: יְבָמָה שֶׁחָלְצוּ לָהּ אַחִים בְּתוֹךְ שְׁלֹשָׁה — צְרִיכָה לְהַמְתִּין שְׁלֹשָׁה חֳדָשִׁים.
human_translation: The Sages taught: a yevama with whom the brothers performed ḥalitza within three needs to wait three months
llm_translation: The Sages taught: A yevamah for whom brothers performed chalitzah within three months - she must wait three months.

hebrew_text: לְאַחַר שְׁלֹשָׁה — אֵין צְרִיכָה לְהַמְתִּין שְׁלֹשָׁה חֳדָשִׁים.
human_translation: after three she does not need to wait three months
llm_translation: After three — not need to wait three months.

hebrew_text: הֱוֵי (הַ)שְׁלֹשָׁה חֳדָשִׁים שֶׁאָמְרוּ, מִשְּׁעַת מִיתַת הַבַּעַל, וְלֹא מִשְּׁעַת חֲלִיצַת הַיָּבָם.
human_translation: must be the three months that are stated from the time of the husband’s death and not from the time of the ḥalitza of the yavam .
llm_translation: Be three months that they said, from time of death of husband, and not from time of release of yavam.

hebrew_text: מַאי שְׁנָא מִגֵּט, דְּרַב אָמַר: מִשְּׁעַת נְתִינָה, וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: מִשְּׁעַת כְּתִיבָה!
human_translation: what is different from a bill of divorce, where Rav said from the time of the giving and Shmuel said from the time of the writing
llm_translation: What is the difference between a divorce document? For Rav said: from the time of giving, and Shmuel said: from the time of writing!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא, קַל וָחוֹמֶר: אִיסּוּר כָּרֵת הִתַּרְתָּ, אִיסּוּר לָאו — לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן.
human_translation: Rava said: a fortiori a prohibition karet , you have permitted negative prohibition, not all the more so
llm_translation: Rava said, "An a fortiori argument: If you permitted a prohibition of karet, how much more so a prohibition of lav - certainly not."

hebrew_text: וְכֵן שְׁאָר כׇּל הַנָּשִׁים. בִּשְׁלָמָא יְבָמָה, כְּדַאֲמַרַן. אֶלָּא שְׁאָר כׇּל הַנָּשִׁים אַמַּאי?
human_translation: And similarly, all other women may Granted, a yevama in accordance with that we said, But all other women, why
llm_translation: And so too, the rest of all the women. In the case of a yevamah, it is understandable, as we have said. But why the rest of all the women?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל, מִשּׁוּם דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״לִהְיוֹת לְךָ לֵאלֹהִים וּלְזַרְעֲךָ אַחֲרֶיךָ״, לְהַבְחִין בֵּין זַרְעוֹ שֶׁל רִאשׁוֹן לְזַרְעוֹ שֶׁל שֵׁנִי.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said Shmuel said: due to that the verse states “To be a God to you and your seed after you” to distinguish between the seed of the first and the seed of the second
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said in the name of Shmuel, because the verse states: "To be your God and the seed after you," to distinguish between the seed of the first generation and the seed of the second generation.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רָבָא: לְפִיכָךְ גֵּר וְגִיּוֹרֶת צְרִיכִין לְהַמְתִּין שְׁלֹשָׁה חֳדָשִׁים, הָכָא מַאי לְהַבְחִין אִיכָּא?
human_translation: Rava raised an objection Therefore, a male convert and a female convert need to wait three months Here, what is there to distinguish?
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: Therefore, a convert and a female convert require to wait three months, what is the distinction here?

hebrew_text: הָכָא נָמֵי, אִיכָּא לְהַבְחִין בֵּין זֶרַע שֶׁנִּזְרַע בִּקְדוּשָּׁה לְזֶרַע שֶׁלֹּא נִזְרַע בִּקְדוּשָּׁה.
human_translation: Here, too, there is to distinguish between seed that was sown in sanctity, and seed that was not sown in sanctity,
llm_translation: Here is the translation of the Talmudic text you provided: Talmudic text: Here we say, there is a distinction between seed that was sown in holiness and seed that was not sown in holiness.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: גְּזֵירָה שֶׁמָּא יִשָּׂא אֶת אֲחוֹתוֹ מֵאָבִיו, וִייַבֵּם אֵשֶׁת אָחִיו מֵאִמּוֹ.
human_translation: Rava stated decree lest marrying his paternal sister, or consummating a levirate marriage with the wife of his maternal brother
llm_translation: Rava said: A decree lest he marry his sister from his father, and perform levirate marriage with his brother's wife from his mother.

hebrew_text: וְיוֹצִיא אֶת אִמּוֹ לַשּׁוּק. וְיִפְטוֹר אֶת יְבִמְתּוֹ לַשּׁוּק.
human_translation: Or he would cause his mother to go out to the public Or, permit yevama to the public.
llm_translation: And he shall take out his mother to the marketplace. And he shall release his yevamah to the marketplace.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַב חֲנַנְיָה: בְּכוּלָּן אֲנִי קוֹרֵא בָּהֶן מִשּׁוּם תַּקָּנַת עֶרְוָה, וְכָאן מִשּׁוּם תַּקָּנַת וָלָד. וְאִם אִיתָא, כּוּלְּהוּ מִשּׁוּם תַּקָּנַת עֶרְוָה!
human_translation: Rav Ḥananya raised an objection In all of those I identify due to an ordinance forbidden relations, and here, due to an ordinance for the offspring. And if it is so all of the due to an ordinance forbidden relations.
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: Rav Chananya challenges: In all those cases I read them as related to the prohibition of incest, but here it is related to the prohibition of causing a child to be born. And if it comes to that, all of them are related to the prohibition of incest!

hebrew_text: הַאי מִשּׁוּם תַּקָּנַת וָלָד, דְּלָא לִפְגַע בְּהוּ עֶרְוָה.
human_translation: this due to an ordinance for the offspring, that will not encounter forbidden relations.
llm_translation: This is because of the decree of a newborn, so as not to come into contact with nakedness.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא תַּמְתִּין שְׁנֵי חֳדָשִׁים וְתִנָּשֵׂא — לָא, דְּהַיְינוּ סְפֵיקָא: אִי בַּר תִּשְׁעָה לְקַמָּא, אִי בַּר שִׁבְעָה לְבָתְרָא.
human_translation: Granted, she should not wait two months and marry, as this is an uncertainty whether is nine old, of the first whether seven old of the latter
llm_translation: In peace, two months are completed and she may be married - no, for this is a doubt: whether it is the ninth month from the beginning or the seventh month from the end.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא תַּמְתִּין חֹדֶשׁ אֶחָד וְתִנָּשֵׂא, וְאִי לְשִׁבְעָה יָלְדָה — הַאי בַּר שִׁבְעָה לְבָתְרָא הוּא. וְאִי לִתְמָנְיָא יָלְדָה — הַאי בַּר תִּשְׁעָה לְקַמָּא הוּא!
human_translation: However, let her wait one month and marry, and if after seven she gives birth, is seven old is of the latter and if after eight she gives birth, this is nine old and is of the first
llm_translation: Rather, wait one month and she will conceive, and if she gave birth after seven months — this child is a son of seven months. And if she gave birth after eight months — this child is a son of nine months!

hebrew_text: אִי נָמֵי לִתְמָנְיָא יָלְדָה, אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר דְּבָתְרָא הוּא. דִּלְמָא אִישְׁתַּהוֹיֵי אִישְׁתַּהַי חֹדֶשׁ אֶחָד וְאִיעַבַּר.
human_translation: Even if she gave birth after eight one could say that of the latter perhaps she waited one month and conceived
llm_translation: If she gave birth after eight months, it is possible to say that it is a case of a subsequent child. Perhaps her husband was her husband for only one month and she conceived.

hebrew_text: וְתַמְתִּין שְׁנֵי חֳדָשִׁים וּמֶחֱצָה וְתִנָּשֵׂא, דְּאִי לְשִׁבְעָה יָלְדָה — הַאי בַּר שִׁבְעָה לְבָתְרָא הוּא, וְאִי לְשִׁיתָּא וּפַלְגָא יָלְדָה — הַאי בַּר תִּשְׁעָה לְקַמָּא הוּא. דְּאִי בַּר בָּתְרָא הוּא — בַּר שִׁיתָּא וּפַלְגָא לָא חָיֵי!
human_translation: But let her wait for two and a half months and marry, as, if after seven she gives birth, this is seven old and is of the latter And if after six and a half she gives birth, this is nine old is of the first if it is of the latter six and a half old, which cannot survive.
llm_translation: And she completes two months and a half and conceives, for if she gave birth after seven months - this child is considered after seven months, and if she gave birth after six and a half months - this child is considered after nine months. For if it is after the latter time - the child is not viable!

hebrew_text: אִי נָמֵי לְשִׁיתָּא וּפַלְגָא יָלְדָה, אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר דְּבָתְרָא הוּא, דְּאָמַר מָר זוּטְרָא: אֲפִילּוּ לְמַאן דְּאָמַר יוֹלֶדֶת לְתִשְׁעָה אֵינָהּ יוֹלֶדֶת לִמְקוּטָּעִין, יָלְדָה לְשִׁבְעָה — יוֹלֶדֶת לִמְקוּטָּעִין.
human_translation: Even if after six and a half she gave birth, one could say that of the latter as Mar Zutra said: Even according to the one who says a woman who gives birth after nine does not give birth after an incomplete a woman who gives birth after seven months can give birth after an incomplete
llm_translation: If a woman gave birth to a premature baby after seven months, there is room to say that it is considered a viable birth, as the Master Zutra said: Even according to the opinion that a baby born after nine months is not considered viable, if she gave birth after seven months, it is considered viable.

hebrew_text: שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיְהִי לִתְקֻפוֹת הַיָּמִים״, מִעוּט ״תְּקוּפוֹת״ — שְׁתַּיִם, מִעוּט ״יָמִים״ — שְׁנַיִם.
human_translation: as it is stated: “And it came to pass, when the seasons of the days had come, The minimal sense of “seasons” is two, The minimal sense of “days” is two.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: As it is stated: "And it came to pass at the end of days," from the word "tekufot" - two, from the word "yamim" - two. English translation:

hebrew_text: וְתַמְתִּין מַשֶּׁהוּ וְתִנָּשֵׂא, וְכִי מָלוּ שְׁלֹשָׁה חֳדָשִׁים — לִבְדְּקַהּ!
human_translation: But let her wait any amount and marry, and when three months are complete, examine her
llm_translation: And they waited for a while, and it was lifted up. And if three months have passed - examine it!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב סָפְרָא: אֵין בּוֹדְקִין אֶת הַנְּשׂוּאוֹת, שֶׁלֹּא יִתְגַּנּוּ עַל בַּעֲלֵיהֶן. וְנִבְדְּקַהּ בְּהִלּוּכַהּ!
human_translation: Rav Safra said: one does not examine married women so as not to shame them before their husbands. But let her be examined through the way she walks,
llm_translation: Rav Safra said: One does not inspect the married women, so as not to cause embarrassment to their husbands. And she should be examined while walking!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָמֵי בַּר חָמָא: אִשָּׁה מְחַפָּה עַצְמָהּ, כְּדֵי שֶׁיִּירַשׁ בְּנָהּ בְּנִכְסֵי בַעֲלָהּ.
human_translation: Rami bar Ḥama said: A woman mask herself in order that her child will inherit her husband’s property.
llm_translation: Ramei bar Ḥama said: A woman who conceals herself, in order for her son to inherit her husband's property.

hebrew_text: הֵיכָא דְּקִים לַן דִּמְעוּבֶּרֶת הִיא, תִּנָּשֵׂא! אַלְּמָה תַּנְיָא: לֹא יִשָּׂא אָדָם מְעוּבֶּרֶת חֲבֵרוֹ וּמֵינֶקֶת חֲבֵרוֹ. וְאִם נָשָׂא — יוֹצִיא וְלֹא יַחְזִיר עוֹלָמִית!
human_translation: where we are convinced that she is pregnant, let her marry Why, is it taught A man may not marry a woman who is pregnant of another nor a woman who is nursing of another and if he married he must divorce and may never take back?
llm_translation: Here where it is established for us that it is a transgression, let it be lifted up! Why is it taught: A person should not lift up the transgression of his fellow and nurse the transgression of his fellow. And if he does lift it up — he should remove it and not return it eternally!

hebrew_text: גְּזֵרָה שֶׁמָּא תַּעֲשֶׂה עוּבָּרָהּ סַנְדָּל. אִי הָכִי, דִּידֵיהּ נָמֵי!
human_translation: decree lest her fetus will be deformed a sandal fish. If so, even his own
llm_translation: Decree lest she make her sandal a miscarriage. If so, her blood is also forfeit!

hebrew_text: אִי לְמַאן דְּאָמַר בְּמוֹךְ — בְּמוֹךְ, וְאִי לְמַאן דְּאָמַר מִן הַשָּׁמַיִם יְרַחֲמוּ — מִן הַשָּׁמַיִם יְרַחֲמוּ.
human_translation: if in accordance with the one who said using a resorbent using a resorbent, and if in accordance with the one who said Heaven will have mercy Heaven will have mercy
llm_translation: To whomsoever says "with a measure" - with a measure, and to whomsoever says "from heaven they shall have mercy" - from heaven they shall have mercy.

hebrew_text: הָכָא נָמֵי: אִי לְמַאן דְּאָמַר בְּמוֹךְ — בְּמוֹךְ, אִי לְמַאן דְּאָמַר מִן הַשָּׁמַיִם יְרַחֲמוּ — מִן הַשָּׁמַיִם יְרַחֲמוּ!
human_translation: here, too, if in accordance with the one who says using a resorbent, using a resorbent, and if in accordance with the one who says Heaven will have mercy Heaven will have mercy
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Here they say: If according to the one who says "b'moch" - b'moch, if according to the one who says "min hashamayim yerachamu" - min hashamayim yerachamu!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, מִשּׁוּם דַּחְסָה. אִי הָכִי, דִּידֵיהּ נָמֵי! דִּידֵיהּ — חָיֵיס עִילָּוֵיהּ. הָכָא נָמֵי: חָיֵיס עִילָּוֵיהּ!
human_translation: Rather, due to the pressure If so, even his own his own he has mercy upon it here, too, he will have mercy upon it,
llm_translation: Rather, because of fear. If so, his own as well! His own - his fear is upon him. Here too: his fear is upon him!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: סְתָם מְעוּבֶּרֶת לְמֵנִיקָה קַיְימָא,
human_translation: Rather, a typical pregnant woman is poised to nurse
llm_translation: Rather: a closed womb is established for nursing.

hebrew_text: דִּלְמָא אִיעַבַּרָה וּמִעֲכַר חַלְבַהּ, וְקָטְלָה לֵיהּ. אִי הָכִי, דִּידֵיהּ נָמֵי! דִּידֵיהּ — מְמַסְמְסָא לֵיהּ בְּבֵיצִים. וְחָלָב דִּידַהּ נָמֵי, מְמַסְמְסָא לֵיהּ בְּבֵצִים וְחָלָב! לָא יָהֵב לַהּ בַּעַל. (וְלִיתְבְּעִינֵיהּ) [וְתִתְבְּעִינְהוּ] לְיוֹרְשִׁים! אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: אִשָּׁה בּוֹשָׁה לָבֹא לְבֵית דִּין, וְהוֹרֶגֶת אֶת בְּנָהּ.
human_translation: perhaps she will become pregnant and her milk will dry up and kill If so, even his own his own she will feed [ memasmesa ] him with eggs and milk her she will also feed him with eggs and milk. The husband will not give her But she could sue heirs Abaye said: A woman is embarrassed to come to court, and she kills her son
llm_translation: Perhaps it will pass through and spoil its milk, and it will kill it. If so, its own is also spoiled! Its own - it feeds it with eggs. And its milk is also spoiled, it feeds it with eggs and milk! The husband should not give it to her. And they should be given to the heirs! Abaye said: A woman is ashamed to go to court, and she kills her son.

hebrew_text: אַחַת בְּתוּלוֹת וְאַחַת בְּעוּלוֹת. הֵי נִיהוּ בְּתוּלוֹת וְהֵי נִיהוּ אֲרוּסוֹת? הֵי נִיהוּ בְּעוּלוֹת וְהֵי נִיהוּ נְשׂוּאוֹת?
human_translation: both to virgins and non-virgins, Which are virgins and which are betrothed? which are non-virgins and which are married,
llm_translation: One woman with virgins and one woman with married women. Is it permissible with virgins and is it permissible with engaged women? Is it permissible with married women and is it permissible with married women?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה, הָכִי קָאָמַר: אַחַת בְּתוּלוֹת וְאַחַת בְּעוּלוֹת שֶׁנִּתְאַרְמְלוּ אוֹ שֶׁנִּתְגָּרְשׁוּ, בֵּין מִן הָאֵרוּסִין בֵּין מִן הַנִּשּׂוּאִין.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda said this is what is saying: to both virgins and non-virgins who were widowed or divorced, whether from betrothal or from marriage,
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yehuda, thus he said: One with virgins and one with married women who were either widowed or divorced, whether from betrothal or from marriage.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר לָא עָל לְבֵי מִדְרְשָׁא. אַשְׁכְּחֵיהּ לְרַבִּי אַסִּי, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַאי אֲמוּר רַבָּנַן בְּבֵי מִדְרְשָׁא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ, הָכִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar did not enter the study hall He found Rabbi Asi said to him: What was said by the Sages in the study hall He said to him: This Rabbi Yoḥanan said: halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yosei
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar did not come to the study hall. He found Rabbi Assi, and said to him: What do the Sages say in the study hall? He said to him, thus said Rabbi Yochanan: The halakha is according to Rabbi Yosei.

hebrew_text: מִכְּלָל דִּיחִידָאָה פְּלִיג עֲלֵיהּ? אִין, וְהָתַנְיָא: הֲרֵי שֶׁהָיְתָה רְדוּפָה לֵילֵךְ לְבֵית אָבִיהָ, אוֹ שֶׁהָיָה לָהּ כַּעַס בְּבֵית בַּעְלָהּ, אוֹ שֶׁהָיָה בַּעְלָהּ חָבוּשׁ בְּבֵית הָאֲסוּרִין, אוֹ שֶׁהָיָה בַּעְלָהּ זָקֵן אוֹ חוֹלֶה, אוֹ שֶׁהָיְתָה הִיא חוֹלָה,
human_translation: From the fact that an individual disagrees with him, Yes, and so it is taught one pursued, to go to her father’s house, or because she had anger in her husband’s house, or because her husband had been incarcerated in prison, or because her husband was elderly or infirm, or because she was infirm.
llm_translation: From the principle of "dichida" does he argue on it? No, and it was taught: If she was pursued to go to her father's house, or if she had anger in her husband's house, or if her husband was imprisoned in the house of the jailers, or if her husband was old or sick, or if she herself was sick,

hebrew_text: אוֹ שֶׁהִפִּילָה אַחַר מִיתַת בַּעְלָהּ, אוֹ שֶׁהָיְתָה עֲקָרָה, אוֹ זְקֵנָה, אוֹ קְטַנָּה, אוֹ אַיְלוֹנִית, אוֹ שֶׁאֵינָהּ רְאוּיָה לֵילֵד — צְרִיכָה לְהַמְתִּין שְׁלֹשָׁה חֳדָשִׁים, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה מַתִּיר לֵיאָרֵס וְלִינָּשֵׂא מִיָּד.
human_translation: Or because she miscarried after her husband’s death, or because she was barren, or elderly, or a minor, or a sexually underdeveloped woman [ aylonit ], or she was unsuited to give birth; she must wait three months. the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda permits to be betrothed or to marry immediately.
llm_translation: Or that she miscarried after the death of her husband, or she was barren, or old, or young, or a minor, or a virgin, or she is not fit to give birth - she must wait three months, the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda permits engagement and marriage immediately.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא: חָזַר בּוֹ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן. אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: אִי הֲדַר בֵּיהּ — מִמַּתְנִיתִין דְּכַרְמָא הֲדַר בֵּיהּ. דְּתַנְיָא: אָמַר רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בְּנוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן בְּרוֹקָה, שָׁמַעְתִּי מִפִּי חֲכָמִים בַּכֶּרֶם בְּיַבְנֶה: כּוּלָּן צְרִיכוֹת לְהַמְתִּין שְׁלֹשָׁה חֳדָשִׁים.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said: Rabbi Yoḥanan retracted Rav Yosef said: if he retract he retract from the baraita of the vineyard As it is taught Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Beroka, said: I heard from the mouth of the Sages in the vineyard of Yavne all need to wait three months.
llm_translation: Rabbi Hiyya bar Abba said: Rabbi Yochanan repeated it. Rav Yosef said: If he repeated it - he repeated it from the Mishnah of the vineyard. As it was taught: Rabbi Yishmael, the son of Rabbi Yochanan ben Brokah, said, "I heard from the Sages in the vineyard of Yavneh: All of them require waiting three months."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה לְרַבִּי זְרִיקָא: כִּי עָיְילַתְּ לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי אֲבָהוּ, רְמִי לֵיהּ: מִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי? וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הֲלָכָה כִּסְתַם מִשְׁנָה. וּתְנַן: כׇּל הַנָּשִׁים לֹא יִנָּשְׂאוּ וְלֹא יִתְאָרְסוּ עַד שֶׁיְּהוּ לָהֶם שְׁלֹשָׁה חֳדָשִׁים, אַחַת בְּתוּלוֹת וְאַחַת בְּעוּלוֹת!
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya said to Rabbi Zerika: When you come before Rabbi Abbahu, raise the contradiction: Did Rabbi Yoḥanan say halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yosei? Didn’t Rabbi Yoḥanan say halakha is in accordance with an unattributed mishna? And we learned All women may not marry and may not be betrothed until they have three months both virgins and non-virgins.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rabbi Yirmeya to Rabbi Zerika: When you went to stand before Rabbi Avahu, ask him: Who said that the halakha follows Rabbi Yosei? But didn't Rabbi Yochanan say: The halakha follows the anonymous Mishnah. And we learned: All women may not be married or betrothed until they have three months, one for virgins and one for those who are married!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: דִּרְמָא לָךְ הָא — לָא חַשׁ לְקִמְחֵיהּ. סְתָם וְאַחַר כָּךְ מַחְלוֹקֶת הִיא, וְאֵין הֲלָכָה כִּסְתָם. דְּאָמַר רַב פָּפָּא, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מַחְלוֹקֶת וְאַחַר כָּךְ סְתָם — הֲלָכָה כִּסְתָם. סְתָם וְאַחַר כָּךְ מַחְלוֹקֶת — אֵין הֲלָכָה כִּסְתָם.
human_translation: said to him: who raised this contradiction to you is not concerned for his flour; is an unattributed followed by a dispute halakha is not in accordance with the unattributed opinion. As Rav Pappa said, and some say Rabbi Yoḥanan a dispute, and afterward an unattributed opinion, halakha is in accordance with the unattributed opinion. an unattributed opinion and afterward a dispute, the halakha is not in accordance with the unattributed opinion.
llm_translation: He said to him: "This is like you - it does not concern his flour." It is a dispute in general, and afterwards it is a dispute, and the law is not like the general rule. For Rav Papa said, and it is taught by Rabbi Yochanan: A dispute and afterwards a general rule - the law is like the general rule. A general rule and afterwards a dispute - the law is not like the general rule.

hebrew_text: מִסְתְּמִיךְ וְאָזֵיל רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ אַכַּתְפֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי נַחוּם שַׁמָּעֵיהּ, מְנַקֵּיט וְאָזֵיל הִלְכָתָא מִינֵּיהּ. בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ: מַחְלוֹקֶת וְאַחַר כָּךְ סְתָם מַאי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הֲלָכָה כִּסְתָם. סְתָם וְאַחַר כָּךְ מַחְלוֹקֶת מַאי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֵין הֲלָכָה כִּסְתָם.
human_translation: Rabbi Abbahu would walk while leaning upon the shoulder of Rabbi Naḥum, his attendant, walk and gather halakhic rulings from him. asked him: a dispute, and afterward an unattributed opinion, what said to him: halakha is in accordance with the unattributed opinion. an unattributed opinion and afterward a dispute, what said to him: halakha is not in accordance with the unattributed opinion.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Mistamich and Azil, Rabbi Avahu Akatpeih d'Rabbi Nachum Shamaei, Menaket and Azil Hilchata mineih. Be'a mineih: Machloket ve'achar kach setam mai? Amar lei: Halacha kistam. Setam ve'achar kach machloket mai? Amar lei: Ein halacha kistam."

hebrew_text: סְתָמָא דְּמַתְנִיתִין וּמַחְלוֹקֶת בְּבָרַיְיתָא, מַאי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הֲלָכָה כִּסְתָם. מַחְלוֹקֶת בְּמַתְנִיתִין וּסְתָמָא בְּבָרַיְיתָא, מַאי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ:
human_translation: the Mishna as unattributed and a dispute in a baraita , what said to him: halakha is in accordance with unattributed opinion the Mishna a dispute, and an unattributed opinion in a baraita , what said to him:
llm_translation: The anonymous Mishnah and a dispute in a Baraita, what is it? He said to him: The halakha is like the anonymous. A dispute in the Mishnah and an anonymous in a Baraita, what is it? He said to him:

hebrew_text: וְכִי רַבִּי לֹא שְׁנָאָהּ, רַבִּי חִיָּיא מִנַּיִן לוֹ?
human_translation: If Rabbi had not taught from where would Rabbi Ḥiyya, have it?
llm_translation: And when Rabbi did not change it, from where did Rabbi Chiya know it?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ, וְהָא תְּנַן: מַסְרֵק שֶׁל פִּשְׁתָּן שֶׁנִּיטְּלוּ שִׁינָּיו, וְנִשְׁתַּיְּירוּ בּוֹ שְׁתַּיִם — טְמֵאוֹת, וְאַחַת — טְהוֹרָה. וְכוּלָּן שֶׁנִּיטְּלוּ אַחַת אַחַת בִּפְנֵי עַצְמָן — טְמֵאוֹת.
human_translation: said to Didn’t we learn A comb for flax which its teeth were removed and two remained in it, ritually impure one ritually pure And any that were individually removed on their own, ritually impure.
llm_translation: He said to him, but we learned in a Mishnah: A linen bandage that had its teeth removed, and two remained in it - they are unclean, and one - is clean. And all of them, if one by one they had their teeth removed separately - they are unclean.

hebrew_text: שֶׁל צֶמֶר שֶׁנִּיטְּלוּ שִׁינָּיו אַחַת מִבֵּינְתַיִם — טָהוֹר. נִשְׁתַּיְּירוּ בּוֹ שְׁלֹשׁ בְּמָקוֹם אֶחָד — טָמֵא. הָיְתָה הַחִיצוֹנָה אַחַת מֵהֶן — טָהוֹר. נִיטְּלוּ שְׁנַיִם וַעֲשָׂאָן לְמַלְקֵט — טְמֵאוֹת. אַחַת וְהִתְקִינָהּ לְנֵר אוֹ לְמִיתּוּחַ — טְמֵאָה.
human_translation: for wool from which every other one of its teeth were removed, ritually pure. three remained in it in a single place ritually impure. one of those was the external ritually pure. two were removed and made into pincers, ritually impure. one and it was prepared for an oil lamp or for stretching ritually impure.
llm_translation: Of wool that they removed one of its two teeth - pure. If three remained in one place - impure. If the outer one was one of them - pure. If two were removed and made into a wick - impure. If one and it was prepared for a lamp or for a wick - impure.

hebrew_text: וְקַיְימָא לַן דְּאֵין הֲלָכָה כְּאוֹתָהּ מִשְׁנָה! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בַּר מִינַּהּ דְּהַהִיא, דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ דְּאָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ: זוֹ אֵינָהּ מִשְׁנָה.
human_translation: But we maintain that halakha is not in accordance with that mishna. said to apart from this as Rabbi Yoḥanan and Reish Lakish who both say: This is not mishna,
llm_translation: And it is established for us that the halakha does not follow that Mishnah! He said to him: In the category of that, of Rabbi Yochanan and Reish Lakish who both said: This is not a Mishnah.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא? אָמַר רַב הוּנָא בַּר מָנוֹחַ מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב אִידִי בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִיקָא: מִשּׁוּם דְּקַשְׁיָא רֵישָׁא לְסֵיפָא. דְּקָתָנֵי: שֶׁל צֶמֶר שֶׁנִּיטְּלוּ שִׁינָּיו אַחַת מִבֵּינְתַיִם — טָהוֹר. הָא נִשְׁתַּיְּירוּ בּוֹ שְׁתַּיִם בְּמָקוֹם אֶחָד — טָמֵא, וַהֲדַר תָּנֵי נִשְׁתַּיְּירוּ בּוֹ שְׁלֹשׁ — טָמֵא. שָׁלֹשׁ — אִין, שְׁתַּיִם — לָא!
human_translation: What is the reason Rav Huna bar Manoaḥ said in the name of Rav Idi, son of Rav Ika: because the first clause contradicts the latter clause, as it teaches: for wool from which every other one of its teeth were removed ritually pure. This were two to remain in it in one place, ritually impure. And then continues and teaches: three remained in it in a single place ritually impure. three, yes, two, no,
llm_translation: What is the reason? Rav Huna son of Manoah said in the name of Rav Idi son of Ika: Because the beginning is difficult for the end. As it is taught: If two threads of wool were removed from a woolen garment, one from between two, it is pure. But if two were left in one place, it is impure. And then it teaches: If three were left in one place, it is impure. Three - no, two - yes!

hebrew_text: וּמַאי קוּשְׁיָא? דִּלְמָא הָא בְּגַוּוֹיָיתָא, הָא בְּבָרָיְיתָא.
human_translation: But what difficulty? Perhaps this the internal that the outer
llm_translation: And what is the question? Perhaps this one is in the case of a Gentile, while this one is in the case of a Jew.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מֵהָכָא, דְּקָתָנֵי: וְכוּלָּן שֶׁנִּיטְּלוּ אַחַת אַחַת בִּפְנֵי עַצְמָן — טְמֵאוֹת, וְאַף עַל גַּב דְּלֹא הִתְקִינָהּ. אֵימָא סֵיפָא: אַחַת וְהִתְקִינָהּ לְנֵר אוֹ לְמִיתּוּחַ — טְמֵאָה. הִתְקִינָהּ — אִין, לֹא הִתְקִינָהּ — לָא!
human_translation: Rather, from here, as it teaches: And any that were individually removed on their own, ritually impure. And even though was not prepared say the latter clause one and it was prepared for an oil lamp or for stretching ritually impure. it was prepared yes, it was not prepared no,
llm_translation: Rather, from here, as it is taught: "And all of them that were taken one by one by themselves - they are impure, even though it was not established." Say the latter part: "If one was taken and it was established for a lamp or for kindling - it is impure. If it was established - no, if it was not established - no!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: וּמַאי קוּשְׁיָא? דִּלְמָא הָא בְּקַתַּיְיהוּ, הָא בְּלָא קַתַּיְיהוּ.
human_translation: Abaye said: But what difficulty? Perhaps this with their base, that without their base
llm_translation: Abaye said: And what is the difficulty? Perhaps this one is with their bundles, and that one is without their bundles.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: וּמַאי קוּשְׁיָא? וְדִלְמָא הָא בְּקַטִּינָתָא, הָא בְּאַלִּימָתָא.
human_translation: Rav Pappa stated But what difficulty? Perhaps this were narrow, that were thick.
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: And what is the difficulty? Perhaps this one is in the small basket, and that one is in the large basket.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם דִּמְסַיְּימִי בָּהּ דַּוְוקָנֵי: זוֹ רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן.
human_translation: Rather, because those who are exact conclude This is Rabbi Shimon.
llm_translation: Rather, because it concludes with the word "davkanei," this refers to Rabbi Shimon.

hebrew_text: שָׁלַח רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אָבִין: מְאָרְסִין תּוֹךְ שְׁלֹשָׁה, וְכֵן עוֹשִׂים מַעֲשֶׂה.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Avin sent One may betroth within three and so one acts in practice.
llm_translation: Sent Rabbi Chiya bar Avin: Betrothing within three, and likewise they do the deed.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן הָיָה רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר מְלַמְּדֵנוּ מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי חֲנִינָא הַגָּדוֹל: רוּבּוֹ שֶׁל רִאשׁוֹן, וְרוּבּוֹ שֶׁל שְׁלִישִׁי, וְאֶמְצָעִי שָׁלֵם.
human_translation: And so Rabbi Elazar would teach us in the name of Rabbi Ḥanina the Great the majority of the first and the majority of the third and the entire middle
llm_translation: And so was Rabbi Elazar teaching us in the name of Rabbi Chanina the Great: The majority of the first, and the majority of the third, and the middle is complete.

hebrew_text: אַמֵּימָר שְׁרָא לֵיאָרֵס בְּיוֹם תִּשְׁעִים. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אָשֵׁי לְאַמֵּימָר: וְהָא רַב וּשְׁמוּאֵל דְּאָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ: צְרִיכָה לְהַמְתִּין שְׁלֹשָׁה חֳדָשִׁים, חוּץ מִיּוֹם שֶׁמֵּת בּוֹ וְחוּץ מִיּוֹם שֶׁנִּתְאָרְסָה בּוֹ! הַהוּא — לְעִנְיַן מֵינֶקֶת אִיתְּמַר, דְּרַב וּשְׁמוּאֵל דְּאָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ: צְרִיכָה לְהַמְתִּין עֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבָּעָה חֹדֶשׁ, חוּץ מִיּוֹם שֶׁנּוֹלַד בּוֹ, וְחוּץ מִיּוֹם שֶׁנִּתְאָרְסָה בּוֹ.
human_translation: Ameimar permitted one to betroth on the ninetieth day Rav Ashi said to Ameimar: Didn’t Rav and Shmuel both say she needs to wait three months, excluding the day on which died and excluding the day on which she is betrothed? That was stated with regard to a nursing woman, as Rav and Shmuel who both said: needs to wait twenty-four months excluding the day on which was born and excluding the day on which she is betrothed.
llm_translation: Ammemar betrothed her on the ninetieth day. Rav Ashe said to Ammemar: But didn't Rav and Shmuel both say: She must wait three months, except for the day on which she died and the day on which she was betrothed! That case - regarding a nursing woman - was stated, for Rav and Shmuel both said: She must wait twenty-four months, except for the day on which she gave birth and the day on which she was betrothed.

hebrew_text: וְהָא הָהוּא דַּעֲבַד סְעוּדַת אֵירוּסִין בְּיוֹם תִּשְׁעִים, וְאַפְסְדֵיהּ רָבָא לִסְעוֹדְתֵּיהּ! הָהִיא, סְעוּדַת נִשּׂוּאִין הֲוַאי.
human_translation: Wasn’t a certain who prepared a betrothal feast on the ninetieth day and Rava caused him to forfeit his feast That was a marriage feast,
llm_translation: And this one who made a wedding feast on the ninetieth day, and Rava caused him a loss for his feast! That one, it was a feast of newlyweds.

hebrew_text: וְהִלְכְתָא: צְרִיכָה לְהַמְתִּין עֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבָּעָה חוֹדֶשׁ — חוּץ מִיּוֹם שֶׁנּוֹלַד בּוֹ, וְחוּץ מִיּוֹם שֶׁנִּתְאָרְסָה בּוֹ. וּצְרִיכָה לְהַמְתִּין שְׁלֹשָׁה חֳדָשִׁים — חוּץ מִיּוֹם שֶׁמֵּת בּוֹ, וְחוּץ מִיּוֹם שֶׁנִּתְאָרְסָה בּוֹ.
human_translation: The halakha is needs to wait twenty-four months, excluding the day on which was born and excluding the day on which she is betrothed. And she needs to wait three months, excluding the day on which died and excluding the day on which she is betrothed.
llm_translation: The Halakha: She must wait twenty-four months - except for the day on which she gave birth, and except for the day on which she became engaged. And she must wait three months - except for the day on which he died, and except for the day on which she became engaged.

hebrew_text: חוּץ מִן הָאַלְמָנָה וְכוּ׳. אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא קַל וָחוֹמֶר: וּמָה בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁאָסוּר לְכַבֵּס, מוּתָּר לֵיאָרֵס. מְקוֹם שֶׁמּוּתָּר לְכַבֵּס — אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁמּוּתָּר לֵיאָרֵס?!
human_translation: except for a widow, Rav Ḥisda said: a fortiori when it is prohibited to launder it is permitted to be betrothed, when it is permitted to launder isn’t it logical that it permitted to be betrothed?
llm_translation: Outside of the widow, etc. Rav Hisda said: A fortiori argument: And what in a place where it is forbidden to launder, it is permitted to comb? In a place where it is permitted to launder - is it not logical that it is permitted to comb?!

hebrew_text: מַאי הִיא, דִּתְנַן: שַׁבָּת שֶׁחָל תִּשְׁעָה בְּאָב בְּתוֹכָהּ — אָסוּר לְסַפֵּר וּלְכַבֵּס, וּבַחֲמִישִׁי — מוּתָּר, מִפְּנֵי כְּבוֹד הַשַּׁבָּת. וְתַנְיָא: קוֹדֶם הַזְּמַן הַזֶּה — הָעָם מְמַעֲטִין בְּעִסְקֵיהֶם, מִלִּישָּׂא וּמִלִּיתֵּן, מִלִּבְנוֹת וְלִנְטוֹעַ. וּמְאָרְסִין אֲבָל לֹא כּוֹנְסִין, וְאֵין עוֹשִׂין סְעוּדַת אֵירוּסִין.
human_translation: What is As we learned the week in which the Ninth of Av occurs, it is prohibited to cut and to launder but on Thursday it is permitted in deference to Shabbat. And it is taught Prior to this time the public reduce their activities, from business transactions, from building and planting, and they may betroth but may not marry and they may not make a betrothal feast.
llm_translation: What is it? As we learned: If Shabbat falls on the ninth of Av, within it - it is forbidden to count and to launder, but on Thursday it is permitted, due to the honor of Shabbat. And it was taught: Before this time - the people decrease their activities, from buying and selling, from building and planting. They may become engaged, but not have the wedding feast of betrothal.

hebrew_text: כִּי תַּנְיָא הָהִיא, קוֹדֶם דְּקוֹדֶם (תַּנְיָא).
human_translation: When that is taught, it is taught prior to prior
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: "Before 'before' (it was taught)."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: וְקוֹדֶם דְּקוֹדֶם נָמֵי קַל וָחוֹמֶר: וּמָה בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁאָסוּר לִישָּׂא וְלִיתֵּן — מוּתָּר לֵיאָרֵס, מְקוֹם שֶׁמּוּתָּר לִישָּׂא וְלִיתֵּן — אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁמּוּתָּר לֵיאָרֵס?!
human_translation: Rava said: prior to prior also a fortiori when it is prohibited to conduct business transactions, it is permitted to be betrothed, when it is permitted to conduct business transactions, isn’t it logical that it permitted to be betrothed?
llm_translation: Rava said: And before the prior, let us say a fortiori: And what in a place where it is forbidden to marry and to give in marriage — it is permitted to betroth, a place where it is permitted to marry and to give in marriage — is it not logical that it is permitted to betroth?!

hebrew_text: לָא תֵּימָא: דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר כׇּל הַנָּשִׁים יִתְאָרְסוּ, אֶלָּא אֵימָא: כָּל הַנָּשִׁים יִנָּשְׂאוּ.
human_translation: Do not say Rabbi Yosei says: All women may be betrothed rather, say: All women may be married
llm_translation: Do not say: that Rabbi Yosei says all women should be betrothed, rather say: all women should be married.

hebrew_text: וְלֵית לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי לְהַבְחִין?
human_translation: But does Rabbi Yosei not accept to distinguish
llm_translation: And there is no need for Rabbi Yosei to distinguish?

hebrew_text: לֵית לֵיהּ. וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: לְעוֹלָם אִית לֵיהּ, וְאֵימָא, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: כׇּל אֲרוּסוֹת גְּרוּשׁוֹת יִנָּשְׂאוּ.
human_translation: he does not accept And if you wish, say actually, he does accept And say: Rabbi Yosei says all who were betrothed divorced may be married
llm_translation: He does not have. And if you wish, say: He indeed has, and say, Rabbi Yosei says: All betrothed and divorced women may be married.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, הַיְינוּ רַבִּי יְהוּדָה? אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ נְשׂוּאָה לֵיאָרֵס. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה סָבַר: נְשׂוּאָה מוּתֶּרֶת לֵיאָרֵס. וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי סָבַר: נְשׂוּאָה אֲסוּרָה לֵיאָרֵס.
human_translation: If so, this is Rabbi Yehuda. There is between them married to be betrothed. Rabbi Yehuda holds it is permitted to betroth married And Rabbi Yosei holds it is prohibited to betroth married
llm_translation: So is this, is this Rabbi Yehuda? There is a difference between them regarding a married woman to a betrothed woman. Rabbi Yehuda holds: a married woman is permitted to a betrothed woman. And Rabbi Yosei holds: a married woman is forbidden to a betrothed woman.

hebrew_text: וְסָבַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי נְשׂוּאָה אֲסוּרָה לֵיאָרֵס? וְהָתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: כׇּל הַנָּשִׁים יִתְאָרְסוּ, חוּץ מִן הָאַלְמָנָה מִפְּנֵי הָאִיבּוּל, וְכַמָּה אִיבּוּל שֶׁלָּהּ — שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם. וְכוּלָּן לֹא יִנָּשְׂאוּ עַד שֶׁיְּהוּ לָהֶן שְׁלֹשָׁה חֳדָשִׁים.
human_translation: But does Rabbi Yosei hold it is prohibited to betroth married Isn’t it taught Rabbi Yosei says all women may be betrothed except for a widow, due to the mourning period and how long is her mourning period? thirty days. And none of them may be married until they have three months.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And Rabbi Yosei thought that a married woman is forbidden to a betrothed man? And it was taught: Rabbi Yosei says: All women may be betrothed, except for a widow due to the disgrace, and how long is her disgrace - thirty days. And all of them may not be married until they have three months.

hebrew_text: הַאי, מַאי קוּשְׁיָא? אִילֵּימָא דְּקָתָנֵי, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: כׇּל הַנָּשִׁים יִתְאָרְסוּ — מִי אַלִּימָא מִמַּתְנִיתִין, דְּאוֹקֵימְנָא בַּאֲרוּסוֹת גְּרוּשׁוֹת יִנָּשְׂאוּ, הָכָא נָמֵי: כׇּל אֲרוּסוֹת גְּרוּשׁוֹת יִנָּשְׂאוּ.
human_translation: What difficulty does this If we say that teaches: Rabbi Yosei says all women may be betrothed is stronger than the mishna that was established betrothed divorced may be married Here, too, all betrothed divorced may be married
llm_translation: This, what is the question? If you say that it is taught, Rabbi Yosei says: "All women will be betrothed" - do we say this from the Mishnah, that we establish that divorced women will be married, here it is stated: "All divorced women will be married."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מִסֵּיפָא, דְּקָתָנֵי: וְכוּלָּן לֹא יִנָּשְׂאוּ עַד שֶׁיְּהוּ לָהֶן שְׁלֹשָׁה חֳדָשִׁים. אִינְּסוֹבֵי הוּא דְּלָא, הָא אִיתְּרוֹסֵי — שַׁפִּיר דָּמֵי!
human_translation: Rather, from the latter clause that teaches: And none of them may marry until they have three months. marrying that not but betrothing seems well
llm_translation: Rather, from the latter part, as it is taught: "And all of them may not marry until they have three months." It is the betrothed who may not, but if they are engaged, it is fine!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: תָּרֵיץ וְאֵימָא הָכִי, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: כׇּל אֲרוּסוֹת גְּרוּשׁוֹת יִנָּשְׂאוּ, חוּץ מִן הָאַלְמָנָה, מִפְּנֵי הָאִיבּוּל. וְכַמָּה אִיבּוּל שֶׁלָּהּ — שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם. וּנְשׂוּאוֹת לֹא יִתְאָרְסוּ עַד שֶׁיְּהֵא לָהֶן שְׁלֹשָׁה חֳדָשִׁים.
human_translation: Rava said: Resolve and say this: Rabbi Yosei says all betrothed divorced may marry except for a widow, due to the mourning period And how long is her mourning period? thirty days. And married may not be betrothed until they have three months.
llm_translation: Rava said: "Let me explain and say as follows: Rabbi Yosei says: All divorced women may remarry, except for a widow, due to the disgrace. And how long is her disgrace? Thirty days. And engaged women may not be betrothed until they have three months."

hebrew_text: וְאַלְמָנָה מִן הָאֵירוּסִין מִי אִית לַהּ אִיבּוּל? וְהָתָנֵי, רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַמֵּי: אִשְׁתּוֹ אֲרוּסָה — לֹא אוֹנֵן וְלֹא מִיטַּמֵּא לָהּ. וְכֵן הִיא — לֹא אוֹנֶנֶת וְלֹא מִיטַּמְּאָה לוֹ. מֵתָה — אֵינוֹ יוֹרְשָׁהּ. מֵת הוּא — גּוֹבָה כְּתוּבָּתָהּ!
human_translation: But does a widow from betrothal have a mourning period Didn’t Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Ami teach wife betrothed he does not observe acute mourning and he is not to become ritually impure for her. And similarly, she does not observe acute mourning she does not become ritually impure for him. she dies, he does not inherit from her. he dies, she collects her marriage contract.
llm_translation: And a widow from the Erusin, who is her yibum? And it was taught, Rabbi Chiya bar Ami said: His betrothed wife - he does not perform levirate marriage with her, and he does not become impure for her. And likewise she - she does not perform levirate marriage, and she does not become impure for him. If she dies - he does not inherit her. If he dies - his obligation is fulfilled!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, תַּנָּאֵי הִיא. דְּתַנְיָא: מֵרֹאשׁ חֹדֶשׁ וְעַד הַתַּעֲנִית הָעָם מְמַעֲטִין מֵעִסְקֵיהֶן, מִלִּישָּׂא וּמִלִּיתֵּן, מִלִּבְנוֹת וְלִנְטוֹעַ, וּמִלֵּיאָרֵס וּמִלִּישָּׂא. שַׁבָּת שֶׁחָל תִּשְׁעָה בְּאָב בְּתוֹכָהּ — אָסוּר לְסַפֵּר וּלְכַבֵּס (וְאָסוּר לֵיאָרֵס). וְיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים: כׇּל הַחֹדֶשׁ אָסוּר.
human_translation: Rather, is tanna’im . As it is taught From the New Moon and until the fast the public reduces its activities, from business transactions, from building and planting, and from betrothing and marrying. the week in which the Ninth of Av occurs, it is prohibited to cut and to launder and it is prohibited to be betrothed. And some say: It is prohibited for the entire month.
llm_translation: Rather, it is taught in a Baraita: From the beginning of the month until the public fast, the people decrease their business activities, from buying and selling, from building and planting, and from betrothing and marrying. If the ninth of Av falls on Shabbat — it is forbidden to cut hair and do laundry (and it is forbidden to betroth). And some say: The entire month is forbidden.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב אָשֵׁי: מִמַּאי דְּלֵיאָרֵס, לֵיאָרֵס מַמָּשׁ? דִּלְמָא לְמִיעְבַּד סְעוּדַת אֵירוּסִין הוּא דְּאָסוּר, הָא לֵיאָרֵס — שַׁפִּיר דָּמֵי.
human_translation: Rav Ashi strongly objects to this: From where that to be betrothed, to actually betrothing? Perhaps it is to make a betrothal feast that is prohibited, but to be betrothed seems well
llm_translation: Challenges her Rav Ashe: From what is it that she is not betrothed, not betrothed literally? Perhaps it is because the betrothal feast of an Aramean is forbidden, but as for a Yares - it is fine.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, מִלִּישָּׂא (לִינָּשֵׂא) נָמֵי, לְמֶיעְבַּד סְעוּדַת נִשּׂוּאִין הוּא דְּאָסוּר, הָא לִישָּׂא שַׁפִּיר דָּמֵי? הָכִי הַשְׁתָּא?! בִּשְׁלָמָא נִשּׂוּאִין בְּלֹא סְעוּדָה — אִיכָּא שִׂמְחָה, אֶלָּא אֵירוּסִין בְּלֹא סְעוּדָה — מִי אִיכָּא שִׂמְחָה?
human_translation: If so, against marrying to marry, too, it is only to make a marriage feast that is prohibited, but to marry seems well How can be compared? Granted, a marriage, without a feast, there is joy, but a betrothal without a feast, is there joy?
llm_translation: If so, from the time of betrothal, to engage in a meal is it that is forbidden, but to betroth is it proper? Is it so now?! Regarding betrothal without a meal - there is joy, but regarding engagement without a meal - is there joy?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: שָׁאנֵי אֲבֵילוּת חֲדָשָׁה מֵאֲבֵילוּת יְשָׁנָה, וְשָׁאנֵי אֲבֵילוּת דְּרַבִּים מֵאֲבֵילוּת דְּיָחִיד.
human_translation: Rather, Rav Ashi stated New mourning, is different from old mourning, And the mourning of the public is different from the mourning of the individual,
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Ashe said: The mourning of a new mourner differs from the mourning of an old mourner, and the mourning of the many differs from the mourning of the individual.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אַרְבָּעָה אַחִין נְשׂוּאִין אַרְבַּע נָשִׁים וָמֵתוּ, אִם רָצָה הַגָּדוֹל שֶׁבָּהֶם לְיַיבֵּם אֶת כּוּלָּן — הָרְשׁוּת בְּיָדוֹ.
human_translation: four brothers married to four women and died If the eldest of wished to consummate the levirate marriage with all of he has permission
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: Four brothers who were married to four women and all of them died. If the eldest brother wishes to perform levirate marriage with all of them - the choice is in his hands.

hebrew_text: מִי שֶׁהָיָה נָשׂוּי לִשְׁתֵּי נָשִׁים וּמֵת — בִּיאָתָהּ אוֹ חֲלִיצָתָהּ שֶׁל אַחַת מֵהֶן פּוֹטֶרֶת צָרָתָהּ.
