human_translation: one who was married to two women and died intercourse or ḥalitza of one of releases her rival wife
llm_translation: One who was married to two women and died - the levirate marriage or the halitzah of one of them exempts her co-wife.

hebrew_text: הָיְתָה אַחַת כְּשֵׁרָה וְאַחַת פְּסוּלָה, אִם הָיָה חוֹלֵץ — חוֹלֵץ לַפְּסוּלָה, וְאִם הָיָה מְיַיבֵּם — מְיַיבֵּם לַכְּשֵׁרָה.
human_translation: one was fit and one was unfit, if he performs ḥalitza , he should perform ḥalitza with the unfit But if he consummates the levirate marriage, he may consummate the levirate marriage with fit.
llm_translation: One was valid and one was invalid, if he was performing chalitzah - he performs chalitzah for the invalid one, and if he was performing yibum - he performs yibum for the valid one.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אַרְבָּעָה אַחִין סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ? אֶלָּא אֵימָא: אַרְבָּעָה מֵאַחִין.
human_translation: enter your mind four brothers Rather, say Four of brothers
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates as follows: Talmudic text: "Is it really four brothers that have gone out of your mind? Rather say: Four from brothers."

hebrew_text: הָרְשׁוּת בְּיָדוֹ. וְשָׁבְקִי לֵיהּ? וְהָתַנְיָא: ״וְקָרְאוּ לוֹ זִקְנֵי עִירוֹ״ — הֵן וְלֹא שְׁלוּחָן. ״וְדִבְּרוּ אֵלָיו״ — מְלַמֵּד שֶׁמַּשִּׂיאִין לוֹ עֵצָה הוֹגֶנֶת לוֹ.
human_translation: he has permission Do they leave him Isn’t it taught “And the Elders of his city shall call him” they, and not their agent, “And they speak to him”; teaches that they offer him advice that is appropriate for him.
llm_translation: The permission is in his hand. And should we leave it? And it was taught: "And the elders of his city shall call him" — yes, but not a table. "And they shall speak to him" — this teaches that they should offer him sound advice.

hebrew_text: שֶׁאִם הָיָה הוּא יֶלֶד וְהִיא זְקֵנָה, הוּא זָקֵן וְהִיא יַלְדָּה, אוֹמְרִין לוֹ: מָה לְךָ אֵצֶל יַלְדָּה, מָה לְךָ אֵצֶל זְקֵנָה? כְּלָךְ אֵצֶל שֶׁכְּמוֹתְךָ, וְאַל תָּשִׂים קְטָטָה בְּבֵיתֶךָ.
human_translation: that if he was a young man and she an elderly woman he was an elderly man and she a young woman, they say to him: What do you with a young woman What do you with an elderly woman Go after your own kind, and do not place discord in your household
llm_translation: If he was a child and she was elderly, he is elderly and she is a child, they say to him: "What do you have with a child, what do you have with an elderly woman? Go to someone like yourself, and do not bring discord into your home."

hebrew_text: לָא צְרִיכָא, דְּאֶפְשָׁר לֵיהּ. אִי הָכִי, אֲפִילּוּ טוּבָא נָמֵי! עֵצָה טוֹבָה קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן: אַרְבַּע — אִין, טְפֵי — לָא, כִּי הֵיכִי דְּנִמְטְיֵיהּ עוֹנָה בְּחֹדֶשׁ.
human_translation: No, necessary where it is possible for him If so, even many as well; teaches us good advice; four yes, more no, in order that he will meet the conjugal rights in month.
llm_translation: Not necessary, for it is possible for him. If so, even better! A good piece of advice we hear: Four - yes, two - no, so that the punishment may be completed in a month.

hebrew_text: מִי שֶׁהָיָה נָשׂוּי וְכוּ׳. וּנְיַיבֵּם לְתַרְוַיְיהוּ! אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אָמַר קְרָא: ״אֲשֶׁר לֹא יִבְנֶה אֶת בֵּית אָחִיו״, בַּיִת אֶחָד הוּא בּוֹנֶה, וְאֵין בּוֹנֵה שְׁנֵי בָתִּים.
human_translation: one who was married But let him consummate levirate marriages with both of them. Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: The verse states who does not build his brother’s house” one house may he build, but he may not build two houses.
llm_translation: One who was married, etc. And they shall marry them to others! Rabbi Hiyya bar Abba said in the name of Rabbi Yohanan: The verse says, "Who will not build his brother's house," it is one house that he builds, and he does not build two houses.

hebrew_text: וְנַחְלוֹץ לְתַרְוַיְיהוּ?! אָמַר מָר זוּטְרָא בַּר טוֹבִיָּה, אָמַר קְרָא: ״בֵּית חֲלוּץ הַנַּעַל״, בַּיִת אֶחָד הוּא חוֹלֵץ, וְאֵין חוֹלֵץ שְׁנֵי בָתִּים.
human_translation: But let him perform ḥalitza with both of them; Mar Zutra bar Toviya said: The verse states “The house of him who had his shoe removed” he performs ḥalitza with one house, and he does not perform ḥalitza with two houses.
llm_translation: And Nachlotz for their mutual benefit?! Master Zutra son of Tobiah said, Scripture says: "House of the one who removes the shoe," it is one house that removes, and one does not remove shoes from two houses.

hebrew_text: וּנְיַיבֵּם לַחֲדָא וְנַחְלוֹץ לַחֲדָא! אָמַר קְרָא: ״אִם לֹא יַחְפּוֹץ״, הָא חָפֵץ — יְיַבֵּם. כׇּל הָעוֹלֶה לְיִבּוּם — עוֹלֶה לַחֲלִיצָה, כֹּל שֶׁאֵין עוֹלֶה לְיִיבּוּם — אֵין עוֹלֶה לַחֲלִיצָה.
human_translation: But let him consummate the levirate marriage with one and perform ḥalitza with the other. the verse states: “If does not wish were he to wish he could consummate the levirate marriage. one who is eligible for levirate marriage is eligible for ḥalitza , one who is ineligible for levirate marriage is ineligible for ḥalitza .
llm_translation: And he shall marry her to one, and he shall release her to one! The verse says: "If he does not wish," if he wishes - he shall marry. Anyone who is eligible for levirate marriage - is eligible for halitzah, anyone who is not eligible for levirate marriage - is not eligible for halitzah.

hebrew_text: וְעוֹד, שֶׁלֹּא יֹאמְרוּ: בַּיִת מִקְצָתוֹ בָּנוּי וּמִקְצָתוֹ חָלוּץ. וְיֹאמְרוּ! אִי דִּמְיַיבֵּם וַהֲדַר חָלֵיץ — הָכִי נָמֵי. אֶלָּא, [דִּלְמָא] חָלֵיץ וַהֲדַר מְיַיבֵּם, וְקָם לֵיהּ בְּ״לֹא יִבְנֶה״.
human_translation: And furthermore, that should not say house was partially built and partially released through ḥalitza . And they will say If he consummated the levirate marriage and subsequently performed ḥalitza indeed, However, perhaps he perform ḥalitza and subsequently consummate levirate marriage and he is liable for of: “He does not build
llm_translation: And furthermore, that they should not say: a house, part of it is built and part of it is demolished. And they should say! If he first built and then demolished — this is correct. Rather, perhaps he demolished and then built, and it turns out that it is "not to be built."

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא: כִּי אִיכָּא חֲדָא — תִּתְקַיֵּים מִצְוַת יִבּוּם, כִּי אִיכָּא תַּרְתֵּי — לֹא תִּתְקַיֵּים מִצְוַת יִבּוּם!
human_translation: But say: When there is only one the mitzva of levirate marriage exists, when there are two the mitzva of levirate marriage does not exist.
llm_translation: And why? If there is one — the mitzvah of yibum is fulfilled, but if there are two — the mitzvah of yibum is not fulfilled!

hebrew_text: אִם כֵּן, צָרַת עֶרְוָה דְּאָסַר רַחֲמָנָא לְמָה לִי? הַשְׁתָּא תַּרְתֵּי בְּעָלְמָא אָמְרַתְּ לָאו בְּנֵי חֲלִיצָה וְיִבּוּם נִינְהוּ — צָרַת עֶרְוָה מִיבַּעְיָא?
human_translation: If so, why do I a rival wife of a forbidden relation, which is forbidden by the Merciful One Now two general, you say they are not eligible for ḥalitza and levirate marriage, is it necessary a rival wife of a forbidden relation
llm_translation: If so, the prohibition of nakedness that the Merciful One forbade, why do I need it? Now, two things in the world you said are not considered as sons of halitzah and yibum - does the prohibition of nakedness apply?

hebrew_text: אַלְּמָה לָא? אִצְטְרִיךְ, סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: עֶרְוָה אַבָּרַאי קָיְימָא, וְתִתְיַיבֵּם צָרָתַהּ, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דַּאֲסִירָא.
human_translation: Why not? it is necessary enter your mind to say the forbidden relation stands outside and her rival wife should enter into levirate marriage teach us that is forbidden.
llm_translation: Why not? It is necessary, as I would say: The nakedness of a limb is established, and its trouble sits, it is heard for us that it is forbidden.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: ״יְבִמְתּוֹ״ ״יְבִמְתּוֹ״ — רִיבָּה.
human_translation: Rather, “his yevama ,” “his yevama ” amplifies
llm_translation: Rather: "Yibmato" "Yibmato" - Ribbah.

hebrew_text: הָיְתָה אַחַת כְּשֵׁרָה. אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף, כָּאן שָׁנָה רַבִּי: לֹא יִשְׁפּוֹךְ אָדָם מֵי בוֹרוֹ, וַאֲחֵרִים צְרִיכִים לָהֶם.
human_translation: one was fit Rav Yosef said here, Rabbi taught a person should not spill out water his pit when others are in need of it.
llm_translation: One was kosher. Rav Yosef said, here Rabbi changed: A person should not pour out the water from his well, and others need it.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַמַּחְזִיר גְּרוּשָׁתוֹ, וְהַנּוֹשֵׂא חֲלוּצָתוֹ, וְהַנּוֹשֵׂא קְרוֹבַת חֲלוּצָתוֹ — יוֹצִיא, וְהַוָּלָד מַמְזֵר, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא.
human_translation: one who remarries his divorcée or one who marries the woman with whom he performed ḥalitza [ ḥalutza ], or one who marries a relative of his ḥalutza , must divorce and the offspring is a mamzer ; the statement of Rabbi Akiva.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who remarries his divorced wife, and one who marries his wife's sister, and one who marries the sister of his divorced wife — he must divorce her. And the child born from such a union is a mamzer. These are the words of Rabbi Akiva.

hebrew_text: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֵין הַוָּלָד מַמְזֵר. וּמוֹדִים בְּנוֹשֵׂא קְרוֹבַת גְּרוּשָׁתוֹ — שֶׁהַוָּלָד מַמְזֵר.
human_translation: The Rabbis say: The offspring is not a mamzer , but they concede with regard to one who marries a relative of his divorcée, that the offspring is a mamzer .
llm_translation: The Sages say: A mamzer does not exist. And they agree with the one who holds that one who marries his close relative who is divorced - the child is a mamzer.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וְסָבַר רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא הַנּוֹשֵׂא קְרוֹבַת חֲלוּצָתוֹ הַוָּלָד מַמְזֵר? וְהָאָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ, כָּאן שָׁנָה רַבִּי: אֲחוֹת גְּרוּשָׁה מִדִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה, אֲחוֹת חֲלוּצָה מִדִּבְרֵי סוֹפְרִים! תְּנִי: קְרוֹבַת גְּרוּשָׁתוֹ.
human_translation: But does Rabbi Akiva hold one who marries a relative of his ḥalutza , the offspring is a mamzer ? Didn’t Reish Lakish say here, Rabbi taught a sister of divorcée by Torah law a sister of ḥalutza by rabbinic law? teach A relative of his divorcée.
llm_translation: Gemara: And Rabbi Akiva holds that one who marries his relative born from a forbidden relationship, is considered a mamzer. But doesn't Reish Lakish say, "Here Rabbi changed the law: A sister of a divorced woman is considered a sister from the Torah, a sister of a halutzah is considered a sister from the Scribes!" It was taught: His relative from a divorced woman is considered a relative.

hebrew_text: הָכִי נָמֵי מִסְתַּבְּרָא, דְּקָתָנֵי סֵיפָא: וּמוֹדִים בְּנוֹשֵׂא קְרוֹבַת גְּרוּשָׁתוֹ שֶׁהַוָּלָד מַמְזֵר. אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא אַיְירִי בָּהּ — הַיְינוּ דְּקָתָנֵי ״וּמוֹדִים״. אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ לָא אַיְירִי בַּהּ, מַאי ״וּמוֹדִים״?
human_translation: So, too, it is reasonable the latter clause teaches: But they concede one who marries a relative of his divorcée that the offspring is a mamzer . Granted, if you say was talking about that this is that which teaches: They concede, However, if you say was not talking about that what They concede,
llm_translation: Thus it was explained: for it is taught in the latter part: "And they agree regarding one who marries off his divorced wife, that the child is a mamzer. If you say it is in accordance with what was said - that is what is meant by 'and they agree.' But if you say it is not in accordance with it, what is meant by 'and they agree'?"

hebrew_text: וְדִלְמָא הָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן, דְּיֵשׁ מַמְזֵר מֵחַיָּיבֵי כָּרֵיתוֹת. הָא קָתָנֵי לַהּ לְקַמַּן: אֵיזֶהוּ מַמְזֵר — כׇּל שְׁאֵר בָּשָׂר שֶׁהוּא בְּ״לֹא יָבֹא״ — דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן הַתִּימְנִי אוֹמֵר: כֹּל שֶׁחַיָּיבִין עָלָיו כָּרֵת בִּידֵי שָׁמַיִם. וַהֲלָכָה כִּדְבָרָיו.
human_translation: But perhaps this teaches us that that from is liable to karet is a mamzer . This is already taught later on Which a mamzer ? any next of kin that is subject to should not engage in sexual relations the statement of Rabbi Akiva. Rabbi Shimon HaTimni says: any for which one is liable to karet at the hand of Heaven. And halakha is in accordance with his statement.
llm_translation: And perhaps this is what he is teaching us, that there are mamzerim who are liable for karet. This is what is taught later on: "Who is a mamzer? Any other flesh that is 'not to come' - these are the words of Rabbi Akiva. Rabbi Shimon the Timnite says: Anyone upon whom karet is incumbent, it is in the hands of Heaven. And the halakha is in accordance with his words.

hebrew_text: וְדִלְמָא קָסָתֵים לַן תַּנָּא כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן הַתִּימְנִי. אִם כֵּן, לִיתְנֵי שְׁאָר חַיָּיבֵי כָּרֵיתוֹת, קְרוֹבַת גְּרוּשָׁתוֹ לְמָה לִי? אֶלָּא שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ אַיְירִי בַּהּ.
human_translation: But perhaps the tanna taught us as unattributed in accordance with Rabbi Shimon HaTimni If so, let him teach other for which one is liable to karet ; why do I a relative of divorcée? Rather, conclude from this was talking about that
llm_translation: And perhaps you will say that we have learned in a Mishnah like Rabbi Shimon HaTzimni. If so, let him teach the other liable parties of keritot, why do I need the proximity of his divorce? Rather, learn from it what it teaches.

hebrew_text: [וְדִלְמָא] לְעוֹלָם לָא אַיְירִי בַּהּ, וְאַיְּידֵי דִּתְנָא מַחֲזִיר גְּרוּשָׁתוֹ וְנוֹשֵׂא חֲלוּצָתוֹ וּקְרוֹבַת חֲלוּצָתוֹ — תָּנֵי נָמֵי קְרוֹבַת גְּרוּשָׁתוֹ.
human_translation: But perhaps he was not actually talking about that but since taught one who remarries his divorcée, or one who marries his ḥalutza or a relative of his ḥalutza , also taught a relative of his divorcée
llm_translation: And perhaps always not he will bring in it, and since that it was taught: he returns his divorced wife and marries his yevamah and the relative of his yevamah - he also taught the relative of his divorced wife.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: קְרוֹבַת חֲלוּצָתוֹ לְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא הָוֵי מַמְזֵר. אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הַיְינוּ טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״בֵּית חֲלוּץ הַנַּעַל״, הַכָּתוּב קְרָאוֹ ״בֵּיתוֹ״.
human_translation: Rather, a relative of one’s ḥalutza according to Rabbi Akiva is a mamzer . Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said Rabbi Yoḥanan said this is Rabbi Akiva’s reasoning: As the verse states: “The house of he who had his shoe removed” The verse called his house,
llm_translation: Rather: proximity of his removal to Rabbi Akiva, he is a mamzer. Rabbi Chiya bar Abba said Rabbi Yochanan said: This is the reason of Rabbi Akiva, as the verse says: "The house of his removal of the shoe," the Scripture calls it "his house."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בַּר רַבִּי: הַכֹּל מוֹדִים בְּמַחֲזִיר גְּרוּשָׁתוֹ,
human_translation: Rav Yosef said Rabbi Shimon bar Rabbi said: All agree in one who remarries his divorcée
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said, Rabbi Shimon bar Rabbi said: Everyone agrees with regard to returning his divorcee.

hebrew_text: שֶׁהַוָּלָד פָּגוּם לַכְּהוּנָּה. מַאן הַכֹּל מוֹדִים — שִׁמְעוֹן הַתִּימְנִי, דְּאַף עַל גַּב דְּאָמַר שִׁמְעוֹן הַתִּימְנִי: אֵין מַמְזֵר מֵחַיָּיבֵי לָאוִין, נְהִי דְּמַמְזֵר לָא הָוֵי, פָּגוּם מִיהָא הָוֵי,
human_translation: that the offspring, has flawed to priesthood. Who All agree? Shimon HaTimni, as although Shimon HaTimni said for which one is liable for a prohibition is not a mamzer , granted he is not a mamzer ; however, he is flawed
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "If a child is blemished for the priesthood. Who all agree? — Shimon the Timnite, for even though Shimon the Timnite said: A mamzer is not liable for negative commandments, even though a mamzer is not considered, he is blemished from the outset."

hebrew_text: מִקַּל וָחוֹמֶר מֵאַלְמָנָה. וּמָה אַלְמָנָה לְכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל, שֶׁאֵין אִיסּוּרָהּ שָׁוֶה בַּכֹּל — בְּנָהּ פָּגוּם, זוֹ, שֶׁאִיסּוּרָהּ שָׁוֶה בַּכֹּל — אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁבְּנָהּ פָּגוּם?
human_translation: through an a fortiori from a widow, Just as a widow to a High Priest, where the prohibition to her is not equally applicable to all, her child have flawed this where the prohibition to her is equally applicable to all isn’t it logical that her child flawed
llm_translation: From a fortiori reasoning from a widow. And just as a widow to the High Priest, whose prohibition is equal in all cases - her son is blemished, this one, whose prohibition is equal in all cases - is it not the same law as her son being blemished?

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא לְמִיפְרַךְ: מָה לְאַלְמָנָה שֶׁכֵּן הִיא עַצְמָהּ מִתְחַלֶּלֶת.
human_translation: can be refuted: What to a widow, where her herself disqualified
llm_translation: There is room to refute: What about a widow who is so modest that she defiles herself.

hebrew_text: וְעוֹד: ״הִיא תּוֹעֵבָה״ כְּתִיב, וְאֵין בָּנֶיהָ תּוֹעֲבִין.
human_translation: And furthermore, “She is an abomination” is written but her children are not abominations
llm_translation: And further: "It is an abomination" is written, and her sons are not abominations.

hebrew_text: וְעוֹד, תַּנְיָא: הַמַּחֲזִיר גְּרוּשָׁתוֹ וְהַנּוֹשֵׂא חֲלוּצָתוֹ וְהַנּוֹשֵׂא קְרוֹבַת חֲלוּצָתוֹ, רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: אֵין לוֹ בָּהּ קִדּוּשִׁין, וְאֵינָהּ צְרִיכָה הֵימֶנּוּ גֵּט, וְהִיא פְּסוּלָה, וּוְלָדָהּ פָּסוּל, וְכוֹפִין אוֹתוֹ לְהוֹצִיא. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: יֵשׁ לוֹ בָּהּ קִדּוּשִׁין, וּצְרִיכָה הֵימֶנּוּ גֵּט, וְהִיא כְּשֵׁרָה וּוְלָדָהּ כָּשֵׁר.
human_translation: And furthermore, it is taught one who remarries his divorcée, and one who marries his ḥalutza , and one who marries a relative of his ḥalutza , Rabbi Akiva says one’s betrothal of such is not And she does not require a bill of divorce from him And she is unfit and her child is unfit, and we force him to send away. The Rabbis say one’s betrothal of such is and she requires a bill of divorce from him, and she fit and her child is fit.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And furthermore, it was taught: One who returns his divorced wife, and one who marries his sister-in-law in a levirate marriage, and one who marries the relative of his sister-in-law in a levirate marriage, Rabbi Akiva says: He does not have sanctity with her, and she does not require a bill of divorce from him, and she is disqualified, and her offspring is disqualified, and he is compelled to divorce her. And the Sages say: He has sanctity with her, and she requires a bill of divorce from him, and she is valid, and her offspring is valid.

hebrew_text: לְמַאן, לָאו לִכְהוּנָּה? לָא, לַקָּהָל. אִי הָכִי, הִיא כְּשֵׁרָה, לְמַאן? אִילֵימָא לַקָּהָל — פְּשִׁיטָא, מִשּׁוּם דְּזַנְּיָא אִפַּסְלָה לַקָּהָל?! אֶלָּא לָאו לִכְהוּנָּה,
human_translation: to whom Is it not to the priesthood? No, to the congregation If so, she is fit, to whom If we say to the congregation this is obvious; because she engaged in forbidden sexual relations that she is rendered unfit from the congregation Rather, is it not to the priesthood?
llm_translation: To whom? Is it not for the priesthood? No, for the congregation. If so, it is valid, for whom? If you say for the congregation - it is obvious, because if she committed adultery, she would be disqualified for the congregation?! Rather, is it not for the priesthood,

hebrew_text: וּמִדְּהִיא לִכְהוּנָּה, וְלָדָהּ נָמֵי לִכְהוּנָּה! מִידֵּי אִירְיָא? הָא כִּדְאִיתָא וְהָא כִּדְאִיתָא.
human_translation: And since to her for the priesthood, the child as well, for the priesthood. Are these cases comparable? This as it is, and that as it is,
llm_translation: And from this to the priesthood, and its law is also for the priesthood! From the city of Ir? This one as it was stated, and this one as it was stated.

hebrew_text: הָכִי נָמֵי מִסְתַּבְּרָא, דְּקָתָנֵי רֵישָׁא: הִיא פְּסוּלָה וּוְלָדָהּ פָּסוּל. הִיא פְּסוּלָה לְמַאן? אִילֵימָא לַקָּהָל, מִשּׁוּם דְּזַנְּיָא אִפַּסְלָה לֵיהּ לַקָּהָל?! אֶלָּא לָאו לִכְהוּנָּה.
human_translation: So, too, it is reasonable as the first clause teaches She is unfit and her child is unfit. She is unfit, to whom If we say to the congregation because she engaged in forbidden sexual relations she is rendered unfit to the congregation Rather, is it not to the priesthood?
llm_translation: Thus it was explained: as it is taught in the beginning of the Mishnah: she is disqualified, and her offspring is disqualified. She is disqualified for whom? If you say for the congregation, because she committed harlotry, should her disqualification apply to the congregation?! Rather, it is not for the priesthood.

hebrew_text: וּוְלָדָהּ פָּסוּל, לְמַאן? אִילֵימָא לִכְהוּנָּה: הָא לַקָּהָל כָּשֵׁר? הָאָמַר רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: הַוָּלָד מַמְזֵר! אֶלָּא פְּשִׁיטָא לַקָּהָל.
human_translation: And her child is unfit, to whom If we say to priesthood, that is fit to the congregation didn’t Rabbi Akiva say the offspring is a mamzer Rather, it is obvious to the congregation
llm_translation: "And her offspring is disqualified, according to whom? If you say for priesthood: but for the congregation it is valid? Didn't Rabbi Akiva say: the offspring is a mamzer! Rather, it is obvious for the congregation."

hebrew_text: וּמִדְּרֵישָׁא הָא כִּדְאִיתָא וְהָא כִּדְאִיתָא, סֵיפָא נָמֵי הָא כִּדְאִיתָא וְהָא כִּדְאִיתָא.
human_translation: And since the first clause this as it is and that as it is, the latter clause as well this as it is and that as it is.
llm_translation: The text reads: "And the explanation is as follows: this one as you have explained, and this one as you have explained; the latter part is similar to this one as you have explained, and this one as you have explained."

hebrew_text: וְ״הִיא תּוֹעֵבָה״ נָמֵי — הִיא תּוֹעֵבָה וְאֵין צָרָתָהּ תּוֹעֵבָה, אֲבָל בָּנֶיהָ תּוֹעֲבִין.
human_translation: And “She is an abomination,” also “She is an abomination” but her rival wife is not an abomination, However, her children are abominations
llm_translation: "And 'it is an abomination' also - it is an abomination and its affliction is not an abomination, but its children are abominations."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אַלְמָנָה קַשְׁיָא: מָה לְאַלְמָנָה שֶׁכֵּן הִיא עַצְמָהּ מִתְחַלֶּלֶת!
human_translation: However, a widow difficult, What to a widow, where her herself disqualified
llm_translation: Rather, a widow is difficult: What is it for a widow that she herself becomes defiled!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, אִי אִתְּמַר הָכִי אִתְּמַר: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בְּרַבִּי: הַכֹּל מוֹדִים בְּבָא עַל חַיָּיבֵי כָּרֵיתוֹת שֶׁהַוָּלָד פָּגוּם. מַאן הַכֹּל מוֹדִים, רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ. דְּאַף עַל גַּב דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: אֵין מַמְזֵר מֵחַיָּיבֵי כָּרֵיתוֹת, נְהִי דְּמַמְזֵר לָא הָוֵי — פָּגוּם מִיהָא הָוֵי,
human_translation: Rather, if was stated, was stated as follows: Rav Yosef said Rabbi Shimon, son of Rabbi said: All agree with regard to one who engages in intercourse with for which one is liable to karet that the offspring has flawed Who All agree? Rabbi Yehoshua, as although Rabbi Yehoshua said that from for which one is liable to karet is not a mamzer , granted he is not a mamzer ; however, he is of flawed
llm_translation: Rather, if it was stated, it was stated thus: Rav Yosef said in the name of Rabbi Shimon, son of Rabbi: Everyone agrees with regard to one who comes upon those liable to receive karet that a child born from such a union is flawed. Who are the ones who all agree? Rabbi Yehoshua. Even though Rabbi Yehoshua said: A mamzer is not liable to receive karet, nevertheless, since a mamzer is not considered a mamzer, he is flawed nonetheless.

hebrew_text: מִקַּל וָחוֹמֶר מֵאַלְמָנָה: וּמָה אַלְמָנָה לְכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל, שֶׁאֵין אִיסּוּרָהּ שָׁוֶה — בַּכֹּל בְּנָהּ פָּגוּם, זוֹ שֶׁאִיסּוּרָהּ שָׁוֶה בַּכֹּל — אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁבְּנָהּ פָּגוּם.
human_translation: through an a fortiori from a widow, Just as a widow to High Priest, where the prohibition to her is not equally applicable to all, her child have flawed this where the prohibition to her is equally applicable to all isn’t it logical that her child have flawed
llm_translation: From a fortiori reasoning from a widow: And just as a widow to a high priest, whose prohibition is not equal - in all her sons are disqualified, this one whose prohibition is equal in all is not the law that her son is disqualified.

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא: מָה לְאַלְמָנָה, שֶׁכֵּן הִיא עַצְמָהּ מִתְחַלֶּלֶת — הָכָא נָמֵי, כֵּיוָן שֶׁבְּעָלָהּ, עֲשָׂאָהּ זוֹנָה.
human_translation: And if you would say what to a widow, who is herself disqualified here, too, once he has engaged in intercourse with her he renders her a zona ,
llm_translation: And if you will say: What about a widow, for she herself is degraded - here it is stated: since her husband, he made her a harlot.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הַכֹּל מוֹדִים בְּעֶבֶד וְגוֹי הַבָּא עַל בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁהַוָּלָד מַמְזֵר.
human_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: All agree with regard to a slave or a gentile who engaged in intercourse with a Jewish woman that the offspring is a mamzer .
llm_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: Everyone agrees with regard to a slave or a gentile who has relations with a Jewish woman, that the offspring is a mamzer.

hebrew_text: מַאן ״הַכֹּל מוֹדִים״ — שִׁמְעוֹן הַתִּימְנִי. דְּאַף עַל גַּב דְּאָמַר שִׁמְעוֹן הַתִּימְנִי אֵין מַמְזֵר מֵחַיָּיבֵי לָאוִין — הָנֵי מִילֵּי
human_translation: Who All agree? Shimon HaTimni, as although Shimon HaTimni said which one is liable for a prohibition is not a mamzer , this applies
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Who is "everyone agrees"? — Shimon the Timnite. Even though Shimon the Timnite said that mamzerim are not liable for negative commandments, those matters.

hebrew_text: מֵחַיָּיבֵי לָאוִין דְּתָפְסִי בְּהוּ קִדּוּשִׁין, אֲבָל הָכָא, גּוֹי וְעֶבֶד, כֵּיוָן דְּלָא תָּפְסִי בְּהוּ קִדּוּשִׁין — כְּחַיָּיבֵי כָּרֵיתוֹת דְּמֵי.
human_translation: to for which one is liable for a prohibition which a betrothal would take effect. However, here, a gentile and a slave, since their betrothal would not take effect, is comparable to for which one is liable to karet ,
llm_translation: From those who are liable for negative commandments that are acquired through betrothal, but here, a non-Jew and a slave, since they are not acquired through betrothal - they are like those liable for the penalties of excision.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: גּוֹי וְעֶבֶד הַבָּא עַל בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל — הַוָּלָד מַמְזֵר. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אֵין מַמְזֵר אֶלָּא מִמִּי שֶׁאִיסּוּרוֹ אִיסּוּר עֶרְוָה וְעָנוּשׁ כָּרֵת.
human_translation: raises an objection a gentile or a slave who engaged in intercourse with a Jewish woman, the offspring is a mamzer . Rabbi Shimon ben Yehuda says: a mamzer only from one who is forbidden by a prohibition of forbidden relations punishable by karet .
llm_translation: Challenger: A non-Jew and a slave who have relations with a Jewish woman - the offspring is a mamzer. Rabbi Shimon ben Yehuda says: A mamzer is only from one whose prohibition is a prohibition of illicit relations and the punishment is karet.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: מַאן ״הַכֹּל מוֹדִים״ — רַבִּי, אַף עַל גַּב דְּרַבִּי אוֹמֵר: אֵין הַדְּבָרִים הַלָּלוּ אֲמוּרִים אֶלָּא לְדִבְרֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, שֶׁהָיָה עוֹשֶׂה חֲלוּצָה כְּעֶרְוָה, וְלֵיהּ לָא סְבִירָא לֵיהּ, בְּגוֹי וְעֶבֶד מוֹדֶה. דְּכִי אֲתָא רַב דִּימִי, אָמַר רַב יִצְחָק בַּר אֲבוּדִימִי מִשּׁוּם רַבֵּינוּ: גּוֹי וְעֶבֶד הַבָּא עַל בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל — הַוָּלָד מַמְזֵר.
human_translation: Rather, Rav Yosef said: Who All agree? Rabbi although Rabbi says This statement was said only according to the statement of Rabbi Akiva, as he would consider a ḥalutza like a forbidden relative And himself does not hold accordingly with regard to a gentile or a slave he concedes As, when Rav Dimi came Rav Yitzḥak bar Avudimi said in the name of our Master, a gentile or a slave who engaged in intercourse with a Jewish woman, the offspring is a mamzer .
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Yosef said: Who is "everyone agrees"? — Rabbi, even though Rabbi says: These matters are only said according to the words of Rabbi Akiva, who used to perform chalitzah like nakedness, and he did not agree with him, regarding a gentile and a slave admitting. For when Rav Dimi came, Rav Yitzchak bar Avudimi said in the name of our teacher: A gentile and a slave who have relations with a Jewish woman — the offspring is a mamzer.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אַחָא שַׂר הַבִּירָה וְרַבִּי תַּנְחוּם בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי חִיָּיא אִישׁ כְּפַר עַכּוֹ פְּרוּק הָנְהוּ שְׁבוּיָיתָא דַּאֲתוֹ מֵאַרְמוֹן לִטְבֶרְיָא. הֲוָה חֲדָא דְּאִעַבַּרָא מִגּוֹי, וַאֲתוֹ לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי אַמֵּי, אֲמַר לְהוּ: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר וְרַבִּי חֲנִינָא דְּאָמְרִי: גּוֹי וְעֶבֶד הַבָּא עַל בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל — הַוָּלָד מַמְזֵר.
human_translation: Rabbi Aḥa, lord of the capital, and Rabbi Tanḥum, son of Rabbi Ḥiyya, man of Akko village, redeemed those captives who came from Armon to Tiberias. One of them had been impregnated by a gentile, and they came before Rabbi Ami He said to them Rabbi Yoḥanan and Rabbi Elazar and Rabbi Ḥanina say: a gentile or a slave who engaged in intercourse with a Jewish woman, the offspring is a mamzer .
llm_translation: Rabbi Ahah, the officer of the fortress, and Rabbi Tanhum, son of Rabbi Hiyya, the man of Kefar Akko, were sitting with the captives who had come from the palace to Tiberias. There was one who had relations with a non-Jew, and he came before Rabbi Ammi. He said to them: Rabbi Yohanan, Rabbi Elazar, and Rabbi Hanina said: A non-Jew or a slave who has relations with a Jewish woman — the offspring is a mamzer.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: רְבוּתָא לְמִחְשַׁב גַּבְרֵי?! הָא רַב וּשְׁמוּאֵל בְּבָבֶל, וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי וּבַר קַפָּרָא בְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ חַלּוֹפֵי בַּר קַפָּרָא וְעַיֹּילֵי זִקְנֵי דָרוֹם, דְּאָמְרִי: גּוֹי וְעֶבֶד הַבָּא עַל בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל הַוָּלָד כָּשֵׁר!
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: Is it so great to enumerate men? But Rav and Shmuel in Babylonia, and Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi and bar Kappara in Eretz Yisrael, and some say remove bar Kappara and insert the Elders of the South, who say: a gentile or a slave who engaged in intercourse with a Jewish woman, the offspring is unflawed,
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: Is it appropriate to calculate the menstrual cycle for men?! Here we have Rav and Shmuel in Babylonia, and Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi and Bar Kapara in the Land of Israel, and they say to her: The substitutes of Bar Kapara and the elders of the South bring a proof, as they say: "A non-Jew and a slave who have relations with a Jewish woman, the offspring is legitimate!"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: רַבִּי הִיא. דְּכִי אֲתָא רַב דִּימִי אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק בַּר אֲבוּדִימִי: מִשּׁוּם רַבֵּינוּ אָמְרוּ: גּוֹי וְעֶבֶד הַבָּא עַל בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל — הַוָּלָד מַמְזֵר.
human_translation: Rather, Rav Yosef said is Rabbi as when Rav Dimi came Rav Yitzḥak bar Avudimi said in the name of our Master, they say: a gentile or a slave who engaged in intercourse with a Jewish woman, the offspring is a mamzer .
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Yosef said: It is Rabbi. For when Rav Dimi came, he said that Rabbi Yitzchak bar Avudimi said in the name of our Rabbis: A non-Jew and a slave who have relations with a Jewish woman—the offspring is a mamzer.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי אוֹמֵר: הַוָּלָד מְקוּלְקָל. לְמַאן? אִילֵימָא לַקָּהָל — הָא אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: הַוָּלָד כָּשֵׁר! אֶלָּא לִכְהוּנָּה, דְּכוּלְּהוּ אָמוֹרָאֵי דְּמַכְשְׁרִי — מוֹדוּ שֶׁהַוָּלָד פָּגוּם לִכְהוּנָּה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi says: the offspring is sullied, To whom If we say to the congregation didn’t Rabbi Yehoshua say the offspring is unflawed Rather, to the priesthood, as all of the amora’im who render fit agree that the offspring has flawed to the priesthood.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi says: A newborn is considered blemished. According to whom? If you say for the congregation - but didn't Rabbi Yehoshua say: A newborn is valid! Rather, for the priesthood, since all the statements of those who validate agree that a newborn is unfit for the priesthood.

hebrew_text: מִקַּל וְחוֹמֶר מֵאַלְמָנָה: מָה אַלְמָנָה לְכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל, שֶׁאֵין אִיסּוּרָהּ שָׁוֶה בַּכֹּל — בְּנָהּ פָּגוּם, זוֹ שֶׁאִיסּוּרָהּ שָׁוֶה בַּכֹּל — אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁבְּנָהּ פָּגוּם.
human_translation: from an a fortiori from a widow, Just as a widow to a High Priest, where the prohibition to her is not equally applicable to all her child have flawed this where the prohibition to her is equally applicable to all isn’t it logical that her child have flawed
llm_translation: From a fortiori reasoning from a widow: Just as the prohibition of a widow to a High Priest, where her disqualification applies universally — if her son is flawed, this is a case where her disqualification applies universally — it is not a valid ruling regarding her flawed son.

hebrew_text: מָה לְאַלְמָנָה לְכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל שֶׁכֵּן הִיא עַצְמָהּ מִתְחַלֶּלֶת! הָכָא נָמֵי, כֵּיוָן שֶׁנִּבְעֲלָה — פְּסָלָהּ.
human_translation: what to a widow to a High Priest, where her herself disqualified here, too, once he has engaged in intercourse with her, he renders her unfit
llm_translation: What is the case of a widow to the High Priest, for she herself becomes disqualified! Here it is stated, once she marries - she is disqualified.

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: מִנַּיִן לְגוֹי וְעֶבֶד הַבָּא עַל הַכֹּהֶנֶת וְעַל הַלְּוִיָּה וְעַל הַיִּשְׂרְאֵלִית שֶׁפְּסָלוּהָ — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּבַת כֹּהֵן כִּי תִהְיֶה אַלְמָנָה וּגְרוּשָׁה״, מִי שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ אַלְמְנוּת וְגֵירוּשִׁין בָּהּ, יָצְאוּ גּוֹי וְעֶבֶד שֶׁאֵין לָהֶם אַלְמְנוּת וְגֵירוּשִׁין בָּהּ.
human_translation: As Rabbi Yoḥanan said in the name of Rabbi Shimon: From where to a gentile or a slave who engaged in intercourse with a daughter of a priest or with a female Levite or with a female Israelite that they render her unfit As it is stated: “But a priest’s daughter when she will become a widow, or a divorcée, one to whom widowhood and divorce can apply, Excluded a gentile or a slave, to whom neither widowhood nor divorce can apply,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of Rabbi Shimon: From where do we derive that a non-Jew and a slave who engage in relations with a Kohenet, a Levite, or an Israelite woman disqualify her? It is stated: "And the daughter of a Kohen, if she becomes a widow or divorced" (Leviticus 22:13). One who has the status of widowhood and divorce in her, they disqualify her – non-Jews and slaves who do not have widowhood and divorce in them.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: מַאי חָזֵית דְּסָמְכַתְּ אַדְּרַב דִּימִי — סְמוֹךְ אַדְּרָבִין! דְּכִי אֲתָא רָבִין, אָמַר: רַבִּי נָתָן וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה הַנָּשִׂיא מוֹרוּ בַּהּ לְהֶיתֵּירָא. וּמַאן רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הַנָּשִׂיא — רַבִּי.
human_translation: Abaye said to What did you see that you rely upon Rav Dimi Rely upon Ravin, as when Ravin came he said Rabbi Natan and Rabbi Yehuda HaNasi rule permitted And who is Rabbi Yehuda HaNasi Rabbi,
llm_translation: He said to him, Abaye: What did you see that you relied on the opinion of Dimi - rely on the opinions of the majority! For when the majority came, they said: Rabbi Nathan and Rabbi Yehuda the Prince ruled leniently in this matter. And who is Rabbi Yehuda the Prince - Rabbi.

hebrew_text: וְאַף רַב מוֹרֵה בַּהּ [לְ]הֶיתֵּירָא. דְּהָהוּא דַּאֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: גּוֹי וְעֶבֶד הַבָּא עַל בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל, מַהוּ?
human_translation: And even Rav rules permitted, as a certain who came before Rav said to him: a gentile or a slave who engaged in intercourse with a Jewish woman, what is
llm_translation: And also Rav teaches in it to be lenient. For that one who came before Rav, he said to him: A non-Jew and a slave who come upon a daughter of Israel, what is the ruling?

hebrew_text: אָמַר לֵיהּ: הַוָּלָד כָּשֵׁר. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הַב לִי בְּרַתָּךְ. לָא יָהֵיבְנָא לָךְ.
human_translation: said to him: the offspring is unflawed. he said to give me your daughter I will not give to you.
llm_translation: He said to him: The offspring is valid. He said to him: Bring me your daughter. We did not give her to you.

hebrew_text: אָמַר שִׁימִי בַּר חִיָּיא לְרַב, אָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי: גַּמְלָא בְּמָדַי אַקַּבָּא רָקְדָא. הָא קַבָּא, וְהָא גַּמְלָא, וְהָא מָדַי — וְלָא רָקְדָא!
human_translation: Shimi bar Ḥiyya, said to Rav: People say a camel in Medes dance upon kav this is kav , and this is a camel, and this is Medes, and is not dancing,
llm_translation: Shimi son of Hiyya said to Rav, people say: "A camel in Media danced." This one is a camel, and this one is Media, and this one is a dance — but not danced!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִי נִיהְוֵי כִּיהוֹשֻׁעַ בִּן נוּן — לָא יָהֵיבְנָא לֵיהּ בְּרַתִּי. אָמַר לֵיהּ: אִי הֲוָה כִּיהוֹשֻׁעַ בִּן נוּן, אִי מָר לָא יָהֵיב לֵיהּ — אַחֲרִינֵי יָהֲבִי לֵיהּ, הַאי אִי מָר לָא יָהֵיב לֵיהּ — אַחֲרִינֵי לָא יָהֲבִי לֵיהּ.
human_translation: He said to him: if he were as Joshua, son of Nun, I would not give him my daughter He said to him: If he were as Joshua, son of Nun, if the Master would not give him others would give him this if the Master does not give him others will not give him
llm_translation: He said to him: If he were like Joshua son of Nun, we would not give him our daughter. He said to him: If he were like Joshua son of Nun, whether we would give him or not, others would give him. If he were not like Joshua son of Nun, others would not give him.

hebrew_text: לָא הֲוָה קָאָזֵיל מִקַּמֵּיהּ. יְהֵיב בֵּיהּ עֵינֵיהּ וּשְׁכֵיב.
human_translation: would not go from before placed his eyes upon him and he died.
llm_translation: He was not sitting in front of him. He gave him his eyes and slept.

hebrew_text: וְאַף רַב מַתְנָה מוֹרֵה בַּהּ לְהֶיתֵּירָא, וְאַף רַב יְהוּדָה מוֹרֵה בַּהּ לְהֶיתֵּירָא. דְּכִי אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב יְהוּדָה, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: זִיל אִיטַּמַּר, אוֹ נְסֵיב בַּת מִינָּךְ. וְכִי אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרָבָא, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אוֹ גְּלִי, אוֹ נְסֵיב בַּת מִינָּךְ.
human_translation: And even Rav Mattana rules permitted, and even Rav Yehuda rules permitted, as when came before Rav Yehuda, he said to him: Go conceal or marry of your own kind, And when came before Rava, he said to him: Either go into exile or marry a woman of your own kind.
llm_translation: And even Rav Matna teaches in it to permit, and even Rav Yehuda teaches in it to permit. For when he came before Rav Yehuda, he said to him: Go and be strict, or marry a woman of your own kind. And when he came before Rava, he said to him: Either reveal it, or marry a woman of your own kind.

hebrew_text: שְׁלַחוּ לֵיהּ בְּנֵי בֵּי מִיכְסֵי לְרַבָּה: מִי שֶׁחֶצְיוֹ עֶבֶד וְחֶצְיוֹ בֶּן חוֹרִין הַבָּא עַל בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל, מַהוּ? אֲמַר לְהוּ: הַשְׁתָּא עֶבֶד כּוּלּוֹ, אָמְרִינַן כָּשֵׁר — חֶצְיוֹ מִיבַּעְיָא?
human_translation: The residents of Bei Mikhsei sent to Rabba: one who is a half-slave half-freeman, who engaged in intercourse with a Jewish woman, what is He said to them: Now a full slave we say unflawed, is necessary a half-
llm_translation: Send to him the sons of the house of Miksei to Rabba: One whose half is a slave and half is a free man who comes upon a daughter of Israel, what is the ruling? He said to them: If currently he is entirely a slave, we say it is valid - does his half require consent?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: מָרָא דִשְׁמַעְתָּא
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: The Master of halakha
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: "Marah dishmata."

hebrew_text: מַנּוּ — רַב יְהוּדָה. וְהָא אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: מִי שֶׁחֶצְיוֹ עֶבֶד וְחֶצְיוֹ בֶּן חוֹרִין הַבָּא עַל בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל — אוֹתוֹ וָלָד אֵין לוֹ תַּקָּנָה!
human_translation: who is he? Rav Yehuda, But didn’t Rav Yehuda say: one who is a half-slave half-freeman who engaged in intercourse with a Jewish woman, that offspring has no recourse
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Manu - Rav Yehudah. Ve'ha amar Rav Yehudah: Mi shechatzio eved ve'chatzio ben chorin haba al bat Yisrael - oto valad ein lo takanah! English translation: Manu - Rav Yehudah. And Rav Yehudah said: One whose half is a slave and half is free, who cohabits with a daughter of Israel - the child born to him has no legal status!

hebrew_text: כִּי אִיתְּמַר דְּרַב יְהוּדָה, כְּגוֹן דְּקַדֵּישׁ בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל, דְּנִמְצָא צַד עַבְדוּת שֶׁבּוֹ מִשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ בְּאֵשֶׁת אִישׁ.
human_translation: When of Rav Yehuda was stated, where betrothed a Jewish woman. that it emerges slave side of him is engaging in relations with a married woman
llm_translation: It was stated that Rav Yehudah said, for example, if one sanctified a daughter of Israel, and it was found that there was a side of servitude in him that he was using with a married woman.

hebrew_text: וְהָאָמְרִי נְהַרְדָּעֵי מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יַעֲקֹב: לְדִבְרֵי הַפּוֹסֵל — פּוֹסֵל אֲפִילּוּ בִּפְנוּיָה, לְדִבְרֵי הַמַּכְשִׁיר — מַכְשִׁיר אֲפִילּוּ בְּאֵשֶׁת אִישׁ.
human_translation: But didn’t of Neharde’a say in the name of Rabbi Ya’akov: According to the statement of the one who renders unfit he renders unfit even when an unmarried woman. according to the statement of the one who renders fit, he renders fit even when is a married woman.
llm_translation: And the Amrei Nehardea said in the name of Rabbi Yaakov: According to the words of one who disqualifies - he disqualifies even in a private chamber, according to the words of one who validates - he validates even with a married woman.

hebrew_text: וּשְׁנֵיהֶם לֹא לְמָדוּהָ אֶלָּא מֵאֵשֶׁת אָב. מַאן דְּפָסֵיל סָבַר: מָה אֵשֶׁת אָב דְּלָא תָּפְסִי בַּהּ קִדּוּשִׁין [הַוָּלָד מַמְזֵר], אַף כֹּל דְּלָא תָּפְסִי בַּהּ קִדּוּשִׁין — הַוָּלָד מַמְזֵר.
human_translation: And both of them derived only from father’s wife, The one who renders unfit holds just as father’s wife, betrothal of her does not take effect the offspring is a mamzer , so too, any betrothal of her does not take effect, the offspring is a mamzer .
llm_translation: And both of them did not learn it except from the wife of a father. Who invalidates, holds: Just as the wife of a father, from whom one does not acquire betrothal the offspring is a mamzer, so too, anyone from whom one does not acquire betrothal — the offspring is a mamzer.

hebrew_text: וּמַאן דְּמַכְשַׁר סָבַר: מָה אֵשֶׁת אָב, דִּלְדִידֵיהּ לָא תָּפְסִי בַּהּ קִדּוּשִׁין, לְאַחֲרִינֵי תָּפְסִי בַּהּ קִדּוּשִׁין, לְאַפּוֹקֵי גּוֹי וְעֶבֶד דְּלָא תָּפְסִי בְּהוּ קִדּוּשִׁין כְּלָל.
human_translation: And the one who renders fit holds just like father’s wife, that betrothal of her does not take effect, with someone else betrothal does take effect. to the exclusion of a gentile and a slave, for whom betrothal does not take effect at all,
llm_translation: And one who validates, holds: What is the wife of a father, according to us she does not acquire with it betrothal, to others she acquires with it betrothal, to exclude a gentile and a slave that she does not acquire with them betrothal at all.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: כִּי אִיתְּמַר דְּרַב יְהוּדָה, כְּגוֹן שֶׁבָּא עַל אֵשֶׁת אִישׁ, וְנִמְצָא צַד חֵירוּת שֶׁבּוֹ מִשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ בְּאֵשֶׁת אִישׁ.
human_translation: Rather, when of Rav Yehuda was stated, where engaged in intercourse with a married woman and it emerges free side of him is engaging in relations with a married woman
llm_translation: Rather: when it was stated that Rav Yehudah said, for example, if one came upon a married woman, and a thread of freedom was found in him, he may engage in relations with a married woman.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבִינָא, אָמַר לִי רַב גַּזָּא: אִיקְּלַע רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר אָבִין לְאַתְרִין וַהֲוָה עוֹבָדָא בִּפְנוּיָה, וְאַכְשַׁר. בְּאֵשֶׁת אִישׁ, וּפְסַיל. אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: לְדִידִי אָמַר לִי רַב גַּזָּא: לָא רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר אָבִין הֲוָה אֶלָּא רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי זְבִידָא הֲוָה, וְאַכְשַׁר בֵּין בִּפְנוּיָה בֵּין בְּאֵשֶׁת אִישׁ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבָּה לְרָבִינָא: אִיקְּלַע אַמֵּימָר לְאַתְרִין וְאַכְשַׁר בֵּין בִּפְנוּיָה בֵּין בְּאֵשֶׁת אִישׁ.
human_translation: Ravina said: Rav Gazza said to me Rabbi Yosei bar Avin happened to our place, and there was an incident involving an unmarried woman and rendered fit involving a married woman and he rendered unfit Rav Sheshet said: Rav Gazza told me not Rabbi Yosei bar Avin; rather, it was Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Zevida, and he rendered fit both in an unmarried woman and in a married woman. Rav Aḥa, son of Rabba, said to Ravina: Ameimar happened to our place and rendered fit both in an unmarried woman and in a married woman.
llm_translation: Ravina said, Rav Gazza said to me: Rabbi Yosei bar Avin came to the marketplace and was conducting business openly, and it is valid. In the case of a married woman, it is invalid. Rav Sheshet said: According to my understanding, Rav Gazza did not say that it was Rabbi Yosei bar Avin, but rather it was Rabbi Yosei bar Rabbi Zebida, and it is valid whether in an open manner or with a married woman. Rav Acha, son of Rabba, said to Ravina: Amemar came to the marketplace and it is valid whether in an open manner or with a married woman.

hebrew_text: וְהִלְכְתָא: גּוֹי וְעֶבֶד הַבָּא עַל בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל — הַוָּלָד כָּשֵׁר, בֵּין בִּפְנוּיָה בֵּין בְּאֵשֶׁת אִישׁ.
human_translation: And the halakha a gentile or slave who engaged in intercourse with a Jewish woman, the offspring is unflawed, whether an unmarried or a married woman.
llm_translation: The Halakha: A gentile or a slave who has relations with a Jewish woman — the offspring is legitimate, whether she is unmarried or married to a man.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אַכְשְׁרֵיהּ לְרַב מָרִי בַּר רָחֵל וּמַנְּיֵיהּ בְּפוּרְסֵי דְּבָבֶל, וְאַף עַל גַּב דְּאָמַר מָר: ״שׂוֹם תָּשִׂים עָלֶיךָ מֶלֶךְ״ — כׇּל מְשִׂימוֹת שֶׁאַתָּה מֵשִׂים אַל יְהוּ אֶלָּא מִקֶּרֶב אַחֶיךָ, הַאי, כֵּיוָן דְּאִמּוֹ מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל — ״מִקֶּרֶב אַחֶיךָ״ קָרֵינַן בֵּיהּ.
human_translation: Rava ruled Rav Mari bar Raḥel, fit and he appointed him as one of the officials [ pursei ] of Babylonia. And although the Master said “You shall place a king over you all positions that you appoint, may be only from among your brethren this one, since his mother is of Jewish we call him “from among your brethren,”
llm_translation: Rava permitted Rav Mari son of Rachel and his utensils in the markets of Babylon, even though Mar said: "You shall surely set a king over you" - all appointments that you make should only be from among your brethren, this one, since his mother is from Israel, we read in it "from among your brethren."

hebrew_text: עַבְדֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַמֵּי אַטְבְּלַהּ לְהָהִיא גּוֹיָה לְשֵׁם אִנְתְּתָא. אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: יָכֵילְנָא לְאַכְשׁוֹרֵי בַּהּ וּבִבְרַתַּהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Ami’s slave immersed a certain gentile woman for the sake of intimate relations, Rav Yosef said: I am able to render her and her daughter fit
llm_translation: The servant of Rabbi Chiya bar Ami immersed her for that Gentile woman in the name of his wife. Rav Yosef said: We may rely on her immersion and her examination.

hebrew_text: בַּהּ, כִּדְרַב אַסִּי. דְּאָמַר רַב אַסִּי, מִי לָא טְבַלָה לְנִדּוּתַהּ?
human_translation: With regard to her, in accordance with of Rav Asi, as Rav Asi said Didn’t she immerse for the sake of her menstruation?
llm_translation: In it, as Rav Assi said, for Rav Assi said, who did not immerse for its impurity?

hebrew_text: בִּבְרַתַּהּ, גּוֹי וְעֶבֶד הַבָּא עַל בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל — הַוָּלָד כָּשֵׁר.
human_translation: with regard to her daughter, a gentile or slave who engaged in intercourse with a Jewish woman, the offspring is unflawed.
llm_translation: In its explanation, a non-Jew and a slave who have relations with a daughter of Israel - the offspring is legitimate.

hebrew_text: הַהוּא דַּהֲווֹ קָרוּ לֵיהּ ״בַּר אַרְמָיְיתָא״, אֲמַר רַב אַסִּי: מִי לָא טְבַלָה לְנִדּוּתַהּ? הָהוּא דַּהֲווֹ קָרוּ לֵיהּ ״בַּר אַרְמָאָה״. אֲמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: מִי לָא טְבַל לְקִרְיוֹ?
human_translation: a certain whom would call: Son of the Aramean woman, Rav Asi said: Didn’t she immerse for the sake of her menstruation? a certain whom would call: Son of an Aramean man, Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: Didn’t he immerse for the sake of his seminal emission?
llm_translation: That one who was called "Bar Armaite," said Rav Assi: Who did not immerse for his impurity? That one who was called "Bar Arma'ah." Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: Who did not immerse for his seminal emission?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חָמָא בַּר גּוּרְיָא אָמַר רַב: הַלּוֹקֵחַ עֶבֶד מִן הַגּוֹי, וְקָדַם וְטָבַל לְשֵׁם בֶּן חוֹרִין, קָנָה עַצְמוֹ בֶּן חוֹרִין. מַאי טַעְמָא —
human_translation: Rav Ḥama bar Gurya said Rav said: who purchased a slave from a gentile, and preempted and immersed for the sake of a freeman, he acquired himself a freeman, What is the reason
llm_translation: Rav Ḥama son of Gurya said in the name of Rav: One who acquires a slave from a gentile, and he precedes and immerses for the sake of freedom, he acquires himself as a free man. What is the reason?

hebrew_text: גּוֹי גּוּפָא לָא קָנֵי לֵיהּ, מַאי דְּקָנֵי לֵיהּ הוּא דְּמַקְנֵי לֵיהּ לְיִשְׂרָאֵל, וְכֵיוָן דִּקְדַם וּטְבַל לְשֵׁם בֶּן חוֹרִין — אַפְקְעֵיהּ לְשִׁעְבּוּדֵיהּ.
human_translation: gentile did not have ownership of the body, that which he owned in him was he sell to Jew. and once preempted and immersed for the sake of a freeman, he abrogates lien
llm_translation: A non-Jew does not acquire ownership through his body, what he acquires ownership through is what he acquires ownership for Israel, and once he precedes and immerses for the sake of freedom — his acquisition is valid for his service.

hebrew_text: כִּדְרָבָא, דְּאָמַר רָבָא: הֶקְדֵּשׁ, חָמֵץ וְשִׁחְרוּר — מַפְקִיעִין מִידֵי שִׁעְבּוּד.
human_translation: in accordance with of Rava, as Rava said: Consecration leavened bread and emancipation abrogate lien
llm_translation: As Rava said: One who consecrates chametz and a freed slave - they are exempt from servitude.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַב חִסְדָּא: מַעֲשֶׂה בִּבְלוֹרְיָא הַגִּיּוֹרֶת שֶׁקָּדְמוּ עֲבָדֶיהָ וְטָבְלוּ לְפָנֶיהָ, וּבָא מַעֲשֶׂה לִפְנֵי חֲכָמִים, וְאָמְרוּ: קָנוּ עַצְמָן בְּנֵי חוֹרִין. לְפָנֶיהָ — אִין, לְאַחֲרֶיהָ — לָא!
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda raised an objection an incident involving Beloreya the female convert in which her slaves preempted and immersed before her And incident came before the Sages, and they said: acquired themselves freemen. before her, yes, after her, no,
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: Rav Ḥisda raised an objection: There was an incident involving a convert woman from Biloria whose slaves preceded her and immersed themselves before her. The matter came before the Sages, and they said: The sons of free women acquired themselves. Before her—yes, after her—no!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: לְפָנֶיהָ, בֵּין בִּסְתָם בֵּין בִּמְפוֹרֵשׁ. לְאַחֲרֶיהָ, בִּמְפוֹרֵשׁ — אִין, בִּסְתָם — לָא.
human_translation: Rava said: before her whether without a specified or whether with explicit after her, with explicit yes, without a specified no,
llm_translation: Rava said: Before her, whether in a concealed manner or in an explicit manner. After her, in an explicit manner - yes, in a concealed manner - no.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אַוְיָא: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא בְּלוֹקֵחַ מִן הַגּוֹי, אֲבָל גּוֹי גּוּפֵיהּ — קָנֵי.
human_translation: Rav Avya said: They taught only with regard to who purchased from a gentile but a gentile his body acquires
llm_translation: Rav Avya said: They only taught this regarding one who buys from a non-Jew, but if the non-Jew himself, he acquires.

hebrew_text: דִּכְתִיב: ״וְגַם מִבְּנֵי הַתּוֹשָׁבִים הַגָּרִים עִמָּכֶם מֵהֶם תִּקְנוּ״, אַתֶּם קוֹנִים מֵהֶם, וְלֹא הֵם קוֹנִים מִכֶּם, וְלֹא הֵם קוֹנִים זֶה מִזֶּה.
human_translation: As it is written: “Moreover, of the children of the strangers that sojourn among you, of them you may acquire” you, can acquire from them, but they cannot acquire from you, and they cannot acquire from one another.
llm_translation: It is written: "And also from the children of the strangers that sojourn among you, of them shall ye buy," you acquire from them, and they do not acquire from you, and they do not acquire from each other.

hebrew_text: וְלֹא הֵם קוֹנִים מִכֶּם. לְמַאי? אִילֵימָא לְמַעֲשֶׂה יָדָיו — אַטּוּ גּוֹי לָא קָנֵי לֵיהּ לְיִשְׂרָאֵל לְמַעֲשֵׂה יָדָיו? וְהָכְתִיב: ״אוֹ לְעֵקֶר מִשְׁפַּחַת גֵּר״, וְאָמַר מָר: ״מִשְׁפַּחַת גֵּר״ — זֶה הַגּוֹי! אֶלָּא לָאו, לְגוּפֵיהּ. וְקָאָמַר רַחֲמָנָא: אַתֶּם קוֹנִין מֵהֶם — אֲפִילּוּ גּוּפֵיהּ.
human_translation: But they cannot acquire from you, to what If we say for his labor, is that to say a gentile cannot acquire a Jew for his labor? Isn’t it written: or to the offshoot of a stranger’s family” and the Master said “a stranger’s family” this a gentile. Rather, is it not to his body, and the Merciful One states you, can acquire from them, even his body.
llm_translation: "And not they acquire from you." For what? If you will say for the work of his hands - a non-Jew does not acquire it for Israel for the work of his hands? But it is written: "Or to the stranger's family," and the Master said: "The stranger's family" - this is the non-Jew! Rather, not for itself. And the Merciful One says: "You acquire from them" - even for itself.

hebrew_text: פָּרֵיךְ רַב אַחָא: אֵימָא בְּכַסְפָּא וּבִטְבִילָה! קַשְׁיָא.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa refutes Say with money and by immersing difficult.
llm_translation: Rav Acha asked: Why not with money and immersion? It is difficult.

hebrew_text: אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל, וְצָרִיךְ לְתׇקְפּוֹ בַּמַּיִם.
human_translation: Shmuel said: And one needs to hold him tightly in the water
llm_translation: Said Shmuel, and needs to immerse it in water.

hebrew_text: כִּי הַאי דְּמִנְיָמִין עַבְדֵּיהּ דְּרַב אָשֵׁי בְּעָא (לאטבולי) [לְאַטְבּוֹלֵיהּ]. מַסְרֵיהּ נִיהֲלַיְיהוּ לְרָבִינָא וּלְרַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרָבָא. אָמַר לְהוּ: חֲזוֹ דְּמִינַּיְיכוּ קָבָעֵינָא לֵיהּ, רְמוֹ לֵיהּ אַרְוִיסָא בְּצַוְּארֵיהּ, אַרְפּוֹ לֵיהּ וְצַמְצִמוּ לֵיהּ.
human_translation: as in this involving Minyamin, Rav Ashi’s slave: he wished to immerse he passed him to Ravina and Rav Aḥa, son of Rava, he said to them: Be aware that I will claim for him from you They placed a bridle [ arvisa ] upon his neck, they loosened it and tightened it
llm_translation: This one, the servants of Rav Ashi requested to immerse him. They handed him over to Ravina and to Rav Acha the son of Rava. He said to them: "See that I have fixed my mind on him, lift him up by his neck, throw him into the water, and submerge him."

hebrew_text: אַרְפּוֹ לֵיהּ — כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלָא לֶהֱוֵי חֲצִיצָה. צַמְצִמוּ לֵיהּ — כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלָא לַקְדֵּים וְלֵימָא לְהוּ: לְשֵׁם בֶּן חוֹרִין אֲנִי טוֹבֵל. בַּהֲדֵי דְּדַלִּי רֵישֵׁיהּ מִמַּיָּא, אַנְּחוּ לֵיהּ זוּלְטָא דְטִינָא אַרֵישֵׁיהּ וַאֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: זִיל אַמְטִי לְבֵי מָרָךְ.
human_translation: They loosened it in order that there should not be any interposition They tightened it in order that should not preempt and say to them: I am immersing for the sake of a freeman. When he lifted his head from the water they placed a bucket of clay upon his head and said to him: Go bring to the house of your master.
llm_translation: Arpo leih - so that it should not be a partition. Tzamtzimu leih - so that it should not be considered as a wall and one should say to him: "I am immersing for the sake of being a free man." While he is still removing his head from the water, they should pour a jug of cold water over his head and say to him: "Go, enter the bathhouse."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב פָּפָּא לְרָבָא: חֲזִי מָר הָנֵי דְּבֵי פָּפָּא בַּר אַבָּא, דְּיָהֲבִי זוּזִי לְאִינָשֵׁי לִכְרָגַיְיהוּ וּמְשַׁעְבְּדִי בְּהוּ. כִּי נָפְקִי, צְרִיכִי גִּיטָּא דְחֵירוּתָא, אוֹ לָא?
human_translation: Rav Pappa said to Rava: the Master seen those of the house of Pappa bar Abba who give money on behalf of people to for their poll tax [ karga ], and they would enslave them. When go free, do they require a bill of emancipation, or not,
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Papa to Rava: "See, Master, those of the house of Papa bar Abba, who give money to people to rent their houses and they work with it. When they go out, do they need a bill of emancipation or not?"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִיכּוֹ שְׁכֵיבִי לָא אֲמַרִי לְכוּ הָא מִילְּתָא. הָכִי אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: מוּהְרְקַיְיהוּ דְּהָנֵי, בְּטֻפְסָא דְמַלְכָּא מַנַּח, וּמַלְכָּא אָמַר: מַאן דְּלָא יָהֵיב כְּרָגָא, מִשְׁתַּעְבֵּד לְמַאן דְּיָהֵיב כְּרָגָא.
human_translation: He said to him: Were I dead I could not say this matter to you, this Rav Sheshet said The writ of slavery [ moharkayehu ] of these rests in the treasury [ tafsa ] of the king, And the king says: One who does not give the poll tax is to be enslaved to the one who give the poll tax
llm_translation: He said to him: "If they do not lie down, do not say to them this matter." Thus said Rav Sheshet: "They would sprinkle them with the king's ashes, and the king would say: 'Whoever does not give tribute, shall serve those who do give tribute.'"

hebrew_text: רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אִיקְּלַע לְגַבְלָא. חֲזָא בְּנוֹת יִשְׂרָאֵל דִּמְעַבְּרָן מִגֵּרִים שֶׁמָּלוּ וְלֹא טָבְלוּ, וַחֲזָא חַמְרָא דְיִשְׂרָאֵל דְּמָזְגִי גּוֹיִם וְשָׁתוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל, וַחֲזָא תּוֹרְמוֹסִין דְּשָׁלְקִי גּוֹיִם וְאָכְלִי יִשְׂרָאֵל, וְלָא אֲמַר לְהוּ וְלָא מִידֵּי.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba happened to Gavla. He saw Jewish women who had become pregnant from converts who were circumcised but had not immersed and he saw wine of Jews that gentiles were pouring, and Jews were drinking and he saw lupines [ turmusin ] that gentiles were cooking, and Jews were eating but he did not say anything to them.
llm_translation: Rabbi Chiya bar Abba encountered a border. He saw Jewish women who were crossing from the non-Jewish territories and did not immerse, and he saw Jewish wine that non-Jews had poured and Jews drank, and he saw cheeses that non-Jews had produced and Jews ate, yet he did not say anything to them.

hebrew_text: אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: צֵא וְהַכְרֵז עַל בְּנֵיהֶם שֶׁהֵם מַמְזֵרִים, וְעַל יֵינָם מִשּׁוּם יֵין נֶסֶךְ, וְעַל תּוֹרְמוֹסָן מִשּׁוּם בִּישּׁוּלֵי גוֹיִם, לְפִי שֶׁאֵינָן בְּנֵי תוֹרָה.
human_translation: he came before Rabbi Yoḥanan Rabbi Yoḥanan said to him: Go and make declaration concerning their children that they are mamzerim , and concerning their wine because wine poured as an libation, and concerning their lupines because food cooked by gentiles. because they are not in Torah,
llm_translation: He came before Rabbi Yochanan. He said to him: Go out and proclaim regarding their children that they are mamzerim, and regarding their wine as wine libations, and regarding their etrogs as idolatrous produce, because they are not sons of Torah.

hebrew_text: עַל בְּנֵיהֶן שֶׁהֵם מַמְזֵרִים — רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן לְטַעְמֵיהּ. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: לְעוֹלָם אֵין גֵּר עַד שֶׁיָּמוּל וְיִטְבּוֹל. וְכֵיוָן דְּלָא טָבֵיל, גּוֹי הוּא. וְאָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: גּוֹי וְעֶבֶד הַבָּא עַל בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל — הַוָּלָד מַמְזֵר.
human_translation: concerning their children that they are mamzerim , Rabbi Yoḥanan to his reasoning as Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: is never a convert until he has been circumcised and has immersed. And since had not immersed, he is a gentile. And Rabba bar bar Ḥana said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: a gentile or a slave who engaged in intercourse with a Jewish woman, the offspring is a mamzer .
llm_translation: Regarding their children who are mamzerim - Rabbi Yochanan according to his reasoning. For Rabbi Chiya bar Abba said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: A convert is never considered legally a Jew until he is circumcised and immersed in the mikveh. And since he did not immerse, he is a gentile. And Rabba bar bar Chana said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: A gentile or a slave who has relations with a Jewish woman - the offspring is a mamzer.

hebrew_text: וְעַל יֵינָם מִשּׁוּם יֵין נֶסֶךְ — מִשּׁוּם: ״לֵךְ לֵךְ, אָמְרִין נְזִירָא, סְחוֹר סְחוֹר, לְכַרְמָא לָא תִּקְרַב״.
human_translation: And concerning their wine because wine poured as an libation due to Go, go, we say to a nazirite, go around and go around, do not come near to the vineyard.
llm_translation: "And regarding their wine, because of the wine libation - because of: 'Go away, go away,' the Nazirites say, 'Do not approach a vineyard.'"

hebrew_text: וְעַל תּוֹרְמוֹסָן מִשּׁוּם בִּשּׁוּלֵי גוֹיִם — לְפִי שֶׁאֵינָן בְּנֵי תוֹרָה. הָא בְּנֵי תוֹרָה שְׁרֵי? וְהָאָמַר רַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר רַב יִצְחָק מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב: כָּל הַנֶּאֱכָל כְּמוֹת שֶׁהוּא חַי — אֵין בּוֹ מִשּׁוּם בִּשּׁוּלֵי גוֹיִם. וְהָא תּוֹרְמוֹס אֵינוֹ נֶאֱכָל כְּמוֹת שֶׁהוּא חַי, וְיֵשׁ בּוֹ מִשּׁוּם בִּשּׁוּלֵי גוֹיִם!
human_translation: And concerning their lupines because food cooked by gentiles because they are not in Torah. were they students of the Torah be permitted? Didn’t Rav Shmuel bar Rav Yitzḥak say in the name of Rav: Any that is eaten as it is, raw, is not to food cooked by gentiles, But a lupine is not eaten as it is, raw, and it is subject to food cooked by gentiles.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And regarding wormy figs, because of the fear of non-Jewish tax collectors - since they are not the children of Torah. But are the children of Torah permitted? And Rav Shmuel bar Rav Yitzchak said in the name of Rav: Anything that is eaten while alive - does not have the status of non-Jewish tax collectors. But a wormy fig is not eaten while alive, and it does have the status of non-Jewish tax collectors!

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן כְּאִידַּךְ לִישָּׁנָא סְבִירָא לֵיהּ, דְּאָמַר רַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר רַב יִצְחָק מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב: כֹּל שֶׁאֵין עוֹלֶה עַל שׁוּלְחַן מְלָכִים לֶאֱכוֹל בּוֹ אֶת הַפַּת — אֵין בּוֹ מִשּׁוּם בִּשּׁוּלֵי גוֹיִם, וְטַעְמָא דְּאֵינָן בְּנֵי תוֹרָה, הָא בְּנֵי תוֹרָה שְׁרֵי.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan holds in accordance with the other version Rav Shmuel bar Rav Yitzḥak said in the name of Rav: Any does not appear on the table of kings to eat bread with it is not to food cooked by gentiles. And the reason because they are not in Torah, in Torah, it is permitted.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan, like the other opinion, holds, as Rav Shmuel bar Rav Yitzchak said in the name of Rav: "Anything that does not go up on the table of kings to be eaten with bread - does not have the status of the bread of non-Jews, and the reason is that they are not Torah scholars, but Torah scholars are permitted."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: גֵּר שֶׁמָּל וְלֹא טָבַל, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: הֲרֵי זֶה גֵּר, שֶׁכֵּן מָצִינוּ בַּאֲבוֹתֵינוּ שֶׁמָּלוּ וְלֹא טָבְלוּ. טָבַל וְלֹא מָל, רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: הֲרֵי זֶה גֵּר, שֶׁכֵּן מָצִינוּ בָּאִמָּהוֹת שֶׁטָּבְלוּ וְלֹא מָלוּ. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: טָבַל וְלֹא מָל, מָל וְלֹא טָבַל — אֵין גֵּר עַד שֶׁיָּמוּל וְיִטְבּוֹל.
human_translation: The Sages taught a convert who was circumcised but did not immerse, Rabbi Eliezer says this is a convert, as so we found with our forefathers that they were circumcised but were not immersed. immersed but was not circumcised, Rabbi Yehoshua says this is a convert, as so we found with our foremothers that they immersed but were not circumcised. And the Rabbis say: he immersed but was not circumcised he was circumcised but did not immerse, he is not a convert until he is circumcised and he immerses.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: A convert who was circumcised but did not immerse in the mikveh, Rabbi Eliezer says: This one is a convert, as we found with our forefathers that they were circumcised but did not immerse. If he immersed but was not circumcised, Rabbi Yehoshua says: This one is a convert, as we found with our foremothers that they immersed but were not circumcised. And the Sages say: If he immersed but was not circumcised, or if he was circumcised but did not immerse — he is not a convert until he is circumcised and immerses.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ נָמֵי נֵילַף מֵאָבוֹת, וְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר נָמֵי נֵילַף מֵאִמָּהוֹת! וְכִי תֵימָא, אֵין דָּנִין אֶפְשָׁר מִשֶּׁאִי אֶפְשָׁר.
human_translation: But let Rabbi Yehoshua also derive from forefathers; And let Rabbi Eliezer also derive from foremothers; And if you would say one cannot derive possible from impossible,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua is named after his paternal ancestors, and Rabbi Eliezer is named after his maternal ancestors! And if you were to say, "We do not judge based on what is impossible, for what is impossible is possible."

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: מִנַּיִן לְפֶסַח דּוֹרוֹת שֶׁאֵין בָּא אֶלָּא מִן הַחוּלִּין — נֶאֱמַר פֶּסַח בְּמִצְרַיִם, וְנֶאֱמַר פֶּסַח בְּדוֹרוֹת. מָה פֶּסַח הָאָמוּר בְּמִצְרַיִם — אֵין בָּא אֶלָּא מִן הַחוּלִּין, אַף פֶּסַח הָאָמוּר לְדוֹרוֹת — אֵין בָּא אֶלָּא מִן הַחוּלִּין.
human_translation: isn’t it taught Rabbi Eliezer says: From where to Paschal lamb generations that it may be brought only from non-sacred A Paschal lamb is stated in Egypt, and a Paschal lamb is stated in generations. just as the Paschal lamb stated in Egypt was only brought from non-sacred so too, the Paschal lamb stated to generations, it may be brought only from non-sacred
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it was taught: Rabbi Eliezer says: From where do we derive that for the Passover of generations, only those who are circumcised may partake? It is stated "Passover in Egypt," and it is stated "Passover in generations." Just as the Passover mentioned in Egypt may only be eaten by those who are circumcised, so too the Passover mentioned for generations may only be eaten by those who are circumcised.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: וְכִי דָּנִין אֶפְשָׁר מִשֶּׁאִי אֶפְשָׁר? אָמַר לוֹ: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאִי אֶפְשָׁר — רְאָיָה גְּדוֹלָה הִיא, וְנִלְמַד הֵימֶנָּה.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva said to him: But can one derive possible, from impossible, said to him: Although it was impossible it is a great proof, and we may learn from it.
llm_translation: He said to him Rabbi Akiva: And is it possible to judge when it is impossible to judge? He said to him: Even though it is impossible to judge - it is a great insight, and we learn from it.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא
human_translation: Rather,
llm_translation: Rather

hebrew_text: בְּטָבַל וְלֹא מָל — כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דְּמַהְנֵי, כִּי פְּלִיגִי בְּמָל וְלֹא טָבַל. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר יָלֵיף מֵאָבוֹת, וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: בְּאָבוֹת נָמֵי טְבִילָה הֲוָה.
human_translation: With regard to one who immersed but was not circumcised, everyone, agrees that is effective. Where they disagree with regard to one who was circumcised but had not immersed; Rabbi Eliezer derives from the forefathers, and Rabbi Yehoshua in forefathers there was also an immersion.
llm_translation: In a case where he immersed but did not circumcise — everyone agrees that they are not valid, for they only disagree when he circumcised but did not immerse. Rabbi Eliezer learns from the fathers, and Rabbi Yehoshua: indeed, immersion was with the fathers.

hebrew_text: מְנָא לֵיהּ? אִילֵּימָא מִדִּכְתִיב: ״לֵךְ אֶל הָעָם וְקִדַּשְׁתָּם הַיּוֹם וּמָחָר וְכִבְּסוּ שִׂמְלֹתָם״, וּמָה בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁאֵין טָעוּן כִּבּוּס — טָעוּן טְבִילָה, מְקוֹם שֶׁטָּעוּן כִּבּוּס — אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁטָּעוּן טְבִילָה.
human_translation: From where did he If we say from that it is written “Go unto the people and sanctify them today and tomorrow, and let them wash their garments” Just as in a case where washing, is not required immersion is required, in a case where washing is required, isn’t it logical that immersion should be required?
llm_translation: He asks him: From where do we derive this? If you say it is derived from what is written: "Go to the people and sanctify them today and tomorrow, and let them wash their garments," then in a place where washing is not required, immersion is required; in a place where washing is required, immersion is not required.

hebrew_text: וְדִלְמָא, נְקִיּוּת בְּעָלְמָא?!
human_translation: But perhaps merely for cleanliness
llm_translation: And perhaps, cleanliness in general?!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מֵהָכָא: ״וַיִּקַּח מֹשֶׁה אֶת הַדָּם וַיִּזְרֹק עַל הָעָם״, וּגְמִירִי דְּאֵין הַזָּאָה בְּלֹא טְבִילָה.
human_translation: Rather, from here, “And Moses took the blood and sprinkled it upon the people” and it is learned that there is no sprinkling without immersion.
llm_translation: Rather, from here: "And Moses took the blood and sprinkled it on the people," and it is learned that the sprinkling is not valid without immersion.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ, טְבִילָה בָּאִמָּהוֹת מְנָלַן? סְבָרָא הוּא, דְּאִם כֵּן, בַּמֶּה נִכְנְסוּ תַּחַת כַּנְפֵי הַשְּׁכִינָה?
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehoshua, from where do we in foremothers immersion? It is logical reasoning, as, if so, with what were they brought under the wings of the Divine Presence?
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua, immersion in their mothers, from where do we derive? It is a logical deduction, for if so, into what did they enter beneath the wings of the Divine Presence?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: לְעוֹלָם אֵינוֹ גֵּר עַד שֶׁיִמּוֹל וְיִטְבּוֹל. פְּשִׁיטָא, יָחִיד וְרַבִּים הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּים!
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: never a convert until he is circumcised and has immersed. Isn’t obvious? an individual and many halakha is in accordance with the many
llm_translation: Rabbi Hiyya bar Abba said, Rabbi Yochanan said: A convert is never considered a convert until he is circumcised and immersed. It is obvious, the law follows the majority in the case of an individual and the majority!

hebrew_text: מַאן חֲכָמִים — רַבִּי יוֹסֵי.
human_translation: Who are the Rabbis Rabbi Yosei.
llm_translation: Who is a sage? — Rabbi Yosei.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: הֲרֵי שֶׁבָּא וְאָמַר מַלְתִּי וְלֹא טָבַלְתִּי — מַטְבִּילִין אוֹתוֹ, וּמָה בְּכָךְ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: אֵין מַטְבִּילִין.
human_translation: as it is taught who came and said: I was circumcised but I did not immerse, should immerse him, what with that; the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Yosei says: does not immerse
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: If one comes and says, "I circumcised but did not immerse," we immerse him. And what is the reason for this? These are the words of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Yosei says: We do not immerse him.

hebrew_text: לְפִיכָךְ מַטְבִּילִין גֵּר בְּשַׁבָּת, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה. וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: אֵין מַטְבִּילִין.
human_translation: Therefore, may immerse a convert on Shabbat; the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. And Rabbi Yosei says: may not immerse
llm_translation: Therefore, immerse a convert on Shabbat, the words of Rabbi Yehuda. And Rabbi Yosei says: Do not immerse.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: לְפִיכָךְ מַטְבִּילִין גֵּר בְּשַׁבָּת. פְּשִׁיטָא, כֵּיוָן דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בַּחֲדָא סַגִּיא, הֵיכָא דְּמָל לְפָנֵינוּ — מַטְבִּילִין, מַאי ״לְפִיכָךְ״?
human_translation: The Master said Therefore, may immerse a convert on Shabbat. Isn’t obvious since Rabbi Yehuda said that one is sufficient, where was circumcised in our presence immerse What, Therefore?
llm_translation: Master said: Therefore, one may immerse a convert on Shabbat. It is obvious, since Rabbi Yehuda said in one significant case, where it is in front of us - we immerse. What is the meaning of "therefore"?

hebrew_text: מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה טְבִילָה עִיקָּר, וּטְבִילָה בְּשַׁבָּת לָא, דְּקָא מְתַקֵּן גַּבְרָא. קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹ הָא אוֹ הָא בָּעֵי.
human_translation: lest you say according to Rabbi Yehuda the immersion is the principal And immersion on Shabbat not as it establishes the person teach us that Rabbi Yehuda requires either this or that,
llm_translation: What is the reasoning? According to Rabbi Yehuda, immersion is essential, but immersion on Shabbat is not, as it is considered fixing a vessel. It can be inferred for us that Rabbi Yehuda either requires this or that.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: אֵין מַטְבִּילִין. פְּשִׁיטָא, דְּכֵיוָן דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי תַּרְתֵּי בָּעֵינַן — תַּקּוֹנֵי גַּבְרָא בְּשַׁבָּת לָא מְתַקְּנִינַן!
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: may not immerse Isn’t obvious As, since Rabbi Yosei requires two we may not establish person on Shabbat
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: we do not immerse. It is obvious, for since Rabbi Yosei said two things, we do not establish the man's correction on Shabbat!

hebrew_text: מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: לְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי מִילָה עִיקָּר, וְהָתָם הוּא דְּלָא הֲוַאי מִילָה בְּפָנֵינוּ, אֲבָל הֵיכָא דַּהֲוַאי מִילָה בְּפָנֵינוּ — אֵימָא (לִיטְבֹּל זֶה) [לַיטְבְּלֵיהּ] בְּשַׁבְּתָא. קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי תַּרְתֵּי בָּעֵי.
human_translation: lest you say according to Rabbi Yosei circumcision is the principal and there, where the circumcision was not performed in our presence however, where the circumcision was performed in our presence, say let us immerse this on Shabbat. teach us that Rabbi Yosei requires two
llm_translation: What is the reasoning? According to Rabbi Yosei, circumcision is essential, and there it is where circumcision is not before us, but here where circumcision is before us — say (let him immerse) on Shabbat. It is implied to us that Rabbi Yosei requires two actions.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה: עוֹבָדָא הֲוָה בֵּי רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר רַבִּי, וְרַב יוֹסֵף מַתְנִי רַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא בַּר רַבִּי, וְרַב סָפְרָא מַתְנֵי רַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא בְּרַבִּי חִיָּיא, דַּאֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ גֵּר שֶׁמָּל וְלֹא טָבַל. אָמַר לֵיהּ: שְׁהִי כָּאן עַד לִמְחַר וְנַטְבְּלִינָךְ.
human_translation: Rabba said: There was an incident in the house of Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Rabbi, and Rav Yosef teaches Rabbi Oshaya bar Rabbi and Rav Safra teaches Rabbi Oshaya, son of Rabbi Ḥiyya, which a convert came before him who was circumcised but had not immersed. He said to Remain here until tomorrow, and we will immerse you.
llm_translation: Rabba said: There was a case involving the household of Rabbi Chiya bar Rabbi, and Rav Yosef teaches in the name of Rabbi Oshaya bar Rabbi, and Rav Safra teaches in the name of Rabbi Oshaya bar Rabbi Chiya, that a convert came before him who had circumcised but had not immersed. He said to him: "Remain here until tomorrow, and we will immerse you."

hebrew_text: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ תְּלָת. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: גֵּר צָרִיךְ שְׁלֹשָׁה. וּשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: אֵינוֹ גֵּר עַד שֶׁיִמּוֹל וְיִטְבּוֹל. וּשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: אֵין מַטְבִּילִין גֵּר בַּלַּיְלָה. וְנֵימָא: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ נָמֵי בָּעֵינַן מוּמְחִין? דִּלְמָא דְּאִיקְּלַעוּ.
human_translation: Learn from three Learn from it a convert requires three And learn from it one is not a convert until he has been circumcised and immersed. And learn from it may not immerse a convert at night, And let us say also learn from it we require experts Perhaps they happened to be
llm_translation: Listen, infer three. Listen, infer: a convert requires three. And listen, infer: he is not a convert until he is circumcised and immersed. And listen, infer: one does not immerse a convert at night. And it was stated: listen, infer, do we require blemishes? Perhaps they have occurred.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: גֵּר צָרִיךְ שְׁלֹשָׁה, ״מִשְׁפָּט״ כְּתִיב בֵּיהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: A convert requires three “judgment,” is written with regard to him,
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Chiya bar Abba said Rabbi Yochanan: A convert requires three, "judgment" is written in it.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מִי שֶׁבָּא וְאָמַר ״גֵּר אֲנִי״, יָכוֹל נְקַבְּלֶנּוּ — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אִתְּךָ״, בְּמוּחְזָק לְךָ. בָּא וְעֵדָיו עִמּוֹ, מִנַּיִן — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְכִי יָגוּר אִתְּךָ גֵּר בְּאַרְצְכֶם״.
human_translation: The Sages taught someone who came and said: I am a convert, might we should accept him; the verse states: with you presumed by you he came and witnesses with him, from where the verse, states: “And if a convert sojourns with you in your land.”
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: If one comes and says, "I am a convert," can we accept him? The Talmud teaches us: "With you," firmly established for you. If he comes and his witnesses are with him, from where do we know? The Talmud teaches us: "And if a stranger dwells with you in your land."

hebrew_text: אֵין לִי אֶלָּא בָּאָרֶץ, בְּחוּץ לָאָרֶץ מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אִתְּךָ״ — בְּכׇל מָקוֹם שֶׁאִתְּךָ. אִם כֵּן, מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״בָּאָרֶץ״? בָּאָרֶץ — צָרִיךְ לְהָבִיא רְאָיָה, בְּחוּץ לָאָרֶץ — אֵין צָרִיךְ לְהָבִיא רְאָיָה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: בֵּין בָּאָרֶץ בֵּין בְּחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ — צָרִיךְ לְהָבִיא רְאָיָה.
human_translation: I have only in Eretz from where outside Eretz The verse states “with you,” in any place that he is with you, If so, what the verse states: In the land? in Eretz he needs to bring evidence but outside Eretz he does not need to bring evidence the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. And the Rabbis say: Whether in Eretz or whether outside Eretz he needs to bring evidence.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: I have only in the land, how do I know outside the land? Scripture says: "with you" - in every place that "with you." If so, why does Scripture say "in the land"? "In the land" - requires proof, outside the land - does not require proof, the words of Rabbi Yehuda. And the sages say: Whether in the land or outside the land - requires proof.

hebrew_text: בָּא הוּא וְעֵדָיו עִמּוֹ, קְרָא לְמָה לִי? אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: דְּאָמְרִי: שָׁמַעְנוּ שֶׁנִּתְגַּיֵּיר בְּבֵית דִּין שֶׁל פְּלוֹנִי. סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא לָא לְיהֵמְנִייהוּ, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: he came and witnesses with him, why do I a verse Rav Sheshet said: where they say: We heard that he converted in court so-and-so, enter your mind to say they should not be relied upon; teaches us
llm_translation: He and his witnesses came, why do I need them? Rav Sheshet said: as we say, we heard that he converted in the court of so-and-so. Do you think I would believe them? He is listening to us.

hebrew_text: ״בָּאָרֶץ״ — אֵין לִי אֶלָּא בָּאָרֶץ. בְּחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ מִנַּיִן — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אִתְּךָ״, בְּכׇל מָקוֹם שֶׁאִתְּךָ. וְהָא אַפֵּיקְתֵּיהּ? חֲדָא מֵ״אִתְּךָ״ וַחֲדָא מֵ״עִמָּךְ״.
human_translation: in land” I have only in Eretz from where outside Eretz The verse states: “With you,” in any place that he is with you, But didn’t you expound that One “with you” and one “with you”
llm_translation: "In the land" — I have only in the land. How do we know outside the land? The Talmud teaches: "with you," in every place that is with you. But didn't he exclude it? One from "with you" and one from "with you."

hebrew_text: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: בֵּין בָּאָרֶץ בֵּין בְּחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ צָרִיךְ לְהָבִיא רְאָיָה. וְאֶלָּא הָא כְּתִיב ״בָּאָרֶץ״!
human_translation: And the Rabbis say: Whether in Eretz or whether outside Eretz he needs to bring evidence. But isn’t “in land” written
llm_translation: The sages say: Whether in the land or outside the land, one must bring proof. But isn't it written "in the land"!

hebrew_text: הַהוּא מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ, דַּאֲפִילּוּ בָּאָרֶץ מְקַבְּלִים גֵּרִים. דְּסָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: מִשּׁוּם טֵיבוּתָא דְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל קָמִגַּיְּירִי, וְהַשְׁתָּא נָמֵי דְּלֵיכָּא טֵיבוּתָא, אִיכָּא לֶקֶט שִׁכְחָה וּפֵאָה וּמַעְשַׂר עָנִי, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: That is necessary that even in Eretz accept converts, as it could enter your mind to say for the sake of the goodness of Eretz Yisrael, they are converting, And nowadays, when there is no the goodness there are gleanings, forgotten sheaves, and corners and the poor man’s tithe teaches us
llm_translation: That one asks him, for even in the land they accept converts.
