Since your mind is made up, I say: Because of the goodness of the land of Israel they convert, but now that there is no goodness, there is gleaning, forgotten sheaves, corner of the field, and tithe for the poor, we hear.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הֲלָכָה, בֵּין בָּאָרֶץ בֵּין בְּחוּץ לָאָרֶץ צָרִיךְ לְהָבִיא רְאָיָה. פְּשִׁיטָא, יָחִיד וְרַבִּים הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּים! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: מִסְתַּבַּר טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, דְּקָמְסַיְּיעִי לֵיהּ קְרָאֵי, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: halakha whether in Eretz or whether outside of Eretz he needs to bring evidence. Isn’t obvious; an individual and many halakha is in accordance with many lest you say Rabbi Yehuda’s reason logical, being that the verse supports him teach us
llm_translation: Rabbi Hiyya bar Abba said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: The halakha, whether in the land or outside the land, requires bringing proof. It is obvious - in a dispute between an individual and the majority, the halakha follows the majority! Lest you say: The reasoning of Rabbi Yehuda is sound, as he supports his opinions with verses, the verses he brings support us.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״וּשְׁפַטְתֶּם צֶדֶק בֵּין אִישׁ וּבֵין אָחִיו וּבֵין גֵּרוֹ״, מִכָּאן אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: גֵּר שֶׁנִּתְגַּיֵּיר בְּבֵית דִּין — הֲרֵי זֶה גֵּר, בֵּינוֹ לְבֵין עַצְמוֹ — אֵינוֹ גֵּר.
human_translation: The Sages taught: “And judge righteously between a man and his brother, and the convert with him” From here, Rabbi Yehuda said: convert who converts in a court is a convert. in private, he is not a convert.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: "And you shall judge with righteousness between a man and his brother and his stranger." From here Rabbi Yehuda said: A convert who converted in a court - he is a convert, between himself and his own self - he is not a convert.

hebrew_text: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּאֶחָד שֶׁבָּא לִפְנֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה, וְאָמַר לוֹ: נִתְגַּיַּירְתִּי בֵּינִי לְבֵין עַצְמִי. אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: יֵשׁ לְךָ עֵדִים? אָמַר לוֹ: לָאו. יֵשׁ לְךָ בָּנִים? אָמַר לוֹ: הֵן. אָמַר לוֹ: נֶאֱמָן אַתָּה לִפְסוֹל אֶת עַצְמְךָ, וְאִי אַתָּה נֶאֱמָן לִפְסוֹל אֶת בָּנֶיךָ.
human_translation: an incident involving one who came before Rabbi Yehuda and said to him: I converted in private, Rabbi Yehuda said to him: you have witnesses He said to him: No. you have children? He said to him: Yes. said to him: You are deemed credible to render yourself unfit but you are not deemed credible to render your children unfit.
llm_translation: Story with one who came before Rabbi Yehuda, and said to him: I converted between me and myself. Rabbi Yehuda said to him: Do you have witnesses? He said to him: No. Do you have children? He said to him: Yes. He said to him: You are trustworthy to disqualify yourself, but you are not trustworthy to disqualify your children.

hebrew_text: [וּמִי] אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אַבָּנִים לָא מְהֵימַן? וְהָתַנְיָא: ״יַכִּיר״ — יַכִּירֶנּוּ לַאֲחֵרִים. מִכָּאן אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: נֶאֱמָן אָדָם לוֹמַר ״זֶה בְּנִי בְּכוֹר״, וּכְשֵׁם שֶׁנֶּאֱמָן לוֹמַר ״זֶה בְּנִי בְּכוֹר״, כָּךְ נֶאֱמָן לוֹמַר: ״בְּנִי זֶה בֶּן גְּרוּשָׁה הוּא״, אוֹ ״בֶּן חֲלוּצָה הוּא״. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֵינוֹ נֶאֱמָן!
human_translation: But did Rabbi Yehuda say with regard to children he is not deemed credible? But isn’t it taught “He shall acknowledge [ yakir ] he can identify him [ yakirenu ] to others. From here Rabbi Yehuda said: A man is deemed credible to say: This is my firstborn son, and just as he is deemed credible to say: This is my firstborn son, so is deemed credible to say: This son of mine is a son of a divorced woman or a son of a ḥalutza And the Rabbis say: He is not deemed credible.
llm_translation: And who said Rabbi Yehuda does not trust stones? And it was taught: "He shall acknowledge" - he shall acknowledge it to others. From here Rabbi Yehuda said: A person is trusted to say, "This is my firstborn son," and just as he is trusted to say, "This is my firstborn son," so too he is trusted to say, "This son of mine is a child of divorce," or "he is a child of halitzah." And the Sages say: He is not trusted!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק, הָכִי קָאָמַר לֵיהּ: לִדְבָרֶיךָ גּוֹי אַתָּה, וְאֵין עֵדוּת לְגוֹי. רָבִינָא אָמַר, הָכִי קָאָמַר לֵיהּ: יֵשׁ לְךָ בָּנִים? הֵן. יֵשׁ לְךָ בְּנֵי בָנִים? הֵן. אָמַר לוֹ: נֶאֱמָן אַתָּה לִפְסוֹל בָּנֶיךָ, וְאִי אַתָּה נֶאֱמָן לִפְסוֹל בְּנֵי בָנֶיךָ.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said this is what said to him: According to your statement you are a gentile, and there is no testimony for a gentile, Ravina said this is what said to him: you have children? He said: Yes. He said to him: you have grandchildren? Yes. He said to him: You are deemed credible to render your children unfit, but you are not deemed credible to render your grandchildren unfit,
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said thus to him: "According to your words, you are a gentile, and there is no testimony for a gentile." Ravina said, thus he said to him: "Do you have sons?" "Yes." "Do you have grandsons?" "Yes." He said to him: "You are trustworthy to disqualify your sons, but you are not trustworthy to disqualify your grandsons."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: נֶאֱמָן אָדָם לוֹמַר עַל בְּנוֹ קָטָן, וְאֵין נֶאֱמָן עַל בְּנוֹ גָּדוֹל. וְאָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: לֹא קָטָן קָטָן מַמָּשׁ, וְלֹא גָּדוֹל גָּדוֹל מַמָּשׁ. אֶלָּא, קָטָן וְיֵשׁ לוֹ בָּנִים — זֶהוּ גָּדוֹל. גָּדוֹל וְאֵין לוֹ בָּנִים — זֶהוּ קָטָן.
human_translation: This is also taught Rabbi Yehuda says: A man is deemed credible to say about his minor son but he is not deemed credible to say about his adult son And Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: a minor not literally a minor, and an adult not literally an adult, rather, a minor who has children, this is an adult, an adult who does not have children, this is a minor.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Yehudah says: A person is trustworthy to speak about his young son, but he is not trustworthy to speak about his adult son. And Rabbi Hiyya bar Abba said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: Not a truly young son, and not a truly adult son. Rather, a young son who has children - this is considered an adult. An adult who does not have children - this is considered a young son.

hebrew_text: וְהִלְכְתָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק. וְהָתַנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרָבִינָא! הָהוּא, לְעִנְיַן ״יַכִּיר״ אִיתְּמַר.
human_translation: And the halakha is in accordance with Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak. But isn’t it taught in accordance with of Ravina? That was stated concerning the matter of “he shall acknowledge,”
llm_translation: The halakha is in accordance with the opinion of Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak. And it was taught in accordance with the opinion of Ravina! That one, in the matter of "recognize," it was stated.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: גֵּר שֶׁבָּא לְהִתְגַּיֵּיר בִּזְמַן הַזֶּה, אוֹמְרִים לוֹ: מָה רָאִיתָ שֶׁבָּאתָ לְהִתְגַּיֵּיר? אִי אַתָּה יוֹדֵעַ שֶׁיִּשְׂרָאֵל בִּזְמַן הַזֶּה דְּווּיִים, דְּחוּפִים, סְחוּפִים וּמְטוֹרָפִין, וְיִסּוּרִין בָּאִין עֲלֵיהֶם? אִם אוֹמֵר: יוֹדֵעַ אֲנִי, וְאֵינִי כְּדַאי — מְקַבְּלִין אוֹתוֹ מִיָּד.
human_translation: The Sages taught convert who comes to convert, at the present time, say to him: What did you see that you come to convert? Don’t you know that the Jewish people at the present time are anguished, suppressed, despised, and harassed, and hardships are visited upon them? If he says: I know, and I am unworthy accepts him immediately
llm_translation: The sages taught: A convert who comes to convert in this time, they say to him: "What did you see that you came to convert? Do you not know that the Israelites in this time are persecuted, oppressed, subjugated, and suffering afflictions? If he says: 'I know and am unworthy,' they accept him immediately.

hebrew_text: וּמוֹדִיעִין אוֹתוֹ מִקְצָת מִצְוֹת קַלּוֹת וּמִקְצָת מִצְוֹת חֲמוּרוֹת, וּמוֹדִיעִין אוֹתוֹ עֲוֹן לֶקֶט שִׁכְחָה וּפֵאָה וּמַעְשַׂר עָנִי. וּמוֹדִיעִין אוֹתוֹ עׇנְשָׁן שֶׁל מִצְוֹת. אוֹמְרִים לוֹ: הֱוֵי יוֹדֵעַ שֶׁעַד שֶׁלֹּא בָּאתָ לְמִדָּה זוֹ, אָכַלְתָּ חֵלֶב — אִי אַתָּה עָנוּשׁ כָּרֵת. חִלַּלְתָּ שַׁבָּת — אִי אַתָּה עָנוּשׁ סְקִילָה. וְעַכְשָׁיו, אָכַלְתָּ חֵלֶב — עָנוּשׁ כָּרֵת, חִלַּלְתָּ שַׁבָּת — עָנוּשׁ סְקִילָה.
human_translation: And inform him some of the lenient mitzvot and some of the stringent mitzvot, and they inform him the sin gleanings, forgotten sheaves, and corner and poor man’s tithe. And they inform him the punishment for the mitzvot, They say to him: Be aware that before you came to this status had you eaten forbidden fat, you would not be punished by karet , had you profaned Shabbat, you would not be punished by stoning, But now, you have eaten forbidden fat you are punished by karet , you have profaned Shabbat, you are punished by stoning.
llm_translation: We inform him of some easy commandments and some severe commandments, and we inform him of the sin of leaving gleanings, forgotten sheaves, and tithes for the poor. And we inform him of the punishments for the commandments. We say to him: Know that until you came to this level, if you ate forbidden fat - you are liable to karet. If you desecrated the Sabbath - you are liable to stoning. And now, if you ate forbidden fat - you are liable to karet, if you desecrated the Sabbath - you are liable to stoning.

hebrew_text: וּכְשֵׁם שֶׁמּוֹדִיעִין אוֹתוֹ עׇנְשָׁן שֶׁל מִצְוֹת, כָּךְ מוֹדִיעִין אוֹתוֹ מַתַּן שְׂכָרָן. אוֹמְרִים לוֹ: הֱוֵי יוֹדֵעַ שֶׁהָעוֹלָם הַבָּא אֵינוֹ עָשׂוּי אֶלָּא לְצַדִּיקִים, וְיִשְׂרָאֵל בִּזְמַן הַזֶּה אֵינָם יְכוֹלִים לְקַבֵּל
human_translation: And just as they inform him punishment for mitzvot, so they inform him reward granted for them. They say to him: Be aware that the World-to-Come is made only for the righteous, and the Jewish people, at the present time, are unable to receive
llm_translation: And as they inform him of the punishment of the commandments, so they inform him of their reward. They say to him: Know that the World to Come is only made for the righteous, and the Israelites in this time are unable to receive.

hebrew_text: לֹא רוֹב טוֹבָה וְלֹא רוֹב פּוּרְעָנוּת. וְאֵין מַרְבִּין עָלָיו, וְאֵין מְדַקְדְּקִין עָלָיו.
human_translation: not an abundance of good nor an abundance of calamities, And they do not overwhelm him and they are not exacting with him
llm_translation: Not majority of good and not majority of punishment. And not increase upon it, and not scrutinize upon it.

hebrew_text: קִיבֵּל — מָלִין אוֹתוֹ מִיָּד. נִשְׁתַּיְּירוּ בּוֹ צִיצִין הַמְעַכְּבִין אֶת הַמִּילָה — חוֹזְרִים וּמָלִין אוֹתוֹ שְׁנִיָּה. נִתְרַפֵּא — מַטְבִּילִין אוֹתוֹ מִיָּד. וּשְׁנֵי תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים עוֹמְדִים עַל גַּבָּיו וּמוֹדִיעִין אוֹתוֹ מִקְצָת מִצְוֹת קַלּוֹת וּמִקְצָת מִצְוֹת חֲמוּרוֹת. טָבַל וְעָלָה — הֲרֵי הוּא כְּיִשְׂרָאֵל לְכׇל דְּבָרָיו.
human_translation: he accepts they circumcise him immediately. there remain on him shreds that invalidate the circumcision, they circumcise him again a second he is healed they immerse him immediately, and two Torah scholars stand over him and inform him of some of the lenient mitzvot and some of the stringent mitzvot. he has immersed and emerged, he is like Jew in every sense.
llm_translation: Received — words him immediately. Remain in it fringes that delay the circumcision — return and circumcise him again. He healed — immerse him immediately. And two Torah scholars stand on his back and inform him some easy commandments and some severe commandments. He immersed and arose — he is like a full-fledged Israelite in all his matters.

hebrew_text: אִשָּׁה — נָשִׁים מוֹשִׁיבוֹת אוֹתָהּ בְּמַיִם עַד צַוָּארָהּ, וּשְׁנֵי תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים עוֹמְדִים לָהּ מִבַּחוּץ, וּמוֹדִיעִין אוֹתָהּ מִקְצָת מִצְוֹת קַלּוֹת וּמִקְצָת מִצְוֹת חֲמוּרוֹת.
human_translation: a woman: Women seat her in the water up to her neck, and two Torah scholars stand outside and they inform her of some of the lenient mitzvot and some of the stringent mitzvot.
llm_translation: A woman - women make her sit in water up to her neck, and two Torah scholars stand outside for her, and inform her of some easy commandments and some severe commandments.

hebrew_text: אֶחָד גֵּר, וְאֶחָד עֶבֶד מְשׁוּחְרָר. וּבִמְקוֹם שֶׁנִּדָּה טוֹבֶלֶת, שָׁם גֵּר וְעֶבֶד מְשׁוּחְרָר טוֹבְלִין. וְכׇל דָּבָר שֶׁחוֹצֵץ בִּטְבִילָה, חוֹצֵץ בְּגֵר וּבְעֶבֶד מְשׁוּחְרָר וּבְנִדָּה.
human_translation: both a convert and an emancipated slave And in the same place that a menstruating woman immerses, there a convert and an emancipated slave also immerse. And anything that interposes with regard to immersion interposes for a convert, and for an emancipated slave, and for a menstruating woman.
llm_translation: One convert, and one freed slave. And in a place where a menstruating woman immerses, there a convert and a freed slave immerse. And anything that requires immersion, requires immersion for a convert, a freed slave, and a menstruating woman.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: גֵּר שֶׁבָּא לְהִתְגַּיֵּיר, אוֹמְרִים לוֹ: מָה רָאִיתָ שֶׁבָּאתָ לְהִתְגַּיֵּיר? וּמוֹדִיעִים אוֹתוֹ מִקְצָת מִצְוֹת קַלּוֹת וּמִקְצָת מִצְוֹת חֲמוּרוֹת. מַאי טַעְמָא? דְּאִי פָּרֵישׁ — נִפְרוֹשׁ. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי חֶלְבּוֹ: קָשִׁים גֵּרִים לְיִשְׂרָאֵל כְּסַפַּחַת, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְנִלְוָה הַגֵּר עֲלֵיהֶם וְנִסְפְּחוּ עַל בֵּית יַעֲקֹב״.
human_translation: The Master said convert who comes to convert, say to him: What did you see that you come to convert? And they inform him some of the lenient mitzvot and some of the stringent mitzvot. What is the reason that if he withdraw let him withdraw as Rabbi Ḥelbo said: Converts are as harmful to the Jewish people as a scab [ sappaḥat ] as it is written: “And the convert shall join himself with them, and they shall cleave [ venispeḥu ] to the house of Jacob”
llm_translation: Master said: A convert who comes to convert, they say to him: "What did you see that you came to convert?" And they inform him of some easy mitzvot and some stringent mitzvot. What is the reason? Because if he separates, let him be separated. As Rabbi Helbo said: Converts are difficult for Israel like a skin disease, as it is written: "And the convert shall join them and be attached to the house of Jacob."

hebrew_text: וּמוֹדִיעִים אוֹתוֹ עֲוֹן לֶקֶט שִׁכְחָה וּפֵאָה וּמַעְשַׂר עָנִי. מַאי טַעְמָא? אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: בֶּן נֹחַ נֶהֱרָג עַל פָּחוֹת מִשָּׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה — וְלֹא נִיתָּן לְהִשָּׁבוֹן.
human_translation: And they inform him the sin gleanings, forgotten sheaves, and corner and poor man’s tithe. What is the reason Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: a gentile is executed on account of less than the value of a peruta , and is not subject to being returned,
llm_translation: They inform him of the sin of gleanings, forgotten sheaves, corners of the field, and the tithe for the poor. What is the reason? Rabbi Hiyya bar Abba said in the name of Rabbi Yohanan: A non-Jew is executed for murdering even less than the value of a perutah - and he is not subject to ransom.

hebrew_text: (וּמוֹדִיעִים אוֹתוֹ עֲוֹן שִׁכְחָה וּפֵאָה) וְאֵין מַרְבִּים עָלָיו וְאֵין מְדַקְדְּקִים עָלָיו. אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: מַאי קְרָאָה — דִּכְתִיב: ״וַתֵּרֶא כִּי מִתְאַמֶּצֶת הִיא לָלֶכֶת אִתָּהּ וַתֶּחְדַּל לְדַבֵּר אֵלֶיהָ״.
human_translation: And they inform him the sin gleanings, forgotten sheaves, and corner And they do not overwhelm him and they are not exacting with him Rabbi Elazar said: What is the verse As it is written: “And when she saw that she was steadfastly minded to go with her, she left off speaking with her”
llm_translation: They inform him of the sin of forgetting and leaving the corner of the field for the poor, and they do not increase upon him, and they do not scrutinize him. Rabbi Elazar said: What is the verse? As it is written: "And she saw that she was steadfastly minded to go with her, and she ceased speaking to her."

hebrew_text: אֲמַרָה לַהּ: אֲסִיר לַן תְּחוּם שַׁבָּת — ״בַּאֲשֶׁר תֵּלְכִי אֵלֵךְ״. אֲסִיר לַן יִחוּד — ״בַּאֲשֶׁר תָּלִינִי אָלִין״.
human_translation: said to her: it is prohibited for us the Shabbat limit. “Where you go, I shall go” It is forbidden for us to be alone together “Where you lodge, I shall lodge”
llm_translation: She said to them: "We are prohibited from leaving the boundary on Shabbat - 'wherever you go, I will go.' We are prohibited from seclusion - 'where you lodge, I will lodge.'"

hebrew_text: מִפַּקְדִינַן שֵׁשׁ מֵאוֹת וּשְׁלֹשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה מִצְוֹת — ״עַמֵּךְ עַמִּי״. אֲסִיר לַן עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה — ״וֵאלֹהַיִךְ אֱלֹהָי״. אַרְבַּע מִיתוֹת נִמְסְרוּ לְבֵית דִּין — ״בַּאֲשֶׁר תָּמוּתִי אָמוּת״. שְׁנֵי קְבָרִים נִמְסְרוּ לְבֵית דִּין — ״וְשָׁם אֶקָּבֵר״.
human_translation: We are commanded six hundred and thirteen mitzvot. “Your people are my people” Idolatrous worship is forbidden to us. “Your God is my God” Four types of capital punishment were handed over to a court “Where you die, I shall die” Two burial grounds were handed over to the court, “And there I shall be buried”
llm_translation: We count six hundred and thirteen commandments - "Your people are my people." We are prohibited from foreign worship - "And your God is my God." Four types of death penalties are entrusted to the court - "Where you die, I will die." Two burial places are entrusted to the court - "And there I will be buried."

hebrew_text: מִיָּד, ״וַתֵּרֶא כִּי מִתְאַמֶּצֶת הִיא וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: Immediately “And when she saw that she was steadfastly minded
llm_translation: Immediately, "And she saw that she was determined, etc."

hebrew_text: קִיבֵּל — מָלִין אוֹתוֹ מִיָּד. מַאי טַעְמָא — שַׁהוֹיֵי מִצְוָה לָא מְשַׁהֵינַן.
human_translation: he accepts they circumcise him immediately. What is the reason we do not delay a mitzva.
llm_translation: Received - words him immediately. What reason - that it should not be delayed a commandment.

hebrew_text: נִשְׁתַּיְּירוּ בּוֹ צִיצִין הַמְעַכְּבִין הַמִּילָה וְכוּ׳. כְּדִתְנַן: אֵלּוּ הֵן צִיצִין הַמְעַכְּבִין הַמִּילָה — בָּשָׂר הַחוֹפֶה אֶת רוֹב הָעֲטָרָה. וְאֵינוֹ אוֹכֵל בִּתְרוּמָה. וְאָמַר רַב יִרְמְיָה בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַב: בָּשָׂר הַחוֹפֶה רוֹב גּוֹבְהָהּ שֶׁל עֲטָרָה.
human_translation: there remain on him shreds that invalidate the circumcision, as we learned These are the shreds that invalidate the circumcision the flesh that cover the greater part of the corona. and he may not partake of teruma . And Rav Yirmeya bar Abba said Rav said: the flesh that covers the greater part of the height of the corona.
llm_translation: Remaining in it fringes that delay circumcision, etc. As we learned: These are the fringes that delay circumcision - flesh that covers most of the corona. And one may not eat terumah. And Rav Yirmiyah bar Abba said in the name of Rav: Flesh that covers most of its height of the corona.

hebrew_text: נִתְרַפֵּא — מַטְבִּילִין אוֹתוֹ מִיָּד. נִתְרַפֵּא — אִין, לֹא נִתְרַפֵּא — לָא. מַאי טַעְמָא? מִשּׁוּם דְּמַיָּא מַרְזוּ מַכָּה.
human_translation: he is healed they immerse him immediately. he has healed, yes, he has not healed, no, What is the reason because water agitates a wound.
llm_translation: He was healed - they immerse him immediately. He was healed - yes, he was healed; he was not healed - no. What is the reason? Because the blood congealed at the wound.

hebrew_text: וּשְׁנֵי תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים עוֹמְדִים עַל גַּבָּיו. וְהָא אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: גֵּר צָרִיךְ שְׁלֹשָׁה! הָא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן לְתַנָּא: תְּנִי, שְׁלֹשָׁה.
human_translation: And two Torah scholars stand over him But didn’t Rabbi Ḥiyya say Rabbi Yoḥanan said a convert requires three Rabbi Yoḥanan said to the tanna teach three.
llm_translation: And two students of sages standing on his back. And behold, Rabbi Chiya said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: A convert requires three! Behold, Rabbi Yochanan said to the Mishnaic sage: Teach, three.

hebrew_text: טָבַל וְעָלָה הֲרֵי הוּא כְּיִשְׂרָאֵל לְכׇל דְּבָרָיו. לְמַאי הִלְכְתָא? דְּאִי הָדַר בֵּיהּ וּמְקַדֵּשׁ בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל, יִשְׂרָאֵל מְשׁוּמָּד קָרֵינָא בֵּיהּ, וְקִידּוּשָׁיו קִידּוּשִׁין.
human_translation: he has immersed and emerged he is a Jew in every sense. With regard to what halakha that if he reverts back and he betroths a Jewish woman, he is considered to be an apostate Jew, his betrothal is betrothal.
llm_translation: He immersed and ascended, behold he is like a Yisrael in all his matters. For what halakha? For if he then marries her and sanctifies the daughter of Yisrael, Yisrael is called by his name, and his sanctifications are sanctifications.

hebrew_text: אֶחָד גֵּר וְאֶחָד עֶבֶד מְשׁוּחְרָר. קָסָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ, לְקַבֵּל עָלָיו עוֹל מִצְוֹת. וּרְמִינְהוּ: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — בְּגֵר, אֲבָל בְּעֶבֶד מְשׁוּחְרָר — אֵין צָרִיךְ לְקַבֵּל!
human_translation: both for a convert and for an emancipated slave. it enters your mind with regard to accepting upon oneself the yoke of mitzvot, raise a contradiction In what is this statement said? with respect to a convert; however, an emancipated slave does not need to accept
llm_translation: One convert and one freed slave. Your mind is at ease, to accept upon him the yoke of commandments. And they raised a dilemma: In what case are these words said - regarding a convert, but regarding a freed slave - it is not necessary to accept!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת, לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא — רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר, הָא — רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: Rav Sheshet said: not difficult, this is Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar, that is the Rabbis,
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet said, it is not difficult: here is Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar, here are the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: ״וּבָכְתָה אֶת אָבִיהָ וְאֶת אִמָּהּ וְגוֹ׳״. בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — שֶׁלֹּא קִבְּלָה עָלֶיהָ. אֲבָל קִבְּלָה עָלֶיהָ — מַטְבִּילָהּ, וּמוּתָּר בָּהּ מִיָּד.
human_translation: As it is taught and bewail her father and her mother Under what are these matters stated? when she did not accept upon herself however, she accepted upon herself he may immerse her and he is permitted to her immediately
llm_translation: Talmudic text: It was taught in a Baraita: "And she shall bewail her father and her mother, etc." In what case are these words said? — That she did not accept it. But if she accepted it, he may immerse her, and she is immediately permitted.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁלֹּא קִבְּלָה עָלֶיהָ, כּוֹפָהּ וּמַטְבִּילָהּ לְשֵׁם שִׁפְחוּת, וְחוֹזֵר וּמַטְבִּילָהּ לְשֵׁם שִׁחְרוּר, וּמְשַׁחְרְרָהּ,
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: Even if she did not accept upon herself he forces and immerses her for the sake of slavery, and then he again immerses her for the sake of emancipation and emancipates her,
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: Even though she did not accept it upon herself, he forces her and immerses her for the sake of servitude, then he immerses her again for the sake of freedom, and he frees her.

hebrew_text: וּמוּתָּר בָּהּ מִיָּד.
human_translation: And he is permitted to her immediately
llm_translation: And permitted in it immediately.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר — דִּכְתִיב: ״כׇּל עֶבֶד אִישׁ מִקְנַת כָּסֶף״. ״עֶבֶד אִישׁ״, וְלֹא עֶבֶד אִשָּׁה? אֶלָּא ״עֶבֶד אִישׁ״ — אַתָּה מָל בְּעַל כׇּרְחוֹ, וְאִי אַתָּה מָל בֶּן אִישׁ בְּעַל כׇּרְחוֹ.
human_translation: Rava said: What is the rationale Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar’s As it is written “Every slave of a man that is bought for money, a man’s slave but not a woman’s slave? rather, a slave who is a man you may circumcise against his will, but you may not circumcise son who is a man, against his will.
llm_translation: Rava said: What is the reason for Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar's statement? Because it is written: "Every male slave acquired with money." "Male slave," and not a female slave? Rather, "male slave" - you may circumcise him against his will, but you may not circumcise a son of a man against his will.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן? אָמַר עוּלָּא: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁאִי אַתָּה מָל בֶּן אִישׁ בְּעַל כׇּרְחוֹ, כָּךְ אִי אַתָּה מָל עֶבֶד אִישׁ בְּעַל כׇּרְחוֹ. וְאֶלָּא הָכְתִיב ״כׇּל עֶבֶד אִישׁ״? הַהוּא מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לִכְדִשְׁמוּאֵל.
human_translation: And the Rabbis Ulla said just as you may not circumcise a son who is a man against his will, so you may not circumcise a slave who is a man against his will. But isn’t it written: “Every slave of a man”? require that for that which Shmuel
llm_translation: The scholars? Ulai said: Just as you may not circumcise the son of a man against his will, so too you may not circumcise the slave of a man against his will. But isn't it written "every male slave"? That case is according to the opinion of Samuel.

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הַמַּפְקִיר עַבְדּוֹ יָצָא לְחֵירוּת וְאֵין צָרִיךְ גֵּט שִׁחְרוּר, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כׇּל עֶבֶד אִישׁ מִקְנַת כָּסֶף״. ״עֶבֶד אִישׁ״, וְלֹא עֶבֶד אִשָּׁה? אֶלָּא: עֶבֶד שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ רְשׁוּת לְרַבּוֹ עָלָיו — קָרוּי עֶבֶד, וְשֶׁאֵין רְשׁוּת לְרַבּוֹ עָלָיו — אֵין קָרוּי עֶבֶד.
human_translation: As Shmuel said: who renounces ownership of his slave, is emancipated, and he does not require a bill of emancipation, as it is stated: “But every slave of a man that is bought for money.” a man’s slave but not a woman’s slave? rather, a slave whose master has possession of him, is called a slave, but whose master does not have possession of him called a slave,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "D'amar Shmuel: Hamafkir avdo yatza lecheirut ve'ein tzarich get shichrur, shene'emar: 'kol eved ish miknat kesef.' 'Eved ish', velo eved isha? Ella: eved sheyesh lo reshut lerabbo alav — karuy eved, v'she'ein reshut lerabbo alav — ein karuy eved." English translation: "Shmuel said: One who emancipates his slave is released to freedom and does not require a bill of emancipation, as it is stated: 'Every slave that is a man's property.' 'Slave of a man,' and not a slave of a woman? Rather, a slave who has the option for his master to have authority over him — is called a slave, and one who does not have the option for his master to have authority over him — is not called a slave."

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב פָּפָּא: אֵימוֹר דְּשָׁמְעַתְּ לְהוּ לְרַבָּנַן בִּיפַת תּוֹאַר, דְּלָא שָׁיְיכָא בְּמִצְוֹת. אֲבָל עֶבֶד, דְּשָׁיֵיךְ בְּמִצְוֹת, הָכִי נָמֵי דַּאֲפִילּוּ רַבָּנַן מוֹדוּ.
human_translation: Rav Pappa strongly objects to Say that you heard the Rabbis with regard to a beautiful female who was not involved in mitzvot however, a slave, who was involved in mitzvot even the Rabbis would agree
llm_translation: Rav Papa objects to her: Say that you have heard from the Rabbis with regard to physical appearance, that it is not fitting for fulfilling commandments. But a slave, who is fitting for fulfilling commandments, so too the Rabbis agree.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: אֶחָד גֵּר וְאֶחָד לוֹקֵחַ עֶבֶד מִן הַגּוֹי — צָרִיךְ לְקַבֵּל. הָא לוֹקֵחַ מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל — אֵין צָרִיךְ לְקַבֵּל.
human_translation: As it is taught Both a convert and one who purchases a slave from a gentile need to accept but one purchases from a Jew, does not need to accept
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: One who takes a convert and one who takes a slave from a non-Jew — must accept. But one who takes from a Jew — does not need to accept.

hebrew_text: מַנִּי? אִי רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר, הָאָמַר: לוֹקֵחַ מִן הַגּוֹי נָמֵי אֵין צָרִיךְ לְקַבֵּל! אֶלָּא לָאו רַבָּנַן, וּשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: דְּלוֹקֵחַ מִן הַגּוֹי — צָרִיךְ לְקַבֵּל, אֲבָל לוֹקֵחַ מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל — אֵין צָרִיךְ לְקַבֵּל.
human_translation: whose If Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar, didn’t he say also one who purchases a slave from a gentile, does not need to accept Rather, must it not the Rabbis? And conclude from that one purchases a slave from a gentile, needs to accept but one who purchases from a Jew, does not need to accept
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Who is the authority? If it is Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar, who said: "One who buys from a non-Jew does not need to accept it!" Rather, it is not according to the Rabbis, and learn from it: that one who buys from a non-Jew — needs to accept, but one who buys from a Jew — does not need to accept.

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא קַשְׁיָא אֶחָד גֵּר וְאֶחָד עֶבֶד מְשׁוּחְרָר! כִּי תַּנְיָא הָהִיא — לְעִנְיַן טְבִילָה תַּנְיָא.
human_translation: But difficult both for a convert and for an emancipated slave. When that is taught, it is taught with regard to the matter of immersion,
llm_translation: And rather, a difficulty: one convert and one freed slave! For it was taught in a Baraita — in the matter of immersion it was taught.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״וְגִלְּחָה אֶת רֹאשָׁהּ וְעָשְׂתָה אֶת צִפׇּרְנֶיהָ״, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: תָּקוֹץ, רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: תְּגַדֵּיל.
human_translation: The Sages taught: “And she shall shave her head and do her nails” Rabbi Eliezer says: she cuts Rabbi Akiva says: she grows
llm_translation: The Sages taught: "And she shall shave her head and make her nails," Rabbi Eliezer says: "She shall make them small," Rabbi Akiva says: "She shall let them grow."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: נֶאֶמְרָה עֲשִׂיָּה בָּרֹאשׁ, וְנֶאֶמְרָה עֲשִׂיָּה בַּצִּפׇּרְנַיִם. מָה לְהַלָּן הַעֲבָרָה — אַף כָּאן הַעֲבָרָה. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: נֶאֶמְרָ[ה] עֲשִׂיָּה בָּרֹאשׁ, וְנֶאֶמְרָ[ה] עֲשִׂיָּה בַּצִּפׇּרְנַיִם. מָה לְהַלָּן נִיוּוּל — אַף כָּאן נִיוּוּל.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer said: doing is stated with regard to the head, and doing is stated with regard to the nails; just as there, removal, so too, here, removal. Rabbi Akiva says: doing is stated with regard to the head, and doing is stated with regard to the nails; just as there, repulsive, so too, here, repulsive,
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer said: It was stated, "Do the act of creation at the beginning," and it was stated, "Do the act of creation with the extremities." Just as there in the case of the Tabernacle, it was done in a crossing-over manner — so too here in the case of the Temple, it should be done in a crossing-over manner. Rabbi Akiva says: It was stated, "Do the act of creation at the beginning," and it was stated, "Do the act of creation with the extremities." Just as there in the case of the Tabernacle, it was done with a twist — so too here in the case of the Temple, it should be done with a twist.

hebrew_text: וּרְאָיָה לְדִבְרֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: ״וּמְפִבֹשֶׁת בֶּן שָׁאוּל יָרַד לִקְרַאת הַמֶּלֶךְ לֹא עָשָׂה רַגְלָיו וְלֹא עָשָׂה שְׂפָמוֹ״, מַאי עֲשִׂיָּה — הַעֲבָרָה.
human_translation: And a proof for the statement of Rabbi Eliezer “And Mephibosheth, the son of Saul, came down to meet the king; and he had neither done his feet nor done his mustache” What doing removal
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And a proof to the words of Rabbi Eliezer: "And Mephibosheth the son of Saul went down to meet the king, and he did not make his feet, and he did not make his mustache." What is the action? - Transgression.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״וּבָכְתָה אֶת אָבִיהָ וְאֶת אִמָּהּ״,
human_translation: The Sages taught “And she shall bewail her father and her mother
llm_translation: The Sages taught: "And she shall mourn her father and her mother."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: ״אָבִיהָ״ — אָבִיהָ מַמָּשׁ, ״אִמָּהּ״ — אִמָּהּ מַמָּשׁ. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: ״אָבִיהָ וְאִמָּהּ״ — זוֹ עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה. וְכֵן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״אוֹמְרִים לָעֵץ אָבִי אַתָּה וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: “Her father” her actual father “her mother” her actual mother. Rabbi Akiva says: Her father and her mother; this idolatrous deity and so it says: “They say to a tree: You are my father,
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: "Her father" - her actual father, "Her mother" - her actual mother. Rabbi Akiva says: "Her father and her mother" - this is idol worship. And so he also says: "They say to a tree, 'You are my father' etc."

hebrew_text: ״יֶרַח יָמִים״ — יֶרַח שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר, תִּשְׁעִים יוֹם: ״יֶרַח״ — שְׁלֹשִׁים, ״יָמִים״ — שְׁלֹשִׁים, ״וְאַחַר כֵּן״ — שְׁלֹשִׁים.
human_translation: “A month of days a thirty-day month. Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: ninety days. “a month” thirty “days” thirty and “after that” thirty
llm_translation: "Yerach yamim" - yerach shloshim yom. Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says, ninety days: "Yerach" - thirty, "yamim" - thirty, "ve'achar ken" - thirty.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רָבִינָא: אֵימָא: ״יֶרַח״ — שְׁלֹשִׁים, ״יָמִים״ — שְׁלֹשִׁים, ״וְאַחַר כֵּן״ — כִּי הָנֵי? קַשְׁיָא.
human_translation: Ravina strongly objects to this: say: “a month” thirty “days” thirty and “after that” equal to those difficult.
llm_translation: Ravina objects to her: Say: "month" - thirty, "days" - thirty, "and afterward" - these? difficult.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מְקַיְּימִין עֲבָדִים שֶׁאֵינָם מָלִין, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: אֵין מְקַיְּימִין. אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל, הֲרֵי הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״וְיִנָּפֵשׁ בֶּן אֲמָתְךָ״! אָמַר לוֹ: בְּלוֹקֵחַ עֶבֶד בֵּין הַשְּׁמָשׁוֹת וְלֹא הִסְפִּיק לְמוּלוֹ הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר.
human_translation: The Sages taught One may maintain slaves that are not circumcised the statement of Rabbi Yishmael. Rabbi Akiva says: One may not maintain Rabbi Yishmael said to him: But it says “And the son of your maidservant will be refreshed” said to him: The verse speaks of one who purchases a slave at twilight and does not have the opportunity to circumcise him
llm_translation: The sages taught: We establish slaves who are not circumcised, the words of Rabbi Yishmael. Rabbi Akiva says: We do not establish them. Rabbi Yishmael said to him: But he himself says, "and he shall be cut off from among his people." He said to him: When one acquires a slave between the suns and did not have time to circumcise him, the verse speaks.

hebrew_text: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא מִיהַת ״וְיִנָּפֵשׁ בֶּן אֲמָתְךָ״ — בְּעֶבֶד עָרֵל כְּתִיב, מַאי מַשְׁמַע? דְּתַנְיָא: ״וְיִנָּפֵשׁ בֶּן אֲמָתְךָ״ — בְּעֶבֶד עָרֵל הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר. אַתָּה אוֹמֵר בְּעֶבֶד עָרֵל, אוֹ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא בְּעֶבֶד מָהוּל? כְּשֶׁהוּא אוֹמֵר ״לְמַעַן יָנוּחַ עַבְדְּךָ וַאֲמָתְךָ כָּמוֹךָ״, הֲרֵי עֶבֶד מָהוּל אָמוּר. הָא מָה אֲנִי מְקַיֵּים ״וְיִנָּפֵשׁ בֶּן אֲמָתְךָ״ — בְּעֶבֶד עָרֵל.
human_translation: In any event, of everyone “And the son of your maidservant will be refreshed,” is written with regard to an uncircumcised slave. From where inferred? As it is taught “And the son of your maidservant will be refreshed”; the verse speaks of an uncircumcised slave. you say of an uncircumcised slave, or it is only of a circumcised slave? When it says so that your slave and your maidservant may rest like you” a circumcised slave is mentioned; how, do I uphold “And the son of your maidservant will be refreshed”? to an uncircumcised slave.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Dekhulei olma miyehat 've-yinapeish ben amatkha' — be-eved arel kativ, mai mashma? D'tanya: 've-yinapeish ben amatkha' — be-eved arel haktuv medaber. Ata omer be-eved arel, o einu ela be-eved mahul? Kesh'hu omer 'lema'an yanuakh avdekha va-amatkha kamokha', harei eved mahul amur. Ha ma ani mekayem 've-yinapeish ben amatkha' — be-eved arel." English translation: "The entire world from one side 'and your servant's son will rest' — it is written in the case of a circumcised slave, what does it imply? As it was taught: 'and your servant's son will rest' — it speaks of a circumcised slave. You say in the case of a circumcised slave, or is it only in the case of a circumcised one? When it says 'so that your male and female servant may rest as you do', it is said regarding a circumcised slave. Thus, how do I fulfill 'and your servant's son will rest' — in the case of a circumcised slave."

hebrew_text: ״וְהַגֵּר״ — זֶה גֵּר תּוֹשָׁב. אַתָּה אוֹמֵר זֶה גֵּר תּוֹשָׁב, אוֹ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא גֵּר צֶדֶק? כְּשֶׁהוּא אוֹמֵר ״וְגֵרְךָ אֲשֶׁר בִּשְׁעָרֶיךָ״, הֲרֵי גֵּר צֶדֶק אָמוּר. הָא מָה אֲנִי מְקַיֵּים ״וְהַגֵּר״ — זֶה גֵּר תּוֹשָׁב.
human_translation: “And the stranger [ ger ]” This a gentile who observes certain mitzvot [ ger toshav ]. you say this is a ger toshav , or it is only a righteous convert [ ger tzedek ], When it says “And your stranger [ ger ] that is within your gates” a righteous convert is mentioned. How, do I uphold “And the stranger [ ger ]”? this is a ger toshav .
llm_translation: "AND THE STRANGER" - THIS REFERS TO A RESIDENT ALIEN. YOU SAY THIS REFERS TO A RESIDENT ALIEN, OR IS IT ONLY A PROSELYTE? WHEN IT SAYS "AND THE STRANGER WHO IS WITHIN YOUR GATES," BEHOLD, A PROSELYTE IS MENTIONED. NOW, HOW DO I ESTABLISH "AND THE STRANGER" - THIS REFERS TO A RESIDENT ALIEN.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: הַלּוֹקֵחַ עֶבֶד מִן הַגּוֹי וְלֹא רָצָה לָמוּל — מְגַלְגֵּל עִמּוֹ עַד שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ. לֹא מָל — חוֹזֵר וּמוֹכְרוֹ לְגוֹיִם.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: one who purchases a slave from a gentile and does not wish to be circumcised, he abides with him up to twelve months. he will not be circumcised, he then sells him to gentiles.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: One who acquires a slave from a gentile and he does not want to circumcise him - he rolls with him until twelve months. If he does not circumcise him - he must return and sell him to gentiles.

hebrew_text: אַמְרוּהָ רַבָּנַן קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב פָּפָּא, כְּמַאן — דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא. דְּאִי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, הָאָמַר: אֵין מְקַיְּימִין! אֲמַר לְהוּ רַב פָּפָּא: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, הָנֵי מִילֵּי הֵיכָא דְּלָא פַּסְקַהּ לְמִילְּתֵיהּ, אֲבָל הֵיכָא דְּפַסְקַהּ לְמִילְּתֵיהּ — פַּסְקַהּ.
human_translation: The Sages said this before Rav Pappa In accordance with whose that it is not in accordance with Rabbi Akiva, as, if Rabbi Akiva, didn’t he say: One may not maintain said to them: You even say Rabbi Akiva, that applies where did not make his explicit; however, where he did make his explicit, he has made it explicit,
llm_translation: The sages said before Rav Papa, as who? Not like Rabbi Akiva. For if it were Rabbi Akiva, he said: "They are not established!" Rav Papa said to them: Even if you were to say it is Rabbi Akiva, those words were said where he did not conclude his statement, but where he concluded his statement - he concluded it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא: אַמְרִיתָא לִשְׁמַעְתָּא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב זְבִיד מִנְּהַרְדְּעָא, אָמַר לִי: אִי הָכִי, כִּי אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא בְּלוֹקֵחַ עֶבֶד בֵּין הַשְּׁמָשׁוֹת, לִישַׁנֵּי לֵיהּ הָא! חֲדָא מִתְּרֵי טַעְמֵי קָאָמַר.
human_translation: Rav Kahana said: I said halakha before Rav Zevid from Neharde’a. He said to me: If so, when Rabbi Akiva said to is referring to one who purchases a slave at twilight let him answer him this said one out of two reasons
llm_translation: Rav Kahana said: A certain teaching I heard before Rav Zevid from Nehardea, he said to me: If so, when Rabbi Akiva said regarding one who acquires a slave between the suns, should we not sleep him? He is saying one of two reasons.

hebrew_text: שְׁלַח רָבִין מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי אִילְעַאי, וְכׇל רַבּוֹתַי אָמְרוּ לִי מִשְּׁמוֹ: אֵיזֶהוּ עֶבֶד עָרֵל שֶׁמּוּתָּר לְקַיְּימוֹ — זֶה שֶׁלְּקָחוֹ רַבּוֹ עַל מְנָת שֶׁלֹּא לְמוּלוֹ. אַמְרוּהָ רַבָּנַן קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב פָּפָּא: כְּמַאן? דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, דְּאִי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, הָאָמַר: אֵין מְקַיְּימִין! אֲמַר לְהוּ רַב פָּפָּא: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, הָנֵי מִילֵּי הֵיכָא דְּלָא אַתְנִי בַּהֲדֵיהּ, אֲבָל הֵיכָא דְּאַתְנִי — אַתְנִי.
human_translation: Ravin sent in the name of Rabbi Ilai: And all of my teachers said to me in his name: What is an uncircumcised slave whom it is permitted to maintain? This is one whose master purchased him on condition not to circumcise him. The Sages said this before Rav Pappa In accordance with whose that it is not in accordance with Rabbi Akiva, as, if Rabbi Akiva, didn’t he say: One may not maintain said to them: You even say Rabbi Akiva, that applies where did not make a condition with regard to however, where he did make a condition, he made a condition,
llm_translation: Rabin sent in the name of Rabbi Ilai, and all my teachers said to me in his name: Who is a non-Jewish slave whose purchase is permitted for his upkeep? This is one whose master acquired him with the condition that he not be circumcised. The Sages said before Rav Papa: According to whom? Not like Rabbi Akiva, for if it were according to Rabbi Akiva, he said: They are not valid! Rav Papa said to them: Even if you were to say it is according to Rabbi Akiva, those matters where he did not teach explicitly, but where he did teach explicitly - he taught.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא: אַמְרִיתָא לִשְׁמַעְתָּא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב זְבִיד מִנְּהַרְדְּעָא, וַאֲמַר לִי: אִי הָכִי, כִּי קָאָמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא בְּלוֹקֵחַ עֶבֶד בֵּין הַשְּׁמָשׁוֹת וְלֹא הִסְפִּיק לְמוּלוֹ — לִישַׁנֵּי לֵיהּ הָא!
human_translation: Rav Kahana said: I said halakha before Rav Zevid from Neharde’a and he said to me: If so, when Rabbi Akiva said to is referring to one who purchases a slave at twilight and does not have the opportunity to circumcise him let him answer him this
llm_translation: Rav Kahana said: A certain teaching I heard before Rav Zevid from Nehardea, and he said to me: If so, when Rabbi Akiva said to him regarding one who purchases a slave between sunsets and did not have time to circumcise him - let him sleep!

hebrew_text: וְלִיטַעְמָיךְ, לִישַׁנֵּי לֵיהּ הָךְ! אֶלָּא, חַד מִתְּרֵי וּתְלָת טַעְמֵי קָאָמַר.
human_translation: But according to your reasoning let answer him that said one out of two or three reasons
llm_translation: "And to taste, to sleep with him! Rather, one of two and three tastes he is saying."

hebrew_text: יְתֵיב רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בַּר פַּפִּי וְרַבִּי אַמֵּי וְרַבִּי יִצְחָק נַפָּחָא אַקִּילְעָא דְּרַבִּי יִצְחָק נַפָּחָא, וְיָתְבִי וְקָאָמְרִי: עִיר אַחַת הָיְתָה בְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל וְלֹא רָצוּ עֲבָדֶיהָ לָמוּל, וְגִלְגְּלוּ עִמָּהֶם עַד שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ, וְחָזְרוּ וּמְכָרוּם לְגוֹיִם. כְּמַאן —
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina bar Pappi, and Rabbi Ami, and Rabbi Yitzḥak Nappaḥa were sitting in the courtyard of Rabbi Yitzḥak Nappaḥa. They were sitting and saying: There was one city in Eretz Yisrael whose slaves did not wish to be circumcised. abided with them until twelve months and then sold them to gentiles. In accordance with whose
llm_translation: Rabbi Chanina bar Papi, Rabbi Ammi, and Rabbi Yitzchak Nafcha were sitting in the presence of Rabbi Yitzchak Nafcha's son-in-law, and they were sitting and saying: "There was once a city in the land of Israel, and its inhabitants did not want to circumcise. They delayed with them for twelve months, and then they went and sold them to the Gentiles. Who is the authority for this?

hebrew_text: כִּי הַאי תַּנָּא, דְּתַנְיָא: הַלּוֹקֵחַ עֶבֶד מִן הַגּוֹי וְלֹא רָצָה לָמוּל — מְגַלְגֵּל עִמּוֹ עַד שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ, לֹא מָל — חוֹזֵר וּמוֹכְרוֹ לְגוֹיִם. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: אֵין מְשַׁהִין אוֹתוֹ בְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל, מִפְּנֵי הֶפְסֵד טְהָרוֹת. וּבָעִיר הַסְּמוּכָה לַסְּפָר אֵין מְשַׁהִין אוֹתוֹ כׇּל עִיקָּר, שֶׁמָּא יִשְׁמַע דָּבָר וְיֵלֵךְ וְיֹאמַר לַחֲבֵרוֹ גּוֹי.
human_translation: It is in accordance with this tanna , as it is taught one who purchases a slave from a gentile and does not wish to be circumcised, abides with him up to twelve months. will not be circumcised, then sells him to gentiles. Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: One may not allow him to remain in Eretz Yisrael due to the loss of ritually pure items And in a city that is near to the border he may not be allowed to remain at all, lest he hear some matter and go and say to his fellow gentile
llm_translation: The Tanna taught: One who acquires a slave from a non-Jew and he does not wish to circumcise him — he must roll the slave with him for twelve months, if he does not circumcise him, he must return and sell him to non-Jews. Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: One may not delay him in the land of Israel due to the loss of purity. And in a city adjacent to the border, one may not delay him at all, lest he hear something and go and tell his non-Jewish friend.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי חֲנַנְיָא בְּנוֹ שֶׁל רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: מִפְּנֵי מָה גֵּרִים בִּזְמַן הַזֶּה מְעוּנִּין, וְיִסּוּרִין בָּאִין עֲלֵיהֶן — מִפְּנֵי שֶׁלֹּא קִיְּימוּ שֶׁבַע מִצְוֹת בְּנֵי נֹחַ. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: גֵּר שֶׁנִּתְגַּיֵּיר — כְּקָטָן שֶׁנּוֹלַד דָּמֵי. אֶלָּא מִפְּנֵי מָה מְעוּנִּין — לְפִי שֶׁאֵין בְּקִיאִין בְּדִקְדּוּקֵי מִצְוֹת כְּיִשְׂרָאֵל. אַבָּא חָנָן אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: לְפִי שֶׁאֵין עוֹשִׂין מֵאַהֲבָה, אֶלָּא מִיִּרְאָה.
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Ḥananya, son of Rabban Gamliel, says: For what are converts at the present time tormented and hardships come upon them? because they did not observe the seven Noahide mitzvot. Rabbi Yosei says: a convert who converted is like a child born Rather, for what are they tormented? because they are not well-versed in the intricacies of the mitzvot as Jew, Abba Ḥanan says in the name of Rabbi Elazar: because they observe not out of love but only out of fear
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Hananiah, the son of Rabban Gamliel, says: Why are converts in this time despised, and afflictions come upon them? Because they did not establish the seven Noahide laws. Rabbi Yosei says: A convert who converts is like a newborn child. Rather, why are they despised? Because they are not well-versed in the details of the commandments like Israel. Abba Hanan says in the name of Rabbi Elazar: Because they do not perform out of love, but out of fear.

hebrew_text: אֲחֵרִים אוֹמְרִים: מִפְּנֵי שֶׁשִּׁהוּ עַצְמָם לְהִכָּנֵס תַּחַת כַּנְפֵי הַשְּׁכִינָה. אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַבִּי חֲנִינָא, מַאי קְרָאָה: ״יְשַׁלֵּם ה׳ פׇּעֳלֵךְ וּתְהִי מַשְׂכֻּרְתֵּךְ שְׁלֵמָה מֵעִם ה׳ אֱלֹהֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל אֲשֶׁר בָּאת לַחֲסוֹת וְגוֹמֵר״.
human_translation: Others say: because they waited before entering under the wings of the Divine Presence, Rabbi Abbahu said, and some say Rabbi Ḥanina What is the verse “The Lord shall recompense your work, and your reward shall be complete from the Lord, the God of Israel, you have come to take refuge”
llm_translation: Others say: because they delayed themselves to gather under the wings of the Shekhinah. Rabbi Avahu said, and some say Rabbi Hanina said, what is the verse: "May the Lord reward your work, and may your reward be complete from the Lord, the God of Israel, under whose wings you have come to seek refuge."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אֵיזֶהוּ מַמְזֵר — כׇּל שְׁאֵר בָּשָׂר שֶׁהוּא בְּ״לֹא יָבֹא״, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא. שִׁמְעוֹן הַתִּימְנִי אוֹמֵר: כֹּל שֶׁחַיָּיבִים עָלָיו כָּרֵת בִּידֵי שָׁמַיִם, וַהֲלָכָה כִּדְבָרָיו. וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: כֹּל שֶׁחַיָּיבִין עָלָיו מִיתַת בֵּית דִּין.
human_translation: Which a mamzer ? any next of kin that is subject to he should not engage in sexual relations the statement of Rabbi Akiva. Shimon HaTimni says: any for which one is liable to karet at the hand of Heaven. And the halakha is in accordance with his statement. Rabbi Yehoshua says: any for which one is liable to court- capital punishment.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: Who is a mamzer? Any other flesh that is "not to come in," the words of Rabbi Akiva. Shimon the Timnite says: Anyone upon whom heavenly excision is incumbent, and the halakha is according to his words. And Rabbi Yehoshua says: Anyone upon whom death by the court is incumbent.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן עַזַּאי: מָצָאתִי מְגִלַּת יוּחֲסִין בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם, וְכָתוּב בָּהּ: אִישׁ פְּלוֹנִי מַמְזֵר מֵאֵשֶׁת אִישׁ, לְקַיֵּים דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Azzai said: I found a scroll lineages in Jerusalem, and it was written in it so-and-so is a mamzer from a married woman, to support the statement of Rabbi Yehoshua.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Azai said: I found a genealogical scroll in Jerusalem, and it is written in it: "So-and-so, a mamzer from a married woman, to fulfill the words of Rabbi Yehoshua."

hebrew_text: אִשְׁתּוֹ שֶׁמֵּתָה — מוּתָּר בַּאֲחוֹתָהּ. גֵּרְשָׁהּ וּמֵתָה — מוּתָּר בַּאֲחוֹתָהּ. נִשֵּׂאת לְאַחֵר וּמֵתָה — מוּתָּר בַּאֲחוֹתָהּ. יְבִמְתּוֹ שֶׁמֵּתָה — מוּתָּר בַּאֲחוֹתָהּ. חָלַץ לָהּ וּמֵתָה — מוּתָּר בַּאֲחוֹתָהּ. נִשֵּׂאת לְאַחֵר וּמֵתָה — מוּתָּר בַּאֲחוֹתָהּ.
human_translation: wife died, he is permitted to her sister. he divorced her and she died, he is permitted to her sister. she was married to another and died, he is permitted to her sister. his yevama died, he is permitted to her sister. he performed ḥalitza with her and she died, he is permitted to her sister. she was married to another and died, he is permitted to her sister.
llm_translation: His wife who died — permitted to her sister. If he divorced her and she died — permitted to her sister. If he married another woman and she died — permitted to her sister. His yevamah who died — permitted to her sister. If he performed chalitzah with her and she died — permitted to her sister. If he married another woman and she died — permitted to her sister.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא? דִּכְתִיב: ״לֹא יִקַּח אִישׁ אֶת אֵשֶׁת אָבִיו וְלֹא יְגַלֶּה כְּנַף אָבִיו״. כָּנָף שֶׁרָאָה אָבִיו — לֹא יְגַלֶּה.
human_translation: What is Rabbi Akiva’s reasoning? As it is written: “A man shall not take his father’s wife, and he shall not uncover his father’s cloak” cloak that his father saw, may not uncover.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: What is the reason for Rabbi Akiva? As it is written: "A man shall not take his father's wife, nor shall he uncover his father's wing." The wing that his father saw - he shall not uncover.

hebrew_text: וְסָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, דְּאָמַר: בַּאֲנוּסַת אָבִיו הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר, דְּהָוְיָא לַהּ חַיָּיבֵי לָאוִין,
human_translation: And holds in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda, who said: the verse speaks of a woman raped by one’s father, she is liable for a prohibition.
llm_translation: And he reasoned with her like Rabbi Yehuda, who said: In the case of one who is compelled by his father, the Scripture speaks, for it would be incumbent upon her to not transgress.

hebrew_text: וּסְמִיךְ לֵיהּ: ״לֹא יָבֹא מַמְזֵר בִּקְהַל ה׳״, אַלְמָא מֵהָנֵי הָוֵי מַמְזֵר.
human_translation: And in close proximity to that “A mamzer shall not enter into the congregation of the Lord” Apparently, from these is a mamzer .
llm_translation: And adjacent to it: "A mamzer shall not enter into the congregation of the Lord," implying that he is considered a mamzer.

hebrew_text: וּלְרַבִּי סִימַאי, דִּמְרַבֵּה שְׁאָר חַיָּיבֵי לָאוִין דְּלָאו דִּ״שְׁאֵר״, וּלְרַבִּי יְשֵׁבָב, דִּמְרַבֵּה אֲפִילּוּ חַיָּיבֵי עֲשֵׂה —
human_translation: But according to Rabbi Simai, who includes other for which one is liable a prohibition, that are not next of kin; and according to Rabbi Yeshevav, who includes even for which one is liable for positive mitzva;
llm_translation: To Rabbi Simai, who increases the rest, the other living beings are not obligated in "rest," and to Rabbi Yeshivav, who increases even those obligated in positive commandments —

hebrew_text: נָפְקָא לְהוּ מִ״וְּלֹא״.
human_translation: They derive from “And he shall not
llm_translation: They went out to him from "Ula."

hebrew_text: וְשִׁמְעוֹן הַתִּימְנִי סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבָּנַן, דְּאָמְרִי: בְּשׁוֹמֶרֶת יָבָם שֶׁל אָבִיו הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר, דְּהָוְיָא לַהּ חַיָּיבֵי כָּרֵיתוֹת, וּסְמִיךְ לֵיהּ ״לֹא יָבֹא מַמְזֵר״. אַלְמָא: מֵחַיָּיבֵי כָּרֵיתוֹת הָוֵי מַמְזֵר.
human_translation: And Shimon HaTimni holds in accordance with the Rabbis, who say: with regard to the widow waiting for his father levirate marriage that the verse is speaking, that she is render one liable karet . And in close proximity to that “A mamzer shall not enter Apparently, for which one is liable karet is a mamzer .
llm_translation: Simon the Timnite holds like the Rabbis, for they say: concerning the yavam guardian of his father's yevamah the Scripture speaks, for it would result in them being liable to karet, and adjacent to it is "A mamzer shall not enter." Therefore: from those liable to karet, a mamzer is included.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ — לִכְתּוֹב רַחֲמָנָא ״לֹא יְגַלֶּה״. ״לֹא יִקַּח״ (״וְלֹא יְגַלֶּה״) לְמָה לִי? אֶלָּא לָאו, הָכִי קָאָמַר: מִ״לֹּא יִקַּח״ עַד ״לֹא יְגַלֶּה״ — הָוֵי מַמְזֵר, טְפֵי — לָא הָוֵי מַמְזֵר.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehoshua let the Merciful One write “He shall not uncover Why do I “a man shall not take “and shall not uncover Rather, is it not this is what is saying: after “a man shall not take” until “he shall not uncover,” is a mamzer , but beyond is not a mamzer .
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua — to write, the Merciful One "he shall not reveal." "He shall not take" ("and he shall not reveal") why do I need it? Rather, no, this is what he is saying: from "he shall not take" until "he shall not reveal" — he is a mamzer, from a drop — he is not a mamzer.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: הַכֹּל מוֹדִים בְּבָא עַל הַנִּדָּה
human_translation: Abaye said: All agree with regard to one who engages in sexual relations with a menstruating woman,
llm_translation: Abbaye said: Everyone agrees with regard to one who has intercourse with a menstruating woman.

hebrew_text: וְעַל הַסּוֹטָה — שֶׁאֵין הַוָּלָד מַמְזֵר.
human_translation: or with a sota , that the offspring is not a mamzer .
llm_translation: And regarding the Sotah - that the offspring is not a mamzer.

hebrew_text: נִדָּה, דְּהָא תָּפְסִי בַּהּ קִידּוּשִׁין, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּתְהִי נִדָּתָהּ עָלָיו״, אֲפִילּוּ בִּשְׁעַת נִדָּתָהּ תָּפְסִי בַּהּ קִידּוּשִׁין.
human_translation: a menstruating woman because betrothal of her takes effect, as it is stated: “And her impurity shall be upon him” even at the time of her impurity, betrothal with her takes effect.
llm_translation: Niddah, for she has engaged in betrothal with it, as it is stated: "And her niddah shall be upon him" (Leviticus 18:19). Even at the time of her niddah, she may engage in betrothal with it.

hebrew_text: סוֹטָה נָמֵי, דְּהָא תָּפְסִי בַּהּ קִידּוּשִׁין.
human_translation: a sota , too, because betrothal of her takes effect.
llm_translation: Sotah namei, deha tafsi bah kidushin.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: הַכֹּל מוֹדִים בְּבָא עַל הַנִּדָּה וְעַל הַסּוֹטָה וְעַל שׁוֹמֶרֶת יָבָם, שֶׁאֵין הַוָּלָד מַמְזֵר.
human_translation: This is also taught All agree with regard to one who engages in sexual relations with a menstruating woman, or with a sota , or with a widow waiting for her yavam that the offspring is not a mamzer .
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Everyone agrees regarding one who comes upon a menstruating woman, and regarding the Sotah, and regarding the levirate bondwoman, that the offspring is not a mamzer.

hebrew_text: וְאַבָּיֵי, שׁוֹמֶרֶת יָבָם — מְסַפְּקָא לֵיהּ אִי כְּרַב אִי כִּשְׁמוּאֵל.
human_translation: And Abaye widow waiting for her yavam he is uncertain whether, in accordance with Rav in accordance with Shmuel
llm_translation: And Abbaye, the guardian of yavam - it is doubtful to him whether like Rav or like Shmuel.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן עַזַּאי כּוּ׳. תָּנֵי, שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן עַזַּאי אוֹמֵר: מָצָאתִי מְגִלַּת יוּחֲסִין בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם, וְכָתוּב בָּהּ: אִישׁ פְּלוֹנִי מַמְזֵר מֵאֵשֶׁת אִישׁ, וְכָתוּב בָּהּ: מִשְׁנַת רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב קַב וְנָקִי. וְכָתוּב בָּהּ: מְנַשֶּׁה הָרַג אֶת יְשַׁעְיָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Azzai said: It is taught Rabbi Shimon ben Azzai said: I found a scroll lineages, in Jerusalem, and it was written in it so-and-so is a mamzer from a married woman. And it was written in it: The teachings of Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov a kav but are clean And it was written in it: Manasseh, killed Isaiah
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Azai said: It was taught, Shimon ben Azai says: I found a genealogical scroll in Jerusalem, and it is written in it: "So-and-so, a mamzer from a married woman." And it is written in it: "According to the teaching of Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov, he is pure and untainted." And it is written in it: "Menashe killed Yeshayahu."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: מֵידָן דַּיְינֵיהּ וְקַטְלֵיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ, מֹשֶׁה רַבְּךָ אָמַר: ״כִּי לֹא יִרְאַנִי הָאָדָם וָחָי״, וְאַתְּ אָמְרַתְּ: ״וָאֶרְאֶה אֶת ה׳ יוֹשֵׁב עַל כִּסֵּא רָם וְנִשָּׂא״. מֹשֶׁה רַבְּךָ אָמַר: ״מִי כַּה׳ אֱלֹהֵינוּ בְּכׇל קׇרְאֵנוּ אֵלָיו״, וְאַתְּ אָמְרַתְּ: ״דִּרְשׁוּ ה׳ בְּהִמָּצְאוֹ״. מֹשֶׁה רַבְּךָ אָמַר: ״אֶת מִסְפַּר יָמֶיךָ אֲמַלֵּא״, וְאַתְּ אָמְרַתְּ: ״וְהוֹסַפְתִּי עַל יָמֶיךָ חֲמֵשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה שָׁנָה״!
human_translation: Rava said: judged him and killed him. said to Moses your master said for man cannot see Me and live” and you said: “I saw the Lord sitting upon a high and lofty throne” Moses your master said: which as the Lord our God is, whenever we call upon Him?” and you said: “Seek the Lord while He may be found, call upon Him while He is near” Moses your master said: “I will fulfill the number of your days” and you said “And I will add to your days, fifteen years”
llm_translation: Rava said: From the measure of His judgment and His killing. He said to him, "Your servant Moses said: 'For no man shall see Me and live,' and you say: 'And I saw the Lord sitting on a high and lofty throne.' Your servant Moses said: 'Who is like the Lord our God whenever we call upon Him,' and you say: 'Seek the Lord while He may be found.' Your servant Moses said: 'I will fulfill the number of your days,' and you say: 'And I will add fifteen years to your days!'

hebrew_text: אָמַר יְשַׁעְיָה: יָדַעְנָא בֵּיהּ דְּלָא מְקַבֵּל מָה דְּאֵימָא לֵיהּ, וְאִי אֵימָא לֵיהּ — אֶישַּׁוְּיֵיהּ מֵזִיד. אֲמַר שֵׁם אִיבְּלַע בְּאַרְזָא, אַתְיוּהּ לְאַרְזָא וְנַסְּרוּהּ. כִּי מְטָא לַהֲדֵי פּוּמָּא, נָח נַפְשֵׁיהּ. מִשּׁוּם דַּאֲמַר: ״וּבְתוֹךְ עַם טְמֵא שְׂפָתַיִם אָנֹכִי יוֹשֵׁב״.
human_translation: Isaiah said I know him, that he will not accept whatever that I will say to him And if I say it to him, I will make him into an intentional transgressor he uttered a name was swallowed within a cedar brought the cedar and sawed through it When reached to where his mouth was, died. due to that which he said: “In the midst of a people of unclean lips, I dwell”
llm_translation: Said Isaiah: I know about him that he does not accept what I say to him, and if I say to him — his intention is deliberate. Shem said: He swallowed a cedar, let a cedar come and remove it. When it reached his intestines, his soul found rest. Because it is said: "And in the midst of a people of unclean lips I dwell."

hebrew_text: מִכׇּל מָקוֹם קָשׁוּ קְרָאֵי אַהֲדָדֵי?
human_translation: In any case, verses contradict each other;
llm_translation: From all places, the verses of Ahadadei are difficult?

hebrew_text: ״וָאֶרְאֶה אֶת ה׳״, כִּדְתַנְיָא: כׇּל הַנְּבִיאִים נִסְתַּכְּלוּ בְּאַסְפַּקְלַרְיָא שֶׁאֵינָהּ מְאִירָה, מֹשֶׁה רַבֵּינוּ נִסְתַּכֵּל בְּאַסְפַּקְלַרְיָא הַמְּאִירָה.
human_translation: “I saw the Lord” as it is taught All of the prophets observed through an obscure looking glass [ aspaklaria ], Moses our master observed through a clear looking glass,
llm_translation: "And I saw the Lord," as it was taught: All the prophets gazed into a cloudy mirror, which does not illuminate; Moses our teacher gazed into a clear mirror that illuminates.

hebrew_text: ״דִּרְשׁוּ ה׳ בְּהִמָּצְאוֹ״ — הָא בְּיָחִיד, הָא בְּצִבּוּר. וְיָחִיד אֵימַת? אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ: אֵלּוּ עֲשָׂרָה יָמִים שֶׁבֵּין רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה לְיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים.
human_translation: “Seek the Lord while He may be found,” this with regard to the individual this with regard to a community, And when the individual? Rav Naḥman said Rabba bar Avuh said: These are the ten days between Rosh HaShana and Yom Kippur.
llm_translation: "Seek God when He is found" — here in private, here in public. And when is it considered private? Rav Nachman said in the name of Rabbah bar Avuh: These are the ten days between Rosh Hashanah and Yom Kippur.

hebrew_text: ״אֶת מִסְפַּר יָמֶיךָ אֲמַלֵּא״ — תַּנָּאֵי הִיא, דְּתַנְיָא: ״אֶת מִסְפַּר יָמֶיךָ אֲמַלֵּא״,
human_translation: “I will fulfill the number of your days,” is tanna’im , as it is taught “I will fulfill the number of your days”;
llm_translation: "Your days I will fill" - this is a teaching, as it was taught: "Your days I will fill."

hebrew_text: אֵלּוּ שְׁנֵי דוֹרוֹת. זָכָה — מַשְׁלִימִין לוֹ, לֹא זָכָה — פּוֹחֲתִין לוֹ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: זָכָה — מוֹסִיפִים לוֹ, לֹא זָכָה — פּוֹחֲתִין לוֹ.
human_translation: these are years of generations, he is deserving, completes his he is not deserving, reduces his the statement of Rabbi Akiva. The Rabbis say: he is deserving, adds to his he is not deserving, reduces his
llm_translation: These are the two generations. If one merits, they add for him; if one does not merit, they subtract from him. These are the words of Rabbi Akiva. And the Sages say: If one merits, they add for him; if one does not merit, they subtract from him.

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ לוֹ לְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, הֲרֵי הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״וְהוֹסַפְתִּי עַל יָמֶיךָ חֲמֵשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה שָׁנָה״! אָמַר לָהֶם: מִשֶּׁלּוֹ הוֹסִיפוּ לוֹ. תֵּדַע, שֶׁהֲרֵי נָבִיא עוֹמֵד וּמִתְנַבֵּא ״הִנֵּה בֵן נוֹלָד לְבֵית דָּוִד יֹאשִׁיָּהוּ שְׁמוֹ״, וַעֲדַיִין לֹא נוֹלַד מְנַשֶּׁה!
human_translation: said to Rabbi Akiva: there is states “And I will add unto your days fifteen years”? said to them: added to his from his own Know as a prophet stood and prophesied: “Behold, a son shall be born unto the House of David, Josiah is his name” Manasseh had not yet been born.
llm_translation: They said to Rabbi Akiva, "Behold, it says: 'And I will add to your days fifteen years'!" He said to them: They added to his own. Know that a prophet stands and prophesies, 'Behold, a son is born to the house of David, Josiah is his name,' and Menashe has not yet been born!

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן — מִי כְּתִיב מֵחִזְקִיָּה? ״לְבֵית דָּוִד״ כְּתִיב, אִי מֵחִזְקִיָּה נוֹלַד, אִי מֵאִינָשׁ אַחֲרִינָא.
human_translation: And the Rabbis Is it written from Hezekiah? It is written “unto the House of David,” he could be born either from Hezekiah or from a different person
llm_translation: The sages — who is it written from Hezekiah? "To the house of David" is written, if from Hezekiah he was born, if from another man.

hebrew_text: אִשְׁתּוֹ שֶׁמֵּתָה וְכוּ׳ יְבִמְתּוֹ שֶׁמֵּתָה וְכוּ׳. אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: כָּאן שָׁנָה רַבִּי מִשְׁנָה שֶׁאֵינָהּ צְרִיכָה.
human_translation: wife died, his yevama died, Rav Yosef said: Here Rabbi taught an unnecessary mishna,
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: His wife who died, etc., his yevamah who died, etc. Rav Yosef said: Here Rabbi changed the Mishnah to state that it is not necessary.

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ הַחוֹלֵץ
llm_translation: We will return to you, O Choletz.

hebrew_text: רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: אֵין גֵּט אַחַר גֵּט, וְלֹא מַאֲמָר אַחַר מַאֲמָר, וְלֹא בְּעִילָה אַחַר בְּעִילָה, וְלֹא חֲלִיצָה אַחַר חֲלִיצָה. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: יֵשׁ גֵּט אַחַר גֵּט, וְיֵשׁ מַאֲמָר אַחַר מַאֲמָר. אֲבָל לֹא אַחַר בְּעִילָה, וְלֹא אַחַר חֲלִיצָה כְּלוּם.
human_translation: Rabban Gamliel says: A bill of divorce [ get ] is not after a bill of divorce And levirate betrothal is not after levirate betrothal and intercourse is not after intercourse and ḥalitza is not after ḥalitza But the Rabbis say: A bill of divorce is after a bill of divorce, and levirate betrothal is after levirate betrothal, but nothing is after intercourse or after ḥalitza .
llm_translation: Rabban Gamliel says: A get after a get is not valid, nor a statement after a statement, nor intercourse after intercourse, nor halitzah after halitzah. And the sages say: There is a get after a get, and there is a statement after a statement. But not after intercourse, and not after halitzah at all.

hebrew_text: כֵּיצַד: עָשָׂה מַאֲמָר בִּיבִמְתּוֹ וְנָתַן לָהּ גֵּט — צְרִיכָה הֵימֶנּוּ חֲלִיצָה. עָשָׂה מַאֲמָר וַחֲלִיצָה — צְרִיכָה הֵימֶנּוּ גֵּט. עָשָׂה מַאֲמָר וּבָעַל — הֲרֵי זוֹ כְּמִצְוָתָהּ.
human_translation: How performed levirate betrothal with his yevama , and he gave her a bill of divorce, she requires ḥalitza from him. he performed levirate betrothal and ḥalitza , she requires a bill of divorce from him performed levirate betrothal and intercourse this is in accordance with its mitzva,
llm_translation: How: he made a statement with his yevamah and gave her a get - she requires from him chalitzah. He made a statement and chalitzah - she requires from him a get. He made a statement and performed yibum - this is in accordance with her obligation.

hebrew_text: נָתַן גֵּט וְעָשָׂה מַאֲמָר — צְרִיכָה גֵּט וַחֲלִיצָה. נָתַן גֵּט וּבָעַל — צְרִיכָה גֵּט וַחֲלִיצָה. נָתַן גֵּט וְחָלַץ — אֵין אַחַר חֲלִיצָה כְּלוּם.
human_translation: gave a bill of divorce and performed levirate betrothal she requires bill of divorce ḥalitza he gave a bill of divorce and engaged in intercourse she requires a bill of divorce and ḥalitza he gave a bill of divorce and performed ḥalitza , nothing is after ḥalitza ,
llm_translation: He gave a bill of divorce and performed the act - she requires a bill of divorce and halitzah. He gave a bill of divorce and married her - she requires a bill of divorce and halitzah. He gave a bill of divorce and performed halitzah - nothing further after halitzah.

hebrew_text: חָלַץ וְעָשָׂה מַאֲמָר, נָתַן גֵּט וּבָעַל, אוֹ בָּעַל וְעָשָׂה מַאֲמָר, נָתַן גֵּט וְחָלַץ — אֵין אַחַר חֲלִיצָה כְּלוּם.
human_translation: performed ḥalitza and performed levirate betrothal, gave a bill of divorce, or engaged in intercourse alternatively, engaged in intercourse and performed levirate betrothal, gave a bill of divorce, or performed ḥalitza nothing is after ḥalitza
llm_translation: He removed and made a statement, he gave a bill of divorce and married, or he married and made a statement, he gave a bill of divorce and removed - there is nothing after removal.

hebrew_text: אֶחָד יְבָמָה אַחַת לְיָבָם אֶחָד, וְאֶחָד שְׁתֵּי יְבָמוֹת לְיָבָם אֶחָד. כֵּיצַד? עָשָׂה מַאֲמָר בָּזוֹ וּמַאֲמָר בָּזוֹ — צְרִיכוֹת שְׁנֵי גִיטִּין וַחֲלִיצָה. מַאֲמָר בָּזוֹ וְגֵט לָזוֹ — צְרִיכָה גֵּט וַחֲלִיצָה. מַאֲמָר בָּזוֹ וּבָעַל אֶת זוֹ — צְרִיכוֹת שְׁנֵי גִיטִּין וַחֲלִיצָה. מַאֲמָר בָּזוֹ וְחָלַץ לָזוֹ — הָרִאשׁוֹנָה צְרִיכָה גֵּט.
human_translation: both one yevama to one yavam , as well as two yevamot to one yavam . How so? he performed levirate betrothal with this and levirate betrothal with that they require two bills of divorce, and ḥalitza levirate betrothal with this and a bill of divorce to that requires a bill of divorce and ḥalitza . levirate betrothal with this and engaged in intercourse with that they require two bills of divorce and ḥalitza levirate betrothal with this and performed ḥalitza with that the first requires a bill of divorce.
llm_translation: One yevamah for one yavam, and one for two yevamot for one yavam. How so? If he performs chalitzah with this one and chalitzah with that one - they require two gittin and chalitzah. If he performs chalitzah with this one and gives a get to that one - she requires a get and chalitzah. If he performs chalitzah with this one and marries that one - they require two gittin and chalitzah. If he performs chalitzah with this one and performs chalitzah with that one - the first one requires a get.

hebrew_text: גֵּט לָזוֹ וְגֵט לָזוֹ — צְרִיכוֹת הֵימֶנּוּ חֲלִיצָה. גֵּט לָזוֹ וּבָעַל אֶת זוֹ — צְרִיכָה גֵּט וַחֲלִיצָה. גֵּט לָזוֹ וּמַאֲמָר בָּזוֹ — צְרִיכָה גֵּט וַחֲלִיצָה. גֵּט לָזוֹ וְחָלַץ לְזוֹ — אֵין אַחַר חֲלִיצָה כְּלוּם.
human_translation: a bill of divorce to this and a bill of divorce to that they require ḥalitza from him. a bill of divorce to this and engaged in intercourse with that requires a bill of divorce and ḥalitza . a bill of divorce to this and levirate betrothal with that requires a bill of divorce and ḥalitza a bill of divorce to this and performed ḥalitza with that nothing is after ḥalitza ,
llm_translation: A get for this one and a get for that one - they require halitzah. A get for this one and he marries that one - she requires a get and halitzah. A get for this one and he declares her forbidden - she requires a get and halitzah. A get for this one and he performs halitzah for that one - there is nothing after halitzah.

hebrew_text: חָלַץ וְחָלַץ, אוֹ חָלַץ וְעָשָׂה מַאֲמָר, נָתַן גֵּט וּבָעַל, אוֹ בַּעַל וּבָעַל, אוֹ בָּעַל וְעָשָׂה מַאֲמָר, נָתַן גֵּט וְחָלַץ — אֵין אַחַר חֲלִיצָה כְּלוּם. בֵּין יָבָם אֶחָד לִשְׁתֵּי יְבָמוֹת, בֵּין שְׁנֵי יְבָמִין לִיבָמָה אַחַת.
human_translation: he performed ḥalitza and performed ḥalitza or he performed ḥalitza and perform levirate betrothal, give a bill of divorce, or engage in intercourse alternatively, he engaged in intercourse engaged in intercourse or he engaged in intercourse and perform levirate betrothal, give a bill of divorce, or perform ḥalitza nothing is after ḥalitza both one yavam to two yevamot , as well as two yevamin to one yevama .
llm_translation: He removed and removed, or he removed and made a statement, he gave a bill of divorce and performed the levirate marriage, or he performed the levirate marriage twice, or he performed the levirate marriage and made a statement, he gave a bill of divorce and removed - there is no further removal at all. Whether with one yavam to two yevamot, or with two yevamim to one yevamah.

hebrew_text: חָלַץ וְעָשָׂה מַאֲמָר, נָתַן גֵּט וּבָעַל, אוֹ בָּעַל וְעָשָׂה מַאֲמָר, וְנָתַן גֵּט וְחָלַץ — אֵין אַחַר חֲלִיצָה כְּלוּם. בֵּין בַּתְּחִלָּה, בֵּין בָּאֶמְצַע, בֵּין בַּסּוֹף.
human_translation: he performed ḥalitza and perform levirate betrothal, give a bill of divorce, or engage in intercourse alternatively, he engaged in intercourse and perform levirate betrothal, or give a bill of divorce, or perform ḥalitza nothing is after ḥalitza , whether at the beginning, in the middle, or at the end.
llm_translation: He removed and made a statement, he gave a bill of divorce and married, or he married and made a statement, and then gave a bill of divorce and removed - there is nothing after removal at all. Whether at the beginning, in the middle, or at the end.

hebrew_text: וְהַבְּעִילָה, בִּזְמַן שֶׁהִיא בַּתְּחִלָּה — אֵין אַחֲרֶיהָ כְּלוּם, בָּאֶמְצַע וּבַסּוֹף — יֵשׁ אַחֲרֶיהָ כְּלוּם. רַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה אוֹמֵר: אַחַת בְּעִילָה וְאַחַת חֲלִיצָה, בֵּין בַּתְּחִלָּה בֵּין בָּאֶמְצַע בֵּין בַּסּוֹף — אֵין אַחֲרֶיהָ כְּלוּם.
human_translation: But intercourse, when it is at the beginning, nothing is after it in the middle, and at the end, something is after it. Rabbi Neḥemya says: Both intercourse and ḥalitza , whether at the beginning, in the middle, or at the end, nothing is after it.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "And the firstborn, when she is at the beginning - there is nothing after her, in the middle and at the end - there is something after her. Rabbi Nechemyah says: One for the firstborn and one for the halitzah, whether at the beginning, in the middle, or at the end - there is nothing after her."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ עַד כָּאן לָא פְּלִיגִי אֶלָּא בְּגֵט אַחַר גֵּט, וּמַאֲמָר אַחַר מַאֲמָר. אֲבָל גֵּט אֶחָד בִּיבָמָה [וּמַאֲמָר אֶחָד בִּיבָמָה] — מַהֲנֵי.
human_translation: disagree only with regard to a bill of divorce after a bill of divorce and levirate betrothal after levirate betrothal, but one bill of divorce to a yevama , or one levirate betrothal with a yevama , is effective.
llm_translation: Gemara: Until here they do not argue except in a bill of divorce after a bill of divorce, and a statement after a statement. But one bill of divorce in yibum levirate marriage and one statement in yibum — what is the law.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא אֲמוּר רַבָּנַן גֵּט בִּיבָמָה מַהֲנֵי — מִשּׁוּם דְּמַהֲנֵי בְּעָלְמָא. דְּאִי אָמְרַתְּ לָא מַהֲנֵי, אָמְרִי: גֵּט לְהוֹצִיאָהּ, וַחֲלִיצָה לְהוֹצִיאָהּ. וּמִדְּגֵט לָא מַהֲנֵי — חֲלִיצָה נָמֵי לָא מַהֲנֵי, וְאָתֵי לְמִיבְעַל אַחַר חֲלִיצָה.
human_translation: What is the reason that the Sages said a bill of divorce is effective for a yevama , because it is effective in general For if you say it is not effective say A bill of divorce to remove her and ḥalitza to remove her since a bill of divorce is ineffective ḥalitza is also ineffective And will come to engage in intercourse after ḥalitza ,
llm_translation: What is the reason that the Rabbis say that a get in the case of yibum is effective? - Because it is effective in general. For if you say it is not effective, they will say: A get to release her, and chalitzah to release her. And from a get it is not effective - chalitzah is also not effective, and he comes to cohabit with her after chalitzah.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי טַעְמָא אֲמוּר רַבָּנַן מַאֲמָר בִּיבָמָה מַהֲנֵי — מִשּׁוּם דְּמַהֲנֵי בְּעָלְמָא. דְּאִי אָמְרַתְּ לָא מַהֲנֵי, אָמְרִי: מַאֲמָר לִקְנוֹת, וּבִיאָה לִקְנוֹת. וּמִדְּמַאֲמָר לָא מַהֲנֵי — בִּיאָה נָמֵי לָא מַהְנְיָא, וְאָתֵי לְמִיבְעַל אַחַר בִּיאָה.
human_translation: And what is the reason the Sages said levirate betrothal is effective for a yevama ? Because it is effective in general, For if you say it is not effective, say: Levirate betrothal serves to acquire and intercourse to acquire since levirate betrothal is ineffective intercourse is also ineffective, And come to engage in intercourse after intercourse
llm_translation: And what is the reason that the Rabbis say that the statement in the case of yibum is effective? - Because it is effective in general. For if you were to say it is not effective, they would say: A statement is effective for acquisition, and intercourse is for acquisition. And from the fact that a statement is not effective - intercourse alone is also not effective, and it comes to nullify after intercourse.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי טַעְמָא אֲמוּר רַבָּנַן בִּיאָה פְּסוּלָה יֵשׁ אַחֲרֶיהָ כְּלוּם —
human_translation: And what is the reason the Sages said invalid intercourse, something is after it?
llm_translation: And what is the reason that the Rabbis say, "If the intercourse is invalid, there is nothing after it"?

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי: אִי בִּיאָה אַחַר הַגֵּט הִיא — גְּזֵירָה בִּיאָה אַחַר הַגֵּט מִשּׁוּם בִּיאָה אַחַר חֲלִיצָה. וְאִי בִּיאָה אַחַר מַאֲמָר הִיא — גְּזֵירָה בִּיאָה אַחַר מַאֲמָר מִשּׁוּם בִּיאָה אַחַר בִּיאָה.
human_translation: say: If this is intercourse after a bill of divorce, a decree intercourse after a bill of divorce because intercourse after ḥalitza . And if this is intercourse after levirate betrothal, a decree intercourse after levirate betrothal because intercourse after intercourse
llm_translation: They said: If it is intercourse after the bill of divorce, it is a decree prohibiting intercourse after the bill of divorce because of intercourse after halitzah. And if it is intercourse after the declaration of betrothal, it is a decree prohibiting intercourse after the declaration because of intercourse after intercourse.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי טַעְמָא אֲמוּר רַבָּנַן הַאי חֲלִיצָה פְּסוּלָה — אֵין אַחֲרֶיהָ כְּלוּם, אָמְרִי: מַאי לִגְזוֹר? נִגְזוֹר חֲלִיצָה אַחַר הַגֵּט מִשּׁוּם חֲלִיצָה אַחַר חֲלִיצָה — כֹּל כִּי הָנֵי תִּחְלוֹץ וְתֵיזִיל.
human_translation: And what is the reason the Sages said this invalid ḥalitza nothing is after it? say: What we should issue a decree Should we issue a decree ḥalitza after a bill of divorce due to ḥalitza after ḥalitza ? any like these, let her continue performing ḥalitza ,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And what is the reason that the Rabbis said that this ḥalitzah is invalid? There is nothing after it. They said: What is there to decree? The decree of ḥalitzah after a divorce is decreed because of ḥalitzah after ḥalitzah - all for these reasons: to untie and to release.

hebrew_text: לִיגְזוֹר חֲלִיצָה אַחַר מַאֲמָר מִשּׁוּם חֲלִיצָה אַחַר בִּיאָה, אַטּוּ חֲלִיצָה אַחַר מַאֲמָר מִי לָא בָּעֲיָא גֵּט לְמַאֲמָרוֹ? חֲלִיצָה אַחַר בִּיאָה נָמֵי בָּעֲיָא גֵּט לְבִיאָתוֹ.
human_translation: should we issue a decree ḥalitza after levirate betrothal due to ḥalitza after intercourse? Is that to say ḥalitza after levirate betrothal she does not require a bill of divorce for his levirate betrothal, ḥalitza after intercourse she likewise requires a bill of divorce for his intercourse.
llm_translation: To cut off a halitzah after a statement because of a halitzah after intercourse, if so, a halitzah after a statement, who does not require a get for his statement? A halitzah after intercourse also requires a get for his intercourse.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא:
human_translation: Rava said:
llm_translation: Rava said:

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל — דִּמְסַפְּקָא לֵיהּ גֵּט אִי דָּחֵי אִי לָא דָּחֵי. מַאֲמָר — אִי קָנֵי אִי לָא קָנֵי. גֵּט — אִי דָּחֵי אִי לָא דָּחֵי. אִי קַמָּא דָּחֵי — בָּתְרָא מַאי קָעָבֵיד. אִי קַמָּא לָא דָּחֵי — בָּתְרָא נָמֵי לָא דָּחֵי.
human_translation: What is the reason Rabban Gamliel because he is uncertain a bill of divorce whether precludes whether does not preclude levirate betrothal, whether it acquires or does not acquire a bill of divorce, whether it precludes or does not preclude If the first precludes , what did he do the latter as if the first does not preclude neither does the latter preclude
llm_translation: What is the reason for Rabban Gamliel's opinion? Because he is in doubt whether the bill of divorce is effective or not effective. The statement: Whether he acquires or does not acquire. The bill of divorce: Whether it is effective or not effective. If he first does not acquire: What is the reason afterward? If he first does acquire: What is the reason afterward?

hebrew_text: מַאֲמָר אִי קָנֵי אִי לָא קָנֵי, אִי קַמָּא קָנֵי — בָּתְרָא מַאי קָעָבֵיד, וְאִי קַמָּא לָא קָנֵי — בָּתְרָא נָמֵי לָא קָנֵי.
human_translation: levirate betrothal, whether it acquires or does not acquire If the first acquires what does the last one accomplish? And if the first one does not acquire the last one also does not acquire
llm_translation: Statement: If he acquires, or if he does not acquire, if he acquires before, what is the law, and if he does not acquire before, he does not acquire after.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: וּמוֹדֶה רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל שֶׁיֵּשׁ גֵּט אַחַר מַאֲמָר, וּמַאֲמָר אַחַר הַגֵּט. וְגֵט אַחַר בִּיאָה וּמַאֲמָר, וּמַאֲמָר אַחַר בִּיאָה וְגֵט.
human_translation: Abaye raised an objection to And Rabban Gamliel concedes that a bill of divorce is after levirate betrothal and levirate betrothal is after a bill of divorce. And a bill of divorce is after intercourse and levirate betrothal And that levirate betrothal is after intercourse and a bill of divorce,
llm_translation: He raised an objection against him, Abaye: And Rabban Gamliel concedes that there is a divorce document after a statement, and a statement after the divorce document. And a divorce document after intercourse and a statement, and a statement after intercourse and a divorce document.

hebrew_text: וְאִי מְסַפְּקָא לֵיהּ לְרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל — תִּהְוֵי כְּבִיאָה דִּלְכַתְּחִלָּה, וְתִקְנֵי. דְּהָא תְּנַן: הַבְּעִילָה, בִּזְמַן שֶׁהִיא בַּתְּחִלָּה — אֵין אַחֲרֶיהָ כְּלוּם.
human_translation: And if Rabban Gamliel is uncertain should be like intercourse at the beginning, and acquire For we learned intercourse, when it is at the beginning, nothing is after it.
llm_translation: If he is in doubt about Rabban Gamliel - it is like a firstborn animal, and it is established. For we learned: The firstborn animal, when it is initially born - nothing follows it.
