hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, לְעוֹלָם פְּשִׁיטָא לֵיהּ לְרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל בְּגֵט דְּדָחֵי וּמַאֲמָר דְּקָנֵי. מִיהוּ, אֲמוּר רַבָּנַן: הָא יְבָמָה — בְּחַד צַד מַהֲנֵי בַּהּ גֵּט, וּבְחַד צַד מַהֲנֵי בַּהּ מַאֲמָר. גֵּט אַחַר גֵּט לָא דָּחֵי — דְּהָא דְּחָה לֵיהּ קַמָּא. וּמַאֲמָר אַחַר מַאֲמָר לָא קָנֵי — דְּהָא קְנָא לֵיהּ קַמָּא. גֵּט אַחַר מַאֲמָר וּמַאֲמָר אַחַר הַגֵּט, הַאי מִילְּתָא קָא דָחֵי וְהַאי מִילְּתָא קָא קָנֵי.
human_translation: Rather, Abaye said: Actually, it is obvious to Rabban Gamliel that a bill of divorce precludes and that levirate betrothal acquires Nevertheless, the Sages said this yevama , in one respect a bill of divorce is effective for her, and in another respect levirate betrothal is effective for her, a bill of divorce after a bill of divorce does not preclude as the first has precluded for him And levirate betrothal after levirate betrothal does not acquire , as the first has acquired for him a bill of divorce after levirate betrothal, and levirate betrothal after a bill of divorce, this action precludes and that action acquires
llm_translation: Rather, Abaye said, always it is clear to Rabban Gamliel in a bill of divorce that is pushed aside and a statement that acquires. However, say the Rabbis: If a yevamah - on one side she acquires with a bill of divorce, and on one side she acquires with a statement. A bill of divorce after a bill of divorce does not push aside - because it pushed it aside previously. And a statement after a statement does not acquire - because it acquired previously. A bill of divorce after a statement and a statement after a bill of divorce, this matter pushes aside and this matter acquires.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן: כֹּל חַד וְחַד תַּקִּינוּ לֵיה רַבָּנַן גֵּט וּמַאֲמָר בִּיבָמָה.
human_translation: However, the Rabbis the Sages instituted for each and every one a bill of divorce and levirate betrothal for a yevama ,
llm_translation: The Sages: Each and every one of them established for him a bill of divorce and a declaration of refusal in the case of levirate marriage.

hebrew_text: וְהַאי בִּיאָה פְּסוּלָה — עֲדִיפָא מִמַּאֲמָר וּגְרִיעָא מִמַּאֲמָר. עֲדִיפָא מִמַּאֲמָר: דְּאִילּוּ מַאֲמָר אַחַר מַאֲמָר לָא מַהֲנֵי, וְאִילּוּ בִּיאָה אַחַר מַאֲמָר מַהֲנֵי. וּגְרִיעָא מִמַּאֲמָר: דְּאִילּוּ מַאֲמָר אַחַר הַגֵּט קָנֵי לְכוּלֵּיהּ שִׁיּוּרָא דְגֵט, וְאִילּוּ בִּיאָה אַחַר הַגֵּט לָא קָנְיָא לֵיהּ לְכוּלֵּיהּ שִׁיּוּרָא דְגֵט.
human_translation: And this invalid intercourse, is superior to levirate betrothal and inferior to levirate betrothal: preferable to levirate betrothal whereas levirate betrothal after levirate betrothal is not effective intercourse after levirate betrothal is effective, And inferior to levirate betrothal, for whereas levirate betrothal after a bill of divorce acquires the entire remainder by the bill of divorce, intercourse after a bill of divorce does not acquire the entire remainder by the bill of divorce,
llm_translation: The act of intercourse is invalid - it is preferable to a statement and inferior to a statement. Preferable to a statement: for if another statement does not have an effect, but if intercourse follows a statement, it does have an effect. And inferior to a statement: for if another statement acquires everything that the bill of divorce acquires, but if intercourse follows the bill of divorce, it does not acquire everything that the bill of divorce acquires.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: כֵּיצַד אָמַר רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אֵין גֵּט אַחַר גֵּט? שְׁתֵּי יְבָמוֹת שֶׁנָּפְלוּ לִפְנֵי יָבָם אֶחָד, וְנָתַן גֵּט לָזוֹ וְגֵט לָזוֹ. רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: חוֹלֵץ לָרִאשׁוֹנָה וְאָסוּר בִּקְרוֹבוֹתֶיהָ, וּמוּתָּר בִּקְרוֹבוֹת שְׁנִיָּה.
human_translation: The Sages taught: How, did Rabban Gamliel say a bill of divorce is not after a bill of divorce? two yevamot who happened before one yavam and he gave a bill of divorce to this one and a bill of divorce to that one. Rabban Gamliel says: He performs ḥalitza with the first one and is forbidden to her relatives, and he is permitted to the relatives of the second one.
llm_translation: The sages taught: How did Rabban Gamliel say, "There is no bill of divorce after another bill of divorce"? Two yevamot who fell before one yavam, and he gave a bill of divorce to this one and a bill of divorce to that one. Rabban Gamliel says: He may marry the first one, is forbidden to the relatives of the first one, and is permitted to the relatives of the second one.

hebrew_text: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: נָתַן גֵּט לָזוֹ וְגֵט לָזוֹ — אָסוּר בִּקְרוֹבוֹת שְׁתֵּיהֶן, וַחֲלִיצָה לְאַחַת מֵהֶן. וְכֵן אַתָּה אוֹמֵר בִּשְׁנֵי יְבָמִים וִיבָמָה אַחַת.
human_translation: But the Rabbis say: he gave a bill of divorce to this one and a bill of divorce to that one, he is forbidden the relatives of both of them, and ḥalitza with one of them. And you say the same with regard to two yevamim and one yevama .
llm_translation: The sages say: If he gave a bill of divorce to this one and a bill of divorce to that one - it is forbidden for them to marry close relatives, and halitzah is required for one of them. And similarly, you say in the case of two levirate brothers and one levirate sister.

hebrew_text: כֵּיצַד אָמַר רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אֵין מַאֲמָר אַחַר מַאֲמָר? שְׁתֵּי יְבָמוֹת שֶׁנָּפְלוּ לִפְנֵי יָבָם אֶחָד, וְעָשָׂה מַאֲמָר בָּזוֹ וּמַאֲמָר בָּזוֹ, רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: נוֹתֵן גֵּט לָרִאשׁוֹנָה וְחוֹלֵץ לָהּ, וְאָסוּר בִּקְרוֹבוֹתֶיהָ, וּמוּתָּר בִּקְרוֹבוֹת שְׁנִיָּה. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: נוֹתֵן גֵּט לִשְׁתֵּיהֶן, וְאָסוּר בִּקְרוֹבוֹת שְׁתֵּיהֶן, וַחֲלִיצָה לְאַחַת מֵהֶן. וְכֵן אַתָּה אוֹמֵר בִּשְׁנֵי יְבָמִים וִיבָמָה אַחַת.
human_translation: How, did Rabban Gamliel say there is no levirate betrothal after levirate betrothal? two yevamot who happened before one yavam , and he performed levirate betrothal with this one and levirate betrothal with that one, Rabban Gamliel says: He gives a bill of divorce to the first one and performs ḥalitza with her, and is forbidden to her relatives, but is permitted to the relatives of second one, But the Rabbis say: He gives a bill of divorce to both of them, and he is forbidden to the relatives of both of them; and ḥalitza , with one of them. And you say the same with regard to two yevamim and one yevama .
llm_translation: How did Rabban Gamliel say, "There is no statement after a statement?" Two yevamot who fell before one yavam, and he made a statement for this one and a statement for that one, Rabban Gamliel says: He gives a get to the first one and releases her, she is forbidden to his relatives, and permitted to the relatives of the second one. And the sages say: He gives a get to both of them, they are forbidden to his relatives, and chalitzah for one of them. And similarly, you say in the case of two yevamim and one yevamah.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: נוֹתֵן גֵּט לָזוֹ וְגֵט לָזוֹ, רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: חוֹלֵץ לְרִאשׁוֹנָה וְאָסוּר בִּקְרוֹבוֹתֶיהָ, וּמוּתָּר בִּקְרוֹבוֹת שְׁנִיָּה. לֵימָא תֶּיהְוֵי תְּיוּבְתָּא דִּשְׁמוּאֵל, דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: חָלַץ לְבַעֲלַת הַגֵּט — לֹא נִפְטְרָה צָרָה!
human_translation: The Master said He gives a bill of divorce to this one and a bill of divorce to that one. Rabban Gamliel says: He performs ḥalitza with the first one and is forbidden to her relatives, and is permitted to the relatives of the second one. Shall we say that is a conclusive refutation of Shmuel? For Shmuel said: he performed ḥalitza with the woman who received a bill of divorce, the rival wife is not exempted
llm_translation: Master said: One gives a get to this one and a get to that one. Rabban Gamliel says: He may divorce the first one and is forbidden to the relatives of the first one, but permitted to the relatives of the second one. Let it be the rebuttal of Shmuel, for Shmuel said: If he divorces the wife of the get - the rival wife is not exempt!

hebrew_text: אָמַר לְךָ שְׁמוּאֵל: כִּי אֲמַרִי אֲנָא, אַלִּיבָּא דְּמַאן דְּאָמַר יֵשׁ זִיקָּה. וְרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל סָבַר אֵין זִיקָּה,
human_translation: Shmuel said to you: When I said in accordance with of the one who said that the levirate bond is substantial, But Rabban Gamliel holds the levirate bond is not substantial,
llm_translation: He said to you, Samuel: "For I say, I do not accept the opinion of whoever says there is liability." And Rabban Gamliel holds that there is no liability.

hebrew_text: וּמִדְּרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל סָבַר אֵין זִיקָּה,
human_translation: But from Rabban Gamliel holds the levirate bond is not substantial,
llm_translation: And from Rabban Gamliel, he holds: there is no liability,

hebrew_text: רַבָּנַן סָבְרִי יֵשׁ זִיקָּה, וְקָתָנֵי סֵיפָא: וְכֵן אַתָּה אוֹמֵר בִּשְׁנֵי יְבָמִין וִיבָמָה אַחַת. לֵימָא תֶּיהְוֵי תְּיוּבְתָּא דְּרַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב. דְּאָמַר רַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב: חֲלִיצָה פְּסוּלָה — צְרִיכָה לַחֲזוֹר עַל כׇּל הָאַחִין.
human_translation: the Rabbis hold that the levirate bond is substantial, And the latter clause teaches: And you say the same with regard to two yevamin and one yevama let us say that it is a conclusive refutation of Rabba bar Rav Huna Rav said. For Rabba bar Rav Huna said Rav said: invalid ḥalitza , is required to repeat with all the brothers.
llm_translation: The sages hold: there is liability, and the Mishnah teaches the conclusion: "And so you say in the case of two brothers and one sister-in-law." Let us say it is the refutation of Rabba bar Rav Huna who said in the name of Rav. For Rabba bar Rav Huna said in the name of Rav: An invalid halitzah requires her to perform halitzah with all the brothers.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָךְ רַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא: בֵּין לְרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל בֵּין לְרַבָּנַן סָבְרִי אֵין זִיקָּה, וְהָכָא בְּגֵט אַחַר גֵּט וּמַאֲמָר אַחַר מַאֲמָר קָמִיפַּלְגִי.
human_translation: Rabba bar Rav Huna said to you: Both Rabban Gamliel and the Rabbis hold the levirate bond is not substantial, And here disagree with regard to a bill of divorce after a bill of divorce and levirate betrothal after levirate betrothal.
llm_translation: Rabah bar Rav Huna said to you: Whether for Rabban Gamliel or for the Rabbis, he holds there is no connection, and here in the case of one divorce document after another divorce document and one declaration after another declaration they disagree.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: עָשָׂה מַאֲמָר בָּזוֹ וּמַאֲמָר בָּזוֹ, רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: נוֹתֵן גֵּט לָרִאשׁוֹנָה וְחוֹלֵץ לָהּ, וְאָסוּר בִּקְרוֹבוֹתֶיהָ, וּמוּתָּר בִּקְרוֹבוֹת שְׁנִיָּה. מִכְּדֵי קָסָבַר רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אֵין מַאֲמָר אַחַר מַאֲמָר, רִאשׁוֹנָה נָמֵי תִּתְיַיבֵּם? גְּזֵירָה דִּלְמָא אָתֵי לְיַיבּוֹמֵי לִשְׁנִיָּה.
human_translation: The Master said he performed levirate betrothal with this one and levirate betrothal with that one, Rabban Gamliel says: He gives a bill of divorce to the first one and performs ḥalitza with her and is forbidden to her relatives, but he is permitted to the relatives of the second one. Since Rabban Gamliel holds levirate betrothal is not after levirate betrothal, first should also be permitted to enter into levirate marriage. decree lest he perform levirate marriage with the second
llm_translation: Master said: He made a statement in this one and a statement in that one, Rabban Gamliel says: He gives a bill of divorce to the first one and she is permitted, and he is forbidden to her relatives, and he is permitted to the relatives of the second one. Since Rabban Gamliel holds that one statement does not follow another, will the first one indeed be permitted? It is a decree lest he come to the levirate marriage of the second one.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל וּבֵית שַׁמַּאי וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן וּבֶן עַזַּאי וְרַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה — כּוּלְּהוּ סְבִירָא לְהוּ מַאֲמָר קוֹנֶה קִנְיָן גָּמוּר. רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל — הָא דַּאֲמַרַן.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Rabban Gamliel, and Beit Shammai, and Rabbi Shimon, and ben Azzai, and Rabbi Neḥemya, they all hold levirate betrothal acquires a full-fledged acquisition, Rabban Gamliel’s that which we said
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: Rabban Gamliel, Beit Shammai, Rabbi Shimon, Ben Azzai, and Rabbi Nechemiah - all of them hold the view that the statement "acquisition finalizes the transaction" is valid. Rabban Gamliel - this is what we said.

hebrew_text: בֵּית שַׁמַּאי — דִּתְנַן: שְׁלֹשָׁה אַחִין, שְׁנַיִם מֵהֶם נְשׂוּאִין לִשְׁתֵּי אֲחָיוֹת, וְאֶחָד מוּפְנֶה, מֵת אֶחָד מִבַּעֲלֵי אֲחָיוֹת, וְעָשָׂה בָּהּ מוּפְנֶה מַאֲמָר, וְאַחַר כָּךְ מֵת אָחִיו הַשֵּׁנִי, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: אִשְׁתּוֹ עִמּוֹ, וְהַלֵּזוּ — תֵּצֵא מִשּׁוּם אֲחוֹת אִשָּׁה.
human_translation: Beit Shammai as we learned three brothers, two were married to two sisters, and one who was single, The husband of one of the sisters died and the single performed levirate betrothal Afterward, the second brother died, Beit Shammai say: His wife remains with him, And this other leaves due to the sister of a wife.
llm_translation: House of Shammai - as we learned: Three brothers, two of them married to two sisters, and one is single. One of the brothers who was married to one of the sisters died, and the other brother, who was single, performed the rite of levirate marriage with her. Subsequently, the second brother also died. The House of Shammai says: His wife shall be with him, and the levirate bond shall be dissolved due to the sister of a wife.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן — דְּתַנְיָא: אֲמַר לְהוּ רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן לַחֲכָמִים: אִם בִּיאַת רִאשׁוֹן בִּיאָה — בִּיאַת שֵׁנִי אֵינָהּ בִּיאָה. אִם בִּיאַת רִאשׁוֹן אֵינָהּ בִּיאָה — בִּיאַת שֵׁנִי נָמֵי אֵינָהּ בִּיאָה. וְהָא בִּיאַת בֶּן תֵּשַׁע, דִּכְמַאֲמָר שַׁוְּיוּהָ רַבָּנַן, וְקָאָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אֵינָהּ בִּיאָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon As it is taught Rabbi Shimon said to the Rabbis: If the intercourse of first intercourse, the intercourse of second is not intercourse If the intercourse of first is not intercourse, the intercourse of second is also not intercourse. And the Sages considered the intercourse of a nine-year-old like levirate betrothal, and Rabbi Shimon says is not intercourse.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon — as it was taught: Rabbi Shimon said to the sages: If the first coming is a coming — the second coming is not a coming. If the first coming is not a coming — the second coming is certainly not a coming. But in the case of the coming of the ninth month, which the sages have established, and Rabbi Shimon said it is not a coming.

hebrew_text: בֶּן עַזַּאי — דְּתַנְיָא, בֶּן עַזַּאי אוֹמֵר: יֵשׁ מַאֲמָר אַחַר מַאֲמָר בִּשְׁנֵי יְבָמִין וִיבָמָה אַחַת, וְאֵין מַאֲמָר אַחַר מַאֲמָר בִּשְׁתֵּי יְבָמוֹת וְיָבָם אֶחָד. רַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה — דִּתְנַן, רַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה אוֹמֵר: אַחַת בְּעִילָה, וְאַחַת חֲלִיצָה, בֵּין בַּתְּחִלָּה בֵּין בָּאֶמְצַע בֵּין בַּסּוֹף — אֵין אַחֲרֶיהָ כְּלוּם. וְהָא בִּיאָה פְּסוּלָה, דִּכְמַאֲמָר שַׁוְּיוּהָ רַבָּנַן, וְקָתָנֵי: אֵין אַחֲרֶיהָ כְּלוּם.
human_translation: ben Azzai’s as it is taught ben Azzai says: Levirate betrothal is after levirate betrothal two yevamin and one yevama , but levirate betrothal is not after levirate betrothal two yevamot and one yavam . Rabbi Neḥemya’s as we learned Rabbi Neḥemya says: both intercourse and ḥalitza , whether at the beginning, in the middle, or at the end, nothing is after it. And the Sages considered invalid intercourse like levirate betrothal, and teaches nothing is after it.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Ben Azzai — d'tanya, Ben Azzai omer: yesh ma'amar achar ma'amar bishnei yevamim viyevamah achat, ve'ein ma'amar achar ma'amar bishtei yevamot viyavam echad. Rabbi Nechemya — ditnan, Rabbi Nechemya omer: achat be'ilah, ve'achat chalitzah, bein bat'chilah bein ba'emtsa bein basof — ein achareha klum. Ve'ha bi'ah pesulah, dikhma'amar shavuyuha rabbana, ve'kataney: ein achareha klum. English translation: Ben Azzai — as it was taught, Ben Azzai says: there is a statement following a statement in the case of two yevamim and one yevamah, but there is no statement following a statement in the case of two yevamot and one yavam. Rabbi Nechemya — as we learned, Rabbi Nechemya says: one through intercourse, and one through chalitzah, whether at the beginning, in the middle, or at the end — there is nothing after it. And if the intercourse was invalid, as the Rabbis said, and it is taught: there is nothing after it.

hebrew_text: כֵּיצַד? עָשָׂה מַאֲמָר כּוּ׳.
human_translation: How so? performed levirate betrothal etc.
llm_translation: How so? He made a statement as follows.

hebrew_text: הַאי גֵּט אַחַר גֵּט הוּא! אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה, הָכִי קָאָמַר: גֵּט אַחַר הַגֵּט, וּמַאֲמָר אַחַר מַאֲמָר — כְּדַאֲמַרַן, יָבָם אֶחָד וִיבָמָה אַחַת כֵּיצַד הַתָּרָתָן? עָשָׂה מַאֲמָר בִּיבִמְתּוֹ וְנָתַן לָהּ גֵּט — צְרִיכָה הֵימֶנּוּ חֲלִיצָה.
human_translation: this case a bill of divorce after a bill of divorce Rav Yehuda said: This is what is saying: a bill of divorce after a bill of divorce, and levirate betrothal after levirate betrothal, as we said one yavam and one yevama , how is their released? he performed levirate betrothal with his yevama and gave her a bill of divorce, she requires ḥalitza from him.
llm_translation: This bill after bill it is! Said Rav Yehudah, thus he said: A bill after the bill, and a statement after a statement - as we said, one yavam and one yevamah, how is their permission? He made a statement with his yevamah and gave her a bill - she needs from him halitzah.

hebrew_text: עָשָׂה מַאֲמָר וּבָעַל — הֲרֵי זוֹ כְּמִצְוָתָהּ. לֵימָא מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ לְרַב הוּנָא, דְּאָמַר רַב הוּנָא: מִצְוַת יְבָמָה — מְקַדֵּשׁ וְאַחַר כָּךְ בּוֹעֵל. אֵימָא: אַף זֶה כְּמִצְוָתָהּ.
human_translation: performed levirate betrothal and engaged in intercourse, this is in accordance with its mitzva. Let us say that supports Rav Huna. As Rav Huna said: The mitzva of a yevama is betroths and afterward engages in intercourse. this also is in accordance with its mitzva.
llm_translation: He made a statement and married - this is its obligation. Let us say that it supports Rav Huna, for Rav Huna said: The obligation of yibum - he must first perform the act of betrothal and then consummate the marriage. Let us say: This too is its obligation.

hebrew_text: פְּשִׁיטָא! סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: כֵּיוָן דְּאָמַר מָר הָעוֹשֶׂה מַאֲמָר בִּיבִמְתּוֹ — פָּרְחָה הֵימֶנּוּ זִיקַּת יְבָמִין, וְחָלָה עָלָיו זִיקַּת אֵרוּסִין וְנִשּׂוּאִין, אֵימָא לָאו מִצְוָה קָעָבֵיד, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: Isn’t obvious? enter your mind to say since the Master said One who performs levirate betrothal with his yevama causes the levirate bond to dissipate from himself, and a bond of betrothal and marriage takes effect on him, say no performs a mitzva teaches us
llm_translation: It is obvious! The conclusion of your reasoning I say: Since the Master said, "One who performs the act with his yevamah - the yavam's obligation has been fulfilled," and he incurs the obligation of levirate betrothal and marriage, one might say that the mitzvah is not esteemed, but he is teaching us otherwise.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא, אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: מִצְוַת יְבָמִין — מְקַדֵּשׁ וְאַחַר כָּךְ בּוֹעֵל, וְאִם בָּעַל וְעָשָׂה מַאֲמָר — קָנָה. אִם בָּעַל וְעָשָׂה מַאֲמָר — פְּשִׁיטָא, דְּהָא קַנְיַהּ בְּבִיאָה! אֶלָּא אֵימָא: אִם בָּעַל בְּלֹא מַאֲמָר — קָנָה.
human_translation: the itself, Rav Huna said: The mitzva of levirate marriage betroths and afterward engages in intercourse, and if he engaged in intercourse and performed levirate betrothal, he has acquired If he engaged in intercourse and performed levirate betrothal it is obvious as he has acquired her by intercourse. Rather, say If he engaged in intercourse without levirate betrothal, he has acquired
llm_translation: The body, Rav Huna said: The mitzvah of yibum - he betroths and afterwards he consummates, and if he betroths and makes a declaration - he acquires. If he betroths and makes a declaration - it is obvious, for he acquires through intercourse! Rather say: If he betroths without a declaration - he acquires.

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא לוֹקֶה! מַכַּת מַרְדּוּת מִדְּרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: But isn’t it taught is flogged? lashes for rebelliousness rabbinic
llm_translation: And it was taught: He is liable to receive lashes! A Rabbinic punishment.

hebrew_text: דְּרַב מְנַגֵּיד מַאן דִּמְקַדֵּשׁ בְּבִיאָה, וּמַאן דִּמְקַדֵּשׁ בְּשׁוּקָא, וּמַאן דִּמְקַדֵּשׁ בְּלָא שִׁדּוּכֵי.
human_translation: As Rav flog one who betroths by intercourse, And flog one who betroths in the marketplace, and to one who betroths without marriage agreement shiddukhei
llm_translation: Rav M'nageid: Who sanctifies through intercourse, and who sanctifies in the marketplace, and who sanctifies without marriage.

hebrew_text: וּמַאן דִּמְבַטֵּל גִּיטָּא, וּמַאן דְּמָסַר מוֹדָעָא אַגִּיטָּא.
human_translation: And one who nullifies a bill of divorce And one who delivers a declaration a bill of divorce,
llm_translation: And one who annuls a get, and one who delivers a known get.

hebrew_text: [דְּמִתְפַּקַּר בִּשְׁלוּחָא] דְרַבָּנַן, וּמַאן דִּ[מְ]שַׁהֵי שַׁמְתָּא דְרַבָּנַן עֲלֵיהּ תְּלָתִין יוֹמִין, וְלָא אָתֵי לְבֵי דִינָא וְתָבַע לְשַׁמְתֵּיהּ.
human_translation: And one who behaves irreverently a messenger of the Sages, And one who remained under an excommunication of the Sages thirty days and did not go to the court and petition for his excommunication after
llm_translation: When it is established through the sending of the Sages, and whoever is appointed by the Sages to act upon it for thirty days, and the matter does not come to the court and he demands his appointment.

hebrew_text: וְעַל חַתְנָא דְּדָאֵיר בְּבֵי חֲמוּהִי. דְּדָאֵיר — אִין, דְּחָלֵיף — לָא? וְהָא הָהוּא דַּחֲלֵיף אַבָּבָא דְּבֵי חֲמוּהִי, וְנַגְּדֵיהּ רַב שֵׁשֶׁת! הָהוּא מֵידָם הֲוָה דַּיִים מֵחֲמָתֵיהּ.
human_translation: And a son-in-law who lives in his father-in-law’s house, one who lives yes, one who passed no, But a certain who passed by the entrance to his father-in-law’s house and Rav Sheshet lashed him. that was suspected with regard to his mother-in-law,
llm_translation: And regarding the son-in-law of Daire who was in the house of his father-in-law. Daire - yes, he switched - no? But that one who switched the gate of the house of his father-in-law, and Rav Sheshet was against him! That one immediately was deemed worthy because of his action.

hebrew_text: נְהַרְדָּעֵי אָמְרִי: בְּכוּלְּהוּ לָא מְנַגֵּיד רַב, אֶלָּא לִמְקַדֵּשׁ בְּבִיאָה וּבְלָא שִׁדּוּכֵי. וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: אֲפִילּוּ בְּשִׁדּוּכֵי נָמֵי מִשּׁוּם פְּרִיצוּתָא.
human_translation: of Neharde’a say: In all Rav would not flog, apart from betrothed by intercourse and without marriage agreement. And there are who say even with marriage agreement, due to the immorality
llm_translation: The scholars of Nehardea said: In all cases, one does not betroth a woman through intercourse, but rather through entering and without witnesses. And there are those who say: Even with witnesses, it is also considered promiscuity.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: כֵּיצַד מַאֲמָר? נָתַן לָהּ כֶּסֶף אוֹ שָׁוֶה כֶּסֶף. וּבִשְׁטָר כֵּיצַד? בִּשְׁטָר כֵּיצַד?! כְּדַאֲמַרַן: כָּתַב לָהּ עַל הַנְּיָיר אוֹ עַל הַחֶרֶס, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ שָׁוֶה פְּרוּטָה: ״הֲרֵי אַתְּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת לִי״! אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, הָכִי קָאָמַר: שְׁטַר כְּתוּבַּת יְבָמִין כֵּיצַד?
human_translation: The Sages taught: How levirate betrothal He gives her money or the equivalent money And with a document, how With a document, how as we have said he wrote to her on paper or on earthenware, even though it is not worth a peruta , You are hereby betrothed to me, Abaye said this is what is saying: the document of a marriage contract for levirate marriage, how
llm_translation: The sages taught: How is a declaration made? He gave her money or something equivalent to money. And in a document, how so? How in a document?! As we said: He wrote for her on paper or on pottery, even though it is not worth a perutah: "Behold, you are betrothed to me"! Abaye said, this is what he meant: A document written for the purpose of levirate marriage, how so?

hebrew_text: כָּתַב לַהּ: ״אֲנָא פְּלוֹנִי בַּר פְּלוֹנִי קַבֵּילִית יָת פְּלוֹנִית יְבִמְתִּי עֲלַי, לָזוּן וּלְפַרְנְסָהּ כָּרָאוּי, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁתְּהֵא כְּתוּבָּתָהּ עַל נִכְסֵי בַּעְלָהּ הָרִאשׁוֹן״. וְאִי לֵית לַהּ מֵרִאשׁוֹן — תַּקִּינוּ לַהּ רַבָּנַן מִשֵּׁנִי, כְּדֵי שֶׁלֹּא תְּהֵא קַלָּה בְּעֵינָיו לְהוֹצִיאָהּ.
human_translation: he writes to her: I, so-and-so, son of so-and-so, have accepted so-and-so, my yevama upon me, to feed and maintain her in a fitting manner, provided that her marriage contract will be from the property of her first husband But if the first does not have the Sages instituted for her from the second So that she will not be demeaned in his eyes such that divorce her.
llm_translation: She wrote to her: "I, so-and-so son of so-and-so, received the yevamah of so-and-so upon myself, to provide for her and support her appropriately, on the condition that her marriage contract be written on the property of her first husband." And if she does not have from the first husband - the Rabbis established for her from the second, so that it should not be easy in his eyes to divorce her.

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ אַבָּיֵי מֵרַבָּה: נָתַן לָהּ גֵּט, וְאָמַר: ״הֲרֵי אַתְּ מְגוֹרֶשֶׁת הֵימֶנִּי, וְאִי אַתְּ מוּתֶּרֶת לְכׇל אָדָם״. מַהוּ? גֵּט יְבָמָה דְּרַבָּנַן הוּא, גֵּט דְּמַהֲנֵי בְּאֵשֶׁת אִישׁ — מַהֲנֵי בִּיבָמָה, גֵּט דְּלָא מַהֲנֵי בְּאֵשֶׁת אִישׁ — לָא מַהֲנֵי בִּיבָמָה, אוֹ דִלְמָא אָתֵי לְאִחַלּוֹפֵי בְּגִיטָּא.
human_translation: Abaye inquired of Rabba: gave a bill of divorce, and said You are hereby divorced from me but you are not permitted to any man, what is Is the bill of divorce of a yevama based on rabbinic a bill of divorce that is effective for a married woman is effective for a yevama , a bill of divorce that is not effective for a married woman is not effective for a yevama ? Or perhaps perhaps will come to confuse with bill of divorce
llm_translation: Abaye asked Rava: He gave her a bill of divorce, and said: "Behold, you are divorced from me, and if you are permitted to any man." What is the ruling? A bill of levirate marriage is a Rabbinic enactment, a bill that is effective in the case of a married woman — is effective in the case of a levirate marriage, a bill that is not effective in the case of a married woman — is not effective in the case of a levirate marriage, or perhaps it comes to exchange with a bill of divorce.

hebrew_text: [אֲמַר לֵיהּ: חָיְישִׁינַן דִּלְמָא אָתֵי לְאִחַלּוֹפֵי בְּגִיטָּא.] מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַבָּה בַּר חָנָן: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, יָהֵיב לַהּ נְיָירָא בְּעָלְמָא — הָכִי נָמֵי דְּפַסְלַהּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָתָם לָא פָּסֵיל בִּכְהוּנָּה, הָכָא קָפָסֵיל בִּכְהוּנָּה,
human_translation: said to him: We are concerned perhaps confuse with a bill of divorce, Rabba bar Ḥanan strongly objects to this: However, if that is so, he gives her a mere paper, so too will it disqualify her? He said to him: There it does not disqualify for the priesthood. Here, disqualifies into the priesthood.
llm_translation: He said to him: We are concerned that perhaps he will come to exchange it for a bill of divorce. Rabba bar Hanan objected to him: Rather, from now on, give her a document in general — is it thus stated that he nullified it? He said to him: There, it does not nullify in the priesthood, here it nullifies in the priesthood.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: ״וְאִשָּׁה גְּרוּשָׁה מֵאִישָׁהּ לֹא יִקָּחוּ״, אֲפִילּוּ לֹא נִתְגָּרְשָׁה אֶלָּא מֵאִישָׁהּ — ״לֹא יִקָּחוּ״, וְהַיְינוּ רֵיחַ הַגֵּט שֶׁפּוֹסֵל בִּכְהוּנָּה.
human_translation: As it is taught and a woman divorced from her husband they shall not take, Even she was only divorced from her husband they may not take And this is the trace of a bill of divorce, which disqualifies into the priesthood.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: "And a woman who is divorced from her husband, they shall not take," even if she was only divorced from her husband - "they shall not take," and this is the invalidation of the priestly status due to the smell of the divorce document.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָמֵי בַּר חָמָא: הֲרֵי אָמְרוּ, אָמַר אֶחָד לְלַבְלָר: כְּתוֹב גֵּט לַאֲרוּסָתִי, לִכְשֶׁאֶכְנְסֶנָּה אֲגָרְשֶׁנָּה — הֲרֵי זֶה גֵּט, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁבְּיָדוֹ לְגָרְשָׁהּ.
human_translation: Rami bar Ḥama said: They said if one said to a scribe lavlar Write a bill of divorce for my betrothed such that when I marry her I will divorce her it is bill of divorce. Because it is in his power to divorce her
llm_translation: Ramei bar Ḥama said: Behold, they said, one said to a scribe: Write a bill of divorce for my betrothed, so that when I marry her, I will divorce her - this is a valid bill of divorce, because he has the power to divorce her.

hebrew_text: וּלְאִשָּׁה בְּעָלְמָא — אֵין גֵּט, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁאֵין בְּיָדוֹ לְגָרְשָׁהּ. בָּעֵי רָמֵי בַּר חָמָא: לִיבִמְתּוֹ, מַהוּ? כֵּיוָן דַּאֲגִידָא בֵּיהּ — כַּאֲרוּסָתוֹ דָּמְיָא, אוֹ דִלְמָא: כֵּיוָן דְּלָא עֲבַד בַּהּ מַאֲמָר — לָא? תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: But for regular woman not a bill of divorce. because it is not in his power to divorce her, Rami bar Ḥama inquires: for his yevama what is since she is tied to him considered like his betrothed; or perhaps, since he has not performed levirate betrothal with her, not shall stand
llm_translation: And for a woman in general — there is no divorce, because he does not have the ability to divorce her. Rami bar Hama asked: Regarding a yevamah, what is the law? Since he has engaged with her — is it considered as if she is his wife, or perhaps: since he has not performed the act of marriage with her — no? This matter shall remain unresolved.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רַב חֲנַנְיָה: כָּתַב גֵּט לְזִיקָּתוֹ וְלֹא לְמַאֲמָרוֹ, לְמַאֲמָרוֹ וְלֹא לְזִיקָּתוֹ, מַהוּ? מַאֲמָר עִילָּוֵי זִיקָה קָא רְמֵי, וְהָוֵה לֵיהּ כִּמְגָרֵשׁ חֲצִי אִשָּׁה, וְהַמְגָרֵשׁ חֲצִי אִשָּׁה לֹא עָשָׂה וְלֹא כְלוּם, אוֹ דִּלְמָא: הַאי לְחוֹדֵיהּ קָאֵי וְהַאי לְחוֹדֵיהּ קָאֵי.
human_translation: Rav Ḥananya inquires: he wrote a bill of divorce for his levirate bond, but not for his levirate betrothal, for his levirate betrothal and not for his levirate bond, what is levirate betrothal superimposed upon the levirate bond, and he is like one who divorces half a woman, and one who divorces half a woman has done nothing; or perhaps this stands on its own and that stands on its own,
llm_translation: The inquiry of Rav Chananya: If he wrote a bill of divorce for her benefit and not for his declaration, for his declaration and not for her benefit, what is the ruling? The declaration is considered as the cause of the benefit, and it is like a half-divorced woman, and a half-divorced woman has not been done and is not null, or perhaps: this one stands for his own benefit and that one stands for her benefit.

hebrew_text: וְתִפְשׁוֹט לֵיהּ מִדְּרָבָא, דְּאָמַר רָבָא: נָתַן גֵּט לְמַאֲמָרוֹ — הוּתְּרָה צָרָתָהּ! לְרָבָא פְּשִׁיטָא לֵיהּ, לְרַב חֲנַנְיָה מִיבַּעְיָא לֵיהּ, מַאי — תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: And resolve from Rava? For Rava said: gave a bill of divorce for his levirate betrothal, her rival wife is permitted. To Rava it is obvious, to Rav Ḥananya it is a dilemma. What, Ḥananya shall stand
llm_translation: And they should strip it from Rava, for Rava said: If he gave a bill of divorce according to his statement - his wife is permitted! According to Rava, they should strip it from him; according to Rav Hananya, they should ask him, what is the resolution.

hebrew_text: חָלַץ וְעָשָׂה מַאֲמָר. אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: זוֹ דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, דְּאָמַר: אֵין קִדּוּשִׁין תּוֹפְסִין בְּחַיָּיבֵי לָאוִין. אֲבָל חֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: יֵשׁ אַחַר חֲלִיצָה כְּלוּם.
human_translation: performed ḥalitza and performed levirate betrothal, Rav Yehuda said Rav said: This is the statement of Rabbi Akiva, who says betrothal does not take effect on liable for a prohibition. But the Rabbis say something is after ḥalitza .
llm_translation: He removed and made a statement. Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: This is the statement of Rabbi Akiva, who said: Betrothals do not take effect with those who are obligated in negative commandments. But the Sages say: There is something after removal, it is as nothing.

hebrew_text: וּמִי מָצֵית מוֹקְמַתְּ לַהּ כְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, וְהָא קָתָנֵי רֵישָׁא: נָתַן גֵּט וְעָשָׂה מַאֲמָר — צְרִיכָה גֵּט וַחֲלִיצָה. וְאִי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, כֵּיוָן דִּיהַב לָהּ גֵּט, מִי מַהֲנֵי בַּהּ מַאֲמָר?
human_translation: And can you establish in accordance with Rabbi Akiva? But doesn’t the first clause teach: gave a bill of divorce and performed levirate betrothal, she requires a bill of divorce and ḥalitza . Now if Rabbi Akiva’s once he gave her a bill of divorce, is levirate betrothal effective for her?
llm_translation: And who found a foundation for her like Rabbi Akiva, and this is what was taught in the beginning: If he gave a bill of divorce and performed the act - she requires a bill of divorce and halitzah. And if it is according to Rabbi Akiva, since he gave her a bill of divorce, who will give her halitzah?

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא, רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: מִנַּיִן לְנוֹתֵן גֵּט לִיבִמְתּוֹ שֶׁנֶּאֶסְרָה עָלָיו עוֹלָמִית — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לֹא יוּכַל בַּעְלָהּ הָרִאשׁוֹן אֲשֶׁר שִׁלְּחָהּ״ — אַחַר שִׁילּוּחַ.
human_translation: But isn’t it taught Rabbi Akiva says: From where that if one gives a bill of divorce to his yevama , she is forbidden to him forever is stated “Her former husband, who sent her away, may not after sending away.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it was taught, Rabbi Akiva says: From where do we derive that one may give a bill of divorce to his yevamah who is permanently forbidden to him? As it is stated: "Her first husband, who sent her away, may not take her back" - after sending her away.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: גֵּט יְבָמִין מִדְּרַבָּנַן, וּקְרָא אַסְמַכְתָּא בְּעָלְמָא.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: the bill of divorce for levirate marriage rabbinic and the verse a mere support.
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said: A get of yibum is according to the Rabbis, and the verse is merely a support.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי, אָמַר רַבִּי: אֵין הַדְּבָרִים הַלָּלוּ אֲמוּרִים אֶלָּא לְדִבְרֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, שֶׁהָיָה עוֹשֶׂה חֲלוּצָה כְּעֶרְוָה. אֲבָל חֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: יֵשׁ אַחַר חֲלִיצָה כְּלוּם. וַאֲנִי אוֹמֵר: אֵימָתַי — בִּזְמַן שֶׁקִּדְּשָׁהּ לְשׁוּם אִישׁוּת, אֲבָל קִדְּשָׁהּ לְשׁוּם יַבְמוּת — אֵין אַחַר חֲלִיצָה כְּלוּם.
human_translation: This is also taught Rabbi said: These matters were only stated in accordance with the statement of Rabbi Akiva, who considers a yevama who underwent ḥalitza to be like a forbidden relation. But the Rabbis say something is after ḥalitza . And I say: When when he betrothed for the purpose of marriage, But he betrothed her for the purpose of levirate marriage, nothing is after ḥalitza .
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Namai the Elder said in the name of Rabbi: These matters are only said in accordance with the words of Rabbi Akiva, who used to perform halitzah like an ervah. But the Sages say: There is nothing after halitzah. And I say: When? When she was betrothed for the sake of marriage, but if she was betrothed for the sake of yibum, there is nothing after halitzah.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא אִידַּךְ: הַחוֹלֵץ לִיבִמְתּוֹ וְחָזַר וְקִדְּשָׁהּ, רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: אִם קִדְּשָׁהּ לְשׁוּם אִישׁוּת — צְרִיכָה הֵימֶנּוּ גֵּט, לְשׁוּם יַבְמוּת — אֵין צְרִיכָה הֵימֶנּוּ גֵּט. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: בֵּין שֶׁקִּדְּשָׁהּ לְשׁוּם אִישׁוּת, בִּין שֶׁקִּדְּשָׁהּ לְשׁוּם יַבְמוּת — צְרִיכָה הֵימֶנּוּ גֵּט.
human_translation: It is taught another one who performs ḥalitza with his yevama and then betroths her, Rabbi says: If he betrothed her for the purpose of marriage she requires a bill of divorce from him; for the purpose of levirate marriage she does not require a bill of divorce from him. And the Rabbis say: Whether he betrothed her for the purpose of marriage, or whether he betrothed her for the purpose of levirate marriage, she requires a bill of divorce from him,
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: The one who performs Chalitzah with his yevamah and then goes back and betroths her, Rabbi says: If he betrothed her for the sake of marriage - she requires a bill of divorce from him, but if he betrothed her for the sake of yibum - she does not require a bill of divorce from him. And the Sages say: Whether he betrothed her for the sake of marriage or for the sake of yibum - she requires a bill of divorce from him.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי — עֲשָׂאוּהָ כְּעוֹדֵר בְּנִכְסֵי הַגֵּר וּכְסָבוּר שֶׁלּוֹ הֵן, דְּלָא קָנֵי.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: What is the reason for Rabbi considered him like hoes the property of a convert while thinking was his own, he has not acquired
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: What is the reason for Rabbi's opinion? They made it like a bundle in the property of a convert, and he thinks that they are his, for he did not acquire them.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: מִי דָּמֵי? הָתָם לָא קָא מְכַוֵּין לְמִיקְנֵי, הָכָא קָא מְכַוֵּין לְמִיקְנֵי! הָא לָא דָּמְיָא אֶלָּא לְעוֹדֵר בְּנִכְסֵי גֵּר זֶה וּכְסָבוּר שֶׁל גֵּר אַחֵר הוּא, דְּקָנֵי.
human_translation: Abaye said to him: Are comparable? There, he does not intend to acquire here he does intend to acquire This is similar only to the one who hoes the property of this convert while thinking it is that of a different convert. that he acquires
llm_translation: He said to him, Abaye: Who is similar? There, he is not intending to acquire, here, he is intending to acquire! This is only similar to Odar in the property of this convert, and he thinks that it is the property of another convert, so he acquires.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן, כְּגוֹן דַּאֲמַר לַהּ: הִתְקַדְּשִׁי לִי בְּמַאֲמָר יְבָמִין. רַבִּי סָבַר: מַאֲמָר עִילָּוֵי זִיקָה קָא רָמֵי, וַאֲתַאי חֲלִיצָה אַפְקַעְתַּהּ לְזִיקָּהּ. וְרַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: הַאי לְחוֹדֵיהּ קָאֵי וְהַאי לְחוֹדֵיהּ קָאֵי. מֵעִיקָּרָא אִילּוּ אֲמַר לַהּ ״הִתְקַדְּשִׁי לִי בְּמַאֲמַר יְבָמִין״, מִי לָא מַהֲנֵי? הַשְׁתָּא נָמֵי מַהֲנֵי.
human_translation: Rather, Abaye said With what are we dealing here? where he said to Be betrothed to me with levirate betrothal. Rabbi holds levirate betrothal is superimposed upon levirate bond, and ḥalitza comes releases the levirate bond, And the Rabbis hold: This, stands on its own, and that, stands on its own. At the outset, if he had said to her: Be betrothed to me with levirate betrothal, would not be effective Now too effective,
llm_translation: Rather, Abaye said: Here, with what are we dealing? For example, if he said to her: "Be consecrated to me with the statement of yibum." Rabbi holds: The statement of levirate marriage is standing above, and then halitzah comes and uproots it for her. But the Rabbis hold: This one is standing for her and that one is standing for her. Initially, if he had said to her, "Be consecrated to me with the statement of yibum," would it not have been effective? Now too, it is effective.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: אִי דְּאָמַר לַהּ ״בְּמַאֲמַר יְבָמִין״, כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דְּמַהְנְיָא. וְהָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן — כְּגוֹן דְּאָמַר לַהּ ״הִתְקַדְּשִׁי לִי בְּזִיקַּת יְבָמִין״. רַבִּי סָבַר:
human_translation: Rava said: If he said to her: with levirate betrothal, everyone agrees that it is effective, And with what are we dealing here? where he said to her: Be betrothed to me with the levirate bond, Rabbi holds
llm_translation: Rava said: If he said to her, "With the statement of yibum," everyone agrees that it is not effective. And here, what are we dealing with? For example, if he said to her, "Be consecrated to me with the bond of yibum." Rabbi Sava holds:

hebrew_text: יֵשׁ זִיקָה, וַאֲתַאי חֲלִיצָה אַפְקַעְתַּיהּ לְזִיקָּה. וְרַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: אֵין זִיקָּה. מֵעִיקָּרָא אִילּוּ אָמַר לַהּ: ״הִתְקַדְּשִׁי לִי בְּזִיקַּת יְבָמִין״, מִי לָא מַהֲנֵי? הַשְׁתָּא נָמֵי מַהֲנֵי.
human_translation: the levirate bond is substantial, And ḥalitza comes releases the levirate bond. But the Rabbis hold the levirate bond is not substantial, And at the outset, if he had said to her: Be betrothed to me by the levirate bond, would not be effective? Now too, effective.
llm_translation: There is a claim, and then comes a halitzah, I have given it to the claim. And the Rabbis hold: there is no claim. Initially, if he said to her, "Be consecrated to me with the claim of yibum," who would not benefit? Now too, who would not benefit.

hebrew_text: רַב שֵׁרֵבְיָא אָמַר: בַּחֲלִיצָה כְּשֵׁירָה, אִי דְּאָמַר לַהּ ״הִתְקַדְּשִׁי לִי בְּזִיקַּת יְבָמִין״ — כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דְּלָא מַהֲנֵי. וְהָכָא בַּחֲלִיצָה פְּסוּלָה קָמִיפַּלְגִי: מָר סָבַר חֲלִיצָה פְּסוּלָה פּוֹטֶרֶת, וּמָר סָבַר חֲלִיצָה פְּסוּלָה אֵינָהּ פּוֹטֶרֶת.
human_translation: Rav Sherevya said: valid ḥalitza , if he said to her: Be betrothed to me by the levirate bond, everyone agrees that it is not effective, And here, disagree invalid ḥalitza . Sage, holds invalid ḥalitza exempts And Sage, holds invalid ḥalitza does not exempt
llm_translation: Rav She'revya said: In the case of halitzah when it is valid, if he said to her, "Be consecrated to me with the sandal of the yavam," everyone agrees that it is ineffective. And here in the case of invalid halitzah they disagree: one Master holds that invalid halitzah exempts her, and one Master holds that invalid halitzah does not exempt her.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא חֲלִיצָה פְּסוּלָה אֵינָהּ פּוֹטֶרֶת, וְהָכָא בְּיֵשׁ תְּנַאי בַּחֲלִיצָה קָמִיפַּלְגִי: מָר סָבַר יֵשׁ תְּנַאי בַּחֲלִיצָה, וּמַר סָבַר אֵין תְּנַאי בַּחֲלִיצָה.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: Everyone invalid ḥalitza does not exempt And here disagree a condition is with regard to ḥalitza . Sage, holds a condition is with regard to ḥalitza . And Sage, holds a condition is not with regard to ḥalitza ,
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: The consensus of the world is that a flawed redemption does not exempt her, and here in this case there is a dispute among the Tannaim regarding the redemption: one Master holds that there is a dispute among the Tannaim regarding the redemption, and the other Master holds that there is no dispute among the Tannaim regarding the redemption.

hebrew_text: רָבִינָא אָמַר: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא יֵשׁ תְּנַאי בַּחֲלִיצָה, וְהָכָא בִּתְנַאי כָּפוּל קָמִיפַּלְגִי: מָר סָבַר בָּעֵינַן תְּנַאי כָּפוּל, וּמָר סָבַר לָא בָּעֵינַן תְּנַאי כָּפוּל.
human_translation: Ravina said: Everyone agrees a condition is with regard to ḥalitza , and here disagree with regard to a compound condition. Sage, holds we require a compound condition. And Sage, holds that we do not require a compound condition.
llm_translation: Ravina said: Throughout the world, there are disputes regarding the law of redemption, and here in our Mishna, a double dispute arises: one Master holds that we require a double dispute, and the other Master holds that we do not require a double dispute.

hebrew_text: חָלֵץ וְעָשָׂה מַאֲמָר וְנָתַן גֵּט וּבָעַל וְכוּ׳. וְנִיתְנֵי נָמֵי אֵין אַחַר בִּיאָה כְּלוּם? אַבָּיֵי וְרָבָא דְּאָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ: תָּנֵי אֵין אַחַר בִּיאָה כְּלוּם. וְתַנָּא דִּידַן? הַתָּרַת יְבָמָה לַשּׁוּק עֲדִיפָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: performed ḥalitza and performed levirate betrothal, or gave a bill of divorce, or engaged in intercourse, And let likewise teach nothing is after intercourse, Abaye and Rava both say teach: Nothing is after intercourse, And the tanna of our The permission for a yevama to public is preferable to him.
llm_translation: He removed and made a statement, and gave a bill of divorce, and married, etc. And it is taught in a Baraita: Is there anything after consummation? Abaye and Rava both said: It was taught, there is nothing after consummation. And in our Mishnah? The permission for a yevamah to go to the marketplace is preferable for her.

hebrew_text: אֶחָד יְבָמָה אַחַת, אֶחָד שְׁתֵּי יְבָמוֹת. מַתְנִיתִין דְּלָא כְּבֶן עַזַּאי, דְּתַנְיָא, בֶּן עַזַּאי אוֹמֵר: יֵשׁ מַאֲמָר אַחַר מַאֲמָר בִּשְׁנֵי יְבָמִין וִיבָמָה אַחַת, וְאֵין מַאֲמָר אַחַר מַאֲמָר בִּשְׁתֵּי יְבָמוֹת וְיָבָם אֶחָד.
human_translation: both one yevama as well as two yevamot The mishna is not in accordance with ben Azzai. As it is taught Ben Azzai says: Levirate betrothal is after levirate betrothal in two yevamin and one yevama , but levirate betrothal is not after levirate betrothal in two yevamot and one yavam .
llm_translation: One yevamah one, one two yevamot. Mishna that not like Ben Azzai, as it was taught, Ben Azzai says: There is a saying after a saying in two yevamim and one yevamah, and there is no saying after a saying in two yevamot and one yavam.

hebrew_text: כֵּיצַד — מַאֲמָר לָזוֹ וְכוּ׳. לֵימָא מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ לִשְׁמוּאֵל, דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: חָלַץ לְבַעֲלַת מַאֲמָר — לֹא נִפְטְרָה צָרָתָהּ.
human_translation: How so? levirate betrothal with this Let us say supports Shmuel. As Shmuel said: performed ḥalitza with who received levirate betrothal, rival wife is not exempt
llm_translation: "How so? — A statement for this and the like. Let us say that it supports Shmuel, for Shmuel said: 'If a husband annulled his wife's vow, her distress is not alleviated.'"

hebrew_text: וּתְיוּבְתָּא דְּרַב יוֹסֵף: מִי קָתָנֵי ״חוֹלֵץ״? ״חָלַץ״ קָתָנֵי, דִּיעֲבַד.
human_translation: And a conclusive refutation Rav Yosef’s Does teach: He should perform ḥalitza , teaches he performed ḥalitza , after the fact.
llm_translation: The dispute of Rav Yosef: Who is the one who teaches "choletz"? "Choletz" is the one who teaches, as it is done.

hebrew_text: גֵּט לָזוֹ וְגֵט לָזוֹ כּוּ׳. לֵימָא מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ לְרַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא, דְּאָמַר רַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא: חֲלִיצָה פְּסוּלָה — צְרִיכָה לְחַזֵּר עַל כׇּל הָאַחִין. מַאי צְרִיכוֹת — צְרִיכוֹת דְּעָלְמָא.
human_translation: a bill of divorce to this one and a bill of divorce to that one, Let us say it supports Rabba bar Rav Huna. As Rabba bar Rav Huna said: invalid ḥalitza , is required to repeat with all of the brothers, What is require require in general.
llm_translation: A bill of divorce for this one and a bill of divorce for that one. Let us say it supports the view of Rabba bar Rav Huna, for Rabba bar Rav Huna said: An invalid halitzah requires going back to all the brothers. What are the requirements? The requirements of the world.

hebrew_text: גֵּט לָזוֹ וְחָלַץ לְזוֹ. לֵימָא מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ לִשְׁמוּאֵל, וְתִהְוֵי תְּיוּבְתָּא דְּרַב יוֹסֵף! מִי קָתָנֵי ״חוֹלֵץ״? ״חָלַץ״ קָתָנֵי, דִּיעֲבַד.
human_translation: a bill of divorce to this one and performed ḥalitza with that one, Let us say that this supports Shmuel, And a conclusive refutation of Rav Yosef, Does it teach: He should perform ḥalitza , It teaches: He performed ḥalitza , after the fact,
llm_translation: Get for him and divorce for him. Let us say it supports for him to Shmuel, and it will be a refutation of Rav Yosef! Who teaches "chalitz"? "Chalatz" it teaches, for it is done.

hebrew_text: חָלַץ וְחָלַץ אוֹ חָלַץ וְכוּ׳. וְלִיתְנֵי נָמֵי אֵין אַחַר בִּיאָה כְּלוּם! אַבָּיֵי וְרָבָא דְּאָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ: תָּנֵי אֵין אַחַר בִּיאָה כְּלוּם. וְתַנָּא דִּידַן — הַתָּרַת יְבָמָה לַשּׁוּק עֲדִיפָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: he performed ḥalitza and performed ḥalitza or he performed ḥalitza And let also teach: Nothing is after intercourse, Abaye and Rava both say teach: Nothing is after intercourse. And the tanna of our the permission for a yevama to public is preferable to him,
llm_translation: He removed and removed or he removed and so on. And let it be taught: There is nothing after intercourse! Abbaye and Rava both said: It was taught: There is nothing after intercourse. And our Mishnah teaches: The permission of yibum is preferable for him.

hebrew_text: בֵּין יָבָם אֶחָד לִשְׁתֵּי יְבָמוֹת כּוּ׳. בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, דְּאָמַר כּוּלֵּהּ בֵּיתָא בְּלָאו קָאֵי — אִיצְטְרִיךְ לְאַשְׁמוֹעִינַן דְּאֵין קִדּוּשִׁין תּוֹפְסִין בְּחַיָּיבֵי לָאוִין.
human_translation: both one yavam to two yevamot , Granted, according to Rabbi Yoḥanan, who said the entire household, is liable due to a prohibition it was necessary to teach us that betrothal does not take effect on liable for a prohibition,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Between yavam one to two yevamot like. In accordance with Rabbi Yochanan, who said: the entire household stands without a brother - it is necessary for us to hear that betrothals do not take effect with those who are obligated in negative commandments.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ, דְּאָמַר כּוּלֵּהּ בֵּיתָא בְּכָרֵת קָאֵי — אִיצְטְרִיךְ לְאַשְׁמוֹעִינַן דְּאֵין קִדּוּשִׁין תּוֹפְסִין בְּחַיָּיבֵי כָּרֵיתוֹת!
human_translation: However, according to Reish Lakish, who said entire household, is liable karet , was it necessary to teach us that betrothal does not take effect on is liable karet ?
llm_translation: To the beginning of the statement of Reish Lakish, who said: "The entire house stands on the edge of a cliff" – it is necessary for us to hear that betrothals do not take effect with those liable for kareth!

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָךְ רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: וְלִיטַעְמָיךְ, סֵיפָא דְּקָתָנֵי בָּעַל וְעָשָׂה מַאֲמָר — אִיצְטְרִיךְ לְאַשְׁמוֹעִינַן דְּאֵין קִדּוּשִׁין תּוֹפְסִין בְּאֵשֶׁת אִישׁ?
human_translation: Reish Lakish said to you: And according to your reasoning, latter clause which teaches engaged in intercourse and performed levirate betrothal was it necessary to teach us that betrothal is not effective for a married woman?
llm_translation: He said to you, Reish Lakish: And to your taste, the end of what is taught in the Baraita - do we need to hear that betrothals do not take effect with a married woman?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: אַיְּידֵי דִּתְנָא הַתָּרַת יָבָם אֶחָד וִיבָמָה אַחַת, תְּנָא נָמֵי שְׁתֵּי יְבָמוֹת וְיָבָם אֶחָד. וְאַיְּידֵי דִּתְנָא שְׁתֵּי יְבָמוֹת וְיָבָם אֶחָד, תְּנָא נָמֵי שְׁתֵּי יְבָמִין וִיבָמָה אַחַת.
human_translation: Rather, Since he teaches the release of one yavam and one yevama , he also teaches two yevamot and one yavam , and since he teaches two yevamot and one yavam , he also teaches two yevamin and one yevama .
llm_translation: Rather: since a Tanna taught the permission of one yavam and one yevamah, let him also teach the case of two yevamot and one yavam. And since a Tanna taught the case of two yevamot and one yavam, let him also teach the case of two yevamin and one yevamah.

hebrew_text: חָלַץ וְעָשָׂה מַאֲמָר וְנָתַן וְכוּ׳. בִּשְׁלָמָא חָלַץ וְעָשָׂה מַאֲמָר, אִיצְטְרִיךְ, סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: נִגְזוֹר מַאֲמָר דְּבָתַר חֲלִיצָה אַטּוּ מַאֲמָר דְּקַמֵּי חֲלִיצָה, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּלָא גָּזְרִינַן. אֶלָּא חָלַץ וְנָתַן גֵּט לְמָה לִי?
human_translation: he performed ḥalitza and perform levirate betrothal, or give Granted, it was necessary performed ḥalitza and then performed levirate betrothal it might enter your mind to say we should issue a decree levirate betrothal that after ḥalitza due to levirate betrothal that before ḥalitza , teaches us that we do not issue a decree However, performed ḥalitza and gave a bill of divorce, why do I
llm_translation: He removed and made a statement and gave, etc. Granted that he removed and made a statement, it is necessary, for I might say: The statement following the divorce is decreed only after the statement preceding the divorce, which would indicate to us that we do not decree. But he removed and gave a bill of divorce, why do I need it?

hebrew_text: וּלְטַעְמָיךְ, אֵימָא סֵיפָא: בָּעַל וְעָשָׂה מַאֲמָר, בָּעַל וְנָתַן גֵּט — בִּשְׁלָמָא בָּעַל וְנָתַן גֵּט אִיצְטְרִיךְ, סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: נִגְזוֹר גֵּט דְּבָתַר בְּעִילָה אַטּוּ גֵּט דְּקַמֵּי בְּעִילָה, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּלָא גָּזְרִינַן, אֲבָל בָּעַל וְעָשָׂה מַאֲמָר לְמָה לִי?
human_translation: And according to your reasoning, say the latter clause he engaged in intercourse and perform levirate betrothal, or give a bill of divorce, or perform ḥalitza Granted, it was necessary engaged in intercourse and gave a bill of divorce. it might enter your mind to say we should issue a decree a bill of divorce that after intercourse, due to a bill of divorce that before intercourse, teaches us that we do not issue a decree. But engaged in intercourse and performed levirate betrothal, why do I
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And according to your reasoning, let us say the conclusion: If a husband both made a statement and gave a bill of divorce - granted, if a husband gave a bill of divorce, it is necessary, for according to your opinion I would say: the bill of divorce is decreed after intercourse, then he gave a bill of divorce before intercourse, it implies to us that we do not decree. But if a husband made a statement, why do I need it?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: אַיְּידֵי דִּתְנָא חָלַץ וְעָשָׂה מַאֲמָר, תְּנָא נָמֵי בָּעַל וְעָשָׂה מַאֲמָר. וְאַיְּידֵי דְבָעֵי לְמִיתְנֵי בָּעַל וְנָתַן גֵּט, תְּנָא נָמֵי חָלַץ וְנָתַן גֵּט.
human_translation: Rather, since taught performed ḥalitza and performed levirate betrothal, he also taught engaged in intercourse and performed levirate betrothal, And since he wished to teach engaged in intercourse and gave a bill of divorce, he also taught performed ḥalitza and gave a bill of divorce.
llm_translation: Rather: since a Tanna taught that if one removes and makes a statement, another Tanna also taught that if one is a Ba'al and makes a statement. And since they want to teach that if one is a Ba'al and gives a bill of divorce, another Tanna also taught that if one removes and gives a bill of divorce.

hebrew_text: בִּזְמַן שֶׁהִיא וְכוּ׳. מַתְנִיתִין דְּלָא כִּי הַאי תַּנָּא, דְּתַנְיָא: אַבָּא יוֹסֵי בֶּן יוֹחָנָן אִישׁ יְרוּשָׁלַיִם אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי מֵאִיר: אַחַת בְּעִילָה וְאַחַת חֲלִיצָה, בַּתְּחִלָּה — אֵין אַחֲרֶיהָ כְּלוּם, בָּאֶמְצַע וּבַסּוֹף — יֵשׁ אַחֲרֶיהָ כְּלוּם.
human_translation: when it is The mishna is not in accordance with this tanna . As it is taught Abba Yosei ben Yoḥanan, a man of Jerusalem, says in the name of Rabbi Meir: both intercourse and ḥalitza , at the beginning, nothing is effective after it, in the middle or at the end, something is after it.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "In a time when she is etc." Mishnah: that not like this Tanna, as it was taught: Abba Yosei ben Yochanan, a man of Jerusalem, says in the name of Rabbi Meir: One in the beginning is nothing after it, in the middle and at the end there is something after it.

hebrew_text: וְשָׁלֹשׁ מַחְלוֹקוֹת בַּדָּבָר, תַּנָּא קַמָּא סָבַר: בִּיאָה, דְּאִיכָּא לְמִיגְזַר — גָּזְרִינַן. חֲלִיצָה, דְּלֵיכָּא לְמִיגְזַר — לָא גָּזְרִינַן.
human_translation: And three disputes with regard to matter, The first tanna holds: intercourse where there is to issue a decree, we issue a decree ḥalitza , where there is no to issue a decree we do not issue a decree.
llm_translation: And three disputes in the matter, a Tanna, the first one holds: with regard to intercourse, where there is a possibility of decreeing — we decree. With regard to halitzah, where there is no possibility of decreeing — we do not decree.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה סָבַר: בִּיאָה נָמֵי לֵיכָּא לְמִיגְזַר, וּדְקָאָמְרַתְּ לִיגְזוֹר בִּיאָה אַחַר הַגֵּט מִשּׁוּם בִּיאָה אַחַר חֲלִיצָה — כֵּיוָן דַּחֲלִיצָה דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא, מִידָּע יָדְעִי. וּדְקָאָמְרַתְּ לִיגְזוֹר בִּיאָה אַחַר מַאֲמָר מִשּׁוּם בִּיאָה אַחַר בִּיאָה — כֵּיוָן דְּבִיאָה דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא, הָא מִידָּע יְדִיעִי. וְאַבָּא יוֹסֵי בֶּן חָנָן סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבָּנַן דְּגָזְרִי בְּבִיאָה, וְגָזַר חֲלִיצָה מִשּׁוּם בִּיאָה.
human_translation: And Rabbi Neḥemya holds intercourse there is also no to issue a decree. And as you said that we should issue a decree intercourse after a bill of divorce due to intercourse after ḥalitza , Since ḥalitza by Torah know And as you said that we should issue a decree intercourse after levirate betrothal due to intercourse after intercourse, since intercourse by Torah this is known And Abba Yosei ben Ḥanan holds in accordance with the Rabbis, who issue a decree with regard to intercourse, and issues a decree ḥalitza due to intercourse.
llm_translation: Rabbi Nechemiah holds: Intercourse is necessary for the decree to take effect, and when she says to cut off intercourse after the divorce because of intercourse after halitzah - since halitzah is biblical, they know immediately. And when she says to cut off intercourse after a statement because of intercourse after intercourse - since intercourse is biblical, they know immediately. And Abba Yosei ben Chanin holds like the Rabbis who decreed regarding intercourse, and he decreed halitzah because of intercourse.

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל
llm_translation: We will return to you, Rabban Gamliel.

hebrew_text: הַבָּא עַל יְבִמְתּוֹ , בֵּין בְּשׁוֹגֵג בֵּין בְּמֵזִיד, בֵּין בְּאוֹנֶס בֵּין בְּרָצוֹן, אֲפִילּוּ הוּא שׁוֹגֵג וְהִיא מְזִידָה, הוּא מֵזִיד וְהִיא שׁוֹגֶגֶת, הוּא אָנוּס וְהִיא לֹא אֲנוּסָה, הִיא אֲנוּסָה וְהוּא לֹא אָנוּס. אֶחָד הַמְעָרֶה וְאֶחָד הַגּוֹמֵר — קָנָה. וְלֹא חִילֵּק בֵּין בִּיאָה לְבִיאָה.
human_translation: One who had intercourse with his yevama , whether unwittingly, or intentionally, whether coercion or willingly; even if he unwitting and her intentional, his intentional and she unwitting, he was coerced and she was not coerced, she was coerced and he was not coerced; both one who engages in the initial stage of intercourse and one who completes has acquired And did not distinguish between intercourse and intercourse
llm_translation: One who comes to his sister-in-law, whether unintentionally or intentionally, whether by force or willingly, even if he is unintentional and she is intentional, he is intentional and she is unintentional, he is forced and she is not forced, she is forced and he is not forced - one who refuses and one who consents, he acquires. And he does not differentiate between one act of intercourse and another.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן הַבָּא עַל אַחַת מִכׇּל הָעֲרָיוֹת שֶׁבַּתּוֹרָה, אוֹ פְּסוּלוֹת, כְּגוֹן אַלְמָנָה לְכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל גְּרוּשָׁה וַחֲלוּצָה לְכֹהֵן הֶדְיוֹט, מַמְזֶרֶת וּנְתִינָה לְיִשְׂרָאֵל, בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל לְמַמְזֵר וּלְנָתִין פְּסָלָהּ — וְלֹא חִילֵּק בֵּין בִּיאָה לְבִיאָה.
human_translation: And so too, who had intercourse with any one of those with whom relations are forbidden [ arayot ] the Torah or unfit for him for example, a widow with a High Priest; a divorcée and a yevama who performed ḥalitza [ ḥalutza ] with a common priest; a mamzeret , or a Gibeonite woman with an Israelite; the daughter of an Israelite with a mamzer or a Gibeonite; he has disqualified her and did not distinguish between intercourse and intercourse
llm_translation: And so one who comes upon any of all the forbidden relations in the Torah, or disqualified ones, such as a widow to a High Priest, a divorced or halutzah woman to an ordinary priest, a mamzeret or a natinah to an Israelite, a daughter of Israel to a mamzer or a natin, her betrothal is invalid — and he did not differentiate between one act of intercourse and another.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי ״אֲפִילּוּ״?
human_translation: What is even
llm_translation: Gemara: What is the meaning of "afilu"?

hebrew_text: לָא מִיבַּעְיָא קָאָמַר. לָא מִיבַּעְיָא הוּא שׁוֹגֵג וְהִיא קָמִכַּוְּונָה לְמִצְוָה, אִי נָמֵי הוּא מֵזִיד וְהִיא קָמִכַּוְּונָה לְמִצְוָה, אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ הוּא שׁוֹגֵג וְהִיא מְזִידָה, דְּתַרְוַיְיהוּ לָא קָמִכַּוְּונִי לְשֵׁם מִצְוָה — אֲפִילּוּ הָכִי קָנָה. תָּנֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא: אֲפִילּוּ שְׁנֵיהֶם שׁוֹגְגִים, שְׁנֵיהֶם מְזִידִים, שְׁנֵיהֶם אֲנוּסִים.
human_translation: Needless to say. needless to say he unwitting and she intended mitzva, alternatively, he intentionally and she intended mitzva, However, even if he unwitting and she intentionally, where both of them did not intend for the sake of the mitzva, he nevertheless acquires Rabbi Ḥiyya taught: Even both of them unwittingly, intentionally, were coerced,
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: He did not need to say. He did not need to say that if he is unintentional and she is intentional for the commandment, or if he is intentional and she is intentional for the commandment, rather even if he is unintentional and she is intentional, since both of them did not have intent for the sake of the commandment — even so, he acquires. Rabbi Chiya taught: Even if both of them are unintentional, both of them are intentional, both of them are coerced.

hebrew_text: אָנוּס דְּמַתְנִיתִין הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִילֵּימָא כְּשֶׁאֲנָסוּהוּ גּוֹיִם וּבָא עָלֶיהָ, וְהָאָמַר רָבָא: אֵין אוֹנֶס לְעֶרְוָה! לְפִי שֶׁאֵין קִישּׁוּי אֶלָּא לְדַעַת.
human_translation: What are the circumstances the mishna was coerced? If we say when gentiles coerced him and had intercourse with her, didn’t Rava say there is no coercion with whom relations are forbidden, because there is no erection without intent?
llm_translation: Anus of Matnitin, how is the value? Perhaps when the Gentiles forced her and he came upon her, and Rava said: There is no compulsion in matters of sexual impropriety! Because compulsion applies only to intent.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא בְּיָשֵׁן. וְהָאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה:
human_translation: Rather, one who was sleeping didn’t Rav Yehuda say
llm_translation: Rather, in the case of a sleeping person. And didn't Rav Yehuda say:

hebrew_text: יָשֵׁן לֹא קָנָה בִּיבִמְתּוֹ. אֶלָּא בְּנִתְקָע — וְהָא אָמַר רַבָּה: נָפַל מִן הַגָּג וְנִתְקַע — חַיָּיב בְּאַרְבָּעָה דְּבָרִים, וּבִיבִמְתּוֹ לֹא קָנָה.
human_translation: a sleeping has not acquired his yevama , Rather, to one who was inserted didn’t Rabba say: fell from a roof and was inserted is liable four types of indemnity and if his yevama , he has not acquired
llm_translation: He who sleeps did not acquire with his yevamah. Rather, with a nitaqa — and didn't Rabba say: If one falls from the roof and gets stuck — he is liable for four things, but he did not acquire with his yevamah.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא כְּגוֹן שֶׁנִּתְכַּוֵּון לְאִשְׁתּוֹ, וּתְקָפַתּוּ יְבִמְתּוֹ, וּבָא עָלֶיהָ. שְׁנֵיהֶם אֲנוּסִים דְּבֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא הֵיכִי דָּמֵי? כְּגוֹן שֶׁנִּתְכַּוֵּון לְאִשְׁתּוֹ, וּתְקָפוּהוּ גּוֹיִם וְדִבְּקוּם זֶה בָּזֶה, וּבָא עָלֶיהָ.
human_translation: Rather, where he intended his wife and his yevama grabbed hold of him and he had intercourse with her. what are the circumstances both of them were coerced the school of Rabbi Ḥiyya? where he intended his wife, and gentiles grabbed hold of him and pressed against each other, and he had intercourse with her.
llm_translation: Rather, for example, when he intended for his wife, and his brother-in-law intended for his yevamah, and he had relations with her. Both of them are considered coerced. How is this comparable to the house of Rabbi Chiya? For example, when he intended for his wife, and non-Jews attacked him and clung to each other, and he had relations with her.

hebrew_text: מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״יְבָמָהּ יָבֹא עָלֶיהָ״, מִצְוָה. דָּבָר אַחֵר: ״יְבָמָהּ יָבֹא עָלֶיהָ״ — בֵּין בְּשׁוֹגֵג בֵּין בְּמֵזִיד, בֵּין בְּאוֹנֶס בֵּין בְּרָצוֹן.
human_translation: From where are these matters As the Sages taught “Her brother-in-law will have intercourse with her” a mitzva, Alternatively, “Her brother-in-law will have intercourse with her,” whether unwittingly or intentionally, whether coercion or willingly.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Mena hanei milei? D'tanu Rabbanan: 'Yevamah yavo aleha', mitzvah. Davar acher: 'Yevamah yavo aleha' — bein beshogeg bein bemezid, bein be'ones bein beratzon." English translation: "What are these matters? The Rabbis taught: 'Her yavam shall come upon her,' a commandment. Another explanation: 'Her yavam shall come upon her' — whether by mistake or intentionally, whether by force or willingly."

hebrew_text: וְהָא אַפֵּיקְתֵּיהּ לְמִצְוָה? לְמִצְוָה מִ״וְּאִם לֹא יַחְפּוֹץ הָאִישׁ״ נָפְקָא, הָא חָפֵץ — יִבֵּם, וְכִי אֲתָא קְרָא: בֵּין בְּשׁוֹגֵג בֵּין בְּמֵזִיד, בֵּין בְּאוֹנֶס בֵּין בְּרָצוֹן.
human_translation: Didn’t you derive mitzva? a mitzva is derived from “And if the man does not wish wishes, he performs levirate marriage, when verse came, whether unwittingly or intentionally, whether coercion or willingly.
llm_translation: And this, she refused for the commandment? For the commandment from "if he does not desire the man" it emerges, if he desires - he shall perform levirate marriage. And when the verse came: "Whether unintentionally or intentionally, whether by force or willingly."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא אִידַּךְ: ״יְבָמָהּ יָבֹא עָלֶיהָ״, כְּדַרְכָּהּ. ״וּלְקָחָהּ״ — שֶׁלֹּא ״כְּדַרְכָּהּ״. ״וְיִבֵּם״ — בִּיאָה גּוֹמֶרֶת בָּהּ, וְאֵין כֶּסֶף וּשְׁטָר גּוֹמְרִין בָּהּ. ״וְיִבְּמָהּ״ — בְּעַל כׇּרְחָהּ. דָּבָר אַחֵר: ״יְבָמָהּ יָבֹא עָלֶיהָ״, בֵּין בְּשׁוֹגֵג כּוּ׳.
human_translation: It is taught another “Her brother-in-law will have intercourse with her” typical “and take her,” atypical, “and consummate the levirate marriage,” sexual intercourse completes her but money and a document do not complete her “and consummate the levirate marriage with her,” against her will. Alternatively: “Her brother-in-law will have intercourse with her” whether unwittingly
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: "Her yavam shall come upon her," in her normal manner. "And take her" — not in her normal manner. "And perform yibum" — completion of intercourse with her, and money and document do not complete it. "And she shall be yibummed" — willingly. Another explanation: "Her yavam shall come upon her," whether unintentionally, etc.

hebrew_text: וְהָא אַפֵּיקְתֵּיהּ לִכְדַרְכָּהּ! הָהוּא — מִ״לְּהָקִים לְאָחִיו שֵׁם״ נָפְקָא, בְּמָקוֹם שֶׁמֵּקִים שֵׁם. וְכִי אֲתָא קְרָא, בֵּין בְּשׁוֹגֵג בֵּין בְּמֵזִיד, בֵּין בְּאוֹנֶס בֵּין בְּרָצוֹן.
human_translation: Didn’t you derive typical That is derived from “To establish a name for his brother” in the place where he establishes a name, when verse came, whether unwittingly or intentionally, whether coercion or willingly.
llm_translation: And she went out according to her way! That one — from "to establish a name for his brother" came out, in a place where they establish a name. And when a verse comes, whether unintentionally or intentionally, whether by force or willingly.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא, אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: יָשֵׁן — לֹא קָנָה בִּיבִמְתּוֹ, דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״יְבָמָהּ יָבֹא עָלֶיהָ״, עַד דִּמְכַוֵּין לַהּ לְשֵׁם בִּיאָה. וְהָתַנְיָא: בֵּין עֵר [בֵּין יָשֵׁן! אֵימָא: בֵּין עֵרָה בֵּין יְשֵׁנָה.
human_translation: the itself Rav Yehuda said: A sleeping has not acquired his yevama , as the verse states: “Her brother-in-law will have intercourse with her” unless he intends for the sake of sexual intercourse. Isn’t it taught whether he awake or asleep? Say Whether she awake or asleep.
llm_translation: The body, Rav Yehudah said: If he is asleep, he did not acquire his yevamah, as the verse states: "Her yavam shall come upon her," until he intends for her for the purpose of intercourse. And it was taught: Whether she is awake or asleep! I would say: Whether she is awake or asleep.

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא: בֵּין עֵר] הוּא בֵּין יָשֵׁן הוּא, בֵּין עֵרָה הִיא בֵּין יְשֵׁנָה הִיא! הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן — בְּמִתְנַמְנֵם. הֵיכִי דָּמֵי מִתְנַמְנֵם? אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: נִים וְלָא נִים תִּיר וְלָא תִּיר, כְּגוֹן דְּקָרוּ לֵיהּ וְעָנֵי, וְלָא יָדַע לְאַהְדּוֹרֵי סְבָרָא, וְכִי מַדְכְּרוּ לֵיהּ מִדְּכַר.
human_translation: Wasn’t it taught whether he was awake or he was asleep whether she was awake or she was asleep? With what are we dealing here who is dozing. What are the circumstances dozing? Rav Ashi said: asleep but not asleep, awake but not awake, when, they call him, he answer, but he is unable to provide a reasonable And when they inform him he remembers
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it was taught: Whether it is done in the city or whether it is done in the field, whether it is done naked or whether it is done clothed! Here, with what are we dealing? — With sleep. How is it considered sleep? Rav Ashi said: He dozes and does not doze, he is awake and not awake, for example, they called to him and he answered, but he did not know to respond with reasoning, and when they reminded him, he remembered.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא, אָמַר רַבָּה: נָפַל מִן הַגָּג וְנִתְקַע — חַיָּיב בְּאַרְבָּעָה דְּבָרִים, וּבִיבִמְתּוֹ לֹא קָנָה. בְּנֵזֶק, בְּצַעַר, בְּשֶׁבֶת, בְּרִפּוּי. אֲבָל בּוֹשֶׁת לָא מִיחַיַּיב, דְּאָמַר מָר: אֵין חַיָּיב עַל הַבּוֹשֶׁת עַד שֶׁיִּתְכַּוֵּון.
human_translation: the itself Rabba said: fell from a roof and was inserted is liable four types of indemnity and if his yevama he has not acquired injury, pain, loss of livelihood, medical costs. However, he is not liable shame as the Master said: One is not liable for shame unless he intends
llm_translation: The body, Rabah said: If one falls from the roof and gets stuck - he is liable for four things, but with regard to yibum he did not acquire. For damage, distress, Sabbath violation, and healing. But for embarrassment he is not liable, as the Master said: One is not liable for embarrassment until he intends.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: נִתְכַּוֵּון לְהָטִיחַ בַּכּוֹתֶל וְהֵטִיחַ בִּיבִמְתּוֹ — לֹא קָנָה. לְהָטִיחַ בִּבְהֵמָה וְהֵטִיחַ בִּיבָמָה — קָנָה, דְּהָא קָמְכַוֵּין לְשֵׁם בִּיאָה בְּעוֹלָם.
human_translation: Rava said: he intended to press into a wall, and he pressed into his yevama , he has not acquired to press into an animal, and he pressed into his yevama , he has acquired as he intended for the purpose of sexual intercourse in general,
llm_translation: Rava said: If one intended to perform chalitzah on the wall and performed chalitzah on the yevamah - he did not acquire her. If one intended to perform chalitzah on an animal and performed chalitzah on the yevamah - he acquired her, for they are ultimately intended for the purpose of marital relations in the world.

hebrew_text: אֶחָד הַמְעָרֶה. אָמַר עוּלָּא: מִנַּיִן לְהַעֲרָאָה מִן הַתּוֹרָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְאִישׁ אֲשֶׁר יִשְׁכַּב אֶת אִשָּׁה דָּוָה וְגִלָּה אֶת עֶרְוָתָהּ אֶת מְקֹרָהּ הֶעֱרָה״, מִכָּאן לְהַעֲרָאָה מִן הַתּוֹרָה.
human_translation: both one who begins the act of intercourse Ulla said: From where the initial stage of intercourse by Torah law? As it is stated: “And if a man shall lie with a woman having her sickness and shall uncover her nakedness, he has made naked [ he’era ] her fountain” from here the initial stage of intercourse [ ha’ara’a ] by Torah law.
llm_translation: One cave. Ulla said: From where do we derive the prohibition of uncovering from the Torah, as it is stated: "And if a man lies with a woman having her sickness, and uncovers her nakedness; he has made naked her fountain" (Leviticus 20:18)? From here we derive the prohibition of uncovering from the Torah.

hebrew_text: אַשְׁכְּחַן נִדָּה, שְׁאָר עֲרָיוֹת מִנַּיִן? וְכִי תֵּימָא: נֵילַף מִנִּדָּה — מָה לְנִדָּה שֶׁכֵּן מְטַמְּאָה אֶת בּוֹעֲלָהּ!
human_translation: We have found a menstruating woman, From where the rest of those with whom relations are forbidden? And if you say we should derive it from a menstruating woman, what to a menstruating woman, in that she causes one who has intercourse with her to become ritually impure?
llm_translation: We find a menstruating woman, how do we know the rest of the forbidden relationships? And if you say: we learn from menstruation - just as menstruation defiles her husband!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָתְיָא מֵאֵשֶׁת אָח, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְאִישׁ אֲשֶׁר יִקַּח אֶת אֵשֶׁת אָחִיו נִדָּה הִיא״ — וְכִי אֵשֶׁת אָחִיו [לְעוֹלָם] נִדָּה הִיא? אֶלָּא כְּנִדָּה: מָה נִדָּה בְּהַעֲרָאָה — אַף אֵשֶׁת אָח בְּהַעֲרָאָה.
human_translation: Rather, comes from a brother’s wife, as it is written: “And if a man shall take his brother’s wife, it is impurity [ nidda ]” Is his brother’s wife always menstruating? Rather, like a menstruating woman: Just as a menstruating woman through the initial stage of intercourse, so too, a brother’s wife through the initial stage of intercourse.
llm_translation: Rather, it comes from the wife of a brother, as it is written: "And a man who takes his brother's wife, it is impurity" — and is the wife of his brother always impure? Rather, like impurity: just as impurity involves forbidden relations — so too, the wife of a brother involves forbidden relations.

hebrew_text: מָה לְאֵשֶׁת אָח — שֶׁכֵּן בְּיָדוֹ לְרַבּוֹת, דְּאִי בָּעֵי מְקַדֵּשׁ וְאָזֵיל כִּי אַלְפָּא.
human_translation: What a brother’s wife wife is it is within his power to increase as, if he wishes, he can go on betrothing a thousand
llm_translation: What about the wife of a brother - that he has the ability to marry her, for if he wants he can sanctify her and then go, for it is a thousand.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָתְיָא מֵאֲחוֹת אָב וַאֲחוֹת אֵם, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְעֶרְוַת אֲחוֹת אִמְּךָ וַאֲחוֹת אָבִיךָ לֹא תְגַלֵּה כִּי אֶת שְׁאֵרוֹ הֶעֱרָה״. אִיכָּא לְמִיפְרַךְ: מָה לַאֲחוֹת אָב וַאֲחוֹת אֵם — שֶׁכֵּן אִיסּוּר הַבָּא מֵאֵלָיו.
human_translation: Rather, comes from a father’s sister and a mother’s sister, as it is written: “And you shall not uncover the nakedness of your mother’s sister nor of your father’s sister; for he has made naked [ he’era ] his kin” It is to refute What a father’s sister and a mother’s sister, which are a prohibition that comes on its own?
llm_translation: Rather, it comes from the sister of the father and the sister of the mother, as it is written: "The nakedness of your father's sister or of your mother's sister, you shall not uncover; their own nakedness you shall not uncover." There is a refutation: What about the sister of the father and the sister of the mother - for the prohibition comes from them.

hebrew_text: מֵחֲדָא לָא אָתְיָא, תֵּיתֵי [חֲדָא] מִתַּרְתֵּי. מֵהֵי תֵּיתֵי? תֵּיתֵי מֵאֵשֶׁת אָח וַאֲחוֹת אָב וַאֲחוֹת אֵם — מָה לְהָנָךְ שֶׁכֵּן אֲסוּרִין מִשּׁוּם שְׁאֵר.
human_translation: does not come from one Let it come one from two From which come come from a brother’s wife and a father’s sister and a mother’s sister, what which are prohibited because kin?
llm_translation: From here it does not come, one is given one from two. From where is one given? One is given from the wife of a brother, and the sister of a father, and the sister of a mother - what is the benefit that they are forbidden due to incest.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא תֵּיתֵי מִנִּדָּה וַאֲחוֹת אָב וַאֲחוֹת אֵם. מָה לְהָנָךְ שֶׁכֵּן אִיסּוּר הַבָּא מֵאֵלָיו. אֶלָּא תֵּיתֵי מִנִּדָּה וְאֵשֶׁת אָח, דְּמַאי פָּרְכַתְּ.
human_translation: Rather, let it come from a menstruating woman and a father’s sister and a mother’s sister, What which are prohibition that comes of its own Rather, let it come from a menstruating woman and a brother’s wife. As, what refute
llm_translation: Rather, it should include a woman who is a menstruant, a paternal sister, and a maternal sister. What is the benefit in this? For the prohibition comes from him. Rather, it should include a woman who is a menstruant and a wife of a brother. What is the resolution?

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִיקָא: מָה לְנִדָּה וְאֵשֶׁת אָח, שֶׁכֵּן אֵין לָהֶם הֶיתֵּר בְּחַיֵּי אוֹסְרָן, תֹּאמַר בְּאֵשֶׁת אִישׁ, שֶׁכֵּן יֵשׁ לָהּ הֶיתֵּר בְּחַיֵּי אוֹסְרָהּ!
human_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rav Ika, strongly objects to this: What a menstruating woman and a brother’s wife, which are they cannot be permitted the existence of the that renders them prohibited? you say with regard to a married woman, who can become permitted during the lifetime of the one who renders her prohibited,
llm_translation: Challenges her Rav Acha son of Rav Ika: What about a menstruating woman and a man's wife, for they have no permission in their lives to permit them? You should say regarding a man's wife, for she has permission in her life to permit her!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַחָא מִדִּפְתִּי לְרָבִינָא: אַטּוּ נִדָּה וְאֵשֶׁת אָח בְּחַיֵּי אוֹסְרָן הוּא דְּאֵין לָהֶם הֶיתֵּר, אֲבָל לְאַחַר מִכָּאן יֵשׁ לָהֶם הֶיתֵּר? נִדָּה —
human_translation: Rav Aḥa of Difti said to Ravina: Is that to say it is the existence of the that renders them prohibited that a menstruating woman and a brother’s wife cannot be permitted but afterward, they can be permitted? a menstruating woman,
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Acha, from Difti to Ravina: "Now, a menstruating woman and the wife of a brother during the lifetime of her husband, it is their prohibition that they have no permission, but after this, do they have permission? Menstruating woman—"

hebrew_text: בְּיוֹמֵי תַּלְיָא מִילְּתָא. אֵשֶׁת אָח — בְּבָנִים תְּלָא רַחֲמָנָא.
human_translation: the matter depends upon days, a brother’s wife, the Merciful One makes dependent upon children,
llm_translation: In the days of Talya, a matter. The wife of a brother - with sons, may the Merciful One spare.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא פָּרֵיךְ הָכִי: מָה לְנִדָּה וְאֵשֶׁת אָח שֶׁכֵּן אֵין אוֹסְרָן מַתִּירָן. תֹּאמַר בְּאֵשֶׁת אִישׁ שֶׁאוֹסְרָהּ מַתִּירָהּ!
human_translation: Rather, refutes What a menstruating woman and a brother’s wife, which that renders them prohibited does not render them permitted? Can you say to a married woman, in that the one who renders her prohibited render her permitted
llm_translation: Rather, the question is thus: What is the case with regard to a menstruating woman and the wife of one's brother, that similarly one who prohibits them also permits them? You may say, in the case of a married woman whose husband prohibits her, he also permits her!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹנָה, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ, אָמַר קְרָא: ״כִּי כׇּל אֲשֶׁר יַעֲשֶׂה מִכֹּל הַתּוֹעֵבֹת הָאֵלֶּה וְנִכְרְתוּ הַנְּפָשׁוֹת הָעֹשֹׂת״ — הוּקְּשׁוּ כׇּל הָעֲרָיוֹת כּוּלָּן לְנִדָּה: מָה נִדָּה בְּהַעֲרָאָה, אַף כֹּל בְּהַעֲרָאָה.
human_translation: Rather, Rabbi Yona said, and some say Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua: The verse states “For whoever shall do any of these abominations, the souls that do them shall be cut off” All those with whom relations are forbidden are compared to a menstruating woman, just as a menstruating woman the initial stage of intercourse, so too, all the initial stage of intercourse.
llm_translation: Rather, Rabbi Yonah said, and it was stated by Rav Huna son of Rav Yehoshua, a verse states: "For all who do any of these abominations, the souls who do them shall be cut off" — all the forbidden relationships are equivalent to menstruation: just as menstruation involves concealment, so too all forbidden relationships involve concealment.

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא ״נִדָּה״ דִּכְתִיבָא גַּבֵּי אֵשֶׁת אָח לְמָה לִי? לְכִדְרַב הוּנָא. דְּאָמַר רַב הוּנָא: רֶמֶז לִיבָמָה מִן הַתּוֹרָה מִנַּיִן, מִנַּיִן?! הָא כְּתִיב: ״יְבָמָהּ יָבֹא עָלֶיהָ״! אֶלָּא: רֶמֶז לִיבָמָה שֶׁאֲסוּרָה בְּחַיֵּי בַּעְלָהּ מִנַּיִן?
human_translation: But why do I need nidda that is written with regard to a brother’s wife? for that which Rav Huna as Rav Huna said: From where in the Torah a hint to a yevama ? From where? Isn’t it written “Her brother-in-law will have intercourse with her” Rather, From where a hint that a yevama is forbidden in her husband’s lifetime,
llm_translation: And rather, "Niddah" as it is written regarding the wife of one's brother, why do I need it? According to Rav Huna. For Rav Huna said: A hint to Yibum from the Torah, from where, from where?! It is written: "Her Yavam shall come upon her"! Rather: A hint to Yibum that is prohibited during the lifetime of her husband, from where?

hebrew_text: הַאי סְבָרָא הִיא: מִדְּאָמַר רַחֲמָנָא לְאַחַר מִיתַת בַּעְלָהּ שָׁרְיָא, מִכְּלָל דִּבְחַיֵּי בַּעְלָהּ אֲסוּרָה!
human_translation: this is logical reasoning: From that the Merciful One says is permitted after her husband’s death it may be inferred that in her husband’s lifetime she is forbidden
