llm_translation: This opinion is: since the Merciful One said after the death of her husband she is permitted, it is inferred that during the lifetime of her husband she is forbidden!

hebrew_text: וְדִלְמָא: לְאַחַר מִיתַת בַּעְלָהּ מִצְוָה, בְּחַיֵּי בַּעְלָהּ רְשׁוּת? אִי נָמֵי: לְאַחַר מִיתַת בַּעְלָהּ אִין, בְּחַיֵּי בַּעְלָהּ לָא, וְלָאו הַבָּא מִכְּלַל עֲשֵׂה — עֲשֵׂה,
human_translation: Perhaps after her husband’s death a mitzva during her husband’s lifetime optional. Alternatively, after her husband’s death, yes, during her husband’s lifetime, no, and a prohibition that stems from a positive mitzva a positive mitzva,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And perhaps: after the death of her husband is it a mitzvah, during the life of her husband is it optional? If yes: after the death of her husband it is not, during the life of her husband it is not, and is it not that which comes from a positive commandment - it is a positive commandment.

hebrew_text: אָמַר קְרָא: ״וְאִישׁ אֲשֶׁר יִקַּח אֶת אֵשֶׁת אָחִיו נִדָּה הִיא״, וְכִי אֵשֶׁת אָחִיו נִדָּה הִיא? אֶלָּא כְּנִדָּה: מָה נִדָּה, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁיֵּשׁ לָהּ הֶיתֵּר לְאַחַר מִכָּאן — בִּשְׁעַת אִיסּוּרָהּ בְּכָרֵת, אַף אֵשֶׁת אָח [נָמֵי], אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁיֵּשׁ לָהּ הֶיתֵּר לְאַחַר מִכָּאן — בְּחַיֵּי בַּעְלָהּ בְּכָרֵת.
human_translation: the verse states: “And if a man shall take his brother’s wife, it is impurity [ nidda ]” Is his brother’s wife a menstruating woman [ nidda ]? Rather, like a menstruating woman Just as a menstruating woman, although she has a permitted afterward, at the time forbidden, to karet , so too, a brother’s wife, although she has a permitted afterward, during her husband’s lifetime by karet .
llm_translation: The verse says: "And a man who takes his brother's wife, it is impurity." Is his brother's wife impure? Rather, like impurity: Just as impurity, even though it has a permitted status for another after this, at the time of its prohibition it incurs karet, so too the wife of a brother, even though she has a permitted status for another after this, during her husband's lifetime it incurs karet.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: הַעֲרָאָה דִּכְתִיבָא גַּבֵּי אָחוֹת אָב וַאֲחוֹת אֵם, לְמָה לִּי?
human_translation: But why do I need a father’s sister and a mother’s sister?
llm_translation: Rather: the nakedness that is written regarding the sister of one's father and the sister of one's mother, what is it to me?

hebrew_text: לִכְדִבְעָא מִינֵּיהּ רָבִינָא מֵרָבָא: הַמְעָרֶה בִּזְכוּר מַהוּ? בִּזְכוּר — ״מִשְׁכְּבֵי אִשָּׁה״ כְּתִיבָא!
human_translation: for the dilemma that Ravina raised before Rava: one who performs the initial stage of intercourse with male, what is With regard to a male, it is written as with a woman”
llm_translation: Ravina from Rava's statement: One who conceals in Zechur, what is it? In Zechur - "lying with a woman" is written!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: הַמְעָרֶה בִּבְהֵמָה, מַהוּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִם אֵינוֹ עִנְיָן לְהַעֲרָאָה, דִּכְתִיבָא גַּבֵּי אֲחוֹת אָב וַאֲחוֹת אֵם, דְּאָתְיָא בְּהֶקֵּישָׁא מִדְּרַבִּי יוֹנָה, תְּנֵהוּ עִנְיָן לְהַעֲרָאָה דִבְהֵמָה.
human_translation: Rather, one performs the initial stage of intercourse with an animal, what is said to If does not to the matter of the initial stage of intercourse where it is written, a father’s sister and a mother’s sister, as is derived from a comparison based upon Rabbi Yona, refer it to the matter of the initial stage of intercourse an animal.
llm_translation: Rather: the cave in an animal, what? He said to him: if it is not relevant for plowing, as it is written regarding the sister of a father and the sister of a mother, which is derived from the juxtaposition of Rabbi Yonah, give it relevance for plowing in an animal.

hebrew_text: מִכְּדֵי בְּהֵמָה חַיָּיבֵי מִיתוֹת בֵּית דִּין הִיא, מַאי טַעְמָא כְּתִיב לְהַעֲרָאָה דִּידַהּ גַּבֵּי חַיָּיבֵי כָּרֵיתוֹת? לִכְתּוֹב גַּבֵּי מִיתַת בֵּית דִּין, וְנֵילַף מִיתַת בֵּית דִּין מִמִּיתַת בֵּית דִּין!
human_translation: Since an animal is liable to capital punishment from the court, what is the reason the initial stage of intercourse it is written with regard to liable to karet ? Let be written with regard to capital punishment from the court, and let us derive capital punishment from the court, from capital punishment from the court.
llm_translation: From the case of an animal, those liable to the death penalty are the court, what is the reason? It is written for comparison to its own liability of excisions? To write regarding the death penalty of the court, and derive the death penalty of the court from the death penalty of the court!

hebrew_text: אַיְּידֵי דְּכוּלֵּיהּ קְרָא לִדְרָשָׁא אָתֵי, כְּתִיב בֵּיהּ נָמֵי הָא מִילְּתָא לִדְרָשָׁא.
human_translation: Since the entire verse comes for an exposition, this matter, is also written for an exposition,
llm_translation: Through all of it, a verse comes for exposition, as it is written in it also the matter for exposition.

hebrew_text: מַאי דְּרָשָׁא? דְּתַנְיָא: ״עֶרְוַת אֲחוֹת אָבִיךָ לֹא תְגַלֵּה״, בֵּין מִן הָאָב, בֵּין מִן הָאֵם. אַתָּה אוֹמֵר בֵּין מִן הָאָב בֵּין מִן הָאֵם, אוֹ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא מִן הָאָב וְלֹא מִן הָאֵם —
human_translation: What is exposition As it is taught in a “You shall not uncover the nakedness of your father’s sister” whether from father, or from mother. Do you say whether from father or from mother, or it is only from father but not from mother?
llm_translation: What is the interpretation of the verse? As it was taught: "The nakedness of your father's sister you shall not uncover," whether from the father's side or from the mother's side. You say whether from the father's side or from the mother's side, or is it only from the father's side and not from the mother's side —

hebrew_text: וְדִין הוּא: חַיָּיב כָּאן וְחַיָּיב בַּאֲחוֹתוֹ, מָה אֲחוֹתוֹ — בֵּין מִן הָאָב בֵּין מִן הָאֵם, אַף כָּאן — בֵּין מִן הָאָב בֵּין מִן הָאֵם.
human_translation: It logically rendered him liable here and rendered him liable with his sister: Just as his sister whether from father or from mother, so too here, whether from father or from mother.
llm_translation: And the judgment is: obligated here and obligated in his sister, what is his sister - whether from the father or from the mother, so too here - whether from the father or from the mother.

hebrew_text: אוֹ כְּלָךְ לְדֶרֶךְ זוֹ: חַיָּיב כָּאן וְחַיָּיב בְּדוֹדָתוֹ, מָה דּוֹדָתוֹ — מִן הָאָב וְלֹא מִן הָאֵם, אַף כָּאן — מִן הָאָב וְלֹא מִן הָאֵם,
human_translation: Or go this way rendered him liable here and rendered him liable with his aunt, Just as his aunt, from father, and not from mother, so too here, from father, and not from mother,
llm_translation: Or like this: liable here and liable in his uncle, what is his uncle - from the father and not from the mother, so here - from the father and not from the mother.

hebrew_text: נִרְאֶה לְמִי דּוֹמֶה? דָּנִין אִיסּוּר הַבָּא מֵאֵלָיו מֵאִיסּוּר הַבָּא מֵאֵלָיו, וְאַל תּוֹכִיחַ דּוֹדָתוֹ, שֶׁאֵין אִיסּוּר הַבָּא מֵאֵלָיו.
human_translation: Let us see to which it is similar, We derive a prohibition that comes on its own, from a prohibition that comes on its own, and his aunt cannot prove as not a prohibition that comes on its own,
llm_translation: It appears to whom is it similar? We evaluate a prohibition that comes from itself from a prohibition that comes from itself, and do not prove his aunt, for a prohibition that comes from itself.

hebrew_text: אוֹ כְּלָךְ לְדֶרֶךְ זֶה: דָּנִין קְרוֹבֵי הָאָב מִקְּרוֹבֵי הָאָב, וְאַל תּוֹכִיחַ אֲחוֹתוֹ שֶׁקְּרוֹבֵי עַצְמוֹ —
human_translation: Or go this way we derive the relatives of father, from the the relatives of father, and his sister cannot prove as his own relative.
llm_translation: Or like this for the way: We judge the relatives of the father from the relatives of the father, and do not prove his sister to be related from his own relatives —

hebrew_text: תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״עֶרְוַת אֲחוֹת אָבִיךָ לֹא תְגַלֵּה״ — בֵּין מִן הָאָב בֵּין מִן הָאֵם. ״עֶרְוַת אֲחוֹת אִמְּךָ לֹא תְגַלֵּה״ — בֵּין מִן הָאָב בֵּין מִן הָאֵם.
human_translation: the verse states: “You shall not uncover the nakedness of your father’s sister,” whether from father or from mother. “You shall not uncover the nakedness of your mother’s sister” whether from father or from mother.
llm_translation: The Talmud teaches: "The nakedness of your father's sister you shall not uncover" - whether from the father's side or from the mother's side. "The nakedness of your mother's sister you shall not uncover" - whether from the father's side or from the mother's side.

hebrew_text: לְמָה לִי לְמִכְתַּב בַּאֲחוֹת אָב, לְמָה לִי לְמִכְתַּב בַּאֲחוֹת אֵם? אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: צְרִיכִי, דְּאִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא בַּאֲחוֹת אָב, שֶׁכֵּן יֵשׁ לָהּ חַיִיס, אֲבָל אֲחוֹת אֵם — אֵימָא לָא.
human_translation: Why do I to write with regard to a father’s sister, why do I to write with regard to a mother’s sister? Rabbi Abbahu said: are necessary. If the Merciful One had written with regard to father’s sister, as she has lineage However, mother’s sister say not
llm_translation: "Why do I need a document regarding the paternal sister, why do I need a document regarding the maternal sister?" Rabbi Avahu said: "I need it, for if the Merciful One wrote regarding the paternal sister, that she has a portion, but regarding the maternal sister - I might say no."

hebrew_text: וְאִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא בַּאֲחוֹת אֵם — שֶׁכֵּן וַדָּאִית, אֲבָל אֲחוֹת אָב — אֵימָא לָא, צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: And if the Merciful One had written with regard to mother’s sister, as she is certainly However, father’s sister, say no, necessary
llm_translation: "And if the Merciful One wrote 'in the sister of the mother' - so it is certain, but 'sister of the father' - I say no, it is necessary."

hebrew_text: וְדוֹדָתוֹ, דִּפְשִׁיטָא לֵיהּ לְתַנָּא דְּמִן הָאָב וְלֹא מִן הָאֵם, מְנָא לֵיהּ?
human_translation: And his aunt, where it is obvious to the tanna from father and not from mother, from where does he
llm_translation: His aunt, that it is obvious to the Mishna that she is from the father and not from the mother, how does he count her?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: אָתְיָא ״דּוֹדוֹ״ ״דּוֹדוֹ״. כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״עֶרְוַת דֹּדוֹ גִּלָּה״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״אוֹ דֹדוֹ אוֹ בֶן דֹּדוֹ יִגְאָלֶנּוּ״, מָה לְהַלָּן — מִן הָאָב וְלֹא מִן הָאֵם, אַף כָּאן — מִן הָאָב וְלֹא מִן הָאֵם.
human_translation: Rava said: derived “his uncle” “his uncle.” It is written here: “He has uncovered his uncle’s nakedness” and it is written there, “Either his uncle or his uncle’s son shall redeem him” Just as there, from the father and not from the mother, so too here, from father, and not from mother.
llm_translation: Rava said: It is written "dodo" "dodo." It is written here: "the nakedness of his uncle he has uncovered," and it is written there: "or his uncle or his cousin shall redeem him." Just as there — from the father and not from the mother, so too here — from the father and not from the mother.

hebrew_text: וְהָתָם מְנָלַן? אָמַר קְרָא: ״מִמִּשְׁפַּחְתּוֹ יִגְאָלֶנּוּ״, מִשְׁפַּחַת אָב קְרוּיָה מִשְׁפָּחָה, מִשְׁפַּחַת אֵם אֵינָהּ קְרוּיָה מִשְׁפָּחָה.
human_translation: And there, from where do we The verse states: of his family shall redeem him” the family of father is called family, the family of mother is not called family,
llm_translation: And there, how do we derive it? The verse says: "From his family he shall redeem him," the family of the father is called a family, the family of the mother is not called a family.

hebrew_text: וְהָדִתְנַן: אָמְרוּ לוֹ מֵתָה אִשְׁתְּךָ וְנָשָׂא אֲחוֹתָהּ מֵאָבִיהָ, מֵתָה וְנָשָׂא אֲחוֹתָהּ מֵאִמָּהּ, מֵתָה וְנָשָׂא אֲחוֹתָהּ מֵאָבִיהָ, מֵתָה וְנָשָׂא אֲחוֹתָהּ מֵאִמָּהּ —
human_translation: And that which we learned they said to him: Your wife is dead, and he married her sister from her father. died, and he married her sister from her mother, died, and he married her sister from her father, died, and he married her sister from her mother,
llm_translation: And we have learned in a Mishnah: If his wife died, and he married her sister from her father, she died, and he married her sister from her mother, she died, and he married her sister from her father, she died, and he married her sister from her mother—

hebrew_text: מוּתָּר בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה וּבַשְּׁלִישִׁית וּבַחֲמִישִׁית, וּפוֹטְרוֹת צָרוֹתֵיהֶן. וְאָסוּר בַּשְּׁנִיָּה וּבָרְבִיעִית, וְאֵין בִּיאַת אַחַת מֵהֶן פּוֹטֶרֶת צָרָתָהּ.
human_translation: permitted first, third, and fifth and exempt their rival wives prohibited second and fourth sexual intercourse one of them does not exempt her rival wife,
llm_translation: Permitted on the first, third, and fifth day, and their creditors are exempt. Prohibited on the second and fourth day, and the arrival of one of them does not exempt her creditor.

hebrew_text: וְאִם בָּא עַל הַשְּׁנִיָּה לְאַחַר מִיתַת הָרִאשׁוֹנָה, מוּתָּר בַּשְּׁנִיָּה וּבָרְבִיעִית, וּפוֹטְרוֹת צָרוֹתֵיהֶן, וְאָסוּר בַּשְּׁלִישִׁית וּבַחֲמִישִׁית.
human_translation: And if and he had intercourse with the second after the death of the first permitted the second and fourth and they exempt their rival wives and prohibited the third and fifth
llm_translation: If one had intercourse with the second wife after the death of the first wife, he is permitted with the second and fourth wives, and they are exempt from the obligation of halitzah, and he is forbidden with the third and fifth wives.

hebrew_text: אַלְמָא אֲחוֹת אִשְׁתּוֹ, בֵּין מִן הָאָב בֵּין מִן הָאֵם — אֲסוּרוֹת. מְנָלַן? יָלֵיף מֵאֲחוֹתוֹ. מָה אֲחוֹתוֹ — בֵּין מִן הָאָב בֵּין מִן הָאֵם, אַף כָּאן — בֵּין מִן הָאָב בֵּין מִן הָאֵם.
human_translation: Apparently, his wife’s sister, whether from the father, or from the mother, is forbidden. From where do we It is derived from his sister. Just as his sister whether from father or from mother, so too here, whether from the father or from the mother.
llm_translation: The sister of his wife, whether from the father or from the mother — are forbidden. From where do we derive this? It is derived from his sister. Just as his sister, whether from the father or from the mother, is forbidden, so too here — whether from the father or from the mother.

hebrew_text: וְלֵילַף מִדּוֹדָתוֹ: מָה דּוֹדָתוֹ מִן הָאָב וְלֹא מִן הָאֵם, אַף כָּאן מִן הָאָב וְלֹא מִן הָאֵם! מִסְתַּבְּרָא מֵאֲחוֹתוֹ הֲוָה לֵיהּ לְמֵילַף, שֶׁכֵּן קְרוֹבֵי עַצְמוֹ מִקְּרוֹבֵי עַצְמוֹ.
human_translation: And let it be derived from his aunt: Just as his aunt from father but not from mother, so too here, from father but not from mother. It is reasonable he should derive from his sister, as one’s own relatives from his own relatives,
llm_translation: And Leilaf from his uncle: Just as his uncle is from the father and not from the mother, so too here, from the father and not from the mother! It makes sense that he would be called Leilaf from his sister, for his close relatives from his father's side are closer than his close relatives from his mother's side.

hebrew_text: אַדְּרַבָּה מִדּוֹדָתוֹ הֲוָה לֵיהּ לְמֵילַף, שֶׁכֵּן דָּבָר עַל יְדֵי קִדּוּשִׁין מִדָּבָר שֶׁעַל יְדֵי קִדּוּשִׁין. אֶלָּא מֵאֵשֶׁת אָח יָלְפִינַן, דְּשֶׁכֵּן דָּבָר עַל יְדֵי קִדּוּשִׁין, וּקְרוֹבֵי עַצְמוֹ.
human_translation: On the contrary, he should derive from his aunt, as a matter through betrothal from matter through betrothal. Rather, is derived from a brother’s wife, as something by means of betrothal and his own relatives.
llm_translation: Rabba from his aunt had a tradition, for so it is stated regarding matters of sanctity from a matter that is through sanctity. Rather, we learn from the wife of a brother, for so it is stated regarding matters of sanctity, and close relatives.

hebrew_text: וְאֵשֶׁת אָח גּוּפַהּ מְנָא לַן? דְּתַנְיָא: ״עֶרְוַת אֵשֶׁת אָחִיךָ לֹא תְגַלֵּה״, בֵּין מִן הָאָב בֵּין מִן הָאֵם.
human_translation: And a brother’s wife itself, from where do we As it is taught in a “You shall not uncover the nakedness of your brother’s wife” Whether from the father or from the mother.
llm_translation: "And the wife of one's brother, how do we establish her status? For it was taught: 'The nakedness of your brother's wife you shall not uncover,' whether from the father's side or from the mother's side."

hebrew_text: אַתָּה אוֹמֵר בֵּין מִן הָאָב בֵּין מִן הָאֵם, אוֹ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא מִן הָאָב וְלֹא מִן הָאֵם? וְדִין הוּא: חַיָּיב כָּאן, וְחַיָּיב בַּאֲחוֹתוֹ. מָה אֲחוֹתוֹ — בֵּין מִן הָאָב בֵּין מִן הָאֵם, אַף כָּאן — בֵּין מִן הָאָב בֵּין מִן הָאֵם.
human_translation: Do you say whether from father or from mother, Or it is only from father and not from mother? It logically rendered him liable here and rendered him liable with his sister: Just as his sister whether from father or from mother, so too here, whether from father or from mother.
llm_translation: You say, whether from the father or from the mother, or is it only from the father and not from the mother? And the judgment is: liable here, and liable to his sister. What is his sister - whether from the father or from the mother, so too here - whether from the father or from the mother.

hebrew_text: אוֹ כְּלָךְ לְדֶרֶךְ זוֹ: חַיָּיב כָּאן וְחַיָּיב בְּדוֹדָתוֹ, מָה דּוֹדָתוֹ — מִן הָאָב וְלֹא מִן הָאֵם, אַף כָּאן — מִן הָאָב וְלֹא מִן הָאֵם?!
human_translation: Or go this way rendered him liable here and rendered him liable with his aunt, Just as his aunt, from father and not from mother, so too here, from father and not from mother.
llm_translation: Or like this for the way: obligated here and obligated in his uncle, what is his uncle - from the father and not from the mother, so too here - from the father and not from the mother?!

hebrew_text: נִרְאֶה לְמִי דּוֹמֶה: דָּנִין קְרוֹבֵי עַצְמוֹ מִקְּרוֹבֵי עַצְמוֹ, וְאַל תּוֹכִיחַ דּוֹדָתוֹ שֶׁקְּרוֹבֵי הָאָב. אוֹ כְּלָךְ לְדֶרֶךְ זוֹ: דָּנִין דָּבָר שֶׁעַל יְדֵי קִדּוּשִׁין, מִדָּבָר שֶׁעַל יְדֵי קִדּוּשִׁין, וְאַל תּוֹכִיחַ אֲחוֹתוֹ, שֶׁאִיסּוּר הַבָּא מֵאֵלָיו.
human_translation: Let us see to which it is similar. We derive his own relatives, from his own relatives, and his aunt cannot prove as father’s relative. Or go this way: We derive matter through betrothal, from matter through betrothal, and his sister cannot prove as a prohibition that comes on its own.
llm_translation: It appears to whom is it similar: one judges relatives of his own, from relatives of his own, and do not prove his aunt that relatives of the father. Or go this way: one judges a matter that is through sanctifications, from a matter that is through sanctifications, and do not prove his sister, for the prohibition comes from him.

hebrew_text: תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״עֶרְוַת אָחִיךָ הִיא״, בֵּין מִן הָאָב בֵּין מִן הָאֵם.
human_translation: the verse states “It is your brother’s nakedness” whether from father or from mother.
llm_translation: The Talmud teaches: "The nakedness of your brother, it is," whether from the father or from the mother.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי בְּאֵשֶׁת אָח מִן הָאָב, חֲדָא דְּיֵשׁ לָהּ בָּנִים בְּחַיֵּי בַּעְלָהּ, וַחֲדָא דְּאֵין לָהּ בָּנִים בְּחַיֵּי בַּעְלָהּ! אֵין לָהּ בָּנִים בְּחַיֵּי בַּעְלָהּ מִדְּרַב הוּנָא נָפְקָא.
human_translation: Say this and that to the wife of a brother from the father, one who has children, during her husband’s lifetime and one who does not have children, during her husband’s lifetime, does not have children her husband’s lifetime is derived from Rav Huna
llm_translation: And why not? In the case where both of them, the co-wives, are the wives of one's brother from the father's side, one of them has children during the lifetime of her husband, and one of them does not have children during the lifetime of her husband! She does not have children during the lifetime of her husband, as Rav Huna derived.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי בְּאֵשֶׁת אָח מִן הָאָב, חֲדָא דְּיֵשׁ לָהּ בָּנִים בְּחַיֵּי בַּעְלָהּ, וַחֲדָא דְּיֵשׁ לָהּ בָּנִים לְאַחַר מִיתַת בַּעְלָהּ!
human_translation: Say this and that to the wife of a brother from the father, one who has children her husband’s lifetime, and one who has children after her husband’s death.
llm_translation: And why not say that both of them, in the case of a brother's wife from the father, one who has children during the lifetime of her husband, and one who has children after the death of her husband!

hebrew_text: יֵשׁ לָהּ בָּנִים לְאַחַר מִיתַת בַּעְלָהּ לָא צְרִיכָא קְרָא, מִדְּאָמַר רַחֲמָנָא שֶׁאֵין לָהּ בָּנִים מוּתֶּרֶת, הָא יֵשׁ לָהּ בָּנִים אֲסוּרָה.
human_translation: who has children after her husband’s death does not require a verse. From that the Merciful One says that who has no children is permitted that she has children, prohibited
llm_translation: She has children after the death of her husband, not necessary a verse, since it says the Merciful One that she has no children is permitted, but she has children is forbidden.

hebrew_text: וְדִלְמָא: אֵין לָהּ בָּנִים אֲסוּרָה לְעָלְמָא וְשַׁרְיָא לְיָבָם, יֵשׁ לָהּ בָּנִים שַׁרְיָא לְעָלְמָא וְשַׁרְיָא לְיָבָם! אִי נָמֵי: אֵין לָהּ בָּנִים מִצְוָה, יֵשׁ לָהּ בָּנִים רְשׁוּת!
human_translation: But perhaps she does not have children prohibited everyone and permitted yavam , she does have children is permitted everyone and is permitted yavam Alternatively, if she does not have children a mitzva she does have children optional.
llm_translation: And perhaps: if she has no children, she is forbidden to the world, but permitted to the levir; if she has children, she is permitted to the world and permitted to the levir! Or rather: if she has no children, it is a mitzvah for her; if she has children, it is optional for her!

hebrew_text: אִי נָמֵי: אֵין לָהּ בָּנִים — אִין, יֵשׁ לָהּ בָּנִים — לָא, וְלָאו הַבָּא מִכְּלַל עֲשֵׂה — עֲשֵׂה!
human_translation: Alternatively, she does not have children, yes, she does have children, no, and a prohibition that stems from a positive mitzva a positive mitzva,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Ei namei: ein lah banim - ein, yesh lah banim - la, velo havah miklal aseh - aseh!" English translation: "If she has no children - no, if she has children - no, and if the negative is derived from an inclusive positive - positive!"

hebrew_text: כְּתַב קְרָא אַחֲרִינָא: ״עֶרְוַת אָחִיו גִּלָּה״.
human_translation: wrote a different verse “He has uncovered his brother’s nakedness;
llm_translation: Text of the Talmud: "Ketav kra acharina: 'ervat achiv gilah'." English translation: "Scripture writes elsewhere: 'The nakedness of his brother he uncovered.'"

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא אֵשֶׁת אָח מִן הָאֵם — כְּאֵשֶׁת אָח מִן הָאָב: מָה אֵשֶׁת אָח מִן הָאָב — לְאַחַר מִיתַת בַּעְלָהּ שַׁרְיָא, אַף אֵשֶׁת אָח מִן הָאֵם — לְאַחַר מִיתַת בַּעְלָהּ שַׁרְיָא! אָמַר קְרָא ״הִיא״, בַּהֲוָיָיתָהּ תְּהֵא.
human_translation: Say the wife of a brother from mother like the wife of a brother from father: Just as the wife of a brother from father is permitted, after her husband’s death, so too, the wife of a brother from mother should be permitted after her husband’s death. The verse states: “She she shall as she is
llm_translation: And why not the wife of a brother from the mother — like the wife of a brother from the father: Just as the wife of a brother from the father — after the death of her husband she is permitted, so too the wife of a brother from the mother — after the death of her husband she is permitted! The verse says "she," she shall be in her existence.

hebrew_text: אֲחוֹתוֹ דִּכְתַב בָּהּ כָּרֵת לְמָה לִי?
human_translation: Why do I need written with regard to one’s sister karet ?
llm_translation: His sister, who wrote in it, "Karet, why do I need it?"

hebrew_text: לְכִדְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן שֶׁאִם עֲשָׂאָן כּוּלָּם בְּהֶעְלֵם אַחַת — חַיָּיב עַל כׇּל אַחַת וְאַחַת.
human_translation: for that Rabbi Yoḥanan as Rabbi Yoḥanan said that if he performed all of them, in a single lapse of awareness, he is liable for each and every one.
llm_translation: According to Rabbi Yochanan: For Rabbi Yochanan said that if one performs all of them in one concealment - he is liable for each and every one.

hebrew_text: וּלְרַבִּי יִצְחָק דְּאָמַר: כׇּל חַיָּיבֵי כָּרֵיתוֹת בַּכְּלָל הָיוּ, וְלָמָּה יָצְתָה כָּרֵת בַּאֲחוֹתוֹ — לְדוּנוֹ בְּכָרֵת וְלֹא בְּמַלְקוֹת. לְחַלֵּק, מְנָלַן?
human_translation: And according to Rabbi Yitzḥak, who said all liable to karet were included why was karet with regard to one’s sister singled out? to sentence him to karet and not to flogging. from where do we to divide
llm_translation: To Rabbi Yitzchak who said: All those liable to karet were included, and why was karet specified in regard to his sister - to judge regarding karet and not regarding lashes. To divide, from where?

hebrew_text: נָפְקָא לֵיהּ מִ״וְּאֶל אִשָּׁה בְּנִדַּת טוּמְאָתָהּ״, לְחַיֵּיב עַל כׇּל אִשָּׁה וְאִשָּׁה.
human_translation: He derives it from “And a woman as long as she is impure by her uncleanness” to render liable for each and every woman.
llm_translation: He went out from there "and to a woman in her menstrual impurity," to obligate upon every woman and woman.

hebrew_text: דּוֹדָתוֹ דִּכְתַב בַּהּ רַחֲמָנָא ״עֲרִירִים יִהְיוּ״, לְמָה לִי? לְכִדְרַבָּה. דְּרַבָּה רָמֵי, כְּתִיב: ״עֲרִירִים יִהְיוּ״, וּכְתִיב: ״עֲרִירִים יָמֻתוּ״, הָא כֵּיצַד? יֵשׁ לוֹ בָּנִים — קוֹבְרָן, אֵין לוֹ בָּנִים — הוֹלֵךְ עֲרִירִי.
human_translation: Why do I need the Merciful One writes with regard to one’s aunt, They shall be childless? for that Rabba as Rabba raised a contradiction: It is written “They shall be childless” and it states “They shall die childless” How so? he has children, he will bury them; he does not have children, he will go childless.
llm_translation: His aunt who wrote in it, the Merciful One wrote "they shall be childless," why do I need it? According to Rabbah. Rabbah raises a contradiction, it is written: "they shall be childless," and it is written: "they shall die childless," how so? If he has children — he buries them, if he has no children — he goes childless.

hebrew_text: וְאִיצְטְרִיךְ לְמִכְתַּב ״עֲרִירִים יִהְיוּ״, וְאִיצְטְרִיךְ לְמִכְתַּב ״עֲרִירִים יָמֻתוּ״, דְּאִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״עֲרִירִים יִהְיוּ״, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: עַד חִטְאֵיהּ, אֲבָל מֵחִטְאֵיהּ וְאֵילָךְ — לָא. כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״עֲרִירִים יָמֻתוּ״, וְאִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״עֲרִירִים יָמֻתוּ״, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: מֵחִטְאֵיהּ וְאֵילָךְ, אֲבָל מֵעִיקָּרָא — לָא, צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: And it is necessary to state: They shall be childless, and it is necessary to state: They shall die childless. As, if the Merciful One had written They shall be childless, I would have said before his sin but from his sin and on, no, The Torah states: They shall die childless, And if the Merciful One had written They shall die childless, I would have said from his sin and on, but from the beginning, no, necessary
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it was necessary to write "they shall be childless," and it was necessary to write "they shall die childless," for if the Merciful One had written "they shall be childless," I would have said: until their sins, but from their sins and onward — no. If the Merciful One had written "they shall die childless," and if the Merciful One had written "they shall die childless," I would have said: from their sins and onward, but from the outset — no, it is necessary.

hebrew_text: הַעֲרָאָה דְּחַיָּיבֵי לָאוִין, מְנָלַן?
human_translation: From where do we the initial stage of intercourse with regard to those liable for prohibitions?
llm_translation: The seeing of those who are obligated in negative commandments, from where?

hebrew_text: מִדְּגַלִּי רַחֲמָנָא ״שִׁכְבַת זֶרַע״ גַּבֵּי שִׁפְחָה חֲרוּפָה. מִכְּלָל דְּחַיָּיבֵי לָאוִין — בְּהַעֲרָאָה.
human_translation: From the Merciful One reveals with regard to a designated maidservant cohabitation with seed, by inference, those liable for prohibitions through the initial stage of intercourse.
llm_translation: From the flag of mercy, "Shikvat Zera" regarding a disgraced maidservant. From the category of those not liable - by way of a hint.

hebrew_text: אַדְּרַבָּה: מִדְּגַלִּי רַחֲמָנָא הַעֲרָאָה בְּחַיָּיבֵי כָּרֵיתוֹת, מִכְּלָל דְּחַיָּיבֵי לָאוִין בִּגְמַר בִּיאָה! אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: אִם כֵּן — לִשְׁתּוֹק קְרָא מִשִּׁפְחָה חֲרוּפָה.
human_translation: On the contrary, from that the Merciful One reveals the initial stage of intercourse with regard to liable to karet , by inference, those liable for prohibitions through the completion of sexual intercourse Rav Ashi said: If so, let the verse remain silent designated maidservant,
llm_translation: The Great Rabba said: Since the Merciful One has shown mercy to those liable for karet, it is inferred that those liable for lavin are not included in the completion of intercourse! Rav Ashe said: If so - let the disgraced family member remain silent.

hebrew_text: הַעֲרָאָה דְּחַיָּיבֵי לָאוִין דִּכְהוּנָּה מְנָלַן? אָתְיָא ״קִיחָה״ ״קִיחָה״.
human_translation: From where do we the initial stage of intercourse with regard to those liable for prohibitions the priesthood? is derived taking taking.
llm_translation: The matter of those liable for negative commandments related to the priesthood, from where is it derived? It is derived from "Kihah, Kihah."

hebrew_text: דְּחַיָּיבֵי עֲשֵׂה מְנָלַן?
human_translation: From where do we those liable a positive mitzva,
llm_translation: The obligated ones of positive commandments, from where do we derive them?

hebrew_text: אָתְיָא ״בִּיאָה״ ״בִּיאָה״.
human_translation: It is derived entering entering.
llm_translation: The text reads: "Atya 'bi'ah' 'bi'ah'."

hebrew_text: יְבָמָה לַשּׁוּק, מְנָלַן? אִי לְמַאן דְּאָמַר לָאו — לָאו, אִי לְמַאן דְּאָמַר עֲשֵׂה — עֲשֵׂה.
human_translation: From where do we yevama the general public? If according to the one who said prohibition, a prohibition If according to the one who said a positive mitzva, a positive mitzva
llm_translation: Yevamah to the market, where are they? If according to the one who says "no" - no, if according to the one who says "do" - do.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: יְבָמָה לְיָבָם מְנָלַן? אָתְיָא ״בִּיאָה״ ״בִּיאָה״.
human_translation: Rather, From where do we yevama yavam It is derived words entering entering.
llm_translation: Rather: a yevamah for a yavam from where? It was stated: "Bi'ah, bi'ah."

hebrew_text: אִשָּׁה לְבַעְלָהּ מְנָלַן? אָתְיָא ״קִיחָה״ ״קִיחָה״.
human_translation: From where do we a woman to her husband It is derived taking taking.
llm_translation: A woman to her husband, from where? It was taught: "Take her, take her."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: לְמָה לִי דִּכְתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״שִׁכְבַת זֶרַע״ בְּשִׁפְחָה חֲרוּפָה, ״שִׁכְבַת זֶרַע״ בְּאֵשֶׁת אִישׁ, ״שִׁכְבַת זֶרַע״ בְּסוֹטָה?
human_translation: Rava said: why do I “cohabitation with seed” that the Merciful One writes with regard to a designated maidservant; “cohabitation with seed” with regard to a married woman; “cohabitation with seed” a sota ?
llm_translation: Rava said: Why did the Merciful One write "the lying of seed" regarding a desolate maidservant, "the lying of seed" regarding a married woman, and "the lying of seed" regarding a sotah?

hebrew_text: דְּשִׁפְחָה חֲרוּפָה — כְּדַאֲמַרַן. דְּאֵשֶׁת אִישׁ פְּרָט לִמְשַׁמֵּשׁ מֵת.
human_translation: a designated maidservant as we said a married woman, excludes one who has intercourse dead
llm_translation: A maidservant who is freed - as we said: the wife of a man is exempt from performing the duty of the deceased.

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר מְשַׁמֵּשׁ מֵת בַּעֲרָיוֹת פָּטוּר, אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר חַיָּיב, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? אֶלָּא: פְּרָט לִמְשַׁמֵּשׁ מֵתָה. דְּסָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא [הוֹאִיל] לְאַחַר מִיתָה נָמֵי אִיקְּרַי ״שְׁאֵרוֹ״, אֵימָא לִיחַיַּיב עֲלַהּ בְּאֵשֶׁת אִישׁ, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: This well according to the one who said has intercourse dead those with whom relations are forbidden, is exempt, However, according to the one who said he is liable, what is there to say? Rather, excludes one who has intercourse with a dead As enter your mind to say: Since after death is also called kin, say that should be liable with a married woman. teaches us
llm_translation: The one who says one who has relations with a dead person is exempt, to whom is this statement attributed? Rather, the one who says he is liable, what can be said? Rather: excluding one who has relations with a dead woman. Since your mind is made up, I would say, since even after death she is called "his flesh," let him be liable for having relations with a married woman, this is what we hear.

hebrew_text: דְּסוֹטָה לְמָה לִי? לְכִדְתַנְיָא: ״שִׁכְבַת זָרַע״, פְּרָט לְדָבָר אַחֵר. מַאי ״דָּבָר אַחֵר״? אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: פְּרָט לְשֶׁקִּינֵּא לָהּ שֶׁלֹּא כְּדַרְכָּהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא: ״מִשְׁכְּבֵי אִשָּׁה״ כְּתִיב!
human_translation: Why do I need a sota ? for that which is taught a cohabitation with seed excludes something else. What is something else? Rav Sheshet said: It excludes where was jealous with regard to her atypical, Rava said to him: It is written: “The cohabitations of a woman”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Why do I need the case of a Sotah? As it was taught: 'The lying with seed,' excluding something else. What is 'something else'? Rav Sheshet said: Excluding the way that is not her way. Rava said to him: 'The lying with a woman' is written!"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: פְּרָט לְשֶׁקִּינֵּא לָהּ דֶּרֶךְ אֵבָרִים. אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: פְּרִיצוּתָא אֲסַר רַחֲמָנָא?
human_translation: Rather, Rava said: excludes where was jealous with regard to her by way of limbs. Abaye said to him: the Merciful One prohibit licentious
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said: This is to exclude the case where she is acquired through limbs. Abaye said to him: Does the Merciful One prohibit promiscuity?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: פְּרָט לְשֶׁקִּינֵּא לָהּ בִּנְשִׁיקָה. הָנִיחָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר הַעֲרָאָה זוֹ הַכְנָסַת עֲטָרָה. אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר זוֹ נְשִׁיקָה, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר?
human_translation: Rather, Abaye said: It excludes where was jealous with regard to her kiss, This well according to the one who said the initial stage of intercourse is the insertion of the corona; However, according to the one who said kiss, what is there to say?
llm_translation: Rather, Abaye said: Specify that it refers to her with a kiss. It is preferable according to the one who said that "this is the act of betrothal." But according to the one who said that it is a kiss, what can be said?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, לְעוֹלָם לְשֶׁקִּינֵּא לָהּ דֶּרֶךְ אֵבָרִים, וְאִיצְטְרִיךְ, סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: בִּקְפֵידָא דְבַעַל תְּלָה רַחֲמָנָא, וְהָא קָא קָפֵיד, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: Rather, actually where was jealous with regard to her by way of limbs. And it is necessary it might enter your mind to say that the Merciful One made dependent on the husband’s objection, and he objects teaches us
llm_translation: Rather, forever to that she should be acquired through the way of limbs, and it is necessary, as your mind has thought: in the strictness of the Master of Mercy, and this is what He is strict, He listens to us.

hebrew_text: אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הַעֲרָאָה זוֹ נְשִׁיקָה. מָשָׁל לְאָדָם שֶׁמַּנִּיחַ אֶצְבָּעוֹ עַל פִּיו, אִי אֶפְשָׁר שֶׁלֹּא יִדְחוֹק הַבָּשָׂר.
human_translation: Shmuel said: the initial stage of intercourse is a kiss, comparable to a person who places his finger on his mouth; impossible that he not press the flesh
llm_translation: Said Samuel: "Ha'ara'ah" is a kiss. A parable to a person who places his finger on his mouth, it is impossible that the flesh will not be pressed.

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: גְּמַר בִּיאָה בְּשִׁפְחָה חֲרוּפָה זוֹ הַכְנָסַת עֲטָרָה. מֵתִיב רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: ״שִׁכְבַת זֶרַע״, אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב אֶלָּא עַל בִּיאַת הַמֵּירוּק. מַאי לָאו — מֵירוּק גִּיד?! לָא, מֵירוּק עֲטָרָה.
human_translation: When Rabba bar bar Ḥana came he said Rabbi Yoḥanan The completion of intercourse with regard to a designated maidservant is the insertion of the corona, Rav Sheshet raised an objection cohabitation with seed one is liable only for a complete sexual intercourse. What, does not complete member? No, complete corona.
llm_translation: When Rabba bar bar Ḥana came, Rabbi Yoḥanan said: The completion of intercourse with a disgraced maidservant is the bringing of a crown. Rav Sheishet raises an objection: "The emission of seed" is only liable for the act of intercourse with the meiruk. What is the reason? Is it not the meiruk's sinew? No, it is the meiruk's crown.

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא רַב דִּימִי, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן הַעֲרָאָה זוֹ הַכְנָסַת עֲטָרָה. אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: וְהָא רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה לָא אָמַר הָכִי! אֲמַר לְהוּ: אוֹ אִיהוּ שַׁקְרַאי אוֹ אֲנָא שַׁקְרַי.
human_translation: When Rav Dimi came he said Rabbi Yoḥanan the initial stage of intercourse is the insertion of the corona. They said to him: But Rabba bar bar Ḥana did not say so, He said to them: Either he lied or I am lying.
llm_translation: When Rav Dimi came, Rabbi Yochanan said: "Ha'ara'ah" is the bringing in of the crown. They said to him: But didn't Rabbah bar bar Chanah say differently? He said to them: Either he is a liar, or I am a liar.

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא רָבִין, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הַעֲרָאָה זוֹ הַכְנָסַת עֲטָרָה. אַדְּרַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה וַדַּאי פְּלִיג. אַדִּשְׁמוּאֵל מִי לֵימָא פְּלִיג?
human_translation: When Ravin came he said Rabbi Yoḥanan the initial stage of intercourse is the insertion of the corona. certainly disagrees with Rabba bar bar Ḥana, Shall we say that he disagrees with Shmuel,
llm_translation: When Rabbin came, Rabbi Yochanan said: This "ha'ara'ah" is the bringing in of the crown. Adrabba bar bar Ḥana and certainly disagree. Adishmuel, who should we say disagrees?

hebrew_text: לֹא, מִנְּשִׁיקָה וְעַד הַכְנָסַת עֲטָרָה — הַעֲרָאָה קָרֵי לַהּ.
human_translation: No; calls from a kiss until the insertion of the corona the initial stage of intercourse,
llm_translation: Not, from a kiss until the placing of the crown - the bedchamber is called for it.

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא רַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר יְהוּדָה, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הַעֲרָאָה זוֹ הַכְנָסַת עֲטָרָה, גְּמַר בִּיאָה — גְּמַר בִּיאָה מַמָּשׁ.
human_translation: When Rav Shmuel bar Yehuda came Rabbi Yoḥanan said: the initial stage of intercourse is the insertion of the corona, a complete sexual intercourse is literally a complete sexual intercourse,
llm_translation: When Rav Shmuel, son of Yehuda, came, Rabbi Yochanan said: This "seeing" is the insertion of the crown, completing the act of intercourse — completing the act of intercourse literally.

hebrew_text: מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ — אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא נְשִׁיקָה, וּפָטוּר עָלֶיהָ. וּפְלִיג אַדִּשְׁמוּאֵל.
human_translation: From this forward, is only a kiss, for which he is exempt. And disagrees with Shmuel,
llm_translation: From here and onwards - it is only a kiss, and one is exempt for it. And Adishmuel disagrees.

hebrew_text: אֶחָד הַמְעָרֶה וְאֶחָד הַגּוֹמֵר — קָנָה. מַאי קָנָה? רַב אָמַר: קָנָה לַכֹּל, וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: לֹא קָנָה אֶלָּא לִדְבָרִים הָאֲמוּרִים בַּפָּרָשָׁה: לִירַשׁ בְּנִכְסֵי אֶחָיו, וּלְפוֹטְרָהּ מִן הַיִּיבּוּם.
human_translation: both one who engages in the initial stage of intercourse and one who completes have acquired What acquired Rav said: acquired for everything. And Shmuel said he has only acquired her with regard to the matters stated in the chapter to inherit his brother’s property and to exempt her from levirate marriage
llm_translation: One who caves and one who completes - acquires. What is "acquires"? Rav said: acquires everything, and Shmuel said: acquires only for matters stated in the portion: to inherit his brother's property, and to exempt her from levirate marriage.

hebrew_text: מִן הַנִּשּׂוּאִין — לְדִבְרֵי הַכֹּל אָכְלָה, דְּהָא הֲוָת קָאָכְלָה מֵעִיקָּרָא. כִּי פְּלִיגִי מִן הָאֵירוּסִין. רַב אָמַר: אוֹכֶלֶת, דְּהָא רַבִּי רַחֲמָנָא בִּיאַת שׁוֹגֵג כְּמֵזִיד.
human_translation: from marriage, everyone agrees partake as she was partaking at the outset, When they disagree is from betrothal. Rav said: may partake, as the Merciful One includes unwitting intercourse like intentional
llm_translation: From the elevated ones — according to everyone she ate, for she had indeed eaten initially. Because they are arguing about the lentils. Rav said: she is eating, for Rabbi Rachamana comes for accidental entry like intentional.

hebrew_text: וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: כִּי רַבִּי רַחֲמָנָא, לְאוֹקְמֵיהּ בִּמְקוֹם בַּעַל, לְאַלּוֹמֵי מִבַּעַל — לָא.
human_translation: And Shmuel said: When the Merciful One includes to establish in place of husband, to strengthen than husband, no.
llm_translation: Samuel said: For Rabbi Rachamana, to establish it in the place of Baal, to elevate it from Baal - no.

hebrew_text: וְאַזְדָּא שְׁמוּאֵל לְטַעְמֵיהּ, דְּאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: כֹּל שֶׁהַבַּעַל מַאֲכִיל — יָבָם מַאֲכִיל, וְכֹל שֶׁאֵין הַבַּעַל מַאֲכִיל — יָבָם אֵינוֹ מַאֲכִיל.
human_translation: And Shmuel follows his reasoning, Rav Naḥman said Shmuel said: any where the husband entitles to partake yavam entitles to partake and any where husband does not entitle to partake yavam does not entitle to partake
llm_translation: And it was established according to the opinion of Shmuel, for Rav Nachman said in the name of Shmuel: "Whoever the husband feeds, the yavam feeds, and whoever the husband does not feed, the yavam does not feed."

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל פִּקַּחַת שֶׁנִּתְאָרְסָה לְכֹהֵן פִּקֵּחַ, וְלֹא הִסְפִּיק לְכוֹנְסָהּ עַד שֶׁנִּתְחָרֵשׁ — אֵינָהּ אוֹכֶלֶת. מֵת, וְנָפְלָה לִפְנֵי יָבָם חֵרֵשׁ — אוֹכֶלֶת, וּבָזוֹ יָפֶה כֹּחַ הַיָּבָם מִכֹּחַ הַבַּעַל.
human_translation: raises an objection a competent daughter of an Israelite who was betrothed to a competent priest, and he did not have a chance to marry her before he became a deaf-mute she may not partake died and happened before a deaf-mute yavam she partake And in this the strength of the yavam is greater than the strength of the husband.
llm_translation: The Tanna raises an objection: If a daughter of Israel was engaged to a priest, and he did not manage to consummate the marriage before he became deaf - she may not eat terumah. If he dies, and she falls to his brother who is deaf - she may eat, and the brother's power is superior to that of the husband.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַב נִיחָא — אֶלָּא לִשְׁמוּאֵל קַשְׁיָא!
human_translation: Granted, according Rav, works out well, However, according to Shmuel, difficult,
llm_translation: In peace to Rav Nihah - rather to Shmuel Kashya!

hebrew_text: אָמַר לְךָ שְׁמוּאֵל, אֵימָא הָכִי: וְלֹא הִסְפִּיק לְכוֹנְסָהּ עַד שֶׁנִּתְחָרֵשׁ — אֵינָהּ אוֹכֶלֶת בִּתְרוּמָה, כָּנַס וְאַחַר כָּךְ נִתְחָרֵשׁ — אוֹכֶלֶת. מֵת וְנָפְלָה לִפְנֵי יָבָם חֵרֵשׁ — אוֹכֶלֶת.
human_translation: Shmuel said to you: say as follows: he did not have a chance to marry her before he became a deaf-mute, she may not partake of teruma . he married her and afterward became a deaf-mute, she partake died, and happened before a deaf-mute yavam she partake
llm_translation: He said to you, Samuel, thus: "And if she did not have the opportunity to be betrothed until she became infertile - she does not eat from the terumah. If she was betrothed and then became infertile - she eats. If she died and fell before her brother-in-law, while she was infertile - she eats."

hebrew_text: וּמַאי ״בָּזוֹ״? דְּאִילּוּ בַּעַל חֵרֵשׁ מֵעִיקָּרָא — לֹא אוֹכֶלֶת. וְאִילּוּ יָבָם חֵרֵשׁ מֵעִיקָּרָא — אָכְלָה.
human_translation: And what In this that if husband deaf-mute from the outset, she would not partake whereas if the yavam deaf-mute from the outset partake
llm_translation: "What is 'bazo'? For if a deaf-mute from the outset — she does not eat. But if a yavam is a deaf-mute from the outset — she does eat."

hebrew_text: וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: מִן הָאֵירוּסִין — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל לָא אָכְלָה, דְּהָא לָא אָכְלָה בְּחַיֵּי בַעַל.
human_translation: And some say from betrothal, everyone agrees not partake as she did not partake in her husband’s lifetime.
llm_translation: And there are those who say: From the betrothal feast - everyone agrees she did not eat, for she did not eat while still in her father's house.

hebrew_text: כִּי פְּלִיגִי מִן הַנִּשּׂוּאִין. רַב אָמַר: אוֹכֶלֶת, דְּהָא הֲוָת אָכְלָה מֵעִיקָּרָא, וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: אֵינָהּ אוֹכֶלֶת, כִּי רַבִּי רַחֲמָנָא בִּיאַת שׁוֹגֵג כְּמֵזִיד — לִדְבָרִים הָאֲמוּרִים בַּפָּרָשָׁה, אֲבָל לְכֹל מִילֵּי — לָא.
human_translation: When they disagree, from marriage. Rav says: She partake as she was partake initially, And Shmuel says may not partake when the Merciful One includes unwitting intercourse like intentional the matters stated in the chapter but for every issue, no.
llm_translation: When they disputed concerning those who are exempt. Rav said: She is permitted, for she had eaten initially, and Shmuel said: She is not permitted, for Rabbi Rachmana holds that unintentional intercourse is like intentional — for matters mentioned in the verse, but for all other matters — no.

hebrew_text: וְהָאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: כֹּל שֶׁהַבַּעַל מַאֲכִיל — יָבָם מַאֲכִיל! אֵימָא: כׇּל בִּיאָה שֶׁהַבַּעַל מַאֲכִיל בָּהּ — יָבָם מַאֲכִיל בָּהּ, וְכׇל בִּיאָה שֶׁאֵין הַבַּעַל מַאֲכִיל בָּהּ — אֵין הַיָּבָם מַאֲכִיל בָּהּ.
human_translation: Didn’t Rav Naḥman say Shmuel said: any where the husband entitles partake yavam entitles partake say any intercourse through which the husband entitles partake a yavam entitles partake and any intercourse through which the husband does not entitle partake a yavam does not entitle partake
llm_translation: And it was said, Rav Nachman said in the name of Shmuel: "Anyone that the husband feeds — the yavam feeds! I might say: Any intercourse that the husband feeds in it — the yavam feeds in it, and any intercourse that the husband does not feed in it — the yavam does not feed in it."

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל פִּקַּחַת שֶׁנִּתְאָרְסָה לְכֹהֵן פִּקֵּחַ, וְלֹא הִסְפִּיק לְכוֹנְסָהּ עַד שֶׁנִּתְחָרֵשׁ — אֵינָהּ אוֹכֶלֶת. מֵת, וְנָפְלָה לִפְנֵי יָבָם חֵרֵשׁ — אוֹכֶלֶת. וּבָזוֹ יָפֶה כֹּחַ יָבָם מִכֹּחַ בַּעַל. בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַב — מְתָרֵץ כִּדְתָרֵיץ מֵעִיקָּרָא. אֶלָּא לִשְׁמוּאֵל קַשְׁיָא! קַשְׁיָא.
human_translation: raises an objection a competent daughter of an Israelite who was betrothed to a competent priest, and he did not have a chance to marry her before he became a deaf-mute she may not partake died, and happened before a deaf-mute yavam she partake And in this the strength of the yavam is greater than the strength of the husband. Granted, according to Rav, he answer as answered initially, However, according to Shmuel, difficult. difficult.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: A question was raised: If a daughter of Israel was engaged to a priest who was a scholar, and he did not have the opportunity to consummate the marriage before he became deaf—she may not eat terumah. If he dies, and she falls to his brother who is deaf—she may eat terumah. And the beauty of the yavam (the brother-in-law) is more effective than the beauty of the husband. According to Rav, this is resolved as he resolves from the outset. But according to Shmuel, it is difficult! Difficult.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל פִּקַּחַת שֶׁנִּתְאָרְסָה לְכֹהֵן פִּקֵּחַ, וְלֹא הִסְפִּיק לְכוֹנְסָהּ עַד שֶׁנִּתְחָרֵשׁ — אֵינָהּ אוֹכֶלֶת. נוֹלַד לָהּ בֵּן — אוֹכֶלֶת. מֵת הַבֵּן, רַבִּי נָתָן אוֹמֵר: אוֹכֶלֶת, וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֵינָהּ אוֹכֶלֶת.
human_translation: The Sages taught: a competent daughter of an Israelite who was betrothed to a competent priest, and he did not have a chance to marry her before he became a deaf-mute she may not partake If a son was born to her she partake the son died, Rabbi Natan says she may partake and the Rabbis say she may not partake
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: If a daughter of Israel was engaged to a priest who was knowledgeable (pikach), and he did not have the opportunity to consummate the marriage before becoming deaf — she may not eat terumah. If she gives birth to a son — she may eat terumah. If the son dies, Rabbi Nathan says: she may eat, and the Sages say: she may not eat.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי נָתָן? אָמַר רַבָּה: הוֹאִיל שֶׁכְּבָר אָכְלָה. אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁנִּיסֵּת לְכֹהֵן וּמִית לֵיהּ, תֵּיכוֹל, שֶׁכְּבָר אָכְלָה! אֶלָּא כֵּיוָן דְּמִית לֵיהּ, פְּקַעָ לֵיהּ קְדוּשְׁתֵּיהּ מִינַּהּ. הָכָא נָמֵי: כֵּיוָן דְּמִית לֵיהּ, פְּקַעָ קְדוּשְׁתֵּיהּ מִינַּהּ!
human_translation: What is the reasoning of Rabbi Natan? Rabba said: Since she has partaken of Abaye said to him: However, if so, daughter of an Israelite who was married to a priest, and he died should partake as she has partaken of Rather, since he has passed away, his sanctity has left her, Here too, since has passed away, his sanctity has left her,
llm_translation: What is the reason for Rabbi Natan's opinion? Rabba said: Because she has already eaten. Abbaye said to him: Rather, from now on, if a daughter of Israel tempted a Kohen and he died, let her eat, for she has already eaten! Rather, once he dies, his holiness is removed from her. Here too: once he dies, his holiness is removed from her!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: קָסָבַר רַבִּי נָתָן נִשּׂוּאֵי חֵרֵשׁ מַאֲכִילִין בִּתְרוּמָה, וְלָא גָּזְרִינַן נִשּׂוּאֵי חֵרֵשׁ אַטּוּ קִדּוּשֵׁי חֵרֵשׁ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: אִי הָכִי, נוֹלַד לָהּ בֵּן לְמָה לִי? מִשּׁוּם רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: Rather, Rav Yosef said: Rabbi Natan holds the marriage of a deaf-mute entitles her to partake of teruma , and we do not decree marriage a deaf-mute due to betrothal a deaf-mute. Abaye said to him: If so, why do I a son was born to her? due to the Rabbis,
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Yosef said: Rabbi Natan holds that the deaf may eat terumah, and we do not decree that the deaf may not sanctify terumah. Abbaye said to him: If so, why was a son born to her for me? Because of the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: וְלִיפְלוֹג רַבִּי נָתָן עֲלַיְיהוּ בְּרֵישָׁא! שָׁבֵיק לְהוּ לְרַבָּנַן עַד דִּמְסַיְּימִי מִילְּתַיְיהוּ וַהֲדַר פְּלִיג עֲלַיְיהוּ. אִי הָכִי, לִיתְנֵי: מֵת הַבֵּן אֵינָהּ אוֹכֶלֶת, רַבִּי נָתָן אוֹמֵר: אוֹכֶלֶת! קַשְׁיָא.
human_translation: And let Rabbi Natan disagree with them in the first clause left the Rabbis until they finished their statement, and then disagreed with them If so, let teach the son died may not partake Rabbi Natan said may eat. is difficult
llm_translation: And Rabbi Nathan disagreed with them at the outset! He left it to the Rabbis until they finished their words, and then he disagreed with them. If so, let it teach: "If the son dies, she does not eat," Rabbi Nathan says: "She does eat!" This is a difficulty.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן הַבָּא עַל אַחַת מִכׇּל הָעֲרָיוֹת. אָמַר רַב עַמְרָם: הָא מִלְּתָא אֲמַר לַן רַב שֵׁשֶׁת,
human_translation: And so too, one who had intercourse with any one of those with whom relations are forbidden the Torah Rav Amram said: This matter was said Rav Sheshet,
llm_translation: And so one who comes upon any of all the forbidden relationships. Rav Amram said: This matter Rav Sheshet told us,

hebrew_text: וְאַנְהֲרִינְהוּ לְעַיְינִין מִמַּתְנִיתִין: אֵשֶׁת יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁנֶּאֶנְסָה, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁמּוּתֶּרֶת לְבַעְלָהּ — פְּסוּלָה לִכְהוּנָּה. וְתַנָּא תּוּנָא: וְכֵן הַבָּא עַל אַחַת מִכׇּל הָעֲרָיוֹת הָאֲמוּרוֹת בְּתוֹרָה, אוֹ פְּסוּלוֹת.
human_translation: and he illuminated our eyes from the mishna, the wife of an Israelite who was raped, although she is permitted to her husband, she is disqualified for the priesthood. And the tanna taught: And so too, one who had intercourse with any one of those with whom relations are forbidden [ arayot ] the Torah or unfit him
llm_translation: And we have taught them in the Mishnah: The wife of an Israelite who was raped, even though she is permitted to her husband — she is disqualified for the priesthood. And a Tanna taught: Similarly, one who engages in relations with any of the forbidden relationships mentioned in the Torah, they are disqualified.

hebrew_text: מַאי ״וְכֵן״? מַאי לָאו: לָא שְׁנָא בְּשׁוֹגֵג, וְלָא שְׁנָא בְּמֵזִיד, וְלָא שְׁנָא בְּאוֹנֶס, וְלָא שְׁנָא בְּרָצוֹן, וְקָתָנֵי: פְּסָלָהּ.
human_translation: What is the meaning of And so too? What, is it not it is no different unwittingly or intentionally, and it is no different due to coercion or willingly? And it is taught he has rendered her disqualified
llm_translation: What is the meaning of "and so"? What is it not? It is not different in unintentional, and not different in intentional, and not different in coercion, and not different in willingness, and it teaches: disqualify it.

hebrew_text: לָא. מַאי ״וְכֵן״ — אַהַעֲרָאָה. הַעֲרָאָה דְּמַאן, אִילֵימָא דַּעֲרָיוֹת — לְמֵימְרָא דַּעֲרָיוֹת יָלְפִינַן מִיְּבָמָה? אַדְּרַבָּה: יְבָמָה יָלְפִינַן מֵעֲרָיוֹת, דְּעִיקַּר הַעֲרָאָה בַּעֲרָיוֹת כְּתִיב!
human_translation: No, what And so too? to the initial stage of intercourse, The initial stage of intercourse of whom? If we say those with whom relations are prohibited [ arayot ], is this to say that with regard to those with whom relations are prohibited is derived from a yevama , On the contrary, we derive a yevama from with regard to those with whom relations are prohibited, as the main the initial stage of intercourse is stated in those with whom relations are prohibited
llm_translation: Not. What "and so" — objection. Objection of whom? If you say of forbidden relationships — to say that forbidden relationships help with levirate marriage? On the contrary: levirate marriage helps with forbidden relationships, as the primary objection is written in forbidden relationships!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, מַאי ״וְכֵן״? אַשֶּׁלֹּא כְּדַרְכָּהּ דַּעֲרָיוֹת. אַדְּרַבָּה: עִיקַּר ״מִשְׁכְּבֵי אִשָּׁה״ בַּעֲרָיוֹת כְּתִיב!
human_translation: Rather, what is And so too? to atypical, sexual intercourse with those with whom relations are prohibited [ arayot ]. On the contrary, the main “The cohabitations of a woman” is written with regard to those with whom relations are prohibited [ arayot ].
llm_translation: Rather, what is the meaning of "and so"? To teach that it is not like its usual manner in matters of forbidden relationships. On the contrary, the main aspect of "lying with a woman" is written in forbidden relationships!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, מַאי ״וְכֵן״? אַשֶּׁלֹּא כְּדַרְכָּהּ דְּחַיָּיבֵי לָאוִין.
human_translation: Rather, what is And so too? to atypical by those liable for prohibition
llm_translation: Rather, what is "and so"? Just as its usual way, those who are obligated in negative commandments.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: אֵשֶׁת כֹּהֵן שֶׁנֶּאֶנְסָה, בַּעְלָהּ — לוֹקֶה עָלֶיהָ מִשּׁוּם זוֹנָה. מִשּׁוּם זוֹנָה אִין, מִשּׁוּם טוּמְאָה לָא? אֵימָא אַף מִשּׁוּם זוֹנָה.
human_translation: Rava said: the wife of a priest who was raped, her husband is flogged her, due to zona . Due to zona , yes; due to ritual impurity, no? Say also due to zona .
llm_translation: Rava said: The wife of a Kohen who was forced, her husband - lashes upon her for the matter of a harlot. For the matter of a harlot it is not, for the matter of impurity is it not? Say also for the matter of a harlot.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַבִּי זֵירָא: ״וְהִיא לֹא נִתְפָּשָׂה״ — אֲסוּרָה, הָא נִתְפָּשָׂה — מוּתֶּרֶת. וְיֵשׁ לְךָ אַחֶרֶת שֶׁאַף עַל פִּי שֶׁנִּתְפָּשָׂה — אֲסוּרָה, וְאֵי זוֹ — זוֹ אֵשֶׁת כֹּהֵן.
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira raised an objection “And neither was she taken” she is forbidden but she was taken, she is permitted you have another who prohibited even though she was taken. And which is this? This is the wife of a priest.
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: "And she was not caught" - she is forbidden; but if she was caught - she is permitted. And you have another case where even if she was caught - she is forbidden, and what is that? That is the wife of a Kohen.

hebrew_text: וְלָאו הַבָּא מִכְּלַל עֲשֵׂה, עֲשֵׂה!
human_translation: And a prohibition that stems from a positive mitzva, a positive mitzva,
llm_translation: And not a negative commandment that comes from a general category of positive commandments, it is considered a positive commandment!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה: הַכֹּל הָיוּ בִּכְלַל זוֹנָה, כְּשֶׁפָּרַט לְךָ הַכָּתוּב גַּבֵּי אֵשֶׁת יִשְׂרָאֵל ״וְהִיא לֹא נִתְפָּשָׂה״ אֲסוּרָה, הָא נִתְפָּשָׂה מוּתֶּרֶת — מִכְּלָל דְּאֵשֶׁת כֹּהֵן כִּדְקָיְימָא קָיְימָא.
human_translation: Rabba said All were included zona . When the verse specified with regard to the wife of an Israelite: “And neither was she taken,” forbidden, she was taken, permitted. By inference, the wife of a priest remains as she was.
llm_translation: Rabba said: Everything was included in the category of a prostitute, when the verse specifically states regarding a Jewish woman, "and she was not caught," she is forbidden. But if she was caught, she is permitted - this is derived from the general principle that the status of a Kohen's wife is as it is established.

hebrew_text: וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי, אָמַר רַבָּה: אֵשֶׁת כֹּהֵן שֶׁנֶּאֶנְסָה — בַּעְלָהּ לוֹקֶה עָלֶיהָ מִשּׁוּם טוּמְאָה. מִשּׁוּם טוּמְאָה — אִין, מִשּׁוּם זוֹנָה — לָא, אַלְמָא בְּאוֹנֶס לָא קָרֵינָא בַּיהּ זוֹנָה.
human_translation: And some say Rabba said: the wife of a priest who was raped, her husband is flogged for her due to ritual impurity. Due to ritual impurity, yes; due to zona , no? Apparently, in rape, is not called a zona .
llm_translation: And there are those who say, Rabba said: A Kohen's wife who was forced - her husband lashes her due to impurity. Due to impurity - no, due to harlotry - no. Therefore, in the case of being forced, she is not called a harlot.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַבִּי זֵירָא: ״וְהִיא לֹא נִתְפָּשָׂה״ — אֲסוּרָה, הָא נִתְפָּשָׂה — מוּתֶּרֶת. וְיֵשׁ לְךָ אַחֶרֶת, שֶׁאַף עַל פִּי שֶׁנִּתְפָּשָׂה — אֲסוּרָה, וְאֵיזוֹ — זוֹ אֵשֶׁת כֹּהֵן, וְלָאו הַבָּא מִכְּלַל עֲשֵׂה, עֲשֵׂה!
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira raised an objection “And neither was she taken” she is forbidden but she was taken, she is permitted you have another who forbidden even though she was taken. And which is this? This is the wife of a priest. And a prohibition that stems from a positive mitzva a positive mitzva,
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: "And she was not seized" - forbidden; but if she was seized - permitted. And you have another case, that even though she was seized - forbidden, and which case is this? This is the wife of a Kohen, and not one that comes from a positive command, fulfill the positive commandment!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: הַכֹּל הָיוּ בִּכְלַל ״אַחֲרֵי אֲשֶׁר הֻטַּמָּאָה״, כְּשֶׁפָּרַט לְךָ הַכָּתוּב גַּבֵּי אֵשֶׁת יִשְׂרָאֵל ״וְהִיא לֹא נִתְפָּשָׂה״ — אֲסוּרָה, הָא נִתְפָּשָׂה — מוּתֶּרֶת, מִכְּלַל דְּאֵשֶׁת כֹּהֵן כִּדְקָיְימָא — קָיְימָא.
human_translation: Rava said: All were included after she was made ritually impure” When the verse specified with regard to the wife of an Israelite: “And neither was she taken,” forbidden, she was taken permitted. By inference, the wife of a priest remains as she was,
llm_translation: Rava said: Everything was included in the phrase "after she became defiled," when the verse specified for you regarding a married woman, "and she was not caught" — she is forbidden; but if she was caught — she is permitted. From the general principle of the wife of a Kohen, as it stands — it stands.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אַלְמָנָה לְכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל, גְּרוּשָׁה וַחֲלוּצָה לְכֹהֵן הֶדְיוֹט, מִן הָאֵירוּסִין — לֹא יֹאכְלוּ בִּתְרוּמָה. רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן מַכְשִׁירִין.
human_translation: A widow to a High Priest, a divorcée, or a ḥalutza to a common priest, betrothal may not partake of teruma . Rabbi Elazar and Rabbi Shimon declare them fit
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: A widow of a High Priest, if divorced or released from the levirate marriage, may not eat of the priestly portion. Rabbi Eliezer and Rabbi Shimon permit it.

hebrew_text: נִתְאַרְמְלוּ אוֹ נִתְגָּרְשׁוּ, מִן הַנִּשּׂוּאִין — פְּסוּלוֹת, מִן הָאֵירוּסִין — כְּשֵׁרוֹת.
human_translation: were widowed or divorced, from marriage, they are disqualified from betrothal, fit
llm_translation: They intermingled or were divorced, from the Nesu'in - disqualified, from the Eirusin - valid.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תַּנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר: קַל וָחוֹמֶר, וּמָה קִדּוּשֵׁי רְשׁוּת — אֵין מַאֲכִילִין, קִדּוּשֵׁי עֲבֵירָה — לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן?!
human_translation: It is taught in a Rabbi Meir said: an a fortiori inference: Just as optional betrothal, does not entitle her to partake is it not all the more so betrothal a transgression,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemara tanya, amar Rabbi Meir: kal va'chomer, u'mah kidushei reshut - ein ma'achilin, kidushei aveirah - lo kol sheken?!" English translation: "It was taught in a Baraita, Rabbi Meir said: a fortiori, and if the sanctifications of permissible things - we do not feed, then the sanctifications of transgressions - all the more so?!"

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ לוֹ: לֹא. אִם אָמַרְתָּ בְּקִידּוּשֵׁי רְשׁוּת שֶׁכֵּן אֵין לוֹ לְהַאֲכִיל בְּמָקוֹם אַחֵר, תֹּאמַר בְּקִדּוּשֵׁי עֲבֵירָה, שֶׁכֵּן יֵשׁ לוֹ לְהַאֲכִיל בְּמָקוֹם אַחֵר.
human_translation: They said to him: No, if you say whose cannot entitle her to partake in another case, shall you say betrothal a transgression, where his does entitle her to partake in a different case,
llm_translation: They said to him: No. If you say in sanctifications of permission that he has no to feed in another place, you should say in sanctifications of transgression that he has to feed in another place.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אָמַר רַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא: פְּצוּעַ דַּכָּא כֹּהֵן שֶׁקִּדֵּשׁ בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל, בָּאנוּ לְמַחְלוֹקֶת רַבִּי מֵאִיר וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar said Rabbi Oshaya said: a priest with crushed testicles who betrothed the daughter of an Israelite, we have arrived at the dispute Rabbi Meir and Rabbi Elazar and Rabbi Shimon
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said, Rabbi Oshaya said: A blemished priest who betrothed a daughter of Israel, we came to a dispute between Rabbi Meir, Rabbi Elazar, and Rabbi Shimon.

hebrew_text: לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר, דְּאָמַר מִשְׁתַּמֶּרֶת לְבִיאָה פְּסוּלָה דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא לָא אָכְלָה — הָא נָמֵי לָא אָכְלָה. לְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, דְּאָמְרִי מִשְׁתַּמֶּרֶת לְבִיאָה פְּסוּלָה דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא אָכְלָה —
human_translation: According to Rabbi Meir, who said reserved for intercourse that is invalid, by Torah law may not partake this one may also not partake According to Rabbi Elazar and Rabbi Shimon, who say reserved for intercourse that is invalid by Torah may partake
llm_translation: To Rabbi Meir, who says that if a forbidden fat was preserved for cooking, it is biblically disqualified and cannot be eaten - this one, indeed, did not eat it. To Rabbi Eliezer and Rabbi Shimon, who say that if a forbidden fat was preserved for cooking, it is biblically disqualified and can be eaten - this one, indeed, ate it.

hebrew_text: הָא נָמֵי אָכְלָה. מִמַּאי? דִּלְמָא עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמְרִי רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן הָתָם, אֶלָּא דְּיֵשׁ לוֹ לְהַאֲכִיל בְּמָקוֹם אַחֵר. אֲבָל הָכָא, דְּאֵין לוֹ לְהַאֲכִיל בְּמָקוֹם אַחֵר — לָא.
human_translation: this one may also partake From where Perhaps Rabbi Elazar and Rabbi Shimon stated there only whose can entitle her to partake in another case, but here, whose cannot entitle her to partake in another case, no,
llm_translation: Here is the translation of the Talmudic text you provided: Talmudic text: "Ha na'mei akhla. Mimai? Dilmah ad kan lo ka'amri Rabbi Elazar veRabbi Shimon hataam, ela deyesh lo lehaakhil be'makom acher. Aval haka, de'ein lo lehaakhil be'makom acher - lo." English translation: "This one ate. From what? Perhaps until here Rabbi Elazar and Rabbi Shimon did not say there, but that he has to feed in another place. But here, where he does not have to feed in another place - no."

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא: הָכָא נָמֵי יֵשׁ לוֹ לְהַאֲכִיל בְּבַת גֵּרִים, וְהָא מִיבַּעְיָא בְּעָא לַהּ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מֵרַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא, וְלָא פְּשַׁיט לֵיהּ.
human_translation: And if you say here too, his can entitle to partake the daughter of converts, wasn’t it raised as a dilemma Rabbi Yoḥanan before Rabbi Oshaya and he was unable to resolve it him?
llm_translation: And if you will say: Here, he has the ability to feed with the daughter of converts, and this is what Rabbi Yochanan asked Rabbi Oshaya, and it did not resolve for him.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר, אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: הוֹאִיל וּמַאֲכִילָהּ בְּלֹא יְדָעָהּ.
human_translation: It was stated Abaye said: since his entitles to partake in he has not known her.
llm_translation: It was stated: Abbaye said: Since he feeds her without her knowledge.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: הוֹאִיל וּמַאֲכִילָהּ בַּעֲבָדָיו וְשִׁפְחוֹתָיו הַכְּנַעֲנִים.
human_translation: Rava said since entitles his Canaanite slaves and maidservants to partake
llm_translation: Rava said: Since he feeds her to his male and female Canaanite slaves.

hebrew_text: אַבָּיֵי לָא אָמַר כְּרָבָא — קִנְיָן דְּאִישׁוּת מִקִּנְיָן דְּאִישׁוּת יָלְפִינַן, וְלָא יָלְפִינַן קִנְיָן דְּאִישׁוּת מִקִּנְיָן דַּעֲבָדִים.
human_translation: Abaye did not say in accordance with Rava we derive the acquisition of marriage from the acquisition of marriage, and we do not derive the acquisition of marriage from the acquisition of slaves.
llm_translation: Abaye did not say like Rava - acquisition of ownership from acquisition of ownership we learn, and we do not learn acquisition of ownership from acquisition of slaves.

hebrew_text: וְרָבָא לָא אָמַר כְּאַבַּיֵּי — שָׁאנֵי הָתָם, שֶׁכְּבָר אָכְלָה. וְאַבָּיֵי: שֶׁכְּבָר אָכְלָה לָא אָמְרִינַן, דְּאִי לָא תֵּימָא הָכִי, בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁנִּיסֵּת לְכֹהֵן וּמִית — תֵּיכוֹל, שֶׁכְּבָר אָכְלָה. וְרָבָא: הָתָם פָּקַע קִנְיָנֵיהּ, הָכָא לָא פָּקַע קִנְיָנֵיהּ.
human_translation: And Rava did not state in accordance with Abaye, it is different there, as she had already partaken of And Abaye we do not say she had already partaken of as, if you do not say so, daughter of an Israelite who married to a priest who died should partake as she had already partaken of And Rava There, his acquisition lapses here, his acquisition does not lapse,
llm_translation: Rava did not say like Abbaye - it is different there, because she already ate. And Abbaye: if she already ate, we do not say, for if you might say so, a daughter of Israel who was tested by a priest and died - let her eat, for she already ate. And Rava: there, her acquisition was nullified, but here, her acquisition was not nullified.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא, בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מֵרַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא: פְּצוּעַ דַּכָּא כֹּהֵן שֶׁנָּשָׂא בַּת גֵּרִים. מַהוּ שֶׁיַּאֲכִילֶנָּה בִּתְרוּמָה? אִישְׁתִּיק וְלָא אֲמַר לֵיהּ וְלָא מִידֵּי. לְסוֹף אֲתָא גַּבְרָא רַבָּה אַחֲרִינָא וּבְעָא מִינֵּיהּ מִילְּתָא [אַחְרִיתָא] וּפְשַׁט לֵיהּ. וּמַנּוּ — רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי יְהוּדָה נְשִׂיאָה לְרַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא: אַטּוּ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן לָאו גַּבְרָא רַבָּה הוּא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: דְּקָבָעֵי מִינַּאי מִילְּתָא דְּלֵית לַהּ פָּתְרִי.
human_translation: itself. Rabbi Yoḥanan raised a dilemma before Rabbi Oshaya: a priest crushed testicles who married the daughter of converts, what is his entitles her to partake of teruma ? was silent and said nothing to him. Eventually another great man came and raised a different dilemma before and he resolved his And who was Reish Lakish. Rabbi Yehuda Nesia said to Rabbi Oshaya: Is Rabbi Yoḥanan not a great man? said to him: because he raised a dilemma before me that has no resolution.
llm_translation: The body, Rabbi Yochanan asked Rabbi Oshaya: A priest who married a convert. Can he feed her terumah? He remained silent and did not respond immediately. Eventually, another man, Rava, came and asked him the same question and he answered him. And who was it? Reish Lakish. Rabbi Yehuda, the prince, said to Rabbi Oshaya: Is Rabbi Yochanan not a great man? He said to him: Because they established a matter that has no solution.

hebrew_text: לְמַאן? אִי לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, בֵּין בִּקְדוּשְׁתֵּיהּ קָאֵי בֵּין לָאו בִּקְדוּשְׁתֵּיהּ קָאֵי — לָא אָכְלָה. אִי בִּקְדוּשְׁתֵּיהּ קָאֵי — לָא אָכְלָה, דְּהָא אָמַר מָר: בַּת גֵּר זָכָר כְּבַת חָלָל זָכָר.
human_translation: According to whom If in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda, whether retains his sanctity or whether he does not retain his sanctity may not partake If he retains his sanctity she may not partake as the Master said: daughter of a male convert like daughter of a male ḥalal .
llm_translation: To whom? If according to Rabbi Yehuda, whether she is standing in her sanctity or not in her sanctity - she did not eat. If she is standing in her sanctity - she did not eat, for the Master said: "The daughter of a convert, whether male or female, is like the daughter of a commoner, whether male or female."

hebrew_text: אִי לָאו בִּקְדוּשְׁתֵּיהּ קָאֵי — לָא אָכְלָה, דְּהָא אָמְרִינַן: קְהַל גֵּרִים אִיקְּרִי קָהָל.
human_translation: if he does not retain his sanctity she may not eat, as we say the congregation of converts is called congregation
llm_translation: If not for its sanctity standing - she did not eat, for we say: A congregation of converts is called a congregation.

hebrew_text: וְאִי לְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי, בֵּין בִּקְדוּשְׁתֵּיהּ קָאֵי בֵּין לָאו בִּקְדוּשְׁתֵּיהּ קָאֵי — אָכְלָה. בִּקְדוּשְׁתֵּיהּ קָאֵי — אָכְלָה, דְּהָא אָמַר: אַף גֵּר שֶׁנָּשָׂא גִּיּוֹרֶת — בִּתּוֹ כְּשֵׁרָה לִכְהוּנָּה. אִי לָאו בִּקְדוּשְׁתֵּיהּ קָאֵי — אָכְלָה, דְּהָא אָמַר: קְהַל גֵּרִים לָא אִיקְּרִי קָהָל.
human_translation: And if in accordance with Rabbi Yosei, whether he retains his sanctity whether he does not retain his sanctity, she partake he retains his sanctity may partake, as said: Even convert married a convert, his daughter is fit for the priesthood. If he does not retain his sanctity may partake, as said: congregation of converts is not called congregation
llm_translation: If it is according to Rabbi Yosei, whether she is standing in her sanctity or not standing in her sanctity - she may eat. If she is standing in her sanctity - she may eat, for he said: Even a convert who married a convert - his daughter is fit for the priesthood. If she is not standing in her sanctity - she may eat, for he said: A congregation of converts is not called a congregation.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אַלִּיבָּא דְּהַאי תַּנָּא: דִּתְנַן, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב אוֹמֵר: אִשָּׁה בַּת גֵּרִים לֹא תִּנָּשֵׂא לִכְהוּנָּה עַד שֶׁתְּהֵא אִמָּהּ מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל.
human_translation: Rather, in accordance with this tanna , as we learned Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov says: A woman the daughter of converts may not marry into the priesthood unless her mother was Jewish
llm_translation: Rather, according to the opinion of this Tanna: as we learned in a Mishnah, Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov says: "A woman, the daughter of converts, may not marry into the priesthood until her mother is from the children of Israel."

hebrew_text: וְהָכִי קָמִיבַּעְיָא לֵיהּ: כַּשְׁרוּת מִיתּוֹסְפָא בַּהּ — וְאָכְלָה, אוֹ דִלְמָא קְדוּשָּׁה מִיתּוֹסְפָא בַּהּ — וְלָא אָכְלָה.
human_translation: And his dilemma was as follows: fitness has been added to her, she partake Or perhaps sanctity has been added to her she may not partake
llm_translation: And thus he raised an objection to him: If it is like the service of the additional offering - and she ate, or perhaps it is like the consecration of the additional offering - and she did not eat.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: כִּי אֲתָא רַבִּי אַחָא בַּר חִינָּנָא מִדָּרוֹמָא, אֲתָא וְאַיְיתִי מַתְנִיתָא בִּידֵיהּ: מִנַּיִן לִפְצוּעַ דַּכָּא כֹּהֵן שֶׁנָּשָׂא בַּת גֵּרִים שֶׁמַּאֲכִילָהּ בִּתְרוּמָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְכֹהֵן כִּי יִקְנֶה נֶפֶשׁ קִנְיַן כַּסְפּוֹ וְגוֹ׳ יֹאכַל בּוֹ״.
human_translation: Come hear: When Rabbi Aḥa bar Ḥinnana came from the south, he came and brought baraita in hand: From where a priest with crushed testicles who married the daughter of converts entitles her to partake of teruma ? As it is stated: “But if a priest buys any soul, the purchase of his money, may eat of it”
llm_translation: Come and hear: When Rabbi Aḥa bar Ḥanina came from the South, he came and brought a baraita in his hand: From where do we derive that a priest who marries a convert's daughter who feeds her with terumah is liable to pay compensation? As it is stated: "And if a priest acquires any soul, the purchase of his money, he shall eat of it."

hebrew_text: לְמַאן? אִילֵימָא לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, הָאָמַר: בֵּין בִּקְדוּשְׁתֵּיהּ קָאֵי בֵּין לָאו בִּקְדוּשְׁתֵּיהּ קָאֵי — לָא אָכְלָה. וְאִי לְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי — לְמָה לִי קְרָא, הָאָמַר: בֵּין בִּקְדוּשְׁתֵּיהּ קָאֵי בֵּין לָאו בִּקְדוּשְׁתֵּיהּ קָאֵי — אָכְלָה! אֶלָּא לָאו, לְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב, וּשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ כַּשְׁרוּת אִיתּוֹסַפָא בַּהּ וְאָכְלָה. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: According to whom If we say in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda, didn’t he say whether retains his sanctity whether he does not retain his sanctity, may not partake And if in accordance with Rabbi Yosei, why do I verse Didn’t he say whether retains his sanctity whether he does not retain his sanctity, she partake Rather, is it not in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov? And learn from this fitness was added to her, and she partake learn from this
llm_translation: For whom? If you say it is according to Rabbi Yehuda, who said: Whether it is standing in its sanctity or not standing in its sanctity - she does not eat. And if you say it is according to Rabbi Yosei - why do I need the verse, which says: Whether it is standing in its sanctity or not standing in its sanctity - she eats! Rather, it is according to Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov, and she ate with him as it is fit, and she ate. She ate with him.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר, רַב אָמַר:
human_translation: It was stated Rav said:
llm_translation: It was stated: Rav said:

hebrew_text: יֵשׁ חוּפָּה לִפְסוּלוֹת. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: אֵין חוּפָּה לִפְסוּלוֹת.
human_translation: There is to a wedding canopy unfit And Shmuel said: There is no to wedding canopy unfit
llm_translation: There is a covering for disqualified items. And Shmuel said: There is no covering for disqualified items.

hebrew_text: אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: וּמוֹדֶה לִי אַבָּא בְּתִינוֹקֶת פְּחוּתָה מִבַּת שָׁלֹשׁ שָׁנִים וְיוֹם אֶחָד, הוֹאִיל וְאֵין לָהּ בִּיאָה, אֵין לָהּ חוּפָּה.
human_translation: Shmuel said: And Abba, concedes to me, with regard to a girl less than three years and one day old, Since there is no intercourse her, there is no wedding canopy her.
llm_translation: Samuel said: "And Abba agrees with me that in the case of a minor less than three years old and one day, since she cannot engage in sexual intercourse, she does not require a marriage contract."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא, אַף אֲנַן נָמֵי תְּנֵינָא: בַּת שָׁלֹשׁ שָׁנִים וְיוֹם אֶחָד מִתְקַדֶּשֶׁת בְּבִיאָה, וְאִם בָּא עָלֶיהָ יָבָם — קְנָאָהּ, וְחַיָּיבִין עָלֶיהָ מִשּׁוּם אֵשֶׁת אִישׁ, וּמְטַמְּאָה אֶת בּוֹעֲלָהּ לְטַמֵּא מִשְׁכָּב תַּחְתּוֹן כְּעֶלְיוֹן.
human_translation: Rava said: We, too, learn A girl three years and one day old can be betrothed via sexual intercourse; and if yavam had intercourse with her, he has acquired her; and is liable on her account because a married woman; and she renders ritually impure a man who has intercourse with her, so that he renders impure the object upon which he lies like the upper one.
llm_translation: Rava said, "We also learned: A girl of three years and one day can be betrothed through intercourse, and if her yavam (deceased husband's brother) engages in intercourse with her - he is zealous for her, and they are liable for the sin of a married woman, and she defiles her husband to defile the lower bed as the upper bed."

hebrew_text: נִשֵּׂאת לְכֹהֵן — אוֹכֶלֶת בִּתְרוּמָה. בָּא עָלֶיהָ אֶחָד מִכׇּל הַפְּסוּלִין — פְּסָלָהּ.
human_translation: she is married to a priest she may partake of teruma . one of those unfit had intercourse with her, he has disqualified her
llm_translation: Elevated to a Kohen — eats in Trumah. One of all the disqualified comes upon it — disqualifies it.

hebrew_text: בַּת שָׁלֹשׁ שָׁנִים וְיוֹם אֶחָד, הוּא דְּמִפַּסְלָה בְּבִיאָה — מִפַּסְלָה בְּחוּפָּה. הָא פְּחוּתָה מִבַּת שָׁלֹשׁ שָׁנִים וְיוֹם אֶחָד, דְּלָא מִפַּסְלָה בְּבִיאָה — לָא מִפַּסְלָה נָמֵי בְּחוּפָּה. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: it is a girl three years and one day old who is disqualified via intercourse, she is disqualified via the wedding canopy. less than three years and one day old, who is not disqualified via intercourse, is also not disqualified via the wedding canopy. learn from this
llm_translation: A girl of three years and one day, if she was defiled through intercourse - she is defiled through marriage. But if she is less than three years and one day, since she was not defiled through intercourse - she is not defiled through marriage either. This is the principle.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָמֵי בַּר חָמָא: יֵשׁ חוּפָּה לִפְסוּלוֹת — בָּאנוּ לְמַחְלוֹקֶת רַבִּי מֵאִיר וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן.
human_translation: Rami bar Ḥama said: there is to wedding canopy unfit we have arrived at the dispute Rabbi Meir and Rabbi Elazar and Rabbi Shimon
llm_translation: Ramei bar Ḥama said: There is a chuppah for disqualified individuals - we have come to the dispute of Rabbi Meir, Rabbi Elazar, and Rabbi Shimon.

hebrew_text: לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר, דְּאָמַר קִדּוּשִׁין פָּסְלִי — חוּפָּה נָמֵי פָּסְלָה. לְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, דְּאָמְרִי קִדּוּשִׁין לָא פָּסְלִי — חוּפָּה נָמֵי לָא פָּסְלָה.
human_translation: According to Rabbi Meir, who says that betrothal disqualifies wedding canopy also disqualifies according to Rabbi Elazar and Rabbi Shimon, who say betrothal does not disqualify wedding canopy also does not disqualify
llm_translation: To Rabbi Meir, who says consecrations invalidate — if the chuppah is valid, the consecration is invalid. To Rabbi Eliezer and Rabbi Shimon, who say consecrations do not invalidate — if the chuppah is not valid, the consecration is not valid.

hebrew_text: וּמִמַּאי? דִּלְמָא עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר הָתָם אֶלָּא בְּקִדּוּשִׁין, דְּקָנֵי לַהּ, אֲבָל חוּפָּה דְּלָא קָנֵי לַהּ — לָא.
human_translation: And from where Perhaps Rabbi Meir only stated there, with regard to betrothal, which acquires her. However, a wedding canopy, which does not acquire her, no,
llm_translation: And from where? Perhaps until here not said Rabbi Meir there rather in betrothal, that acquires for her, but marriage that does not acquire for her — no.

hebrew_text: אִי נָמֵי: עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמְרִי רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן הָתָם אֶלָּא בְּקִדּוּשִׁין, דְּלָא קְרִיבִי לְבִיאָה, אֲבָל חוּפָּה דִּקְרִיבָא לְבִיאָה — הָכִי נָמֵי דְּפָסְלָה.
human_translation: Alternatively, Rabbi Elazar and Rabbi Shimon stated only there, with regard to betrothal, as it is not close to sexual intercourse. However, wedding canopy, which is close to sexual intercourse, that it also disqualifies
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Iy namei: ad kan lo ka'amri Rabbi Elazar veRabbi Shimon hataam ela beKiddushin, d'la k'rivii levi'ah, aval chupah dikrivah levi'ah - hachi namei d'faslah." English translation: "If you will say: until here did not say Rabbi Elazar and Rabbi Shimon there, rather in betrothals, for it is not brought for consummation, but a wedding canopy that is brought for consummation - thus it is said that it is disqualified."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אִי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר, בִּפְלוּגְתָּא דְּהָנֵי תַּנָּאֵי, דְּתַנְיָא: נִישְּׂאוּ זוֹ וָזוֹ, כְּשֵׁרוֹת וּפְסוּלוֹת, אוֹ שֶׁנִּכְנְסוּ לְחוּפָּה וְלֹא נִבְעֲלוּ — אוֹכְלוֹת מִשֶּׁלּוֹ, וְאוֹכְלוֹת בִּתְרוּמָה.
