human_translation: Rather, if it can be said in the dispute these tanna’im , as it is taught in they married one another, fit or unfit or they entered the wedding canopy and did not have intercourse they eat of his and partake of teruma .
llm_translation: Rather, if there is to say, in the dispute of those Tannaim, as it was taught: "These and these are married, both valid and invalid, or if they entered the wedding canopy but did not consummate the marriage - they may eat from his food, and they may eat from terumah."

hebrew_text: נִכְנְסוּ, מִכְּלָל דְּ״נִישְּׂאוּ״ — נִישְּׂאוּ מַמָּשׁ?!
human_translation: they entered by inference that they married, actual marriage.
llm_translation: They entered, from the inference of "they lifted" - did they really lift?!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לָאו: כְּגוֹן שֶׁנִּכְנְסוּ לְחוּפָּה וְלֹא נִבְעֲלוּ. וְקָתָנֵי: אוֹכְלוֹת מִשֶּׁלּוֹ וְאוֹכְלוֹת בִּתְרוּמָה.
human_translation: Rather, is it not Where they entered the canopy, and had not had intercourse? And it is taught they partake of his and partake of teruma .
llm_translation: Rather, no: for example, when they entered the wedding canopy and did not consummate the marriage. And it is taught: "Eating from his own and eating from the heave-offering."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בְּנוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן בְּרוֹקָה אוֹמֵר: כֹּל שֶׁבִּיאָתָהּ מַאֲכִילָתָהּ — חוּפָּתָהּ מַאֲכִילָתָהּ, וְכֹל שֶׁאֵין בִּיאָתָהּ מַאֲכִילָתָהּ — אֵין חוּפָּתָהּ מַאֲכִילָתָהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Beroka, says: Any whose intercourse entitles her to partake of teruma , her wedding canopy entitles her to partake of teruma ; and any whose intercourse does not entitle her to partake of teruma , her wedding canopy does not entitle her to partake of teruma .
llm_translation: Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yochanan ben Brokah, says: Anything that its bringing in feeds it, its covering feeds it, and anything that its bringing in does not feed it, its covering does not feed it.

hebrew_text: מִמַּאי? דִּלְמָא רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בְּנוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן בְּרוֹקָה כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר סְבִירָא לֵיהּ, דְּאָמַר קִדּוּשִׁין לָא אָכְלָה?
human_translation: From where Perhaps Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Beroka, holds in accordance with Rabbi Meir, who said betrothal she may not partake of
llm_translation: From where? Perhaps Rabbi Yishmael, the son of Rabbi Yochanan ben Brokah, holds like Rabbi Meir, for he said: "Kiddushin does not take effect"?

hebrew_text: הַאי ״כֹּל שֶׁאֵין בִּיאָתָהּ מַאֲכִילָתָהּ אֵין חוּפָּתָהּ מַאֲכִילָתָהּ״, ״כֹּל שֶׁאֵין בִּיאָתָהּ מַאֲכִילָתָהּ אֵין כַּסְפָּהּ מַאֲכִילָתָהּ״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ! דִּלְמָא, אַיְּידֵי דְּאָמַר תַּנָּא קַמָּא חוּפָּה, אָמַר אִיהוּ נָמֵי חוּפָּה.
human_translation: this Any whose intercourse does not entitle her to partake her wedding canopy does not entitle her to partake It should have Any whose intercourse does not entitle her to partake her money does not entitle her to partake Perhaps since first tanna said a wedding canopy, also said a wedding canopy,
llm_translation: This one, "Anything that does not bring its own coming does not feed itself," "Anything that does not bring its own coming does not feed its purse," he asks: Does he require both? Perhaps, since the first Tanna said "its hupa," he also said "its hupa."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב עַמְרָם: הָא מִילְּתָא אֲמַר לַן רַב שֵׁשֶׁת, וְאַנְהֲרִינְהוּ לְעַיְינִין מִמַּתְנִיתִין: יֵשׁ חוּפָּה לִפְסוּלוֹת. וְתַנָּא תּוּנָא: אָמֵן שֶׁלֹּא שָׂטִיתִי אֲרוּסָה וּנְשׂוּאָה, שׁוֹמֶרֶת יָבָם וּכְנוּסָה.
human_translation: Rav Amram said: This matter was said Rav Sheshet, and he illuminated our eyes from the mishna, There is to wedding canopy unfit And the tanna taught amen, that: I did not go astray betrothed, or married, a widow waiting for her yavam , or married
llm_translation: Rav Amram said: This matter Rav Sheshet told us, and we investigated it from the Mishnah: There is a canopy for disqualified women. And a Tanna taught: "Amen" that I have not turned away a betrothed woman and a married woman, who observes yibum and chalitzah.

hebrew_text: הַאי אֲרוּסָה הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִילֵּימָא דְּקַנִּי לַהּ כְּשֶׁהִיא אֲרוּסָה וְקָא מַשְׁקֵה לַהּ כְּשֶׁהִיא אֲרוּסָה — אֲרוּסָה בַּת מִשְׁתְּיָא הִיא? וְהָא תְּנַן: אֲרוּסָה וְשׁוֹמֶרֶת יָבָם — לֹא שׁוֹתוֹת וְלֹא נוֹטְלוֹת כְּתוּבָה!
human_translation: This a betrothed what are the circumstances? If we say that he was jealous of her when she was betrothed, and he causes her to drink when she is betrothed, a betrothed fit to drink Didn’t we learn A betrothed and a widow waiting for her yavam do not drink, and they do not collect their marriage contract
llm_translation: This betrothed woman, what is the status of her blood money? If you say that he acquires her when she is betrothed and he is giving her to drink while she is betrothed — is she a betrothed daughter of two fathers? But didn't we learn: A betrothed woman who is also a yevamah — they do not give her to drink, and they do not perform the levirate marriage!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא דְּקַנִּי לַהּ כְּשֶׁהִיא אֲרוּסָה וְאִיסְתְּתַר, וְקָמַשְׁקֵה לַהּ כְּשֶׁהִיא נְשׂוּאָה, מִי בָּדְקִי לַהּ מַיָּא? וְהָתַנְיָא: ״וְנִקָּה הָאִישׁ מֵעָוֹן״, בִּזְמַן שֶׁהָאִישׁ מְנוּקֶּה מֵעָוֹן — הַמַּיִם בּוֹדְקִין אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ, אֵין הָאִישׁ מְנוּקֶּה מֵעָוֹן — אֵין הַמַּיִם בּוֹדְקִין אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ.
human_translation: Rather, that he was jealous of her when she was betrothed, and she secluded herself and causes her to drink when she is married. do the waters examine her? Isn’t it taught “And the man shall be clear from iniquity, when the man is clear of iniquity the waters examine his wife, the man is not clear of iniquity the waters do not examine his wife?
llm_translation: Rather, he acquires her when she is engaged and concealed, and he gives her to drink when she is married, who checks her water? And it was taught: "And the man shall be clear from iniquity," when the man is clear from iniquity - the waters check his wife, when the man is not clear from iniquity - the waters do not check his wife.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, דְּקַנִּי לָהּ כְּשֶׁהִיא אֲרוּסָה, וְאִיסְתְּתַר, וְנִכְנְסָה לְחוּפָּה וְלֹא נִבְעֲלָה — וּשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ יֵשׁ חוּפָּה לִפְסוּלוֹת.
human_translation: Rather, that he was jealous of her when she was betrothed, and she secluded herself and she had entered the wedding canopy but did not have intercourse Learn from this there is to wedding canopy unfit
llm_translation: Rather, he acquired her when she was betrothed, and she became forbidden, and she entered the wedding canopy but did not consummate the marriage - and we learn from this that there is a wedding canopy for disqualified women.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: וְתִסְבְּרָא דְּהָא מְתָרַצְתָּא הִיא? וְהָא כִּי אֲתָא רַבִּי אַחָא בַּר חֲנִינָא מִדָּרוֹמָא, אֲתָא וְאַיְיתִי מַתְנִיתָא בִּידֵיהּ: ״מִבַּלְעֲדֵי אִישֵׁךְ״, מִי שֶׁקָּדְמָה שְׁכִיבַת בַּעַל לַבּוֹעֵל, וְלֹא שֶׁקָּדְמָה שְׁכִיבַת בּוֹעֵל לַבַּעַל.
human_translation: Rava said: Do you hold that this is accurate But when Rabbi Aḥa bar Ḥanina came from the South, he came with baraita in hand: besides your husband” when the cohabitation of the husband preceded that of the adulterer, but not when the cohabitation of the adulterer preceded that of the husband.
llm_translation: Rava said: And do you think that this is a satisfactory answer? But when Rabbi Aḥa bar Ḥanina came from the South, he came and brought a baraita in his hand: "Apart from your husband," meaning that the lying down of the husband precedes the cohabitation, and not that the lying down of the cohabitation precedes the husband.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָמֵי בַּר חָמָא: מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ כְּגוֹן שֶׁבָּא עָלֶיהָ אֲרוּסָהּ בְּבֵית אָבִיהָ.
human_translation: Rami bar Ḥama said: You find it in such as her betrothed had intercourse with her in her father’s house.
llm_translation: Ramei bar Ḥama said: "He finds her, for example, that he came upon her betrothed in her father's house."

hebrew_text: דִּכְווֹתַהּ גַּבֵּי שׁוֹמֶרֶת יָבָם — שֶׁבָּא עָלֶיהָ יָבָם בְּבֵית חָמִיהָ,
human_translation: the corresponding with regard to a widow waiting for yavam , which yavam had intercourse with her in her father-in-law’s house,
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Dikvotah above the guardian of yavam — that the yavam came upon her in the house of her father-in-law,"

hebrew_text: שׁוֹמֶרֶת יָבָם קָרֵית לַהּ? אִשְׁתּוֹ מְעַלְּיָא הִיא, דְּהָא אָמַר רַב: קָנָה לַכֹּל! כִּשְׁמוּאֵל, דְּאָמַר: לֹא קָנָה אֶלָּא לִדְבָרִים הָאֲמוּרִים בַּפָּרָשָׁה.
human_translation: do you call her a widow waiting for her yavam ? she is his proper wife, as Rav said has acquired her for all with Shmuel, who said has acquired her only with regard to the matters stated in the chapter
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Does a yevamah who performs chalitzah acquire the right to marry anyone? She is considered his wife, for Rav said: She acquires the right to marry anyone! Like Shmuel, who said: She only acquires the right to marry for matters stated in the Torah portion."

hebrew_text: מִידֵּי הוּא טַעְמָא אֶלָּא לְרַב. הָא אָמַר רַב: קָנָה לַכֹּל. הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן — כְּגוֹן דַּעֲבַד בַּהּ מַאֲמָר, וּבֵית שַׁמַּאי הִיא, דְּאָמְרִי: מַאֲמָר קוֹנֶה קִנְיָן גָּמוּר.
human_translation: The only reason Rav, Didn’t Rav say he has acquired her for all With what are we dealing here? For example, performed levirate betrothal with her And this is Beit Shammai, who say: Levirate betrothal acquires a full-fledged
llm_translation: From him is the reason, but for Rav. For Rav said: Acquire for everyone. Here, what are we dealing with? For example, he transacted with it a statement, and it is Beit Shammai, who said: A statement acquires complete ownership.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי — הַיְינוּ אֲרוּסָה? וּלְטַעְמָיךְ, נְשׂוּאָה וּכְנוּסָה לָאו חֲדָא מִילְּתָא הִיא?! אֶלָּא: נְשׂוּאָה דִּידֵיהּ, וּכְנוּסָה דְּחַבְרֵיהּ. הָכָא נָמֵי: אֲרוּסָה דִּידֵיהּ, וְשׁוֹמֶרֶת יָבָם דְּחַבְרֵיהּ.
human_translation: If so, is a betrothed And according to your reasoning, a married and a fully married not a single matter? Rather, A married his own and married to that of his fellow, Here too, a betrothed his own and a widow waiting for her yavam that of his fellow,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: If so — is that the same as being betrothed? And according to your reasoning, is marriage and cohabitation not one and the same thing?! Rather: Betrothed to himself, and cohabitation with others. Here too: Betrothed to himself, and levirate marriage with others.

hebrew_text: רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר: הַאי תַּנָּא הוּא, דְּתַנְיָא: אֵין מְקַנִּין לָהּ לָאֲרוּסָה לְהַשְׁקוֹתָהּ כְּשֶׁהִיא אֲרוּסָה, אֲבָל מְקַנִּין אוֹתָהּ לְהַשְׁקוֹתָהּ כְּשֶׁהִיא נְשׂוּאָה.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: is this tanna , as it is taught in a One cannot be jealous over a betrothed to cause her to drink when she is betrothed, but one can be jealous over her to cause her to drink when she is married,
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: This Mishnah is the one that teaches: One does not acquire for her to betroth her to drink when she is betrothed, but one does acquire her to betroth her to drink when she is married.

hebrew_text: רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק אָמַר: עַל יְדֵי גִלְגּוּל.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: by means of extension.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: "Through the process of reincarnation."

hebrew_text: שְׁלַח רַב חֲנִינָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הָעוֹשֶׂה מַאֲמָר בִּיבִמְתּוֹ [וְיֵשׁ לוֹ אָח], אֲפִילּוּ הוּא כֹּהֵן וְהִיא כֹּהֶנֶת — פְּסָלָהּ מִן הַתְּרוּמָה.
human_translation: Rav Ḥanina sent in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: One who performs levirate betrothal with his yevama and he has a brother, even if he is a priest and she is a priest, he has disqualified her from teruma .
llm_translation: Rav Chanina sent in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: One who performs a matter with his yevamah and he has a brother, even if he is a Kohen and she is a Kohenet — he disqualifies her from terumah.

hebrew_text: לְמַאן? אִילֵּימָא לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר — אֵימַר דְּאָמַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר מִשְׁתַּמֶּרֶת לְבִיאָה פְּסוּלָה לָא אָכְלָה מִדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא, דְּרַבָּנַן מִי אָמַר? וְאֶלָּא לְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן. הַשְׁתָּא מִשְׁתַּמֶּרֶת לְבִיאָה פְּסוּלָה דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא אָכְלָה — דְּרַבָּנַן מִיבַּעְיָא?!
human_translation: According to whom If we say in accordance with Rabbi Meir, say that Rabbi Meir said reserved for an invalid intercourse may not eat by Torah by rabbinic did say Rather, in accordance with Rabbi Elazar and Rabbi Shimon, now reserved for intercourse prohibited by Torah may partake of is it necessary by rabbinic ?
llm_translation: To whom? If you say it is according to Rabbi Meir - say that Rabbi Meir holds that if a disqualified animal was consumed, it is not considered to have violated a biblical prohibition. But who says this according to the Rabbis? Rather, it is according to Rabbi Eliezer and Rabbi Shimon. If a disqualified animal was consumed, which is a biblical prohibition, do the Rabbis require this?!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, כִּי אֲתָא רָבִין, אָמַר: עָשָׂה בָּהּ מַאֲמָר בִּיבִמְתּוֹ — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל אָכְלָה, יֵשׁ לוֹ אָח חָלָל — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל אֵינָהּ אוֹכֶלֶת. לֹא נֶחְלְקוּ אֶלָּא שֶׁנָּתַן לָהּ גֵּט. רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: אוֹכֶלֶת. רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר: אֵינָהּ אוֹכֶלֶת.
human_translation: Rather, when Ravin came he said performed levirate betrothal with his yevama all agree may partake he has a brother a ḥalal , all agree may not partake They disagreed only he gave her a bill of divorce. Rabbi Yoḥanan said she may partake of Reish Lakish said she may not partake of
llm_translation: Rather, when Ravin came, he said: If he made a statement regarding his yevamah - the words of all sages are that she may eat terumah, he has a deceased brother - the words of all sages are that she may not eat terumah. They only disagreed when he gave her a bill of divorce. Rabbi Yochanan said: She may eat terumah. Reish Lakish said: She may not eat terumah.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר אוֹכֶלֶת — אֲפִילּוּ לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר דְּאָמַר אֵינָהּ אוֹכֶלֶת, הָנֵי מִילֵּי מִשְׁתַּמֶּרֶת לְבִיאָה פְּסוּלָה דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא, אֲבָל דְּרַבָּנַן — אָכְלָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said she may eat even according to Rabbi Meir, who said she may not partake this applies only waiting for intercourse invalid by Torah but by rabbinic she may partake
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: A woman who eats, even according to Rabbi Meir who says she does not eat, those words are safeguarded for a forbidden sexual relation by Torah law, but according to the Rabbis, she has eaten.

hebrew_text: וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר אֵינָהּ אוֹכֶלֶת — אֲפִילּוּ לְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן דְּאָמְרִי אוֹכֶלֶת, הָנֵי מִילֵּי דְּיֵשׁ לוֹ לְהַאֲכִיל בְּמָקוֹם אַחֵר, אֲבָל הָכָא, כֵּיוָן דְּאֵין לוֹ לְהַאֲכִיל בְּמָקוֹם אַחֵר — לָא.
human_translation: And Reish Lakish said: She may not partake because even according to Rabbi Elazar and Rabbi Shimon, who say she may partake this applies only as can entitle to partake in another case But here, since he cannot entitle to partake in other case no.
llm_translation: Reish Lakish said: It does not eat — even according to Rabbi Elazar and Rabbi Shimon who say it does eat, those words apply when it has another place to eat, but here, since it does not have another place to eat — no.

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא: הָכָא נָמֵי יֵשׁ לוֹ לְהַאֲכִילָהּ בְּחוֹזֶרֶת — חוֹזֶרֶת פָּסְקָה מִינֵּיהּ, וּקְרוֹבָה לְבֵי נָשָׁא, אֲבָל הָא אֲגִידָא בֵּיהּ.
human_translation: And lest you say here too, he can entitle her to partake of when she returns who returns has been severed from and she is close to her house [ bei nasha ], However, this is bound to
llm_translation: And if you will say: Here, there is for him to feed it with grass - the grass has withered from it, and it is close to the house of people, but here is a garden in it.

hebrew_text: נִתְאַרְמְלוּ אוֹ נִתְגָּרְשׁוּ וְכוּ׳. בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר יוֹסֵף מִשְּׁמוּאֵל: כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל שֶׁקִּדֵּשׁ אֶת הַקְּטַנָּה וּבָגְרָה תַּחְתָּיו,
human_translation: they were widowed or divorced Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Yosef raised a dilemma before Shmuel: a High Priest who betrothed a minor and she matured under him,
llm_translation: They became mixed or they were divorced, etc. Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Yosef inquired of Samuel: A high priest who betrothed a minor and she grew up beneath him,

hebrew_text: מַהוּ? בָּתַר נִישּׂוּאִין אָזְלִינַן, אוֹ בָּתַר אֵירוּסִין אָזְלִינַן.
human_translation: what is Do we follow marriage, Or do we follow betrothal,
llm_translation: What? After marriage we go, or after betrothal we go.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ, תְּנֵיתוּהָ: נִתְאַרְמְלוּ אוֹ נִתְגָּרְשׁוּ, מִן הַנִּשּׂוּאִין — פְּסוּלוֹת, מִן הָאֵירוּסִין — כְּשֵׁרוֹת.
human_translation: said to him: You learned it they were widowed or divorced from marriage, they are disqualified from betrothal, they are fit
llm_translation: He said to him, "You should teach it: if they were mixed up or divorced, from the betrothed - disqualified, from the married - valid."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לְשַׁוּוֹיֵהּ חֲלָלָה לָא קָמִיבַּעְיָא לִי, דְּבִיאָה הִיא דִּמְשַׁוְּויָה חֲלָלָה. כִּי קָמִיבַּעְיָא לִי: ״וְהוּא אִשָּׁה בִבְתוּלֶיהָ יִקָּח״, מַאי? קִיחָה דְקִדּוּשִׁין בָּעֵינַן, אוֹ קִיחָה דְנִישּׂוּאִין בָּעֵינַן.
human_translation: said to causing her a ḥalala I did not raise a dilemma, as that it is intercourse that causes her a ḥalala . When I raised a dilemma, “And he shall take a wife in her virginity” What Do we require the taking of betrothal or we require the taking of marriage
llm_translation: He said to him: "For the purpose of betrothal, I do not require it to be whole, for it is the entrance that needs to be whole. When I require it to be whole: 'And he shall take a wife in her virginity,' what is meant? Do we require the taking of betrothal, or the taking of marriage?"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ, הָא נָמֵי תְּנֵיתוּהָ: אֵירַס אֶת הָאַלְמָנָה וְנִתְמַנָּה לִהְיוֹת כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל — יִכְנוֹס. שָׁאנֵי הָתָם, דִּכְתִיב: ״יִקַּח אִשָּׁה״.
human_translation: said to him: This, too, you learned he betrothed a widow and was appointed to be High Priest, he may marry There it is different, as it is written: “He shall take for a wife”
llm_translation: He said to him, "Here is an example: If one betroths a widow with the intention that she become a High Priest's wife - he may enter. It is different there, for it is written: 'He shall take a wife'."

hebrew_text: הָכָא נָמֵי, כְּתִיב ״אִשָּׁה״! אַחַת וְלֹא שְׁתַּיִם.
human_translation: Here, too, it is written: a wife one but not two.
llm_translation: Here it is taught, it is written "a woman"! One and not two.

hebrew_text: וּמָה רָאִיתָ? הָא — אִישְׁתַּנִּי גּוּפַהּ, וְהָא — לָא אִישְׁתַּנִּי גּוּפַהּ.
human_translation: And what did you see this her body has changed, that her body has not changed.
llm_translation: And what did you see? This one - her body changed, and that one - her body did not change.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל לֹא יִשָּׂא אַלְמָנָה, בֵּין אַלְמָנָה מִן הָאֵירוּסִין, בֵּין אַלְמָנָה מִן הַנִּישּׂוּאִין. וְלֹא יִשָּׂא אֶת הַבּוֹגֶרֶת. רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן מַכְשִׁירִין בְּבוֹגֶרֶת [וְלֹא יִשָּׂא אֶת מוּכַּת עֵץ].
human_translation: A High Priest may not marry a widow, whether a widow from betrothal or a widow from marriage. And he may not marry a grown woman. Rabbi Elazar and Rabbi Shimon declare a grown woman fit And he may not marry a woman whose hymen was torn accidentally.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: A High Priest may not marry a widow, whether she is a widow from betrothal or a widow from marriage. And he may not marry a virgin who had been previously married. Rabbi Eliezer and Rabbi Shimon permit him to marry a virgin who had been previously married, but he may not marry a woman who was previously punished with wooden rods.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״אַלְמָנָה ... לֹא יִקַּח״ — בֵּין אַלְמָנָה מִן הָאֵירוּסִין, בֵּין אַלְמָנָה מִן הַנִּישּׂוּאִין. פְּשִׁיטָא! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: לֵילַף ״אַלְמָנָה״ ״אַלְמָנָה״ מִתָּמָר, מָה לְהַלָּן מִן הַנִּישּׂוּאִין — אַף כָּאן מִן הַנִּישּׂוּאִין, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: The Sages taught: “A widow…he shall not take” whether a widow from betrothal or a widow from marriage. obvious, lest you say that one should derive “widow” “widow,” Tamar, Just as there, from marriage, so too here from marriage. teaches us
llm_translation: The Sages taught: "A widow ... shall not take" - whether a widow from betrothal, or a widow from marriage. It is obvious! Lest you say: to differentiate "widow" "widow" from date, just as there from marriage - here too from marriage, it teaches us.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא הָכִי נָמֵי?! דּוּמְיָא דִּגְרוּשָׁה: מָה גְּרוּשָׁה — בֵּין מִן הַנִּישּׂוּאִין בֵּין מִן הָאֵירוּסִין, אַף אַלְמָנָה — בֵּין מִן הָאֵירוּסִין בֵּין מִן הַנִּישּׂוּאִין.
human_translation: And say it is indeed so, similar to a divorcée: Just as a divorcée whether from marriage or from betrothal, so too a widow whether from marriage or from betrothal.
llm_translation: And why not say so?! Like the case of a divorcee: What is a divorcee? — Whether from those who are married or from those who are betrothed, so too a widow — Whether from those who are betrothed or from those who are married.

hebrew_text: וְלֹא יִשָּׂא אֶת הַבּוֹגֶרֶת. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״וְהוּא אִשָּׁה בִבְתוּלֶיהָ יִקָּח״, פְּרָט לַבּוֹגֶרֶת — שֶׁכָּלוּ לָהּ בְּתוּלֶיהָ. דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן מַכְשִׁירִין בְּבוֹגֶרֶת.
human_translation: And may not marry a grown woman. The Sages taught “And he shall take a wife in her virginity” excludes a grown woman, whose hymen has worn away, the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Elazar and Rabbi Shimon declare a grown woman fit
llm_translation: "And he shall not take the virgin. The Rabbis taught: 'And he shall take a wife in her virginity,' excluding the bogeret - that he must take her in her virginity. These are the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Eliezer and Rabbi Shimon permit with a bogeret."

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי קָא מִיפַּלְגִי? רַבִּי מֵאִיר סָבַר: ״בְּתוּלָה״ — אֲפִילּוּ מִקְצָת בְּתוּלִים מַשְׁמַע. ״בְּתוּלֶיהָ״ — עַד דְּאִיכָּא כׇּל הַבְּתוּלִים. ״בִּבְתוּלֶיהָ״, בִּכְדַרְכָּהּ — אִין, שֶׁלֹּא כְּדַרְכָּהּ — לָא.
human_translation: With regard to what do they disagree? Rabbi Meir holds a virgin indicated even partial virginity, “her virginity,” if all of her virginity are “in her virginity” a typical yes, an atypical no,
llm_translation: With what do they disagree? Rabbi Meir holds: "in her virginity" - even some of the virgins is implied. "In her virgins" - until all the virgins. "In her virgins," in her usual manner - no, not in her usual manner - yes.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן סָבְרִי: ״בְּתוּלָה״ — בְּתוּלָה שְׁלֵימָה מַשְׁמַע. ״בְּתוּלֶיהָ״ — וַאֲפִילּוּ מִקְצָת בְּתוּלִים. ״בִּבְתוּלֶיהָ״ — עַד שֶׁיִּהְיוּ כׇּל בְּתוּלֶיהָ קַיָּימִין, בֵּין בִּכְדַרְכָּהּ, בֵּין שֶׁלֹּא כְּדַרְכָּהּ.
human_translation: And Rabbi Elazar and Rabbi Shimon hold a virgin, indicated a complete virgin “her virginity,” even partial virginity, “in her virginity” unless all of her virginity is intact, whether typical or atypical
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar and Rabbi Shimon hold: "B'tulah" - implies a complete virgin. "B'tuleha" - even some virgins. "Bivtuleha" - until all her virgins are intact, whether in the usual manner or not in the usual manner.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: נִבְעֲלָה שֶׁלֹּא כְּדַרְכָּהּ — פְּסוּלָה לַכְּהוּנָּה. מֵתִיב רָבָא: ״וְלוֹ תִהְיֶה לְאִשָּׁה״ — בְּאִשָּׁה הָרְאוּיָה לוֹ, פְּרָט לְאַלְמָנָה לְכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל, גְּרוּשָׁה וַחֲלוּצָה לְכֹהֵן הֶדְיוֹט.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Rav said: she had atypical sexual intercourse, she is disqualified from Priesthood, Rava raised an objection “And she shall be his wife” to a woman suitable for him, excluding a widow for a High Priest a divorcée or a ḥalutza for a common priest.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: If a woman was violated not in her usual manner - she is disqualified for the priesthood. Rava raises an objection: "And if she shall be for a man" - for a woman suitable for him, excluding a widow for the High Priest, a divorced woman, and a redeemed bondwoman for an ordinary priest.

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָּמֵי? אִלֵּימָא בִּכְדַרְכָּהּ, מַאי אִירְיָא מִשּׁוּם אַלְמָנָה? תִּיפּוֹק לֵיהּ מִשּׁוּם דְּהָוְיָא לַהּ בְּעוּלָה, אֶלָּא לָאו: שֶׁלֹּא כְּדַרְכָּהּ, וּמִשּׁוּם אַלְמָנָה — אִין, מִשּׁוּם בְּעוּלָה — לָא!
human_translation: What are the circumstances If we say in typical why specifically because a widow? Let him derive from that she is a non-virgin. Rather, not atypical and due to a widow, yes, due to a non-virgin, no,
llm_translation: "How are the laws of the case? If you say in her usual manner, what is the concern regarding widowhood? Let her go out because it is considered as if she is married to him. Rather, not in her usual manner, and because of widowhood - no, because of marriage - no!"

hebrew_text: הָא מַנִּי — רַבִּי מֵאִיר הִיא, וְרַב דְּאָמַר כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר.
human_translation: whose is this It is Rabbi Meir, and when Rav said in accordance with Rabbi Elazar,
llm_translation: This is a dispute: Rabbi Meir says it is, and Rav says it is like Rabbi Elazar.

hebrew_text: אִי כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, מַאי אִירְיָא מִשּׁוּם בְּעוּלָה? תִּיפּוֹק לֵיהּ דְּהָוְיָא לַהּ זוֹנָה! דְּהָא אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: פָּנוּי הַבָּא עַל הַפְּנוּיָה שֶׁלֹּא לְשֵׁם אִישׁוּת — עֲשָׂאָהּ זוֹנָה.
human_translation: If in accordance with Rabbi Elazar, why specifically because a non-virgin? Let him derive from that she is a zona , as Rabbi Elazar said: an unmarried man who had intercourse with an unmarried woman not for the purpose of marriage, he has caused her to become a zona .
llm_translation: If according to Rabbi Elazar, what is the status of a woman who engages in sexual relations out of wedlock? Let it be known that she is considered a prostitute! For Rabbi Elazar said: "If an unmarried man has relations with an unmarried woman not for the sake of marriage, he has made her a prostitute."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: כְּגוֹן שֶׁנִּבְעֲלָה לִבְהֵמָה, דְּהָתָם מִשּׁוּם בְּעוּלָה אִיכָּא, מִשּׁוּם זוֹנָה לֵיכָּא.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: to who had intercourse with an animal, as there is because a non-virgin, is not because a zona .
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: For example, if one married an animal, there is a case of adultery, but there is no case of prostitution.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי, מִמָּה נַפְשָׁךְ: אִי בְּעוּלָה הָוְיָא — זוֹנָה נָמֵי הָוְיָא. וְאִי זוֹנָה לָא הָוְיָא — בְּעוּלָה נָמֵי לָא הָוְיָא. וְכִי תֵּימָא: מִידֵי דְּהָוֵיא אַמוּכַּת עֵץ שֶׁלֹּא כְּדַרְכָּהּ, אִם כֵּן, אֵין לְךָ אִשָּׁה שֶׁכְּשֵׁרָה לַכְּהוּנָּה, שֶׁלֹּא נַעֲשֵׂית מוּכַּת עֵץ עַל יְדֵי צְרוֹר.
human_translation: Abaye said to him: Whichever way you If she is a non-virgin, she is a zona , and if she is not a zona she is not a non-virgin. And lest you say analogous to a woman who lost her virginity via penetration by a foreign object atypically, If so, you have no woman who is fit for the Priesthood, who has not lost her virginity via penetration by a foreign object by a pebble
llm_translation: He said to him, Abaye, from what is your soul: if it is in promiscuity, it is considered as a prostitute. And if it is not in promiscuity, it is not considered as a prostitute. And if you will say: since it is a wooden peg that is not in its proper place, then you have no woman who is fit for the priesthood, as she is not made into a peg by a bundle.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: בִּמְמָאֶנֶת.
human_translation: Rather, Rabbi Zeira said to one who refused
llm_translation: Rather, Rabbi Zeira said: "Bimma'enet."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שִׁימִי בַּר חִיָּיא: נִבְעֲלָה לִבְהֵמָה — כְּשֵׁרָה לַכְּהוּנָּה. תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: נִבְעֲלָה לְמִי שֶׁאֵינוֹ אִישׁ, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁבִּסְקִילָה — כְּשֵׁרָה לַכְּהוּנָּה.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimi bar Ḥiyya said: had intercourse with an animal fit for the priesthood. This is also taught had intercourse with one who is not a man, although stoning fit for the priesthood.
llm_translation: Rav Shimi bar Chiya said: If a woman marries an animal — she is valid for the priesthood. It was taught in a baraita similarly: If a woman marries someone who is not a man, even though she is liable to be stoned — she is valid for the priesthood.

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא רַב דִּימִי, אָמַר: מַעֲשֵׂה בְּרִיבָה אַחַת בְּהַיְתָלוֹ שֶׁהָיְתָה מְכַבֶּדֶת אֶת הַבַּיִת, וּרְבָעָהּ כֶּלֶב כּוּפְרִי מֵאַחֲרֶיהָ, וְהִכְשִׁירָהּ רַבִּי לַכְּהוּנָּה. אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: וּלְכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל. בִּימֵי רַבִּי כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל מִי הֲוָה? אֶלָּא — רְאוּיָה לְכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל.
human_translation: When Rav Dimi came he said: an incident a certain girl [ riva ] in Hitlu who was sweeping the house, and a village [ kufri ] dog sodomized her from behind. And Rabbi permitted her to the priesthood, Shmuel said: And to a High Priest, Was there a High Priest in the days of Rabbi Rather, she is fit for a High Priest.
llm_translation: When Rav Dimi came, he said: There was an incident in the town of Hiyatlo where a woman was disgracing the house, and a dog named Kufri was following her, and Rabbi deemed her fit for the priesthood. Samuel said: And for the high priest. In the days of Rabbi, was there a high priest? Rather - she was suitable for the high priesthood.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא מִפַּרְזַקְיָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: מְנַָא הָא מִילְּתָא דַּאֲמוּר רַבָּנַן אֵין זְנוּת לִבְהֵמָה? דִּכְתִיב: ״לֹא תָבִיא אֶתְנַן זוֹנָה וּמְחִיר כֶּלֶב״.
human_translation: Rava of Pirkin said to Rav Ashi: From where is this matter that the Sages stated there is no harlotry with regard to an animal? as it is written: “You shall not bring the hire of a harlot or the price of a dog
llm_translation: He said to him, Rava from Pumbedita to Rav Ashi: From where is the matter that the Rabbis say, "There is no bestiality"? As it is written: "You shall not bring the hire of a prostitute or the wages of a dog" (Deuteronomy 23:19).

hebrew_text: וּתְנַן: אֶתְנַן כֶּלֶב וּמְחִיר זוֹנָה — מוּתָּרִין, (מִשּׁוּם) שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״גַּם שְׁנֵיהֶם״ — שְׁנַיִם וְלֹא אַרְבָּעָה.
human_translation: And we learned The hire of a dog, and the price of a prostitute, are permitted because it is stated both of them, two and not four,
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: "Et'nan Kelev u'Mechir Zonah" - they are permitted, because it is stated: "Both of them" - two and not four.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֲנוּסַת עַצְמוֹ וּמְפוּתַּת עַצְמוֹ — לֹא יִשָּׂא, וְאִם נָשָׂא — נָשׂוּי. אֲנוּסַת חֲבֵירוֹ וּמְפוּתַּת חֲבֵירוֹ — לֹא יִשָּׂא, וְאִם נָשָׂא, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב אוֹמֵר: הַוָּלָד חָלָל, וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: הַוָּלָד כָּשֵׁר.
human_translation: The Sages taught: may not marry he himself raped and he himself seduced, And if he married he is married. raped by another and seduced by another he may not marry And if he married Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov says the child is a ḥalal , and the Rabbis say the offspring is unflawed.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: If one's bone is forced or broken - he should not marry, and if he marries - it is considered a valid marriage. If one's friend's bone is forced or broken - he should not marry, and if he marries, Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov says: the offspring is a mamzer, and the Sages say: the offspring is legitimate.

hebrew_text: אִם נָשָׂא — נָשׂוּי, אָמַר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב: וּמוֹצִיא בְּגֵט. וְאֶלָּא הָא דְּקָתָנֵי: אִם נָשָׂא נָשׂוּי! אָמַר רַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב: לוֹמַר
human_translation: if he married he is married. Rav Huna said Rav said: And he must divorce with a bill of divorce. But that which teaches: If he married he is married. Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov said: to say
llm_translation: If he married - married, Rav Huna said Rav said: and he issues a divorce. But rather, this that it teaches: if he married, married! Rav Acha bar Yaakov said: to say

hebrew_text: שֶׁאֵין מְשַׁלֵּם קְנָס בִּמְפוּתָּה.
human_translation: that he does not pay the fine of a seduced
llm_translation: That one does not pay a penalty in a case of enticement.

hebrew_text: אֲזַל רַב גְּבִיהָה מִבֵּי כָתִיל, אַמְרַהּ לִשְׁמַעְתָּא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב אָשֵׁי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: וְהָא רַב וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן דְּאָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ: בּוֹגֶרֶת וּמוּכַּת עֵץ — לֹא יִשָּׂא, וְאִם נָשָׂא — נָשׂוּי.
human_translation: Rav Geviha went from Bei Ketil he stated halakha before Rav Ashi, said to him: Isn’t it Rav and Rabbi Yoḥanan who both say: may not marry a grown woman and a woman whose hymen was torn accidentally, but if he married he is married?
llm_translation: Rav Geviha went from the house of Katil, she said to hear before Rav Ashe. He said to her: But Rav and Rabbi Yochanan who both said: A pregnant and a nursing woman should not fast, and if she did fast, it is considered as if she had taken an oath.

hebrew_text: אַלְמָא: סוֹפָהּ לִהְיוֹת בּוֹגֶרֶת תַּחְתָּיו, סוֹפָהּ לִהְיוֹת מוּכַּת עֵץ תַּחְתָּיו. הָכָא נָמֵי: סוֹפָהּ לִהְיוֹת בְּעוּלָה תַּחְתָּיו. קַשְׁיָא.
human_translation: Apparently, she will eventually be a grown woman under him, she will eventually be a woman whose hymen was torn under him, Here too, she will eventually be a non-virgin under him, difficult
llm_translation: The Gemara asks: Is it not the case that its end should be plowed beneath it, and its end should be struck with wood beneath it? Here, too, it should be the case that its end should be married beneath it. This is difficult.

hebrew_text: אֲנוּסַת חֲבֵירוֹ וּמְפוּתַּת חֲבֵירוֹ — לֹא יִשָּׂא. וְאִם נָשָׂא — רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב אוֹמֵר: הַוָּלָד חָלָל, וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: הַוָּלָד כָּשֵׁר. אָמַר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב. וְכֵן אָמַר רַב גִּידֵּל אָמַר רַב: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב.
human_translation: raped by another and seduced by another may not marry And if he married Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov says the child is a ḥalal , and the Rabbis say the offspring is unflawed. Rav Huna said Rav said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov. And, so too, Rav Giddel said Rav said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov.
llm_translation: The coerced wife of his friend and the seduced wife of his friend - he shall not marry. And if he married - Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov says: The offspring is a halal, and the sages say: The offspring is legitimate. Rav Huna said in the name of Rav: The halacha is according to Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov. And so said Rav Giddel in the name of Rav: The halacha is according to Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי, אָמַר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב — סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר.
human_translation: Some say Rav Huna said that Rav said: What is the reason of Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov? He holds in accordance with Rabbi Elazar,
llm_translation: There are some who say, Rav Huna said Rav: What is the reason for Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov's opinion? He holds like Rabbi Elazar.

hebrew_text: וּמִי סָבַר לַהּ כְּוָתֵיהּ? וְהָא קַיְימָא לַן: מִשְׁנַת רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב קַב וְנָקִי. וְאִילּוּ בְּהָא אָמַר רַב עַמְרָם אָמַר רַב: אֵין הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר. קַשְׁיָא.
human_translation: Does hold in accordance with Don’t we maintain the teaching of Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov a kav but is clean, However, with regard to this Rav Amram said that Rav said the halakha is not in accordance with Rabbi Elazar. difficult.
llm_translation: And who holds like him? But we have established: From the teaching of Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov, "A kab and clean." And if in this, Rav Amram said in the name of Rav: The halakha does not follow Rabbi Elazar. It is difficult.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: בְּיֵשׁ חָלָל מֵחַיָּיבֵי עֲשֵׂה קָמִיפַּלְגִי. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב סָבַר: יֵשׁ חָלָל מֵחַיָּיבֵי עֲשֵׂה, וְרַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: אֵין חָלָל מֵחַיָּיבֵי עֲשֵׂה.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: disagree with regard to whether there is a ḥalal from liable for a positive mitzva. Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov holds there is a ḥalal from liable for a positive mitzva, and the Rabbis hold there is no ḥalal from liable for a positive mitzva.
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: In a case where there is a conflict between positive and negative commandments, one is liable for the positive commandment. Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov holds: In a case of conflict, one is liable for the positive commandment, while the Sages hold: One is not liable for the positive commandment in such a case.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב — דִּכְתִיב: ״אַלְמָנָה וּגְרוּשָׁה וַחֲלָלָה זוֹנָה אֶת אֵלֶּה לֹא יִקָּח כִּי אִם בְּתוּלָה וְגוֹ׳״, וּכְתִיב: ״וְלֹא יְחַלֵּל זַרְעוֹ בְּעַמָּיו״, אַכּוּלְּהוּ.
human_translation: What is the reason of Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov? As it is written: “A widow, or one divorced, or a ḥalala , or a zona , these shall he not take; but a virgin and it states “And he shall not profane his seed among his people” to all of them,
llm_translation: What is the reason for Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov's opinion? Because it is written: "A widow, a divorced woman, a defiled woman, a harlot, these he shall not take, but a virgin, etc." And it is also written: "And he shall not defile his offspring among his people." Let him eat it.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן: ״אֵלֶּה״ הִפְסִיק הָעִנְיָן. וְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב אָמַר: ״אֵלֶּה״ לְמַעוֹטֵי נִדָּה.
human_translation: And the Sages “these” concluded that matter. And Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov said: “these” to exclude a menstruating woman.
llm_translation: The scholars said: "These" interrupted the matter. And Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov said: "These" to exclude cases of impurity.

hebrew_text: כְּמַאן אָזְלָא הָא דְּתַנְיָא: מֵ״אֵלֶּה״ אַתָּה עוֹשֶׂה חָלָל, וְאִי אַתָּה עוֹשֶׂה חָלָל מִנִּדָּה. כְּמַאן — כְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב. וְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב, נִכְתְּבֵיהּ לְ״אֵלֶּה״ לְבַסּוֹף? קַשְׁיָא.
human_translation: In accordance with whose is that which is taught From “these you cause a ḥalal , but you do not cause a ḥalal with a menstruating woman. In accordance with whose It is in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov. And Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov, let write these at the end, difficult.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: As to where this goes, as it was taught: "From 'אֵלֶּה' you make a hollow, and if you make a hollow from 'אֵלֶּה,' it is like making a hollow from 'נִדָּה.'" As to where - like Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov. And Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov, was it written for 'אֵלֶּה' at the end? It is difficult.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֲחוֹתוֹ אֲרוּסָה, רַבִּי מֵאִיר וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמְרִים: מִטַּמֵּא לָהּ. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמְרִים: אֵין מִטַּמֵּא לָהּ. אֲנוּסָה וּמְפוּתָּה — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל אֵין מִטַּמֵּא לָהּ. וּמוּכַּת עֵץ — אֵין מִטַּמֵּא לָהּ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן. שֶׁהָיָה רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: רְאוּיָה לְכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל — מִטַּמֵּא לָהּ, שֶׁאֵין רְאוּיָה לְכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל — אֵין מִטַּמֵּא לָהּ.
human_translation: The Sages taught: betrothed sister, Rabbi Meir and Rabbi Yehuda say: He become impure for her Rabbi Yosei and Rabbi Shimon say: He not become impure for her. raped or seduced, all agree he may not become impure for her whose hymen was torn accidentally, he may not become impure for her; the statement of Rabbi Shimon, as Rabbi Shimon would say fit for a High Priest, he become impure for her, not fit for a High Priest, he may not become impure for her.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: If his sister is betrothed, Rabbi Meir and Rabbi Yehuda say: she becomes impure for him. Rabbi Yosei and Rabbi Shimon say: she does not become impure for him. In the case of one who is raped or seduced - everyone agrees she does not become impure. And if she is struck with a piece of wood - she does not become impure, the words of Rabbi Shimon. For Rabbi Shimon used to say: If she is fit for a High Priest - she becomes impure for him, but if she is not fit for a High Priest - she does not become impure for him.

hebrew_text: וּבוֹגֶרֶת — מִטַּמֵּא לָהּ, דִּבְרֵי כׇּל אָדָם.
human_translation: And a grown woman, he become impure for her according to everyone.
llm_translation: And bogeret — from impurity for her, the words of all people.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה — דְּדָרְשִׁי הָכִי: ״וְלַאֲחוֹתוֹ הַבְּתוּלָה״ — פְּרָט לַאֲנוּסָה וּמְפוּתָּה.
human_translation: What is the reason of Rabbi Meir and Rabbi Yehuda? They expound as follows: “And for his virgin sister” excludes raped or seduced,
llm_translation: What is the reason for Rabbi Meir and Rabbi Yehuda? Because they interpreted thus: "And to his virgin sister" - excluding a woman violated and defiled.

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל שֶׁאֲנִי מוֹצִיא אַף מוּכַּת עֵץ — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אֲשֶׁר לֹא הָיְתָה לְאִישׁ״. מִי שֶׁהֲוָיָיתָהּ עַל יְדֵי אִישׁ, יָצְאָה זוֹ שֶׁאֵין הֲוָיָיתָהּ עַל יְדֵי אִישׁ. ״הַקְּרוֹבָה״ — לְרַבּוֹת הָאֲרוּסָה. ״אֵלָיו״ — לְרַבּוֹת הַבּוֹגֶרֶת.
human_translation: might that I should exclude even a woman whose hymen was torn accidentally The verse states: “Who has had no man,” one whose becoming by a man, This whose becoming was not by a man excluded “Who is near”; to include a betrothed “To him”; to include a grown woman.
llm_translation: I might have thought that I can also derive the law from a wooden peg - the Torah teaches otherwise: "which was not under the control of a man." If it was under the control of a man, this one is excluded; if it was not under the control of a man, this one is included. "The close relative" - to include the betrothed woman. "To him" - to include the convert.

hebrew_text: הָא לְמָה לִי קְרָא? וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר: ״בְּתוּלָה״ — אֲפִילּוּ מִקְצָת בְּתוּלָה מַשְׁמַע! אִיצְטְרִיךְ, סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא נֵילַף ״בְּתוּלָה״ ״בְּתוּלָה״ מֵהָתָם: מָה לְהַלָּן נַעֲרָה, אַף כָּאן נָמֵי נַעֲרָה, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: Why do I need a verse Didn’t Rabbi Meir say “virgin” indicates even partly a virgin, necessary, enter your mind to say we should derive “virgin” “virgin” from there, just as there a young woman and not a grown woman, so too here a young woman. teaches us
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Why do I need a verse? And Rabbi Meir said: 'Virgin' - even a partial virgin is implied! It was necessary, for your mind might say, let us learn 'virgin' from 'virgin' there: just as there it refers to a young woman, so too here it also refers to a young woman, teaching us."

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, מַאי טַעְמַיְיהוּ — דָּרְשִׁי הָכִי: ״וְלַאֲחוֹתוֹ הַבְּתוּלָה״ — פְּרָט לַאֲנוּסָה וּמְפוּתָּה וּמוּכַּת עֵץ, ״אֲשֶׁר לֹא הָיְתָה״ — פְּרָט לַאֲרוּסָה, ״הַקְּרוֹבָה״ — לְרַבּוֹת אֲרוּסָה שֶׁנִּתְגָּרְשָׁה, ״אֵלָיו״ — לְרַבּוֹת אֶת הַבּוֹגֶרֶת. ״הַקְּרוֹבָה״ — לְרַבּוֹת אֲרוּסָה שֶׁנִּתְגָּרְשָׁה,
human_translation: And Rabbi Yosei and Rabbi Shimon, what is their reason? They expound as follows: “And for his virgin sister” excludes raped or seduced and a woman whose hymen was torn accidentally, “Who has had no excludes a betrothed “Who is near”; to include a betrothed who was divorced, “To him”; to include a grown woman. “who is near” to include a betrothed who was divorced?
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei and Rabbi Shimon, what is their reasoning? They interpreted thus: "And to his sister, the virgin" - to exclude one who was raped, seduced, or struck by a wooden object. "Who has not been" - to exclude one who is engaged. "Who is near" - to include a betrothed woman who was divorced. "To him" - to include a convert. "Who is near" - to include a betrothed woman who was divorced.

hebrew_text: וְהָא אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: רְאוּיָה לְכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל — מִטַּמֵּא לָהּ, שֶׁאֵין רְאוּיָה לְכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל — אֵין מִטַּמֵּא לָהּ. שָׁאנֵי הָתָם, דְּרַבִּי רַחֲמָנָא ״קְרוֹבָה״.
human_translation: Didn’t Rabbi Shimon say: fit for a High Priest, become impure for her, not fit for a High Priest, may not become impure for her? It is different there, as the Merciful One includes near,
llm_translation: And this, Rabbi Shimon said: If it is fitting for the High Priest - she becomes impure, but if it is not fitting for the High Priest - she does not become impure. It is different there, for Rabbi Rachmana says "close."

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, מוּכַּת עֵץ נָמֵי! [רַבִּי] ״קְרוֹבָה״ — אַחַת וְלֹא שְׁתַּיִם. וּמָה רָאִיתָ? הָא — אִתְעֲבִיד בַּהּ מַעֲשֶׂה, הָא — לָא אִתְעֲבִיד בַּהּ מַעֲשֵׂה.
human_translation: If so, a woman whose hymen was torn accidentally also included. near, one and not two. And what did you see this an action has been performed that no action has been performed
llm_translation: So it is, a wooden beam is considered stationary! Rabbi "Close" - one and not two. And what did you see? This - if it is used for work, this - if it is not used for work.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי, מִדְּשַׁבְקֵיהּ לְבַר זוּגֵיהּ, מִכְּלָל דִּבְמוּכַּת עֵץ כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר סְבִירָא לֵיהּ, מְנָא לֵיהּ — מִ״לֹּא הָיְתָה לְאִישׁ״.
human_translation: From that Rabbi Yosei left his partner, it may be inferred that with regard to a woman whose hymen was torn accidentally he holds in accordance with Rabbi Meir, From where he from has had no man,”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei, from when he left his son-in-law, from the principle of the tree of Mukkat like Rabbi Meir, he holds it likely, from where does he derive it - "from 'she was not for a man'."

hebrew_text: וְהָא אַפֵּיקְתֵּיהּ! חַד מִ״לֹּא הָיְתָה״, וְחַד מִ״לְּאִישׁ״.
human_translation: Haven’t you derived one from “has had no,” and one from “man,”
llm_translation: And behold, she has produced it! One from "lo haytah," and one from "le'ish."

hebrew_text: ״אֵלָיו״ — לְרַבּוֹת הַבּוֹגֶרֶת. וְהָא אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: ״בְּתוּלָה״ — בְּתוּלָה שְׁלֵימָה מַשְׁמַע! טַעְמָא דִּידֵיהּ נָמֵי הָתָם מֵהָכָא, דְּדָרֵישׁ הָכִי מִדְּ״אֵלָיו״ — לְרַבּוֹת הַבּוֹגֶרֶת, מִכְלָל דִּ״בְתוּלָה״ — בְּתוּלָה שְׁלֵימָה מַשְׁמַע.
human_translation: “to him,” to include a grown woman. Didn’t Rabbi Shimon say virgin indicates a complete virgin, His reason there is also from here, as he expounds as follows: From that “to him” to include a grown woman, inferred that virgin indicates a complete virgin.
llm_translation: "To him" - to include the mature woman. But didn't Rabbi Shimon say: "Virgin" - implies a complete virgin! The reason for his opinion is also derived from here, as he interprets it thus: from the word "to him" - to include the mature woman, from the generalization of "virgin" - implies a complete virgin.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַי אוֹמֵר: גִּיּוֹרֶת פְּחוּתָה מִבַּת שָׁלֹשׁ שָׁנִים וְיוֹם אֶחָד — כְּשֵׁירָה לַכְּהוּנָּה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְכֹל הַטַּף בַּנָּשִׁים אֲשֶׁר לֹא יָדְעוּ מִשְׁכַּב זָכָר הַחֲיוּ לָכֶם״, וַהֲרֵי פִּנְחָס עִמָּהֶם.
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai says: A female convert less than three years and one day old is permitted to the priesthood, as it is stated: “But all the women children that have not known man by lying with him, keep alive for yourselves” and Pinehas was with them
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai says: A convert who is less than three years old and one day - she is fit for the priesthood, as it is stated: "But all the young girls who have not known a man by lying with him, keep alive for yourselves," and behold, Pinchas was with them.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן? לַעֲבָדִים וְלִשְׁפָחוֹת. אִי הָכִי, בַּת שָׁלֹשׁ שָׁנִים וְיוֹם אֶחָד נָמֵי?
human_translation: And the Rabbis, as slaves and as maidservants, If so, age of three years and one day old also
llm_translation: The sages? For slaves and maidservants. If so, a girl of three years and one day also?

hebrew_text: כִּדְרַב הוּנָא. דְּרַב הוּנָא רָמֵי, כְּתִיב: ״כׇּל אִשָּׁה יֹדַעַת אִישׁ לְמִשְׁכַּב זָכָר הֲרֹגוּ״, הָא אֵינָהּ יוֹדַעַת — קַיֵּימוּ, מִכְּלָל דְּהַטַּף, בֵּין יָדְעוּ בֵּין לֹא יָדְעוּ — קַיֵּימוּ. וּכְתִיב: ״וְכׇל הַטַּף בַּנָּשִׁים אֲשֶׁר לֹא יָדְעוּ מִשְׁכַּב זָכָר הַחֲיוּ לָכֶם״, הָא יָדְעִי — הֲרוֹגוּ!
human_translation: as Rav Huna, as Rav Huna raised a contradiction: It is written “Kill every woman that has known man by lying with him” has not known you may keep by inference that the children, you may keep whether they knew or they did not know And it is written “But all the women children that have not known man by lying with him, keep alive for yourselves” they have known you must kill
llm_translation: As Rav Huna said: Rav Huna raises a contradiction, as it is written: "Every woman who knows a man for lying with a male, they shall be put to death." If she does not know - the law is established, from the general principle of "whether they knew or did not know" - the law is established. And it is written: "But all the young girls who have not known a man by lying with a male, keep alive for yourselves." If they knew - they shall be put to death!

hebrew_text: הֱוֵי אוֹמֵר בִּרְאוּיָה לִיבָּעֵל הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר.
human_translation: You must say that the verse is speaking of fit for intercourse.
llm_translation: "Be said in readiness to be married, the Scripture speaks."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: ״וְכׇל אִשָּׁה יוֹדַעַת אִישׁ״ — בִּרְאוּיָה לִיבָּעֵל הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר. אַתָּה אוֹמֵר בִּרְאוּיָה לִיבָּעֵל, אוֹ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא נִבְעֲלָה מַמָּשׁ? כְּשֶׁהוּא אוֹמֵר: ״וְכׇל הַטַּף בַּנָּשִׁים אֲשֶׁר לֹא יָדְעוּ מִשְׁכַּב זָכָר״, הֱוֵי אוֹמֵר: בִּרְאוּיָה לִיבָּעֵל הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר.
human_translation: This is also taught “Every woman that has known man”; the verse is speaking of who is fit for intercourse. you say to fit for intercourse, it is only one who has actually had intercourse? When states: “But all the women children that have not known man by lying with him, you must say that the verse is speaking of who is fit for intercourse.
llm_translation: It was taught in a baraita: "And every woman who knows a man" — when she is fit to be married, the verse is speaking. You might say, when she is fit to be married, or is it only if she has actually been married? When it says, "And all the young girls who have not known a man intimately," you must say: the verse is speaking when she is fit to be married.

hebrew_text: מְנָא יָדְעִי? אָמַר רַב הוּנָא בַּר בִּיזְנָא אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן חֲסִידָא: הֶעֱבִירוּם לִפְנֵי הַצִּיץ. כׇּל שֶׁפָּנֶיהָ מוֹרִיקוֹת — בְּיָדוּעַ שֶׁהִיא רְאוּיָה לִיבָּעֵל, כֹּל שֶׁאֵין פָּנֶיהָ מוֹרִיקוֹת — בְּיָדוּעַ שֶׁאֵינָהּ רְאוּיָה לִיבָּעֵל. אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: סִימָן לַעֲבֵירָה — הִדְרוֹקָן.
human_translation: From where did they know Rav Huna bar Bizna said that Rabbi Shimon Ḥasida said: They passed them before the frontplate Any whose face turned sallow, it was known that she was fit for intercourse, any whose face did not turn sallow, it known that she was not fit for intercourse. Rav Naḥman said: A sign of transgression is hidrokan ,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Mena yadai? Amar Rav Huna bar Bizna Amar Rabbi Shimon Chasida: He'evirum lifnei hatzitz. Kol she'paneha morikot - beyadua shehi reuyah liyiba'al, kol she'ein paneha morikot - beyadua she'einah reuyah liyiba'al. Amar Rav Nachman: Siman la'aveirah - hidrokan." English translation: "How do I know? Rav Huna son of Bizna said in the name of Rabbi Shimon the Pious: They brought them before the forehead plate. If her face is pale - it is known that she is fit to be married, if her face is not pale - it is known that she is not fit to be married. Rav Nachman said: A sign of promiscuity - a wrinkled forehead."

hebrew_text: כַּיּוֹצֵא בַּדָּבָר, אַתָּה אוֹמֵר: ״וַיִּמְצְאוּ מִיּוֹשְׁבֵי יָבֵשׁ גִּלְעָד אַרְבַּע מֵאוֹת נַעֲרָה בְתוּלָה אֲשֶׁר לֹא יָדְעוּ אִישׁ לְמִשְׁכַּב זָכָר״, מְנָא יָדְעִי? אָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא: הוֹשִׁיבוּם עַל פִּי חָבִית שֶׁל יַיִן, בְּעוּלָה — רֵיחָהּ נוֹדֵף, בְּתוּלָה — אֵין רֵיחָהּ נוֹדֵף.
human_translation: Similarly, you say “And they found among the inhabitants of Jabesh-gilead four hundred young virgins that had not known man by lying with him” From where did they know Rav Kahana said: They sat them on the opening of a barrel of wine. a non-virgin, her breath smell a virgin, her breath did not smell
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "As an example of this matter, you say: 'And they found among the inhabitants of Yavesh Gilead four hundred young virgins who had not known a man by lying with a male.' How do I know that they did not know? Rav Kahana said: They made them sit on the edge of a barrel of wine, if she is married - her scent is emitted, if she is a virgin - her scent is not emitted." English translation:

hebrew_text: וּנְעַבְּרִינְהוּ לִפְנֵי צִיץ? אֲמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב נָתָן: ״לְרָצוֹן לָהֶם״ כְּתִיב, לְרָצוֹן וְלֹא לְפוּרְעָנוּת. אִי הָכִי בְּמִדְיָן נָמֵי? אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: ״לָהֶם״ כְּתִיב, לָהֶם — לְרָצוֹן וְלֹא לְפוּרְעָנוּת, וּלְגוֹיִם — אֲפִילּוּ לְפוּרְעָנוּת.
human_translation: They should passed them before the frontplate, Rav Kahana, son of Rav Natan, said: that they may be accepted for acceptance but not for calamity. If so, also with regard to Midian. Rav Ashi said: “they” is written for them, for acceptance but not for calamity; but for gentiles even for calamity.
llm_translation: And should we pass them before the tzitz? Rav Kahana, son of Rav Nathan, said: "For their acceptance" is written, for acceptance and not for punishment. If so, in Midian as well? Rav Ashe said: "For them" is written, for them — for acceptance and not for punishment, and for the nations — even for punishment.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב בַּר אִידִי אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַאי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי זֵירָא לְרַבִּי יַעֲקֹב בַּר אִידִי: בְּפֵירוּשׁ שְׁמִיעַ לָךְ, אוֹ מִכְּלָלָא שְׁמִיעַ לָךְ?
human_translation: Rabbi Ya’akov bar Idi said Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai. Rabbi Zeira said to Rabbi Ya’akov bar Idi: you hear explicitly or you learn by inference?
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yaakov bar Idi said Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi: The halakha is according to Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai. Rabbi Zeira said to Rabbi Yaakov bar Idi: Do you have a specific teaching, or is it a general teaching?

hebrew_text: מַאי כְּלָלָא? דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: עִיר אַחַת הָיְתָה בְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁקָּרָא עָלֶיהָ עַרְעָר, וְשִׁגֵּר רַבִּי אֶת רַבִּי רוֹמָנוּס וּבְדָקָהּ, וּמָצָא בָּהּ בַּת גִּיּוֹרֶת פְּחוּתָה מִבַּת שָׁלֹשׁ שָׁנִים וְיוֹם אֶחָד, וְהִכְשִׁירָהּ רַבִּי לַכְּהוּנָּה. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בְּפֵירוּשׁ שְׁמִיעַ לִי.
human_translation: What inference As Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: There was a certain city in Eretz Yisrael where they contested And Rabbi sent Rabbi Romanus, and he examined and found it the daughter a convert less than three years and one day old, And Rabbi permitted her to the priesthood. said to him: I heard explicitly
llm_translation: What is the general principle? For Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: There was once a city in the land of Israel called Ar'ar, and Rabbi sent Rabbi Romanus to investigate it. He found there a convert girl who was less than three years old by one day, and Rabbi deemed her fit for priesthood. He said to him: Explain it to me clearly.

hebrew_text: וְאִי מִכְּלָלָא מַאי? דִּלְמָא שָׁאנֵי הָתָם: הוֹאִיל וְאִנְּסִיב — אִנְּסִיב. דְּהָא רַב וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן דְּאָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ: בּוֹגֶרֶת וּמוּכַּת עֵץ לֹא יִשָּׂא, וְאִם נָשָׂא — נָשׂוּי.
human_translation: And if by inference, what Perhaps it was different there, since she married she married as Rav and Rabbi Yoḥanan who both say: may not marry a grown woman and a woman whose hymen was torn accidentally, but if he married he is married
llm_translation: "And if so, what is the implication? Perhaps it is different there, since if one is compelled - he is compelled. For Rav and Rabbi Yochanan both said: One may not carry a bundle or a stick on Shabbat, and if he did carry - he is liable."

hebrew_text: הָכִי הַשְׁתָּא?! בִּשְׁלָמָא הָתָם: סוֹפָהּ לִהְיוֹת בּוֹגֶרֶת תַּחְתָּיו, סוֹפָהּ לִהְיוֹת בְּעוּלָה תַּחְתָּיו. הָכָא, סוֹפָהּ לִהְיוֹת זוֹנָה תַּחְתָּיו?!
human_translation: How can be compared? Granted, there, will eventually be a grown woman under him, she will eventually be a non-virgin under him. here, will she eventually be a zona under him?
llm_translation: So now?! Granted there: its end to be a virgin beneath him, its end to be married beneath him. Here, its end to be a prostitute beneath him?!

hebrew_text: רַב סָפְרָא מַתְנֵי לַהּ מִכְּלָלָא וְקַשְׁיָא לֵיהּ, וּמְשַׁנֵּי (לֵיהּ) הָכִי.
human_translation: Rav Safra taught this by inference, And difficult for him, and he resolved it in this
llm_translation: Rav Safra teaches it to him from the general principle, and it is difficult for him, and he repeats it to him thus.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא כָּהֲנָא דְּאִנְּסִיב גִּיּוֹרֶת פְּחוּתָה מִבַּת שָׁלֹשׁ שָׁנִים וְיוֹם אֶחָד. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: מַאי הַאי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב בַּר אִידִי אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַאי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: זִיל אַפֵּיק, וְאִי לָא — מַפֵּיקְנָא לָךְ רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב בַּר אִידִי מֵאוּנָּךְ.
human_translation: A certain priest married a convert, less than three years and one day old. Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said to him: What is this? He said to him: as Rabbi Ya’akov bar Idi said that Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said the halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai. He said to him: Go remove And if not, I will remove Rabbi Ya’akov bar Idi from your ear [ me’unekh ] for you.
llm_translation: That Kehana who married a convert minor of three years and one day. Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said to him: What is this? He said to him, as Rabbi Yaakov bar Idi said in the name of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi: The halacha is according to Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai. He said to him: Go out, and if not, I will expel you from your place, Rabbi Yaakov bar Idi.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, וְכֵן הָיָה רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַאי אוֹמֵר:
human_translation: It is taught And similarly, Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai would say:
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: And so too Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai said:

hebrew_text: קִבְרֵי גוֹיִם אֵינָן מְטַמְּאִין בְּאֹהֶל, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְאַתֵּן צֹאנִי צֹאן מַרְעִיתִי אָדָם אַתֶּם״. אַתֶּם קְרוּיִין אָדָם, וְאֵין הַגּוֹיִם קְרוּיִין אָדָם.
human_translation: The graves of gentiles do not render impure through a tent, as it is stated: “And you My sheep, the sheep of My pasture, are men [ adam ]” you, are called men [ adam ] but gentiles are not called men [ adam ].
llm_translation: Graves of gentiles do not impart impurity in a tent, as it is stated: "And you are My flock, the flock of My pasture, you are men." You are called men, and gentiles are not called men.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: ״וְנֶפֶשׁ אָדָם שִׁשָּׁה עָשָׂר אָלֶף״! מִשּׁוּם בְּהֵמָה.
human_translation: raises an objection “And the persons [ nefesh adam ] were sixteen thousand” due to animals
llm_translation: Challenger: "And the soul of man is sixteen thousand!" Because of an animal.

hebrew_text: ״אֲשֶׁר יֶשׁ בָּהּ הַרְבֵּה מִשְׁתֵּים עֶשְׂרֵה רִבּוֹא אָדָם אֲשֶׁר לֹא יָדַע בֵּין יְמִינוֹ לִשְׂמֹאלוֹ (וּבְהֵמָה רַבָּה)״! מִשּׁוּם בְּהֵמָה.
human_translation: “Wherein are more than one hundred and twenty thousand men [ adam ] that cannot discern between their right hand and their left hand, and also much cattle” due to animals
llm_translation: "Which has in it many twelve ten thousand man who not know between his right to his left (and much cattle)!" Because of cattle.

hebrew_text: ״כֹּל הוֹרֵג נֶפֶשׁ וְכֹל נוֹגֵעַ בֶּחָלָל תִּתְחַטְּאוּ״! דִּלְמָא אִיקְּטִיל חַד מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל. וְרַבָּנַן: ״לֹא נִפְקַד מִמֶּנּוּ אִישׁ״. וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַי: ״לֹא נִפְקַד מִמֶּנּוּ אִישׁ״ — לַעֲבֵירָה.
human_translation: “Whoever has killed anyone, and whoever has touched any slain, purify yourselves” Perhaps a Jew was killed, And the Rabbis “Not one man of us is missing” And Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai not one man of us is missing transgression,
llm_translation: "Whoever kills a soul, and whoever touches a corpse shall be impure!" Perhaps one of the Israelites was killed. And the Sages say: "No man was found missing from among us." But Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai says: "No man was found missing from among us" — for evil intent.

hebrew_text: רָבִינָא אָמַר: נְהִי דְּמַעֲטִינְהוּ קְרָא מֵאִטַּמּוֹיֵי בְּאֹהֶל, דִּכְתִיב: ״אָדָם כִּי יָמוּת בְּאֹהֶל״, מִמַּגָּע וּמַשָּׂא מִי מַעֲטִינְהוּ קְרָא?
human_translation: Ravina said Granted, the verse excluded from rendering impure through a tent, as it is written: “When a man [ adam ] dies in a tent” did the verse exclude them from touching and carrying?
llm_translation: Ravina said: "Yes, since the verse minimized them from the impurity of the tent, as it is written: 'When a man dies in a tent,' who is minimized from contact and carrying?"

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אֵירַס אֶת הָאַלְמָנָה וְנִתְמַנָּה לִהְיוֹת כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל — יִכְנוֹס. וּמַעֲשֶׂה בִּיהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן גַּמְלָא שֶׁקִּדֵּשׁ אֶת מָרְתָּא בַּת בַּיְתּוֹס, וּמִנָּהוּ הַמֶּלֶךְ לִהְיוֹת כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל, וּכְנָסָהּ. שׁוֹמֶרֶת יָבָם שֶׁנָּפְלָה לִפְנֵי כֹּהֵן הֶדְיוֹט, וְנִתְמַנָּה לִהְיוֹת כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁעָשָׂה בָּהּ מַאֲמָר — הֲרֵי זֶה לֹא יִכְנוֹס.
human_translation: betrothed a widow and was appointed to be High Priest, he may marry And an incident with Yehoshua ben Gamla, who betrothed Marta bat Baitos, and the king appointed him to be High Priest, and married her. a widow waiting for her yavam who happened before a common priest, and he was appointed to be High Priest, even if he performed levirate betrothal with her, he may not marry her,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If one betroths a widow with the intention that she will become the wife of the High Priest, he may enter the priesthood. There was an incident involving Yehoshua ben Gamla, who betrothed Martha, the daughter of Baytos, and the king appointed her to be the wife of the High Priest, and she entered the priesthood. If a yevamah (a widow awaiting levirate marriage) falls before an ordinary priest, and he is appointed to be the High Priest, even though he performed the act of yibum with her, he may not enter the priesthood.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מִנַּיִן שֶׁאִם אֵירַס אֶת הָאַלְמָנָה וְנִתְמַנָּה לִהְיוֹת כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל שֶׁיִּכְנוֹס — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״יִקַּח אִשָּׁה״. אִי הָכִי, שׁוֹמֶרֶת יָבָם נָמֵי! ״אִשָּׁה״, וְלֹא יְבָמָה.
human_translation: The Sages taught: From where that if betrothed a widow and was appointed to be High Priest, that he may marry The verse states: “Shall he take for a wife” If so, a widow waiting for her yavam also “wife” not a yevama ,
llm_translation: The Sages taught: From where do we derive that if one betroths a widow and she is designated to marry a High Priest, he should enter the priesthood? The verse states: "He shall take a wife." If not for this, a waiting sister-in-law should also be included! "A wife," and not a waiting sister-in-law.

hebrew_text: מַעֲשֶׂה בִּיהוֹשֻׁעַ וְכוּ׳. מִנָּהוּ — אִין, נִתְמַנָּה — לָא. אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: קְטִיר קָחָזֵינָא הָכָא. דְּאָמַר רַב אַסִּי: תַּרְקַבָּא דְּדִינָרֵי עַיִּילָהּ לֵיהּ מָרְתָּא בַּת בַּיְתּוֹס לְיַנַּאי מַלְכָּא עַד דְּמוֹקֵי לֵיהּ לִיהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן גַּמְלָא בְּכָהֲנֵי רַבְרְבֵי.
human_translation: an incident with Yehoshua appointed him, yes, not was appointed. Rav Yosef said: I see a conspiracy here, as Rav Asi said: Marta bat Baitos brought a half- se’a [ tarkav ] of dinars to King Yannai until he appointed Yehoshua ben Gamla High Priest.
llm_translation: The story of Yehoshua and so on. From where? — No, appointed — no. Rav Yosef said: I have seen a smoke here. As Rav Assi said: A carriage of dinars brought it to Marata, the daughter of Baytos, for the king until Yehoshua ben Gamla, of the Rabbinic priests, cried out.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל שֶׁמֵּת אָחִיו — חוֹלֵץ וְלֹא מְיַיבֵּם.
human_translation: A High Priest whose brother died performs ḥalitza and he does not perform levirate marriage,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "If a Kohen Gadol dies without children, his brother performs chalitzah but does not perform yibbum."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ קָא פָּסֵיק וְתָנֵי, לָא שְׁנָא מִן הָאֵירוּסִין וְלָא שְׁנָא מִן הַנִּשּׂוּאִין. בִּשְׁלָמָא מִן הַנִּשּׂוּאִין, עֲשֵׂה וְלֹא תַעֲשֶׂה הוּא, וְאֵין עֲשֵׂה דּוֹחֶה לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה וַעֲשֵׂה. אֶלָּא מִן הָאֵירוּסִין, יָבֹא עֲשֵׂה וְיִדְחֶה אֶת לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה?!
human_translation: teaches categorically, it is no different from betrothal, and it is no different from marriage. Granted, from marriage, as, it positive mitzva and prohibition And a positive mitzva, does not override a prohibition and a positive However, from betrothal the positive mitzva should come and override the prohibition
llm_translation: The text states: "When he interrupted and taught, it is no different whether from betrothal or from marriage. Regarding betrothal, it is a case of 'do and do not do,' and positive commandments do not override negative commandments. But regarding marriage, let the positive commandment come and push aside the negative commandment?!"

hebrew_text: גְּזֵירָה בִּיאָה רִאשׁוֹנָה אַטּוּ בִּיאָה שְׁנִיָּה.
human_translation: decree first intercourse due to second intercourse.
llm_translation: Decree first intercourse, then second intercourse.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ כֹּהֵן הֶדְיוֹט לֹא יִשָּׂא אַיְלוֹנִית, אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן יֵשׁ לוֹ אִשָּׁה וּבָנִים. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ אִשָּׁה וּבָנִים לֹא יִשָּׂא אַיְלוֹנִית, שֶׁהִיא זוֹנָה הָאֲמוּרָה בַּתּוֹרָה. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֵין זוֹנָה אֶלָּא גִּיּוֹרֶת וּמְשׁוּחְרֶרֶת וְשֶׁנִּבְעֲלָה בְּעִילַת זְנוּת.
human_translation: A common priest may not marry a sexually underdeveloped woman [ aylonit ], unless he has a wife and children. Rabbi Yehuda says: Even he has a wife and children, he may not marry a sexually underdeveloped woman, as she is the zona stated in the Torah And the Rabbis say: The only zona , a female convert, a freed and who engaged in licentious sexual intercourse
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: A commoner priest may not marry a widow, unless he has a wife and children. Rabbi Yehuda says: Even if he has a wife and children, he may not marry a widow, as she is the harlot mentioned in the Torah. And the Sages say: A harlot refers only to a convert, a freed woman, or one who engaged in promiscuous intercourse.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אֲמַר לֵיהּ רֵישׁ גָּלוּתָא לְרַב הוּנָא: מַאי טַעְמָא — מִשּׁוּם פְּרִיָּה וּרְבִיָּה, אַפְּרִיָּה וּרְבִיָּה כֹּהֲנִים הוּא דְּמִפַּקְּדִי וְיִשְׂרָאֵל לָא מִפַּקְּדִי?! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִשּׁוּם דְּקָא בָּעֵי לְמִיתְנֵי סֵיפָא, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ אִשָּׁה
human_translation: The Exilarch said to Rav Huna: What is the reason because be fruitful and multiply. Is it priests who were commanded to be fruitful and multiply, but Israelites were not commanded? said to him: because he wants to teach the latter clause Rabbi Yehuda says: Even he has a wife
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara said to him, the head of the exile to Rav Huna: What is the reason? - Because of "be fruitful and multiply," why is it that priests are counted and Israelites are not counted?! He said to him: Because he wants to teach the latter part, Rabbi Yehuda says: Even though he has a wife.

hebrew_text: וְיֵשׁ לוֹ בָּנִים — לֹא יִשָּׂא אַיְלוֹנִית, שֶׁהִיא זוֹנָה הָאֲמוּרָה בַּתּוֹרָה. דְּאַזּוֹנָה כֹּהֲנִים הוּא דְּמִפַּקְדִי וְיִשְׂרָאֵל לָא מִפַּקְּדִי, מִשּׁוּם הָכִי קָתָנֵי כֹּהֵן.
human_translation: and he has children, he may not marry a sexually underdeveloped woman, as she is the zona stated in the Torah It is priests who were commanded a zona , but Israelites were not commanded due to that he taught a priest,
llm_translation: "And if he has children - he shall not marry a harlot, for she is the harlot mentioned in the Torah. For if she is a harlot, it is the priests who are disqualified, and not Israelites. Therefore, the Mishnah teaches: A priest."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״אָכְלוּ וְלֹא יִשְׂבָּעוּ הִזְנוּ וְלֹא יִפְרֹצוּ״, כׇּל בִּיאָה שֶׁאֵין בָּהּ פִּירְצָה — אֵינָהּ אֶלָּא בְּעִילַת זְנוּת.
human_translation: Rav Huna said: What is the reason Rabbi Yehuda? As it is written: “And they shall eat, and not have enough, they shall commit harlotry, and shall not increase” Any intercourse that does not increase is nothing other licentious sexual intercourse.
llm_translation: Rav Huna said: What is the reason for Rabbi Yehuda, as it is written: "They eat but are not satisfied; they play the harlot but do not increase." Any sexual intercourse that does not involve ejaculation is considered nothing but promiscuity.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: כֹּהֵן לֹא יִשָּׂא אֶת הַקְּטַנָּה. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב חִסְדָּא לְרַבָּה: פּוֹק עַיֵּין בָּהּ, דִּלְאוּרְתָּא בָּעֵי לַהּ רַב הוּנָא מִינָּךְ. נְפַק עַיֵּין בָּהּ: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר, וְסָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Eliezer says: A priest may not marry a minor. Rav Ḥisda said to Rabba: Go investigate as in the evening Rav Huna ask you He went investigated it, Rabbi Eliezer holds in accordance with Rabbi Meir, and he holds in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Eliezer says: A priest may not marry a minor. Rav Ḥisda said to Rabba: Go out and examine this matter, for Rav Huna requires a ruling from you. He went out and examined the matter: Rabbi Eliezer holds like Rabbi Meir, and he holds like Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר, דְּחָיֵישׁ לְמִיעוּטָא. וְסָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, דְּאָמַר: אַיְלוֹנִית זוֹנָה הָוְיָא.
human_translation: He holds in accordance with Rabbi Meir, who one must be concerned for the minority. And holds in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda, who said a sexually underdeveloped woman is a zona
llm_translation: He thought according to Rabbi Meir, who is concerned for the minority. And he thought according to Rabbi Yehuda, who said: "Aylonit is considered a prostitute."

hebrew_text: וּכְרַבִּי מֵאִיר מִי סָבַר לַהּ? וְהָתַנְיָא: קָטָן וּקְטַנָּה לֹא חוֹלְצִין וְלֹא מְיַבְּמִין, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. אָמְרוּ לוֹ לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר: יָפֶה אָמַרְתָּ שֶׁאֵין חוֹלְצִין. ״אִישׁ״ כְּתִיב בַּפָּרָשָׁה, וּמַקְּשִׁינַן אִשָּׁה לְאִישׁ. אֶלָּא מַאי טַעְמָא אֵין מְיַבְּמִין?
human_translation: And does hold in accordance with Rabbi Meir? Isn’t it taught A boy minor and a girl minor may not perform ḥalitza or levirate marriage; the statement of Rabbi Meir. said to Rabbi Meir: You spoke well that they may not perform ḥalitza , “man” is written in the passage and we compare a woman to a man However, what is the reason they may not perform levirate marriage?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And what does Rabbi Meir hold? And it was taught: A minor boy and a minor girl do not perform ḥalitza nor do they perform levirate marriage, the words of Rabbi Meir. They said to Rabbi Meir: You have nicely said that they do not perform ḥalitza. "Man" is written in the Torah portion, and we juxtapose a woman to a man. Rather, what is the reason they do not perform levirate marriage?

hebrew_text: [אָמַר לָהֶם:] קָטָן — שֶׁמָּא יִמָּצֵא סָרִיס, קְטַנָּה — שֶׁמָּא תִּמָּצֵא אַיְלוֹנִית, וְנִמְצְאוּ פּוֹגְעִין בְּעֶרְוָה. וְתַנְיָא: קְטַנָּה מִתְיַיבֶּמֶת וְאֵינָהּ חוֹלֶצֶת, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר.
human_translation: said to them: A boy minor lest he be found a eunuch, a girl minor lest she be found sexually underdeveloped and they turn out encountered a forbidden relative. And it was taught A girl minor enters into levirate marriage but does not perform ḥalitza ; the statement of Rabbi Eliezer.
llm_translation: He said to them: "A minor - lest he find a eunuch, a minor girl - lest she find a heathen woman, and they will be found engaging in forbidden relations." And it was taught: "A minor can perform levirate marriage but she does not perform chalitzah," the words of Rabbi Eliezer.

hebrew_text: וּכְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה מִי סָבַר לַהּ? וְהָתַנְיָא: ״זוֹנָה״ — זוֹנָה כִּשְׁמָהּ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: ״זוֹנָה״ זוֹ מוּפְקֶרֶת. רַבִּי מַתְיָא בֶּן חָרָשׁ אוֹמֵר: אֲפִילּוּ הָלַךְ בַּעְלָהּ לְהַשְׁקוֹתָהּ, וּבָא עָלֶיהָ בַּדֶּרֶךְ — עֲשָׂאָהּ זוֹנָה.
human_translation: And does hold in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda? Wasn’t it is taught in zona the name zona the statement of Rabbi Eliezer. Rabbi Akiva says: A zona is who available Rabbi Matya ben Ḥarash says: Even her husband went to make her drink he had intercourse with her on the way, he has caused her a zona
llm_translation: And according to Rabbi Yehuda, who does he hold like? And it was taught: "Zonah" - this is her name, the words of Rabbi Eliezer. Rabbi Akiva says: "Zonah" - she is available. Rabbi Matya ben Charash says: Even if her husband went to water her, and someone else had relations with her on the way - she is considered a zonah.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: זוֹנָה — זוֹ אַיְלוֹנִית. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֵין זוֹנָה אֶלָּא גִּיּוֹרֶת וּמְשׁוּחְרֶרֶת וְשֶׁנִּבְעֲלָה בְּעִילַת זְנוּת. רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: פָּנוּי הַבָּא עַל הַפְּנוּיָה שֶׁלֹּא לְשֵׁם אִישׁוּת — עֲשָׂאָהּ זוֹנָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: A zona is a sexually underdeveloped woman. And the Rabbis say: zona only to a female convert, a freed and one who engaged in licentious sexual intercourse. Rabbi Elazar says: an unmarried man who had intercourse with an unmarried woman not for the purpose of marriage, he has caused her a zona .
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: A prostitute - this is aylonit. And the sages say: A prostitute is only a convert, freedwoman, and one who engaged in promiscuous intercourse. Rabbi Elazar says: A single man who has relations with a single woman without intent for marriage - he makes her a prostitute.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה: הָכָא בְּכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל עָסְקִינַן. לְאֵימַת קָנֵי לַה, לְכִי גָדְלָה [לְכִי גָדְלָה] — בְּעוּלָה הִיא.
human_translation: Rather, Rav Adda bar Ahava said Here we are dealing with a High Priest, When can he acquire her when she is grown up. she is a non-virgin,
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Adda bar Ahava said: Here we are dealing with a High Priest. When did he acquire her? When she reached puberty - it is through sexual intercourse.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: מְכַלֵּי לֵב, אִי דְּקַדְּשַׁהּ אֲבוּהּ — מֵהַהִיא שַׁעְתָּא הוּא דְּקָנֵי לַהּ. וְאִי דְּקַדִּשָׁה נַפְשַׁהּ — הָא רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר הִיא וְלָא רַבָּנַן?
human_translation: Rava said: without reason. If her father betrothed her acquired her from that time, And if betrothed herself, this Rabbi Eliezer’s and not the Rabbis?
llm_translation: Rava said: If he consecrated it as an offering — it is from that moment that he acquires it. But if he consecrated himself — is he Rabbi Eliezer and not the Rabbis?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: לְעוֹלָם בְּכֹהֵן הֶדְיוֹט — וְחָיְישִׁינַן שֶׁמָּא תִּתְפַּתֶּה עָלָיו. אִי הָכִי יִשְׂרָאֵל נָמֵי! פִּתּוּיי קְטַנָּה אוֹנֶס הוּא, וְאוֹנֶס בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל מִישְׁרָא שְׁרֵי.
human_translation: Rather, Rava said: Actually, a common priest, we are concerned lest she be seduced to him. If so, an Israelite also. The seduction of a minor is rape, and a rape permitted in an Israelite,
llm_translation: Rava said: Rather, always appoint a commoner as a Kohen - and we are concerned lest he become arrogant. If so, this applies to Yisrael as well! A minor transgression is considered coercion, and coercion in Yisrael is considered as if done willingly.

hebrew_text: רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר: בְּכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל, וְהַאי תַּנָּא הוּא דְּתַנְיָא: ״בְּתוּלָה״, יָכוֹל קְטַנָּה — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אִשָּׁה״. אִי אִשָּׁה, יָכוֹל בּוֹגֶרֶת — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״בְּתוּלָה״. הָא כֵּיצַד? יָצְתָה מִכְּלַל קַטְנוּת, וְלִכְלַל בַּגְרוּת לֹא בָּאתָה.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: to a High Priest, and it is this tanna , as it is taught “A virgin might a minor; the verse states a woman [ isha ], If woman, might a grown woman. The verse states a virgin, How so? has left the class of minority but has not reached the class of grown womanhood,
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: In regards to a High Priest, and this is what the Mishnah teaches: "virgin," one might think it includes a minor — the Torah teaches: "woman." If it is a woman, one might think it includes a widow — the Torah teaches: "virgin." How so? She emerged from the category of minor, but did not enter the category of widow.

hebrew_text: רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק אָמַר: הַאי תַּנָּא הוּא דְּתַנְיָא: ״בְּתוּלָה״, אֵין בְּתוּלָה אֶלָּא נַעֲרָה. וְכֵן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״וְהַנַּעֲרָה טוֹבַת מַרְאֶה מְאֹד בְּתוּלָה״.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: It is this tanna , as it is taught a virgin, and virgin only a maiden. And similarly states: “And the maiden was very fair to look upon, a virgin,
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: This Tanna is the one who teaches: "Virgin," only a virgin is a virgin. And so he also says: "And the young woman was very beautiful in appearance, a virgin."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: פָּנוּי הַבָּא עַל הַפְּנוּיָה שֶׁלֹּא לְשֵׁם אִישׁוּת — עֲשָׂאָהּ זוֹנָה. אָמַר רַב עַמְרָם: אֵין הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: an unmarried man who had intercourse with an unmarried woman not for the purpose of marriage, he has caused her a zona . Rav Amram said: The halakha is not in accordance with Rabbi Elazar.
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: A man who approaches an unmarried woman not for the sake of marriage - he has made her into a prostitute. Rav Amram said: The halakha is not in accordance with Rabbi Elazar.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ לֹא יִבָּטֵל אָדָם מִפְּרִיָּה וּרְבִיָּה אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן יֵשׁ לוֹ בָּנִים. בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: שְׁנֵי זְכָרִים, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: זָכָר וּנְקֵבָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״זָכָר וּנְקֵבָה בְּרָאָם״.
human_translation: A man may not neglect be fruitful and multiply unless he has children. Beit Shammai say: two males, and Beit Hillel say: A male and a female, as it is stated: “Male and female He created them”
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: A man should not refrain from procreation, unless he already has children. Beit Shammai say: Two males, and Beit Hillel say: A male and a female, as it is stated: "Male and female He created them."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ הָא יֵשׁ לוֹ בָּנִים — מִפְּרִיָּה וּרְבִיָּה בָּטֵיל, מֵאִשָּׁה לָא בָּטֵיל. מְסַיְּיעָא לֵיהּ לְרַב נַחְמָן אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל. דְּאָמַר: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ לְאָדָם כַּמָּה בָּנִים, אָסוּר לַעֲמוֹד בְּלֹא אִשָּׁה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לֹא טוֹב הֱיוֹת הָאָדָם לְבַדּוֹ״.
human_translation: he has children he may neglect be fruitful and multiply, he may not neglect a wife. supports Rav Naḥman said Shmuel, who said: Even a man has several children, it is prohibited to remain without a wife, as it is stated: “It is not good that the man should be alone”
llm_translation: Gemara: Does one who has children have fulfilled the obligation of "be fruitful and multiply"? From the perspective of "be fruitful and multiply," he has not fulfilled it, but from the perspective of marriage, he has fulfilled it. This supports the opinion of Rav Nachman as Shmuel said: Even though a person may have many children, it is forbidden to remain without a wife, as it is stated: "It is not good for man to be alone."

hebrew_text: וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: הָא יֵשׁ לוֹ בָּנִים — בָּטֵיל מִפְּרִיָּה וּרְבִיָּה, וּבָטֵיל נָמֵי מֵאִשָּׁה. נֵימָא תֶּיהְוֵי תְּיוּבְתָּא דְּרַב נַחְמָן אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל! לָא: אֵין לוֹ בָּנִים — נוֹשֵׂא אִשָּׁה בַּת בָּנִים, יֵשׁ לוֹ בָּנִים — נוֹשֵׂא אִשָּׁה דְּלָאו בַּת בָּנִים. נָפְקָא מִינַּהּ לִמְכּוֹר סֵפֶר תּוֹרָה בִּשְׁבִיל בָּנִים.
