human_translation: And some say he has children, he may neglect be fruitful and multiply and may also neglect a wife. Shall we say is a conclusive refutation of Rav Naḥman said Shmuel No, if he does not have children he must marry a woman of children, he has children he may marry a woman who is not of children. A practical difference to sell a Torah scroll in order to children.
llm_translation: There are those who say: If he has children - he is exempt from being fruitful and multiplying, and he is also exempt from marriage. Let it be said that this is the opinion of Rav Nachman who said in the name of Shmuel! No: If he has no children - he should marry a woman who is the daughter of sons, if he has children - he should marry a woman who is not the daughter of sons. The conclusion is drawn from this regarding the sale of a Torah scroll for the sake of children.

hebrew_text: בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: שְׁנֵי זְכָרִים. מַאי טַעְמַיְיהוּ דְּבֵית שַׁמַּאי? יָלְפִינַן מִמֹּשֶׁה, דִּכְתִיב: ״בְּנֵי מֹשֶׁה גֵּרְשׁוֹם וֶאֱלִיעֶזֶר״. וּבֵית הִלֵּל: יָלְפִינַן מִבְּרִיָּיתוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם. וּבֵית שַׁמַּאי, לֵילְפֵי מִבְּרִיָּיתוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם? אֵין דָּנִין אֶפְשָׁר
human_translation: Beit Shammai say two males. What is the reason of Beit Shammai? We learn from Moses as it is written: “The sons of Moses, Gershom and Eliezer” And Beit Hillel we learn from the creation of the world, And Beit Shammai, let them learn from the creation of the world We do not derive possible
llm_translation: House of Shammai says: Two males. What is the reason of House of Shammai? We derive from Moses, as it is written: "The sons of Moses were Gershom and Eliezer." And House of Hillel: We derive from the creation of the world. And House of Shammai, do they not derive from the creation of the world? It is not possible to judge.

hebrew_text: מִשֶּׁאִי אֶפְשָׁר. וּבֵית הִלֵּל נָמֵי, לֵילְפוּ מִמֹּשֶׁה! אָמְרִי לָךְ: מֹשֶׁה מִדַּעְתֵּיהּ הוּא דַּעֲבַד. דְּתַנְיָא: שְׁלֹשָׁה דְּבָרִים עָשָׂה מֹשֶׁה מִדַּעְתּוֹ, וְהִסְכִּימָה דַּעְתּוֹ לְדַעַת הַמָּקוֹם: פֵּירַשׁ מִן הָאִשָּׁה, וְשִׁיבֵּר הַלּוּחוֹת, וְהוֹסִיף יוֹם אֶחָד.
human_translation: from not possible. And Beit Hillel, let them also learn from Moses. say to you: Moses acted on his own perception as it is taught in Moses did three things on his own perception, and his perception agreed with the perception of the Omnipresent: He separated from wife, he broke the tablets, and he added one day
llm_translation: Talmudic text: When is it possible? And Beit Hillel also agree, let them learn from Moses! They say to you: Moses acted on his own accord. As it was taught: Moses did three things of his own accord, and his mind agreed with the mind of the Omnipresent: he separated from his wife, he broke the tablets, and he added one day. English translation:

hebrew_text: פֵּירַשׁ מִן הָאִשָּׁה, מַאי דְּרַשׁ? אֲמַר: וּמָה יִשְׂרָאֵל, שֶׁלֹּא דִּבְּרָה עִמָּהֶם שְׁכִינָה אֶלָּא לְפִי שָׁעָה, וְקָבַע לָהֶם זְמַן, אָמְרָה תּוֹרָה: ״אַל תִּגְּשׁוּ אֶל אִשָּׁה״ — אֲנִי, שֶׁמְּיוּחָד לְדִבּוּר בְּכׇל שָׁעָה וְשָׁעָה, וְלֹא קָבַע לִי זְמַן — עַל אַחַת כַּמָּה וְכַמָּה. וְהִסְכִּימָה דַּעְתּוֹ לְדַעַת הַמָּקוֹם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לֵךְ אֱמוֹר לָהֶם שׁוּבוּ לָכֶם לְאׇהֳלֵיכֶם. וְאַתָּה פֹּה עֲמוֹד עִמָּדִי״.
human_translation: separated from wife what did he interpret He said: If Israel, with whom the Divine Presence spoke only temporarily and for whom set time for the Torah stated: “Do not approach a woman” I, who am set aside for speech all the time and for whom did not set time, all the more so And his perception agreed with the perception of the Omnipresent, as it is stated “Go say to them: Return to your tents; and you, stand here with Me”
llm_translation: He explained from the woman, what did he interpret? He said: And what is Israel, that the Divine Presence did not speak with them except for a limited time, and established for them a set time, the Torah said: "Do not approach a woman" — I, who am designated for constant communication at all times, and a set time was not established for me — how much more so. And his opinion agreed with the opinion of the Omnipresent, as it is stated: "Go, say to them, return to your tents. But you, stand here with Me."

hebrew_text: שִׁיבֵּר אֶת הַלּוּחוֹת, מַאי דְּרַשׁ? אָמַר: וּמָה פֶּסַח, שֶׁהוּא אֶחָד מִשֵּׁשׁ מֵאוֹת וּשְׁלֹשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה מִצְוֹת, אָמְרָה תּוֹרָה ״כׇּל בֶּן נֵכָר לֹא יֹאכַל בּוֹ״. הַתּוֹרָה כּוּלָּהּ, וְיִשְׂרָאֵל מְשׁוּמָּדִים — עַל אַחַת כַּמָּה וְכַמָּה.
human_translation: broke the tablets What did he interpret said: If Paschal lamb, which is one of 613 mitzvot, the Torah states: “No alien shall eat of it” the entire Torah and the Jewish people apostates, all the more so
llm_translation: He broke the tablets, what did he expound? He said: Just as with the Passover offering, which is one of six hundred and thirteen commandments, the Torah stated, "No foreigner shall eat of it." The entire Torah, and Israelites who are circumcised — how much more so.

hebrew_text: וְהִסְכִּימָה דַּעְתּוֹ לְדַעַת הַמָּקוֹם, דִּכְתִיב: ״אֲשֶׁר שִׁבַּרְתָּ״, וְאָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: אָמַר לוֹ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לְמֹשֶׁה: יִישַׁר כֹּחֲךָ שֶׁשִּׁבַּרְתָּ.
human_translation: And his perception agreed with the perception of the Omnipresent, as it is written: that you broke [ asher shibbarta ]” and Reish Lakish said: the Holy One, Blessed be He, said to Moses: May your strength be true [ yishar koḥakha ] that you broke
llm_translation: The text reads: "And his opinion agreed with the opinion of the place, as it is written: 'which you broke.' And Reish Lakish said: The Holy One, blessed be He, said to Moses: Well done for breaking."

hebrew_text: הוֹסִיף יוֹם אֶחָד מִדַּעְתּוֹ, מַאי דְּרַשׁ? דִּכְתִיב: ״וְקִדַּשְׁתָּם הַיּוֹם וּמָחָר״. הַיּוֹם כְּמָחָר: מָה מָחָר לֵילוֹ עִמּוֹ, אַף הַיּוֹם לֵילוֹ עִמּוֹ. וְלַיְלָה דְּהָאִידָּנָא נְפַק לֵיהּ, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ תְּרֵי יוֹמֵי לְבַר מֵהָאִידָּנָא. וְהִסְכִּימָה דַּעְתּוֹ לְדַעַת הַמָּקוֹם — דְּלָא שָׁרְיָא שְׁכִינָה עַד שַׁבְּתָא.
human_translation: added one day on his perception, what did he interpret that it is written: “And sanctify them today and tomorrow” today like tomorrow: Just as tomorrow and night it, so too, today and night it. and the night of that day passed, Conclude from two days aside from now, And his perception agreed with the perception of the Omnipresent, as Divine Presence did not rest until Shabbat
llm_translation: He added one day from his own knowledge, what is the interpretation? As it is written: "And you shall sanctify them today and tomorrow." Today is like tomorrow: just as tomorrow includes its night, so too today includes its night. And the night that is departing now, consider from it two days for one day. And his opinion agreed with the opinion of the place - that the Divine Presence does not depart until the Sabbath.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי נָתָן אוֹמֵר: בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: שְׁנֵי זְכָרִים וּשְׁתֵּי נְקֵבוֹת, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: זָכָר וּנְקֵבָה.
human_translation: It is taught in Rabbi Natan says Beit Shammai say: two males and two females. And Beit Hillel say: A male and a female.
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Nathan says: Beit Shammai say: two males and two females, and Beit Hillel say: male and female.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי נָתָן אַלִּיבָּא דְּבֵית שַׁמַּאי? דִּכְתִיב: ״וַתּוֹסֶף לָלֶדֶת אֶת אָחִיו אֶת הָבֶל״: הֶבֶל וַאֲחוֹתוֹ, קַיִן וַאֲחוֹתוֹ, וּכְתִיב: ״כִּי שָׁת לִי אֱלֹהִים זֶרַע אַחֵר תַּחַת הֶבֶל כִּי הֲרָגוֹ קָיִן״. וְרַבָּנַן? אוֹדוֹיֵי הוּא דְּקָא מוֹדְיָא.
human_translation: Rav Huna said: What is the reason of Rabbi Natan, in accordance with Beit Shammai? as it is written: “And again she bore his brother [ et aḥiv ] Abel [ et Hevel ]” Abel and his sister, Cain and his sister. And it states: “For God has appointed me another seed instead of Abel; for Cain slew him” And the Rabbis, was thanking God
llm_translation: Rav Huna said: What is the reason for Rabbi Natan's opinion in accordance with Beit Shammai? For it is written: "And she continued to bear his brother, Abel." - Abel and his sister, Cain and his sister. And it is written: "For God has appointed me another seed instead of Abel, for Cain slew him." And the Rabbis? They agree with the one who admits.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא אִידַּךְ, רַבִּי נָתָן אוֹמֵר: בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: זָכָר וּנְקֵבָה, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: אוֹ זָכָר אוֹ נְקֵבָה. אָמַר רָבָא: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי נָתָן אַלִּיבָּא דְּבֵית הִלֵּל, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לֹא תֹהוּ בְרָאָהּ לָשֶׁבֶת יְצָרָהּ״, וְהָא עֲבַד לַהּ שֶׁבֶת.
human_translation: It is taught in another Rabbi Natan says Beit Shammai say: a male and a female. And Beit Hillel say: Either a male or a female. Rava said: What is the reason of Rabbi Natan in accordance with the opinion of Beit Hillel? as it is stated: “He did not create it a waste; He formed it to be inhabited” and one has made inhabited
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: The other one, Rabbi Natan says: Beit Shammai say: male and female, and Beit Hillel say: either male or female. Rava said: What is the reason for Rabbi Natan's opinion in accordance with Beit Hillel, as it is stated: "He did not create it a waste, He formed it to be inhabited," and He formed it to be inhabited.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר: הָיוּ לוֹ בָּנִים בְּגַיּוּתוֹ וְנִתְגַּיֵּיר, רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: קִיֵּים פְּרִיָּה וּרְבִיָּה. וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר: לֹא קִיֵּים פְּרִיָּה וּרְבִיָּה. רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: קִיֵּים פְּרִיָּה וּרְבִיָּה — דְּהָא הֲווֹ לֵיהּ. וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר: לֹא קִיֵּים פְּרִיָּה וּרְבִיָּה — גֵּר שֶׁנִּתְגַּיֵּיר כְּקָטָן שֶׁנּוֹלַד דָּמֵי.
human_translation: It was stated had children when he a gentile and he converted, Rabbi Yoḥanan said: He has fulfilled be fruitful and multiply, and Reish Lakish said: not fulfilled be fruitful and multiply. Rabbi Yoḥanan said he has fulfilled to be fruitful and multiply, as he had And Reish Lakish said he has not fulfilled be fruitful and multiply, a convert who converted is like a child born,
llm_translation: It was stated: If he had children in his gentile state and he converted, Rabbi Yohanan said: He fulfilled the commandment to be fruitful and multiply. And Resh Lakish said: He did not fulfill the commandment to be fruitful and multiply. Rabbi Yohanan said: He fulfilled the commandment to be fruitful and multiply - for he had them. And Resh Lakish said: He did not fulfill the commandment to be fruitful and multiply - a convert is like a newborn infant.

hebrew_text: וְאָזְדוּ לְטַעְמַיְיהוּ, דְּאִיתְּמַר: הָיוּ לוֹ בָּנִים בְּגַיּוּתוֹ וְנִתְגַּיֵּיר, רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: אֵין לוֹ בְּכוֹר לְנַחֲלָה, דְּהָא הֲוָה לֵיהּ ״רֵאשִׁית אוֹנוֹ״. וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר: יֵשׁ לוֹ בְּכוֹר לְנַחֲלָה, גֵּר שֶׁנִּתְגַּיֵּיר כְּקָטָן שֶׁנּוֹלַד דָּמֵי.
human_translation: And they follow their as it was stated: one had children he a gentile and he converted, Rabbi Yoḥanan said: He does not have a firstborn with regard to inheritance, as had “the first of his strength” And Reish Lakish said: He does have a firstborn with regard to inheritance, a convert who converted is like a child born.
llm_translation: And they went according to their reasons, for it was stated: If he had sons in his gentile state and then converted, Rabbi Yochanan said: He does not have a firstborn for inheritance, for he had "the beginning of his strength." And Reish Lakish said: He does have a firstborn for inheritance, for a convert who converts is like a newborn in terms of blood.

hebrew_text: וּצְרִיכָא: דְּאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן בְּהָהִיא קַמַּיְיתָא, בְּהַהִיא קָאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן — מִשּׁוּם דְּמֵעִיקָּרָא נָמֵי בְּנֵי פְּרִיָּה וּרְבִיָּה נִינְהוּ, אֲבָל לְעִנְיַן נַחֲלָה, דְּלָאו בְּנֵי נַחֲלָה נִינְהוּ — אֵימָא מוֹדֵי לֵיהּ לְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ.
human_translation: And necessary As, had it taught us with regard to that first it is in that Rabbi Yoḥanan said because from the outset, are also subject to fruitful and multiply. However, with regard to inheritance, they are not subject inheritance, say concedes to Reish Lakish.
llm_translation: The question arises: for if we were to hear in that place, in that place where Rabbi Yochanan stated - because from the outset they are also considered children of "P'riyah u'Reviyah," but regarding matters of inheritance, as they are not considered children of inheritance - we should perhaps agree with Reish Lakish.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אִיתְּמַר בְּהָא — בְּהָא קָאָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ, אֲבָל בְּהַהִיא — אֵימָא מוֹדֶה לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: And if was stated with regard to this it is in this Reish Lakish said But with regard to that say he concedes to Rabbi Yoḥanan. necessary
llm_translation: "And if it was stated in this case - in this case Reish Lakish said, but in that case - say that he agrees with Rabbi Yochanan, this is necessary."

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן לְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: ״בָּעֵת הַהִיא שָׁלַח בְּרֹאדַךְ בַּלְאֲדָן בֶּן בַּלְאֲדָן מֶלֶךְ בָּבֶל וְגוֹ׳״! אֲמַר לֵיהּ בְּגַיּוּתָן — אִית לְהוּ חַיִיס, נִתְגַּיְּירוּ — לֵית לְהוּ חַיִיס.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan raises an objection to Reish Lakish “At that time Berodach-baladan, son of Baladan, king of Babylon, sent said to When they are gentiles they do have lineage, they convert they do not have lineage,
llm_translation: He raised an objection to Reish Lakish: "At that time, Merodach-baladan son of Baladan, king of Babylon, sent messengers..." He said to him mockingly: "They have a god of dung, they have been converted — they have no god."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב: הַכֹּל מוֹדִין בְּעֶבֶד שֶׁאֵין לוֹ חַיִיס, דִּכְתִיב: ״שְׁבוּ לָכֶם פֹּה עִם הַחֲמוֹר״: עַם הַדּוֹמֶה לַחֲמוֹר. מֵיתִיבִי: ״וּלְצִיבָא חֲמִשָּׁה עָשָׂר בָּנִים וְעֶשְׂרִים עֲבָדִים״! אָמַר רַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב: כְּ״פַר בֶּן בָּקָר״.
human_translation: Rav said: Everyone agrees with regard to slave, that he does not have lineage, as it is written “Remain here with the donkey” a nation comparable to a donkey, raises an objection “And Ziba had fifteen sons and twenty servants” Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov said: like A bullock, son of a bull.
llm_translation: Rav said: Everyone agrees regarding a slave who does not have any possessions, as it is written: "Stay here with the donkey," comparing the people to the donkey. It was raised: "And Job had fifteen sons and twenty slaves!" Rav Acha bar Yaakov said: Like "a young bull."

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, הָכָא נָמֵי! שָׁאנֵי הָתָם, דְּיַחֲסִינְהוּ בִּשְׁמַיְיהוּ וּבִשְׁמָא דַאֲבוּהוֹן, וְהָכָא לָא מְפָרֵשׁ. וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: יַחֲסִינְהוּ בְּדוּכְתָּא אַחֲרִיתִי בַּאֲבוּהוֹן וּבְאַבָּא דַאֲבוּהוֹן, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיִּשְׁלָחֵם הַמֶּלֶךְ אָסָא אֶל בֶּן הֲדַד בֶּן טַבְרִימּוֹן בֶּן חֶזְיוֹן מֶלֶךְ אֲרָם הַיּוֹשֵׁב בְּדַמֶּשֶׂק לֵאמֹר״.
human_translation: If so, here too, There it is different, as identified him by his name and by his father’s name, But here, not specify And if you wish, say identified elsewhere by their father and their father’s father, as it is written: “And King Asa sent them to Ben-hadad, son of Tabrimmon, son of Hezion, king of Aram, who dwelled in Damascus, saying”
llm_translation: If so, here too! It is different there, for they are reckoned by their own names and the name of their fathers, but here it is not explained. And if you wish, say: reckon them in the last generation by their fathers and by the father of their fathers, as it is written: "And Asa sent them to Ben-hadad son of Tabrimmon son of Hezion, king of Aram, who lived in Damascus, saying."

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר: הָיוּ לוֹ בָּנִים וּמֵתוּ, רַב הוּנָא אָמַר: קִיֵּים פְּרִיָּה וּרְבִיָּה. רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: לֹא קִיֵּים.
human_translation: It was stated had children and they died, Rav Huna said: fulfilled fruitful and multiply Rabbi Yoḥanan said: not fulfilled
llm_translation: It was stated: If one had children and they died, Rav Huna said: He fulfilled the mitzvah of procreation. Rabbi Yochanan said: He did not fulfill it.

hebrew_text: רַב הוּנָא אָמַר: קִיֵּים — מִשּׁוּם דְּרַב אַסִּי. דְּאָמַר רַב אַסִּי: אֵין בֶּן דָּוִד בָּא עַד שֶׁיִּכְלוּ כׇּל נְשָׁמוֹת שֶׁבַּגּוּף, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי רוּחַ מִלְּפָנַי יַעֲטוֹף וְגוֹ׳״, וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: לֹא קִיֵּים פְּרִיָּה וּרְבִיָּה — ״לָשֶׁבֶת יְצָרָהּ״ בָּעֵינַן, וְהָא לֵיכָּא.
human_translation: Rav Huna said fulfilled due to of Rav Asi, as Rav Asi said son of David, will not come until all the souls of the body have been finished, as it is stated: “For the spirit that enwraps itself is from Me, And Rabbi Yoḥanan said not fulfilled we require “He formed it to be inhabited” and is not
llm_translation: Rav Huna said: It is established — in the name of Rav Assi. For Rav Assi said: The son of David will not come until all the souls in the body are finished, as it is stated: "For the spirit from before Me will wrap itself" (Isaiah 57:16). And Rabbi Yochanan said: If there is no fulfillment of procreation and multiplication — "to sit in its formation" we require, and this is not so.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי:
human_translation: raises an objection
llm_translation: Challenged (is the questioner):

hebrew_text: בְּנֵי בָנִים הֲרֵי הֵן כְּבָנִים! כִּי תַּנְיָא הָהִיא, לְהַשְׁלִים.
human_translation: Grandchildren are like children. When that is taught to completing
llm_translation: Descendants of descendants, behold they are like descendants! For it was taught: to complete.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: בְּנֵי בָנִים הֲרֵי הֵם כְּבָנִים, מֵת אֶחָד מֵהֶם אוֹ שֶׁנִּמְצָא סָרִיס — לֹא קִיֵּים פְּרִיָּה וּרְבִיָּה. תְּיוּבְתָּא דְרַב הוּנָא תְּיוּבְתָּא.
human_translation: raises an objection Grandchildren are like children. one of died or was discovered a eunuch, not fulfilled fruitful and multiply. The refutation of Rav Huna is a conclusive refutation.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates as follows: Challenger: The sons of sons are considered like sons, if one of them dies or is found to be a eunuch - he does not fulfill the commandment of procreation. The objection of Rav Huna's challenger is an objection.

hebrew_text: בְּנֵי בָנִים הֲרֵי הֵם כְּבָנִים. סְבַר אַבָּיֵי לְמֵימַר, בְּרָא לִבְרָא וּבְרַתָּא לִבְרַתָּא, וְכׇל שֶׁכֵּן בְּרָא לִבְרַתָּא. אֲבָל בְּרַתָּא לִבְרָא — לָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא: ״לָשֶׁבֶת יְצָרָהּ״ בָּעֲיָא, וְהָא אִיכָּא.
human_translation: grandchildren are like children. Abaye thought to say a son to son and a daughter to daughter, and all the more so a son to daughter, However, a daughter to son, no, Rava said to him: require “He formed it to be inhabited,” and there is
llm_translation: Sons of sons, behold they are like sons. Abaye thought to say, with a male to a male and with a female to a female, and certainly with a male to a female. But with a female to a male — no. Rava said to him: "To sit, it requires its form," and there is the matter.

hebrew_text: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא מִיהַת תְּרֵי מֵחַד לָא. וְלָא? וְהָא אָמְרִי לֵיהּ רַבָּנַן לְרַב שֵׁשֶׁת: נְסֵיב אִיתְּתָא וְאוֹלֵיד בְּנֵי, וַאֲמַר לְהוּ: בְּנֵי בְרַתִּי — בְּנֵי נִינְהוּ!
human_translation: In any event, everyone two from one no, And not? Didn’t the Rabbis say to Rav Sheshet: Marry a woman and have sons, and said to them: The sons of my daughter are my sons?
llm_translation: The people of the world, from this side, two from one not. And not? And they said to him the Rabbis to Rav Sheshet: Marry a woman and bear sons, and he said to them: Sons of my daughter - they are my sons!

hebrew_text: הָתָם דַּחוֹיֵי קָמְדַחֵי לְהוּ, דְּרַב שֵׁשֶׁת אִיעֲקַר מִפִּירְקֵיהּ דְּרַב הוּנָא.
human_translation: There, was putting them off. because Rav Sheshet became impotent from Rav Huna’s discourse.
llm_translation: There, where they pushed him, because Rav Sheshet was uprooted from the explanation of Rav Huna.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבָּה לְרָבָא בַּר מָארִי: מְנַָא הָא מִילְּתָא דַּאֲמוּר רַבָּנַן בְּנֵי בָנִים הֲרֵי הֵן כְּבָנִים? אִילֵּימָא מִדִּכְתִיב ״הַבָּנוֹת בְּנוֹתַי וְהַבָּנִים בָּנַי״, אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה: ״וְהַצֹּאן צֹאנִי״ הָכִי נָמֵי?! אֶלָּא דִּקְנֵית מִינַּאי, הָכָא נָמֵי — דִּקְנֵית מִינַּאי.
human_translation: Rabba said to Rava bar Mari: From where is this matter that the Sages stated grandchildren are like children? If we say from that it is written “The daughters are my daughters and the children are my children” if so, “And the flocks are my flocks” so too, Rather, that you, acquired from me. Here too, You acquired from me,
llm_translation: Rabba said to Rava bar Mari: "From where is this matter that the Sages say, 'The sons of sons, are they like sons?' If you say it is because it is written, 'The daughters are my daughters, and the sons are my sons,' then from now on, should it also be said, 'And the flock is my flock' in the same way? Rather, if you acquired something, here it is said - if you acquired something."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מֵהָכָא: ״וְאַחַר בָּא חֶצְרוֹן אֶל בַּת מָכִיר אֲבִי גִלְעָד וַתֵּלֶד לוֹ אֶת שְׂגוּב״, וּכְתִיב: ״מִנִּי מָכִיר יָרְדוּ מְחוֹקְקִים״, וּכְתִיב ״יְהוּדָה מְחוֹקְקִי״.
human_translation: Rather, from here: “And afterward Hezron went in to the daughter of Machir, the father of Gilead…and she bore him Segub” and it is written: “Out of Machir came down governors” and it is written: “Judah is my governor”
llm_translation: Rather from here: "And after that, Hezron went in to the daughter of Machir the father of Gilead, and she bore him Segub." And it is written: "From Machir, rulers came down." And it is written, "Judah, you are he whom your brothers shall praise."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִיתִין דְּלָאו כְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ, דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: נָשָׂא אָדָם אִשָּׁה בְּיַלְדוּתוֹ — יִשָּׂא אִשָּׁה בְּזִקְנוּתוֹ. הָיוּ לוֹ בָּנִים בְּיַלְדוּתוֹ — יִהְיוּ לוֹ בָּנִים בְּזִקְנוּתוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בַּבֹּקֶר זְרַע אֶת זַרְעֶךָ וְלָעֶרֶב אַל תַּנַּח יָדֶךָ כִּי אֵינְךָ יוֹדֵעַ אֵי זֶה יִכְשָׁר הֲזֶה אוֹ זֶה וְאִם שְׁנֵיהֶם כְּאֶחָד טוֹבִים״.
human_translation: The mishna is not in accordance with Rabbi Yehoshua. As it is taught in a Rabbi Yehoshua says: a man married a woman in his youth, he should marry woman in his old age. he had children in his youth, he should have children in his old age, as it is stated: “In the morning sow your seed, and in the evening do not withhold your hand; for you do not know which shall prosper, whether this or that, or whether they both alike shall be good”
llm_translation: Mishnah that is not like Rabbi Yehoshua, as it was taught, Rabbi Yehoshua says: If a man marries a woman in his youth - he should marry a woman in his old age. If he had children in his youth - he should have children in his old age, as it is stated: "In the morning sow your seed, and in the evening do not withhold your hand, for you do not know which will succeed, whether this or that, or whether both are equally good."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: לָמַד תּוֹרָה בְּיַלְדוּתוֹ — יִלְמוֹד תּוֹרָה בְּזִקְנוּתוֹ. הָיוּ לוֹ תַּלְמִידִים בְּיַלְדוּתוֹ — יִהְיוּ לוֹ תַּלְמִידִים בְּזִקְנוּתוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בַּבֹּקֶר זְרַע אֶת זַרְעֶךָ וְגוֹ׳״. אָמְרוּ: שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר אָלֶף זוּגִים תַּלְמִידִים הָיוּ לוֹ לְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא מִגְּבָת עַד אַנְטִיפְרַס, וְכוּלָּן מֵתוּ בְּפֶרֶק אֶחָד, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁלֹּא נָהֲגוּ כָּבוֹד זֶה לָזֶה.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva says studied Torah in his youth he should study Torah in his old age; he had students in his youth he should have students in his old age, as it is stated: “In the morning sow your seed, etc.” They said Rabbi Akiva had twelve thousand pairs of students from Gevat to Antipatris and they all died in one period because they did not treat each other with respect.
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: One who learned Torah in his youth - let him learn Torah in his old age. If he had students in his youth - he will have students in his old age, as it is stated: "In the morning sow your seed, and so on." They said: Twelve thousand pairs of students Rabbi Akiva had, from Gevat to Antipatris, and they all died in one period, because they did not treat each other with respect.

hebrew_text: וְהָיָה הָעוֹלָם שָׁמֵם, עַד שֶׁבָּא רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אֵצֶל רַבּוֹתֵינוּ שֶׁבַּדָּרוֹם וּשְׁנָאָהּ לָהֶם: רַבִּי מֵאִיר, וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי, וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן שַׁמּוּעַ, וְהֵם הֵם הֶעֱמִידוּ תּוֹרָה אוֹתָהּ שָׁעָה.
human_translation: And the world was desolate until Rabbi Akiva came to our Rabbis in the South and taught to them. Rabbi Meir, Rabbi Yehuda, Rabbi Yosei, Rabbi Shimon, and Rabbi Elazar ben Shamua. And these are the very ones upheld Torah at that time.
llm_translation: And the world was desolate, until Rabbi Akiva came to our Rabbis in the South and expounded it to them: Rabbi Meir, Rabbi Yehuda, Rabbi Yosei, Rabbi Shimon, and Rabbi Elazar ben Shamua, and they established Torah at that time.

hebrew_text: תָּנָא, כּוּלָּם מֵתוּ מִפֶּסַח וְעַד עֲצֶרֶת. אָמַר רַב חָמָא בַּר אַבָּא וְאִיתֵּימָא רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אָבִין: כּוּלָּם מֵתוּ מִיתָה רָעָה. מַאי הִיא? אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: אַסְכָּרָה.
human_translation: taught all of them died from Passover until Shavuot . Rav Ḥama bar Abba said, and some say Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Avin: They all died a bad death. What is it Rav Naḥman said: Diphtheria.
llm_translation: Mishna: All of them died from Passover until Shavuot. Rav Hama son of Abba said, and some say it was Rabbi Hiyya bar Avin: All of them died a bad death. What is it? Rav Nachman said: Ascarah.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב מַתְנָא: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ.
human_translation: Rav Mattana said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yehoshua,
llm_translation: Rav Matna said: The halakha is according to Rabbi Yehoshua.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי תַּנְחוּם אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִילַאי: כׇּל אָדָם שֶׁאֵין לוֹ אִשָּׁה — שָׁרוּי בְּלֹא שִׂמְחָה, בְּלֹא בְּרָכָה, בְּלֹא טוֹבָה. בְּלֹא שִׂמְחָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְשָׂמַחְתָּ אַתָּה וּבֵיתֶךָ״. בְּלֹא בְּרָכָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״לְהָנִיחַ בְּרָכָה אֶל בֵּיתֶךָ״. בְּלֹא טוֹבָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״לֹא טוֹב הֱיוֹת הָאָדָם לְבַדּוֹ״.
human_translation: Rabbi Tanḥum said Rabbi Ḥanilai said: Any man who does not have a wife is without joy, without blessing, without goodness. without joy, as it is written: “And you shall rejoice, you and your household” without blessing, as it is written: “To cause a blessing to rest in your house” without goodness, as it is written: “It is not good that man should be alone”
llm_translation: Rabbi Tanhum said, Rabbi Hanilai said: Every man who does not have a wife - is dwelling without joy, without blessing, without goodness. Without joy, as it is written: "And you shall rejoice, you and your household." Without blessing, as it is written: "To bestow a blessing upon your household." Without goodness, as it is written: "It is not good for man to be alone."

hebrew_text: בְּמַעְרְבָא אָמְרִי: בְּלֹא תּוֹרָה, בְּלֹא חוֹמָה. בְּלֹא תּוֹרָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״הַאִם אֵין עֶזְרָתִי בִי וְתוּשִׁיָּה נִדְּחָה מִמֶּנִּי״. בְּלֹא חוֹמָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״נְקֵבָה תְּסוֹבֵב גָּבֶר״.
human_translation: In the West, say: without Torah, without a wall without Torah, as it is written: “Is it that I have no help in me, and that sound wisdom is driven from me?” without a wall, as it is written: “A woman shall go round a man”
llm_translation: In the West they say: Without Torah, without a wall. Without Torah, as it is written: "Is my help not within me, and has deliverance been driven from me?" Without a wall, as it is written: "A woman shall surround a man."

hebrew_text: רָבָא בַּר עוּלָּא אָמַר: בְּלֹא שָׁלוֹם, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְיָדַעְתָּ כִּי שָׁלוֹם אׇהֳלֶךָ וּפָקַדְתָּ נָוְךָ וְלֹא תֶחֱטָא״.
human_translation: Rava bar Ulla said: without peace, as it is written: “And you shall know that your tent is in peace; and you shall visit your habitation and shall miss nothing”
llm_translation: Rava bar Ulla said: Without peace, as it is written: "And you shall know that your tent is at peace, and you shall visit your fold and not sin."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: כׇּל הַיּוֹדֵעַ בְּאִשְׁתּוֹ שֶׁהִיא יִרְאַת שָׁמַיִם וְאֵינוֹ פּוֹקְדָהּ — נִקְרָא חוֹטֵא, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְיָדַעְתָּ כִּי שָׁלוֹם אׇהֳלֶךָ וְגוֹ׳״. וְאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: חַיָּיב אָדָם לִפְקוֹד אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁהוּא יוֹצֵא לַדֶּרֶךְ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְיָדַעְתָּ כִּי שָׁלוֹם אׇהֳלֶךָ וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: Whoever knows that his wife fears Heaven and he does not visit her, called a sinner, as it is stated: And you shall know that your tent is in peace; And Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: A man is obligated to visit his wife when he depart on a journey, as it is stated: “And you shall know that your tent is in peace, etc.”
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi: Anyone who knows that his wife is God-fearing and does not visit her is called a sinner, as it is stated: "And you shall know that there is peace in your tent." And Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: A person is obligated to visit his wife when he is about to embark on a journey, as it is stated: "And you shall know that there is peace in your tent."

hebrew_text: הָא מֵהָכָא נָפְקָא? מֵהָתָם נָפְקָא: ״וְאֶל אִישֵׁךְ תְּשׁוּקָתֵךְ״, מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהָאִשָּׁה מִשְׁתּוֹקֶקֶת עַל בַּעְלָהּ בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁהוּא יוֹצֵא לְדֶרֶךְ! אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: לֹא נִצְרְכָה אֶלָּא סָמוּךְ לְוִוסְתָּהּ.
human_translation: this derived from here? derived from there: “And your desire shall be to your husband” teaches that a wife desires her husband when he is about to depart on a journey. Rav Yosef said: is necessary only near her set pattern,
llm_translation: The Gemara asks: From where is this derived? It is derived from there: "And to your husband is your desire," teaching that a woman longs for her husband at the time he is departing on a journey! Rav Yosef said: It is necessary only adjacent to her bed.

hebrew_text: וְכַמָּה? אָמַר רָבָא: עוֹנָה. וְהָנֵי מִילֵּי לִדְבַר הָרְשׁוּת, אֲבָל לִדְבַר מִצְוָה — מִיטְּרִידִי.
human_translation: And how much Rava said: An interval And this applies for an optional matter, but to a matter mitzva, preoccupied
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And how much? Rava said: 'Onah.' And these matters are regarding matters of permission, but regarding matters of obligation - they are stringent." English translation:

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הָאוֹהֵב אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ כְּגוּפוֹ, וְהַמְכַבְּדָהּ יוֹתֵר מִגּוּפוֹ, וְהַמַּדְרִיךְ בָּנָיו וּבְנוֹתָיו בְּדֶרֶךְ יְשָׁרָה, וְהַמַּשִּׂיאָן סָמוּךְ לְפִירְקָן — עָלָיו הַכָּתוּב אוֹמֵר: ״וְיָדַעְתָּ כִּי שָׁלוֹם אׇהֳלֶךָ״. הָאוֹהֵב אֶת שְׁכֵינָיו, וְהַמְקָרֵב אֶת קְרוֹבָיו, וְהַנּוֹשֵׂא אֶת בַּת אֲחוֹתוֹ,
human_translation: The Sages taught: who loves his wife as himself, and who honors her more than himself, and who instructs his sons and daughters in an upright path, and who marries them off near the time they about him the verse states: And you shall know that your tent is in peace. who loves his neighbors, and who draws his relatives close, and who marries the daughter of his sister,
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: One who loves his wife as himself, and honors her more than himself, and guides his sons and daughters in the path of righteousness, and marries them off close to their maturity - upon him the verse says: "And you shall know that there is peace in your tent." One who loves his neighbors, and brings his relatives close, and marries his sister's daughter,

hebrew_text: וְהַמַּלְוֶה סֶלַע לְעָנִי בִּשְׁעַת דׇּחְקוֹ — עָלָיו הַכָּתוּב אוֹמֵר: ״אָז תִּקְרָא וַה׳ יַעֲנֶה תְּשַׁוַּע וְיֹאמַר הִנֵּנִי״.
human_translation: and who lends a sela to a pauper at his time of need, about him the verse states: “Then shall you call, and the Lord will answer; you shall cry, and He will say: Here I am”
llm_translation: The one who lends a stone to a poor person in his time of distress - upon him the Scripture says: "Then you shall call, and the Lord will answer; you shall cry, and He will say, 'Here I am.'"

hebrew_text: סִימָן: אִשָּׁה. וְקַרְקַע. עֵזֶר. זֹאת. שְׁתֵּי. הַבְרָכוֹת. תַּגָּרֵי. פָּחֲתִי. אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: כׇּל אָדָם שֶׁאֵין לוֹ אִשָּׁה — אֵינוֹ אָדָם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״זָכָר וּנְקֵבָה בְּרָאָם וַיִּקְרָא אֶת שְׁמָם אָדָם״. וְאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: כׇּל אָדָם שֶׁאֵין לוֹ קַרְקַע — אֵינוֹ אָדָם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הַשָּׁמַיִם שָׁמַיִם לַה׳ וְהָאָרֶץ נָתַן לִבְנֵי אָדָם״.
human_translation: a mnemonic Woman; and land; helper; this; two; the blessings; merchants; lowly. Rabbi Elazar said: Any man who does not have a wife is not a man, as it is stated: “Male and female He created them…and called their name Adam” And Rabbi Elazar said: Any man who does not have land is not a man, as it is stated: “The heavens are the heavens of the Lord; but the earth He has given to the children of men”
llm_translation: Topic: Woman. Earth. Help. This. Two. Blessings. Tagarei. Pachati. Rabbi Elazar said: Any man who does not have a woman - is not a man, as it is stated: "Male and female He created them and He called their name Adam." And Rabbi Elazar said: Any man who does not have land - is not a man, as it is stated: "The heavens belong to the Lord, but the earth He gave to the sons of man."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, מַאי דִּכְתִיב ״אֶעֱשֶׂה לּוֹ עֵזֶר כְּנֶגְדּוֹ״: זָכָה — עוֹזַרְתּוֹ, לֹא זָכָה — כְּנֶגְדּוֹ. וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר רָמֵי, כְּתִיב ״כְּנַגְּדוֹ״, וְקָרֵינַן ״כְּנֶגְדּוֹ״. זָכָה — כְּנֶגְדּוֹ, לֹא זָכָה — מְנַגַּדְתּוֹ.
human_translation: And Rabbi Elazar said: What is that is written: “I will make him a helpmate for him [ kenegdo ]” worthy helps him; not worthy against him. And some say Rabbi Elazar raised a contradiction: It is written Striking him [ kenagdo ], and we read For him [ kenegdo ]. worthy for him not worthy strikes him.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Elazar said, what is the meaning of what is written, "I will make him a helper as his counterpart": if he merits it - his helper, if he does not merit it - as his counterpart. And there are those who say: Rabbi Elazar raises an objection, it is written "as his counterpart," and we read it as "as his counterpart." If he merits it - as his counterpart, if he does not merit it - opposing him.

hebrew_text: אַשְׁכְּחֵיהּ רַבִּי יוֹסֵי לְאֵלִיָּהוּ, אֲמַר לֵיהּ, כְּתִיב: ״אֶעֱשֶׂה לוֹ עֵזֶר״, בַּמָּה אִשָּׁה עוֹזַרְתּוֹ לָאָדָם? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אָדָם מֵבִיא חִיטִּין — חִיטִּין כּוֹסֵס? פִּשְׁתָּן — פִּשְׁתָּן לוֹבֵשׁ? לֹא נִמְצֵאת מְאִירָה עֵינָיו וּמַעֲמִידָתוֹ עַל רַגְלָיו?!
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei encountered Elijah said to him: It is written: I will make him a helpmate. In what does a woman help a man? said to him: a man brings wheat chew wheat? flax, wear flax? not found lights up his eyes and stands him on his feet?
llm_translation: He found Rabbi Yosei with Elijah. He said to him, "It is written: 'I will make him a helper.' In what way does a woman help a man?" He said to him: "A man brings wheat - does wheat grind itself? Flax - does flax clothe itself? It is not found that she enlightens his eyes and establishes him on his feet?!"

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״זֹאת הַפַּעַם עֶצֶם מֵעֲצָמַי וּבָשָׂר מִבְּשָׂרִי״ — מְלַמֵּד שֶׁבָּא אָדָם עַל כׇּל בְּהֵמָה וְחַיָּה, וְלֹא נִתְקָרְרָה דַּעְתּוֹ עַד שֶׁבָּא עַל חַוָּה.
human_translation: And Rabbi Elazar said: What is that is written: “This is now bone of my bones and flesh of my flesh” teaches that Adam had intercourse with each animal and beast and his mind was not at ease, until he had intercourse with Eve.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Elazar said, what is the meaning of what is written: "This time, bone of my bones and flesh of my flesh" — it teaches that a person is superior to all animals and beasts, and his mind was not at ease until he came upon Eve.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״וְנִבְרְכוּ בְךָ כֹּל מִשְׁפְּחֹת הָאֲדָמָה״, אֲמַר לֵיהּ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לְאַבְרָהָם: שְׁתֵּי הַבְרָכוֹת טוֹבוֹת יֵשׁ לִי לְהַבְרִיךְ בְּךָ: רוּת הַמּוֹאֲבִיָּה, וְנַעֲמָה הָעַמּוֹנִית. ״כֹּל מִשְׁפְּחוֹת הָאֲדָמָה״ — אֲפִילּוּ מִשְׁפָּחוֹת הַדָּרוֹת בָּאֲדָמָה אֵין מִתְבָּרְכוֹת אֶלָּא בִּשְׁבִיל יִשְׂרָאֵל. ״כׇּל גּוֹיֵי הָאָרֶץ״ — אֲפִילּוּ סְפִינוֹת הַבָּאוֹת מִגַּלְיָא לְאַסְפַּמְיָא אֵינָן מִתְבָּרְכוֹת אֶלָּא בִּשְׁבִיל יִשְׂרָאֵל.
human_translation: And Rabbi Elazar said: What is that is written: “And in you shall all the families of the earth be blessed [ nivrekhu ]” The Holy One, Blessed be He, said to Abraham: I have two good shoots to graft lehavrikh onto you: Ruth the Moabite, and Naamah the Ammonite, “All the families of the earth” Even families that live in the earth, are blessed only due to the Jewish people. “All the nations of the earth even ships that come from Galia to Hispania are blessed only due to the Jewish people.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And Rabbi Elazar said, what is the meaning of what is written: "And all the families of the earth shall bless themselves by you"? The Holy One, blessed be He, said to Abraham: I have two good blessings to bless through you: Ruth the Moabite and Naamah the Ammonite. "All the families of the earth" - even the families of the dwellers on the earth do not receive blessings except for the sake of Israel. "All the nations of the earth" - even the ships that come from Galya to Aspamya do not receive blessings except for the sake of Israel.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: עֲתִידִים כׇּל בַּעֲלֵי אוּמָּנִיּוֹת שֶׁיַּעַמְדוּ עַל הַקַּרְקַע, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְיָרְדוּ מֵאֳנִיּוֹתֵיהֶם כֹּל תֹּפְשֵׂי מָשׁוֹט מַלָּחִים כֹּל חֹבְלֵי הַיָּם עַל הָאָרֶץ יַעֲמֹדוּ״. וְאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: אֵין לְךָ אוּמָּנוּת פְּחוּתָה מִן הַקַּרְקַע, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְיָרְדוּ״. רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר חַזְיַהּ לְהַהִיא אַרְעָא דְּשָׁדֵי בַּיהּ כְּרָבָא לְפוּתְיָא, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִי תִּשְׁדְּיֵיהּ לְאוּרְכָּיךְ — הַפּוֹכֵי בְּעִיסְקָא טָב מִינָּךְ.
human_translation: And Rabbi Elazar said: All craftsmen are destined to stand upon the land, as it is stated: “And all that handle the oar, the mariners, and all the pilots of the sea, shall come down from their ships, they shall stand upon the land” And Rabbi Elazar said: There is no occupation lowlier than the land, as it is stated: “And they shall come down,” Rabbi Elazar saw land that was plowed its width. He said to it: if they plow you lengthwise, conducting business is better than you,
llm_translation: And Rabbi Elazar said: All owners of ships are destined to stand on the ground, as it is stated: "And they shall come down from their ships, all who handle the oar, the mariners, all the seafaring men, they shall stand on the land." And Rabbi Elazar said: You have no craftsmanship lower than the ground, as it is stated: "And they shall come down." Rabbi Elazar saw a certain land that produced pumpkins as large as rafts, he said to it: If you do not produce for your length - the pumpkin is better than you.

hebrew_text: רַב עָל לְבֵינֵי שֻׁיבְלֵי, חֲזַנְהוּ דְּקָא נָיְיפָן, אֲמַר לְהוּ: אִי נָיְיפַתְּ — אִיתְנוֹפֵי. הַפּוֹכֵי בְּעִיסְקָא טָב מִינָּךְ. אָמַר רָבָא: מְאָה זוּזֵי בְּעִיסְקָא — כֹּל יוֹמָא בִּשְׂרָא וְחַמְרָא, מְאָה זוּזֵי בְּאַרְעָא — מִילְחָא וַחֲפוּרָה. וְלֹא עוֹד אֶלָּא מַגְנְיָא לֵיהּ אַאַרְעָא, וּמַרְמְיָא לֵיהּ תִּיגְרֵי.
human_translation: Rav entered between the sheaves saw them waving He said to them: If you wave wave, conducting business is better than you. Rava said: a hundred dinars in business meat and wine every day, a hundred dinars of land salt and vegetables. And what is more, causes him to lie on the ground and draws quarrels upon him
llm_translation: Rav said to the residents of Shuvali, their cantor who was beautiful, he said to them: if you are beautiful - you will be beaten. The bread in the basket is better than yours. Rava said: one hundred zuz in the basket - every day with meat and wine, one hundred zuz in the land - with salt and vegetables. And not only that, but the land protects it, and the basket exposes it to disputes.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: זְרַע וְלָא תִּזְבֹּין. אַף עַל גַּב דְּכִי הֲדָדֵי נִינְהוּ, הָנֵי מִבָּרְכָן. זַבֵּין וְלָא תִּיזּוֹל. הָנֵי מִילֵּי בִּיסְתַּרְקֵי, אֲבָל גְּלִימָא — לָא מִיתְרַמְיָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: Sow and do not buy Even though they are equal to each other these will be blessed. buy rather than weave [ teizul ] This applies mats [ bistarkei ], but cloak he will not find it
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: "Sow, but do not irrigate." Even though they are like Hadadeans, those are blessed. Irrigate, but do not soak. Those are matters of concealment, but a cloak does not protect it.

hebrew_text: טוּם וְלָא תְּשַׁפֵּיץ. שַׁפֵּיץ וְלָא תִּיבְנֵי. שֶׁכׇּל הָעוֹסֵק בְּבִנְיָן — מִתְמַסְכֵּן. קְפוֹץ זְבֹין אַרְעָא, מְתוֹן נְסֵיב אִיתְּתָא. נְחֵית דַּרְגָּא נְסֵיב אִיתְּתָא. סַק דַּרְגָּא בְּחַר שׁוֹשְׁבִינָא.
human_translation: close up and do not plaster plaster and do not build As, whoever engages in construction becomes poor. Hurry buy land patient and marry a woman Descend a level marry a woman ascend a level choose a friend [ shushevina ].
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Tum v'lo t'shapeitz. Shapeitz v'lo tivnei. Shekol ha'osek bivniyan — mitmasken. K'fotz z'voin ar'a, m'ton n'seiv it'ta. N'cheit darga n'seiv it'ta. Sak darga b'char shoshvinah." English translation: "Inspect and do not scatter. Scatter and do not build. For anyone who engages in building — becomes impoverished. One who jumps over a fence to steal land, ends up with a wife. One who descends a step ends up with a wife. Remove a step in a wall — and sit in peace."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בַּר אֲבִינָא: אֵין פּוּרְעָנוּת בָּאָה לָעוֹלָם אֶלָּא בִּשְׁבִיל יִשְׂרָאֵל, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הִכְרַתִּי גוֹיִם נָשַׁמּוּ פִּנּוֹתָם הֶחֱרַבְתִּי חוּצוֹתָם״, וּכְתִיב: ״אָמַרְתִּי אַךְ תִּירְאִי אוֹתִי תִּקְחִי מוּסָר״.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar bar Avina said: Calamity befalls the world only due to the Jewish people, as it is stated: “I have cut off nations, their corners are desolate; I have made their streets waste” and it is written: “I said: Surely you will fear Me, you will receive correction”
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar son of Avina said: Misfortune comes to the world only on account of Israel, as it is stated: "I have cut off nations, their corners are desolate; I have made their streets waste." And it is written: "Surely you will fear Me; you will accept correction."

hebrew_text: רַב הֲוָה מִיפְּטַר מֵרַבִּי חִיָּיא, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: רַחֲמָנָא לַיצְּלָךְ מִמִּידֵּי דְּקָשֵׁה מִמּוֹתָא. וּמִי אִיכָּא מִידֵּי דְּקָשֵׁה מִמּוֹתָא? נְפַק, דָּק וְאַשְׁכַּח: ״וּמוֹצֶא אֲנִי מַר מִמָּוֶת אֶת הָאִשָּׁה וְגוֹ׳״. רַב הֲוָה קָא מְצַעֲרָא לֵיהּ דְּבֵיתְהוּ, כִּי אָמַר לַהּ ״עֲבִידִי לִי טְלוֹפְחֵי״, עָבְדָא לֵיהּ חִימְצֵי. ״חִימְצֵי״, עָבְדָא לֵיהּ טְלוֹפְחֵי.
human_translation: Rav was taking leave of Rabbi Ḥiyya, said to him: May the Merciful One save you from something that is worse than death. Is there anything that is worse than death? He went, examined and found “And I find more bitter than death the woman, etc.” Rav’s wife would aggravate him. When he would say to her: Prepare me lentils, she would prepare him peas; peas, she would prepare him lentils.
llm_translation: Rav was taking leave of Rabbi Chiya, he said to him: "May the Merciful One save you from the hands of death." Is there anything harder than death? He went out, searched, and found: "I find more bitter than death the woman, etc." Rav was causing distress to his wife, for he said to her, "Prepare for me lentils," so she made for him chickpeas. "Chickpeas," she made for him lentils.

hebrew_text: כִּי גְדַל חִיָּיא בְּרֵיהּ, אֲפֵיךְ לַהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִיעַלַּיָא לָךְ אִמָּךְ! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֲנָא הוּא דְּקָא אָפֵיכְנָא לַהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ, הַיְינוּ דְּקָא אָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי: דְּנָפֵיק מִינָּךְ, טַעְמָא מַלְּפָךְ. אַתְּ לָא תַּעֲבֵיד הָכִי, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לִמְּדוּ לְשׁוֹנָם דַּבֶּר שֶׁקֶר הַעֲוֵה וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: When Ḥiyya, his son, grew up, he would reverse to her, said to Your mother has improved you He said to It is I who reverse to her. said to him: This is that people say: who comes from you shall teach you wisdom; You, should not do so, as it is stated: “They have taught their tongue to speak lies, they commit iniquity, etc.”
llm_translation: When G'dal, son of Hiyya, grew up, he turned his face away from her. She said to him: "May your mother be bereaved!" He said to her: "I am the one who is turning my face away from her." He said to her: "This is what people say: 'When you depart from her, the taste of your words will be sweet.' You should not act in this way, as it is said: 'They have taught their tongue to speak lies; they weary themselves to commit iniquity.'"

hebrew_text: רַבִּי חִיָּיא הֲוָה קָא מְצַעֲרָא לֵיהּ דְּבֵיתְהוּ. כִּי הֲוָה מַשְׁכַּח מִידֵּי, צָיַיר לֵיהּ בְּסוּדָרֵיהּ וּמַיְיתֵי נִיהֲלַהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב: וְהָא קָא מְצַעֲרָא לֵיהּ לְמָר? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: דַּיֵּינוּ שֶׁמְּגַדְּלוֹת בָּנֵינוּ, וּמַצִּילוֹת אוֹתָנוּ
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya’s wife would aggravate him. when he would find something he would wrap it in his shawl and bring to her. Rav said to him: Doesn’t she aggravate you? said to him: It is enough for us raise our children and save us
llm_translation: Rabbi Chiya was causing distress to his wife. When he would forget from him, he would draw her in his garments and appease her. Rav said to him: Is it not causing distress to the Master? He said to him: Sufficient are the judges who raise our children and save us.

hebrew_text: מִן הַחֵטְא. מַקְרֵי לֵיהּ רַב יְהוּדָה לְרַב יִצְחָק בְּרֵיהּ ״וּמוֹצֶא אֲנִי מַר מִמָּוֶת אֶת הָאִשָּׁה״. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: כְּגוֹן מַאן? כְּגוֹן אִמָּךְ.
human_translation: from sin. Rav Yehuda teaching to Rav Yitzḥak, his son, “And I find more bitter than death the woman” said to him: For example, whom? For example, your mother.
llm_translation: From the sin. Rav Yehudah called to Rav Yitzchak his son, "And I find something more bitter than death, the woman." He said to him: Who is an example? Your mother is an example.

hebrew_text: וְהָא מַתְנֵי לֵיהּ רַב יְהוּדָה לְרַב יִצְחָק בְּרֵיהּ: אֵין אָדָם מוֹצֵא קוֹרַת רוּחַ אֶלָּא מֵאִשְׁתּוֹ רִאשׁוֹנָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״יְהִי מְקוֹרְךָ בָרוּךְ וּשְׂמַח מֵאֵשֶׁת נְעוּרֶיךָ״, וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ: כְּגוֹן מַאן? כְּגוֹן אִמָּךְ! מִתְקָיף תְּקִיפָא, וְעַבּוֹרֵי מְיעַבְּרָא בְּמִלַּהּ.
human_translation: Didn’t Rav Yehuda teach Rav Yitzḥak, his son, A man finds peace of mind only with his first wife, as it is stated: “Let your fountain be blessed, and have joy from the wife of your youth” and said to him: For example, whom, For example, your mother. forceful, but easily appeased.
llm_translation: The Gemara teaches it to Rav Yehuda to Rav Yitzchak his son: A person does not find tranquility except from his first wife, as it is stated: "Let your fountain be blessed, and rejoice with the wife of your youth." He said to him: Who is an example of this? Your mother is an example of this! The objection was raised, and the matter was left unresolved.

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָּמֵי אִשָּׁה רָעָה? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: מְקַשְּׁטָא לֵיהּ תַּכָּא וּמְקַשְּׁטָא לֵיהּ פּוּמָּא. רָבָא אָמַר: מְקַשְּׁטָא לֵיהּ תַּכָּא וּמַהְדְּרָא לֵיהּ גַּבָּא.
human_translation: What are the circumstances a bad wife? Abaye said: She arranges a table for him and arranges mouth for him Rava said: She arranges a table for him and turns back to him,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: How is the appearance of a wicked woman? Abaye said: She adorns herself with a container and adorns herself with a coal. Rava said: She adorns herself with a container and honors herself with a hump.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חָמָא בַּר חֲנִינָא: כֵּיוָן שֶׁנָּשָׂא אָדָם אִשָּׁה עֲוֹנוֹתָיו מִתְפַּקְּקִין, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״מָצָא אִשָּׁה מָצָא טוֹב וַיָּפֶק רָצוֹן מֵה׳״. בְּמַעְרְבָא כִּי נָסֵיב אִינָשׁ אִיתְּתָא, אָמְרִי לֵיהּ הָכִי: ״מָצָא״ אוֹ ״מוֹצֵא״? ״מָצָא״ דִּכְתִיב: ״מָצָא אִשָּׁה מָצָא טוֹב״, מוֹצֵא דִּכְתִיב: ״וּמוֹצֶא אֲנִי מַר מִמָּוֶת אֶת הָאִשָּׁה״.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥama bar Ḥanina said: Once a man marries a woman his iniquities crumble [ mitpakekin ], as it is stated: “Whoever finds a wife finds good, and obtains [ veyafek ] favor of the Lord” In the West, when a man married a woman they would say to him as follows: Matza or motze ? matza , as it is written: Whoever finds [ matza ] a wife finds good, motze , as it is written: “And I find [ motze ] more bitter than death the woman”
llm_translation: Rabbi Ḥama son of Ḥanina said: Once a person marries, his sins are scrutinized, as it is stated: "He who finds a wife finds good and obtains favor from the Lord." In the West, when a man marries a woman, they ask him: Is it "matsa" or "motzei"? "Matsa," as it is written: "He who finds a wife finds good," "motzei" as it is written: "And I find more bitter than death the woman."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: אִשָּׁה רָעָה מִצְוָה לְגָרְשָׁהּ, דִּכְתִיב: ״גָּרֵשׁ לֵץ וְיֵצֵא מָדוֹן וְיִשְׁבּוֹת דִּין וְקָלוֹן״, וְאָמַר רָבָא: אִשָּׁה רָעָה וּכְתוּבָּתָהּ מְרוּבָּה — צָרָתָהּ בְּצִדָּהּ. דְּאָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי: בַּחֲבִרְתַּהּ, וְלָא בְּסִילְתָּא. וְאָמַר רָבָא: קָשָׁה אִשָּׁה רָעָה כְּיוֹם סַגְרִיר, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״דֶּלֶף טוֹרֵד בְּיוֹם סַגְרִיר וְאֵשֶׁת מִדְיָנִים נִשְׁתָּוָה״.
human_translation: Rava said: It is a mitzva to divorce a bad wife, as it is written: “Cast out the scorner and contention will depart; strife and shame will cease” And Rava said: A bad wife whose marriage contract is large her rival wife is at her side. As people say with her peer and not with a thorn. And Rava said: A bad wife is as troublesome as a day of heavy rain, as it is stated: “A continual dropping on a very rainy day and a contentious woman are alike”
llm_translation: Rava said: A bad wife, it is a commandment to divorce her, as it is written: "Drive out the scoffer, and strife will go out, and quarreling and disgrace will cease." And Rava said: A bad wife whose deeds are numerous - her distress is on her side. For people say: In her companionship, but not in her basket. And Rava said: A bad wife is as difficult as the day of closing, as it is said: "A leaking roof on a rainy day and a quarrelsome wife are alike."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רָבָא: בֹּא וּרְאֵה כַּמָּה טוֹבָה אִשָּׁה טוֹבָה, וְכַמָּה רָעָה אִשָּׁה רָעָה. כַּמָּה טוֹבָה אִשָּׁה טוֹבָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״מָצָא אִשָּׁה מָצָא טוֹב״, אִי בְּגַוַּהּ מִשְׁתַּעֵי קְרָא — כַּמָּה טוֹבָה אִשָּׁה טוֹבָה, שֶׁהַכָּתוּב מְשַׁבְּחָהּ. אִי בַּתּוֹרָה מִשְׁתַּעֵי קְרָא — כַּמָּה טוֹבָה אִשָּׁה טוֹבָה, שֶׁהַתּוֹרָה נִמְשְׁלָה בָּהּ. כַּמָּה רָעָה אִשָּׁה רָעָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״וּמוֹצֶא אֲנִי מַר מִמָּוֶת אֶת הָאִשָּׁה״. אִי בְּגַוַּהּ מִשְׁתַּעֵי קָרָא — כַּמָּה רָעָה אִשָּׁה רָעָה, שֶׁהַכָּתוּב מְגַנֶּהָ. אִי בְּגֵיהִנָּם מִשְׁתַּעֵי קְרָא — כַּמָּה רָעָה אִשָּׁה רָעָה, שֶׁגֵּיהִנָּם נִמְשְׁלָה בָּהּ.
human_translation: And Rava said: Come and see how good a good wife is and how bad a bad wife is. How good is a good wife? As it is written: Whoever finds a wife finds good. If the verse speaks of her, how good a good wife is, as the Bible praises her. If the verse speaks of the Torah, how good a good wife is, as the Torah is compared to her. how bad is a bad wife? As it is written: “And I find more bitter than death the woman.” If the verse speaks of her, how bad a bad wife is, as the Bible condemns her. If the verse speaks of Gehenna, how bad a bad wife is, as Gehenna is compared to her.
llm_translation: And Rava said: Come and see how good a good woman is, and how bad a bad woman is. How good a good woman is, as it is written: "He who finds a wife finds good," if in his lifetime, the verse is fulfilled — how good a good woman is, for the Scripture praises her. If in matters of Torah, the verse is fulfilled — how good a good woman is, for the Torah is compared to her. How bad a bad woman is, as it is written: "And I find more bitter than death the woman," if in his lifetime, the verse is fulfilled — how bad a bad woman is, for the Scripture protects him. If in Gehenna, the verse is fulfilled — how bad a bad woman is, for Gehenna is compared to her.

hebrew_text: ״הִנְנִי מֵבִיא רָעָה אֲשֶׁר לֹא יוּכְלוּ לָצֵאת מִמֶּנָּה״, אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ: זוֹ אִשָּׁה רָעָה וּכְתוּבָּתָהּ מְרוּבָּה. ״נְתָנַנִי ה׳ בִּידֵי לֹא אוּכַל קוּם״, אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא אָמַר מָר עוּקְבָא בַּר חִיָּיא: זוֹ אִשָּׁה רָעָה וּכְתוּבָּתָהּ מְרוּבָּה. בְּמַעְרְבָא אָמְרוּ: זֶה שֶׁמְּזוֹנוֹתָיו תְּלוּיִן בְּכַסְפּוֹ.
human_translation: “Behold, I will bring evil upon them, which they shall not be able to escape” Rav Naḥman said Rabba bar Avuh said: This is a bad wife whose marriage contract is large. “The Lord has given me into the hands of those against whom I cannot stand” Rav Ḥisda said Mar Ukva bar Ḥiyya said: This is a bad wife whose marriage contract is large. In the West, they said this whose food is dependent on his money.
llm_translation: "Behold, I am bringing evil upon them from which they cannot escape," said Rav Nachman in the name of Rabba bar Avuhah: This refers to a wicked woman whose deeds are numerous. "The Lord has given me into the hands, I cannot rise," said Rav Chisda in the name of Mar Ukva bar Chama: This refers to a wicked woman whose deeds are numerous. In the West, they say: This refers to one whose sustenance depends on his money.

hebrew_text: ״בָּנֶיךָ וּבְנוֹתֶיךָ נְתוּנִים לְעַם אַחֵר״, אָמַר רַב חָנָן בַּר רָבָא אָמַר רַב: זוֹ אֵשֶׁת הָאָב. ״בְּגוֹי נָבָל אַכְעִיסֵם״, אָמַר רַב חָנָן בַּר רָבָא אָמַר רַב: זוֹ אִשָּׁה רָעָה וּכְתוּבָּתָהּ מְרוּבָּה. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: אֵלּוּ הַמִּינִים. וְכֵן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״אָמַר נָבָל בְּלִבּוֹ אֵין אֱלֹהִים וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: “Your sons and your daughters shall be given to another people” Rav Ḥanan bar Rava said Rav said: This is father’s wife, “I will provoke them with a vile nation” Rav Ḥanan bar Rava said Rav said: This is a bad wife whose marriage contract is large. Rabbi Eliezer says these are apostates, and so too states: “The vile man has said in his heart: There is no God,
llm_translation: "Your sons and daughters are given to another people," said Rav Hanan bar Rava said Rav: This refers to the stepmother. "In a foolish nation, I will provoke them," said Rav Hanan bar Rava said Rav: This refers to a wicked woman whose deeds are numerous. Rabbi Eliezer says: These are the heretics. And he also says: "Nabal said in his heart, 'There is no God, etc.'"

hebrew_text: בְּמַתְנִיתָא תָּנָא: אֵלּוּ אַנְשֵׁי בַּרְבַּרְיָא וְאַנְשֵׁי מַרְטְנַאי, שֶׁמְּהַלְּכִין עֲרוּמִּים בַּשּׁוּק. שֶׁאֵין לְךָ מְשׁוּקָּץ וּמְתוֹעָב לִפְנֵי הַמָּקוֹם יוֹתֵר מִמִּי שֶׁמְּהַלֵּךְ בַּשּׁוּק עָרוֹם. רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: אֵלּוּ חַבָּרִים. אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אֲתוֹ חַבָּרֵי לְבָבֶל, שְׁגָא נְפַל. אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: מְקַבְּלִי שׁוּחְדָּא, תָּרֵיץ יְתֵיב.
human_translation: It was taught in a baraita these are the inhabitants of Barbarya and the inhabitants of Martenai, who walk naked in the marketplace, as none is more despised and abominable before the Omnipresent than one who walks naked in the marketplace. Rabbi Yoḥanan said: These are Ḥabbarim , they said to Rabbi Yoḥanan: Ḥabbarim have come to Babylonia, he shuddered and fell They said to him: they accept bribes. he straightened himself sat
llm_translation: In the Mishnah it was taught: These are the people of Barvarya and the people of Martnaya, who walk naked in the marketplace. For there is no abomination and detestable thing before the Omnipresent more than one who walks naked in the marketplace. Rabbi Yochanan said: These are companions. They said to Rabbi Yochanan: Your companions have come to Babylon, the pride has fallen. They said to him: Accept a bribe, and you will give a ruling.

hebrew_text: גָּזְרוּ עַל שְׁלֹשָׁה מִפְּנֵי שְׁלֹשָׁה. גָּזְרוּ עַל הַבָּשָׂר — מִפְּנֵי הַמַּתָּנוֹת, גָּזְרוּ עַל הַמֶּרְחֲצָאוֹת — מִפְּנֵי הַטְּבִילָה.
human_translation: issue decrees against three due to three They decreed against meat, due to the gifts They decreed against bathhouses, due to immersion.
llm_translation: They decreed regarding three because of three. They decreed regarding meat - because of the loins, they decreed regarding baths - because of immersion.

hebrew_text: קָא מְחַטְּטִי שָׁכְבֵי — מִפְּנֵי שֶׁשְּׂמֵחִים בְּיוֹם אֵידָם. שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְהָיְתָה יַד ה׳ בָּכֶם וּבַאֲבוֹתֵיכֶם״. אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר שְׁמוּאֵל: (זוֹ) חַטּוֹטֵי שָׁכְבֵי. דְּאָמַר מָר: בַּעֲוֹן חַיִּים — מֵתִים מִתְחַטְּטִין.
human_translation: they exhumed the dead because rejoice on holidays as it is stated: “Then shall the hand of the Lord be against you and against your fathers” Rabba bar Shmuel said: This exhuming the dead, as the Master said: to the iniquity of the living, the dead are exhumed.
llm_translation: I am sifting through the beds - because they rejoice on the day of their calamity. As it is stated: "And the hand of the Lord shall be against you and your fathers." Rabbah bar Shmuel said: (This refers to) those who sift through the beds. As the Master said: For the sin of the living, the dead are sifted.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא לְרַבָּה בַּר מָארִי, כְּתִיב: ״לֹא יֵאָסְפוּ וְלֹא יִקָּבֵרוּ לְדוֹמֶן עַל פְּנֵי הָאֲדָמָה יִהְיוּ״, וּכְתִיב: ״וְנִבְחַר מָוֶת מֵחַיִּים״. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: נִבְחַר מָוֶת לָרְשָׁעִים, שֶׁלֹּא יִחְיוּ בְּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה וְיֶחֶטְאוּ, וְיִפְּלוּ בְּגֵיהִנָּם.
human_translation: Rava said to Rabba bar Mari: It is written: “They shall not be gathered nor buried; they shall be for dung upon the face of the earth” and it is written: “And death shall be chosen rather than life” said to him: Death is preferable for the wicked, that they not live in this world and sin and descend into Gehenna.
llm_translation: Rava said to Rabba bar Mari, it is written: "They shall not be gathered nor buried; they shall be as dung upon the face of the earth," and it is written: "And death shall be chosen rather than life." He said to him: Death is chosen for the wicked, that they shall not live in this world and sin, and they shall fall into Gehenna.

hebrew_text: כָּתוּב בְּסֵפֶר בֶּן סִירָא: ״אִשָּׁה טוֹבָה מַתָּנָה טוֹבָה לְבַעְלָהּ״, וּכְתִיב: ״טוֹבָה בְּחֵיק יְרֵא אֱלֹהִים תִּנָּתֵן״. ״אִשָּׁה רָעָה צָרַעַת לְבַעְלָהּ״, מַאי תַּקַּנְתֵּיהּ — ״יְגָרְשֶׁנָּה וְיִתְרַפֵּא מִצָּרַעְתּוֹ״. ״אִשָּׁה יָפֶה אַשְׁרֵי בַּעְלָהּ, מִסְפַּר יָמָיו כִּפְלַיִם״.
human_translation: It is written in the book of Ben Sira: A good wife is a good gift for her husband. And it is written: A good one will be placed in the bosom of a God-fearing man; a bad wife is a plague to her husband. What is his remedy? He should divorce her and he will be cured of his plague. A beautiful wife, happy is her husband; the number of his days are doubled.
llm_translation: It is written in the book of Ben Sira: "A good wife is a good gift to her husband," and it is written: "Goodness is given to one who fears God." "An evil wife is a leprosy to her husband," what is her remedy? "Let him divorce her and be healed from his leprosy." "A beautiful wife brings happiness to her husband, the days of his life are doubled."

hebrew_text: ״הַעְלֵם עֵינֶיךָ מֵאֵשֶׁת חֵן פֶּן תִּלָּכֵד בִּמְצוּדָתָהּ. אַל תֵּט אֵצֶל בַּעְלָהּ לִמְסוֹךְ עִמּוֹ יַיִן וְשֵׁכָר, כִּי בְּתוֹאַר אִשָּׁה יָפָה רַבִּים הוּשְׁחֲתוּ, וַעֲצוּמִים כׇּל הֲרוּגֶיהָ״. ״רַבִּים הָיוּ פִּצְעֵי רוֹכֵל״. ״הַמַּרְגִּילִים לִדְבַר עֶרְוָה כְּנִיצוֹץ מַבְעִיר גַּחֶלֶת. כִּכְלוּב מָלֵא עוֹף — כֵּן בָּתֵּיהֶם מְלֵאִים מִרְמָה״.
human_translation: Turn your eyes from a graceful woman lest you be caught in her trap. Do not turn to her husband to mix wine and strong drink with him, For on the countenance of a beautiful woman many have been destroyed, and her slain is a mighty host. many have been the wounded peddlers. Those who accustom to licentious matters are like a spark that ignites a coal. As a cage is full of birds, so are their houses full of deceit.
llm_translation: "Turn away your eyes from a woman of grace, lest you be ensnared by her allure. Do not recline with her husband to drink wine and strong drink, for many have been led astray by the beauty of a woman, and mighty men have been slain by her. 'Many were the wounds of the peddlers.' 'Those who accustom themselves to speak of lewdness are like a spark that kindles coals.' 'As a cage full of birds, so are their houses full of deceit.'"

hebrew_text: ״אַל תֵּצַר צָרַת מָחָר, כִּי לֹא תֵדַע מַה יֵּלֶד יוֹם. שֶׁמָּא מָחָר בָּא וְאֵינֶנּוּ, נִמְצָא מִצְטַעֵר עַל הָעוֹלָם שֶׁאֵין שֶׁלּוֹ״. ״מְנַע רַבִּים מִתּוֹךְ בֵּיתֶךָ, וְלֹא הַכֹּל תָּבִיא בֵּיתֶךָ״. ״רַבִּים יִהְיוּ דּוֹרְשֵׁי שְׁלוֹמֶךָ. גַּלֵּה סוֹד לְאֶחָד מֵאָלֶף״.
human_translation: Do not suffer from tomorrow’s trouble, as you do not know what a day will bring. Perhaps tomorrow comes, not he consequently upset over a world that is not his. Prevent a crowd from inside your house, and do not bring all your house. a crowd seeks your welfare, Reveal a secret to one in a thousand,
llm_translation: "Do not worry about tomorrow's trouble, for you do not know what a day may bring forth. Perhaps tomorrow will come and he will not be found, causing one to grieve over a world that is not his. Withhold many from entering your house, and do not bring everyone into your house. Many will seek your peace. Reveal a secret to one out of a thousand."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אַסִּי: אֵין בֶּן דָּוִד בָּא עַד שֶׁיִּכְלוּ כׇּל הַנְּשָׁמוֹת שֶׁבַּגּוּף, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי רוּחַ מִלְּפָנַי יַעֲטוֹף וּנְשָׁמוֹת אֲנִי עָשִׂיתִי״. תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: כׇּל מִי שֶׁאֵין עוֹסֵק בִּפְרִיָּה וּרְבִיָּה — כְּאִילּוּ שׁוֹפֵךְ דָּמִים, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״שׁוֹפֵךְ דַּם הָאָדָם בָּאָדָם דָּמוֹ יִשָּׁפֵךְ״, וּכְתִיב בָּתְרֵיהּ: ״וְאַתֶּם פְּרוּ וּרְבוּ״.
human_translation: Rabbi Asi said: The son of David, will not come until all the souls of the body have been finished, As it is stated: “For the spirit that enwraps itself is from Me, and the souls that I have made” It is taught Rabbi Eliezer says: Anyone who does not engage in fruitful and multiply as though he sheds blood, as it is stated: “Whoever sheds the blood of man, by man shall his blood be shed” and it is written afterward: “And you, be fruitful and multiply”
llm_translation: Rabbi Assi said: The son of David will not come until all the souls in the body are finished, as it is stated: "For the spirit from before Me will envelop, and the souls which I have made." It was taught in a baraita: Rabbi Eliezer says: Anyone who does not engage in the mitzvah of procreation is as if he sheds blood, as it is stated: "Whoever sheds the blood of man, by man shall his blood be shed." And it is written thereafter: "Be fruitful and multiply."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב אוֹמֵר: כְּאִילּוּ מְמַעֵט הַדְּמוּת, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי בְּצֶלֶם אֱלֹהִים עָשָׂה אֶת הָאָדָם״, וּכְתִיב בָּתְרֵיהּ: ״וְאַתֶּם פְּרוּ וְגוֹ׳״. בֶּן עַזַּאי אוֹמֵר: כְּאִילּוּ שׁוֹפֵךְ דָּמִים וּמְמַעֵט הַדְּמוּת, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְאַתֶּם פְּרוּ וּרְבוּ״.
human_translation: Rabbi Ya’akov says: It is as though he diminishes the Image, as it is stated: “For in the image of God He made man” and it is written afterward: “And you, be fruitful Ben Azzai says: as though he sheds blood and diminishes the Image, as it is stated: “And you, be fruitful and multiply,”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yaakov says: As if diminishing the likeness, as it is stated: "For in the image of God He made man," and it is written thereafter: "And you, be fruitful and multiply." Ben Azzai says: As if shedding blood and diminishing the likeness, as it is stated: "And you, be fruitful and multiply."

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ לוֹ לְבֶן עַזַּאי: יֵשׁ נָאֶה דּוֹרֵשׁ וְנָאֶה מְקַיֵּים, נָאֶה מְקַיֵּים וְאֵין נָאֶה דּוֹרֵשׁ, וְאַתָּה נָאֶה דּוֹרֵשׁ, וְאֵין נָאֶה מְקַיֵּים. אָמַר לָהֶן בֶּן עַזַּאי: וּמָה אֶעֱשֶׂה שֶׁנַּפְשִׁי חָשְׁקָה בַּתּוֹרָה, אֶפְשָׁר לָעוֹלָם שֶׁיִּתְקַיֵּים עַל יְדֵי אֲחֵרִים.
human_translation: They said to ben Azzai: There expounds well and fulfills well, fulfills well and does not expound well. But you, expound well and you do not fulfill well Ben Azzai said to them: What shall I do, as my soul yearns for Torah, It is possible for the world to be maintained by others,
llm_translation: They said to him, to Ben Azzai: There is one who is pleasing in expounding and pleasing in fulfilling, pleasing in fulfilling and not pleasing in expounding, and you are pleasing in expounding, and not pleasing in fulfilling. Ben Azzai said to them: And what shall I do, for my soul desires the Torah, perhaps it is forever that it will be fulfilled by others.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא אִידַּךְ, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: כׇּל מִי שֶׁאֵין עוֹסֵק בִּפְרִיָּה וּרְבִיָּה — כְּאִילּוּ שׁוֹפֵךְ דָּמִים, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״שׁוֹפֵךְ דַּם הָאָדָם״, וּסְמִיךְ לֵיהּ: ״וְאַתֶּם פְּרוּ וְגוֹ׳״. רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה אוֹמֵר: כְּאִילּוּ מְמַעֵט הַדְּמוּת. בֶּן עַזַּאי אוֹמֵר וְכוּ׳. אָמְרוּ לוֹ לְבֶן עַזַּאי: יֵשׁ נָאֶה דּוֹרֵשׁ וְכוּ׳.
human_translation: It is taught another Rabbi Eliezer says: Anyone who does not engage in fruitful and multiply as though he sheds blood, as it is stated: “Whoever sheds the blood of man,” and near it: “And you, be fruitful Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya says: as though he diminishes the Image. Ben Azzai says: They said to ben Azzai: There is expounds well, etc.
llm_translation: It was taught in another Baraita: Rabbi Eliezer says: Anyone who does not engage in procreation is as if he sheds blood, as it is stated: "Whoever sheds the blood of man," and juxtaposed to it: "And you, be fruitful, etc." Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah says: It is as if he diminishes the likeness. Ben Azzai says, and so forth. They said to Ben Azzai: There is a beautiful quality in seeking, etc.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״וּבְנֻחֹה יֹאמַר שׁוּבָה ה׳ רִבְבוֹת אַלְפֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל״ —
human_translation: The Sages taught “And when it rested, he would say: Return, Lord, to the ten thousands of the thousands of Israel”
llm_translation: The sages taught: "And when the ark would rest, Moses would say: Return, O Lord, to the myriads of thousands of Israel."

hebrew_text: מְלַמֵּד שֶׁאֵין הַשְּׁכִינָה שׁוֹרָה עַל פָּחוֹת מִשְּׁנֵי אֲלָפִים וּשְׁנֵי רְבָבוֹת מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל. הֲרֵי שֶׁהָיוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל שְׁנֵי אֲלָפִים וּשְׁנֵי רְבָבוֹת חָסֵר אֶחָד, וְזֶה לֹא עָסַק בִּפְרִיָּה וּרְבִיָּה — לֹא נִמְצָא זֶה גּוֹרֵם לַשְּׁכִינָה שֶׁתִּסְתַּלֵּק מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל?!
human_translation: teaches that the Divine Presence does not rest upon less than two thousands and two ten-thousands of the Jewish people, there were two thousands and two ten-thousands of the Jewish people, less one, and this did not engage in fruitful and multiply, is he not found caused the Divine Presence to be depart from the Jewish people?
llm_translation: It teaches that the Divine Presence does not dwell upon fewer than two thousand and two hundred Israelites. If the Israelites were two thousand and two hundred lacking one, and this one did not engage in procreation — can it be found that this one causes the Divine Presence to depart from Israel?!

hebrew_text: אַבָּא חָנָן אָמַר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: חַיָּיב מִיתָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּבָנִים לֹא הָיוּ לָהֶם״, הָא הָיוּ לָהֶם בָּנִים — לֹא מֵתוּ. אֲחֵרִים אוֹמְרִים: גּוֹרֵם לַשְּׁכִינָה שֶׁתִּסְתַּלֵּק מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לִהְיוֹת לְךָ לֵאלֹהִים וּלְזַרְעֲךָ אַחֲרֶיךָ״, בִּזְמַן שֶׁזַּרְעֲךָ אַחֲרֶיךָ — שְׁכִינָה שׁוֹרָה, אֵין ״זַרְעֲךָ אַחֲרֶיךָ״ — עַל מִי שׁוֹרָה? עַל הָעֵצִים וְעַל הָאֲבָנִים?!
human_translation: Abba Ḥanan said in the name of Rabbi Eliezer: liable to death, as it is stated and they had no children” had children they would not have died. Others say: causes the Divine Presence to depart from the Jewish people, as it is stated: “To be a God to you and to your seed after you” When your seed is after you, the Divine Presence rests your seed is not after you, upon whom rest? Upon wood and stones?
llm_translation: Abba Hanan said in the name of Rabbi Eliezer: liable to death, as it is stated: "And they had no children," if they had children - they would not have died. Others say: causing the Shechinah to depart from Israel, as it is stated: "To be a God to you and to your offspring after you," when your offspring are after you - the Shechinah dwells, if "your offspring after you" - upon whom does the Shechinah dwell? Upon the trees and upon the stones?!

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ נָשָׂא אִשָּׁה וְשָׁהָה עִמָּהּ עֶשֶׂר שָׁנִים וְלֹא יָלְדָה — אֵינוֹ רַשַּׁאי לְבַטֵּל. גֵּירְשָׁהּ — מוּתֶּרֶת לִינָּשֵׂא לְאַחֵר. וְרַשַּׁאי הַשֵּׁנִי לִשְׁהוֹת עִמָּהּ עֶשֶׂר שָׁנִים. וְאִם הִפִּילָה — מוֹנֶה מִשָּׁעָה שֶׁהִפִּילָה.
human_translation: married a woman and stayed with her ten years and she did not give birth, he is no permitted to neglect he divorced her she is permitted to marry another and the second is permitted to stay with her ten years. And if she had a miscarriage, he counts from the time of the miscarriage.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If a man married a woman and lived with her for ten years but she did not give birth, he is not permitted to divorce her. If he divorced her, she is permitted to marry another man. The second man is permitted to delay living with her for ten years. If she miscarried, he counts from the time of the miscarriage.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: נָשָׂא אִשָּׁה וְשָׁהָה עִמָּהּ עֶשֶׂר שָׁנִים וְלֹא יָלְדָה — יוֹצִיא וְיִתֵּן כְּתוּבָה, שֶׁמָּא לֹא זָכָה לְהִבָּנוֹת מִמֶּנָּה.
human_translation: The Sages taught: married a woman and stayed with her ten years and she did not give birth, he should divorce and pay marriage contract, perhaps he did not merit to be built, from her.
llm_translation: The sages taught: If a man married a woman and lived with her for ten years but she did not give birth, he may divorce her and give her the marriage contract, lest he did not merit to build from her.

hebrew_text: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין רְאָיָה לַדָּבָר, זֵכֶר לַדָּבָר: ״מִקֵּץ עֶשֶׂר שָׁנִים לְשֶׁבֶת אַבְרָם בְּאֶרֶץ כְּנָעַן״ — לְלַמֶּדְךָ שֶׁאֵין יְשִׁיבַת חוּץ לָאָרֶץ עוֹלֶה לוֹ מִן הַמִּנְיָן. לְפִיכָךְ, חָלָה הוּא אוֹ שֶׁחָלְתָה הִיא, אוֹ שְׁנֵיהֶם חֲבוּשִׁים בְּבֵית הָאֲסוּרִים — אֵין עוֹלִין לוֹ מִן הַמִּנְיָן.
human_translation: Although there is no proof for the matter an allusion to the matter, after Abram had dwelled ten years in the land of Canaan, to teach you that dwelling outside of Eretz Yisrael do not count his tally. Consequently, he was sick or she was sick, or the two of them imprisoned in jail, does not count his tally.
llm_translation: Even though there is no direct proof for the matter, a remembrance for the matter: "After ten years of Abram dwelling in the land of Canaan" — to teach you that dwelling outside the land does not count towards the total. Therefore, whether he is sick or she is sick, or both of them are imprisoned in the house of the captives — they do not count towards the total.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא לְרַב נַחְמָן: וְלֵילַף מִיִּצְחָק, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיְהִי יִצְחָק בֶּן אַרְבָּעִים שָׁנָה בְּקַחְתּוֹ אֶת רִבְקָה וְגוֹ׳״, וּכְתִיב: ״וְיִצְחָק בֶּן שִׁשִּׁים שָׁנָה בְּלֶדֶת אוֹתָם״! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: יִצְחָק עָקוּר הָיָה.
human_translation: Rava said to Rav Naḥman: Let us derive from Isaac as it is written: “And Isaac was forty years old when he took Rebekah and it is written “And Isaac was sixty years old when she bore them” said to him: Isaac was infertile,
llm_translation: Rava said to Rav Nachman: And what about Yitzchak, as it is written: "And Yitzchak was forty years old when he took Rivkah," and it is also written: "And Yitzchak was sixty years old when they were born to him!" He said to him: Yitzchak was sterile.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, אַבְרָהָם נָמֵי עָקוּר הָיָה! הַהוּא מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְכִדְרַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: לָמָּה נִמְנוּ שְׁנוֹתָיו שֶׁל יִשְׁמָעֵאל — כְּדֵי לְיַיחֵס בָּהֶן שְׁנוֹתָיו שֶׁל יַעֲקֹב.
human_translation: If so, Abraham was also infertile. requires that for Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba because Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Why were Ishmael’s years counted In order to determine through them the years of Jacob,
llm_translation: So it is, Abraham was indeed sterile! That one sought to argue with Rabbi Hiyya bar Abba. For Rabbi Hiyya bar Abba said in the name of Rabbi Yohanan: Why were the years of Ishmael counted? In order to include in them the years of Jacob.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: יִצְחָק אָבִינוּ עָקוּר הָיָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיֶּעְתַּר יִצְחָק לַה׳ לְנֹכַח אִשְׁתּוֹ״. ״עַל אִשְׁתּוֹ״ לֹא נֶאֱמַר, אֶלָּא ״לְנוֹכַח״, מְלַמֵּד שֶׁשְּׁנֵיהֶם עֲקוּרִים הָיוּ. אִי הָכִי: ״וַיֵּעָתֶר לוֹ״ — ״וַיֵּעָתֵר לָהֶם״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ! לְפִי שֶׁאֵינוֹ דּוֹמֶה תְּפִלַּת צַדִּיק בֶּן צַדִּיק לִתְפִלַּת צַדִּיק בֶּן רָשָׁע.
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak said: Isaac our father was infertile, as it is stated: “And Isaac entreated the Lord concerning [ lenokhaḥ ] his wife It is not stated for [ al ] his wife, but lenokhaḥ , teaches that they were both infertile. If so, “And let Himself be entreated of him”? should say: And let Himself be entreated of them. because the prayer of a righteous individual the son of a righteous individual is not similar to the prayer of a righteous individual the son of a wicked individual,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yitzchak said: Our father Yitzchak was barren, as it is stated: "And Yitzchak entreated the Lord opposite his wife." It does not say "opposite his wife," but rather "opposite," teaching that both of them were barren. If so, when it says "he entreated for her," why does it not say "he entreated for them"? Because the prayer of a righteous son of a righteous person is not comparable to the prayer of a righteous son of a wicked person.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: מִפְּנֵי מָה הָיוּ אֲבוֹתֵינוּ עֲקוּרִים — מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא מִתְאַוֶּה לִתְפִלָּתָן שֶׁל צַדִּיקִים. אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: לָמָּה נִמְשְׁלָה תְּפִלָּתָן שֶׁל צַדִּיקִים כְּעֶתֶר — מָה עֶתֶר זֶה מְהַפֵּךְ הַתְּבוּאָה מִמָּקוֹם לְמָקוֹם, כָּךְ תְּפִלָּתָן שֶׁל צַדִּיקִים מְהַפֶּכֶת מִדּוֹתָיו שֶׁל הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא מִמִּדַּת רַגְזָנוּת לְמִדַּת רַחֲמָנוּת. אָמַר רַבִּי אַמֵּי: אַבְרָהָם וְשָׂרָה טוּמְטְמִין הָיוּ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הַבִּיטוּ אֶל צוּר
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak said: For what reason were our forefathers infertile? Because the Holy One, Blessed be He, desires the prayers of the righteous, Rabbi Yitzḥak said: Why are the prayers of the righteous compared to a pitchfork [ eter ], just as this pitchfork turns over produce from one place to another, so the prayer of the righteous turns over the attributes of the Holy One, Blessed be He, from attribute of rage to attribute of mercy. Rabbi Ami said: Abraham and Sarah were tumtumin , as it is stated: “Look to the rock
llm_translation: Rabbi Yitzchak said: Why were our forefathers barren? Because the Holy One, blessed be He, desires the prayers of the righteous. Rabbi Yitzchak said: Why is the prayer of the righteous likened to a pitchfork? Just as this pitchfork turns the hay from place to place, so too the prayer of the righteous turns the attribute of the Holy One, blessed be He, from the attribute of anger to the attribute of mercy. Rabbi Ammi said: Abraham and Sarah were barren, as it is said: "Look to the rock..."

hebrew_text: חֻצַּבְתֶּם וְאֶל מַקֶּבֶת בּוֹר נֻקַּרְתֶּם״, וּכְתִיב, ״הַבִּיטוּ אֶל אַבְרָהָם אֲבִיכֶם וְאֶל שָׂרָה תְּחוֹלֶלְכֶם״.
human_translation: from where you were hewn, and to the hole of the pit from where you were dug” and it is written “Look to Abraham your father and to Sarah who bore you”
llm_translation: "You have hewn and you have dug a cistern, and it is written, 'Look to Abraham your father and to Sarah who bore you.'"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ: שָׂרָה אִמֵּנוּ אַיְלוֹנִית הָיְתָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַתְּהִי שָׂרַי עֲקָרָה אֵין לָהּ וָלָד״, אֲפִילּוּ בֵּית וָלָד אֵין לָהּ.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said Rabba bar Avuh said: Our mother Sarah was sexually underdeveloped woman [ aylonit ], as it is stated: “And Sarah was barren; she had no child” she did not have even a place, for a child.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said, Rabba bar Avuh said: Sarah our mother was like an aylonit, as it is stated: "And Sarai was barren; she had no child." (Genesis 11:30) She did not even have a womb.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר שִׁילַת מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא בְּדוֹרוֹת הָרִאשׁוֹנִים, שֶׁשְּׁנוֹתֵיהֶן מְרוּבּוֹת. אֲבָל בְּדוֹרוֹת הָאַחֲרוֹנִים, שֶׁשְּׁנוֹתֵיהֶן מוּעָטוֹת — שְׁתֵּי שָׁנִים וּמֶחֱצָה, כְּנֶגֶד שְׁלֹשָׁה עִיבּוּרִים. רַבָּה אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: שָׁלֹשׁ שָׁנִים, כְּנֶגֶד שָׁלֹשׁ פְּקִידוֹת. דְּאָמַר מָר: בְּרֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה נִפְקְדוּ שָׂרָה רָחֵל וְחַנָּה.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda, son of Rav Shmuel bar Sheilat, said in the name of Rav: They taught only in former generations, whose years numerous, However, in later generations, whose years are few, two and half years corresponding to three pregnancies. Rabba said Rav Naḥman: three years, corresponding to three remembrances as the Master said: On Rosh HaShana Sarah, Rachel, and Hannah were remembered,
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah, son of Rav Shmuel, son of Shilat, said in the name of Rav: They only taught this regarding the earlier generations, whose years are abundant. But in the later generations, whose years are few - two and a half years, corresponding to three transgressions. Rabbah said that Rav Nachman said: Three years, corresponding to three appointments. As Mar said: At the beginning of the year, Sarah, Rachel, and Hannah were visited.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה: לֵיתַנְהוּ לְהָנֵי כְּלָלֵי. מִכְּדֵי מַתְנִיתִין מַאן תַּקֵּין — רַבִּי, וְהָא בִּימֵי דָוִד אִימַּעוּט שְׁנֵי, דִּכְתִיב: ״יְמֵי שְׁנוֹתֵינוּ בָהֶם שִׁבְעִים שָׁנָה״.
human_translation: Rabba said: These principles are not Now who established mishna? Rabbi in the days of David, the years were diminished, as it is written: “The days of our years are seventy years,
llm_translation: Rabba said: Let them give to those communities. From where do we establish this? From the Mishnah, who is the authority? Rabbi. But in the days of David they would diminish two, as it is written: "The days of our years among them are seventy years."

hebrew_text: וְהַאי ״שֶׁמָּא לֹא זָכָה לְהִבָּנוֹת הֵימֶנָּה״, וְדִלְמָא אִיהִי דְּלָא זָכְיָא? אִיהִי כֵּיוָן דְּלָא מְפַקְּדָא אַפְּרִיָּה וּרְבִיָּה, לָא מִיעַנְשָׁה.
human_translation: And this Perhaps he did not merit to be built from her; perhaps she who did not merit She, since she is not commanded fruitful and multiply, is not punished.
llm_translation: And this, "perhaps he did not merit to understand it from her," and maybe she herself did not merit? She, since she did not bear offspring and multiply, was not punished.

hebrew_text: אִינִי? וְהָא אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ רַבָּנַן לְרַבִּי אַבָּא בַּר זַבְדָּא: נְסֵיב אִיתְּתָא וְאוֹלֵיד בְּנֵי, וַאֲמַר לְהוּ: אִי זְכַאי — הֲווֹ לִי מִקַּמַּיְיתָא. הָתָם דַּחוֹיֵי קָא מְדַחֵי לְהוּ לְרַבָּנַן, דְּרַבִּי אַבָּא בַּר זַבְדָּא אִיעֲקַר מִפִּרְקֵיהּ דְּרַב הוּנָא.
human_translation: Is that so? Didn’t the Sages say to Rabbi Abba bar Zavda: Marry a woman and have children, and he said to them: If I had merited, I would have from first There, was putting the Rabbis off as Rabbi Abba bar Zavda became impotent from Rav Huna’s discourse.
llm_translation: I am not? But didn't the Rabbis say to Rabbi Abba bar Zavda: "Marry a woman and have children, and he said to them: If I am worthy - they will come before me." There, he was pushing them away, pushing them away to the Rabbis, because Rabbi Abba bar Zavda was absent from the discussion of Rav Huna.

hebrew_text: רַב גִּידֵּל אִיעֲקַר מִפִּרְקֵיהּ דְּרַב הוּנָא. רַבִּי חֶלְבּוֹ אִיעֲקַר מִפִּרְקֵיהּ דְּרַב הוּנָא. רַב שֵׁשֶׁת אִיעֲקַר מִפִּרְקֵיהּ דְּרַב הוּנָא. רַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב אֲחַדְתֵּיהּ סוּסְכִּינְתָּא, תַּלְיוּהּ בְּאַרְזָא דְּבֵי רַב וּנְפַק מִינֵּיהּ כְּהוּצָא יַרְקָא. אָמַר רַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב: שִׁיתִּין סָבֵי הֲוֵינָא וְכוּלְּהוּ אִיעֲקוּר מִפִּרְקֵיהּ דְּרַב הוּנָא לְבַר מֵאֲנָא, דְּקַיֵּימִי בְּנַפְשַׁאי ״הַחׇכְמָה תְּחַיֶּה בְעָלֶיהָ״.
