human_translation: Rav Giddel became impotent from Rav Huna’s discourse, Rav Ḥelbo became impotent from Rav Huna’s discourse, Rav Sheshet became impotent from Rav Huna’s discourse. Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov was afflicted by suskhinta , They suspended him from the cedar the study hall, and green leaf emerged from him, Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov said: We were sixty elders and they all became impotent from Rav Huna’s discourse, aside from me, as I fulfilled with regard to myself “Wisdom preserves the life of he who has it”
llm_translation: Rav Gidel was absent from the discussion of Rav Huna. Rabbi Chelbo was absent from the discussion of Rav Huna. Rav Sheshet was absent from the discussion of Rav Huna. Rav Acha bar Yaakov brought a knife, hung it on the cedar tree of the house of Rav, and went out with it like a vegetable vendor. Rav Acha bar Yaakov said: "Six elders I was, and all of them were absent from the discussion of Rav Huna, except for me, who upheld the verse in my soul, 'Wisdom will give life to those who possess it.'"

hebrew_text: גֵּירְשָׁהּ מוּתֶּרֶת וְכוּ׳. שֵׁנִי — אִין, שְׁלִישִׁי — לָא.
human_translation: divorced she is permitted A second yes, a third no.
llm_translation: She was divorced, permissible, etc. The second - yes, the third - no.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִיתִין מַנִּי? רַבִּי הִיא. דְּתַנְיָא: מָלָה הָרִאשׁוֹן וָמֵת, שֵׁנִי וָמֵת, שְׁלִישִׁי — לֹא תָּמוּל, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: שְׁלִישִׁי תָּמוּל, רְבִיעִי — לֹא תָּמוּל.
human_translation: Who is the mishna? It is Rabbi As it is taught circumcised first and he died second and he died, she should not circumcise third the statement of Rabbi Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: She should circumcise third she should not circumcise fourth
llm_translation: Mishnah: Who is the Tanna? It is Rabbi. As it was taught: The first circumciser and he dies, the second and he dies, the third - do not delay, these are the words of Rabbi. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: The third - delay, the fourth - do not delay.

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא אִיפְּכָא, הֵי מִינַּיְיהוּ (אַחֲרִינִיתָא)?
human_translation: Isn’t the reverse taught Which of them later
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And it was taught: וְהָתַנְיָא אִיפְּכָא, הֵי מִינַּיְיהוּ (אַחֲרִינִיתָא)?" English translation: "And it was taught: And is it not reversed, let him ask them (in the latter case)?"

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּאַרְבַּע אֲחָיוֹת בְּצִפּוֹרִי שֶׁמָּלָה רִאשׁוֹנָה וָמֵת, שְׁנִיָּה וָמֵת, שְׁלִישִׁית וָמֵת, רְבִיעִית בָּאת לִפְנֵי רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל. אָמַר לָהּ: אַל תָּמוּלִי.
human_translation: Come hear, as Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: An incident involving four sisters in Tzippori, that first circumcised and he died, second and he died, third and he died. fourth came before Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, said to her: Do not circumcise
llm_translation: Come and hear, for Rabbi Chiya bar Abba said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: There was an incident with four sisters in Tzipori, the first one got married and died, the second one got married and died, the third one got married and died, the fourth one came before Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel. He said to her: Do not delay.

hebrew_text: וְדִלְמָא אִי אָתְיָא שְׁלִישִׁית נָמֵי הֲוָה אָמַר לָהּ? אִם כֵּן, מַאי אַסְהָדוּתֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא? וְדִלְמָא הָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דַּאֲחָיוֹת מְחַזְּקוֹת.
human_translation: Perhaps if third come he would also have said to her If so, what is of Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba’s testimony? Perhaps teach us that sisters establish a presumption
llm_translation: Perhaps if the third one comes before her, did he say to her? If so, what is the testimony of Rabbi Chiya bar Abba? And perhaps this teaches us that sisters strengthen each other.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: הַשְׁתָּא דְּאָמְרַתְּ אֲחָיוֹת מְחַזְּקוֹת, לֹא יִשָּׂא אָדָם אִשָּׁה לֹא מִמִּשְׁפַּחַת נִכְפִּין וְלֹא מִמִּשְׁפַּחַת מְצוֹרָעִים. וְהוּא דְּאִתַּחְזַק תְּלָתָא זִימְנֵי.
human_translation: Rava said: Now that you have said sisters establish a presumption, a man should not marry a woman from a family of epileptics or from a family of lepers, And this was established three times,
llm_translation: Rava said: "Now that you have said that sisters strengthen each other, a man should not marry a woman neither from the family of lepers nor from the family of those afflicted with boils." And this is established three times.

hebrew_text: מַאי הֲוָה עֲלַהּ? כִּי אֲתָא רַב יִצְחָק בַּר יוֹסֵף, אָמַר: עוֹבָדָא הֲוָה קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בִּכְנִישְׁתָּא דְמָעוֹן בְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים שֶׁחָל לִהְיוֹת בְּשַׁבָּת, וּמָלָה רִאשׁוֹנָה וָמֵת, שְׁנִיָּה וָמֵת, שְׁלִישִׁית בָּאָה לְפָנָיו. אָמַר לָהּ: לְכִי וּמוּלִי.
human_translation: Which was about this When Rav Yitzḥak bar Yosef came he said: An incident occurred before Rabbi Yoḥanan in the synagogue of Maon on Yom Kippur that occurred on Shabbat. first circumcised and he died; second and he died. third came before him, said to her: Go and circumcise
llm_translation: What was the matter? When Rav Yitzchak son of Yosef came, he said: An incident occurred before Rabbi Yochanan in the synagogue of Maon on Yom Kippur that fell on Shabbat, and the first angel spoke and died, the second spoke and died, the third came before Him. He said to her: Go and circumcise me.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: חֲזִי דְּקָשָׁרֵית אִיסּוּרָא וְסַכַּנְתָּא.
human_translation: Abaye said to See as you are permitting a prohibition and a danger.
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: See that you have tied the prohibition and the danger.

hebrew_text: סְמַךְ עֲלַהּ אַבָּיֵי, וַאֲזַל נַסְבַהּ לְחוּמָה בְּרַתֵּיה דְּאִיסִי בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יִצְחָק בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוּדָה, דְּנַסְבַהּ רַחֲבָא דְפוּמְבְּדִיתָא וּשְׁכֵיב, רַב יִצְחָק בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה וּשְׁכֵיב, וְנַסְבַהּ הוּא וּשְׁכֵיב.
human_translation: Abaye relied on this and went married Ḥuma, the daughter of Isi, son of Rav Yitzḥak, son of Rav Yehuda. had married Raḥava of Pumbedita, and he died, Rav Yitzḥak, son of Rabba bar bar Ḥana, and he died; and he, married her and he died
llm_translation: Abaye relied on it, and went to sleep in the upper chamber of the house of Issi, son of Rav Yitzchak, son of Rav Yehudah. He went to sleep on a bed of marble and lay down. Rav Yitzchak, son of Rabbah bar bar Chanah, also went to sleep and lay down, and he went to sleep and lay down.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: וּמִי אִיכָּא דְּעָבֵיד עוֹבָדָא בְּנַפְשֵׁיהּ כִּי הַאי, וְהָא אִיהוּ דְּאָמַר: אָבִין — דְּסַמְכָא, יִצְחָק סוּמָּקָא — לָאו בַּר סַמְכָא. אָבִין — יֶשְׁנוֹ בַּחֲזָרָה, יִצְחָק סוּמָּקָא — אֵינוֹ בַּחֲזָרָה. וְעוֹד: אֵימַר דִּפְלִיגִי לְעִנְיַן מִילָה, בְּנִישּׂוּאִין מִי פְּלִיגִי?
human_translation: Rava said: Is there who performs an action like this himself Wasn’t it he, who said Avin is reliable Yitzḥak the Red, is not reliable? Avin returns Yitzḥak the Red does not return And furthermore, say that they disagree with regard to circumcision, do argue with regard to marriage?
llm_translation: Rava said: And is there anyone who performs a deed on his own behalf like this, and this one said: Avin - that he is a reliable person, Yitzchak Sumak'a - is not a reliable person. Avin - he sleeps on his back, Yitzchak Sumak'a - he does not sleep on his back. And furthermore: If they argue regarding the matter of circumcision, who do they argue about in matters of marriage?

hebrew_text: אִין, וְהָתַנְיָא: נִיסֵּת לָרִאשׁוֹן וָמֵת, לַשֵּׁנִי וָמֵת, לַשְּׁלִישִׁי — לֹא תִּנָּשֵׂא, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: לַשְּׁלִישִׁי — תִּנָּשֵׂא, לִרְבִיעִי — לֹא תִּנָּשֵׂא.
human_translation: Yes, and it is taught was married to first and he died, to a second and he died, she may not get married to a third the statement of Rabbi Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: She may get married to a third she may not get married to a fourth
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Ein, vehatan'ya: nisset larishon vamet, lasheni vamet, lashlishi — lo tinnasei, divrei Rabbi. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel omer: lashlishi — tinnasei, lirvi'i — lo tinnasei." English translation: "There is, and it was taught: If he married the first and died, the second and died, the third — she shall not marry, the words of Rabbi. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: For the third — she shall marry, for the fourth — she shall not marry."

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא גַּבֵּי מִילָה, אִיכָּא מִשְׁפָּחָה דִּרְפֵי דְּמָא וְאִיכָּא מִשְׁפָּחָה דִּקְמִיט דְּמָא, אֶלָּא נִישּׂוּאִין מַאי טַעְמָא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב מָרְדֳּכַי לְרַב אָשֵׁי: הָכִי אָמַר אֲבִימִי מֵהַגְרוֹנְיָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב הוּנָא: מַעְיָן גּוֹרֵם. וְרַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: מַזָּל גּוֹרֵם.
human_translation: Granted with regard to circumcision there are families whose blood is thin and there are families whose blood clots. However, marriage, what is the reason Rav Mordekhai said to Rav Ashi: Avimi of Hagron-ya said in the name of Rav Huna as follows: spring cause. And Rav Ashi said constellation cause
llm_translation: In the matter of circumcision, there is a family of Rafei who use wine, and there is a family of Kimtit who use wine. But in the case of marriages, what is the reason? Rav Mordechai said to Rav Ashi: So said Avimi from Hagraonya in the name of Rav Huna: The source causes. And Rav Ashi said: The constellation causes.

hebrew_text: מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ? אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ דְּאֵירְסַהּ וּמִית, אִי נָמֵי דִּנְפַל מִדִּיקְלָא וּמִית.
human_translation: What is between them? There is between them where betrothed her and died alternatively, where he fell off a palm tree and died.
llm_translation: What is the difference between them? There is a difference between them: if one uproots and dies, or if one falls from a palm tree and dies.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב יוֹסֵף בְּרֵיהּ דְּרָבָא לְרָבָא, בְּעַי מִינֵּיהּ מֵרַב יוֹסֵף: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי? וַאֲמַר לִי: אִין. הֲלָכָה כְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל? וַאֲמַר לִי: אִין, אַחוֹכֵי אַחֵיךָ בִּי!
human_translation: Rav Yosef, son of Rava, said to Rava: I inquired of Rav Yosef halakha is in accordance with Rabbi and he said to me: Yes. halakha is in accordance with Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, and he said to me: Yes. Was he mocking me
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Yosef, son of Rava, said to Rava, he asked him from Rav Yosef: Is the halakha like Rabbi? And he said to me: No. Is the halakha like Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel? And he said to me: No, your brothers are waiting for me!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא, סְתָמֵי הִיא וּפְשַׁיט לָךְ: נִישּׂוּאִין וּמַלְקִיּוֹת — כְּרַבִּי. וְסָתוֹת וְשׁוֹר הַמּוּעָד — כְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל.
human_translation: said to him: No, there are unattributed and he resolved for you marriage and lashings in accordance with Rabbi set patterns and a forewarned ox, in accordance with Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel
llm_translation: He said to him: No, it is a general principle, and you may deduce from it: betrothals and lashes - like Rabbi. And plowing and an appointed ox - like Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel.

hebrew_text: נִישּׂוּאִין — הָא דַּאֲמַרַן. מַלְקִיּוֹת — דִּתְנַן: מִי שֶׁלָּקָה וְשָׁנָה — בֵּית דִּין כּוֹנְסִין אוֹתוֹ לְכִיפָּה וּמַאֲכִילִין אוֹתוֹ שְׂעוֹרִים עַד שֶׁתְּהֵא כְּרֵיסוֹ נִבְקַעַת. וְסָתוֹת — דִּתְנַן: אֵין הָאִשָּׁה
human_translation: Marriage that which we said lashings as we learned One who was flogged and repeated court places him in a vaulted chamber and they feed him barley until his stomach bursts. set patterns as we learned A woman does not
llm_translation: Marriages - this that we said. Lashes - as we learned: One who was lashed and changed - the court gathers him for atonement and feeds him barley until his belly bursts. And bundles of grain - as we learned: A woman does not...

hebrew_text: קוֹבַעַת לָהּ וֶסֶת, עַד שֶׁתִּקְבָּעֶנָּה שָׁלֹשׁ פְּעָמִים. וְאֵין מִטַּהֶרֶת מִן הַוֶּסֶת, עַד שֶׁתֵּעָקֵר מִמֶּנָּה שָׁלֹשׁ פְּעָמִים. וְשׁוֹר הַמּוּעָד — דִּתְנַן: אֵין הַשּׁוֹר נַעֲשֶׂה מוּעָד, עַד שֶׁיָּעִידוּ בּוֹ שְׁלֹשָׁה פְּעָמִים.
human_translation: establish a set pattern for herself, until she has established it three times. she is not purified from her set pattern until it is uprooted from her three times, And forewarned ox as we learned An ox does not become forewarned until testify it three times.
llm_translation: She establishes it and removes it, until it is established three times. And a woman does not become purified from the menstrual impurity of the cloth, until it is uprooted from it three times. And the ox designated for stoning — as we learned: The ox is not designated for stoning until three times they testify about it.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: נִיסֵּת לָרִאשׁוֹן וְלֹא הָיוּ לָהּ בָּנִים, לַשֵּׁנִי וְלֹא הָיוּ לָהּ בָּנִים, לַשְּׁלִישִׁי לֹא תִּנָּשֵׂא אֶלָּא לְמִי שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ בָּנִים. נִישֵּׂאת לְמִי שֶׁאֵין לוֹ בָּנִים — תֵּצֵא בְּלֹא כְּתוּבָּה.
human_translation: The Sages taught: was married to first and she did not have children, to second and she did not have children, she may not get married to a third unless to one who has children she got married to one who does not have children she is divorced without marriage contract,
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: If she was married to the first husband and did not have children, to the second and did not have children, to the third she should not marry unless he has children. If she married someone who does not have children - she should leave without a marriage contract.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: נִישֵּׂאת לַשְּׁלִישִׁי וְלֹא הָיוּ לָהּ בָּנִים, מַהוּ דְּלִיתְבְּעוּהָ הָנָךְ קַמָּאֵי? מִי מָצוּ אָמְרִי לַהּ: אִיגַּלַּאי מִילְּתָא דְּאַתְּ הוּא דִּגְרַמְתְּ. אוֹ דִלְמָא מָצֵית אֲמַרָה לְהוּ: הַשְׁתָּא הוּא דִּכְחַשִׁי. מִסְתַּבְּרָא מָצְיָא אֲמַרָה לְהוּ הַשְׁתָּא הוּא דִּכְחַשִׁי.
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before she was married to a third and she did not have children what is those first can demand her Can say to her: It has been revealed that it was you who caused or perhaps can say to them: It is now that I have become weak, reasonable she can say to them: It is now that I have become weak.
llm_translation: The Gemara asks: If a woman was married to a third husband and did not have children, what is the law if the first husband comes before her? Did they say to her: "It is you who caused this"? Or perhaps she can say to them: "Now it is he who caused this."

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: נִישֵּׂאת לָרְבִיעִי וְהָיוּ לָהּ בָּנִים, מַהוּ דְּתִיתְבְּעֵיהּ לִשְׁלִישִׁי! אָמְרִינַן לַהּ: שְׁתִיקוּתִיךְ יָפָה מִדִּיבּוּרִיךְ. דְּמָצֵי אָמַר לַהּ: אֲנָא אַדַּעְתָּא דְּהָכִי לָא גָּרֵשְׁתִּיךְ.
human_translation: dilemma was raised before she was married to a fourth and she had children what is she can demand third We say to her: Your silence is preferable to your speech, as he can say to her: I did not divorce you with this understanding,
llm_translation: The question was asked to them: If she was married to the fourth husband and she had children, what is the law regarding the third husband? They said to her: Your silence is better than your speech. For he found a reason to say to her: I know that I did not divorce you in this manner.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב פָּפָּא: אִי אִיהִי שָׁתְקָא, אֲנַן מִי שָׁתְקִינַן?! נִמְצָא גֵּט בָּטֵל, וּבָנֶיהָ מַמְזֵרִין! אֶלָּא אָמְרִינַן: הַשְׁתָּא הוּא דִּבְרִיַּית.
human_translation: Rav Pappa strongly objects to this: If she was silent do we remain silent? bill of divorce found invalid and her children mamzerin . Rather, we say it is now that she has become healthy.
llm_translation: Rav Papa strongly objects: If she remains silent, have we then remained silent?! It would be found that the divorce document is nullified, and her children are considered illegitimate! Rather, we say: Now is the time for the word of the Torah.

hebrew_text: הוּא אָמַר מִינַּהּ, וְהִיא אָמְרָה מִינֵּיהּ, אֲמַר רַבִּי אַמֵּי: דְּבָרִים שֶׁבֵּינוֹ לְבֵינָהּ — נֶאֱמֶנֶת, וְטַעְמָא מַאי? הִיא (קַיְימָא) [קִים] לַהּ בְּיוֹרֶה כְּחֵץ, הוּא לָא קִים לֵיהּ בְּיוֹרֶה כְּחֵץ.
human_translation: he said from her, and she said from him, Rabbi Ami said: matters between him and her, she is believed. What is the reason She is certain shoots like an arrow, he is not certain shoots like an arrow.
llm_translation: He said from her, and she said from her kind, Rabbi Ammi said: Matters between him and her - trustworthy, and the reason is what? She stands for herself like an arrow, he does not stand for her like an arrow.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר אִיהוּ: אֵיזִיל אִינְּסִיב אִיתְּתָא וְאֶיבְדּוֹק נַפְשַׁאי. אָמַר רַבִּי אַמֵּי: אַף בָּזוֹ יוֹצִיא וְיִתֵּן כְּתוּבָּה. שֶׁאֲנִי אוֹמֵר: כׇּל הַנּוֹשֵׂא אִשָּׁה עַל אִשְׁתּוֹ — יוֹצִיא וְיִתֵּן כְּתוּבָּה. רָבָא אָמַר: נוֹשֵׂא אָדָם כַּמָּה נָשִׁים עַל אִשְׁתּוֹ, וְהוּא דְּאִית לֵיהּ לְמֵיזַיְינִינְהִי.
human_translation: he says: I will go marry a woman and examine myself Rabbi Ami said: Even in this must divorce and give marriage contract, as I say whoever marries a woman in addition to his wife must divorce and give marriage contract. Rava said a man may marry several women in addition to his wife, and as long as he has to support them
llm_translation: He said: I will go marry a woman and lose my soul. Rabbi Ammi said: Even with a disgrace, he should divorce and give a bill of divorce. For I say: Anyone who marries a woman on top of his wife - he should divorce and give a bill of divorce. Rava said: A man marries many women on top of his wife, and he has to support them.

hebrew_text: הוּא אָמַר: אַפִּלַת בְּגוֹ עֲשַׂר. וְהִיא אָמְרָה: לָא אַפֵּלִית. אָמַר רַבִּי אַמֵּי: אַף בְּזוֹ הִיא נֶאֱמֶנֶת. דְּאִם אִיתָא דְּאַפִּלָה — נַפְשַׁהּ בְּעַקְרְתָה לָא מַחְזְקָה.
human_translation: he said: You miscarried within ten and she said: I did not miscarry, Rabbi Ami said: Even in this she is believed, because if it is so that she miscarried she not establish herself as barren
llm_translation: He said: "Even in a pit of ten." And she said: "I did not fall." Rabbi Ammi said: "Even in this she is believed. For if it is found that she fell - her own soul does not strengthen her case."

hebrew_text: הִפִּילָה, וְחָזְרָה וְהִפִּילָה, וְחָזְרָה וְהִפִּילָה — הוּחְזְקָה לִנְפָלִים. הוּא אָמַר: אַפִּילָה תְּרֵי, וְהִיא אָמְרָה: תְּלָת, אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר: עוֹבָדָא הֲוָה בֵּי מִדְרְשָׁא, וַאֲמַרוּ: הִיא מְהֵימְנָא, דְּאִם אִיתָא דְּלָא אַפִּלָה — נַפְשַׁהּ בְּנִיפְלֵי לָא מַחְזְקָה.
human_translation: she miscarried, and miscarried again, and miscarried again, she has been established to miscarriages, he said she miscarried twice, and she said three Rabbi Yitzḥak ben Elazar said: There was an incident the study hall and they said she is believed, because if it is so that not miscarried she not establish herself miscarriages.
llm_translation: She fell, and then she fell again, and then she fell again - she is established as a faller. He said: "Two falls," and she said: "Three." Rabbi Yitzchak ben Elazar said: There was a case in the study hall, and they said: She is trustworthy, for if it comes that she did not fall - her credibility is not established among the fallers.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הָאִישׁ מְצֻוֶּוה עַל פְּרִיָּה וּרְבִיָּה, אֲבָל לֹא הָאִשָּׁה. רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן בְּרוֹקָה אוֹמֵר: עַל שְׁנֵיהֶם הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״וַיְבָרֶךְ אוֹתָם אֱלֹהִים וַיֹּאמֶר לָהֶם [אֱלֹהִים] פְּרוּ וּרְבוּ״.
human_translation: A man is commanded with regard to fruitful and multiply, but not a woman. Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Beroka says states with regard to both of them: “And God blessed them, and God said to them: Be fruitful and multiply”
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: A man is commanded concerning procreation, but not a woman. Rabbi Yochanan ben Beroka says: Regarding both of them, it says: "And God blessed them, and God said to them, 'Be fruitful and multiply.'"

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר רַבִּי אִילְעָא מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: אָמַר קְרָא: ״וּמִלְאוּ אֶת הָאָרֶץ וְכִבְשׁוּהָ״. אִישׁ דַּרְכּוֹ לְכַבֵּשׁ, וְאֵין אִשָּׁה דַּרְכָּהּ לְכַבֵּשׁ.
human_translation: From where are these matters Rabbi Ile’a said in the name of Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon: The verse states: and fill the land and conquer it” It is the manner of a man to conquer and it is not the manner of a woman to conquer.
llm_translation: Gemara: What are these words teaching us? Rabbi Ilai said in the name of Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Shimon: The verse states, "And fill the land and conquer it." A man's way is to conquer, but a woman's way is not to conquer.

hebrew_text: אַדְּרַבָּה: ״וְכִבְשׁוּהָ״ תַּרְתֵּי מַשְׁמַע! אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: ״וְכׇבְשֶׁהָ״ כְּתִיב. רַב יוֹסֵף אָמַר, מֵהָכָא: ״אֲנִי אֵל שַׁדַּי פְּרֵה וּרְבֵה״, וְלָא קָאָמַר ״פְּרוּ וּרְבוּ״.
human_translation: On the contrary, “And conquer it [ vekhivshuha ],” indicates two Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: It is written And conquer it [ vekhivsha ], Rav Yosef said: from here: I am God Almighty, be fruitful and multiply [ perei urvei ]” and it does not state: Be fruitful and multiply [ peru urvu ]
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Ad'rabbah: "ve'chibshuha" tartei mashma! Amar Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak: "ve'chovsheha" ktiv. Rav Yosef amar, mehacha: "ani El Shaddai preh urveha," ve'lo ka'amar "peru urvu." English translation: Ad'rabbah: "And they shall subdue it" implies two things! Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: "And they shall subdue her" is written. Rav Yosef said, from here: "I am God Almighty, be fruitful and multiply," and not saying "be fruitful and multiply."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי אִילְעָא מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁמִּצְוָה עַל אָדָם לוֹמַר דָּבָר הַנִּשְׁמָע — כָּךְ מִצְוָה עַל אָדָם שֶׁלֹּא לוֹמַר דָּבָר שֶׁאֵינוֹ נִשְׁמָע. רַבִּי אַבָּא אוֹמֵר: חוֹבָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אַל תּוֹכַח לֵץ פֶּן יִשְׂנָאֶךָּ הוֹכַח לְחָכָם וְיֶאֱהָבֶךָּ״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Ile’a said in the name of Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon: Just as it is a mitzva for a person to say that which will be heeded, so is it a mitzva for a person not to say that which will not be heeded. Rabbi Abba says: obligatory as it is stated: “Do not reprove a scorner lest he hate you; reprove a wise man and he will love you”
llm_translation: And Rabbi Ilai said in the name of Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Shimon: Just as there is a commandment upon a person to say something that will be heard, so too there is a commandment upon a person not to say something that will not be heard. Rabbi Abba says: It is an obligation, as it is stated: "Do not rebuke a scoffer, lest he hate you; rebuke a wise man, and he will love you."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי אִילְעָא מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: מוּתָּר לוֹ לָאָדָם לְשַׁנּוֹת בִּדְבַר הַשָּׁלוֹם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אָבִיךְ צִוָּה וְגוֹ׳ כֹּה תֹאמְרוּ לְיוֹסֵף אָנָּא שָׂא נָא וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Ile’a said in the name of Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon: It is permitted for a person to depart in a matter peace, as it is stated: “Your father commanded So you shall say to Joseph: Please pardon
llm_translation: And said Rabbi Ilai in the name of Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Shimon: It is permitted for a person to change the wording in matters of peace, as it is stated: "Your father commanded, etc., 'Thus you shall say to Joseph, Please forgive, etc.'"

hebrew_text: רַבִּי נָתָן אוֹמֵר: מִצְוָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיֹּאמֶר שְׁמוּאֵל אֵיךְ אֵלֵךְ וְשָׁמַע שָׁאוּל וַהֲרָגָנִי וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: Rabbi Natan says: a mitzva as it is stated: “And Samuel said: How can I go, and Saul will hear and kill me”
llm_translation: Rabbi Nathan says: A commandment, as it is stated: "And Samuel said, 'How can I go? If Saul hears it, he will kill me...'"

hebrew_text: דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל תָּנָא: גָּדוֹל הַשָּׁלוֹם, שֶׁאַף הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא שִׁינָּה בּוֹ, דְּמֵעִיקָּרָא כְּתִיב: ״וַאֲדוֹנִי זָקֵן״, וּלְבַסּוֹף, כְּתִיב: ״וַאֲנִי זָקַנְתִּי״.
human_translation: taught the school of Rabbi Yishmael: Great is peace, as even the Holy One, Blessed be He, departed it. As, initially it is written “And my lord is old” and in the end it is written “And I am old”
llm_translation: In the school of Rabbi Yishmael it was taught: Great is peace, for even the Holy One, blessed be He, altered His speech for it, as it is initially written: "And my lord is old," and ultimately it is written: "And I have grown old."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן בְּרוֹקָה אוֹמֵר. אִתְּמַר, רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי, חַד אָמַר: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן בְּרוֹקָה, וְחַד אָמַר: אֵין הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן בְּרוֹקָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Beroka says It was stated Rabbi Yoḥanan and Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, One said halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Beroka, and one said halakha is not in accordance with Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Beroka.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan ben Beroka says: It was stated, Rabbi Yochanan and Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, one said: the halakha is like Rabbi Yochanan ben Beroka, and one said: the halakha is not like Rabbi Yochanan ben Beroka.

hebrew_text: תִּסְתַּיַּים דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן הוּא דְּאָמַר אֵין הֲלָכָה: דִּיתֵיב רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ וְקָאָמַר מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הֲלָכָה, וְאַהְדְּרִינְהוּ רַבִּי אַמֵּי וְרַבִּי אַסִּי לְאַפַּיְיהוּ.
human_translation: Conclude that it was Rabbi Yoḥanan who said halakha is not as Rabbi Abbahu sat and said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan halakha and Rabbi Ami and Rabbi Asi, turned their faces
llm_translation: The completion of Rabbi Yochanan, he said: The halacha is not as stated. Rabbi Avahu sat and said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: The halacha is as stated, and Rabbi Ammi and Rabbi Assi confirmed it.

hebrew_text: וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר, וְאַהְדְּרִינְהוּ רַבִּי אַמֵּי וְרַבִּי אַסִּי לְאַפַּיְיהוּ. אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ אַמְרַהּ, מִשּׁוּם כְּבוֹד בֵּי קֵיסָר לָא אָמְרוּ לֵיהּ וְלָא מִידֵּי. אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אַמְרַהּ — לֵימְרוּ לֵיהּ: לָא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן הָכִי.
human_translation: And some say Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said and Rabbi Ami and Rabbi Asi turned their faces. Rav Pappa said: Granted, according to the one who said Rabbi Abbahu said it, due to the honor of Caesar’s court, did not say anything to him However, according to the one who said Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said it, let them say to him explicitly: Rabbi Yoḥanan did not say this.
llm_translation: There is one who says: Rabbi Chiya bar Abba said, and then Rabbi Ammi and Rabbi Assi repeated it before him. Rav Papa said: Granted, according to the one who says Rabbi Avahu said it, they did not say it out of respect for the Roman government, but not immediately. However, according to the one who says Rabbi Chiya bar Abba said it, they should say to him: Rabbi Yochanan did not say so.

hebrew_text: מַאי הֲוָה עֲלַהּ? תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אַחָא בַּר חֲנִינָא אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ אָמַר רַבִּי אַסִּי: עוֹבָדָא הֲוָה קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בִּכְנִישְׁתָּא דְקֵיסָרִי, וַאֲמַר: יוֹצִיא וְיִתֵּן כְּתוּבָּה. וְאִי סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ לָא מְפַקְּדָה — כְּתוּבָּה מַאי עֲבִידְתַּהּ?
human_translation: What was about Come hear, as Rabbi Aḥa bar Ḥanina said Rabbi Abbahu said Rabbi Asi said: There was an incident before Rabbi Yoḥanan in the synagogue of Caesarea and he said must divorce and give marriage contract. If it enters your mind that she is not commanded what is a marriage contract doing
llm_translation: What was the matter with it? Come and hear, for Rabbi Aḥa bar Ḥanina said in the name of Rabbi Abbahu who said in the name of Rabbi Assi: An incident occurred before Rabbi Yoḥanan in the synagogue of the Caesar, and he said: "Bring forth and present a document." And if it enters your mind that it was not registered — what is the purpose of the document?

hebrew_text: דִּלְמָא בְּבָאָה מֵחֲמַת טַעֲנָה.
human_translation: Perhaps in she came due to claim,
llm_translation: Perhaps it is in the case of a pit due to the weight of a load.

hebrew_text: כִּי הַהִיא דַּאֲתַאי לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי אַמֵּי. אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: הַב לִי כְּתוּבָּה! אֲמַר לַהּ: זִיל, לָא מִיפַּקְּדַתְּ! אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: מִסֵּיבוּ דִּילַהּ מַאי תֶּיהְוֵי עֲלַהּ דְּהָךְ אִתְּתָא? אָמַר: כִּי הָא — וַדַּאי כָּפֵינַן.
human_translation: like a certain who came before Rabbi Ami She said to him Give me marriage contract. He said to her: Go you are not commanded She said to him: In her old age, what will be with this woman, said: such as this, we certainly force
llm_translation: When she came before Rabbi Ammi, she said to him: "Bring me a document!" He said to her: "Go, it is not necessary!" She said to him: "Since her husband is not here, what will become of this woman?" He said: "For this reason - and certainly we are concerned."

hebrew_text: הָהִיא דַּאֲתַאי לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן. אֲמַר לַהּ: לָא מִיפַּקְּדַתְּ. אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: לָא בָּעֲיָא הָךְ אִתְּתָא חוּטְרָא לִידָה וּמָרָה לִקְבוּרָה? אֲמַר: כִּי הָא וַדַּאי כָּפֵינַן.
human_translation: A certain came before Rav Naḥman He said to her: You are not commanded She said to him: Does this woman not require a staff for her hand and a hoe for burial? said: such as this, we certainly force
llm_translation: That one who came before Rav Nachman. He said to her: You are not meticulous. She said to him: Do you not require a thread for spinning and a needle for burying? He said: Indeed, we certainly need them.

hebrew_text: יְהוּדָה וְחִזְקִיָּה תְּאוֹמִים הָיוּ, אֶחָד נִגְמְרָה צוּרָתוֹ לְסוֹף תִּשְׁעָה, וְאֶחָד נִגְמְרָה צוּרָתוֹ לִתְחִלַּת שִׁבְעָה. יְהוּדִית, דְּבֵיתְהוּ דְּרַבִּי חִיָּיא, הֲוָה לַהּ צַעַר לֵידָה. שַׁנַּאי מָנַהּ, וַאֲתַאי לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי חִיָּיא, אֲמַרָה: אִתְּתָא מְפַקְּדָא אַפְּרִיָּה וּרְבִיָּה? אֲמַר לַהּ: לָא. אֲזַלָא אִשְׁתְּיָא סַמָּא דַעֲקַרְתָּא.
human_translation: Yehuda and Ḥizkiyya, were twins, one was fully developed after nine and one was fully developed at the beginning of the seventh Yehudit, the wife of Rabbi Ḥiyya, had birthing pain changed her clothes and came before Rabbi Ḥiyya She said: Is a woman commanded fruitful and multiply? He said to her: No. She went and drank an infertility potion.
llm_translation: Judah and Hezekiah were twins, one completed his formation at the end of nine months, and one completed his formation at the beginning of seven months. Judah's wife, the wife of Rabbi Hiyya, had difficulty in childbirth. They appointed a midwife for her, and she came before Rabbi Hiyya. She said to him: Does a woman give birth to a male and a female child? He said to her: No. The midwife went and uprooted the fetus.

hebrew_text: לְסוֹף אִיגַּלַּאי מִילְּתָא. אֲמַר לַהּ: אִיכּוֹ יְלַדְתְּ לִי חֲדָא כַּרְסָא אַחְרִיתָא, דְּאָמַר מָר: יְהוּדָה וְחִזְקִיָּה אַחֵי, פַּזִּי וְטָוִי
human_translation: Eventually the matter was revealed, He said to her: If only you had given birth to one more belly for me, As the Master said: Yehuda and Ḥizkiyya brothers Pazi and Tavi,
llm_translation: At the end of the matter, he said to her: "How did you give birth to me a last chair, as the Master said: 'Judah and Hezekiah are brothers, Pazzi and Tavi.'"

hebrew_text: אַחְווֹתָא.
human_translation: sisters,
llm_translation: Brotherhood.

hebrew_text: וְלָא מִיפַּקְדִי? וְהָאָמַר רַב אַחָא בַּר רַב קַטִּינָא אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּאִשָּׁה אַחַת שֶׁחֶצְיָהּ שִׁפְחָה וְחֶצְיָהּ בַּת חוֹרִין, וְכָפוּ אֶת רַבָּהּ וַעֲשָׂאָהּ בַּת חוֹרִין! אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: מִנְהַג הֶפְקֵר נָהֲגוּ בָּהּ.
human_translation: Are not commanded Didn’t Rav Aḥa bar Rav Ketina say Rabbi Yitzḥak said: an incident with a certain woman who half-slave and half-free woman and they forced her master and he made her a free Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: treated her in a loose manner.
llm_translation: "And not was she taken into account? But didn't Rav Ahah bar Rav Katina say in the name of Rabbi Yitzchak: There was an incident with a certain woman, half of her was a maidservant and half was a free woman, and they freed her and made her a free woman! Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: They acted according to the custom of hefker."

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ הַבָּא עַל יְבִמְתּוֹ
llm_translation: We will return to you regarding one who comes upon his sister-in-law.

hebrew_text: אַלְמָנָה לְכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל , גְּרוּשָׁה וַחֲלוּצָה לְכֹהֵן הֶדְיוֹט, הִכְנִיסָה לוֹ עַבְדֵי מְלוֹג וְעַבְדֵי צֹאן בַּרְזֶל, עַבְדֵי מְלוֹג — לֹא יֹאכְלוּ בִּתְרוּמָה, עַבְדֵי צֹאן בַּרְזֶל — יֹאכֵלוּ.
human_translation: A widow to a High Priest, a divorcée or a yevama who performed ḥalitza [ ḥalutza ] to a common priest brought into slaves of usufruct [ melog ] or slaves of guaranteed investment, slaves of usufruct do not partake of teruma slaves of guaranteed investment do partake
llm_translation: Widow to High Priest, divorced and redeemed to common priest, she brought for him slaves of Melog and slaves of sheep of iron, slaves of Melog - they shall not eat of the heave-offering, slaves of sheep of iron - they shall eat.

hebrew_text: וְאֵלּוּ הֵן עַבְדֵי מְלוֹג: אִם מֵתוּ — מֵתוּ לָהּ, וְאִם הוֹתִירוּ — הוֹתִירוּ לָהּ, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁהוּא חַיָּיב בִּמְזוֹנוֹתָן הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ לֹא יֹאכְלוּ בִּתְרוּמָה. וְאֵלּוּ הֵן עַבְדֵי צֹאן בַּרְזֶל: אִם מֵתוּ — מֵתוּ לוֹ, וְאִם הוֹתִירוּ — הוֹתִירוּ לוֹ, הוֹאִיל וְהוּא חַיָּיב בְּאַחְרָיוּתָן — הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ יֹאכְלוּ בִּתְרוּמָה.
human_translation: And these are slaves of usufruct if die, their death her and if they increase their increase her Although is obligated in their sustenance, they do not partake of teruma , And these are slaves of guaranteed investment: if they die, their death his and if they increase their increase his Since he bears responsibility their they partake of teruma ,
llm_translation: These are the slaves of Melog: If they die - they die for her, and if they are left - they are left for her, even though he is obligated in their sustenance, these may not eat from the terumah. And these are the slaves of the iron sheep: If they die - they die for him, and if they are left - they are left for him, since he is obligated in their offspring, these may eat from the terumah.

hebrew_text: בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁנִּיסֵּת לְכֹהֵן וְהִכְנִיסָה לוֹ עֲבָדִים, בֵּין עַבְדֵי מְלוֹג, בֵּין עַבְדֵי צֹאן בַּרְזֶל — הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ יֹאכְלוּ בִּתְרוּמָה. וּבַת כֹּהֵן שֶׁנִּיסֵּת לְיִשְׂרָאֵל וְהִכְנִיסָה לוֹ עֲבָדִים, בֵּין עַבְדֵי מְלוֹג, בֵּין עַבְדֵי צֹאן בַּרְזֶל — הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ לֹא יֹאכְלוּ בִּתְרוּמָה.
human_translation: an Israelite woman who married a priest and brought slaves into whether slaves of usufruct or slaves of guaranteed investment, they partake of teruma . And the daughter of a priest who married an Israelite and brought slaves into whether slaves of usufruct or slaves of guaranteed investment, they do not partake of teruma ,
llm_translation: Daughter of Israel who tempted a Kohen and brought him slaves, whether slaves of Melog, whether slaves of iron sheep - these may eat from the Terumah. And daughter of a Kohen who tempted an Israelite and brought him slaves, whether slaves of Melog, whether slaves of iron sheep - these may not eat from the Terumah.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וְעַבְדֵי מְלוֹג לֹא יֹאכְלוּ בִּתְרוּמָה, אַמַּאי? לֶהֱוֵי כְּקִנְיָנוֹ שֶׁקָּנָה קִנְיָן! דְּתַנְיָא: מִנַּיִן לְכֹהֵן שֶׁנָּשָׂא אִשָּׁה וְקָנָה עֲבָדִים שֶׁיֹּאכְלוּ בִּתְרוּמָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְכֹהֵן כִּי יִקְנֶה נֶפֶשׁ קִנְיַן כַּסְפּוֹ הוּא יֹאכַל בּוֹ״.
human_translation: slaves of usufruct do not partake of teruma . Why Let be like his acquisition who acquired an acquisition, as it is taught From where to a priest who married a woman and acquired slaves that they partake of teruma ? As it is stated: “But if a priest buys any soul, the purchase of his money, he may eat of it”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: A "Gemar" and slaves of "Melog" may not eat of the Terumah. Why? It should be considered as if he acquired property! As it was taught: From where do we know that a priest who marries a woman and acquires slaves may eat of the Terumah? As it is said: "And if a priest acquires any soul as a possession with his money, he may eat of it."

hebrew_text: וּמִנַּיִן לְאִשָּׁה שֶׁקָּנְתָה עֲבָדִים, וַעֲבָדָיו שֶׁקָּנוּ עֲבָדִים, שֶׁיֹּאכְלוּ בִּתְרוּמָה — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְכֹהֵן כִּי יִקְנֶה נֶפֶשׁ קִנְיַן כַּסְפּוֹ הוּא יֹאכַל בּוֹ״, קִנְיָנוֹ שֶׁקָּנָה קִנְיָן — אוֹכֵל.
human_translation: And from where to wife who acquired slaves and slaves who acquired slaves, that may partake of teruma ? As it is stated: “But if a priest buys any soul, the purchase of his money, he may eat of it,” his acquisition acquired an acquisition, partakes slaves of usufruct
llm_translation: And from where do we know for a woman who acquired slaves, and her slaves acquired slaves, that they may eat of the heave-offering? — As it is stated: "And if a priest acquires any soul as a possession with his money, he may eat of it" (Leviticus 22:11), the acquisition of his acquisition — he may eat.

hebrew_text: כׇּל הָאוֹכֵל — מַאֲכִיל, כֹּל שֶׁאֵין אוֹכֵל — אֵינוֹ מַאֲכִיל.
human_translation: anyone who partake enable to partake anyone who does not partake cannot enable to partake.
llm_translation: All who eat - feed, all who do not eat - do not feed.

hebrew_text: וְלָא? וַהֲרֵי עָרֵל, וְכׇל הַטְּמֵאִים שֶׁאֵינָן אוֹכְלִין, וּמַאֲכִילִין! הָתָם, פּוּמַּיְיהוּ כָּאֵיב לְהוּ.
human_translation: And cannot enable to partake? But aren’t uncircumcised and all impure who do not partake and they enable to partake there, their mouths hurt,
llm_translation: And no? But behold, uncircumcised, and all the impure who do not eat, and feed! There, their mouths are painful to them.

hebrew_text: וַהֲרֵי מַמְזֵר, שֶׁאֵין אוֹכֵל, וּמַאֲכִיל!
human_translation: But isn’t a son born from an incestuous or adulterous relationship [ mamzer ] who does not partake enables
llm_translation: And behold, a mamzer, who does not eat, and feeds!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבִינָא: קִנְיָן אוֹכֵל קָאָמַר, קִנְיָן אוֹכֵל — מַאֲכִיל, שֶׁאֵינוֹ אוֹכֵל — אֵינוֹ מַאֲכִיל.
human_translation: Ravina said is referring an acquisition who partakes acquisition partakes enables to partake, who does not partake, cannot enable to partake.
llm_translation: Ravina said: "Kinyan Ochel, he said, Kinyan Ochel - feeds, that which does not eat - does not feed."

hebrew_text: וְרָבָא אָמַר: מִדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא מֵיכָל אָכְלִי, וְרַבָּנַן הוּא דְּגָזְרִי בְּהוּ, כְּדֵי שֶׁתֹּאמַר: אֲנִי אֵינִי אוֹכֶלֶת, עֲבָדַי אֵינָן אוֹכְלִין — זוֹנָה הִיא אֶצְלוֹ?! הִלְכָּךְ אָתֵי לְאַפּוֹקַהּ.
human_translation: And Rava said By Torah partake And it was the Sages who issued a decree them so that would say: I do not partake my slaves do not partake she is a prostitute to him. therefore come to divorce her,
llm_translation: Rava said: From the Torah, Michal ate, and the Rabbis decreed upon it, so that it should be said: "I am not eating, my servants are not eating - is she a prostitute with him?!" Therefore, he comes to exempt her.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: גְּזֵירָה שֶׁמָּא תַּאֲכִיל לְאַחַר מִיתָה.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said decree lest she have partake after death
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: A decree lest it lead to after death.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁנִּשֵּׂאת לְכֹהֵן לֹא תַּאֲכִיל, גְּזֵירָה שֶׁמָּא תַּאֲכִיל לְאַחַר מִיתָה!
human_translation: However, if so, Israelite woman who marries a priest should not enable to partake decree, lest she have them partake after death.
llm_translation: Rather, from now on, a daughter of Israel who marries a Kohen shall not eat, a decree lest she feed the Terumah to others after his death!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: בְּאַלְמָנָה כֹּהֶנֶת, דְּאָתְיָא לְאוֹרוֹיֵי: מֵעִיקָּרָא אֲכַלִי בִּתְרוּמָה דְּבֵי נָשָׁא, אִינְּסֵבִי לֵיהּ לְהַאי — אֲכַלִי בִּתְרוּמָה דְגַבְרַאי, וְהַשְׁתָּא הֲדַרִי לִי לְמִילְּתַאי קַמַּיְיתָא. וְלָא יָדְעָה דְּמֵעִיקָּרָא לָא שַׁוֵּיתַהּ לְנַפְשַׁהּ חֲלָלָה, הַשְׁתָּא שַׁוֵּיתַהּ לְנַפְשַׁהּ חֲלָלָה.
human_translation: Rather, Rav Ashi said with a widowed priestess, as she is likely to rationalize Initially, partook of the teruma of my father’s house. I married this and they partook of the teruma of my husband. And now I have returned to the original circumstance, And she does not realize that initially she did not render herself a woman disqualified from marrying a priest [ ḥalala ], now, she rendered herself a ḥalala ,
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Ashe said: In the case of a widow who is a Kohenet, who comes to be married: Initially, she ate from the terumah of the house of her husband, she should not be married to this one — she ate from the terumah of my husband, and now she should return to her original status. And she did not know that initially she made herself unfit, now she has made herself unfit.

hebrew_text: תִּינַח אַלְמָנָה כֹּהֶנֶת, אַלְמָנָה בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? בְּאַלְמְנוּתַהּ לָא פְּלִיגִי רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: works out well a widowed priestess. widow an Israelite woman, what can be said? With regard to widowhood, the Sages did not distinguish
llm_translation: The widow of a Kohen, a widow who is the daughter of an Israelite, what is there to say? The Rabbis do not dispute regarding her widowhood.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר: הַמַּכְנֶסֶת שׁוּם לְבַעְלָהּ, הִיא אוֹמֶרֶת: כֵּלַי אֲנִי נוֹטֶלֶת, וְהוּא אוֹמֵר: דָּמִים אֲנִי נוֹתֵן, הַדִּין עִם מִי? רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר:
human_translation: It was stated: who brings appraised, property into her husband, she says: I am taking my belongings, and he says: I am give you monetary the halakha whom? Rav Yehuda said:
llm_translation: It was stated: If the wife brings in garlic for her husband, she says, "I am taking vessels," and he says, "I am giving blood." In such a case, with whom is the law according to? Rav Yehudah said:

hebrew_text: הַדִּין עִמָּהּ, וְרַב אַמֵּי אָמַר: הַדִּין עִמּוֹ.
human_translation: The halakha her; And Rav Ami said: The halakha him;
llm_translation: The same with her, and Rav Ammi said: The same with him.

hebrew_text: רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר הַדִּין עִמָּהּ — מִשּׁוּם שֶׁבַח בֵּית אָבִיהָ דִּידַהּ הָוֵי. רַבִּי אַמֵּי אָמַר: הַדִּין עִמּוֹ — כֵּיוָן דְּאָמַר מָר: אִם מֵתוּ — מֵתוּ לוֹ, וְאִם הוֹתִירוּ — הוֹתִירוּ לוֹ, הוֹאִיל וְחַיָּיב בְּאַחְרָיוּתָן — יֹאכֵלוּ. אָמַר רַב סָפְרָא: מִי קָתָנֵי ״וְהֵן שֶׁלּוֹ״? ״הוֹאִיל וְחַיָּיב בְּאַחְרָיוּתָן״ קָתָנֵי, וּלְעוֹלָם לָאו דִּידֵיהּ נִינְהוּ.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said the halakha her because the assets of her paternal family, they are hers. Rabbi Ami said that the halakha him, since the Master said If they die, their death his and if they increase their increase his Since he bears responsibility for their they partake Rav Safra said Does teach they are his? teaches he bears responsibility for their but actually they are not his.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said: The judgment is with her - because of the praise of her father's household, she shall be. Rabbi Ammi said: The judgment is with him - since the Master said: If they died - they died for him, and if they left - they left for him, since he is obligated in their aftermath - they shall eat. Rav Safra said: Who is the one who teaches "and they are his"? It teaches "since he is obligated in their aftermath," and they are not his at all.

hebrew_text: וְכׇל הֵיכָא דְּחַיָּיב בְּאַחְרָיוּתָן אָכְלִי בִּתְרוּמָה? וְהָתְנַן: יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁשָּׂכַר פָּרָה מִכֹּהֵן — הֲרֵי זֶה יַאֲכִילֶנָּה כַּרְשִׁינֵּי תְרוּמָה. כֹּהֵן שֶׁשָּׂכַר פָּרָה מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁמְּזוֹנוֹתֶיהָ עָלָיו — לָא יַאֲכִילֶנָּה כַּרְשִׁינֵּי תְרוּמָה!
human_translation: And do they partake of teruma wherever he bears responsibility for their But didn’t we learn An Israelite who rented a cow from a priest may feed it vetches [ karshinin ] of teruma , a priest who rented a cow from an Israelite, although is upon him, he may not feed it vetches of teruma ,
llm_translation: And all where of obligated in their afterness, ate in terumah? And we learned: An Israelite who hired a cow from a Kohen - behold, he shall feed it like the owners of terumah. A Kohen who hired a cow from an Israelite, even though its sustenance is upon him - he shall not feed it like the owners of terumah!

hebrew_text: וְתִסְבְּרָא? נְהִי נָמֵי דִּמְחַיֵּיב בִּגְנֵבָה וַאֲבֵדָה, בְּאוֹנְסֶיהָ בְּכַחְשָׁהּ וּבְנִפְחַת דָּמֶיהָ — מִי מִיחַיַּיב? הָא לָא דָּמְיָא אֶלָּא לְסֵיפָא: יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁשָּׁם פָּרָה מִכֹּהֵן, לָא יַאֲכִילֶנָּה כַּרְשִׁינֵּי תְרוּמָה. אֲבָל כֹּהֵן שֶׁשָּׁם פָּרָה מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל — יַאֲכִילֶנָּה כַּרְשִׁינֵּי תְרוּמָה.
human_translation: And you understand Though is indeed liable for theft and loss, is he liable for unavoidable accidents, for emaciation, or for decrease in its value? is similar only to the latter clause an Israelite who appraised a cow from a priest may not feed it vetches of teruma , However, a priest who appraised a cow from an Israelite may feed it vetches of teruma .
llm_translation: And is it created? Yes, similar to one who is liable for theft and loss, in its compulsion, in its deception, and in the blowing of its blood - who is liable? This is not for the blood but for the end: An Israelite who has a cow from a priest, should not feed it like the common cattle of Terumah. But a priest who has a cow from an Israelite - should feed it like the common cattle of Terumah.

hebrew_text: יָתֵיב רַבָּה וְרַב יוֹסֵף בְּשִׁילְהֵי פִּרְקֵיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן וְיָתְבִי וְקָאָמְרִי: תַּנְיָא כְּוָתֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוּדָה, וְתַנְיָא כְּוָתֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי אַמֵּי. תַּנְיָא כְּוָתֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי אַמֵּי: עַבְדֵי צֹאן בַּרְזֶל יוֹצְאִין בְּשֵׁן וָעַיִן. לָאִישׁ, אֲבָל לֹא לָאִשָּׁה.
human_translation: Rabba and Rav Yosef sat at the conclusion of Rav Naḥman’s sermon, and they sat and said: It is taught in accordance with Rav Yehuda, and it is taught in accordance with Rabbi Ami. It is taught in accordance with Rabbi Ami Slaves of guaranteed investment go at a tooth or an eye by the husband, but not by the wife.
llm_translation: Rabba and Rav Yosef were sitting in the neighborhood of Rav Nachman's chapter, and they were saying: It was taught in the Mishnah according to the opinion of Rabbi Yehuda, and it was taught in the Mishnah according to the opinion of Rabbi Ammi. It was taught in the Mishnah according to the opinion of Rabbi Ammi: Sheep shearers go out with a metal tool in the tail and eye. For a man, but not for a woman.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּוָתֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוּדָה: הַמַּכְנֶסֶת שׁוּם לְבַעְלָהּ, אִם רָצָה הַבַּעַל לִמְכּוֹר — לֹא יִמְכּוֹר. וְלֹא עוֹד אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ הִכְנִיס לָהּ שׁוּם מִשֶּׁלּוֹ, אִם רָצָה הַבַּעַל לִמְכּוֹר — לֹא יִמְכּוֹר. מָכְרוּ שְׁנֵיהֶם לְפַרְנָסָה, זֶה הָיָה מַעֲשֶׂה לִפְנֵי רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, וְאָמַר: הַבַּעַל מוֹצִיא מִיַּד הַלָּקוֹחוֹת.
human_translation: it is taught in accordance with Rav Yehuda: brings appraised, property to her husband, if the husband wishes to sell he may not sell And not only even brought into her an appraised, of his own, if the husband wishes to sell he may not sell either sold for subsistence, was an incident this before Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, and he said: the husband he may repossess from the purchasers,
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Rav Yehudah: If a woman brings in her husband's garlic, if the husband wants to sell it - he may not sell it. And not only that, but even if he brought in her own garlic, if the husband wants to sell it - he may not sell it. If they both sold it for sustenance, this was the incident before Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, and he said: The husband removes it from the hands of the buyers.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: הֲלָכָה כְּרַב יְהוּדָה. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא לְרַב נַחְמָן: וְהָתַנְיָא כְּוָתֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי אַמֵּי! אַף עַל גַּב דְּתַנְיָא כְּוָתֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי אַמֵּי, מִסְתַּבְּרָא טַעְמָא דְּרַב יְהוּדָה, מִשּׁוּם שֶׁבַח בֵּית אָבִיהָ.
human_translation: Rava said Rav Naḥman said: The halakha is in accordance with Rav Yehuda. Rava said to Rav Naḥman: But isn’t it taught in accordance with Rabbi Ami? Although it is taught in accordance with Rabbi Ami, Rav Yehuda’s rationale, because assets of her paternal family is reasonable.
llm_translation: Rava said, Rav Nachman said: The halakha is according to Rav Yehudah. Rava said to Rav Nachman: But isn't it taught in accordance with the opinion of Rabbi Ammi! Even though it is taught in accordance with the opinion of Rabbi Ammi, the reasoning of Rav Yehudah is more plausible, due to the honor of her father's house.

hebrew_text: הָהִיא אִיתְּתָא דְּעַיִּילָה לֵיהּ לְגַבְרַאּ אִיצְטְלָא דְמֵילָתָא בִּכְתוּבְּתַהּ. שְׁכֵיב, שַׁקְלוּהָ יַתְמֵי וּפַרְסוּהָ אַמִּיתָנָא.
human_translation: A certain woman brought into husband a robe [ itztela ] of fine wool [ meileta ], by her marriage contract. died, the orphans took and spread it over the corpse
llm_translation: That woman who was going to her husband, the strap of her sandal snapped on her. She lay down, they removed her shoe, and they found it to be true.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר רָבָא: קַנְיַיהּ מִיתָנָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ נָאנַאי בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יוֹסֵף בְּרֵיהּ דְּרָבָא לְרַב כָּהֲנָא: וְהָאָמַר רָבָא אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: הֲלָכָה כְּרַב יְהוּדָה? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִי לָא מוֹדֶה רַב יְהוּדָה דִּמְחוּסַּר גּוּבְיָינָא. וְכֵיוָן דִּמְחוּסַּר גּוּבְיָינָא — בִּרְשׁוּתֵיהּ קָאֵי.
human_translation: Rava said: The dead has acquired it, Nanai, son of Rav Yosef, son of Rava, said to Rav Kahana: But didn’t Rava say Rav Naḥman said the halakha is in accordance with Rav Yehuda? He said to him: Doesn’t Rav Yehuda admit that has not yet been collected? And since it has not yet been collected, it remains in his possession,
llm_translation: Rava said: His acquisition is from the basket. Na'anai, the son of Rav Yosef, the son of Rava, said to Rav Kahana: But didn't Rava say in the name of Rav Nachman: Is the halakha in accordance with Rav Yehudah? He said to him: Who does not agree that Rav Yehudah concedes in a case of a deficiency in the basket. And since there is a deficiency in the basket - it stands in his possession.

hebrew_text: רָבָא לְטַעְמֵיהּ, דְּאָמַר רָבָא: הֶקְדֵּשׁ, חָמֵץ,
human_translation: Rava to his reasoning, as Rava said: Consecration leavened bread
llm_translation: Rava according to his reasoning, for Rava said: "He sanctified, leaven."

hebrew_text: וְשִׁחְרוּר — מַפְקִיעִין מִידֵי שִׁעְבּוּד.
human_translation: and manumission release from a lien.
llm_translation: And "shichrur" - we release from the hands of servitude.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: הִכְנִיסָה לוֹ שְׁנֵי כֵלִים בְּאֶלֶף זוּז, וְשָׁבְחוּ וְעָמְדוּ עַל שְׁנֵי אֲלָפִים. אֶחָד נוֹטַלְתּוֹ בִּכְתוּבָּתָהּ, וְאֶחָד נוֹתֶנֶת דָּמִים וְנוֹטַלְתּוֹ, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁבַח בֵּית אָבִיהָ.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said: brought into two belongings one thousand dinars, and they appreciated they stood at two thousand, one she collects as her marriage contract, And one, she pays its monetary and takes it because an asset of her paternal family.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said: He brought in for him two vessels for a thousand zuz, and they praised him and stood on two thousand. One takes it with its inscription, and one gives blood and takes it, because of the honor of her father's house.

hebrew_text: מַאי קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן — שֶׁבַח בֵּית אָבִיהָ דִּידַהּ הָוֵי? הָא אַמְרַהּ רַב יְהוּדָה חֲדָא זִימְנָא! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: הָנֵי מִילֵּי הֵיכָא דְּמָטְיָא לְמִשְׁקַל בִּכְתוּבְּתַהּ, אֲבָל מִיתָּן דְּמֵי וּמִישְׁקָל — לָא, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: What is he teaching us? assets of her paternal family are hers? Rav Yehuda said this once, lest you say this applies where she comes to collect her marriage contract, but to give money and take not teaches us
llm_translation: What is it teaching us? - That praise of her father's household should be hers? But didn't Rav Yehudah say once! What might you say: those words where it is easy to weigh in her favor, but those where it is difficult to weigh and balance - no, it is teaching us.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁנִּיסֵּת לְכֹהֵן וּמֵת, וְהִנִּיחָהּ מְעוּבֶּרֶת — לֹא יֹאכְלוּ עֲבָדֶיהָ בִּתְרוּמָה, מִפְּנֵי חֶלְקוֹ שֶׁל עוּבָּר, שֶׁהָעוּבָּר פּוֹסֵל. וְאֵינוֹ מַאֲכִיל, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי.
human_translation: an Israelite woman who married a priest and he died and left her pregnant, her slaves may not partake of teruma due to the share of the fetus, where the fetus disqualifies does not enable to partake the statement of Rabbi Yosei.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If a daughter of Israel was betrothed to a Kohen and he died, leaving her pregnant, her servants may not eat Terumah due to the portion of the fetus, which disqualifies. And he does not feed her, the words of Rabbi Yosei.

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ לוֹ: מֵאַחַר שֶׁהֵעַדְתָּ לָנוּ עַל בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל לְכֹהֵן — אַף בַּת כֹּהֵן לְכֹהֵן וּמֵת, וְהִנִּיחָה מְעוּבֶּרֶת — לֹא יֹאכְלוּ עֲבָדֶיהָ בִּתְרוּמָה, מִפְּנֵי חֶלְקוֹ שֶׁל עוּבָּר.
human_translation: said to him: Since you testified before us about an Israelite woman to a priest, the daughter of a priest to a priest and he died and left her pregnant, her slaves should not partake of teruma either, due to the fetus’s share.
llm_translation: They said to him: "After you have testified to us regarding the daughter of Israel to the priest - so too, the daughter of a priest to a priest, and she died, and she left behind a fetus - her slaves may not eat terumah, because of the portion of the fetus."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי מִשּׁוּם דְּקָסָבַר עוּבָּר בִּמְעֵי זָרָה — זָר הוּא, אוֹ דִלְמָא: יָלוּד — מַאֲכִיל, שֶׁאֵינוֹ יָלוּד — אֵינוֹ מַאֲכִיל?
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before the reason for Rabbi Yosei because he holds that a fetus in the womb of a non-priest is a non-priest, Or, perhaps one who was born enables to partake one who is not born does not enable to partake,
llm_translation: Gemara: He asked them: What is the reason for the opinion of Rabbi Yosei, because he holds that if a fetus is found in the bowels of a non-Jew, it is considered a non-Jew, or perhaps: if it is a born child, it may eat, but if it is not a born child, it may not eat?

hebrew_text: לְמַאי נָפְקָא מִינַּהּ — לְעוּבָּר בִּמְעֵי כֹהֶנֶת, מַאי? אָמַר רַבָּה, הַיְינוּ טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי: דְּקָסָבַר עוּבָּר בִּמְעֵי זָרָה זָר הוּא. רַב יוֹסֵף אָמַר: יָלוּד — מַאֲכִיל, שֶׁאֵין יָלוּד — אֵינוֹ מַאֲכִיל.
human_translation: What practical difference a fetus in the womb of the priestess, What Rabba said this is Rabbi Yosei’s reasoning: He holds a fetus in the womb of a non-priest is a non-priest. Rav Yosef said: one who was born enables to partake one who is not born does not enable to partake.
llm_translation: Regarding what does it come out? — Regarding a fetus in the bowels of a Kohenet, what is it? Rabba said, this is the reason of Rabbi Yosei: for he holds that a fetus in the bowels of a non-Kohenet is a non-Kohen. Rav Yosef said: If it is born — it feeds, if it is not born — it does not feed.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי, אָמְרוּ לוֹ לְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי: מֵאַחַר שֶׁהֵעַדְתָּ לָנוּ עַל בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל לְכֹהֵן, בַּת כֹּהֵן לְכֹהֵן מַהוּ? אָמַר לָהֶם: זוֹ שָׁמַעְתִּי וְזוֹ לֹא שָׁמַעְתִּי.
human_translation: raises an objection said to Rabbi Yosei: Since you testified before us about an Israelite woman to a priest, the daughter of a priest to a priest, what is He said to them: I heard but this I did not hear
llm_translation: Challenger: They said to Rabbi Yosei: "After you testified to us regarding the daughter of Israel to a Kohen, what about the daughter of a Kohen to a Kohen?" He said to them: "This I have heard, and this I have not heard."

hebrew_text: אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא: עוּבָּר בִּמְעֵי זָרָה זָר הוּא — הַיְינוּ דְּקָאָמַר לְהוּ: זוֹ שָׁמַעְתִּי וְזוֹ לֹא שָׁמַעְתִּי. אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ: יָלוּד — מַאֲכִיל, שֶׁאֵין יָלוּד — אֵין מַאֲכִיל, מַאי זוֹ שָׁמַעְתִּי וְזוֹ לֹא שָׁמַעְתִּי? אִיהִי הִיא קַשְׁיָא.
human_translation: Granted, if you say a fetus in the womb of a non-priest is a non-priest, this is that he said to them: This I heard but this I did not hear. However, if you say one who was born enables to partake one who is not born does not enable to partake, what This I heard but this I did not hear? It is the same a difficult
llm_translation: If you say: "A fetus in the bowels of a non-Jew is considered a foreign entity" — that is what he means to say to them: "This I have heard, and this I have not heard." Rather, if you say: "A born child — one may feed, but if not born — one may not feed," what is "this I have heard, and this I have not heard"? This is a difficulty.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: זוֹ דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי. אֲבָל חֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: יֵשׁ לוֹ בָּנִים — אוֹכְלִים מִשּׁוּם בָּנִים. אֵין לוֹ בָּנִים — אוֹכְלִים מִשּׁוּם אַחִים. אֵין לוֹ אַחִים — אוֹכְלִים מִשּׁוּם מִשְׁפָּחָה כּוּלָּהּ.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: This is the statement of Rabbi Yosei. However, the Rabbis say has children, partake due to children, he does not have children, they partake due to brothers, he does not have brothers they partake due to entire family,
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: These are the words of Rabbi Yosei. But the sages say: If one has sons, they eat because of the sons. If one does not have sons, they eat because of the brothers. If one does not have brothers, they eat because of the entire extended family.

hebrew_text: ״זוֹ״ וְלָא סְבִירָא לֵיהּ. הָא אֲמַר לֵיהּ שְׁמוּאֵל לְרַב חָנָא בַּגְדָּתָאָה: פּוֹק אַיְיתִי לִי בֵּי עַשְׂרָה, דְּאֵימָא לָךְ בְּאַנְפַּיְיהוּ: הַמְזַכֶּה לְעוּבָּר — קָנָה. אֶלָּא: ״זוֹ״ וּסְבִירָא לֵיהּ. מַאי קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן — דִּפְלִיגִי רַבָּנַן עֲלֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי.
human_translation: this he does not maintain Shmuel said to Rav Ḥana of Baghdad: Go and bring me an assembly of ten and I will say to you before them One who transfers ownership to a fetus, acquires Rather, this he holds What is teaching us that the Rabbis disagree with Rabbi Yosei.
llm_translation: "This one" and not he holds. This, Samuel said to Rav Ḥana in the garden: Go, bring me figs from the house of Asarah, so that I may say to you with their leaves: One who benefits an unborn child — acquires. Rather, "this one" and he holds. What does this teach us? That the Rabbis disagreed with regard to the opinion of Rabbi Yosei.

hebrew_text: וּמִי פְּלִיגִי? מֵתִיב רַבִּי זַכַּאי: זוֹ עֵדוּת הֵעִיד רַבִּי יוֹסֵי מִפִּי שְׁמַעְיָה וְאַבְטַלְיוֹן, וְהוֹדוּ לוֹ! אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: מִי קָתָנֵי ״וְקִבְּלוּ״? ״וְהוֹדוּ לוֹ״ קָתָנֵי, דְּמִסְתַּבַּר טַעְמֵיהּ.
human_translation: But do they disagree? Rabbi Zakkai raised an objection This a testimony Rabbi Yosei testified from the mouths of Shemaya and Avtalyon, and acknowledged Rav Ashi said: Does state: And accepted It states: And they acknowledged that his opinion is reasonable.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And who disputes? It was asked: Rabbi Zakkai raised an objection: This is the testimony that Rabbi Yosei testified from the mouth of Shemaiah and Avtalyon, and they acknowledged it! Rav Ashi said: Who is the tanna that teaches 'and they acknowledged'? It teaches 'and they acknowledged,' for its reasoning is clear."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הִנִּיחַ בָּנִים — אֵלּוּ וָאֵלּוּ אוֹכְלִים. הִנִּיחָהּ מְעוּבֶּרֶת — אֵלּוּ וָאֵלּוּ אֵין אוֹכְלִים. הִנִּיחַ בָּנִים, וְהִנִּיחָהּ מְעוּבֶּרֶת — עַבְדֵי מְלוֹג אוֹכְלִים כְּדֶרֶךְ שֶׁהִיא אוֹכֶלֶת, עַבְדֵי צֹאן בַּרְזֶל — לֹא יֹאכְלוּ, מִפְּנֵי חֶלְקוֹ שֶׁל עוּבָּר. שֶׁהָעוּבָּר פּוֹסֵל וְאֵינוֹ מַאֲכִיל, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי.
human_translation: The Sages taught left children, and may partake he left pregnant these and those may not partake he left children and left her pregnant, slaves of usufruct partake just as she partakes slaves of guaranteed investment, may not partake, due to the fetus’s share, as a fetus can disqualify but it cannot not enable to partake. the statement of Rabbi Yosei.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: "If one left grain for children - both these and those may eat. If one left it for a pregnant woman - both these and those may not eat. If one left grain for children, and left it for a pregnant woman - the slaves of a miller may eat it as it is eaten, the slaves of a shepherd with iron teeth may not eat it, because of the embryo's portion. For the embryo disqualifies and does not feed, the words of Rabbi Yosei."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם אָבִיו: הַבַּת — מַאֲכֶלֶת, הַבֵּן — אֵינוֹ מַאֲכִיל. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַי אוֹמֵר: זְכָרִים יֹאכְלוּ כּוּלָּן, נְקֵבוֹת לֹא יֹאכֵלוּ, שֶׁמָּא יִמָּצֵא עוּבָּר זָכָר, וְאֵין לַבָּנוֹת בִּמְקוֹם הַבֵּן כְּלוּם.
human_translation: Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei, says in the name of his father: a daughter, enables to partake a son does not enable to partake. Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai says: males, partake all females, they do not partake, lest the fetus be found a male, and daughters do not any where a son.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei, says in the name of his father: The daughter—she feeds, the son—does not feed. Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai says: Males may all eat, females may not eat, lest a male fetus be found, and there are no daughters in place of sons at all.

hebrew_text: מַאי אִירְיָא שֶׁמָּא יִמָּצֵא עוּבָּר זָכָר? תִּיפּוֹק לֵיהּ דִּנְקֵבָה נָמֵי פָּסְלָה! חֲדָא וְעוֹד קָאָמַר: חֲדָא, דִּנְקֵבָה נָמֵי פָּסְלָה. וְעוֹד, שֶׁמָּא יִמָּצֵא עוּבָּר זָכָר, וְאֵין לַבָּנוֹת בִּמְקוֹם הַבֵּן כְּלוּם.
human_translation: Why specifically lest the fetus be found a male? Derive that a female also disqualifies stated one and another. One that a female also disqualifies and another lest the fetus be found a male, and daughters have no at all in a place a son.
llm_translation: What is the meaning of "perhaps a male fetus will be found"? Let him bring forth a female, she too invalidates! One and furthermore he said: one, a female too invalidates. And furthermore, perhaps a male fetus will be found, and daughters have no significance in the place of a son.

hebrew_text: זְכָרִים יֹאכֵלוּ: וְהָאִיכָּא עוּבָּר! קָסָבַר:
human_translation: males, may partake But isn’t there a fetus holds
llm_translation: Males shall eat. But what about the unborn? He holds:

hebrew_text: אֵין חוֹשְׁשִׁין לְמִיעוּטָא. וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: לְעוֹלָם קָסָבַר חוֹשְׁשִׁין לְמִיעוּטָא, דְּעָבְדִינַן לֵיהּ תַּקַּנְתָּא כְּרַב נַחְמָן אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל.
human_translation: we are not concerned about the minority And if you wish, say actually he holds we are concerned about the minority. we make an arrangement for in accordance with Rav Naḥman Shmuel said.
llm_translation: We do not worry about a minority. And if you wish, say: Indeed, he always holds that we worry about a minority, for we establish for him a remedy as Rav Nachman said in the name of Shmuel.

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: יְתוֹמִים שֶׁבָּאוּ לַחֲלוֹק בְּנִכְסֵי אֲבִיהֶם, בֵּית דִּין מַעֲמִידִין לָהֶם אַפּוֹטְרוֹפּוֹס, וּבוֹרֵר לָהֶם חֵלֶק יָפֶה. הִגְדִּילוּ — יְכוֹלִין לְמַחוֹת. וְרַב נַחְמָן דִּידֵיהּ אָמַר: הִגְדִּילוּ — אֵין יְכוֹלִין לְמַחוֹת, דְּאִם כֵּן מָה כֹּחַ בֵּית דִּין יָפֶה.
human_translation: as Rav Naḥman said Shmuel said: orphans who came to divide up their father’s property, court appoints for them a steward [ apotropos ], and he selects for them a fine share. have grown up, they may object And Rav Naḥman himself said they have grown up they may not object, as, if what good is the power of the court?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rabbi Nachman said in the name of Shmuel: Orphans who come to divide their father's estate, the court appoints for them an apotropos, who selects for them a good portion. If they grow up — they are able to protest. And Rabbi Nachman himself said: If they grow up — they are not able to protest, for if so, what power does the court have in selecting a good portion.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא דְּרַב נַחְמָן תַּנָּאֵי הִיא? לָא, דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא אִית לְהוּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן. וְהָכָא בְּחוֹשְׁשִׁין לְמִיעוּטָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי.
human_translation: Let us say Rav Naḥman’s is tanna’im , No; that everyone accepts Rav Naḥman’s and here they disagree with regard to we are concerned about the minority,
llm_translation: Let us say that Rav Nachman is a Tanna? No, for the entire world has a Rav Nachman. And here, we are concerned about a small amount that he disputes.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם אָבִיו: הַבַּת מַאֲכֶלֶת, הַבֵּן אֵינוֹ מַאֲכִיל. מַאי שְׁנָא בֵּן דְּלֹא מַאֲכִיל — מִשּׁוּם חֶלְקוֹ שֶׁל עוּבָּר? בַּת נָמֵי לֹא תַּאֲכִיל — מִפְּנֵי חֶלְקוֹ שֶׁל עוּבָּר!
human_translation: Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei, says in the name of his father: a daughter, enables to partake a son does not enable to partake What is different a son, who does not enable to partake, due to the fetus’s share, A daughter should not enable to partake either, due to fetus’s share.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei, says in the name of his father: The daughter feeds, the son does not feed. What is the difference between a son who does not feed - because of his share in the womb? A daughter, if she does not feed - because of her share in the womb!

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: הָכָא בִּנְכָסִים מוּעָטִים עָסְקִינַן. וּכְגוֹן דְּאִיכָּא בֵּן בַּהֲדֵי בַּת,
human_translation: Abaye said: Here we are dealing with insufficient property also where there is son together with daughter.
llm_translation: Abbaye said: Here we are dealing with minimal assets. For example, where there is a son of a daughter.

hebrew_text: מָה נַפְשָׁךְ: אִי הַאי דִּמְעַבְּרָא בֵּן הוּא — לָא עֲדִיף מֵהַאי דְּקָאֵי. אִי בַּת הִיא, אַמַּאי אָכְלָה — בְּתַקַּנְתָּא דְרַבָּנַן, כַּמָּה דְּלָא נְפַק לַאֲוִיר הָעוֹלָם לָא תַּקִּינוּ רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: no matter what, If this with which she is pregnant, is a son, it is no better than this who exists. If it is a daughter, Why does partake by a rabbinic ordinance. as long as has not emerged into the atmosphere of the world, the Sages did not establish
llm_translation: "What is your opinion? If this one who is passing by is a son - he is not preferable to this one who is standing. If she is a daughter, why did she eat? According to the ordinance of the Rabbis, just as they did not establish for the air of the world, so too the Rabbis did not establish."

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי אוֹקֵימְתַּאּ — בִּנְכָסִים מוּעָטִים, אֵימָא סֵיפָא: שֶׁמָּא יִמָּצֵא הָעוּבָּר זָכַר, וְאֵין לַבָּנוֹת בִּמְקוֹם בֵּן כְּלוּם. אַדְּרַבָּה, נְכָסִים מוּעָטִים דְּבָנוֹת נִינְהוּ! סֵיפָא אֲתָאן לִנְכָסִים מְרוּבִּין.
human_translation: In what did you establish to insufficient property. say the latter clause Lest the fetus be found a male, and daughters do not any where a son. on the contrary, insufficient property is the daughters’, the latter clause we have come to sufficient property.
llm_translation: In what case is it established? — In a case of minimal assets. Say the latter clause: perhaps a male fetus will be found, and there will be no daughters in place of a son. On the contrary, they are considered minimal assets because of daughters! The latter clause comes to discuss abundant assets.

hebrew_text: וּנְכָסִים מוּעָטִים דְּבָנוֹת נִינְהוּ? וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי אַסִּי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: יְתוֹמִין שֶׁקָּדְמוּ וּמָכְרוּ בִּנְכָסִים מוּעָטִים — מַה שֶּׁמָּכְרוּ מָכְרוּ?!
human_translation: insufficient property to the daughters? Didn’t Rabbi Asi say Rabbi Yoḥanan said: orphans proceeded to sell insufficient property, what they sold was sold.
llm_translation: And assets few, what are they? And said Rabbi Assi said Rabbi Yochanan: Orphans who preceded and sold with few assets - what did they sell, did they sell?!

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא, מַאי ״בַּת״ דְּקָתָנֵי — אֵם. אִי הָכִי, הַיְינוּ רַבִּי יוֹסֵי? כּוּלָּהּ רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי קָתָנֵי לַהּ.
human_translation: Rather, what is daughter that is taught mother If so, this is Rabbi Yosei’s entire is taught by Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei.
llm_translation: And rather, what is the meaning of "bat" that is taught? — Mother. If so, is this not Rabbi Yosei? The entire teaching is Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei, teaches it.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הָעוּבָּר, וְהַיָּבָם, וְהָאֵירוּסִין, וְהַחֵרֵשׁ, וּבֶן תֵּשַׁע שָׁנִים וְיוֹם אֶחָד — פּוֹסְלִין, וְלֹא מַאֲכִילִין.
human_translation: the fetus and a man whose married brother died childless [ yavam ]; and betrothal; and deaf-mute; and a nine-year-and-one-day-old disqualify But do not enable to partake
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: The unborn fetus, the yavam (brother-in-law), the betrothed woman, the deaf-mute, and a child of nine years and one day - they disqualify (from certain matters) but do not feed (from terumah).

hebrew_text: סָפֵק שֶׁהוּא בֶּן תֵּשַׁע שָׁנִים וְיוֹם אֶחָד סָפֵק שֶׁאֵינוֹ, סָפֵק הֵבִיא שְׁתֵּי שְׂעָרוֹת וְסָפֵק שֶׁלֹּא הֵבִיא,
human_translation: uncertainty whether he is nine years and one day old uncertainty he is not, uncertainty whether he has grown two hairs and uncertainty whether he has not grown,
llm_translation: Doubtful whether he is nine years old and one day, doubtful whether he is not, doubtful whether he brought two hairs and doubtful whether he did not bring.

hebrew_text: נָפַל הַבַּיִת עָלָיו וְעַל בַּת אָחִיו, וְאֵין יָדוּעַ אֵי זֶה מֵת רִאשׁוֹן — צָרָתָהּ חוֹלֶצֶת וְלֹא מִתְיַיבֶּמֶת.
human_translation: the house fell upon and upon his brother’s daughter, and it is unknown which died first, her rival wife performs ḥalitza and does not enter into levirate marriage.
llm_translation: The house fell on him and on the daughter of his brother, and it is not known which one died first - his wife performs ḥaliẓah and does not engage in levirate marriage.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ הָעוּבָּר. אִי בַּת כֹּהֵן לְיִשְׂרָאֵל הִיא — פָּסֵיל לָהּ. ״כִּנְעוּרֶיהָ״ — פְּרָט לִמְעוּבֶּרֶת. אִי בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל לְכֹהֵן הִיא — לֹא מַאֲכִיל לָהּ, יָלוּד — מַאֲכִיל, שֶׁאֵינוֹ יָלוּד — אֵינוֹ מַאֲכִיל.
human_translation: the fetus If she is the daughter of a priest to an Israelite, disqualifies her “as in her youth” excludes a pregnant woman, If is an Israelite woman to a priest, does not enable her to partake, one who was born enables to partake one who is not born does not enable to partake.
llm_translation: Gemara: "The offspring of a forbidden union. If she is the daughter of a Kohen married to an Israelite, she is disqualified. 'From her youth' - this excludes a forbidden union. If she is the daughter of an Israelite married to a Kohen, he does not feed her. If she is a child, he feeds her; if she is not a child, he does not feed her."

hebrew_text: הַיָּבָם. אִי בַּת כֹּהֵן לְיִשְׂרָאֵל הִיא — פָּסֵיל לָהּ. ״וְשָׁבָה אֶל בֵּית אָבִיהָ״ — פְּרָט לְשׁוֹמֶרֶת יָבָם. אִי בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל לְכֹהֵן הִיא — לָא מַאֲכֵיל לָהּ, ״קִנְיַן כַּסְפּוֹ״ אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא, וְהָא קִנְיָן דְּאָחִיו הוּא.
human_translation: a yavam . If she is the daughter of a priest to an Israelite, he disqualifies her, “And is returned to her father’s house,” excludes a widow waiting for her yavam , If she is an Israelite woman to a priest, he does not enable her to partake the Merciful One states “The purchase of his money, and this is his brother’s acquisition.
llm_translation: Yavam. If she is the daughter of a Kohen to an Israelite - she is disqualified. "And she shall return to her father's house" - excluding the Yavam's guardian. If she is the daughter of an Israelite to a Kohen - he does not feed her, "her father's money" the Merciful One said, and that is the money of her brother.

hebrew_text: וְהָאֵירוּסִין. אִי בַּת כֹּהֵן לְיִשְׂרָאֵל הִיא — פָּסֵיל לָהּ,
human_translation: also betrothal. If she is the daughter of a priest to an Israelite, he disqualifies her,
llm_translation: The betrothed woman of a Kohen to an Israelite - she is disqualified.

hebrew_text: דְּהָא קַנְיַהּ בַּהֲוָיָה. וְאִי בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל לְכֹהֵן הִיא — לֹא מַאֲכִיל לָהּ מִשּׁוּם דְּעוּלָּא.
human_translation: as he acquired her by means of betrothal. And if she is an Israelite woman to a priest, he does not enable her to partake due to Ulla:
llm_translation: The text reads: "deha kanya bahavaya. vei bat Yisrael lekohen hi - lo ma'achil lah mishum de'ula." Translation: "Because he acquired her with her existence. And if she is a daughter of Israel to a priest - he does not feed her because of impropriety."

hebrew_text: וְהַחֵרֵשׁ. אִי בַּת כֹּהֵן לְיִשְׂרָאֵל הִיא — פָּסֵיל לַהּ, דְּהָא קַנְיַהּ בְּתַקַּנְתָּא דְרַבָּנַן. וְאִי בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל לְכֹהֵן הִיא — לָא מַאֲכֵיל, ״קִנְיַן כַּסְפּוֹ״ אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא, וְהַאי לָאו בַּר קִנְיָן הוּא.
human_translation: also a deaf-mute If she is the daughter of a priest Israelite, he disqualifies her, as he acquired her through an ordinance of the Sages. And if she is an Israelite woman to priest, he does not enable to partake the Merciful One states “The purchase of his money, and this is not capable of acquisition
llm_translation: The deaf-mute. If she is the daughter of a Kohen to an Israelite - she is disqualified, for she acquires through the Rabbinic enactment. And if she is the daughter of an Israelite to a Kohen - he does not feed her, for "the acquisition of his money" the Merciful One said, and this is not an acquisition of money.

hebrew_text: וּבֶן תֵּשַׁע שָׁנִים וְכוּ׳. קָא סָלְקָא דַּעְתִּין, בְּשׁוֹמֶרֶת יָבָם לְבֶן תֵּשַׁע וְיוֹם אֶחָד. לְמַאי? אִי לְמִיפְסַל — קָטָן נָמֵי מִיפְסָל פָּסֵיל, אִי לְאוֹכוֹלֵי — גָּדוֹל נָמֵי לֹא מַאֲכִיל!
human_translation: also a nine-year-old It enters our mind to a widow waiting for her yavam , nine and one day old. to what If to disqualifying a younger also disqualifies if to enabling to partake an older does not enable to partake either,
llm_translation: "And a nine-year-old and so on. The matter of their opinion arose, regarding the waiting period of yavam for a nine-year-old and one day. For what? If to disqualify - a minor also disqualifies, if for eating - an adult also does not feed!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: הָכָא בְּיָבָם בֶּן תֵּשַׁע שָׁנִים וְיוֹם אֶחָד הַבָּא עַל יְבִמְתּוֹ עָסְקִינַן. דְּמִדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא קַנְיָא לֵיהּ, סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: הוֹאִיל וּמִדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא קַנְיָא לֵיהּ וּבִיאָתוֹ בִּיאָה, אֵימָא לוֹכֵיל, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן עָשׂוּ בִּיאַת בֶּן תֵּשַׁע שָׁנִים וְיוֹם אֶחָד כְּמַאֲמָר בְּגָדוֹל.
human_translation: Abaye said: Here we are dealing with a nine-year-and-one-day-old yavam who engaged in intercourse with his yevama , as she was acquired by him by Torah enter your mind to say since by Torah she was acquired by him, as his intercourse is intercourse, he enables to partake teaches us rendered the intercourse of a nine-year-and-one-day-old like levirate betrothal by an adult man,
llm_translation: Abaye said: Here in the case of yavam, a nine-year-old boy who comes to his yevamah, we are dealing with. Since he acquires her by Torah law, your mind should say: Since he acquires her by Torah law and his coming is a valid coming, let us say he is capable. It is evident to us that they engaged in the act of coming of a nine-year-old boy, as it is stated in the verse "like the matter of the greater one."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא: אִי הָכִי, סֵיפָא דְּקָתָנֵי: סָפֵק בֶּן תֵּשַׁע שָׁנִים וְיוֹם אֶחָד סָפֵק שֶׁאֵינוֹ — הַשְׁתָּא וַדַּאי בֶּן תֵּשַׁע לֹא מַאֲכִיל, סָפֵק מִיבַּעְיָא?!
human_translation: Rava said to him: If so, the latter clause which teaches uncertainty he is nine years and one day old uncertainty he is not, Now definitely nine old does not enable to partake is necessary uncertainty
llm_translation: He said to him, Rava: If so, the latter part of what is taught: If there is a doubt about a child of nine years and one day whether he is capable or not - now, surely, if he is nine, he does not feed him, does he need a doubt?!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: בְּבֶן תֵּשַׁע שָׁנִים וְיוֹם אֶחָד דְּהָנָךְ פְּסוּלִים קָתָנֵי, דְּפָסְלִי בְּבִיאָתָן. וְכִדְתַנְיָא: בֶּן תֵּשַׁע שָׁנִים וְיוֹם אֶחָד, גֵּר, עַמּוֹנִי וּמוֹאָבִי, מִצְרִי וַאֲדוֹמִי, כּוּתִי, נָתִין, חָלָל וּמַמְזֵר שֶׁבָּאוּ עַל כֹּהֶנֶת לְוִיָּה וְיִשְׂרְאֵלִית — פְּסָלוּהָ.
human_translation: Rather, Rava said is teaching with regard to a nine-year-and-one-day-old of those unfit who disqualify by their intercourse, as it is taught A nine-year-and-one-day-old an Ammonite or a Moabite convert; an Egyptian or an Edomite a Samaritan [ kuti ], a Gibeonite, a ḥalal , or a mamzer , engaged in intercourse with a priestess, a Levite, or an Israelite, disqualified her
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said: In a nine-year-old and one day old boy, where they are disqualified, it is taught, that they disqualified through their entry. And as it was taught: A nine-year-old and one day old, a convert, an Ammonite and a Moabite, an Egyptian and an Edomite, a Kutite, a Natin, a Halal, and a Mamzer who came upon a Kohenet, a Levite, or an Israelite — they disqualify her.

hebrew_text: וְהָא מִדְּקָתָנֵי סֵיפָא: אִם אֵינָן רְאוּיִן לָבֹא בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל — הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ פּוֹסְלִים, מִכְּלָל דְּרֵישָׁא לָאו בִּפְסוּלִים עָסְקִינַן! רֵישָׁא פְּסוּלֵי קָהָל, סֵיפָא פְּסוּלֵי כְהוּנָּה.
human_translation: from that the latter clause, teaches if are unfit to enter Israel they disqualify It may be inferred that the first clause, we are dealing not with unfit The first clause unfit to the assembly the latter clause unfit for priesthood.
llm_translation: And this is what is taught in the latter part: If they are not fit to enter into Israel - behold, these are disqualified, from the inference of the first part are we not dealing with disqualifications! The first part refers to disqualifications of the congregation, the latter part refers to disqualifications of the priesthood.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא: בֶּן תֵּשַׁע שָׁנִים וְיוֹם אֶחָד, גֵּר, עַמּוֹנִי וּמוֹאָבִי, מִצְרִי וַאֲדוֹמִי, כּוּתִי, נָתִין, חָלָל וּמַמְזֵר שֶׁבָּאוּ עַל כֹּהֶנֶת לְוִיָּה וְיִשְׂרְאֵלִית — פְּסָלוּהָ.
human_translation: itself A nine-year-and-one-day-old an Ammonite or a Moabite convert; an Egyptian or an Edomite a Samaritan, a Gibeonite, a ḥalal , or a mamzer , engaged in intercourse with a priestess, a Levite, or an Israelite, disqualified her
llm_translation: Body: A nine-year-old and one day, a convert, an Ammonite and Moabite, an Egyptian and Edomite, a Kutite, a Natin, a Halal and a Mamzer who came upon a Kohenet of the Levites and Israelite - disqualify her.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: כֹּל שֶׁזַּרְעוֹ פָּסוּל — פּוֹסֵל, כֹּל שֶׁאֵין זַרְעוֹ פָּסוּל — אֵינוֹ פּוֹסֵל. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: כֹּל שֶׁאַתָּה נוֹשֵׂא בִּתּוֹ — אַתָּה נוֹשֵׂא אַלְמְנָתוֹ, וְכֹל שֶׁאֵין אַתָּה נוֹשֵׂא בִּתּוֹ — אִי אַתָּה נוֹשֵׂא אַלְמְנָתוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: anyone whose offspring is unfit disqualifies anyone whose offspring is not unfit does not disqualify Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Anyone whose daughter you may marry, you may marry his widow, And anyone whose daughter you may not marry, you may not marry his widow
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: "Anyone whose seed is disqualified - he disqualifies; anyone whose seed is not disqualified - he does not disqualify." Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: "Anyone who marries off his daughter - he marries off his widow; and anyone who does not marry off his daughter - he does not marry off his widow."

hebrew_text: מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב, אָמַר קְרָא: ״וּבַת כֹּהֵן כִּי תִהְיֶה לְאִישׁ זָר״, כֵּיוָן שֶׁנִּבְעֲלָה לְפָסוּל לָהּ — פְּסָלָהּ.
human_translation: From where are these matters Rav Yehuda said Rav said: The verse states: “And if a priest’s daughter be married to a common man [ ish zar ], since she engaged in intercourse with one who is unfit for her, he disqualified her
