llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Mena hanei millei? Amar Rav Yehudah amar Rav, amar kra: 'Uvat kohein ki tiheyeh le'ish zar', keivan she'nib'alah le'pasul lah - pesalah." English translation: "What are these words? Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav, a verse states: 'And the daughter of a kohen, if she becomes married to a stranger, she is disqualified.'"

hebrew_text: הַאי מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ דְּקָאָמַר רַחֲמָנָא בַּת כֹּהֵן דְּמִינַּסְבָא לְזָר — לָא תֵּיכוּל!
human_translation: That is necessary that the Merciful One says: The daughter of a priest who marries a non-priest, may not partake
llm_translation: This one, he requires it, for the Merciful One said, "The daughter of a Kohen who marries a non-Kohen - she shall not eat!"

hebrew_text: הָהִיא, מִ״וְּשָׁבָה אֶל בֵּית אָבִיהָ כִּנְעוּרֶיהָ מִלֶּחֶם אָבִיהָ תֹּאכֵל״ נָפְקָא. מִדְּקָאָמַר רַחֲמָנָא: ״וְשָׁבָה אֶל בֵּית אָבִיהָ ... תֹּאכֵל״, מִכְּלָל דְּמֵעִיקָּרָא לָא אָכְלָה.
human_translation: That is derived from and is returned to her father’s house, as in her youth, she may eat of her father’s bread” ( From the fact that the Merciful One says: “And is returned to her father’s house…she may eat,” it may be inferred that initially, she not eat.
llm_translation: That one, "and she returned to her father's house as in her youth, she shall eat her father's bread," she went out. From where do we derive this? As the Merciful One said: "and she shall return to her father's house... she shall eat," indicating that she did not eat from the outset.

hebrew_text: אִי מֵהַהִיא, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: לָאו הַבָּא מִכְּלַל עֲשֵׂה — עֲשֵׂה, כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא הַאי לְלָאו. [לָאו] מִ״וְכָל זָר לֹא יֹאכַל קֹדֶשׁ״ נָפְקָא.
human_translation: If from that I would have said a prohibition that stems from a positive mitzva is a positive mitzva, The Merciful One writes that to prohibition. prohibition is derived from “No common man may eat of the sacred”
llm_translation: If from there, I would say: If not that it comes from the general category of positive commandments - it is a positive commandment, as the Merciful One wrote this as a negative commandment. "Not and any stranger shall not eat holy" is derived.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְגוּפֵיהּ! תְּרֵי ״וְכׇל זָר״ כְּתִיבִי.
human_translation: That is necessary to its own Two a “common man” are written,
llm_translation: That one asked for himself! Two "and any outsider" are written.

hebrew_text: וְאַכַּתִּי מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְכִדְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: ״וְכׇל זָר״ — זָרוּת אָמַרְתִּי לְךָ, וְלֹא אֲנִינוּת! דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא מִן ״זָר״ ״וְכׇל זָר״ נָפְקָא.
human_translation: is still necessary to that by Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, as Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, said “no common man” I, said to you commonness, but acute mourning, not of Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, is derived from A common man “No common man.”
llm_translation: And once he asked him according to Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Chanina, for Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Chanina said: "And any outsider" - I have told you about outsiderliness, not about an inn! For Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Chanina derived from "outsider" that "and any outsider" is derived.

hebrew_text: וְאַכַּתִּי מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְכִדְתַנְיָא: כְּשֶׁהִיא חוֹזֶרֶת — חוֹזֶרֶת לִתְרוּמָה וְאֵינָהּ חוֹזֶרֶת לְחָזֶה וָשׁוֹק. וְאָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא אָמַר רָבִינָא בַּר רַב שֵׁילָא: מַאי קְרָא, דִּכְתִיב: ״וּבַת כֹּהֵן כִּי תִהְיֶה לְאִישׁ זָר הִיא בִּתְרוּמַת הַקֳּדָשִׁים לֹא תֹאכֵל״ — לֹא תֹּאכַל בַּמּוּרָם מִן הַקֳּדָשִׁים.
human_translation: is still necessary for that which is taught When returns she resumes teruma , but she does not resume breast and hind leg And Rav Ḥisda said Ravina, son of Rav Sheila, said: What is the verse As it is written: “And if a priest’s daughter be married to a common man, she may not eat of that which is set apart from the sacred” she may not partake of the separated from consecrated
llm_translation: And once he asked him according to the teaching: when she returns — she returns to terumah and does not return to her beauty and her thigh. And Rav Ḥisda said that Ravina, son of Rav Sheilah, said: What is the verse, as it is written: "And the daughter of a kohen, if she becomes a stranger by becoming married to a man outside of the kohanim, she shall not eat of the terumah of the holy things" — she shall not eat in the upper chamber from the holy things.

hebrew_text: אִם כֵּן, לִכְתּוֹב קְרָא: ״הִיא בַּקֳּדָשִׁים לֹא תֹאכַל״. מַאי ״בִּתְרוּמַת הַקֳּדָשִׁים״? שָׁמְעַתְּ מִינַּהּ תַּרְתֵּי.
human_translation: If so, let the verse write: She may not eat of the sacred. What is “that which is set apart from the sacred”? Conclude from this two
llm_translation: If so, let it be written: "She shall not eat in the holy places." What is "from the offerings of the holy places"? Learn from it two.

hebrew_text: אַשְׁכְּחַן כֹּהֶנֶת — לְוִיָּה וְיִשְׂרְאֵלִית מְנָלַן? כִּדְאָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא אָמַר רַב — ״בַּת״ ״וּבַת״, הָכָא נָמֵי — ״בַּת״ ״וּבַת״.
human_translation: We found a priestess; from where do we a Levite or an Israelite as Rabbi Abba Rav said: “But daughter daughter. Here too, daughter, “And daughter,”
llm_translation: I found a Kohenet - from which tribe is she, Levi or Israelite? As Rabbi Abba said in the name of Rav: "daughter" and "and daughter," here too it is stated: "daughter" and "and daughter."

hebrew_text: כְּמַאן — כְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, דְּדָרֵישׁ וָוִין? אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבָּנַן, כּוּלֵּיהּ ״וּבַת״ קְרָא יַתִּירָא הוּא.
human_translation: In accordance with whose in accordance with Rabbi Akiva, as derives vav , Even you say the Rabbis, the entire “And daughter,” is superfluous verse,
llm_translation: As whom - as Rabbi Akiva, who expounds and adds? Even if you say the Rabbis, the entire verse "and daughter" is superfluous.

hebrew_text: אַשְׁכְּחַן לִתְרוּמָה, לִכְהוּנָּה מְנָלַן? אַטּוּ לְוִיָּה וְיִשְׂרְאֵלִית לָא לִכְהוּנָּה מְרַבֵּינַן לְהוּ? דְּאִי לִתְרוּמָה, בְּנוֹת מֵיכַל תְּרוּמָה נִינְהוּ?
human_translation: We found teruma ; from where do we from priesthood? Is that to say we did not include a Levite and an Israelite woman to the priesthood? as if to teruma , are fit to partake of teruma
llm_translation: I found a contribution, to the priesthood where is it from? If for the priesthood, do we not say that Levites and Israelites do not contribute to the priesthood? For if it is for a contribution, are the daughters of Michal considered a contribution?

hebrew_text: אַלְּמָה לָא, מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ דְּקָאָכְלָה בִּשְׁבִיל בְּנָהּ.
human_translation: Why not? You find that when she partakes due to her son.
llm_translation: "Why not? You forget that she ate for the sake of her son."

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁבִיל בְּנָהּ קַל וָחוֹמֶר: וּמָה כֹּהֶנֶת, דְּבִקְדוּשָּׁה דְנַפְשַׁהּ אָכְלָה — פָּסֵיל לָהּ, לְוִיָּה וְיִשְׂרְאֵלִית, דְּלָא אָכְלָה אֶלָּא בִּשְׁבִיל בְּנָהּ — לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן?
human_translation: due to her son is an a fortiori If a priestess, who partakes by her own sanctity, is disqualified a Levite or Israelite woman, who partakes only due to her son, not all the more so
llm_translation: Talmudic text: For her son, kal vachomer: And what about a Kohenet, whose sanctity is inherent in her soul, if she consumed the offering — it is disqualified for her. But for a Levite or an Israelite, who only consumed the offering for her son — is it not all the more so?

hebrew_text: וְהִיא הַנּוֹתֶנֶת: כֹּהֶנֶת דְּקַדִּישׁ גּוּפַהּ — פָּסֵיל לַהּ, הָא, דְּלָא קַדִּישׁ גּוּפַהּ — לָא פָּסֵיל לַהּ. אֶלָּא לִכְהוּנָּה, קַל וָחוֹמֶר מִגְּרוּשָׁה: וּמָה גְּרוּשָׁה שֶׁמּוּתֶּרֶת בִּתְרוּמָה — אֲסוּרָה לַכְּהוּנָּה, זוֹ שֶׁאֲסוּרָה בִּתְרוּמָה — אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁפְּסוּלָה לַכְּהוּנָּה?!
human_translation: But that provides a priestess, who is herself sacred, is disqualified this who is not sacred herself, not disqualify her. Rather, into the priesthood an a fortiori from a divorcée: If a divorcée who is permitted to teruma , is prohibited into the priesthood, this whom is prohibited to teruma , is it not right that disqualified into the priesthood?
llm_translation: And she who gives: like a consecrated woman, her body is disqualified for her. This, that if her body is not consecrated, it is not disqualified for her. Rather, regarding priesthood, it is a fortiori from divorce: And just as a divorced woman who is permitted in terumah is forbidden for priesthood, this one who is forbidden in terumah - is it not logical that she is disqualified for priesthood?!

hebrew_text: וְכִי מַזְהִירִין מִן הַדִּין? גִּלּוּי מִילְּתָא בְּעָלְמָא הוּא.
human_translation: But do we warn, logical derivation? it is merely a revelation
llm_translation: And are we cautious about the law? It is a revealed matter in the world.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא נִבְעֲלָה לְפָסוּל לָהּ — חַיָּיבֵי כָּרֵיתוֹת, ״כִּי תִהְיֶה״ אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא: הָנָךְ דְּאִית בְּהוּ הֲוָיָה. חַיָּיבֵי כָּרֵיתוֹת לָאו בְּנֵי הֲוָיָה.
human_translation: And say engaged in intercourse with unfit for her those liable to receive karet the Merciful One states “If be married” those who have marriage, those liable to receive karet are not fit for marriage.
llm_translation: "And why should she become disqualified? — Those liable to karet, 'when she becomes' said the Merciful One: you who are in it, be. Those liable to karet are not 'beings.'"

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, גּוֹי וְעֶבֶד לָא לִיפְסְלוּ! הָנָךְ פָּסְלִי מִדְּרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: מִנַּיִן לְגוֹי וְעֶבֶד שֶׁבָּא עַל בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל וְעַל כֹּהֶנֶת וּלְוִיָּה, שֶׁפְּסָלוּהָ — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּבַת כֹּהֵן כִּי תִהְיֶה אַלְמָנָה וּגְרוּשָׁה וְגוֹ׳״ —
human_translation: If so, a gentile or a slave should not have disqualified These disqualify as by Rabbi Yishmael, as Rabbi Yoḥanan said in the name of Rabbi Yishmael: From where to a gentile or a slave who engaged in intercourse with an Israelite woman, or with a priestess, or a Levite woman, that they have disqualified her? As it is stated: “But if a priest’s daughter be a widow, or divorced,
llm_translation: So, a gentile and a slave do not disqualify! Here, disqualify from Rabbi Yishmael. For Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of Rabbi Yishmael: From where do we know that a gentile and a slave who cohabited with a daughter of Israel, a Kohenet, or a Levite, disqualify her? As it is stated: "And the daughter of a Kohen, if she becomes a widow or divorced, etc."

hebrew_text: מִי שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ אַלְמְנוּת וְגֵירוּשִׁין בָּהּ, יָצְאוּ גּוֹי וְעֶבֶד שֶׁאֵין לוֹ אַלְמְנוּת וְגֵירוּשִׁין.
human_translation: who has widowhood and divorce with her, excluding a gentile and a slave, who do not have widowhood and divorce
llm_translation: One who has widows and divorces in it, goy and slave who does not have widows and divorces.

hebrew_text: אַשְׁכְּחַן כֹּהֶנֶת — לְוִיָּה וְיִשְׂרְאֵלִית מְנָא לַן? כִּדְאָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא אָמַר רַב: ״בַּת״ ״וּבַת״, הָכָא נָמֵי ״בַּת״ ״וּבַת״.
human_translation: We have found a priestess. From where do we a Levite and an Israelite woman? as Rabbi Abba Rav said: “But daughter daughter. Here too, daughter, “But daughter,”
llm_translation: We found a Kohenet - from which tribe is she, from Levi or from Israel? As Rabbi Abba said in the name of Rav: "daughter" and "granddaughter," here too it is "daughter" and "granddaughter."

hebrew_text: כְּמַאן — כְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא דְּדָרֵישׁ וָוֵי? אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבָּנַן — כּוּלֵּהּ ״וּבַת״ קְרָא יַתִּירָא הוּא.
human_translation: In accordance with whose in accordance with Rabbi Akiva, as he derives vav . Even you say the Rabbis, the entire “But daughter,” is superfluous verse,
llm_translation: As whom - as Rabbi Akiva who expounds "woe"? Even if you say the Rabbis - all of it "and" the Scripture permits it.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא: מִי שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ אַלְמְנוּת וְגֵירוּשִׁין בָּהּ, כִּי לֵית לֵיהּ זֶרַע — קָאָכְלָה, כִּי אִית לֵיהּ זֶרַע — לָא אָכְלָה. מִי שֶׁאֵין לוֹ אַלְמְנוּת וְגֵירוּשִׁין בָּהּ, אַף עַל גַּב דְּאִית לֵיהּ זֶרַע נָמֵי תֵּיכוֹל!
human_translation: But say one who has widowhood and divorce with her, if he does not have offspring she may partake if he does have offspring she does not partake. one who does not have widowhood and divorce with her, even if she has offspring she should partake
llm_translation: And why? One who has widowhood and divorces in it, if he has no seed - she may eat, if he has seed - she may not eat. One who does not have widowhood and divorces in it, even though he has seed, she may not eat!

hebrew_text: אִם כֵּן, רַבּוֹיֵי לְוִיָּה וְיִשְׂרְאֵלִית לְמָה לִי?
human_translation: If so, why do I include a Levite and an Israelite woman?
llm_translation: If so, the multitude of Levi and the Israelite, what to me?

hebrew_text: וּלְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא דְּאָמַר: אֵין קִדּוּשִׁין תּוֹפְסִין בְּחַיָּיבֵי לָאוִין, וּמַאי ״כִּי תִהְיֶה לְאִישׁ זָר״ — כִּי תִּיבָּעֵל, אַלְמָנָה וּגְרוּשָׁה לְמָה לִי?
human_translation: And according to Rabbi Akiva, who said betrothal of those liable for a prohibition, does not take effect, and “And if be [ tihye ] to a common man” If she engages in intercourse why do I “a widow, or divorced”
llm_translation: To Rabbi Akiva who said: Sanctifications do not take effect on those obligated in negative commandments. And what is "when she shall be to a man a stranger" - when she becomes betrothed, why do I need a widow and a divorcee?

hebrew_text: אַלְמָנָה לְהַחְמִיר עָלֶיהָ, וּגְרוּשָׁה לְהָקֵל עָלֶיהָ. וּצְרִיכָא. דְּאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן אַלְמָנָה: אַלְמָנָה הוּא דְּכִי לֵית לַהּ זֶרַע — אָכְלָה, מִשּׁוּם דְּחַזְיָא לִכְהוּנָּה. אֲבָל גְּרוּשָׁה, דְּלָא חַזְיָא לִכְהוּנָּה, אֵימָא אַף עַל גַּב דְּלֵית לַהּ זֶרַע — לָא אָכְלָה. וְאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן גְּרוּשָׁה: גְּרוּשָׁה הוּא דְּכִי אִית לַהּ זֶרַע — לָא אָכְלָה, מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא חַזְיָא לִכְהוּנָּה. אֲבָל אַלְמָנָה, דְּחַזְיָא לִכְהוּנָּה, אֵימָא אַף עַל גַּב דְּאִית לַהּ זֶרַע — נָמֵי תֵּיכוֹל, צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: A widow to be stringent with her, and a divorcée to be lenient with her, and are necessary. As, had taught us a widow, specifically a widow partakes when she does not have offspring because she is fit for the priesthood, but a divorcée, who is not fit for the priesthood say even if she does not have offspring she does not partake And had it taught us a divorcée, a divorcée does not partake when she has offspring because she is not fit for the priesthood, but a widow, who is fit for the priesthood, say even if she has offspring she should also partake necessary
llm_translation: Widow to be strict upon her, and divorcee to be lenient upon her. And it is necessary. For if we were to hear about a widow: If a widow, who since she has no offspring — she may eat terumah, because she is seen for priesthood. But a divorcee, who is not seen for priesthood, we might say even though she has no offspring — she may not eat terumah. And if we were to hear about a divorcee: If a divorcee, who since she has offspring — she may not eat terumah, because she is not seen for priesthood. But a widow, who is seen for priesthood, we might say even though she has offspring — she may also eat, this is necessary.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא נִבְעֲלָה לְפָסוּל לָהּ אַף מַחְזִיר גְּרוּשָׁתוֹ! ״לְאִישׁ זָר״ אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא, מִי שֶׁזָּר אֶצְלָהּ מֵעִיקָּרָא. לְאַפּוֹקֵי הַאי, דְּלֹא זָר אֶצְלָהּ מֵעִיקָּרָא הוּא.
human_translation: And say who engaged in intercourse with unfit for her even remarrying his divorcée The Merciful One states “To a common man [ ish zar ],” who was a stranger, to her from the outset to the exclusion of one who was not a stranger to her from the outset,
llm_translation: "And why should she become disqualified even if her divorcee returns to her! 'To a strange man,' the Merciful One said, one who is a stranger to her from the outset. To exclude this case, where he is not a stranger to her from the outset."

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, חָלָל, דְּלָאו זָר הוּא מֵעִיקָּרָא, לָא לִפְסוֹל! אָמַר קְרָא: ״לֹא יְחַלֵּל זַרְעוֹ בְּעַמָּיו״, מַקִּישׁ זַרְעוֹ לוֹ, מָה הוּא פּוֹסֵל — אַף זַרְעוֹ נָמֵי פּוֹסֵל.
human_translation: If so, a ḥalal , who was not excluded at the outset, should not disqualify the verse states, “He shall not profane his seed among his people” juxtaposing his seed to him. Just as he, disqualifies so too, his seed, also disqualifies
llm_translation: If so, it is invalid, for he is not a legitimate priest from the outset, he does not disqualify! The verse says: "He shall not defile his offspring among his people," equating his offspring to him, just as he disqualifies — so too his offspring disqualifies.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא מִשְּׁעַת הֲוָיָה! דּוּמְיָא דְּכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל בְּאַלְמָנָה: מָה כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל בְּאַלְמָנָה בְּבִיאָה, אַף הַאי נָמֵי בְּבִיאָה.
human_translation: And say from the time of betrothal, similar to a High Priest with a widow: Just as a High Priest with a widow through intercourse, so too, this also through intercourse.
llm_translation: And why not from the time of existence! Similar to the High Priest with a widow: Just as the High Priest with a widow in intercourse, so too this one with intercourse.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא: עַד דְּאִיכָּא הֲוָיָה וּבִיאָה?! דּוּמְיָא דְּכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל בְּאַלְמָנָה: מָה כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל בְּאַלְמָנָה בְּבִיאָה לְחוּדַּהּ, אַף הַאי נָמֵי בְּבִיאָה לְחוּדַּהּ.
human_translation: And say until there is betrothal and intercourse. similar to a High Priest with a widow: Just as a High Priest with a widow through intercourse alone, so too, this also through intercourse alone.
llm_translation: And why? Until when will there be existence and coming?! Similar to a High Priest with a widow: Just as a High Priest with a widow is for her sake, so too this one is for her sake.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: כֹּל שֶׁזַּרְעוֹ פָּסוּל — פּוֹסֵל, וְכֹל שֶׁאֵין זַרְעוֹ פָּסוּל — אֵינוֹ פּוֹסֵל. מַאי אִיכָּא בֵּין תַּנָּא קַמָּא לְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי?
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: anyone whose offspring are unfit disqualifies anyone whose offspring are not unfit does not disqualify What is there between the first tanna and Rabbi Yosei?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And Rabbi Yosei says: Anything whose seed is invalid - invalidates, and anything whose seed is valid - does not invalidate. What is the practical difference between the first Tanna and Rabbi Yosei? English translation:

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מִצְרִי שֵׁנִי וַאֲדוֹמִי שֵׁנִי אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: between them a second- Egyptian and a second- Edomite.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: "An Egyptian second and an Edomite second, there is a difference between them."

hebrew_text: וּשְׁנֵיהֶם לֹא לְמָדוּהָ אֶלָּא מִכֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל בְּאַלְמָנָה. תַּנָּא קַמָּא סָבַר: מָה כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל בְּאַלְמָנָה, שֶׁבִּיאָתוֹ בַּעֲבֵירָה וּפוֹסֵל — אַף הַאי נָמֵי פּוֹסֵל.
human_translation: And both derived only from a High Priest with a widow, The first tanna reasoned: Just as a High Priest with a widow, his intercourse is a transgression, and he disqualifies so too, this also disqualifies
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And both of them did not learn it except from the High Priest in regard to a widow. The first Tanna thought: Just as the High Priest in regard to a widow, whose entry is through a transgression and disqualifies — so too this one disqualifies."

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי סָבַר: כְּכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל. מָה כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל שֶׁזַּרְעוֹ פָּסוּל וּפוֹסֵל, אַף כֹּל שֶׁזַּרְעוֹ פָּסוּל — פּוֹסֵל. לְאַפּוֹקֵי מִצְרִי שֵׁנִי דְּאֵין זַרְעוֹ פָּסוּל. דִּכְתִיב: ״בָּנִים אֲשֶׁר יִוָּלְדוּ לָהֶם דּוֹר שְׁלִישִׁי יָבֹא לָהֶם בִּקְהַל ה׳״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yosei reasoned: like a High Priest Just as High Priest’s children are unfit and he disqualifies so too, any whose children are unfit disqualifies to exclude a second- Egyptian, whose children are not unfit, as it is written: “The children of the third generation that are born to them may enter into the assembly of the Lord”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei holds: Like a High Priest. Just as a High Priest whose seed is disqualified and disqualifies, so too anyone whose seed is disqualified disqualifies. To exclude a second-generation Egyptian whose seed is not disqualified. As it is written: "The children that are begotten to them shall enter into the congregation of the Lord in their third generation."

hebrew_text: רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: כֹּל שֶׁאַתָּה נוֹשֵׂא בִּתּוֹ — אַתָּה נוֹשֵׂא אַלְמְנָתוֹ וְכוּ׳. מַאי אִיכָּא בֵּין רַבִּי יוֹסֵי לְרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל?
human_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Anyone whose daughter you may marry, you may marry his widow; What is there between Rabbi Yosei and Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel?
llm_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: "Everything that you carry with your daughter - you also carry with his widow, etc." What is the difference between Rabbi Yosei and Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel?

hebrew_text: אָמַר עוּלָּא: גֵּר עַמּוֹנִי וּמוֹאָבִי אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ, וּשְׁנֵיהֶם לֹא לְמָדוּהָ אֶלָּא מִכֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל בְּאַלְמָנָה. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי סָבַר: מָה כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל בְּאַלְמָנָה שֶׁזַּרְעוֹ פָּסוּל וּפוֹסֵל, אַף כֹּל שֶׁזַּרְעוֹ פָּסוּל — פּוֹסֵל.
human_translation: Ulla said: between them an Ammonite and a Moabite convert. And both of them derived from none other than a High Priest with a widow. Rabbi Yosei reasoned: Just as a High Priest with a widow, his children are unfit and disqualifies so too, any whose children are unfit disqualifies
llm_translation: Ula said: There is a convert Ammonite and Moabite, and there is a distinction between them, and both of them only learned it from a High Priest in the case of a widow. Rabbi Yosei holds: Just as a High Priest in the case of a widow whose seed is disqualified disqualifies, so too, anyone whose seed is disqualified disqualifies.

hebrew_text: רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל סָבַר: מָה כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל בְּאַלְמָנָה שֶׁכׇּל זַרְעוֹ פָּסוּל וּפוֹסֵל, אַף שֶׁכׇּל זַרְעוֹ פָּסוּל וּפוֹסֵל. לְאַפּוֹקֵי עַמּוֹנִי וּמוֹאָבִי, דְּאֵין כָּל זַרְעוֹ פָּסוּל. דְּאָמַר מָר: ״עַמּוֹנִי״, וְלֹא עַמּוֹנִית, ״מוֹאָבִי״ וְלֹא מוֹאָבִית.
human_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel reasoned: Just as a High Priest with a widow, where all of his children are unfit and he disqualifies so too, all of whose children are unfit, he disqualifies to the exclusion of an Ammonite or a Moabite as not all of his children are unfit as the Master said: An Ammonite man but not an Ammonite woman; a Moabite man but not a Moabite woman.
llm_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel holds: Just as a High Priest with a widow, whose entire seed is disqualified and disqualifies, so too with one whose entire seed is disqualified and disqualifies. This is to exclude an Ammonite and Moabite, whose entire seed is not disqualified. For Mar said: "Ammonite," and not Ammonitess, "Moabite," and not Moabitess.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הָאוֹנֵס וְהַמְפַתֶּה וְהַשּׁוֹטֶה — לֹא פּוֹסְלִין וְלֹא מַאֲכִילִין. וְאִם אֵינָן רְאוּיִין לָבֹא בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל — הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ פּוֹסְלִין. כֵּיצַד? (הָיָה) יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁבָּא עַל בַּת כֹּהֵן — תֹּאכַל בִּתְרוּמָה.
human_translation: one who rapes or one who seduces or an imbecile they do not disqualify and they do not enable to partake And if they are not fit to enter Israel they disqualify How so? it was an Israelite who engaged in intercourse with the daughter of a priest, she may partake of teruma ,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who rapes, seduces, or entices a woman - they do not disqualify her nor do they render her unfit to eat terumah. But if they are not fitting to enter into the congregation of Israel - these disqualify her. How so? If an Israelite marries a daughter of a kohen - she may eat terumah.

hebrew_text: עִיבְּרָה — לֹא תֹּאכַל בִּתְרוּמָה. נֶחְתַּךְ הָעוּבָּר בְּמֵעֶיהָ — תֹּאכַל. הָיָה כֹּהֵן שֶׁבָּא עַל בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל — לֹא תֹּאכַל בִּתְרוּמָה, עִיבְּרָה — לֹא תֹּאכַל. יָלְדָה — תֹּאכַל. נִמְצָא כֹּחוֹ שֶׁל בֵּן גָּדוֹל מִשֶּׁל אָב.
human_translation: he impregnated her, she may not partake of teruma , the fetus was cut in her womb, she may partake was a priest who engaged in with an Israelite woman, she may not partake of teruma . he impregnated her, she may not partake she gave birth she may partake found the power of the son is greater than of the father,
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "An animal that has a blemish - you shall not eat from the offering. If the fetus was cut within her - you may eat. If a priest marries an Israelite woman - you shall not eat from the offering, an animal that has a blemish - you shall not eat. If it was born - you may eat. If the strength is like that of an adult son rather than that of the father."

hebrew_text: הָעֶבֶד פּוֹסֵל מִשּׁוּם בִּיאָה, וְאֵינוֹ פּוֹסֵל מִשּׁוּם זֶרַע. כֵּיצַד? בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל לְכֹהֵן, בַּת כֹּהֵן לְיִשְׂרָאֵל, וְיָלְדָה הֵימֶנּוּ בֵּן, וְהָלַךְ הַבֵּן וְנִכְבַּשׁ עַל הַשִּׁפְחָה, וְיָלְדָה הֵימֶנּוּ בֵּן — הֲרֵי זֶה עֶבֶד. הָיְתָה אֵם אָבִיו בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל לְכֹהֵן — לֹא תֹּאכַל בִּתְרוּמָה. בַּת כֹּהֵן לְיִשְׂרָאֵל — תֹּאכַל בִּתְרוּמָה.
human_translation: A slave disqualifies due to intercourse and he does not disqualify because offspring. How so? an Israelite woman to a priest, the daughter of a priest to an Israelite; and she bore him a son; and the son went and pressed himself onto a maidservant, and she bore him a son, this is a slave. father’s mother was an Israelite to a priest, she may not partake of teruma she was the daughter of a priest to an Israelite, she may partake of teruma ,
llm_translation: The slave disqualifies due to intercourse, and does not disqualify due to seed. How so? A daughter of Israel to a Kohen, a daughter of a Kohen to an Israelite, and she bore a son from him, and the son went and cohabited with a maidservant, and she bore a son from him - this one is a slave. If the mother of his father was a daughter of Israel to a Kohen - she may not eat of the Terumah. If a daughter of a Kohen to an Israelite - she may eat of the Terumah.

hebrew_text: מַמְזֵר פּוֹסֵל וּמַאֲכִיל. כֵּיצַד? בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל לְכֹהֵן, וּבַת כֹּהֵן לְיִשְׂרָאֵל, וְיָלְדָה הֵימֶנּוּ בַּת, וְהָלְכָה הַבַּת וְנִישֵּׂאת לְעֶבֶד אוֹ לְגוֹי וְיָלְדָה הֵימֶנּוּ בֵּן — הֲרֵי זֶה מַמְזֵר. הָיְתָה אֵם אִמּוֹ בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל לְכֹהֵן — תֹּאכַל בִּתְרוּמָה. בַּת כֹּהֵן לְיִשְׂרָאֵל — לֹא תֹּאכַל בִּתְרוּמָה.
human_translation: A mamzer disqualifies and enables to partake How so? an Israelite woman to a priest, or the daughter of a priest to an Israelite, and she bore him a daughter, and the daughter went and married a slave or a gentile and bore him a son, this is a mamzer . his mother’s mother was an Israelite woman to a priest, she may partake of teruma , the daughter of a priest to an Israelite, she may not partake of teruma ,
llm_translation: Illegitimate disqualifies and feeds. How so? A daughter of Israel to a Kohen, and a daughter of a Kohen to an Israelite, and she bore a son from him, and the daughter went and married a slave or a gentile, and she bore a son from him - this is an illegitimate child. If his mother was a daughter of Israel to a Kohen - he may eat Terumah. If a daughter of a Kohen to an Israelite - she may not eat Terumah.

hebrew_text: כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל, פְּעָמִים שֶׁהוּא פּוֹסֵל. כֵּיצַד? בַּת כֹּהֵן לְיִשְׂרָאֵל וְיָלְדָה הֵימֶנּוּ בַּת, וְהָלְכָה הַבַּת וְנִיסֵּת לַכֹּהֵן, וְיָלְדָה הֵימֶנּוּ בֵּן — הֲרֵי זֶה רָאוּי לִהְיוֹת כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל עוֹמֵד וּמְשַׁמֵּשׁ עַל גַּבֵּי הַמִּזְבֵּחַ. מַאֲכִיל אֶת אִמּוֹ, וּפוֹסֵל אֵם אִמּוֹ. זֹאת אוֹמֶרֶת: לֹא כִּבְנִי כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל, שֶׁהוּא פּוֹסְלֵנִי מִן הַתְּרוּמָה.
human_translation: a High Priest, sometimes he disqualifies How so? the daughter of a priest to an Israelite, and she bore him a daughter, and the daughter went and married a priest and bore him a son, this is fit to be a High Priest, stands and serves on the altar. enables his mother to partake And he disqualifies his mother’s mother This say not like my son, High Priest, as he disqualifies me from teruma .
llm_translation: High Priest, sometimes he disqualifies. How so? A daughter of a priest to an Israelite, and she bore a daughter from him, and the daughter went and married a priest, and she bore a son from him - this one is fit to be a High Priest, standing and serving upon the altar. He feeds his mother, and disqualifies his mother. This is what it means: Not like my son, the High Priest, who disqualified me from the terumah.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תְּנֵינָא לְהָא דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: שׁוֹטֶה וְקָטָן שֶׁנָּשְׂאוּ נָשִׁים, וּמֵתוּ נְשׁוֹתֵיהֶן — פְּטוּרוֹת מִן הַחֲלִיצָה וּמִן הַיִּיבּוּם.
human_translation: We learned that as the Sages taught an imbecile and a minor boy who married women and died, their wives are exempt from ḥalitza and from levirate marriage.
llm_translation: The Gemara teaches in accordance with what the Rabbis taught: A fool and a minor who married women, and their wives died - they are exempt from chalitzah and yibum.

hebrew_text: כֵּיצַד? הָיָה יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁבָּא עַל בַּת כֹּהֵן — תֹּאכַל בִּתְרוּמָה, עִיבְּרָה — לֹא תֹּאכַל. כֵּיוָן דְּעִיבְּרָה לֹא תֹּאכַל? לֵיחוּשׁ שֶׁמָּא עִיבְּרָה! מִי לָא תְּנַן: מַפְרִישִׁין אוֹתָן שְׁלֹשָׁה חֳדָשִׁים, שֶׁמָּא מְעוּבָּרוֹת הֵן?
human_translation: How so? If an Israelite engaged in intercourse with the daughter of a priest, she may partake of teruma . he impregnated her, she may not partake Since he impregnated her she may not partake, let us be concerned lest he impregnated her, Didn’t we learn removes for three months, lest they are pregnant
llm_translation: How so? If a Israelite marries a daughter of a priest - she may eat terumah, if she miscarries - she may not eat. Once she miscarries, she may not eat? Lest one suspect that she miscarried! Didn't we learn: They separate them for three months, perhaps they are pregnant?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא: לְיוּחֲסִין חָשְׁשׁוּ, לִתְרוּמָה לֹא חָשְׁשׁוּ. וְלִתְרוּמָה לֹא חָשְׁשׁוּ? וְהָתַנְיָא: ״הֲרֵי זֶה גִּיטֵּיךְ שָׁעָה אַחַת קוֹדֶם לְמִיתָתִי״ — אֲסוּרָה לֶאֱכוֹל בִּתְרוּמָה מִיָּד!
human_translation: Rabba, son of Rav Huna, said: About lineage were concerned, about teruma they were not concerned. And for teruma were they not concerned? Isn’t it taught This is your bill of divorce one hour before my death, it is prohibited for her to partake of teruma immediately,
llm_translation: Rabba bar Rav Huna said: Concerning genealogy they were cautious, concerning terumah they were not cautious. And concerning terumah they were not cautious? But it was taught: "Behold, this is your divorce document, one hour before my death" — it is forbidden to eat terumah immediately!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא: בְּנִישּׂוּאִין חָשְׁשׁוּ, בִּזְנוּת לֹא חָשְׁשׁוּ.
human_translation: Rather, Rabba, son of Rav Huna, said: About marriage they were concerned, about licentious intercourse they were not concerned,
llm_translation: Rather, Rabba bar Rav Huna said: In matters of marriage they were concerned, but in matters of promiscuity they were not concerned.

hebrew_text: וּבְנִישּׂוּאִין מִי חָשְׁשׁוּ? וְהָתַנְיָא: בַּת כֹּהֵן שֶׁנִּישֵּׂאת לְיִשְׂרָאֵל, וָמֵת — טוֹבֶלֶת, וְאוֹכֶלֶת בִּתְרוּמָה לְעָרֵב!
human_translation: And about marriage were they concerned? Isn’t it taught the daughter of a priest who married an Israelite and died she immerses and she may partake of teruma that evening?
llm_translation: In marriage, who is concerned? And it was taught: A daughter of a kohen who married an Israelite, and he died - she immerses and eats terumah at night!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: טוֹבֶלֶת וְאוֹכֶלֶת עַד אַרְבָּעִים, דְּאִי לָא מִיעַבְּרָא — הָא לָא מִיעַבְּרָא, וְאִי מִיעַבְּרָא — עַד אַרְבָּעִים מַיָּא בְּעָלְמָא הִיא.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: She immerses and partakes until forty as if she is not pregnant she is not pregnant. And if she is pregnant, until forty is merely water.
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: A woman who immerses in a mikveh and eats terumah until forty days, for if she is not pregnant — it is not considered as if she is pregnant, and if she is pregnant — it is merely water in the world.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: אִי הָכִי, אֵימָא סֵיפָא: הוּכַּר עוּבָּרָהּ בְּמֵעֶיהָ — תְּהֵא מְקוּלְקֶלֶת לְמַפְרֵעַ. מַאי מְקוּלְקֶלֶת — עַד אַרְבָּעִים.
human_translation: Abaye said to him: If so, say the latter clause her fetus in her womb is noticeable, is ruined retroactively. What is ruined? until forty
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: If so, say the latter part: If her fetus was recognizable in her womb - she should be considered a miscarriage. What is meant by "recognizable"? - Up to forty days.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר: הַבָּא עַל אֲרוּסָתוֹ בְּבֵית חָמִיו — רַב אָמַר: הַוָּלָד מַמְזֵר, וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: הַוָּלָד שְׁתוּקִי. אָמַר רָבָא: מִסְתַּבְּרָא מִילְּתֵיהּ דְּרַב דְּדָיְימָא מֵעָלְמָא, אֲבָל לָא דָּיְימָא מֵעָלְמָא — בָּתְרֵיהּ דִּידֵיהּ שָׁדֵינַן לֵיהּ.
human_translation: It was stated: who engaged in intercourse with his betrothed in his father-in-law’s house, Rav said the offspring is a mamzer , And Shmuel said the offspring is a shetuki , Rava said: Rav’s statement stands to reason where she is rumored with others. However, she is not rumored with others, we cast after him,
llm_translation: It was stated: One who comes upon his betrothed in his father-in-law's house - Rav said: The child is a mamzer, and Shmuel said: The child is legitimate. Rava said: The matter of Rav is logical when there is sufficient evidence from the world, but when there is not sufficient evidence from the world - we rely on his own testimony.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: מְנָא אָמֵינָא לַהּ — דְּקָתָנֵי: יָלְדָה — תֹּאכַל. הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִילֵּימָא דְּדָיְימָא מֵעָלְמָא, יָלְדָה אַמַּאי תֹּאכַל? אֶלָּא לָאו: מִינֵיהּ דָּיְימָא, וְלָא דָּיְימָא מֵעָלְמָא.
human_translation: Rava said: From where do I say that? teaches gave birth, she may partake What are the circumstances? If we say that she is rumored with others, she gave birth, why may she partake Rather, is it not she is rumored with him and is not rumored with others?
llm_translation: Rava said: From where do I say this to her - that it teaches: she gave birth - she shall eat. How so? If you say that she is nourished from the world, why should she eat after giving birth? Rather, it is not from her nourishment, but not from the world.

hebrew_text: וּמָה הָתָם, דִּלְהַאי אִיסּוּרָא וּלְהַאי אִיסּוּרָא — בָּתְרָא דִּידֵיהּ שָׁדֵינַן לֵיהּ, הָכָא, דִּלְהַאי אִיסּוּרָא וּלְהַאי הֶיתֵּירָא — לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן?!
human_translation: And if there, where to this a prohibition, and to that a prohibition we cast after here, where to that prohibition, and to this is permitted not all the more so
llm_translation: And what is the case there, that for this prohibition and for that prohibition - we permit it after its own kind, here, that for this prohibition and for this permission - all the more so?!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: לְעוֹלָם אֵימָא לָךְ כׇּל הֵיכָא דְּדָיְימָא מִינֵּיהּ אַף עַל גַּב דְּלָא דָּיְימָא מֵעָלְמָא אָמַר רַב הַוָּלָד מַמְזֵר. מַאי טַעְמָא — דְּאָמְרִינַן: מִדְּאַפְקַרָא נַפְשָׁהּ לְגַבֵּי אָרוּס — אַפְקַרָא נַפְשָׁהּ לְעָלְמָא, וּמַתְנִיתִין שֶׁהָיוּ שְׁנֵיהֶם חֲבוּשִׁים בְּבֵית הָאֲסוּרִין.
human_translation: Abaye said to him Actually, I say to you anywhere that she is rumored with him, even if she is not rumored with others, Rav said the offspring is a mamzer . What is the reason? that we say since she exposed herself to her betrothed, she exposed herself to others And the mishna where they were both incarcerated in prison.
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: Always say to you, wherever it is that she is found to be pregnant from him, even though she is not found to be pregnant from the world, Rav says: The child is a mamzer. What is the reason? - Because we say: Since she exposed herself to someone else while betrothed, she exposed herself to the world, and the Mishnaic teaching is that they were both confined in a place of confinement.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: בְּבָא עָלֶיהָ — כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דְּבָתְרֵיהּ דִּידֵיהּ שָׁדֵינַן לֵיהּ. וְהָכִי אִיתְּמַר: אֲרוּסָה שֶׁעִיבְּרָה, רַב אָמַר: הַוָּלָד מַמְזֵר. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: הַוָּלָד שְׁתוּקִי. אָמַר רָבָא: מִסְתַּבְּרָא מִילְּתֵיהּ דְּרַב דְּלָא דָּיְימָא מִינֵּיהּ וְדָיְימָא מֵעָלְמָא,
human_translation: Some say when he engaged in intercourse with her, everyone agrees that we cast after him. was stated as follows: a betrothed woman who became pregnant, Rav said the offspring is a mamzer , and Shmuel said the offspring is a child whose father’s identity is not known. Rava said: Rav’s statement stands to reason where is not rumored with him and she is rumored with others.
llm_translation: There are those who say: when he came upon her - everyone agrees that his own wife we do not suspect him of. And thus it was stated: a betrothed woman who became pregnant, Rav said: the child is a mamzer. And Shmuel said: the child is legitimate. Rava said: it is reasonable the matter of Rav, for it is not common for him to err, and it is common for people to err.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל דָּיְימָא מִנֵּיהּ, אַף עַל גַּב דְּדָיְימָא מֵעָלְמָא — בָּתְרֵיהּ דִּידֵיהּ שָׁדֵינַן לֵיהּ.
human_translation: However, she is rumored with him, even if she is rumored with others, we cast after him.
llm_translation: But Daima from him, even though Daima from the world - after his death we support his daughter.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: מְנָא אָמֵינָא לַהּ — דְּקָתָנֵי: יָלְדָה — תֹּאכַל. הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִילֵּימָא דְּדָיְימָא מִנֵּיהּ וְלָא דָּיְימָא מֵעָלְמָא — צְרִיכָא לְמֵימַר דְּתֵיכוֹל?! אֶלָּא לָאו — דְּדָיְימָא נָמֵי מֵעָלְמָא,
human_translation: Rava said: From where do I say that? teaches gave birth, she may partake What are the circumstances? If we say that she is rumored with him and she is not rumored with others, need it be said that she may partake Rather, is it not where she is rumored with others as well?
llm_translation: Rava said: From where do I say this to her - that it teaches: if she gives birth - she shall eat. How so? If you say that it is similar to her blood, and not similar to blood from elsewhere - it is necessary to say that she shall eat?! Rather, is it not - that it is similar to blood from elsewhere.

hebrew_text: וּמָה הָתָם, דִּלְהַאי אִיסּוּרָא וּלְהַאי אִיסּוּרָא — בָּתְרֵיהּ דִּידֵיהּ שָׁדֵינַן לֵיהּ, הָכָא, דִּלְהַאי אִיסּוּרָא וּלְהַאי הֶיתֵּירָא — לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן?!
human_translation: And if there, where to this a prohibition and to that a prohibition we cast after here, where to that prohibition and to this is permitted not all the more so
llm_translation: And what is the case there, that for this prohibition and for that prohibition - we permit it for his daughter, here, that for this prohibition and for that permission - all the more so?!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: לְעוֹלָם אֵימָא לָךְ כׇּל הֵיכָא דְּדָיְימָא מֵעָלְמָא, אַף עַל גַּב דְּדָיְימָא מִנֵּיהּ, אֲמַר רַב: הַוָּלָד מַמְזֵר. וּמַתְנִיתִין בִּדְלָא דָּיְימָא כְּלָל.
human_translation: Abaye said to him: Actually, I say to you anywhere that she is rumored with others, even if she is rumored with him, Rav said the offspring is a mamzer . And the mishna, where she is not rumored at all.
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: Always say to you wherever it is said from the world, even though it is said from him, Rav said: The offspring is a mamzer. And the Mishnah in a case where it is not said at all.

hebrew_text: הָעֶבֶד פּוֹסֵל מִשּׁוּם בִּיאָה כּוּ׳. מַאי טַעְמָא — אָמַר קְרָא: ״הָאִשָּׁה וִילָדֶיהָ תִּהְיֶה וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: a slave disqualifies due to intercourse What is the reason The verse states “the wife and her children shall be
llm_translation: The slave disqualifies due to intercourse. What is the reason? - The verse says: "The woman and her children shall be."

hebrew_text: מַמְזֵר פּוֹסֵל וּמַאֲכִיל. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״וְזֶרַע אֵין לָהּ״, אֵין לִי אֶלָּא זַרְעָהּ, זֶרַע זַרְעָהּ מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְזֶרַע אֵין לָהּ״ — מִכׇּל מָקוֹם.
human_translation: a mamzer disqualifies and he enables to partake The Sages taught: and have no child I have only her child from where her child’s child The verse states: “And she has no child [ zera ]” at all,
llm_translation: Illegitimate child disqualifies and feeds. The Rabbis taught: "And she has no seed," I only know her seed, where is the seed of her seed from? The Talmud teaches: "And she has no seed" - from any place.

hebrew_text: אֵין לִי אֶלָּא זֶרַע כָּשֵׁר, זֶרַע פָּסוּל מִנַּיִן — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְזֶרַע אֵין לָהּ״, עַיֵּין עָלֶיהָ.
human_translation: I have only an unflawed child from where an unfit child The verse states: “And she has no [ ein la ] child,” examine her [ ayyein ala ]
llm_translation: I have only valid seed, invalid seed from where - Talmud teaches: "And she has no seed," look into it.

hebrew_text: וְהָא אַפֵּיקְתֵּיהּ לְזֶרַע זַרְעָהּ! זֶרַע זַרְעָהּ לָא אִיצְטְרִיךְ קְרָא, בְּנֵי בָנִים הֲרֵי הֵן כְּבָנִים. כִּי אִיצְטְרִיךְ קְרָא, לְזֶרַע פָּסוּל.
human_translation: But didn’t you derive that her child’s child her child’s child, no verse was necessary, the children of children are like children. The verse was necessary for an unfit child.
llm_translation: And the female has produced offspring for a different species! Offspring for a different species does not require a verse, the offspring of offspring are considered like offspring. Since a verse is required, the offspring is disqualified for seed.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כְּמַאן — כְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, דְּאָמַר: יֵשׁ מַמְזֵר מֵחַיָּיבֵי לָאוִין? אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבָּנַן, בְּגוֹי וְעֶבֶד מוֹדוּ, דְּכִי אֲתָא רַב דִּימִי, אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק בַּר אַבְדִּימִי מִשּׁוּם רַבֵּינוּ: גּוֹי וְעֶבֶד הַבָּא עַל בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל — הַוָּלָד מַמְזֵר.
human_translation: Reish Lakish said to Rabbi Yoḥanan: In accordance with whose in accordance with Rabbi Akiva, who said for which is liable a prohibition is a mamzer ? You even say the Rabbis, they concede with regard to a slave and a gentile, as when Rav Dimi came Rabbi Yitzḥak bar Avdimi said in the name of Rabbi a gentile or a slave who engaged in intercourse with a Jewish woman, the offspring is a mamzer .
llm_translation: He said to him, Reish Lakish to Rabbi Yochanan: Like whom — like Rabbi Akiva, who said: Are mamzerim liable for negative commandments? Even if you say the Rabbis, in the case of a non-Jew and a slave they agree, for when Rav Dimi came, Rabbi Yitzchak bar Avdimi said in the name of our teacher: A non-Jew and a slave who have relations with a Jewish woman — the offspring is a mamzer.

hebrew_text: כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל, פְּעָמִים שֶׁפּוֹסֵל. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הֲרֵינִי כַּפָּרַת בֶּן בִּתִּי כּוּזָא — שֶׁמַּאֲכִילֵנִי בַּתְּרוּמָה, וְאֵינִי כַּפָּרַת בֶּן בִּתִּי כַּדָּא — שֶׁפּוֹסְלֵנִי מִן הַתְּרוּמָה.
human_translation: a High Priest sometimes disqualifies The Sages taught I am hereby atonement for my daughter’s son, the small jug [ kuza ], as he enables me to partake of teruma . However, I am not atonement for my daughter’s son, the large jug [ kada ], as he disqualifies me from teruma .
llm_translation: The High Priest, at times, disqualifies. The Rabbis taught: "I am like the atonement of my son-in-law Kuzah - perhaps he will feed me from the offering, and I am not like the atonement of my son-in-law Dada - for he disqualified me from the offering."

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ אַלְמָנָה
llm_translation: We will return to you, widow.

hebrew_text: הֶעָרֵל וְכׇל הַטְּמֵאִים — לֹא יֹאכְלוּ בִּתְרוּמָה. נְשֵׁיהֶן וְעַבְדֵיהֶן יֹאכְלוּ בִּתְרוּמָה.
human_translation: An uncircumcised and all who are ritually impure may not partake of teruma , their wives and their slaves may partake of teruma .
llm_translation: The uncircumcised and all the impure ones — they shall not eat of the terumah. Their wives and their slaves may eat of the terumah.

hebrew_text: פְּצוּעַ דַּכָּא וּכְרוּת שׇׁפְכָה — הֵן וְעַבְדֵיהֶן יֹאכֵלוּ, וּנְשֵׁיהֶן לֹא יֹאכֵלוּ. וְאִם לֹא יָדְעָה מִשֶּׁנַּעֲשָׂה פְּצוּעַ דַּכָּא וּכְרוּת שׇׁפְכָה — הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ יֹאכֵלוּ.
human_translation: a man with crushed testicles [ petzua dakka ] and one whose penis has been severed [ kerut shofkha ], they and their slaves may partake their wives may not partake If did not know after his testicles were crushed or his penis was severed, she may partake
llm_translation: Wounded, crushed, and cut off — behold, their slaves may eat, but their wives may not eat. And if she did not know from when the wound, crush, and cut off occurred — these may eat.

hebrew_text: וְאֵי זֶהוּ פְּצוּעַ דַּכָּא — כׇּל שֶׁנִּפְצְעוּ הַבֵּיצִים שֶׁלּוֹ, וַאֲפִילּוּ אַחַת מֵהֶן. וּכְרוּת שׇׁפְכָה — כׇּל שֶׁנִּכְרַת הַגִּיד, וְאִם נִשְׁתַּיֵּיר מֵעֲטָרָה אֲפִילּוּ כְּחוּט הַשַּׂעֲרָה — כָּשֵׁר.
human_translation: And who is a man with crushed testicles? anyone whose testicles have been wounded, even one of them. And one whose penis has been severed anyone whose member has been cut off. if there remains of the corona, even as a hairsbreadth, fit.
llm_translation: "And where is the case of a crushed egg? — Any animal whose testicles were crushed, even one of them. And a severed tube — any animal whose sinew was severed, and if a little bit of the membrane remains, even as thin as a hair's breadth — it is valid."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תַּנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: מִנַּיִן לֶעָרֵל שֶׁאֵין אוֹכֵל בִּתְרוּמָה? נֶאֱמַר ״תּוֹשָׁב וְשָׂכִיר״ בַּפֶּסַח, וְנֶאֱמַר ״תּוֹשָׁב וְשָׂכִיר״ בַּתְּרוּמָה. מָה ״תּוֹשָׁב וְשָׂכִיר״ הָאָמוּר בַּפֶּסַח — עָרֵל אָסוּר בּוֹ, אַף ״תּוֹשָׁב וְשָׂכִיר״ הָאָמוּר בַּתְּרוּמָה — עָרֵל אָסוּר בּוֹ.
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Elazar said: From where that an uncircumcised may not partake of teruma ? It is stated: “A sojourner and a hired servant with regard to the Paschal lamb, and it is stated: “A sojourner and a hired servant with regard to teruma . Just as “a sojourner and a hired servant” stated with regard to the Paschal lamb an uncircumcised is prohibited it, so too, “a sojourner and a hired servant” stated with regard to teruma an uncircumcised is prohibited it.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemara: It was taught in a baraita, Rabbi Elazar said: From where do we derive that an uncircumcised person may not eat terumah? It is stated 'resident and hired worker' regarding the Paschal offering, and it is stated 'resident and hired worker' regarding terumah. Just as 'resident and hired worker' mentioned in connection with the Paschal offering - an uncircumcised person is prohibited from it, so too 'resident and hired worker' mentioned in connection with terumah - an uncircumcised person is prohibited from it."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ, הֲרֵי הוּא אוֹמֵר ״אִישׁ אִישׁ״ — לְרַבּוֹת הֶעָרֵל.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: is not necessary, as states: “Any man [ ish ish ] to include an uncircumcised
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: It is not necessary, as he says "each man" - to include the uncircumcised.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: נֶאֱמַר ״תּוֹשָׁב וְשָׂכִיר״ בַּפֶּסַח, וְנֶאֱמַר ״תּוֹשָׁב וְשָׂכִיר״ בַּתְּרוּמָה. מָה ״תּוֹשָׁב וְשָׂכִיר״ הָאָמוּר בַּפֶּסַח — עָרֵל אָסוּר בּוֹ, אַף ״תּוֹשָׁב וְשָׂכִיר״ הָאָמוּר בַּתְּרוּמָה — עָרֵל אָסוּר בּוֹ.
human_translation: The Master said: Rabbi Eliezer says it is stated: “A sojourner and a hired servant” with regard to the Paschal lamb, and it is stated: “A sojourner and a hired servant” with regard to teruma . Just as “a sojourner and a hired servant” stated with regard to the Paschal lamb an uncircumcised is prohibited it, so too, “a sojourner and a hired servant” stated with regard to teruma an uncircumcised is prohibited it.
llm_translation: Master said, Rabbi Eliezer says: It is stated "resident and hired worker" in regards to Passover, and it is stated "resident and hired worker" in regards to the offering. Just as the "resident and hired worker" mentioned in relation to Passover - an uncircumcised person is prohibited in it, so too the "resident and hired worker" mentioned in regards to the offering - an uncircumcised person is prohibited in it.

hebrew_text: מוּפְנֶה. דְּאִי לָאו מוּפְנֶה אִיכָּא לְמִיפְרַךְ: מָה לְפֶסַח, שֶׁכֵּן חַיָּיבִין עָלָיו מִשּׁוּם פִּיגּוּל וְנוֹתָר וְטָמֵא. לָאיֵי, אַפְנוֹיֵי מוּפְנֶה.
human_translation: available, As, if it is not available, can be refuted What to the Paschal lamb? that one is liable for it due to piggul , notar , or ritually impure. not so [ la’ei ], is available
llm_translation: Turned away. Because if not turned away there is to distinguish: what for Passover, so obligated upon it from the prohibition of disqualified and leftover and impure. To come, the turning away is turned away.

hebrew_text: הֵי מוּפְנֶה? אִי דִּתְרוּמָה — מִצְרָךְ צְרִיכִי, דְּתַנְיָא: ״תּוֹשָׁב״ זֶה קָנוּי קִנְיַן עוֹלָם, ״שָׂכִיר״ — זֶה קָנוּי קִנְיַן שָׁנִים.
human_translation: Which is available If teruma , are necessary, as it is taught “A sojourner”; this acquired as a permanent acquisition “A hired servant”; this acquired as an acquisition for years.
llm_translation: Be turned? If terumah — need necessary, as it was taught: "resident" this is called acquisition of eternity, "hire" — this is called acquisition of years.

hebrew_text: וְיֵאָמֵר ״תּוֹשָׁב״ וְאַל יֵאָמֵר ״שָׂכִיר״, וַאֲנִי אוֹמֵר: קָנוּי קִנְיַן עוֹלָם אֵינוֹ אוֹכֵל — קָנוּי קִנְיַן שָׁנִים לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן!
human_translation: And let state “a sojourner” and not state “a hired servant,” and I say acquired as a permanent acquisition may not partake acquired as an acquisition for years, all the more so not
llm_translation: And it shall be said "resident" and not "hireling," and I say: an acquired acquisition does not eat - an acquired acquisition of two years even more so!

hebrew_text: אִילּוּ כֵּן, הָיִיתִי אוֹמֵר ״תּוֹשָׁב״ — זֶה קָנוּי קִנְיַן שָׁנִים, אֲבָל קָנוּי קִנְיַן עוֹלָם — אוֹכֵל, בָּא שָׂכִיר וְלִימֵּד עַל תּוֹשָׁב, שֶׁאַף עַל פִּי שֶׁקָּנוּי קִנְיַן עוֹלָם — אֵין אוֹכֵל.
human_translation: If it was so, I would have said “a sojourner” this acquired as an acquisition for years, but acquired as a permanent acquisition may partake “a hired servant” comes and teaches “a sojourner” that although he was acquired as a permanent acquisition, may not partake
llm_translation: If so, I would say "resident" - this is a nickname for acquiring two years, but acquiring eternal ownership - he eats, a hired worker comes and teaches about a resident, even though acquiring eternal ownership - does not eat.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא דְּפֶסַח מוּפְנֵי. הַאי ״תּוֹשָׁב וְשָׂכִיר״ דִּכְתַב רַחֲמָנָא בְּפֶסַח מַאי נִיהוּ? אִי נֵימָא תּוֹשָׁב וְשָׂכִיר מַמָּשׁ, מִשּׁוּם דְּהָוֵה לֵיהּ תּוֹשָׁב וְשָׂכִיר אִיפְּטַר לֵיהּ מִפֶּסַח?! וְהָא קַיְימָא לַן גַּבֵּי תְּרוּמָה דְּלָא אָכֵיל!
human_translation: Rather, the Paschal lamb is available This “A sojourner and a hired servant,” that the Merciful One writes with regard to the Paschal lamb, what is it If we say an actual sojourner and a hired servant, because he is a sojourner or a hired servant he is exempt from the Paschal lamb? as we maintain with regard to teruma that may not partake
llm_translation: Rather, regarding Pesach, it is turned away. This "resident and hired worker" that the Merciful One wrote about in Pesach, what is it? If you say a literal resident and hired worker, is it because he is a resident and hired worker that exempts him from Pesach?! But we have established it regarding Terumah, which he does not eat!

hebrew_text: אַלְמָא לָא קָנֵי לֵיהּ רַבֵּיהּ. הָכָא נָמֵי לָא קָנֵי לֵיהּ רַבֵּיהּ, אֶלָּא לְאַפְנוֹיֵי.
human_translation: Apparently his master does not acquire his Here too, his master does not acquire his Rather, to be available
llm_translation: The Gemara: If so, he did not acquire it for his master. Here too, he did not acquire it for his master, rather for his own benefit.

hebrew_text: וְאַכַּתִּי מוּפְנֶה מִצַּד אֶחָד הוּא, וְשָׁמְעִינַן לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר דְּאָמַר: מוּפְנֶה מִצַּד אֶחָד, לְמֵדִין וּמְשִׁיבִין?
human_translation: And still is available from one side, and we heard Rabbi Elazar, who said available from one side one derive and one refute
llm_translation: And once it is turned from one side, it is, and we heard it to Rabbi Elazar who said: turned from one side, do we learn and respond?

hebrew_text: כֵּיוָן דִּלְגוּפֵיהּ לָא צְרִיךְ — שְׁדִי חַד אַלָּמֵד וּשְׁדִי חַד אַמְּלַמֵּד, וְהָוֵה לֵיהּ גְּזֵירָה שָׁוָה מוּפְנָה מִשְּׁנֵי צְדָדִין.
human_translation: Since not needed for its own cast one on it is learned and cast one on teaches and it is a verbal analogy available from both sides,
llm_translation: Since it is not necessary for itself - one side teaches and one side learns, and it becomes for him a decree that is equal and turned from both sides.

hebrew_text: אִי: מָה פֶּסַח אוֹנֵן אָסוּר בּוֹ — אַף תְּרוּמָה אוֹנֵן אָסוּר בָּהּ.
human_translation: if Just as the Paschal lamb, an acute mourner, is prohibited it, so too, teruma , an acute mourner prohibited it,
llm_translation: If: what Pesach mourner forbidden in it - also Terumah mourner forbidden in it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר חֲנִינָא, אָמַר קְרָא: (״זָר״) ״וְכׇל זָר״, זָרוּת אָמַרְתִּי לְךָ, וְלֹא אֲנִינוּת. אֵימָא: וְלֹא עֲרֵלוּת! הָא כְּתִיב ״תּוֹשָׁב וְשָׂכִיר״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei bar Ḥanina said: The verse states: “No foreigner foreignness I told you but not acute mourning. Say but not lack of circumcision, Isn’t it written “A sojourner and a hired servant”?
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei bar Hanina said, the verse says: "And any stranger," I have said to you "strangeness," and not "uncircumcision." Say: And not "uncircumcision"! But it is written "resident and hired worker."

hebrew_text: וּמָה רָאִיתָ? מִסְתַּבְּרָא עֲרֵלוּת הֲוָה לֵיהּ לְרַבּוֹיֵי, שֶׁכֵּן (מַעֲשִׂים. כְּרוּתִים. בִּדְבַר. הָעֶבֶד.) מְחוּסַּר מַעֲשֶׂה, וּמַעֲשֶׂה בְּגוּפוֹ, וְעָנוּשׁ כָּרֵת, וְיֶשְׁנוֹ לִפְנֵי הַדִּבּוּר, וּמִילַת זְכָרָיו וַעֲבָדָיו מְעַכֶּבֶת!
human_translation: And what did you see It stands to reason lack of circumcision should be included as Acts; karetim ; the word; the slave. lacks act and act on his body; punishable by karet ; existed before the word and the circumcision of one’s male and slaves precludes
llm_translation: And what did you see? The foreskin was a deficiency for him in his abundance, for so it is written (Deuteronomy 15:18): "carved." In a matter of deed, lacking in action, and action in his body, and the punishment is excision, and it is subject to the prior statement, and the matter of his male and female slaves delays!

hebrew_text: אַדְּרַבָּה: אֲנִינוּת הֲוָה לֵיהּ לְרַבּוֹיֵי, שֶׁכֵּן יֶשְׁנָהּ בְּכׇל שָׁעָה, וְנוֹהֶגֶת בָּאֲנָשִׁים וְנָשִׁים, וְאֵין בְּיָדוֹ לְתַקֵּן אֶת עַצְמוֹ! הָנָךְ נְפִישָׁן.
human_translation: On the contrary, acute mourning should be included as It is at any time it applies to men and women, and it is not in power to render himself fit these are numerous.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Ad'rabbah: Aninut havah lei l'rabbuyei, sheken yeshnah b'kol sha'ah, v'noheget b'anashim v'nashim, v'ein b'yado l'taken et atzmo! Hanach nefishan. English translation: Ad'rabbah: He had a great affliction, for she would sleep at all times, and she was familiar with both men and women, and he could not correct himself! There lies the difficulty.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: בְּלָא הָנָךְ נְפִישָׁן נָמֵי לָא מָצֵית אָמְרַתְּ. שָׁבְקִינַן עֲרֵלוּת דִּכְתִיב בְּגוּפֵיהּ דְּפֶסַח, וְיָלְפִינַן אֲנִינוּת מִפֶּסַח?! דְּפֶסַח גּוּפֵיהּ מִמַּעֲשֵׂר גָּמְרִינַן.
human_translation: Rava said: without these are numerous, you still could not say we leave out the lack of circumcision it is written with regard to the Paschal lamb itself, and learn acute mourning from the Paschal lamb As the Paschal lamb itself we learn from tithes.
llm_translation: Rava said: Without the Hanach, their Nefishan, you did not find. You said. We leave the foreskin as it is written in their bodies of Pesach, and we derive a law from Pesach?! From Pesach itself we learn the law of Maaser.

hebrew_text: אִי: מָה פֶּסַח מִילַת זְכָרָיו וַעֲבָדָיו מְעַכֶּבֶת, אַף תְּרוּמָה מִילַת זְכָרָיו וַעֲבָדָיו מְעַכֶּבֶת!
human_translation: If Just as Paschal lamb, the circumcision of one’s male and slaves prevents so too, the circumcision of one’s male and slaves prevent
llm_translation: If: what Pesach matter of its males and its servants impedes, also Terumah matter of its males and its servants impedes!

hebrew_text: אָמַר קְרָא: ״וּמַלְתָּה אוֹתוֹ אָז יֹאכַל בּוֹ״. מִילַת זְכָרָיו וַעֲבָדָיו מְעַכֶּבֶת בּוֹ מִלֶּאֱכוֹל בְּפֶסַח, וְאֵין מִילַת זְכָרָיו וַעֲבָדָיו מְעַכֶּבֶת בִּתְרוּמָה.
human_translation: The verse states “When you have circumcised him, then he shall eat from it” the circumcision of one’s male and slaves prevents one from eating the Paschal lamb, the circumcision of one’s male and slaves does not prevent one from teruma ,
llm_translation: The verse says: "And when he is circumcised, then shall he eat thereof." The circumcision of his males and his slaves prevents him from eating the Passover offering, but the circumcision of his males and his slaves does not prevent him from partaking of the heave offering.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, אֵימָא: ״כׇּל עָרֵל לֹא יֹאכַל בּוֹ״, בּוֹ אֵינוֹ אוֹכֵל, אֲבָל אוֹכֵל הוּא בִּתְרוּמָה! הָא כְּתִיב ״תּוֹשָׁב וְשָׂכִיר״!
human_translation: If so, say “No uncircumcised person shall eat from it” “from it,” may not eat, but he may eat from teruma . Isn’t it written “A sojourner and a hired servant”?
llm_translation: If so, say: "Any uncircumcised person shall not eat of it," he himself does not eat of it, but he may eat of terumah! Is it not written, "resident and hired worker"!

hebrew_text: וּמָה רָאִיתָ? מִסְתַּבְּרָא עֲרֵלוּת דְּגוּפֵיהּ הֲוָה לֵיהּ לְרַבּוֹיֵי, שֶׁכֵּן מַעֲשֶׂה בְּגוּפוֹ, וְעָנוּשׁ כָּרֵת. אַדְּרַבָּה: מִילַת זְכָרָיו וַעֲבָדָיו הֲוָה לֵיהּ לְרַבּוֹיֵי, שֶׁכֵּן יֶשְׁנָהּ בְּכׇל שָׁעָה!
human_translation: And what did you see It stands to reason one’s own lack of circumcision should be included as act on his body, and is punishable by karet . On the contrary, the circumcision of one’s male and slaves should be included as it is at any time,
llm_translation: And what did you see? The foreskin of its body was abundant, which caused it to be subject to a greater punishment, as was the case with its body, and the punishment is excision. On the contrary: the matter of his male organs and his slaves caused it to be subject to a greater punishment, as it is always present at all times!

hebrew_text: הָנָךְ נְפִישָׁן. וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: בְּלָא [הָנָךְ] נְפִישָׁן נָמֵי לָא מָצֵית אָמְרַתְּ. מִי אִיכָּא מִידֵּי דַּעֲרֵלוּת דְּגוּפֵיהּ לָא מְעַכְּבָא בֵּיהּ, עֲרֵלוּת דְּאַחֲרִינֵי מְעַכְּבָא בֵּיהּ?!
human_translation: These are numerous. And if you wish, say: without these are numerous, you still could not say is there anything that his own lack of circumcision does not preclude him the lack of circumcision of others does preclude him
llm_translation: Here is the word-for-word English translation of the Talmudic text: הָנָךְ - Here נְפִישָׁן - the issue is weighty. וְאִיבָּעֵית - And if you wish to say אֵימָא - say: בְּלָא הָנָךְ - without this weightiness נְפִישָׁן - the issue is not found. נָמֵי - you should say לָא - not מָצֵית - have you found. אָמְרַתְּ - You have said. מִי - Who אִיכָּא - is there מִידֵּי - from the aspect of דַּעֲרֵלוּת - uncircumcision דְּגוּפֵיהּ - of itself לָא - not מְעַכְּבָא - does it prevent בֵּיהּ - in it, עֲרֵלוּת - uncircumcision דְּאַחֲרִינֵי - of others מְעַכְּבָא - does it prevent בֵּיהּ - in it?!

hebrew_text: הַשְׁתָּא דְּאָמְרַתְּ: ״בּוֹ״ לִדְרָשָׁה הוּא דַּאֲתָא, ״כׇּל בֶּן נֵכָר לֹא יֹאכַל בּוֹ״ — לְמָה לִי? בּוֹ
human_translation: Now that you have said “from it” comes for an exposition “No stranger shall eat from it” why do I from it,
llm_translation: The matter of which you said: "in it" for interpretation, that is what has come, "every foreigner shall not eat of it" - why do I need it? In it.

hebrew_text: מְשׁוּמָּדוּת פּוֹסֶלֶת, וְאֵין מְשׁוּמָּדוּת פּוֹסֶלֶת בְּמַעֲשֵׂר.
human_translation: apostasy [ meshumadut ] disqualifies, but apostasy does not disqualify tithe.
llm_translation: Dispute invalid, and dispute not invalid in tithing.

hebrew_text: ״כׇּל עָרֵל לֹא יֹאכַל בּוֹ״ לְמָה לִי? בּוֹ אֵינוֹ אוֹכֵל, אֲבָל אוֹכֵל הוּא בְּמַצָּה וּמָרוֹר.
human_translation: “No uncircumcised person shall eat from it” why do I from it, may not eat, but he eats matza and bitter herbs.
llm_translation: "Any uncircumcised person shall not eat of it" - Why do I need it? He does not eat of it, but he may eat it with matzah and bitter herbs.

hebrew_text: וְאִיצְטְרִיךְ לְמִכְתַּב ״עָרֵל״, וְאִיצְטְרִיךְ לְמִכְתַּב ״כׇּל בֶּן נֵכָר״. דְּאִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״עָרֵל״, מִשּׁוּם דִּמְאִיס. אֲבָל בֶּן נֵכָר, דְּלָא מְאִיס — אֵימָא לָא. וְאִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״כׇּל בֶּן נֵכָר״, מִשּׁוּם דְּאֵין לִבּוֹ לַשָּׁמַיִם, אֲבָל עָרֵל, דְּלִבּוֹ לַשָּׁמַיִם — אֵימָא לָא, צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: And it was necessary to write an uncircumcised and it was necessary to write any stranger. As, if the Merciful One had written an uncircumcised because is repulsive, but a stranger, is not repulsive, say not And if the Merciful One had written any stranger, because his heart is not toward Heaven but an uncircumcised whose heart is toward Heaven, say no it is necessary
llm_translation: And it is necessary for a writing of "uncircumcised," and it is necessary for a writing of "every foreign son." For if the Merciful One wrote "uncircumcised," it is because he despises. But a foreign son, since he does not despise — say no. And if the Merciful One wrote "every foreign son," it is because his heart is not towards heaven, but uncircumcised, whose heart is towards heaven — say no, it is necessary.

hebrew_text: ״מִמֶּנּוּ״ ״מִמֶּנּוּ״. לְמָה לִי? לְכִדְרַבָּה אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק.
human_translation: “of it” “of it” why do I for that which Rabba said Rabbi Yitzḥak said,
llm_translation: "From him" "From him." Why do I need it? According to Rabbah, Rabbi Yitzchak said.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר, רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ, הֲרֵי הוּא אוֹמֵר ״אִישׁ אִישׁ״, לְרַבּוֹת אֶת הֶעָרֵל. וְאֵימָא: לְרַבּוֹת אֶת הָאוֹנֵן? אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא, אָמַר קְרָא: ״וְכׇל זָר״ — זָרוּת אָמַרְתִּי לְךָ, וְלֹא אֲנִינוּת.
human_translation: The Master said Rabbi Akiva says is not necessary as says: “Any man [ ish ish ] to include an uncircumcised But say to include an acute mourner Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, said: The verse states: “No foreigner foreignness I told you but not acute mourning.
llm_translation: Master said, Rabbi Akiva says: It is not necessary, for he says "each man" to include the uncircumcised. And why not: to include the mourner? Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Chanina, said, Scripture says: "And any stranger" - I have spoken of strangeness to you, not of mourning.

hebrew_text: אֵימָא: וְלֹא עֲרֵלוּת? הָא כְּתִיב ״אִישׁ אִישׁ״.
human_translation: Say but not lack of circumcision, Isn’t it written: “Any man [ ish ish ],”
llm_translation: Concerning what? And not uncircumcision? It is written "each man."

hebrew_text: וּמָה רָאִיתָ? מִסְתַּבְּרָא עֲרֵלוּת הֲוָה לֵיהּ לְרַבּוֹיֵי, שֶׁכֵּן: מַעֲשִׂים, כְּרוּתִים, בִּדְבַר, הָעֶבֶד. מְחוּסַּר מַעֲשֶׂה, וּמַעֲשֶׂה בְּגוּפוֹ, וְעָנוּשׁ כָּרֵת, וְיֶשְׁנוֹ לִפְנֵי הַדִּבּוּר, וּמִילַת זְכָרָיו וַעֲבָדָיו מְעַכֶּבֶת.
human_translation: And what did you see It stands to reason lack of circumcision should be included as Acts; karetim ; the word; the slave. lacks act and act on his body; punishable by karet ; existed before the word and the circumcision of one’s male and slaves precludes
llm_translation: And what did you see? The foreskin was a hindrance to its growth, as it is written: "Deeds, engraved, in a matter, the slave." Lacking an action, and the action in his body, and the punishment is excision, and it is subject to the spoken word, and the matter of his male organ and his slaves delays.

hebrew_text: אַדְּרַבָּה: אֲנִינוּת הֲוָה לֵיהּ לְרַבּוֹיֵי, שֶׁכֵּן: יֶשְׁנָהּ בְּכׇל שָׁעָה, וְנוֹהֶגֶת בַּאֲנָשִׁים וְנָשִׁים, וְאֵין בְּיָדוֹ לְתַקֵּן עַצְמוֹ!
human_translation: On the contrary, acute mourning should be included as is at any time, it applies to men and women, and it is not in power to render himself fit
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Ad'rabbah: Aninut havah lei l'ravvoyei, sheken: yeshnah b'kol sha'ah, v'noheget b'anashim v'nashim, v'ein b'yado l'taken atzmo! English translation: Ad'rabbah said: He had mourning for his teachers, as it is said: "She is always sleeping, and her ways are among men and women, and he has no power to correct himself!"

hebrew_text: הָנָךְ נְפִישָׁן. רָבָא אָמַר: בְּלָא הָנָךְ נְפִישָׁן נָמֵי לָא מָצֵית אָמְרַתְּ. אָמַר קְרָא ״אִישׁ אִישׁ״, אֵיזֶהוּ דָּבָר שֶׁיֶּשְׁנוֹ בָּאִישׁ וְאֵינוֹ בָּאִשָּׁה — הָוֵי אוֹמֵר זֶה עֲרֵלוּת.
human_translation: These are numerous. Rava said: without these are numerous, you still cannot say the verse states: “Any man [ ish ish ],” what matter applies to a man and not to a woman? You must say it is lack of circumcision,
llm_translation: The text reads: "Hanaḥ nefishan. Rava said: Without hanaḥ nefishan, it is as if you have not found. You said. The verse says 'each man,' which thing is found in a man and not in a woman - this is considered uncircumcision."

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, הַאי ״תּוֹשָׁב וְשָׂכִיר״ מַאי עָבֵיד לֵיהּ? אָמַר רַב שְׁמַעְיָא: לְאֵתוֹיֵי עַרְבִי מָהוּל וְגִבְעוֹנִי מָהוּל.
human_translation: And what does Rabbi Akiva do this “A sojourner and a hired servant,” Rav Shemaya said: to include a circumcised Arab and a circumcised Gibeonite
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva, this "resident and hired worker," what does he do with it? Rav Shemaya said: To include the Arvii who is circumcised and the Giboni who is circumcised.

hebrew_text: וְהָנֵי מוּלִין נִינְהוּ? וְהָא תְּנַן: ״קֻוֽנָּם שֶׁאֲנִי נֶהֱנֶה לַעֲרֵלִים״ — מוּתָּר בְּעַרְלֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל, וְאָסוּר בְּמוּלֵי אוּמּוֹת הָעוֹלָם. ״קֻוֽנָּם שֶׁאֲנִי נֶהֱנֶה לְמוּלִין״ — מוּתָּר בְּמוּלֵי אוּמּוֹת הָעוֹלָם, וְאָסוּר בְּעַרְלֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל!
human_translation: And are these circumcised? But didn’t we learn The benefit that I from the uncircumcised is konam is permitted from uncircumcised Jews, and is prohibited from the circumcised of the nations of the world, The benefit that I from the circumcised is konam permitted from the circumcised of the nations of the world, and is prohibited from uncircumcised Jews.
llm_translation: These are the foreskins, are they not? But didn't we learn: "Their spittle, from which I derive benefit, is permitted with regard to Jewish foreskins, and prohibited with regard to Gentile foreskins." "Their spittle, from which I derive benefit, is permitted with regard to Gentile foreskins, and prohibited with regard to Jewish foreskins!"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, לְאֵתוֹיֵי גֵּר שֶׁמָּל וְלֹא טָבַל, וְקָטָן שֶׁנּוֹלַד כְּשֶׁהוּא מָהוּל. וְקָסָבַר: צָרִיךְ לְהַטִּיף מִמֶּנּוּ דַּם בְּרִית.
human_translation: Rather, to include a convert who was circumcised but did not immerse and a child who was born circumcised, And he, maintains it is necessary to drip covenantal blood from him,
llm_translation: Rather, for the case of a convert who was circumcised but did not immerse, and a minor who was born circumcised. And he holds: one must extract blood of the covenant from him.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר לְטַעְמֵיהּ, דְּאָמַר: גֵּר שֶׁמָּל וְלֹא טָבַל — גֵּר מְעַלְּיָא הוּא, וְקָסָבַר: קָטָן כְּשֶׁנּוֹלַד מָהוּל — אֵין צָרִיךְ לְהַטִּיף מִמֶּנּוּ דַּם בְּרִית.
human_translation: And Rabbi Eliezer, to his reasoning, as he said: A convert who was circumcised but did not immerse is a proper convert And he maintains a child who was born circumcised, it is not necessary to drip covenantal blood from him.
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer according to his reasoning, as he said: A convert who circumcised but did not immerse — he is a convert above, and he holds: A minor when born circumcised — there is no need to drip blood of the covenant from him.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, הַאי ״אִישׁ אִישׁ״ מַאי עָבֵיד לֵיהּ? דִּבְּרָה תּוֹרָה כִּלְשׁוֹן בְּנֵי אָדָם.
human_translation: And what does Rabbi Eliezer do this “any man [ ish ish ]”? the Torah spoke in the language of men,
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer, this "man to man," what does he do with it? The Torah spoke in the language of people.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רַב חָמָא בַּר עוּקְבָא: קָטָן עָרֵל מַהוּ לְסוּכוֹ בְּשֶׁמֶן שֶׁל תְּרוּמָה? עֲרֵלוּת שֶׁלֹּא בִּזְמַנָּהּ מְעַכְּבָא, אוֹ לָא מְעַכְּבָא?!
human_translation: Rav Ḥama bar Ukva raises a dilemma: an uncircumcised child what is to anointing him with oil of teruma ? lack of circumcision not at its time, preclude or does not preclude
llm_translation: The question of Rav Hama son of Ukva: A minor who is uncircumcised, what is the law regarding anointing him with oil of terumah? Does the uncircumcision, if not in its proper time, render it invalid, or not render it invalid?!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא, תָּא שְׁמַע: אֵין לִי אֶלָּא מִילַת זְכָרָיו בִּשְׁעַת עֲשִׂיָּה, וַעֲבָדָיו בִּשְׁעַת אֲכִילָה. מִנַּיִן לִיתֵּן אֶת הָאָמוּר שֶׁל זֶה בָּזֶה, וְאֶת הָאָמוּר שֶׁל זֶה בָּזֶה — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אָז״ ״אָז״ לִגְזֵירָה שָׁוָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira said: Come hear I have only the circumcision of one’s male at the time of the preparation, and one’s slaves at the time of the eating From where to apply that was stated about this to that and that was said about that to this the verse states “then” “then” as a verbal analogy.
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira said, "Come and hear: I have only the matter of his male parts at the time of action, and his servants at the time of eating." From where do we derive that one should give the statement of this one to that one, and the statement of that one to this one? The Torah teaches us to say, "then" - to equate the decree.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא עֲבָדָיו, מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ דְּאִיתַנְהוּ בִּשְׁעַת אֲכִילָה וְלֵיתַנְהוּ בִּשְׁעַת עֲשִׂיָּה, כְּגוֹן דְּזַבְנִינְהוּ בֵּינֵי בֵּינֵי.
human_translation: Granted, one’s slaves you find where they are present at the time of eating but they were not present at the time of preparation; for example, if he purchased them in the meantime,
llm_translation: In truth, his servants, she finds that they are with him at the time of eating, but they are not with him at the time of work, for example, she buys them between the times.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא זְכָרָיו, דְּאִיתַנְהוּ בִּשְׁעַת אֲכִילָה וְלֵיתַנְהוּ בִּשְׁעַת עֲשִׂיָּה הֵיכִי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ — לָאו דְּאִתְיְלוּד בֵּין עֲשִׂיָּה לַאֲכִילָה? שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: עֲרֵלוּת שֶׁלֹּא בִּזְמַנָּהּ הָוְיָא עֲרֵלוּת!
human_translation: However, his male how can you find where they are present at the time of eating, but they were not present at the time of preparation? not where they were born between preparation and eating? Learn from this lack of circumcision, not at, its time, is lack of circumcision
llm_translation: Rather, his male organs, which are present during eating but not present during action, how does one forget them? Is it not that they are not formed between eating and action? Learn from it: Uncircumcision that is not in its proper time is considered uncircumcision!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: וְתִסְבְּרָא? ״הִמּוֹל לוֹ כׇל זָכָר״ אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא, ״וְאָז יִקְרַב לַעֲשׂוֹתוֹ״. וְהַאי לָאו בַּר מְהִילָא הוּא. אֶלָּא, הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן — כְּגוֹן שֶׁחֲלָצַתּוּ חַמָּה.
human_translation: Rava said: And you understand the Merciful One state: “Let all his males be circumcised,” “and then let him come near and keep it” and this is not fit for circumcision Rather, with what are we dealing here? for example, the fever left him
llm_translation: Rava said: And do you think so? "If he circumcised every male" - the Merciful One said, "then he shall draw near to perform it." But this is not a case of a Bar Mitzvah. Rather, here we are dealing with what? For example, when the sun set.

hebrew_text: וְנִיתֵּוב לֵיהּ כׇּל שִׁבְעָה. דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: חֲלָצַתּוּ חַמָּה — נוֹתְנִין לוֹ כׇּל שִׁבְעָה! דְּיָהֲבִינַן לֵיהּ כׇּל שִׁבְעָה. וְנִימְהֲלֵיהּ מִצַּפְרָא! בָּעֵינַן
human_translation: let us give him the full seven As Shmuel said: the fever left him, one gives him a full seven days we gave him a full seven But He should have circumcised him in the morning, We require
llm_translation: And we will answer him with seven. For Shmuel said: If his forehead is hot - we give him seven! Because we gave him seven. And we will lead him from the north! We require.

hebrew_text: מֵעֵת לְעֵת.
human_translation: from time to time
llm_translation: From time to time.

hebrew_text: וְהָתָנֵי לוּדָאָה: יוֹם הַבְרָאָתוֹ כְּיוֹם הִוָּלְדוֹ. מַאי לָאו: מָה יוֹם הִוָּלְדוֹ לָא בָּעֵינַן מֵעֵת לְעֵת, אַף יוֹם הַבְרָאָתוֹ לָא בָּעֵינַן מֵעֵת לְעֵת?
human_translation: Didn’t from Lod teach the day of his healing is like the day of his birth? What, is it not just as the day of his birth we need not from time to time so too, the day of his healing we need not from time to time
llm_translation: The Tanna taught Ludah: The day of his creation is like the day of his birth. What is the reason? Just as the day of his birth we do not require from time to time, so too the day of his creation we do not require from time to time.

hebrew_text: לָא, עֲדִיף יוֹם הַבְרָאָתוֹ מִיּוֹם הִוָּלְדוֹ. דְּאִילּוּ יוֹם הִוָּלְדוֹ לָא בָּעֵינַן מֵעֵת לְעֵת, וְאִילּוּ יוֹם הַבְרָאָתוֹ בָּעֵינַן מֵעֵת לְעֵת.
human_translation: No, the day of his healing is superior to the day of his birth: While the day of his birth we need not from time to time the day of his healing we need from time to time
llm_translation: Not preferred, day of creation than day of birth. Because if day of birth not we need from time to time, and if day of creation we need from time to time.

hebrew_text: רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר: כְּגוֹן דְּכָאֵיב לֵיהּ עֵינֵיהּ לְיָנוֹקָא וְאִיתְּפַח בֵּינֵי וּבֵינֵי.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: for example, if the baby’s eye hurt him and he recovered in the meantime
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: For example, if he is causing pain to the child's eyes while nursing, and there is a barrier between them.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: כְּגוֹן שֶׁהָיוּ אָבִיו וְאִמּוֹ חֲבוּשִׁין בְּבֵית הָאֲסוּרִין.
human_translation: Rava said: for example, if father and mother were incarcerated in a prison
llm_translation: Rava said: For example, if his father and mother were imprisoned in the house of the captives.

hebrew_text: רַב כָּהֲנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב נְחֶמְיָה אָמַר: כְּגוֹן טוּמְטוּם שֶׁנִּקְרַע, וְנִמְצָא זָכָר בֵּינֵי וּבֵינֵי.
human_translation: Rav Kahana, son of Rav Neḥemya, said: for example, a tumtum , in the meantime he was torn and he was found a male,
llm_translation: Rav Kahana, son of Rav Nechemyah, said: For example, a "tumtum" that was torn, and a male was found between it and between it.

hebrew_text: רַב שֵׁרֵבְיָא אָמַר: כְּגוֹן שֶׁהוֹצִיא רֹאשׁוֹ חוּץ לַפְּרוֹזְדוֹר.
human_translation: Rav Sherevya said: for example, if extended his head, out of the corridor
llm_translation: Rav She'revya said: For example, if he extended his head outside the privy.

hebrew_text: וּמִי חָיֵי? וְהָתַנְיָא: כֵּיוָן שֶׁיָּצָא לַאֲוִיר הָעוֹלָם, נִפְתַּח הַסָּתוּם וְנִסְתַּם הַפָּתוּחַ. שֶׁאִלְמָלֵא כֵּן, אֵין יָכוֹל לִחְיוֹת אֲפִילּוּ שָׁעָה אַחַת!
human_translation: But can live Isn’t it taught Once emerges into the air of the world, closed, open, and open, closes, as, if this not it could not live for even an hour,
llm_translation: "And who is alive? And it was taught: Once he goes out into the air of the world, the closed one opens and the open one closes. For if not for this, he could not survive even for one hour!"

hebrew_text: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן, כְּגוֹן דְּזַנְתֵּיהּ אִישָּׁתָא. אִישָּׁתָא דְּמַאן? אִילֵימָא אִישָּׁתָא דִּידֵיהּ, אִי הָכִי כֹּל שִׁבְעָה בָּעֵי? אֶלָּא דְּזַנְתֵּיהּ אִישָּׁתָא דְּאִימֵּיהּ. וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: הָנֵי מִילֵּי הֵיכָא דְּלָא מְעַוֵּי, אֲבָל הֵיכָא דִּמְעַוֵּי, מִחְיָיא חָיֵי.
human_translation: With what are we dealing here? for example, where he was sustained by a fever Whose fever? If we say his own fever, if so, necessary a full seven Rather, that he was sustained by his mother’s fever. And if you wish, say this applies only when he does not cry, but when he cries he live,
llm_translation: Here we are dealing with what? For example, that his wife. Whose wife? If you say his own wife, then does everyone need seven? Rather, his father's wife. And if you wish, say: These matters apply where he does not support, but where he does support, he must support.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי בְּנָאָה: עָרֵל מְקַבֵּל הַזָּאָה, שֶׁכֵּן מָצִינוּ בַּאֲבוֹתֵינוּ שֶׁקִּבְּלוּ הַזָּאָה כְּשֶׁהֵן עֲרֵלִים, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְהָעָם עָלוּ מִן הַיַּרְדֵּן בֶּעָשׂוֹר לַחֹדֶשׁ הָרִאשׁוֹן״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said in the name of Rabbi Bena’a: An uncircumcised may receive sprinkling As we found that our forefathers received sprinkling when they were uncircumcised, as it is stated: “And the people came up out of the Jordan on the tenth day of the first month”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of Rabbi Bena'ah: An uncircumcised person can receive the coin, for we find in our ancestors that they received the coin when they were uncircumcised, as it is stated: "And the people came up from the Jordan on the tenth day of the first month."

hebrew_text: בַּעֲשָׂרָה לָא מְהִילִי, מִשּׁוּם חוּלְשָׁא דְאוֹרְחָא. הַזָּאָה אֵימַת עָבֵיד לְהוּ?! לָאו כְּשֶׁהֵן עֲרֵלִים?
human_translation: On the tenth they did not circumcise due to the weariness their journey. When, was sprinkling done to them wasn’t when they were uncircumcised?
llm_translation: On the tenth day he does not begin, due to the weakness of the road. When will he do it for them?! Are they not uncircumcised?

hebrew_text: וְדִלְמָא לָא עֲבוּד פֶּסַח כְּלָל? לָא סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיַּעֲשׂוּ אֶת הַפֶּסַח״.
human_translation: But perhaps they did not sacrifice Paschal lamb at all. This cannot enter your mind, as it is written: “And they kept the Passover”
llm_translation: And perhaps not performed Passover at all? It is not a valid assumption, as it is written: "And they made the Passover."

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ מָר זוּטְרָא: וְדִלְמָא פֶּסַח הַבָּא בְּטוּמְאָה הָיָה? אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אָשֵׁי, תַּנְיָא בְּהֶדְיָא: מָלוּ, וְטָבְלוּ, וְעָשׂוּ פִּסְחֵיהֶן בְּטׇהֳרָה.
human_translation: Mar Zutra strongly objects to this: But perhaps it was a Paschal lamb that comes in impurity? Rav Ashi said to him: It is taught explicitly they circumcised immersed and performed their Paschal lambs in purity.
llm_translation: The Master Zutra objected to him: But perhaps the Passover offering was brought in a state of impurity? Rav Ashe said to him: It was taught explicitly: They circumcised, immersed, and made their Passovers in a state of purity.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר יִצְחָק אָמַר רַב: לֹא נִיתְּנָה פְּרִיעַת מִילָה לְאַבְרָהָם אָבִינוּ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בָּעֵת הַהִיא אָמַר ה׳ אֶל יְהוֹשֻׁעַ עֲשֵׂה לְךָ חַרְבוֹת צֻרִים וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: Rabba bar Yitzḥak said Rav said: The uncovering circumcision was not given to our Patriarch Abraham. As it is stated: “At that time the Lord said to Joshua: Make yourself knives of flint,
llm_translation: Rabah bar Yitzchak said in the name of Rav: The covenant of circumcision was not given to our father Abraham, as it is stated: "At that time, Hashem said to Joshua, 'Make for yourself sharp knives' etc."

hebrew_text: וְדִלְמָא הָנָךְ דְּלָא מְהוּל, דִּכְתִיב: ״כִּי מֻלִים הָיוּ כׇּל הָעָם הַיֹּצְאִים וְכׇל הָעָם הַיִּלֹּדִים וְגוֹ׳״.
