human_translation: Perhaps those who had not been circumcised at all, as it is written: “For all the people who came out were circumcised; but all the people who were born
llm_translation: And perhaps there, that is not circumcised, as it is written: "For all the people who came out were circumcised, and all the people who were born, etc."

hebrew_text: אִם כֵּן, מַאי ״שׁוּב״? אֶלָּא לָאו לִפְרִיעָה. וּמַאי ״שֵׁנִית״ —
human_translation: If so, what is again,” Rather, is it not to uncovering And what is “a second time,”
llm_translation: If so, what is "return"? Rather, not for prevention. And what is "second"?

hebrew_text: לְאַקּוֹשֵׁי סוֹף מִילָה לִתְחִלַּת מִילָה: מָה תְּחִלַּת מִילָה מְעַכֶּבֶת — אַף סוֹף מִילָה מְעַכְּבִין בּוֹ. דִּתְנַן: אֵלּוּ הֵן צִיצִין הַמְעַכְּבִין אֶת הַמִּילָה — בָּשָׂר הַחוֹפֶה אֶת [רוֹב] הָעֲטָרָה, וְאֵין אוֹכֵל בִּתְרוּמָה.
human_translation: to equate the end of circumcision, with the beginning of circumcision: Just as the beginning of circumcision invalidates so too, the end of circumcision, invalidates As we learned These are the shreds that invalidate the circumcision the flesh that covers most of the corona, and he does not partake of teruma .
llm_translation: For those who delay the end of circumcision to the beginning of circumcision: Just as the beginning of circumcision delays, so too the end of circumcision delays. As we learned: These are the tzitzit that delay the circumcision - flesh that covers most of the crown, and one may not eat from the terumah.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבִינָא, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַב יִרְמְיָה בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַב: בָּשָׂר הַחוֹפֶה אֶת רוֹב גּוֹבְהָהּ שֶׁל עֲטָרָה.
human_translation: Ravina said, and some say Rav Yirmeya bar Abba Rav said: the flesh that covers most of the height of the corona
llm_translation: Ravina said, and some say Rav Yirmeya bar Abba said in the name of Rav: The flesh that covers most of its height of the crown.

hebrew_text: וּבַמִּדְבָּר מַאי טַעְמָא לָא מְהוּל? אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא מִשּׁוּם חוּלְשָׁא דְּאוֹרְחָא,
human_translation: And what is the reason they did not circumcise in the wilderness If you wish, say due to the weariness their journey.
llm_translation: In the wilderness, what is the reason that one is not circumcised? If you wish, say it is due to the weakness of the journey.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא נְשִׁיב לְהוּ רוּחַ צְפוֹנִית. דְּתַנְיָא: כׇּל אוֹתָן אַרְבָּעִים שָׁנָה שֶׁהָיוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל בַּמִּדְבָּר לֹא נָשְׁבָה לָהֶם רוּחַ צְפוֹנִית.
human_translation: And if you wish, say because north wind did not blow for them, As it is taught All those forty years that the Jewish people were in the wilderness, north wind did not blow for them.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: Because we do not turn to them the northern wind. As it was taught: All those forty years that the Israelites were in the wilderness, the northern wind did not blow upon them.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא? אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא מִשּׁוּם דִּנְזוּפִים הָווּ, וְאִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא דְּלָא נִבַּדּוּר עַנְנֵי כָבוֹד.
human_translation: What is the reason If you wish, say because they were under censure And if you wish, say that clouds of glory should not disperse.
llm_translation: What is the reason? If you wish, say it is because they were suspected of adultery, and if you wish, say it is because the clouds of glory did not accompany them.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: הִלְכָּךְ יוֹמָא דְעֵיבָא וְיוֹמָא דְשׁוּתָא — לָא מָהֲלִינַן בֵּיהּ, וְלָא מְסוֹכְרִינַן בֵּיהּ. וְהָאִידָּנָא דְּדָשׁוּ בַּהּ רַבִּים, ״שׁוֹמֵר פְּתָאִים ה׳״.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: Therefore, a cloudy day or a day a south wind [ shuta ] we may neither circumcise nor let [ mesokhrinan ], But nowadays, when many are accustomed to “The Lord preserves the simple”
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: Therefore, on the day of Eiva and the day of Shuta, we do not walk in it, and we do not lock it. And now that the public has trampled upon it, "The Lord guards the simple."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: כׇּל אוֹתָן אַרְבָּעִים שָׁנָה שֶׁהָיוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל בַּמִּדְבָּר, לֹא הָיָה יוֹם שֶׁלֹּא נָשְׁבָה בּוֹ רוּחַ צְפוֹנִית בַּחֲצִי הַלַּיְלָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיְהִי בַּחֲצִי הַלַּיְלָה וַה׳ הִכָּה כׇל בְּכוֹר וְגוֹ׳״ מַאי תַּלְמוּדָא? הָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּעֵת רְצוֹן מִילְּתָא הִיא.
human_translation: The Sages taught All those forty years that the Jewish people were in the wilderness there was not a day in which north wind did not blow at midnight, as it is stated: “And it came to pass at midnight, that the Lord smote all the firstborn What is the derivation? This teach us that a time of favor is a matter.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: All those forty years that the Israelites were in the wilderness, there was not a day in which the north wind did not blow at midnight, as it is stated: "And it came to pass at midnight, and the Lord smote all the firstborn, etc." What is the Talmudic derivation? It teaches us that the knowledge of the will of the matter is implied.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: דְּבַר תּוֹרָה, מָשׁוּךְ — אוֹכֵל בִּתְרוּמָה, וּמִדִּבְרֵיהֶם גָּזְרוּ עָלָיו, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁנִּרְאֶה כְּעָרֵל.
human_translation: Rav Huna said: By Torah law, drawn forward partake of teruma , However, from the words of they decreed because he looks uncircumcised.
llm_translation: Rav Huna said: A matter of Torah, extended - he may eat of the terumah, and they decreed upon him regarding their words, because he appears like an uncircumcised person.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: מָשׁוּךְ צָרִיךְ שֶׁיָּמוּל! מִדְּרַבָּנַן. וּדְקָאָרֵי לַהּ, מַאי קָאָרֵי לַהּ? הָא ״צָרִיךְ״ קָתָנֵי!
human_translation: raises an objection drawn forward requires circumcision, by rabbinic law, And who asked why did he ask it teaches requires
llm_translation: Challenger: "Extended needs to be smoothened!" From the Rabbis. And he is reading it as, what is he reading it as? This, "needs," it teaches!

hebrew_text: קָטָעֵי בְּסֵיפָא, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: לֹא יִמּוֹל, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁסַּכָּנָה הִיא לוֹ. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: וַהֲלֹא הַרְבֵּה מָלוּ בִּימֵי בֶּן כּוֹזֵיבָא וְהוֹלִידוּ בָּנִים וּבָנוֹת, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הִמּוֹל יִמּוֹל״, אֲפִילּוּ מֵאָה פְּעָמִים, וְאוֹמֵר: ״אֶת בְּרִיתִי הֵפַר״ — לְרַבּוֹת אֶת הַמָּשׁוּךְ.
human_translation: erred due to the latter clause Rabbi Yehuda says: He should not be circumcised because it would be dangerous for him said to him: But weren’t many were circumcised in the days of ben Koziva, and they fathered sons and daughters. as it is stated: “He must surely be circumcised [ himmol yimmol ]” Even one hundred times. And it says: “He has broken My covenant” to include one drawn forward.
llm_translation: Cutting in the latter part, Rabbi Yehuda says: He should not circumcise, because it is a danger to him. They said to him: But didn't many circumcise in the days of Ben Koziva and had sons and daughters, as it is said: "He shall surely be circumcised," even a hundred times, and it says: "He has broken My covenant" - to include one who is drawn out.

hebrew_text: מַאי ״וְאוֹמֵר״? וְכִי תֵּימָא: הַאי ״הִמּוֹל יִמּוֹל״ לְרַבּוֹת צִיצִין הַמְעַכְּבִים אֶת הַמִּילָה — ״תָּא שְׁמַע: ״אֶת בְּרִיתִי הֵפַר״, לְרַבּוֹת אֶת הַמָּשׁוּךְ.
human_translation: What is And it says? lest you say this “He shall surely be circumcised,” to include the shreds that invalidate the circumcision come hear “He has broken My covenant,” to include one drawn forward.
llm_translation: What is "and he shall say"? And if you say: This "he shall surely be circumcised" is to include fringes that delay the circumcision - "come and hear": "He has broken My covenant," to include the one who is delayed.

hebrew_text: הוּא סָבַר: מִדְּקָא נָסֵיב לַהּ תַּלְמוּדָא (קְרָא) — דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא הִיא. וְלָא הִיא: מִדְּרַבָּנַן, וּקְרָא אַסְמַכְתָּא בְּעָלְמָא.
human_translation: he, thought since brings a derivation a verse, by Torah law. But that is not so. by rabbinic law, and the verse a mere support
llm_translation: He thought: Since it is derived from the verse, it is of biblical origin. But it is not: it is of rabbinic origin, and the verse is merely a support in general.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: טוּמְטוּם — אֵין אוֹכֵל בִּתְרוּמָה, נָשָׁיו וַעֲבָדָיו — אוֹכְלִין. מָשׁוּךְ, וְנוֹלַד כְּשֶׁהוּא מָהוּל — הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ אוֹכְלִים. אַנְדְּרוֹגִינוֹס — אוֹכֵל בִּתְרוּמָה, וְאֵין אוֹכֵל בְּקָדָשִׁים. טוּמְטוּם — אֵינוֹ אוֹכֵל לֹא בִּתְרוּמָה וְלֹא בְּקָדָשִׁים.
human_translation: raises an objection a tumtum may not partake of teruma , his wives and slaves may partake drawn forward, and one who was born circumcised, may partake a hermaphrodite [ androginos ], may partake of teruma , but he may not partake of sacrificial food, a tumtum may not partake of teruma or sacrificial food,
llm_translation: The opponent raises an objection: "Tumtum - one may not eat of the terumah, but his wives and slaves may eat. If he is drawn out and is born circumcised, they may eat. Androgynos - may eat of the terumah, but may not eat of the holy things. Tumtum - does not eat neither of the terumah nor of the holy things."

hebrew_text: קָתָנֵי מִיהַת: מָשׁוּךְ, וְנוֹלַד כְּשֶׁהוּא מָהוּל — הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ אוֹכְלִין, תְּיוּבְתָּא דְרַב הוּנָא! תְּיוּבְתָּא.
human_translation: In any event, teaches drawn forward and born circumcised may partake a conclusive refutation of Rav Huna a conclusive refutation
llm_translation: The text states: "It was taught in one place: If it is drawn out and born while it is still circumcised - behold, these are fit to eat, the surplus of Rav Huna! The surplus."

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: טוּמְטוּם — אֵינוֹ אוֹכֵל בִּתְרוּמָה, נָשָׁיו וַעֲבָדָיו — אוֹכְלִים. נָשָׁיו לְטוּמְטוּם מְנָא לֵיהּ? אִילֵּימָא דְּקַדֵּישׁ, דְּתַנְיָא: טוּמְטוּם שֶׁקִּידֵּשׁ — קִדּוּשָׁיו קִדּוּשִׁין, נִתְקַדֵּשׁ — קִדּוּשָׁיו קִדּוּשִׁין,
human_translation: The Master said a tumtum may not partake of teruma , his wives [ nashav ] and slaves may partake From where does a tumtum have wives? If we say that he betrothed as it is taught a tumtum betrothed his betrothal is a betrothal, was betrothed his betrothal is a betrothal
llm_translation: The Master said: "Tumtum - does not eat from the terumah, his wives and his slaves - eat. How do his wives eat from the tumtum? If you say that he sanctified, for it was taught: If a tumtum who sanctified - his sanctifications are sanctified, if he was sanctified - his sanctifications are sanctified."

hebrew_text: אֵימַר דְּאָמַר לְחוּמְרָא, לְקוּלָּא מִי אָמְרִינַן? סְפֵק אִשָּׁה הוּא, וְאֵין אִשָּׁה מְקַדֶּשֶׁת אִשָּׁה?
human_translation: say that said as a stringency, should we say as a leniency, uncertainty he is a woman, and woman cannot betroth woman.
llm_translation: Statement: If he said it stringently, do we say it leniently? It is a doubtful case of a woman, and does a woman sanctify another woman?

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: כְּשֶׁבֵּיצָיו נִיכָּרוֹת מִבַּחוּץ.
human_translation: Abaye said: where his testicles are visible externally.
llm_translation: Abbaye said: When his eggs are recognizable from the outside.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: מַאי ״נָשָׁיו״ — אִמּוֹ. אִמּוֹ, פְּשִׁיטָא! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: מוֹלִיד — מַאֲכִיל, שֶׁאֵין מוֹלִיד — אֵינוֹ מַאֲכִיל, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: Rava said What is his women? mother, His mother? is obvious lest you say is capable of having children enable to eat is incapable of having children does not enable to eat teaches us
llm_translation: Rava said: What is meant by "his wives" - his mother. His mother, it is obvious! Lest you say: One who begets - he feeds, if one does not beget - he does not feed, it teaches us.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: טוּמְטוּם — אֵינוֹ אוֹכֵל לֹא בִּתְרוּמָה וְלֹא בְּקָדָשִׁים. בִּשְׁלָמָא לְאַבָּיֵי, תְּנָא רֵישָׁא עָרֵל וַדַּאי, וְקָתָנֵי סֵיפָא סְפֵק עָרֵל.
human_translation: Come hear a tumtum may not partake of teruma or sacrificial food. Granted, according to Abaye, teaches first clause definitely uncircumcised, And he teaches the latter clause uncertainty uncircumcised,
llm_translation: "Come and hear: Tumtum - does not eat neither from terumah nor from holy things. According to Abbaye, the first part is certain and the latter part is doubtful."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְרָבָא, טוּמְטוּם דְּסֵיפָא לְמָה לִי? מַאי טוּמְטוּם — עָרֵל.
human_translation: But according to Rava, why do I tumtum the latter clause? What is tumtum uncircumcised.
llm_translation: Rather, for Rava, why do I need the conclusion of the latter part? What is "tumtum" - uncircumcised.

hebrew_text: הַשְׁתָּא סְפֵק עָרֵל לָא אָכֵיל — וַדַּאי עָרֵל אָכֵיל?! מָה טַעַם קָאָמַר: מָה טַעַם טוּמְטוּם אֵינוֹ אוֹכֵל בִּתְרוּמָה? מִפְּנֵי שֶׁסְּפֵק עָרֵל הוּא, וְעָרֵל אֵינוֹ אוֹכֵל לֹא בִּתְרוּמָה וְלֹא בְּקָדָשִׁים.
human_translation: Now, uncertainty uncircumcised, may not partake definitely uncircumcised He is saying: What is the reason. What is the reason a tumtum may not partake of teruma ? because uncertainty uncircumcised, and an uncircumcised may not partake of teruma or sacrificial food.
llm_translation: The matter of a doubtful uncircumcised person, one does not eat — and surely an uncircumcised person eats?! What is the reason he said: Why does a doubtful uncircumcised person not eat terumah? Because he is a doubtful uncircumcised person, and an uncircumcised person does not eat either terumah or holy things.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא כְּתַנָּאֵי: מָשׁוּךְ (וְנוֹלַד כְּשֶׁהוּא מָהוּל), וְגֵר שֶׁנִּתְגַּיֵּיר כְּשֶׁהוּא מָהוּל, וְקָטָן שֶׁעָבַר זְמַנּוֹ, וּשְׁאָר כׇּל הַנִּימּוֹלִים, לְאֵיתוֹיֵי מִי שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ שְׁתֵּי עֲרָלוֹת — אֵינָן נִימּוֹלִין אֶלָּא בַּיּוֹם. רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בַּר שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: בִּזְמַנּוֹ —
human_translation: Let us say parallel to tanna’im . drawn forward, and one who was born circumcised, and a convert who converted when he was circumcised, and a child whose time passed and all others circumcision, to include one who has two foreskins, may be circumcised only during the day. Rabbi Elazar bar Shimon says: at its time,
llm_translation: Let us say as the Tannaim: Pulled (and born as if circumcised), and a convert who converted as if circumcised, and a minor who passed his time, and all other uncircumcised individuals, for the purpose of one who has two foreskins - they are not circumcised except during the day. Rabbi Elazar bar Shimon says: In his time -

hebrew_text: אֵין נִימּוֹלִין אֶלָּא בְּיוֹם, שֶׁלֹּא בִּזְמַנּוֹ — נִימּוֹלִין בְּיוֹם וּבַלַּיְלָה. מַאי לָאו, בְּהָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי: דְּמָר סָבַר מָשׁוּךְ דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא, וּמָר סָבַר מָשׁוּךְ דְּרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: they may be circumcised only during the day. not at its time, they may be circumcised during the day or at night. What, is it not they disagree about the following: One Sage, holds drawn forward by Torah law, and one Sage, holds drawn forward by rabbinic law.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Circumcision is performed only during the day, not out of its proper time — it is performed during the day and at night. What is the reason? This is the point of their dispute: one Sage holds that it is derived from the Torah, and the other Sage holds that it is derived from the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: וְתִסְבְּרָא? קָטָן שֶׁעָבַר זְמַנּוֹ מִי אִיכָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר דְּרַבָּנַן?
human_translation: And you understand a child whose time has passed, is there anyone who says that by rabbinic law?
llm_translation: And was created? A minor who passed his time, who is there according to the one who says of the sages?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא: מָשׁוּךְ — דְּרַבָּנַן, וְקָטָן שֶׁעָבַר זְמַנּוֹ — דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא. וְהָכָא בְּהָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי: מָר סָבַר דָּרְשִׁינַן ״וּבַיּוֹם״, וּמָר סָבַר לָא דָּרְשִׁינַן ״וּבַיּוֹם״.
human_translation: Rather, everyone drawn forward by rabbinic law, and a child whose time has passed by Torah law. And here they disagree with regard to the following: One Sage holds we expound “and on the day” And one Sage, holds we do not expound “and on the day,”
llm_translation: Rather, the entirety of the world: drawn — of the Sages, and a minor who has passed his time — of the Torah. And here in this case they dispute: one Master holds that we interpret "and in the day," and one Master holds that we do not interpret "and in the day."

hebrew_text: כִּי הָא דְּיָתֵיב רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן וְקָדָרֵישׁ: נוֹתָר, בִּזְמַנּוֹ — אֵינוֹ נִשְׂרָף אֶלָּא בַּיּוֹם, שֶׁלֹּא בִּזְמַנּוֹ — נִשְׂרָף בֵּין בַּיּוֹם בֵּין בַּלַּיְלָה.
human_translation: As in where Rabbi Yoḥanan was sitting and he expounded: Notar , at its time, may be burned only during the day. not at its time, may be burned either during the day or at night.
llm_translation: The one who was sitting, Rabbi Yochanan, and Kadarish said: leftover, in its time — it is not burned except by day, out of its time — it is burned whether by day or by night.

hebrew_text: וְאֵיתִיבֵיהּ רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אֵין לִי אֶלָּא נִימּוֹל לִשְׁמִינִי שֶׁאֵין נִימּוֹל אֶלָּא בַּיּוֹם, מִנַּיִן לְרַבּוֹת לְתִשְׁעָה, לַעֲשָׂרָה, לְאַחַד עָשָׂר לִשְׁנֵים עָשָׂר (מִנַּיִן)? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וּבַיּוֹם״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Elazar raises an objection to Rabbi Yoḥanan I have only is circumcised on eighth may be circumcised only during the day. From where to include on the ninth, tenth, eleventh, twelfth From where the verse states: “And on the day,”
llm_translation: And Rabbi Elazar raised an objection to Rabbi Yochanan: I have only the eighth day for circumcision, for circumcision is only on the day. From where do we derive to include the ninth, the tenth, the eleventh, and the twelfth (days)? The Talmud teaches: "And on the day."

hebrew_text: וַאֲפִילּוּ לְמַאן דְּלָא דָּרֵישׁ וָאו, וָאו וְהֵי דָּרֵישׁ. אִישְׁתִּיק.
human_translation: And even who does not expound vav , expounds vav and heh was silent,
llm_translation: And even according to the one who does not expound, expound and expound. He remained silent.

hebrew_text: בָּתַר דִּנְפַק, אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן לְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: רָאִיתִי לְבֶן פְּדָת שֶׁיּוֹשֵׁב וְדוֹרֵשׁ כְּמֹשֶׁה מִפִּי הַגְּבוּרָה. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: דִּידֵיהּ הִיא? מַתְנִיתָא הִיא. הֵיכָא תְּנָא לֵיהּ? בְּתוֹרַת כֹּהֲנִים. נְפַק, תַּנְיַיהּ בִּתְלָתָא יוֹמֵי, וְסַבְרַהּ בִּתְלָתָא יַרְחֵי.
human_translation: After left, Rabbi Yoḥanan, said to Reish Lakish: I saw that son of Pedat, was sitting and expounding as Moses from the mouth of the Almighty. Reish Lakish said to him: his own? It is a baraita . Where is this taught? in Torat Kohanim , went out learned in three days, and reached understanding of it in three months.
llm_translation: After he went out, Rabbi Yohanan said to Reish Lakish: "I saw the son of Pedat sitting and expounding like Moses from the mouth of the Almighty." Reish Lakish said to him: "Is he of our caliber?" "He is a Mishnah," he replied. "Where did he learn it from?" "In the Torah of the Priests." He went out, taught it for three days, and she accepted it for three months.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: עָרֵל שֶׁהִזָּה — הַזָּאָתוֹ כְּשֵׁרָה. מִידֵי דְּהָוֵה אַטְּבוּל יוֹם, שֶׁאַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאָסוּר בִּתְרוּמָה, כָּשֵׁר בַּפָּרָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: an uncircumcised sprinkled his sprinkling is valid, just as it is who immersed himself that day As, although is prohibited from teruma , fit for heifer.
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: An uncircumcised person who immersed — his immersion is valid. Because when he becomes ritually pure that day, even though he is prohibited from partaking of the priestly portion, he is valid for the heifer.

hebrew_text: מָה לִטְבוּל יוֹם — שֶׁכֵּן מוּתָּר בְּמַעֲשֵׂר! אַטּוּ אֲנַן לַאֲכִילָה קָאָמְרִינַן, אֲנַן לִנְגִיעָה קָאָמְרִינַן: וּמָה טְבוּל יוֹם שֶׁאָסוּר בִּנְגִיעָה דִּתְרוּמָה — מוּתָּר בַּפָּרָה, עָרֵל שֶׁמּוּתָּר בִּנְגִיעָה — אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁמּוּתָּר בַּפָּרָה?!
human_translation: one who immersed himself that day he is permitted to tithes, Is that to say we are speaking about eating? We spoke to touching, If one who immersed himself that day who is forbidden to touch teruma , permitted in heifer; uncircumcised, who is permitted to touch is it not right that permitted in the heifer?
llm_translation: What is the difference with a Tevul Yom? — That it is permitted for Ma'aser! But we are talking about eating, we are talking about touching. And what about a Tevul Yom that is prohibited for touching Terumah — it is permitted for a cow, but a foreskin that is permitted for touching — is it not logical that it is permitted for a cow?!

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: עָרֵל שֶׁהִזָּה — הַזָּאָתוֹ כְּשֵׁרָה. וּמַעֲשֶׂה הָיָה וְהִכְשִׁירוּ חֲכָמִים הַזָּאָתוֹ.
human_translation: That is also taught an uncircumcised sprinkled his sprinkling is valid. And an incident occurred and the Sages validated his sprinkling.
llm_translation: It was taught in a baraita: Namai the Elder said: An uncircumcised person who immersed — his immersion is valid. And there was an incident where the Sages validated his immersion.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: טוּמְטוּם שֶׁקִּידֵּשׁ — קִידּוּשׁוֹ פָּסוּל, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא סְפֵק עָרֵל, וְעָרֵל פָּסוּל לְקַדֵּשׁ. וְאַנְדְּרוֹגִינוֹס שֶׁקִּידֵּשׁ — קִידּוּשׁוֹ כָּשֵׁר. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אַף אַנְדְּרוֹגִינוֹס שֶׁקִּידֵּשׁ — קִדּוּשָׁיו פְּסוּלִים, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁסְּפֵק אִשָּׁה [הוּא], וְאִשָּׁה פְּסוּלָה מִלְּקַדֵּשׁ. קָתָנֵי מִיהָא: עָרֵל וּסְפֵק עָרֵל פָּסוּל מִלְּקַדֵּשׁ!
human_translation: raises an objection a tumtum sanctified his sanctification is invalid because uncertainty uncircumcised, and an uncircumcised is disqualified from sanctifying But a hermaphrodite sanctified his sanctification is valid. Rabbi Yehuda says: Even a hermaphrodite sanctified his sanctification is invalid, because uncertainty a woman, and a woman is disqualified from sanctifying In any event, teaches uncircumcised, and uncertainty uncircumcised, is disqualified from sanctifying
llm_translation: Challenger: If a tumtum who performed kiddush - his kiddush is invalid, because he is in doubt whether he is uncircumcised, and an uncircumcised person is invalid to sanctify. And an androgynos who performed kiddush - his kiddush is valid. Rabbi Yehuda says: Even an androgynos who performed kiddush - his sanctifications are invalid, because he is in doubt whether he is a woman, and a woman is invalid to sanctify. It was taught in a Baraita: An uncircumcised person and one in doubt of being uncircumcised are invalid to sanctify!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: הַאי תַּנָּא — תַּנָּא דְּבֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא הוּא, דִּמְרַבֵּי לֵיהּ לְעָרֵל כְּטָמֵא. דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: ״אִישׁ אִישׁ״, לְרַבּוֹת הֶעָרֵל.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: This tanna is a tanna from the school of Rabbi Akiva, who includes the uncircumcised as the ritually impure. As it is taught Rabbi Akiva says “Any man to include uncircumcised,
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: This Tanna — he is a Tanna of the school of Rabbi Akiva, for he increases the stringency of the law regarding an uncircumcised person like one who is ritually impure. As it was taught: Rabbi Akiva says, "A man, a man," to include the uncircumcised.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: הֲוָה יָתֵיבְנָא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב יוֹסֵף, וְקַשְׁיָא לִי: לָא לִישְׁתְּמִיט תַּנָּא וְלִיתְנֵי הֶעָרֵל וְהַטָּמֵא, וְלֵימָא רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא הִיא.
human_translation: Rava said: I was sitting before Rav Yosef, and I had difficulty: not to find a tanna who teaches the uncircumcised and the ritually impure and we should say Rabbi Akiva?
llm_translation: Rava said: I was sitting before Rav Yosef, and a difficulty arose for me: The Mishnah does not include the case of the uncircumcised and the ritually impure, and one might say that it is the opinion of Rabbi Akiva.

hebrew_text: וְלָא? וְהָא קָתָנֵי: הֶעָרֵל וְהַטָּמֵא פְּטוּרִים מִן הָרְאִיָּיה! הָתָם מִשּׁוּם דִּמְאִיס.
human_translation: And not But isn’t it taught uncircumcised and ritually impure are exempt from appearance there because he is repulsive,
llm_translation: And not? And this is what it teaches: The uncircumcised and the impure are exempt from seeing! There, because it is repulsive.

hebrew_text: וְאָזְדוּ לְטַעְמַיְיהוּ. דְּתַנְיָא: הַכֹּל כְּשֵׁרִים לְקַדֵּשׁ — חוּץ מֵחֵרֵשׁ שׁוֹטֶה וְקָטָן, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה מַכְשִׁיר בַּקָּטָן וּפוֹסֵל בְּאִשָּׁה וּבְאַנְדְּרוֹגִינוֹס.
human_translation: And follow their reasoning As it is taught All are fit to sanctify except for a deaf-mute, an imbecile, and a minor. Rabbi Yehuda deems a minor fit but deems a woman and a hermaphrodite unfit.
llm_translation: And they went according to their reasons. As it was taught: Everything is fit for sanctification - except for a deaf-mute, a fool, and a minor. Rabbi Yehuda deems the minor fit, and disqualifies with regard to a woman and an androgynous.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבָּנַן — דִּכְתִיב: ״וְלָקְחוּ לַטָּמֵא מֵעֲפַר שְׂרֵיפַת הַחַטָּאת״, הָנָךְ דְּפָסְלִי בַּאֲסִיפָה — פְּסוּלִין בְּקִידּוּשׁ, הָנָךְ דִּכְשֵׁרִין בַּאֲסִיפָה — כְּשֵׁרִים בְּקִידּוּשׁ.
human_translation: What is the reasoning of the Rabbis? As it is written: “And they shall take for the impure of the ashes of the burning of the sin-offering, those who are unfit for gathering are unfit for sanctification, those who are fit for gathering are fit for sanctification.
llm_translation: What is the reason of the Rabbis? — As it is written: "And they shall take for the unclean person some of the ashes of the burnt sin offering" (Numbers 19:17). Those that are disqualified in the gathering are disqualified for sanctification; those that are qualified in the gathering are qualified for sanctification.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אָמַר לָךְ: אִם כֵּן, נֵימָא קְרָא ״וְלָקַח״, מַאי ״וְלָקְחוּ״? דַּאֲפִילּוּ הָנָךְ דִּפְסוּלִין הָתָם, כְּשֵׁרִים הָכָא.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda said to you: If so, let the verse state: And he shall take. What “And they shall take”? that even those who are unfit there are fit here.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda said to you: If so, let us say the verse "and he shall take," what is "and they shall take"? For even those that are disqualified there, are valid here.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, אִשָּׁה נָמֵי! ״וְנָתַן״ וְלֹא ״וְנָתְנָה״. וְרַבָּנַן — אִי כְּתִיב: ״וְלָקַח״ ״וְנָתַן״, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא שָׁקֵיל חַד וְיָהֵיב חַד, כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״וְלָקְחוּ״.
human_translation: If so, a woman also “And he shall place and not: And she shall place And the Rabbis If was written: And he shall take…and he shall place, I would say one take and one place The Merciful One writes: “And they shall take,”
llm_translation: So it is, a woman indeed! "And he shall give" and not "and she shall give." And the Rabbis - if it were written: "and he shall take" "and he shall give," I would say he takes one and gives one, but the Merciful One wrote "and they shall take."

hebrew_text: וְאִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״וְלָקְחוּ״ ״וְנָתְנוּ״, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא דְּשָׁקְלִי תְּרֵי וְיָהֲבִי תְּרֵי, כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״וְלָקְחוּ״ ״וְנָתַן״ — דַּאֲפִילּוּ שָׁקְלִי תְּרֵי וְיָהֵיב חַד.
human_translation: And if the Merciful One had written: And they shall take…and they shall place, I would say that two take and two place The Torah states: “And they shall take…and he shall place,” that even two take and one places
llm_translation: If the Merciful One wrote "and they shall take" and "and they shall give," I would have said that one should take two and give two. But since the Merciful One wrote "and they shall take" and "and he shall give" - even if one takes two and gives one.

hebrew_text: ״וְהִזָּה הַטָּהוֹר עַל הַטָּמֵא״, ״טָהוֹר״ — מִכְּלָל שֶׁהוּא טָמֵא, לִימֵּד עַל טְבוּל יוֹם שֶׁכָּשֵׁר בַּפָּרָה.
human_translation: “And the pure person shall sprinkle upon the impure” “pure”; by inference that he is ritually impure. teaches that one who immersed himself that day is fit to heifer.
llm_translation: "And he shall sprinkle the clean upon the unclean," "clean" - from the inclusive that he is unclean, taught regarding one who immersed during the day that he is fit for the heifer."

hebrew_text: בְּעוֹ מִינֵּיהּ מֵרַב שֵׁשֶׁת: עָרֵל מַהוּ בַּמַּעֲשֵׂר? כִּי הֵיכִי דְּיָלֵיף פֶּסַח מִמַּעֲשֵׂר לְעִנְיַן אֲנִינוּת, יָלֵיף נָמֵי מַעֲשֵׂר מִפֶּסַח לְעִנְיַן עֲרֵלוּת,
human_translation: They raised a dilemma before Rav Sheshet: an uncircumcised what is with regard to tithe? just as Paschal lamb is derived from tithe with regard to acute mourning, too, tithe is derived from Paschal lamb with regard to lack of circumcision,
llm_translation: He asked from Rav Sheshet: Uncircumcised, what about in regards to tithing? Just as he deduces Passover from tithing regarding the matter of affliction, he should also deduce tithing from Passover regarding the matter of uncircumcision.

hebrew_text: אוֹ דִלְמָא: חָמוּר מִקַּל יָלֵיף, קַל מֵחָמוּר לָא יָלֵיף.
human_translation: Or perhaps stringent is derived from lenient lenient is not derived from stringent
llm_translation: Or perhaps: the stringent ruling from the lenient ruling can be derived, but the lenient ruling from the stringent ruling cannot be derived.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהוּ, תְּנֵיתוּהָ: הַתְּרוּמָה וְהַבִּכּוּרִים חַיָּיבִים עֲלֵיהֶן מִיתָה וָחוֹמֶשׁ, וַאֲסוּרִין לְזָרִים,
human_translation: said to them: You learned teruma and first fruits he is liable death and one-fifth and they are forbidden to non-priests.
llm_translation: He said to them, "You should teach it: the terumah and the first fruits are liable for them to receive death and a fifth, and are forbidden to non-priests."

hebrew_text: וְהֵן נִכְסֵי כֹהֵן, וְעוֹלִין בְּאֶחָד וּמֵאָה, וּטְעוּנִין רְחִיצַת יָדַיִם וְהֶעֱרֵב שֶׁמֶשׁ. הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ בַּתְּרוּמָה וּבַבִּכּוּרִים, מַה שֶּׁאֵין כֵּן בַּמַּעֲשֵׂר.
human_translation: And they are the property of the priest and they are nullified, in one hundred and one, and they require washing of the hands and sunset these to teruma and first fruits, which is not with tithe.
llm_translation: And they are the possessions of a Kohen, and they ascend in one and one hundred, and they require washing of the hands and the mixing of the water. These are in the category of Terumah and Bikurim, which is not the case with Maaser.

hebrew_text: וְאִם אִיתָא — נִיתְנֵי: עָרֵל אָסוּר בָּהֶן, מַה שֶּׁאֵין כֵּן בַּמַּעֲשֵׂר!
human_translation: And if it is so let teach: It is prohibited for an uncircumcised man which is not with tithe.
llm_translation: If it is stated - it was taught: uncircumcised is forbidden in them, which is not the case with tithing!

hebrew_text: תְּנָא וְשַׁיַּיר. וּמַאי שַׁיַּיר דְּהַאי שַׁיַּיר?
human_translation: taught and he omitted What did he omit that he omitted this
llm_translation: Mishna: "Tana v'shayyar. U'mai shayyar d'hai shayyar?"

hebrew_text: שַׁיַּיר דְּקָא תָנֵי סֵיפָא: יֵשׁ בַּמַּעֲשֵׂר וּבַבִּכּוּרִים מַה שֶּׁאֵין כֵּן בַּתְּרוּמָה, שֶׁהַמַּעֲשֵׂר וְהַבִּכּוּרִים טְעוּנִין הֲבָאַת מָקוֹם, וּטְעוּנִין וִידּוּי, וַאֲסוּרִין לְאוֹנֵן, וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן מַתִּיר. וְחַיָּיבִין בְּבִיעוּר, וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן פּוֹטֵר.
human_translation: He omitted as he teaches the latter clause There are tithe and first fruits, which is not with teruma . As tithe and first fruits require brought to place, and they require a declaration, and they are forbidden to an acute mourner; and Rabbi Shimon permits And they require eradication and Rabbi Shimon exempts
llm_translation: The Talmudic text states: "Shayir is teaching in the latter part: There is in Maaser and in Bikkurim something that is not the case in Terumah, for Maaser and Bikkurim require a designated place, and they require declaration, and they are prohibited to a mourner, yet Rabbi Shimon permits it. And they are subject to biur, and Rabbi Shimon exempts."

hebrew_text: וְאִילּוּ אָסוּר לְבַעֵר מֵהֶן בְּטוּמְאָה,
human_translation: And yet it is prohibited to burn in ritual impurity
llm_translation: And if it is forbidden to burn them in impurity,

hebrew_text: וְאוֹכְלָן בְּטוּמְאַת עַצְמָן לוֹקֶה, מַה שֶּׁאֵין כֵּן בַּתְּרוּמָה — לָא קָתָנֵי. אַלְמָא תָּנֵי וְשַׁיַּיר.
human_translation: and one who eats them when they themselves, are ritually impure is flogged, which is not with teruma ; does not teach. Apparently, taught and omitted
llm_translation: "And one who eats terumah in their impurity is liable, which is not the case with regard to their own impurity — it is not taught. This implies that it was taught and left."

hebrew_text: וַאֲסוּרִין לְאוֹנֵן, וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן מַתִּיר. מְנָא לְהוּ — דִּכְתִיב: ״לֹא תוּכַל לֶאֱכוֹל בִּשְׁעָרֶיךָ מַעְשַׂר דְּגָנְךָ וְתִירֹשְׁךָ וְיִצְהָרֶךָ וְגוֹ׳ וּתְרוּמַת יָדֶךָ״, וְאָמַר מָר: ״תְּרוּמַת יָדֶךָ״ — אֵלּוּ בִּכּוּרִים, וְאִיתַּקַּשׁ בִּכּוּרִים לְמַעֲשֵׂר: מָה מַעֲשֵׂר אָסוּר לְאוֹנֵן — אַף בִּכּוּרִים אָסוּר לְאוֹנֵן.
human_translation: are forbidden to an acute mourner; and Rabbi Shimon permits From where do As it is written: “You may not eat within your gates the tithe of your grain, or of your wine, or of your oil…nor the offering of your hand” and the Master said: “The offering [ teruma ] of your hand,” these are first fruits. And first fruits are juxtaposed to tithe: Just as tithe is forbidden to an acute mourner, so too, first fruits forbidden to an acute mourner.
llm_translation: The text reads: "And it is forbidden for a mourner, and Rabbi Shimon permits. From where do they derive this? — As it is written: 'You may not eat within your gates the tithe of your grain, your wine, your oil, and so forth, and the offering of your hand,' and the Master said: 'the offering of your hand' — these are the first fruits, and the first fruits are connected to the tithe: just as the tithe is forbidden for a mourner, so too the first fruits are forbidden for a mourner."

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: תְּרוּמָה קְרִינְהוּ רַחֲמָנָא, מָה תְּרוּמָה מוּתֶּרֶת לְאוֹנֵן — אַף בִּכּוּרִים מוּתָּרִים לְאוֹנֵן.
human_translation: And Rabbi Shimon the Merciful One calls “ teruma ,” Just as teruma is permitted to an acute mourner, so too, first fruits permitted to an acute mourner.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon said: "Terumah is called 'mercy.' Just as Terumah is permitted for a mourner, so too firstborn animals are permitted for a mourner."

hebrew_text: וְחַיָּיבִין בְּבִיעוּר, וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן פּוֹטֵר. מָר מַקֵּישׁ וּמָר לָא מַקֵּישׁ.
human_translation: And require eradication and Rabbi Shimon exempts One Sage, juxtaposes And one Sage, does not juxtapose
llm_translation: And they are obligated in bi'ur, and Rabbi Shimon exempts. Mar makes a comparison and Mar does not make a comparison.

hebrew_text: וְאָסוּר לְבַעֵר מֵהֶן בְּטוּמְאָה, וְאוֹכְלָן בְּטוּמְאַת עַצְמָן לוֹקֶה, מְנָלַן — דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: ״לֹא בִעַרְתִּי מִמֶּנּוּ בְּטָמֵא״, בֵּין שֶׁאֲנִי טָמֵא וְהוּא טָהוֹר, בֵּין שֶׁאֲנִי טָהוֹר וְהוּא טָמֵא.
human_translation: it is prohibited to burn in ritual impurity, and one who eats them when they themselves, are ritually impure is flogged, From where do we As it is taught Rabbi Shimon says: “I did not consume of it while impure” whether I, ritually impure, and was ritually pure, whether I was ritually pure and was ritually impure.
llm_translation: It is forbidden to burn them in their impurity, and one who eats them in their own impurity is liable to receive lashes. From where do we derive this? As it was taught: Rabbi Shimon says, "I did not burn it in its impurity," whether I am impure and it is pure, or I am pure and it is impure.

hebrew_text: וְהֵיכָא מוּזְהָר עַל אֲכִילָתוֹ אֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ. טוּמְאַת הַגּוּף בְּהֶדְיָא כְּתִיב בֵּיהּ: ״נֶפֶשׁ אֲשֶׁר תִּגַּע בּוֹ וְטָמְאָה עַד הָעָרֶב וְלֹא יֹאכַל מִן הַקֳּדָשִׁים כִּי אִם רָחַץ בְּשָׂרוֹ בַּמָּיִם״!
human_translation: And where one is warned against eating I do not know. ritual impurity of the body explicitly written, “The soul that touches it shall be impure until the evening, and he shall not eat from the holy things unless he has washed his flesh in water”
llm_translation: The text reads: "And where is it warned against its consumption, I do not know. The impurity of the body is written in it: 'The soul that touches it and is impure until evening shall not eat of the holy things unless he washes his flesh with water'!"

hebrew_text: הָכִי קָמִיבַּעְיָא לֵיהּ: טוּמְאַת עַצְמוֹ מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״לֹא תוּכַל לֶאֱכוֹל בִּשְׁעָרֶיךָ מַעְשַׂר דְּגָנְךָ״, וּלְהַלָּן הוּא אוֹמֵר ״בִּשְׁעָרֶיךָ תֹּאכְלֶנּוּ הַטָּמֵא וְהַטָּהוֹר יַחְדָּו כַּצְּבִי וְכָאַיָּל״, וְתָנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: אֲפִילּוּ טָמֵא וְטָהוֹר אוֹכְלִין עַל שׁוּלְחָן אֶחָד בִּקְעָרָה אַחַת וְאֵינָן חוֹשְׁשִׁין, וְקָאָמַר רַחֲמָנָא: הָהוּא דַּאֲמַרִי לָךְ הָתָם ״בִּשְׁעָרֶיךָ תֹּאכְלֶנּוּ״ — הָכָא לָא תֵּיכוֹל.
human_translation: this is dilemma he is raising: From where itself ritual impurity? The verse states: “You may not eat within your gates the tithe of your grain” and later it states “You shall eat it within your gates, the impure and the pure alike, as the gazelle and as the hart” And of the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: Even a ritually impure and a ritually pure may eat on one table out of one bowl without concern. And the Merciful One states: That which I said to you there, “You shall eat it within your gates,” here, you may not eat
llm_translation: So did Rabbi Yehuda ask him: From where do we derive the impurity of bone itself? The teaching states: "You may not eat within your gates the tithe of your grain," and elsewhere it says, "Within your gates you shall eat it, the impure and the pure together, like the gazelle and the deer." And it was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael: Even if the impure and the pure eat at one table from one bowl, they are not concerned. And the Merciful One says: That which He said to you there, "Within your gates you shall eat it" — here you may not eat.

hebrew_text: מַה שֶּׁאֵין כֵּן בַּתְּרוּמָה. מְנָא לַן? אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״לֹא בִעַרְתִּי מִמֶּנּוּ בְּטָמֵא״ — מִמֶּנּוּ אִי אַתָּה מַבְעִיר, אֲבָל אַתָּה מַבְעִיר שֶׁמֶן שֶׁל תְּרוּמָה שֶׁנִּטְמָא.
human_translation: which is not with teruma . From where do we Rabbi Abbahu said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: As the verse states: “I did not consume of it while impure” of it, you may not burn but you may burn the oil of teruma that has become ritually impure.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: That which is not the case with Terumah. Whence do we know? Rabbi Abahu said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan, as the verse states: "I have not consumed it in a state of impurity" - from it you do not consume, but you do consume the oil of Terumah that became impure.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא: מִמֶּנּוּ אִי אַתָּה מַבְעִיר, אֲבָל אַתָּה מַבְעִיר שֶׁמֶן שֶׁל קֹדֶשׁ שֶׁנִּטְמָא! לָאו קַל וָחוֹמֶר הוּא? וּמָה מַעֲשֵׂר הַקַּל אָמְרָה תּוֹרָה ״לֹא בִעַרְתִּי מִמֶּנּוּ בְּטָמֵא״ — קֹדֶשׁ חָמוּר לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן?!
human_translation: But say Of it you may not burn, but you may burn consecrated oil that became ritually impure. not an a fortiori If the tithe, which is lenient, the Torah said: “I did not burn of it while impure,” consecrated which is stringent, not all the more so
llm_translation: And why? If from it you are not burning, but you are burning holy oil that became impure! Is it not a fortiori? And what is the lighter tithe that the Torah said "I did not burn from it in a state of impurity" - holy is more stringent, all the more so?!

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, תְּרוּמָה נָמֵי קַל וָחוֹמֶר הוּא! הָא כְּתִיב ״מִמֶּנּוּ״!
human_translation: If so, teruma as well, it is an a fortiori Isn’t it written “of it”?
llm_translation: If so, terumah is a logical inference a fortiori! For it is written, "from it"!

hebrew_text: וּמָה רָאִיתָ? מִסְתַּבְּרָא קֹדֶשׁ לָא מְמַעֵיטְנָא שֶׁכֵּן פנקעכ״ס:
human_translation: And what did you see It is reasonable I do not exclude consecrated items peh , nun , kuf , ayin , kaf , samekh ,
llm_translation: And what did you see? A holy gathering, not diminishing, as it is written in the book of Psalms.

hebrew_text: פִּגּוּל, נוֹתָר, קׇרְבָּן, מְעִילָה, כָּרֵת, וְאָסוּר לְאוֹנֵן.
human_translation: Piggul : Notar : Offering [ korban ]: Misuse [ me’ila ]: Karet : Forbidden to an acute mourner [ asur le’onen ]:
llm_translation: פִּגּוּל, נוֹתָר, קׇרְבָּן, מְעִילָה, כָּרֵת, וְאָסוּר לְאוֹנֵן. Pigul, notar, korban, meilah, karet, and it is forbidden for a mourner.

hebrew_text: אַדְּרַבָּה, תְּרוּמָה לָא מְמַעֵיטְנָא שֶׁכֵּן מחפ״ז: מִיתָה וָחוֹמֶשׁ, וְאֵין לָהּ פִּדְיוֹן, וַאֲסוּרָה לְזָרִים!
human_translation: On the contrary, it is teruma that I would not exclude as mem , ḥet , peh , zayin , Death [ mita ]: One-fifth [ ḥomesh ]: And does not have redemption [ pidyon ]: And it is forbidden to non-priests [ zarim ].
llm_translation: The great Rabbi, we do not lessen the contribution, as it is stated in Exodus 30:15: "The rich shall not give more, and the poor shall not give less than half a shekel, when they give the offering of the Lord, to make atonement for your souls." And it is not redeemable, and it is forbidden to non-priests!

hebrew_text: הָנָךְ נְפִישָׁן. וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: כָּרֵת עֲדִיפָא.
human_translation: Those are numerous And if you wish, say karet , is more severe
llm_translation: Here is the English translation: "Their souls are at rest. And if you wish, say: 'Cutting is preferable.'"

hebrew_text: וְאוֹכְלָן בְּטוּמְאַת עַצְמָן לוֹקֶה, מַה שֶּׁאֵין כֵּן בַּתְּרוּמָה. מִילְקָא הוּא דְּלָא לָקֵי, הָא אִיסּוּרָא אִיכָּא — מְנָלַן? אָמַר קְרָא: ״בִּשְׁעָרֶיךָ תֹּאכְלֶנּוּ״ — לָזֶה וְלֹא לְאַחֵר. וְלָאו הַבָּא מִכְּלַל עֲשֵׂה — עֲשֵׂה.
human_translation: one who eats when they themselves, are ritually impure is flogged, which is not with teruma . it is lashes that he does not receive however, a prohibition is From where do we The verse states: “You shall eat it within your gates” this, but not another And a prohibition that stems from a positive mitzva a positive mitzva,
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "And one who eats them in their impurity is liable, which is not the case with terumah. What is the reason that one is not liable for milk? Because there is no prohibition — from where do we derive this? The verse says: 'You shall eat it within your gates' — for this one and not for another. And is it not derived from a positive commandment — it is a positive commandment."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: מֵרֵישָׁא נָמֵי שָׁמְעַתְּ מִינַּהּ דִּתְנָא וְשַׁיַּיר — מִדְּלָא קָתָנֵי
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: From the first part as well, you conclude that he taught and omitted from he does not teach
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said: From the beginning, you should listen to her, as it was taught and left over - because it was not taught.

hebrew_text: וְנוֹהֲגִין בִּשְׁאָר שְׁנֵי שָׁבוּעַ, וְאֵין לָהֶם פִּדְיוֹן. מַה שֶּׁאֵין כֵּן בַּמַּעֲשֵׂר. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: apply in all the years of the seven-year and they do not have redemption, This is not with second tithe, Learn from here
llm_translation: And they practice in the rest of the two weeks, and they do not have redemption. What is not so in tithing. Learn from it.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: נִשְׁתַּיְּירוּ בּוֹ צִיצִין הַמְעַכְּבִין אֶת הַמִּילָה — הֲרֵי זֶה אֵינוֹ אוֹכֵל לֹא בַּתְּרוּמָה, וְלֹא בַּפֶּסַח, וְלֹא בַּקֳּדָשִׁים, וְלֹא בַּמַּעֲשֵׂר. מַאי לָאו מַעְשַׂר דָּגָן, לָא — מַעְשַׂר בְּהֵמָה.
human_translation: Come hear shreds that invalidate the circumcision one may not eat teruma , nor the Paschal lamb, nor sacrificial food, nor tithe. What, is it not tithe of produce, No, animal tithe.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Ta shema: nishtayiru bo tzitzin ha'ma'akvin et ha'milah — harei zeh einu okhel lo batrumah, v'lo bapesach, v'lo bakodashim, v'lo bama'aser. Mai lav ma'aser dagan, la — ma'aser behemah." English translation: "Come and hear: If there remain in it fringes that delay the circumcision — this one does not eat neither from the heave-offering, nor from the Passover offering, nor from the holy things, nor from the tithe. What is meant by 'not from the tithe of grain'? Not — the tithe of animals."

hebrew_text: מַעְשַׂר בְּהֵמָה הַיְינוּ קָדָשִׁים? וְלִיטַעְמָיךְ, מִי לָא תְּנַן פֶּסַח וְקָתָנֵי קָדָשִׁים!
human_translation: Animal tithe is sacrificial food, And according to your reasoning didn’t we learn Paschal lamb, and it teaches sacrificial food?
llm_translation: Tithe animal this sanctified? And to learn, who not we teach Passover and we teach sanctified!

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא פֶּסַח וְקָדָשִׁים צְרִיכִי, דְּאִי תְּנָא פֶּסַח — מִשּׁוּם דַּעֲרֵלוּת בְּפֶסַח כְּתִיבָא, אֲבָל קָדָשִׁים — אֵימָא לָא. וְאִי תְּנָא קָדָשִׁים, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: מַאי קָדָשִׁים — פֶּסַח. אֶלָּא מַעְשַׂר בְּהֵמָה לְמָה לִי?
human_translation: Granted, necessary the Paschal lamb and sacrificial food. As, if taught the Paschal lamb, because lack of circumcision written with regard to the Paschal lamb, but sacrificial food, say no And if taught sacrificial food, I would say: What sacrificial food? the Paschal lamb, But why do I animal tithe
llm_translation: In peace Passover and holy things are needed, for if one teaches Passover — because of uncircumcision in Passover it is written, but holy things — why not. And if one teaches holy things, I would say: What are holy things — Passover. Rather, why do I need tithes of animals?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מַעֲשֵׂר רִאשׁוֹן, וְרַבִּי מֵאִיר הִיא, דְּאָמַר: מַעֲשֵׂר רִאשׁוֹן אָסוּר לְזָרִים.
human_translation: Rather, first tithe, and is Rabbi Meir, who said first tithe is forbidden to common
llm_translation: Rather, the first tithe, and Rabbi Meir it is, as he said: "The first tithe is forbidden to non-priests."

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, מִדְּתָנֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר רַב מִדִּפְתִּי: עָרֵל אָסוּר בִּשְׁתֵּי מַעַשְׂרוֹת. מַאי לָאו: אֶחָד מַעְשַׂר דָּגָן וְאֶחָד מַעְשַׂר בְּהֵמָה! הָכָא נָמֵי, מַעֲשֵׂר רִאשׁוֹן וְרַבִּי מֵאִיר.
human_translation: Come hear from Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Rav of Difti taught An uncircumcised is prohibited of two tithes. What, is it not one tithe of produce and one animal tithe? Here, too, first tithe, and Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: Come and hear, as it was taught by Rabbi Chiya bar Rav from Difti: An uncircumcised person is prohibited in two tithes. What is the reason? One is the tithe of grain and one is the tithe of animals! Here too, the first tithe and Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: אוֹנֵן — אָסוּר בַּמַּעֲשֵׂר, וּמוּתָּר בַּתְּרוּמָה וּבַפָּרָה. טְבוּל יוֹם — אָסוּר בִּתְרוּמָה, וּמוּתָּר בַּפָּרָה וּבַמַּעֲשֵׂר. מְחוּסַּר כִּפּוּרִים — אָסוּר בַּפָּרָה, וּמוּתָּר בַּתְּרוּמָה וּבַמַּעֲשֵׂר. וְאִם אִיתָא — נִיתְנֵי: עָרֵל אָסוּר בַּתְּרוּמָה, וּמוּתָּר בַּפָּרָה וּבַמַּעֲשֵׂר!
human_translation: Come hear It is prohibited for an acute mourner tithe, but permitted teruma and heifer. It is prohibited for one who immersed himself that day teruma , but permitted heifer and tithe. It is prohibited for lacks atonement, heifer, but permitted teruma and tithe. And if it is so let teach: It is prohibited for an uncircumcised teruma , but permitted heifer and tithe.
llm_translation: Come and hear: An onen is prohibited in ma'aser, and permitted in terumah and parah. A tevul yom is prohibited in terumah, and permitted in parah and ma'aser. One lacking atonement is prohibited in parah, and permitted in terumah and ma'aser. And if it is said: A uncircumcised person is prohibited in terumah, and permitted in parah and ma'aser!

hebrew_text: הַאי תַּנָּא — דְּבֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא הִיא, דִּמְרַבֵּי לֵיהּ לְעָרֵל כְּטָמֵא. דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: ״אִישׁ אִישׁ״ — לְרַבּוֹת אֶת הֶעָרֵל.
human_translation: this taught from the school of Rabbi Akiva, who includes an uncircumcised as ritually impure. As it is taught Rabbi Akiva says: “Any man to include uncircumcised;
llm_translation: This is the Tanna — the school of Rabbi Akiva, for they increase the impurity of the uncircumcised like the impure. As it was taught, Rabbi Akiva says: "Each man" — to include the uncircumcised.

hebrew_text: וּמַאן תַּנָּא דִּפְלִיג עֲלֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא תַּנָּא דְּ(רַבִּי) יוֹסֵף הַבַּבְלִי הִיא. דְּתַנְיָא: שְׂרֵפַת אוֹנֵן וּמְחוּסַּר כִּפּוּרִים — כְּשֵׁרָה. (רַבִּי) יוֹסֵף הַבַּבְלִי אוֹמֵר: אוֹנֵן — כְּשֵׁרָה, מְחוּסַּר כִּפּוּרִים — פְּסוּלָה.
human_translation: And who tanna who disagrees with Rabbi Akiva? It is tanna Rabbi Yosef the Babylonian. As it is taught The burning by an acute mourner or by lacks atonement is valid. Rabbi Yosef the Babylonian says: an acute mourner, valid; lacks atonement, invalid.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And who is the Tanna who disputes with regard to the ruling of Rabbi Akiva? It is the Tanna of Rabbi Yosef the Babylonian. For it was taught: A burnt offering of a bird and one lacking atonement — it is valid. Rabbi Yosef the Babylonian says: A bird offering — it is valid, one lacking atonement — it is invalid."

hebrew_text: וְאַף רַבִּי יִצְחָק סָבַר עָרֵל אָסוּר בְּמַעֲשֵׂר, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: מִנַּיִן לֶעָרֵל שֶׁאָסוּר בַּמַּעֲשֵׂר — נֶאֱמַר ״מִמֶּנּוּ״ בַּמַּעֲשֵׂר, וְנֶאֱמַר ״מִמֶּנּוּ״ בַּפֶּסַח. מָה ״מִמֶּנּוּ״ הָאָמוּר בַּפֶּסַח — עָרֵל אָסוּר בּוֹ, אַף ״מִמֶּנּוּ״ הָאָמוּר בַּמַּעֲשֵׂר — עָרֵל אָסוּר בּוֹ.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yitzḥak, too, maintains an uncircumcised prohibited from tithe, as Rabbi Yitzḥak said: From where an uncircumcised is prohibited from tithe? It is stated: of it with regard to tithe, and it is stated: of it with regard to the Paschal lamb. Just as the Paschal lamb, “of it” is stated, an uncircumcised is prohibited from it, so too, tithe, “of it” is stated, an uncircumcised is prohibited from it.
llm_translation: And even Rabbi Yitzchak holds that an uncircumcised person is prohibited in matters of tithing, as Rabbi Yitzchak said: From where do we derive that an uncircumcised person is prohibited in tithing? It is stated "from him" regarding tithing, and it is also stated "from him" regarding Passover. Just as "from him" that is said regarding Passover - an uncircumcised person is prohibited in it, so too "from him" that is said regarding tithing - an uncircumcised person is prohibited in it.

hebrew_text: מוּפְנֵי. דְּאִי לָא מוּפְנֵי, אִיכָּא לְמִיפְרַךְ: מָה לְפֶסַח, שֶׁכֵּן חַיָּיבִין עָלָיו מִשּׁוּם פִּיגּוּל וְנוֹתָר וְטָמֵא. לָאיֵי אַפְנוֹיֵי מוּפְנֵי.
human_translation: is available, As, if it is not available, can be refuted What to the Paschal lamb? that one is liable for it due to piggul or notar , or ritually impure. not so, is available
llm_translation: Facing. Because if not facing, there is room to differentiate: Just as for the Passover offering, so too are they obligated regarding it for the sake of Pigul, Notar, and Tamei. Therefore, facing is necessary.

hebrew_text: מַאי מוּפְנֵי? אָמַר רָבָא אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: תְּלָתָא ״מִמֶּנּוּ״ כְּתִיבִי בְּפֶסַח: חַד לְגוּפֵיהּ, וְחַד לִגְזֵירָה שָׁוָה, וְחַד —
human_translation: Which is available Rava said Rabbi Yitzḥak said: “Of it” is written three with the Paschal lamb: One for itself, and one for the verbal analogy; and one for
llm_translation: What is the meaning of "mufnei"? Rava said in the name of Rabbi Yitzchak: It is written three times "from it" in regards to the Passover offering: one for itself, and one for the decree of similarity, and one —

hebrew_text: לְמַאן דְּאָמַר: בָּא הַכָּתוּב לִיתֵּן לְךָ עֲשֵׂה אַחַר לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה — אַיְּידֵי דִּכְתִיב ״נוֹתָר״, כְּתִיב נָמֵי ״מִמֶּנּוּ״. וּלְמַאן דְּאָמַר לִיתֵּן לוֹ בֹּקֶר שֵׁנִי לִשְׂרֵיפָתוֹ — אַיְּידֵי דִּכְתִיב ״עַד בֹּקֶר״, כְּתִיב נָמֵי ״מִמֶּנּוּ״.
human_translation: According to the one who says the verse comes to provide you with a positive after the prohibition since “that which remains [ notar ]” is written, “of it” is also written. And according to the one who says to provide him with the second morning for burning, since “until morning” is written, “of it” is also written.
llm_translation: To whom says: the Scripture comes to give you a positive command after a negative command - since it is written "leftover," it is also written "from it." And to whom says to give him a second morning for its burning - since it is written "until morning," it is also written "from it."

hebrew_text: תְּלָתָא ״מִמֶּנּוּ״ כְּתִיבִי בְּמַעֲשֵׂר: חַד לְגוּפֵיהּ, וְחַד לִדְרַבִּי אֲבָהוּ אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, וְחַד לִדְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ.
human_translation: “of it” is written three with tithe: One for itself; and one for Rabbi Abbahu said Rabbi Yoḥanan and one for Reish Lakish.
llm_translation: Three "from it" is written in the matter of tithing: one for itself, and one for Rabbi Abahu said Rabbi Yohanan, and one for Resh Lakish.

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר רַבִּי סִימַאי: מִנַּיִן לְמַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי שֶׁנִּטְמָא שֶׁמּוּתָּר לְסוּכוֹ — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְלֹא נָתַתִּי מִמֶּנּוּ לְמֵת״. לְמֵת הוּא דְּלֹא נָתַתִּי, הָא לְחַי דֻּומְיָא דְמֵת — נָתַתִּי. אֵיזֶהוּ דָּבָר שֶׁשָּׁוֶה בַּחַיִּים וּבַמֵּתִים? הֱוֵי אוֹמֵר זוֹ סִיכָה.
human_translation: As Reish Lakish said Rabbi Samya said: From where second tithe became ritually impure, it is permitted for one to anoint with it? As it is stated: “Nor did I give of it for the dead.” for the dead that I did not give but for the living similar the dead, I gave what usage is the same for the living and the dead? You must say it is anointing.
llm_translation: The head of the academy, Reish Lakish, said in the name of Rabbi Simai: From where do we derive that the second tithe, which became ritually impure, is permitted for use in one's booth? It is derived from the verse: "And I have not given of it to the dead." It is for the dead that I have not given, but for the living who are similar to the dead - I have given. What is something that is equal for the living and the dead? One should say this is a booth.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ מָר זוּטְרָא: וְאֵימָא לִיקַּח לוֹ אָרוֹן וְתַכְרִיכִים? אָמַר רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: ״מִמֶּנּוּ״ — מִגּוּפוֹ. רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: ״לָא נָתַתִּי״ דֻּומְיָא דְּ״לֹא אָכַלְתִּי״: מָה לְהַלָּן מִגּוּפוֹ — אַף כָּאן מִגּוּפוֹ.
human_translation: Mar Zutra strongly objects to this: But say purchasing a coffin and shrouds for Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said: “Of it” from itself Rav Ashi said “I did not give” similar to “I did not eat”; just as there, from itself, so too here, from itself.
llm_translation: The Master Zutra objected to him: But why not take for himself an ark and cushions? Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said: "From him" - from his own body. Rav Ashe said: "I did not give" is similar to "I did not eat." Just as there, it is from his own body - so too here, it is from his own body.

hebrew_text: וְאַכַּתִּי מוּפְנֶה מִצַּד אֶחָד הוּא. הָנִיחָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר לְמֵדִין וְאֵין מְשִׁיבִין. אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר לְמֵדִין וּמְשִׁיבִין, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר?
human_translation: And still is available from one side, this well according to the one who says one can derive from and one cannot refute it But according to the one who said one can derive from one can refute it what can be said?
llm_translation: And once he turns from one side, he is. It is preferable according to the one who says we teach but do not respond. But according to the one who says we teach and respond, what can be said?

hebrew_text: הָךְ דְּרַבִּי אֲבָהוּ — מִדְּרַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ נָפְקָא. דְּאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ: מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״וַאֲנִי הִנֵּה נָתַתִּי לְךָ אֶת מִשְׁמֶרֶת תְּרוּמֹתָי״ — בִּשְׁתֵּי תְרוּמוֹת הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר: אַחַת תְּרוּמָה טְהוֹרָה, וְאַחַת תְּרוּמָה טְמֵאָה. וְאָמַר רַחֲמָנָא: ״לְךָ״ — שֶׁלְּךָ תְּהֵא, לְהַסָּקָה תַּחַת תַּבְשִׁילְךָ.
human_translation: This of Rabbi Abbahu is derived from what Rav Naḥman said Rabba bar Avuh As Rav Naḥman said Rabba bar Avuh said: What is which is written: “And I, behold, I have given you the charge of My terumot ” the verse is speaking of two terumot , one teruma that is ritually pure and one teruma that is ritually impure. And the Merciful One states: you,” it shall be yours, to burn it beneath your cooked dish.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Hakh d'Rabbi Avahu — mid'Rav Nachman amar Rabba bar Avuh napka. D'amar Rav Nachman amar Rabba bar Avuh: Maai dichtiv: "va'ani hineh natati lekha et mishmeret terumotai" — bishetei terumot hakatuv medaber: achat terumah tehorah, ve'achat terumah teme'ah. Ve'amar rachamana: "lekha" — shelekha tehe, lehasaka tachat tavshilcha. English translation: Thus did Rabbi Avahu say in the name of Rav Nachman, Rabba bar Avuh interjected. For Rav Nachman said in the name of Rabba bar Avuh: What is the meaning of what is written: "And behold, I have given you the charge of My heave offerings"? The Scripture speaks of two heave offerings: one pure heave offering, and one impure heave offering. And the Merciful One said: "to you" — it shall be yours, to be consumed beneath your cooked dish.

hebrew_text: וְכׇל הַטְּמֵאִים כּוּ׳. מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל, אָמַר קְרָא: ״אִישׁ אִישׁ מִזֶּרַע אַהֲרֹן וְהוּא צָרוּעַ אוֹ זָב וְגוֹ׳״. אֵי זֶהוּ דָּבָר שֶׁשָּׁוֶה
human_translation: all who are ritually impure From where are these matters Rabbi Yoḥanan said in the name of Rabbi Yishmael: The verse states: “Any man from the seed of Aaron who is a leper or a zav what matter is the same
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And all the impure ones, etc." Where are these matters derived from? Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of Rabbi Yishmael, who said a verse: "A man, a man from the offspring of Aaron, who is a leper or has a discharge, etc." What is a matter that is similar?

hebrew_text: בְּזַרְעוֹ שֶׁל אַהֲרֹן — הֱוֵי אוֹמֵר זוֹ תְּרוּמָה. וְאֵימָא בְּחָזֶה וָשׁוֹק? אֵינָהּ בְּחוֹזֶרֶת.
human_translation: for seed of Aaron, You must say it is teruma . But say the breast and thigh are not to who returns
llm_translation: With the seed of Aaron - one should say this is terumah. But what about with the chest and the thigh? It is not with the returning.

hebrew_text: תְּרוּמָה נָמֵי, אֵינָהּ בַּחֲלָלָה! חֲלָלָה לָאו זַרְעוֹ דְּאַהֲרֹן הִיא.
human_translation: teruma as well, not to a ḥalala , A ḥalala is not the seed of Aaron.
llm_translation: Truma namei, einah bachalala! Chalala la'av zar'o de'Aharon hi.

hebrew_text: וּמִמַּאי דְּהַאי ״עַד אֲשֶׁר יִטְהָר״, עַד דְּאִיכָּא הֶעֱרֵב שֶׁמֶשׁ, אֵימָא: עַד דְּמַיְיתֵי כַּפָּרָה?
human_translation: And from where that this until he be pure,” until sunset? Say until he brings atonement
llm_translation: And from what is derived this phrase "until he is purified," until there is the evening of the sun, say: until the atonement is completed?

hebrew_text: לָא סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ, דְּתָנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: בְּזָב בַּעַל שְׁתֵּי רְאִיּוֹת וּבִמְצוֹרָע מוּסְגָּר הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר, דּוּמְיָא דִּ״טְמֵא נֶפֶשׁ״, מָה ״טְמֵא נֶפֶשׁ״ דְּלָאו בַּר כַּפָּרָה הוּא — הָנֵי נָמֵי דְּלָאו בְּנֵי כַּפָּרָה נִינְהוּ.
human_translation: This cannot enter your mind, as the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught the verse is speaking of a zav who two sightings and of a quarantined leper, similar to impure a corpse, Just as impure a corpse does not require an atonement these too, do not require an atonement
llm_translation: It did not occur to you, as it was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael: "With regard to a seminal emission and a leper who is closed up, the verse speaks, similar to 'one who is impure by a corpse.' Just as 'one who is impure by a corpse' is not subject to atonement, so too, these are not considered children of atonement."

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא, הָנֵי מִילֵּי דְּלָאו בַּר כַּפָּרָה, אֲבָל דְּבַר כַּפָּרָה, עַד דְּמַיְיתֵי כַּפָּרָה?!
human_translation: But say this that applies only who does not require atonement However, one who does require atonement until he brings atonement
llm_translation: And why not, these matters that are not related to the Day of Atonement, but as for the matter of the Day of Atonement, until the Day of Atonement arrives?!

hebrew_text: וְתוּ, הָא דִּתְנַן: טָבַל וְעָלָה — אוֹכֵל בַּמַּעֲשֵׂר, הֶעֱרִיב שִׁמְשׁוֹ — אוֹכֵל בַּתְּרוּמָה, הֵבִיא כַּפָּרָה — אוֹכֵל בַּקֳּדָשִׁים, מְנָא לַן?
human_translation: And furthermore, that which we learned immersed and emerged, he may partake of tithe; the sun has set for him, partake of teruma ; brought his atonement eat sacrificial food. From where do we
llm_translation: And come, this that we learned: He immersed and ascended — he eats in the tithe, he mixed his oil — he eats in the heave-offering, he brought an atonement — he eats in the holy things, whence do we know?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: תְּלָתָא קְרָאֵי כְּתִיבִי. כְּתִיב: ״וְלֹא יֹאכַל מִן הַקֳּדָשִׁים כִּי אִם רָחַץ בְּשָׂרוֹ בַּמָּיִם״, הָא רָחַץ — טָהוֹר. וּכְתִיב: ״וּבָא הַשֶּׁמֶשׁ וְטָהֵר וְאַחַר יֹאכַל מִן הַקֳּדָשִׁים״. וּכְתִיב: ״וְכִפֶּר עָלֶיהָ הַכֹּהֵן וְטָהֵרָה״. הָא כֵּיצַד? כָּאן לְמַעֲשֵׂר, כָּאן לִתְרוּמָה, כָּאן לְקָדָשִׁים.
human_translation: Rava said Rav Ḥisda said: Three verses are written It is written: “And he shall not eat of the holy things, unless he has bathed his flesh in water” but he has bathed, pure And it is written: “And when the sun has set, he shall be pure, and afterward he may eat from the holy things” And it is written: “And the priest shall make atonement for her, and she shall be pure” How so? Here, to tithe; there, to teruma ; here, to sacrificial food.
llm_translation: Rava said, Rav Ḥisda said: Three verses are written. It is written: "And he shall not eat of the holy things unless he bathe his flesh in water," if he bathed - he is pure. And it is written: "And when the sun sets, he shall be clean, and afterward he may eat of the holy things." And it is written: "And the priest shall make atonement for her, and she shall be clean." How so? Here for tithe, here for heave-offering, here for holy things.

hebrew_text: וְאֵיפוֹךְ אֲנָא? מִסְתַּבְּרָא תְּרוּמָה עֲדִיפָא, שֶׁכֵּן מחפ״ז.
human_translation: But I can reverse It is reasonable teruma is more stringent as it is mem , ḥet , peh , zayin ,
llm_translation: And the opposite? It is logical that Terumah is preferable, as it is so in the Mishnah.

hebrew_text: אַדְּרַבָּה: מֵעֶשֶׂר עֲדִיפָא, שֶׁכֵּן הֲדַ״ס טָ״ב?
human_translation: On the contrary, tithe more stringent as it has heh , dalet , samekh , tet , beit ,
llm_translation: Ad Ravva: From tithe preferable, so Hadas good?

hebrew_text: אֲפִילּוּ הָכִי, מִיתָה עֲדִיפָא.
human_translation: Even so, death is a greater
llm_translation: Even so, death is preferable.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: בְּלָא מִיתָה עֲדִיפָא, נָמֵי לָא מָצֵית אָמְרַתְּ, אָמַר קְרָא: ״נֶפֶשׁ״, אֵיזֶהוּ דָּבָר שֶׁשָּׁוֶה בְּכׇל נֶפֶשׁ? הֱוֵי אוֹמֵר זֶה מַעֲשֵׂר.
human_translation: Rava said: without death is a greater you still could not say the verse states soul what matter is the same for every soul? You must say it is tithe,
llm_translation: Rava said: Without death preferable, yes not found you said, said scripture: "soul", what thing that equal in all soul? Be saying this tithe.

hebrew_text: וְאַכַּתִּי, הָנֵי מִילֵּי הֵיכָא דְּלָאו בַּר כַּפָּרָה, אֲבָל הֵיכָא דְּבַר כַּפָּרָה — עַד דְּמַיְיתֵי כַּפָּרָה!
human_translation: But still, this that applies only who does not require atonement However, one who does require atonement until he brings atonement
llm_translation: And as for that, where they are not in the category of atonement, but where they are in the category of atonement - until atonement is achieved!

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: תְּרֵי קְרָאֵי כְּתִיבִי. בְּיוֹלֶדֶת כְּתִיב: ״עַד מְלֹאת יְמֵי טׇהֳרָהּ״, כֵּיוָן שֶׁמָּלְאוּ יָמֶיהָ — טָהֵרָה. וּכְתִיב: ״וְכִפֶּר עָלֶיהָ הַכֹּהֵן וְטָהֵרָה״. הָא כֵּיצַד? כָּאן לִתְרוּמָה, כָּאן לְקׇדָשִׁים.
human_translation: Abaye said: Two verses are written with regard to a woman after childbirth: It is written: until the days of her purification are completed” once her days are completed she is pure And it is written: “And the priest shall make atonement for her, and she shall be pure” How so? Here, to teruma ; there, to sacrificial food.
llm_translation: Abaye said: Two verses are written. Regarding a woman who has given birth, it is written: "Until the days of her purification are completed," once her days are completed — she is pure. And it is written: "And the priest shall make atonement for her, and she shall be clean." How so? Here for terumah, here for holy items.

hebrew_text: וְאֵיפוֹךְ אֲנָא! מִסְתַּבְּרָא קֹדֶשׁ חָמוּר, שֶׁכֵּן פנקעכ״ס.
human_translation: But I can reverse It is reasonable sacrificial food is more stringent peh , nun , kuf , ayin , kaf , samekh ,
llm_translation: And the opposite! It is inferred, holy is severe, as it is written in the Pentateuch.

hebrew_text: אַדְּרַבָּה תְּרוּמָה חֲמוּרָה, שֶׁכֵּן מחפ״ז? הָנָךְ נְפִישָׁן!
human_translation: On the contrary, teruma more stringent as, mem , ḥet , peh , zayin . Those are numerous
llm_translation: Great is the Terumah, for so it is said: "Here is the tithe!"

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: בְּלָא הָנָךְ נְפִישָׁן לָא מָצֵית אָמְרַתְּ, אָמַר קְרָא: ״וְכִפֶּר עָלֶיהָ הַכֹּהֵן וְטָהֵרָה״, מִכְּלָל שֶׁהִיא טְמֵאָה. וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ בְּקָדָשִׁים, אִיקְּרִי כָּאן: ״וְהַבָּשָׂר אֲשֶׁר יִגַּע בְּכׇל טָמֵא לֹא יֵאָכֵל״. אֶלָּא שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ בִּתְרוּמָה.
human_translation: Rava said: without those are numerous, you still could not say the verse states: “And the priest shall make atonement for her, and she shall be pure,” by inference that she ritually impure And if it enters your mind sacrificial food apply here “And the flesh that touches anything impure shall not be eaten” Rather, learn from this teruma .
llm_translation: Rava said: Without the sprinkling, their fat is not found, you said, Scripture says: "And the priest shall make atonement for her, and she shall be clean," implying that she is impure. And if you think it refers to holy things, it should be read here: "But the flesh that touches any unclean thing shall not be eaten." Rather, infer from it regarding terumah.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב שִׁישָׁא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִידִי: וּמִי מָצֵית אָמְרַתְּ תְּרוּמָה כְּתִיבָא הָכָא? וְהָתַנְיָא: ״דַּבֵּר אֶל בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל״, אֵין לִי אֶלָּא בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל — גִּיּוֹרֶת וְשִׁפְחָה מְשׁוּחְרֶרֶת מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אִשָּׁה״. וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ בִּתְרוּמָה, גִּיּוֹרֶת וְשִׁפְחָה בְּנוֹת מֵיכַל תְּרוּמָה נִינְהוּ?
human_translation: Rav Sheisha, son of Rav Idi, strongly objects to this And how can you say teruma is written here, Isn’t it taught “Speak to the children of Israel, I have only the children of Israel from where a convert and an emancipated maidservant the verse states: “A woman,” And if it enters your mind of teruma , are a convert and a maidservant eligible to eat teruma ?
llm_translation: Rav Shisha, son of Rav Idi, raised an objection to her: "And where did you find that 'terumah' is written here?" And it was taught: "Speak to the children of Israel," I have only learned about the children of Israel - how do we know that a convert and a freed maidservant are included? The verse teaches: "A woman." And if you were to suggest that they are not included in the context of terumah, are a convert and a freed maidservant daughters of Michal King Saul's daughter considered terumah?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: וְלָא?
human_translation: Rava said: And not
llm_translation: Rava said: And not?

hebrew_text: וְהָכְתִיב: ״בְּכׇל קֹדֶשׁ לֹא תִגָּע״ — לְרַבּוֹת [אֶת] הַתְּרוּמָה! אֶלָּא, קְרָא מִילֵּי מִילֵּי קָא חָשֵׁיב.
human_translation: But isn’t it written “She shall touch no hallowed thing, to include teruma ? Rather, the Torah considers several matters
llm_translation: And it is written: "In any holy thing you shall not touch" — to include the terumah! Rather, he considers each and every word as significant.

hebrew_text: וּתְלָתָא קְרָאֵי בִּתְרוּמָה לְמָה לִי? צְרִיכִי, דְּאִי מֵ״עַד אֲשֶׁר יִטְהָר״, לָא הֲוָה יָדַעְנָא בְּמַאי — כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא: ״וּבָא הַשֶּׁמֶשׁ וְטָהֵר״.
human_translation: And why do I three verses with regard to teruma ? They are necessary, as, had until he be pure” I would not have known by what the Merciful One writes: “And when the sun has set he shall be pure,
llm_translation: And three verses in regards to Terumah, why do I need them? I need them, for if it were not for "until he is purified," I would not have known with what — the Merciful One wrote: "And the sun shall set and he shall be clean."

hebrew_text: וְאִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״וּבָא הַשֶּׁמֶשׁ״, הָנֵי מִילֵּי דְּלָאו בַּר כַּפָּרָה, אֲבָל דְּבַר כַּפָּרָה אֵימָא עַד דְּמַיְיתֵי כַּפָּרָה — כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא: ״עַד מְלֹאת״.
human_translation: And had the Merciful One written “And when the sun has set,” this applies to who does not require atonement but who requires atonement say until he brings atonement the Merciful One writes: until the days of her purification are completed”
llm_translation: If the Merciful One wrote "and the sun sets," those matters that are not dependent on atonement, but matters of atonement, why should we wait until atonement is achieved? The Merciful One wrote: "Until the filling."

hebrew_text: וְאִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״עַד מְלֹאת״ — הֲוָה אָמֵינָא אֲפִילּוּ בְּלֹא טְבִילָה — כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא: ״עַד אֲשֶׁר יִטְהָר״.
human_translation: And had the Merciful One written “Until are completed,” I would say even without immersion. the Merciful One writes: “Until he be pure.”
llm_translation: If the Merciful One had written "until full," I would have said even without immersion. The Merciful One wrote: "until he is purified."

hebrew_text: וּלְהָךְ תַּנָּא דִּפְלִיג עֲלֵיהּ דְּתַנָּא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל, דְּאָמַר בְּזָב בַּעַל שָׁלֹשׁ רְאִיּוֹת וּבִמְצוֹרָע מוּחְלָט הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר, וְהַאי ״עַד אֲשֶׁר יִטְהָר״ — עַד דְּמַיְיתֵי כַּפָּרָה, תְּרֵי קְרָאֵי בְּקָדָשִׁים לְמָה לִי?
human_translation: And according to that tanna who disagrees with the tanna of the school of Rabbi Yishmael and says the verse is speaking of a zav who three sightings and of a confirmed leper, and, that “until he be pure” until he brings atonement why do I two verses with regard to sacrificial food,
llm_translation: And to counter this, a Tanna taught who disputes with the Tanna of the school of Rabbi Ishmael, who said regarding a seminal emission: in the case of a Baal Keri with three sightings, and in the case of a leper who is already declared clean, the verse speaks. And this phrase "until he is purified" - until the atonement is completed. Two verses in the holy texts, why do I need them?

hebrew_text: צְרִיכִי, דְּאִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא בְּיוֹלֶדֶת — מִשּׁוּם דִּמְרוּבָּה טוּמְאָתָהּ, אֲבָל בְּזָב — אֵימָא לָא. וְאִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא בְּזָב — דְּלֹא הוּתַּר מִכְּלָלוֹ, אֲבָל יוֹלֶדֶת — אֵימָא לָא, צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: They are necessary, as had the Merciful One written with regard to a woman after childbirth, because her impurity is long, But with regard to a zav , say not And had the Merciful One written with regard to a zav , as no exemption is made from its general prohibition But a woman after childbirth, say not are necessary.
llm_translation: I need, for if the Merciful One wrote regarding a woman in childbirth — because her impurity is more severe, but for a zav — I might say no. And if the Merciful One wrote regarding a zav — that he is not exempt from his category, but for a woman in childbirth — I might say no, it is necessary.

hebrew_text: ״בַּמַּיִם יוּבָא וְטָמֵא עַד הָעֶרֶב״ לְמָה לִי? אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: לִנְגִיעָה.
human_translation: “It must be put into water, and it shall be impure until the evening; why do I Rabbi Zeira said: touching.
llm_translation: "In water he shall bathe, and be unclean until evening" - why do I need it? Rabbi Zeira said: for touching.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: ״וְטָמֵא״ — יָכוֹל לַכֹּל, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְטָהֵר״. אִי ״וְטָהֵר״ — יָכוֹל לַכֹּל, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְטָמֵא״. הָא כֵּיצַד? כָּאן לְמַעֲשֵׂר, כָּאן לִתְרוּמָה.
human_translation: As it is taught and it shall be impure might in all Therefore, the verse states: “Then shall it be pure,” had “Then shall it be pure,” might in all Therefore, the verse states: “And it shall be impure How so; Here, to tithe, there to teruma ,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Detanya: 've'tamei' — yakhol l'kol, Talmud lomar: 've'tehar'. Ei 've'tehar' — yakhol l'kol, Talmud lomar: 've'tamei'. Ha ketsad? Kan l'maaser, kan l'trumah." English translation: It was taught in a Baraita: "And impure" — could apply to everything, the Torah teaches: "And pure." If "and pure" — could apply to everything, the Torah teaches: "And impure." How so? Here for tithe, here for offering.

hebrew_text: וְאֵיפוֹךְ אֲנָא! מִסְתַּבְּרָא כִּי הֵיכִי דַּחֲמִירָא אֲכִילָה דִתְרוּמָה מֵאֲכִילָה דְמַעֲשֵׂר — הָכִי נָמֵי חֲמִירָא נְגִיעָה דִתְרוּמָה מִנְּגִיעָה דְמַעֲשֵׂר.
human_translation: But I can reverse It is reasonable just as the eating of teruma is greater stringency than the eating of tithe, so too, the touching of teruma greater stringency than the touching of tithe.
llm_translation: And the opposite! It is logical that just as the consumption of Terumah is more stringent than the consumption of Maaser, so too the touching of Terumah is more stringent than the touching of Maaser.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא נְגִיעָה דִתְרוּמָה מֵהָכָא נָפְקָא: ״בְּכׇל קֹדֶשׁ לֹא תִגָּע״ — אַזְהָרָה לָאוֹכֵל. אוֹ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא לַנּוֹגֵעַ?
human_translation: And if you wish, say touching of teruma is derived from here: “She shall touch no hallowed thing, a warning with respect to one who eats Or, it is nothing other than with respect to one who touches
llm_translation: And if you will say, let the impurity of terumah come from here: "With any holy thing, do not touch" — a warning to the eater. Or is it only for the one touching?

hebrew_text: תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״בְּכׇל קֹדֶשׁ לֹא תִגָּע וְאֶל הַמִּקְדָּשׁ לֹא תָבֹא״, מַקִּישׁ קֹדֶשׁ לַמִּקְדָּשׁ: מָה מִקְדָּשׁ — דָּבָר שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ נְטִילַת נְשָׁמָה, אַף קֹדֶשׁ — דָּבָר שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ נְטִילַת נְשָׁמָה. וּבִנְגִיעָה, נְטִילַת נְשָׁמָה לֵיכָּא,
human_translation: the verse states: “She shall touch no hallowed thing, nor come into the Sanctuary, juxtaposing consecrated to the Sanctuary. Just as the Sanctuary is a matter that involves the taking of life, so too, consecrated a matter that involves the taking of life, but touching does not involve the taking of life,
llm_translation: The Talmud teaches: "In all holiness you shall not touch, and to the sanctuary you shall not come." It juxtaposes holiness to the sanctuary: Just as the sanctuary is a place that involves the taking of a soul, so too holiness is something that involves the taking of a soul. And in the case of touching, the taking of a soul does not apply.

hebrew_text: וְהַאי דְּאַפְּקֵיהּ בִּלְשׁוֹן נְגִיעָה, הָכִי קָאָמַר: נְגִיעָה כַּאֲכִילָה.
human_translation: And that expressed in terms of touching, this is what is saying: touching is like eating,
llm_translation: This one who expressed in the language of touching, thus he said: Touching is like eating.

hebrew_text: פְּצוּעַ דַּכָּא וְכוּ׳. מַאן תַּנָּא מִשְׁתַּמֶּרֶת לְבִיאָה פְּסוּלָה, דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא אָכְלָה? אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: בְּמַחְלוֹקֶת שְׁנוּיָה, וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן הִיא.
human_translation: crushed testicles Who is who taught awaiting intercourse that would disqualify by Torah may eat Rabbi Elazar said: is subject to dispute, and it is Rabbi Elazar and Rabbi Shimon,
llm_translation: Injured, crushed, etc. Who is the Tanna that maintains that a disqualified animal that was guarded for mating has consumed something forbidden by Torah law? Rabbi Elazar said: In a case of a disputed matter, and it is Rabbi Elazar and Rabbi Shimon who are involved.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבִּי מֵאִיר, שָׁאנֵי הָכָא שֶׁכְּבָר אָכְלָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: even you say it is Rabbi Meir, it is different here, as she already eaten
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: Even if you say Rabbi Meir, it is different here because she has already eaten.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, שֶׁכְּבָר אָכְלָה לָא אָמְרִינַן. דְּאִי לָא תֵּימָא הָכִי, בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁנִּשֵּׂאת לְכֹהֵן וּמֵת בַּעְלָהּ — תֹּאכַל, שֶׁכְּבָר אָכְלָה.
human_translation: And Rabbi Elazar we do not say that she eaten as, if you do not say this should an Israelite woman who married a priest and her husband died eating as she already eaten
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar, that already ate no we say. For if not you will say thus, a daughter of Israel that marries a priest and her husband dies - she may eat, for she already ate.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הָתָם — פָּקַע קִנְיָינֵיהּ, הָכָא — לָא פָּקַע קִנְיָינֵיהּ.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan there, his acquisition has lapsed, here, his acquisition has not lapsed.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan: There — he has severed his acquisitions, here — he has not severed his acquisitions.

hebrew_text: אֵיזֶהוּ פְּצוּעַ. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֵיזֶהוּ פְּצוּעַ דַּכָּא — כׇּל שֶׁנִּפְצְעוּ בֵּיצִים שֶׁלּוֹ, וַאֲפִילּוּ אַחַת מֵהֶן, וַאֲפִילּוּ נִיקְּבוּ, וַאֲפִילּוּ נִמּוֹקוּ, וַאֲפִילּוּ חָסְרוּ. אָמַר רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בְּנוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן בְּרוֹקָה: שָׁמַעְתִּי מִפִּי חֲכָמִים בַּכֶּרֶם בְּיַבְנֶה: כֹּל שֶׁאֵין לוֹ אֶלָּא בֵּיצָה אַחַת — אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא סְרִיס חַמָּה, וְכָשֵׁר.
human_translation: Who is a man with crushed The Sages taught Who is a man with crushed testicles? anyone whose testicles have been wounded, even one of them. even punctured, or decayed or are deficient Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Beroka, said: I heard from the Sages in the vineyard in Yavne anyone who has only one testicle is nothing other a eunuch by natural causes, and he is fit.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Who is considered a crushed testicle? The Rabbis taught: Who is considered a crushed testicle of the kind that is crushed - anyone whose testicles were crushed, even if only one of them, even if they were perforated, even if they were pulverized, even if they were lacking. Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yochanan ben Brokah, said: I heard from the Sages in the vineyard in Yavneh: Anyone who has only one testicle is considered a eunuch of the sun, and he is valid."

hebrew_text: סְרִיס חַמָּה סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ?! אֶלָּא: הֲרֵי הוּא כִּסְרִיס חַמָּה, וְכָשֵׁר.
human_translation: Can it enter your mind a eunuch by natural causes, Rather, he resembles a eunuch by natural causes, and he is fit.
llm_translation: "Is a eunuch of the sun your concern?! Rather, behold, he is like a eunuch of the sun, and valid."

hebrew_text: וְנִיקַּב לָא מוֹלֵיד? וְהָא הָהוּא גַּבְרָא דִּסְלֵיק לְדִיקְלָא
human_translation: were punctured, is he incapable of having children, Wasn’t a certain man was climbing up a palm tree,
llm_translation: And is he not sterile? But that man who went up to the palm tree.

hebrew_text: וְחַרְזֵיהּ סִילְוָא בְּבֵיצִים, וּנְפַק מִינֵּיהּ כְּחוּט דְּמוּגְלָא, וְאוֹלֵיד! הָא שְׁלַח שְׁמוּאֵל לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ: צֵא וְחָזַר עַל בָּנָיו מֵאֵין הֵם.
human_translation: and a thorn [ silva ] punctured him in the testicles, and resembling a thread of pus issued from him, and he had children. Didn’t Shmuel send before Rav, who said to him: Go inquire about his children where they come from,
llm_translation: And his womb was filled with eggs, and he expelled from it like a thread of scarlet wool, and he gave birth! This is what Shmuel sent to stand before Rav and said to him: Go and return on his sons, for they are not.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: פְּצוּעַ דַּכָּא בִּידֵי שָׁמַיִם כָּשֵׁר. אָמַר רָבָא: הַיְינוּ דְּקָרֵינַן ״פְּצוּעַ״, וְלָא קָרֵינַן ״הַפָּצוּעַ״.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: A man wounded with crushed at the hand of Heaven, is fit Rava said: This is that we read “A man wounded and we do not read: The man wounded
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: A wound caused by heaven is valid. Rava said: This is what we read as "p'tzua," and not as "hap'tzua."

hebrew_text: בְּמַתְנִיתָא תָּנָא, נֶאֱמַר: ״לֹא יָבֹא פְצוּעַ״, וְנֶאֱמַר ״לֹא יָבֹא מַמְזֵר״. מָה לְהַלָּן בִּידֵי אָדָם, אַף כָּאן בִּידֵי אָדָם.
