human_translation: was taught in a baraita . It is stated: “A man wounded [ petzua ] shall not enter and it is stated “A mamzer shall not enter Just as there, at the hands of man, so too, here, at the hands of man.
llm_translation: In the Mishnah it was taught: It is stated, "A man with crushed testicles shall not enter," and it is stated, "A mamzer shall not enter." Just as there, it is in the hands of man, so too here, it is in the hands of man.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: פָּצוּעַ — בְּכוּלָּן, דַּךְ — בְּכוּלָּן, כָּרוּת — בְּכוּלָּן. פָּצוּעַ בְּכוּלָּן — בֵּין שֶׁנִּפְצַע הַגִּיד, בֵּין שֶׁנִּפְצְעוּ בֵּיצִים, בֵּין שֶׁנִּפְצְעוּ חוּטֵי בֵּיצִים. דַּךְ בְּכוּלָּן — בֵּין שֶׁנִּידַּךְ הַגִּיד, בֵּין שֶׁנִּידַּכּוּ בֵּיצִים, בֵּין שֶׁנִּידַּכּוּ חוּטֵי בֵיצִים. כְּרוּת [בְּכוּלָּן] — בֵּין שֶׁנִּכְרַת הַגִּיד, בֵּין שֶׁנִּכְרְתוּ בֵּיצִים, בֵּין שֶׁנִּכְרְתוּ חוּטֵי בֵיצִים.
human_translation: Rava said: Wounded to all of them; crushed to all of them; severed to all of them, Wounded to all of them, whether the member was wounded, or the testicles were wounded, or the spermatic cords were wounded. crushed to all of them, whether the member was crushed, or the testicles were crushed, or the spermatic cords were crushed. severed to all of them, whether the member was severed, or the testicles were severed, or the spermatic cords were severed.
llm_translation: Rava said: A wound - in all of them, crushed - in all of them, torn - in all of them. A wound in all of them - whether the sinew was wounded, or the testicles were wounded, or the cords of the testicles were wounded. Crushed in all of them - whether the sinew was crushed, or the testicles were crushed, or the cords of the testicles were crushed. Torn in all of them - whether the sinew was torn, or the testicles were torn, or the cords of the testicles were torn.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ הָהוּא מֵרַבָּנַן לְרָבָא: מִמַּאי דְּהַאי פְּצוּעַ דַּכָּא בְּאוֹתוֹ מָקוֹם? אֵימָא מֵרֹאשׁוֹ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִדְּלָא מְנָה בֵּיהּ דּוֹרוֹת, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ בְּאוֹתוֹ מָקוֹם.
human_translation: One of the Sages said to Rava: From where that this “ petzua dakka ,” in that place, Say on his head. said to him: From does not mention generations learn from this in that place.
llm_translation: He said to him, that one from the sages to Rava: From what is this wound that is hard in that place? Say from its beginning? He said to him: Since he did not count its generations, infer from that place.

hebrew_text: וְדִלְמָא הַאי דְּלָא מָנָה בּוֹ דּוֹרוֹת, דְּאִיהוּ הוּא דְּאָסוּר, בְּרֵיהּ וּבַר בְּרֵיהּ כָּשֵׁר?
human_translation: But perhaps that does not mention generations that he is prohibited his son and his son’s son are fit
llm_translation: Perhaps this one who did not count generations, for he himself is the one who is forbidden, his son and his son's son are valid?

hebrew_text: דּוּמְיָא דִּכְרוּת שׇׁפְכָה: מָה כְּרוּת שׇׁפְכָה — בְּאוֹתוֹ מָקוֹם, אַף הַאי נָמֵי בְּאוֹתוֹ מָקוֹם.
human_translation: similar to one whose penis has been severed, Just as one whose penis has been severed in that place, so too, this in that place.
llm_translation: "Dumya dikhrut shofkha: mah krut shofkha - be'oto makom, af hai namei be'oto makom."

hebrew_text: וּכְרוּת שׇׁפְכָה גּוּפֵיהּ מִמַּאי דִּבְאוֹתוֹ מָקוֹם הוּא? אֵימָא מִשִּׂפְתֵּיהּ! ״שׇׁפְכָה״ כְּתִיב — בְּמָקוֹם שֶׁשּׁוֹפֵךְ.
human_translation: one whose penis has been severed [ kerut shofkha ] himself, from where in that place, Say to his lips, It is written “ shofkha ,” in a place that pours out [ shofekh ],
llm_translation: "And a cut-off limb spills its blood from where does it come? Say from its lip! 'Spills' is written - in the place where it spills."

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא מֵחוֹטְמוֹ? מִי כְּתִיב ״בִּשְׁפוֹךְ״?! ״כְּרוּת שׇׁפְכָה״ כְּתִיב — מִי שֶׁעַל יְדֵי כְּרִיתָה שׁוֹפֵךְ, שֶׁלֹּא עַל יְדֵי כְּרִיתָה אֵינוֹ שׁוֹפֵךְ אֶלָּא מְקַלֵּחַ. לְאַפּוֹקֵי הַאי, דְּאִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי שׁוֹפֵךְ הוּא.
human_translation: But say to his nose. Is it written bishpokh , it is written “ kerut shofkha ,” something that pours out as a result of having been severed. But in the absence of having been severed, does not pour out; rather, it is ejected out. to exclude this as this or that pours out.
llm_translation: And why not from circumcision? Where is it written "when he pours out"?! It is written "a cut-off flow" — one who pours out through circumcision, but not through circumcision only shaves. To exclude this, for both of them pour out.

hebrew_text: בְּמַתְנִיתָא תָּנָא, נֶאֱמַר: ״לֹא יָבֹא פְצוּעַ דַּכָּא״, וְנֶאֱמַר: ״לֹא יָבֹא מַמְזֵר״. מָה לְהַלָּן בְּאוֹתוֹ מָקוֹם, אַף כָּאן בְּאוֹתוֹ מָקוֹם.
human_translation: it was taught in a baraita It is stated: “A man wounded with crushed testicles shall not enter and it is stated: “A mamzer shall not enter Just as there, from that place, so too, here, in that place
llm_translation: In the Mishnah it was taught: It is stated, "A man with crushed testicles shall not enter," and it is stated, "A mamzer shall not enter." Just as there, in that place, so too here, in that place.

hebrew_text: נִיקַּב לְמַטָּה מֵעֲטָרָה, שֶׁכְּנֶגְדּוֹ לְמַעְלָה מֵעֲטָרָה, סָבַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא לְאַכְשׁוֹרֵי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי אַסִּי: הָכִי אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: עֲטָרָה כׇּל שֶׁהִיא מְעַכֶּבֶת.
human_translation: was punctured below the corona, on the opposite above the corona Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba thought to render him fit Rabbi Asi said to him: This is what Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: the corona of any size impedes
llm_translation: He pierced below the crown, that opposite it above the crown, Rabbi Hiyya bar Abba thought for the anchors. Rabbi Assi said to him: So said Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi: Any crown that is, it impedes.

hebrew_text: וְאִם נִשְׁתַּיֵּיר מֵעֲטָרָה כּוּ׳. יָתֵיב רָבִינָא וְקָמִיבַּעְיָא לֵיהּ: מְלֹא הַחוּט שֶׁאָמְרוּ, עַל פְּנֵי כּוּלָּהּ אוֹ עַל פְּנֵי רוּבָּהּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא תּוֹסְפָאָה לְרָבִינָא: מְלֹא הַחוּט — עַל פְּנֵי רוּבָּהּ, וּכְלַפֵּי רֵישָׁא.
human_translation: if there remains of the corona, Ravina sat and raised the dilemma: hairsbreadth of which they spoke, the entire or a majority of it? Rava Tosfa’a said to Ravina: A hairsbreadth a majority and toward its head,
llm_translation: And if some of the crown remains. Ravina sat and asked: "When they said, 'a full thread,' is it on its entirety or the majority?" Rava replied to Ravina: "A full thread - on the majority, and according to the beginning."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: כְּקוּלְמוֹס — כְּשֵׁרָה, כְּמַרְזֵב — פְּסוּלָה. הַאי — שָׁלֵיט בַּהּ אַוֵּירָא, וְהַאי — לָא שָׁלֵיט בַּהּ אַוֵּירָא. וְרַב חִסְדָּא אָמַר: כְּמַרְזֵב כְּשֵׁרָה, כְּקוּלְמוֹס פְּסוּלָה! הַאי — גָּרֵיד, וְהַאי — לָא גָּרֵיד.
human_translation: Rav Huna said: like a quill [ kulmus ], fit; like a gutter, unfit. this the air penetrates whereas that the air does not penetrate And Rav Ḥisda said like a gutter, fit; like a quill, unfit. this rubs whereas that does not rub
llm_translation: Rav Huna said: Like a kulumos - kosher, like a marzev - pasul. This one - has control over it (the animal), and this one - does not have control over it. And Rav Ḥisdah said: Like a marzev - kosher, like a kulumos - pasul! This one - grazes, and this one - does not graze.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַב הוּנָא מִסְתַּבְּרָא. הַאי לָא שָׁלֵיט בַּהּ אַוֵּירָא וְהַאי שָׁלֵיט בַּהּ אַוֵּירָא, אִי מִשּׁוּם גְּרִידוּתָא — מִידֵּי דְּהָוֵה אַבַּרְזָא דְחָבִיתָא.
human_translation: Rava said: It stands to reason in accordance with Rav Huna, this the air penetrates, whereas that the air does not penetrate. With respect to the rubbing, just as it is in a stopper of a barrel.
llm_translation: Rava said: The intestines of Rav Huna are well arranged. This one does not have control over the air, and this one has control over the air. If it is due to the thickness of the intestines, it is because he is the son of a barrel maker.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבִינָא לְמָרִימָר, הָכִי אָמַר מָר זוּטְרָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב פָּפָּא: הִלְכְתָא, בֵּין כְּקוּלְמוֹס בֵּין כְּמַרְזֵב — כְּשֵׁרָה. מִיהוּ, מִיבַּעְיָא לֵיהּ: לְמַטָּה מֵעֲטָרָה, אוֹ לְמַעְלָה? פְּשִׁיטָא דִּלְמַעְלָה מֵעֲטָרָה, דְּאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ לְמַטָּה מֵעֲטָרָה — אֲפִילּוּ נִכְרַת הַגִּיד נָמֵי. וְרָבִינָא לְשַׁבּוֹשֵׁי לְמָרִימָר הוּא דְּבָעֵי.
human_translation: Ravina said to Mareimar Mar Zutra said in the name of Rav Pappa as follows: The halakha is whether like a quill or like a gutter, fit. However, he raised a dilemma below the corona, or above is obvious to above the corona, as, if it enters your mind to below the corona, even the member was severed, also And Ravina he wanted to mislead Mereimar
llm_translation: Ravina said to Marimar: So said Mar Zutra in the name of Rav Papa: The halacha is, whether like a kulumos or like a marzev, it is valid. However, he asked him: Towards the bottom of the crown, or towards the top? It is obvious that towards the top of the crown, for if it were to enter your mind towards the bottom of the crown, even if the sinew were severed, it would still be valid. And Ravina was the one who sought to embarrass Marimar.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא עוֹבָדָא דַּהֲוָה בְּמָתָא מַחְסֵיָא, שַׁפְּיֵיהּ מָר בַּר רַב אָשֵׁי כְּקוּלְמוֹס וְאַכְשְׁרֵיהּ. הָהוּא עוֹבָדָא דַּהֲוָה בְּפוּמְבְּדִיתָא, אִיסְתְּתִים גּוּבְתָּא דְּשִׁכְבַת זֶרַע, וְאַפֵּיק בִּמְקוֹם קְטַנִּים. סְבַר רַב בִּיבִי בַּר אַבָּיֵי לְאַכְשׁוֹרֵי. אָמַר רַב פַּפִּי: מִשּׁוּם דְּאַתּוּ
human_translation: A certain incident occurred in Mata Meḥasya, Mar bar Rav Ashi cut like a quill and rendered him fit A certain incident occurred in Pumbedita, the seminal duct became blocked, and he emitted through the urinary duct. Rav Beivai bar Abaye thought to render him fit, Rav Pappi said: Because you come
llm_translation: That certain worker who was in the city of Mahseya, Mar bar Rav Ashi appointed him like a Kullmos and made him fit. That certain worker who was in the city of Pumbedita, he found a pit of semen and he brought it to a place of small ones. Rav Bibi bar Abbaye thought to permit it. Rav Pappi said: Because they came...

hebrew_text: מִמּוּלָאֵי, אָמְרִיתוּ מִילֵּי מוּלְיָתָא? בִּמְקוֹמָהּ — מְבַשְּׁלָה, שֶׁלֹּא בִּמְקוֹמָהּ — לָא מְבַשְּׁלָה.
human_translation: from truncated [ mimula’ei ] people, you speak truncated [ mulayata ] matters. its place, it fertilizes; not its place, it does not fertilize.
llm_translation: From the foreskins, did they say the words of the foreskin? In its place - it cooks, not in its place - it does not cook.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: נִיקַּב וְנִסְתַּם, כֹּל שֶׁאִילּוּ נִקְרֵי וְנִקְרָע — פְּסוּל. וְאִי לָאו — כָּשֵׁר. הָוֵי בֵּהּ רָבָא: הֵיכָא? אִילֵּימָא לְמַטָּה מֵעֲטָרָה — אֲפִילּוּ נִכְרַת נָמֵי, אֶלָּא בַּעֲטָרָה עַצְמָהּ. אִיתְּמַר נָמֵי, אָמַר רַב מָרִי בַּר מָר אָמַר מָר עוּקְבָא אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: נִיקַּב בַּעֲטָרָה עַצְמָהּ וְנִסְתַּם, כֹּל שֶׁאִילּוּ נִקְרֵי וְנִקְרָע פָּסוּל, וְאִי לָאו — כָּשֵׁר.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: had been punctured and it closed any where, he would emit semen, it would tear unfit but if not, fit. Rava discussed Where If we say below the corona, Even if was severed, also Rather, in the corona itself, It was also stated Rav Mari bar Mar said Mar Ukva said Shmuel said: had been punctured in the corona itself, and it closed any where he would emit semen it would tear unfit; but if not, fit.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: If it was perforated and then sealed, anything that if it were to be read and torn would render it invalid, and if not, it is valid. Rava raised a difficulty: Where? If we say below the rim — even if it was cut off, it is still considered part of the rim itself. If it was said that it was cut off, Rav Mari bar Mar said in the name of Mar Ukva in the name of Shmuel: If it was perforated in the actual rim itself and then sealed, anything that if it were to be read and torn would render it invalid, and if not, it is valid.

hebrew_text: שְׁלַח לֵיהּ רָבָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבָּה לְרַב יוֹסֵף: יְלַמְּדֵנוּ רַבֵּינוּ, הֵיכִי עָבְדִינַן? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַיְיתִינַן נַהֲמָא חַמִּימָא דִּשְׂעָרֵי, וּמַנְּחִינַן לֵיהּ אַבֵּי פוֹקְרֵי, וּמִקְּרֵי, וְחָזֵינַן לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rava, son of Rabba, sent to Rav Yosef: Let our teacher teach us, what we do said to him: We bring warm barley bread and place it upon his anus [ bei pukrei ], and he emits semen, and we observe
llm_translation: Send to him Rava son of Rabba to Rav Yosef: Teach us, our teacher, how did we do it? He said to him: We bring a hot cup of barley flour, and we place before him the father of bakers, and we read, and we see him.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: אַטּוּ כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא יַעֲקֹב אָבִינוּ הֲוַאי, דִּכְתִיב בֵּיהּ ״כֹּחִי וְרֵאשִׁית אוֹנִי״, שֶׁלֹּא רָאָה קֶרִי מִיָּמָיו!
human_translation: Abaye said: Is that to say everyone is our Patriarch Jacob, with regard to whom it is written: my might and the first fruits of my strength” that never experienced an emission of semen in all his days,
llm_translation: Abaye said: Now, all the people of the world were like our forefather Jacob, as it is written about him, "My strength and the first of my vigor," for he did not see a seminal emission all his days!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: מְעַבְּרִינַן קַמֵּיהּ בִּגְדֵי צִבְעוֹנִין. אָמַר רָבָא: אַטּוּ כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא בַּרְזִילַּי הַגִּלְעָדִי הוּא?! אֶלָּא מְחַוַּורְתָּא כִּדְשַׁנִּין מֵעִיקָּרָא.
human_translation: Rather, Abaye said We pass before him colorful garments Rava said: Is that to say everyone is Barzilai the Gileadite, Rather, it is clear as we initially answered,
llm_translation: Rather, Abaye said: We pass before him with colored garments. Rava said: Is everyone in the world a resident of the Giladite city of Barzillai?! Rather, it is like a dyed garment that is dyed from the outset.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: נִיקַּב — פָּסוּל, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא שׁוֹתֵת. נִסְתַּם — כָּשֵׁר, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא מוֹלִיד. וְזֶהוּ פְּסוּל שֶׁחוֹזֵר לְהֶכְשֵׁירוֹ. ״זֶהוּ״ לְמַעוֹטֵי מַאי? לְמַעוֹטֵי קְרוּם שֶׁעָלָה מֵחֲמַת מַכָּה בָּרֵיאָה, דְּאֵינוֹ קְרוּם.
human_translation: The Sages taught was punctured, unfit because is discharged gently closed fit, because he can father And this is unfit who returns to his fitness. What this to exclude? to exclude a membrane that formed on the lung in the wake of a wound, which is not a membrane,
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: If it is perforated - it is invalid, because it pours. If it is sealed - it is valid, because it gives birth. And this is invalid that returns to be valid. "This" - to exclude what? To exclude a crust that emerged due to a healthy wound, which is not considered a crust.

hebrew_text: שְׁלַח לֵיהּ רַב אִידִי בַּר אָבִין לְאַבָּיֵי: הֵיכִי עָבְדִינַן? מַיְיתִינַן שְׂעָרְתָּא וּמְסָרְטִינַן לֵיהּ, וּמַיְיתִינַן תַּרְבָּא וְשָׁיְיפִינַן, וּמַיְיתִינַן שׁוּמְשָׁנָא גַּמְלָא וּמְנַכְּתִינַן לֵיהּ, וּפָסְקִינַן לֵיהּ לְרֵישֵׁיהּ. וְדַוְקָא שְׂעָרְתָּא, אֲבָל פַּרְזְלָא — מִזְרָף זָרֵיף. וְהָנֵי מִילֵּי קָטָן, אֲבָל גָּדוֹל — אִיקַּפּוֹלֵי מִיקַּפַּל.
human_translation: Rav Idi bar Avin sent to Abaye: What we do We bring barley and lacerate We bring fat and rub it and we bring a large ant [ shumshena ] and let it bite We cut off head And specifically barley, but iron cause inflammation [ zareif ]. And this applies only a small but a large one will peel
llm_translation: Send to him Rav Idi bar Avin to Abbaye: How do we do it? We bring a razor and shave him, and we bring a comb and comb him, and we bring a woolen garment and dress him, and we cut his hair at the top. Specifically with a razor, but with iron — it is forbidden. These are small matters, but with big ones — they are more stringent.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא: הַמֵּטִיל מַיִם מִשְּׁתֵּי מְקוֹמוֹת, פָּסוּל. אָמַר רָבָא: לֵית הִלְכְתָא לָא כִּבְרָא וְלָא כְּאַבָּא, בְּרָא — הָא דַּאֲמַרַן. אַבָּא — דְּאָמַר רַב הוּנָא: נָשִׁים הַמְסוֹלְלוֹת זוֹ בָּזוֹ, פְּסוּלוֹת לַכְּהוּנָּה.
human_translation: Rabba bar Rav Huna said: One who passes water from two places, unfit Rava said: halakha is in accordance neither with the son nor with the father. The son, that which we stated. the father, Rav Huna said: Women who rub against one another are unfit to the priesthood,
llm_translation: Rabbah son of Rav Huna said: One who pours water from two places, invalid. Rava said: There is no halakha like Rava and not like Abba, like Rava — as we said. Abba — as Rav Huna said: Women who curse one another, disqualified for the priesthood.

hebrew_text: וַאֲפִילּוּ לְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, דְּאָמַר: פָּנוּי הַבָּא עַל הַפְּנוּיָה שֶׁלֹּא לְשֵׁם אִישׁוּת עֲשָׂאָהּ זוֹנָה — הָנֵי מִילֵּי אִישׁ, אֲבָל אִשָּׁה פְּרִיצוּתָא בְּעָלְמָא.
human_translation: And even according to Rabbi Elazar, who said that an unmarried man who has intercourse with an unmarried woman not for the sake of marriage renders her a zona , this applies only to a man, but woman is mere licentiousness
llm_translation: Even according to Rabbi Elazar, who said: "A man who engages in relations with a woman not for the sake of marriage makes her a prostitute," those words apply to a man, but a woman's promiscuity is in itself.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ פְּצוּעַ דַּכָּא וּכְרוּת שׇׁפְכָה מוּתָּרִין בְּגִיּוֹרֶת וּמְשׁוּחְרֶרֶת, וְאֵינָן אֲסוּרִין אֶלָּא מִלָּבֹא בַּקָּהָל, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לֹא יָבֹא פְצוּעַ דַּכָּא וּכְרוּת שׇׁפְכָה בִּקְהַל ה׳״.
human_translation: A man with crushed testicles and one whose penis has been severed are permitted convert or an emancipated and they are prohibited only from entering into the congregation as it is stated: “A man wounded with crushed testicles or a severed penis shall not enter into the congregation of the Lord”
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: A person with a crushed limb or severed organ is permitted in the assembly and is considered free, and they are only prohibited from entering the congregation, as it is stated: "No one with a crushed limb or severed organ shall enter the assembly of the Lord" (Deuteronomy 23:2).

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ בְּעוֹ מִינֵּיהּ מֵרַב שֵׁשֶׁת: פְּצוּעַ דַּכָּא כֹּהֵן מַהוּ, בְּגִיּוֹרֶת וּמְשׁוּחְרֶרֶת? בִּקְדוּשְׁתֵּיהּ קָאֵי וַאֲסִיר, אוֹ דִלְמָא לָאו בִּקְדוּשְׁתֵּיהּ קָאֵי וּשְׁרֵי?
human_translation: They raised a dilemma before Rav Sheshet: What is a priest with crushed testicles with respect to convert or an emancipated he retain his sanctity and is prohibited or perhaps he does not retain his sanctity and is permitted
llm_translation: Gemara: From where is it derived that a blemished priest is valid, in the case of a convert and a freed slave? Is he standing in his sanctity and prohibited, or perhaps he is not standing in his sanctity and permitted?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהוּ רַב שֵׁשֶׁת, תְּנֵיתוּהָ: פְּצוּעַ דַּכָּא יִשְׂרָאֵל — מוּתָּר בִּנְתִינָה. וְאִי סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ בִּקְדוּשְׁתֵּיהּ קָאֵי, אִקְרִי כָּאן ״לֹא תִתְחַתֵּן בָּם״.
human_translation: Rav Sheshet said to them: You learned this It is permitted for an Israelite with crushed testicles a Gibeonite woman. Now, if it enters your mind retains his sanctity apply here “You shall not marry them”
llm_translation: He said to them, Rav Sheshet, "You have taught: A crushed testicle of a Jew — permitted for marriage. And if it enters your mind that he stands in his holiness, it is read here, 'You shall not intermarry with them.'"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: אַטּוּ הָתָם מִשּׁוּם קְדוּשָּׁה וְלָאו קְדוּשָּׁה הוּא? דִּלְמָא מוֹלֵיד בֵּן, וְאָזֵיל פָּלַח לַעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה. וְהָנֵי מִילֵּי — בְּגוֹיוּתָן, כִּי מִגַּיְירִי (בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל) [מִישְׁרָא] שְׁרוּ, וְרַבָּנַן הוּא דִּגְזַרוּ בְּהוּ. וְכִי גְּזַרוּ בְּהוּ רַבָּנַן — בְּהָנָךְ דִּבְנֵי אוֹלוֹדֵי, אֲבָל הַאי דְּלָאו בַּר אוֹלוֹדֵי — לָא גְּזַרוּ בֵּיהּ רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: Rava said: is that to say there is due to sanctity or lack of sanctity? perhaps one will father a child and will go idolatrous worship. Now, this applies only when gentiles, when convert, permitted to Jews. And it is the Sages who decreed And when the Sages decreed to those who are capable of having children, but this one, who is incapable of having children, the Sages did not issue a decree.
llm_translation: Rava said: There, perhaps it is due to sanctity, and it is not sanctity? Perhaps he will beget a son, and he will go and serve idolatry. And these matters - in their nations, for when they convert to Israel, they are fit, and it is the Rabbis who decreed upon them. And when did the Rabbis decree upon them? In the case of the children of converts, but this one who is not a child of converts - the Rabbis did not decree upon him.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, מַמְזֵר, דְּבַר אוֹלוֹדֵי, הָכִי נָמֵי דַּאֲסִיר? וְהָא תְּנַן: מַמְזֵרִים וּנְתִינִים מוּתָּרִים לָבֹא זֶה בָּזֶה! אֶלָּא: כִּי גְּזוּר רַבָּנַן — בִּכְשֵׁרִים. בִּפְסוּלִים לָא גְּזוּר רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: However, if that is so, a mamzer , who is capable of having children, so too that he is prohibited But didn’t we learn Mamzerim and Gibeonites are permitted to marry one another. Rather, When the Sages decreed to fit, with regard to unfit the Sages did not issue a decree.
llm_translation: Rather, from now on, a mamzer, a child of forbidden relationships, is thus considered prohibited? But didn't we learn: mamzers and freed slaves are permitted to marry each other! Rather, when the Rabbis decreed, it was regarding those who are valid. For those who are invalid, the Rabbis did not decree.

hebrew_text: הֲדַר אָמַר רָבָא: לָאו מִילְּתָא הִיא, בְּגוֹיוּתָן — לֵית לְהוּ חַתְנוּת, נִתְגַּיְּירוּ — אִית לְהוּ חַתְנוּת.
human_translation: Rava then said is not correct. when they are gentiles there can be no marriage with them they have converted there can be marriage with them,
llm_translation: Rava said: It is not a matter, in their gentileness — they do not have a wedding, they converted — they have a wedding.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַב יוֹסֵף: ״וַיִּתְחַתֵּן שְׁלֹמֹה אֶת בַּת פַּרְעֹה מֶלֶךְ מִצְרַיִם״! גַּיּיוֹרֵי גַּיְּירַהּ. וְהָא לֹא קִבְּלוּ גֵּרִים לֹא בִּימֵי דָוִד וְלֹא בִּימֵי שְׁלֹמֹה! מִידֵּי הוּא טַעְמָא — אֶלָּא לְשׁוּלְחַן מְלָכִים,
human_translation: Rav Yosef raised an objection “And Solomon married the daughter of Pharaoh, king of Egypt” he converted her. But isn’t they did not accept converts, neither in the days of David nor in the days of Solomon? But isn’t the reason only to the table of kings,
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: "And Solomon married the daughter of Pharaoh, king of Egypt!" Converts convert. But did they not accept converts neither in the days of David nor in the days of Solomon! The reason is that it was for the sake of the royal table.

hebrew_text: הָא לָא צְרִיכָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: this one, did not require such
llm_translation: This does not require it.

hebrew_text: [וְתִיפּוֹק לֵיהּ] דְּהָא מִצְרִית רִאשׁוֹנָה הִיא! וְכִי תֵּימָא: הָנָךְ אָזְלִי לְעָלְמָא וְהָנֵי אַחֲרִינֵי נִינְהוּ,
human_translation: But let him derive as she a first- Egyptian And if you would say those left in the world, and those are others,
llm_translation: And let it come out for behold, she is the first Egyptian! And if you say: "Those went to the world, and these are others,"

hebrew_text: וְהָא תַּנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: מִנְיָמִין גֵּר מִצְרִי הָיָה לִי חָבֵר מִתַּלְמִידֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, אָמַר: אֲנִי מִצְרִי רִאשׁוֹן, וְנָשָׂאתִי מִצְרִית רִאשׁוֹנָה. אַשִּׂיא לִבְנִי מִצְרִית שְׁנִיָּה כְּדֵי שֶׁיְּהֵא בֶּן בְּנִי רָאוּי לָבֹא בַּקָּהָל!
human_translation: isn’t it taught Rabbi Yehuda said: Minyamin, an Egyptian convert, was a friend of mine from among the students of Rabbi Akiva, he said: I a first- Egyptian and I married first- Egyptian I will marry off my son, to second- Egyptian so that my grandson will be fit to enter into the congregation.
llm_translation: The Gemara teaches: Rabbi Yehuda said: I had a convert from Egypt as a friend from the disciples of Rabbi Akiva. He said: I am the first Egyptian, and I married the first Egyptian woman. I will marry my son to a second Egyptian woman so that my grandson will be fit to enter the congregation!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: אֲנַן מִשְּׁלֹמֹה לֵיקוּ וְנֹתֵיב? שְׁלֹמֹה לָא נְסֵיב מִידֵּי, דִּכְתִיב בֵּיהּ: ״מִן הַגּוֹיִם אֲשֶׁר אָמַר ה׳ אֶל בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל לֹא תָבוֹאוּ בָּהֶם וְהֵם לֹא יָבוֹאוּ בָכֶם אָכֵן יַטּוּ אֶת לְבַבְכֶם אַחֲרֵי אֱלֹהֵיהֶם, בָּהֶם דָּבַק שְׁלֹמֹה לְאַהֲבָה״. אֶלָּא קַשְׁיָא ״וַיִּתְחַתֵּן״!
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: Shall we stand up and raise an objection from Solomon? Solomon did not marry anyone, as it is written in his regard: “Of the nations concerning which the Lord said to the children of Israel, You shall not go among them, neither shall they come among you; for surely they will turn away your heart after their gods; Solomon cleaved to these in love” But “and married” difficult,
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: Do we marry off Shlomo and Noteiv? Shlomo did not marry her immediately, as it is written about him: "From the nations that Hashem said to the children of Israel, 'You shall not intermarry with them, and they shall not intermarry with you; for they will surely turn your heart away after their gods.' Solomon clung to love with them." Rather, the difficulty is "and he married her!"

hebrew_text: מִתּוֹךְ אַהֲבָה יְתֵירָה שֶׁאֲהֵבָהּ, מַעֲלֶה עָלָיו הַכָּתוּב כְּאִילּוּ נִתְחַתֵּן בָּהּ.
human_translation: Due to the extraordinary love that he had for her, the verse relates to him as if he had married her
llm_translation: From the midst of excessive love that he loved her, the Scripture regards him as if he had married her.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבִינָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי, וְהָא אֲנַן תְּנַן: פְּצוּעַ דַּכָּא וּכְרוּת שׇׁפְכָה מוּתָּרִים בְּגִיּוֹרֶת וּמְשׁוּחְרֶרֶת. הָא בִּנְתִינָה — אֲסִירִי!
human_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: But didn’t we learn a man with crushed testicles and one whose penis has been severed are permitted to convert and an emancipated but they are prohibited from a Gibeonite woman.
llm_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi, "But didn't we learn: A wound caused by a thorn and a cut from glass are permitted for immersion and for release. But with regard to a needle - they are forbidden!"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: וְלִיטַעְמָיךְ, אֵימָא סֵיפָא: וְאֵינָן אֲסוּרִין אֶלָּא מִלָּבֹא בַּקָּהָל. הָא בִּנְתִינָה שָׁרוּ! אֶלָּא מֵהָא לֵיכָּא לְמִשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: said to And according to your reasoning, say the latter clause And they are prohibited only from entering into the congregation, but they are permitted to a Gibeonite woman, Rather, no to be learned from this
llm_translation: He said to him: And for your taste, I will say the conclusion: And they are not forbidden except to enter the congregation. But in the case of a gift, they are permitted! Rather, from this you can infer her status.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ עַמּוֹנִי וּמוֹאָבִי — אֲסוּרִים, וְאִיסּוּרָן אִיסּוּר עוֹלָם. אֲבָל נְקֵבוֹתֵיהֶם — מוּתָּרוֹת מִיָּד.
human_translation: Ammonite and Moabite are prohibited and their prohibition is eternal, However, their female are permitted immediately.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Ammonites and Moabites — prohibited, and their prohibition is an eternal prohibition. However, their women — permitted immediately.

hebrew_text: מִצְרִי וַאֲדוֹמִי אֵינָם אֲסוּרִים אֶלָּא עַד שְׁלֹשָׁה דּוֹרוֹת, אֶחָד זְכָרִים וְאֶחָד נְקֵבוֹת. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן מַתִּיר אֶת הַנְּקֵבוֹת מִיָּד. אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, קַל וָחוֹמֶר הַדְּבָרִים: וּמָה אִם בְּמָקוֹם שֶׁאָסַר אֶת הַזְּכָרִים אִיסּוּר עוֹלָם — הִתִּיר אֶת הַנְּקֵבוֹת מִיָּד, מָקוֹם שֶׁלָּא אָסַר אֶת הַזְּכָרִים אֶלָּא עַד שְׁלֹשָׁה דּוֹרוֹת — אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁנַּתִּיר אֶת הַנְּקֵבוֹת מִיָּד?
human_translation: Egyptian and Edomite are prohibited only for three generations, both males and females. Rabbi Shimon renders permitted females immediately. Rabbi Shimon said: The matter an a fortiori If in a place where prohibited the males with an eternal prohibition, rendered permitted the females immediately, a place where it rendered prohibited the males for only three generations, is it not right that we should render permitted the females immediately?
llm_translation: Egyptian and Edomite are not prohibited except for three generations, one male and one female. Rabbi Shimon permits the females immediately. Rabbi Shimon said, a fortiori reasoning: And if in a place where he prohibited the males with an eternal prohibition, he permitted the females immediately, in a place where he only prohibited the males for three generations, is it not logical that he should permit the females immediately?

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ לוֹ: אִם הֲלָכָה — נְקַבֵּל, וְאִם לַדִּין — יֵשׁ תְּשׁוּבָה. אָמַר לָהֶם: לֹא כִּי, הֲלָכָה אֲנִי אוֹמֵר.
human_translation: said to him: If halakha we will accept But if inference there is a refutation said to them: not so. I am stating a halakha
llm_translation: They said to him: If it is a halacha - we will accept it, but if it is a legal ruling - there is room for repentance. He said to them: Not so, I am saying a halacha.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״וְכִרְאוֹת שָׁאוּל אֶת דָּוִד יוֹצֵא לִקְרַאת הַפְּלִשְׁתִּי אָמַר אֶל אַבְנֵר שַׂר הַצָּבָא בֶּן מִי זֶה הַנַּעַר אַבְנֵר וַיֹּאמֶר אַבְנֵר חֵי נַפְשְׁךָ הַמֶּלֶךְ אִם יָדָעְתִּי״. וְלָא יְדַע לֵיהּ? וְהָכְתִיב: ״וַיֶּאֱהָבֵהוּ מְאֹד וַיְהִי לוֹ נוֹשֵׂא כֵּלִים״! אֶלָּא אַאֲבוּהּ קָא מְשַׁאֵיל.
human_translation: From where are these matters Rabbi Yoḥanan said: As the verse states: “And when Saul saw David go forth against the Philistine, he said to Abner, the captain of the host: Abner, whose son is this youth? And Abner said: As your soul lives, O king, I cannot tell” Did not recognize him? But isn’t it written: and he loved him greatly; and he became his armor-bearer” Rather, he was asking about father.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemar mena hanei milei? Amar Rabbi Yochanan, de'amar kra: "Vekir'ot Sha'ul et David yotze likrat haplishti amar el Avner sar hatzava ben mi zeh hana'ar Avner vayomer Avner chei nafshecha hamelech im ya'da'ti." Velao yeda lei? Vehaktiv: "Vayehavehu me'od vayehi lo nosei kelim"! Ella a'abuh ka meshaeil. English translation: What is the conclusion regarding these matters? Rabbi Yochanan said, as the verse states: "When Saul saw David going out to meet the Philistine, he said to Abner, the commander of the army, 'Whose son is this youth, Abner?' And Abner said, 'As your soul lives, O king, I do not know.'" But did he not know him? And it is written: "And he loved him greatly, and he became his armor-bearer"! Rather, his father was borrowing him.

hebrew_text: וְאָבִיו לָא יְדַע לֵיהּ? וְהָכְתִיב: ״וְהָאִישׁ בִּימֵי שָׁאוּל זָקֵן בָּא בַאֲנָשִׁים״, וְאָמַר רַב, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַבִּי אַבָּא: זֶה יִשַׁי אֲבִי דָוִד, שֶׁנִּכְנַס בְּאוּכְלוּסָא וְיָצָא בְּאוּכְלוּסָא!
human_translation: And did not recognize father? But isn’t it written “And the man in the days of Saul was old, and came among men” and Rav, and some say Rabbi Abba, said: This Jesse, father of David, who entered with multitudes [ ukhlusa ] and left with multitudes.
llm_translation: And his father did not know him? And it is written: "And the man in the days of Saul was old, advanced among men," and Rav said, and it is taught: Rabbi Abba said: This is Jesse the father of David, who entered with the people and left with the people!

hebrew_text: הָכִי קָאָמַר שָׁאוּל: אִי מִפֶּרֶץ אָתֵי, אִי מִזֶּרַח אָתֵי? אִי מִפֶּרֶץ אָתֵי — מַלְכָּא הָוֵי, שֶׁהַמֶּלֶךְ פּוֹרֵץ לַעֲשׂוֹת דֶּרֶךְ וְאֵין מְמַחִין בְּיָדוֹ. אִי מִזֶּרַח אָתֵי — חֲשִׁיבָא בְּעָלְמָא הָוֵי.
human_translation: this is Saul was saying, Does come from Perez, or does come from Zerah? If comes from Perez he will be king, as a king may breach [ poretz ] a way and no one can stop him. if he comes from Zerah he will be merely a man of importance,
llm_translation: So said Saul: Is he coming from the breach, or is he coming from the east? If he is coming from the breach - he is a king, for the king breaks through to make a path and no one can stop him. If he is coming from the east - he is considered a craftsman in the world.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא אֲמַר לֵיהּ שַׁאֵל עֲלֵיהּ, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיַּלְבֵּשׁ שָׁאוּל אֶת דָּוִד מַדָּיו״, כְּמִדָּתוֹ. וּכְתִיב בֵּיהּ בְּשָׁאוּל: ״מִשִּׁכְמוֹ וָמַעְלָה גָּבוֹהַּ מִכׇּל הָעָם״. אֲמַר לֵיהּ דּוֹאֵג הָאֲדוֹמִי: עַד שֶׁאַתָּה מְשַׁאֵיל עָלָיו אִם הָגוּן הוּא לַמַּלְכוּת אִם לָאו, שְׁאַל עָלָיו אִם רָאוּי לָבֹא בַּקָּהָל אִם לָאו. מַאי טַעְמָא? דְּקָאָתֵי מֵרוּת הַמּוֹאֲבִיָּה.
human_translation: For what reason did say to inquire about As it is written: “And Saul clad David with his apparel [ maddav ]” of size [ kemiddato ]. And it is written with regard to Saul: “From his shoulders and upward he was higher than any of the people” Doeg the Edomite said to Before you inquire as to whether or not he is fit for kingship, inquire as to whether or not he is fit to enter into the congregation. What is the reason that descends from Ruth the Moabite,
llm_translation: What is the reason? He said to him, inquire about him, as it is written: "And Saul dressed David in his garments," according to his measure. And it is written about Saul: "From his shoulders and upward he was taller than any of the people." He said to him, Doeg the Edomite: Until you inquire about whether he is suitable for the kingship or not, inquire about whether he is fit to enter the congregation or not. What is the reason? Because he is descended from Moab.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבְנֵר, תְּנֵינָא: ״עַמּוֹנִי״, וְלֹא עַמּוֹנִית. ״מוֹאָבִי״, וְלֹא מוֹאָבִית. אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה: ״מַמְזֵר״, וְלֹא מַמְזֶרֶת? ״מַמְזֵר״ כְּתִיב — מוּם זָר.
human_translation: Abner said to him: We learned an Ammonite but not an Ammonite woman; a Moabite but not a Moabite woman. However, if that is so, mamzer , but not a female mamzer . It is written: “A mamzer ,” a strange blemish [ mum zar ],
llm_translation: He said to him, Avner, we have learned: "Ammonite," and not Ammonitess. "Moabite," and not Moabitess. Rather, from now on: "Mamzer," and not Mamzeret? "Mamzer" is written - a foreign blemish.

hebrew_text: ״מִצְרִי״, וְלֹא מִצְרִית! שָׁאנֵי הָכָא, דִּמְפָרֵשׁ טַעְמָא דִקְרָא: ״עַל אֲשֶׁר לֹא קִדְּמוּ אֶתְכֶם בַּלֶּחֶם וּבַמַּיִם״ — דַּרְכּוֹ שֶׁל אִישׁ לְקַדֵּם, וְלֹא דַּרְכָּהּ שֶׁל אִשָּׁה לְקַדֵּם. הָיָה לָהֶם לְקַדֵּם אֲנָשִׁים לִקְרַאת אֲנָשִׁים וְנָשִׁים לִקְרַאת נָשִׁים! אִישְׁתִּיק.
human_translation: an Egyptian but not an Egyptian woman. Here it is different, as the reason for verse is explicit: “Because they did not meet you with bread and with water it is the way of a man to meet but it is not the way of a woman the men should have gone to meet the men, and the women to meet the women. was silent,
llm_translation: "Talmudic text: 'Egyptian,' and not 'Egyptian woman'! The difference here is that the reason of the verse is explained: 'Because they did not meet you with bread and with water' — it is the way of a man to meet, and not the way of a woman to meet. They should have had men meet men and women meet women! Let him be silent."

hebrew_text: מִיָּד: ״וַיֹּאמֶר הַמֶּלֶךְ שְׁאַל אַתָּה בֶּן מִי זֶה הָעָלֶם״. הָתָם קָרֵי לֵיהּ ״נַעַר״, הָכָא קָרֵי לֵיהּ ״עֶלֶם״? הָכִי קָא אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הֲלָכָה נִתְעַלְּמָה מִמְּךָ — צֵא וּשְׁאַל בְּבֵית הַמִּדְרָשׁ. שָׁאַל, אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: ״עַמּוֹנִי״, וְלֹא עַמּוֹנִית. ״מוֹאָבִי״, וְלֹא מוֹאָבִית.
human_translation: Immediately: “And the king said, inquire you whose son is this lad” There, calls him youth [ na’ar ], here he calls him lad [ elem ]. said to as follows: halakha is hidden [ nitalma ] from you, Go and inquire in the study hall. He asked. They said to him: An Ammonite but not an Ammonite woman; a Moabite but not a Moabite woman.
llm_translation: Immediately: "And the king said, 'Ask, whose son is this youth?'" There, it is called "na'ar," here it is called "elem"? Thus he said to him: Has the halakha been hidden from you? Go and ask in the study hall. He asked, they said to him: "Ammoni," and not Ammonit. "Mo'avi," and not Mo'avit.

hebrew_text: אַקְשִׁי לְהוּ דּוֹאֵג כֹּל הָנֵי קוּשְׁיָיתָא, אִישְׁתִּיקוּ. בָּעֵי לְאַכְרוֹזֵי עֲלֵיהּ. מִיַּד ״וַעֲמָשָׂא בֶן אִישׁ וּשְׁמוֹ יִתְרָא הַיִּשְׂרְאֵלִי אֲשֶׁר בָּא אֶל אֲבִיגַל בַּת נָחָשׁ״, וּכְתִיב, ״יֶתֶר הַיִּשְׁמְעֵאלִי״, אָמַר רָבָא: מְלַמֵּד שֶׁחָגַר חַרְבּוֹ כְּיִשְׁמָעֵאל, וְאָמַר: כׇּל מִי שֶׁאֵינוֹ שׁוֹמֵעַ הֲלָכָה זוֹ — יִדָּקֵר בַּחֶרֶב. כָּךְ מְקוּבְּלַנִי מִבֵּית דִּינוֹ שֶׁל שְׁמוּאֵל הָרָמָתִי: ״עַמּוֹנִי״, וְלֹא עַמּוֹנִית. ״מוֹאָבִי״, וְלֹא מוֹאָבִית.
human_translation: Doeg raised before them all those objections they were silent, wanted to proclaim immediately “Now Amasa was the son of a man, whose name was Jithra the Israelite, that went into Abigal the daughter of Nahash” and it is written “Jether the Ishmaelite” Rava said: teaches that he girded his sword like Ishmael, and said: Whoever does not accept this halakha shall be stabbed with the sword. This is I received from the court of Samuel from Rama: An Ammonite but not an Ammonite woman; a Moabite but not a Moabite woman.
llm_translation: Difficult for them, Doeg all these difficulties, they were silent. He wanted to proclaim concerning it. Immediately "And Amasa son of a man, and his name Yitra the Yisraeli who came to Avigayil daughter of Nachash," and it is written, "Yitra the Yishmaeli," Rava said: It teaches that he girded his sword like Yishmael, and he said: Anyone who does not heed this law - shall be pierced with a sword. So have I received from the court of Shmuel the Ramati: "Ammoni," and not Ammonit. "Moavi," and not Moavit.

hebrew_text: וּמִי מְהֵימַן? וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא אָמַר רַב: כׇּל תַּלְמִיד חָכָם שֶׁמּוֹרֶה הֲלָכָה וּבָא, אִם קוֹדֶם מַעֲשֶׂה אֲמָרָהּ — שׁוֹמְעִין לוֹ, וְאִם לָאו — אֵין שׁוֹמְעִין לוֹ! שָׁאנֵי הָכָא, דְּהָא שְׁמוּאֵל וּבֵית דִּינוֹ קַיָּים.
human_translation: And is he trusted But didn’t Rabbi Abba say Rav said: every Torah scholar who issues a halakhic ruling if he stated before the incident, one listens to him; but if not, one does not listen to him, Here it is different, as Samuel and his court were living,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And who is trustworthy? And Rabbi Abba said in the name of Rav: Any Torah scholar who teaches a halacha and it comes to pass, if he said it before the action – we listen to him, but if not – we do not listen to him! This is different here, for Shmuel and his court are established." English translation:

hebrew_text: מִכׇּל מָקוֹם קַשְׁיָא! הָכָא תַּרְגִּימוּ: ״כׇּל כְּבוּדָּה בַת מֶלֶךְ פְּנִימָה״. בְּמַעְרְבָא אָמְרִי, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַבִּי יִצְחָק, אָמַר קְרָא: ״וַיֹּאמְרוּ אֵלָיו אַיֵּה שָׂרָה אִשְׁתֶּךָ וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: In any case, difficult. Here, they explained “The king’s daughter is all glorious within” In the West, they say, and some say Rabbi Yitzḥak The verse states: “And they said to him: Where is Sarah your wife?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: From every place it is difficult! Here they interpreted: "All the glory of the daughter of the king is within." In the west, they say, and it was stated by Rabbi Yitzchak, a verse says: "And they said to him, 'Where is Sarah your wife, etc.'" English translation:

hebrew_text: כְּתַנָּאֵי: ״עַמּוֹנִי״, וְלֹא עַמּוֹנִית, ״מוֹאָבִי״, וְלֹא מוֹאָבִית, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: ״עַל דְּבַר אֲשֶׁר לֹא קִדְּמוּ אֶתְכֶם בַּלֶּחֶם וּבַמַּיִם״ — דַּרְכּוֹ שֶׁל אִישׁ לְקַדֵּם וְכוּ׳.
human_translation: like the tanna’im : an Ammonite but not an Ammonite woman, a Moabite but not a Moabite woman. the statement of Rabbi Yehuda, Rabbi Shimon says: “Because they did not meet you with bread and with water it is the way of a man, to meet
llm_translation: Tannaite: "Ammoni", and not Ammonit, "Moavi", and not Moavit, the words of Rabbi Yehuda, Rabbi Shimon says: "Because they did not meet you with bread and water" - it is the way of a person to precede, and so on.

hebrew_text: דָּרֵשׁ רָבָא, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״פִּתַּחְתָּ לְמוֹסֵרָי״ — אָמַר דָּוִד לִפְנֵי הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, שְׁנֵי מוֹסֵרוֹת שֶׁהָיוּ עָלַי, פִּתַּחְתָּם: רוּת הַמּוֹאֲבִיָּה וְנַעֲמָה הָעַמּוֹנִית.
human_translation: Rava taught: What is which is written: “You have loosened my bands” David said before the Holy One, Blessed be He: Master of the Universe, You have loosened the two bands that were on me, Ruth the Moabite woman and Na’ama the Ammonite woman.
llm_translation: Rava expounded, what is the meaning of what is written: "You have opened my bonds" — David said before the Holy One, blessed be He: Master of the world, two bonds that were upon me, You have opened them: Ruth the Moabite and Naamah the Ammonite.

hebrew_text: דָּרֵשׁ רָבָא: מַאי דִּכְתִיב ״רַבּוֹת עָשִׂיתָ אַתָּה ה׳ אֱלֹהַי נִפְלְאוֹתֶיךָ וּמַחְשְׁבוֹתֶיךָ אֵלֵינוּ״. ״אֵלַי״ לֹא נֶאֱמַר, אֶלָּא ״אֵלֵינוּ״ — מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהָיָה רְחַבְעָם יוֹשֵׁב בְּחֵיקוֹ שֶׁל דָּוִד, אָמַר לוֹ: עָלַי וְעָלֶיךָ נֶאֶמְרוּ שְׁתֵּי מִקְרָאוֹת הַלָּלוּ.
human_translation: Rava taught: What is which is written: “Many things have You done, O Lord my God, Your wonders and Your thoughts are upon us” Upon me is not stated, but “upon us,” teaches that Rehoboam, sitting on the lap of David, said to him: These two verses were stated about me and about you,
llm_translation: Rava expounded: What is the meaning of the verse, "You have multiplied, O Lord my God, Your wondrous deeds and Your thoughts toward us"? The word "to me" is not stated, rather "toward us" - this teaches that Rahab was sitting in the lap of David, and he said to him: "Both of these verses were said about me and you."

hebrew_text: דָּרֵשׁ רָבָא, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״אָז אָמַרְתִּי הִנֵּה בָאתִי בִּמְגִילַּת סֵפֶר כָּתוּב עָלָי״, אָמַר דָּוִד: אֲנִי אָמַרְתִּי ״עַתָּה בָאתִי״, וְלֹא יָדַעְתִּי שֶׁ״בִּמְגִילַּת סֵפֶר כָּתוּב עָלָי״. הָתָם כְּתִיב: ״הַנִּמְצָאוֹת״, הָכָא כְּתִיב: ״מָצָאתִי דָּוִד עַבְדִּי בְּשֶׁמֶן קׇדְשִׁי מְשַׁחְתִּיו״.
human_translation: Rava taught: What is which is written: “Then I said: Behold, I have come; in the scroll of a book it is written about me” David said: I said I have come now; But I did not know that it was written about me in the scroll of a book, There, it is written: that are found here, it is written: “I have found David, My servant; I have anointed him with My holy oil”
llm_translation: Rava expounded, what is the meaning of what is written: "Then I said, 'Behold, I have come; in the scroll of the book it is written of me'"? David said: I said, "Now I have come," and I did not know that "in the scroll of the book it is written of me." There it is written: "the things found," here it is written: "I have found David My servant; with My holy oil I have anointed him."

hebrew_text: אָמַר עוּלָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: בַּת גֵּר עַמּוֹנִי כְּשֵׁרָה לַכְּהוּנָּה. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא בַּר עוּלָּא לְעוּלָּא: כְּמַאן? אִי כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, הָא אָמַר: בַּת גֵּר זָכָר — כְּבַת חָלָל זָכָר! וְאִי כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי, פְּשִׁיטָא, הָא אָמַר: אַף גֵּר שֶׁנָּשָׂא גִּיּוֹרֶת — בִּתּוֹ כְּשֵׁרָה לִכְהוּנָּה.
human_translation: Ulla said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: The daughter of an Ammonite convert is fit to the priesthood. Rava bar Ulla said to Ulla: In accordance with whose If in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda, didn’t he say the daughter of a male convert is like the daughter of a male ḥalal , And if in accordance with Rabbi Yosei, is obvious as he said even a male convert marries a female convert, his daughter is fit to the priesthood.
llm_translation: Ula said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: The daughter of an Ammonite convert is fit for priesthood. Rava bar Ula said to Ula: According to whom? If according to Rabbi Yehuda, didn't he say: The daughter of a male convert is like the daughter of a profaned one? And if according to Rabbi Yosei, it is obvious, as he said: Even a convert who married a convert - his daughter is fit for priesthood.

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא, בְּהָנָךְ דִּרְאוּיִן לָבֹא בַּקָּהָל, אֲבָל הַאי דְּאֵין רָאוּי לָבֹא בַּקָּהָל — לָא, מְנָא לֵיהּ?
human_translation: And if you would say of those who are fit to enter into the congregation, but this one, who is not fit to enter into the congregation, not From where he
llm_translation: And if you will say, with regard to a person who is fit to enter the congregation, but this one who is not fit to enter the congregation — no, how do we establish it?

hebrew_text: דְּיָלֵיף מִכֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל בְּאַלְמָנָה. מָה לְכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל בְּאַלְמָנָה — שֶׁכֵּן בִּיאָתוֹ בַּעֲבֵירָה.
human_translation: He derives from a High Priest a widow, What a High Priest a widow, as his intercourse involves a transgression?
llm_translation: It is preferable for a High Priest to marry a widow. What is the reason for a High Priest to marry a widow? Because his entry into transgression.

hebrew_text: חָלָל יוֹכִיחַ! מָה לְחָלָל שֶׁכֵּן יְצִירָתוֹ בַּעֲבֵירָה —
human_translation: Let a ḥalal prove What a ḥalal , that his formation involved a transgression,
llm_translation: A desecrated one shall prove! What for a desecrated one that its formation in transgression —

hebrew_text: כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל יוֹכִיחַ. וְחָזַר הַדִּין:
human_translation: Let a High Priest prove And the derivation has reverted
llm_translation: Kohen Gadol yochiach. Ve'chazar hadin.

hebrew_text: לֹא רְאִי זֶה כִּרְאִי זֶה, וְלֹא רְאִי זֶה כִּרְאִי זֶה. הַצַּד הַשָּׁוֶה שֶׁבָּהֶן: שֶׁאֵינוֹ בְּרוֹב קָהָל, וּבִתּוֹ פְּסוּלָה. אַף כָּאן, שֶׁאֵינוֹ בְּרוֹב קָהָל — וּבִתּוֹ פְּסוּלָה.
human_translation: The aspect of this is not like the aspect of that and the aspect of that is not like the aspect of this their common denominator is that he is not included in the majority of the congregation, And daughter is disqualified So too, is not included in the majority of the congregation, and his daughter is disqualified
llm_translation: Not the sight this like the sight this, and not the sight this like the sight this. The common side in them: that it is not in the majority of the congregation, and his daughter is disqualified. Also here, that it is not in the majority of the congregation — and his daughter is disqualified.

hebrew_text: מָה לְהַצַּד הַשָּׁוֶה שֶׁבָּהֶן שֶׁכֵּן יֵשׁ בָּהֶן צַד עֲבֵירָה!
human_translation: What the common denominator include an aspect of transgression;
llm_translation: What for the side the equal that in them so there is in them side transgression!

hebrew_text: דִּלְמָא וַדַּאי בְּעַמּוֹנִי שֶׁנָּשָׂא בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל קָאָמְרַתְּ, אַף עַל גַּב דְּבִיאָתוֹ בַּעֲבֵירָה — בִּתּוֹ כְּשֵׁרָה! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִין.
human_translation: Perhaps you spoke of an Ammonite who married the daughter of a Jew, although his intercourse involves a transgression, his daughter is fit said to him: Yes,
llm_translation: Perhaps indeed in the case of an Ammonite who married a daughter of Israel, she is considered valid, even though his union was through transgression - his daughter is valid! He said to him: No.

hebrew_text: דְּכִי אֲתָא רָבִין אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: בַּת גֵּר עַמּוֹנִי, וּבַת מִצְרִי שֵׁנִי, רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: כְּשֵׁרָה, וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר: פְּסוּלָה. רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר פְּסוּלָה — דְּיָלֵיף לַהּ מִכֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל בְּאַלְמָנָה. רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר כְּשֵׁרָה —
human_translation: As, when Ravin came Rabbi Yoḥanan said: the daughter of an Ammonite convert and the daughter of a second- Egyptian Rabbi Yoḥanan said fit whereas Reish Lakish said disqualified Reish Lakish said disqualified, as he derives from a High Priest a widow Rabbi Yoḥanan said fit,
llm_translation: When Rabbin came, Rabbi Yohanan said: The daughter of an Ammonite is valid, and the daughter of an Egyptian is invalid. Rabbi Yohanan said: She is valid, and Reish Lakish said: She is invalid. Reish Lakish said she is invalid - because she is disqualified from marrying a High Priest. Rabbi Yohanan said she is valid -

hebrew_text: דְּתָנֵי רַבִּי זַכַּאי קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: ״כִּי אִם בְּתוּלָה מֵעַמָּיו יִקַּח אִשָּׁה״, לְהָבִיא גִּיּוֹרֶת מִכַּנָּהּ — שֶׁהִיא כְּשֵׁרָה לַכְּהוּנָּה. וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֲנִי שׁוֹנֶה ״עַמָּיו״, ״מֵעַמָּיו״ — לְהָבִיא בְּתוּלָה הַבָּאָה מִשְּׁנֵי עַמְמִין, וְאַתְּ אָמְרַתְּ גִּיּוֹרֶת מִכַּנָּהּ וְתוּ לָא?
human_translation: as Rabbi Zakkai taught before Rabbi Yoḥanan: “But a virgin of his own people shall he take to wife” to include an established female convert, that she is fit into the priesthood. And said to him: I teach “his own people” “of his own people” to include a virgin who comes from two peoples, and you say an established female convert and no more?
llm_translation: The text states: Rabbi Zakkai taught before Rabbi Yochanan: "But he shall take a wife in her virginity from among his people," to bring a convert from her purchase - who is fit for the priesthood. And he said to him: I differentiate between "from among his people" and "from his people" - to bring a virgin who comes from two nations, and you say a convert from her purchase, is that not so?

hebrew_text: מַאי ״שְׁנֵי עַמְמִין״? אִילֵּימָא עַמּוֹנִי שֶׁנָּשָׂא עַמּוֹנִית, וּמַאי מִשְּׁנֵי עַמְמִין, דִּזְכָרִים אֲסוּרִין וּנְקֵבוֹת מוּתָּרוֹת, הַיְינוּ גִּיּוֹרֶת מִכַּנָּהּ. אֶלָּא בְּעַמּוֹנִי שֶׁנָּשָׂא בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל.
human_translation: What two peoples? If we say an Ammonite who married an Ammonite woman, and what is “from two peoples,” as males are prohibited whereas females are permitted this is an established female convert, Rather, to an Ammonite who married the daughter of a Jew,
llm_translation: "What is 'two nations'? Perhaps an Ammonite who married an Ammonitess. And what is meant by 'two nations'? That males are forbidden and females are permitted, meaning that the offspring follows the mother. Rather, it refers to an Ammonite who married a daughter of Israel."

hebrew_text: וְאִיכָּא דְאָמְרִי, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֲנִי שׁוֹנֶה ״עַמָּיו״ ״מֵעַמָּיו״ — לְהָבִיא בְּתוּלָה הַבָּאָה מִשְּׁנֵי עַמְמִין, וּמֵעַם שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ שְׁנֵי עַמְמִין, וְאַתְּ אָמְרַתְּ גִּיּוֹרֶת מִכַּנָּהּ וְתוּ לָא?
human_translation: And there are who say said to Rabbi Zakkai: I teach “his own people” “from his own people” to include a virgin who comes from two peoples, and from a people that consists of two peoples, and you say an established female convert and no more?
llm_translation: And there are those who say, he said to him: I differentiate "his people" from "from his people" - to bring a virgin who comes from two nations, and from a nation that has two nations within it, and you say she is a convert from her cradle, is it not so?

hebrew_text: וּלְהָךְ לִישָּׁנָא, בַּת מִצְרִי שֵׁנִי, דִּכְשֵׁרָה לִכְהוּנָּה מְנָא לֵיהּ? וְכִי תֵּימָא דְּיָלֵיף מֵעַמּוֹנִי שֶׁנָּשָׂא בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל: מָה לְעַמּוֹנִי שֶׁנָּשָׂא בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל, שֶׁכֵּן נְקֵבוֹת מוּתָּרוֹת.
human_translation: And according to this version, from where the daughter of a second- Egyptian is fit into the priesthood, And if you would say that he derives from an Ammonite who married daughter of a Jew, What an Ammonite who married daughter of a Jew as female are permitted?
llm_translation: And to strike a comparison, the daughter of an Egyptian, a second marriage, when she is fit for the priesthood, how do we know? And if you say that it is preferable for an Ammonite who married a daughter of Israel: What about an Ammonite who married a daughter of Israel, for women of his nation are permitted.

hebrew_text: מִצְרִי שֵׁנִי שֶׁנָּשָׂא מִצְרִית שְׁנִיָּה יוֹכִיחַ!
human_translation: Let a second- male Egyptian who married a second- female Egyptian prove
llm_translation: An Egyptian, a second husband, who married an Egyptian woman, shall prove his case!

hebrew_text: מָה לְמִצְרִי שֵׁנִי שֶׁנָּשָׂא מִצְרִית שְׁנִיָּה, שֶׁכֵּן אֵין בִּיאָתוֹ בַּעֲבֵירָה.
human_translation: What a second- male Egyptian who married a second- female Egyptian that his intercourse does not involve a transgression,
llm_translation: Egyptian man who married Egyptian woman second that he married Egyptian woman second, so there is no in his coming in transgression.

hebrew_text: עַמּוֹנִי שֶׁנָּשָׂא בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל יוֹכִיחַ. וְחָזַר הַדִּין וְכוּ׳.
human_translation: Let an Ammonite who married the daughter of a Jew prove And the derivation has reverted
llm_translation: Ammonite who married daughter of Israel shall prove. And the law returned and so forth.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: הַיְינוּ דִּשְׁמַעְנָא לֵיהּ לְרַב יְהוּדָה דְּאָמַר ״עַמָּיו״ ״מֵעַמָּיו״, וְלָא יָדַעְנָא מַאי קָאָמַר.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: This is what I heard Rav Yehuda say “his own people” “from his own people,” and I did not know what he was saying.
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: This is what we heard from Rav Yehuda who said, "His people" and "from his people," and we do not know what he is saying.

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא רַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר יְהוּדָה, אָמַר: הָכִי תַּנָּא קַמֵּיהּ: אִשָּׁה עַמּוֹנִית — כְּשֵׁרָה, בְּנָהּ מֵעַמּוֹנִי — פָּסוּל, וּבִתָּהּ מֵעַמּוֹנִי — כְּשֵׁרָה. בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים: בְּעַמּוֹנִי וְעַמּוֹנִית שֶׁנִּתְגַּיְּירוּ, אֲבָל בִּתָּהּ מֵעַמּוֹנִי — פְּסוּלָה.
human_translation: When Rav Shmuel bar Yehuda came he said taught before as follows: An Ammonite woman is fit, her son from an Ammonite is unfit, and her daughter from an Ammonite is fit. In what is this statement said? with regard to an Ammonite and an Ammonite woman who converted, but her daughter from an Ammonite is unfit.
llm_translation: When Rav Shmuel, son of Yehuda, came, he said: Thus was taught before him: An Ammonite woman - valid, her son from an Ammonite - disqualified, and her daughter from an Ammonite - valid. In what case are these matters said: regarding an Ammonite and an Ammonitess who converted, but her daughter from an Ammonite - disqualified.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: פּוֹק תְּנִי לְבָרָא. מַאי דַּאֲמַרְתְּ אִשָּׁה עַמּוֹנִית כְּשֵׁרָה — ״עַמּוֹנִי״ וְלֹא עַמּוֹנִית. בְּנָהּ מֵעַמּוֹנִי פָּסוּל — דְּהָא עַמּוֹנִי הוּא.
human_translation: said to him: Go out teach outside, What you said, an Ammonite woman is fit, a male Ammonite but not a female Ammonite. her son from an Ammonite is unfit, as he is an Ammonite.
llm_translation: He said to him: Go, teach the son of Bara. What did you say, "an Ammonite woman is permissible" - "Ammonite" and not Ammonitess. Her son from an Ammonite is disqualified - because he is an Ammonite.

hebrew_text: וּבִתָּהּ מֵעַמּוֹנִי כְּשֵׁרָה, לְמַאי? אִילֵימָא לָבֹא בַּקָּהָל — הַשְׁתָּא אִמָּהּ כְּשֵׁרָה, הִיא מִיבַּעְיָא? אֶלָּא לִכְהוּנָּה.
human_translation: Her daughter from an Ammonite is fit, with regard to what If we say to enter into the congregation, Now her mother is fit necessary she Rather, into the priesthood.
llm_translation: And her daughter from an Ammonite is valid, for what? If you say to enter the congregation - now, if her mother is valid, is it necessary? Rather, for priesthood.

hebrew_text: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים: בְּעַמּוֹנִי וְעַמּוֹנִית שֶׁנִּתְגַּיְּירוּ, אֲבָל בִּתָּהּ מֵעַמּוֹנִי פְּסוּלָה. מַאי בִּתָּהּ מֵעַמּוֹנִי? אִילֵּימָא עַמּוֹנִי שֶׁנָּשָׂא עַמּוֹנִית — הַיְינוּ גִּיּוֹרֶת מִכַּנָּהּ! אֶלָּא עַמּוֹנִי שֶׁנָּשָׂא בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: פּוֹק תְּנִי לְבָרָא.
human_translation: In what is this statement said? with regard to an Ammonite and an Ammonite woman who converted, but her daughter from an Ammonite is unfit. What is her daughter from an Ammonite? If we say an Ammonite who married an Ammonite woman, this is an established female convert, Rather, an Ammonite who married the daughter of a Jew, he said to Go out teach outside,
llm_translation: In what case are these words spoken? In the case of an Ammonite man and an Ammonite woman who converted, but his daughter from an Ammonite woman is disqualified. What is meant by "his daughter from an Ammonite woman"? If you say an Ammonite man who married an Ammonite woman - that is a conversion from her own nation! Rather, an Ammonite man who married a daughter of Israel, he says to her: "Go, bring proof of your lineage."

hebrew_text: מִצְרִי וַאֲדוֹמִי אֵינָן אֲסוּרִין וְכוּ׳. מַאי תְּשׁוּבָה?
human_translation: Egyptian and Edomite are prohibited only What refutation
llm_translation: Egyptian and Edomite are not forbidden, etc. What is the repentance?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, מִשּׁוּם דְּאִיכָּא לְמֵימַר: עֲרָיוֹת יוֹכִיחוּ, שֶׁלֹּא אָסַר בָּהֶן אֶלָּא עַד שְׁלֹשָׁה דּוֹרוֹת, אֶחָד זְכָרִים וְאֶחָד נְקֵבוֹת!
human_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: because it may be said those with whom relations are forbidden, prove as prohibits them only for three generations, both males and females,
llm_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan, because there is to say: they shall prove the forbidden relationships, that He only prohibited them for three generations, one male and one female!

hebrew_text: מָה לַעֲרָיוֹת, שֶׁכֵּן כָּרֵת! מַמְזֵר יוֹכִיחַ.
human_translation: What those with whom relations are forbidden, as karet ? Let a mamzer prove
llm_translation: What about forbidden relationships, that they incur karet! A mamzer shall prove.

hebrew_text: מָה לְמַמְזֵר, שֶׁכֵּן אֵינוֹ רָאוּי לָבֹא בַּקָּהָל לְעוֹלָם. עֲרָיוֹת יוֹכִיחוּ, וְחָזַר הַדִּין.
human_translation: What a mamzer , that he is forever unfit to enter into the congregation Let those with whom relations are forbidden prove And the derivation has reverted
llm_translation: What is a mamzer, that he is not fitting to enter the congregation forever. They shall prove his illegitimacy, and the judgment was reversed.

hebrew_text: לֹא רְאִי זֶה כִּרְאִי זֶה, וְלֹא רְאִי זֶה כִּרְאִי זֶה. הַצַּד הַשָּׁוֶה שֶׁבָּהֶן שֶׁאֲסוּרִין, וְאֶחָד זְכָרִים וְאֶחָד נְקֵבוֹת. אַף אֲנִי אָבִיא מִצְרִי וּמִצְרִית שֶׁיִּהְיוּ אֲסוּרִין, אֶחָד זְכָרִים וְאֶחָד נְקֵבוֹת.
human_translation: The aspect of this is not like the aspect of that and the aspect of that is not like the aspect of this their common denominator is that their prohibition both males and females. I will also bring a male Egyptian and a female Egyptian that they are forbidden, both males and females.
llm_translation: Not seeing this like seeing this, and not seeing this like seeing this. The common factor between them is that they are both forbidden, with one being male and one being female. I will also bring an Egyptian man and an Egyptian woman who will be forbidden, one male and one female.

hebrew_text: מָה לְהַצַּד הַשָּׁוֶה שֶׁבָּהֶן, שֶׁכֵּן יֵשׁ בָּהֶן צַד כָּרֵת.
human_translation: What the common denominator include an aspect of karet ,
llm_translation: What is the common characteristic of both, that they both have an aspect of excision.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן, מֵחָלָל דְּחַיָּיבֵי עֲשֵׂה, וּכְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב.
human_translation: And the Rabbis, from a ḥalal , liable for a positive mitzva, And in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov,
llm_translation: The Sages say, "One who desecrates Shabbat is liable for violating positive commandments," and according to Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי ״לָא כִּי״? הָכִי קָאָמַר לְהוּ: לְדִידִי, לָא סְבִירָא לִי דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב. לְדִידְכוּ, דִּסְבִירָא לְכוּ כְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב — הֲלָכָה אֲנִי אוֹמֵר.
human_translation: And what Not so? this is what he said to them: According to my own I do not hold in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov, according to you, who do maintain in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov, I am stating a halakha
llm_translation: And what is "לָא כִּי"? This is what he is saying to them: According to my opinion, I do not think that Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov is correct. But according to your opinion, that Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov is correct — I say it is a halacha.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, אָמַר לָהֶן רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: הֲלָכָה אֲנִי אוֹמֵר, וְעוֹד: מִקְרָא מְסַיְּיעֵנִי, ״בָּנִים״ — וְלֹא בָּנוֹת.
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Shimon said to them: I am stating a halakha , and furthermore a verse supports me, sons but not daughters.
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Shimon said to them: I am stating a halakha, and furthermore: a verse supports me, "sons" - and not daughters.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״בָּנִים״ וְלֹא בָּנוֹת, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן. אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה, הֲרֵי הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״בָּנִים אֲשֶׁר יִוָּלְדוּ לָהֶם דּוֹר שְׁלִישִׁי״, הַכָּתוּב תְּלָאָן בְּלֵידָה.
human_translation: The Sages taught sons, but not daughters; the statement of Rabbi Shimon. Rabbi Yehuda said: states: “The sons of the third generation that are born to them the verse made their dependent on birth,
llm_translation: The sages taught: "sons" and not daughters, the words of Rabbi Shimon. Rabbi Yehuda said, behold he says: "sons who will be born to them in the third generation," the Scripture relies on their birth.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אִי לָאו דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הַכָּתוּב תְּלָאָן בְּלֵידָה — לֹא מָצָא יָדָיו וְרַגְלָיו בְּבֵית הַמִּדְרָשׁ. כֵּיוָן דְּאָמַר מָר: קְהַל גֵּרִים אִיקְּרִי קָהָל,
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Had Rabbi Yehuda not said the verse made their dependent on birth, he would not have found his hands and feet in the study hall, Since the Master said a congregation of converts is called a congregation
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: If not for what Rabbi Yehuda said, the written word would have been lost in childbirth - his hands and feet were not found in the study hall. Once the Master said: "A congregation of strangers is called a congregation."

hebrew_text: מִצְרִי שֵׁנִי בְּמַאי יִטְהַר? דִּלְמָא דְּאִי עֲבַר וּנְסֵיב. ״דְּאִי״ לָא כְּתִיב קְרָא.
human_translation: how could a second- Egyptian achieve purity, Perhaps that if he transgressed and married That if, is not written verse.
llm_translation: Egyptian, the second, with what will he become pure? Perhaps if he transgressed and married. "If" is not written in the verse.

hebrew_text: הֲרֵי מַמְזֵר ״דְּאִי״, וְכַתְבֵיהּ קְרָא! ״דְּאִי״ לְאִיסּוּרָא — כְּתַב, ״דְּאִי״ לְהֶיתֵּרָא — לָא כְּתַב.
human_translation: isn’t a mamzer , that if, and the verse writes it? that if a prohibition, writes, that if to an allowance, does not write.
llm_translation: Behold, a mamzer "de'i," and its writing is scripture! "De'i" for prohibition - it is written, "de'i" for permission - it is not written.

hebrew_text: הֲרֵי מַחֲזִיר גְּרוּשָׁתוֹ, ״דְּאִי״ לְהֶיתֵּרָא וְכַתְבֵיהּ? הָתָם מִשּׁוּם עִיקַּר אִיסּוּרָא הוּא דְּכַתְבֵיהּ.
human_translation: isn’t one who remarries his divorcée that if to an allowance, and writes it. There, writes due to the basic prohibition,
llm_translation: Behold, he returns his divorced wife, "because" to permit and her writings? There, because of the main prohibition is her writings.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אִם נֶאֱמַר ״בָּנִים״, לָמָּה נֶאֱמַר ״דּוֹרוֹת״? וְאִם נֶאֱמַר ״דּוֹרוֹת״, לָמָּה נֶאֱמַר ״בָּנִים״? אִם נֶאֱמַר ״בָּנִים״ וְלֹא נֶאֱמַר ״דּוֹרוֹת״, הָיִיתִי אוֹמֵר: בֵּן רִאשׁוֹן וְשֵׁנִי — אָסוּר, שְׁלִישִׁי — מוּתָּר, לְכָךְ נֶאֱמַר ״דּוֹרוֹת״.
human_translation: The Sages taught If it is stated “sons” why is it stated “generation,” and if it is stated “generation” why is it stated “sons”? If it stated “sons” and not stated “generation,” I would say first and second sons forbidden, third permitted. Therefore, it is stated “generation”
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: If it was stated "sons," why was it stated "generations"? And if it was stated "generations," why was it stated "sons"? If it was stated "sons" and not stated "generations," I would say: the first and second son - prohibited, the third - permitted, therefore it was stated "generations."

hebrew_text: וְאִם נֶאֱמַר ״דּוֹרוֹת״ וְלֹא נֶאֱמַר ״בָּנִים״, הָיִיתִי אוֹמֵר לְאוֹתָן הָעוֹמְדִים עַל הַר סִינַי, לְכָךְ נֶאֱמַר ״בָּנִים״.
human_translation: And if stated “generation” and not stated “sons,” I would say those standing on Mount Sinai, Therefore, it is stated “sons”
llm_translation: And if it were said "generations" and not said "children," I would say to those who stood at Mount Sinai, therefore it is said "children."

hebrew_text: ״לָהֶם״ — מֵהֶם מְנֵה. ״לָהֶם״ — הַלֵּךְ אַחַר פְּסוּלָן.
human_translation: “to them” from them count. “to them” follow their disqualification.
llm_translation: "To them" - from them count. "To them" - follow after their disqualification.

hebrew_text: וְאִיצְטְרִיךְ לְמִיכְתַּב ״לָהֶם״, וְאִיצְטְרִיךְ לְמִיכְתַּב ״אֲשֶׁר יִוָּלְדוּ״. דְּאִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״אֲשֶׁר יִוָּלְדוּ״, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: מִבְּנֵיהֶם מְנֵה, כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״לָהֶם״. וְאִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״לָהֶם״, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: מִצְרִית מְעוּבֶּרֶת שֶׁנִּתְגַּיְּירָה — הִיא וּבְנָהּ חַד, כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״אֲשֶׁר יִוָּלְדוּ״.
human_translation: And it is necessary to write “to them,” and it is necessary to write “that are born.” As, if the Merciful One had written “that are born,” I would say count from sons. the Merciful One writes “to them” And if the Merciful One had written “to them,” I would say a pregnant Egyptian who converted, she and her child, one the Merciful One writes “that are born,”
llm_translation: The text reads: "And it was necessary to write 'to them,' and it was necessary to write 'that they shall be born.' For if the Merciful One had written 'that they shall be born,' I would have said: count from their sons. But since the Merciful One wrote 'to them,' I would say: an Egyptian convert who gave birth - she and her son are considered as one. The Merciful One wrote 'that they shall be born.'"

hebrew_text: וְאִיצְטְרִיךְ לְמִיכְתַּב ״לָהֶם״ הָכָא, וְאִיצְטְרִיךְ לְמִיכְתַּב ״לוֹ״ גַּבֵּי מַמְזֵר.
human_translation: And it is necessary to write “to them” here, and it is necessary to write “to him [ lo ]” with regard to a mamzer ,
llm_translation: And it was necessary to write "to them" here, and it was necessary to write "to him" regarding a mamzer.

hebrew_text: דְּאִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא הָכָא, מִשּׁוּם דְּבָא מִטִּיפָּה פְּסוּלָה, אֲבָל מַמְזֵר דְּבָא מִטִּיפָּה כְּשֵׁרָה — אֵימָא לָא.
human_translation: as, if the Merciful One had written here, because comes from an unfit drop But a mamzer , who comes from a fit drop no
llm_translation: If the Merciful One wrote here, because from a forbidden drop it is disqualified, but a mamzer, because of a forbidden drop it is valid - say no.

hebrew_text: וְאִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא גַּבֵּי מַמְזֵר, מִשּׁוּם דְּאֵין רָאוּי לָבֹא בַּקָּהָל לְעוֹלָם, אֲבָל הָכָא — אֵימָא לָא, צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: And if the Merciful One had written with regard to a mamzer , he is forever unfit to enter into the congregation, but here, say not necessary.
llm_translation: "And if the Merciful One wrote regarding a mamzer, because he is not fitting to enter the congregation forever, but here - I might say no, it is necessary."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מִצְרִי שֵׁנִי שֶׁנָּשָׂא מִצְרִית רִאשׁוֹנָה — בְּנָהּ שְׁלִישִׁי הָאוֵי. אַלְמָא קָסָבַר בָּתַר דִּידֵיהּ שָׁדֵינַן לֵיהּ,
human_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: a second- Egyptian married a first- Egyptian her child is a third- Apparently maintains we assign to him,
llm_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: An Egyptian who married an Egyptian woman as his first wife—his son is considered a third-generation Egyptian. This implies that he agrees with his own reasoning.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַב יוֹסֵף, רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן אוֹמֵר: יְכוֹלִין מַמְזֵרִים לִיטָּהֵר. כֵּיצַד? מַמְזֵר נָשָׂא שִׁפְחָה — הַוָּלָד עֶבֶד. שִׁחְרְרוֹ — נִמְצָא בֶּן חוֹרִין. אַלְמָא בָּתַר דִּידַהּ שָׁדֵינַן לֵיהּ! שָׁאנֵי הָתָם, דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״הָאִשָּׁה וִילָדֶיהָ תִּהְיֶה לַאדוֹנֶיהָ״.
human_translation: Rav Yosef raised an objection Rabbi Tarfon says: Mamzerim can purify themselves How so? a mamzer married maidservant, the child a slave. freed he becomes a free man Apparently we assign to her, It is different there, as the verse states: “The wife and her children shall be her master’s”
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: Rav Yosef raised an objection: Rabbi Tarfon says: Mamzerim can become pure. How so? If a mamzer marries a maidservant, and she gives birth to a slave. If he frees him, he is found to be a free man. This proves that we rely on her status! The case is different there, for the verse states: "The woman and her children shall belong to her master."

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רָבָא, אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: מִנְיָמִין גֵּר מִצְרִי הָיָה לִי חָבֵר מִתַּלְמִידֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, וְאָמַר: אֲנִי מִצְרִי רִאשׁוֹן, וְנָשָׂאתִי מִצְרִית רִאשׁוֹנָה, אַשִּׂיא לִבְנֵי מִצְרִית שְׁנִיָּה, כְּדֵי שֶׁיְּהֵא בֶּן בְּנִי רָאוּי לָבֹא בַּקָּהָל. וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ בָּתְרֵיהּ דִּידֵיהּ שָׁדֵינַן לֵיהּ — אֲפִילּוּ רִאשׁוֹנָה נָמֵי! הָא אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן לְתַנָּא: תְּנִי רִאשׁוֹנָה.
human_translation: Rava raised an objection Rabbi Yehuda said: Minyamin, an Egyptian convert, was a friend of mine from among the students of Rabbi Akiva, and he said: I a first- Egyptian and I married first- Egyptian I will marry off my son, to second- Egyptian so that my grandson will be fit to enter into the congregation. Now, if it enters your mind we assign to even first- Didn’t Rabbi Yoḥanan say to the tanna teach a first-
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: Rabbi Yehuda said, "I had a convert from Egypt who was a companion of the disciples of Rabbi Akiva, and he said: 'I am the first Egyptian, and I married an Egyptian woman who was also the first. I will marry a second Egyptian woman so that my son's son will be fit to enter the congregation.' And if you think that we should prevent him from marrying a second Egyptian woman, even the first one as well! Rabbi Yochanan said to a Tanna: Teach the first one."

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא רַב דִּימִי, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מִצְרִי שֵׁנִי שֶׁנָּשָׂא מִצְרִית רִאשׁוֹנָה — בְּנָהּ שֵׁנִי הָוֵי. אַלְמָא בָּתַר אִימֵּיהּ שָׁדֵינַן לֵיהּ.
human_translation: When Rav Dimi came he said Rabbi Yoḥanan said a second- Egyptian married a first- Egyptian her son is a second- Apparently, we assign to the mother
llm_translation: When Rav Dimi came, Rabbi Yochanan said: A second Egyptian who married a first Egyptian - his son is considered a second class Egyptian. This implies that they permit him after his mother.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: אֶלָּא הָא דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הִפְרִישׁ חַטָּאת מְעוּבֶּרֶת וְיָלְדָה — רָצָה מִתְכַּפֵּר בָּהּ, רָצָה מִתְכַּפֵּר בִּוְלָדָהּ.
human_translation: Abaye said to him: But that which Rabbi Yoḥanan said: one set aside a pregnant sin-offering, and gave birth he wishes he may gain atonement with itself, he wishes he may gain atonement with young,
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: Rather, this that Rabbi Yochanan said: If one separated a pregnant sin-offering and it gave birth - he wants to atone with it, he wants to atone with its offspring.

hebrew_text: אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא עוּבָּר לָאו יֶרֶךְ אִמּוֹ הוּא — הָוֵה לֵיהּ כְּמַפְרִישׁ שְׁתֵּי חַטָּאוֹת לְאַחְרָיוּת, וְאָמַר רַב אוֹשַׁעְיָא: הִפְרִישׁ שְׁתֵּי חַטָּאוֹת לְאַחְרָיוּת — מִתְכַּפֵּר בְּאַחַת מֵהֶן, וְהַשְּׁנִיָּה תִּרְעֶה.
human_translation: Granted, if you say a fetus is not the thigh, of its mother is like one who sets aside two sin-offerings as a guarantee, And Rav Oshaya said one set aside two sin-offerings as a guarantee, he gains atonement with one of them, and the second is left to graze
llm_translation: If you say that the fetus is not considered a thigh of its mother - it would be like separating two sin-offerings for later, and Rav Oshaya said: If one separates two sin-offerings for later - he atones with one of them, and the other one grazes.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ עוּבָּר יֶרֶךְ אִמּוֹ הוּא, הָוֵה לֵיהּ וְלַד חַטָּאת, וּוְלַד חַטָּאת לְמִיתָה אָזֵיל?
human_translation: But if you say a fetus is the thigh of its mother it is the young of a sin-offering, and the young of a sin-offering goes to death.
llm_translation: Rather if you say, "Ubar Yerech Imo Hu," he should have a sin-offering born to him, and the offspring of a sin-offering goes to death?

hebrew_text: אִישְׁתִּיק. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: דִּלְמָא שָׁאנֵי הָתָם, דִּכְתִיב: ״אֲשֶׁר יִוָּלְדוּ״, הַכָּתוּב תְּלָאוֹ בְּלֵידָה. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: קַרְקַפְנָא, חֲזֵיתֵיהּ לְרֵישָׁךְ בֵּינֵי עַמּוּדֵי כִּי אֲמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן לְהָא שְׁמַעְתָּא.
human_translation: was silent, said to him: Perhaps it is different there, as it is written that are born to them the verse made dependent on birth, said to him: skull, I saw your head between the pillars when Rabbi Yoḥanan taught this halakha .
llm_translation: The man remained silent. He said to him: Perhaps it is different there, as it is written: "that they shall be born," the Scripture is dependent on birth. He said to him: Bald one, have you seen it in your head between the pillars, for Rabbi Yochanan said this teaching.

hebrew_text: טַעְמָא דִּכְתִיב ״אֲשֶׁר יִוָּלְדוּ״, הָא בְּעָלְמָא — בָּתַר אֲבוּהּ שָׁדֵינַן לֵיהּ. אֶלָּא הָא דְּאָמַר רָבָא: גּוֹיָה מְעוּבֶּרֶת שֶׁנִּתְגַּיְּירָה — בְּנָהּ אֵין צָרִיךְ טְבִילָה, אַמַּאי אֵין צָרִיךְ טְבִילָה?
human_translation: The reason that it is written: “That are born But generally, we assign to the father. But that which Rava said: a pregnant gentile converted, her son, does not require immersion why should he not require immersion?
llm_translation: Reason for it is written "that they shall be born," this in the world - after his father we establish it. Rather this that Rava said: A convert who was conceived - her son does not require immersion, why does he not require immersion?

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא מִשּׁוּם דְּרַבִּי יִצְחָק, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: דְּבַר תּוֹרָה, רוּבּוֹ וּמַקְפִּיד עָלָיו — חוֹצֵץ, רוּבּוֹ שֶׁאֵינוֹ מַקְפִּיד עָלָיו — אֵינוֹ חוֹצֵץ.
human_translation: And if you would say because of Rabbi Yitzḥak, As Rabbi Yitzḥak said: By Torah law, the majority his and he is particular is it an interposition the majority his he is not particular about it is not an interposition.
llm_translation: And if you say because of Rabbi Yitzchak, for Rabbi Yitzchak said: Regarding a matter of Torah, its majority and its strictness upon it - it is a barrier; its majority that is not strict upon it - it is not a barrier.

hebrew_text: וְהָא אָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא רוּבּוֹ, אֲבָל כּוּלּוֹ — חוֹצֵץ! שָׁאנֵי עוּבָּר, דְּהַיְינוּ רְבִיתֵיהּ.
human_translation: didn’t Rav Kahana say they taught only a majority his but all of it, it is an interposition A fetus is different, as this is its growth.
llm_translation: And this, Rav Kahana said: They only taught the majority, but the entirety - is forbidden! It is different with a crossing, which is its entirety.

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא רָבִינָא, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: בְּאוּמּוֹת, הַלֵּךְ אַחַר הַזָּכָר. נִתְגַּיְּירוּ, הַלֵּךְ אַחַר פָּגוּם שֶׁבִּשְׁנֵיהֶם. בָּאוּמּוֹת הַלֵּךְ אַחַר הַזָּכָר, כִּדְתַנְיָא: מִנַּיִן לְאֶחָד מִן הָאוּמּוֹת שֶׁבָּא עַל הַכְּנַעֲנִית וְהוֹלִיד בֵּן, שֶׁאַתָּה רַשַּׁאי לִקְנוֹתוֹ בְּעֶבֶד — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְגַם מִבְּנֵי הַתּוֹשָׁבִים הַגָּרִים עִמָּכֶם מֵהֶם תִּקְנוּ״.
human_translation: When Ravina came Rabbi Yoḥanan said: among the nations follow the male, they converted, follow the flawed of the two. Among the nations, follow the male, as it is taught From where that one from the nations had relations with a Canaanite and had a son you are permitted to purchase him as a slave, As it is stated: “And also from the children of the strangers that dwell among you, of them may you buy,
llm_translation: When Ravina came, Rabbi Yohanan said: In the case of Ammonites, follow the male. If they converted, follow the one who is unblemished in both of them. In the case of Ammonites, follow the male, as it was taught: From where do we know that if one of the Ammonites came upon a Canaanite woman and fathered a son, you are permitted to acquire him as a slave? It is stated: "And also from the children of the residents who dwell among you, from them you may acquire."

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל אֲפִילּוּ אֶחָד מִן הַכְּנַעֲנִים שֶׁבָּא עַל אַחַת מִן הָאוּמּוֹת וְהוֹלִיד בֵּן, שֶׁאַתָּה רַשַּׁאי לִקְנוֹתוֹ בְּעֶבֶד — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אֲשֶׁר הוֹלִידוּ בְּאַרְצְכֶם״ — מִן הַנּוֹלָדִים בְּאַרְצְכֶם, וְלֹא מִן הַגָּרִים בְּאַרְצְכֶם.
human_translation: might even one from the Canaanite had relations with from the nations and had a son you are permitted to purchase him as a slave. the verse states: “Which they have begotten in your land,” from those begotten in your land, But not from those dwelling in your land.
llm_translation: One might have thought that even if one of the Canaanites who came upon one of the nations and fathered a son, that you are permitted to acquire him as a slave - the Talmud teaches us: "Whom they have fathered in your land" - from those born in your land, and not from the strangers in your land.

hebrew_text: נִתְגַּיְּירוּ הַלֵּךְ אַחַר פָּגוּם שֶׁבִּשְׁנֵיהֶם. בְּמַאי? אִילֵימָא בְּמִצְרִי שֶׁנָּשָׂא עַמּוֹנִית — מַאי פָּגוּם שֶׁבִּשְׁנֵיהֶם אִית בַּהּ? ״עַמּוֹנִי״ וְלֹא עַמּוֹנִית! אֶלָּא בְּעַמּוֹנִי שֶׁנָּשָׂא מִצְרִית. אִי זָכָר הָוֵי — שִׁדְיֵיהּ בָּתַר עַמּוֹנִי, אִי נְקֵבָה הָוֵי — שִׁדְיַיהּ בָּתַר מִצְרִית.
human_translation: they converted, follow the more flawed of the two. To what If we say a male Egyptian who married a female Ammonite what flawed of the two, this an Ammonite but not an Ammonite woman, Rather, to a male Ammonite who married a female Egyptian If is male, assign him to Ammonite If a female, assign her to Egyptian
llm_translation: They converted, he followed the blemish in both of them. With what? If you say with an Egyptian who married an Ammonite woman - what blemish is there in both of them? "Ammonite" and not Ammonitess! Rather, with an Ammonite who married an Egyptian woman. If it is a male, his offspring follows the Ammonite; if it is a female, her offspring follows the Egyptian.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מַמְזֵרִין וּנְתִינִין אֲסוּרִין, וְאִיסּוּרָן אִיסּוּר עוֹלָם. אֶחָד זְכָרִים וְאֶחָד נְקֵבוֹת.
human_translation: Mamzerim and Gibeonites are prohibited Their prohibition is eternal, both males and females.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: Mamzerim and Netinim are forbidden, and their prohibition is an eternal prohibition. Whether they are male or female.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: מַמְזֶרֶת לְאַחַר עֲשָׂרָה דּוֹרוֹת מוּתֶּרֶת. יָלֵיף ״עֲשִׂירִי״ ״עֲשִׂירִי״ מֵעַמּוֹנִי וּמוֹאָבִי. מָה לְהַלָּן נְקֵבוֹת מוּתָּרוֹת — אַף כָּאן נְקֵבוֹת מוּתָּרוֹת.
human_translation: Reish Lakish said: A mamzeret , is permitted after ten generations. derived “tenth” to an Ammonite and a Moabite “tenth” Just as below, females are permitted, so too here, females are permitted.
llm_translation: Gemara. Reish Lakish said: A mamzeret after ten generations is permitted. It is derived "tenth" "tenth" from Ammonite and Moabite. Just as there women are permitted, so too here women are permitted.

hebrew_text: אִי: מָה לְהַלָּן מִיָּד, אַף כָּאן מִיָּד! כִּי אַהֲנִי גְּזֵירָה שָׁוָה, מֵעֲשִׂירִי וְאֵילָךְ.
human_translation: Or just as below, immediately, so too here, immediately. The verbal analogy is effective from tenth and onward.
llm_translation: Here is the English translation of the Talmudic text: אִי: - If: מָה - what לְהַלָּן - there מִיָּד - immediately, אַף - so כָּאן - here מִיָּד - immediately! כִּי - for אַהֲנִי - it is a decree גְּזֵירָה - decree שָׁוָה - equal, מֵעֲשִׂירִי - from the rich וְאֵילָךְ - and onwards.

hebrew_text: וְהָאֲנַן תְּנַן: מַמְזֵרִים וּנְתִינִין אֲסוּרִין, וְאִיסּוּרָן אִיסּוּר עוֹלָם, אֶחָד זְכָרִים וְאֶחָד נְקֵבוֹת! לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא כְּמַאן דְּאָמַר דּוּן מִינַּהּ וּמִינַּהּ.
human_translation: But didn’t we learn mamzerim and Gibeonites are prohibited, and their prohibition is eternal both males and females? not difficult This in accordance with who said Infer from it, and from it.
