llm_translation: And we learned in a Mishnah: Mamzerim and Netinim are forbidden, and their prohibition is an eternal prohibition, whether male or female! This is not difficult: this is like one who says judge each one separately.

hebrew_text: הָא כְּמַאן דְּאָמַר דּוּן מִינַּהּ וְאוֹקֵי בְּאַתְרָא.
human_translation: That in accordance with who said Infer from it, and leave it in its place.
llm_translation: This is like the one who says judge her and pierce her in her place.

hebrew_text: שָׁאֲלוּ אֶת רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: מַמְזֶרֶת לְאַחַר עַשְׂרָה דָּרֵי מַהוּ? אָמַר לָהֶם: מִי יִתֵּן לִי דּוֹר שְׁלִישִׁי וַאֲטַהֲרֶנּוּ. אַלְמָא קָסָבַר מַמְזֵרָא לָא חָיֵי. וְכֵן אֲמַר רַב הוּנָא: מַמְזֵרָא לָא חָיֵי.
human_translation: asked Rabbi Eliezer: a mamzeret after ten generations, what is He said to them: Who will give me a third-generation I will declare him pure? Apparently he maintains a mamzer does not survive. And similarly, Rav Huna said a mamzer does not survive.
llm_translation: They asked Rabbi Eliezer: A mamzeret after ten generations, what is the law? He said to them: Would that I had a third generation and I could purify him. This implies that he holds a mamzer does not live. And so said Rav Huna: A mamzer does not live.

hebrew_text: וְהָא אֲנַן תְּנַן: מַמְזֵרִין אֲסוּרִין, וְאִיסּוּרָן אִיסּוּר עוֹלָם! אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: לְדִידִי מִפָּרְשָׁא לִי מִינֵּיהּ דְּרַב יְהוּדָה: דִּידִיעַ — חָיֵי, דְּלָא יְדִיעַ — לָא חָיֵי. דִּידִיעַ וְלָא יְדִיעַ — עַד תְּלָתָא דָּרֵי חָיֵי, טְפֵי — לָא חָיֵי.
human_translation: But didn’t we learn mamzerim are prohibited and their prohibition is eternal Rabbi Zeira said: was explained to me by Rav Yehuda who is known survive, who is not known not survive, who is known and not known, survive for three generations, more not survive.
llm_translation: And we learned: Mamzerim are forbidden, and their prohibition is an eternal prohibition! Rabbi Zeira said: According to my understanding from the explanation of Rav Yehuda: If one knows - he lives, if one does not know - he does not live. If one knows and does not know - up to three generations he lives, more than that - he does not live.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא דְּהָוֵי בְּשִׁבָבוּתֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי אַמֵּי. אַכְרֵיז עֲלֵיהּ דְּמַמְזֵרָא הֲוָה. בָּכֵי וְאָזֵיל, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: חַיִּים נָתַתִּי לָךְ.
human_translation: a certain person in Rabbi Ami’s neighborhood, declared him to be a mamzer . went about weeping said to him: I have given you life.
llm_translation: That one who was in the neighborhood of Rabbi Ammi. He proclaimed about him that he was a mamzer. He wept and went out, he said to him: "I have given you life."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חָנָא בַּר אַדָּא: נְתִינִים — דָּוִד גָּזַר עֲלֵיהֶם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיִּקְרָא הַמֶּלֶךְ לַגִּבְעוֹנִים וַיֹּאמֶר אֲלֵיהֶם וְהַגִּבְעוֹנִים לֹא מִבְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל הֵמָּה וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: Rav Ḥana bar Adda said: Gibeonites, David decreed that they as it is stated: “And the king called the Gibeonites and said to them. Now the Gibeonites are not of the children of Israel,
llm_translation: Rav Hanah bar Adda said: Netinim - David decreed upon them, as it is stated: "And the king called the Gibeonites and said to them, and the Gibeonites were not of the children of Israel, etc."

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא גְּזַר עֲלַיְיהוּ? דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיְהִי רָעָב בִּימֵי דָוִד שָׁלֹשׁ שָׁנִים שָׁנָה אַחַר שָׁנָה״. שָׁנָה רִאשׁוֹנָה אָמַר לָהֶם: שֶׁמָּא עוֹבְדֵי עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה יֵשׁ בָּכֶם, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַעֲבַדְתֶּם אֱלֹהִים אֲחֵרִים וְהִשְׁתַּחֲוִיתֶם לָהֶם. וְעָצַר אֶת הַשָּׁמַיִם וְלֹא יִהְיֶה מָטָר וְגוֹ׳״. בָּדְקוּ, וְלֹא מָצְאוּ.
human_translation: What is the reason decreed As it is written: “And there was a famine in the days of David three years, year after year” first year said to Perhaps there are idol worshippers among you, as it is written: and serve other gods, and worship them; and He shut up the heaven, so that there shall be no rain, They examined but did not find
llm_translation: What is the reason that he decreed upon them? As it is written: "And there was a famine in the days of David for three years, year after year." In the first year, he said to them: Perhaps there are idolaters among you, as it is written: "And you will serve other gods and bow down to them. And He will shut up the heavens and there will be no rain, etc." They investigated, but did not find.

hebrew_text: שְׁנִיָּה אָמַר לָהֶם: שֶׁמָּא עוֹבְרֵי עֲבֵירָה יֵשׁ בָּכֶם, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיִּמָּנְעוּ רְבִיבִים וּמַלְקוֹשׁ לֹא הָיָה וּמֵצַח אִשָּׁה זוֹנָה הָיָה לָךְ וְגוֹ׳״. בָּדְקוּ, וְלֹא מָצְאוּ.
human_translation: second said to them: Perhaps there are transgressors among you, as it is written: “Therefore the showers have been withheld, and there has been no latter rain; yet you had a harlot’s forehead, they examined but did not find
llm_translation: Second one said to them: perhaps transgressors of sin among you, as it is written: "And they withheld the rain, and there was no early rain, and a woman who commits harlotry was yours, etc." They investigated, but did not find.

hebrew_text: שְׁלִישִׁית אָמַר לָהֶם: שֶׁמָּא פּוֹסְקֵי צְדָקָה בָּרַבִּים יֵשׁ בָּכֶם וְאֵין נוֹתְנִין, דִּכְתִיב: ״נְשִׂיאִים וְרוּחַ וְגֶשֶׁם אָיִן אִישׁ מִתְהַלֵּל בְּמַתַּת שָׁקֶר״. בָּדְקוּ, וְלֹא מָצְאוּ.
human_translation: third he said to them: Perhaps there are among you those who pledge to charity in public, but do not give As it is written: “As vapors and wind without rain, so is he that boasts himself of a false gift” they examined but could not find
llm_translation: Third one said to them: perhaps there are those who decide on charity in public among you and do not give, as it is written: "Princes and a wind, and rain, there is no man who boasts in a gift of falsehood." They investigated, but did not find.

hebrew_text: אָמַר: אֵין הַדָּבָר תָּלוּי אֶלָּא בִּי, מִיָּד: ״וַיְבַקֵּשׁ דָּוִד אֶת פְּנֵי ה׳״. מַאי הִיא? אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: שֶׁשָּׁאַל בְּאוּרִים וְתוּמִּים.
human_translation: said: The matter depends on nothing other myself. Immediately “And David sought the presence of the Lord” What is this? Reish Lakish said: He inquired through the Urim VeTummim ,
llm_translation: He said: The matter depends only on me, immediately: "And David sought the presence of the Lord." What is it? Reish Lakish said: That he inquired through Urim and Thummim.

hebrew_text: מַאי מַשְׁמַע? אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: אָתְיָא ״פְּנֵי״ ״פְּנֵי״. כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״וַיְבַקֵּשׁ דָּוִד אֶת פְּנֵי ה׳״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״וְשָׁאַל לוֹ בְּמִשְׁפַּט הָאוּרִים לִפְנֵי ה׳״.
human_translation: From where be inferred Rabbi Elazar said: derived “presence” used “presence” It is written here: “And David sought the presence of the Lord,” and it is written there: who shall inquire for him by the judgment of the Urim in the presence of the Lord”
llm_translation: What is implied? Rabbi Elazar said: It comes to teach "face" "face." It is written here: "And David sought the face of Hashem," and it is written there: "And he shall ask of Him by the judgment of the Urim before Hashem."

hebrew_text: ״וַיֹּאמֶר ה׳ אֶל שָׁאוּל וְאֶל בֵּית הַדָּמִים עַל אֲשֶׁר הֵמִית הַגִּבְעוֹנִים״. ״אֶל שָׁאוּל״ — שֶׁלֹּא נִסְפַּד כַּהֲלָכָה, ״וְאֶל בֵּית הַדָּמִים״ — ״עַל אֲשֶׁר הֵמִית הַגִּבְעוֹנִים״. וְכִי הֵיכָן מָצִינוּ בְּשָׁאוּל שֶׁהֵמִית הַגִּבְעוֹנִים? אֶלָּא מִתּוֹךְ שֶׁהָרַג נוֹב עִיר הַכֹּהֲנִים שֶׁהָיוּ מַסְפִּיקִין לָהֶם מַיִם וּמָזוֹן, מַעֲלֶה עָלָיו הַכָּתוּב כְּאִילּוּ הֲרָגָן.
human_translation: “And the Lord said: It is for Saul, and for his bloody house, because he put to death the Gibeonites” “For Saul” because he was not eulogized properly. “And for his bloody house” “because he put to death the Gibeonites.” Now, where do we find that Saul put to death the Gibeonites? Rather, because he killed Nob, the city of priests, who would provide with water and food the verse ascribes to him as if he killed them.
llm_translation: "And Hashem said to Saul and to the house of blood, because he killed the Gibeonites." "To Saul" - that he was not eulogized properly, "and to the house of blood" - "because he killed the Gibeonites." And where do we find in Saul that he killed the Gibeonites? Rather, because he killed the city of Nob, the city of the priests who were providing them with water and sustenance, the Scripture attributes to him as if he killed them.

hebrew_text: קָא תָבַע אֶל שָׁאוּל שֶׁלֹּא נִסְפַּד כַּהֲלָכָה, וְקָא תָבַע עַל אֲשֶׁר הֵמִית הַגִּבְעוֹנִים?! אִין, דְּאָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״בַּקְּשׁוּ אֶת ה׳ כׇּל עַנְוֵי אֶרֶץ אֲשֶׁר מִשְׁפָּטוֹ פָּעָלוּ״, בַּאֲשֶׁר מִשְׁפָּטוֹ — שָׁם פׇּעֳלוֹ.
human_translation: demands because Saul was not eulogized properly, while He demands because put to death the Gibeonites. Yes, As Reish Lakish said: What is which is written: “Seek the Lord, all the humble of the earth, that have executed [ pa’alu ] His justice” Where justice his deeds pa’alo there
llm_translation: He demanded of Saul that he did not eulogize according to the law, and he demanded concerning the fact that he killed the Gibeonites?! No, as Reish Lakish said: What is the meaning of what is written: "Seek the Lord, all you humble of the earth, who have carried out His justice" - in the place where His justice is, there His action is.

hebrew_text: אָמַר דָּוִד: שָׁאוּל, נְפַקוּ לְהוּ
human_translation: David said: Saul, there have passed
llm_translation: David said: "Shaul, they went out to him."

hebrew_text: תְּרֵיסַר יַרְחֵי שַׁתָּא, וְלָא דַּרְכֵּיהּ לְמִסְפְּדֵיהּ.
human_translation: twelve months the year and it is not the way to eulogize
llm_translation: Twelve months, and not its way to mourn.

hebrew_text: נְתִינִים נִיקְרִינְהוּ וּנְפַיְּיסִינְהוּ: ״וַיִּקְרָא הַמֶּלֶךְ לַגִּבְעוֹנִים וַיֹּאמֶר אֲלֵיהֶם. מָה אֶעֱשֶׂה לָכֶם וּבַמָּה אֲכַפֵּר וּבָרְכוּ אֶת נַחֲלַת ה׳. וַיֹּאמְרוּ לוֹ הַגִּבְעוֹנִים אֵין לָנוּ כֶּסֶף וְזָהָב עִם שָׁאוּל וְעִם בֵּיתוֹ וְאֵין לָנוּ אִישׁ וְגוֹ׳ יֻתַּן לָנוּ שִׁבְעָה אֲנָשִׁים מִבָּנָיו וְהוֹקַעֲנוּם לַה׳ וְגוֹ׳״, פַּיְּיסִינְהוּ וְלָא מִיפַּיְיסוּ.
human_translation: Gibeonites, let us call them and appease them. “And the king called the Gibeonites and said to them…What shall I do for you, and with what shall I make atonement that you may bless the inheritance of the Lord? And the Gibeonites said to him: It is not a matter of silver or gold between us and Saul or his house; neither is it for us any man Let seven men of his sons be delivered to us, and we will hang them up to the Lord…” appease them but they would not be appeased.
llm_translation: The Levites were recognized and appeased. "And the king called the Gibeonites and said to them, 'What shall I do for you, and with what shall I make atonement, that you may bless the heritage of the Lord?' And the Gibeonites said to him, 'We have no silver or gold with Saul and his house, and we have no man, etc. Let seven men from his sons be given to us, and we will hang them up to the Lord, etc." They appeased them, but they were not appeased.

hebrew_text: אָמַר, שְׁלֹשָׁה סִימָנִים יֵשׁ בְּאוּמָּה זוֹ: הָרַחְמָנִים, וְהַבַּיְישָׁנִין, וְגוֹמְלֵי חֲסָדִים. רַחְמָנִים — דִּכְתִיב: ״וְנָתַן לְךָ רַחֲמִים וְרִחַמְךָ וְהִרְבֶּךָ״. בַּיְישָׁנִין — דִּכְתִיב: ״בַּעֲבוּר תִּהְיֶה יִרְאָתוֹ עַל פְּנֵיכֶם״. גּוֹמְלֵי חֲסָדִים — דִּכְתִיב: ״לְמַעַן אֲשֶׁר יְצַוֶּה אֶת בָּנָיו וְאֶת בֵּיתוֹ וְגוֹ׳״. כֹּל שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ שְׁלֹשָׁה סִימָנִים הַלָּלוּ — רָאוּי לְהִדָּבֵק בְּאוּמָּה זוֹ.
human_translation: said: There are three distinguishing marks of this nation, merciful, shamefaced, and they perform acts of kindness. merciful, as it is written: “And He will give you mercy, and have mercy upon you and multiply you” shamefaced, as it is written: “And that His fear shall be upon your faces” They perform acts of kindness, as it is written: to the end that he may command his children and his household Whoever has these three distinguishing marks is fit to cleave to this nation.
llm_translation: He said, three signs exist in this nation: the merciful, the bashful, and those who perform acts of kindness. Merciful — as it is written: "And He will give you mercy, and He will have mercy on you and multiply you." Bashful — as it is written: "So that His fear may be upon your faces." Those who perform acts of kindness — as it is written: "In order that He may command his children and his household, etc." Anyone who possesses these three signs is fitting to cleave to this nation.

hebrew_text: ״וַיִּקַּח הַמֶּלֶךְ אֶת שְׁנֵי בְּנֵי רִצְפָּה בַת אַיָּה אֲשֶׁר יָלְדָה לְשָׁאוּל אֶת אַרְמֹנִי וְאֶת מְפִבֹשֶׁת וְאֶת חֲמֵשֶׁת בְּנֵי מִיכַל בַּת שָׁאוּל אֲשֶׁר יָלְדָה לְעַדְרִיאֵל בֶּן בַּרְזִילַּי הַמְּחֹלָתִי״. מַאי שְׁנָא הָנֵי? אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: הֶעֱבִירוּם לִפְנֵי אָרוֹן, כֹּל שֶׁאָרוֹן קוֹלְטוֹ — לְמִיתָה, כֹּל שֶׁאֵין אָרוֹן קוֹלְטוֹ — לְחַיִּים.
human_translation: “And the king took the two sons of Rizpah, daughter of Aiah, whom she bore unto Saul, Armoni and Mephibosheth, and the five sons of Michal, daughter of Saul, whom she bore to Adriel the son of Barzillai the Meholathite” What is different these Rav Huna said: He passed before the Ark Whoever was held back by the Ark, to death; whoever was not held back by the Ark for life.
llm_translation: The king took the two sons of Rizpah the daughter of Aiah, whom she bore to Saul, Armoni and Mephibosheth, and the five sons of Michal the daughter of Saul, whom she bore to Adriel the son of Barzillai the Meholathite. What is the difference between them? Rav Huna said: If they were placed before the Ark, anything the Ark accepts leads to death, anything the Ark does not accept leads to life.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַב חָנָא בַּר קַטִּינָא: ״וַיַּחְמֹל הַמֶּלֶךְ עַל מְפִבֹשֶׁת בֶּן יְהוֹנָתָן בֶּן שָׁאוּל״ — שֶׁלֹּא הֶעֱבִירוֹ.
human_translation: Rav Ḥana bar Ketina raised an objection: “And the king had pity on Mephibosheth, son of Jonathan, son of Saul, that he did not pass
llm_translation: The text states: Rav Hanah bar Katina raises an objection: "And the king showed kindness to Mephibosheth, the son of Jonathan, the son of Saul" — that he did not pass him over.

hebrew_text: וְכִי מַשּׂוֹא פָּנִים יֵשׁ בַּדָּבָר? אֶלָּא: שֶׁהֶעֱבִירוֹ וּקְלָטוֹ, וּבִקֵּשׁ עָלָיו רַחֲמִים, וּפְלָטוֹ. וְאַכַּתִּי: מַשּׂוֹא פָּנִים יֵשׁ בַּדָּבָר? אֶלָּא, שֶׁבִּקֵּשׁ רַחֲמִים שֶׁלֹּא יִקְלְטֶנּוּ הָאָרוֹן.
human_translation: favoritism in this matter? Rather, that passed and held him back, but asked for mercy on his behalf, and released him. But still favoritism in this matter? Rather, asked for mercy that the Ark should not hold him back
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates as follows: Is there favoritism in the matter? Rather, that he passed by him and took him in, and he sought mercy upon him, and he saved him. And is it so: Is there favoritism in the matter? Rather, that he sought mercy so that the Ark would not take him in.

hebrew_text: וְהָא כְּתִיב: ״לֹא יוּמְתוּ אָבוֹת עַל בָּנִים וְגוֹ׳״? אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מוּטָב שֶׁתֵּעָקֵר אוֹת אַחַת מִן הַתּוֹרָה, וְאַל יִתְחַלֵּל שֵׁם שָׁמַיִם בְּפַרְהֶסְיָא.
human_translation: But isn’t it written: “The fathers shall not be put to death for the children; Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: better that one letter be uprooted from the Torah name of Heaven not be desecrated in public [ parhesya ].
llm_translation: The text reads: "And is it not written: 'Fathers shall not be put to death because of children, etc.'? Rabbi Hiyya bar Abba said in the name of Rabbi Yohanan: It is better that one letter be uprooted from the Torah, and that the name of Heaven not be desecrated in public."

hebrew_text: ״וַתִּקַּח רִצְפָּה בַת אַיָּה אֶת הַשַּׂק וַתַּטֵּהוּ לָהּ אֶל הַצּוּר מִתְּחִלַּת קָצִיר עַד נִתַּךְ מַיִם עֲלֵיהֶם מִן הַשָּׁמָיִם וְלֹא נָתְנָה עוֹף הַשָּׁמַיִם לָנוּחַ עֲלֵיהֶם יוֹמָם וְחַיַּת הַשָּׂדֶה לַיְלָה״. וְהָא כְּתִיב: ״לֹא תָלִין נִבְלָתוֹ עַל הָעֵץ״!
human_translation: “And Rizpah, daughter of Aiah, took sackcloth and spread it for her upon the rock, from the beginning of harvest until water was poured upon them from heaven; and she allowed neither the birds of the air to rest on them by day, nor the beasts of the field by night” Isn’t it written: “His body shall not remain all night upon the tree;
llm_translation: "And Ritzpah, the daughter of Aiah, took the sackcloth and spread it out for herself on the rock, from the beginning of the harvest until water poured down on them from the sky, and the birds of the sky did not rest on them by day, and the beasts of the field by night." But isn't it written: "You shall not leave his corpse on the tree!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יְהוֹצָדָק: מוּטָב שֶׁתֵּעָקֵר אוֹת אַחַת מִן הַתּוֹרָה, וְיִתְקַדֵּשׁ שֵׁם שָׁמַיִם בְּפַרְהֶסְיָא. שֶׁהָיוּ עוֹבְרִים וְשָׁבִים אוֹמְרִים: מָה טִיבָן שֶׁל אֵלּוּ? הַלָּלוּ בְּנֵי מְלָכִים הֵם. וּמָה עָשׂוּ? פָּשְׁטוּ יְדֵיהֶם בְּגֵרִים גְּרוּרִים. אָמְרוּ: אֵין לְךָ אוּמָּה שֶׁרְאוּיָה לְהִדָּבֵק בָּהּ כָּזוֹ. וּמָה בְּנֵי מְלָכִים כָּךְ — בְּנֵי הֶדְיוֹטוֹת עַל אַחַת כַּמָּה וְכַמָּה! וּמָה גֵּרִים גְּרוּרִים כָּךְ — יִשְׂרָאֵל עַל אַחַת כַּמָּה וְכַמָּה!
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yehotzadak: better that one letter be uprooted from the Torah and the name of Heaven be sanctified in public. As the passersby would say: What is the nature of these these are sons of kings. And what did they do They had laid their hands upon calculating converts said: There is no nation as worthy of cleaving to it as this one. If the sons of kings in this all the more so the sons of ordinary people [ hedyotot ] And if calculating converts in this all the more so the Jewish people
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yehotzadak: It is better that one letter be uprooted from the Torah, and the name of Heaven be sanctified publicly. For they used to pass by and say: What is the quality of these? These are the sons of kings. And what did they do? They would extend their hands to the poor like a winnowing basket. They said: Is there anyone fitting to cleave to it like these? And if the sons of kings are like this, how much more so the common people! And if the poor are like this, how much more so Israel!

hebrew_text: מִיָּד נִתּוֹסְפוּ עַל יִשְׂרָאֵל מֵאָה וַחֲמִשִּׁים אֶלֶף, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיְהִי לִשְׁלֹמֹה שִׁבְעִים אֶלֶף נוֹשֵׂא סַבָּל וּשְׁמֹנִים אֶלֶף חוֹצֵב בָּהָר״. וְדִלְמָא יִשְׂרָאֵל הֲווֹ? לָא סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ, דִּכְתִיב: ״וּמִבְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל לֹא נָתַן שְׁלֹמֹה עָבֶד״.
human_translation: Immediately, one hundred and fifty thousand joined the Jewish people, as it is stated: “And Solomon had seventy thousand that bore burdens and eighty thousand that were hewers in the mountains” But perhaps were Jews? This cannot enter your mind, as it is written: “But of the children of Israel Solomon made no slaves”
llm_translation: Immediately added to Israel one hundred and fifty thousand, as it is stated: "And Solomon had seventy thousand who carried burdens and eighty thousand who quarried in the mountain." And perhaps they were Israelites? It is not to be considered, as it is written: "But of the children of Israel did Solomon make no bondmen."

hebrew_text: וְדִלְמָא דּוּגְזַר בְּעָלְמָא. אֶלָּא מֵהָכָא: ״וַיִּסְפֹּר שְׁלֹמֹה כׇּל הָאֲנָשִׁים הַגֵּרִים אֲשֶׁר בְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל [וְגוֹ׳] וַיִּמָּצְאוּ מֵאָה וַחֲמִשִּׁים אֶלֶף [וְגוֹ׳] וַיַּעַשׂ מֵהֶם שִׁבְעִים אֶלֶף (נוֹשֵׂא) סַבָּל וּשְׁמוֹנִים אֶלֶף חוֹצֵב בָּהָר״.
human_translation: But Perhaps merely employed [ dogzar ] Rather, here: “And Solomon counted all the converted men that were in Eretz Yisrael…and they were found to be one hundred and fifty thousand…and he made seventy thousand of them to bear burdens, and eighty thousand to be hewers in the mountains”
llm_translation: Perhaps it was merely a decree in general. Rather, from here: "And Solomon counted all the strangers who were in the land of Israel etc. and he found a hundred and fifty thousand etc. and he made of them seventy thousand carriers and eighty thousand stonecutters in the mountain."

hebrew_text: וּנְתִינִים דָּוִד גָּזַר עֲלֵיהֶם? מֹשֶׁה גָּזַר עֲלֵיהֶם, דִּכְתִיב: ״מֵחוֹטֵב עֵצֶיךָ עַד שׁוֹאֵב מֵימֶיךָ״! מֹשֶׁה גְּזַר לְהָהוּא דָּרָא, דָּוִד גְּזַר לְכוּלֵּי דָּרֵא.
human_translation: the Gibeonites, David issued a decree against them Moses issued a decree against them, as it is written: “From the hewer of your wood to the drawer of your water” Moses issued a decree with regard to that generation David decreed for all generations.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Did David establish the tithes? Moses established the tithes, as it is written: "From the hewer of your wood to the drawer of your water" (Deuteronomy 29:10)! Moses decreed for that generation, David decreed for all generations.

hebrew_text: וְאַכַּתִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ גְּזַר עֲלַיְיהוּ, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיִּתְּנֵם יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בַּיּוֹם הַהוּא חוֹטְבֵי עֵצִים וְשׁוֹאֲבֵי מַיִם לָעֵדָה וּלְמִזְבַּח ה׳״! יְהוֹשֻׁעַ גָּזַר בִּזְמַן שֶׁבֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ קַיָּים, דָּוִד גָּזַר בִּזְמַן שֶׁאֵין בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ קַיָּים.
human_translation: But still, Joshua issued a decree against as it is written: “And Joshua made them that day hewers of wood and drawers of water, for the congregation and for the altar of the Lord” Joshua issued a decree for the period when the Temple is standing, David issued a decree for the period when the Temple is not standing.
llm_translation: And once Yehoshua decreed upon them, as it is written: "And Yehoshua gave it on that day, hewers of wood and drawers of water for the congregation and for the altar of the Lord!" Yehoshua decreed when the Temple stood, David decreed when the Temple was not standing.

hebrew_text: בִּימֵי רַבִּי בִּקְּשׁוּ לְהַתִּיר נְתִינִים. אָמַר לָהֶם רַבִּי: חֶלְקֵנוּ נַתִּיר, חֵלֶק מִזְבֵּחַ מִי יַתִּיר?
human_translation: in the days of Rabbi sought to permit the Gibeonites Rabbi said to them: we permit our share who can permit the altar’s share?
llm_translation: In the days of Rabbi, they sought to permit the Levites. Rabbi said to them: "Our portion is permitted, who will permit a portion of the altar?"

hebrew_text: וּפְלִיגָא דְּרַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: חֵלֶק עֵדָה — לְעוֹלָם אָסוּר, חֵלֶק מִזְבֵּחַ, בִּזְמַן שֶׁבֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ קַיָּים — אָסוּר, אֵין בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ קַיָּים — שְׁרֵי.
human_translation: And disagrees with Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba. As Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: The share to the congregation is forbidden forever the share to the altar, when the Temple is standing forbidden, the Temple is not standing permitted.
llm_translation: Dispute of Rabbi Chiya bar Abba. For Rabbi Chiya bar Abba said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: A portion of the congregation - always forbidden, a portion of the altar, when the Temple is standing - forbidden, when the Temple is not standing - permitted.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: שָׁמַעְתִּי שֶׁהַסָּרִיס חוֹלֵץ וְחוֹלְצִין לְאִשְׁתּוֹ, וְהַסָּרִיס לֹא חוֹלֵץ וְלֹא חוֹלְצִין לְאִשְׁתּוֹ, וְאֵין לִי לְפָרֵשׁ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua said: I heard that a eunuch performs ḥalitza and perform ḥalitza with his wife, and a eunuch does not perform ḥalitza and do not perform ḥalitza with his wife. And I cannot explain
llm_translation: The Mishnah: Rabbi Yehoshua said: I heard that a eunuch may divorce and be divorced by his wife, but a eunuch may not divorce and may not be divorced by his wife, and I have no explanation.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, אֲנִי אֲפָרֵשׁ: סְרִיס אָדָם — חוֹלֵץ וְחוֹלְצִין לְאִשְׁתּוֹ, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהָיְתָה לוֹ שְׁעַת הַכּוֹשֶׁר. סְרִיס חַמָּה — לֹא חוֹלֵץ וְלֹא חוֹלְצִין לְאִשְׁתּוֹ, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁלֹּא הָיְתָה לוֹ שְׁעַת הַכּוֹשֶׁר.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva said: I will explain. A eunuch by man, performs ḥalitza and perform ḥalitza with his wife, because he had an hour of fitness, a eunuch by natural causes, does not perform ḥalitza and do not perform ḥalitza with his wife, because he did not have an hour of fitness,
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva said, I will explain: A eunuch man - he undresses and they undress for his wife, because he had a time of fitness. A eunuch of the sun - he does not undress and they do not undress for his wife, because he did not have a time of fitness.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: לֹא כִי, אֶלָּא: סְרִיס חַמָּה — חוֹלֵץ וְחוֹלְצִין לְאִשְׁתּוֹ, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ רְפוּאָה. סְרִיס אָדָם — לֹא חוֹלֵץ וְלֹא חוֹלְצִין לְאִשְׁתּוֹ, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁאֵין לוֹ רְפוּאָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: No; rather, A eunuch by natural causes performs ḥalitza and perform ḥalitza with his wife because he can be cured, a eunuch by man does not perform ḥalitza and do not perform ḥalitza with his wife because he cannot be cured.
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: Not because, but rather: a eunuch of the sun — he uncovers and they uncover for his wife, because he has a remedy. A eunuch of a man — he does not uncover and they do not uncover for his wife, because he has no remedy.

hebrew_text: הֵעִיד רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן בְּתֵירָא עַל בֶּן מְגוּסַת שֶׁהָיָה בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם סְרִיס אָדָם, וְיִבְּמוּ אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ, לְקַיֵּים דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Beteira testified about ben Megusat, who in Jerusalem was a eunuch by man, entered into levirate marriage with his wife, to fulfill the statement of Rabbi Akiva.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Beteira testified concerning Ben Megusat who was a eunuch in Jerusalem, and they should perform levirate marriage with his wife, to fulfill the words of Rabbi Akiva.

hebrew_text: הַסָּרִיס — לֹא חוֹלֵץ וְלֹא מְיַיבֵּם, וְכֵן אַיְילוֹנִית — לֹא חוֹלֶצֶת וְלֹא מִתְיַיבֶּמֶת.
human_translation: A sexually underdeveloped man does not perform ḥalitza or enter into levirate marriage And similarly, a sexually underdeveloped woman aylonit does not perform ḥalitza or enter into levirate marriage
llm_translation: The eunuch - does not perform chalitzah and does not perform levirate marriage, and similarly the female eunuch - does not perform chalitzah and does not perform levirate marriage.

hebrew_text: הַסָּרִיס שֶׁחָלַץ לִיבִמְתּוֹ — לֹא פְּסָלָהּ. בְּעָלָהּ — פְּסָלָהּ, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהִיא בְּעִילַת זְנוּת. וְכֵן אַיְילוֹנִית שֶׁחָלְצוּ לָהּ אַחִין — לֹא פְּסָלוּהָ. בְּעָלוּהָ — פְּסָלוּהָ, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁבְּעִילָתָהּ בְּעִילַת זְנוּת.
human_translation: a sexually underdeveloped man performed ḥalitza with his yevama , he has not disqualified her he had intercourse with her, he has disqualified her. because it is licentious sexual intercourse, And similarly, a sexually underdeveloped woman, the brothers performed ḥalitza has not disqualified her had intercourse with her, has disqualified her because the intercourse is licentious sexual intercourse.
llm_translation: The eunuch who performed chalitzah for his yevamah - he did not disqualify her. Her husband - he disqualified her, because she engaged in promiscuous intercourse. Similarly, if brothers performed chalitzah for a woman - they did not disqualify her. Her husband - he disqualified her, because her intercourse is promiscuous.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מִכְּדִי שָׁמְעִינַן לְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא דְּאָמַר חַיָּיבֵי לָאוִין כְּחַיָּיבֵי כָּרֵיתוֹת דָּמוּ, וְחַיָּיבֵי כָּרֵיתוֹת לָאו בְּנֵי חֲלִיצָה וְיִיבּוּם נִינְהוּ!
human_translation: Now, we learned Rabbi Akiva said: Those liable for a prohibition are like those liable to karet and those liable to karet are not eligible ḥalitza or levirate marriage.
llm_translation: The text reads: "We have learned from here in accordance with the opinion of Rabbi Akiva who said: Those liable for negative commandments are like those liable for karet, and those liable for karet are not like the sons of halitzah and yibum!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אַמֵּי: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן — כְּגוֹן שֶׁנָּשָׂא אָחִיו גִּיּוֹרֶת, וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי, דְּאָמַר: קְהַל גֵּרִים — לָא אִקְּרִי קָהָל.
human_translation: Rabbi Ami said: With what are we dealing here? where brother married a convert, and Rabbi Akiva holds in accordance with Rabbi Yosei, said congregation of converts is not called a congregation
llm_translation: Rabbi Ammi said: Here, with what are we dealing? For example, if one's brother married a convert, and Rabbi Akiva holds like Rabbi Yosei, who said: "An assembly of converts is not called an assembly."

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, יַבּוֹמֵי נָמֵי מְיַיבֵּם! אִין הָכִי נָמֵי, וְאַיְּידֵי דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ חוֹלֵץ, אָמַר אִיהוּ נָמֵי חוֹלֵץ.
human_translation: If so, perform levirate marriage Yes, it is indeed so, but since Rabbi Yehoshua said performs ḥalitza as well said he performs ḥalitza
llm_translation: If so, the yavomei should perform yibum! If not, then since Rabbi Yehoshua says "cholitz," he should also say "cholitz."

hebrew_text: דַּיְקָא נָמֵי, דְּקָתָנֵי: הֵעִיד רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן בְּתֵירָא עַל בֶּן מְגוּסַת שֶׁהָיָה בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם סְרִיס אָדָם, וְיִבְּמוּ אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ לְקַיֵּים דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: is also precise as it teaches: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Beteira testified about ben Megusat, who in Jerusalem was a eunuch by man, entered into levirate marriage with his wife, to fulfill the statement of Rabbi Akiva. Learn from this
llm_translation: Precisely it is stated, as it was taught: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Beteira testified concerning Ben Megusas who was in Jerusalem, a eunuch, and they performed the levirate marriage with his wife in order to fulfill the words of Rabbi Akiva. Learn from this.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַבָּה: פְּצוּעַ דַּכָּא וּכְרוּת שׇׁפְכָה, סְרִיס אָדָם וְהַזָּקֵן — אוֹ חוֹלְצִין אוֹ מְיַיבְּמִין. כֵּיצַד: מֵתוּ וְלָהֶם נָשִׁים, וְלָהֶם אַחִין, וְעָמְדוּ אַחִין וְעָשׂוּ מַאֲמָר בִּנְשׁוֹתֵיהֶן, וְנָתְנוּ גֵּט, אוֹ שֶׁחָלְצוּ — מַה שֶּׁעָשׂוּ עָשׂוּ, וְאִם בָּעֲלוּ — קָנוּ.
human_translation: Rabba raised an objection A man with crushed testicles, and one whose penis has been severed, a eunuch by man, and an elderly either perform ḥalitza or enter into levirate marriage. How so? died and they had wives and they had brothers, and the brothers proceeded to perform levirate betrothal with their wives, gave a bill of divorce, or performed ḥalitza what they did is done, And if had intercourse they acquired
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: A crushed testicle and a severed male organ, a eunuch and an elderly man - they either perform chalitzah or engage in levirate marriage. How so? If they died leaving wives and brothers, and the brothers stood up and performed chalitzah with their wives, or they gave them a bill of divorce, or they performed levirate marriage - whatever they did, they did, and if they married - they acquired.

hebrew_text: מֵתוּ אַחִין, וְעָמְדוּ הֵן וְעָשׂוּ מַאֲמָר בִּנְשׁוֹתֵיהֶן, וְנָתְנוּ גֵּט אוֹ חָלְצוּ — מַה שֶּׁעָשׂוּ עָשׂוּ. וְאִם בָּעֲלוּ — קָנוּ, וְאָסוּר לְקַיְּימָן, מִשּׁוּם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לֹא יָבֹא פְצוּעַ דַּכָּא וּכְרוּת שׇׁפְכָה בִּקְהַל ה׳״, אַלְמָא בְּקָהָל עָסְקִינַן!
human_translation: the brothers died, and proceeded to perform levirate betrothal with their wives, gave a bill of divorce, or performed ḥalitza what they did is done, And if they had intercourse they acquired but prohibited from maintaining them because it is stated: “A man with crushed testicles or a severed penis shall not enter into the congregation of the Lord” Apparently, we are dealing with in the congregation
llm_translation: The brothers died, and their wives stood up and made a statement, and they gave a bill of divorce or performed the rite of levirate marriage - whatever they did, they did. And if they married - they acquired, and it is forbidden to fulfill the levirate marriage, as it is stated: "A man with crushed testicles or a severed member shall not enter the congregation of the Lord" - this indicates that we are dealing with a congregation!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַבָּה: כְּגוֹן שֶׁנָּפְלָה לוֹ, וּלְבַסּוֹף נִפְצַע.
human_translation: Rather, Rabba said where happened before him and he was injured afterward.
llm_translation: Rather, Rabah said: For example, if it fell to him, and ultimately he was injured.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: וְלַיְתֵי אִיסּוּר פָּצוּעַ וְנִידְחֵי עֲשֵׂה דְּיִיבּוּם! מִי לָא תְּנַן, רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: אִם מֵיאֲנָה — מֵיאֲנָה,
human_translation: Abaye said to him: let the prohibition crushed come and override positive of levirate marriage. Didn’t we learn Rabban Gamliel says: If refuses she has refused him.
llm_translation: He said to him, Abaye: And let her bring a disqualifying issue and rejected positive commandments of levirate marriage! Did we not learn, Rabban Gamliel says: If she refuses — she refuses.

hebrew_text: וְאִם לָאו — תַּמְתִּין עַד שֶׁתַּגְדִּיל, וְתֵצֵא הַלֵּזוּ מִשּׁוּם אֲחוֹת אִשָּׁה. אַלְמָא: אָתֵי אִיסּוּר אֲחוֹת אִשָּׁה וְדָחֵי. הָכָא נָמֵי: נֵיתֵי אִיסּוּר פָּצוּעַ וְנִידְחֵי!
human_translation: But if not must wait until she reaches adulthood this one, goes out as wife’s sister. Apparently, the prohibition a wife’s sister comes and overrides Here too, let the prohibition crushed come and override
llm_translation: And if not — wait until she grows up, and this one will leave due to the status of a sister of a woman. It follows: the prohibition of a sister of a woman comes and pushes aside. Here too: the prohibition of a wound comes and pushes aside!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: הַאי תַּנָּא — הָךְ תַּנָּא דְּבֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא הִיא, דְּאָמַר: מֵחַיָּיבֵי לָאוִין דִּשְׁאֵר הָוֵי מַמְזֵר, מֵחַיָּיבֵי לָאוִין גְּרִידִי לָא הָוֵי מַמְזֵר.
human_translation: Rather, Rav Yosef said: This tanna is the tanna of the school of Rabbi Akiva, who said are liable for prohibitions involving incestuous relationships is a mamzer , are liable for ordinary prohibitions is not a mamzer .
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Yosef said: This Mishnah is the teaching of the school of Rabbi Akiva, as he said: Those liable for the prohibitions of other kinds of forbidden relationships will be considered mamzerim, but those liable for the prohibitions of girdi will not be considered mamzerim.

hebrew_text: אִיקְּרִי כָּאן ״לְהָקִים לְאָחִיו שֵׁם״, וְהָא לָאו בַּר הָכִי הוּא?
human_translation: Read here “To establish a name for his brother and this one is no capable of this,
llm_translation: It is written here "to establish a name for his brother," but is he not the son of Haki?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: אִם כֵּן, אֵין לְךָ אִשָּׁה שֶׁכְּשֵׁרָה לְיַבֵּם, שֶׁלֹּא נַעֲשָׂה בַּעְלָהּ סְרִיס חַמָּה שָׁעָה אַחַת קוֹדֶם לְמִיתָתוֹ!
human_translation: Rava said: If so there is no instance of a woman who is fit for the yavam , her husband did not become a eunuch by natural causes an hour before his death.
llm_translation: Rava said: If so, you do not have a woman who is fit for levirate marriage, that her husband did not become a eunuch of the sun for one hour before his death!

hebrew_text: לְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, פֵּירוּקָא דְרָבָא פִּירְכָא הִיא!
human_translation: According to Rabbi Eliezer Rava’s answer, is a refutation.
llm_translation: To Rabbi Eliezer, the interpretation of Rava is an interpretation!

hebrew_text: הָתָם כְּחִישׁוּתָא דְּאַתְחִילָה בֵּיהּ.
human_translation: there, the weakness that begins
llm_translation: There, as the beginning of it was hasty.

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָּמֵי סְרִיס חַמָּה? אָמַר רַב יִצְחָק בַּר יוֹסֵף אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כֹּל
human_translation: What are the circumstances of a eunuch by natural causes? Rav Yitzḥak bar Yosef said that Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Anyone
llm_translation: "How are the wages of a eunuch like the sun? Rav Yitzchak son of Yosef said, Rabbi Yochanan said: All..."

hebrew_text: שֶׁלֹּא רָאָה שָׁעָה אַחַת בְּכַשְׁרוּתוֹ. מְנָא יָדְעִינַן? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: כׇּל הַמֵּטִיל מַיִם וְאֵינוֹ עוֹשֶׂה כִּיפָּה.
human_translation: who never saw a single hour in fitness, How do we know Abaye said: Anyone who passes water and does not form an arch
llm_translation: Talmudic text: He did not see one hour in his fitness. How do we know? Abaye said: Anyone who pours water and does not make a covering.

hebrew_text: מִמַּאי הָוֵאי? דְּאָפְיָה אִימֵּיהּ בְּטִיהֲרָא וְשָׁתְיָא שִׁיכְרָא מַרְקָא. אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: הַיְינוּ דְּשָׁמַעְנָא לְאִמִּי דְּאָמַר: ״כֹּל שֶׁמִּמְּעֵי אִמּוֹ לָקוּי״, וְלָא יָדַעְנָא מַאי נִיהוּ.
human_translation: From what his mother baking at noon and drinking strong beer [ shikhra marka ] Rav Yosef said: This is which I heard Ami say: Anyone who is impaired from his mother’s womb, and I did not know what
llm_translation: From what was it? That her mother-in-law would bake and she would drink beer. Rav Yosef said: This is what I heard from my mother who said, "Anyone who belittles his mother will be hung," but I do not know who he is.

hebrew_text: וְלֵיחוּשׁ שֶׁמָּא הִבְרִיא בֵּינָתַיִם! כֵּיוָן דִּתְחִלָּתוֹ וְסוֹפוֹ לָקוּי — לָא חָיְישִׁינַן.
human_translation: Let us be concerned that perhaps he was cured in the meantime, Since his beginning and his end are impaired, we are not concerned
llm_translation: And to be concerned that perhaps he was healed in the interim! Since its beginning and end are established - we are not concerned.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַב מָרִי, רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בֶּן אַנְטִיגְנוֹס אוֹמֵר: בּוֹדְקִין אוֹתוֹ שָׁלֹשׁ פְּעָמִים בְּתוֹךְ שְׁמוֹנִים יוֹם!
human_translation: Rav Mari raised an objection Rabbi Ḥanina ben Antigonus says: One examines three times within eighty days
llm_translation: The text states: Rav Mari raises an objection. Rabbi Chanina ben Antigonus says: One examines it three times within eighty days!

hebrew_text: לְחַד אֵבֶר חָיְישִׁינַן, לְכוּלֵּיהּ גּוּפָא לָא חָיְישִׁינַן.
human_translation: With respect to a single organ, we are concerned with regard to the entire body, we are not concerned
llm_translation: To one limb we pay attention, to the entire body we do not pay attention.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר לֹא כִּי וְכוּ׳. וּרְמִינְהוּ: בֶּן עֶשְׂרִים שָׁנָה וְלֹא הֵבִיא שְׁתֵּי שְׂעָרוֹת — יָבִיאוּ רְאָיָה שֶׁהוּא בֶּן עֶשְׂרִים, וְהוּא הַסָּרִיס — לֹא חוֹלֵץ וְלֹא מְיַיבֵּם. בַּת עֶשְׂרִים וְלֹא הֵבִיאָה שְׁתֵּי שְׂעָרוֹת — יָבִיאוּ רְאָיָה שֶׁהִיא בַּת עֶשְׂרִים, וְהִיא הָאַיְלוֹנִית — לֹא חוֹלֶצֶת וְלֹא מִתְיַיבֶּמֶת, דִּבְרֵי בֵּית הִלֵּל. וּבֵית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: זֶה וְזֶה בְּנֵי שְׁמֹנֶה עֶשְׂרֵה.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: No; rather, raises a contradiction a twenty-year-old has not grown two hairs, must bring proof that he is twenty years old, and he, a sexually underdeveloped man, does not perform ḥalitza or levirate marriage a twenty-year-old has not grown two hairs, must bring proof that she is twenty years old, and she, a sexually underdeveloped woman, does not perform ḥalitza or enter into levirate marriage the statement of Beit Hillel. And Beit Shammai say: this and that, eighteen years old,
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: "Not like etc." And they asked: "A man who is twenty years old and has not brought two hairs - they should bring proof that he is twenty, and he is a eunuch - he neither performs halitzah nor levirate marriage. A woman who is twenty years old and has not brought two hairs - they should bring proof that she is twenty, and she is a eilonit - she neither performs halitzah nor enters into levirate marriage, the words of Beit Hillel. Beit Shammai says: Both this and that are the offspring of eighteen years."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: הַזָּכָר כְּדִבְרֵי בֵּית הִלֵּל, וּנְקֵבָה כְּדִבְרֵי בֵּית שַׁמַּאי, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהָאִשָּׁה מְמַהֶרֶת לָבֹא לִפְנֵי הָאִישׁ!
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says male in accordance with the statement of Beit Hillel, and a female in accordance with the statement of Beit Shammai, because a woman reaches more quickly than a man,
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: The male according to the words of Beit Hillel, and the female according to the words of Beit Shammai, because a woman hastens to come before the man!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָמֵי בַּר דִּיקּוּלֵי אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: חָזַר בּוֹ רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר. אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: מֵהֵי הֲדַר בֵּיהּ? תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: סְרִיס חַמָּה — חוֹלֵץ וְחוֹלְצִין לְאִשְׁתּוֹ, שֶׁכֵּן בְּמִינָן מִתְרַפְּאִין בַּאֲלֶכְּסַנְדְּרִיָּא שֶׁל מִצְרַיִם.
human_translation: Rami bar Dikulei said Shmuel said: Rabbi Eliezer retracted his A dilemma was raised before Which did he retract? Come hear as it is taught Rabbi Eliezer says: A eunuch by natural causes performs ḥalitza and perform ḥalitza with his wife, as such type are cured in Alexandria of Egypt.
llm_translation: Ramei son of Dikulei said in the name of Shmuel: Rabbi Eliezer reconsidered it. They asked him: Is it proper for him to return? Come and hear, as it was taught, Rabbi Eliezer says: A eunuch of the sun - he may uncover and uncover for his wife, for we are healed by the Egyptian sandal.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: לְעוֹלָם לָא הֲדַר בֵּיהּ. וְכִי תְּנַן הָהִיא — לָעוֹנָשִׁין.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: Actually, he did not retract And when we learned that with regard to punishments,
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: Always not dwell in it. And did we not learn that — for punishments.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר: אָכַל חֵלֶב, מִבֶּן שְׁתֵּים עֶשְׂרֵה [וְיוֹם אֶחָד] עַד בֶּן שְׁמֹנֶה עֶשְׂרֵה, וְנוֹלְדוּ בּוֹ סִימָנֵי סָרִיס, וּלְאַחַר מִכָּאן הֵבִיא שְׁתֵּי שְׂעָרוֹת. רַב אָמַר: נַעֲשֶׂה סָרִיס לְמַפְרֵעַ. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: קָטָן הָיָה בְּאוֹתָהּ שָׁעָה.
human_translation: it was stated ate fats between the age of twelve years and one day and the age of eighteen years, and he developed the signs of one who was a eunuch and afterward he grew two hairs, Rav said: retroactively considered a eunuch And Shmuel said: he was a minor at the time
llm_translation: It was stated: one who ate fat, from twelve years and one day until eighteen years, and signs of eunuchism appeared in him, and thereafter he brought two hairs. Rav said: he becomes a eunuch for licentiousness. And Shmuel said: he was a minor at that time.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב יוֹסֵף: לְרַב, אַיְלוֹנִית לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר יְהֵא לָהּ קְנָס!
human_translation: Rav Yosef strongly objects to this: according to Rav, a sexually underdeveloped woman according to Rabbi Meir should be entitled to the fine
llm_translation: Rav Yosef objects to him: "To Rav, if it were a matter of ayalonit for Rabbi Meir, let her have a penalty!"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: מִקַּטְנוּתָהּ יָצְתָה לְבֶגֶר.
human_translation: Abaye said to him: passes from minority to adulthood.
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: From her smallness she emerged to greatness.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: כֹּל כִּי הָנֵי מִילֵּי מְעַלְּיָיתָא יִתְאַמְּרוּ מִשְּׁמַאי. דְּתַנְיָא: אֵין הַסָּרִיס נִידּוֹן כְּבֵן סוֹרֵר וּמוֹרֶה — לְפִי שֶׁאֵין בֵּן סוֹרֵר וּמוֹרֶה נִידּוֹן אֶלָּא בַּחֲתִימַת זָקָן הַתַּחְתּוֹן. וְאֵין אַיְלוֹנִית נִידּוֹנֶית כְּנַעֲרָה הַמְאוֹרָסָה — שֶׁמִּקַּטְנוּתָהּ יָצְתָה לְבֶגֶר.
human_translation: said to all such excellent matters be stated in my name. As it is taught A sexually underdeveloped man is not judged as a stubborn and rebellious son, as judged as a stubborn and rebellious son only when the mark of lower beard, And a sexually underdeveloped woman is not judged a betrothed young woman as she passes from minority to adulthood
llm_translation: He said to him: All these matters of higher authority will be said in the name of Shammai. As it was taught: A eunuch is not judged like a rebellious son and a rebellious son and teacher - because a rebellious son and teacher are judged only by the consent of the lower elder. And a young widow is not judged like a betrothed maiden - because from her youth she has grown to maturity.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: סִימָנֵי סָרִיס, וְאַיְלוֹנִית וּבֶן שְׁמֹנֶה אֵין עוֹשִׂין בָּהֶן מַעֲשֶׂה — עַד שֶׁיְּהוּ בֶּן עֶשְׂרִים.
human_translation: Rabbi Abbahu said: the signs of a sexually underdeveloped man; or a sexually underdeveloped woman; or born during the eighth no action is taken in their regard, until they are twenty
llm_translation: Rabbi Avahu said: The signs of a eunuch, a hermaphrodite, and a boy of eight do not perform an action with them until they are twenty years old.

hebrew_text: וּבֶן שְׁמֹנֶה מִי קָחָיֵי? וְהָתַנְיָא: בֶּן שְׁמֹנֶה — הֲרֵי הוּא כְּאֶבֶן, וְאָסוּר לְטַלְטְלוֹ, אֲבָל אִמּוֹ שׁוֹחָה עָלָיו וּמְנִיקָתוֹ
human_translation: Can born during the eighth survive? But isn’t it taught born during the eighth is like a stone it is prohibited to move him However, his mother may bend over him and nurse him,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And who are the Ben Shmonah? And it was taught: Ben Shmonah — behold he is like a stone, and it is forbidden to move him, but his mother rocks over him and nurses him.

hebrew_text: מִפְּנֵי הַסַּכָּנָה. הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן — כְּשֶׁגָּמְרוּ סִימָנָיו. דְּתַנְיָא: אֵיזֶהוּ בֶּן שְׁמֹנֶה? כֹּל שֶׁלֹּא כָּלוּ לוֹ חֳדָשָׁיו. רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: סִימָנִין מוֹכִיחִין עָלָיו, שְׂעָרוֹ וְצִפׇּרְנָיו שֶׁלֹּא גָּמְרוּ. טַעְמָא דְּלֹא גָּמְרוּ. הָא גָּמְרוּ — אָמְרִינַן הַאי בַּר שִׁבְעָה הוּא, וְאִישְׁתַּהוֹיֵי הוּא דְּאִישְׁתַּהִי.
human_translation: due to the danger, With what are we dealing here? where his signs are developed, As it is taught Who is born during the eighth anyone whose months have not been completed, Rabbi says: signs prove his hair and nails are not developed. the reason is that they are not developed; but are developed, we say this born after seven but was delayed
llm_translation: Because of danger. Here, with what are we dealing? - When they have completed his signs. As it was taught: Who is a ben shmonah (an eight-day-old infant)? Anyone whose first month has not yet been completed. Rabbi says: Signs testify about him, his hair and nails have not yet been completed. The reason they have not been completed. If they have been completed - we say, this is a bar shiv'ah (a seven-day-old infant), and his wife is as his wife.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא הָא דַּעֲבַד רָבָא תּוֹסְפָאָה עוֹבָדָא בְּאִשָּׁה שֶׁהָלַךְ בַּעְלָהּ לִמְדִינַת הַיָּם וְאִישְׁתַּהִי עַד תְּרֵיסַר יַרְחֵי שַׁתָּא, וְאַכְשְׁרֵיהּ. כְּמַאן — כְּרַבִּי, דְּאָמַר מִשְׁתַּהֵא!
human_translation: But the action taken by Rava Tosfa’a concerning a woman whose husband went overseas and delayed for the twelve months the year and rendered fit, according to whose in accordance with Rabbi who says can be delayed
llm_translation: Rather, this that Rava did, he performed a marriage with a woman whose husband went to the land of the sea, and she was his wife for twelve months, and it is valid. According to whom? According to Rabbi, who says: "From the time of marriage!"

hebrew_text: כֵּיוָן דְּאִיכָּא רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל דְּאָמַר מִשְׁתַּהֵי, כְּרַבִּים עֲבַד. דְּתַנְיָא, רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: כׇּל שֶׁשָּׁהָה שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם בָּאָדָם — אֵינוֹ נֵפֶל.
human_translation: Since there is Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, who says can be delayed acted in accordance with the majority, As it is taught Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Any human who stays for thirty days is not a stillborn.
llm_translation: Since there is Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel who said, "When he becomes drunk, he acts like many." As it was taught, Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: "Anyone who remains thirty days without falling is not considered to have fallen."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֵיזֶהוּ סְרִיס חַמָּה? כׇּל שֶׁהוּא בֶּן עֶשְׂרִים, וְלֹא הֵבִיא שְׁתֵּי שְׂעָרוֹת. וַאֲפִילּוּ הֵבִיא לְאַחַר מִכָּאן הֲרֵי הוּא כְּסָרִיס לְכׇל דְּבָרָיו. וְאֵלּוּ הֵן סִימָנָיו: כֹּל שֶׁאֵין לוֹ זָקָן, וּשְׂעָרוֹ לָקוּי, וּבְשָׂרוֹ מַחְלִיק. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן יָאִיר: כֹּל שֶׁאֵין מֵימָיו מַעֲלִין רְתִיחוֹת.
human_translation: The Sages taught: Who is a eunuch by natural causes? anyone who is twenty years old and has not grown two hairs. And even if he grows afterward, he is a eunuch all his matters. And his signs are as follows: Whoever does not have a beard, and his hair is defective, and his skin is smooth, Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says in the name of Rabbi Yehuda ben Ya’ir: anyone whose urine does not raise foam.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Who is a eunuch of the sun? Anyone who is twenty years old, and has not brought forth two hairs. And even if he brought forth afterwards, behold, he is like a eunuch in all matters. And these are his signs: anyone who does not have a beard, and his hair is thin, and his skin is smooth. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says in the name of Rabbi Yehuda ben Ya'ir: anyone whose urine does not cause his boiling.

hebrew_text: וְיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים: כׇּל הַמֵּטִיל מַיִם וְאֵין עוֹשֶׂה כִּיפָּה. וְיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים: כֹּל שֶׁשִּׁכְבַת זַרְעוֹ דּוֹחָה. וְיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים: כֹּל שֶׁאֵין מֵימֵי רַגְלָיו מַחְמִיצִין. אֲחֵרִים אוֹמְרִים: כֹּל שֶׁרוֹחֵץ בִּימוֹת הַגְּשָׁמִים וְאֵין בְּשָׂרוֹ מַעֲלֶה הֶבֶל. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: כֹּל שֶׁקּוֹלוֹ לָקוּי, וְאֵין נִיכָּר בֵּין אִישׁ לְאִשָּׁה.
human_translation: And some say: anyone who urinates without forming an arch. And some say: anyone whose semen dissipates And some say: Anyone whose urine does not ferment. Others say: anyone who bathes in the rainy season and his flesh does not give off steam. Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: anyone whose voice is defective, so that it is not evident whether a man or a woman.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And some say: Anyone who pours water and does not make a covering. And some say: Anyone whose seminal emission is interrupted. And some say: Anyone whose footwater does not ferment. Others say: Anyone who bathes during the rainy days and his flesh does not emit a scent. Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: Anyone whose voice is recognizable, and there is no distinction between a man and a woman.

hebrew_text: וְאֵיזוֹ הִיא אַיְלוֹנִית? כֹּל שֶׁהִיא בַּת עֶשְׂרִים וְלֹא הֵבִיאָה שְׁתֵּי שְׂעָרוֹת, וַאֲפִילּוּ הֵבִיאָה לְאַחַר מִכָּאן — הֲרֵי הִיא כְּאַיְלוֹנִית לְכׇל דְּבָרֶיהָ. וְאֵלּוּ הֵן סִימָנֶיהָ: כֹּל שֶׁאֵין לָהּ דַּדִּים, וּמִתְקַשָּׁה בִּשְׁעַת תַּשְׁמִישׁ. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: כֹּל שֶׁאֵין לָהּ שִׁיפּוּלֵי מֵעַיִם כְּנָשִׁים. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: כֹּל שֶׁקּוֹלָה עָבֶה, וְאֵינָהּ נִיכֶּרֶת בֵּין אִשָּׁה לְאִישׁ.
human_translation: And who is a sexually underdeveloped woman [ aylonit ]? anyone who is twenty years old and has not grown two hairs. And even if she grows afterward, she is a sexually underdeveloped woman all her matters. And her signs are as follows: anyone who does not have breasts and experiences pain during intercourse. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: anyone whose lower abdomen is not like women, Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: anyone whose voice is deep, so that it is not evident whether a woman or a man.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And which is the 'aylonit'? Any woman who is twenty years old and has not brought two hairs, and even if she brought them afterwards - behold, she is like an 'aylonit' in all her matters. And these are her signs: any woman who has no breasts, and experiences difficulty during intercourse. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: any woman who has no menstrual discharge like women. Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: any woman whose voice is deep, and is not distinguishable between a woman and a man."

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר: סִימָנֵי סָרִיס, רַב הוּנָא אָמַר: עַד שֶׁיְּהוּ כּוּלָּם. רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ בְּאֶחָד מֵהֶן. הֵיכָא דְּהֵבִיא שְׁתֵּי שְׂעָרוֹת בַּזָּקָן — כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דְּעַד שֶׁיְּהוּ כּוּלָּן. כִּי פְּלִיגִי — בְּשֶׁלֹּא הֵבִיא.
human_translation: It was stated signs of a eunuch. Rav Huna said unless all are present; Rabbi Yoḥanan said: even one of them when he has grown two hairs in beard, everyone agrees that unless all are present. When they disagree, when he has not grown
llm_translation: It was stated: Signs of a eunuch. Rav Huna said: Until they all are. Rabbi Yochanan said: Even with one of them. Where he brought two hairs in the beard - they do not disagree that until they all are. When they disagree - when he did not bring.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא הָא דַּאֲמַר לְהוּ רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ לְרַבָּנַן: עַיִּינוּ בֵּיהּ בְּרַב נַחְמָן, אִי בְּשָׂרוֹ מַעֲלֶה הֶבֶל אִיתֵּיב לֵיהּ בְּרַת. כְּמַאן, כְּרַב הוּנָא! לָא, רַב נַחְמָן סִיכֵּי דִיקְנָא הַוְיָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: But that which Rabba bar Avuh said to the Sages: Examine Rav Naḥman if his flesh gives off steam I will give him daughter in accordance with whose in accordance with Rav Huna, No, Rav Naḥman had wisps a beard,
llm_translation: Rather, this that Rabba bar Avuh said to the Rabbis: "Examine it with Rab Nachman, if his flesh brings up vapor." He answered him with a proof. Like whom? Like Rav Huna! No, Rab Nachman is a sharp knife, it is fitting for him.

hebrew_text: הַסָּרִיס לֹא חוֹלֵץ וְלֹא מְיַיבֵּם, וְכֵן אַיְלוֹנִית וְכוּ׳. קָתָנֵי סָרִיס דּוּמְיָא דְּאַיְלוֹנִית: מָה אַיְלוֹנִית בִּידֵי שָׁמַיִם, אַף סָרִיס בִּידֵי שָׁמַיִם. וּסְתָמָא כְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, דְּאָמַר: בִּידֵי אָדָם — אִין, בִּידֵי שָׁמַיִם — לָא.
human_translation: a sexually underdeveloped man does not perform ḥalitza or enter into levirate marriage and similarly, a sexually underdeveloped woman teaches a sexually underdeveloped man similarly to a sexually underdeveloped woman, Just as a sexually underdeveloped woman, by the hand of Heaven, so too, a sexually underdeveloped man, by the hand of Heaven. And unattributed in accordance with Rabbi Akiva, who said: by the hands of man, yes, by the hand of Heaven not
llm_translation: The eunuch does not perform chalitzah nor does he perform levirate marriage, and similarly the androgynous and so forth. The Mishnah teaches: An androgynous is similar to a eunuch: just as an androgynous is in the hands of Heaven, so too a eunuch is in the hands of Heaven. And it is assumed to be in accordance with Rabbi Akiva, who said: In the hands of man — no, in the hands of Heaven — yes.

hebrew_text: הַסָּרִיס שֶׁחָלַץ לִיבִמְתּוֹ לֹא פְּסָלָהּ כּוּ׳. טַעְמָא דִּבְעָלָהּ הוּא, הָא אַחֵר — לָא,
human_translation: a eunuch performed ḥalitza with his yevama , he has not disqualified her the reason is that he, had intercourse with her, But a different not
llm_translation: The eunuch who performed chalitzah with his yevamah did not disqualify her. The reason is because he is considered like her husband, but if it was another man - no.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא תֶּיהְוֵי תְּיוּבְתָּא דְּרַב הַמְנוּנָא, דְּאָמַר: שׁוֹמֶרֶת יָבָם שֶׁזִּינְּתָה פְּסוּלָה לִיבָמָהּ! לֹא: הוּא הַדִּין אֲפִילּוּ לְאַחֵר נָמֵי, וְאַיְּידֵי דִּתְנָא רֵישָׁא בְּדִידֵיהּ, תְּנָא נָמֵי סֵיפָא בְּדִידֵיהּ.
human_translation: Shall we say is a conclusive refutation of Rav Hamnuna, who said: A widow waiting for her yavam , who engaged in an act of licentious relations, is disqualified from her yavam , No, the same is true even with a different too But since taught the first clause with regard to himself, he also taught the latter clause with regard to himself,
llm_translation: Let it be the response of Rav Hamnuna, who said: "A yevamah who committed adultery is disqualified for her yavam!" No, the same ruling applies even to another case, and since the first Tanna taught his statement separately, let the later Tanna teach his statement separately as well.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן אַיְילוֹנִית שֶׁחָלְצוּ לָהּ אַחִין כּוּ׳. טַעְמָא דִּבְעָלוּהָ. הָא לֹא בְּעָלוּהָ — לָא. כְּמַאן? דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, דְּאִי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה, הָאָמַר: אַיְילוֹנִית זוֹנָה הִיא.
human_translation: And similarly, a sexually underdeveloped woman, the brothers performed ḥalitza with her the reason is that he had intercourse with her; but he did not have intercourse with her not According to whose not in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda. As, if Rabbi Yehuda, didn’t he say a sexually underdeveloped woman is a woman who has had sexual relations with a man forbidden to her by the Torah [ zona ],
llm_translation: And so, the Aylonit that her brothers betrothed her. Reason of her husband. This is not her husband - no. Like whom? Like not Rabbi Yehuda, for if Rabbi Yehuda, he said: "The Aylonit is a harlot."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ סְרִיס חַמָּה כֹּהֵן שֶׁנָּשָׂא בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל — מַאֲכִילָהּ בִּתְרוּמָה. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמְרִים: אַנְדְּרוֹגִינוֹס כֹּהֵן שֶׁנָּשָׂא בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל — מַאֲכִילָהּ בִּתְרוּמָה.
human_translation: a priest who is a eunuch by natural causes married an Israelite woman, enables her to eat teruma . Rabbi Yosei and Rabbi Shimon say: a priest who is a hermaphrodite, married an Israelite woman, enables her to eat teruma .
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: A eunuch who is a priest who married a daughter of Israel - he feeds her from the Terumah. Rabbi Yosei and Rabbi Shimon say: An androgynous priest who married a daughter of Israel - he feeds her from the Terumah.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: טוּמְטוּם שֶׁנִּקְרַע וְנִמְצָא זָכָר — לֹא יַחְלוֹץ, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא כְּסָרִיס. אַנְדְּרוֹגִינוֹס נוֹשֵׂא אֲבָל לֹא נִישָּׂא. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: אַנְדְּרוֹגִינוֹס חַיָּיבִין עָלָיו סְקִילָה כַּזָּכָר.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: a tumtum , was torn and he was found a male, must not perform ḥalitza , because he is like a eunuch. A hermaphrodite may marry but he may not be married Rabbi Eliezer says: a hermaphrodite, is liable to stoning on his account as if a male.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: A eunuch whose tumtum was torn and found to be male - he may not marry, because he is like a saris. An androgynos may carry but not be carried. Rabbi Eliezer says: An androgynos is liable to stoning like a male.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ פְּשִׁיטָא? מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: מוֹלִיד — מַאֲכִיל, שֶׁאֵינוֹ מוֹלִיד — אֵינוֹ מַאֲכִיל, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: is obvious; lest you say one who can father enables to eat one who cannot father does not enable to eat teaches us
llm_translation: Gemara: Is it obvious? What might you say: If it gives birth - it feeds, if it does not give birth - it does not feed, it is teaching us.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמְרִים: אַנְדְּרוֹגִינוֹס. אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: מַאֲכִילָהּ בִּתְרוּמָה, וְאֵין מַאֲכִילָהּ בְּחָזֶה וָשׁוֹק. רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אוֹמֵר: אַף מַאֲכִילָהּ בְּחָזֶה וָשׁוֹק. וּלְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ, מַאי שְׁנָא חָזֶה וָשׁוֹק — דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא? תְּרוּמָה נָמֵי דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא!
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei and Rabbi Shimon say: a hermaphrodite Reish Lakish said: He enables her to eat teruma , but he does not enable her to eat the breast and thigh Rabbi Yoḥanan says: He even enables her to eat the breast and thigh And according to Reish Lakish, what is different the breast and thigh by Torah teruma also by Torah
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei and Rabbi Shimon say: Androgynos. Reish Lakish said: One may feed it with terumah, but one may not feed it with breast and thigh. Rabbi Yochanan says: One may also feed it with breast and thigh. And to Reish Lakish, what is the difference between breast and thigh - is it biblical? Terumah is also biblical!

hebrew_text: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן — בִּתְרוּמָה בַּזְּמַן הַזֶּה דְּרַבָּנַן. אֲבָל בִּזְמַן שֶׁבֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ קַיָּים מַאי — לֹא? אַדְּתָנֵי ״אֵין מַאֲכִילָהּ בְּחָזֶה וָשׁוֹק״, לִיפְלוֹג וְלִיתְנֵי בְּדִידַהּ: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — בִּתְרוּמָה דְּרַבָּנַן, אֲבָל בִּתְרוּמָה דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא — לָא!
human_translation: With what are we dealing here? with teruma in the present, by rabbinic But when the Temple is standing, what not Instead of teaching he does not enable her to eat the breast and thigh let him distinguish and teach within itself In what is this statement said? with regard to teruma by rabbinic but with regard to teruma by Torah not
llm_translation: Here we are dealing with - with regards to Terumah in our time of the Rabbis. But in a time when the Temple stood, what is the law - not? For it was taught: "One does not feed it from the chest and the thigh," to distinguish and to say on its own: in what case are these matters said - regarding the Terumah of the Rabbis, but regarding the Terumah of the Torah - no!

hebrew_text: הָכִי נָמֵי קָאָמַר: כְּשֶׁהוּא מַאֲכִילָהּ — מַאֲכִילָהּ בִּתְרוּמָה בַּזְּמַן הַזֶּה דְּרַבָּנַן, וְאֵין מַאֲכִילָהּ בִּזְמַן חָזֶה וָשׁוֹק, וַאֲפִילּוּ בִּתְרוּמָה דְּרַבָּנַן, דִּלְמָא אָתֵי לְאוֹכֹלַהּ בִּתְרוּמָה דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא.
human_translation: That is also what he is saying. When he enables her to eat, he enables her to eat teruma in the present, by rabbinic but he does not enable her to eat at a time the breast and thigh even teruma by rabbinic perhaps he will bring her to eat teruma by Torah
llm_translation: So it was stated: When he feeds her - he feeds her with terumah in the present time of the Rabbis, and he does not feed her in the future time of the seer and the prophet, and even with the terumah of the Rabbis, perhaps he will come to eat it as terumah of the Torah.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: אַף מַאֲכִילָהּ בְּחָזֶה וָשׁוֹק. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן לְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: מִי סָבְרַתְּ תְּרוּמָה בַּזְּמַן הַזֶּה דְּרַבָּנַן? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִין, שֶׁאֲנִי שׁוֹנֶה: עִיגּוּל בְּעִגּוּלִים עוֹלֶה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says he even enables her to eat the breast and thigh Rabbi Yoḥanan said to Reish Lakish: do you maintain teruma in the present by rabbinic He said to him: Yes, that I teach a cake with cakes is nullified.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: Also feeding it with chest and thigh. Rabbi Yochanan said to Reish Lakish: Do you think that Terumah is applicable nowadays according to the Rabbis? He said to him: No, for I maintain: A round cake in round pans is effective.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ, וַהֲלֹא אֲנִי שׁוֹנֶה: חֲתִיכָה בַּחֲתִיכוֹת — עוֹלָה. מִי סָבְרַתְּ ״כׇּל שֶׁדַּרְכּוֹ לִימָּנוֹת״ שָׁנִינוּ? ״אֶת שֶׁדַּרְכּוֹ לִימָּנוֹת״ שָׁנִינוּ.
human_translation: said to him: But don’t I teach a piece with pieces is nullified, Do you maintain we learned any that it is usual to count, we learned that which it is usual to count,
llm_translation: He said to him, "But didn't I teach: a piece among pieces - it ascends. Who holds the opinion 'all that is accustomed to be counted'? We taught 'that which is accustomed to be counted.'"

hebrew_text: מַאי הִיא — דִּתְנַן: מִי שֶׁהָיוּ לוֹ חֲבִילֵי תִלְתָּן שֶׁל כִּלְאֵי הַכֶּרֶם — יִדְלְקוּ. נִתְעָרְבוּ בַּאֲחֵרוֹת —
human_translation: What is As we learned one who had bundles of clover, of food crops in a vineyard, must be burned, became intermingled with others
llm_translation: What is it? — As we learned in a Mishnah: One who had three bundles of grapevines tied together — they should be burned. If they got mixed with others —

hebrew_text: כּוּלָּן יִדָּלְקוּ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: יַעֲלוּ בְּאֶחָד וּמָאתַיִם. שֶׁהָיָה רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: כֹּל שֶׁדַּרְכּוֹ לִימָּנוֹת — מְקַדֵּשׁ. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֵינוֹ מְקַדֵּשׁ אֶלָּא שִׁשָּׁה דְּבָרִים בִּלְבַד. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: שִׁבְעָה.
human_translation: they must all be burned; the statement of Rabbi Meir. And the Rabbis say: They are nullified in one to two hundred As Rabbi Meir would say: Any that it is usual to count renders prohibited. But the Rabbis say: Only six objects render forbidden. Rabbi Akiva says: seven
llm_translation: They all are liable, the words of Rabbi Meir. And the sages say: One hundred and one. For Rabbi Meir used to say: Anyone whose way is to count by hundreds — sanctifies. And the sages say: He sanctifies only with six things alone. Rabbi Akiva says: Seven.

hebrew_text: אֵלּוּ הֵן: אֱגוֹזֵי פֶרֶךְ, וְרִמּוֹנֵי בָּדָן, וְחָבִיּוֹת סְתוּמוֹת, וְחִלְפֵי תְרָדִין, וְקוּלְחֵי כְּרוּב, וְדַלַּעַת יְוָנִית. וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא מוֹסִיף אַף כִּכָּרוֹת שֶׁל בַּעַל הַבַּיִת. הָרְאוּיִן לְעׇרְלָה — עׇרְלָה. לְכִלְאֵי הַכֶּרֶם — כִּלְאֵי הַכֶּרֶם.
human_translation: They are Perekh nuts, Badan pomegranates, sealed barrels shoots of beet; cabbage stalks; and Greek gourd. Rabbi Akiva adds, a homeowner’s loaves. Those that are fit for orla , orla . Those that are fit food crops in a vineyard, food crops in a vineyard.
llm_translation: These are they: walnuts of Perach, pomegranates of Badan, sealed barrels, turnip peels, cabbage stalks, and Greek gourds. And Rabbi Akiva adds even the bread crusts of the householder. Those fit for circumcision - circumcision. Those fit for the vineyard - for the vineyard.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן סָבַר: ״אֶת שֶׁדַּרְכּוֹ לִימָּנוֹת״ שָׁנִינוּ. וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ סָבַר: ״כֹּל שֶׁדַּרְכּוֹ לִימָּנוֹת״ שָׁנִינוּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan holds we learned: That which it is usual to count, And Reish Lakish holds we learned: Any that it is usual to count,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan holds: "One who is accustomed to marry women of the south," as we have learned. And Reish Lakish holds: "Anyone who is accustomed to marry women of the south," as we have learned.

hebrew_text: מַאי חֲתִיכָה — דְּתַנְיָא: חֲתִיכָה שֶׁל חַטָּאת טְמֵאָה שֶׁנִּתְעָרְבָה בְּמֵאָה חֲתִיכוֹת שֶׁל חַטָּאוֹת טְהוֹרוֹת, וְכֵן פְּרוּסָה שֶׁל לֶחֶם הַפָּנִים טְמֵאָה שֶׁנִּתְעָרְבָה בְּמֵאָה פְּרוּסוֹת שֶׁל לֶחֶם הַפָּנִים טְהוֹרוֹת — תַּעֲלֶה. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: לֹא תַּעֲלֶה.
human_translation: What is a piece, As it is taught a piece of a ritually impure sin-offering became intermingled with one hundred pieces of ritually pure sin-offerings, and similarly, a slice of ritually impure shewbread became intermingled with one hundred slices of ritually pure showbread, is nullified Rabbi Yehuda says: It is not nullified.
llm_translation: What is the case of a "piece"? — As it was taught: A piece of a sin-offering that became mixed with one hundred pieces of pure sin-offerings, and similarly, a portion of the showbread that became mixed with one hundred portions of pure showbread — it is elevated. Rabbi Yehuda says: it is not elevated.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל חֲתִיכָה שֶׁל חַטָּאת טְהוֹרָה שֶׁנִּתְעָרְבָה בְּמֵאָה חֲתִיכוֹת שֶׁל חוּלִּין טְהוֹרוֹת, וְכֵן פְּרוּסָה שֶׁל לֶחֶם הַפָּנִים טְהוֹרָה שֶׁנִּתְעָרְבָה בְּמֵאָה פְּרוּסוֹת שֶׁל חוּלִּין טְהוֹרוֹת — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל לָא תַּעֲלֶה.
human_translation: However, a piece of a ritually pure sin-offering became intermingled with one hundred pieces of ritually pure non-sacred and similarly, a slice of ritually pure shewbread became intermingled with one hundred slices of ritually pure non-sacred bread, everyone agrees that is not nullified
llm_translation: But a piece of pure sin-offering that got mixed up with a hundred pieces of pure common food, and similarly a portion of the showbread that got mixed up with a hundred portions of pure common food — the consensus is that it does not ascend.

hebrew_text: קָתָנֵי מִיהַת רֵישָׁא תַּעֲלֶה! אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב הוּנָא: בְּנִימּוֹחָה.
human_translation: In any event, the first clause teaches can be nullified. Rabbi Ḥiyya, son of Rav Huna, said: to one that had been crushed
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches from there, at the beginning, it should ascend! Rabbi Hiyya, son of Rav Huna, said: in Nimmokha.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה?
human_translation: If so what is the reason for Rabbi Yehuda’s
llm_translation: If so, what is the reason for Rabbi Yehuda?

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה לְטַעְמֵיהּ, דְּאָמַר: מִין בְּמִינוֹ לֹא בָּטֵיל.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda to his reasoning, as he stated type with its type, cannot be nullified
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda according to his reasoning, as he said: a species with its own kind is not nullified.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל לֹא נִימּוֹחָה מַאי — לֹא תַּעֲלֶה, אַדְּתָנֵי: אֲבָל חֲתִיכָה שֶׁל חַטָּאת טְהוֹרָה שֶׁנִּתְעָרְבָה בְּמֵאָה חֲתִיכוֹת שֶׁל חוּלִּין טְהוֹרוֹת לֹא תַּעֲלֶה, נִיפְלוֹג וְנִיתְנֵי בְּדִידַהּ: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים, בְּשֶׁנִּימּוֹחָה, אֲבָל לֹא נִימּוֹחָה — לֹא תַּעֲלֶה!
human_translation: But not crushed, what not nullified. instead of teaching However, if a piece of a ritually pure sin-offering became intermingled with one hundred pieces of ritually pure non-sacred is not nullified; let distinguish and teach in In what is this statement said? where has been crushed but has not been crushed, not nullified.
llm_translation: But if it was not mixed, what is the law? It shall not ascend. For it was taught: But a piece of pure sin-offering that became mixed with one hundred pieces of pure common food shall not ascend. They disputed and it was resolved according to his opinion: In what case are these words said? When it was mixed. But if it was not mixed, it shall not ascend!

hebrew_text: טְהוֹרוֹת בִּטְהוֹרוֹת עֲדִיף לֵיהּ.
human_translation: prefers ritually pure with ritually pure
llm_translation: Pure things with pure things are preferable.

hebrew_text: וּלְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ, מַאי שְׁנָא רֵישָׁא וּמַאי שְׁנָא סֵיפָא? אָמַר רַב שִׁישָׁא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִידִי: רֵישָׁא, בְּטוּמְאַת מַשְׁקִין דְּרַבָּנַן. סֵיפָא, דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא.
human_translation: And according to Reish Lakish, what is different the first clause and what is different the latter clause? Rav Sheisha, son of Rav Idi, said: The first clause ritual impurity due to liquids, by rabbinic The latter clause, by Torah
llm_translation: To Reish Lakish, what is the difference between the beginning and the end? Rav Shisha, son of Rav Idi, said: The beginning is regarding the impurity of liquids according to the Rabbis. The end is regarding biblical law.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל טוּמְאַת שֶׁרֶץ מַאי — לֹא תַּעֲלֶה,
human_translation: But ritual impurity through a creeping animal, what not nullified.
llm_translation: But the impurity of a creeping thing, what is it? - It shall not ascend.

hebrew_text: אַדְּתָנֵי סֵיפָא: אֲבָל חֲתִיכָה שֶׁל חַטָּאת טְהוֹרָה שֶׁנִּתְעָרְבָה בְּמֵאָה חֲתִיכוֹת שֶׁל חוּלִּין טְהוֹרוֹת לֹא תַּעֲלֶה, נִיפְלוֹג וְלִיתְנֵי בְּדִידַהּ: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — בְּטוּמְאַת מַשְׁקִין, אֲבָל בְּטוּמְאַת שֶׁרֶץ — לֹא! טְהוֹרָה בִּטְהוֹרוֹת עֲדִיף לֵיהּ.
human_translation: instead of teaching latter clause However, a piece of a ritually pure sin-offering became intermingled with one hundred pieces of ritually pure non-sacred is not nullified; let distinguish and teach in In what is this statement said? where ritual impurity due to liquids, but where ritual impurity through a creeping animal not prefers ritually pure with ritually pure
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches in the latter clause: But a piece of pure sin-offering that became mixed with one hundred pieces of pure common food does not ascend. They disagreed and taught it separately: In what case are these matters stated? — In the case of the impurity of liquids, but in the case of the impurity of a creeping thing — no! Pure with the pure is preferable.

hebrew_text: רַבָּה אָמַר: רֵישָׁא — אִיסּוּר לָאו, סֵיפָא — אִיסּוּר כָּרֵת.
human_translation: Rabba said the first clause a standard prohibition, the latter clause a prohibition of karet ,
llm_translation: Rabba said: the beginning - prohibition negative, the end - prohibition excision.

hebrew_text: וְהָא רַבָּה הוּא דְּאָמַר: כֹּל בִּדְאוֹרָיְיתָא, לָא שְׁנָא אִיסּוּר לָאו, וְלָא שְׁנָא אִיסּוּר כָּרֵת! קַשְׁיָא.
human_translation: But wasn’t it Rabba who said: any by Torah no difference between standard prohibition a prohibition of karet . difficult
llm_translation: And behold, Rabba said: "Everything in the Torah, whether it is a prohibition of a negative commandment, or a prohibition of karet, is not different!" This is difficult.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: סֵיפָא — מִשּׁוּם דְּהָוֵי לֵיהּ דָּבָר שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ מַתִּירִין, וְכׇל דָּבָר שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ מַתִּירִין — אֲפִילּוּ בְּאֶלֶף לֹא בָּטֵיל.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said the latter clause, because it is an object whose prohibition is temporary. And any object whose prohibition is temporary cannot be nullified, even in one thousand.
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said: The latter clause — because it involves a matter that has those who permit it, and any matter that has those who permit it — even with a thousand, it is not nullified.

hebrew_text: וְהָא דְּרַב אָשֵׁי בְּדוּתָא הִיא. לְמַאן? אִי לְכֹהֵן — מִישְׁרָא שְׁרֵי. אִי לְיִשְׂרָאֵל — לְעוֹלָם אָסוּר! אֶלָּא הָא דְּרַב אָשֵׁי בְּדוּתָא הִיא.
human_translation: Now, that to Rav Ashi is a mistake [ beduta ], to whom If for a priest, was permitted if for an Israelite, always forbidden Rather, that to Rav Ashi is a mistake.
llm_translation: And this that Rav Ashei said in Duta, it is. According to whom? If for a Kohen - from Yisrael it is permitted. If for a Yisrael - forever it is forbidden! Rather, this that Rav Ashei said in Duta, it is.

hebrew_text: וְסָבַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן תְּרוּמָה בִּזְמַן הַזֶּה דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא? וְהָתַנְיָא: שְׁתֵּי קוּפּוֹת, אַחַת שֶׁל חוּלִּין וְאַחַת שֶׁל תְּרוּמָה, וְלִפְנֵיהֶם שְׁתֵּי סְאִין, אַחַת שֶׁל חוּלִּין וְאַחַת שֶׁל תְּרוּמָה, וְנָפְלוּ אֵלּוּ בְּתוֹךְ אֵלּוּ — הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ מוּתָּרִים, שֶׁאֲנִי אוֹמֵר: תְּרוּמָה לְתוֹךְ תְּרוּמָה נָפְלָה, וְחוּלִּין בְּתוֹךְ חוּלִּין נָפְלוּ.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan maintain that teruma in the present by Torah But isn’t it taught two baskets, one non-sacred and one teruma , and before them two se’a one non-sacred and one teruma . And these, fell into those, is permitted, as I say the teruma fell into the teruma and the non-sacred fell into the non-sacred
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And Rabbi Yochanan thought, is Terumah nowadays from the Torah? And it was taught: Two baskets, one of common produce and one of Terumah, and before them two measures, one of common produce and one of Terumah, and if these fell into each other - they are permitted, for I say: Terumah that fell into Terumah, and common produce that fell into common produce.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: וְהוּא שֶׁרַבּוּ חוּלִּין עַל הַתְּרוּמָה, וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁלֹּא רַבּוּ חוּלִּין עַל הַתְּרוּמָה.
human_translation: And Reish Lakish said this if the non-sacred was greater than the teruma And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: even if the non-sacred was not greater than the teruma ,
llm_translation: And Reish Lakish said: And this is when the non-consecrated items outnumber the terumah, and Rabbi Yochanan said: Even though the non-consecrated items did not outnumber the terumah.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ, קָסָבַר בִּדְרַבָּנַן נָמֵי רִבּוּיָא הוּא דְּבָעֵינַן. אֶלָּא לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן קַשְׁיָא?
human_translation: Granted, according to Reish Lakish, he maintains with regard to by rabbinic we also require greater But according to Rabbi Yoḥanan, difficult
llm_translation: In peace to Reish Lakish, he holds according to the Rabbis, it is also a form of multiplication that we require. But to Rabbi Yochanan, is it difficult?

hebrew_text: הָא מַנִּי — רַבָּנַן הִיא,
human_translation: whose is this It the Rabbis,
llm_translation: This is the translation: "This is a dispute among the Rabbis."

hebrew_text: וַאֲנָא דְּאָמְרִי כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי.
human_translation: But I, said in accordance with Rabbi Yosei
llm_translation: And I say like Rabbi Yosei.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא בְּסֵדֶר עוֹלָם: ״אֲשֶׁר יָרְשׁוּ אֲבוֹתֶיךָ וִירִשְׁתָּהּ״, יְרוּשָּׁה רִאשׁוֹנָה וּשְׁנִיָּה — יֵשׁ לָהֶן, וּשְׁלִישִׁית — אֵין לָהֶן.
human_translation: As it is taught in Seder Olam , that your fathers inherited, and you shall inherit it” they had a first inheritance and a second But they will not have a third
llm_translation: It was taught in the order of the world: "Which your fathers inherited, and you shall inherit it," the first and second inheritance - they have, but the third - they do not have.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מַאן תְּנָא סֵדֶר עוֹלָם — רַבִּי יוֹסֵי.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Who taught Seder Olam ? Rabbi Yosei.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yochanan said: Who is the Tanna that arranged the world? - Rabbi Yosei.

hebrew_text: וְסָבַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בִּדְרַבָּנַן לָא בָּעֵינַן רִבּוּיָא? וְהָא תְּנַן: מִקְוֶה שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ אַרְבָּעִים סְאָה מְכֻוּוֹנוֹת, נָתַן סְאָה וְנָטַל סְאָה — כָּשֵׁר. וְאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בַּר שֵׁילָא אָמַר רַבִּי אַסִּי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: עַד רוּבּוֹ.
human_translation: But Rabbi Yoḥanan maintain with regard to by rabbinic we do not require greater Didn’t we learn a ritual bath that contains exactly forty se’a one added a se’a and removed a se’a fit, And Rabbi Yehuda bar Sheila said Rabbi Asi said Rabbi Yoḥanan said up to the greater part
llm_translation: And thought Rabbi Yochanan according to the Rabbis, do we not require a majority? But didn't we learn: A mikveh that has forty se'ah of drawn water, he put in a se'ah and took out a se'ah - it is valid. And Rabbi Yehuda bar Sheilah said in the name of Rabbi Assi who said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: Until its majority.

hebrew_text: מַאי לָאו, דְּנִשְׁתַּיֵּיר רוּבּוֹ! לָא, דְּלָא נִשְׁקוֹל רוּבּוֹ.
human_translation: What, is it not that its greater part must remain, No, that its greater part must not be removed,
llm_translation: What is the reason that his majority is not considered? No, because his majority is not taken into account.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: שָׁאנֵי הָכָא, דְּאִיכָּא לְמֵימַר ״שֶׁאֲנִי אוֹמֵר״.
human_translation: And if you wish, say It is different here, since it may be said: As I say
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: The difference here is that there is room to say "I say."

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: אַנְדְּרוֹגִינוֹס נוֹשֵׂא! תְּנִי ״אִם נָשָׂא״.
human_translation: We learned A hermaphrodite may marry Teach If he married.
llm_translation: We learned in the Mishnah: Androgynos carries! Teach: "If he carried."

hebrew_text: וְהָא ״נוֹשֵׂא״ קָתָנֵי! וְלִיטַעְמָיךְ: מַאי ״אֲבָל לֹא נִישָּׂא״? אֶלָּא מַאי ״נִישָּׂא״ — דִּיעֲבַד, ״נוֹשֵׂא״ נָמֵי — דִּיעֲבַד!
human_translation: But doesn’t he may marry And according to your reasoning, what is But he may not be married Rather, what is be married after the fact may marry also after the fact.
llm_translation: The text says: "And this 'nosei' is taught! And let me taste: What is 'aval lo nisa'? Rather, what is 'nisa' - that it happened, 'nosei' also - that it happened!"

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי, לָא: ״נוֹשֵׂא״ — לְכַתְּחִלָּה מַשְׁמַע, ״אֲבָל לֹא נִישָּׂא״ — דִּיעֲבַד נָמֵי לָא.
human_translation: said No; May marry, indicate ab initio , But he may not be married, not even after the fact.
llm_translation: They said, no: "nosei" - implies initially, "but not nisa" - it happened, no.

hebrew_text: וְהָא מִדְּקָתָנֵי סֵיפָא, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: אַנְדְּרוֹגִינוֹס חַיָּיבִין עָלָיו סְקִילָה כַּזָּכָר, מִכְּלָל דְּתַנָּא קַמָּא סַפּוֹקֵי מְסַפְּקָא לֵיהּ!
human_translation: But from that teaches the latter clause: Rabbi Eliezer says a hermaphrodite, is liable to stoning on his account as if a male, by inference that the first tanna is uncertain
llm_translation: And this is what we learned in the latter part: Rabbi Eliezer says: Androginos is liable to stoning like a male, as it is derived from the first Tanna, they are in doubt, let him be in doubt!

hebrew_text: בֵּין לְמָר בֵּין לְמָר מִפְשָׁט פְּשִׁיטָא לֵיהּ, אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ סְקִילָה מִשְּׁנֵי מְקוֹמוֹת. דְּמָר סָבַר: חַיָּיבִין עָלָיו סְקִילָה מִשְּׁנֵי מְקוֹמוֹת, וּמָר סָבַר: כְּזָכָר.
human_translation: is obvious both to this Master and to that Master between them stoning at two places. As one Sage, holds one is liable to stoning on account at two places, And one Sage, holds as if a male.
llm_translation: Between Mar and Mar, the simple understanding is with him, there is a difference between them in stoning from two places. For Mar holds: he is liable to stoning from two places, and Mar holds: like a male.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב:
human_translation: Rav said:
llm_translation: Said Rav:

hebrew_text: לֵיתַהּ לְמַתְנִיתִין מִקַּמֵּי בָּרַיְיתָא, דְּתַנְיָא: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: אַנְדְּרוֹגִינוֹס — בְּרִיָּה בִּפְנֵי עַצְמָהּ הוּא, וְלֹא הִכְרִיעוּ בּוֹ חֲכָמִים אִם זָכָר אִם נְקֵבָה.
