human_translation: The mishna is not in the presence of a baraita As it is taught Rabbi Yosei says: A hermaphrodite is a creature unto himself, and the Sages did not determine whether he is a male or a female.
llm_translation: There is no Mishnah before the Baraita, as it was taught: Rabbi Yosei says: Androgynos — a separate creation in its own right, and the sages did not determine regarding it whether it is male or female.

hebrew_text: אַדְּרַבָּה לֵיתַהּ לְבָרַיְיתָא מִקַּמֵּי מַתְנִיתִין! מִדְּשַׁבְקֵיהּ רַבִּי יוֹסֵי לְבַר זוּגֵיהּ — שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ הֲדַר בֵּיהּ.
human_translation: On the contrary, the baraita is not in the presence of the mishna From that Rabbi Yosei left his colleague, learn from this retracted
llm_translation: Rabba did not leave him before the Baraita! Since Rabbi Yosei left his son Zugei - hear from it, he returned to him.

hebrew_text: וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: לֵיתַהּ לְבָרַיְיתָא מִקַּמֵּי מַתְנִיתִין. אַדְּרַבָּה, לֵיתָא לְמַתְנִיתִין מִקַּמֵּי בָּרַיְיתָא, דְּהָא שָׁמְעִינַן לֵיהּ לִשְׁמוּאֵל דְּחָיֵישׁ לִיחִידָאָה! הָנֵי מִילֵּי, כִּי לָא מִתְעַקְרָא מַתְנִיתִין, אֲבָל כִּי מִתְעַקְרָא מַתְנִיתִין — לָא חָיֵישׁ.
human_translation: And Shmuel said The baraita is not in the presence of the mishna On the contrary, the mishna is not in the presence of the baraita , as we heard that Shmuel takes into consideration an individual This applies only when the mishna not uprooted, But when the mishna is uprooted he does not take into consideration.
llm_translation: Samuel said: There is no need for a baraita before mishnayot. On the contrary, a baraita is needed before mishnayot, for we have heard regarding Samuel that he is concerned for the individual! These matters, when mishnayot are not uprooted, there is no concern. But when mishnayot are uprooted, there is no concern.

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי בֵּי רַב מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּאַנְדְּרוֹגִינוֹס וּבְהַרְכָּבָה, וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: בְּקוֹשִׁי וּבְקִידּוּשׁ.
human_translation: the school of Rav said in the name of Rav halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yosei, with regard to a hermaphrodite and with regard to grafting. And Shmuel says: with regard to protracted labor and forfeiture.
llm_translation: The House of Rav said in the name of Rav: The halakha is like Rabbi Yosei in Androgynos and in Harkavah, and Shmuel said: In difficulty and in sanctification.

hebrew_text: אַנְדְּרוֹגִינוֹס — הָא דַּאֲמַרַן. הַרְכָּבָה — דִּתְנַן: אֵין נוֹטְעִין וְאֵין מַבְרִיכִין וְאֵין מַרְכִּיבִין עֶרֶב שְׁבִיעִית פָּחוֹת מִשְּׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם לִפְנֵי רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה. וְאִם נָטַע וְהִבְרִיךְ וְהִרְכִּיב — יַעֲקוֹר. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: כׇּל הַרְכָּבָה שֶׁאֵינָהּ קוֹלֶטֶת בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה יָמִים — שׁוּב אֵינָהּ קוֹלֶטֶת. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמְרִים: שְׁתֵּי שַׁבָּתוֹת.
human_translation: a hermaphrodite that which we said, grafting as we learned One may not plant, or sink or graft eve of the Sabbatical Year less than thirty days before Rosh HaShana, And if he planted or sank or grafted, he must uproot Rabbi Yehuda says: Any graft that does not take root in three days will never take root, Rabbi Yosei and Rabbi Shimon say two weeks
llm_translation: Androgynos - the one we said. The carriage - as we learned: One may not plant, irrigate, or ride on a carriage less than thirty days before Rosh Hashanah. And if one planted, irrigated, and rode the carriage - it shall be uprooted. Rabbi Yehuda says: Any carriage that does not collect rainwater for three days - will no longer collect rainwater. Rabbi Yosei and Rabbi Shimon say: Two Sabbaths.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ: לְדִבְרֵי הָאוֹמֵר שְׁלֹשִׁים — צָרִיךְ שְׁלֹשִׁים ושְׁלֹשִׁים. לְדִבְרֵי הָאוֹמֵר שְׁלֹשָׁה — צָרִיךְ שְׁלֹשָׁה ושְׁלֹשִׁים. לְדִבְרֵי הָאוֹמֵר שְׁתֵּי שַׁבָּתוֹת — צָרִיךְ שְׁתֵּי שַׁבָּתוֹת וּשְׁלֹשִׁים.
human_translation: And Rav Naḥman said Rabba bar Avuh said: According to who says thirty thirty required and thirty according to who says three three are required and thirty according to who say two weeks, two weeks are required and thirty
llm_translation: And Rav Nachman said in the name of Rabba bar Avuh: According to the one who says thirty - he requires thirty and thirty. According to the one who says three - he requires three and thirty. According to the one who says two Sabbaths - he requires two Sabbaths and thirty.

hebrew_text: וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: בְּקוֹשִׁי וְקִידּוּשׁ. קוֹשִׁי — דִּתְנַן:
human_translation: And Shmuel said with regard to protracted labor and proscription protracted labor? As we learned
llm_translation: And Samuel said: in Koshi and Kiddush. Koshi - as we learned:

hebrew_text: כַּמָּה יְהֵא קִישּׁוּיָהּ — רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: אוֹ אַרְבָּעִים אוֹ חֲמִשִּׁים יוֹם. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: דַּיָּיהּ חׇדְשָׁהּ. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמְרִים: אֵין קִישּׁוּי יוֹתֵר מִשְּׁתֵּי שַׁבָּתוֹת.
human_translation: How long is protracted labor? Rabbi Meir says: forty or fifty days Rabbi Yehuda says: Her month suffices for her, Rabbi Yosei and Rabbi Shimon say: Protracted labor does not last for more than two weeks.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates as follows: "How long should the betrothal period be?" Rabbi Meir says: Either forty or fifty days. Rabbi Yehuda says: A full month is sufficient. Rabbi Yosei and Rabbi Shimon say: The betrothal period should not exceed two Sabbaths."

hebrew_text: קִידּוּשׁ — דִּתְנַן: הַמְסַכֵּךְ גַּפְנוֹ עַל גַּבֵּי תְּבוּאָתוֹ שֶׁל חֲבֵרוֹ — הֲרֵי זֶה קִדֵּשׁ, וְחַיָּיב בְּאַחְרָיוּתוֹ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמְרִים:
human_translation: proscription? As we learned one causes his grapevine to overshadow the grain of another, he has proscribed and he bears responsibility for it, the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yosei and Rabbi Shimon say:
llm_translation: Sanctification — as we learned: One who covers his grapevine with the produce of his friend — behold, this is sanctification, and he is liable for its consequences, the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yosei and Rabbi Shimon say:

hebrew_text: אֵין אָדָם אוֹסֵר דָּבָר שֶׁאֵינוֹ שֶׁלּוֹ.
human_translation: A person cannot render forbidden an item that is not his.
llm_translation: A person does not forbid a thing that is not his.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: בְּאַנְדְּרוֹגִינוֹס מָה לִי אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל? תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל לְרַב עָנָן: לֵיתַהּ לְבָרַיְיתָא מִקַּמֵּי מַתְנִיתִין.
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before As for a hermaphrodite, what did Shmuel say? Come hear, as Shmuel said to Rav Anan: The baraita is not in the presence of the mishna.
llm_translation: He asked them: In Androgynos, what did Shmuel say? Come and hear, for Shmuel said to Rav Anan: It is not fitting for him to sit before the scholars.

hebrew_text: הַרְכָּבָה מָה לִי אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל? תָּא שְׁמַע, דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ שְׁמוּאֵל לְרַב עָנָן: תְּנִי כְּמַאן דְּאָמַר שְׁלֹשָׁה וּשְׁלֹשִׁים.
human_translation: grafting, what did Shmuel say? Come hear, as Shmuel said to Rav Anan teach in accordance with the one who said thirty-three
llm_translation: The chariot, what to me? Said Shmuel? Come and hear, for Shmuel said to Rav Anan: Teach as one who says thirty-three.

hebrew_text: קוֹשִׁי מָה לִי אָמַר רַב? תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: protracted labor, what did Rav say? shall stand
llm_translation: It is difficult for me, what did Rav say? Teyku.

hebrew_text: קִידּוּשׁ מָה לִי אָמַר רַב? אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּאָמַר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב: אֵין הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: מַאי חָזֵית דְּסָמְכַתְּ אַהָא? סְמוֹךְ אַהָא! דְּאָמַר רַב אַדָּא אָמַר רַב: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי. ״אָמְרִי בֵּי רַב״ — מַנּוּ? רַב הוּנָא, וְרַב הוּנָא אָמַר: אֵין הֲלָכָה.
human_translation: proscription, what did Rav say? Rav Yosef said: Come hear, as Rav Huna said Rav said halakha is not in accordance with Rabbi Yosei. Abaye said to him: What did you see that you rely on that Rely on this as Rav Adda said Rav said halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yosei. the school of Rav said whom Rav Huna. And Rav Huna said halakha is not
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "What is the relevance of Kiddush," said Rav? Rav Yosef said: Come and hear, as Rav Huna said in the name of Rav: The halakha does not follow Rabbi Yosei. Abaye said to him: What did you see that you relied on Ahah? Rely on Ahah! As Rav Ada said in the name of Rav: The halakha follows Rabbi Yosei. "The students of Rav said" - who are they? Rav Huna, and Rav Huna said: The halakha does not follow."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: טוּמְטוּם וְכוּ׳. אָמַר רַבִּי אַמֵּי: מַאי עָבֵיד לֵיהּ רַבִּי יְהוּדָה לְטוּמְטוּם דְּבֵירֵי, דְּאוֹתְבוּהּ אַבֵּי כּוּרְסְיָה וְאִיקְּרַע, וְאוֹלֵיד שְׁבַע בְּנִין! וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אָמַר לָךְ: חַזֵּר עַל בָּנָיו מֵאַיִן הֵם.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: a tumtum , Rabbi Ami said: What Rabbi Yehuda do with the tumtum of Biri, who was placed in a seat and was torn and fathered seven children? Rabbi Yehuda said to you: inquire about his children from where they came.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: "Tumtum and so forth." Rabbi Ammi said: What does Rabbi Yehuda do with the tumtum of Beirei, who was embraced by Abba Kursya and became pregnant, giving birth to seven children! And Rabbi Yehuda said to you: Look at his children, where are they from.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: טוּמְטוּם לֹא יַחְלוֹץ, שֶׁמָּא יִקָּרַע וְנִמְצָא סְרִיס חַמָּה. אַטּוּ כֹּל דְּמִקְּרַע זָכָר הָוֵי? הָכִי קָאָמַר: שֶׁמָּא יִקָּרַע וְנִמְצָא נְקֵבָה, וַאֲפִילּוּ נִמְצָא זָכָר — שֶׁמָּא יִמָּצֵא סָרִיס חַמָּה.
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: A tumtum must not perform ḥalitza , perhaps he will be torn and found a eunuch by natural causes. Is that to say every a male? This is what he said: perhaps he will be torn and found a female, and even he is found a male, perhaps he will be found a eunuch by natural causes.
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: A eunuch should not be circumcised, lest he tear and be found to be a eunuch of the sun. Does everyone who tears become male? This is what he is saying: Lest he tear and be found to be female, and even if he is found to be male - lest he be found to be a eunuch of the sun.

hebrew_text: מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ? אָמַר רָבָא: לִפְסוֹל בִּמְקוֹם אַחִין וְלַחְלוֹץ שֶׁלֹּא בִּמְקוֹם אַחִין אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: What is between Rava said: There is between them disqualifies where there are brothers And perform ḥalitza where there are no brothers
llm_translation: What is the difference between them? Rava said: To disqualify in the place of brothers, and to permit in a place that is not the place of brothers - this is the difference between them.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא אֲחוּהּ דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה בַּר זַבְדִּי אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: אַנְדְּרוֹגִינוֹס חַיָּיבִין עָלָיו סְקִילָה, מִשְּׁתֵּי מְקוֹמוֹת. מֵיתִיבִי, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אָמַר: אַנְדְּרוֹגִינוֹס חַיָּיבִין עָלָיו סְקִילָה כַּזָּכָר. בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — בְּזַכְרוּת שֶׁלּוֹ, אֲבָל בְּנַקְבוּת שֶׁלּוֹ — פָּטוּר!
human_translation: Rav Shmuel bar Yehuda said Rabbi Abba, brother of Rabbi Yehuda bar Zavdi, said Rav Yehuda said Rav said: a hermaphrodite, one is liable to stoning on his account at two places, raises an objection Rabbi Eliezer said: a hermaphrodite, is liable to stoning on his account as if with a male. In what is this statement said? through his male but through his female exempt.
llm_translation: Rav Shmuel son of Yehuda said, Rabbi Abba the brother of Rabbi Yehuda son of Zavdi said, Rav Yehuda said in the name of Rav: Androginos is liable for stoning from two places. It was asked: Rabbi Eliezer said, Androginos is liable for stoning like a male. In what case are these words said? In his male aspect, but in his female aspect, he is exempt!

hebrew_text: הוּא דְּאָמַר כִּי הַאי תַּנָּא, דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי סִימַאי אוֹמֵר: אַנְדְּרוֹגִינוֹס חַיָּיבִין עָלָיו סְקִילָה מִשְּׁתֵּי מְקוֹמוֹת. מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי סִימַאי? אָמַר רָבָא: בַּר הַמְדּוּרֵי אַסְבְּרַהּ לִי: ״וְאֶת זָכָר לֹא תִשְׁכַּב מִשְׁכְּבֵי אִשָּׁה״, אֵי זֶהוּ זָכָר שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ שְׁנֵי מִשְׁכָּבוֹת — הֱוֵי אוֹמֵר זֶה אַנְדְּרוֹגִינוֹס.
human_translation: stated in accordance with this tanna , as it is taught Rabbi Simai says: a hermaphrodite, one is liable to stoning on his account at two places. What is the reasoning of Rabbi Simai? Rava said: bar Hamedurei explained to me, “And you shall not lie with a male as with a woman [ mishkevei isha ]” what male has two lying? You must say this a hermaphrodite,
llm_translation: He who said: for this Mishnah, as it was taught, Rabbi Simai says: Androginos is liable for stoning from two places. What is the reason for Rabbi Simai's opinion? Rava said: Bar Hamdurei explained it to me: "And with a male you shall not lie as with a woman," - which male has two beds - you would say this is Androginos.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן, אַף עַל גַּב דְּאִית בֵּיהּ שְׁנֵי מִשְׁכָּבוֹת — ״אֶת זָכָר״ כְּתִיב.
human_translation: And the Rabbis Although he has two lying, it is written: “With a male,”
llm_translation: The sages, even though it has two beds - "male" is written.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן, זָכָר גְּרֵידָא מְנָא לְהוּ? מֵ״אִשָּׁה״. בְּאִשָּׁה שֶׁלֹּא כְּדַרְכָּהּ מְנָא לְהוּ? מִ״וְּאִשָּׁה״.
human_translation: And the Rabbis, from where do they an ordinary male? from “a woman.” from where do a woman in an unnatural manner, from “and…with a woman.”
llm_translation: The sages, did Zakhur Greida count for them? From "isha." From a woman who is not in her usual manner did he count for them? From "u'isha."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שֵׁזְבִי אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: לֹא לַכֹּל אָמַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אַנְדְּרוֹגִינוֹס זָכָר מְעַלְּיָא הוּא, שֶׁאִם אַתָּה אוֹמֵר כֵּן, בְּמוּקְדָּשִׁין — יִקְדַּשׁ.
human_translation: Rav Shezvi said Rav Ḥisda said: Not in all Rabbi Eliezer say a hermaphrodite is a proper male. As, if you say so, with regard to consecrated should become sacred
llm_translation: Rav Shezbi said in the name of Rav Hisda: Not for everyone did Rabbi Eliezer say Androgynos is male above, for if you say so, in the sanctuaries - he shall be sanctified.

hebrew_text: וּמְנָלַן דְּלָא קָדֵשׁ — דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: הַנִּרְבָּע וְהַמּוּקְצֶה וְהַנֶּעֱבָד וְהָאֶתְנַן וּמְחִיר וְטוּמְטוּם וְאַנְדְּרוֹגִינוֹס — מְטַמְּאִין בְּגָדִים אַבֵּית הַבְּלִיעָה.
human_translation: And from where do we that it does not become sacred? As the Sages taught used for sexual relations and one set aside and one worshipped and one payment and one the price of a dog and a tumtum or a hermaphrodite, render garments ritually impure, with throat.
llm_translation: And from where do we derive that it does not sanctify? For the Rabbis taught: The Nerba, the Muktzeh, the Ne'evad, the Etnan, the Mechir, the Tumtum, and the Androgynos - they render garments susceptible to impurity in the house of swallowing.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: טוּמְטוּם וְאַנְדְּרוֹגִינוֹס אֵין מְטַמְּאִין בְּגָדִים אַבֵּית הַבְּלִיעָה. שֶׁהָיָה רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר זָכָר וּנְקֵבָה — אַתָּה מוֹצִיא טוּמְטוּם וְאַנְדְּרוֹגִינוֹס מִבֵּינֵיהֶם. וְעוֹף, הוֹאִיל וְלֹא נֶאֱמַר בּוֹ זָכָר וּנְקֵבָה — אִי אַתָּה מוֹצִיא טוּמְטוּם וְאַנְדְּרוֹגִינוֹס מִבֵּינֵיהֶם.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: a tumtum or a hermaphrodite, it does not render garments ritually impure with throat, As Rabbi Eliezer would say: Wherever it is stated “male” and “female,” you remove a tumtum and a hermaphrodite from among them, a bird- since male and female are not stated with regard to it, you not remove a tumtum and a hermaphrodite from among them,
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: Tumtum and Androgynous do not render garments susceptible to impurity in the house of a privy. For Rabbi Eliezer used to say: In any place where it is stated "male" and "female," you may bring forth Tumtum and Androgynous from among them. And with regard to birds, since it is not stated regarding them "male" and "female," you may not bring forth Tumtum and Androgynous from among them.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: אַף אֲנַן נָמֵי תְּנֵינָא, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר:
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: We too learned Rabbi Eliezer says:
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: We also learned in a Mishnah, Rabbi Eliezer says:

hebrew_text: הַכִּלְאַיִם וּטְרֵפָה וְיוֹצֵא דּוֹפֶן, טוּמְטוּם וְאַנְדְּרוֹגִינוֹס — לֹא קְדוֹשִׁין וְלֹא מַקְדִּישִׁין.
human_translation: Forbidden crossbred livestock, an animal with a condition that will cause it to die within twelve months tereifa delivered through the abdominal wall, a tumtum or a hermaphrodite do not become sacred and do not render sacred
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "The kilayim, treifah, and yotzei dofen, tumtum and androgynos - not sanctified and not sanctifying."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: לֹא קְדוֹשִׁין — בִּתְמוּרָה. וְלֹא מַקְדִּישִׁין — בְּעוֹשֶׂה תְּמוּרָה. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: And Shmuel said: They do not become sacred by way of substitution, And they do not render sacred when it is made a substitute Learn from this
llm_translation: And Samuel said: Not consecrated - with exchange. And not consecrating - with making an exchange. Hear from it.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: חַיָּיבִין עָלָיו סְקִילָה כַּזָּכָר. תַּנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי: כְּשֶׁהָלַכְתִּי לִלְמוֹד תּוֹרָה אֵצֶל רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן שַׁמּוּעַ, חָבְרוּ עָלַי תַּלְמִידָיו כְּתַרְנְגוֹלִים שֶׁל בֵּית בּוּקְיָא, וְלֹא הִנִּיחוּנִי לִלְמוֹד אֶלָּא דָּבָר אֶחָד בְּמִשְׁנָתֵינוּ — רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: אַנְדְּרוֹגִינוֹס חַיָּיבִין עָלָיו סְקִילָה כַּזָּכָר.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: a hermaphrodite, is liable to stoning on his account as if a male. It is taught Rabbi says: When I went to learn Torah from Rabbi Elazar ben Shamua, his students joined against me like the roosters of Beit Bukya, and they did not let me learn only one thing in our mishna, Rabbi Eliezer says: a hermaphrodite, is liable to stoning on his account as if a male.
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: obligated upon him stoning like a male. It was taught: Rabbi said: when I went to study Torah by Rabbi Elazar ben Shamua, his students surrounded me like the roosters of the house of Bukya, and they did not let me study except one thing in our Mishnah - Rabbi Eliezer says: Androginos is obligated upon him stoning like a male.

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ הֶעָרֵל
llm_translation: We will return to you, O uncircumcised one.

hebrew_text: יֵשׁ מוּתָּרוֹת לְבַעְלֵיהֶן וַאֲסוּרוֹת לְיִבְמֵיהֶן, מוּתָּרוֹת לְיִבְמֵיהֶן וַאֲסוּרוֹת לְבַעְלֵיהֶן. מוּתָּרוֹת לָאֵלּוּ וְלָאֵלּוּ, וַאֲסוּרוֹת לָאֵלּוּ וְלָאֵלּוּ.
human_translation: There are who are permitted to their husbands and forbidden to their yevamin , are permitted to their yevamin and forbidden to their husbands. are permitted to these and to those, and are forbidden to these and to those.
llm_translation: There are permissions for their husbands and prohibitions for their brothers-in-law, permissions for their brothers-in-law and prohibitions for their husbands. Permissions for these and for those, and prohibitions for these and for those.

hebrew_text: וְאֵלּוּ מוּתָּרוֹת לְבַעְלֵיהֶן וַאֲסוּרוֹת לְיִבְמֵיהֶן: כֹּהֵן הֶדְיוֹט שֶׁנָּשָׂא אֶת הָאַלְמָנָה, וְיֵשׁ לוֹ אָח כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל; חָלָל שֶׁנָּשָׂא כְּשֵׁרָה, וְיֵשׁ לוֹ אָח כָּשֵׁר;
human_translation: And these are permitted to their husbands and forbidden to their yevamin : a common priest who married a widow, and he has a brother is High Priest, a priest disqualified due to flawed lineage ḥalal who married fit and he has a brother is fit
llm_translation: And these are permitted to their husbands and forbidden to their levirate husbands: A commoner priest who married a widow, and he has a brother who is a high priest; a disqualified priest who married a valid woman, and he has a brother who is valid.

hebrew_text: יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁנָּשָׂא בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל, וְיֵשׁ לוֹ אָח מַמְזֵר; מַמְזֵר שֶׁנָּשָׂא מַמְזֶרֶת, וְיֵשׁ לוֹ אָח יִשְׂרָאֵל — מוּתָּרוֹת לְבַעְלֵיהֶן וַאֲסוּרוֹת לְיִבְמֵיהֶן.
human_translation: an Israelite who married an Israelite woman and he has a brother a son born from an incestuous or adulterous relationship [ mamzer ]; a mamzer who married a daughter born from an incestuous or adulterous relationship [ mamzeret ], and he has a brother is an Israelite are permitted to their husbands and forbidden to their yevamin .
llm_translation: Israel who married a daughter of Israel, and he has a brother who is a mamzer; a mamzer who married a mamzeret, and he has a brother who is an Israelite — permitted to their husbands and forbidden to their yavamim.

hebrew_text: וְאֵלּוּ מוּתָּרוֹת לְיִבְמֵיהֶן וַאֲסוּרוֹת לְבַעְלֵיהֶן: כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל שֶׁקִּידֵּשׁ אֶת הָאַלְמָנָה, וְיֵשׁ לוֹ אָח כֹּהֵן הֶדְיוֹט; כָּשֵׁר שֶׁנָּשָׂא חֲלָלָה, וְיֵשׁ לוֹ אָח חָלָל; יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁנָּשָׂא מַמְזֶרֶת, וְיֵשׁ לוֹ אָח מַמְזֵר; מַמְזֵר שֶׁנָּשָׂא בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל, וְיֵשׁ לוֹ אָח יִשְׂרָאֵל — מוּתָּרוֹת לְיִבְמֵיהֶן וַאֲסוּרוֹת לְבַעְלֵיהֶן.
human_translation: And these are permitted to their yevamin and forbidden to their husbands: a High Priest who betrothed a widow, and he has a brother is a common priest, fit who married a ḥalala and he has a brother is a ḥalal ; an Israelite who married a mamzeret , and he has a brother is a mamzer ; a mamzer who married an Israelite woman and he has a brother is, an Israelite are permitted to their yevamin and forbidden to their husbands.
llm_translation: And these are permitted for their levirs and forbidden for their husbands: A High Priest who sanctified a widow, and he has a brother who is an ordinary priest; A valid priest who married a halalah, and he has a brother who is a halal; An Israelite who married a mamzeret, and he has a brother who is a mamzer; A mamzer who married a daughter of Israel, and he has a brother who is an Israelite — permitted for their levirs and forbidden for their husbands.

hebrew_text: וְאֵלּוּ אֲסוּרוֹת לָאֵלּוּ וְלָאֵלּוּ: כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל שֶׁנָּשָׂא אֶת הָאַלְמָנָה, וְיֵשׁ לוֹ אָח כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל; אוֹ כֹּהֵן הֶדְיוֹט כָּשֵׁר שֶׁנָּשָׂא חֲלָלָה, וְיֵשׁ לוֹ אָח כָּשֵׁר; יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁנָּשָׂא מַמְזֶרֶת, וְיֵשׁ לוֹ אָח יִשְׂרָאֵל; מַמְזֵר שֶׁנָּשָׂא בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל, וְיֵשׁ לוֹ אָח מַמְזֵר — אֲסוּרוֹת לָאֵלּוּ וְלָאֵלּוּ, וּשְׁאָר כׇּל הַנָּשִׁים מוּתָּרוֹת לְבַעְלֵיהֶן וּלְיִבְמֵיהֶן.
human_translation: And these are forbidden to these and to those: A High Priest who married a widow, and he has a brother is a High Priest or a common priest; fit who married a ḥalala , and he has a brother is fit an Israelite who married a mamzeret , and he has a brother is Israelite, a mamzer who married an Israelite woman and he has a brother is a mamzer . are forbidden to these and to those. And all other women are permitted to their husbands and to their yevamin .
llm_translation: And these are forbidden to these and to these: A High Priest who married a widow, and has a brother who is a High Priest; or a common priest who married a divorcee, and has a brother who is a common priest; an Israelite who married a mamzeret, and has a brother who is an Israelite; a mamzer who married a daughter of an Israelite, and has a brother who is a mamzer — these are forbidden to each other, but all other women are permitted to their husbands and to their levirate husbands.

hebrew_text: שְׁנִיּוֹת מִדִּבְרֵי סוֹפְרִים, שְׁנִיָּיה לַבַּעַל וְלֹא שְׁנִיָּיה לַיָּבָם — אֲסוּרָה לַבַּעַל, וּמוּתֶּרֶת לַיָּבָם. שְׁנִיָּיה לַיָּבָם וְלֹא שְׁנִיָּיה לַבַּעַל — אֲסוּרָה לַיָּבָם וּמוּתֶּרֶת לַבַּעַל, שְׁנִיָּיה לָזֶה וְלָזֶה — אֲסוּרָה לָזֶה וְלָזֶה.
human_translation: secondary relatives, by rabbinic law, a secondary relative to the husband but not a secondary relative to the yavam , is forbidden to the husband and permitted to the yavam . a secondary relative to the yavam but not a secondary relative to the husband, is forbidden to the yavam and permitted to the husband. a secondary relative to this and to that is forbidden to this and to that
llm_translation: Disputes of the scribes, if she is married to the husband and not married to the brother - forbidden to the husband, and permitted to the brother. If she is married to the brother and not married to the husband - forbidden to the brother and permitted to the husband. If she is married to both - forbidden to both.

hebrew_text: אֵין לָהּ לֹא כְּתוּבָה וְלֹא פֵּירוֹת וְלֹא מְזוֹנוֹת וְלֹא בְּלָאוֹת. וְהַוָּלָד כָּשֵׁר, וְכוֹפִין אוֹתוֹ לְהוֹצִיא.
human_translation: she does not have marriage contract nor produce nor sustenance nor worn clothes And the offspring is unflawed, and forces him to divorce
llm_translation: She has no writing, no fruits, no sustenance, and no liabilities. And the offspring is valid, and they force her to divorce.

hebrew_text: אַלְמָנָה לְכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל, גְּרוּשָׁה וַחֲלוּצָה לְכֹהֵן הֶדְיוֹט, מַמְזֶרֶת וּנְתִינָה לְיִשְׂרָאֵל, בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל לְנָתִין וּלְמַמְזֵר — יֵשׁ לָהֶן כְּתוּבָּה.
human_translation: a widow to a High Priest, a divorcée or a yevama who performed ḥalitza [ ḥalutza ] to a common priest, a mamzeret or a Gibeonite woman to an Israelite an Israelite woman to a Gibeonite or to a mamzer have marriage contract,
llm_translation: Widow to High Priest, divorced and halutzah to ordinary priest, mamzeret and netinah to Israelite, daughter of Israel to netin and mamzer - they have a document.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי אִירְיָא דְּתָנֵי ״נָשָׂא״? לִיתְנֵי ״קִידֵּשׁ״!
human_translation: Why does specifically teach married Let him teach betrothed
llm_translation: Gemara: What is the meaning of the teaching "nasa"? It should have taught "kidash"!

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא: טַעְמָא דְּנָשָׂא — דְּהָוֵה לֵיהּ עֲשֵׂה וְלֹא תַעֲשֶׂה, אֲבָל קִידֵּשׁ — אָתֵי עֲשֵׂה וְדוֹחֶה לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה, וְהָא כּוּלֵּהּ פִּירְקִין עֲשֵׂה וְלֹא תַעֲשֶׂה הוּא, וְלָא אָתֵי עֲשֵׂה וְדָחֵי לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה!
human_translation: And if you would say: reason were married there is a positive mitzva and a prohibition However, he betrothed positive mitzva comes and overrides prohibition But the entire chapter positive mitzva and prohibitions, positive mitzva does not come and override the prohibition,
llm_translation: And if you will say: The reason for the case of "Nasa" - because it involves a positive commandment and a negative commandment, but in the case of "Kidesh" - a positive commandment comes and overrides a negative commandment, and this is all a case of a positive commandment and a negative commandment, and a positive commandment does not come and override a negative commandment!

hebrew_text: מִשּׁוּם דְּקָבָעֵי לְמִיתְנֵי סֵיפָא ״כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל שֶׁנָּשָׂא אֶת הָאַלְמָנָה״, דַּוְקָא נָשָׂא — דְּשַׁוְּיַיהּ חֲלָלָהּ, אֲבָל קִידֵּשׁ — שַׁרְיָא לֵיהּ, תַּנָּא נָמֵי רֵישָׁא ״נָשָׂא״!
human_translation: due to that wants to teach the latter clause a High Priest who married a widow specifically married because he rendered her a ḥalala . However, betrothed she is permitted also taught first clause married
llm_translation: Due to the fact that they established to teach the latter part, "a High Priest who marries a widow," specifically if he marries - it is forbidden to him, but if he sanctifies - it is permitted to him. A tanna also taught in the beginning, "he marries"!

hebrew_text: וְאַדְּתָנֵי מִשּׁוּם סֵיפָא, לִיתְנֵי מִשּׁוּם מְצִיעֲתָא: כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל שֶׁקִּידֵּשׁ אֶת הָאַלְמָנָה וְיֵשׁ לוֹ אָח כֹּהֵן הֶדְיוֹט! אֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם בַּת בּוּקְתָּא, דְּקָבָעֵי לְמִיתְנֵי ״חָלָל שֶׁנָּשָׂא כְּשֵׁרָה״, טַעְמָא דְּנָשָׂא — דְּשַׁוְּיַיהּ חֲלָלָה, אֲבָל קִידֵּשׁ — שַׁרְיָא לֵיהּ, מִשּׁוּם הָכִי קָתָנֵי ״נָשָׂא״.
human_translation: But rather than teaching due to the latter clause let him teach due to the middle clause, a High Priest who betrothed a widow, and he has a brother a common priest. Rather, due to neighbor [ bat bukta ], that he wants to teach a ḥalal who married fit reason married as he rendered her a ḥalala However, betrothed her, she is permitted to him. Due to that teaches married
llm_translation: And it was taught in the name of the conclusion, let it be taught in the name of the supporting argument: A High Priest who betroths a widow and has a brother who is a common priest! Rather, it is because of the daughter of Bukta, who established the teaching of "a disqualified offering that was accepted as valid," the reason it is accepted as valid - because it was mistakenly disqualified, but if he betrothed her - it is permitted to him, as it is taught: "he betrothed."

hebrew_text: וּמַאי אִירְיָא דְּקָתָנֵי אַלְמָנָה? לִיתְנֵי בְּתוּלָה!
human_translation: And why does specifically teach a widow? Let him teach a virgin.
llm_translation: And what is the meaning of the teaching that mentions a widow? To teach about a virgin!

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא: קָסָבַר הַאי תַּנָּא נִישּׂוּאִין הָרִאשׁוֹנִים מַפִּילִין — הֲרֵי חָלָל שֶׁנָּשָׂא כְּשֵׁרָה, וְלָא אָמְרִינַן נִישּׂוּאִין הָרִאשׁוֹנִים מַפִּילִין!
human_translation: And if you would say this tanna holds the first marriage she happens a ḥalal who married fit And we do not say the first marriage she happens
llm_translation: And if you will say: Does this Tanna hold that the first marriages are valid - behold, a hollow vessel that carried is valid, and we do not say that the first marriages are invalid!

hebrew_text: הָא וַדַּאי מִשּׁוּם סֵיפָא, מִשּׁוּם דְּקָבָעֵי לְמִיתְנָא סֵיפָא: כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל שֶׁנָּשָׂא אֶת הָאַלְמָנָה, וְיֵשׁ לוֹ אָח כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל אוֹ כֹּהֵן הֶדְיוֹט. דַּוְקָא אַלְמָנָה — אֲבָל בְּתוּלָה חַזְיָא לֵיהּ, מִשּׁוּם הָכִי קָתָנֵי אַלְמָנָה.
human_translation: That certainly due to the latter clause due to that wants to teach the latter clause: A High Priest who married a widow, and he has a brother High Priest or a common priest. specifically a widow, However, a virgin she fit for due to that teaches a widow
llm_translation: This and certainly because of the conclusion, because he established to teach the conclusion: A High Priest who marries a widow, and he has a brother who is a High Priest or an ordinary priest. Specifically a widow - but with a virgin, he should see to it, therefore it teaches "widow."

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב פָּפָּא: אִם אִיתָא לְהָא דְּכִי אֲתָא רַב דִּימִי, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מִצְרִי שֵׁנִי שֶׁנָּשָׂא מִצְרִית רִאשׁוֹנָה — בְּנָהּ שֵׁנִי הָוֵי, לִתְנֵי נָמֵי:
human_translation: Rav Pappa objects to If it is so, as when Rav Dimi came Rabbi Yoḥanan said a second-generation Egyptian who married a first-generation Egyptian woman, her son is considered a let also teach
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates to: Rav Papa objects to him: If it is for this reason that Rav Dimi came, Rabbi Yochanan said: An Egyptian who married an Egyptian woman first - his son is considered a second generation Egyptian. Let him also teach this.

hebrew_text: מִצְרִי שֵׁנִי שֶׁנָּשָׂא שְׁתֵּי מִצְרִיּוֹת, אַחַת רִאשׁוֹנָה וְאַחַת שְׁנִיָּיה, וְהָיוּ לוֹ בָּנִים מֵרִאשׁוֹנָה וּשְׁנִיָּיה. אִי נְסוּב כִּי אוֹרְחַיְיהוּ — מוּתָּרוֹת לְבַעְלֵיהֶן וַאֲסוּרוֹת לְיִבְמֵיהֶן.
human_translation: a second-generation Egyptian who married two Egyptian women, one a first-generation and one second and he had sons the first and second if married in their way, they are permitted to their husbands and forbidden to their yevamin .
llm_translation: Egyptian, a second, who married two Egyptians, one first and one second, and had children from the first and the second. If they died, since they followed their ways - they are permitted to their husbands and forbidden to their brothers-in-law.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אֵיפוּךְ וּנְסוּב — מוּתָּרוֹת לְיִבְמֵיהֶן וַאֲסוּרוֹת לְבַעְלֵיהֶן. מוּתָּרוֹת לָאֵלּוּ וְלָאֵלּוּ — גִּיּוֹרוֹת. אֲסוּרוֹת לָאֵלּוּ וְלָאֵלּוּ — אַיְלוֹנִיּוֹת!
human_translation: And if they married reverse they are permitted to their yevamin and forbidden to their husbands. they are permitted to these and to those converts, they are forbidden to these and to those, sexually underdeveloped women [ ayloniot ].
llm_translation: And if they are the opposite and switched - permitted for their yavam and forbidden for their husbands. Permitted for these and for those - converts. Forbidden for these and for those - illegitimate!

hebrew_text: תְּנָא וְשַׁיַּיר. מַאי שַׁיַּיר דְּהַאי שַׁיַּיר? שַׁיַּיר פְּצוּעַ דַּכָּא.
human_translation: he taught and omitted What did he omit that he omitted this? He omitted man with crushed testicles
llm_translation: Mishna: "Veshayir." What is "shayir" that this is "shayir"? "Shayir" is a wounded animal of the field.

hebrew_text: אִי מִשּׁוּם פְּצוּעַ דַּכָּא — לָאו שִׁיּוּרָא, דְּהָא תְּנָא לֵיהּ חַיָּיבֵי לָאוִין!
human_translation: If due to of a man with crushed testicles is not an omission, as taught liable for a prohibition.
llm_translation: If due to a wound, it is crushed - it is not considered a leftover, for the Tanna taught them: the living are not considered leftovers!

hebrew_text: אַטּוּ חַיָּיבֵי לָאוִין מִי לָא קָתָנֵי וַהֲדַר תָּנֵי? וְהָא קָתָנֵי כֹּהֵן הֶדְיוֹט שֶׁנָּשָׂא אַלְמָנָה, וְחָלָל שֶׁנָּשָׂא כְּשֵׁרָה!
human_translation: Is that to say liable for a prohibition, he does not teach and again teach He teaches a common priest who married a widow and a ḥalal who married fit
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "Atu chayavei la'avin mi la katanei vahadar tanei? Veha katanei kohen hediot shenasa almanah, vehachalal shenasa keshara!" English translation: "Do the liable parties of a negative commandment come from where it is taught, and then it teaches again? And it teaches: A commoner priest who marries a widow, and a desecrated priest who marries a fit woman!"

hebrew_text: הָהוּא, אִיצְטְרִיכָא לֵיהּ לְאַשְׁמוֹעִינַן כִּדְרַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב. דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: לֹא הוּזְהֲרוּ כְּשֵׁרוֹת לְהִנָּשֵׂא לִפְסוּלִין.
human_translation: That it was necessary for to teach us that Rav Yehuda said Rav as Rav Yehuda said Rav said: not prohibited fit marry men disqualified
llm_translation: That one, it is necessary for him to hear like Rav Yehudah said Rav. For Rav Yehudah said Rav: They were not careful to marry permissible women to disqualified men.

hebrew_text: וְהָא קָתָנֵי: חָלָל שֶׁנָּשָׂא כְּשֵׁרָה, וְיִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁנָּשָׂא בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל וְיֵשׁ לוֹ אָח מַמְזֵר! הָא נָמֵי, לָא מִהְדָּר מִיתְנָא הִיא, דְּאִשְׁמוּעִינַן לָאו שֶׁאֵין שָׁוֶה בַּכֹּל, וְקָמַשְׁמַע לַן לָאו הַשָּׁוֶה בַּכֹּל.
human_translation: But teaches A ḥalal who married fit and an Israelite who married an Israelite woman and he has a brother a mamzer . This too is not going back and teaching as he teaches us a prohibition that is not equally applicable to all, a prohibition that is equally applicable to all,
llm_translation: The Gemara asks: But isn't it taught in a Baraita: If a non-priest marries a woman who is fit for a priestly marriage, and an Israelite marries a daughter of an Israelite woman and he has a brother who is a mamzer! The Gemara answers: That is not a valid teaching, for we hear that it is not the case that there is nothing that is equal in all cases, and it is heard for us that it is not the case that there is something that is equal in all cases.

hebrew_text: הָא קָתָנֵי: יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁנָּשָׂא מַמְזֶרֶת וְיֵשׁ לוֹ אָח יִשְׂרָאֵל (וּמַמְזֵר שֶׁנָּשָׂא מַמְזֶרֶת וְיֵשׁ לוֹ אָח יִשְׂרָאֵל), אֶלָּא לָאו, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ תְּנָא וְשַׁיַּיר. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: But teaches an Israelite who married a mamzeret and who has a brother is an Israelite and a mamzer who married a mamzeret and he has a brother is an Israelite Rather, isn’t it conclude from it he taught and omitted Indeed, conclude from it
llm_translation: The Gemara teaches: If an Israelite marries a mamzeret, and he has a brother who is an Israelite (and likewise, if a mamzer marries a mamzeret, and he has a brother who is an Israelite), rather, no, learn from it and leave it. Learn from it.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא. אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: לֹא הוּזְהֲרוּ כְּשֵׁרוֹת לְהִנָּשֵׂא לִפְסוּלִין. לֵימָא מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ: חָלָל שֶׁנָּשָׂא כְּשֵׁרָה, מַאי לָאו כֹּהֶנֶת [הָרְאוּיָה לוֹ], וּמַאי ״כְּשֵׁרָה״ — כְּשֵׁרָה לִכְהוּנָּה?
human_translation: the itself: Rav Yehuda said Rav said: not prohibited fit marry disqualified Let us say that supports his A ḥalal who married fit, What, is it not a priestess, who is appropriate to him? And what is Fit? she is fit for the priesthood,
llm_translation: Body. Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: One should not be cautious to marry kosher women to disqualified men. Let him say, a widow who married a Kohen, what is it if not a fitting Kohenet for him, and what is "kosher" - kosher for priesthood?

hebrew_text: לָא, יִשְׂרְאֵלִית. וּמַאי ״כְּשֵׁרָה״ — כְּשֵׁרָה לַקָּהָל.
human_translation: No, an Israelite woman. And what is Fit? she is fit to the congregation
llm_translation: Not, Israelite. And what is "kosher" - kosher for the community.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי: ״יֵשׁ לוֹ אָח כָּשֵׁר״, נָמֵי כָּשֵׁר לַקָּהָל, מִכְּלָל דְּהוּא פָּסוּל לַקָּהָל! אֶלָּא לָאו — כֹּהֵן, וּמִדְּהוּא כֹּהֵן, הִיא כֹּהֶנֶת! מִידֵּי אִירְיָא — הָא כִּדְאִיתָא וְהָא כִּדְאִיתָא.
human_translation: If so, he has a brother is fit. too is fit to the congregation. by inference that he, unfit to the congregation? Rather, is it not priest, and from the fact that he be a priest, she a priestess? Are the cases comparable? This as it is, And that as it is,
llm_translation: So it is: "He has a legitimate brother," also legitimate for the congregation, from the principle that he is disqualified for the congregation! Rather, is it not so — a priest, and from the fact that he is a priest, she is a priestess! From the house of Irya — this one as it was stated, and that one as it was stated.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רָבִין בַּר נַחְמָן: ״לֹא יִקָּחוּ ... לֹא יִקָּחוּ״, מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהָאִשָּׁה מוּזְהֶרֶת עַל יְדֵי הָאִישׁ!
human_translation: Ravin bar Naḥman raised an objection “They may not take “They may not take teaches that the woman is prohibited by means of the man.
llm_translation: Rabin bar Nachman raises an objection: "They shall not take... they shall not take," teaches that a woman is acquired through a man!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: כֹּל הֵיכָא דְּהוּא מוּזְהָר — הִיא מוּזְהֶרֶת, וְכׇל הֵיכָא דְּהוּא לֹא מוּזְהָר — הִיא לֹא מוּזְהֶרֶת.
human_translation: Rava said: anywhere that a prohibition him, prohibition her, And anywhere that a prohibition does not him, the prohibition does not her
llm_translation: Rava said: "Wherever he is warned - she is warned, and wherever he is not warned - she is not warned."

hebrew_text: וְהָא מֵהָכָא נָפְקָא? מִדְּרַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב נָפְקָא! דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב, וְכֵן תָּנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: ״אִישׁ אוֹ אִשָּׁה כִּי יַעֲשׂוּ מִכׇּל חַטֹּאת הָאָדָם״ — הִשְׁוָה הַכָּתוּב אִשָּׁה לְאִישׁ לְכׇל עוֹנָשִׁין שֶׁבַּתּוֹרָה!
human_translation: And is this derived from here? It is derived from Rav Yehuda Rav said, as Rav Yehuda said Rav said, and the school of Rabbi Yishmael similarly taught: “When a man or woman commit any sin people The verse equates a woman to a man with regard to all punishments of the Torah.
llm_translation: The Gemara asks: And from where do we derive this? From Rav Yehudah who said in the name of Rav, and similarly it was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael: "When a man or a woman commits any sin against mankind" - the verse equates a woman to a man in all punishments in the Torah!

hebrew_text: אִי מֵהַהִיא, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: לָאו הַשָּׁוֶה בַּכֹּל. אֲבָל לָאו שֶׁאֵינוֹ שָׁוֶה בַּכֹּל, לָא.
human_translation: If from that I would say a prohibition that is equally to all, but a prohibition that is not equally to all, not
llm_translation: If from there, I would say: not equal in all. But if not equal in all, no.

hebrew_text: וַהֲרֵי טוּמְאָה, דְּלָאו שֶׁאֵין שָׁוֶה בַּכֹּל, וְטַעְמָא דִּכְתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״בְּנֵי אַהֲרֹן״ וְלֹא בְּנוֹת אַהֲרֹן, הָא לָאו הָכִי, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא נָשִׁים חַיָּיבוֹת, מַאי טַעְמָא? לָאו מִשּׁוּם דְּרַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב?
human_translation: But ritual impurity which is a prohibition that is not equally to all, and the reason that the Merciful One writes: the sons of Aaron, The sons of Aaron and not the daughters of Aaron. Therefore, not this I would say women are obligated What is the reason not due to Rav Yehuda said Rav
llm_translation: Behold, impurity, that it is not equal in all, and the reason that the Merciful One wrote "sons of Aharon" and not "daughters of Aharon," isn't it so that I would have said that women are obligated, what is the reason? Not because Rav Yehuda said in the name of Rav.

hebrew_text: לָא, דְּגָמְרִינַן מִ״לֹּא יִקָּחוּ״.
human_translation: No, we learn from “they may not take.”
llm_translation: Not, that we learned from "lo yikchu."

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: קִיחָה אִיצְטְרִיכָא לֵיהּ, סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: לִיגְמַר מִטּוּמְאָה — קָמַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: There are who say taking, was necessary for him it might enter your mind to say: We should learn from impurity ritual impurity, teaches us,
llm_translation: There are those who say: A spoon is needed for it, as your mind said: to finish from impurity - it is heard to us.

hebrew_text: רַב פָּפָּא וְרַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אִיקְּלַעוּ לְהִינְצְבוּ, לְאַתְרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִידִי בַּר אָבִין. בְּעוֹ מִינַּיְיהוּ: הוּזְהֲרוּ כְּשֵׁרוֹת לְהִנָּשֵׂא לִפְסוּלִין, אוֹ לָא?
human_translation: Rav Pappa and Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, arrived at Hintzevu, to the place Rav Idi bar Avin. asked them: prohibited fit marry disqualified or not?
llm_translation: Rav Papa and Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, came to stand at the place of Rav Idi bar Avin. They asked him: "Should one be cautious with kosher items to be used for invalid purposes, or not?"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהוּ רַב פָּפָּא, תְּנֵיתוּהָ: עֲשָׂרָה יוּחֲסִין עָלוּ מִבָּבֶל: כֹּהֲנִים, לְוִיִּם, וְיִשְׂרְאֵלִים, חֲלָלִים, גֵּרִים, וַחֲרוּרִים, וּמַמְזֵרִים, נְתִינִים, שְׁתוּקֵי, וַאֲסוּפֵי. כֹּהֲנִים לְוִיִּם יִשְׂרְאֵלִים — מוּתָּרִין לָבֹא זֶה בָּזֶה. לְוִיִּם, יִשְׂרְאֵלִים, חֲלָלִים, גֵּרִים, חֲרוּרִים — מוּתָּרִין לָבֹא זֶה בָּזֶה. גֵּירֵי, חֲרוֹרֵי, וּמַמְזֵרֵי, נְתִינֵי, שְׁתוּקֵי, וַאֲסוּפֵי — מוּתָּרִים לָבֹא זֶה בָּזֶה. וְאִילּוּ כֹּהֶנֶת לְחָלָל — לָא קָתָנֵי.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said to them: You learned it ten lineages ascended from Babylonia: Priests, Levites, and Israelites, ḥalalim , converts, and freed and mamzerim , Gibeonites, children of unknown paternity [ shetukim ], and foundlings. Priests, Levites, Israelites, are permitted to marry one another’s Levites, Israelites, ḥalalim , converts, freed are permitted to marry one another’s converts, freed and mamzerim , Gibeonites, shetukim , and foundlings are permitted to marry one another’s whereas does not teach priestesses, to a ḥalal .
llm_translation: He said to them, Rav Papa, you have taught: Ten lineages ascended from Babylon: Kohanim, Leviim, and Yisraelim, Challalim, converts, freed slaves, mamzerim, Netinim, shetukim, and asufim. Kohanim, Leviim, and Yisraelim - they are permitted to intermarry with one another. Leviim, Yisraelim, Challalim, converts, freed slaves - they are permitted to intermarry with one another. Converts, freed slaves, mamzerim, Netinim, shetukim, and asufim - they are permitted to intermarry with one another. But if a female Kohenet marries a Challal - it is not taught.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: כֹּל הֵיכָא דְּהָנֵי נָסְבִי מֵהָנֵי וְהָנֵי נָסְבִי מֵהָנֵי — קָתָנֵי. כֹּהֵן, כֵּיוָן דְּאִילּוּ בָּעֵי לְמִינְסַב חֲלָלָה אֲסִירָא לֵיהּ — לָא קָתָנֵי. אֲתוֹ לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב אִידִי בַּר אָבִין. אֲמַר לְהוּ: דַּרְדְּקֵי, הָכִי אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: לֹא הוּזְהֲרוּ כְּשֵׁרוֹת לִינָּשֵׂא לִפְסוּלִים.
human_translation: Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said to him: he teaches anywhere that these may marry those and these may marry those a priest, since if he wants to marry a ḥalala this is prohibited does not teach They came before Rav Idi bar Avin He said to them: Children, this Rav Yehuda said Rav said: fit are not warned against marrying disqualified
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Huna son of Rav Yehoshua: Anywhere that these are intermingled with those, and those are intermingled with these - it is taught. A kohen, as long as he is willing to marry a halalah, it is prohibited for him - it is not taught. They came before Rav Idi bar Avin. He said to them: You are reckless, thus said Rav Yehudah in the name of Rav: They were not careful to marry kosher women to disqualified men.

hebrew_text: שְׁנִיּוֹת מִדִּבְרֵי סוֹפְרִים וְכוּ׳. בְּעוֹ מִינֵּיהּ בְּנֵי בֵירֵי מֵרַב שֵׁשֶׁת: שְׁנִיָּה לַבַּעַל וְלֹא שְׁנִיָּה לַיָּבָם, יֵשׁ לָהּ כְּתוּבָּה מִיָּבָם אוֹ לָא? כֵּיוָן דְּאָמַר מָר: כְּתוּבָּתָהּ עַל נִכְסֵי בַּעְלָהּ הָרִאשׁוֹן — לֵית לַהּ,
human_translation: secondary relatives, by rabbinic law, The residents of Biri inquired of Rav Sheshet: a secondary relative of the husband but not a secondary relative of the yavam a marriage contract from the yavam or not? since the Master said her marriage contract is from the property of her first husband, she does not have
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Sh'niyot mi'divrei sofrim ve'chul. Be'o minei beinei beirei meiRav Sheshet: sh'niyah la'baal ve'lo sh'niyah la'yavam, yesh lah ketuvah mi'yavam o lo? Keivan d'amr mar: ketuvatah al nichsei baalah harishon - leit la." English translation: "Second marriages from the words of the Sages, etc. They asked in the study hall of the disciples of Rav Sheshet: If a woman has a marriage document from her first husband but not from her brother-in-law, does she have a legal claim from the brother-in-law or not? Since the Master said: If her marriage document is on the property of her first husband - she does not have a claim."

hebrew_text: אוֹ דִלְמָא: כֵּיוָן דְּאִילּוּ לֵית לַהּ מֵרִאשׁוֹן, תַּקִּינוּ לַהּ רַבָּנַן מִשֵּׁנִי — אִית לַהּ?
human_translation: Or perhaps, since that if she does not have from first the Sages instituted for her from second she has
llm_translation: Or perhaps: since if it does not have from the beginning, the Rabbis established for it from the second - does it have?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהוּ רַב שֵׁשֶׁת, תְּנֵיתוּהָ: כְּתוּבָּתָהּ עַל נִכְסֵי בַּעְלָהּ הָרִאשׁוֹן. וְאִם הָיְתָה שְׁנִיָּה לַבַּעַל — אֲפִילּוּ מִיָּבָם אֵין לָהּ.
human_translation: Rav Sheshet said to them: You learned it her marriage contract is from the property of her first husband, and if she was a secondary relative of the husband, she does not have even from the yavam .
llm_translation: He said to them, Rav Sheshet, "Her marriage contract: its writing is on the property of her first husband. And if she was married to a second husband - even from yibum she does not have rights."

hebrew_text: מִכְּלָל דְּאִיכָּא דְּאִית לַהּ מִיָּבָם? חַסּוֹרֵי מִיחַסְּרָא, וְהָכִי קָתָנֵי: כְּתוּבָּתָהּ עַל נִכְסֵי בַּעְלָהּ הָרִאשׁוֹן, וְאִי לֵית לַהּ מֵרִאשׁוֹן — תַּקִּינוּ לַהּ מִשֵּׁנִי. וְאִם הָיְתָה שְׁנִיָּה לַבַּעַל — אֲפִילּוּ מִיָּבָם אֵין לָהּ.
human_translation: by inference that there is who have from the yavam ? is incomplete and this is it is teaching: her marriage contract is from the property of her first husband, and if she does not have from the first husband they instituted for her from the second And if she was a secondary relative of the husband, she does not have even from the yavam .
llm_translation: From the principle that there is one who has a yavam? lacking from the yichasra, and thus it was taught: Her document is written on the property of her first husband, and if she does not have from the first husband — they establish for her from the second. And if she was married to the second husband — even from the yavam she does not have.

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר מֵרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אַלְמָנָה לְכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל, גְּרוּשָׁה וַחֲלוּצָה לְכֹהֵן הֶדְיוֹט, יֵשׁ לָהֶן מְזוֹנוֹת אוֹ אֵין לָהֶן מְזוֹנוֹת? הֵיכִי דָמֵי: אִילֵּימָא דְּיָתְבָה תּוּתֵיהּ, בַּ״עֲמוֹד וְהוֹצֵא״ קָאֵי, מְזוֹנוֹת אִית לַהּ? לָא צְרִיכָא, שֶׁהָלַךְ הוּא לִמְדִינַת הַיָּם, וְלָוְתָה וְאָכְלָה. מַאי?
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar inquired of Rabbi Yoḥanan: a widow to a High Priest a divorcée or a ḥalutza to a common priest have sustenance or do they not have sustenance? What are the circumstances If we say that is dwelling under his stands in arise and divorce she have sustenance? No, necessary where he went overseas and she borrowed and ate. What is
llm_translation: Requested from him Rabbi Elazar from Rabbi Yochanan: A widow to a High Priest, a divorcee and a halutzah to a common priest, do they have sustenance or do they not have sustenance? How so? If she was sitting with her dowry, in the "pillar and removal" stance, does she have sustenance? Not necessary, for he went to the province of the sea, and she sold and ate. What?

hebrew_text: מְזוֹנֵי תְּנַאי כְּתוּבָה נִינְהוּ, מִדְּאִית לַהּ כְּתוּבָה אִית לַהּ מְזוֹנֵי, אוֹ דִלְמָא: כְּתוּבָּה דִּלְמִשְׁקַל וּמִיפַּק — אִית לַהּ, מְזוֹנֵי, דִּלְמָא תִּיעַכַּב גַּבֵּיהּ — לֵית לַהּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לֵית לַהּ.
human_translation: sustenance is a stipulation in the marriage contract, since she has a marriage contract she has sustenance, Or perhaps a marriage contract, which take and leave she has sustenance, perhaps she might tarry with him, she not have He said to him: She does not have
llm_translation: The sustenance of the students is considered as a written obligation, for if it is written for him, he has sustenance. Or perhaps: if it is written for him, it is because he has taken and received — he has sustenance. But if perhaps his sustenance will be delayed — does he not have it? He said to him: he does not have it.

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא: יֵשׁ לָהּ! כִּי תַּנְיָא הָהִיא — לְאַחַר מִיתָה.
human_translation: But isn’t it taught she does have When that is taught, after death.
llm_translation: And it was taught: She has it! For it was taught in that regard — after death.

hebrew_text: אִית דְּאָמַר: אֲמַר לֵיהּ, תַּנְיָא: יֵשׁ לָהּ. הָא בַּ״עֲמוֹד וְהוֹצֵא״ קָאֵי? וְאֶלָּא, הָתַנְיָא יֵשׁ לָהּ! כִּי תַּנְיָא הָהִיא, לְאַחַר מִיתָה.
human_translation: Some say he said to him: is taught she has stands in arise and divorce But isn’t it taught she has When that is taught after death.
llm_translation: There is one who said: he said to him, it was taught: she has. This one stands on "and he shall take out"? Rather, it was taught: she has! For it was taught that, after death.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אַלְמָנָה לְכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל, גְּרוּשָׁה וַחֲלוּצָה לְכֹהֵן הֶדְיוֹט — יֵשׁ לָהּ כְּתוּבָּה, פֵּירוֹת, מְזוֹנוֹת, בְּלָאוֹת, וְהִיא פְּסוּלָה, וּוְלָדָהּ פָּסוּל, וְכוֹפִין אוֹתוֹ לְהוֹצִיא. שְׁנִיּוֹת מִדִּבְרֵי סוֹפְרִים — אֵין לָהּ כְּתוּבָּה, לֹא פֵּירוֹת, לֹא מְזוֹנוֹת, וְלֹא בְּלָאוֹת, וְהִיא כְּשֵׁירָה, וּוְלָדָהּ כָּשֵׁר, וְכוֹפִין אוֹתוֹ לְהוֹצִיא.
human_translation: The Sages taught: A widow to a High Priest, a divorcée or a ḥalutza to a common priest has marriage contract; produce of sustenance; worn clothes and she is disqualified and her offspring is disqualified and forces him to divorce a secondary relative by rabbinic law has neither a marriage contract; nor produce nor sustenance; nor worn clothes; and she is fit and her offspring is fit and forces him to divorce
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: A widow of a High Priest, divorced and redeemed to an ordinary priest - she has a document, fruits, sustenance, prohibitions, and she is disqualified, and her child is disqualified, and they force him to divorce her. Two opinions from the words of the Sages - she does not have a document, neither fruits, nor sustenance, nor prohibitions, and she is valid, and her child is valid, and they force him to divorce her.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר: מִפְּנֵי מָה אָמְרוּ אַלְמָנָה לְכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל יֵשׁ לָהּ כְּתוּבָּה — מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא פָּסוּל וְהִיא פְּסוּלָה. וְכׇל מָקוֹם שֶׁהוּא פָּסוּל וְהִיא פְּסוּלָה —
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar said: For what say a widow to a High Priest has a marriage contract? Because he is disqualified and she is disqualified and any place where he is disqualified and she is disqualified,
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar said: Why did they say that a widow of a High Priest has a Scriptural prohibition? Because he is disqualified, and she is disqualified. And in every place where he is disqualified, and she is disqualified—

hebrew_text: קָנְסוּ אוֹתוֹ כְּתוּבָּה. וּמִפְּנֵי מָה אָמְרוּ שְׁנִיּוֹת מִדִּבְרֵי סוֹפְרִים אֵין לָהֶן כְּתוּבָּה — מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא כָּשֵׁר וְהִיא כְּשֵׁרָה. וְכׇל מָקוֹם שֶׁהוּא כָּשֵׁר וְהִיא כְּשֵׁרָה — קָנְסוּ אוֹתָהּ כְּתוּבָּה.
human_translation: they penalized him marriage contract. And for what they say secondary relatives by rabbinic law do not have a marriage contract? Because he is fit and she is fit, and any place where he is fit and she is fit they penalized her marriage contract,
llm_translation: They acquired it as a written document. And why did they say that second marriages from the words of the Sages do not have a written document? Because he is valid and she is valid. And in any place where he is valid and she is valid, they acquired it as a written document.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: הַלָּלוּ דִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה — וְדִבְרֵי תוֹרָה אֵין צְרִיכִין חִיזּוּק. וְהַלָּלוּ דִּבְרֵי סוֹפְרִים — וְדִבְרֵי סוֹפְרִים צְרִיכִין חִיזּוּק. דָּבָר אַחֵר: זֶה — הוּא מַרְגִּילָהּ, וְזוֹ — הִיא מַרְגִּילָתוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi says These Torah law, and Torah law does not require strengthening But those rabbinic law, and rabbinic law require strengthening. Alternatively, this he who encourages her But that she encourages him,
llm_translation: Rabbi says: These are the words of the Torah - and the words of the Torah do not require strengthening. And these are the words of the Scribes - and the words of the Scribes require strengthening. Another explanation: This one - is accustomed to it, and that one - is accustomed to him.

hebrew_text: דָּבָר אַחֵר מַאן קָתָנֵי לַהּ? אִיכָּא דְּאָמַר: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר קָתָנֵי לַהּ, וּמָה טַעַם קָאָמַר. מָה טַעַם אָמְרוּ הוּא פָּסוּל וְהִיא פְּסוּלָה קָנְסוּ אוֹתוֹ כְּתוּבָּה — מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא מַרְגִּילָהּ. וּמָה טַעַם הוּא כָּשֵׁר וְהִיא כְּשֵׁרָה קָנְסוּ אוֹתָהּ כְּתוּבָּה — מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהִיא מַרְגִּילָתוֹ.
human_translation: Who teaches the alternative Some say Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar teaches it and is saying: What is the reason? What is the reason they said he is disqualified and she is disqualified, they penalized him marriage contract? because he encourages her And what reason did they say he is fit and she is fit they penalized her marriage contract? because she encourages him,
llm_translation: Another explanation, who is the Tanna that teaches it? There is one who says: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar teaches it, and what is the reason he says. What is the reason they said: If he is disqualified and she is disqualified, they penalize him as it is habitual for him. And what is the reason they said: If he is valid and she is valid, they penalize her as it is habitual for him.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמַר: רַבִּי קָתָנֵי לַהּ, וַחֲלוּצָה קָא קַשְׁיָא לֵיהּ: וְהָא חֲלוּצָה דְּרַבָּנַן, וְאִית לַהּ כְּתוּבָּה! הֲדַר אָמַר: כֵּיוָן דְּפָסֵיל לָהּ מִדְּרַבָּנַן, זֶה — הוּא מַרְגִּילָהּ, וְזוֹ — הִיא מַרְגִּילָתוֹ.
human_translation: some say Rabbi teaches it, and a ḥalutza a difficulty A ḥalutza by rabbinic and she does have a marriage contract. he then said Since he disqualifies her by rabbinic law, this he who encourages her, and that she encourages him.
llm_translation: There is one who said: Rabbi Katanei to her, and a garment is difficult for him: and the garment of the Rabbis, and it has a writing! He then said: Since he disqualified it from the Rabbis, this one - he is accustomed to it, and this one - she is accustomed to him.

hebrew_text: מַאי אִיכָּא בֵּין רַבִּי לְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר? אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: מַמְזֶרֶת וּנְתִינָה לְיִשְׂרָאֵל אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: what is there between Rabbi and Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar? Rav Ḥisda said: The between them a mamzeret or a Gibeonite woman to a Jew
llm_translation: What is the difference between Rabbi and Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar? Rav Hisda said: There is a difference between them regarding mamzeret and natinah for Israel.

hebrew_text: מַאן דְּאָמַר דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא — הָא נָמֵי דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא, מַאן דְּאָמַר מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא מַרְגִּילָהּ — הָא הִיא מַרְגְּלָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: the one who says by Torah this too is by Torah the one who says because he encourages her, she encourages him,
llm_translation: One who says it is from the Torah - this is the appearance of the Torah. One who says because he is accustomed to it - this is his custom.

hebrew_text: וּלְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר דְּאָמַר הֲרֵי זֶה עֶבֶד וּמַמְזֵר, הָא לָא מַרְגְּלָא לֵיהּ וְלָא מִידֵּי! אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: מַחֲזִיר גְּרוּשָׁה מִשֶּׁנִּיסֵּת אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ. מַאן דְּאָמַר דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא — הָא נָמֵי דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא, וּמַאן דְּאָמַר מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא מַרְגִּילָהּ — הָא הִיא מַרְגְּלָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: But according to Rabbi Eliezer, who said a slave and a mamzer , she does not encourage him at all. Rather, Rav Yosef said: The between them is remarries his divorcée after she has married the one who says by Torah this too is by Torah And the one who says because he encourages her, she encourages him,
llm_translation: And for Rabbi Eliezer who said, "Behold, this one is a slave and a mamzer," is it not a disgrace to him and not from his own doing! Rather, Rav Yosef said: He returns a divorced woman from when there is something between them. Whoever says it is from the Torah - it is also from the Torah, and whoever says it is because he is accustomed to her - it is she who is accustomed to him.

hebrew_text: וּלְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא דְּאָמַר יֵשׁ מַמְזֵר מֵחַיָּיבֵי לָאוִין, הָא לָא מַרְגְּלָא לֵיהּ וְלָא מִידֵּי! אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: בְּעוּלָה לְכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ. מַאן דְּאָמַר דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא — הָא נָמֵי דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא, וּמַאן דְּאָמַר מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא מַרְגִּילָהּ — הָא הִיא מַרְגְּלָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: But according to Rabbi Akiva, who said from is liable a prohibition is a mamzer , she does not encourage him at all, Rather, Rav Pappa said: between them a non-virgin to a High Priest. the one who says by Torah this too is by Torah And the one who says is because he encourages her, she encourages him,
llm_translation: To Rabbi Akiva who said: There are mamzerim from those liable to negative commandments, this is not a tradition from him, nor from his teachers! Rather, Rav Papa said: There is a distinction between them in the case of a High Priest's wife. Whoever says it is from the Torah — it is indeed from the Torah, and whoever says it is because he is accustomed to it — this is the reason for him.

hebrew_text: וּלְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב דְּאָמַר יֵשׁ חָלָל מֵחַיָּיבֵי עֲשֵׂה, הָא לָא מַרְגְּלָא לֵיהּ וְלָא מִידֵּי! אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: מַחֲזִיר סָפֵק סוֹטָתוֹ אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: But according to Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov, who said for which one is liable for a positive mitzva is a ḥalal , she does not encourage him at all. Rather, Rav Ashi said: The between them is remarries his an uncertainty an adulteress.
llm_translation: And for Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov who said there is liability for a negative commandment from positive commandments, this is not a proof, and not immediately! Rather, Rav Ashi said: There is a difference between returning his doubtful wife.

hebrew_text: מַאן דְּאָמַר דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא — הָא נָמֵי דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא, וּמַאן דְּאָמַר מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא מַרְגִּילָהּ — הָא הִיא מַרְגְּלָא לֵיהּ. וּלְרַבִּי מַתְיָא בֶּן חָרָשׁ, דְּאָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ הָלַךְ בַּעְלָהּ לְהַשְׁקוֹתָהּ, וּבָא עָלֶיהָ בַּדֶּרֶךְ — עֲשָׂאָהּ זוֹנָה, הָא לָא מַרְגְּלָא לֵיהּ וְלָא מִידֵּי! אֶלָּא אָמַר מָר בַּר רַב אָשֵׁי: סוֹטָה וַדַּאי אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: the one who says by Torah this too is by Torah And the one who says because he encourages her, she encourages him, But according to Rabbi Matya ben Ḥarash, who said even if her husband went to cause her to drink and had intercourse with her on the way, he has rendered her a zona she does not encourage him at all. Rather, Mar bar Rav Ashi said: between them is definite adulteress.
llm_translation: One who says it is from the Torah - this is the one who says it is from the Torah, and one who says because he is accustomed to it - this is accustomed to him. And regarding Rabbi Matya ben Charash, who said: Even if her husband went to give her to drink, and he found her on the way - he made her a harlot, this is not accustomed to him and not immediately! Rather, Mar bar Rav Ashi said: There is certainly a difference between them.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל מְאוֹרֶסֶת לְכֹהֵן, מְעוּבֶּרֶת מִכֹּהֵן, שׁוֹמֶרֶת יָבָם לְכֹהֵן, וְכֵן בַּת כֹּהֵן לְיִשְׂרָאֵל — לֹא תֹּאכַל בִּתְרוּמָה. בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל מְאוֹרֶסֶת לְלֵוִי, מְעוּבֶּרֶת מִלֵּוִי, שׁוֹמֶרֶת יָבָם לְלֵוִי, וְכֵן בַּת לֵוִי לְיִשְׂרָאֵל — לֹא תֹּאכַל בְּמַעֲשֵׂר.
human_translation: an Israelite woman betrothed to a priest pregnant from a priest, a widow awaiting her yavam , a priest; and similarly, daughter of a priest for an Israelite, she may not partake of teruma . an Israelite woman betrothed to a Levite or pregnant from a Levite; a widow awaiting her yavam , who is a Levite; and similarly daughter of a Levite for an Israelite, she may not partake of tithes.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: A daughter of Israel who is betrothed to a Kohen, impregnated by a Kohen, awaiting yibum from a Kohen, and likewise a daughter of a Kohen betrothed to an Israelite — may not eat terumah. A daughter of Israel who is betrothed to a Levite, impregnated by a Levite, awaiting yibum from a Levite, and likewise a daughter of a Levite betrothed to an Israelite — may not eat from the tithe.

hebrew_text: בַּת לֵוִי מְאוֹרֶסֶת לְכֹהֵן, מְעוּבֶּרֶת מִכֹּהֵן, שׁוֹמֶרֶת יָבָם לְכֹהֵן, וְכֵן בַּת כֹּהֵן לְלֵוִי — לֹא תֹאכַל לֹא בִּתְרוּמָה וְלֹא בְּמַעֲשֵׂר.
human_translation: daughter of a Levite betrothed to a priest pregnant from a priest; a widow awaiting her yavam , who is a priest; and similarly a daughter of a priest to a Levite, she may partake of neither teruma nor tithes.
llm_translation: Daughter of Levi betrothed to a Kohen, impregnated by a Kohen, awaiting yibum from a Kohen, and likewise, daughter of a Kohen to a Levi — she shall not eat neither from terumah nor from maaser.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וּתְהֵא זָרָה, זָרָה מִי לָא אָכְלָה בְּמַעֲשֵׂר?! אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הָא מַנִּי — רַבִּי מֵאִיר הִיא, דְּאָמַר: מַעֲשֵׂר רִאשׁוֹן אָסוּר לְזָרִים. דְּתַנְיָא:
human_translation: And let her be foreigner may a foreigner not partake of tithes? Rav Naḥman said Shmuel said: whose is this It is Rabbi Meir, who said first tithe is forbidden to foreigners, as it is taught
llm_translation: Gemara: And let it be a zarah, zarah who did not eat in maaser?! Rav Nachman said in the name of Shmuel: This is the opinion of Rabbi Meir, who said: The first tithe is forbidden to non-priests. As it was taught:

hebrew_text: תְּרוּמָה לְכֹהֵן, וּמַעֲשֵׂר רִאשׁוֹן לְלֵוִי, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה מַתִּירוֹ לְכֹהֵן. מַתִּירוֹ?! מִכְּלָל דְּאִיכָּא מַאן דְּאָסַר? אֶלָּא אֵימָא: נוֹתְנוֹ אַף לְכֹהֵן.
human_translation: Teruma is for a priest and first tithe is for a Levite; the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya permits it, to a priest, Permits it. by inference that there is one that prohibits Rather, say one may give it even to a priest.
llm_translation: Trumah for the Kohen, and the first tithe for the Levi, the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Elazar ben Azaria permits it for the Kohen. Permits it?! From the principle that whoever prohibits something exists? Rather say: Give it also to the Kohen.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר? אָמַר רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבָּה מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דִּגְמָרָא: ״כִּי אֶת מַעְשַׂר בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל אֲשֶׁר יָרִימוּ לַה׳ תְּרוּמָה״. מָה תְּרוּמָה אֲסוּרָה לְזָרִים, אַף מַעֲשֵׂר רִאשׁוֹן אָסוּר לְזָרִים. אִי מָה תְּרוּמָה חַיָּיבִין עָלָיו מִיתָה וָחוֹמֶשׁ — אַף מַעֲשֵׂר חַיָּיבִין עָלָיו מִיתָה וָחוֹמֶשׁ?
human_translation: What is the reason Rabbi Meir’s Rav Aḥa, son of Rabba, said in the name of tradition “For the tithe of the children of Israel that they set apart as a teruma to the Lord, Just as teruma is forbidden to foreigners, so too first tithe forbidden to foreigners, If just as teruma , is liable death and fifth for it, so too, tithes, liable for it death and fifth?
llm_translation: What is the reason for Rabbi Meir's opinion? Rav Acha, son of Rabba, said in the name of tradition: "When you take the tithe from the Israelites that they have set apart for the Lord as a contribution." Just as the contribution is forbidden to non-priests, so too the first tithe is forbidden to non-priests. Just as for the contribution one is liable to death and a fifth for misuse, so too for the tithe one is liable to death and a fifth for misuse.

hebrew_text: אָמַר קְרָא: ״וּמֵתוּ בוֹ כִּי יְחַלְּלֻהוּ״, ״וְיָסַף חֲמִישִׁיתוֹ עָלָיו״. ״בּוֹ״ — וְלֹא בְּמַעֲשֵׂר, ״עָלָיו״ — וְלֹא עַל מַעֲשֵׂר. וְרַבָּנַן, מָה תְּרוּמָה טוֹבֶלֶת, אַף מַעֲשֵׂר רִאשׁוֹן נָמֵי טוֹבֵל.
human_translation: the verse states: “They will die through it if they profane it” “Then he shall add the fifth part thereof unto it” through it, and not through tithes, to it, but not to tithes. And the Rabbis, just as teruma produces untithed produce, so too first tithe also produces untithed produce.
llm_translation: The verse says: "And they shall die in it if they profane it," "and he shall add its fifth to it." "In it" - and not in tithe, "to it" - and not to tithe. And the Rabbis, just as terumah purifies, so too the first tithe purifies.

hebrew_text: וְכִדְתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: יָכוֹל לֹא יְהֵא חַיָּיב אֶלָּא עַל טֶבֶל שֶׁלֹּא הוּרַם מִמֶּנּוּ כׇּל עִיקָּר. הוּרַם מִמֶּנּוּ תְּרוּמָה גְּדוֹלָה וְלֹא הוּרַם מִמֶּנּוּ מַעֲשֵׂר רִאשׁוֹן מַעֲשֵׂר רִאשׁוֹן וְלֹא מַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי, וַאֲפִילּוּ מַעְשַׂר עָנִי, מִנַּיִן?
human_translation: And as it is taught Rabbi Yosei says: might should be liable only for untithed produce from which no have been separated at all, great teruma has been separated from it and the first tithe has not been separated from it; first tithe and second tithe has not; or even poor man’s tithe, from where
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And as it was taught, Rabbi Yosei says: Can it be that one is liable only for the immersion that did not remove any essence from it? If one removed from it a large donation, but did not remove from it the first tithe, not the first tithe, nor the second tithe, and not even the poor tithe, from where? English translation:

hebrew_text: תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״לֹא תוּכַל לֶאֱכוֹל בִּשְׁעָרֶיךָ״, וּלְהַלָּן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״וְאָכְלוּ בִשְׁעָרֶיךָ וְשָׂבֵעוּ״. מָה ״שְׁעָרֶיךָ״ הָאָמוּר לְהַלָּן — מַעְשַׂר עָנִי, אַף ״שְׁעָרֶיךָ״ הָאָמוּר כָּאן — מַעְשַׂר עָנִי, וְאָמַר רַחֲמָנָא ״לֹא תוּכַל״.
human_translation: The verse states: “You may not eat within your gates and below, it states: “That they may eat within your gates and be satisfied” Just as “your gates” stated below the poor man’s tithe, so too “your gates” stated here the poor man’s tithe, and the Merciful One states “you may not
llm_translation: The Talmud teaches: "You shall not be able to eat within your gates," and elsewhere it says: "And they shall eat within your gates and be satisfied." Just as "your gates" mentioned there refers to the tithe for the poor, so too "your gates" mentioned here refers to the tithe for the poor, and the Merciful One says, "You shall not be able."

hebrew_text: וְאִי מֵהָתָם, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא לְלָאו, אֲבָל מִיתָה — לָא, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: And if from there, I would say a prohibition but death not teaches us
llm_translation: And if from there, would I say for this, but death - no, it is implied to us.

hebrew_text: לִישָּׁנָא אַחֲרִינָא: מַעֲשֵׂר רִאשׁוֹן דְּטָבֵיל, מִדְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי נָפְקָא! אִי מֵהַהִיא, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא לְלָאו, אֲבָל מִיתָה — לָא, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: A different version first tithe creates untithed produce is derived from Rabbi Yosei If from that I would say by a prohibition but death not teaches us
llm_translation: Another teaching: The first tithe that was immersed, according to Rabbi Yosei it emerges! If it were from that teaching, I would say it is valid for something else, but for death — no, it is not valid, this is what he is teaching us.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי אוֹקֵימְתַּהּ — כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר, אֵימָא סֵיפָא: בַּת לֵוִי מְאוֹרֶסֶת לְכֹהֵן, וּבַת כֹּהֵן לְלֵוִי — לֹא תֹּאכַל לֹא בִּתְרוּמָה וְלֹא בְּמַעֲשֵׂר, הָכָא מַאי זָרוּת אִיכָּא! אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: מַאי ״אֵינָהּ אוֹכֶלֶת״ דְּקָתָנֵי — אֵינָהּ נוֹתֶנֶת רְשׁוּת לִתְרוֹם.
human_translation: In what did you establish In accordance with Rabbi Meir. say the latter clause: daughter of a Levite betrothed to a priest and daughter of a priest to a Levite may eat neither teruma nor tithe. Here, what foreignness is there Rav Sheshet said: What is She may not eat, that teaches? she may not give permission to separate
llm_translation: With what is she established? - Like Rabbi Meir, say the latter clause: A daughter of Levi betrothed to a Kohen, and a daughter of a Kohen betrothed to a Levi - she shall not eat neither from the terumah nor from the tithe. What is the extent of her prohibition? Rab Sheshet said: What does "she does not eat" that it teaches? - She does not give permission to separate terumah.

hebrew_text: מִכְלָל דִּנְשׂוּאָה נוֹתֶנֶת רְשׁוּת? אִין, וְהָתַנְיָא: ״וַאֲכַלְתֶּם אוֹתוֹ בְּכׇל מָקוֹם אַתֶּם וּבֵיתְכֶם״ — לִימֵּד עַל נְשׂוּאָה בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁנּוֹתֶנֶת רְשׁוּת לִתְרוֹם.
human_translation: by inference that a married may give permission Yes, and isn’t it taught: “And you may eat it in any place, you and your households” teaches that an Israelite woman married may give permission to separate
llm_translation: From the principle that a married woman has the authority to give, does she have the authority? No, and it was taught: "And you shall eat it in every place, you and your household" — this teaches about a married daughter of Israel who has the authority to separate terumah.

hebrew_text: אַתָּה אוֹמֵר רְשׁוּת לִתְרוֹם, אוֹ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא לֶאֱכוֹל? אָמְרַתְּ: תְּרוּמָה חֲמוּרָה אוֹכֶלֶת, מַעֲשֵׂר הַקַּל לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן?! אֶלָּא לִימֵּד עַל נְשׂוּאָה בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁנּוֹתֶנֶת רְשׁוּת לִתְרוֹם.
human_translation: you say permission to separate or it is only to eating? Say may partake of teruma , stringent, not all the more so tithe, lenient? Rather, teaches that an Israelite woman married may give permission to separate
llm_translation: You say, "Permission to give Terumah, or is it only to eat?" You say: "A stringent Terumah eats, a lenient Ma'aser all the more so?!" Rather, it teaches about the elevation of a daughter of Israel who gives permission to give Terumah.

hebrew_text: מָר בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבְנָא אָמַר: לוֹמַר שֶׁאֵין חוֹלְקִין לָהּ מַעֲשֵׂר בְּבֵית הַגְּרָנוֹת. הָנִיחָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר מִשּׁוּם יִיחוּד, אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר מִשּׁוּם גְּרוּשָׁה, גְּרוּשָׁה בַּת לֵוִי מִי לָא אָכְלָה בְּמַעֲשֵׂר?!
human_translation: Mar, son of Rabbana, said: to say that we do not distribute tithe to her in the granary. This works out well according to the one who says due to being alone But according to the one who says due to a divorcée, daughter of a Levite. Does she not partake of tithe
llm_translation: Mar, son of Ravina, said: To say that they do not divide the tithe for her in the granary. It is preferable according to the one who said due to unique status, rather than according to the one who said due to divorce. If a divorced woman, daughter of Levi, who did not eat from the tithe, who did?

hebrew_text: וְלִיטַעְמָיךְ, גְּרוּשָׁה בַּת כֹּהֵן מִי לָא אָכְלָה בִּתְרוּמָה? אֶלָּא גְּזֵירָה מִשּׁוּם גְּרוּשָׁה בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל.
human_translation: And according to your reasoning does a divorcée daughter of a priest not partake of teruma ? Rather, decree due to divorcée daughter of a non-priest,
llm_translation: "And to taste, Gerushah the daughter of a Kohen, who did not eat from Terumah? Rather, it is a decree due to Gerushah the daughter of Yisrael."

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, מַאי אִירְיָא מְאוֹרֶסֶת? אֲפִילּוּ נְשׂוּאָה נָמֵי! אַיְּידֵי דִּתְנָא רֵישָׁא מְאוֹרֶסֶת, תְּנָא נָמֵי סֵיפָא מְאוֹרֶסֶת.
human_translation: If so, why specifically betrothed; the same would hold true even a married as well. since taught first clause Betrothed, he also taught the latter clause: Betrothed,
llm_translation: If so, what is meant by "me'orset"? Even if she is married! Since a Tanna taught in the beginning "me'orset," let the end also teach "me'orset."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: תְּרוּמָה לְכֹהֵן, וּמַעֲשֵׂר רִאשׁוֹן לְלֵוִי, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא. רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה אוֹמֵר:
human_translation: The Sages taught: Teruma is to a priest, and first tithe is to a Levite; the statement of Rabbi Akiva. Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya says:
llm_translation: The Sages taught: A contribution for the priest, and the first tithe for the Levite, are the words of Rabbi Akiva. Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah says:

hebrew_text: לְכֹהֵן. לְכֹהֵן וְלֹא לְלֵוִי? אֵימָא אַף לְכֹהֵן. מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא — דִּכְתִיב: ״וְאֶל הַלְוִיִּם תְּדַבֵּר וְאָמַרְתָּ אֲלֵיהֶם״, בִּלְוִיִּם קָא מִשְׁתַּעֵי קְרָא. וְאִידַּךְ כִּדְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: בְּעֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבָּעָה מְקוֹמוֹת נִקְרְאוּ כֹּהֲנִים לְוִיִּם, וְזֶה אֶחָד מֵהֶם: ״וְהַכֹּהֲנִים הַלְוִיִּם בְּנֵי צָדוֹק״.
human_translation: to a priest. To a priest and not to a Levite? Say also to a priest. What is the reason Rabbi Akiva’s As it is written: “You shall speak to the Levites, and you shall say to them” the verse speaks of Levites, And the other in accordance with of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, as Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: In twenty-four places priests are called Levites. And this is one of those “And the priests the Levites, the sons of Zadok”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: To a Kohen. To a Kohen and not to a Levi? Say also to a Kohen. What is the reason of Rabbi Akiva? — As it is written: "And to the Levites you shall speak and say to them," the verse is speaking about Levites. And the other opinion is like that of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, as Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: In twenty-four places, Kohanim are called Leviim, and this is one of them: "And the Kohanim, the Levites, the sons of Zadok."

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, הָכָא לָא מָצֵית אָמְרַתְּ, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַאֲכַלְתֶּם אוֹתוֹ בְּכׇל מָקוֹם״, מִי שֶׁיָּכוֹל לְאוֹכְלוֹ בְּכׇל מָקוֹם. יָצָא כֹּהֵן, שֶׁאֵין יָכוֹל לְאוֹכְלוֹ בְּבֵית הַקְּבָרוֹת. וְאִידַּךְ? כֹּל הֵיכָא דְּבָעֵי — דְּלָא בָּעֵי חוֹמָה, וְאִי אָכֵיל לֵיהּ בְּטוּמְאַת הַגּוּף — לָא לָקֵי.
human_translation: And Rabbi Akiva Here you cannot say as it is written: “And you may eat it in any place” one who can eat it in any place. excludes a priest, who cannot eat it in a cemetery, And the other anywhere that he wishes, as it does not require wall And if he eats it in bodily impurity he is not flogged.
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva, here did not find your statement, as it is written: "And you shall eat it in every place," anyone who can eat it in every place. A priest is excluded, for he cannot eat it in a cemetery. And the other? In any place that requires a wall, and if he eats it in a state of bodily impurity, he is not liable.

hebrew_text: הָהִיא גִּינְּתָא דַּהֲוָה שָׁקֵיל רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה מַעֲשֵׂר רִאשׁוֹן מִינַּהּ. אֲזַל רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אַהְדְּרֵיהּ לְפִתְחָא לְבֵי קִבְרֵי. אֲמַר: עֲקִיבָא בְּתַרְמִילוֹ, וַאֲנָא חָיֵי?
human_translation: a certain garden from which Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya, would take first tithe, Rabbi Akiva went, changed its entrance toward the cemetery, said Akiva, with his satchel, but I have to live;
llm_translation: That garden that Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah used to take his first tithe from. Rabbi Akiva went after him to the entrance of the cemetery. He said: "Akiva, with your sack, and I am alive?"

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר, מִפְּנֵי מָה קָנְסוּ לְוִיִּם בְּמַעֲשֵׂר? פְּלִיגִי בַּהּ רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן וְסָבַיָּא. חַד אָמַר: שֶׁלֹּא עָלוּ בִּימֵי עֶזְרָא. וְחַד אָמַר: כְּדֵי שֶׁיִּסְמְכוּ כֹּהֲנִים עָלָיו בִּימֵי טוּמְאָתָן.
human_translation: It was stated For what reason did penalize Levites with regard to tithe, Rabbi Yonatan and the Elders disagree this One said they did not ascend, in the days of Ezra. And one said so that they rely on it during their days of impurity.
llm_translation: It was stated: For what reason did the Levites enact tithing? Rabbi Yonatan and Sabiya disagree about it. One said: Because they did not ascend in the days of Ezra. And one said: So that the priests could rely on it in the days of their impurity.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר שֶׁלֹּא עָלוּ — מִשּׁוּם הָכִי קַנְסִינְהוּ. אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר כְּדֵי שֶׁיִּסְמְכוּ עָלָיו כֹּהֲנִים בִּימֵי טוּמְאָתָן — מִשּׁוּם כֹּהֲנִים קַנְסִינְהוּ לַלְוִיִּם?! אֶלָּא כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא קְנָסָא שֶׁלֹּא עָלוּ בִּימֵי עֶזְרָא. וְהָכָא בְּהָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי: מָר סָבַר: קְנָסָא לַעֲנִיִּים, וּמָר סָבַר: כֹּהֲנִים בִּימֵי טוּמְאָתָן — עֲנִיִּים נִינְהוּ.
human_translation: Granted, according to the one who says they did not ascend, due to that they penalized But according to the one who says so that the priests rely on it during their days of impurity, penalize the Levites for priests? Rather, everyone agrees a penalty that they did not ascend in the days of Ezra, and here they disagree about this: Sage holds penalty to the poor, and Sage holds priests are poor in the days of their impurity.
llm_translation: In truth, according to the one who says they did not ascend — it is for this reason that they penalized them. But according to the one who says it is in order for the priests to rely on him during their impurity days — is it the priests who penalized the Levites?! Rather, the entire world was penalized for not ascending in the days of Ezra. And here they dispute: One Master holds: the penalty is for the poor, and one Master holds: the priests during their impurity days — they are the poor.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר קְנָסָא לַעֲנִיִּים — מִשּׁוּם הָכִי אַהְדְּרֵיהּ רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא לְפִתְחָא לְבֵי קִבְרֵי. אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר לְכֹהֲנִים, אַמַּאי אַהְדְּרֵיהּ לְפִתְחָא לְבֵי קִבְרֵי? הָכִי קָאָמַר לֵיהּ: אִי דְּקָא אָתֵית בְּתוֹרַת קְנָסָא — אִית לָךְ, וְאִי קָא אָתֵית בְּתוֹרַת חֲלוּקָּה — לֵית לָךְ.
human_translation: Granted, according to the one who says penalty to the poor, due to that Rabbi Akiva changed entrance toward the cemetery, But according to the one who says to the priests, why did he change entrance toward the cemetery? This is what he said to him, If you come by virtue of penalty you may have but if you come by the of distribution, you may not have
llm_translation: In truth, according to the one who says "a fine for the poor," — therefore Rabbi Akiva returned to the entrance of the graves. But according to the one who says "for the priests," why did he return to the entrance of the graves? This is what he said to him: If you come with a law of a fine — you have a point, but if you come with a law of division — you do not have a point.
