hebrew_text: וּמְנָא לַן דְּלָא סְלִיקוּ בִּימֵי עֶזְרָא? דִּכְתִיב: ״וָאֶקְבְּצֵם אֶל הַנָּהָר הַבָּא עַל אַהֲוָא וַנַּחֲנֶה שָׁם יָמִים שְׁלֹשָׁה וָאָבִינָה בָעָם וּבַכֹּהֲנִים וּמִבְּנֵי לֵוִי לֹא מָצָאתִי שָׁם״. אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: בַּתְּחִלָּה לֹא הָיוּ מֵעֲמִידִים שׁוֹטְרִים אֶלָּא מִן הַלְוִיִּם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְשׁוֹטְרִים הַלְוִיִּם לִפְנֵיכֶם״, עַכְשָׁיו אֵין מַעֲמִידִין שׁוֹטְרִים אֶלָּא מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְשׁוֹטְרִים הָרַבִּים בְּרָאשֵׁיכֶם״.
human_translation: And from where do we that did not ascend in the days of Ezra? As it is written: “And I gathered them together to the river that runs to Ahava; and we encamped there three days; and I viewed the people, and the priests, and found there none of the sons of Levi” Rav Ḥisda said: Initially they would establish officers only from the Levites, as it states: “And the officers, the Levites, before you” now they establish officers only from Israelites, as it is stated: And the officers of the many at your heads.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And count for us that they did not ascend in the days of Ezra? As it is written: "And I gathered them to the river that runs to Ahava, and we camped there for three days, and I examined the people and the priests, but I did not find any Levites there." Rav Hisda said: Initially, they would only appoint officers from the Levites, as it is stated: "And the officers, the Levites, shall be before you." Now, they only appoint officers from the Israelites, as it is stated: "And the officers of the people at your heads."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁנִּיסֵּת לְכֹהֵן — תֹּאכַל בִּתְרוּמָה. מֵת וְלָהּ הֵימֶנּוּ בֵּן — תֹּאכַל בִּתְרוּמָה. נִיסֵּת לְלֵוִי — תֹּאכַל בְּמַעֲשֵׂר. מֵת וְלָהּ הֵימֶנּוּ בֵּן — תֹּאכַל בְּמַעֲשֵׂר. נִיסֵּת לְיִשְׂרָאֵל — לֹא תֹּאכַל לֹא בִּתְרוּמָה וְלֹא בְּמַעֲשֵׂר. מֵת וְלָהּ הֵימֶנּוּ בֵּן — לֹא תֹּאכַל לֹא בִּתְרוּמָה וְלֹא בְּמַעֲשֵׂר.
human_translation: An Israelite woman married to a priest may partake of teruma . died and she had a child from him, she may partake of teruma . married a Levite, she may partake of tithe died and she a child from him, she may partake of tithe married an Israelite, she may partake of neither teruma nor tithe. died and she a child from him, she may partake of neither teruma nor tithe.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: A daughter of Israel who marries a Kohen - she may eat Terumah. If her husband dies and she has a son from him - she may eat Terumah. If she marries a Levi - she may eat Ma'aser. If her husband dies and she has a son from him - she may eat Ma'aser. If she marries an Israelite - she may not eat either Terumah or Ma'aser. If her husband dies and she has a son from him - she may not eat either Terumah or Ma'aser.

hebrew_text: מֵת בְּנָהּ מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל — תֹּאכַל בְּמַעֲשֵׂר. מֵת בְּנָהּ מִלֵּוִי — תֹּאכַל בִּתְרוּמָה. מֵת בְּנָהּ מִכֹּהֵן — לֹא תֹּאכַל לֹא בִּתְרוּמָה וְלֹא בְּמַעֲשֵׂר.
human_translation: her child from the Israelite died, she may partake of tithe her child from the Levite died, she may partake of teruma . her child from the priest died she may no partake of either teruma or tithe.
llm_translation: Deceased her son from Israelite — shall eat in tithe. Deceased her son from Levi — shall eat in heave-offering. Deceased her son from Kohen — not shall eat neither in heave-offering nor in tithe.

hebrew_text: בַּת כֹּהֵן שֶׁנִּיסֵּת לְיִשְׂרָאֵל — לֹא תֹּאכַל בִּתְרוּמָה. מֵת וְלָהּ הֵימֶנּוּ בֵּן — לֹא תֹּאכַל בִּתְרוּמָה. נִיסֵּת לְלֵוִי — תֹּאכַל בְּמַעֲשֵׂר. מֵת וְלָהּ הֵימֶנּוּ בֵּן — תֹּאכַל בְּמַעֲשֵׂר. נִיסֵּת לְכֹהֵן — תֹּאכַל בִּתְרוּמָה. מֵת וְלָהּ הֵימֶנּוּ בֵּן — תֹּאכַל בִּתְרוּמָה.
human_translation: daughter of a priest married to an Israelite may not partake of teruma . died and she a son from him, she may not partake of teruma married a Levite she may partake of tithe. died, and she a son from him, she may partake of tithe. married a priest, she may partake of teruma . died and she a son from him, she may partake of teruma .
llm_translation: Daughter of a Kohen who married an Israelite - she may not eat from the Terumah. If her husband dies and she has a son - she may not eat from the Terumah. If she married a Levite - she may eat from the Maaser. If her husband dies and she has a son - she may eat from the Maaser. If she married a Kohen - she may eat from the Terumah. If her husband dies and she has a son - she may eat from the Terumah.

hebrew_text: מֵת בְּנָהּ מִכֹּהֵן — לֹא תֹּאכַל בִּתְרוּמָה. מֵת בְּנָהּ מִלֵּוִי — לֹא תֹּאכַל בְּמַעֲשֵׂר. מֵת בְּנָהּ מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל — חוֹזֶרֶת לְבֵית אָבִיהָ, וְעַל זוֹ נֶאֱמַר: ״וְשָׁבָה אֶל בֵּית אָבִיהָ כִּנְעוּרֶיהָ מִלֶּחֶם אָבִיהָ תֹּאכֵל״.
human_translation: her son from the priest died, she may not partake of teruma , her son from the Levite died, she may no partake of tithe. her son from the Israelite died, she returns to her father’s house And with regard to this is stated: “And she is returned unto her father’s house, as in her youth; she may eat of her father’s bread”
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "If her son, from a Kohen, dies — she shall not eat from the Terumah. If her son, from a Levi, dies — she shall not eat from the Maaser. If her son, from Yisrael, dies — she returns to her father's house, and regarding this it is said: 'And she shall return to her father's house as in her youth; her father's bread she shall eat.'"

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מֵת בְּנָהּ מִלֵּוִי — תֹּאכַל בִּתְרוּמָה. דְּהָדְרָא אָכְלָה מִשּׁוּם בְּנָהּ, מְנָלַן? אָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא אָמַר רַב: ״בַּת״ ״וּבַת״.
human_translation: her son from the Levite died she may partake of teruma . that she once again may partake due to her son from where do we Rabbi Abba said Rav said: daughter. “But daughter,”
llm_translation: Gemar (a widow who) dies with her son from Levi — (the son) may eat from the terumah. When she (the widow) then eats (from the terumah) in the name of her son, where (is the source)? Rabbi Abba said in the name of Rav: "Daughter" and "granddaughter."

hebrew_text: כְּמַאן, כְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא דְּדָרֵישׁ וָוֵי? אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבָּנַן, כּוּלֵּהּ ״וּבַת״ קְרָא יַתִּירָא הוּא.
human_translation: In accordance with which in accordance with Rabbi Akiva, who expounds even you say the Rabbis, entire “But daughter,” is superfluous,
llm_translation: As whom, as Rabbi Akiva who expounds "woe"? Even if you say the Rabbis, all of it is an extra verse.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: כְּשֶׁהִיא חוֹזֶרֶת — חוֹזֶרֶת לִתְרוּמָה, וְאֵינָהּ חוֹזֶרֶת לְחָזֶה וָשׁוֹק. אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא אָמַר רָבִינָא בַּר שֵׁילָא: מַאי קְרָא — ״הִיא בִּתְרוּמַת הַקֳּדָשִׁים לֹא תֹאכֵל״, בַּמּוּרָם מִן הַקֳּדָשִׁים לֹא תֹאכֵל. רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ: ״מִלֶּחֶם״, וְלֹא כׇּל לֶחֶם, פְּרָט לְחָזֶה וָשׁוֹק.
human_translation: The Sages taught: when she returns she returns to teruma but she does not return to the breast and hind leg Rav Ḥisda said Ravina bar Sheila said: What is the verse “She may not eat of that which is set apart from the sacred things” From that which is separated from the sacred things, she may not eat. Rav Naḥman Rabba bar Avuh said of bread” not all bread; exclude the breast and hind leg.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: When it (the animal) returns - it returns for Terumah, but it does not return for the chest and the thigh. Rav Ḥisda said in the name of Ravina bar Sheila: What is the verse? "She shall not eat of the holy things" (Leviticus 22:12) - from the top of the holy things she shall not eat. Rav Naḥman said Rabba bar Avuh: "Of bread," and not all bread, excluding the chest and the thigh.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רָמֵי בַּר חָמָא: אֵימָא: פְּרָט לַהֲפָרַת נְדָרִים! אָמַר רָבָא: כְּבָר פַּסְקַהּ תַּנָּא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל, דְּתָנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: ״וְנֵדֶר אַלְמָנָה וּגְרוּשָׁה יָקוּם עָלֶיהָ״, מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר? וַהֲלֹא מוּצָאָה מִכְּלַל אָב, וּמוּצָאָה מִכְּלַל בַּעַל!
human_translation: Rami bar Ḥama objects to this: say exclude nullification of vows. Rava said: already been severed, the school of Rabbi Yishmael, as the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: “But the vow of a widow, or of a divorcée…shall stand against her” What the verse states She was removed from the category father and she has been removed from the category husband,
llm_translation: The Gemara challenges it: Ramei bar Ḥama says: Say, perhaps it comes to exclude the annulment of vows! Rava said: A tanna of the school of Rabbi Yishmael has already established this, as a tanna of the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: "And a widow or divorced woman shall fulfill that which is upon her." What is the teaching coming to say? Is it not that she is found in the category of a father, and she is found in the category of a husband!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, הֲרֵי שֶׁמָּסַר הָאָב לִשְׁלוּחֵי הַבַּעַל, אוֹ שֶׁמָּסְרוּ שְׁלוּחֵי הָאָב לִשְׁלוּחֵי הַבַּעַל, וְנִתְאַרְמְלָה אוֹ נִתְגָּרְשָׁה בַּדֶּרֶךְ, הֵיאַךְ אֲנִי קוֹרֵא בָּהּ בֵּית אָבִיהָ שֶׁל זוֹ, אוֹ בֵּית בַּעְלָהּ שֶׁל זוֹ, אֶלָּא לוֹמַר לְךָ: כֵּיוָן שֶׁיָּצְאָה שָׁעָה אַחַת מֵרְשׁוּת הָאָב — שׁוּב אֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לְהָפֵר.
human_translation: Rather, where the father transferred to the husband’s agents Or, where the father’s agents transferred to the husband’s agents and she was widowed or divorced on the way, How shall I consider her? house of this one, her father, or house of that one, her husband? Rather, to tell you: Since she has left her father’s jurisdiction one moment, is no longer able to nullify
llm_translation: Rather, if the father handed over to the messengers of the husband, or if the messengers of the father handed over to the messengers of the husband, and she was either kidnapped or divorced on the way, how do I read regarding her, the father's house of this one, or the husband's house of this one, rather to tell you: once she has left the domain of the father for even a moment - he can no longer annul.

hebrew_text: רַב סָפְרָא אָמַר: ״מִלֶּחֶם אָבִיהָ תֹּאכֵל״, לֶחֶם וְלֹא בָּשָׂר. רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר: ״מִלֶּחֶם אָבִיהָ תֹּאכֵל״, לֶחֶם הַקָּנוּי לְאָבִיהָ, פְּרָט לְחָזֶה וָשׁוֹק — דְּמִשֻּׁלְחַן גָּבוֹהַּ קָא זָכוּ.
human_translation: Rav Safra said: “From her father’s bread she may eat,” “bread” but not meat Rav Pappa said “From her father’s bread she may eat” bread owned by her father, excludes the breast and hind leg, as receive from the table of Most High.
llm_translation: Rav Safra said: "You shall eat the bread of her father," bread and not meat. Rav Papa said: "You shall eat the bread of her father," the bread that is designated for her father, excluding the chest and the thigh - for they are considered as coming from a high table.

hebrew_text: וְרָבָא אָמַר: ״וְאֵת חֲזֵה הַתְּנוּפָה וְאֵת שׁוֹק הַתְּרוּמָה תֹּאכְלוּ אַתָּה וּבָנֶיךָ וּבְנוֹתֶיךָ אִתָּךְ״ — בִּזְמַן שֶׁאִתְּךָ.
human_translation: And Rava said: “And the breast of waving and the hind leg of heaving you shall eat…you, and your sons and your daughters with you” at a time when “with you,”
llm_translation: Rava said: "And the breast of the wave offering and the thigh of the heave offering you shall eat, you and your sons and your daughters with you" — when you are with them.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה, תָּנָא: כְּשֶׁהִיא חוֹזֶרֶת לְבֵית אָבִיהָ — חוֹזֶרֶת לִתְרוּמָה, וְאֵינָהּ חוֹזֶרֶת לְחָזֶה וָשׁוֹק. בִּשְׁבִיל בְּנָהּ — חוֹזֶרֶת אַף לְחָזֶה וָשׁוֹק.
human_translation: Rav Adda bar Ahava said: taught: when she returns to her father’s house, she returns for teruma , but she does not return for the breast and hind leg. on account of her son she returns even of the breast and hind leg.
llm_translation: Rav Adda bar Ahava said, it was taught: When she returns to her father's house - she returns to Terumah, but she does not return to the chest and the thigh. Because of her son - she even returns to the chest and the thigh.

hebrew_text: אֲזַל רַב מָרְדֳּכַי, אַמְרַהּ לִשְׁמַעְתָּא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב אָשֵׁי. אֲמַר: מֵהֵיכָא קָא מִתְרַבְּיָא — מִ״וּבַת״, מִי עֲדִיפָא לַהּ מִינַּהּ? הָתָם כְּתִיבִי מִיעוּטֵי, הָכָא לָא כְּתִיבִי מִיעוּטֵי.
human_translation: Rav Mordekhai went stated halakha before Rav Ashi, said From where does include From “but daughter” Is preferable to her, There, writes exclusions, here it does not write exclusions.
llm_translation: Rav Mordechai went, she said in front of Rav Ashi. He said: From where does she become pregnant - from the male or the female? There it is written with fewer letters, here it is not written with fewer letters.

hebrew_text: בַּת כֹּהֵן שֶׁנִּיסֵּת לְיִשְׂרָאֵל וְכוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״וְשָׁבָה אֶל בֵּית אָבִיהָ״ — פְּרָט לְשׁוֹמֶרֶת יָבָם. ״כִּנְעוּרֶיהָ״ — פְּרָט לִמְעוּבֶּרֶת.
human_translation: daughter of a priest married to an Israelite The Sages taught: “And she is returned unto her father’s house” excludes a widow awaiting her yavam , “As in her youth”; excludes a pregnant woman,
llm_translation: Daughter of a Kohen who married an Israelite and so forth. The Rabbis taught: "And she shall return to her father's house" - excluding a yevamah who is a shomeret yavam. "In her youth" - excluding a me'uberes.

hebrew_text: וַהֲלֹא דִין הוּא: וּמָה בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁלֹּא עָשָׂה וָלָד מִן הָרִאשׁוֹן כְּוָלָד מִן הַשֵּׁנִי לְפוֹטְרָהּ מִן הַיִּיבּוּם — עָשָׂה עוּבָּר כְּיָלוּד,
human_translation: But not inference, If in a place, where did not make a child from the first like a child from the second to exempt her from levirate marriage; made a fetus like born,
llm_translation: And isn't it so: And what in a case where he did not make a child from the first one like a child from the second one to exempt her from levirate marriage - if he made a fetus like a born child,

hebrew_text: מָקוֹם שֶׁעָשָׂה וָלָד מִן הָרִאשׁוֹן כְּוָלָד מִן הַשֵּׁנִי לְפוֹסְלָהּ מִן הַתְּרוּמָה — אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁנַּעֲשֶׂה עוּבָּר כְּיָלוּד?!
human_translation: a place where did make a child from the first like a child from the second to disqualify her from teruma ; Is it not, right that we should make a fetus like born
llm_translation: Place that made a child from the first like a child from the second to disqualify it from the terumah - is it not the same as if it were made a fetus like a newborn?!

hebrew_text: לָא, מָה לִי עָשָׂה עוּבָּר כְּיָלוּד לְעִנְיַן יִיבּוּם, שֶׁהֲרֵי עָשָׂה מֵתִים כְּחַיִּים — נַעֲשֶׂה עוּבָּר כְּיָלוּד לְעִנְיַן תְּרוּמָה, שֶׁלֹּא עָשָׂה מֵתִים כְּחַיִּים?! תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״כִּנְעוּרֶיהָ״ — פְּרָט לִמְעוּבֶּרֶת.
human_translation: No, what I made a fetus like born with regard to levirate marriage, because made the dead like the living: Shall we make a fetus like born with regard to teruma , where did not make the dead like the living? the verse states “as in her youth” exclude a pregnant woman.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: No, what did the fetus do like a born child regarding the matter of yibum, for behold, it made the dead like the living - should the fetus be considered like a born child regarding the matter of terumah, for it did not make the dead like the living?! The verse teaches: "like her youth" - excluding the fetus.

hebrew_text: וְאִיצְטְרִיךְ לְמִכְתַּב מְעוּבֶּרֶת, וְאִיצְטְרִיךְ לְמִכְתַּב ״וְזֶרַע אֵין לָהּ״. דְּאִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״וְזֶרַע אֵין לָהּ״, מֵעִיקָּרָא חַד גּוּפָא וְהַשְׁתָּא תְּרֵי גוּפֵי, אֲבָל מְעוּבֶּרֶת, דְּמֵעִיקָּרָא חַד גּוּפָא וְהַשְׁתָּא חַד גּוּפָא — אֵימָא תֵּיכוֹל, צְרִיכָא. וְאִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא מְעוּבֶּרֶת, דְּמֵעִיקָּרָא גּוּפָא
human_translation: And it was necessary to write a pregnant woman, and it was necessary to write “and she have no child” because had the Merciful One written “And she have no child,” at the outset one body and now, two bodies, But a pregnant woman, who at the outset one body and now one body, say she may partake of necessary And had the Merciful One written a pregnant woman, because at the outset body
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "And it is necessary for a written document of a crossed-out nature, and it is necessary for a written document 'and she has no offspring.' For if the Merciful One wrote 'and she has no offspring,' initially it is one body, and now it is two bodies. But a crossed-out document, since initially it is one body and now it is one body — say, perhaps it is necessary. And if the Merciful One wrote a crossed-out document, since initially it is one body."

hebrew_text: סְרִיקָא וְהַשְׁתָּא גּוּפָא מַלְיָא. אֲבָל ״זֶרַע אֵין לָהּ״, דְּמֵעִיקָּרָא גּוּפָא סְרִיקָא וְהַשְׁתָּא גּוּפָא סְרִיקָא — אֵימָא לָא, צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: empty, and now body full But “she has no child,” when at the outset body empty and now body empty, say not necessary
llm_translation: "Sarika and hastaa gufa malya. Aval 'zera ein lah', de-me'ikara gufa sarika ve-hastaa gufa sarika — eima la, tzerikha."

hebrew_text: [סִימָן: (אָמַר לֵיהּ) לֹא נַעֲשֶׂה מַעֲשֶׂיהָ בְּמִיתָה נַעֲשֶׂה וְלֹא נַעֲשֶׂה בְּוָלָד יִבֻּם וּתְרוּמָה יִבּוּם וּתְרוּמָה — סִימָן].
human_translation: a mnemonic Said to him, we should not make, by death, we should make and not make, by a child, yavam and teruma , levirate marriage and teruma . mnemonic.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Siman: (Amar lei) lo na'aseh ma'aseha bemitah na'aseh velo na'aseh bevlad yibum uturemah yibum uturemah - siman. English translation: Sign: (He said to him) her actions are not done through death, they are done, and her actions are not done through childbirth, yibum and terumah are done - sign.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב יְהוּדָה מִדִּאסְקַרְתָּא לְרָבָא: לֹא נַעֲשֶׂה מֵתִים כְּחַיִּים לְעִנְיַן יִבּוּם מִקַּל וְחוֹמֶר: וּמָה בְּמָקוֹם שֶׁעָשָׂה וָלָד מִן הָרִאשׁוֹן כְּוָלָד מִן הַשֵּׁנִי לְפוֹסְלָהּ מִן הַתְּרוּמָה — לֹא עָשָׂה מֵתִים כְּחַיִּים; מָקוֹם שֶׁלֹּא עָשָׂה וָלָד מִן הָרִאשׁוֹן כְּוָלָד מִן הַשֵּׁנִי לְפוֹטְרָהּ מִן הַיִּיבּוּם — אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁלֹּא נַעֲשֶׂה מֵתִים כְּחַיִּים?!
human_translation: Rav Yehuda from De’iskarta said to Rava, we not make the dead like the living with regard to levirate marriage by an a fortiori And if in a place where made a child from the first like a child from the second to disqualify her from teruma , did not make dead like living place where did not make a child from the first like a child from the second to exempt her from levirate marriage, is it not right that we should not make the dead like the living?
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Yehudah from Diskarta to Rava: "The dead are not made like the living regarding the matter of yibum, a fortiori: And what in a case where he had a child from the first wife, and he had a child from the second wife, disqualifying her from terumah - he did not make the dead like the living; in a case where he did not have a child from the first wife, and he had a child from the second wife, exempting her from yibum - is it not logical that the dead are not made like the living?!"

hebrew_text: תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״דְּרָכֶיהָ דַרְכֵי נוֹעַם וְכׇל נְתִיבוֹתֶיהָ שָׁלוֹם״.
human_translation: The verse states: “Her ways are the ways of pleasantness, and all her paths are peace”
llm_translation: The Talmud teaches: "Her ways are ways of pleasantness, and all her paths are peace."

hebrew_text: וְנַעֲשָׂה מֵתִים כְּחַיִּים לְעִנְיַן תְּרוּמָה מִקַּל וְחוֹמֶר: וּמָה בְּמָקוֹם שֶׁלֹּא עָשָׂה וָלָד מִן הָרִאשׁוֹן כְּוָלָד מִן הַשֵּׁנִי לְפוֹטְרָהּ מִן הַיִּיבּוּם — עָשָׂה מֵתִים כְּחַיִּים; מָקוֹם שֶׁעָשָׂה וָלָד מִן הָרִאשׁוֹן כְּוָלָד מִן הַשֵּׁנִי לְפוֹסְלָהּ מִן הַתְּרוּמָה — אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁנַּעֲשֶׂה מֵתִים כְּחַיִּים?! תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְזֶרַע אֵין לָהּ״, וְהָא אֵין לָהּ.
human_translation: And let us make dead like living with regard to teruma , from an a fortiori And if in a place where did not make a child from the first like a child from the second to exempt her from levirate marriage, made the living like the dead, a place where made a child from the first like a child from the second to disqualify her from teruma , is it not right that we should make the living like the dead? the verse states “and she have no child, and she does not have
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And the dead shall be as the living in the matter of terumah, from a fortiori reasoning: And in a case where the first husband did not have offspring, and the second husband had offspring with her, to exempt her from levirate marriage - if he makes the dead like the living; in a case where the first husband had offspring with her, and the second husband had offspring with her to disqualify her from terumah - is it not logical that he should make the dead like the living?! The Talmud teaches: 'And she has no seed,' and yet she does have seed." English translation:

hebrew_text: וְנַעֲשֶׂה וָלָד מִן הָרִאשׁוֹן כְּוָלָד מִן הַשֵּׁנִי לְעִנְיַן יִבּוּם מִקַּל וְחוֹמֶר: וּמָה בְּמָקוֹם שֶׁלֹּא עָשָׂה מֵתִים כְּחַיִּים לְעִנְיַן תְּרוּמָה — עָשָׂה וָלָד מִן הָרִאשׁוֹן כְּוָלָד מִן הַשֵּׁנִי; מָקוֹם שֶׁעָשָׂה מֵתִים כְּחַיִּים לְעִנְיַן יִבּוּם — אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁנַּעֲשֶׂה וָלָד מִן הָרִאשׁוֹן כְּוָלָד מִן הַשֵּׁנִי?! תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וּבֵן אֵין לוֹ״, וְהָא אֵין לוֹ.
human_translation: And let us make child from the first like child from the second with regard to levirate marriage, from an a fortiori And if in a place where did not make the living like the dead with regard to teruma , made a child from the first like a child from the second, a place where it made the living like the dead, with regard to levirate marriage, is it not right that we should make a child from the first like a child from the second, The verse states “And he has no child” and he had none
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And a child born from the first husband is like a child born from the second husband regarding the matter of yibum, from a fortiori reasoning: And in a case where he did not make the dead like the living regarding the matter of terumah - a child born from the first husband is like a child born from the second husband; in a case where he made the dead like the living regarding the matter of yibum - is it not logical that a child born from the first husband is like a child born from the second husband?! The Torah teaches: 'And he has no son,' and here he has no son."

hebrew_text: וְלֹא נַעֲשֶׂה וָלָד מִן הָרִאשׁוֹן כְּוָלָד מִן הַשֵּׁנִי לִתְרוּמָה מִקַּל וְחוֹמֶר: מָה בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁעָשָׂה מֵתִים כְּחַיִּים לְפוֹטְרָהּ מִן הַיִּיבּוּם — לֹא עָשָׂה וָלָד מִן הָרִאשׁוֹן כְּוָלָד מִן הַשֵּׁנִי; מָקוֹם שֶׁלֹּא עָשָׂה מֵתִים כְּחַיִּים לְעִנְיַן תְּרוּמָה — אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁלֹּא נַעֲשֶׂה וָלָד מִן הָרִאשׁוֹן כְּוָלָד מִן הַשֵּׁנִי?! תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אֵין לָהּ״, וְהָא יֵשׁ לָהּ.
human_translation: And should we make a child from the first not like a child from the second with regard to teruma , from an a fortiori If in a place where made the living like the dead to exempt her from levirate marriage, did not make a child from the first like a child from the second, a place where did not make the living like the dead, with regard to teruma , is it not right that we should not make child from the first like child from the second? the verse states: she have no but has
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And a child is not made from the first like a child from the second for the purpose of terumah by way of a fortiori argument: Just as in a case where one performed levirate marriage with the deceased as if he were alive, thereby exempting her from levirate marriage, and a child was not made from the first like a child from the second; in a case where one did not perform levirate marriage with the deceased as if he were alive for the matter of terumah — is it not logical that a child should not be made from the first like a child from the second?! The Talmud teaches: 'She has none,' yet she does have a child."

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ יֵשׁ מוּתָּרוֹת
llm_translation: We will return to you, there are permissions.

hebrew_text: הָאִשָּׁה שֶׁהָלַךְ בַּעְלָהּ לִמְדִינַת הַיָּם, וּבָאוּ וְאָמְרוּ לָהּ ״מֵת בַּעְלִיךְ״, וְנִיסֵּת, וְאַחַר כָּךְ בָּא בַּעְלָהּ — תֵּצֵא מִזֶּה וּמִזֶּה, וּצְרִיכָה גֵּט מִזֶּה וּמִזֶּה,
human_translation: a woman whose husband went overseas, and came and said to her: Your husband is dead, and she married and afterward her husband came she must leave this and that And she requires a bill of divorce from this and that
llm_translation: The woman that her husband went to the province of the sea, and they came and said to her "Your husband has died," and she married, and afterwards her husband came - she shall depart from this one and from that one, and she requires a bill of divorce from this one and from that one.

hebrew_text: וְאֵין לָהּ כְּתוּבָּה, וְלֹא פֵּירוֹת, וְלֹא מְזוֹנוֹת, וְלֹא בְּלָאוֹת — לֹא עַל זֶה וְלֹא עַל זֶה. וְאִם נָטְלָה מִזֶּה וּמִזֶּה — תַּחְזִיר.
human_translation: And she has neither marriage contract, nor profits nor sustenance, nor worn clothes neither against this nor against that And if she took from this or from that return
llm_translation: And she has no kesubah, and not fruits, and not sustenance, and not liabilities — not for this and not for that. And if she took from this and from that — she shall return.

hebrew_text: וְהַוָּלָד מַמְזֵר מִזֶּה וּמִזֶּה. וְלֹא זֶה וָזֶה מִטַּמֵּא לָהּ, וְלֹא זֶה וָזֶה זַכָּאִים לֹא בִּמְצִיאָתָהּ, וְלֹא בְּמַעֲשֵׂה יָדֶיהָ, וְלֹא בַּהֲפָרַת נְדָרֶיהָ.
human_translation: And the offspring is a mamzer from this and from that And neither this nor that may become impure for her And neither this nor that one is entitled Neither to her found nor to her earnings, nor to the nullification of her vows.
llm_translation: The child of a mamzer from this one and from this one. And neither this one nor that one renders her impure, and neither this one nor that one are deemed responsible for her, neither in her creation, nor in her actions, nor in the annulment of her vows.

hebrew_text: הָיְתָה בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל — נִפְסְלָה מִן הַכְּהוּנָּה. וּבַת לֵוִי — מִן הַמַּעֲשֵׂר, וּבַת כֹּהֵן — מִן הַתְּרוּמָה. וְאֵין יוֹרְשִׁין שֶׁל זֶה וְיוֹרְשִׁין שֶׁל זֶה יוֹרְשִׁין אֶת כְּתוּבָּתָהּ. וְאִם מֵתוּ — אָחִיו שֶׁל זֶה וְאָחִיו שֶׁל זֶה חוֹלְצִין וְלֹא מְיַיבְּמִין.
human_translation: was Israelite woman, she is disqualified from the priesthood, and daughter of a Levite from tithe, and daughter of a priest from teruma . And neither heirs of this heirs of that inherit her marriage contract, And if they died the brothers of this and the brothers of this perform ḥalitza and they do not enter into levirate marriage.
llm_translation: Daughter of Israel - disqualified from the priesthood. Daughter of Levi - from the tithe, and daughter of a Kohen - from the heave offering. And the heirs of this one and the heirs of that one inherit her written document. And if they die - the brothers of this one and the brothers of that one perform chalitzah and do not perform levirate marriage.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: כְּתוּבָּתָהּ עַל נִכְסֵי בַּעְלָהּ הָרִאשׁוֹן. רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: הָרִאשׁוֹן זַכַּאי בִּמְצִיאָתָהּ וּבְמַעֲשֵׂה יָדֶיהָ וּבַהֲפָרַת נְדָרֶיהָ. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: בִּיאָתָהּ אוֹ חֲלִיצָתָהּ מֵאָחִיו שֶׁל רִאשׁוֹן פּוֹטֶרֶת צָרָתָהּ. וְאֵין הַוָּלָד מִמֶּנּוּ מַמְזֵר.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei says her marriage contract is upon the property of her first husband. Rabbi Elazar says: The first is entitled to her found to her earnings, and to the nullification of her vows. Rabbi Shimon says Her sexual relations or her ḥalitza with the brothers of the first exempts her rival wife, And the child from him is not a mamzer .
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: Its writing is on the property of her first husband. Rabbi Elazar says: The first husband is entitled to its finding, the work of her hands, and the annulment of her vows. Rabbi Shimon says: Her coming or her release from the brother of the first husband exempts her from her rival. And the child is not from him is a mamzer.

hebrew_text: וְאִם נִיסַּת שֶׁלֹּא בִּרְשׁוּת — מוּתֶּרֶת לַחְזוֹר לוֹ. נִיסֵּת עַל פִּי בֵּית דִּין — תֵּצֵא, וּפְטוּרָה מִן הַקׇּרְבָּן.
human_translation: But if she married without consent permitted to return to she married by the court, she must leave and she is exempt from the offering,
llm_translation: If she was raped without consent - she is permitted to return to him. If she was raped according to the ruling of the court - she shall leave, and she is exempt from the offering.

hebrew_text: לֹא נִיסֵּת עַל פִּי בֵּית דִּין — תֵּצֵא, וְחַיֶּיבֶת בְּקׇרְבָּן. יִפָּה כֹּחַ בֵּית דִּין, שֶׁפּוֹטְרָהּ מִן הַקׇּרְבָּן. הוֹרוּהָ בֵּית דִּין לִינָּשֵׂא, וְהָלְכָה וְקִלְקְלָה — חַיֶּיבֶת בְּקׇרְבָּן, שֶׁלֹּא הִתִּירוּהָ אֶלָּא לִינָּשֵׂא.
human_translation: she did not marry by the court, she must leave and is liable to an offering power of the court is greater, as she is exempt from an offering. court instructed her to marry and she went and ruined she is liable to an offering, as they permitted her only to marry,
llm_translation: Not tested on the mouth of the court — she shall leave, and is obligated in a sacrifice. The court's power is praiseworthy, for they exempt her from the sacrifice. If the court instructed her to marry, and the outcome was a complication — she is obligated in a sacrifice, for they only permitted her to marry.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מִדְּקָתָנֵי סֵיפָא: נִשֵּׂאת שֶׁלֹּא בִּרְשׁוּת — מוּתֶּרֶת לַחְזוֹר לוֹ, שֶׁלֹּא בִּרְשׁוּת בֵּית דִּין, אֶלָּא בְּעֵדִים. מִכְּלָל דְּרֵישָׁא בִּרְשׁוּת בֵּית דִּין, וּבְעֵד אֶחָד. אַלְמָא עֵד אֶחָד נֶאֱמָן.
human_translation: From that the latter clause teaches: she married without consent permitted to return to him, not by consent court, but by witnesses, it may be inferred that the first clause with the consent of court, when one witness. Apparently, one witness is deemed credible
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara from the end: If it was carried without permission - it is permitted to return it, not with the permission of the court, but with witnesses. From the general principle of the beginning, with the permission of the court, and with one witness. This implies that one witness is trusted.

hebrew_text: וּתְנַן נָמֵי: הוּחְזְקוּ לִהְיוֹת מַשִּׂיאִין עֵד מִפִּי עֵד, וְאִשָּׁה מִפִּי אִשָּׁה, וְאִשָּׁה מִפִּי עֶבֶד וּמִפִּי שִׁפְחָה. אַלְמָא עֵד אֶחָד מְהֵימַן.
human_translation: And we also learned They established they would marry witness, from the mouth of witness, and a woman from woman, and a woman from a slave or from a maidservant. Apparently, one witness is deemed credible
llm_translation: And we learned in a Mishnah: We establish to be believed one witness from the mouth of another witness, and a woman from the mouth of another woman, and a woman from the mouth of a slave or a maidservant. This implies that one witness is believed.

hebrew_text: וּתְנַן נָמֵי: עֵד אֶחָד אוֹמֵר ״אָכַלְתָּ חֵלֶב״, וְהוּא אוֹמֵר ״לֹא אָכַלְתִּי״ — פָּטוּר. טַעְמָא דְּאָמַר ״לֹא אָכַלְתִּי״, הָא אִישְׁתִּיק — מְהֵימַן. אַלְמָא עֵד אֶחָד מְהֵימַן מִדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא.
human_translation: And we also learned one witness says You ate forbidden fat, and says: I did not eat exempt The reason is that said: I did not eat he silent deemed credible. Apparently, one witness is deemed credible by Torah
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: If one witness says, "You ate fat," and the accused says, "I did not eat," he is exempt. The reason that if he says, "I did not eat," he is believed is because he could have remained silent. This implies that one witness is believed from the Torah.

hebrew_text: מְנָא לַן? דְּתַנְיָא: ״אוֹ הוֹדַע אֵלָיו חַטָּאתוֹ״. וְלֹא שֶׁיּוֹדִיעוּהוּ אֲחֵרִים. יָכוֹל אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵינוֹ מַכְחִישׁוֹ יְהֵא פָּטוּר? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אוֹ הוֹדַע אֵלָיו״ — מִכׇּל מָקוֹם.
human_translation: From where do we As it is taught “Or if his sin be known to him” and not if it was made known to him by others. might he should be exempt even though he does not contradict the verse states: If his sin be known to him, in any case,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Menah lan? D'tanya: 'O hoda eilav chatato.' V'lo sheyodiu acherim. Yakhol af al pi she'eino makhchisho yehi patur? Talmud lomar: 'O hoda eilav' — mikol makom." English translation: "How do we know? For it was taught: 'Or if his sin which he has sinned be made known to him.' And not that others inform him. Could it be that even though he does not deny it, he is exempt? The Talmud teaches: 'Or if his sin which he has sinned be made known to him' — from any place."

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִילֵּימָא דַּאֲתוֹ תְּרֵי וְלָא קָא מַכְחִישׁ לְהוּ, קְרָא לְמָה לִי? אֶלָּא לָאו — חַד, וְכִי לָא קָא מַכְחִישׁ לֵיהּ — מְהֵימַן, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ עֵד אֶחָד נֶאֱמָן. וּמִמַּאי דְּמִשּׁוּם דִּמְהֵימַן? דִּלְמָא מִשּׁוּם דְּקָא שָׁתֵיק, וּשְׁתִיקָה כְּהוֹדָאָה דָמְיָא?
human_translation: What are the circumstances? If we say that two came and does not contradict them, why do I verse Rather, is it not one and if he does not contradict deemed credible? learn from this one witness is deemed credible And from where that due to is deemed credible? Perhaps because silent, as silence is considered like an admission.
llm_translation: "How are the laws of similarity? If you say that two witnesses came and did not contradict each other, why do I need a verse? Rather, it must be that it is not — one witness, and if he does not contradict him — he is believed, for we rely on the principle that one reliable witness suffices. And from what do we know that he is believed? Perhaps because he is silent, and silence is like admission?"

hebrew_text: תֵּדַע, דְּקָתָנֵי סֵיפָא: אָמְרוּ שְׁנַיִם ״אָכַלְתָּ חֵלֶב״, וְהוּא אוֹמֵר ״לֹא אָכַלְתִּי״ — פָּטוּר. רַבִּי מֵאִיר מְחַיֵּיב. אָמַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר: קַל וָחוֹמֶר, אִם הֱבִיאוּהוּ שְׁנַיִם לִידֵי מִיתָה חֲמוּרָה — לֹא יְבִיאוּהוּ לִידֵי קׇרְבָּן הַקַּל?
human_translation: know as the latter clause that teaches two said You ate forbidden fat, and he says: I did not eat exempt, Rabbi Meir obligates Rabbi Meir said an a fortiori If two can bring him to severe death not bring him to more lenient an offering?
llm_translation: You should know, as it is taught in the latter part: They said, "You ate fat," and he says, "I did not eat" — he is exempt. Rabbi Meir obligates. Rabbi Meir said: A fortiori, if they brought him before two for a severe death penalty — should they not bring him before two for a lighter penalty?

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ לוֹ: מָה אִם יִרְצֶה לוֹמַר ״מֵזִיד הָיִיתִי״! רֵישָׁא
human_translation: said to him: what if he would choose to say: I was an intentional the first clause
llm_translation: They said to him: What if he wants to say "I acted intentionally"? The beginning.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא קָא מְחַיְּיבִי רַבָּנַן? אִילֵּימָא מִשּׁוּם דִּמְהֵימַן — וְהָא תְּרֵי בְּעָלְמָא, דְּאַף עַל גַּב דְּקָא מַכְחִישׁ לְהוּ אִינְהוּ — מְהֵימְנִי, וְקָא פָּטְרִי רַבָּנַן. אֶלָּא לָאו, מִשּׁוּם דְּאִישְׁתִּיק — וּשְׁתִיקָה כְּהוֹדָאָה דָמְיָא.
human_translation: what is the reason that the Rabbis obligate If we say because is deemed credible, but an ordinary pair where even though he contradicts their they are deemed credible, and the Rabbis exempt Rather, is it not because he silent, and silence is considered like an admission?
llm_translation: What is the reason that the Rabbis obligate one to bring a sacrifice? If you say it is because they trust the witness - but there are two witnesses in general, and even though one contradicts them, they are still trusted, and the Rabbis exempt the accused. Rather, is it not because he is silent - and silence is like admission.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא סְבָרָא הִיא, מִידֵּי דְּהָוֵה אַחֲתִיכָה סָפֵק שֶׁל חֵלֶב סָפֵק שֶׁל שׁוּמָּן, וַאֲתָא עֵד אֶחָד וְאָמַר: בָּרִי לִי, דְּשׁוּמָּן הוּא — דִּמְהֵימַן.
human_translation: Rather, is logical reasoning: Just as it is in a piece uncertain forbidden fat uncertain of fat, and one witness comes and says: It is clear to me that it is fat, that he is deemed credible.
llm_translation: Rather, it is a matter of logic, since it is a case where there is doubt whether it is a mixture of forbidden fat or a mixture of permitted fat, and then one witness came and said: "It is clear to me that it is permitted fat" — he is believed.

hebrew_text: מִי דָּמֵי? הָתָם לָא אִיתַּחְזַק אִיסּוּרָא, הָכָא אִיתַּחְזַק אִיסּוּרָא דְּאֵשֶׁת אִישׁ, וְאֵין דָּבָר שֶׁבְּעֶרְוָה פָּחוֹת מִשְּׁנַיִם!
human_translation: Is it comparable? There, the presumption of a prohibition has not here, the presumption of prohibition to a married woman is and nothing involving with whom relations are forbidden fewer than two
llm_translation: Who is similar? There, it is not firmly established as forbidden, but here it is firmly established as the prohibition of a married woman, and there is nothing in the matter of forbidden relationships less than two!

hebrew_text: הָא לָא דָּמְיָא אֶלָּא לַחֲתִיכָה דְּוַדַּאי חֵלֶב, וַאֲתָא עֵד אֶחָד וְאָמַר: בָּרִי לִי דְּשׁוּמָּן הֲוָה — דְּלָא מְהֵימַן! מִי דָּמֵי? הָתָם, אֲפִילּוּ אָתוּ בֵּי מְאָה לָא מְהֵימְנִי. הָכָא, כֵּיוָן דְּכִי אָתוּ בֵּי תְרֵי מְהֵימְנִי — חַד נָמֵי לְהֵימְנֵיהּ, מִידֵּי דְּהָוֵה אַטֶּבֶל, הֶקְדֵּשׁ, וְקֻוֽנָּמוֹת.
human_translation: this is comparable only to a piece that definitely fat, and one witness comes and says: It is clear to me that it is fat, that he is not deemed credible. Is it comparable? There, even one hundred come they are not deemed credible. Here, since if two come they deemed credible, let us also deem one credible. just as it is in untithed produce, consecrated and konamot ,
llm_translation: Here is the English translation of the Talmudic text: "This is not comparable except to a piece of fat that was definitely forbidden, and one witness came and said: 'I am certain that it was sesame oil' — for he is not believed! Who is comparable? There, even if a hundred people came, they are not believed. Here, once two people came and testified — one is believed, as it becomes established, sanctified, and confirmed."

hebrew_text: הַאי טֶבֶל, הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִי דִּידֵיהּ — מִשּׁוּם דִּבְיָדוֹ לְתַקְּנוֹ. אֶלָּא דְּאַחֵר, מַאי קָסָבַר:
human_translation: this untithed produce, what are the circumstances? If is his, because it is within his power to prepare Rather, of another, what does hold
llm_translation: This immersion, how is its status? If it is his own — because it is in his hand to fix it. But if it belongs to another, what does he hold?

hebrew_text: אִי קָא סָבַר: תּוֹרֵם מִשֶּׁלּוֹ עַל שֶׁל חֲבֵרוֹ אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ דַּעַת בְּעָלִים — מִשּׁוּם דִּבְיָדוֹ לְתַקְּנוֹ, וְאִי קָסָבַר: צָרִיךְ דַּעַת בְּעָלִים, וְאָמַר: אֲנָא יָדַעְנָא בֵּיהּ דִּמְתַקַּן, הִיא גּוּפַהּ מְנָלַן?
human_translation: If holds one who separates from his for of another does not require the owner’s knowledge, because it is within his power to prepare it. And if he holds the owner’s knowledge is required and says: I know with regard to it that it is prepared, it itself, from where do we
llm_translation: If he holds: one who contributes his own money to that of his fellow does not require the consent of the owners - because it is in his power to fix it; and if he holds: the consent of the owners is required, and he says: "I know that it is being fixed," where is his body i.e., where is the proof?

hebrew_text: הֶקְדֵּשׁ נָמֵי, אִי קְדוּשַּׁת דָּמִים — מִשּׁוּם דִּבְיָדוֹ לִפְדּוֹתוֹ. אִי קְדוּשַּׁת הַגּוּף, אִי דִּידֵיהּ — מִשּׁוּם דִּבְיָדוֹ לְאִיתְּשׁוֹלֵי עֲלֵיהּ. אֶלָּא דְּאַחֵר, וְאָמַר: יָדַעְנָא בֵּיהּ דְּאִיתְּשִׁיל מָרֵיהּ עֲלֵיהּ, הִיא גּוּפַהּ מְנָלַן?
human_translation: consecrated too, sanctity value, due to it is within his power to redeem it. if inherent sanctity, If his due to it is within his power to request that Rather, of another, and he said: I know with regard to it that its owner requested that itself, from where do we
llm_translation: He sanctified a blemished animal, if the sanctity of the blood — because it is in his power to redeem it. If the sanctity of the body, if it is his own — because it is in his power to stumble over it. Rather, another explanation, and he said: We know concerning it that if his master stumbles over it, where is its body from?

hebrew_text: קֻוֽנָּמוֹת נָמֵי, אִי קָסָבַר: יֵשׁ מְעִילָה בְּקֻוֽנָּמוֹת, וּקְדוּשַּׁת דָּמִים נָחֲתָא לְהוּ — מִשּׁוּם דִּבְיָדוֹ לִפְדּוֹתוֹ, וְאִי קָסָבַר: אֵין מְעִילָה בְּקֻוֽנָּמוֹת, וְאִיסּוּר בְּעָלְמָא הוּא דְּרָכֵיב לְהוּ אַכַּתְפֵּיהּ, אִי דִּידֵיהּ — מִשּׁוּם דִּבְיָדוֹ לְאִיתְּשׁוֹלֵי עֲלֵיהּ,
human_translation: konamot too, if holds there is misuse with regard to konamot , and sanctity value applies to them, because it is within his power to redeem it. And if maintains there is no misuse in konamot , and it is an ordinary prohibition that rides on its shoulders, If is his, because it is within his power to request that
llm_translation: "Kuvnamot namei, if kasavar: yesh me'ilah bekuvnamot, u'kedushat damim nachata lehu - mishum dibyado lifdoto, ve'if kasavar: ein me'ilah bekuvnamot, ve'issur be'alma hu deracheiv lehu akatpeih, if dideih - mishum dibyado le'itsholei aleih."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא דְּאַחֵר, וְאָמַר: אֲנָא יָדַעְנָא דְּאִיתְּשִׁיל מָרֵיהּ עֲלֵיהּ — הִיא גּוּפַהּ מְנָלַן?
human_translation: Rather, to another, and he said: I know with regard to it that its owner requested that itself, from where do we
llm_translation: Rather, another explanation, and it said: "I know that his master has reproached him" - where is his body from?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: מִתּוֹךְ חוֹמֶר שֶׁהֶחְמַרְתָּ עָלֶיהָ בְּסוֹפָהּ — הֵקַלְתָּ עָלֶיהָ בַּתְּחִלָּה. לָא לַיחְמַיר וְלָא לַיקֵּיל!
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira said: Due to the stringency that you were stringent with her, at the end, you are lenient with her at the beginning, not be stringent and not be lenient
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira said: From the strictness that you were stringent upon it at the end - you were lenient upon it at the beginning. Not to be stringent and not to be lenient!

hebrew_text: מִשּׁוּם עִיגּוּנָא אַקִּילוּ בַּהּ רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: Due to a deserted wife, the Sages were lenient with her.
llm_translation: Due to the concern of Iguna, the Rabbis were lenient with it.

hebrew_text: תֵּצֵא מִזֶּה וּמִזֶּה וְכוּ׳. אָמַר רַב: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא שֶׁנִּיסֵּת בְּעֵד אֶחָד, אֲבָל נִיסֵּת עַל פִּי שְׁנֵי עֵדִים — לֹא תֵּצֵא. מַחֲכוּ עֲלֵיהּ בְּמַעְרְבָא: אֲתָא גַּבְרָא וְקָאֵי, וְאַתְּ אָמְרַתְּ לֹא תֵּצֵא? לָא צְרִיכָא, דְּלָא יָדְעִינַן לֵיהּ.
human_translation: she must leave this one and this one. Rav said: They taught only if she married by one witness, but she married on the basis of two witnesses, she does not leave They laughed at him in the West, The man, has come and stands and you say she does not leave No, necessary when we do not know
llm_translation: The text reads: "She shall depart from this one and from that one, etc." Rav said: They only taught this when she was tested with one witness, but if she was tested based on the testimony of two witnesses, she shall not depart. They waited for her in the evening. A man came and stood, and you said she shall not depart? It is not necessary, for we do not know her testimony.

hebrew_text: אִי דְּלָא יָדְעִינַן לֵיהּ, בְּעֵד אֶחָד אַמַּאי תֵּצֵא? לָא צְרִיכָא, דַּאֲתוֹ בֵּי תְרֵי וְאָמְרִי: אֲנַן הֲוֵינַן בַּהֲדֵיהּ מִכִּי נְפַק וְעַד הַשְׁתָּא, וְאַתּוּן הוּא דְּלָא יָדְעִיתוּ לֵיהּ, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיַּכֵּר יוֹסֵף אֶת אֶחָיו וְהֵם לֹא הִכִּירוּהוּ״, וְאָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: מְלַמֵּד שֶׁיָּצָא בְּלֹא חֲתִימַת זָקָן, וּבָא בַּחֲתִימַת זָקָן.
human_translation: If we do not know him, by one witness, why leave? No, necessary when two came and said: We were with him from when he left until now, and it is you who do not recognize him, as it is written: “And Joseph recognized his brothers but they did not recognize him” and Rav Ḥisda said teaches that left without a full beard, and he came with a full beard,
llm_translation: If we do not know him, why should we go to one witness? It is unnecessary, for two people came and said: We were with him from when he left until now, and you are the ones who did not know him, as it is written: "And Joseph recognized his brothers, but they did not recognize him." And Rav Ḥisdah said: This teaches that he went out without a beard and came in with a beard.

hebrew_text: סוֹף סוֹף תְּרֵי וּתְרֵי נִינְהוּ,
human_translation: ultimately they are two two.
llm_translation: At the end, two and two are they.

hebrew_text: וְהַבָּא עָלֶיהָ בְּאָשָׁם תָּלוּי קָאֵי! אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: כְּגוֹן שֶׁנִּיסֵּת לְאֶחָד מֵעֵדֶיהָ.
human_translation: And one who has intercourse with her stands an uncertain guilt- Rav Sheshet said: where married one of her witnesses,
llm_translation: The one who comes upon it with guilt offering hanging stands! Rav Sheshet said: For example, if she tempted one of her witnesses.

hebrew_text: הִיא גּוּפַהּ בְּאָשָׁם תָּלוּי קָיְימָא! בְּאוֹמֶרֶת ״בָּרִי לִי״. אִי הָכִי, מַאי לְמֵימְרָא? אֲפִילּוּ רַבִּי מְנַחֵם בְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי לָא קָאָמַר אֶלָּא כְּשֶׁבָּאוּ עֵדִים וְאַחַר כָּךְ נִיסֵּת, אֲבָל נִיסֵּת וְאַחַר כָּךְ בָּאוּ עֵדִים — לָא אָמַר.
human_translation: she herself stands a uncertain guilt- where she says: It is clear to me. If so, what of stating even Rabbi Menaḥem, son of Rabbi Yosei, stated only where witnesses came and afterward married, but married and afterward witnesses came, he did not state
llm_translation: It (הִיא) is (גּוּפַהּ) its body (בְּאָשָׁם) dependent (תָּלוּי) standing (קָיְימָא)! In saying (בְּאוֹמֶרֶת) "It is clear to me" (בָּרִי לִי). If so, what (מַאי) is meant (לְמֵימְרָא)? Even Rabbi Menachem son of Rabbi Yosei did not say (לָא קָאָמַר) except when witnesses came and then he was tested, but if he was tested and then witnesses came - he did not say.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: שְׁנַיִם אוֹמְרִים ״מֵת״ וּשְׁנַיִם אוֹמְרִים ״לָא מֵת״, שְׁנַיִם אוֹמְרִים ״נִתְגָּרְשָׁה״ וּשְׁנַיִם אוֹמְרִים ״לֹא נִתְגָּרְשָׁה״ — הֲרֵי זוֹ לֹא תִּנָּשֵׂא, וְאִם נִיסֵּת — לֹא תֵּצֵא. רַבִּי מְנַחֵם בְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי אָמַר: תֵּצֵא. אָמַר רַבִּי מְנַחֵם בְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי: אֵימַת אֲנִי אוֹמֵר תֵּצֵא? בִּזְמַן שֶׁבָּאוּ עֵדִים וְאַחַר כָּךְ נִיסֵּת. אֲבָל נִיסֵּת וְאַחַר כָּךְ בָּאוּ עֵדִים — הֲרֵי זוֹ לֹא תֵּצֵא!
human_translation: As it is taught two say dead and two say not dead, two say was divorced and two say was not divorced, this may not marry; and if she married not leave Rabbi Menaḥem, son of Rabbi Yosei, said: leave Rabbi Menaḥem, son of Rabbi Yosei, said: When I say leave When the witnesses came and afterward she married, However, she married and afterward witnesses came, this not leave
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Two say "she is dead" and two say "she is not dead," two say "she was divorced" and two say "she was not divorced" — in this case she may not marry, and if she did marry — she must leave. Rabbi Menachem, son of Rabbi Yosei, said: she must leave. Rabbi Menachem, son of Rabbi Yosei, said: When do I say she must leave? When witnesses came and afterwards she married. But if she married and afterwards witnesses came — she may not leave!

hebrew_text: כִּי קָאָמַר רַב נָמֵי, בִּזְמַן שֶׁבָּאוּ עֵדִים וְאַחַר כָּךְ נִיסֵּת. לְאַפּוֹקֵי מִדְּרַבִּי מְנַחֵם בְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי. וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמַר: טַעְמָא דְּנִיסֵּת וְאַחַר כָּךְ בָּאוּ עֵדִים, אֲבָל בָּאוּ עֵדִים וְאַחַר כָּךְ נִיסֵּת — תֵּצֵא. כְּמַאן — כְּרַבִּי מְנַחֵם בְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי.
human_translation: When Rav spoke too, when witnesses came and afterward she married. to exclude Rabbi Menaḥem, son of Rabbi Yosei, And some say The reason is that she married and afterward witnesses came; however, witnesses came and afterward she married, leave According to whose in accordance with Rabbi Menaḥem, son of Rabbi Yosei.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: When Rav Namei said, when witnesses came and afterwards he was tested. To exclude from Rabbi Menachem son of Rabbi Yosei. And there are those who say: The reason he was tested and afterwards witnesses came, but if witnesses came and afterwards he was tested - he shall depart. Whose opinion? Like Rabbi Menachem son of Rabbi Yosei.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רָבָא: מִנַּיִן שֶׁאִם לֹא רָצָה — דׇּפְנוֹ, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְקִדַּשְׁתּוֹ״, בְּעַל כׇּרְחוֹ.
human_translation: Rava raised an objection From where that if does not want forces him [ dafno ] The verse states, “And you shall sanctify him against his will.
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: From where do we derive that if he does not desire to marry her, he may refuse to do so? The Talmud teaches: "And you shall sanctify him," against his will.

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָמֵי, אִילֵּימָא דְּלָא נִיסֵּת לְאֶחָד מֵעֵדֶיהָ וְלֹא קָאָמְרָה ״בָּרִי לִי״, צְרִיכָא לְמֵימַר דְּדׇפְנוֹ? אֶלָּא לָאו, דְּנִיסֵּת לְאֶחָד מֵעֵדֶיהָ, וְקָאָמְרָה ״בָּרִי לִי״, וְקָתָנֵי דׇּפְנוֹ. אַלְמָא, מַפְּקִינַן לַהּ מִינֵּיהּ!
human_translation: What are the circumstances? if we say that she did not marry one of her witnesses and did not say: It is clear to me, need this be said forces him? Rather, is it not when she married one of her witnesses and she says: It is clear to me, and is teaching forces him? Apparently, they remove her from him,
llm_translation: How so are the laws of damages? If you want to say that it was not tested by one of its witnesses and she did not say, "It is clear to me," do we need to say that it was not tested by one of its witnesses, and she said, "It is clear to me," and the Mishnah teaches that it was tested by one of its witnesses. Therefore, we conclude that we remove her from her status as a witness!

hebrew_text: אִיסּוּר כְּהוּנָּה שָׁאנֵי. וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: מַאי דׇּפְנוֹ — דׇּפְנוֹ בְּעֵדִים. וְאִבָּעֵית אֵימָא: כְּשֶׁבָּאוּ עֵדִים וְאַחַר כָּךְ נִיסֵּת, וְרַבִּי מְנַחֵם בְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי הִיא.
human_translation: A prohibition to the priesthood is different, And if you wish, say: What is forces him? forces him by witnesses. And if you wish, say when witnesses came and afterward she married, and is Rabbi Menaḥem, son of Rabbi Yosei.
llm_translation: Prohibition of priesthood is different. And if you wish, say: What is the meaning of "dofno" - he turned with witnesses. And if you wish, say: When witnesses came and afterwards she was tested, it is in accordance with Rabbi Menachem, son of Rabbi Yosei.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אוֹמֵר: מַאי ״לֹא תֵּצֵא״ דְּקָאָמַר רַב — לֹא תֵּצֵא מֵהֶיתֵּירָהּ הָרִאשׁוֹן.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: What is not leave that Rav said? not leave her being permitted first
llm_translation: Rav Ashei says: What is the meaning of "you shall not go out" that Rav is saying? - You shall not go out from its original permission.

hebrew_text: הָא אַמְרַהּ רַב חֲדָא זִימְנָא, דִּתְנַן: נִיסֵּת שֶׁלֹּא בִּרְשׁוּת — מוּתֶּרֶת לַחְזוֹר לוֹ. וְאָמַר רַב הוּנָא אֲמַר רַב: הָכִי הִלְכְתָא! חֲדָא מִכְּלָלָא דַּחֲבֶרְתַּהּ אִיתְּמַר.
human_translation: Rav said it once. As we learned married without consent permitted her to return to him. And Rav Huna said Rav said: That is halakha . One was stated by inference from the other.
llm_translation: Here is the English translation: Rav Hada said once, as we learned in a Mishnah: If it was moved without permission - it is permitted to return it. And Rav Huna said in the name of Rav: This is the halakha! One thing was stated from the general principle of his colleague.

hebrew_text: אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא שֶׁלֹּא מַכְחַשְׁתּוֹ, אֲבָל מַכְחַשְׁתּוֹ — לֹא תֵּצֵא. בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן? אִילֵימָא בְּבֵי תְרֵי, כִּי מַכְחֲשָׁא לֵיהּ מַאי הָוֵי! אֶלָּא בְּחַד, טַעְמָא דְּמַכְחַשְׁתּוֹ, הָא שָׁתְקָה — תֵּצֵא.
human_translation: Shmuel said: They taught only if she does not contradict However, she contradicts him, not leave With what are we dealing If we say with two if she contradicts him, what of it? Rather, to one the reason is that she contradicts him, if she silent leave
llm_translation: Samuel said: They only taught this law in a case where she did not deceive him, but if she deceived him, she shall not leave with the marriage contract. With what are we dealing? If we say we are dealing with two witnesses, for what reason would she deceive him? Rather, we are dealing with one witness. The reason she does not leave is because she was silent.

hebrew_text: וְהָאָמַר עוּלָּא: כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁהֶאֱמִינָה תּוֹרָה עֵד אֶחָד, הֲרֵי כָּאן שְׁנַיִם, וְאֵין דְּבָרָיו שֶׁל אֶחָד בִּמְקוֹם שְׁנַיִם! הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן — בִּפְסוּלֵי עֵדוּת, וְכִדְרַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה.
human_translation: But didn’t Ulla say wherever that the Torah relies on one witness, this is two and the statement of one has no in a place where two With what are we dealing here? disqualified testimony, and in accordance with Rabbi Neḥemya.
llm_translation: The Gemara asks: And didn't Ula say: In any place where the Torah believed the testimony of one witness, here it believes two, and the words of one are not in the place of two! What are we dealing with here? We are dealing with invalid witnesses, as in the case of Rabbi Nechemyah.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה אוֹמֵר: כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁהֶאֱמִינָה תּוֹרָה עֵד אֶחָד — הַלֵּךְ אַחַר רוֹב דֵּעוֹת. וְעָשׂוּ שְׁתֵּי נָשִׁים בְּאִישׁ אֶחָד כִּשְׁנֵי אֲנָשִׁים בְּאִישׁ אֶחָד.
human_translation: As it is taught Rabbi Neḥemya says: Wherever the Torah relies on one witness, follow the majority of opinions. And they established two women against one man like two men against one man,
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Nechemiah says: In any place where the Torah believed one witness — follow the majority of opinions. And they made two women for one man like two men for one man.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: כֹּל הֵיכָא דַּאֲתָא עֵד אֶחָד כָּשֵׁר מֵעִיקָּרָא, אֲפִילּוּ מֵאָה נָשִׁים — כְּעֵד אֶחָד דָּמְיָין. הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן, כְּגוֹן דְּאָתְיָא אִשָּׁה מֵעִיקָּרָא.
human_translation: And if you wish, say anywhere that one valid witness came initially even one hundred women are considered like one with what are we dealing here? where a woman came initially.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: In every place that one witness comes initially, even if a hundred women - it is like one witness. What are we dealing with here? For example, when a woman comes initially.

hebrew_text: וְתָרְצַהּ לִדְרַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה הָכִי: רַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה אוֹמֵר: כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁהֶאֱמִינָה תּוֹרָה עֵד אֶחָד — הַלֵּךְ אַחַר רוֹב דֵּעוֹת, וְעָשׂוּ שְׁתֵּי נָשִׁים בְּאִשָּׁה אַחַת — כִּשְׁנֵי אֲנָשִׁים בְּאִישׁ אֶחָד אֲבָל שְׁתֵּי נָשִׁים בְּאִישׁ אֶחָד — כְּפַלְגָא וּפַלְגָא דָּמֵי.
human_translation: And amend of Rabbi Neḥemya as follows: Rabbi Neḥemya says: Wherever the Torah relies on one witness, follow the majority of opinions, and they established two women against one woman like two men against one man. However, two women against one man is like half against half,
llm_translation: And she wanted to argue with Rabbi Nechemiah the Kohen: Rabbi Nechemiah says: In any place where the Torah believed one witness — follow the majority of opinions, and they made two women into one woman — it is like two men in one man, but two women in one man — it is like half and half.

hebrew_text: צְרִיכָה גֵּט מִזֶּה וּמִזֶּה. בִּשְׁלָמָא מֵרִאשׁוֹן תִּבְעֵי גֵּט, אֶלָּא מִשֵּׁנִי אַמַּאי? זְנוּת בְּעָלְמָא הוּא!
human_translation: she requires a bill of divorce from this one and from that one. Granted, from the first she requires a bill of divorce, But from the second, why is merely licentious.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Needs a get from this and from this. Granted, from the first one requires a get, but from the second, why? It is mere promiscuity!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: גְּזֵירָה שֶׁמָּא יֹאמְרוּ גֵּירַשׁ זֶה וְנָשָׂא זֶה, וְנִמְצֵאת אֵשֶׁת אִישׁ יוֹצְאָה בְּלָא גֵּט. אִי הָכִי, סֵיפָא דְּקָתָנֵי: אָמְרוּ לָהּ ״מֵת בַּעְלִךְ״ וְנִתְקַדְּשָׁה, וְאַחַר כָּךְ בָּא בַּעְלָהּ — מוּתֶּרֶת לַחְזוֹר לוֹ. הָתָם נָמֵי, נֵימָא: גֵּירַשׁ זֶה וְקִדֵּשׁ זֶה, וְנִמְצֵאת אֵשֶׁת אִישׁ יוֹצְאָה שֶׁלֹּא בַּגֵּט!
human_translation: Rav Huna said: decree lest say this divorced and this married And find a married woman leaving without a bill of divorce. If so, the latter clause that teaches they said to her: Your husband is dead, and she became betrothed and afterward her husband came, permitted to return to There too, let us say this one divorced and that one betrothed and find a married woman leaving without a bill of divorce.
llm_translation: Rav Huna said: A decree was enacted lest people say, "This one divorced her and this one married her," and the wife of a man will be found to be leaving without a divorce. If so, the latter clause of what is taught: They said to her, "Your husband died," and she became betrothed, and afterwards her husband comes – she is permitted to return to him. There too, it should be said: This one divorced her and this one betrothed her, and the wife of a man will be found to be leaving without a divorce!

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם בָּעֲיָא גֵּט. אִי הָכִי, נִמְצָא זֶה מַחֲזִיר גְּרוּשָׁתוֹ מִשֶּׁנִּתְאָרְסָה! כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בֶּן כִּיפָּר, דְּאָמַר: מִן הַנִּשּׂוּאִין — אֲסוּרָה, מִן הָאֵירוּסִין — מוּתֶּרֶת.
human_translation: Actually, requires a bill of divorce If so, find this one remarrying his divorcée after she was betrothed in accordance with Rabbi Yosei ben Keifar, who stated from marriage prohibited from betrothal permitted.
llm_translation: Forever requires a get. If not, this would result in him taking back his divorced wife after she has been betrothed! Like Rabbi Yosei ben Kippar, who said: From the married ones - forbidden, from the betrothed ones - permitted.

hebrew_text: הָא מִדְּקָתָנֵי סֵיפָא: אַף עַל פִּי
human_translation: From that the latter clause teaches: Even though
llm_translation: The text from the Talmud: This is what is taught in the latter part: Even though

hebrew_text: שֶׁנָּתַן לָהּ אַחֲרוֹן גֵּט — לֹא פְּסָלָהּ מִן הַכְּהוּנָּה, מִכְּלָל דְּלָא בָּעֲיָא גֵּט. דְּאִי בָּעֲיָא גֵּט, אַמַּאי לֹא פְּסָלָהּ מִן הַכְּהוּנָּה? אֶלָּא סֵיפָא, אָמְרִי: קִידּוּשֵׁי טָעוּת הֲווֹ.
human_translation: last one gave her a bill of divorce, he has not disqualified her from the priesthood, by inference that she does not require a bill of divorce that if she requires a bill of divorce, why not disqualified her from the priesthood? Rather, the latter clause, say it was a mistaken betrothal.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "If he gave her a final divorce document - he did not disqualify her from the priesthood, because it is not necessary for a divorce document. For if it were necessary for a divorce document, why did he not disqualify her from the priesthood? Rather, the latter part states: they said: betrothals of error are effective."

hebrew_text: רֵישָׁא נָמֵי, אָמְרִי: נִישּׂוּאֵי טָעוּת הֲווֹ? קַנְסוּהָ רַבָּנַן. סֵיפָא נָמֵי לִיקְנְסוּהָ! רֵישָׁא, דַּעֲבַדָא אִיסּוּרָא — קַנְסוּהָ. סֵיפָא, דְּלָא עֲבַדָא אִיסּוּרָא — לָא קַנְסוּהָ רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: the first clause too, say it was a mistaken marriage. The Sages penalized her the latter clause let us also penalize her. The first clause where she violated a prohibition penalized her. the latter clause, when she did not violate a prohibition, the Sages did not penalize her.
llm_translation: Beginning: The first ones said: Are engagements considered a mistaken act? The Rabbis penalized it. The end: Let them penalize it! The beginning, where a prohibition is involved - they penalized it. The end, where no prohibition is involved - the Rabbis did not penalize it.

hebrew_text: אֵין לָהּ כְּתוּבָּה. מַאי טַעְמָא תַּקִּינוּ לַהּ רַבָּנַן כְּתוּבָּה, כְּדֵי שֶׁלֹּא תְּהֵא קַלָּה בְּעֵינָיו לְהוֹצִיאָהּ — הָא תְּהֵא קַלָּה בְּעֵינָיו לְהוֹצִיאָהּ.
human_translation: does not have, marriage contract. What is the reason the Sages instituted a marriage contract for So that she will not be demeaned in his eyes such that divorce her. this she will be demeaned in his eyes such that divorce her,
llm_translation: It is not written for her. What is the reason? The Rabbis established it for her in writing, so that it should not be easy in his eyes to divorce her - for it should be easy in his eyes to divorce her.

hebrew_text: אֵין לָהּ פֵּירוֹת וְלֹא מְזוֹנוֹת וְלֹא בְּלָאוֹת. תְּנַאי כְּתוּבָּה — כִּכְתוּבָּה דָּמֵי.
human_translation: she does not have profits, or sustenance, or worn clothes. stipulations in the marriage contract, are considered like marriage contract
llm_translation: It has no fruits, nor sustenance, nor clothing. A Tannaic teaching — as it is written, "like its writing, so shall its value be."

hebrew_text: נָטְלָה מִזֶּה וּמִזֶּה. פְּשִׁיטָא! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: כֵּיוָן דְּתָפְשָׂה לָא מַפְּקִינַן מִינַּהּ, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: she took from this or from that is obvious. lest you say since she has taken hold we do not remove from her teaches us
llm_translation: She took from this and from this. It is obvious! What might you say: since she has already grasped it, we do not remove it from her, it is evident to us.

hebrew_text: הַוָּלָד מַמְזֵר. תְּנַן הָתָם: אֵין תּוֹרְמִין מִן הַטָּמֵא עַל הַטָּהוֹר, וְאִם תָּרַם, בְּשׁוֹגֵג — תְּרוּמָתוֹ תְּרוּמָה, בְּמֵזִיד — לֹא עָשָׂה וְלֹא כְּלוּם. מַאי לֹא עָשָׂה וְלֹא כְּלוּם? אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: לֹא עָשָׂה וְלֹא כְּלוּם כׇּל עִיקָּר, דַּאֲפִילּוּ הָהֻיא גְּרִיוָא הָדַר לְטִיבְלֵיהּ.
human_translation: the child a mamzer . We learned elsewhere One may not separate from ritually impure to ritually pure and if he separated unwittingly, his teruma is teruma . intentionally, he has done nothing, What He has done nothing? Rav Ḥisda said: He has done nothing at all, that even that griva returns to untithed
llm_translation: The child of a mamzer. We learned there: One does not separate from the impure onto the pure, and if one separated, unintentionally - his contribution is a contribution, intentionally - he did not fulfill and it is not considered. What is meant by "he did not fulfill and it is not considered"? Rav Ḥisda said: He did not fulfill and it is not considered at all, for even if that convert were to return to immerse himself.

hebrew_text: רַב נָתָן בְּרַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא אָמַר: לֹא עָשָׂה וְלֹא כְלוּם — לְתַקֵּן אֶת הַשִּׁירַיִם, אֲבָל תְּרוּמָה הָוֵי. רַב חִסְדָּא לָא אָמַר כְּרַב נָתָן בְּרַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא, דְּאִי אָמְרַתְּ הָוֵי תְּרוּמָה, זִימְנִין דְּפָשַׁע וְלָא מַפְרֵישׁ.
human_translation: Rav Natan, son of Rabbi Oshaya, said: He has done nothing preparing the remaining but is teruma . Rav Ḥisda did not say in accordance with Rav Natan, son of Rabbi Oshaya, as, if you say it is teruma , on occasion will be negligent and not separate
llm_translation: Rav Natan, son of Rabbi Oshaya, said: "He did not do and did not complete - to fix the songs, but it is considered a donation." Rav Chisda did not say like Rav Natan, son of Rabbi Oshaya, for if you say it is considered a donation, sometimes he will transgress and not separate.

hebrew_text: מַאי שְׁנָא מֵהָא דִּתְנַן: הַתּוֹרֵם קִישּׁוּת וְנִמְצֵאת מָרָה, אֲבַטִּיחַ וְנִמְצֵאת סָרוּחַ — תְּרוּמָה, וְיַחֲזוֹר וְיִתְרוֹם! שׁוֹגֵג אַמֵּזִיד קָרָמֵית? שׁוֹגֵג — לָא עֲבַד אִיסּוּרָא, מֵזִיד — קָעָבֵד אִיסּוּרָא.
human_translation: what is different from that which we learned one who separates a serpent melon [ kishut ] and it was discovered bitter, a watermelon and it was discovered spoiled, teruma , and go back and separate Are you raising a contradiction an unwitting of an intentional unwitting did not commit a transgression an intentional did commit a transgression.
llm_translation: What is different from what we learned: If one separates terumah and it is found to be bitter, he should pledge and it is found to be spoiled - it is terumah, and he should return and separate it! Is unintentional like intentional? Unintentional - he did not perform a prohibition, intentional - he performed a prohibition.

hebrew_text: וּרְמִי שׁוֹגֵג אַשּׁוֹגֵג — הָכָא קָתָנֵי: בְּשׁוֹגֵג תְּרוּמָתוֹ תְּרוּמָה, הָתָם קָתָנֵי: תְּרוּמָה, וְיַחְזוֹר וְיִתְרוֹם!
human_translation: And raises a contradiction an unwitting of an unwitting Here, it is taught unwitting, his teruma is teruma , there, it is taught teruma and separate again.
llm_translation: And Remi, who unintentionally commits a transgression - here it is taught: in an unintentional manner his offering is an offering, there it is taught: an offering, and he shall return and offer!

hebrew_text: הָתָם — שׁוֹגֵג קָרוֹב לְמֵזִיד, דְּאִיבְּעִי לֵיהּ לְמִיטְעֲמֵיהּ.
human_translation: There, an unwitting close to an intentional as he should have tasted it
llm_translation: There — unintentional is close to intentional, for he intended for his benefit.

hebrew_text: וּרְמִי מֵזִיד אַמֵּזִיד — הָכָא קָתָנֵי: בְּמֵזִיד לֹא עָשָׂה כְּלוּם, הָתָם תְּנַן: הַתּוֹרֵם מִשֶּׁאֵין נָקוּב עַל נָקוּב — תְּרוּמָה, וְיַחְזוֹר וְיִתְרוֹם!
human_translation: And raises a contradiction an intentional of an intentional Here, it taught an intentional he has done nothing. There, we learned one who separates from that is not perforated, for a perforated teruma , but he must go back and separate
llm_translation: And Remi intentionally from intentionally — here it teaches: with intentional he did nothing, there we learned: one who separates from what is not perforated onto what is perforated — it is terumah, and he shall return and separate!

hebrew_text: בִּתְרֵי מָאנֵי — צָיֵית, בְּחַד מָנָא — לָא צָיֵית.
human_translation: In two vessels he will listen. in one vessel he will not listen,
llm_translation: Between two utensils - you are careful, with one utensil - you are not careful.

hebrew_text: וּלְרַב נָתָן בְּרַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא, דְּאָמַר: לֹא עָשָׂה וְלֹא כְלוּם — לְתַקֵּן שִׁירַיִם, אֲבָל תְּרוּמָה הָוֵי,
human_translation: And according to Rav Natan, son of Rabbi Oshaya, who said he has done nothing preparing the remaining but it is teruma ,
llm_translation: And to Rav Natan, son of Rabbi Oshaya, who said: "He did not do and did not complete - to fix the gates, but it is considered a donation."

hebrew_text: מַאי שְׁנָא מֵהָא דִּתְנַן: מִן הַנָּקוּב עַל שֶׁאֵין נָקוּב — תְּרוּמָתוֹ תְּרוּמָה, וְלֹא תֵּאָכֵל עַד שֶׁיּוֹצִיא עָלֶיהָ תְּרוּמָה וּמַעֲשֵׂר מִמָּקוֹם אַחֵר.
human_translation: what is different from that which we learned from a perforated for that which is a non-perforated his teruma is teruma , but it may not be eaten until he removes of teruma and tithe from another place?
llm_translation: What is the difference from what we learned: From produce that is designated as non-tithed produce - his contribution is a contribution, and it shall not be eaten until he separates from it a contribution and a tithe from another place.

hebrew_text: שָׁאנֵי הָכָא, דְּמִדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא תְּרוּמָה מְעַלַּיְיתָא הִיא, כִּדְרַבִּי אִלְעַאי. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אִלְעַאי: מִנַּיִן לַתּוֹרֵם מִן הָרָעָה עַל הַיָּפָה שֶׁתְּרוּמָתוֹ תְּרוּמָה — דִּכְתִיב: ״וְלֹא תִשְׂאוּ עָלָיו חֵטְא בַּהֲרִימְכֶם אֶת חֶלְבּוֹ מִמֶּנּוּ״.
human_translation: Here, it is different, as by Torah it is full-fledged teruma , in accordance with Rabbi Elai, as Rabbi Elai said: From where with regard to one who separates teruma from poor- for superior that his teruma is teruma ? As it is written “And you shall bear no sin by reason of it, seeing that you have set apart from it its best”
llm_translation: The matter here is different, for regarding Terumah, it is a higher level than from the Torah, as Rabbi Elai. For Rabbi Elai said: From where do we derive that one who separates from the evil for the beautiful, his separation is a true separation? As it is written: "And you shall not bear sin because of it when you have lifted up from it its fat."

hebrew_text: וְאִם אֵין קָדוֹשׁ — נְשִׂיאוּת חֵטְא לָמָּה? מִיכָּן לַתּוֹרֵם מִן הָרָעָה עַל הַיָּפָה — שֶׁתְּרוּמָתוֹ תְּרוּמָה.
human_translation: And if not sanctified why a bearing of sin? From here with regard to one who separated from the bad for the good that his teruma is teruma
llm_translation: "And if there is no holy - why is there a leadership of sin? From here to separate from evil upon beauty - that his contribution is a contribution."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבָּה לְרַב חִסְדָּא: לְדִידָךְ דְּאָמְרַתְּ לֹא עָשָׂה וְלֹא כְּלוּם כׇּל עִיקָּר, דַּאֲפִילּוּ הָהוּא גְּרִיוָא הָדַר לְטִיבְלֵיהּ, מַאי טַעְמָא — גְּזֵירָה דִּלְמָא פָּשַׁע וְלָא מַפְרֵישׁ, מִי אִיכָּא מִידֵּי דְּמִדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא הָוֵי תְּרוּמָה, וּמִשּׁוּם דִּלְמָא פָּשַׁע אַפְּקוּהּ רַבָּנַן לְחוּלִּין? וְכִי בֵּית דִּין מַתְנִין לַעֲקוֹר דָּבָר מִן הַתּוֹרָה?
human_translation: Rabba said to Rav Ḥisda: According to your that you said he has done nothing at all, that even that se’a returns to untithed what is the reason decree, perhaps he will be negligent and will not separate is there anything that by Torah is teruma , and due to Perhaps he will be negligent, the Sages removed to non-sacred And can the court stipulate to uproot something by Torah
llm_translation: Rabah said to Rav Ḥisda: According to your opinion that one who says "I will not do" and "I will not nullify" has not fundamentally done anything, for even if that person immersed himself, what is the reason? - a decree, lest perhaps he transgressed and did not separate himself. For if there is something that is immediately derived from the Torah, it would be considered terumah, and perhaps if he transgressed, the Rabbis would uproot it for secular use? And does the court establish to uproot something from the Torah?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: וְאַתְּ לָא תִּסְבְּרַאּ? וְהָתְנַן: הַוָּלָד מַמְזֵר מִזֶּה וּמִזֶּה. בִּשְׁלָמָא מִשֵּׁנִי מַמְזֵר — אֶלָּא מֵרִאשׁוֹן אַמַּאי? אִשְׁתּוֹ הִיא, וְיִשְׂרָאֵל מְעַלְּיָא הוּא, וְקָא שָׁרֵינַן לֵיהּ בְּמַמְזֶרֶת!
human_translation: said to And you, do you not hold But didn’t we learn the child is a mamzer from this one and from that one? Granted, from the second a mamzer , However, from the first why she is his wife, and is a full-fledged Jew. And they permit him to a mamzeret .
llm_translation: He said to him: And you do not agree? And we learned: A mamzer is from this one and from this one. Granted, if from two mamzerim — but from the outset, why? It is his wife, and Israel is superior, and we permit him with a mamzeret!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ, הָכִי אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: אָסוּר בְּמַמְזֶרֶת. וְכֵן כִּי אֲתָא רָבִין אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אָסוּר בְּמַמְזֶרֶת. וְאַמַּאי קָרֵי לֵיהּ ״מַמְזֵר״ — לְאוֹסְרוֹ בְּבַת יִשְׂרָאֵל.
human_translation: said to Shmuel said as follows: forbidden to a mamzeret . And similarly, when Ravin came he Rabbi Yoḥanan said forbidden to a mamzeret . And why does call him a mamzer ? to prohibited him to Jewish woman.
llm_translation: He said to him, thus said Shmuel: forbidden in mamzeret. And so when Ravin came, Rabbi Yochanan said: forbidden in mamzeret. And why is it called "mamzer" - to forbid him to marry a daughter of Israel.

hebrew_text: שְׁלַח לֵיהּ רַב חִסְדָּא לְרַבָּה בְּיַד רַב אַחָא בַּר רַב הוּנָא: וְאֵין בֵּית דִּין מַתְנִין לַעֲקוֹר דָּבָר מִן הַתּוֹרָה? וְהָתַנְיָא: מֵאֵימָתַי אָדָם יוֹרֵשׁ אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ קְטַנָּה? בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: מִשֶּׁתַּעֲמוֹד בְּקוֹמָתָהּ, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: מִשֶּׁתִּכָּנֵס לַחוּפָּה, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: מִשֶּׁתִּבָּעֵל. וְיוֹרְשָׁהּ, וּמִיטַּמֵּא לָהּ, וְאוֹכֶלֶת בְּגִינוֹ תְּרוּמָה.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda sent to Rabba, in the hand Rav Aḥa bar Rav Huna: And can the court not stipulate to uproot something prohibited by Torah But isn’t it taught From when does a man inherit his minor wife, Beit Shammai say: From when she stands at her height, And Beit Hillel say: From when she enters the wedding canopy. Rabbi Eliezer says: From when she has sexual relations. And he inherits her and becomes impure for her and she eats teruma on his account
llm_translation: Send to him Rav Ḥisda to Rabbah by the hand of Rav Aḥa bar Rav Huna: And does a court have the authority to uproot something from the Torah? And it was taught: From when can a man inherit his minor wife? Beit Shammai say: From when she reaches her stature, and Beit Hillel say: From when she enters the wedding canopy, Rabbi Eliezer says: From when she engages in marital relations. And she inherits from him, and he becomes impure for her, and she eats terumah from his garden.

hebrew_text: בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: מִשֶּׁתַּעֲמוֹד בְּקוֹמָתָהּ. אַף עַל גַּב דְּלֹא נִכְנְסָה לַחוּפָּה? אֵימָא: מִשֶּׁתַּעֲמוֹד בְּקוֹמָתָהּ וְתִכָּנֵס לַחוּפָּה. וְהָכִי קָאָמְרוּ לֵיהּ בֵּית שַׁמַּאי לְבֵית הִלֵּל: דְּקָאָמְרִיתוּ מִשֶּׁתִּכָּנֵס לַחוּפָּה, אִי עָמְדָה בְּקוֹמָתָהּ — מַהְנְיָא לַהּ חוּפָּה, וְאִי לָא — לָא מַהְנְיָא לַהּ חוּפָּה.
human_translation: Beit Shammai say: From when she stands at her height. even though she has not entered the wedding canopy? say from when she stands at her height and enters the wedding canopy. And Beit Shammai said to Beit Hillel as follows: That which you said, from when she enters the wedding canopy, if she stands at her height, wedding canopy is effective for her and if not, wedding canopy is not effective for her
llm_translation: House of Shammai says: "From when she stands in her place." Even though she did not enter the courtyard? Say: "From when she stands in her place and then enters the courtyard." And thus they said to him, House of Shammai to House of Hillel: "For you say, 'From when she enters the courtyard,' if she stood in her place - what benefit is there for her in the courtyard? And if not - there is no benefit for her in the courtyard."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: מִשֶּׁתִּבָּעֵל. וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: אֵין מַעֲשֵׂה קְטַנָּה כְּלוּם! אֵימָא: מִשֶּׁתַּגְדִּיל וְתִבָּעֵל.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: From when she has sexual relations. But didn’t Rabbi Eliezer say the actions of a minor girl are nothing, say from when she matures and has sexual relations.
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: From when he marries. But didn't Rabbi Eliezer say: A minor's act is nothing! I might say: From when he grows up and marries.

hebrew_text: קָתָנֵי מִיהַת יוֹרְשָׁהּ — וְהָא הָכָא, דְּמִדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא אֲבוּהָ יָרֵית לַהּ, וּמִדְּרַבָּנַן יָרֵית לַהּ בַּעַל?! הֶפְקֵר בֵּית דִּין הֶפְקֵר.
human_translation: In any event is teaching he inherits her. But here where by Torah her father, inherits her, and by rabbinic husband inherits her. property declared ownerless by the court is ownerless,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "Her heirs inherit her" - But here, according to the Torah, the father bequeathed it to her, and according to the Rabbis, the husband bequeathed it to her?! The court has declared it ownerless.

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: מִנַּיִן שֶׁהֶפְקֵר בֵּית דִּין הֶפְקֵר — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כֹּל אֲשֶׁר לֹא יָבֹא לִשְׁלֹשֶׁת הַיָּמִים בַּעֲצַת הַשָּׂרִים וְהַזְּקֵנִים יׇחֳרַם כׇּל רְכוּשׁוֹ וְהוּא יִבָּדֵל מִקְּהַל הַגּוֹלָה״.
human_translation: As Rabbi Yitzḥak said: From where that property declared ownerless by the court is ownerless? As it is stated: “And whoever does not come within three days, according to the council of the princes and the Elders, all his property should be forfeited, and himself separated from the congregation of the captivity”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rabbi Yitzchak said: From where do we derive that the court can declare ownerless property as ownerless? As it is stated: "All that does not come within three days, by the counsel of the officials and the elders, shall have all his property forfeited and he himself separated from the congregation of the exile."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אָמַר, מֵהָכָא: ״אֵלֶּה הַנְּחָלוֹת אֲשֶׁר נִחֲלוּ אֶלְעָזָר הַכֹּהֵן וִיהוֹשֻׁעַ בִּן נוּן וְרָאשֵׁי הָאָבוֹת לְמַטּוֹת בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל״, וְכִי מָה עִנְיַן רָאשִׁים אֵצֶל אָבוֹת? אֶלָּא לוֹמַר לָךְ: מָה אָבוֹת מַנְחִילִין בְּנֵיהֶם כׇּל מַה שֶּׁיִּרְצוּ — אַף רָאשִׁים מַנְחִילִין אֶת הָעָם כׇּל מַה שֶּׁיִּרְצוּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar says from here: “These are the inheritances that Elazar the priest, and Joshua, son of Nun, and the heads of the fathers’ houses of the tribes of the children of Israel distributed for inheritance” What do heads have to do with fathers? Rather, to tell you: Just as fathers bequeath to their sons anything they want so too, heads, bequeath to the people anything they want
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said, from here: "These are the inheritances that Eleazar the priest, and Joshua the son of Nun, and the heads of the fathers' houses of the tribes of the children of Israel inherited." And what is the relevance of heads with fathers? Rather, to tell you: Just as fathers bequeath to their children whatever they desire, so too heads bequeath to the people whatever they desire.

hebrew_text: וּמִיטַּמֵּא לָהּ. וְהָא הָכָא, דְּמִדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא אָבִיהָ מִיטַּמֵּא לָהּ, וּמִדְּרַבָּנַן מִיטַּמֵּא לָהּ בַּעַל! מִשּׁוּם דְּהָוְיָא לַהּ מֵת מִצְוָה.
human_translation: becomes impure for her, But here where by Torah her father, become impure for her, and by rabbinic husband defiles himself for her. because she is a corpse with no one to bury it [ met mitzva ],
llm_translation: And he becomes impure to her. But here, since according to the Torah her father becomes impure to her, and according to the Rabbis her husband becomes impure to her! Because it would be a mitzvah for her.

hebrew_text: וּמִי הָוְיָ[א] מֵת מִצְוָה? וְהָתַנְיָא: אֵי זֶהוּ מֵת מִצְוָה — כֹּל שֶׁאֵין לוֹ קוֹבְרִין. קוֹרֵא וַאֲחֵרִים עוֹנִין אוֹתוֹ — אֵין זֶה מֵת מִצְוָה! הָכָא נָמֵי, כֵּיוָן דְּלָא יָרְתִי לַהּ — קָרְיָא וְלָא עָנוּ לַהּ.
human_translation: And is she a met mitzva ? But isn’t it taught Which is a met mitzva ? Any that does not have to bury it. one calls and others answer him, this is not a met mitzva . Here too, since do not inherit her, call and they not answer her,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And who is considered a mitzvah obligation to bury? And it was taught: Who is considered a mitzvah to bury? — Anyone for whom there are no mourners. He reads the Shema and others respond to him — this is not a mitzvah to bury! Here in this case, since they did not come to him — he reads and they do not respond to him.

hebrew_text: וְאוֹכֶלֶת בְּגִינוֹ תְּרוּמָה. בִּתְרוּמָה דְּרַבָּנַן. תָּא שְׁמַע: אָכַל תְּרוּמָה טְמֵאָה — מְשַׁלֵּם חוּלִּין טְהוֹרִים. שִׁילֵּם חוּלִּין טְמֵאִים, סוֹמְכוֹס אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי מֵאִיר: בְּשׁוֹגֵג — תַּשְׁלוּמָיו תַּשְׁלוּמִין, בְּמֵזִיד — אֵין תַּשְׁלוּמָיו תַּשְׁלוּמִין. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֶחָד זֶה וְאֶחָד זֶה — תַּשְׁלוּמָיו תַּשְׁלוּמִין, וְחוֹזֵר וּמְשַׁלֵּם חוּלִּין טְהוֹרִין.
human_translation: And she eats teruma on his account. teruma by rabbinic Come hear ate ritually impure teruma pay ritually pure, non-sacred paid impure, non-sacred Sumakhos says in the name of Rabbi Meir unwittingly, his payment is payment, intentionally, his payment is not payment And the Rabbis say: Both this and that his payment is payment, and go back and pay pure, non-sacred
llm_translation: Eating in his garden terumah. In the terumah of the Rabbis. Come and hear: One who ate impure terumah - he pays with pure common (produce). He pays with impure common (produce), Somechus says in the name of Rabbi Meir: If it was unintentional - his payments are payments, if it was intentional - his payments are not payments. And the sages say: Whether it was unintentional or intentional - his payments are payments, and he goes back and pays with pure common (produce).

hebrew_text: וְהָוֵינַן בַּהּ: בְּמֵזִיד אֵין תַּשְׁלוּמָיו תַּשְׁלוּמִין? תָּבֹא עָלָיו בְּרָכָה, דַּאֲכַל מִינֵּיהּ מִידֵּי דְּלָא (קָ)חֲזֵי לֵיהּ בִּימֵי טוּמְאָתוֹ, וְקָא מְשַׁלֵּם מִידֵּי דְּ(קָ)חֲזֵי לֵיהּ בִּימֵי טוּמְאָתוֹ.
human_translation: And we discussed intentionally, his payment not payment? should be blessed, as he ate something of his that is not fit for him during days of impurity, and he pays something that is fit for him during his days of impurity.
llm_translation: We ask in it: intentionally, are his payments payments? A blessing should come upon him, for he ate from it immediately upon his impurity, and he is paying from it immediately upon his impurity.
