hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רָבָא, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ כְּדִי: חַסּוֹרֵי מִיחַסְּרָא וְהָכִי קָתָנֵי: אָכַל תְּרוּמָה טְמֵאָה — מְשַׁלֵּם כָּל דְּהוּ. אָכַל תְּרוּמָה טְהוֹרָה — מְשַׁלֵּם חוּלִּין טְהוֹרִין, שִׁילֵּם חוּלִּין טְמֵאִים — סוֹמְכוֹס אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי מֵאִיר: בְּשׁוֹגֵג — תַּשְׁלוּמָיו תַּשְׁלוּמִין, בְּמֵזִיד — אֵין תַּשְׁלוּמָיו תַּשְׁלוּמִין. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: בֵּין בְּשׁוֹגֵג בֵּין בְּמֵזִיד — תַּשְׁלוּמָיו תַּשְׁלוּמִין, וְחוֹזֵר וּמְשַׁלֵּם חוּלִּין טְהוֹרִין.
human_translation: And Rava said, and some say unattributed is incomplete, and this is teaching: ate ritually impure teruma , he pays anything, ate pure teruma he pays pure, non-sacred paid impure, non-sacred Sumakhos says in the name of Rabbi Meir: unwittingly, his payment is payment; intentionally, his payment is not payment. And the Rabbis say: Whether unwittingly or intentionally, his payment is payment, and go back and pay pure, non-sacred
llm_translation: And Rava said, and some say it was said to him: when lacking from the pure, and thus it was taught: if one ate impure terumah — he pays everything. If one ate pure terumah — he pays with pure common food. If he paid with impure common food — Somechos says in the name of Rabbi Meir: if it was unintentional — his payments are payments, if it was intentional — his payments are not payments. And the sages say: whether it was unintentional or intentional — his payments are payments, and he goes back and pays with pure common food.

hebrew_text: וְהָא הָכָא, דְּמִדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא תַּשְׁלוּמֵי מְעַלְּיָא הָוֵי, דְּאִי מְקַדֵּשׁ בְּהוּ כֹּהֵן אִשָּׁה — תָּפְסוּ לַהּ קִידּוּשֵׁי, וַאֲמוּר רַבָּנַן אֵין תַּשְׁלוּמָיו תַּשְׁלוּמִין, וְקָשָׁרֵינַן אֵשֶׁת אִישׁ לְעָלְמָא!
human_translation: And here where by Torah is proper payment, that if a priest betroths a woman with them, betrothal with her is valid. And the Sages said, his payment is not payment. And we permit a married woman to all
llm_translation: And here, for from the Torah, payments of trespass-offerings are considered as being of a higher degree, for if one sanctifies a woman with them, they are deemed valid for her betrothal, and the Sages say: His payments are not considered payments, and we connect a woman to a man forever!

hebrew_text: מַאי אֵין תַּשְׁלוּמָיו תַּשְׁלוּמִין דְּקָאָמַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר — דְּבָעֵי לְמֶיהְדַּר שַׁלּוֹמֵי חוּלִּין טְהוֹרִין. אִי הָכִי, סוֹמְכוֹס הַיְינוּ רַבָּנַן!
human_translation: What is His payment is not payment, that Rabbi Meir said? that he is required to go back and pay ritually pure, non-sacred If so, Sumakhos is the Rabbis.
llm_translation: What is "his payments are payments" that Rabbi Meir said? - He requires to return pure secular payments. If so, the Rabbis rely on it!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִיקָא: קָנְסוּ שׁוֹגֵג אַטּוּ מֵזִיד אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rav Ika, said: The between them they decreed an unwitting due to an intentional
llm_translation: Rav Ahah, son of Rav Ika, said: They incurred a penalty unwittingly, then intentionally; there is a distinction between them.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: דָּם שֶׁנִּטְמָא וּזְרָקוֹ, בְּשׁוֹגֵג — הוּרְצָה, בְּמֵזִיד — לֹא הוּרְצָה.
human_translation: Come hear blood that became ritually impure, and sprinkled it unwittingly, is accepted. intentionally, is not accepted.
llm_translation: Come and hear: Blood that became impure and was sprinkled, if it was done unintentionally - it is acceptable; if it was done intentionally - it is not acceptable.

hebrew_text: וְהָא הָכָא, דְּמִדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא אַרְצוֹיֵי מְרַצֵּה, דְּתַנְיָא: עַל מָה הַצִּיץ מְרַצֶּה — עַל הַדָּם, וְעַל הַבָּשָׂר, וְעַל הַחֵלֶב שֶׁנִּטְמָא, בֵּין בְּשׁוֹגֵג בֵּין בְּמֵזִיד, בֵּין בְּאוֹנֶס בֵּין בְּרָצוֹן, בֵּין בְּיָחִיד בֵּין בְּצִבּוּר. וְאָמְרִי רַבָּנַן: לֹא הוּרְצָה, וְקָא הָדַר מְעַיֵּיל חוּלִּין לָעֲזָרָה!
human_translation: And here where by Torah effects acceptance, as it is taught For what does the frontplate effect acceptance? For blood, for meat, and for fat that became impure, whether unwittingly or intentionally, whether by unavoidable accident or willingly, whether of an individual or of the community. And the Sages said does not effect acceptance, subsequently brings in a non-sacred to courtyard.
llm_translation: And here, since from the Torah it is acceptable, as it was taught: "For what does the Tzitz atone? For blood, and for flesh, and for fat that became impure, whether unintentionally or intentionally, whether coerced or willingly, whether for an individual or for the community." And the Rabbis say: "He was not pleased, yet he goes and brings ordinary offerings to the altar!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר חֲנִינָא: מַאי ״לֹא הוּרְצָה״ דְּקָאָמַר — לְהַתִּיר בָּשָׂר בַּאֲכִילָה, אֲבָל בְּעָלִים נִתְכַּפְּרוּ בּוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei bar Ḥanina said what is Does not effect acceptance, that said? in permits to be eaten. However, the owners attain atonement through it,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei bar Chanina said: What is the meaning of "Lo hortzah" that he is saying? — To permit the eating of meat, but the owners are atoned for.

hebrew_text: סוֹף סוֹף קָמִתְעַקְּרָא אֲכִילַת בָּשָׂר, וּכְתִיב: ״וְאָכְלוּ אֹתָם אֲשֶׁר כֻּפַּר בָּהֶם״, מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהַכֹּהֲנִים אוֹכְלִים וּבְעָלִים מִתְכַּפְּרִים! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: שֵׁב וְאַל תַּעֲשֶׂה שָׁאנֵי.
human_translation: Ultimately, eating meat is uprooted, and it is written: “And they shall eat those things with which atonement was made” teaches that the priests eat and owner gains atonement. He said to him: sit and refrain from action [ shev ve’al ta’aseh ] is different. refrain from action,
llm_translation: At the end, the verse of the uprooting of the eating of meat, and it is written: "And they shall eat those for whom atonement was made," teaching that the priests eat and the owners are atoned for! He said to him: Sit and do not make changes.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ, בְּעַאי לְאוֹתוֹבָךְ: עָרֵל, הַזָּאָה.
human_translation: said to I wanted to raise a difficulty against you an uncircumcised man. sprinkling
llm_translation: He said to him, "I want to sign with you: uncircumcised, the impure."

hebrew_text: וְאִזְמֵל, סָדִין בְּצִיצִית.
human_translation: And knife, And cloak, on ritual fringes
llm_translation: And Izmel, a linen garment with tzitzit.

hebrew_text: וְכִבְשֵׂי עֲצֶרֶת, וְשׁוֹפָר,
human_translation: And the lambs sacrificed on Shavuot . And shofar ,
llm_translation: "And the rams of the assembly, and the trumpet,"

hebrew_text: וְלוּלָב. הַשְׁתָּא דְּשַׁנִּית לַן ״שֵׁב וְאַל תַּעֲשֶׂה״ לָא מִיעֲקַר הוּא, כּוּלְּהוּ נָמֵי ״שֵׁב וְאַל תַּעֲשֶׂה״ נִינְהוּ.
human_translation: And a lulav , now that you have resolved for us Sit and refrain from action, is not uprooting, all these are also sit and refrain from action.
llm_translation: "And a lulav. The year that you repeated to us 'sit and do not act,' it is not invalidated, all of them also 'sit and do not act' they are."

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: ״אֵלָיו תִּשְׁמָעוּן״ — אֲפִילּוּ אוֹמֵר לְךָ: עֲבוֹר עַל אַחַת מִכׇּל מִצְוֹת שֶׁבַּתּוֹרָה, כְּגוֹן אֵלִיָּהוּ בְּהַר הַכַּרְמֶל, הַכֹּל לְפִי שָׁעָה — שְׁמַע לוֹ.
human_translation: Come hear “To him you shall listen” even says to you: Transgress one of the mitzvot of the Torah, for example, Elijah at Mount Carmel, everything for hour, listen to him.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Come and hear: 'To him you shall listen' — even if he tells you, 'Transgress any one of all the commandments in the Torah,' such as Elijah on Mount Carmel, everything for a limited time — listen to him."

hebrew_text: שָׁאנֵי הָתָם, דִּכְתִיב: ״אֵלָיו תִּשְׁמָעוּן״. וְלִיגְמַר מִינֵּיהּ! מִיגְדַּר מִילְּתָא שָׁאנֵי.
human_translation: There it is different, as it is written: “To him you shall listen,” And let him derive from Safeguarding a matter is different.
llm_translation: The matter is different there, as it is written: "To him you shall listen." And to derive from it! The matter is different in terms of the language.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: בִּטְּלוֹ — מְבוּטָּל, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: אֵינוֹ יָכוֹל לֹא לְבַטְּלוֹ, וְלֹא לְהוֹסִיף עַל תְּנָאוֹ. אִם כֵּן — מָה כֹּחַ בֵּית דִּין יָפֶה.
human_translation: Come hear: nullify it nullified; the statement of Rabbi Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: He cannot nullify or add to its condition if so, what good is the power of the court
llm_translation: Listen: If it was nullified — it is nullified, the words of Rabbi. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: He cannot neither nullify it, nor add to his stipulation. If so — what power does the court have?

hebrew_text: וְהָא הָכָא, דְּמִדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא בָּטֵל גֵּט, וּמִשּׁוּם ״מָה כֹּחַ בֵּית דִּין״ קָא שָׁרֵינַן אֵשֶׁת אִישׁ לְעָלְמָא! מַאן דִּמְקַדֵּשׁ — אַדַּעְתָּא דְּרַבָּנַן מְקַדֵּשׁ, וְאַפְקְעִינְהוּ רַבָּנַן לְקִידּוּשִׁין,
human_translation: And here where by Torah bill of divorce is nullified, and due to What is the power of the court, we permit a married woman to all one who betroths betroths on the authorization of the Sages, and the Sages nullified the betrothal,
llm_translation: Here is the English translation of the Talmudic text: "And here, where a bill of divorce is nullified from the Torah, and due to the principle of 'the power of the court,' we permit a woman to any man forever! Whoever betroths - it is the knowledge of the Rabbis who betroth, and the Rabbis establish them for betrothals."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבִינָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: הָתִינַח דְּקַדֵּישׁ בְּכַסְפָּא, קַדֵּישׁ בְּבִיאָה מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? שַׁוְּיוּהּ רַבָּנַן לִבְעִילָתוֹ בְּעִילַת זְנוּת.
human_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: works out well when he betrothed with money, he betrothed by sexual relations, what can be said? The Sages equated his relations licentious sexual intercourse.
llm_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: If one consecrated with money, what is there to say if he consecrated with intercourse? The Rabbis have already established his intercourse as illicit intercourse.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב: שָׁמַעְתִּי שֶׁבֵּית דִּין מַכִּין וְעוֹנְשִׁין שֶׁלֹּא מִן הַתּוֹרָה, וְלֹא לַעֲבוֹר עַל דִּבְרֵי תוֹרָה, אֶלָּא לַעֲשׂוֹת סְיָיג לַתּוֹרָה. וּמַעֲשֶׂה בְּאָדָם אֶחָד שֶׁרָכַב עַל סוּס בַּשַּׁבָּת בִּימֵי יְוָנִים — וֶהֱבִיאוּהוּ לְבֵית דִּין וּסְקָלוּהוּ, לֹא מִפְּנֵי שֶׁרָאוּי לְכָךְ, אֶלָּא שֶׁהַשָּׁעָה צְרִיכָה לְכָךְ.
human_translation: Come hear, Rabbi Elazar ben Ya’akov said: I have heard that the court may administer lashes and punish not by Torah not to transgress matters of Torah, but to establish a safeguard for the Torah. And an incident involving a certain person who rode on a horse on Shabbat in the days of the Greeks, and they brought him to the court and they stoned him not because he was deserving of this, but because the hour required it,
llm_translation: Come and hear, Rabbi Elazar ben Yaakov said: I heard that the court administers beatings and punishments that are not from the Torah, not to transgress the words of the Torah, but to make a protective fence for the Torah. And there was an incident with a certain man who rode on a horse on Shabbat in the days of the Greeks - and they brought him to the court and stoned him, not because he deserved it, but because the moment required it.

hebrew_text: וְשׁוּב מַעֲשֶׂה בְּאָדָם אֶחָד שֶׁהֵטִיחַ בְּאִשְׁתּוֹ תַּחַת הַתְּאֵנָה, וֶהֱבִיאוּהוּ לְבֵית דִּין וְהִלְקוּהוּ. לֹא מִפְּנֵי שֶׁרָאוּי לְכָךְ, אֶלָּא שֶׁהַשָּׁעָה צְרִיכָה לְכָךְ! מִיגְדַּר מִילְּתָא שָׁאנֵי.
human_translation: And again, an incident involving a certain person who cohabited with his wife under a fig tree and they brought him to the court and flogged him, not because this fitting for him, but because the hour required it, Safeguarding a matter is different.
llm_translation: And there was an incident with one man who suspected his wife of infidelity beneath the fig tree, and they brought him to the court and they flogged him. Not because it was fitting for this, but because the hour required it! This matter is different.

hebrew_text: וְלֹא זֶה וָזֶה מְטַמְּאִין לָהּ. מְנָלַן? דִּכְתִיב: ״כִּי אִם לִשְׁאֵרוֹ הַקָּרוֹב אֵלָיו״, וְאָמַר מָר: ״שְׁאֵרוֹ״ — זוֹ אִשְׁתּוֹ,
human_translation: Neither this one, nor that one, may become impure for her, From where do we that it is written: “But to his relative, who is close to him, and the Master said: “His relative” is his wife.
llm_translation: "And not this and that they defile her. From where do we derive this? As it is written: 'But for his kin, who is near to him,' and the Master said: 'His kin' - this refers to his wife."

hebrew_text: וּכְתִיב: ״לֹא יִטַּמָּא בַּעַל בְּעַמָּיו לְהֵחַלּוֹ״, יֵשׁ בַּעַל שֶׁמִּיטַּמֵּא, וְיֵשׁ בַּעַל שֶׁאֵין מִיטַּמֵּא. הָא כֵּיצַד? מִיטַּמֵּא הוּא לְאִשְׁתּוֹ כְּשֵׁרָה, וְאֵינוֹ מִיטַּמֵּא לְאִשְׁתּוֹ פְּסוּלָה.
human_translation: And it is written: “He shall not defile himself, a husband among his people, to profane himself” there is a husband who becomes impure and there is a husband who does not become impure. How so? He becomes impure for his fit wife, but he does not become impure for his disqualified wife.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it is written: "A man shall not defile himself among his people to profane himself." There is a husband who becomes defiled, and there is a husband who does not become defiled. How so? He becomes defiled for his wife who is permissible, but he does not become defiled for his wife who is forbidden. English translation: And it is written: "A man shall not defile himself among his people to profane himself." There is a husband who becomes defiled, and there is a husband who does not become defiled. How so? He becomes defiled for his wife who is permissible, but he does not become defiled for his wife who is forbidden.

hebrew_text: וְלֹא זֶה וָזֶה זַכָּאִין בִּמְצִיאָתָהּ וְכוּ׳. טַעְמָא מַאי אֲמוּר רַבָּנַן מְצִיאַת אִשָּׁה לְבַעְלָהּ — כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלָא תִּיהְוֵי לֵיהּ אֵיבָה. הָכָא תִּיהְוֵי לֵיהּ אֵיבָה וְאֵיבָה.
human_translation: Neither this one nor that one is entitled to her found What is the reason the Sages said found of a wife to her husband? So that he should not harbor enmity Here, let him harbor much enmity
llm_translation: "And not this and that are meritorious in its finding, etc. What is the reason that the Rabbis said: The finding of a woman for her husband - so that enmity does not arise. Here, enmity arises and enmity."

hebrew_text: וּבְמַעֲשֵׂה יָדֶיהָ. טַעְמָא מַאי אָמְרִי רַבָּנַן מַעֲשֵׂה יָדֶיהָ לְבַעְלָהּ — מִשּׁוּם דְּקָאָכְלָה מְזוֹנֵי, הָכָא כֵּיוָן דִּמְזוֹנֵי לֵית לַהּ — מַעֲשֵׂה יָדֶיהָ לָאו דִּידֵיהּ.
human_translation: And to her earnings. What is the reason the Sages said earnings Because she eats food. here, since she does not have food, her earnings are not his
llm_translation: "And in the matter of her handiwork. What is the reason that the Rabbis say 'her handiwork belongs to her husband'? - Because she consumes her sustenance. Here, since she has no sustenance, her handiwork does not belong to him."

hebrew_text: וְלֹא מֵיפֵר נְדָרֶיהָ. טַעְמָא מַאי אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא בַּעַל מֵיפֵר — כְּדֵי שֶׁלֹּא תִּתְגַּנֶּה, הָכָא תִּתְגַּנֶּה וְתִתְגַּנֶּה.
human_translation: And may not nullify her vows. What is the reason the Merciful One states a husband may nullify So that not to become repulsive Here, her be highly repulsive,
llm_translation: "And not annuls her vows. The reason what said the Merciful One 'husband annuls' — so that she not be disgraced, here she will be disgraced and be disgraced."

hebrew_text: הָיְתָה בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל נִפְסְלָה מִן הַכְּהוּנָּה וְכוּ׳.
human_translation: was an Israelite woman, she is disqualified from the priesthood.
llm_translation: A daughter of Israel was disqualified from the priesthood, etc.

hebrew_text: פְּשִׁיטָא! בַּת לֵוִי מִן הַמַּעֲשֵׂר אִיצְטְרִיכָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: is obvious was necessary for a daughter of a Levite from the tithe,
llm_translation: It is obvious! The daughter of Levi requires support from the tithe.

hebrew_text: וּבַת לֵוִי מִן הַמַּעֲשֵׂר מִי מִיפַּסְלָא בִּזְנוּת? וְהָתַנְיָא: לְוִיָּה שֶׁנִּשְׁבֵּית, אוֹ שֶׁנִּבְעֲלָה בְּעִילַת זְנוּת — נוֹתְנִין לָהּ מַעֲשֵׂר וְאוֹכֶלֶת. אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: קְנָסָא.
human_translation: And a daughter of a Levite, is disqualified from the tithe by licentiousness? But isn’t it taught a Levite woman who was captured, or where engaged in licentious sexual relations, we give her tithe and she may eat Rav Sheshet said: a penalty
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And the daughter of Levi from the tithe, who disqualifies her with promiscuity? And it was taught: If a Levi woman was captured, or if she engaged in illicit intercourse — they give her tithe and she may eat. Rav Sheshet said: a penalty. English translation:

hebrew_text: בַּת כֹּהֵן מִן הַתְּרוּמָה. אֲפִילּוּ בִּתְרוּמָה דְּרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: daughter of a priest from teruma . even from teruma by rabbinic
llm_translation: Daughter of a kohen from the terumah. Even in the terumah of the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: וְאֵין יוֹרְשָׁיו שֶׁל זֶה וְיוֹרְשָׁיו שֶׁל זֶה יוֹרְשִׁין כְּתוּבָּתָהּ וְכוּ׳. כְּתוּבָּה מַאי עֲבִידְתַּהּ! אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: כְּתוּבַּת בְּנִין דִּיכְרִין.
human_translation: And Neither heirs of this heirs of that inherit her marriage contract. A marriage contract, what is its purpose; Rav Pappa said: the marriage contract of the male sons.
llm_translation: "And the heirs of this one and the heirs of that one inherit according to its writing, etc." What is the meaning of 'its writing'? Rav Papa said: The writing of the building of male heirs."

hebrew_text: פְּשִׁיטָא! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: לְדִידַהּ דַּעֲבַדָא אִיסּוּרָא — קַנְסוּהָ רַבָּנַן, לְזַרְעַהּ לָא קְנַסוּ רַבָּנַן — קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: is obvious. Lest you say with regard to herself, who committed a prohibition, the Sages penalized her, with regard to her offspring the Sages did not penalize them, teaches us
llm_translation: It is obvious! What might you say: regarding the prohibition that he did — the Rabbis penalized her, for sowing it they did not penalize the Rabbis — this is implied to us.

hebrew_text: אָחִיו שֶׁל זֶה וְאָחִיו שֶׁל זֶה חוֹלְצִין וְלֹא מְיַיבְּמִין. אָחִיו שֶׁל רִאשׁוֹן חוֹלֵץ — מִדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא, וְלָא מְיַיבֵּם — מִדְּרַבָּנַן. אָחִיו שֶׁל שֵׁנִי חוֹלֵץ — מִדְּרַבָּנַן, וְלָא מְיַיבֵּם — לָא מִדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא וְלָא מִדְּרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: the brothers of this and the brothers of that perform ḥalitza , and they do not consummate levirate marriage. The brother of the first one performs ḥalitza by Torah But he does not consummate levirate marriage by rabbinic the brother of the second one performs ḥalitza by rabbinic But he does not consummate levirate marriage, neither by Torah nor by rabbinic
llm_translation: His brother of this and his brother of this remove and not perform levirate marriage. His brother of the first removes — from the Torah, and does not perform levirate marriage — from the Rabbis. His brother of the second removes — from the Rabbis, and does not perform levirate marriage — not from the Torah and not from the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: כְּתוּבָּתָהּ עַל נִכְסֵי בַּעְלָהּ וְכוּ׳. אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: בָּתְרָאֵי מוֹדוּ לְקַמָּאֵי, קַמָּאֵי לָא מוֹדוּ לְבָתְרָאֵי.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei says her marriage contract is upon the property of her husband. Rav Huna said: The last concede to the first the first do not concede to the last
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: Its writing on her husband's property, etc. Rav Huna said: The latter ones admit to the former ones, but the former ones do not admit to the latter ones.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן מוֹדֵי לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: דְּמָה בִּיאָה דְּעִיקַּר אִיסּוּרָא — לָא קָנֵיס, וְכׇל שֶׁכֵּן מְצִיאָתָהּ וּמַעֲשֵׂה יָדֶיהָ — דְּמָמוֹנָא הוּא. וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר לָא מוֹדֵי לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: מְצִיאָתָהּ וּמַעֲשֵׂה יָדֶיהָ דְּמָמוֹנָא הוּא — לָא קָנֵיס, אֲבָל בִּיאָה דְּאִיסּוּרָא הוּא — קָנֵיס.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon concedes to Rabbi Elazar. For if sexual relations, which is the main prohibition, did not penalize all the more so her found and her earnings, which money. And Rabbi Elazar does not concede to Rabbi Shimon, her found and her earnings, which money, not penalize but sexual intercourse, which is a prohibition, penalize
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon agrees with Rabbi Elazar: The initial act of prohibition - did not acquire, and certainly its finding and the work of her hands - it is money. But Rabbi Elazar does not agree with Rabbi Shimon: Its finding and the work of her hands, which is money - did not acquire, but the initial act of prohibition - did acquire.

hebrew_text: וְתַרְוַיְיהוּ מוֹדוּ לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי: הָנֵי דְּיָתְבָא תּוּתֵיהּ לָא קָנֵיס, וְכׇל שֶׁכֵּן כְּתוּבָּה דִּלְמִשְׁקַל וּמִיפַּק קָאֵי. וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי לָא מוֹדֵי לְהוּ, כְּתוּבָּה דִּלְמִשְׁקַל וּמִיפַּק — הוּא דְּלָא קָנֵיס, אֲבָל הָנֵי דְּיָתְבָא תּוּתֵיהּ — קָנֵיס.
human_translation: And both concede to Rabbi Yosei these which when she is living under not penalize all the more so marriage contract, which for to take and leave And Rabbi Yosei does not concede to them. a marriage contract, which for to take and leave, not penalize but these when she is living under his penalize
llm_translation: And their dispute they admitted to Rabbi Yosei: those who sit with their backs to the entrance did not acquire, and certainly so if it is written, for when he takes and removes he stands. And Rabbi Yosei did not admit to them, for if it is written, for when he takes and removes — it is that he did not acquire, but those who sit with their backs to the entrance — did acquire.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: קַמָּאֵי מוֹדוּ לְבָתְרָאֵי, בָּתְרָאֵי לָא מוֹדוּ לְקַמָּאֵי. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי מוֹדֵי לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: כְּתוּבָּה, דְּמִדִּידֵיהּ לְדִידַהּ — לָא קָנֵיס, וְכׇל שֶׁכֵּן מְצִיאָתָהּ וּמַעֲשֵׂה יָדֶיהָ, דְּמִדִּידַהּ לְדִידֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: The first concede to the last ones, the last ones do not concede to the first Rabbi Yosei concedes to Rabbi Elazar, a marriage contract, which from him to her, not penalize all the more so her found and her earnings, which from her to him.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: The former ones concede to the latter ones, but the latter ones do not concede to the former ones. Rabbi Yosei concedes to Rabbi Elazar: A written document, if it is from his perspective to hers — he does not acquire, and certainly her discovery and her handiwork, if it is from her perspective to his.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר לָא מוֹדֵי לֵיהּ: מְצִיאָתָהּ וּמַעֲשֵׂה יָדֶיהָ הוּא דְּמִדִּידַהּ לְדִידֵיהּ — לָא קָנֵיס, אֲבָל כְּתוּבָה דְּמִדִּידֵיהּ לְדִידַהּ — קָנֵיס.
human_translation: And Rabbi Elazar does not agree with it is her found and her earnings, which from her to him, not penalize However, marriage contract, which from him to her, penalize
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar does not agree with him: her finding and the work of her hands, that is what caused her to be beloved to him - he did not acquire her, but the written document of her that caused her to be beloved to him - he acquired.

hebrew_text: וְתַרְוַיְיהוּ מוֹדוּ לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: וּמָה הָנֵי, דְּמֵחַיִּים — לָא קָנְסִי, בִּיאָה דִּלְאַחַר מִיתָה — לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן. וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן לָא מוֹדֵי לְהוּ: בִּיאָה הוּא דִּלְאַחַר מִיתָה לָא קָנֵיס, אֲבָל הָנֵי דְּמֵחַיִּים — קָנֵיס.
human_translation: And both concede to Rabbi Shimon, And if these, which in his lifetime, not penalize sexual relations which after the death not all the more so And Rabbi Shimon does not concede to them, it sexual relations, which after death, not penalize However, these during lifetime, penalize
llm_translation: And their opinions agree with Rabbi Shimon: And what are those cases, where the act while alive — one does not incur a penalty, but post-mortem intercourse — certainly not. And Rabbi Shimon does not agree with them: Post-mortem intercourse is a case where one does not incur a penalty, but those cases while alive — one incurs a penalty.

hebrew_text: נִשֵּׂאת שֶׁלֹּא בִּרְשׁוּת וְכוּ׳. אָמַר רַב הוּנָא אֲמַר רַב: הָכִי הִלְכְתָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב נַחְמָן: גַּנָּבָא גַּנּוֹבֵי לְמָה לָךְ? אִי סְבִירָא לָךְ כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, אֵימָא: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, דִּשְׁמַעְתָּיךְ כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן קָאָזְלָה.
human_translation: she married without consent Rav Huna said Rav said: This is the halakha . Rav Naḥman said to him: Why do you steal If you maintain in accordance with Rabbi Shimon, say: halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Shimon, as your halakha follows of Rabbi Shimon.
llm_translation: The stolen item not with permission, etc. Rav Huna said in the name of Rav: This is the halakha. Rav Nachman said to him: Thieves, thieves, what do you need? If you think like Rabbi Shimon, say: The halakha is like Rabbi Shimon, for I heard you saying the halakha is like Rabbi Shimon.

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא: אִי אָמֵינָא הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן — מַשְׁמַע אֲפִילּוּ בְּקַמַּיְיתָא, אֵימָא: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בָּאַחֲרוֹנָה! קַשְׁיָא.
human_translation: And lest you say: If I say halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Shimon, indicate even with regard to the first say The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Shimon with regard to the last difficult.
llm_translation: And if you will say: If I were to say that the halakha follows Rabbi Shimon - understand that even in the town of Kamayta, I would say: the halakha follows Rabbi Shimon in the latter case! This is a difficulty.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: אָמֵינָא, כִּי נָיֵים וְשָׁכֵיב רַב אַמְרַהּ לְהָא שְׁמַעְתְּתָא. הֲלָכָה מִכְּלָל דִּפְלִיגִי, מַאי הֲוָה לַהּ לְמִיעְבַּד — מֵיאנָס אֲנִיסָה?
human_translation: Rav Sheshet said: I say when Rav dozed and was falling asleep he said this halakha . From the fact halakha , that disagree what could she have done? he raped her.
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet said: I said, when Rav was dozing off, she said to him, "Did you hear this?" Is it a halacha derived from a general principle that she disagreed with, what would have caused her to be distressed — was she forced into it?

hebrew_text: וְעוֹד תַּנְיָא: כׇּל עֲרָיוֹת שֶׁבַּתּוֹרָה אֵין צְרִיכוֹת הֵימֶנּוּ גֵּט, חוּץ מֵאֵשֶׁת אִישׁ שֶׁנִּיסֵּת עַל פִּי בֵּית דִּין. עַל פִּי בֵּית דִּין הוּא דְּבָעֲיָא גִּיטָּא, עַל פִּי עֵדִים לָא בָּעֲיָא גִּיטָּא.
human_translation: And it was further taught Any of those with whom relations are forbidden by Torah do not require a bill of divorce except for a married woman who remarried by the court. It is by the court who requires a bill of divorce, based on witnesses she does not require a bill of divorce.
llm_translation: And furthermore it was taught: All forbidden relationships in the Torah do not require a divorce document, except for a married woman who was seduced with the consent of the court. It is the court that requires a divorce document, it does not require a divorce document based on witnesses.

hebrew_text: מַנִּי? אִילֵימָא רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, עַל פִּי בֵּית דִּין מִי בָּעֲיָא גֵּט? וְהָתַנְיָא, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: עָשׂוּ בֵּית דִּין בְּהוֹרָאָתָן — כִּזְדוֹן אִישׁ בְּאִשָּׁה. עַל פִּי עֵדִים — כְּשִׁגְגַת אִישׁ בְּאִשָּׁה. אִידֵּי וְאִידִי לָא בָּעֲיָא גֵּט.
human_translation: Who is If we say Rabbi Shimon, does by the court require a bill of divorce But isn’t it taught Rabbi Shimon says: the court acted with their instruction a willful a man with a woman, based on witnesses, like an unwitting a man with a woman. neither this nor that require a bill of divorce,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Who is the authority? If you say it is Rabbi Shimon, does the court require a bill of divorce? And it was taught: Rabbi Shimon says, "If the court acts on their own authority - it is as if a man acted willfully with a woman. If based on witnesses - it is as if a man acted unintentionally with a woman. In either case, the court does not require a bill of divorce."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לָאו רַבָּנַן הִיא.
human_translation: Rather, is it not the Rabbis?
llm_translation: Rather, it is not according to the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן הִיא, וְתָרֵיץ הָכִי: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: עָשׂוּ בֵּית דִּין בְּהוֹרָאָתָן — כְּכַוּוֹנַת אִישׁ בְּאִשָּׁה [וּבָעֲיָא גֵּט], עַל פִּי עֵדִים — כְּשֶׁלֹּא בְּכַוּוֹנַת אִישׁ בְּאִשָּׁה [וְלֹא בָּעֲיָא גֵּט].
human_translation: Actually, is Rabbi Shimon, answer as follows: Rabbi Shimon says the court acted with their instruction, as though the intention of a man with a woman, and she requires a bill of divorce based on witnesses as though no intention of a man with a woman, and she does not require a bill of divorce.
llm_translation: Forever Rabbi Shimon is, and he explained thus: Rabbi Shimon says: They made a court with their ruling — like the intention of a man with a woman and requiring a divorce document, based on witnesses — when not with the intention of a man with a woman and not requiring a divorce document.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר, לְעִנְיַן אִיסּוּרָא קָתָנֵי, וְהָכִי קָאָמַר: עָשׂוּ בֵּית דִּין בְּהוֹרָאָתָן — כִּזְדוֹן אִישׁ בְּאִשָּׁה, וּמִיתַּסְרָא עַל בַּעְלַהּ. עַל פִּי עֵדִים — כְּשִׁגְגַת אִישׁ בְּאִשָּׁה, וְלָא מִיתַּסְרָא עַל בַּעְלַהּ.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said taught with regard to prohibition and this is what he said: the court acted with their instruction, as though a willful of a man with a woman, and she is forbidden to her husband based on witnesses, as though an unwitting of a man with a woman, and she is not forbidden to her husband.
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said, regarding matters of prohibition, it is taught: And thus he says: If the court acts according to their ruling — it is like a deliberate act of a man with a woman, and she is punished for it. Based on the testimony of witnesses — it is like an unintentional act of a man with a woman, and she is not punished for it.

hebrew_text: רָבִינָא אָמַר, לְעִנְיַן קׇרְבָּן קָתָנֵי: עָשׂוּ בֵּית דִּין בְּהוֹרָאָתָן — כִּזְדוֹן אִישׁ בָּאִשָּׁה, וְלָא מַתְיָא קׇרְבָּן. עַל פִּי עֵדִים — כְּשִׁגְגַת אִישׁ בְּאִשָּׁה, וּמַתְיָא קׇרְבָּן.
human_translation: Ravina said is taught with regard to an offering, the court acted with their instruction, as though a willful of a man with a woman, and she does not bring an offering, based on witnesses, as though an unwitting of a man with a woman, and she brings an offering.
llm_translation: Ravina said, regarding the matter of a minor offering: If the court acted according to their ruling — it is like intentional, a man with a woman, and the offering is not brought. Based on the testimony of witnesses — it is like unintentional, a man with a woman, and the offering is brought.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: הָא קַמַּיְיתָא — רַבָּנַן הִיא, וְתָרֵיץ הָכִי: חוּץ מֵאֵשֶׁת אִישׁ, וְשֶׁנִּיסֵּת עַל פִּי בֵּית דִּין.
human_translation: And if you wish, say This first is the Rabbis, answer as follows: Apart from a married woman and who married by the court,
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: This is before the sages, and interpret thus: Except for a married woman, and one who was raped according to the ruling of the court.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב עוּלָּא: מִי אָמְרִינַן מַאי הֲוָה לַהּ לְמִיעְבַּד? וְהָתְנַן: כָּתַב לְשֵׁם מַלְכוּת שֶׁאֵינָהּ הוֹגֶנֶת, לְשֵׁם מַלְכוּת מָדַי, לְשֵׁם מַלְכוּת יָוָן, לְבִנְיַן הַבַּיִת, לְחוּרְבַּן הַבַּיִת, הָיָה בַּמִּזְרָח וְכָתַב בַּמַּעֲרָב, בַּמַּעֲרָב וְכָתַב בַּמִּזְרָח —
human_translation: Ulla raised an objection Do we say What could she have done? But didn’t we learn wrote to a kingdom that is not suitable [ hogenet ], to the kingdom of Media to the kingdom of Greece, to the building of the Temple to the destruction of the Temple; was in the east and he wrote in the west, in the west and he wrote in the east,
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: Who said what was the intention for it to be done? And we learned in a Mishnah: If one wrote for the sake of a kingdom that is not dignified, for the sake of the kingdom of Media, for the sake of the kingdom of Greece, for the construction of a house, for the destruction of a house, if he was in the east and wrote in the west, in the west and wrote in the east—

hebrew_text: תֵּצֵא מִזֶּה וּמִזֶּה, וְכׇל הַדְּרָכִים הָאֵלּוּ בָּהּ. וְאַמַּאי? לֵימָא: מַאי הֲוָה לַהּ לְמִיעְבַּד! אִיבְּעִי לַהּ לְאַקְרוֹיֵי לְגִיטָּא.
human_translation: she must leave this one and that one, And all these matters to her. But why? Let us say: What could she have done. she should have had the bill of divorce read
llm_translation: She shall go out from this and from this, and all these ways in it. And why? Let us say: What was for her to be done! If she wants, let her be called to the document.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שִׁימִי בַּר אָשֵׁי, תָּא שְׁמַע: הַכּוֹנֵס אֶת יְבִמְתּוֹ וְהָלְכָה צָרָתָהּ וְנִשֵּׂאת, וְנִמְצֵאת זוֹ אַיְלוֹנִית — תֵּצֵא מִזֶּה וּמִזֶּה, וְכׇל הַדְּרָכִים הָאֵלּוּ בָּהּ. וְאַמַּאי? נֵימָא: מַאי הֲוָה לַהּ לְמִיעְבַּד? אִיבְּעִי לַהּ לְאַמְתּוֹנֵי.
human_translation: Rav Shimi bar Ashi said: Come hear one who married his yevama , and the rival wife went and married and this was discovered a sexually underdeveloped woman, leave this one and that one, and all these matters to her. But why? let us say: What could she have done. she should have waited
llm_translation: Rav Shimi bar Ashei said, come and hear: one who gathers his yevamah and her rival and marries her, and she is found to be sterile - she should leave from here and from there, and all these paths are in her. And why? Let us say: what was there for her to become pregnant? Let her seek remedies.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, תָּא שְׁמַע: כׇּל עֲרָיוֹת שֶׁאָמְרוּ פּוֹטְרוֹת צָרוֹתֵיהֶן, הָלְכוּ צָרוֹת וְנִישְּׂאוּ וְנִמְצְאוּ אֵלּוּ אַיְלוֹנִיּוֹת — תֵּצֵא מִזֶּה וּמִזֶּה, וְכׇל הַדְּרָכִים הָאֵלּוּ בָּהּ. וְאַמַּאי? נֵימָא: מַאי הֲוָה לַהּ לְמִיעְבַּד? אִיבְּעִי לַהּ לְאַמְתּוֹנֵי.
human_translation: Abaye said: Come hear: all those with whom relations are forbidden, with regard to said they exempt their rival wives, rival wives went and married, and these discovered a sexually underdeveloped woman, leave this and that, and all these matters to her. But why? Let us say: What could she have done. She should have waited.
llm_translation: Abaye said, "Come and hear: All forbidden relationships for which they said their rivals exempt them, their rivals went and married, and these are the Ilonit women - she will come out from this one and from that one, and all these paths are in it." And why? Let us say: What was there for her to be involved with? If she wanted to be with the strong ones.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא, תָּא שְׁמַע: כָּתַב סוֹפֵר גֵּט לָאִישׁ וְשׁוֹבָר לָאִשָּׁה, וְטָעָה וְנָתַן גֵּט לָאִשָּׁה וְשׁוֹבָר לָאִישׁ, וְנָתְנוּ זֶה לָזֶה וְזֶה לָזֶה,
human_translation: Rava said: Come hear: A scribe wrote a bill of divorce for the man and a receipt for the woman, And erred and gave bill of divorce to the woman and receipt to the man, and they gave this one to that one and that one to this one.
llm_translation: Rava said, "Come and hear: If a scribe writes a bill of divorce for a man and gives it to the woman, or if he gives it to the man and breaks it for the woman, and they mistakenly exchange and give one to the other,"

hebrew_text: וּלְאַחַר זְמַן הֲרֵי הַגֵּט יוֹצֵא מִתַּחַת יְדֵי הָאִישׁ, וְשׁוֹבָר מִתַּחַת יְדֵי הָאִשָּׁה — תֵּצֵא מִזֶּה וּמִזֶּה, וְכׇל הַדְּרָכִים הָאֵלּוּ בָּהּ. וְאַמַּאי? נֵימָא: מַאי הֲוָה לַהּ לְמֶיעְבַּד! אִיבְּעִי לַהּ לְאַקְרוֹיֵי לְגִיטָּא.
human_translation: And after a while that the bill of divorce is in the man’s possession and the receipt in the woman’s possession, leave this one and that one, and all these matters to her. But why? Let us say: What could she have done. she should have had the bill of divorce read
llm_translation: And after a time, behold, the get exits from under the man's hand, and breaks from under the woman's hand — it goes out from here and from there, and all these ways are in it. And why? Let us say: What was there for it to be done! If she wants, let her go to seek a get.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי, תָּא שְׁמַע: שִׁינָּה שְׁמוֹ וּשְׁמָהּ, שֵׁם עִירוֹ וְשֵׁם עִירָהּ — תֵּצֵא מִזֶּה וּמִזֶּה, וְכׇל הַדְּרָכִים הָאֵלּוּ בָּהּ. וְאַמַּאי? נֵימָא: מַאי הֲוָה לַהּ לְמִיעְבַּד! אִיבְּעִי לַהּ לְאַקְרוֹיֵי לְגִיטָּא.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: Come hear: changed his name, or name, the name of his city, or the name of her city, leave this one and that one, and all these matters to her. But why? Let us say: What could she have done. she should have had the bill of divorce read
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said, come and hear: "Shinna is his name and her name, the name of his city and the name of her city - she shall go out from here and from here, and all these paths are in it." And why? Let us say: What was there for her to be involved with! She should have been asked to read the document.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבִינָא, תָּא שְׁמַע: כְּנָסָהּ בְּגֵט קֵרֵחַ תֵּצֵא מִזֶּה וּמִזֶּה כּוּ׳ — אִיבְּעִי לַהּ לְאַקְרוֹיֵי לְגִיטָּא.
human_translation: Ravina said: Come hear: married on a bare bill of divorce, leave this one and this one, She should have had the bill of divorce read
llm_translation: Ravina said, "Come and hear: If she entered with a get of Kerach, she will exit from here and from here - she should be asked to read the get."

hebrew_text: רַב פָּפָּא סָבַר לְמִיעְבַּד עוֹבָדָא בְּמַאי הֲוָה לַהּ לְמִיעְבַּד. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ לְרַב פָּפָּא: וְהָתַנְיָא כׇּל הָנֵי מַתְנְיָיתָא!
human_translation: Rav Pappa thought to take action What could she have done. Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said to Rav Pappa: But isn’t it taught in all these mishnayot
llm_translation: Rav Papa thought to conduct the matter with what was available to him to conduct it. Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said to Rav Papa: "And it was taught in a Baraita: All these teachings!"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: וְלָאו שַׁנִּינְהוּ! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: וְאַשִּׁינּוּיֵי לֵיקוּ וְלִיסְמוֹךְ! (וּפְסַק).
human_translation: said to And we not resolve He said to him: And shall we stand and rely on answers? And ceased
llm_translation: He said to him: And did we not learn them? He said to him: To establish and to rely upon! (And he concluded).

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי, וּלְקָלָא לָא חָיְישִׁינַן. הֵי קָלָא? אִילֵּימָא קָלָא דְּבָתַר נִשּׂוּאִין — הָא אַמְרַהּ רַב אָשֵׁי חֲדָא זִימְנָא, דְּאָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי:
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: And we are not concerned about a rumor. Which rumor If we say a rumor that after marriage Rav Ashi has said this once, as Rav Ashi said:
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said, "And regarding a kalah, we are not concerned." What is meant by 'kalah'? If you say the kalah of a betrothed woman - this is what Rav Ashe said once, as Rav Ashe said:

hebrew_text: כֹּל קָלָא דְּבָתַר נִשּׂוּאִין לָא חָיְישִׁינַן! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: הוֹאִיל וַאֲתַאי לְבֵי דִינָא וּשְׁרֵינַן, כְּקָלָא דְּקַמֵּי נִשּׂוּאִין דָּמֵי וְתִיתְּסַר, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: We are not concerned about any rumor after marriage. Lest you say since she came to the court and they permitted considered like a rumor before marriage, and she should be forbidden, teaches us
llm_translation: All light of after marriage not we are concerned! What that you may say: Since he came to the court and we released, like light of before marriage blood and she became barren, it is evident to us.

hebrew_text: נִיסֵּת עַל פִּי בֵּית דִּין תֵּצֵא וְכוּ׳. אָמַר זְעֵירִי: לֵיתַהּ לְמַתְנִיתִין, מִדִּתְנַן בֵּי מִדְרְשָׁא. דְּתָנֵי בֵּי מִדְרְשָׁא: הוֹרוּ בֵּית דִּין שֶׁשָּׁקְעָה חַמָּה, וּלְבַסּוֹף זָרְחָה — אֵין זוֹ הוֹרָאָה, אֶלָּא טָעוּת.
human_translation: she married by the court she must leave Ze’eiri said: The mishna is not from what was taught the study hall, as it was taught the study hall: the court ruled that the sun had set and later shone, this is not a ruling but an error.
llm_translation: The matter was tested according to the ruling of the court, it shall go out, etc. Zeiri said: It is not in accordance with the Mishnah, as we learned in the study hall. For the study hall teaches: If the court instructed that the sun had set, and ultimately it was seen to rise - this is not instruction, but rather an error.

hebrew_text: וְרַב נַחְמָן אָמַר: הוֹרָאָה הִיא.
human_translation: And Rav Naḥman said is a ruling
llm_translation: And Rav Nachman said: It is a teaching.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: תֵּדַע דְּהוֹרָאָה הִיא, דִּבְכׇל הַתּוֹרָה כּוּלָּהּ עֵד אֶחָד לָא מְהֵימַן וְהָכָא מְהֵימַן, מַאי טַעְמָא? לָאו מִשּׁוּם דְּהוֹרָאָה הִיא. אָמַר רָבָא: תֵּדַע דְּטָעוּת הוּא, דְּאִילּוּ הוֹרוּ בֵּית דִּין בְּחֵלֶב וּבְדָם לְהֶיתֵּירָא, וַהֲדַר חֲזוֹ טַעְמָא לְאִיסּוּרָא, כִּי הָדְרִי וְאָמְרִי לְהֶיתֵּירָא — לָא מַשְׁגְּחִינַן בְּהוּ.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said: know that is a ruling, in the entire Torah one witness is not deemed credible, and here he is deemed credible. What is the reason not because it is a ruling, Rava said know that is an error. that had the court ruled with regard to forbidden fat or with regard to blood that permitted, and they went back and saw a reason to prohibit if retract and say that permitted we take no notice of them.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said: Know that it is a teaching, for in all the entire Torah, one witness is not believed, but here one witness is believed. What is the reason? Not because it is a teaching. Rava said: Know that it is a mistake, for if the court had permitted fat and blood, and then they reconsidered and said it is prohibited, when they reconsider and say it is permitted again, we do not pay attention to them.

hebrew_text: וְאִילּוּ, הֵיכָא דַּאֲתָא עֵד אֶחָד — שְׁרֵינָא. אֲתוֹ תְּרֵי — אֲסַרְנָא. כִּי הֲדַר אֲתָא עֵד אַחֲרִינָא — שָׁרֵינַן לַהּ. מַאי טַעְמָא, לָאו מִשּׁוּם דְּטָעוּת הוּא?!
human_translation: Whereas when one witness comes permits two come they render forbidden. When one witness again comes they permit What is the reason not because it is an error
llm_translation: And if, where one witness came - we believe him. Two came - we disqualify. When another witness comes - we believe him. What is the reason? Is it not because it is not due to error?!

hebrew_text: וְאַף רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר סָבַר דְּטָעוּת הוּא, דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: יִקּוֹב הַדִּין אֶת הָהָר, וְתָבִיא חַטַּאת שְׁמֵינָה. אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא דְּטָעוּת הוּא — מִשּׁוּם הָכִי מַתְיָא קׇרְבָּן, אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ דְּהוֹרָאָה הִיא, אַמַּאי מַתְיָא קׇרְבָּן?
human_translation: And Rabbi Eliezer also maintains that is an error, as it is taught Rabbi Eliezer says: let the law pierce the mountain, and she brings a choice sin-offering. Granted, if you say that it is an error, due to that she must bring an offering. However, if you say it is a ruling, why does she bring an offering?
llm_translation: And even Rabbi Eliezer holds that it is a mistake, as it was taught: Rabbi Eliezer says, "Let the judgment pierce the mountain, and bring the sin offering of its name." If you say it is a mistake - for this reason the offering is brought. But if you say it is a teaching, why is the offering brought?

hebrew_text: וְדִלְמָא קָסָבַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר יָחִיד שֶׁעָשָׂה בְּהוֹרָאַת בֵּית דִּין חַיָּיב?! אִם כֵּן, מָה ״יִקּוֹב הַדִּין אֶת הָהָר״.
human_translation: But perhaps Rabbi Eliezer maintains an individual who acted by ruling of the court liable If so, what Let the law pierce the mountain?
llm_translation: And perhaps Rabbi Eliezer holds that an individual who acts in accordance with the ruling of the court is liable?! If so, what does "the law will pierce the mountain" mean?

hebrew_text: הוֹרוּהָ בֵּית דִּין לְהִנָּשֵׂא כּוּ׳. מַאי ״קִלְקְלָה״? רַבִּי אֶלְיעָזָר אוֹמֵר: זִינְּתָה. רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: אַלְמָנָה לְכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל, גְּרוּשָׁה וַחֲלוּצָה לְכֹהֵן הֶדְיוֹט.
human_translation: the court instructed her to marry, What is Ruined herself? Rabbi Eliezer says: She engaged in licentious sexual relations Rabbi Yoḥanan said: a widow to a High Priest, a divorcée or a yevama who performed ḥalitza [ ḥalutza ] to a common priest.
llm_translation: They instructed the court to marry her. What is "disgrace"? Rabbi Eliezer says: she was promiscuous. Rabbi Yochanan says: a widow to a High Priest, a divorcee and a halutzah to an ordinary priest.

hebrew_text: מַאן דְּאָמַר זִינְּתָה — כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן אַלְמָנָה לְכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל. מַאן דְּאָמַר אַלְמָנָה לְכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל, אֲבָל זִינְּתָה — לָא. מַאי טַעְמָא — [דְּאָמְרָה] אַתּוּן הוּא דְּשַׁוִּיתוּן פְּנוּיָה.
human_translation: the one who says she engaged in licentious sexual relations, all the more so a widow with a High Priest, the one who says a widow with a High Priest, however, she engaged in licentious sexual relations not What is the reason? As she can say: you who deemed me unattached,
llm_translation: One who says "she was married" - all the more so a widow to the High Priest. One who says "a widow to the High Priest," but "she was married" - no. What is the reason? Because you are the ones who made her designated.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הוֹרוּהָ בֵּית דִּין לְהִנָּשֵׂא וְהָלְכָה וְקִלְקְלָה, כְּגוֹן: אַלְמָנָה לְכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל, גְּרוּשָׁה וַחֲלוּצָה לְכֹהֵן הֶדְיוֹט — חַיֶּיבֶת בְּקׇרְבָּן עַל כׇּל בִּיאָה וּבִיאָה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר,
human_translation: is taught in accordance with Rabbi Yoḥanan: the court ruled that she may marry, and she went and ruined for example a widow with a High Priest, a divorcée or a ḥalutza with a common priest, she is liable to an offering for each and every sexual act, the statement of Rabbi Elazar.
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Rabbi Yochanan: The court instructed her to marry, and the halakha is that she is obligated to bring a sacrifice for each act of intercourse, such as a widow to a High Priest, a divorced woman or a redeemed bondwoman to an ordinary priest - she is obligated to bring a sacrifice for each act of intercourse. These are the words of Rabbi Elazar.

hebrew_text: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: קׇרְבָּן אֶחָד עַל הַכֹּל. וּמוֹדִים חֲכָמִים לְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר שֶׁאִם נִשֵּׂאת לַחֲמִשָּׁה בְּנֵי אָדָם — שֶׁחַיֶּיבֶת בְּקׇרְבָּן עַל כׇּל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד, הוֹאִיל וְגוּפִין מוּחְלָקִין.
human_translation: And the Rabbis say one offering for all And the Rabbis concede to Rabbi Elazar that if married to five people, that she is liable to an offering for each and every one since separate bodies.
llm_translation: The sages say: "One offering for all." And the sages agree with Rabbi Eliezer that if it is lifted by five people - it is obligated in an offering for each and every one, since the bodies are divided.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הָאִשָּׁה שֶׁהָלַךְ בַּעְלָהּ וּבְנָהּ לִמְדִינַת הַיָּם, וּבָאוּ וְאָמְרוּ לָהּ: מֵת בַּעְלִיךְ וְאַחַר כָּךְ מֵת בְּנֵךְ, וְנִשֵּׂאת, וְאַחַר כָּךְ אָמְרוּ לָהּ: חִילּוּף הָיוּ הַדְּבָרִים — תֵּצֵא, וְהַוָּלָד רִאשׁוֹן וְאַחֲרוֹן מַמְזֵר.
human_translation: a woman whose husband and child went overseas, and came and said to her: Your husband died and afterward your child died, And married And afterward they said to her the matters were reversed, she must leave And the first child, and the last one, a mamzer .
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: A woman whose husband and son went to the province of the sea, and they came and said to her: "Your husband has died, and afterwards your son died," and she remarried, and afterwards they said to her: "The matters were mistaken" — she should leave, and the firstborn and lastborn are mamzerim.

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ לָהּ: מֵת בְּנֵךְ וְאַחַר כָּךְ מֵת בַּעְלִיךְ, וְנִתְיַיבְּמָה, וְאַחַר כָּךְ אָמְרוּ לָהּ: חִילּוּף הָיוּ הַדְּבָרִים — תֵּצֵא, וְהַוָּלָד רִאשׁוֹן וְאַחֲרוֹן מַמְזֵר. אָמְרוּ לָהּ: מֵת בַּעְלִיךְ וְנִיסֵּת, וְאַחַר כָּךְ אָמְרוּ לָהּ: קַיָּים הָיָה וָמֵת — תֵּצֵא, וְהַוָּלָד רִאשׁוֹן — מַמְזֵר, וְהָאַחֲרוֹן — אֵינוֹ מַמְזֵר.
human_translation: they said to her: Your child died and afterward your husband died, and she entered into levirate marriage, and afterward they said to her the matters were reversed, she must leave and the first child and the last one a mamzer . they said to her: Your husband died, and she married, and afterward they said to her he was alive and he died, she must leave And the first child, a mamzer , and the last one, is not a mamzer .
llm_translation: They said to her: "Your son died, and afterwards your husband died, and she was married, and afterwards they said to her: 'The matters were confused' — she shall leave, and the firstborn child is a mamzer. They said to her: "Your husband died and you remarried, and afterwards they said to her: 'He was alive and then died' — she shall leave, and the firstborn is a mamzer, and the latter is not a mamzer."

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ לָהּ: מֵת בַּעְלִיךְ, וְנִתְקַדְּשָׁה, וְאַחַר כָּךְ בָּא בַּעְלָהּ — מוּתֶּרֶת לַחְזוֹר לוֹ. אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁנָּתַן לָהּ אַחֲרוֹן גֵּט — לֹא פְּסָלָהּ מִן הַכְּהוּנָּה. אֶת זוֹ דָּרַשׁ רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן מַתְיָא: ״וְאִשָּׁה גְּרוּשָׁה מֵאִישָׁהּ״ — וְלֹא מֵאִישׁ שֶׁאֵינוֹ אִישָׁהּ.
human_translation: they said to her: Your husband died, and she became betrothed and afterward her husband came, she is permitted to return to him, although last gave her a bill of divorce, not disqualified her This was taught by Rabbi Elazar ben Matya: “Neither a woman divorced from her husband” And not from a man who is not her husband,
llm_translation: They said to her: "If your husband dies, and you become consecrated, and afterwards her husband comes — she is permitted to return to him. Even though he gave her a divorce afterwards — it does not disqualify her from the priesthood." This is what Rabbi Elazar ben Matya expounded: "And a woman who is divorced from her husband" — and not from a man who is not her husband.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי רִאשׁוֹן וּמַאי אַחֲרוֹן? אִילֵּימָא רִאשׁוֹן — לִפְנֵי שְׁמוּעָה, וְאַחֲרוֹן — לְאַחַר שְׁמוּעָה, לִיתְנֵי: הַוָּלָד מַמְזֵר!
human_translation: What is first and what is last If we say first before hearing and last after heard, let him teach The offspring is a mamzer ,
llm_translation: Gemara: What is "first" and what is "last"? If you say "first" - before hearing, and "last" - after hearing, let it teach: A mamzer is born!

hebrew_text: מִשּׁוּם דְּקָבָעֵי לְמִיתְנֵי סֵיפָא: אָמְרוּ לָהּ מֵת בַּעְלִיךְ וְנִשֵּׂאת, וְאַחַר כָּךְ אָמְרוּ לָהּ קַיָּים הָיָה וּמֵת, הָרִאשׁוֹן מַמְזֵר וְהָאַחֲרוֹן אֵינוֹ מַמְזֵר — תְּנָא נָמֵי רֵישָׁא רִאשׁוֹן וְאַחֲרוֹן מַמְזֵר.
human_translation: because wanted to teach latter clause: they said to her your husband died, and she married, and afterward they said to her he was alive and he died, the first a mamzer and the last one is not a mamzer , he also taught first clause: first and last mamzer ,
llm_translation: Due to the fact that they established to teach the latter part: they said to her, "Your husband died and you may remarry," and afterwards they said to her, "He was alive and then died," the first one is a mamzer and the latter one is not a mamzer - a Tanna taught in the first part: the first and the last are mamzerim.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: זוֹ דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, שֶׁהָיָה אוֹמֵר: אֵין קִדּוּשִׁין תּוֹפְסִין בְּחַיָּיבֵי לָאוִין. אֲבָל חֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֵין מַמְזֵר מִיְּבָמָה. וְלֵימָא: אֵין מַמְזֵר מֵחַיָּיבֵי לָאוִין!
human_translation: The Sages taught: This the statement of Rabbi Akiva, who would say betrothal does not take effect for liable for prohibitions, However, the Rabbis say there is no mamzer from a yevama . And let say, There is no mamzer from liable for prohibitions.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: These are the words of Rabbi Akiva, who used to say: betrothals do not take effect with those who are obligated in negative commandments. But the Sages say: a mamzer does not perform the rite of levirate marriage. And let us say: a mamzer does not come from those who are obligated in negative commandments!

hebrew_text: הַאי תַּנָּא — הָךְ תַּנָּא דְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא הוּא, דְּאָמַר: מֵחַיָּיבֵי לָאוִין דִּשְׁאֵר הָוֵי מַמְזֵר, מֵחַיָּיבֵי לָאוִין גְּרִידִי — לָא הָוֵי מַמְזֵר. אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה
human_translation: This tanna is tanna Rabbi Akiva, that said from liable for prohibitions close is a mamzer , from liable for regular prohibitions, is not a mamzer . Rav Yehuda said
llm_translation: This Mishna - so did the Mishna of Rabbi Akiva, who said: From those liable to the prohibition of "Shetar" will be a Mamzer, from those liable to the prohibition of "Geridi" - will not be a Mamzer. Rav Yehuda said:

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב: מִנַּיִן שֶׁאֵין קִדּוּשִׁין תּוֹפְסִין בִּיבָמָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לֹא תִהְיֶה אֵשֶׁת הַמֵּת הַחוּצָה לְאִישׁ זָר״ — לֹא תְּהֵא בָּהּ הֲוָיָה לְזָר.
human_translation: Rav said: From where that betrothal does not take effect with a yevama ? As it is stated: “The wife of the dead man shall not be married outside of the family to one not of his kin” She shall not have becoming to one not of his kin,
llm_translation: Rav said: From where do we derive that the sanctifications do not take effect with a yevamah? As it is stated: "The wife of the deceased outside to a stranger shall not be" — she shall not be a possession for a stranger.

hebrew_text: וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: בַּעֲנִיּוּתֵינוּ, צְרִיכָה גֵּט. מְסַפְּקָא לֵיהּ לִשְׁמוּאֵל הַאי ״לָא תִהְיֶה אֵשֶׁת הַמֵּת״, אִי לְלָאו הוּא דַּאֲתָא, אִי דְּלָא תָּפְסִי בַּהּ קִדּוּשִׁין הוּא דַּאֲתָא.
human_translation: And Shmuel said: In our poverty she requires a bill of divorce. Shmuel was uncertain with regard to this “The wife of the dead man shall not be married whether it comes for a prohibition, whether comes that betrothal does not take effect with her.
llm_translation: Samuel said: In our poverty, she requires a divorce document. It is a question for Samuel: this "the wife of the deceased shall not be married to a stranger," whether it is without him that it comes, or whether it is that she did not accept betrothal with him.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב מָרִי בַּר רָחֵל לְרַב אָשֵׁי, הָכִי אָמַר אַמֵּימָר: הֲלָכָה כְּווֹתֵיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל. אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: הַשְׁתָּא דְּאָמַר אַמֵּימָר הִלְכְתָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל — אִם הָיָה יְבָמָהּ כֹּהֵן, חוֹלֵץ לָהּ, וְשַׁרְיָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Mari bar Raḥel said to Rav Ashi Ameimar said as follows: The halakha is in accordance Shmuel. Rav Ashi said: Now that Ameimar said the halakha is in accordance Shmuel, if her yavam was a priest, he performs ḥalitza with her, and she is permitted to
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Mari son of Rachel said to Rav Ashi, thus said Amemar: the halakha is in accordance with the opinion of Shmuel. Rav Ashi said: now that Amemar said the halakha is in accordance with the opinion of Shmuel - if her yavam was a kohen, he performs chalitzah for her, and he may marry her.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּגוֹרֵי אִיתְּגַר, אִם כֵּן מָצִינוּ חוֹטֵא נִשְׂכָּר! אֶלָּא, אִם הָיָה יְבָמָהּ יִשְׂרָאֵל, נוֹתֵן לָהּ שֵׁנִי גֵּט, וְהוּתְּרָה לוֹ.
human_translation: gains If so, we find a sinner benefiting Rather, If her yavam was Israelite, second must give her a bill of divorce, and she is permitted to
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "If there are converts, there are converts; if so, we find a sinner rewarded! Rather, if her yevamah was an Israelite, he gives her a second bill of divorce, and he is permitted to her."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב גִּידֵּל אָמַר רַב חִיָּיא בַּר יוֹסֵף אָמַר רַב: יְבָמָה — קִדּוּשִׁין אֵין בָּהּ, נִשּׂוּאִין יֵשׁ בָּהּ. אִי קִדּוּשִׁין אֵין בָּהּ — נִשּׂוּאִין נָמֵי אֵין בָּהּ! אֵימָא: קִדּוּשִׁין וְנִשּׂוּאִין אֵין בָּהּ.
human_translation: Rav Giddel said Rav Ḥiyya bar Yosef said Rav said: a yevama , betrothal does not to her, marriage does to her. If betrothal does not to her, marriage also not to her. say: Neither betrothal nor marriage to her.
llm_translation: Rav Giddel said, Rav Hiyya bar Yosef said Rav: Yevamah - there is no betrothal in her, there is marriage in her. If there is no betrothal in her - is there also no marriage in her! Say: There is neither betrothal nor marriage in her.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: מַאי ״נִשּׂוּאִין יֵשׁ בָּהּ״ — בִּזְנוּת, כִּדְרַב הַמְנוּנָא. דְּאָמַר רַב הַמְנוּנָא: שׁוֹמֶרֶת יָבָם שֶׁזִּינְּתָה — אֲסוּרָה לִיבָמָהּ.
human_translation: And if you wish, say What is Marriage does to her? to licentious sexual relations. in accordance with Rav Hamnuna, as Rav Hamnuna said a widow awaiting her yavam who committed an act of licentious sexual relations is forbidden to her yavam .
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: What is "it has been engaged in" - in prostitution, as Rav Hamnuna said: For Rav Hamnuna said: A yevamah who committed adultery is forbidden to her yavam.

hebrew_text: וְאִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא, לְעוֹלָם כְּדַאֲמַרַן מֵעִיקָּרָא: קִדּוּשִׁין אֵין בָּהּ, נִשּׂוּאִין יֵשׁ בָּהּ. דְּמִיחַלְּפָא בְּאִשָּׁה שֶׁהָלַךְ בַּעְלָהּ לִמְדִינַת הַיָּם.
human_translation: And if you wish, say: Actually, as we said initially, betrothal does not to her marriage does to her. as confuse with a woman whose husband went overseas.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: Always as we said initially: There is no sanctity in it, but there is betrothal. For he exchanged her for a woman whose husband went to the overseas province.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יַנַּאי: בַּחֲבוּרָה, נִמְנוּ וְגָמְרוּ: אֵין קִדּוּשִׁין תּוֹפְסִין בִּיבָמָה. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: רַבִּי, לֹא מִשְׁנָתֵנוּ הִיא זוֹ? דִּתְנַן, הָאוֹמֵר לָאִשָּׁה: ״הֲרֵי אַתְּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת לִי לְאַחַר שֶׁאֶתְגַּיֵּיר״, ״לְאַחַר שֶׁתִּתְגַּיְּירִי״, ״לְאַחַר שֶׁאֶשְׁתַּחְרֵר״, ״לְאַחַר שֶׁתִּשְׁתַּחְרְרִי״, ״לְאַחַר שֶׁיָּמוּת בַּעְלִיךְ״, ״לְאַחַר שֶׁתָּמוּת אֲחוֹתִיךְ״, אוֹ ״לְאַחַר שֶׁיַּחְלוֹץ לִיךְ יְבָמִיךְ״ — אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִי לָאו דְּדַלַּאי לָךְ חַסְפָּא, מִי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ מַרְגָּנִיתָא תּוּתֵיהּ?
human_translation: Rabbi Yannai said: In the group they counted and concluded betrothal does not take effect with a yevama . Rabbi Yoḥanan said to him: My teacher, is this not a mishna As we learned one who says to a woman: You are hereby betrothed to me after I convert; after you convert; after I am freed after you are freed; after your husband dies; after your sister dies; after your yavam performs ḥalitza with you, she is not betrothed. said to Had I not lifted the earthenware shard for you, would you have discovered the pearl marganita beneath it?
llm_translation: Rabbi Yannai said: In a group, they counted and concluded: betrothals do not take effect with a yevamah. Rabbi Yochanan said to him: Rabbi, is this not from our Mishnah? As we learned: One who says to a woman, "Behold, you are betrothed to me after you convert," "after you have converted," "after you are freed," "after you have been freed," "after your husband dies," "after your sister dies," or "after your yavam performs chalitzah for you" — she is not betrothed. He said to him: If it is not because you lack money, would you forget your precious pearl?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: אִי לָאו דְּקַלְּסָךְ גַּבְרָא רַבָּה, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא לָךְ אֲנָא: מַתְנִיתִין רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא הִיא, דְּאָמַר: אֵין קִידּוּשִׁין תּוֹפְסִין בְּחַיָּיבֵי לָאוִין.
human_translation: Reish Lakish said If not that a great man, praised you, I would say the mishna is Rabbi Akiva, who said betrothal does not take effect for liable for prohibitions,
llm_translation: He said to him Resh Lakish: If not that a great man has rebuked you, I would have said to you: It is a Mishnah of Rabbi Akiva, who said: Betrothals do not take effect with those who are not obligated.

hebrew_text: וְאִי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, כִּי אָמַר לַהּ ״לְאַחַר שֶׁיַּחֲלוֹץ לִיךְ יְבָמִיךְ״ לִיתְפְּסוּ בָּהּ קִידּוּשֵׁי! דְּהָא שָׁמְעִינַן לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא דְּאָמַר: אָדָם מַקְנֶה דָּבָר שֶׁלֹּא בָּא לָעוֹלָם. דִּתְנַן:
human_translation: And if Rabbi Akiva, when he said to her: After your yavam performs ḥalitza for you, let the betrothal take effect with her, as we have heard that Rabbi Akiva said a man can transfer an entity that has not come into the world. as we learned
llm_translation: If Rabbi Akiva, when he said to her, "After your yavam removes his shoe from you," they should be betrothed to her! For we have heard him say, Rabbi Akiva said: A person acquires something that has not come into the world. As we learned:

hebrew_text: קֻוֽנָּם שֶׁאֲנִי עוֹשָׂה לְפִיךָ — אֵין צָרִיךְ לְהָפֵר.
human_translation: Konam , that I will prepare for your mouth, he is not required to nullify
llm_translation: Their measure that I am doing according to your mouth — there is no need to annul.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: יָפֵר, שֶׁמָּא תַּעֲדִיף עָלָיו יוֹתֵר מִן הָרָאוּי לוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: nullify lest she exceed more than is fitting for him.
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: Beautiful, lest you prefer him more than is fitting for him.

hebrew_text: הָא אִיתְּמַר עֲלַהּ: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: בְּאוֹמֶרֶת: ״יִקְדְּשׁוּ יָדַי לְעוֹשֵׂיהֶם״, דְּיָדַיִם אִיתַנְהוּ בְּעָלְמָא.
human_translation: But wasn’t it stated with regard to that Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said: to who says: Let my hands be consecrated to their Maker. Since hands in the world,
llm_translation: Here is the English translation: It was stated about it: Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said in the name of the verse: "They shall sanctify My hands to do" (Isaiah 65:3), indicating that hands are given to them in this world.

hebrew_text: וּפְלִיגָא דְּרַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק. דְּאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: רַב הוּנָא כְּרַב, וְרַב כְּרַבִּי יַנַּאי, וְרַבִּי יַנַּאי כְּרַבִּי חִיָּיא, וְרַבִּי חִיָּיא כְּרַבִּי, וְרַבִּי כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר, וְרַבִּי מֵאִיר כְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב, וְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב כְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, דְּאָמַר: אָדָם מַקְנֶה דָּבָר שֶׁלֹּא בָּא לָעוֹלָם.
human_translation: And disagrees with Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak, as Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: Rav Huna with Rav, and Rav with Rabbi Yannai, and Rabbi Yannai with Rabbi Ḥiyya, and Rabbi Ḥiyya with Rabbi and Rabbi with Rabbi Meir, and Rabbi Meir with Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov, and Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov with Rabbi Akiva, who said: A person can transfer an entity that has not come into the world.
llm_translation: Dispute of Rav Nachman son of Yitzchak. For Rav Nachman son of Yitzchak said: Rav Huna is like Rav, and Rav is like Rabbi Yannai, and Rabbi Yannai is like Rabbi Chiya, and Rabbi Chiya is like Rabbi, and Rabbi is like Rabbi Meir, and Rabbi Meir is like Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov, and Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov is like Rabbi Akiva, who said: A person acquires something that has not come into the world.

hebrew_text: רַב הוּנָא מַאי הִיא? דְּאִיתְּמַר: הַמּוֹכֵר פֵּירוֹת דֶּקֶל לַחֲבֵרוֹ, אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: עַד שֶׁלֹּא בָּאוּ לָעוֹלָם — יָכוֹל לַחְזוֹר בּוֹ. מִשֶּׁבָּאוּ לָעוֹלָם — אֵין יָכוֹל לַחְזוֹר בּוֹ.
human_translation: Rav Huna, what is As it was stated: one who sells the fruit of a palm tree to another Rav Huna said: Until has come into the world, he can retract after has come into the world, he can no retract,
llm_translation: Rav Huna: What is it? It was stated: One who sells dates of a palm tree to his friend, Rav Huna said: Until they have not come into the world - he can retract. Once they have come into the world - he cannot retract.

hebrew_text: וְרַב נַחְמָן אָמַר: אַף מִשֶּׁבָּאוּ לָעוֹלָם — יָכוֹל לַחְזוֹר בּוֹ. אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: מוֹדֵינָא דְּאִי שָׁמֵיט וְאָכֵיל — לָא מַפְּקִינַן מִינֵּיהּ.
human_translation: And Rav Naḥman said: Even after they have come into the world he can retract, Rav Naḥman said: I concede that if seizes and consumes does not remove them from him,
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said: Even after they come into the world - one can still retract. Rav Nachman said: The halacha is that if one releases and eats - we do not remove from him.

hebrew_text: רַב — דְּאָמַר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב: הָאוֹמֵר לַחֲבֵרוֹ ״שָׂדֶה זוֹ שֶׁאֲנִי לוֹקֵחַ לִכְשֶׁאֶקָּחֶנָּה, קְנוּיָה לְךָ מֵעַכְשָׁיו״ — קָנָה.
human_translation: Rav as Rav Huna said Rav said: one who says to another: This field that I am buy, when I buy it, it is acquired by you from now, has acquired
llm_translation: Rav - for Rav Huna said Rav: One who says to his friend, "This field that I am buying, when I acquire it, it is acquired for you from now" - has acquired it.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יַנַּאי כְּרַבִּי חִיָּיא — דְּרַבִּי יַנַּאי הֲוָה לֵיהּ אֲרִיסָא דַּהֲוָה מַיְיתֵי לֵיהּ כַּנְתָּא דְפֵירֵי כׇּל מַעֲלֵי שַׁבְּתָא. הָהוּא יוֹמָא נְגַהּ לֵיהּ וְלָא אֲתָא. שְׁקַל עַשַּׂר מִפֵּירֵי דְבֵיתֵיהּ עֲלַיְיהוּ. אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי חִיָּיא,
human_translation: Rabbi Yannai with Rabbi Ḥiyya, as Rabbi Yannai had a sharecropper who would bring him a basket [ kanta ] of fruit every Shabbat eve. One day he was late and did not come. took tithe from the fruit in his house for came before Rabbi Ḥiyya
llm_translation: Rabbi Yannai like Rabbi Hiyya - for Rabbi Yannai had a sharecropper who would bring him a basket of fruits every Shabbat eve. One day the sharecropper did not come. He took ten of his household members and went to him. He came before Rabbi Hiyya,

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: שַׁפִּיר עֲבַדְתְּ. דְּתַנְיָא: ״לְמַעַן תִּלְמַד לְיִרְאָה אֶת ה׳ אֱלֹהֶיךָ כׇּל הַיָּמִים״ — אֵלּוּ שַׁבָּתוֹת וְיָמִים טוֹבִים. לְמַאי הִלְכְתָא? אִילֵּימָא לְעַשּׂוֹרֵי וּמֵיכַל, אִיצְטְרִיךְ קְרָא לְמִישְׁרֵי טִלְטוּל דְּרַבָּנַן?!
human_translation: said to him: You acted well, as it is taught in order that you should learn to fear the Lord your God all the days” these are Shabbatot and Festivals. With regard to what halakha If we say of tithing and eating Was a verse necessary to permit moving by rabbinic
llm_translation: He said to him: "You have done well." As it was taught: "So that you may learn to fear the Lord your God all the days" - these are Sabbaths and festivals. What is the halakha? If you say for the tenth and the basket, does Scripture need to be cited for the straightening of the Sages' bundles?!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לָאו, כִּי הַאי גַוְונָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: וְהָא אַקְרְיוּן בְּחֶלְמָא ״קָנֶה רָצוּץ״, מַאי לָאו, הָכִי קָאָמְרִי לִי: ״הִנֵּה בָטַחְתָּ לְּךָ עַל מִשְׁעֶנֶת הַקָּנֶה הָרָצוּץ הַזֶּה״?
human_translation: Rather, is it not a case like this, said to But they read before me in a dream Bruised reed. What, is it not they said to me as follows: “Behold you trust upon the staff of this bruised reed”
llm_translation: Rather, no, for this reason. He said to him: But is it not written in a dream, "a bruised reed"? What is the reason? This is what they are saying to me: "Behold, you have relied on a broken reed for support."

hebrew_text: לָא, הָכִי קָאָמְרִי לָךְ: ״קָנֶה רָצוּץ לֹא יִשְׁבּוֹר וּפִשְׁתָּה כֵהָה לֹא יְכַבֶּנָּה״.
human_translation: No; they said to you as follows: “A bruised reed he shall not break and the dimly burning wick he shall not quench;
llm_translation: Not so, this is what they are saying to you: "A bruised reed He will not break, and a dimly burning wick He will not extinguish."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי — דְּתַנְיָא: ״לֹא תַסְגִּיר עֶבֶד אֶל אֲדוֹנָיו״, רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: בְּלוֹקֵחַ עֶבֶד עַל מְנָת לְשַׁחְרְרוֹ הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר. הֵיכִי דָּמֵי? אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: דִּכְתַב לֵיהּ לִכְשֶׁאֶקָּחֲךָ — הֲרֵי עַצְמְךָ קָנוּי לְךָ מֵעַכְשָׁיו.
human_translation: Rabbi as it is taught “You shall not deliver a slave to his master” Rabbi says: The verse is speaking of one who buys a slave on the condition to free him. What are the circumstances? Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: where one wrote to When I acquire you you are acquired by yourself from now.
llm_translation: Rabbi — as it was taught: "Do not close a slave to his master," Rabbi says: When one acquires a slave with the intention of freeing him, the Scripture speaks. How so? Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: For it is written to him, "When you acquire him — he is your possession from now."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי מֵאִיר — דִּתְנַן, הָאוֹמֵר לְאִשָּׁה: ״הֲרֵי אַתְּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת לִי לְאַחַר שֶׁאֶתְגַּיֵּיר״, ״לְאַחַר שֶׁתִּתְגַּיְּירִי״, ״לְאַחַר שֶׁאֶשְׁתַּחְרֵר״, ״לְאַחַר שֶׁתִּשְׁתַּחְרְרִי״, ״לְאַחַר שֶׁיָּמוּת בַּעְלִיךְ״, ״לְאַחַר שֶׁתָּמוּת אֲחוֹתִיךְ״, ״לְאַחַר שֶׁיַּחְלוֹץ לִיךְ יְבָמִיךְ״ — אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת. רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת.
human_translation: Rabbi Meir, as we learned One who says to a woman: You are hereby betrothed to me after I convert; after you convert; after I am freed; after you are freed; after your husband dies; after your sister dies; after your yavam performs ḥalitza with you, she is not betrothed. Rabbi Meir says she is betrothed,
llm_translation: Rabbi Meir - as we learned: one who says to a woman, "Behold, you are betrothed to me after you convert," "after you have converted," "after you are freed," "after you have been freed," "after your husband dies," "after your sister dies," "after your yavam performs chalitzah with you" - she is not betrothed. Rabbi Meir says: she is betrothed.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב — דְּתַנְיָא: יָתֵר עַל כֵּן אָמַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב: אֲפִילּוּ אִם אָמַר ״פֵּירוֹת עֲרוּגָה זוֹ תְּלוּשִׁים יְהוּ תְּרוּמָה עַל פֵּירוֹת עֲרוּגָה מְחוּבָּרִים״, אוֹ ״פֵּירוֹת עֲרוּגָה מְחוּבָּרִים עַל פֵּירוֹת זוֹ תְּלוּשִׁין, לִכְשֶׁיָּבִיאוּ שְׁלִישׁ וְיִתָּלְשׁוּ״, וְהֵבִיאוּ שְׁלִישׁ וְנִתְלְשׁוּ — דְּבָרָיו קַיָּימִין.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov, as it is taught Moreover, Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov said even if one said: detached fruit of this garden bed shall be teruma for attached fruit of garden bed or attached fruit of garden bed for detached fruit of this garden bed when reach a third and are detached, and they reached a third and were detached, his words are upheld
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov — as it was taught: Therefore Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov said: Even if one says, "The fruits of the citron are detached, let there be terumah on the fruits of the citron that are attached," or "The fruits of the citron that are attached should be on the fruits that are detached, when they bring a third and they become detached," and they brought a third and they became detached — his words stand.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא — דִּתְנַן: ״קֻוֽנָּם שֶׁאֲנִי עוֹשָׂה לְפִיךָ״ — אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ לְהָפֵר. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: יָפֵר, שֶׁמָּא תַּעֲדִיף עָלָיו יֶתֶר מִן הָרָאוּי לוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva, as we learned Konam that I will prepare for your mouth, is not required to nullify Rabbi Akiva says: nullify lest she exceed more than is fitting for him,
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva — as we learned: "Their bow, which I will make according to your mouth" — does not need to be nullified. Rabbi Akiva says: Nullify it, lest you give it more importance than is fitting for it.

hebrew_text: בְּעוֹ מִינֵּיהּ מֵרַב שֵׁשֶׁת: עֵד אֶחָד בִּיבָמָה, מַהוּ? טַעְמָא דְּעֵד אֶחָד — מִשּׁוּם דְּמִילְּתָא דַּעֲבִידָא לְאִיגַּלּוֹיֵי לָא מְשַׁקַּר, וְהָכָא נָמֵי לָא מְשַׁקַּר. אוֹ דִלְמָא: טַעְמָא דְּעֵד אֶחָד מִשּׁוּם — דְּאִיהִי דָּיְיקָא וּמִינַּסְבָא. וְהָכָא, כֵּיוָן דְּזִימְנִין דְּרָחֲמָא לֵיהּ — לָא דָּיְיקָא וּמִינַּסְבָא.
human_translation: They raised a dilemma before Rav Sheshet: one witness with regard to a yevama , what is the reason one witness because does not lie about something that will be discovered, and here, too, not lie, Or, perhaps the reason for one witness is because is exacting marries But here, since sometimes loves she is not exacting marries
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Be'o minei mar Rav Sheshet: Eid echad b'Yevamah, mahu? Ta'ama de'eid echad - mi'shum de'milta d'avidah l'iglayei la meshakar, v'hacha namei la meshakar. O dilma: Ta'ama de'eid echad mi'shum - de'ihhi dayika u'minasva. V'hacha, keivan de'zimnin d'rachama lei - la dayika u'minasva." English translation: "In a case where there is one witness regarding Yibum, what is the ruling? The reason for one witness - because in matters that lead to disgrace, he would not lie, and here too he would not lie. Or perhaps: The reason for one witness is because - she is precise and modest. And here, since sometimes mercy is shown to him - he is not precise and modest."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהוּ רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: תְּנֵיתוּהָ, אָמְרוּ לָהּ: מֵת בְּנֵךְ וְאַחַר כָּךְ מֵת בַּעְלִיךְ וְנִתְיַיבְּמָה, וְאַחַר כָּךְ אָמְרוּ לָהּ חִילּוּף הַדְּבָרִים — תֵּצֵא, וְהַוָּלָד רִאשׁוֹן וְאַחֲרוֹן מַמְזֵר. הֵיכִי דָמֵי: אִילֵּימָא תְּרֵי וּתְרֵי — מַאי חָזֵית דְּסָמְכַתְּ אַהָנֵי, סְמוֹךְ אַהָנֵי!
human_translation: Rav Sheshet said to him: You learned they said to her: Your child died and afterward your husband died, and she entered into levirate marriage, and afterward they said to her the matters were reversed, she must leave and the first child and the last one a mamzer . What are the circumstances? If we say two and two, what did you see you rely on these rely on
llm_translation: He said to them, Rav Sheshet: "You have taught her, they said to her: 'Your son died, and afterwards your husband died, and she remarried, and then they said to her, 'The matter was a substitution' — she shall leave, and the firstborn and lastborn are mamzer. How so? If you say two and two — what do you see that you rely on brothers, rely on brothers!"

hebrew_text: וְעוֹד, מַמְזֵר? סְפֵק מַמְזֵר הוּא. וְכִי תֵּימָא לָא דָּק, וְהָא מִדְּקָתָנֵי סֵיפָא: הָרִאשׁוֹן מַמְזֵר וְהָאַחֲרוֹן אֵינוֹ מַמְזֵר, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ דַּוְקָא קָתָנֵי.
human_translation: And furthermore, mamzer ? he is a mamzer uncertain, And if you would say was not precise but from that it teaches the latter clause The first is a mamzer and the last is not a mamzer , learn from here was taught specifically
llm_translation: And furthermore, a mamzer? It is a doubt mamzer. And if you will say it is not fine, but it is fine from the end of the Mishnah: the first one is a mamzer and the last one is not a mamzer, learn from it that specifically it teaches.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לָאו שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: חַד. וְטַעְמָא דַּאֲתוֹ בֵּי תְרֵי אַכְחֲשׁוּהּ, הָא לָאו הָכִי — מְהֵימַן.
human_translation: Rather, isn’t it conclude from one and the reason that two came and contradicted him, not so, deemed credible.
llm_translation: Rather, it is not a valid deduction. One. And the reason that if two people contradict it, it is not so - it is reliable.

hebrew_text: וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמַר: הָא לָא תִּיבְּעֵי לָךְ דַּאֲפִילּוּ אִיהִי נָמֵי מְהֵימְנָא, דִּתְנַן: הָאִשָּׁה שֶׁאָמְרָה מֵת בַּעְלִי — תִּנָּשֵׂא. מֵת בַּעְלִי — תִּתְיַיבֵּם. כִּי תִּיבְּעֵי לָךְ לְמִישְׁרֵי יְבָמָה לְעָלְמָא:
human_translation: And some says: Let the dilemma not be raised, as even is also deemed credible as we learned a woman who said: My husband is dead, she may marry. My husband is dead, she should enter into levirate marriage. where you raise the dilemma to permitting a yevama to all
llm_translation: And there is one who said: Behold, it is not necessary for you, for even if she is trustworthy, as we learned: If a woman said, "My husband is dead" — she may marry. If her husband is dead — she must perform the rite of levirate marriage. For it is not necessary for you to seek out a perfectly trustworthy yevamah forever.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּעֵד אֶחָד — מִשּׁוּם דְּמִילְּתָא דַּעֲבִידָא לְאִיגַּלּוֹיֵי לָא מְשַׁקַּר, הָכָא נָמֵי לָא מְשַׁקַּר. אוֹ דִלְמָא: טַעְמָא דְּעֵד אֶחָד, מִשּׁוּם דְּאִיהִי דָּיְיקָא וּמִינַּסְבָא, וְהָא לָא דָּיְיקָא וּמִינַּסְבָא — דְּמִיסְנָא הוּא
human_translation: What is the reason that one witness because does not lie about something that will be discovered, here too he not lie? Or, perhaps the reason for one witness because is exacting marries but this is not exacting marries Because
llm_translation: What is the reason for the testimony of one witness? Because in a matter that is done to be revealed, he does not lie; here too, he does not lie. Or perhaps the reason for the testimony of one witness is that since he is precise and cautious, and this one is not precise and cautious - that is a Mishnah.

hebrew_text: דְּסָנְיָא לֵיהּ. אֲמַר לְהוּ רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: תְּנֵיתוּהָ. אָמְרוּ לָהּ: ״מֵת בַּעְלִיךְ וְאַחַר כָּךְ מֵת בְּנֵךְ״ וְנִשֵּׂאת, וְאַחַר כָּךְ אָמְרוּ לָהּ: ״חִילּוּף הָיוּ הַדְּבָרִים״ — תֵּצֵא, וְהַוָּלָד רִאשׁוֹן וְאַחֲרוֹן מַמְזֵר.
human_translation: hates Rav Sheshet said to them you learned it they said to her: Your husband died and afterward your child died, and she married and afterward they said to her the matters were reversed, she must leave and the first child and the last one a mamzer .
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "Desanya leih. Amar lehu Rav Sheshet: Tenituhah. Amru lah: 'Met ba'alikh ve'achar kach met b'nekh' ve'nise'et, ve'achar kach amru lah: 'Hiluf hayu hadvarim' — teitzei, ve'havvalad rishon ve'acharon mamzer." English translation: "They hated him. Rav Sheshet said to them: Present it. They said to her: 'Your husband died, and afterwards your son died,' and she remarried, and afterwards they said to her: 'The matters were switched' — she should leave, and the firstborn and lastborn are mamzer."

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָּמֵי: אִילֵּימָא תְּרֵי וּתְרֵי — מַאי חָזֵית דְּסָמְכַתְּ אַהָנֵי, סְמוֹךְ אַהָנֵי? וְעוֹד, מַמְזֵר? סְפֵק מַמְזֵר הוּא. וְכִי תֵּימָא לָא דָּק — הָא מִדְּקָתָנֵי סֵיפָא: הָרִאשׁוֹן מַמְזֵר וְהָאַחֲרוֹן אֵינוֹ מַמְזֵר, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ דְּדַוְקָא קָתָנֵי!
human_translation: What are the circumstances? If we say two and two, what did you see you rely on these rely on those? And furthermore, a mamzer ? he is a mamzer uncertain, And if you would say not precise but from that it teaches the latter clause The first is a mamzer and the last is not a mamzer , learn from here was taught specifically
llm_translation: How are the cases similar: If you say two and two - what do you see that you rely on two, rely on two? And furthermore, a mamzer? It is a doubt of mamzer. And if you say it is not thin - behold, it is taught in the end: The first is a mamzer and the last is not a mamzer, learn from it that specifically it is taught!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לָאו: חַד, וְטַעְמָא דַּאֲתוֹ בֵּי תְּרֵי אַכְחֲשׁוּהּ, הָא לָאו הָכִי — מְהֵימַן! לָעוֹלָם תְּרֵי וּתְרֵי, וְכִדְאָמַר רַב אַחָא בַּר מִנְיוֹמֵי, בְּעֵדֵי הֲזָמָה,
human_translation: Rather, is it not one and the reason that two came and contradicted him. not so, deemed credible. Actually, two two and as Rav Aḥa bar Manyumi said, to witnesses of conspiring testimony.
llm_translation: Rather, no: one, and the reason that he came to the two, they contradicted it, but it is not so - trustworthy! Always two and two, as Rav Acha bar Minyomi said, with the witnesses of conspiracy.

hebrew_text: הָכָא נָמֵי בְּעֵדֵי הֲזָמָה.
human_translation: Here too, with witnesses of conspiring testimony.
llm_translation: Here it is stated in the presence of witnesses of conspiracy.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב מָרְדֳּכַי לְרַב אָשֵׁי, וְאָמְרִי לֵיהּ רַב אַחָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי, תָּא שְׁמַע: אֵין הָאִשָּׁה נֶאֱמֶנֶת לוֹמַר מֵת יְבָמִי, שֶׁאֶנָּשֵׂא, וְלֹא מֵתָה אֲחוֹתִי, שֶׁאֶכָּנֵס לְבֵיתָהּ. הִיא נִיהִי דְּלָא מְהֵימְנָא, הָא עֵד אֶחָד — מְהֵימַן!
human_translation: Rav Mordekhai said to Rav Ashi, and some say Rav Aḥa said to Rav Ashi: Come hear A woman is not deemed credible says: My yavam is dead, so that I may marry, And not My sister is dead, so that I may enter her house, she herself who is not deemed credible. one witness deemed credible.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Mordechai to Rav Ashi, and others say Rav Acha to Rav Ashi, come and hear: A woman is not believed to say "my yavam (deceased husband's brother) died" when he is married, and my sister did not die when he enters her house. If she is not believed, with one witness she is believed!
