hebrew_text: וְלִיטַעְמָיךְ, אֵימָא סֵיפָא: אֵין הָאִישׁ נֶאֱמָן לוֹמַר מֵת אָחִי, שֶׁאֲיַיבֵּם אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ, וְלֹא מֵתָה אִשְׁתִּי, שֶׁאֶשָּׂא אֶת אֲחוֹתָהּ. הוּא נִיהוּ דְּלָא מְהֵימַן, הָא עֵד אֶחָד — מְהֵימַן, בִּשְׁלָמָא גַּבֵּי אִשָּׁה, מִשּׁוּם עִיגּוּנָא אַקִּילוּ בַּהּ רַבָּנַן, אֶלָּא גַּבֵּי אִישׁ מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר?
human_translation: And according to your reasoning, say the latter clause A man is not deemed credible says: My brother is dead, so that I may enter into levirate marriage with his wife. And not My wife is dead, so that I may marry her sister. he himself is not deemed credible, one witness is deemed credible. Granted, with regard to a woman, due to a deserted wife, the Sages were lenient in her However, with regard to a man, what can be said?
llm_translation: And to support your argument, say the following: A man is not believed to say, "My brother is dead," in order to marry his wife, and my wife did not die, so that I may marry her sister. He is not believed, but one witness is believed. Regarding a woman, it is understandable that the Rabbis were lenient due to the concern of suspicion. But regarding a man, what can be said?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, כִּי אִיצְטְרִיךְ — לְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אִיצְטְרִיךְ, סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: הוֹאִיל וְאָמַר רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא יֵשׁ מַמְזֵר מֵחַיָּיבֵי לָאוִין, אֵימָא חָיְישָׁא אַקִּלְקוּלָא דְזַרְעַאּ וְדָיְיקָא, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן (דְּאַקִּלְקוּלָא דִידַהּ חָיְישָׁא, אַקִּלְקוּלָא דְזַרְעַאּ לָא חָיְישָׁא).
human_translation: Rather, when is necessary is necessary for Rabbi Akiva. enter your mind to say: Since Rabbi Akiva said for which is liable a prohibition is a mamzer , say she is concerned for the ruin of her offspring and is exacting teaches us that is concerned for her own ruin, she is not concerned for the ruin of her offspring,
llm_translation: Rather, when it is necessary - for Rabbi Akiva it is necessary. Since your mind says: Since Rabbi Akiva said that mamzerim are liable for negative commandments, say perhaps he is concerned about the weakening of the seed and the precise examination, he teaches us that (if she is concerned about the weakening of her own seed, the weakening of the seed is not a concern).

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: עֵד אֶחָד נֶאֱמָן בִּיבָמָה מִקַּל וָחוֹמֶר. לְאִיסּוּר כָּרֵת הִתַּרְתָּ, לְאִיסּוּר לָאו לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן?! אֲמַר לֵיהּ הָהוּא מֵרַבָּנַן לְרָבָא: הִיא עַצְמָהּ תּוֹכִיחַ, דִּלְאִיסּוּר כָּרֵת הִתַּרְתָּ — לְאִיסּוּר לָאו לֹא הִתַּרְתָּ!
human_translation: Rava said: One witness is deemed credible of a yevama by an a fortiori for a prohibition involving karet , you permitted for a prohibition, not all the more so? One of the Sages said to Rava: She herself, can prove For a prohibition involving karet you permitted for prohibition you did not permit
llm_translation: Rava said: One witness is believed regarding yibum from a fortiori reasoning. For a prohibition that carries the penalty of karet, you have permitted it, so for a prohibition that does not carry the penalty of karet, all the more so?! That certain one said to Rava: She herself will prove it, for you permitted it for a prohibition that carries the penalty of karet - for a prohibition that does not carry the penalty of karet, you certainly permitted it!

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא אִיהִי מַאי טַעְמָא לָא מְהֵימְנָא, דְּכֵיוָן דְּזִימְנִין דְּסָנְיָא לֵיהּ, לָא דָּיְיקָא וּמִינַּסְבָא, עֵד אֶחָד נָמֵי: דְּכֵיוָן דְּזִמְנִין דְּסָנְיָא לֵיהּ, לָא דָּיְיקָא וּמִינַּסְבָא.
human_translation: But rather, she what is the reason she is not deemed credible? Since sometimes hate him, she is not exacting and marries. one witness, also Since sometimes hate him, she is not exacting marries
llm_translation: And rather what is the reason we do not trust him? Because since the times that the haters hate him, it is not fitting and it is not accepted, one witness: because since the times that the haters hate him, it is not fitting and it is not accepted.

hebrew_text: זֶה מִדְרָשׁ דָּרַשׁ רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן מַתְיָא וְכוּ׳. אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: הֲוָה לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר לְמִדְרַשׁ בֵּיהּ מַרְגָּנִיתָא וּדְרַשׁ בֵּיהּ חַסְפָּא.
human_translation: this was an exposition taught by Rabbi Elazar ben Matya: Rav Yehuda said Rav said: Rabbi Elazar should have taught a pearl but he taught it as an earthenware shard.
llm_translation: This is the exposition that Rabbi Elazar ben Matya expounded, etc. Rav Yehuda said in the name of Rav: Rabbi Elazar used to have a crystal lectern and he would expound with it a sapphire.

hebrew_text: מַאי מַרְגָּנִיתָא — דְּתַנְיָא: ״וְאִשָּׁה גְּרוּשָׁה מֵאִישָׁהּ״, אֲפִילּוּ לֹא נִתְגָּרְשָׁה אֶלָּא מֵאִישָׁהּ — פְּסוּלָה לַכְּהוּנָּה, וְהַיְינוּ רֵיחַ הַגֵּט דְּפוֹסֵל בִּכְהוּנָּה.
human_translation: What pearl As it is taught a woman divorced from her husband,” even was divorced only from her husband. disqualified from the priesthood. And this is the trace of a bill of divorce, which disqualifies from the priesthood.
llm_translation: What is the case of a woman who is divorced from her husband? As it was taught: "And a woman who is divorced from her husband," even if she was only divorced from her husband - she is disqualified for the priesthood, and this is the same as the smell of the divorce document that disqualifies for the priesthood.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מִי שֶׁהָלְכָה אִשְׁתּוֹ לִמְדִינַת הַיָּם, בָּאוּ וְאָמְרוּ לוֹ ״מֵתָה אִשְׁתְּךָ״, וְנָשָׂא אֶת אֲחוֹתָהּ, וְאַחַר כָּךְ בָּאת אִשְׁתּוֹ — מוּתֶּרֶת לַחְזוֹר
human_translation: one whose wife went overseas came and told him: Your wife is dead, and he married her sister, and afterward his wife came is permitted to return
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If a man's wife went to a coastal region, and people came and said to him, "Your wife has died," and he married her sister, and afterwards his wife returned - she is permitted to him to return.

hebrew_text: לוֹ. וּמוּתָּר בִּקְרוֹבוֹת שְׁנִיָּה, וּשְׁנִיָּה מוּתֶּרֶת בִּקְרוֹבָיו. וְאִם מֵתָה רִאשׁוֹנָה — מוּתָּר בַּשְּׁנִיָּה.
human_translation: to him, And he is permitted to the relatives of the second and second is permitted to his relatives, And if the first died permitted to the second
llm_translation: He. And permitted in his relatives second, and second permitted in his relatives. And if the first one died — permitted in the second.

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ לוֹ: מֵתָה אִשְׁתּוֹ, וְנָשָׂא אֶת אֲחוֹתָהּ. וְאַחַר כָּךְ אָמְרוּ לוֹ: קַיֶּימֶת הָיְתָה, וּמֵתָה. הַוָּלָד רִאשׁוֹן — מַמְזֵר, וְהָאַחֲרוֹן — אֵין מַמְזֵר. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: כׇּל שֶׁפּוֹסֵל עַל יְדֵי אֲחֵרִים — פּוֹסֵל עַל יְדֵי עַצְמוֹ, וְכֹל שֶׁאֵין פּוֹסֵל עַל יְדֵי אֲחֵרִים — אֵינוֹ פּוֹסֵל עַל יְדֵי עַצְמוֹ.
human_translation: they said to him his wife is dead, and he married her sister, and afterward they said to him she was alive and died, the first child, a mamzer , and the last one is not a mamzer . Rabbi Yosei says: Whoever disqualifies others disqualifies himself, and whoever does not disqualify others does not disqualify himself
llm_translation: They said to him: his wife died, and he married her sister. And afterwards they said to him: she was already alive, and she died. The first-born child is a mamzer, and the last-born is not a mamzer. Rabbi Yosei says: anyone who disqualifies through the agency of others, disqualifies through his own agency, and anyone who does not disqualify through the agency of others, does not disqualify through his own agency.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וְאַף עַל גַּב דַּאֲזוּל אִשְׁתּוֹ וְגִיסוֹ לִמְדִינַת הַיָּם, דְּאַהֲנִי הָנֵי נִשּׂוּאִים דְּקָמִיתַּסְרָא אֵשֶׁת גִּיסוֹ אַגִּיסוֹ, אֲפִילּוּ הָכִי: אֵשֶׁת גִּיסוֹ אֲסִירָא, אִשְׁתּוֹ שַׁרְיָא,
human_translation: And even if his wife and his brother-in-law went overseas that this marriage is effective that his brother-in-law’s wife is forbidden to his brother-in-law. Even so, his brother-in-law’s wife is forbidden his wife permitted
llm_translation: Gemara: Even though he went to the province of the sea, where the wives of his brother and his brother's wife are permitted to him, nevertheless: the wife of his brother is prohibited, his brother's wife is permitted.

hebrew_text: וְלָא אָמְרִינַן: מִתּוֹךְ שֶׁנֶּאֶסְרָה אֵשֶׁת גִּיסוֹ אַגִּיסוֹ, תֵּיאָסֵר אִשְׁתּוֹ עָלָיו. לֵימָא מַתְנִיתִין דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, דְּאִי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא — הָוְיָא לַהּ אֲחוֹת גְּרוּשָׁתוֹ.
human_translation: But we do not say: Since his brother-in-law’s wife is forbidden to his brother-in-law, his wife is forbidden to him. Let us say that the mishna is not in accordance with Rabbi Akiva. that if Rabbi Akiva, is sister of his divorcée.
llm_translation: And we do not say: Since his wife's sister is forbidden, his wife's sister-in-law is also forbidden to him. Let us say the Mishnah that does not follow Rabbi Akiva, for if it were Rabbi Akiva, his divorced wife's sister would be permitted to him.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: כׇּל עֲרָיוֹת שֶׁבַּתּוֹרָה — אֵין צְרִיכוֹת הֵימֶנּוּ גֵּט, חוּץ מֵאֵשֶׁת אִישׁ שֶׁנִּשֵּׂאת עַל פִּי בֵּית דִּין, וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא מוֹסִיף אַף אֵשֶׁת אָח וַאֲחוֹת אִשָּׁה. וְכֵיוָן דְּאָמַר רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא בָּעֲיָא גֵּט, מִמֵּילָא אִיתַּסְרָא עֲלֵיהּ, דְּהָוְיָא לַהּ אֲחוֹת גְּרוּשָׁתוֹ.
human_translation: As it is taught None of those with whom relations are forbidden by Torah law require a bill of divorce from him, apart from a married woman who married by the court. And Rabbi Akiva adds: Also a brother’s wife and a wife’s sister. And since Rabbi Akiva said requires a bill of divorce, by itself forbidden to him, as is the sister of his divorcée.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: All the forbidden relationships in the Torah - do not require a divorce document from him, except for a man's wife who he married through the authority of the court. And Rabbi Akiva adds even a man's sister or a woman's sister. And since Rabbi Akiva said he requires a divorce document, it is automatically forbidden for him, as she would be his divorced sister.

hebrew_text: וְלָאו אִיתְּמַר עֲלַהּ, אָמַר רַב גִּידֵּל אָמַר רַב חִיָּיא בַּר יוֹסֵף אָמַר רַב: הַאי אֵשֶׁת אָח הֵיכִי דָּמֵי — כְּגוֹן שֶׁקִּדֵּשׁ אָחִיו אֶת הָאִשָּׁה, וְהָלַךְ לִמְדִינַת הַיָּם, וְשָׁמַע שֶׁמֵּת אָחִיו, וְעָמַד וְנָשָׂא אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ, דְּאָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי: הָךְ קַמָּא, תְּנָאָה הֲוָה לֵיהּ בְּקִידּוּשִׁין, וְהַאי שַׁפִּיר נָסֵיב.
human_translation: And wasn’t it stated with regard to Rav Giddel said Rav Ḥiyya bar Yosef said Rav said: this brother’s wife, what are the circumstances? For example, if his brother betrothed a woman and went overseas, and heard that his brother was dead, and he arose and married his wife that people will say: This first one had a condition in the betrothal and this one married well,
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "And if it was not stated regarding her, Rav Giddel said in the name of Rav Chiya bar Yosef who said in the name of Rav: How is the case of the wife of a brother who passed away — for example, if his brother betrothed his wife, and then went to a distant country, and heard that his brother had died, and he arose and married his wife, as people say: 'He acted properly, there was a condition of betrothal with her, and he married her beautifully.'"

hebrew_text: וְהַאי אֲחוֹת אִשָּׁה נָמֵי הֵיכִי דָּמֵי — כְּגוֹן שֶׁקִּידֵּשׁ אֶת אִשָּׁה, וְהָלְכָה לִמְדִינַת הַיָּם, וְשָׁמַע שֶׁמֵּתָה, עָמַד וְנָשָׂא אֶת אֲחוֹתָהּ. דְּאָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי: הָךְ קַמַּיְיתָא, תְּנָאֵי הֲוָה לֵיהּ בְּקִדּוּשֶׁיהָ, וְהָא שַׁפִּיר נָסֵיב. אֶלָּא נִשּׂוּאִין, מִי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר תְּנָאָה הֲוָה לֵיהּ בְּנִשּׂוּאִין?
human_translation: And this a wife’s sister as well, what are the circumstances? For example, if he betrothed a woman and she went overseas, and he heard she died arose and married her sister. As people will say: This first one, he had a condition in her betrothal, and this one married well. However, marriage, can it be said he had a condition in the marriage?
llm_translation: The sister of a woman, how is it considered? For example, if one betrothed a woman, and he went to a maritime province, and heard that she died, he stood up and married her sister. As people say: "So you stood up, there was a betrothal with her, and it is proper to marry." Rather, in the case of marriage, what can be said about a betrothal in marriage?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אָשֵׁי לְרַב כָּהֲנָא: אִי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, לִיתְנֵי נָמֵי חֲמוֹתוֹ. דְּהָא שָׁמְעִינַן לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, דְּאָמַר: חֲמוֹתוֹ לְאַחַר מִיתָה — לָאו בִּשְׂרֵפָה.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said to Rav Kahana: If Rabbi Akiva, let him also teach his mother-in-law, as we have heard him, Rabbi Akiva, say: mother-in-law after death is not burning,
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Ashe to Rav Kahana: If it is Rabbi Akiva, let him teach in the name of his father-in-law. For we have heard from Rabbi Akiva, who said: His father-in-law after death - not through burning.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: ״בָּאֵשׁ יִשְׂרְפוּ אוֹתוֹ וְאֶתְהֶן״ — אוֹתוֹ וְאֶת אַחַת מֵהֶן, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: אוֹתוֹ וְאֶת שְׁתֵּיהֶן.
human_translation: As it is taught “They shall be burned in fire, he and they [ et’hen ]” means he and one of them [ mehen ]. the statement of Rabbi Yishmael. Rabbi Akiva says: He and both of them.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "D'tanya: 'ba'esh yisrefu oto ve'et-hen' — oto ve'et achat mehen, divrei Rabbi Yishmael. Rabbi Akiva omer: oto ve'et shtehen." English translation: "It was taught in a Baraita: 'With fire they shall be burned, him and them' — him and one of them, the words of Rabbi Yishmael. Rabbi Akiva says: him and both of them."

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְאַבָּיֵי דְּאָמַר מַשְׁמָעוּת דּוֹרְשִׁין אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ, דְּרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל סָבַר: חֲדָא כְּתִיב, וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא סָבַר: תַּרְתֵּי כְּתִיב — שַׁפִּיר.
human_translation: Granted, according to Abaye, who said interpretation of the meaning is between them. That Rabbi Yishmael holds it states: One And Rabbi Akiva holds it states: Two, fine,
llm_translation: In truth, according to Abbaye who said the tradition is expounded, there is a distinction between them, for Rabbi Yishmael holds: one verse, and Rabbi Akiva holds: two verses - it is fine.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְרָבָא, דְּאָמַר: חֲמוֹתוֹ לְאַחַר מִיתָה אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ — לִיתְנֵי נָמֵי חֲמוֹתוֹ!
human_translation: However, according to Rava, who said the between one’s mother-in-law after death. let also teach mother-in-law
llm_translation: Rather, according to Rava, who said: If there is a difference between his mother-in-law before his death and after his death - let him bring his mother-in-law!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: נְהִי דְּמַיעֲטַהּ קְרָא מִשְּׂרֵפָה — מֵאִיסּוּרָא מִי מַיעֲטַהּ קְרָא?
human_translation: said to Granted the verse excluded her from burning, did the verse exclude her from a prohibition?
llm_translation: He said to him: "If a small amount of scripture is burned - from what prohibition is the scripture diminished?"

hebrew_text: וְתֵאָסֵר בִּשְׁכִיבָה דַּאֲחוֹתָהּ, מִידֵּי דְּהָוֵה אַאִשָּׁה שֶׁהָלַךְ בַּעְלָהּ לִמְדִינַת הַיָּם! לָא דָּמֵי: אִשְׁתּוֹ, דִּבְמֵזִיד אֲסִירָא מִדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא, בְּשׁוֹגֵג גְּזַרוּ בַּהּ רַבָּנַן,
human_translation: And let be forbidden by sexual relations her sister, just as it is in a woman whose husband went overseas, not comparable. his wife, who is forbidden by Torah intentionally, the Sages decreed concerning her unwittingly.
llm_translation: And it shall be prohibited in the case of her sister's lying down, because she becomes like a woman whose husband went to the sea! It is not comparable: his wife, who intentionally is prohibited by biblical law, in error the Rabbis decreed upon her.

hebrew_text: אֲחוֹת אִשָּׁה, דִּבְמֵזִיד לָא אֲסִירָא מִדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא, בְּשׁוֹגֵג לָא גְּזַרוּ בַּהּ רַבָּנַן. וּמְנָלַן דְּלָא אֲסִירָא, דְּתַנְיָא: ״אוֹתָהּ״, אוֹתָהּ — שְׁכִיבָתָהּ אוֹסַרְתָּהּ, וְאֵין שְׁכִיבַת אֲחוֹתָהּ אוֹסַרְתָּהּ.
human_translation: a wife’s sister, intentionally is not forbidden by Torah unwittingly the Sages did not decree with regard to him. And from where do we that she is not forbidden? As it is taught with her” her intercourse renders her forbidden but the intercourse of her sister does not render her forbidden.
llm_translation: Sister of a woman, intentional not forbidden from the Torah, unintentional not decreed by the Rabbis. And from where do we derive that it is not forbidden? For it was taught: "her" - her lying with her prohibits her, but the lying with her sister does not prohibit her.

hebrew_text: שֶׁיָּכוֹל, וַהֲלֹא דִּין הוּא: וּמָה בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁבָּא עַל אִיסּוּר קַל — נֶאֱסָר הָאוֹסֵר, מְקוֹם שֶׁבָּא עַל אִיסּוּר חָמוּר — אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁנֶּאֱסָר הָאוֹסֵר.
human_translation: As, might not an inference: And if in where he has relations subject to a light prohibition, the one causing prohibited is forbidden, in where he has intercourse subject to a severe prohibition, is it not right that the one causing prohibited forbidden?
llm_translation: He is able, and isn't this the law: And what in a case where he came upon a light prohibition - the one prohibiting is prohibited, in a case where he came upon a severe prohibition - it is not the law that the one prohibiting is prohibited.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: לֹא נֶחְלְקוּ בֵּית שַׁמַּאי וּבֵית הִלֵּל בְּבָא עַל חֲמוֹתוֹ שֶׁפָּסַל אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ, עַל מָה נֶחְלְקוּ — בְּבָא עַל אֲחוֹת אִשְׁתּוֹ, שֶׁבֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: פָּסַל, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: לֹא פָּסַל. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: לֹא נֶחְלְקוּ בֵּית שַׁמַּאי וּבֵית הִלֵּל בְּבָא עַל אֲחוֹת אִשְׁתּוֹ שֶׁלֹּא פָּסַל אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ, עַל מָה נֶחְלְקוּ — בְּבָא עַל חֲמוֹתוֹ, שֶׁבֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: פָּסַל, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: לֹא פָּסַל.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda said: Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel did not disagree with regard to one who has relations with his mother-in-law, that he renders his wife disqualified With regard to what did they disagree? With regard to one who has relations with his wife’s sister, as Beit Shammai say he renders disqualified, and Beit Hillel say he does not render disqualified. Rabbi Yosei said: Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel did not disagree with regard to one who has relations with his wife’s sister, that he does not render his wife disqualified With regard to what did they disagree? With regard to one who has relations with his mother-in-law, as Beit Shammai say he renders disqualified and Beit Hillel say he does not render disqualified.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda said: Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel did not disagree regarding one who comes upon his mother-in-law who disqualified his wife, what did they disagree about? They disagreed regarding one who comes upon his wife's sister. Beit Shammai says: he disqualified her, and Beit Hillel says: he did not disqualify her. Rabbi Yosei said: Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel did not disagree regarding one who comes upon his wife's sister and did not disqualify his wife, what did they disagree about? They disagreed regarding one who comes upon his mother-in-law. Beit Shammai says: he disqualified her, and Beit Hillel says: he did not disqualify her.

hebrew_text: לְפִי שֶׁבַּתְּחִלָּה, הוּא מוּתָּר בְּכׇל הַנָּשִׁים שֶׁבָּעוֹלָם, וְהִיא מוּתֶּרֶת בְּכׇל הָאֲנָשִׁים שֶׁבָּעוֹלָם. קִדְּשָׁהּ — הוּא אֲסָרָהּ, וְהִיא אֲסָרַתּוּ. מְרוּבֶּה אִיסּוּר שֶׁאֲסָרָהּ, מֵאִיסּוּר שֶׁאֲסָרַתְהוּ. שֶׁהוּא אֲסָרָהּ בְּכׇל אֲנָשִׁים שֶׁבָּעוֹלָם, וְהִיא לָא אֲסָרַתְהוּ אֶלָּא בִּקְרוֹבוֹתֶיהָ.
human_translation: because at first, he is permitted to all the women in the world and she is permitted to all the men in the world. he betrothed he renders her forbidden and she renders him forbidden prohibition by which renders her forbidden greater than prohibition by which renders him forbidden, as he renders her forbidden to all men in the world and she renders him forbidden only to her relatives.
llm_translation: At the outset, he is permitted with all the women in the world, and she is permitted with all the men in the world. He sanctified her - he prohibited her, and she prohibited him. If there is a greater prohibition that he prohibited her, than the prohibition that she prohibited him. For he prohibited her to all the men in the world, but she only prohibited him to her close relatives.

hebrew_text: וַהֲלֹא דִּין הוּא: וּמָה הוּא, שֶׁאֲסָרָהּ בְּכׇל אֲנָשִׁים שֶׁבָּעוֹלָם, שָׁגְגָה בָּאָסוּר לָהּ — אֵינָהּ נֶאֱסֶרֶת בַּמּוּתָּר לָהּ, הִיא, שֶׁלֹּא אֲסָרַתְהוּ אֶלָּא בִּקְרוֹבוֹתֶיהָ, שָׁגַג בָּאָסוּר לוֹ — אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁלֹּא נֶאֱסַר (לוֹ) בַּמּוּתָּר לוֹ?!
human_translation: not inference: And if he prohibited her to all men in the world, unwitting with one forbidden to her, she is not forbidden to permitted to her, she, who prohibited him only to her relatives, he was unwitting with one forbidden to him, is it not right that we should not render him forbidden to permitted to him,
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates as follows: "And isn't this the law: And what is it, that if she forbade it to all men in the world, if she made a mistake in the prohibition to her – she is not forbidden in the permissible to her, she, that she only forbade it to her relatives, if he made a mistake in the prohibition to him – it is not the law that it is not forbidden to him in the permissible to him?!"

hebrew_text: וְזֶה הַדִּין לְשׁוֹגֵג. לְמֵזִיד מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אוֹתָהּ״, אוֹתָהּ — שְׁכִיבָתָהּ אוֹסַרְתָּהּ, וְאֵין שְׁכִיבַת אֲחוֹתָהּ אוֹסַרְתָּהּ.
human_translation: And this is the inference an unwitting With regard to intentional, from where The verse states: “Her,” her intercourse renders her forbidden but the intercourse of her her sister does not render her forbidden
llm_translation: And this is the law for unintentional sin. For intentional sin, from where is it derived? The Torah teaches: "her," her - her lying down prohibits her, but the lying down of her sister does not prohibit her.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אַמֵּי אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה — דִּכְתִיב: ״בָּאֵשׁ יִשְׂרְפוּ אוֹתוֹ וְאֶתְהֶן״, וְכִי כׇּל הַבַּיִת כּוּלּוֹ בִּשְׂרֵפָה?! אִם אֵינוֹ עִנְיָן לִשְׂרֵפָה, תְּנֵהוּ עִנְיָן לְאִיסּוּרָא.
human_translation: Rabbi Ami said Reish Lakish said: What is the reason of Rabbi Yehuda, As it is written: “They shall be burned in fire, he and they” And shall the entire house be burning? If it does not the matter burning, refer it to a prohibition,
llm_translation: Rabbi Ammi said Resh Lakish said: What is the reason of Rabbi Yehuda? — As it is written: "With fire they shall be burned, he and they," and is the entire house to be burned?! If it is not a matter for burning, attribute it as a matter of prohibition.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: אֵין הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה. הָהוּא דַּעֲבַד אִיסּוּרָא בַּחֲמָתֵיהּ. אַתְיֵיהּ רַב יְהוּדָה, נַגְּדֵיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִי לָאו דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל אֵין הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה — אַסְרִיתַהּ עֲלָךְ אִיסּוּרָא דְעָלַם.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: The halakha is not in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda. A certain performed a transgression with his mother-in-law. Rav Yehuda had him brought be flogged. He said to him: If not Shmuel said the halakha is not in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda, I would render forbidden to you permanently.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: The halakha does not follow Rabbi Yehudah. That one who performed an issur in his anger. Rav Yehudah came before him. He said to him: If you do not hold that the halakha follows Rabbi Yehudah - you have imposed upon yourself an eternal issur.

hebrew_text: מַאי ״אִיסּוּר קַל״? אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: מַחְזִיר גְּרוּשָׁתוֹ מִשֶּׁנִּשֵּׂאת.
human_translation: What is light prohibition? Rav Ḥisda said: remarries his divorcée after she married
llm_translation: What is "issur kal"? Rav Ḥisdah said: He returns his divorced wife after he marries her.

hebrew_text: בָּא עָלֶיהָ הַאי — אַסְרַהּ עֲלֵיהּ דְּהַאי. בָּא עָלֶיהָ אִידַּךְ — אַסְרַהּ עֲלֵיהּ דְּהַאי.
human_translation: this one, has relations with her, he has rendered her forbidden to that one, the other one, had relations with her, he has rendered her forbidden to this one.
llm_translation: He came upon it - he prohibited it upon it of this. He came upon it the other - he prohibited it upon it of this.

hebrew_text: מָה לְמַחְזִיר גְּרוּשָׁתוֹ מִשֶּׁנִּשֵּׂאת, שֶׁכֵּן נִטְמָא הַגּוּף, וְאִיסּוּרָהּ בְּרוֹב, וְאִיסּוּרָהּ אִיסּוּר עוֹלָם.
human_translation: What that one who remarries his divorcée after she married As the body is defiled and her prohibition to the majority and her prohibition an irrevocable prohibition,
llm_translation: What is the law regarding returning his divorced wife from when he married another, for the body becomes impure, and its prohibition is frequent, and its prohibition is a perpetual prohibition.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: יְבָמָה. יְבָמָה לְמַאן? אִילֵּימָא לְאַחֵר, וְכִדְרַב הַמְנוּנָא, דְּאָמַר רַב הַמְנוּנָא: שׁוֹמֶרֶת יָבָם שֶׁזִּינְּתָה אֲסוּרָה לִיבָמָהּ —
human_translation: Rather, Reish Lakish said: yevama , yevama , with whom If we say with another in accordance with Rav Hamnuna. As Rav Hamnuna said: A widow waiting for her yavam who engaged in licentious sexual relations forbidden to her yavam .
llm_translation: Rather, Reish Lakish said: Yevamah. Yevamah for whom? If you say for another, as Rav Hamnuna said, for Rav Hamnuna said: A yevamah who has engaged in yibum is forbidden to her yavam —

hebrew_text: מָה לִיבָמָה שֶׁכֵּן נִטְמָא הַגּוּף, וְאִיסּוּרָהּ בְּרוֹב.
human_translation: What that a yevama the body is defiled and her prohibition to the majority
llm_translation: What is the case of yibum that the body becomes impure, and its prohibition is by majority.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא יְבָמָה לָאַחִין. עֲבַד בַּהּ מַאֲמָר הַאי — אַסְרַהּ עֲלֵיהּ דְּהַאי. בָּא עָלֶיהָ אִידַּךְ — אַסְרַהּ עֲלֵיהּ דְּהַאי. מַאי אִירְיָא שֶׁבָּא עָלֶיהָ שֵׁנִי? אֲפִילּוּ עֲבַד בָּהּ נָמֵי מַאֲמָר!
human_translation: Rather, a yevama to the brothers, this performed levirate betrothal [ ma’amar ] with her he has rendered her forbidden to that one, other has relations with her, he has rendered her forbidden to this one why specifically that second had relations with her? Even he performed levirate betrothal with her too,
llm_translation: Rather, a yevamah to brothers. He performed with her the statement of this one - he prohibited her to that one. The other one came upon her - he prohibited her to this one. What is the difference when the other one came upon her a second time? Even if he also performed the statement with her!

hebrew_text: הָא לָא קַשְׁיָא, כְּרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, דְּאָמַר: אֵין מַאֲמָר אַחַר מַאֲמָר. אֶלָּא, אֲפִילּוּ נָתַן לָהּ גֵּט, וַאֲפִילּוּ חָלַץ לָהּ!
human_translation: This not difficult, in accordance with Rabban Gamliel, who said: There is no levirate betrothal after a levirate betrothal, However, even gave her a bill of divorce, even he performed ḥalitza with her,
llm_translation: Here is the English word-for-word translation of the Talmudic text: "This is not difficult, like Rabban Gamliel, who said: 'No statement after a statement.' Rather, even if he gave her a bill of divorce, and even if he performed halitzah for her!"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: סוֹטָה. סוֹטָה לְמַאן? אִילֵימָא לַבַּעַל: בָּא עָלֶיהָ בַּעַל — אַסְרַהּ עֲלֵיהּ דְּבוֹעֵל. מַאי אִירְיָא בָּא עָלֶיהָ? אֲפִילּוּ נָתַן לָהּ גֵּט — וַאֲפִילּוּ אָמַר ״אֵין אֲנִי מַשְׁקֶה״!
human_translation: Rather, Rabbi Yoḥanan said: a sota . sota , to whom If we say to the husband, husband has relations with her, has rendered her forbidden to the fornicator, why specifically had relations with her? Even gave her a bill of divorce or even he said: I to drink
llm_translation: Rather, Rabbi Yochanan said: Sotah. Sotah for whom? If you say for the husband: If her husband came upon her - he forbids her to her husband. What is meant by "came upon her"? Even if he gave her a bill of divorce - and even if he said, "I do not wish to marry her"!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא סוֹטָה לַבּוֹעֵל. הַאי אִיסּוּר קַל הוּא? אִיסּוּר חָמוּר הוּא, דְּהַיְינוּ אֵשֶׁת אִישׁ!
human_translation: Rather, a sota with the fornicator, Is this a light prohibition? It is a severe prohibition, as this is a married woman,
llm_translation: Rather, a Sotah suspected adulteress to the one who had relations with her. Is this prohibition light? It is a severe prohibition, for it is a married woman!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: אֵשֶׁת אִישׁ. וְכֵן כִּי אֲתָא רָבִין, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אֵשֶׁת אִישׁ. וּמַאי קָרֵי לַהּ ״אִיסּוּר קַל״ — שֶׁאֵין הָאוֹסְרָהּ אוֹסְרָהּ כׇּל יָמָיו. תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: אַבָּא חָנָן אָמַר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: אֵשֶׁת אִישׁ.
human_translation: Rather, Rava said a married woman. And similarly, when Ravin came he said Rabbi Yoḥanan said a married woman. And what call a light prohibition? that who renders her forbidden, does not render her forbidden for his whole lifetime, This is also taught Abba Ḥanan said in the name of Rabbi Elazar: a married woman.
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said: A man's wife. And similarly, when Ravin came, Rabbi Yochanan said: A man's wife. And what is it called "a light prohibition"? — That one who forbids her forbids her for all his days. It was also taught similarly: Abba Hanan said in the name of Rabbi Elazar: A man's wife.

hebrew_text: וּמָה בִּמְקוֹם הַבָּא עַל אִיסּוּר קַל, שֶׁאֵין הָאוֹסְרָהּ אוֹסְרָהּ כׇּל יָמָיו — נֶאֱסָר הָאוֹסֵר, הַבָּא עַל אִיסּוּר חָמוּר, שֶׁהָאוֹסְרָהּ אוֹסְרָהּ כׇּל יָמָיו — אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁנֶּאֱסָר הָאוֹסְרָהּ?
human_translation: And if in where he has relations with a light prohibition, that he who renders her forbidden does not render her forbidden for his whole lifetime, the one who renders her forbidden is forbidden, One who has relations subject to a severe transgression, the one who renders forbidden renders her forbidden for her whole lifetime, is it not right that the one who renders her forbidden should be forbidden?
llm_translation: And what is the law in a case where one comes upon a light prohibition, that if the one prohibiting it prohibits it, the prohibition is prohibited all his days — is it the same as the one who comes upon a severe prohibition, that if the one prohibiting it prohibits it, the prohibition is prohibited all his days? Is it not the law that if the one prohibiting it prohibits it, it is prohibited?

hebrew_text: תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אוֹתָהּ״, אוֹתָהּ — שְׁכִיבָתָהּ אוֹסַרְתָּהּ, וְאֵין שְׁכִיבַת אֲחוֹתָהּ אוֹסַרְתָּהּ.
human_translation: The verse states: “Her,” her intercourse renders her forbidden, but the intercourse of her sister does not render her forbidden.
llm_translation: The Talmud teaches: "Her," her - her lying down prohibits her, but the lying down of her sister does not prohibit her.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: כֹּל שֶׁפּוֹסֵל וְכוּ׳. מַאי קָאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי? אִילֵּימָא דְּקָאָמַר תַּנָּא קַמָּא, דְּאָזֵיל אִשְׁתּוֹ וְגִיסוֹ לִמְדִינַת הַיָּם — אֵשֶׁת גִּיסוֹ אֲסִירָא, וְאִשְׁתּוֹ שַׁרְיָא,
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: Whoever disqualifies What is it Rabbi Yosei is saying? If we say that the first tanna said that one’s wife and brother-in-law went overseas wife of his brother-in-law is forbidden and his wife is permitted
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: "Anyone who disqualifies, etc." What is Rabbi Yosei saying? If you say he is saying what the first Tanna said, that if he goes to the province by the sea, his wife's sister is forbidden, but his wife is permitted.

hebrew_text: וְקָאָמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: כִּי הֵיכִי דְּאִשְׁתּוֹ שַׁרְיָא — אֵשֶׁת גִּיסוֹ נָמֵי שַׁרְיָא. אִי הָכִי, כׇּל שֶׁאֵין פּוֹסֵל עַל יְדֵי אֲחֵרִים — אֵין פּוֹסֵל עַל יְדֵי עַצְמוֹ, כֹּל שֶׁאֵין פּוֹסֵל עַל יְדֵי עַצְמוֹ — אֵינוֹ פּוֹסֵל עַל יְדֵי אֲחֵרִים, מִיבַּעְיָא לֵיהּ!
human_translation: And Rabbi Yosei says to Just as his wife is permitted wife of his brother-in-law is also permitted If so, Whoever does not disqualify others does not disqualify himself, he should have Whoever does not disqualify himself, does not disqualify others,
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates as follows: "And Rabbi Yosei said to him: 'In order for his wife to be permitted - the wife of his brother-in-law is considered permitted. If so, anyone who does not disqualify a marriage by the hands of others - does not disqualify it by his own hands; anyone who does not disqualify it by his own hands - does not disqualify it by the hands of others. He requires it!"

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא כִּי הֵיכִי דְּאֵשֶׁת גִּיסוֹ אֲסִירָא — אִשְׁתּוֹ נָמֵי אֲסִירָא. הָתִינַח ״כֹּל שֶׁפּוֹסֵל״, — ״כֹּל שֶׁאֵינוֹ פּוֹסֵל״ מַאי עֲבִידְתֵּיהּ?
human_translation: But rather, Just as wife of his brother-in-law is forbidden his wife is also forbidden works out well Whoever disqualifies, Whoever does not disqualify, what is its purpose?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And rather, how is it that his wife is forbidden? — His wife is like him forbidden. He raised an objection: "Anyone who disqualifies," — "Anyone who does not disqualify," what does he do?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אַמֵּי אַרֵישָׁא: נִיסֵּת עַל פִּי בֵּית דִּין — תֵּצֵא, וּפְטוּרָה מִן הַקׇּרְבָּן. עַל פִּי עֵדִים — תֵּצֵא, וְחַיֶּיבֶת בְּקׇרְבָּן. יִפָּה כֹּחוֹ שֶׁל בֵּית דִּין, שֶׁפֹּטְרָהּ מִן הַקׇּרְבָּן.
human_translation: Rabbi Ami said: to the first married by the court she must leave and is exempt from an offering. based on witnesses, she must leave and is liable to an offering. power of the court is enhanced, as she is exempt from an offering.
llm_translation: Rabbi Ammi the First said: If she was divorced by the authority of the court — she shall depart, and she is exempt from the offering. If by the testimony of witnesses — she shall depart, and is obligated in the offering. Great is the power of the court, that it exempts her from the offering.

hebrew_text: וְקָאָמַר תַּנָּא קַמָּא: לָא שְׁנָא עַל פִּי עֵדִים, דְּאֵשֶׁת גִּיסוֹ שַׁרְיָא. וְלָא שְׁנָא עַל פִּי בֵּית דִּין, דְּאֵשֶׁת גִּיסוֹ אֲסִירָא.
human_translation: And the first tanna says is no different based on witnesses which wife of his brother-in-law is permitted and is no different by the court, as wife of his brother-in-law is prohibited,
llm_translation: The Tanna of the first teaching says: It is not different when based on the testimony of witnesses, for his wife is permitted. And it is not different when based on the ruling of the court, for his wife is forbidden.

hebrew_text: וְקָאָמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: עַל פִּי בֵּית דִּין, דְּפוֹסֵל עַל יְדֵי אֲחֵרִים — פּוֹסֵל עַל יְדֵי עַצְמוֹ. עַל פִּי עֵדִים, דְּאֵינוֹ פּוֹסֵל עַל יְדֵי אֲחֵרִים — אֵינוֹ פּוֹסֵל עַל יְדֵי עַצְמוֹ.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yosei says to by the court, who disqualifies others, disqualified himself based on witnesses does not disqualify others, that he does not disqualify himself,
llm_translation: And he said to him Rabbi Yosei: According to the court, that disqualifies by the hands of others — disqualifies by his own hands. According to witnesses, that does not disqualify by the hands of others — does not disqualify by his own hands.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יִצְחָק נַפָּחָא אָמַר: לְעוֹלָם אַסֵּיפָא (הָא — דִּנְסֵיב אֵשֶׁת גִּיסוֹ, וְהָא — דִּנְסֵיב אֲרוּסַת גִּיסוֹ). הָא — דְּאָזְלִי אֲרוּסָתוֹ וְגִיסוֹ, הָא — דְּאָזְלִי אִשְׁתּוֹ וְגִיסוֹ, וְקָאָמַר תַּנָּא קַמָּא: לָא שְׁנָא אִשְׁתּוֹ וְגִיסוֹ, וְלָא שְׁנָא אֲרוּסָתוֹ וְגִיסוֹ — אֵשֶׁת גִּיסוֹ אֲסִירָא, וְאִשְׁתּוֹ שַׁרְיָא,
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak Nappaḥa said: Actually, to the latter clause This who married his brother-in-law’s wife, and that who married his brother-in-law’s betrothed. this where his betrothed and his brother-in-law went that when his wife and his brother-in-law went And the first tanna said: is no different his wife and his brother-in-law, and is no different his betrothed and his brother-in-law. his brother-in-law’s wife is forbidden and his wife is permitted
llm_translation: Rabbi Yitzchak Nappacha said: Always the latter (this one — who married his wife's sister, and this one — who married his brother's betrothed). This one — whose wife's sister goes out, and his brother-in-law goes out, this one — whose wife goes out, and his brother-in-law goes out, and the first Tanna said: It is not different whether his wife's sister goes out, or his brother-in-law goes out — his brother's wife is forbidden, and his own wife is permitted.

hebrew_text: וְקָאָמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: אִשְׁתּוֹ וְגִיסוֹ, דְּלֵיכָּא לְמֵימַר תְּנָאָה הֲוָה לֵיהּ בְּנִשּׂוּאִין, דְּאֵינוֹ פּוֹסֵל עַל יְדֵי אַחֵר — אֵינוֹ פּוֹסֵל עַל יְדֵי עַצְמוֹ. אֲרוּסָתוֹ וְגִיסוֹ, דְּאִיכָּא לְמֵימַר תְּנָאָה הֲוָה לֵיהּ בְּקִידּוּשִׁין, וּפוֹסֵל עַל יְדֵי אֲחֵרִים — אַף פּוֹסֵל עַל יְדֵי עַצְמוֹ.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yosei said to his wife and his brother-in-law which it cannot be said he had a condition with regard to his marriage as he does not disqualify another, he does not disqualify himself his betrothed and his brother-in-law when it can be said he had a condition with regard to his betrothal And he disqualifies others he also disqualifies himself,
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yosei said to him: His wife and his daughter-in-law, for there is no need to say that if there was a stipulation in the marriage contract, that he does not disqualify a sacrifice through the agency of another, he does not disqualify through his own agency. His betrothed and his daughter-in-law, for if there was a stipulation in the betrothal, and he disqualifies through the agency of others, he also disqualifies through his own agency.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי. מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב יוֹסֵף: וּמִי אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל הָכִי? וְהָאִתְּמַר: יְבָמָה, רַב אָמַר: הֲרֵי הִיא כְּאֵשֶׁת אִישׁ, וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: אֵינָהּ כְּאֵשֶׁת אִישׁ. וְאָמַר רַב הוּנָא: כְּגוֹן שֶׁקִּדֵּשׁ אָחִיו אֶת הָאִשָּׁה, וְהָלַךְ לוֹ לִמְדִינַת הַיָּם, וְשָׁמַע שֶׁמֵּת אָחִיו, וְעָמַד וְנָשָׂא אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yosei. Rav Yosef strongly objects to this: And did Shmuel say this? But wasn’t it stated a yevama : Rav said she is like a married woman, and Shmuel said she is not like a married woman. And Rav Huna said where his brother betrothed a woman and went off overseas, and heard that his brother was dead and he arose and married his wife,
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: The halakha is according to Rabbi Yosei. Rav Yosef objected to him: Did Shmuel really say so? And it was stated: concerning a yevamah, Rav said: She is like a married woman, and Shmuel said: She is not like a married woman. And Rav Huna said: For example, if his brother betrothed a woman, and he went to a distant country, and heard that his brother had died, he should arise and marry his wife.

hebrew_text: דְּרַב אָמַר: הֲרֵי הִיא כְּאֵשֶׁת אִישׁ — וַאֲסוּרָה לַיָּבָם, וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: אֵינָהּ כְּאֵשֶׁת אִישׁ, וְשַׁרְיָא לֵיהּ!
human_translation: As Rav said she is like a married woman and is forbidden to the yavam , And Shmuel said she is not like a married woman, and is permitted to him.
llm_translation: Rav said: "Behold, she is like a married woman" - and forbidden to the yavam, and Shmuel said: "She is not like a married woman, and he may marry her!"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: וּמִמַּאי דְּכִי אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי — אַדְּרַבִּי יִצְחָק נַפָּחָא קָאָמַר? דִּלְמָא אַדְּרַבִּי אַמֵּי קָאָמַר! וְאִי נָמֵי אַדְּרַבִּי יִצְחָק נַפָּחָא, מִמַּאי דְּאַ״פּוֹסֵל״,
human_translation: Abaye said to And from where that when Shmuel said the halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yosei, he was speaking of Rabbi Yitzḥak Nappaḥa Perhaps he was speaking of Rabbi Ami, And even of Rabbi Yitzḥak Nappaḥa, from where One who disqualifies?
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: And from where did Samuel say that the halakha follows Rabbi Yosei? Perhaps Rabbi Ammi said it! And if indeed Rabbi Yitzchak Nafcha said it, from where did he disqualify?

hebrew_text: וְדִלְמָא אַ״אֵינוֹ פּוֹסֵל״?! אִי נָמֵי: מִמַּאי דְּאִיתַהּ לִדְרַב הוּנָא? דִּלְמָא לֵיתַהּ דְּרַב הוּנָא כְּלָל, וּבִדְרַב הַמְנוּנָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי. דְּאָמַר רַב הַמְנוּנָא: שׁוֹמֶרֶת יָבָם שֶׁזִּינְּתָה — אֲסוּרָה לִיבָמָהּ.
human_translation: But perhaps he does not disqualify Alternatively, From where that there is to Rav Huna Perhaps there is no Rav Huna at all, and disagree with regard to of Rav Hamnuna. As Rav Hamnuna said: A widow waiting for her yavam who engaged in licentious sexual relations is forbidden to her yavam .
llm_translation: And perhaps he does not disqualify it?! If so: from what does Rav Huna have to disqualify it? Perhaps Rav Huna does not have a reason to disqualify it at all, and it is Rav Hamnuna who disagrees. For Rav Hamnuna said: A yevamah who had relations with someone other than her yavam — her yavam is prohibited from performing yibum with her.

hebrew_text: דְּרַב אָמַר: הֲרֵי הִיא כְּאֵשֶׁת אִישׁ, וּמִיפַּסְלָא בִּזְנוּת. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: אֵינָהּ כְּאֵשֶׁת אִישׁ, וְלָא מִיפַּסְלָא בִּזְנוּת. וְאִי נָמֵי, בְּקִדּוּשִׁין תּוֹפְסִין בִּיבָמָה קָמִיפַּלְגִי, דְּרַב אָמַר: הֲרֵי הִיא כְּאֵשֶׁת אִישׁ, וְלָא תָּפְסִי בַּהּ קִדּוּשִׁין. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: אֵינָהּ כְּאֵשֶׁת אִישׁ, וְתָפְסִי בַּהּ קִדּוּשִׁין.
human_translation: As Rav said, she is like a married woman and she is disqualified by licentious sexual relations. And Shmuel said she is not like a married woman and is not disqualified by licentious sexual relations. And alternatively, that disagree with regard to betrothal takes effect with a yevama : As Rav said, she is like a married woman and betrothal does not take effect with her. And Shmuel said she is not like a married woman, and betrothal does take effect with her.
llm_translation: Rav said: Behold, she is like a married woman, and disqualifies through promiscuity. And Shmuel said: She is not like a married woman, and does not disqualify through promiscuity. And if you wish, in the case of yibum, where they are in dispute, for Rav said: Behold, she is like a married woman, and do not perform the marriage with her. And Shmuel said: She is not like a married woman, and perform the marriage with her.

hebrew_text: וְהָא אִפְּלִיגוּ בַּהּ חֲדָא זִימְנָא? חֲדָא מִכְּלָל דַּחֲבֶרְתַּהּ אִיתְּמַר.
human_translation: But disagreed over this once. one was stated by inference from the other.
llm_translation: And did they argue about it once? One from the general principle of his colleague was stated.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אָמְרוּ לוֹ: ״מֵתָה אִשְׁתְּךָ״, וְנָשָׂא אֲחוֹתָהּ מֵאָבִיהָ. מֵתָה, וְנָשָׂא אֲחוֹתָהּ מֵאִמָּהּ. מֵתָה, וְנָשָׂא אֲחוֹתָהּ מֵאָבִיהָ. מֵתָה, וְנָשָׂא אֲחוֹתָהּ מֵאִמָּהּ, וְנִמְצְאוּ כּוּלָּן קַיָּימוֹת — מוּתָּר בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה וּבַשְּׁלִישִׁית וּבַחֲמִישִׁית, וּפוֹטְרוֹת צָרוֹתֵיהֶן.
human_translation: said to Your wife is dead, and he married her paternal sister, was dead and he married her maternal sister; was dead and he married her paternal sister; was dead and he married maternal sister, and they were all discovered to be alive. permitted to first and to the third and to the fifth. and they exempt their rival wives.
llm_translation: They taught him: "Your wife died," and he may marry her sister from her father. She died, and he may marry her sister from her mother. She died, and he may marry her sister from her father. She died, and he may marry her sister from her mother, and if they are all found alive - he is permitted in the first, third, and fifth cases, and they are exempt from their rival wives.

hebrew_text: וְאָסוּר בַּשְּׁנִיָּה וּבָרְבִיעִית, וְאֵין בִּיאַת אַחַת מֵהֶן פּוֹטֶרֶת צָרָתָהּ.
human_translation: But forbidden to the second and fourth and relations with one of them does not exempt her rival wife,
llm_translation: And forbidden in the second and fourth generations, and the coming of one of them does not exempt her from her affliction.

hebrew_text: וְאִם בָּא עַל הַשְּׁנִיָּה לְאַחַר מִיתַת הָרִאשׁוֹנָה — מוּתָּר בַּשְּׁנִיָּה וּבָרְבִיעִית, וּפוֹטְרוֹת צָרוֹתֵיהֶן, וְאָסוּר בַּשְּׁלִישִׁית וּבַחֲמִישִׁית, וְאֵין בִּיאַת אַחַת מֵהֶן פּוֹטֶרֶת צָרָתָהּ.
human_translation: And if he had relations with the second after the death of the first, permitted to the second and the fourth, and they exempt their rival wives, and forbidden to the third and the fifth, and the sexual relations with one of them does not exempt her rival wife.
llm_translation: If he had intercourse with the second one after the death of the first one - he is permitted with the second and the fourth, and they are exempt from their yevamot, and he is forbidden with the third and the fifth, and the intercourse with one of them does not exempt her rival.

hebrew_text: בֶּן תֵּשַׁע שָׁנִים וְיוֹם אֶחָד — הוּא פּוֹסֵל עַל יְדֵי אַחִין, וְהָאַחִין פּוֹסְלִין עַל יָדוֹ. אֶלָּא הוּא פּוֹסֵל תְּחִלָּה, וְהָאַחִין פּוֹסְלִין תְּחִלָּה וָסוֹף.
human_translation: aged nine years and one day he disqualifies brothers and the brothers disqualify him However, he disqualifies first, and the brothers disqualify first or last.
llm_translation: Son of nine years and one day — he disqualifies by the hands of his brothers, and the brothers disqualify by his hand. Rather, he disqualifies first, and the brothers disqualify both at the beginning and the end.

hebrew_text: כֵּיצַד? בֶּן תֵּשַׁע שָׁנִים וְיוֹם אֶחָד שֶׁבָּא עַל יְבִמְתּוֹ — פָּסַל עַל יְדֵי אַחִין. בָּאוּ עָלֶיהָ אַחִין וְעָשׂוּ בָּהּ מַאֲמָר, נָתְנוּ גֵּט אוֹ חָלְצוּ — פּוֹסְלִין עַל יָדוֹ.
human_translation: How so? aged nine years and one day who had relations with his yevama has disqualified his brothers, brothers had relations with her, performed levirate betrothal with her, gave a bill of divorce, or performed ḥalitza with her, they disqualify him
llm_translation: How so? A nine-year-old boy who came to his brother's wife - he disqualifies her through his brothers. If his brothers came upon her and performed chalitzah or gave her a bill of divorce - they disqualify her through him.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אַטּוּ כּוּלְּהוּ לָאו לְאַחַר מִיתַת רִאשׁוֹנָה נִינְהוּ? אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: לְאַחַר מִיתַת רִאשׁוֹנָה וַדַּאי.
human_translation: Is that to say all of them, are not after the death of the first Rav Sheshet said: After the definite death of the first one.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Is it that all of them are not considered to be after the death of the first wife? Rav Sheshet said: They are considered after the death of the first wife for sure.

hebrew_text: בֶּן תֵּשַׁע שָׁנִים וְכוּ׳. בֶּן תֵּשַׁע שָׁנִים וְיוֹם אֶחָד, תְּחִלָּה פָּסֵיל בְּסוֹף לָא פָּסֵיל? וְהָתָנֵי רַב זְבִיד בַּר רַב אוֹשַׁעְיָא: הָעוֹשֶׂה מַאֲמָר בִּיבִמְתּוֹ, וְאַחַר כָּךְ בָּא אָחִיו שֶׁהוּא בֶּן תֵּשַׁע שָׁנִים וְיוֹם אֶחָד עָלֶיהָ — פְּסָלָהּ!
human_translation: aged nine years aged nine years and one day disqualify first, last he does not disqualify But didn’t Rav Zevid bar Rav Oshaya teach: One who performs levirate betrothal with his yevama , and afterward his brother, who is nine years and one day old, had relations with her, he has disqualified her.
llm_translation: Son of nine years and etc. Son of nine years and one day, initially invalid but in the end not invalid? And it was taught by Rav Zevid son of Rav Oshaya: One who performs chalitzah with his yevamah, and afterwards his brother who is nine years and one day comes upon her - he disqualifies her!

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי: בִּיאָה — פָּסֵיל אֲפִילּוּ בְּסוֹף, מַאֲמָר — תְּחִלָּה פָּסֵיל, בְּסוֹף לָא פָּסֵיל. וּבִיאָה אֲפִילּוּ בְּסוֹף פָּסֵיל? וְהָא קָתָנֵי: אֶלָּא שֶׁהוּא פּוֹסֵל תְּחִלָּה, וְהֵן תְּחִלָּה וָסוֹף. כֵּיצַד? בֶּן תֵּשַׁע שָׁנִים וְיוֹם אֶחָד שֶׁבָּא עַל יְבִמְתּוֹ וְכוּ׳!
human_translation: They say intercourse disqualifies even last; levirate betrothal first he disqualifies last, he does not disqualify And sexual relations disqualify even last? But isn’t it taught However, he disqualifies first, and the brothers disqualify first or last. How so? aged nine years and one day who had relations with his yevama
llm_translation: They said: Regarding intercourse - invalid even at the end, declaration - invalid at the beginning, not invalid at the end. And intercourse, even at the end, is it invalid? But it teaches: Rather, it invalidates at the beginning, both at the beginning and the end. How so? A nine-year-old and one day who engages in levirate marriage with his sister-in-law, and so forth!

hebrew_text: חַסּוֹרֵי מִיחַסְּרָא וְהָכִי קָתָנֵי: בֶּן תֵּשַׁע שָׁנִים וְיוֹם אֶחָד — הוּא פּוֹסֵל תְּחִלָּה, וְהֵן פּוֹסְלִין תְּחִלָּה וָסוֹף. בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — בְּמַאֲמָר, אֲבָל בִּיאָה פּוֹסֶלֶת אֲפִילּוּ בַּסּוֹף. כֵּיצַד: בֶּן תֵּשַׁע שָׁנִים וְיוֹם אֶחָד הַבָּא עַל יְבִמְתּוֹ — פָּסַל עַל יְדֵי אַחִין.
human_translation: is incomplete and this it is teaching: aged nine years and one day, he disqualifies first, and they disqualify first and last. In what is this statement said? with regard to levirate betrothal, However, relations disqualifies even last. How so? aged nine years and one day had relations with his yevama has disqualified brothers.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "Hasorei michasra ve'hachi katanei: Ben teshah shanim ve'yom echad — hu posel techilah, ve'hen poselin techilah va'sof. Bameh devarim amurim — be'ma'amar, aval bi'ah poshelet afilu basof. Keitzad: Ben teshah shanim ve'yom echad haba al yevimto — pasal al yedei achin." English translation: "Those lacking from the count, and thus it is taught: A boy of nine years and one day — he disqualifies initially, and they disqualify both initially and ultimately. In what context are these matters said — in a statement, but in actual intercourse she disqualifies even at the end. How so: A boy of nine years and one day who engages with his brother's wife — he disqualifies through the intervention of relatives."

hebrew_text: וּמִי אִית לֵיהּ מַאֲמָר כְּלָל עַל יְדֵי אַחִין? וְהָתַנְיָא: בֶּן תֵּשַׁע שָׁנִים וְיוֹם אֶחָד, הוּא פּוֹסֵל בְּדָבָר אֶחָד, וְהָאַחִין פּוֹסְלִין עַל יָדוֹ בְּאַרְבָּעָה דְּבָרִים. הוּא פּוֹסֵל עַל יְדֵי אַחִין בְּבִיאָה, וְהָאַחִין פּוֹסְלִין עַל יָדוֹ בְּבִיאָה, בְּמַאֲמָר, בְּגֵט, בַּחֲלִיצָה!
human_translation: And does have levirate betrothal at all with regard to But isn’t it taught aged nine years and one day, he disqualifies in one way, and the brothers disqualify him in four ways. He disqualifies the brothers by relations, and the brothers disqualify him by relations, by levirate betrothal, by a bill of divorce, and by ḥalitza .
llm_translation: And who has a statement in general through the hands of brothers? And it was taught: A boy of nine years and one day, he disqualifies in one matter, and brothers disqualify through him in four matters. He disqualifies through the hands of brothers in intercourse, and brothers disqualify through him in intercourse, in a statement, in a divorce document, in levirate marriage!

hebrew_text: בִּיאָה דְּפָסְלָה בֵּין בִּתְחִלָּה בֵּין בְּסוֹף — פְּסִיקָא לֵיהּ, מַאֲמָר דְּבִתְחִילָּה פָּסֵיל, בְּסוֹף לָא פָּסֵיל — לָא פְּסִיקָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: sexual relations which disqualifies whether first or last, definite levirate betrothal which first disqualifies last, does not disqualify cannot definite
llm_translation: Intercourse with a disqualified woman, whether at the beginning or at the end - it is a definitive ruling, the statement is: at the beginning it disqualifies, at the end it does not disqualify - it is not a definitive ruling.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר נָמֵי, אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: יֵשׁ לוֹ גֵּט. וְכֵן אָמַר רַב תַּחְלִיפָא בַּר אֲבִימִי: יֵשׁ לוֹ מַאֲמָר. תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: יֵשׁ לוֹ גֵּט, וְיֵשׁ לוֹ מַאֲמָר, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר.
human_translation: It was also stated Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: has a bill of divorce And similarly Rav Taḥalifa bar Avimi said: He has levirate betrothal. This is also taught has a bill of divorce and he has levirate betrothal; the statement of Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: It was stated similarly, Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: he has a get. And so said Rav Tahalifa bar Avimi: he has a statement. It was taught similarly: he has a get, and he has a statement, the words of Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: וְסָבַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר יֵשׁ לוֹ גֵּט? וְהָתַנְיָא: עָשׂוּ בִּיאַת בֶּן תֵּשַׁע כְּמַאֲמָר בַּגָּדוֹל, רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: עָשׂוּ חֲלִיצַת בֶּן תֵּשַׁע כְּגֵט בַּגָּדוֹל. וְאִם אִיתָא — לִיתְנֵי: כְּגִיטּוֹ! אָמַר רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: אִית לֵיהּ וְזוּטַר.
human_translation: And Rabbi Meir hold has a bill of divorce? But isn’t it taught They established the sexual relations of a nine-year-old like a levirate betrothal an adult. Rabbi Meir says: They established the ḥalitza of a nine-year-old like a bill of divorce of an adult. And if it is so, let teach: like his bill of divorce, Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said: He does have but less
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And Rabbi Meir holds that he has a get? And it was taught: They performed the consummation of a nine-year-old boy as the statement of the Great One, Rabbi Meir says: They performed the halitzah of a nine-year-old boy as a get of the Great One. And if it is necessary — let it be taught: like his get! Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said: He has it and it is valid.

hebrew_text: לְרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, דְּאָמַר אֵין גֵּט אַחַר גֵּט — הָנֵי מִילֵּי בְּגָדוֹל אַחַר גָּדוֹל וְקָטָן אַחַר קָטָן, אֲבָל גָּדוֹל אַחַר קָטָן — מַהֲנֵי.
human_translation: According to Rabban Gamliel, who said there is no bill of divorce after a bill of divorce this applies only by an adult after an adult, or a minor after a minor. an adult after a minor, is effective
llm_translation: To Rabbi Gamliel, who said: A bill of divorce cannot follow another bill of divorce - these matters apply to a major bill of divorce following another major bill of divorce, and a minor bill of divorce following another minor bill of divorce, but a major bill of divorce following a minor bill of divorce - what is the law?

hebrew_text: לְרַבָּנַן, דְאָמְרִי יֵשׁ גֵּט אַחַר גֵּט — הָנֵי מִילֵּי בְּגָדוֹל אַחַר גָּדוֹל, אוֹ בְּקָטָן אַחַר קָטָן, אֲבָל קָטָן אַחַר גָּדוֹל — לָא מַהֲנֵי.
human_translation: According to the Rabbis, who say there is a bill of divorce after a bill of divorce, this applies only of an adult after an adult, or to a minor after a minor. However, a minor after an adult is not effective,
llm_translation: The Sages, who say there is a bill of divorce after a bill of divorce — these matters apply when it is a major bill of divorce after a major bill of divorce, or a minor bill of divorce after a minor bill of divorce, but a minor bill of divorce after a major bill of divorce — is not effective.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ בֶּן תֵּשַׁע שָׁנִים וְיוֹם אֶחָד שֶׁבָּא עַל יְבִמְתּוֹ, וְאַחַר כָּךְ בָּא עָלֶיהָ אָחִיו שֶׁהוּא בֶּן תֵּשַׁע שָׁנִים וְיוֹם אֶחָד — פּוֹסַל עַל יָדוֹ. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: לֹא פָּסַל. בֶּן תֵּשַׁע שָׁנִים וְיוֹם אֶחָד שֶׁבָּא עַל יְבִמְתּוֹ, וְאַחַר כָּךְ בָּא עַל צָרָתָהּ — פָּסַל עַל יְדֵי עַצְמוֹ. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: לֹא פָּסַל.
human_translation: aged nine years and one day had relations with his yevama , and afterward his brother, who is nine years and one day old, had relations with her, disqualifies to Rabbi Shimon says not disqualify aged nine years and one day had relations with his yevama , and afterward had relations with her rival wife, disqualifies her to himself, Rabbi Shimon says not disqualify
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If a boy of nine years and one day came to his brother's widow for levirate marriage, and afterwards his brother, who is also a boy of nine years and one day, came to her - he disqualifies her. Rabbi Shimon says: He does not disqualify her. If a boy of nine years and one day came to his brother's widow for levirate marriage, and afterwards he came to her co-wife - he disqualifies her by his own action. Rabbi Shimon says: He does not disqualify her.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תַּנְיָא, אָמַר לָהֶם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן לַחֲכָמִים: אִם בִּיאָה רִאשׁוֹנָה בִּיאָה — בִּיאָה שְׁנִיָּיה אֵינָהּ בִּיאָה. וְאִם בִּיאָה רִאשׁוֹנָה אֵינָהּ בִּיאָה — בִּיאָה שְׁנִיָּיה נָמֵי אֵינָהּ בִּיאָה.
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Shimon said to the Rabbis: If first sexual act sexual relations, second act is not an act And if first sexual act is not a sexual act, second act is also not a sexual act.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemara: Tanya, Amar Lahem Rabbi Shimon laChachamim: Im Bi'ah Rishonah Bi'ah - Bi'ah Shniyah Einah Bi'ah. Ve'im Bi'ah Rishonah Einah Bi'ah - Bi'ah Shniyah Namei Einah Bi'ah." English translation: "It was taught in a Baraita, Rabbi Shimon said to the Sages: If the first Bi'ah is a Bi'ah - the second Bi'ah is not a Bi'ah. And if the first Bi'ah is not a Bi'ah - the second Bi'ah is also not a Bi'ah."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִיתִין דְּלָא כְּבֶן עַזַּאי. דְּתַנְיָא, בֶּן עַזַּאי אוֹמֵר: יֵשׁ מַאֲמָר אַחַר מַאֲמָר בִּשְׁנֵי יְבָמִין וִיבָמָה אַחַת.
human_translation: the mishna is not in accordance with ben Azzai. As it is taught ben Azzai says: There is levirate betrothal after levirate betrothal of two yevamin and one yevama .
llm_translation: Mishnah that is not like Ben Azzai. As it was taught: Ben Azzai says: There is a saying after a saying in two yevamot and one yevamah.

hebrew_text: וְאֵין מַאֲמָר אַחַר מַאֲמָר בִּשְׁתֵּי יְבָמוֹת וְיָבָם אֶחָד.
human_translation: But there is no levirate betrothal after a levirate betrothal of two yevamot and one yavam ,
llm_translation: And there is no statement after a statement in two yevamot and one yavam.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ בֶּן תֵּשַׁע שָׁנִים וְיוֹם אֶחָד שֶׁבָּא עַל יְבִמְתּוֹ וּמֵת — חוֹלֶצֶת וְלֹא מִתְיַיבֶּמֶת. נָשָׂא אִשָּׁה וָמֵת — הֲרֵי זוֹ פְּטוּרָה. בֶּן תֵּשַׁע שָׁנִים וְיוֹם אֶחָד שֶׁבָּא עַל יְבִמְתּוֹ, וּמִשֶּׁהִגְדִּיל נָשָׂא אִשָּׁה אַחֶרֶת, וָמֵת, אִם לֹא יָדַע אֶת הָרִאשׁוֹנָה מִשֶּׁהִגְדִּיל — הָרִאשׁוֹנָה חוֹלֶצֶת וְלֹא מִתְיַיבֶּמֶת, וְהַשְּׁנִיָּיה אוֹ חוֹלֶצֶת אוֹ מִתְיַיבֶּמֶת.
human_translation: aged nine years and one day had relations with his yevama and died, performs ḥalitza and may not enter into levirate marriage. married a woman and died, she is exempt aged nine years and one day had relations with his yevama , and after he matured he married a different woman and died if he did not know the first after he matured, the first one performs ḥalitza and may not enter into levirate marriage, and the second either performs ḥalitza or enters into levirate marriage,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: A boy of nine years and one day who comes to his brother's widow and dies - she performs ḥalitza but does not engage in levirate marriage. If he married a woman and died - she is exempt. A boy of nine years and one day who comes to his brother's widow, and after he grew up he married another woman, and then he died, if he did not know the first one before he grew up - the first one performs ḥalitza but does not engage in levirate marriage, and the second one either performs ḥalitza or engages in levirate marriage.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: מְיַיבֵּם לְאֵי זוֹ שֶׁיִּרְצֶה, וְחוֹלֵץ לַשְּׁנִיָּיה. אֶחָד שֶׁהוּא בֶּן תֵּשַׁע שָׁנִים וְיוֹם אֶחָד, וְאֶחָד שֶׁהוּא בֶּן עֶשְׂרִים שֶׁלֹּא הֵבִיא שְׁתֵּי שְׂעָרוֹת.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: consummates levirate marriage with whichever he chooses, and performs ḥalitza with the second one. both who is nine years and one day old, and also who is twenty old who has not developed two hairs.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: He may choose whichever one he desires, and he must pay the other. One who is nine years old and one day, and one who is twenty years old but has not yet brought two pubic hairs.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רָבָא: הָא דַּאֲמוּר רַבָּנַן זִיקַּת שְׁנֵי יְבָמִין, מִיחְלָץ חָלְצָה יַבּוֹמֵי לָא מִיַּבְּמָה, לָא תֵּימָא הֵיכָא דְּאִיכָּא צָרָה, דְּאִיכָּא לְמִגְזַר מִשּׁוּם צָרָה.
human_translation: Rava said: that which the Rabbis said, the bond of two yevamin she performs ḥalitza and she does not enter into levirate marriage, you should not say this when there is a rival wife, as there is to decree due to a rival wife.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara said Rava: This that the Rabbis said, the connection of two yevamot, if he releases the yevama, the yavam does not perform yibum, do not say where there is a co-wife, for there is a decree due to the co-wife.

hebrew_text: דְּהָא הָכָא לֵיכָּא צָרָה, מִיחְלָץ חָלְצָה, יַבּוֹמֵי לָא מִיַּבְּמָה.
human_translation: that here, there is no rival wife, she performs ḥalitza she does not enter into levirate marriage.
llm_translation: Here is the English word-for-word translation of the Talmudic text: "Because here there is no need, he redeems she is redeemed, yevamot not from yibum."

hebrew_text: נָשָׂא אִשָּׁה וּמֵת כּוּ׳. תְּנֵינָא לְהָא דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: שׁוֹטֶה וְקָטָן שֶׁנָּשְׂאוּ וּמֵתוּ — נְשׁוֹתֵיהֶן פְּטוּרוֹת מִן הַחֲלִיצָה וּמִן הַיִּיבּוּם.
human_translation: married a woman and died, We learned this, as the Sages taught an imbecile and a minor who married and died, their wives are exempt from ḥalitza and from levirate marriage,
llm_translation: He married a woman and died. We learned in the Mishnah that the Sages taught: A fool and a minor who married and died - their wives are exempt from halitzah and yibbum.

hebrew_text: בֶּן תֵּשַׁע וְכוּ׳ מִשֶּׁהִגְדִּיל וְכוּ׳. וְיַעֲשׂוּ בִּיאַת בֶּן תֵּשַׁע כְּמַאֲמָר בַּגָּדוֹל, וְתִדָּחֶה צָרָה מִיִּבּוּם! אָמַר רַב: לֹא עָשׂוּ בִּיאַת בֶּן תֵּשַׁע כְּמַאֲמָר בַּגָּדוֹל. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: עָשׂוּ וְעָשׂוּ. וְכֵן אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: עָשׂוּ וְעָשׂוּ.
human_translation: a nine-year-old after he matured And let establish the sexual relations of a nine-year-old like the levirate betrothal of an adult, and override rival wife to levirate marriage, Rav said: They did not establish the intercourse of a nine-year-old like the levirate betrothal of an adult and Shmuel said: They certainly did. And similarly, Rabbi Yoḥanan said: They certainly did.
llm_translation: Son of nine and so on, from when he grows up and so on. And they should perform the levirate marriage of a son of nine as the statement in the case of an adult, and the rival wife should be pushed aside from levirate marriage! Rav said: They did not perform the levirate marriage of a son of nine as the statement in the case of an adult. And Shmuel said: They did and they did. And so said Rabbi Yochanan: They did and they did.

hebrew_text: וְיַעֲשׂוּ? תַּנָּאֵי הִיא. הָךְ תַּנָּא דְּאַרְבָּעָה אַחִין גָּזַר מִשּׁוּם צָרָה.
human_translation: And let them establish is tanna’im . This tanna of four brothers, he decreed due to a rival wife.
llm_translation: "And they should do? It is a teaching. Thus taught the Tanna of the four brothers decreed due to distress."

hebrew_text: וְאַשְׁמְעִינַן בְּגָדוֹל, וְהוּא הַדִּין בְּקָטָן. וְהַאי דְּאָמַר גָּדוֹל — מִשּׁוּם דִּבְגָדוֹל קָאֵי.
human_translation: And taught us with regard to an adult and the same is true of a minor And that he stated an adult because referring to an adult.
llm_translation: We hear in the case of the adult, and it is the same with the minor. And this that it says "adult" - because he stands on account of the adult.

hebrew_text: וְהַאי תַּנָּא דְּהָכָא סְבִירָא לֵיהּ עָשׂוּ, וְלָא גָּזַר מִשּׁוּם צָרָה. וְאַשְׁמְעִינַן בְּקָטָן, וְהוּא הַדִּין בְּגָדוֹל. וְהַאי דְּקָאָמַר בְּקָטָן — דִּבְקָטָן קָאֵי.
human_translation: And this tanna , of here, holds that they established and he did not decree due to a rival wife. And he taught us with regard to a minor, and the same is true of an adult. And that he stated a minor because referring to a minor.
llm_translation: And this Tanna here thinks they did it, and did not decree due to trouble. And we hear about a minor, and it is the same with an adult. And what he says about a minor - it is with a minor that he is dealing.

hebrew_text: אֲזַל רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אֲמַר לִשְׁמַעְתָּא בֵּי מִדְרְשָׁא, וְלָא אַמְרַהּ מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן. שְׁמַע רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אִיקְּפַד. עוּל לְגַבֵּיהּ רַבִּי אַמֵּי וְרַבִּי אַסִּי. אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: לֹא כָּךְ הָיָה הַמַּעֲשֶׂה בְּבֵית הַכְּנֶסֶת שֶׁל טְבֶרְיָא בְּנֶגֶר שֶׁיֵּשׁ בְּרֹאשׁוֹ גְּלוֹסְטְרָא,
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar went said this halakha the study hall, but he did not state it in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan. Rabbi Yoḥanan heard and became angry Rabbi Ami and Rabbi Asi visited They said to him: Wasn’t there an incident in the synagogue of Tiberias involving a bolt that has knob [ gelustera ] at its end?
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar went to the study hall and did not mention it in the name of Rabbi Yochanan. Rabbi Yochanan heard and became upset. Rabbi Ammi and Rabbi Assi went to him and said: "That is not how it happened in the synagogue of Tiberias in Negar, where there was a glass window above him."

hebrew_text: שֶׁנֶּחְלְקוּ בּוֹ רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי, עַד שֶׁקָּרְעוּ סֵפֶר תּוֹרָה בַּחֲמָתָן. קָרְעוּ סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ?! אֶלָּא אֵימָא שֶׁנִּקְרַע סֵפֶר תּוֹרָה בַּחֲמָתָן. וְהָיָה שָׁם רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בֶּן קִיסְמָא, אָמַר: תָּמֵיהַּ אֲנִי אִם לֹא יִהְיֶה בֵּית הַכְּנֶסֶת זוֹ עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה. וְכֵן הֲוָה.
human_translation: that Rabbi Elazar and Rabbi Yosei argued over until that they tore a Torah scroll in their anger. Tore? enter your mind Rather, say that a Torah scroll was torn through their anger. And Rabbi Yosei ben Kisma, was there said: I would be surprised if this synagogue does not become idolatrous worship. And this occurred.
llm_translation: The text is as follows: "Wherein Rabbi Elazar and Rabbi Yosei disagreed, until they tore a Torah scroll in their anger. Did they really tear it according to your opinion?! Rather say that a Torah scroll was torn in their anger. And there was Rabbi Yosei ben Kisma there, who said: I swear by the Temple service, if this synagogue is not a place of idolatry. And so it was."

hebrew_text: הֲדַר אִיקְּפַד טְפֵי, אֲמַר: חַבְרוּתָא נָמֵי?!
human_translation: grew even angrier, saying: even colleagues
llm_translation: The text in English: "Hadar ikpad tefei, amar: chavruta namei?!"

hebrew_text: עוּל לְגַבֵּיהּ רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב בַּר אִידִי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: ״כַּאֲשֶׁר צִוָּה ה׳ אֶת מֹשֶׁה עַבְדּוֹ כֵּן צִוָּה מֹשֶׁה אֶת יְהוֹשֻׁעַ וְכֵן עָשָׂה יְהוֹשֻׁעַ לֹא הֵסִיר דָּבָר מִכׇּל אֲשֶׁר צִוָּה ה׳ אֶת מֹשֶׁה״, וְכִי עַל כׇּל דָּבָר שֶׁאָמַר יְהוֹשֻׁעַ הָיָה אוֹמֵר לָהֶם: כָּךְ אָמַר לִי מֹשֶׁה? אֶלָּא יְהוֹשֻׁעַ יוֹשֵׁב וְדוֹרֵשׁ סְתָם, וְהַכֹּל יוֹדְעִין שֶׁתּוֹרָתוֹ שֶׁל מֹשֶׁה הִיא. אַף רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר תַּלְמִידְךָ יוֹשֵׁב וְדוֹרֵשׁ סְתָם, וְהַכֹּל יוֹדְעִין כִּי שֶׁלְּךָ הִיא.
human_translation: Rabbi Ya’akov bar Idi visited said to him: “As God commanded His servant Moses, so did Moses command Joshua, and so did Joshua, he left nothing undone of all that the Lord commanded Moses” Now did Joshua, with regard to every matter that he said, say to Thus Moses said to me? Rather, Joshua sit and teach without attributing and everyone would know that it was the Torah of Moses. So too, your disciple Rabbi Elazar sits and teaches without attribution, and everyone knows that is your
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Ul to his father Rabbi Yaakov bar Idi. He said to him: 'As the Lord commanded Moses his servant, so Moses commanded Joshua, and so Joshua did; he did not remove a thing from all that the Lord commanded Moses.' And for every matter that Joshua would say, he would say to them: 'Did Moses say this to me?' Rather, Joshua would sit and expound generally, and all knew that it was the Torah of Moses. Even Rabbi Elazar, your disciple, sits and expounds generally, and all know that it is yours." English translation:

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָהֶם: מִפְּנֵי מָה אִי אַתֶּם יוֹדְעִין לְפַיֵּיס כְּבֶן אִידִי חֲבֵרֵינוּ. וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מַאי טַעְמָא קָפֵיד כּוּלֵּי הַאי? דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״אָגוּרָה בְּאׇהׇלְךָ עוֹלָמִים״, וְכִי אֶפְשָׁר לוֹ לְאָדָם לָגוּר בִּשְׁנֵי עוֹלָמִים? אֶלָּא אָמַר דָּוִד לִפְנֵי הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, יְהִי רָצוֹן
human_translation: he said to Why don’t you know how to appease me like our colleague ben Idi? And Rabbi Yoḥanan, what is the reason he was so angry as Rav Yehuda said Rav said: What is which is written: “I will dwell in Your tent in worlds” And is it possible for a person to live in two worlds Rather, David said before the Holy One, Blessed be He: Master of the Universe, let it be Your will
llm_translation: He said to them: Why do you not know how to appease like the son of Iddo our colleagues? And Rabbi Yochanan, what is the reason that he was so particular about this? For Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: What is the meaning of what is written: "I will dwell in Your tent forever"? Can a person really dwell in two worlds? Rather, David said before the Holy One, blessed be He: Master of the world, may it be Your will.

hebrew_text: שֶׁיֹּאמְרוּ דְּבַר שְׁמוּעָה מִפִּי בָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַי: כׇּל תַּלְמִיד חָכָם שֶׁאוֹמְרִים דְּבַר שְׁמוּעָה מִפִּיו בָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה, שִׂפְתוֹתָיו דּוֹבְבוֹת בַּקֶּבֶר. אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק בֶּן זְעֵירָא, וְאִיתֵּימָא שִׁמְעוֹן נְזִירָא: מַאי קְרָאָה — ״וְחִכֵּךְ כְּיֵין הַטּוֹב הוֹלֵךְ לְדוֹדִי לְמֵישָׁרִים דּוֹבֵב שִׂפְתֵי יְשֵׁנִים״.
human_translation: that they will say a matter of halakha in my name in this world As Rabbi Yoḥanan said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai: any Torah scholar in whose name a matter of halakha is said in this world, his lips mouth in the grave, Rabbi Yitzḥak ben Ze’eira said, and some say Shimon the Nazirite: What is the verse “And the roof of your mouth is like the best wine that glides down smoothly for my beloved, moving gently the lips of those who are asleep”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "That they should say a matter heard from his mouth in this world. For Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai: Every Torah scholar that they say a matter heard from his mouth in this world, his lips move in the grave. Rabbi Yitzchak ben Zerika said, and some say it was Shimon Nazira: What is the verse? 'And your palate like good wine flowing to my beloved, causing the lips of the sleeping to speak.'"

hebrew_text: כְּכוֹמֶר שֶׁל עֲנָבִים: מָה כּוֹמֶר שֶׁל עֲנָבִים, כֵּיוָן שֶׁמַּנִּיחַ אָדָם אֶצְבָּעוֹ עָלָיו — מִיָּד דּוֹבֵב; אַף תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים, כֵּיוָן שֶׁאוֹמְרִים דְּבַר שְׁמוּעָה מִפִּיהֶם בָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה — שִׂפְתוֹתֵיהֶם דּוֹבְבוֹת בַּקֶּבֶר.
human_translation: like a pile [ komer ] of grapes Just as a pile of grapes, when a person places his finger on it, immediately it moves, so too Torah scholars: When a teaching is said in their name in this world their lips mouth in the grave.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Like a cluster of grapes: What is a cluster of grapes? When a person places his finger on it - immediately a wasp; so too the disciples of the sages, when they speak a matter heard from their mouths in this world - their lips are buzzing in the grave.

hebrew_text: אֶחָד בֶּן תֵּשַׁע שָׁנִים וְכוּ׳. וּרְמִינְהוּ: בֶּן עֶשְׂרִים שָׁנָה שֶׁלֹּא הֵבִיא שְׁתֵּי שְׂעָרוֹת — יָבִיאוּ רְאָיָה שֶׁהוּא בֶּן עֶשְׂרִים, וְהוּא הַסָּרִיס — לֹא חוֹלֵץ וְלֹא מְיַיבֵּם.
human_translation: both who is nine years And raises a contradiction twenty years old who has not developed two hairs, they must bring proof that he is twenty years old, and is a eunuch, may neither perform ḥalitza nor perform levirate marriage.
llm_translation: One who is nine years old, etc. And they raised a dilemma: Regarding a twenty-year-old who has not produced two pubic hairs - they should bring proof that he is twenty, and he is a eunuch - he neither performs chalitzah nor levirate marriage.

hebrew_text: בַּת עֶשְׂרִים שָׁנָה שֶׁלֹּא הֵבִיאָה שְׁתֵּי שְׂעָרוֹת — יָבִיאוּ רְאָיָה שֶׁהִיא בַּת עֶשְׂרִים, וְהִיא הָאַיְלוֹנִית — לֹא חוֹלֶצֶת וְלֹא מִתְיַיבֶּמֶת.
human_translation: twenty years old and has not developed two hairs, they must bring proof that she is twenty years old, and she is a sexually underdeveloped woman, may neither perform ḥalitza nor enter into levirate marriage.
llm_translation: Daughter of twenty years that not brought two hairs - they bring proof that she is daughter of twenty, and she is the aylonit - not she removes and not she performs levirate marriage.

hebrew_text: הָא אִתְּמַר עֲלַהּ, אָמַר רַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר יִצְחָק אָמַר רַב: וְהוּא שֶׁנּוֹלְדוּ לוֹ סִימָנֵי סָרִיס. אָמַר רָבָא: דַּיְקָא נָמֵי, דְּקָתָנֵי: וְהוּא הַסָּרִיס. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Wasn’t it stated with regard to this Rav Shmuel bar Yitzḥak said Rav said: And this if he developed signs of a eunuch Rava said: is also precise, as it teaches: And he is the eunuch. learn from here
llm_translation: Here is the translation of the Talmudic text you provided: Talmudic text: It was stated about him, Rav Shmuel bar Yitzchak said in the name of Rav: And he who has the signs of a eunuch were born to him. Rava said: It is indeed fitting, as it was taught: And he is a eunuch. Learn from this.

hebrew_text: וְכִי לֹא נוֹלְדוּ לוֹ סִימָנֵי סָרִיס, עַד כַּמָּה? תָּנֵי דְּבֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא: עַד רוֹב שְׁנוֹתָיו.
human_translation: And where he does not develop the signs of a eunuch, until what The school of Rabbi Ḥiyya taught: Until most of his years
llm_translation: And if he did not develop signs of a eunuch, until when? The school of Rabbi Chiya taught: Until most of his years.

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתוֹ לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרָבָא, אִי כָּחוּשׁ אֲמַר לְהוּ: זִילוּ אַבְרְיוּהּ. וְאִי בָּרִיא אֲמַר לְהוּ: זִילוּ אַכְחֲשׁוּהּ. דְּהָנֵי סִימָנִין, זִמְנִין דְּנָתְרִי מֵחֲמַת כְּחִישׁוּתָא, וְזִמְנִין דְּנָתְרִי מֵחֲמַת בְּרִיּוּתָא.
human_translation: When they would come before Rava if thin, he would say to them: Go fatten him And if he fat, he would say to them: Go make him thin. As these signs, sometimes they fall off due to thinness and sometimes they fall off due to fatness.
llm_translation: When they came before Rava, if he appeared pale, he would say to them: "Go and heal him." And if he appeared healthy, he would say to them: "Go and deceive him." These are the signs: sometimes they are removed due to weakness, and sometimes they are removed due to health.

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ הָאִשָּׁה רַבָּה
llm_translation: We will return to you, O woman Rabba.

hebrew_text: נוֹשְׂאִין עַל הָאֲנוּסָה וְעַל הַמְפוּתָּה, הָאוֹנֵס וְהַמְפַתֶּה עַל הַנְּשׂוּאָה — חַיָּיב. נוֹשֵׂא אָדָם אֲנוּסַת אָבִיו וּמְפוּתַּת אָבִיו, אֲנוּסַת בְּנוֹ וּמְפוּתַּת בְּנוֹ. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹסֵר בַּאֲנוּסַת אָבִיו וּמְפוּתַּת אָבִיו.
human_translation: One may marry of the woman he raped and of the woman he seduced. one who rapes and one who seduces of the woman who is married is liable A man may marry a woman raped by his father, or a woman seduced by his father, a woman raped by his son, or a woman seduced by his son. Rabbi Yehuda prohibits in a woman raped by his father or a woman seduced by his father.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Carrying a burden on the coerced and on the seduced, the one who coerces and the one who seduces are liable for the married woman. A person carries the burden of his coerced father and his seduced father, the burden of his coerced son and his seduced son. Rabbi Yehuda prohibits carrying the burden of his coerced father and his seduced father."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תְּנֵינָא לְהָא דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: אָנַס אִשָּׁה — מוּתָּר לִישָּׂא בִּתָּהּ, נָשָׂא אִשָּׁה — אָסוּר לִישָּׂא בִּתָּהּ. וּרְמִינְהוּ: הַנִּטְעָן מִן הָאִשָּׁה — אָסוּר בְּאִמָּהּ וּבְבִתָּהּ וּבַאֲחוֹתָהּ! מִדְּרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: We learned that which the Sages teach raped a woman, he is permitted to marry her daughter. he married a woman, it is prohibited to marry her daughter. However, raises a contradiction One who is alleged with woman is prohibited with her mother, and with her daughter, and with her sister. rabbinic
llm_translation: The Gemara teaches in accordance with what the Rabbis taught: If a man was forced to have relations with a woman - he is permitted to marry her daughter, but if he willingly married a woman - he is forbidden to marry her daughter. And they raised a dilemma: One who plants seeds from the woman - is forbidden to marry her mother, her daughter, and her sister! This is the ruling of the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: וְכֹל הֵיכָא דְּאִיכָּא אִיסּוּרָא מִדְּרַבָּנַן תָּנֵי נוֹשְׂאִין לְכַתְּחִלָּה?! כִּי תְּנַן מַתְנִיתִין — לְאַחַר מִיתָה.
human_translation: And anywhere that there is a rabbinic prohibition, teach one may marry ab initio ? When we learned the mishna after death
llm_translation: And all places where there is a prohibition from the Rabbis, it is taught: we lift it initially?! For we learned in a Mishnah - after death.

hebrew_text: מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: בְּכוּלָּן נֶאֱמַר שְׁכִיבָה, וְכָאן נֶאֱמַר קִיחָה, לוֹמַר לְךָ: דֶּרֶךְ לִיקּוּחִין אָסְרָה תּוֹרָה.
human_translation: from where are these matters as the Sages taught: With all lying is stated, whereas here, taking is stated. to tell you Torah prohibited through taking,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "What are these words? For the Rabbis taught: In all of them it is stated 'lying,' and here it is stated 'taking,' to tell you: The Torah prohibited the way of taking."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב פָּפָּא לְאַבָּיֵי: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, גַּבֵּי אֲחוֹתוֹ דִּכְתִיב: ״אִישׁ אֲשֶׁר יִקַּח אֶת אֲחוֹתוֹ בַּת אָבִיו אוֹ בַת אִמּוֹ״, הָכִי נָמֵי דֶּרֶךְ קִיחָה הוּא דַּאֲסִיר, דֶּרֶךְ שְׁכִיבָה שְׁרֵי?!
human_translation: Rav Pappa said to Abaye: However, if so, with regard to one’s sister, it is written: “And if a man takes his sister, his father’s daughter, or his mother’s daughter” also through taking, prohibited. through lying, permitted.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Papa to Abbaye: Rather, from now on, regarding his sister, as it is written: "A man who takes his sister, the daughter of his father or the daughter of his mother," so too, in the manner of taking, it is prohibited, but in the manner of cohabitation, it is permitted?!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לִיקּוּחִין כְּתִיבִי בַּתּוֹרָה סְתָם. הָרָאוּי לְקִיחָה — קִיחָה, הָרָאוּי לִשְׁכִיבָה — שְׁכִיבָה.
human_translation: said to taking is stated in the Torah without specification, that has potential for taking taking that has potential for lying, lying
llm_translation: He said to him: Regarding acquisitions, it is written in the Torah explicitly. That which is fit for acquisition - it is acquired, that which is fit for lying down - it is laid down.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: אָנַס אִשָּׁה — מוּתָּר לִישָּׂא בִּתָּהּ מֵהָכָא, כְּתִיב: ״עֶרְוַת בַּת בִּנְךָ אוֹ בַת בִּתְּךָ לֹא תְגַלֶּה״, הָא בַּת בְּנָהּ דִּידַהּ, וּבַת בִּתָּהּ דִּידַהּ — גַּלִּי,
human_translation: Rava said: raped a woman it is permitted to marry her daughter from here. It is stated: “The nakedness of your son’s daughter, or of your daughter’s daughter, you may not uncover” the daughter of own son and the daughter of her own daughter, uncovered,
llm_translation: Rava said: If one was forced with a woman - he is permitted to marry his daughter from her, as it is written: "The nakedness of your son's daughter or your daughter's daughter, you shall not uncover." This refers to his son's daughter from her, but his daughter's daughter from her - he may uncover.

hebrew_text: וּכְתִיב: ״עֶרְוַת אִשָּׁה וּבִתָּהּ לֹא תְגַלֵּה אֶת בַּת בְּנָהּ וְאֶת בַּת בִּתָּהּ לֹא תִקַּח״, הָא כֵּיצַד? כָּאן בָּאוֹנָסִין, כָּאן בְּנִשּׂוּאִין.
human_translation: And it is written: “You may not uncover the nakedness of a woman and her daughter; you may not take her son’s daughter, or her daughter’s daughter, How so? with regard to rape. with regard to marriage.
