llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it is written: "The nakedness of a woman and her daughter you shall not uncover; you shall not take her son's daughter or her daughter's daughter, to uncover her nakedness" (Leviticus 18:17). How so? Here it refers to cases of rape, here to cases of marriage.

hebrew_text: אֵיפוֹךְ אֲנָא? עֲרָיוֹת ״שְׁאֵר״ כְּתִיב בְּהוּ. בְּנִשּׂוּאִין אִיכָּא שְׁאֵר, בָּאוֹנָסִין לֵיכָּא שְׁאֵר.
human_translation: I should reverse With those with whom intercourse is forbidden, kinship is stated In marriage there is kinship, in rape there is no kinship.
llm_translation: The opposite, I? Nakedness "she'er" is written in it. In consensual relations there is she'er, in cases of rape there is no she'er.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹסֵר בַּאֲנוּסַת אָבִיו וְכוּ׳. אָמַר רַב גִּידֵּל אָמַר רַב: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״לֹא יִקַּח אִישׁ אֶת אֵשֶׁת אָבִיו וְלֹא יְגַלֶּה כְּנַף אָבִיו״, כָּנָף שֶׁרָאָה אָבִיו לֹא יְגַלֶּה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda prohibits a woman raped by his father Rav Giddel said Rav said: What is the reasoning of Rabbi Yehuda? as it is written: “A man may not take his father’s wife, and may not uncover his father’s skirt” one may not uncover skirt that his father has seen.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehudah prohibits the "anusat aviv," etc. Rav Giddel said in the name of Rav: What is the reason for Rabbi Yehudah? As it is written: "A man shall not take his father's wife, and shall not uncover his father's wing," the wing that his father saw, he shall not uncover.

hebrew_text: וּמִמַּאי דְּבַאֲנוּסָה כְּתִיב — דִּכְתִיב מֵעִילָּוֵיהּ דִּקְרָא: ״וְנָתַן הָאִישׁ הַשּׁוֹכֵב עִמָּהּ לַאֲבִי הַנַּעֲרָה חֲמִשִּׁים כָּסֶף״.
human_translation: And from where that is written with regard to a woman raped as it is written before that verse, “And the man who lay with her shall give the young woman’s father fifty shekels of silver”
llm_translation: And from where is it derived that in the case of rape it is written — as it is written from its beginning in the verse: "And the man who lies with her shall give to the father of the young woman fifty silver shekels."

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן: אִי הֲוָה סְמִיךְ לֵיהּ — כִּדְקָאָמְרַתְּ. הַשְׁתָּא דְּלָא סְמִיךְ לֵיהּ, מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְכִדְרַב עָנָן. דְּאָמַר רַב עָנָן אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: בְּשׁוֹמֶרֶת יָבָם שֶׁל אָבִיו הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר. וּמַאי ״כְּנַף אָבִיו״ — כָּנָף הָרָאוּי לְאָבִיו לֹא יְגַלֶּה.
human_translation: And the Rabbis, If had been juxtaposed with as you said. now that it is not juxtaposed with it, is necessary to that which Rav Anan as Rav Anan said Shmuel said: The verse is speaking of a widow waiting for her brother-in-law, father, And what “his father’s skirt”? skirt that is potentially his father’s, he may not uncover.
llm_translation: The sages said: If he was close to him - as you said. Now that he is not close to him, he requires the consent of Rav Anan. For Rav Anan said in the name of Shmuel: The Torah speaks of the yavam of his father's wife. And what is "the wing of his father"? - The wing that is fitting for his father, he shall not uncover.

hebrew_text: וְתִיפּוֹק לֵיהּ מִשּׁוּם דּוֹדָתוֹ! לַעֲבוֹר עָלֶיהָ בִּשְׁנֵי לָאוִין.
human_translation: Derive due to his aunt, with her has violated two prohibitions. to with her violate two prohibitions,
llm_translation: And let him marry her because of his affection for her! To transgress upon her with two prohibitions.

hebrew_text: וְתִיפּוֹק לֵיהּ מִשּׁוּם יְבָמָה לַשּׁוּק! לַעֲבוֹר עָלֶיהָ בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה לָאוִין. וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: לְאַחַר מִיתָה.
human_translation: But derive because a yevama with the public, with her violated three prohibitions: And if you wish, say after death
llm_translation: And she shall go out because of the levirate marriage to the market! To transgress upon her in three negative commandments. And if you will say: after death.

hebrew_text: ״אַח מֵאַב וְלֹא מֵאֵם, וְהוּא בַּעֲלַהּ דְּאֵם, וַאֲנָא בְּרַתַּהּ דְּאִנְתְּתֵיהּ״. אָמַר רָמֵי בַּר חָמָא: דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה דְּמַתְנִיתִין.
human_translation: brother from father and not from mother, and is the husband of mother, and I am the daughter of his wife. Rami bar Ḥama said: not according to Rabbi Yehuda in the mishna,
llm_translation: Brother from father and not from mother, and he is the husband of the mother, and I am the daughter of the one who gave birth to him. Ramei son of Hama said: Not like Rabbi Yehuda as it is taught in the Mishnah.

hebrew_text: ״אָח הוּא, וּבְרִי הוּא, אֲחָתֵיהּ אֲנָא דְּהַאי דְּדָרֵינָא אַכַּתְפַּאי״ — מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ בְּגוֹי הַבָּא עַל בִּתּוֹ.
human_translation: He is brother and he is my son; I am the sister of this one, whom I carry on my shoulders. You find it in a gentile who engaged in intercourse with his daughter,
llm_translation: "Brother he is, and son he is, his sister I am, for this one that I dwell with is his wife" — she found in him a non-Jew who came upon his daughter.

hebrew_text: ״שְׁלָמָא לָךְ בְּרִי, בַּת אֲחָתִיךְ אֲנָא״ — מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ בְּגוֹי הַבָּא עַל בַּת בִּתּוֹ.
human_translation: Peace upon you, my son; I am the daughter of your sister. You find in a gentile who engaged in intercourse with the daughter of his daughter,
llm_translation: "Shlama to you, my daughter, I am your brother" - she found in him a non-Jew who came upon his daughter's daughter.

hebrew_text: ״דַּלָּאֵי דְּדָלוּ דַּוְולָא, לִיפּוֹל בְּכוּ סְתַר פְּתַר: דְּהַאי דְּדָרֵינָא הוּא בַּר, וַאֲנָא בְּרַת אֲחוּהּ״ — מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ בְּגוֹי הַבָּא עַל בַּת בְּנוֹ.
human_translation: Water drawers, who draw in buckets let cryptic fall among you: This whom I carry is son, and I am the daughter of his brother. You find in a gentile who engaged in intercourse with the daughter of his son,
llm_translation: "Because they were poor, they fell into a pit of mud, for this one is a son of a bear, and I am a daughter of his brother" - she found him among the nations who came upon his grandson's daughter.

hebrew_text: ״בִּיָּיא בִּיָּיא מֵאַח, וְהוּא אַב, וְהוּא בְּעֵל, וְהוּא בַּר בְּעֵל, וְהוּא בַּעְלַהּ דְּאֵם, וַאֲנָא בְּרַתַּהּ דְּאִיתְּתֵיהּ, וְלָא יָהֵיב פִּיתָּא לַאֲחוּהּ יַתְמֵי בְּנֵי בְרַתֵּיה״ — מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ בְּגוֹי הַבָּא עַל אִמּוֹ וְהוֹלִיד מִמֶּנָּה בַּת, וְחָזַר וּבָא עַל אוֹתָהּ בַּת, וְחָזַר זָקֵן וּבָא עָלֶיהָ וְהוֹלִיד מִמֶּנָּה בָּנִים.
human_translation: Woe, woe [ baya , baya ] for brother, who is father, and who is husband, and who is the son of husband, and who is the husband of mother, and I am the daughter of his wife; and he does not provide bread for his brothers, who are orphans, the sons of his daughter. You find in a gentile who engaged in intercourse with his mother, and she bore him a daughter. And he engaged in intercourse with that daughter. And then old man, engaged in intercourse with her, and she bore him sons.
llm_translation: "Biya biya me'ach, vehu av, vehu ba'al, vehu bar be'al, vehu ba'lah de'em, va'ana bratah de'ititeih, velo yahev pitah la'achuha yatmei bnei brateih" — mashkachatei lah begoi haba al immo veholid mimenna bat, vehazar uva al otah bat, vehazar zaken uva aleiha veholid mimenna banim.

hebrew_text: ״אֲנָא וְאַתְּ — אַחֵי, אֲנָא וַאֲבוּךְ — אַחֵי, אֲנָא וְאִמָּךְ — אַחֵי״ — מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ בְּגוֹי הַבָּא עַל אִמּוֹ וְהוֹלִיד מִמֶּנָּה שְׁתֵּי בָנוֹת, וְחָזַר וּבָא עַל אַחַת מֵהֶן, וְהוֹלִיד מִמֶּנָּה בֵּן, וְקָרְיָא לֵיהּ אֲחָתֵיהּ דְּאִימָּא וְקָאָמְרָה לֵיהּ הָכִי.
human_translation: You and I are siblings; your father and I are siblings; your mother and I are siblings. You find in a gentile who engaged in intercourse with his mother, and she bore him two daughters, and he then engaged in intercourse with one of them, and she bore him a son. And the sister of mother calls him and says this to him,
llm_translation: "Ana ve'at - achei, ana va'avuch - achei, ana ve'imach - achei" - mashkachat la b'goy haba al imo veholid mimehna shetay banot, vehazar uva alachat mehen, veholid mimehna ben, vekarya leih achateih de'ima ve'kaamra leih hachi.

hebrew_text: ״אֲנָא וְאַתְּ — בְּנֵי אַחֵי, אֲנָא וַאֲבוּךְ — בְּנֵי אַחֵי, אֲנָא וְאִמָּךְ — בְּנֵי אַחֵי״. הָא בְּהֶיתֵּירָא נָמֵי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ — כְּגוֹן רְאוּבֵן שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ שְׁתֵּי בָנוֹת, וַאֲתָא שִׁמְעוֹן וּנְסַב חֲדָא מִינַּיְיהוּ, וַאֲתָא בַּר לֵוִי וּנְסַב חַד מִינַּיְיהוּ, וְקָאָמַר לֵיהּ בְּרֵיהּ דְּשִׁמְעוֹן לְבַר בְּרֵיהּ דְּלֵוִי.
human_translation: You and I are cousins; your father and I are cousins; your mother and I are cousins. You find this in a permitted as well. For example, Reuven, who has two daughters, and Shimon came and married one of them, and the son of Levi, came and married one of them. And the son of Shimon says to the grandson of Levi.
llm_translation: "Ana and you — sons of brothers, Ana and your father — sons of brothers, Ana and your mother — sons of brothers." When there is a doubt, one should be stringent with her — for example, Reuben who has two daughters, and then Simeon came and married one of them, and then Levi came and married one of them, and he said to the son of Simeon to the son of Levi.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַגִּיּוֹרֶת שֶׁנִּתְגַּיְּירוּ בָּנֶיהָ עִמָּהּ לֹא — חוֹלְצִין וְלֹא מְיַיבְּמִין, אֲפִלּוּ הוֹרָתוֹ שֶׁל רִאשׁוֹן שֶׁלֹּא בִּקְדוּשָּׁה וְלֵידָתוֹ בִּקְדוּשָּׁה, וְהַשֵּׁנִי הוֹרָתוֹ וְלֵידָתוֹ בִּקְדוּשָּׁה. וְכֵן שִׁפְחָה שֶׁנִּשְׁתַּחְרְרוּ בָּנֶיהָ עִמָּהּ.
human_translation: a female convert whose sons converted with her, they do not perform ḥalitza and they do not perform levirate marriage even the conception of the first was not in sanctity but his birth was in sanctity whereas the second conceived and born in sanctity. And similarly a maidservant whose sons were freed with her,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: A convert whose children converted with her - they do not perform chalitzah nor do they perform levirate marriage, even if the first husband was not sanctified and the second husband was sanctified. Similarly, a freed maidservant whose children were freed with her.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ בְּנֵי יוּדָן אַמְתָּא אִשְׁתַּחְרוּר, שְׁרָא לְהוּ רַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב לְמִינְסַב נְשֵׁי דַּהֲדָדֵי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא: וְהָא רַב שֵׁשֶׁת אָסַר! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הוּא אָסַר וַאֲנָא שָׁרֵינָא.
human_translation: The sons of Yudan the maidservant were freed. Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov allowed them to marry each other’s wives Rava said to him: Didn’t Rav Sheshet prohibit said to him: He prohibited and I permit
llm_translation: Gemar in the name of the sons of Judah, Amata sought freedom, Rav Acha bar Yaakov permitted them to marry the daughters of Hadadezer. Rava said to him: But didn't Rav Sheshet prohibit it? He replied to him: He prohibited it, but I permit it.

hebrew_text: מִן הָאָב וְלֹא מִן הָאֵם — כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דִּשְׁרֵי. מִן הָאֵם וְלֹא מִן הָאָב — כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דַּאֲסִיר.
human_translation: from father’s and not from mother’s everyone agrees that is permitted, from mother and not from father, everyone agrees that it is prohibited.
llm_translation: From the father and not from the mother - everyone agrees that it is permissible. From the mother and not from the father - everyone agrees that it is forbidden.

hebrew_text: כִּי פְּלִיגִי, מִן הָאָב וּמִן הָאֵם. מַאן דְּשָׁרֵי: בָּתַר אַבָּא שָׁדֵינַן, דְּהָא ״בְּנֵי פְלָנְיָא״ קָרוּ לְהוּ. וְרַב שֵׁשֶׁת: קָרוּ לְהוּ נָמֵי ״בְּנֵי פְלוֹנִית״.
human_translation: When they disagree, is from father and from mother. The one who permits we trace after father. since they are called the sons of so-and-so, And Rav Sheshet they are also called the sons of so-and-so,
llm_translation: When they argue, from the father and from the mother. Who permits: after the father we name, for "the sons of so-and-so" they are called. And Rav Sheshet: they are also called "the sons of so-and-so."

hebrew_text: וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמַר: פְּלִיג רַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב אֲפִילּוּ בְּאַחִין מִן הָאֵם, וּמַאי טַעְמָא? גֵּר שֶׁנִּתְגַּיֵּיר כְּקָטָן שֶׁנּוֹלַד דָּמֵי.
human_translation: And some say Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov disagrees even with regard to maternal brothers. And what is the reasoning a convert who converted like a child born,
llm_translation: And there is one who said: Rav Acha bar Yaakov disagrees, even in the case of brothers from the same mother, and what is the reason? A convert is like a newborn infant.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: הַגִּיּוֹרֶת שֶׁנִּתְגַּיְּירוּ בָּנֶיהָ עִמָּהּ — לֹא חוֹלְצִין וְלֹא מְיַיבְּמִין. מַאי טַעְמָא, לָאו מִשּׁוּם דַּאֲסִירִי! לָא, דְּאֵינָהּ בְּתוֹרַת חֲלִיצָה וְיִיבּוּם, וְשַׁרְיָא לְעָלְמָא. וְאִינְהוּ נָמֵי שְׁרוּ.
human_translation: We learned a female convert whose sons converted with her, they do not perform ḥalitza and they do not perform levirate marriage What is the reason not because they are prohibited No, that not in the law of ḥalitza and levirate marriage, and is permitted to anyone. And they, too, are permitted
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: A convert whose sons converted with her - they do not perform chalitzah nor yibum. What is the reason? Not because they are forbidden! No, it is because she is not subject to the laws of chalitzah and yibum, and is permitted to the world. And they also permitted.

hebrew_text: וְהָא קָתָנֵי ״אֲפִילּוּ״, אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא אֲסִירִי, הַיְינוּ דְּקָתָנֵי ״אֲפִילּוּ״ — דְּאַף עַל גַּב דְּרִאשׁוֹן הוֹרָתוֹ שֶׁלֹּא בִּקְדוּשָּׁה וְלֵידָתוֹ בִּקְדוּשָּׁה, וְהַשֵּׁנִי הוֹרָתוֹ וְלֵידָתוֹ בִּקְדוּשָּׁה, וְכִשְׁתֵּי אִמָּהוֹת דָּמוּ, אֲפִילּוּ הָכִי — אֲסִירִי. אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ שָׁרוּ, מַאי ״אֲפִילּוּ״?
human_translation: But doesn’t teach even Granted, if you say they are prohibited this is that which is taught: Even Although the first was not conceived in sanctity and his birth was in sanctity, whereas the second conceived and born in sanctity, and they are like two mothers, even so they are prohibited But if you say they are permitted what is even?
llm_translation: The Gemara asks: But it is taught "even if." If you say it is referring to cases where the first woman's conception and birth were not in sanctity, and the second woman's conception and birth were in sanctity, and both their mothers were valid wives, even so, they are prohibited. Rather, if you say they are permitted, what is the meaning of "even if"?

hebrew_text: דְּאַף עַל גַּב דְּתַרְוַיְיהוּ לֵידָתָן בִּקְדוּשָּׁה, וְאָתֵי לְאִיחַלּוֹפֵי בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל, אֲפִילּוּ הָכִי — שְׁרֵי.
human_translation: that although both of them were born in sanctity, and come to confuse them with Jews nevertheless they are permitted
llm_translation: Even though both of them were born through a holy act, and they come to exchange in Israel, even so - it is permitted.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: הָכִי נָמֵי מִסְתַּבְּרָא דִּשְׁרוּ, דְּקָתָנֵי ״אֲפִילּוּ״. אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא שְׁרוּ — הַיְינוּ דְּקָתָנֵי ״אֲפִילּוּ״, דְּאַף עַל גַּב דְּתַרְוַיְיהוּ לֵידָתָן בִּקְדוּשָּׁה, דְּאָתֵי לְאִיחַלּוֹפֵי בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל — אֲפִילּוּ הָכִי שְׁרוּ. אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ אֲסִירִי, מַאי ״אֲפִילּוּ״?
human_translation: There are who say So too, it is reasonable that they are permitted as teaches: Even Granted, if you say they are permitted, this is that which is taught: Even Although both of them were born in sanctity, and come to confuse them with Jews nevertheless, they are permitted. But if you say they are prohibited, what is even?
llm_translation: There are those who say: So it is fitting that they permitted, for it is taught "even if." If you say fitting, that is what it is taught "even if," that even though both of them are born in holiness, for they come to exchange in Israel — even so it is fitting. But if you say forbidden, what is "even if"?

hebrew_text: דְּאַף עַל גַּב דְּרִאשׁוֹן הוֹרָתוֹ שֶׁלֹּא בִּקְדוּשָּׁה וְלֵידָתוֹ בִּקְדוּשָּׁה, וְהַשֵּׁנִי הוֹרָתוֹ וְלֵידָתוֹ בִּקְדוּשָּׁה, דְּכִשְׁתֵּי אִמָּהוֹת דָּמֵי — אֲפִילּוּ הָכִי אֲסִירִי.
human_translation: that although the first was not conceived in sanctity and his birth was in sanctity, whereas the second conceived and born in sanctity, that like two mothers, nevertheless, they are prohibited
llm_translation: Firstly, even though his conception was not in holiness and his birth was in holiness, and the second, his conception and birth were in holiness, for when there are two mothers, it is as if they are sisters — even so, they are forbidden.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: שְׁנֵי אַחִים תְּאוֹמִים גֵּרִים, וְכֵן מְשׁוּחְרָרִים — לֹא חוֹלְצִין וְלֹא מְיַיבְּמִין, וְאֵין חַיָּיבִין מִשּׁוּם אֵשֶׁת אָח. הָיְתָה הוֹרָתָן שֶׁלֹּא בִּקְדוּשָּׁה וְלֵידָתָן בִּקְדוּשָּׁה — לֹא חוֹלְצִין וְלֹא מְיַיבְּמִין, אֲבָל חַיָּיבִין מִשּׁוּם אֵשֶׁת אָח. הָיְתָה הוֹרָתָן וְלֵידָתָן בִּקְדוּשָּׁה — הֲרֵי הֵן כְּיִשְׂרְאֵלִים לְכׇל דִּבְרֵיהֶן. קָתָנֵי מִיהַת: אֵין חַיָּיבִין מִשּׁוּם אֵשֶׁת אָח, חִיּוּבָא לֵיכָּא —
human_translation: Come hear: Two twin brothers converts, and similarly freed do not perform ḥalitza and they do not perform levirate marriage and they are not liable for intercourse with a brother’s wife. they were not conceived in sanctity and their birth was in sanctity, they do not perform ḥalitza or levirate marriage, but they are liable for intercourse with a brother’s wife. they were conceived and born in sanctity, they are like Jews in all of their matters. In any event, is teaching are not liable for intercourse with a brother’s wife. is no liability
llm_translation: Come and hear: Two twin brothers who are converts, and similarly freed slaves — do not perform ḥalitza nor engage in levirate marriage, and they are not obligated due to the wife of a brother. If their conception was not in sanctity but their birth was in sanctity — they do not perform ḥalitza nor engage in levirate marriage, but they are obligated due to the wife of a brother. If both their conception and birth were in sanctity — they are considered like Israelites in all matters. It was taught in a baraita: They are not obligated due to the wife of a brother, the obligation does not apply —

hebrew_text: הָא אִיסּוּרָא אִיכָּא! הוּא הַדִּין דַּאֲפִילּוּ אִיסּוּרָא נָמֵי לֵיכָּא, וְאַיְּידֵי דְּבָעֵי לְמִיתְנֵי סֵיפָא ״אֲבָל חַיָּיבִין״, תַּנָּא נָמֵי רֵישָׁא ״אֵין חַיָּיבִין״.
human_translation: there is prohibition, The same is true that there is no prohibition, either. And since wanted to teach in the latter clause they are liable, it also taught in the first clause they are not liable.
llm_translation: The prohibition, there is! It is the same as that even if the prohibition is also not there, and since it wants to teach the end "but they are liable," a tanna also taught the beginning "they are not liable."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא, הָא דַּאֲמוּר רַבָּנַן: אֵין אָב לְגוֹי, לָא תֵּימָא מִשּׁוּם דִּשְׁטִופִי בְּזִמָּה, דְּלָא יְדִיעַ, אֲבָל יְדִיעַ — חָיְישִׁינַן, אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ דִּידִיעַ — נָמֵי לָא חָיְישִׁינַן.
human_translation: Rava said: that which the Sages said, a gentile has no patrilineage, do not say because they are steeped in licentiousness that they do not know but is known, we are concerned Rather, when it is known, we are still not concerned.
llm_translation: Rava said, this that the Rabbis say: "There is no father for a non-Jew," do not say it is because of the suspicion of adultery, for he is not knowledgeable, but if he is knowledgeable, we are concerned. Rather, even if he is knowledgeable, we are not concerned.

hebrew_text: דְּהָא שְׁנֵי אַחִין תְּאוֹמִים, דְּטִפָּה אַחַת הִיא וְנֶחְלְקָה לִשְׁתַּיִם, וְקָתָנֵי סֵיפָא: לֹא חוֹלְצִין וְלֹא מְיַיבְּמִין, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: אַפְקוֹרֵי אַפְקְרֵיהּ רַחֲמָנָא לְזַרְעֵיהּ, דִּכְתִיב: ״בְּשַׂר חֲמוֹרִים בְּשָׂרָם וְזִרְמַת סוּסִים זִרְמָתָם״.
human_translation: from two twin brothers, who were one drop that was divided into two and is taught the latter clause They do not perform ḥalitza and they do not perform levirate marriage, Learn from this the Merciful One dispossesses his offspring, as it is written “Whose flesh is the flesh of donkeys, and whose semen is the semen of horses”
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: For two brothers who are twins, there is one drop and it is divided into two. And the latter clause teaches: They do not perform ḥalitza nor do they perform levirate marriage. Learn from it: The All-Merciful has declared them free from the obligation to perpetuate their seed, as it is written: "The flesh of donkeys is their flesh and the issue of horses is their issue."

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּנִיפְטַיִים הַגֵּר שֶׁנָּשָׂא אֵשֶׁת אָחִיו מֵאִמּוֹ, וּבָא מַעֲשֶׂה לִפְנֵי חֲכָמִים, וְאָמְרוּ: אֵין אִישׁוּת לַגֵּר. וְאֶלָּא גֵּר דְּקַדֵּישׁ הָכִי נָמֵי לָא תָּפְסִי בַּהּ קִידּוּשִׁין?! אֶלָּא אֵימָא: אֵין אִסּוּר אֵשֶׁת אָח לַגֵּר. מַאי לָאו דְּנַסְבַהּ אַח כְּשֶׁהוּא גֵּר!
human_translation: Come hear as Rabbi Yosei said: An incident involving Niftayim the convert, who married the wife of his maternal brother, and the incident came before the Sages, and they said there is no marriage for a convert. And if a convert betroths is betrothal to her indeed ineffective? Rather, say with regard to a convert there is no prohibition a brother’s wife. What, is not where brother, married her when he was a convert,
llm_translation: Come and hear, for Rabbi Yosei said: There was an incident in Niftayim of a convert who married his brother's wife from his mother, and the matter came before the sages, and they said: A convert has no lineage. But if a convert who sanctified himself is it not fitting to perform the betrothal with her?! Rather say: There is no prohibition of a brother's wife for a convert. What is the reason that a brother is not forbidden when he is a convert!

hebrew_text: לָא, דְּנַסְבַהּ כְּשֶׁהוּא גּוֹי. כְּשֶׁהוּא גּוֹי, מַאי לְמֵימְרָא? מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: לִיגְזוֹר כְּשֶׁהוּא גּוֹי אַטּוּ כְּשֶׁהוּא גֵּר, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: No, where married her while he was a gentile, while he was a gentile, what of stating Lest you say should decree while he was a gentile, due to when he was a convert. teaches us
llm_translation: Not to, that he converted when he was a gentile. When he was a gentile, what to say? What you might say: to decree when he is a gentile, then when he is a convert, it is heard for us.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּאָמַר בֶּן יָאסְיָין: כְּשֶׁהָלַכְתִּי לִכְרַכֵּי הַיָּם מָצָאתִי גֵּר אֶחָד שֶׁנָּשָׂא אֵשֶׁת אָחִיו מֵאִמּוֹ. אָמַרְתִּי לוֹ: בְּנִי, מִי הִרְשְׁךָ? אָמַר לִי: הֲרֵי אִשָּׁה וְשִׁבְעָה בָּנֶיהָ, עַל סַפְסָל זֶה יָשַׁב רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא וְאָמַר שְׁנֵי דְבָרִים: גֵּר נוֹשֵׂא אֵשֶׁת אָחִיו מֵאִמּוֹ, וְאָמַר: ״וַיְהִי דְבַר ה׳ אֶל יוֹנָה שֵׁנִית לֵאמֹר״ — שֵׁנִית דִּבְּרָה עִמּוֹ שְׁכִינָה, שְׁלִישִׁית לֹא דִּבְּרָה עִמּוֹ שְׁכִינָה. קָתָנֵי מִיהַת גֵּר נוֹשֵׂא אֵשֶׁת אָחִיו מֵאִמּוֹ. מַאי לָאו, דְּנַסְבַהּ אָחִיו כְּשֶׁהוּא גֵּר?
human_translation: Come hear as ben Yasiyan said: When I went to cities overseas, I found one convert who married the wife of his maternal brother. I said to him: My son, who permitted you? He said to me: There is woman and her seven sons On this bench [ safsal ], Rabbi Akiva sat and said two statements: a convert may marry the wife of his maternal brother, and he said “And the word of the Lord came to Jonah a second time, saying” Divine Presence spoke with him a second a third Divine Presence did not speak with him, In any event, teaches a convert may marry the wife of his maternal brother. What, is it not where brother married her when he was a convert?
llm_translation: Come and hear, for Ben Yasiyin said: When I went to the coastal towns, I found a convert who had taken his brother's wife from his mother. I said to him: My son, who permitted you? He said to me: Here is a woman and her seven children, Rabbi Akiva sat on this bench and said two things: a convert who takes his brother's wife from his mother, and he said: "And the word of the Lord came to Jonah a second time saying" - a second time the Divine Presence spoke with him, a third time the Divine Presence did not speak with him. It was taught from there regarding a convert who takes his brother's wife from his mother. What is the reason that his brother did not marry her when he was a convert?

hebrew_text: לָא, דְּנַסְבַהּ כְּשֶׁהוּא גּוֹי. מַאי לְמֵימְרָא? מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: נִגְזוֹר כְּשֶׁהוּא גּוֹי אַטּוּ כְּשֶׁהוּא גֵּר, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: No, where married her while he was a gentile. what of stating Lest you say we should decree while he was a gentile, due to when he was a convert. teaches us
llm_translation: Not that he converted when he was a gentile. What is the reason? Perhaps you will say: It is decreed that when he is a gentile, then when he is a convert, it is heard for us.

hebrew_text: וּמִי מְהֵימַן, וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא אָמַר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב: כׇּל תַּלְמִיד חָכָם שֶׁמּוֹרֶה הֲלָכָה וּבָא, אִם קוֹדֶם מַעֲשֶׂה אֲמָרָהּ — שׁוֹמְעִין לוֹ, וְאִם לָאו — אֵין שׁוֹמְעִין לוֹ!
human_translation: And is a reliable Didn’t Rabbi Abba say Rav Huna said Rav said: any Torah scholar who teaches halakha and it comes if he said it before the incident, one listens to him. And if not, does not listen to him.
llm_translation: "And who is trustworthy? And Rabbi Abba said that Rav Huna said that Rav said: Any Torah scholar who teaches a halacha and it comes to pass, if he said it before the action – we listen to him, but if not – we do not listen to him!"

hebrew_text: אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: מוֹרֶה וּבָא הָיָה. וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: מִשּׁוּם דְּקָאָמַר הֲרֵי אִשָּׁה וְשִׁבְעָה בָּנֶיהָ. וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: שָׁאנֵי הָכָא, דְּקָאָמַר מַעֲשֶׂה אַחֲרִינָא בַּהֲדֵהּ.
human_translation: If you wish, say taught and it came And if you wish, say because he stating a woman and her seven sons, And if you wish, say here it is different, as stated a different incident with it.
llm_translation: If you ask, say: "He taught and came." And if you ask, say: "Because he said, 'Here is a woman and her seven sons.'" And if you ask, say: "It is different here, for he said another matter in its place."

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: ״וַיְהִי דְבַר ה׳ אֶל יוֹנָה שֵׁנִית לֵאמֹר״, שֵׁנִית דִּבְּרָה עִמּוֹ שְׁכִינָה, שְׁלִישִׁית לֹא דִּבְּרָה עִמּוֹ. וְהָא כְּתִיב: ״הוּא הֵשִׁיב [אֶת] גְּבוּל יִשְׂרָאֵל מִלְּבוֹא חֲמָת עַד יָם הָעֲרָבָה כִּדְבַר ה׳ אֲשֶׁר דִּבֶּר בְּיַד עַבְדּוֹ יוֹנָה בֶן אֲמִתַּי הַנָּבִיא״!
human_translation: The Master said “And the word of the Lord came to Jonah a second time, saying” Divine Presence spoke with him a second a third did not speak with him. Isn’t it written “He restored the border of Israel from the entrance of Hamath to the Sea of the Arabah, according to the word of the Lord, which He spoke by the hand of His servant Jonah the son of Amittai, the prophet”
llm_translation: Master said: "And the word of the Lord came to Jonah a second time saying," a second time the Divine Presence spoke with him, a third time did not speak with him. But is it not written: "He restored the border of Israel from the entrance of Hamath to the Sea of the Arabah, according to the word of the Lord which He spoke through His servant Jonah son of Amittai the prophet!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבִינָא: עַל עִסְקֵי נִינְוֵה קָאָמַר. רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק אָמַר, הָכִי קָאָמַר: ״כִּדְבַר ה׳ אֲשֶׁר דִּבֶּר בְּיַד עַבְדּוֹ הַנָּבִיא״ — כְּשֵׁם שֶׁנֶּהְפַּךְ לְנִינְוֵה מֵרָעָה לְטוֹבָה, כָּךְ בִּימֵי יָרׇבְעָם בֶּן יוֹאָשׁ נֶהֱפַךְ לָהֶם לְיִשְׂרָאֵל מֵרָעָה לְטוֹבָה.
human_translation: Ravina said: was saying about the issue of Nineveh. Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said this is “According to the word of the Lord, which He spoke by the hand of His servant Jonah the son of Amittai, the prophet”: just as Nineveh turned from bad to good, so too, in the days of Jeroboam ben Joash, Israel’s turned from bad to good.
llm_translation: Ravina said: Regarding the affairs of Nineveh he spoke. Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said, thus he spoke: "As the word of the Lord that He spoke through His servant the prophet" — Just as Nineveh was transformed from evil to good, so too in the days of Jeroboam son of Joash, it was transformed for them from evil to good for Israel.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: גֵּר שֶׁהָיָה לֵידָתוֹ בִּקְדוּשָּׁה וְהוֹרָתוֹ שֶׁלֹּא בִּקְדוּשָּׁה — יֵשׁ לוֹ שְׁאֵר הָאֵם, וְאֵין לוֹ שְׁאֵר הָאָב. כֵּיצַד? נָשָׂא אֲחוֹתוֹ מִן הָאֵם — יוֹצִיא. מִן הָאָב — יְקַיֵּים. אֲחוֹת הָאָב מִן הָאֵם — יוֹצִיא,
human_translation: Come hear A convert whose birth was in sanctity but whose conception was not in sanctity has maternal kinship, However, he does not have paternal kinship. How so? he married his maternal sister, he must divorce paternal he may maintain father’s maternal sister, he must divorce her.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Come and hear: A convert whose birth was in sanctity and his lineage not in sanctity — he has the status of his mother's family, and he does not have the status of his father's family. How so? If he married his sister from the mother's side — he may divorce her. If from the father's side — he must fulfill the marriage. If he married his father's sister from the mother's side — he may divorce her.

hebrew_text: מִן הָאָב — יְקַיֵּים. אָחוֹת הָאֵם מִן הָאֵם — יוֹצִיא, מִן הָאָב — רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: יוֹצִיא, וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: יְקַיֵּים. שֶׁהָיָה רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: כׇּל עֶרְוָה שֶׁהִיא מִשּׁוּם שְׁאֵר הָאֵם — יוֹצִיא, מִשּׁוּם הָאָב — יְקַיֵּים.
human_translation: paternal he may maintain mother’s maternal sister, he must divorce paternal Rabbi Meir says he must divorce and the Rabbis say he may maintain as Rabbi Meir would say: Any relative forbidden due to kinship with the mother, he must divorce due to the father, he may maintain
llm_translation: From the father - he fulfills. The sister of the mother from the mother - he excludes, from the father - Rabbi Meir says: he excludes, and the sages say: he fulfills. For Rabbi Meir used to say: any nakedness that is due to the mother's flesh - he excludes, due to the father - he fulfills.

hebrew_text: וּמוּתָּר בְּאֵשֶׁת אָחִיו מֵאִמּוֹ, וּבְאֵשֶׁת אֲחִי אָבִיו. וּשְׁאָר כׇּל הָעֲרָיוֹת מוּתָּרוֹת לוֹ. לְאֵיתוֹיֵי אֵשֶׁת הָאָב.
human_translation: And he is permitted to his maternal brother’s wife and his father’s brother’s wife, and all other forbidden relatives are permitted to him. to include the father’s wife.
llm_translation: And permitted in the wife of his brother from his mother, and in the wife of his father's brother. And the rest of all the forbidden relationships are permitted to him. For the purpose of the wife of the father.

hebrew_text: נָשָׂא אִשָּׁה וּבִתָּהּ — כּוֹנֵס אַחַת וּמוֹצִיא אַחַת. לְכַתְּחִלָּה לֹא יִכְנוֹס. מֵתָה אִשְׁתּוֹ — מוּתָּר בַּחֲמוֹתוֹ. וְאִיכָּא דְּתָנֵי: אָסוּר בַּחֲמוֹתוֹ.
human_translation: married a woman and her daughter he may remarry one but must divorce one. He should not marry ab initio . his wife, died, he is permitted to his mother-in-law And some teach he is prohibited from his mother-in-law.
llm_translation: He married a woman and her daughter - he may marry one and divorce one. Initially, he should not marry. If his wife dies - he is permitted to marry her mother. And there are those who teach: it is forbidden to marry her mother.

hebrew_text: קָתָנֵי מִיהַת: מוּתָּר בְּאֵשֶׁת אָחִיו, מַאי לָאו, דְּנַסְבַהּ אָחִיו כְּשֶׁהוּא גֵּר? לָא, דְּנַסְבַהּ כְּשֶׁהוּא גּוֹי. מַאי לְמֵימְרָא? מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: לִיגְזוֹר כְּשֶׁהוּא גּוֹי אַטּוּ כְּשֶׁהוּא גֵּר, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: In any event, teaches he is permitted to his brother’s wife. What, is it not where his brother married her when he was a convert? No, where he married her while he was a gentile. what of stating Lest you say should decree while he was a gentile, due to when he was a convert. teaches us
llm_translation: It was taught in one place: Permitted with the wife of his brother. What is the reason? Is it not because his brother married her when he was a convert? No, it is because he married her when he was a gentile. What is the conclusion to be drawn? If you might say: Let him divorce her when he is a gentile, then marry her when he is a convert, it has been heard for us.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: נָשָׂא אִשָּׁה וּבִתָּהּ — כּוֹנֵס אַחַת וּמוֹצִיא אַחַת. לְכַתְּחִלָּה לֹא יִכְנוֹס. הַשְׁתָּא אַפּוֹקֵי מַפֵּיק — לְכַתְּחִלָּה מִיבַּעְיָא?! הָתָם קָאֵי, וְהָכִי קָאָמַר: הָךְ דַּאֲמוּר רַבָּנַן יְקַיֵּים, לְכַתְּחִלָּה לֹא יִכְנוֹס.
human_translation: The Master said: married a woman and her daughter he may remarry one but must divorce one. He should not marry ab initio . Now he must divorce is necessary ab initio ? is standing there, and this is what it is saying: Those that the Sages said he may maintain, he should not marry ab initio .
llm_translation: Master said: "One who marries a woman and her daughter - he may marry one and divorce one. Initially, he should not marry. Now, if he divorces the daughter, should he not marry initially? There, it is standing, and thus he said: Just as the Rabbis said it should be fulfilled, initially he should not marry."

hebrew_text: מֵתָה אִשְׁתּוֹ — מוּתָּר בַּחֲמוֹתוֹ. וְאִיכָּא דְּתָנֵי: אָסוּר בַּחֲמוֹתוֹ. חֲדָא כְּרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל, וַחֲדָא כְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא.
human_translation: his wife, died, he is permitted to his mother-in-law And some teach he is prohibited to his mother-in-law. One is in accordance with Rabbi Yishmael, and one is in accordance with Rabbi Akiva.
llm_translation: His wife died — permitted to his mother-in-law. And there are those who teach: forbidden to his mother-in-law. One like Rabbi Yishmael, and one like Rabbi Akiva.

hebrew_text: מַאן דְּאָסַר, כְּרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל, דְּאָמַר: חֲמוֹתוֹ לְאַחַר מִיתָה — בְּאִיסּוּרָא קָיְימָא, וְגַבֵּי גֵר גְּזַרוּ בֵּיהּ רַבָּנַן. וּמַאן דְּשָׁרֵי, כְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, דְּאָמַר: חֲמוֹתוֹ לְאַחַר מִיתָה — קְלַשׁ לֵיהּ אִיסּוּרָא, וְגַבֵּי גֵר לָא גְּזַרוּ בֵּיהּ רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: The one who prohibits is in accordance with Rabbi Yishmael, who said mother-in-law after death remains forbidden And with regard to a convert, the Sages decreed And the one who permits is in accordance with Rabbi Akiva, who said the prohibition mother-in-law is weakened after death, And with regard to a convert, the Sages did not decree
llm_translation: The one who prohibits, like Rabbi Yishmael, who said: "His mother-in-law after his death - he is in a state of prohibition, and regarding a convert, the Rabbis decreed upon him." And the one who permits, like Rabbi Akiva, who said: "His mother-in-law after his death - he is not in a state of prohibition, and regarding a convert, the Rabbis did not decree upon him."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ חָמֵשׁ נָשִׁים שֶׁנִּתְעָרְבוּ וַלְדוֹתֵיהֶן, הִגְדִּילוּ הַתַּעֲרוֹבוֹת וְנָשְׂאוּ נָשִׁים, וּמֵתוּ — אַרְבָּעָה חוֹלְצִין לְאַחַת, וְאֶחָד מְיַיבֵּם אוֹתָהּ.
human_translation: five women whose offspring were mixed, the mixed matured and married women and died, four must perform ḥalitza with one And one may perform levirate marriage with her
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: Five women who were betrothed and their husbands died, the betrothed women grew up and married other men, and then they also died - four of them require chalitzah from one man, and one man performs levirate marriage with her.

hebrew_text: הוּא וּשְׁלֹשָׁה חוֹלְצִין לְאַחַת, וְאֶחָד מְיַיבֵּם. נִמְצְאוּ אַרְבַּע חֲלִיצוֹת וְיִיבּוּם לְכׇל אַחַת וְאַחַת.
human_translation: he and three must perform ḥalitza with one and one may perform levirate marriage. four ḥalitzot and a levirate marriage are found for each and every
llm_translation: He and three exempt for one, and one performs levirate marriage. If there were four exempt women and they performed levirate marriage with each one individually.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וְדַוְקָא מִיחְלָץ וַהֲדַר יַבּוֹמֵי, אֲבָל יַבּוֹמֵי בְּרֵישָׁא — לָא, דְּקָפָגַע בִּיבָמָה לַשּׁוּק.
human_translation: ḥalitza specifically is performed and afterward levirate marriage. However, levirate marriage may not be performed first, as would breach a yevama with the public,
llm_translation: Gemara: And specifically from Yichalatz and then Yabomei, but Yabomei initially - no, because he encountered the Yevamah in the marketplace.

hebrew_text: מַאי הוּא וּשְׁלֹשָׁה חוֹלְצִין לְאַחַת? דְּלָא תֵּימָא לְיַבְּמִינְהוּ חַד לְכוּלְּהוּ, אֶלָּא כֹּל חַד וְחַד מְיַיבֵּם חֲדָא, דִּלְמָא מִתְרַמְיָא לֵיהּ דִּידֵיהּ.
human_translation: What is and three must perform ḥalitza with one Do not say one may perform levirate marriage with all of them. Rather, each one of them should perform levirate marriage with one, perhaps one will happen upon his own
llm_translation: What is it that three remove for one? That you should not say they all remove for the same yavam, rather each one removes for a different one, lest he become attached to her for himself.

hebrew_text: מִקְצָתָן אַחִין וּמִקְצָתָן שֶׁאֵין אַחִין — הָאַחִין חוֹלְצִין, וְשֶׁאֵין אַחִין מְיַיבְּמִין. מַאי קָאָמַר? אָמַר רַב סָפְרָא, הָכִי קָאָמַר: מִקְצָתָן אַחִין מִן הָאָב וּמִקְצָתָן אַחִין מִן הָאֵם. אַחִין מִן הָאֵם — חוֹלְצִין, וְאַחִין מִן הָאָב — מְיַיבְּמִין.
human_translation: some of them are brothers, and some of them are not brothers, the brothers perform ḥalitza and those who are not brothers perform levirate marriage. What is saying? Rav Safra said this is what it is saying: some of are paternal brothers and some of them, are maternal brothers maternal brothers must perform ḥalitza And paternal brothers perform levirate marriage.
llm_translation: Some of them are brothers and some of them are not brothers - the brothers perform chalitzah, and those who are not brothers do not perform yibbum. What is it saying? Rav Safra said, this is what it is saying: Some of them are brothers from the father and some of them are brothers from the mother. Brothers from the mother - perform chalitzah, and brothers from the father - perform yibbum.

hebrew_text: מִקְצָתָן כֹּהֲנִים וּמִקְצָתָן שֶׁאֵינָן כֹּהֲנִים — כֹּהֲנִים חוֹלְצִין, שֶׁאֵינָן כֹּהֲנִים — מְיַיבְּמִין. מִקְצָתָן כֹּהֲנִים וּמִקְצָתָן אַחִין מִן הָאֵם — אֵלּוּ וָאֵלּוּ חוֹלְצִין וְלֹא מְיַיבְּמִין.
human_translation: some of them are priests and some of them are not priests, priests perform ḥalitza , those who are not priests perform levirate marriage, some of them are priests and some of them are maternal brothers, these and those perform ḥalitza and not levirate marriage.
llm_translation: Some of them are priests and some of them are not priests - the priests perform halitzah, those who are not priests perform yibum. Some of them are priests and some of them are brothers from the mother's side - both these and those perform halitzah and do not perform yibum.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: יֵשׁ חוֹלֵץ לְאִמּוֹ מִסָּפֵק, לַאֲחוֹתוֹ מִסָּפֵק, לְבִתּוֹ מִסָּפֵק.
human_translation: The Sages taught: There is performs ḥalitza with his mother due to uncertainty, with his sister due to uncertainty, with his daughter due to uncertainty.
llm_translation: The sages taught: There is a halitzah for his mother from doubt, for his sister from doubt, for his daughter from doubt.

hebrew_text: כֵּיצַד? אִמּוֹ וְאִשָּׁה אַחֶרֶת, וְלָהֶן שְׁנֵי זְכָרִים, וְחָזְרוּ וְיָלְדוּ שְׁנֵי זְכָרִים בְּמַחֲבֵא, וּבָא בְּנָהּ שֶׁל זוֹ וְנָשָׂא אִמּוֹ שֶׁל זֶה, וּבְנָהּ שֶׁל זוֹ נָשָׂא אִמּוֹ שֶׁל זֶה, וּמֵתוּ בְּלֹא בָּנִים — זֶה חוֹלֵץ לִשְׁתֵּיהֶן, וְזֶה חוֹלֵץ לִשְׁתֵּיהֶן. נִמְצָא כׇּל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד חוֹלֵץ לְאִמּוֹ מִסָּפֵק.
human_translation: How so? his mother and another woman had two sons, and they gave birth to two sons in hiding, and the son of this woman came and married the mother of that and the son of that woman married this mother, and they died without children, this one performs ḥalitza with both women, and that one performs ḥalitza with both women. It is found each one of them performs ḥalitza with his mother, due to uncertainty.
llm_translation: How so? His mother and another woman, and they have two males, and they went back and gave birth to two males in a hiding place, and the son of this one came and married the mother of that one, and the son of this one married the mother of that one, and they died without children - this one performs chalitzah for both of them, and that one performs chalitzah for both of them. It turns out that each and every one performs chalitzah for his mother due to doubt.

hebrew_text: לַאֲחוֹתוֹ מִסָּפֵק כֵּיצַד? אִמּוֹ וְאִשָּׁה אַחֶרֶת שֶׁיָּלְדוּ שְׁתֵּי נְקֵבוֹת בְּמַחֲבֵא, וּבָאוּ אֲחֵיהֶן שֶׁלֹּא מֵאוֹתָהּ הָאֵם וּנְשָׂאוּם, וּמֵתוּ בְּלֹא בָּנִים — חוֹלֵץ לִשְׁתֵּיהֶן, נִמְצָא חוֹלֵץ לַאֲחוֹתוֹ מִסָּפֵק.
human_translation: with his sister due to uncertainty. How so? his mother and another woman gave birth to two females in hiding, and not maternal, brothers came and married them, and died without children, perform ḥalitza with both It is found one performs ḥalitza with his sister due to uncertainty.
llm_translation: To his sister from doubt how? His mother and another woman who gave birth two females in a hiding place, and their brothers came who are not from that mother and married them, and they died without children - he performs chalitzah for both of them, it is found he performs chalitzah to his sister from doubt.

hebrew_text: לְבִתּוֹ מִסָּפֵק כֵּיצַד? אִשְׁתּוֹ וְאִשָּׁה אַחֶרֶת שֶׁיָּלְדוּ שְׁתֵּי נְקֵבוֹת בְּמַחֲבֵא, וּבָאוּ אֲחֵיהֶן וּנְשָׂאוּם, וּמֵתוּ בְּלֹא בָּנִים — זֶה חוֹלֵץ לְבִתּוֹ מִסָּפֵק, וְזֶה חוֹלֵץ לְבִתּוֹ מִסָּפֵק.
human_translation: with his daughter due to uncertainty. How so? his wife and another woman gave birth to two females in hiding, and his brothers came and married them, and they died without children, this one performs ḥalitza with his daughter due to uncertainty, and that one performs ḥalitza with his daughter due to uncertainty.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Regarding his daughter from doubt, how so? His wife and another woman who gave birth to two females in a hiding place, and their brothers came and married them, and they died without children - this one removes his daughter from doubt, and this one removes his daughter from doubt.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, הָיָה רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: אִישׁ וְאִשָּׁה פְּעָמִים שֶׁמּוֹלִידִין חָמֵשׁ אוּמּוֹת.
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Meir would say: A man and a woman can sometimes bear five nations,
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Meir would say: A man and a woman sometimes give birth to five nations.

hebrew_text: כֵּיצַד? יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁלָּקַח עֶבֶד וְשִׁפְחָה מִן הַשּׁוּק, וְלָהֶן שְׁנֵי בָנִים, וְנִתְגַּיֵּיר אֶחָד מֵהֶן — נִמְצָא אֶחָד גֵּר וְאֶחָד גּוֹי. הִטְבִּילָן לְשֵׁם עַבְדוּת וְנִזְקְקוּ זֶה לָזֶה, הֲרֵי כָּאן גֵּר וְגוֹי וְעֶבֶד. שִׁחְרֵר אֶת הַשִּׁפְחָה וּבָא עָלֶיהָ הָעֶבֶד, הֲרֵי כָּאן גֵּר וְגוֹי וְעֶבֶד וּמַמְזֵר. שִׁחְרֵר שְׁנֵיהֶם, וְהִשִּׂיאָן זֶה לָזֶה — הֲרֵי כָּאן גֵּר וְגוֹי וְעֶבֶד וּמַמְזֵר וְיִשְׂרָאֵל.
human_translation: How so? a Jew bought a slave and a maidservant from the market, and had two children and one of converted, it is found one is a convert and one is a gentile. immersed for the sake of slaves, and they engaged in intercourse with each other here there are a convert, and a gentile, and a slave. freed the maidservant, and the slave engaged in intercourse with her, here there are a convert, a gentile, a slave, and a mamzer . freed both and married them to each other here there are a convert, a gentile, a slave, a mamzer , and Jew.
llm_translation: How so? If a Jew acquires a male slave and a female slave from the market, and they have two children, and one of them converts - it turns out one is a convert and one is a gentile. If he immersed them for the sake of servitude, and they intermingled with one another, here we have a convert, a gentile, and a slave. If he frees the female slave and the male slave cohabits with her, here we have a convert, a gentile, a slave, and a mamzer. If he frees both of them, and marries them to each other, here we have a convert, a gentile, a slave, a mamzer, and a Jew.

hebrew_text: מַאי קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן — גּוֹי וְעֶבֶד הַבָּא עַל בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל הַוָּלָד מַמְזֵר.
human_translation: What is teaching us? a gentile or a slave engaged in intercourse with a Jewish woman, offspring is a mamzer .
llm_translation: What is it teaching us? - A non-Jew and a slave who have relations with a Jewish woman, the child born is a mamzer.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: יֵשׁ מוֹכֵר אֶת אָבִיו לְהַגְבּוֹת אִמּוֹ כְּתוּבָּתָהּ. כֵּיצַד? יִשְׂרָאֵל לָקַח עֶבֶד וְשִׁפְחָה מִן הַשּׁוּק וְלָהֶם בֵּן. וְשִׁחְרֵר אֶת הַשִּׁפְחָה וּנְשָׂאָהּ, וְעָמַד וְכָתַב כׇּל נְכָסָיו לִבְנָהּ, נִמְצָא זֶה מוֹכֵר אֶת אָבִיו לְהַגְבּוֹת לְאִמּוֹ כְּתוּבָּתָהּ.
human_translation: The Sages taught: There is sells his father to collect his mother’s marriage contract for her. How so? A Jew bought a slave and a maidservant from the market, and they had a son, and freed the maidservant and married her, and he arose and wrote all his property to her son, It is found this sell his father to collect his mother her marriage contract.
llm_translation: The sages taught: There is one who sells his father in order to pay his mother's ketubah. How so? A Jew acquired a male and female slave from the market, and they had a son. He freed the female slave and married her, and then he stood and wrote all his possessions to her son. It is found that this one is selling his father to pay his mother's ketubah.

hebrew_text: מַאי קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן? כּוּלַּהּ רַבִּי מֵאִיר הִיא, וְעַבְדָּא מִטַּלְטְלֵי, וּמִטַּלְטְלֵי מִשְׁתַּעְבְּדִי לִכְתוּבָה. וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: הָא קָמַשְׁמַע לַן עַבְדָּא כִּמְקַרְקַע דָּמֵי.
human_translation: What is teaching us? The entire is Rabbi Meir, and a slave is movable property, and movable property is mortgaged for a marriage contract. And if you wish, say teaching us this: a slave is like real estate,
llm_translation: What is it teaching us? The entire matter is according to Rabbi Meir, and the service of the celestial beings, and the celestial beings are subservient to destiny. And if you wish, say: This teaches us that the service is like the ground.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הָאִשָּׁה שֶׁנִּתְעָרֵב וְלָדָהּ בִּוְלַד כַּלָּתָהּ, הִגְדִּילוּ הַתַּעֲרוֹבוֹת וְנָשְׂאוּ נָשִׁים, וּמֵתוּ — בְּנֵי הַכַּלָּה חוֹלְצִין וְלֹא מְיַיבְּמִין, שֶׁהוּא סָפֵק אֵשֶׁת אָחִיו, סָפֵק אֵשֶׁת אֲחִי אָבִיו.
human_translation: a woman whose offspring was mixed with the offspring of her daughter-in-law, the mixed matured and married women, and they died, the sons of the daughter-in-law perform ḥalitza but not levirate marriage, as it is uncertain his brother’s wife, uncertain his father’s brother’s wife,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: A woman who became pregnant and gave birth to a child from her daughter-in-law, if the daughters-in-law grew up and married, and then died - the sons of the daughter-in-law perform chalitzah and do not perform levirate marriage, because she is a doubtful wife of his brother, a doubtful wife of his father's brother.

hebrew_text: בְּנֵי הַזְּקֵנָה אוֹ חוֹלְצִין אוֹ מְיַיבְּמִין, שֶׁ[הוּא] סָפֵק אֵשֶׁת אָחִיו וְאֵשֶׁת בֶּן אָחִיו.
human_translation: the sons of the elder woman, perform either ḥalitza or levirate marriage, as it is uncertain his brother’s wife, or his brother’s son’s wife,
llm_translation: Sons of the elder brother either perform ḥalitzah or engage in levirate marriage, when there is doubt regarding the wife of his brother and the wife of the son of his brother.

hebrew_text: מֵתוּ הַכְּשֵׁרִים, הַתַּעֲרוֹבוֹת לִבְנֵי הַזְּקֵנָה חוֹלְצִין וְלֹא מְיַיבְּמִין, שֶׁהוּא סָפֵק אֵשֶׁת אָחִיו וְאֵשֶׁת אֲחִי אָבִיו. לִבְנֵי הַכַּלָּה — אֶחָד חוֹלֵץ, וְאֶחָד מְיַיבֵּם.
human_translation: the unflawed died, the mixed perform ḥalitza with the elder woman’s sons but not levirate marriage, as it is uncertain his brother’s wife or his father’s brother’s wife. With the sons of the daughter-in-law, one performs ḥalitza , And one performs levirate marriage,
llm_translation: Deceased the eligible, the mixtures to the sons of the elders they release and do not perform levirate marriage, for it is a doubt of the wife of his brother and the wife of his father's brother. To the sons of the bride — one releases, and one performs levirate marriage.

hebrew_text: כֹּהֶנֶת שֶׁנִּתְעָרֵב וְלָדָהּ בִּוְלַד שִׁפְחָתָהּ — הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ אוֹכְלִים בִּתְרוּמָה — וְחוֹלְקִין חֵלֶק אֶחָד בַּגּוֹרֶן,
human_translation: a priestess whose offspring was mixed with her maidservant’s offspring, they may partake of teruma , And they receive one share in the granary.
llm_translation: A Kohenet who became betrothed and gave birth to a child from her maidservant - these may eat Terumah - and they divide one portion in the granary.

hebrew_text: וְאֵינָן מִטַּמְּאִין לְמֵתִים. וְאֵינָן נוֹשְׂאִין נָשִׁים, בֵּין כְּשֵׁרוֹת בֵּין פְּסוּלוֹת. הִגְדִּילוּ הַתַּעֲרוֹבוֹת וְשִׁחְרְרוּ זֶה אֶת זֶה — נוֹשְׂאִין נָשִׁים רְאוּיוֹת לַכְּהוּנָּה.
human_translation: And they may not become ritually impure by a corpse, And they may not marry women, whether unflawed or unfit the mixed matured and freed each other, they may marry women fit into the priesthood,
llm_translation: They do not become impure for the dead. And they do not marry women, whether they are fit or unfit. If the mixed multitudes increase and intermingle with each other — they marry women suitable for the priesthood.

hebrew_text: וְאֵינָן מְטַמְּאִין לְמֵתִים, וְאִם נִטְמְאוּ — אֵינָן סוֹפְגִין הָאַרְבָּעִים. וְאֵינָן אוֹכְלִין בִּתְרוּמָה, וְאִם אָכְלוּ — אֵינָן מְשַׁלְּמִין קֶרֶן וָחוֹמֶשׁ. וְאֵינָן חוֹלְקִין עַל הַגּוֹרֶן. וּמוֹכְרִין אֶת הַתְּרוּמָה, וְהַדָּמִים שֶׁלָּהֶן.
human_translation: And they may not become ritually impure by a corpse, However, if they became impure, they do not receive the forty And they may not partake of teruma , However, if they ate they do not pay principal and the fifth, And they do not receive a share in the granary, However, they may sell the teruma and the money is theirs.
llm_translation: They do not become impure for the dead, and if they became impure - they do not absorb the forty. And they do not eat from the terumah, and if they ate - they do not pay the principal and the fifth. And they do not divide on the threshing floor. And they sell the terumah, and their blood.

hebrew_text: וְאֵינָן חוֹלְקִין בְּקׇדְשֵׁי הַמִּקְדָּשׁ, וְאֵין נוֹתְנִים לָהֶם קָדָשִׁים. וְאֵין מוֹצִיאִין שֶׁלָּהֶם מִידֵיהֶם.
human_translation: And they do not receive a share of the consecrated of the Temple, And one may not give them consecrated However, their own may not be appropriated from their possession,
llm_translation: They do not divide in the holy items of the Temple, and they do not give them sanctified items. And they do not remove their items from their hands.

hebrew_text: וּפְטוּרִין מִן הַזְּרוֹעַ וּמִן הַלְּחָיַיִם וּמִן הַקֵּיבָה, וּבְכוֹרוֹ יְהֵא רוֹעֶה עַד שֶׁיִּסְתָּאֵב. וְנוֹתְנִין עָלָיו חוּמְרֵי כֹהֲנִים וְחוּמְרֵי יִשְׂרְאֵלִים.
human_translation: And they are exempt from the foreleg, and from the jaw, and from the maw And firstling of his should graze until it becomes unfit And we place upon him the stringencies of priests and the stringencies of Israelites.
llm_translation: And exempt from the arm and from the cheeks and from the stomach, and his firstborn shall be a shepherd until he grows weary. And they place upon him the strictures of the priests and the strictures of the Israelites.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מֵתוּ הַכְּשֵׁרִים וְכוּ׳. אֶלָּא הָנָךְ, מִשּׁוּם דְּאִיעָרוּב לְהוּ הָווּ לְהוּ פְּסוּלִין? אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא, אֵימָא: וּמֵתוּ הַוַּדָּאִין.
human_translation: the unflawed ones who died, because these were mixed up they are unfit? Rava Pappa said: Say And if the certain died.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemar metu haksherim ve'khu. Ela hanach, mi'shum de'iyaru lehu havu lehu pesulim? Amar Rav Papa, eima: u'metu havadain." English translation: "The ones who were fit died, and so on. Rather, here, because they were mixed together, they became disqualified? Rav Papa said: Say, 'And the ones who were certain died.'"

hebrew_text: לִבְנֵי הַכַּלָּה אֶחָד חוֹלֵץ וְכוּ׳. דַּוְקָא מִיחְלָץ וַהֲדַר יַבּוֹמֵי, אֲבָל יַבּוֹמֵי בְּרֵישָׁא — לָא, דְּקָפָגַע בִּיבָמָה לַשּׁוּק.
human_translation: with the sons of the daughter-in-law, one performs ḥalitza ḥalitza is specifically performed and afterward levirate marriage. However, levirate marriage is not first, because breaches a yevama with the public.
llm_translation: To the sons of the bride, one performs chalitzah, etc. Specifically, he performs chalitzah and then the yavamim. But the yavamim initially - no, because he encountered the yevamah in the marketplace.

hebrew_text: כֹּהֶנֶת שֶׁנִּתְעָרֵב וְכוּ׳. חֵלֶק אֶחָד פְּשִׁיטָא! אֵימָא חֵלֶק כְּאֶחָד.
human_translation: a priestess was mixed Isn’t obvious one share say a share as one,
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Kohenet who became intermingled, etc. One portion is obvious! Say, a portion like one."

hebrew_text: תְּנַן כְּמַאן דְּאָמַר אֵין חוֹלְקִין תְּרוּמָה לְעֶבֶד אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן רַבּוֹ עִמּוֹ. דְּתַנְיָא: אֵין חוֹלְקִין תְּרוּמָה לְעֶבֶד אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן רַבּוֹ עִמּוֹ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: יָכוֹל שֶׁיֹּאמַר, אִם כֹּהֵן אֲנִי — תְּנוּ לִי בִּשְׁבִיל עַצְמִי, וְאִם עֶבֶד כֹּהֵן אֲנִי — תְּנוּ לִי בִּשְׁבִיל רַבִּי.
human_translation: we learned in accordance with the one who said one may distribute teruma to a slave only if his master is with him, as it is taught One may distribute teruma to the slave only if his master is with him; the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Yosei says he can say: If I am a priest, give me due to my and if I am the slave of a priest, give me due to my master.
llm_translation: We learned in accordance with the one who says: One does not apportion terumah to a slave unless his master is with him. As it was taught: One does not apportion terumah to a slave unless his master is with him, the words of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Yosei says: It is possible to say, "If I am a kohen - give it to me for my own sake, and if I am a slave of a kohen - give it to me for the sake of my master."

hebrew_text: בִּמְקוֹמוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הָיוּ מַעֲלִין מִתְּרוּמָה לְיוּחֲסִין. בִּמְקוֹמוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי יוֹסֵי לֹא הָיוּ מַעֲלִין מִתְּרוּמָה לְיוּחֲסִין.
human_translation: In Rabbi Yehuda’s place, they would elevate to lineage on teruma . in Rabbi Yosei’s place they would not elevate to lineage teruma .
llm_translation: In the place of Rabbi Yehuda, they would bring up Terumah for genealogical purposes. In the place of Rabbi Yosei, they would not bring up Terumah for genealogical purposes.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בַּר צָדוֹק: מִיָּמַי לֹא הֵעַדְתִּי אֶלָּא עֵדוּת אֶחָד, וְהֶעֱלוּ עֶבֶד לַכְּהוּנָּה עַל פִּי.
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Elazar bar Tzadok said: In my days I never testify besides one testimony, and they promoted a slave to priesthood on my word.
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Elazar son of Tzadok said: "From my days I have only testified to one witness, and they brought a slave to the priesthood based on his testimony."

hebrew_text: הֶעֱלוּ סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ?! הַשְׁתָּא בְּהֶמְתָּן שֶׁל צַדִּיקִים אֵין הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא מֵבִיא תַּקָּלָה עַל יָדָן, צַדִּיקִים עַצְמָן לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן!
human_translation: enter your mind they promoted Now through the animals of the righteous, the Holy One, Blessed be He, does not bring a stumbling block, the righteous themselves, all the more so not
llm_translation: "Did you ascend the ladder of your understanding?! Now, in the case of the livestock of the righteous, the Holy One, blessed be He, does not bring calamity upon them; the righteous themselves, even more so!"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אֵימָא: בִּקְּשׁוּ לְהַעֲלוֹת עֶבֶד לַכְּהוּנָּה עַל פִּי. חֲזָא בְּאַתְרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי — וַאֲזַל וְאַסְהֵיד בְּאַתְרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: Rather, say They sought to promote a slave to priesthood on my word. saw in Rabbi Yosei’s locale and went and testified in Rabbi Yehuda’s locale
llm_translation: Rather say: They sought to elevate a slave to the priesthood by the mouth. He saw in the place of Rabbi Yosei - and went and testified in the place of Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: עֲשָׂרָה אֵין חוֹלְקִין לָהֶם תְּרוּמָה בְּבֵית הַגֳּרָנוֹת, וְאֵלּוּ הֵן: חֵרֵשׁ, שׁוֹטֶה, וְקָטָן, טוּמְטוּם, וְאַנְדְּרוֹגִינוֹס, וְהָעֶבֶד, וְהָאִשָּׁה, וְהֶעָרֵל, וְהַטָּמֵא, וְנוֹשֵׂא אִשָּׁה שֶׁאֵינָהּ הוֹגֶנֶת לוֹ. וְכוּלָּן מְשַׁגְּרִין לָהֶם לְבָתֵּיהֶם, חוּץ מִטָּמֵא וְנוֹשֵׂא אִשָּׁה שֶׁאֵינָהּ הוֹגֶנֶת לוֹ.
human_translation: The Sages taught: ten to whom one may not distribute teruma in the granary, and they are: A deaf-mute, an imbecile, and a minor, a person whose sexual organs are concealed [ tumtum ], and a hermaphrodite, and a slave, and a woman, and an uncircumcised man, and a ritually impure man, and marries a woman unfit for him, And all of them, one may send to them, to their homes, with the exception of a ritually impure man and marries a woman unfit for him.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Ten do not have a share in the contribution in the granary, and these are they: a deaf person, a fool, a minor, a mentally incompetent person, a hermaphrodite, a slave, a woman, a non-Jew, a ritually impure person, and one who marries a woman who is not fitting for him. And all of them are provided for in their homes, except for a ritually impure person and one who marries a woman who is not fitting for him.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא חֵרֵשׁ שׁוֹטֶה וְקָטָן — לָאו בְּנֵי דֵּיעָה נִינְהוּ. טוּמְטוּם וְאַנְדְּרוֹגִינוֹס נָמֵי —
human_translation: Granted, a deaf-mute, an imbecile, and a minor, they are not competent, also a tumtum and a hermaphrodite,
llm_translation: In truth, a deaf-mute, a fool, and a minor — they are not considered of legal competence. Tumtum and Androgynous are also...

hebrew_text: בְּרִיָּה בִּפְנֵי עַצְמָהּ נִינְהוּ. עֶבֶד נָמֵי — דִּלְמָא אָתֵי לְאַסּוֹקֵי מִתְּרוּמָה לְיוּחֲסִין. עָרֵל וְטָמֵא — מִשּׁוּם דִּמְאִיסִי. נוֹשֵׂא אִשָּׁה שֶׁאֵינָהּ הוֹגֶנֶת לוֹ — מִשּׁוּם קְנָסָא. אֶלָּא אִשָּׁה, מַאי טַעְמָא לָא?
human_translation: they are creature of own a slave also teruma , perhaps will come to elevate to lineage. an uncircumcised man and a ritually impure man, because are repulsive one who marries a woman unfit for him, due to a penalty But what reason not a woman?
llm_translation: Creation by itself they are. A non-Jewish slave - perhaps he will come to engage in tithing to marry. Uncircumcised and impure - because they are repulsive. One who marries a woman who is not fitting for him - because of a penalty. But a woman, what is the reason not?

hebrew_text: פְּלִיגִי בַּהּ רַב פָּפָּא וְרַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ. חַד אָמַר: מִשּׁוּם גְּרוּשָׁה. וְחַד אָמַר: מִשּׁוּם יִחוּד.
human_translation: Rav Pappa and Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, disagree One said due to divorcée And one said due to be alone together
llm_translation: They disputed it: Rav Papa and Rav Huna the son of Rav Yehoshua. One said: Because of divorce. And one said: Because of betrothal.

hebrew_text: מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ? אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ בֵּי דָרֵי דִּמְקָרַב לְמָתָא, וְלָא שְׁכִיחִי בְּהוּ אִינָשֵׁי. אִי נָמֵי: דִּמְרַחַק, וּשְׁכִיחִי בֵּהּ אִינָשֵׁי.
human_translation: What is between them? between them a granary that is close to town but is not frequented by people. Alternatively, that is distant but is frequented by people.
llm_translation: What is the difference between them? There is a difference between them in the houses of those who are close to the city, and people are not commonly found in them. Alternatively, the difference is in houses that are far away, and people are commonly found in them.

hebrew_text: וְכוּלָּן מְשַׁגְּרִין לָהֶם לְבָתֵּיהֶן, חוּץ מִטָּמֵא וְנוֹשֵׂא אִשָּׁה שֶׁאֵינָהּ הוֹגֶנֶת לוֹ. אֲבָל עָרֵל מְשַׁגְּרִינַן לֵיהּ, מַאי טַעְמָא?
human_translation: And all of them, one may send to them, to their homes, with the exception of a ritually impure man and who marries a woman unfit for him. However, to an uncircumcised man one may send What is the reason?
llm_translation: And all of them escort them to their homes, except for one who is impure and one who carries a woman who is not fitting for him. But we escort a convert, what is the reason?

hebrew_text: מִשּׁוּם דַּאֲנִיס. טָמֵא נָמֵי, הָא אֲנִיס? הַאי נְפִישׁ אוּנְסֵיהּ, וְהַאי לָא נְפִישׁ אוּנְסֵיהּ.
human_translation: because of circumstances beyond his control, Isn’t an impure man also circumstances beyond his control? This circumstances entirely beyond his control, whereas that is not under circumstances entirely beyond his control,
llm_translation: Because he was coerced. He is impure, was he coerced? This one, his coercion is effective, and this one, his coercion is not effective.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הָעֶבֶד וְהָאִשָּׁה, אֵין חוֹלְקִין לָהֶם תְּרוּמָה בְּבֵית הַגֳּרָנוֹת. וּבְמָקוֹם שֶׁחוֹלְקִין — נוֹתְנִין לָאִשָּׁה תְּחִלָּה וּפוֹטְרִין אוֹתָהּ מִיָּד. מַאי קָאָמַר?
human_translation: The Sages taught: One may not distribute teruma to a slave or a woman in the granary. And in a place where distribute the woman is given first and released immediately. What is saying?
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: A slave and a woman, do not divide for them terumah in the granary. And in a place where they do divide - they give to the woman first and exempt her immediately. What is it saying?

hebrew_text: הָכִי קָאָמַר: בְּמָקוֹם שֶׁחוֹלְקִין מַעְשַׂר עָנִי — נוֹתְנִין לְאִשָּׁה תְּחִלָּה. מַאי טַעְמָא — מִשּׁוּם זִילוּתָא.
human_translation: This is what it is saying: In a case where the poor man’s tithe is distributed the woman is given first. What is the reason? because demeaning
llm_translation: So it is stated: In a place where they separate the tithe for the poor — they give it to a woman first. What is the reason? — Because of respect.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: מֵרֵישָׁא, כִּי הֲווֹ אָתוּ גַּבְרָא וְאִתְּתָא לְדִינָא קַמַּאי, הֲוָה שָׁרֵינָא תִּיגְרָא דְגַבְרָא בְּרֵישָׁא. אָמֵינָא: דְּמִיחַיַּיב בְּמִצְוֹת. כֵּיוָן דִּשְׁמַעְנָא לְהָא, שָׁרֵינָא תִּיגְרָא דְּאִתְּתָא בְּרֵישָׁא. מַאי טַעְמָא? מִשּׁוּם זִילוּתָא.
human_translation: Rava said: Initially, when a man and a woman would come for judgment before me, I would resolve the man’s quarrel first. I would say that he is obligated in mitzvot since I heard this I resolve the woman’s quarrel first. What is the reason? because demeaning
llm_translation: Rava said: From the beginning, when a man and his wife would come to court, the man's bag would be placed first. I thought: He is obligated in mitzvot. Once I heard this, the woman's bag was placed first. What is the reason? Out of respect.

hebrew_text: הִגְדִּילוּ הַתַּעֲרוֹבוֹת וְכוּ׳. שִׁיחְרְרוּ, אִי בָּעֵי — אִין, אִי לָא בָּעֵי — לָא, וְאַמַּאי? לִישָּׂא שִׁפְחָה אֵינוֹ יָכוֹל, בַּת חוֹרִין אֵינוֹ יָכוֹל! אָמַר רָבָא, אֵימָא: כּוֹפִין אוֹתָן, וּמְשַׁחְרְרִין זֶה אֶת זֶה.
human_translation: the mixed matured freed If one desires if he does not desire not And why Neither can marry a maidservant nor can a free woman, Rava said: Say we coerce them and they free each other.
llm_translation: The mixtures have increased, etc. They should be released, if they want - yes, if they do not want - no. And why? To marry a maidservant he cannot, to marry a free woman he cannot! Rava said, perhaps: We force them, and they release each other.

hebrew_text: נוֹתְנִין עֲלֵיהֶם חוּמְרֵי וְכוּ׳. לְמַאי הִלְכְתָא? אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: לְמִנְחָתָם נִקְמֶצֶת כְּמִנְחַת יִשְׂרָאֵל וְאֵינָהּ נֶאֱכֶלֶת כְּמִנְחַת כֹּהֲנִים. הָא כֵּיצַד? הַקּוֹמֶץ קָרֵב בְּעַצְמוֹ, וְהַשִּׁירַיִם קְרֵיבִין בְּעַצְמָן.
human_translation: we place upon them the stringencies of priests and the stringencies of Israelites. With regard to what halakha Rav Pappa said: to their meal-offering: The handful is taken from it like the meal-offering of an Israelite, However, does not get eaten, like the meal-offering of priests. How so? The handful is sacrificed by itself, and the remainder is offered by itself.
llm_translation: We place upon them chumrei, etc. What is the halakha? Rav Papa said: Their meal-offering is accepted like the meal-offering of Israel, but it is not eaten like the meal-offering of the priests. How so? The handful is brought by itself, and the leftover parts are brought by themselves.

hebrew_text: אִיקְּרִי כָּאן: כֹּל שֶׁמִּמֶּנּוּ לָאִישִּׁים, הֲרֵי הוּא בְּ״בַל תַּקְטִירוּ״.
human_translation: apply here, whatever is partly in fire is subject to “you may not make…as an offering”
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "One who appoints others, behold, he is in 'do not kindle'."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן פַּזִּי: דְּמַסֵּיק לְהוּ לְשׁוּם עֵצִים, כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר. דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: ״לְרֵיחַ נִיחוֹחַ״ אִי אַתָּה מַעֲלֶה, אֲבָל אַתָּה מַעֲלֶה לְשׁוּם עֵצִים.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda, son of Rabbi Shimon ben Pazi, said that is brought up for the purpose of wood, in accordance with Rabbi Elazar, as it is taught Rabbi Elazar said: for a sweet savor you may not bring up However, you may bring up for the purpose of wood.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yehuda, son of Rabbi Shimon ben Pazi: who is particular about gathering wood, like Rabbi Eliezer. As it was taught, Rabbi Eliezer says: "For a pleasing aroma" you do not bring up, but you do bring up for gathering wood.

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר. אֶלָּא לְרַבָּנַן, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? דְּעָבֵיד לַהּ כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן. דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: הַקּוֹמֶץ קָרֵב לְעַצְמוֹ, וְהַשִּׁירַיִם מִתְפַּזְּרִין עַל בֵּית הַדֶּשֶׁן. וַאֲפִילּוּ רַבָּנַן לָא פְּלִיגִי עֲלֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אֶלָּא בְּמִנְחַת חוֹטֵא שֶׁל כֹּהֲנִים, דְּבַת הַקְרָבָה הִיא, אֲבָל הָכָא — אֲפִילּוּ רַבָּנַן מוֹדוּ.
human_translation: This works out well according to Rabbi Elazar. However, according to the Rabbis, what can be said? that is treated in accordance with Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, as it is taught Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, says: The handful is sacrificed by itself, and the remainder is scattered over the place of the ashes. And even the Rabbis disagree with Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, only with regard to a sinner’s meal-offering that belongs to priests, as it is fit to be sacrificed However, here, even the Rabbis agree
llm_translation: The text is as follows: "He left it for Rabbi Elazar. Rather, for the Rabbis, what can be said? That he did for it like Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Shimon. As it was taught: Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Shimon says: The handful comes close to itself, and the leftover parts scatter on the ash heap. And even the Rabbis do not argue with him except in the case of the sin-offering of the priests, for there the handful is essential, but here - even the Rabbis agree."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מִי שֶׁלֹּא שָׁהֲתָה אַחַר בַּעֲלָהּ שְׁלֹשָׁה חֳדָשִׁים, וְנִשֵּׂאת, וְיָלְדָה, וְאֵין יָדוּעַ אִם בֶּן תִּשְׁעָה לָרִאשׁוֹן אִם בִּן שִׁבְעָה לָאַחֲרוֹן — הָיוּ לָהּ בָּנִים מִן הָרִאשׁוֹן וּבָנִים מִן הַשֵּׁנִי, חוֹלְצִין וְלֹא מְיַיבְּמִין. וְכֵן הוּא לָהֶם — חוֹלֵץ וְלֹא מְיַיבֵּם.
human_translation: who did not wait three months after her husband, and remarried and gave birth and it is not known if he was born after nine to the former if he was born after seven to the latter she had sons from the first and sons from the second must perform ḥalitza But they may not perform levirate marriage And similarly, him and their he performs ḥalitza and not levirate marriage.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: A woman who did not wait after her husband for three months, and she got married, and she gave birth, and it is not known whether the first child is nine months old or the last child is seven months old — she has children from the first husband and children from the second husband, they perform ḥalitza and do not perform levirate marriage. And the same applies to them — they perform ḥalitza and do not perform levirate marriage.

hebrew_text: הָיוּ לוֹ אַחִים מִן הָרִאשׁוֹן וְאַחִים מִן הַשֵּׁנִי, שֶׁלֹּא מֵאוֹתָהּ הָאֵם — הוּא חוֹלֵץ וּמְיַיבֵּם, וְהֵם — אֶחָד חוֹלֵץ וְאֶחָד מְיַיבֵּם.
human_translation: he had brothers from the first and brothers from the second, not from the same mother he performs ḥalitza or levirate marriage And them one performs ḥalitza and one performs levirate marriage.
llm_translation: If he had brothers from the first marriage and brothers from the second marriage, not from the same mother - he performs chalitzah and yibum, and they - one performs chalitzah and one performs yibum.

hebrew_text: הָיָה אֶחָד יִשְׂרָאֵל וְאֶחָד כֹּהֵן — נוֹשֵׂא אִשָּׁה רְאוּיָה לְכֹהֵן, וְאֵין מִטַּמֵּא לְמֵתִים. וְאִם נִטְמָא — אֵינוֹ סוֹפֵג אֶת הָאַרְבָּעִים. אֵינוֹ אוֹכֵל בִּתְרוּמָה, וְאִם אָכַל — אֵינוֹ מְשַׁלֵּם קֶרֶן וָחוֹמֶשׁ. וְאֵינוֹ חוֹלֵק עַל הַגּוֹרֶן. וּמוֹכֵר הַתְּרוּמָה, וְהַדָּמִים שֶׁלּוֹ.
human_translation: one was an Israelite and one a priest, he may marry a woman fit to a priest, And he may not become ritually impure by a corpse But if he became impure, he does not receive the forty he does not partake of teruma , However, if he ate he does not pay principal and the fifth, And he does not receive at the granary. However, he may sell the teruma and the money is his.
llm_translation: There was one Israelite and one Kohen - he marries a woman fitting for a Kohen, and does not become impure for the dead. And if he becomes impure - he does not absorb the forty lashes. He does not eat from the Terumah, and if he eats - he does not pay the principal and the fifth. He does not share in the granary. And he sells the Terumah, and its blood.

hebrew_text: וְאֵינוֹ חוֹלֵק בְּקׇדְשֵׁי הַקֳּדָשִׁים. וְאֵין נוֹתְנִין לוֹ אֶת הַקֳּדָשִׁים, וְאֵין מוֹצִיאִין אֶת שֶׁלּוֹ מִיָּדוֹ. וּפָטוּר מִן הַזְּרוֹעַ וְהַלְּחָיַיִם וְהַקֵּיבָה. וּבְכוֹרוֹ יְהֵא רוֹעֶה עַד שֶׁיִּסְתָּאֵב. וְנוֹתְנִין עָלָיו חוּמְרֵי כֹּהֲנִים וְחוּמְרֵי יִשְׂרְאֵלִים.
human_translation: And he does not receive a share of the sacred of the consecrated and one may not give him the consecrated However, his own may not be appropriated from his possession. And he is exempt from the foreleg, and the jaw, and the maw And the firstling of his should graze until it becomes unfit And we place upon him the stringencies of priests and the stringencies of Israelites.
llm_translation: He does not divide in the holy of holies. And they do not give him the holy items, and they do not take his away from him. And he is exempt from the shoulder, cheek, and stomach. And his firstborn shall be a shepherd until he grows a blemish. And they place upon him the stringencies of priests and the stringencies of Israelites.

hebrew_text: הָיוּ שְׁנֵיהֶם כֹּהֲנִים — הוּא אוֹנֵן עֲלֵיהֶם, וְהֵם אוֹנְנִים עָלָיו. הוּא אֵינוֹ מִטַּמֵּא לָהֶם, וְהֵם אֵינָן מְטַמְּאִים לוֹ. הוּא אֵינוֹ יוֹרֵשׁ אוֹתָן, אֲבָל הֵם יוֹרְשִׁין אוֹתוֹ.
human_translation: both were priests, he is in acute mourning over them, And they are in a acute mourning over him, He may not become ritually impure to them, and they may not become ritually impure to him He does not inherit them, However, they inherit him
llm_translation: They were both priests - he mourns for them, and they mourn for him. He does not become impure for them, and they do not become impure for him. He does not inherit them, but they inherit him.

hebrew_text: וּפָטוּר עַל מַכָּתוֹ וְעַל קִלְלָתוֹ שֶׁל זֶה וְשֶׁל זֶה. עוֹלֶה בְּמִשְׁמָרוֹ שֶׁל זֶה וְשֶׁל זֶה, וְאֵינוֹ חוֹלֵק. אִם הָיוּ שְׁנֵיהֶם בְּמִשְׁמָר אֶחָד — נוֹטֵל חֵלֶק אֶחָד.
human_translation: And he is exempt for striking and for cursing this and that one. He must ascend with the priestly watch of this and of that one, However, he does not receive a share If both were in one priestly watch, he receives one share,
llm_translation: And exempt for his wound and his disgrace, this one and that one. He ascends in his shift, this one and that one, and does not divide. If both of them were in one shift - he takes one portion.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ דַּוְקָא מִיחְלָץ וַהֲדַר יַבּוֹמֵי, אֲבָל יַבּוֹמֵי בְּרֵישָׁא — לָא, דְּקָא פָגַע בִּיבָמָה לַשּׁוּק.
human_translation: ḥalitza is specifically performed and afterward levirate marriage. However, levirate marriage is not first, as would breach a yevama with the public
llm_translation: The text: "Gemara specifically from Yichalatz and then Yabomei, but Yabomei initially - no, for he encountered the yevamah in the marketplace."

hebrew_text: אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: עֲשָׂרָה כֹּהֲנִים עוֹמְדִים, וּפֵירַשׁ אֶחָד מֵהֶם, וּבָעַל — הַוָּלָד שְׁתוּקִי. מַאי ״שְׁתוּקִי״? אִילֵימָא שֶׁמְּשַׁתְּקִין אוֹתוֹ מִנִּכְסֵי אָבִיו — פְּשִׁיטָא! מִי יָדְעִינַן אֲבוּהּ מַנּוּ? אֶלָּא שֶׁמְּשַׁתְּקִין אוֹתוֹ מִדִּין כְּהוּנָּה.
human_translation: Shmuel said ten priests were standing and one of them, left and engaged in intercourse the child is a silenced one, What is silenced one [ shetuki ] If we say that he is silenced from his father’s property, is obvious; do we know who his father is? Rather, that he is silenced from the status of priesthood,
llm_translation: Shmuel said: Ten kohanim are standing, and one of them abstained, and the one who abstained — the newborn is silent. What is "silent"? If you say that they silence him from his father's estate — it is obvious! Who would know his father's estate? Rather, they silence him from the status of priesthood.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא? אָמַר קְרָא: ״וְהָיְתָה לּוֹ וּלְזַרְעוֹ אַחֲרָיו״, בָּעֵינַן זַרְעוֹ מְיוּחָס אַחֲרָיו, וְלֵיכָּא.
human_translation: What is the reason verse states: “And it shall be to him and to his seed after him, we require descendants attributed to his lineage, and there is no
llm_translation: What is the reason? The verse says: "And it shall be for him and for his descendants after him." We require that his descendants be considered after him, and this is not the case.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב פָּפָּא: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה גַּבֵּי אַבְרָהָם, דִּכְתִיב: ״לִהְיוֹת לְךָ לֵאלֹהִים וּלְזַרְעֲךָ אַחֲרֶיךָ״, הָתָם מַאי קָא מַזְהַר לֵיהּ רַחֲמָנָא? הָכִי קָאָמַר לֵיהּ: לָא תִּנְסַב גּוֹיָה וְשִׁפְחָה, דְּלָא לֵיזִיל זַרְעָךְ בָּתְרַהּ.
human_translation: Rav Pappa strongly objects to this: However, if that is so, since is written with regard to Abraham: “To be a God to you and to your seed after you” what is the Merciful One warning him there? this is what He said to him: You may not marry a gentile woman or a maidservant, so that your offspring will not follow her
llm_translation: Rav Papa objects to him: Rather, from now on, regarding Abraham, as it is written: "To be a God to you and to your seed after you." What is the Merciful One warning him there? He is saying to him: Do not marry a gentile woman or a maidservant, so that your seed will not go after her.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: רִאשׁוֹן רָאוּי לִהְיוֹת כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל. וְהָא בָּעֵינַן זַרְעוֹ מְיוּחָס אַחֲרָיו, וְלֵיכָּא! זַרְעוֹ מְיוּחָס אַחֲרָיו — דְּרַבָּנַן, וּקְרָא אַסְמַכְתָּא בְּעָלְמָא. וְכִי גְּזוּר רַבָּנַן — בִּזְנוּת, בְּנִשּׂוּאִין לָא גְּזוּר רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: raises an objection: first is fit to be a High Priest. But don’t we require his descendants attributed to his lineage, and that is not so his descendants attributed to his lineage is rabbinic and the verse is a mere support, And when the Sages decreed with regard to licentious With regard to marriage, the Sages did not decree.
llm_translation: Challenger: The first is fitting to be a High Priest. But we require that his seed be of distinguished lineage after him, and there is none! His seed is of distinguished lineage after him - this is a Rabbinic decree, and a mere support in general. And when did the Rabbis decree - in matters of promiscuity, but in matters of marriage the Rabbis did not decree.

hebrew_text: וּבִזְנוּת מִי גְּזוּר רַבָּנַן? וְהָתְנַן: מִי שֶׁלֹּא שָׁהֲתָה אַחַר בַּעְלָהּ שְׁלֹשָׁה חֳדָשִׁים וְנִשֵּׂאת וְיָלְדָה.
human_translation: And with regard to licentious did the Sages a decree? Didn’t we learn who did not wait three months after her husband and remarried and gave birth
llm_translation: "And in the matter of adultery, whose decree is it, the Rabbis'? And it was taught: 'A woman who did not wait after her husband for three months, and she marries and gives birth.'"

hebrew_text: מַאי ״אַחַר בַּעְלָהּ״? אִילֵימָא אַחַר מִיתַת בַּעְלָהּ, אֵימָא סֵיפָא: הוּא אוֹנֵן עֲלֵיהֶם, וְהֵם אוֹנְנִים עָלָיו. בִּשְׁלָמָא הוּא אוֹנֵן עֲלֵיהֶם — מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ בְּנִשּׂוּאִין דְּשֵׁנִי וְלִיקּוּט עֲצָמוֹת דְּקַמָּא. אֶלָּא: הֵם אוֹנְנִים עָלָיו, הֵיכִי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ? קַמָּא הָא מִית לֵיהּ!
human_translation: What is After her husband? If we say after her husband’s death, say the latter clause he is in a acute mourning over them, and they are in acute mourning over him. Granted, he is in acute mourning over them. You find with regard to marriage to the second man. and the gathering of the bones of the first But they are in acute mourning for him, how can you find these The first is dead.
llm_translation: What is "after her husband"? If you say after the death of her husband, say the latter part: He mourns for them, and they mourn for him. If he mourns for them - she is reminded of the second marriage and the gathering of the bones of the first. Rather, they mourn for him, how is she reminded? The first one dies!

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא בִּגְרוּשָׁה, וּמַאי ״אַחַר בַּעְלָהּ״ — אַחַר גֵּט בַּעְלָהּ. אֵימָא סֵיפָא: הוּא אֵין מִטַּמֵּא לָהֶם וְהֵם אֵינָן מִטַּמְּאִין לוֹ. בִּשְׁלָמָא הֵן אֵין מִטַּמְּאִין לוֹ — לְחוּמְרָא, דְּכֹל חַד וְחַד דִּלְמָא לָאו בְּרֵיהּ הוּא. אֶלָּא הוּא אֵין מִטַּמֵּא לָהֶם, אַמַּאי?
human_translation: And rather with regard to a divorcée. And what is After her husband? After a bill of divorce her husband. say the latter clause He may not become impure to them, and they may not become impure to him. Granted, they may not become impure to him, as stringent, as each one perhaps he is not his son. However, why may he not become impure to them?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And rather in the case of divorce, and what is "after her husband" - after her husband's bill of divorce. Say the latter clause: He does not render them impure, and they do not render him impure. Granted, they do not render him impure - stringency, for perhaps each one is not his child. Rather, he does not render them impure, why? English translation:

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְשֵׁנִי לָא לִיטַּמֵּי לֵיהּ, אֶלָּא לְרִאשׁוֹן לִיטַּמֵּי לֵיהּ מִמָּה נַפְשָׁךְ? אִי בְּרֵיהּ הוּא — שַׁפִּיר קָא מִטַּמֵּא לֵיהּ, וְאִי בַּר בָּתְרָא הוּא — שַׁפִּיר קָא מִטַּמֵּא לֵיהּ, דְּחָלָל הוּא.
human_translation: Granted, for the second one he should not become impure, However, for the first he should become impure whichever way you If he is his son, it is appropriate for him to become impure to him, And if he is the son of the latter one, it is appropriate for him to become impure to him, as he, is a ḥalal .
llm_translation: In truth, for the second one it is not fitting for him, rather for the first one it is fitting for him. From what are you defiled? If he is his son — it is fitting that he defiles him, and if he is his daughter's son — it is fitting that he defiles him, for he is a commoner.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לָאו, בִּזְנוּת. וּמַאי ״אַחַר בַּעְלָהּ״ — אַחַר בּוֹעֲלָהּ. וְקָתָנֵי סֵיפָא: עוֹלֶה בְּמִשְׁמָר שֶׁל זֶה וְשֶׁל זֶה. וּתְיוּבְתָּא דִּשְׁמוּאֵל!
human_translation: Rather, is not with regard to licentious And what is After her husband [ ba’ala ]? After the man with whom she engaged in intercourse [ bo’ala ], And it is taught the latter clause ascends with the priestly watch of this one and of that one, And a conclusive refutation of Shmuel.
llm_translation: Rather, it is not a case of adultery. And what is meant by "after her husband"? — After her cohabitation. And the latter clause teaches: She may ascend to the Temple with the offering of this one and that one. And the excellence of Shmuel!
