hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שְׁמַעְיָא: בִּמְמָאֶנֶת.
human_translation: Rav Shemaya said: pertains to a girl who refused
llm_translation: Rav Shemaya said: in Memaneit.

hebrew_text: מְמָאֶנֶת מִי קָא יָלְדָה? וְהָתָנֵי רַב בִּיבִי קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן: שָׁלֹשׁ נָשִׁים מְשַׁמְּשׁוֹת בְּמוֹךְ: קְטַנָּה, מְעוּבֶּרֶת, וּמְנִיקָה. קְטַנָּה — שֶׁמָּא תִּתְעַבֵּר וְתָמוּת, מְעוּבֶּרֶת — שֶׁמָּא תַּעֲשֶׂה עוּבָּרָהּ סַנְדָּל, מְנִיקָה — שֶׁמָּא תִּגְמוֹל אֶת בְּנָהּ וְיָמוּת. וְאֵיזוֹ הִיא קְטַנָּה — מִבַּת אַחַת עֶשְׂרֵה שָׁנָה וְיוֹם אֶחָד עַד בַּת שְׁתֵּים עֶשְׂרֵה שָׁנָה וְיוֹם אֶחָד. פָּחוֹת מִיכֵּן אוֹ יָתֵר עַל כֵּן — מְשַׁמֶּשֶׁת כְּדַרְכָּהּ וְהוֹלֶכֶת, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר.
human_translation: Can a girl who refuses give birth? Didn’t Rav Beivai teach before Rav Naḥman women three may engage in intercourse with resorbent, A minor girl, a pregnant woman, and a nursing woman? A minor girl lest she become pregnant and die, A pregnant woman lest her fetus becomes a sandal, A nursing woman lest she wean her child and he will die And who is a minor girl from age eleven years and one day until age twelve years and one day. younger than this or older than this, she should go ahead and engage in intercourse in her usual manner. the statement of Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: Refusing, who from gave birth? And taught Rav Bevai stood before Rav Nachman: Three women serve in the capacity of a midwife: a minor, a pregnant woman, and a nursing woman. A minor - lest she become pregnant and die, a pregnant woman - lest she miscarry her fetus, a nursing woman - lest she wean her child and he die. And who is considered a minor? From the age of eleven years and one day until the age of twelve years and one day. Less than this or more than this - she serves in her usual manner and goes about, the words of Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אַחַת זוֹ וְאַחַת זוֹ מְשַׁמֶּשֶׁת כְּדַרְכָּהּ וְהוֹלֶכֶת, וּמִן הַשָּׁמַיִם יְרַחֲמוּ. שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״שׁוֹמֵר פְּתָאִים ה׳״!
human_translation: And the Rabbis say: this one and that one, should go ahead and engage in intercourse in their usual manner, and Heaven will have mercy as it is stated: “The Lord preserves the simple”
llm_translation: The sages say: "One this and one this serving in their own way and going, and from the heavens they have mercy." As it is said: "The Lord preserves the simple."

hebrew_text: מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ בְּקִידּוּשֵׁי טָעוּת, וְכִדְרַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל. דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: ״וְהִיא לֹא נִתְפָּשָׂה״ — אֲסוּרָה, הָא נִתְפָּשָׂה — מוּתֶּרֶת.
human_translation: You find in a mistaken betrothal. And in accordance with that Rav Yehuda Shmuel said, as Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said in the name of Rabbi Yishmael: “Neither was she [ hi ] coerced in the act” forbidden she was coerced she is permitted
llm_translation: She found in her Kiddushin a mistake, and as Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: For Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel in the name of Rabbi Yishmael: "And she was not caught" - forbidden, but if she was caught - permitted.

hebrew_text: וְיֵשׁ לְךָ אַחֶרֶת, שֶׁאַף עַל פִּי שֶׁלֹּא נִתְפָּשָׂה, מוּתֶּרֶת. וְאֵי זוֹ — זוֹ שֶׁקִּדּוּשֶׁיהָ קִידּוּשֵׁי טָעוּת, שֶׁאֲפִילּוּ בְּנָהּ מוּרְכָּב לָהּ עַל כְּתֵפָהּ — מְמָאֶנֶת וְהוֹלֶכֶת לָהּ.
human_translation: And you have another woman who, although she was not coerced, is permitted And who is this? This whose betrothal was a mistaken betrothal, as even if her child is riding on her shoulders, she may refuse and go off her
llm_translation: And you have another case, that even though it was not seized, it is permitted. And what is it? This is a case where its sanctifications are sanctifications of error, that even if her son is intertwined with her on her shoulder, she refuses and goes away from her.

hebrew_text: הָיוּ שְׁנֵיהֶם כֹּהֲנִים וְכוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הִכָּה זֶה וְחָזַר וְהִכָּה זֶה, קִלֵּל זֶה וְחָזַר וְקִלֵּל זֶה, קִלֵּל שְׁנֵיהֶם בְּבַת אַחַת, הִכָּה שְׁנֵיהֶם בְּבַת אַחַת — חַיָּיב. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: בְּבַת אַחַת — חַיָּיב, בָּזֶה אַחַר זֶה — פָּטוּר.
human_translation: both were priests, The Sages taught: he struck this and then struck that one, he cursed this one and then cursed that one, he cursed both of them simultaneously struck both of them simultaneously, he is liable Rabbi Yehuda says: simultaneously he is liable, one after the other, he is exempt.
llm_translation: They were both priests, etc. The Rabbis taught: If this one struck and then struck again, cursed and then cursed again, cursed both of them at once, struck both of them at once - he is liable. Rabbi Yehuda says: If he struck both at once, he is liable; if one after the other, he is exempt.

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: פָּטוּר בְּבַת אַחַת! תְּרֵי תַּנָּאֵי אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: But isn’t it taught Rabbi Yehuda says: He is exempt simultaneously? two tanna’im , in accordance with of Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: The text states: "And it was taught, Rabbi Yehuda says: He is exempt with one daughter! Two Tannaim disagree in the school of Rabbi Yehuda."

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּמַאן דְּפָטַר? אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: נֶאֶמְרָה בְּרָכָה לְמַטָּה, וְנֶאֶמְרָה בְּרָכָה לְמַעְלָה. מָה לְמַעְלָה שֶׁאֵין בָּהּ שׁוּתָּפוּת — אַף לְמַטָּה שֶׁאֵין בָּהּ שׁוּתָּפוּת. וְאִיתַּקַּשׁ הַכָּאָה לִקְלָלָה.
human_translation: What is the reasoning of the one who exempts Rabbi Ḥanina said: Blessing is stated below and blessing is stated above Just as above, that does not involve partnership, so too below, that does not involve partnership, And striking is juxtaposed with cursing.
llm_translation: What is the reason that one who is exempt? Rabbi Chanina said: A blessing was said below, and a blessing was said above. Just as above, which does not have partnership in it, so too below, which does not have partnership in it. And a connection is made here to a curse.

hebrew_text: וְעוֹלֶה בְּמִשְׁמָרוֹ וְכוּ׳. וְכִי מֵאַחַר דְּאֵינוֹ חוֹלֵק, לָמָּה עוֹלֶה? לָמָּה עוֹלֶה?! הָאָמַר: בָּעֵינָא דְּנֶיעְבֵּיד מִצְוָה! אֶלָּא: ״עָלָה״ לָא קָתָנֵי, אֶלָּא ״עוֹלֶה״ — בְּעַל כׇּרְחוֹ.
human_translation: And he ascends with the priestly watch Since he does not receive a share, why does he ascend? Why does he ascend? Doesn’t he say: I wish to perform a mitzva However, does not state: he ascended, but rather: He ascends, against his will.
llm_translation: And he goes up in his watch and so on. And since he does not divide, why does he go up? Why does he go up?! It was said: Because I want to fulfill the commandment! Rather, it does not teach "he went up," but "he goes up" - of his own accord.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אַחָא בַּר חֲנִינָא אָמַר אַבָּיֵי אָמַר רַבִּי אַסִּי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מִשּׁוּם פְּגַם מִשְׁפָּחָה.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa bar Ḥanina said Abaye said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: due to family flaw,
llm_translation: Said Rav Acha bar Chanina said Abbaye said Rabbi Assi said Rabbi Yochanan: Because of a blemish in the family.

hebrew_text: וְאִם הָיוּ שְׁנֵיהֶם בְּמִשְׁמָר כּוּ׳. מַאי שְׁנָא שְׁנֵי מִשְׁמָרוֹת דְּלָא — דְּאָזֵיל לְהָא מִשְׁמָרָה וּמְדַחוּ לֵיהּ, וְאָזֵיל לְהָא מִשְׁמָרָה וּמְדַחוּ לֵיהּ. מִשְׁמָר אֶחָד נָמֵי: אָזֵיל לְהַאי בֵּית אָב וּמְדַחוּ לֵיהּ!
human_translation: And if both were in one priestly watch, What is different two priestly watches, that does not as he goes to this watch and they reject him, and he goes to that watch and they reject him so too, one watch, he goes to this patrilineal family and they reject him,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And if they were both on duty together. What is different about two shifts? — That he goes to this shift and pushes him away, and he goes to that shift and pushes him away. Only one shift is effective: he goes to this father's house and pushes him away! English translation: And if they were both on duty together. What is different about two shifts? — That he goes to this shift and pushes him away, and he goes to that shift and pushes him away. Only one shift is effective: he goes to this father's house and pushes him away!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא, הָכִי קָאָמַר: אִם הָיוּ שְׁנֵיהֶם מִשְׁמָר אֶחָד וּבֵית אָב אֶחָד — נוֹטֵל חֵלֶק אֶחָד.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said this is what is saying: If they were both in one priestly watch and one patrilineal family, he receives one share,
llm_translation: Rav Papa said, thus he said: If both of them were from one watch and one father's house - he takes one portion.

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ נוֹשְׂאִין עַל הָאֲנוּסָה
llm_translation: We will return to you, bearers of the burden of the forced one.

hebrew_text: מִצְוַת חֲלִיצָה בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה דַּיָּינִין, וַאֲפִילּוּ שְׁלָשְׁתָּן הֶדְיוֹטוֹת. חָלְצָה בְּמִנְעָל — חֲלִיצָתָהּ כְּשֵׁרָה, בְּאַנְפִּילְיָא — חֲלִיצָתָהּ פְּסוּלָה. בְּסַנְדָּל שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ עָקֵב — כָּשֵׁר, וְשֶׁאֵין לוֹ עָקֵב — פְּסוּל.
human_translation: The mitzva of ḥalitza , must be three judges, and even if all three are laymen, If she performed ḥalitza a shoe her ḥalitza is valid, a soft shoe [ anpileya ] her ḥalitza is invalid, a sandal, that has a heel, valid; but without a heel, it is invalid
llm_translation: The commandment of chalitzah requires three judges, even if they are laymen. If she performed chalitzah with a sandal - her chalitzah is valid, but if she performed chalitzah with a shoe - her chalitzah is invalid. If the sandal has a heel - it is valid, but if it does not have a heel - it is invalid.

hebrew_text: מִן הָאַרְכּוּבָּה וּלְמַטָּה — חֲלִיצָה כְּשֵׁרָה. מִן הָאַרְכּוּבָּה וּלְמַעְלָה — חֲלִיצָה פְּסוּלָה. חָלְצָה בְּסַנְדָּל שֶׁאֵין שֶׁלּוֹ, אוֹ בְּסַנְדָּל שֶׁל עֵץ, אוֹ בְּשֶׁל שְׂמֹאל בְּיָמִין — חֲלִיצָה כְּשֵׁרָה. חָלְצָה בְּגָדוֹל שֶׁהוּא יָכוֹל לַהֲלוֹךְ בּוֹ, אוֹ בְּקָטָן שֶׁהוּא חוֹפֶה אֶת רוֹב רַגְלוֹ — חֲלִיצָתָהּ כְּשֵׁרָה.
human_translation: from the knee down it is valid ḥalitza . from the knee and above, it is invalid ḥalitza . If she performed ḥalitza a sandal that did not belong to him, or a sandal made of wood, or on the left which was on his right it is valid ḥalitza . If she performed ḥalitza large which he can walk in, or small that covered most of his foot, her ḥalitza is valid.
llm_translation: From the ankle and below - the chalitzah is valid. From the ankle and above - the chalitzah is invalid. If she performed chalitzah with a sandal that is not hers, or with a wooden sandal, or with a left sandal on the right foot - the chalitzah is valid. If she performed chalitzah with a large sandal that she can walk in, or with a small sandal that covers most of her foot - her chalitzah is valid.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וּמֵאַחַר דַּאֲפִילּוּ שְׁלֹשָׁה הֶדְיוֹטוֹת, דַּיָּינִין לְמָה לִי? הָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּבָעֵינַן בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה שֶׁיּוֹדְעִים לְהַקְרוֹת כְּעֵין דַּיָּינִים. תְּנֵינָא לְהָא דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: מִצְוַת חֲלִיצָה בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה שֶׁיּוֹדְעִין לְהַקְרוֹת כְּעֵין דַּיָּינִים. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: בַּחֲמִשָּׁה.
human_translation: Now that even three laymen why do I judges? This teaches us that we require three who can dictate like judges, We learned this as the Sages taught: The mitzva of ḥalitza is before three who know to dictate like judges. Rabbi Yehuda says: before five
llm_translation: Gemara: And after the Mishnah stated that even with three laymen, why do I need to know this? This teaches us that we require three who are knowledgeable to read like judges. We learned in a Mishnah: The mitzvah of chalitzah levirate marriage release requires three who are knowledgeable to read like judges. Rabbi Yehudah says: It requires five.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּתַנָּא קַמָּא, דְּתַנְיָא: ״זְקֵנִים״ — שְׁנַיִם, וְאֵין בֵּית דִּין שָׁקוּל, מוֹסִיפִין עֲלֵיהֶן עוֹד אֶחָד — הֲרֵי כָּאן שְׁלֹשָׁה. וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה: ״זִקְנֵי״ — שְׁנַיִם, ״זְקֵנִים״ — שְׁנַיִם, וְאֵין בֵּית דִּין שָׁקוּל, מוֹסִיפִין עֲלֵיהֶן עוֹד אֶחָד — הֲרֵי כָּאן חֲמִשָּׁה.
human_translation: What is the reason of the first tanna , As it is taught Elders” two, and a court may not even one more is added to them. Therefore, there are three And Rabbi Yehuda Elders of two “Elders” two and a court may not even one more is added to them. Therefore, there are five
llm_translation: What is the reason for the teaching of the first Tanna, as it was taught: "Elders" - two, and if the court is not balanced, they add one more - here we have three. And Rabbi Yehuda: "Elders" - two, "Zekenim" - two, and if the court is not balanced, they add one more - here we have five.

hebrew_text: וְתַנָּא קַמָּא, הַאי ״זִקְנֵי״ מַאי עָבֵיד לֵיהּ? מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְרַבּוֹיֵי אֲפִילּוּ שְׁלֹשָׁה הֶדְיוֹטוֹת.
human_translation: And what does the first tanna do with this “Elders”? He requires it for inclusion even three laymen
llm_translation: And it was taught in the first Tanna, what does this "elderly man" do with it? He requires it for his needs even three laymen.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, הֶדְיוֹטוֹת מְנָא לֵיהּ? נָפְקָא לֵיהּ מִ״לְּעֵינֵי״, דְּאָמַר מָר: ״לְעֵינֵי״ — פְּרָט לְסוֹמִים,
human_translation: From where does Rabbi Yehuda derive laymen? He derives it from “Before the eyes of for the Master said: “Before the eyes of” excludes blind individuals
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda, how does he count the commoners? It was derived for him from "l'einei," as the Master said: "l'einei" - excluding the blind.

hebrew_text: וּמִדְּאִיצְטְרִיךְ ״לְעֵינֵי״ לְמַעוֹטֵי סוֹמִים, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ דַּאֲפִילּוּ הֶדְיוֹטוֹת. דְּאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ סַנְהֶדְרִין בָּעֵינַן, לְמָה לִי לְמַעוֹטֵי סוֹמִין? מִדְּתָנֵי רַב יוֹסֵף נָפְקָא, דְּתָנֵי רַב יוֹסֵף: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁבֵּית דִּין מְנוּקִּים בְּצֶדֶק, כָּךְ בֵּית דִּין מְנוּקִּים מִכׇּל מוּם,
human_translation: And since it was necessary “before the eyes of” to exclude blind individuals learn from here even laymen For if it enters your mind we require Sanhedrin, why do I to exclude blind individuals? For that derived from Rav Yosef taught, as Rav Yosef taught: Just as a court must be clean in righteousness, likewise a court must be clean of any blemish,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And from where do we need "to the eyes" to exclude the blind? Learn from it that even commoners. For if it enters your mind that we need a Sanhedrin, why do I need to exclude the blind? For Rav Yosef taught, for Rav Yosef taught: Just as a court must be clear of any blemish, so too a court must be clear of any flaw.

hebrew_text: שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כֻּלָּךְ יָפָה רַעְיָתִי וּמוּם אֵין בָּךְ״. וְאִידַּךְ: הַהוּא ״לְעֵינֵי״ מַאי עָבֵיד לֵיהּ? הַהוּא לְכִדְרָבָא הוּא דַּאֲתָא. דְּאָמַר רָבָא: צְרִיכִי דַּיָּינֵי לְמִיחְזֵי רוּקָּא דְּקָא נָפֵיק מִפּוּמָּא דִיבָמָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״לְעֵינֵי הַזְּקֵנִים ... וְיָרְקָה״.
human_translation: as it is stated: “You are entirely beautiful, my love, and there is no blemish in you” And the other what does he do with “before the eyes of”? That comes for Rava as Rava said: The judges must see the spittle that exits from the mouth of the yevama as it is written: before the eyes of the Elders, and spit
llm_translation: Talmudic text: As it is stated: "You are all beautiful, my love, and there is no blemish in you." And the other one: What does that one do with "before the eyes"? That one is in accordance with Rava who came, as Rava said: I need judges to see the spittle that comes out from the mouth of the yavamah, as it is written: "Before the eyes of the elders... and she shall spit." English translation:

hebrew_text: וְאִידַּךְ נָמֵי, מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְכִדְרָבָא! אִין הָכִי נָמֵי, וְאֶלָּא הֶדְיוֹטוֹת מְנָא לֵיהּ? נָפְקָא מִ״בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל״ — יִשְׂרָאֵל כֹּל דְּהוּ.
human_translation: the other also require to Rava’s Yes, is so, But from where does he derive laymen? derives from “In Israel,” any Israelite,
llm_translation: And the other one, it is necessary for him according to Ravah! Is it really so? But perhaps he relies on laymen? It emerges from "of Israel" - Israel, whoever it may be.

hebrew_text: וְאִידַּךְ, הַאי ״יִשְׂרָאֵל״ מַאי עָבֵיד לֵיהּ? מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְכִדְתָנֵי רַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר יְהוּדָה: ״בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל״ — בְּבֵית דִּין שֶׁל יִשְׂרָאֵל, וְלֹא בְּבֵית דִּין שֶׁל גֵּרִים.
human_translation: And the other what does he do with this “In Israel”? He requires it for that which was taught by Rav Shmuel bar Yehuda: “In Israel” in a court of Israelites and not in a court of converts.
llm_translation: And the other opinion, this "Israel," what does it do for him? It is necessary for him, as Rav Shmuel bar Yehudah taught: "In Israel" - in the court of Israel, and not in the court of converts.

hebrew_text: וְאִידַּךְ? ״בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל״ אַחֲרִינָא כְּתִיב. וְאִידַּךְ? מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְכִדְתַנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: פַּעַם אַחַת הָיִינוּ יוֹשְׁבִין לִפְנֵי רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן, וּבָאָה יְבָמָה לַחְלוֹץ, וְאָמַר לָנוּ, עֲנוּ כּוּלְּכֶם: ״חֲלוּץ הַנָּעַל״.
human_translation: And the other “In Israel” is written another And the other, He requires it for that which is taught Rabbi Yehuda said: Once we were sitting before Rabbi Tarfon, and a yevama came to perform ḥalitza , and he said to us: you should all respond: “He who had his shoe removed.”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And the other? "In Israel" is written elsewhere. And the other? He needs it for what was taught, Rabbi Yehuda said: Once we were sitting before Rabbi Tarfon, and a yevamah came to perform chalitzah, and he said to us, all of you respond: "Loosen the sandal."

hebrew_text: וְאִידַּךְ? מִ״וְּנִקְרָא״ נָפְקָא.
human_translation: And the other, He derives from “Shall be called,”
llm_translation: And the other? From where is it derived?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, ״וְקָרְאוּ״ — שְׁנַיִם, ״וְדִבְּרוּ״ שְׁנַיִם! הָכִי נָמֵי, לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה הֲרֵי כָּאן תִּשְׁעָה, לְרַבָּנַן הֲרֵי כָּאן שִׁבְעָה!
human_translation: However, if that is so, “And they shall call”; two “And they shall speak” two according to Rabbi Yehuda’s there nine judges here, and according to the Rabbis there seven
llm_translation: Rather, from now on, "and they shall call" — two, "and they shall speak" two! Thus it was stated: According to Rabbi Yehuda, here there are nine, according to the Rabbis, here there are seven!

hebrew_text: הָהוּא מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְכִדְתַנְיָא: ״וְקָרְאוּ לוֹ״ — וְלֹא שְׁלוּחָם, ״וְדִבְּרוּ אֵלָיו״ — מְלַמֵּד שֶׁמַּשִּׂיאִין לוֹ עֵצָה הַהוֹגֶנֶת לוֹ. שֶׁאִם הָיָה הוּא יֶלֶד וְהִיא זְקֵנָה, הוּא זָקֵן וְהִיא יַלְדָּה, אוֹמְרִים לוֹ: מָה לְךָ אֵצֶל יַלְדָּה, מָה לְךָ אֵצֶל זְקֵנָה? כְּלָךְ אֵצֶל שֶׁכְּמוֹתְךָ, וְאַל תַּכְנִיס קְטָטָה לְתוֹךְ בֵּיתְךָ.
human_translation: That is necessary for him the that is taught “They shall call him” and not their agents. “They shall speak to him” teaches that they give him counsel appropriate for him if he was boy and she was elderly, he was elderly and she was girl, they would tell him What you with girl What you with an elderly woman Go be with someone like yourself, and do not bring a quarrel into your household,
llm_translation: That one asked him according to the teaching: "And they shall call him" — not their emissary, "and they shall speak to him" — teaches that they should give him advice that is fitting for him. For if he is young and she is old, he is old and she is young, they say to him: What do you have with a young one, what do you have with an old one? Go to one who is like you, and do not bring discord into your home.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: הֲלָכָה, חֲלִיצָה בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה, הוֹאִיל וּסְתַם לַן תְּנָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא לְרַב נַחְמָן: אִי הָכִי, מֵיאוּן נָמֵי, דִּתְנַן: הַמֵּיאוּן וְהַחֲלִיצָה בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה.
human_translation: Rava said Rav Naḥman said: The halakha ḥalitza before three since the tanna taught us an unattributed in accordance with Rava said to Rav Naḥman: If that is so, declarations of refusal, also As we learned Declarations of refusal and ḥalitza before three
llm_translation: Rava said, Rav Nachman said: The halakha is that chalitzah requires three, since a Mishna was taught to us in accordance with his opinion. Rava said to Rav Nachman: If so, what about the case where we learned: Yibum and chalitzah require three?

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא: הָכִי נָמֵי, וְהָתַנְיָא: מֵיאוּן, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים בֵּית דִּין מוּמְחִין, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: בְּבֵית דִּין וְשֶׁלֹּא בְּבֵית דִּין. אֵלּוּ וְאֵלּוּ מוֹדִים שֶׁצָּרִיךְ שְׁלֹשָׁה. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי מַכְשִׁירִין בִּשְׁנַיִם. וְאָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף בַּר מִנְיוֹמֵי אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: הֲלָכָה כְּאוֹתוֹ הַזּוּג.
human_translation: And if you would say that indeed but isn’t it taught refusal, Beit Shammai say a court of experts, and Beit Hillel say: in a court or not in a court Both concede three are required. Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, and Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Yosei, validate before two And Rav Yosef bar Minyumi said Rav Naḥman said: The halakha follows that pair.
llm_translation: And if you will say: so it is indeed, and it was taught: mayun, Beit Shammai say the court is blemished, and Beit Hillel say: whether in the court or not in the court. These and these agree that three are required. Rabbi Yosei son of Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Yosei permit with two. And Rav Yosef son of Minyomi said that Rav Nachman said: the halakha is like that pair.

hebrew_text: הָתָם חַד סְתָמָא, וְהָכָא תְּרֵי סְתָמֵי. הָתָם נָמֵי תְּרֵי סְתָמֵי נִינְהוּ, דִּתְנַן: מֵיאֲנָה אוֹ שֶׁחָלְצָה בְּפָנָיו — יִשָּׂאֶנָּה, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא בְּבֵית דִּין.
human_translation: There, one unattributed here, two unattributed There too, there are two unattributed as we learned If she made a declaration of refusal or performed ḥalitza before may marry her because he is a member of a court.
llm_translation: There, one anonymous, and here, two anonymous. There, also, they are two anonymous, as we learned: If she refuses or she removes it in his presence - he should compel her, because he is in a court.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, הָתָם תְּרֵי סְתָמֵי הָכָא תְּלָתָא סְתָמֵי.
human_translation: Rather, there, two unattributed and here, three unattributed
llm_translation: Rather, there (are) two anonymous (cases); here (there) are three anonymous (cases).

hebrew_text: מִכְּדֵי הָא סְתָמָא וְהָא סְתָמָא, מָה לִי חַד סְתָם, מָה לִי תְּרֵי סְתָם, מָה לִי תְּלָתָא? אֶלָּא, אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: הוֹאִיל וּסְתָם בִּמְקוֹם מַחְלוֹקֶת,
human_translation: Since this is unattributed and that is an unattributed what difference does it make to me one unattributed What difference does it make to me two unattributed What difference does it make to me three unattributed Rather, Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: because the unattributed in a place dispute
llm_translation: From here the anonymous and the anonymous, what do I need one anonymous, what do I need two anonymous, what do I need three? Rather, Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: Since it is anonymous in a place of dispute,

hebrew_text: דִּתְנַן: סְמִיכַת זְקֵנִים וְעֶגְלָה עֲרוּפָה בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: בַּחֲמִשָּׁה. הַחֲלִיצָה וְהַמֵּיאוּנִין בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה, וְלָא קָפָלֵיג רַבִּי יְהוּדָה — שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ הֲדַר בֵּיהּ רַבִּי יְהוּדָה. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: As we learned Ordination of Elders and the heifer whose neck is broken before three the statement of Rabbi Yosei. Rabbi Yehuda says: Before five. Ḥalitza and declarations of refusal before three. And Rabbi Yehuda did not dispute learn from here: Rabbi Yehuda retracted learn from here
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: The leaning of elders and the decapitated calf require three, the words of Rabbi Yosei. Rabbi Yehuda says: with five. The freeing and the appraisals require three, and Rabbi Yehuda does not disagree — learn from it that Rabbi Yehuda retracted. Learn from it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: צְרִיכִי דַּיָּינֵי לְמִיקְבַּע דּוּכְתָּא, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְעָלְתָה יְבִמְתּוֹ הַשַּׁעְרָה אֶל הַזְּקֵנִים״. רַב פָּפָּא וְרַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ עָבְדִי עוֹבָדָא בְּחַמְשָׁה. כְּמַאן — כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, וְהָא הֲדַר בֵּיהּ! לְפִרְסוֹמֵי מִילְּתָא.
human_translation: Rava said: The judges need to establish a location as it is written: “His yevama shall ascend to the gate to the Elders” Rav Pappa and Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, conducted a case before five In accordance with in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda, but Rabbi Yehuda retracted to publicize the matter
llm_translation: Rava said: I need the judges to be gathered in a circle, as it is written: "Then his brother's wife shall go up to him in the presence of the elders." Rav Papa and Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, performed the act with five. According to whom? According to Rabbi Yehuda, and then he retracted! For the publicity of the matter.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אִיקְּלַע לְבֵי רַב כָּהֲנָא, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: סְלֵיק מָר לְגַבַּן לְמַלּוֹיֵי בֵּי חַמְשָׁה. אָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא: הֲוָה קָאֵימְנָא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב יְהוּדָה, וַאֲמַר לִי: תָּא סַק לְזִירְזָא דִּקְנֵי, לְאִיצְטְרוֹפֵי בֵּי חַמְשָׁה. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: לְמָה לִי חַמְשָׁה? אֲמַר לְהוּ: כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלִיפַּרְסַם מִילְּתָא.
human_translation: Rav Ashi once happened to Rav Kahana’s house. said to Will the master come up with us to complete the quorum of five Rav Kahana said When I stood before Rav Yehuda, he said to me: Go up to the bundle [ zirza ] said to Why do I five He said to them: In order to publicize the matter,
llm_translation: Rav Ashei entered the house of Rav Kahana, he said to him: "The master should go out to the people of Malloye of Beis Chamsha." Rav Kahana said: "I was standing before Rav Yehudah, and he said to me: 'Go sharpen the knife for the buyers, to distribute to the people of Beis Chamsha.'" They said to him: "Why do I need five?" He said to them: "So that the matter will be spread out."

hebrew_text: רַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר יְהוּדָה הֲוָה קָאֵי קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב יְהוּדָה, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: סַק תָּא לְזִירְזָא דִּקְנֵי לְאִצְטְרוֹפֵי בֵּי חַמְשָׁה, לְפַרְסוֹמֵי מִילְּתָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ, תְּנֵינָא: ״בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל״ — בְּבֵית דִּין יִשְׂרָאֵל וְלֹא בְּבֵית דִּין שֶׁל גֵּרִים, וַאֲנָא גֵּר אֲנָא.
human_translation: Rav Shmuel bar Yehuda was standing before Rav Yehuda. said to him: Go up to the bundle of reeds to complete the five in order to publicize the matter said to him: We learned “In Israel” before a court of Israelites and not before a court f converts, but I am a convert,
llm_translation: Rav Shmuel bar Yehudah was standing before Rav Yehudah, he said to him: "Take a look at the Zirzah of Kinai for the gathering of five, for the spreading of the matter." He said to him, "We have learned: 'In Israel' - in the court of Israel and not in the court of converts, and I am a convert."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: כְּגוֹן רַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר יְהוּדָה, מַפֵּיקְנָא מָמוֹנָא אַפּוּמֵּיהּ. מַפֵּיקְנָא סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ? וְהָא ״עַל פִּי שְׁנַיִם עֵדִים״ אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא! אֶלָּא: מַרַעְנָא שְׁטָרָא אַפּוּמֵּיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said I would exact payment based on the word of such as Rav Shmuel bar Yehuda, Does it enter your mind one can exact the Merciful One state “By the mouth of two witnesses Rather, I would declare a bill invalid based on his word,
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said: For example, like Rav Shmuel bar Yehudah, he collects money from his debtor. Do you collect according to your own opinion? But doesn't the Merciful One say, "By the mouth of two witnesses"? Rather, he shows him a promissory note.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא:
human_translation: Rava said:
llm_translation: Rava said:

hebrew_text: גֵּר דָּן אֶת חֲבֵירוֹ דְּבַר תּוֹרָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״שׂוֹם תָּשִׂים עָלֶיךָ מֶלֶךְ אֲשֶׁר יִבְחַר ה׳ אֱלֹהֶיךָ בּוֹ מִקֶּרֶב אַחֶיךָ תָּשִׂים עָלֶיךָ מֶלֶךְ״. ״עָלֶיךָ״ הוּא דְּבָעֵינַן ״מִקֶּרֶב אַחֶיךָ״, אֲבָל גֵּר דָּן אֶת חֲבֵירוֹ גֵּר.
human_translation: By Torah law a convert may judge his fellow as it is stated: “You shall set a king over you, whom the Lord your God shall choose; one from among your brothers you shall set king over you” “over you,” is where we require “From among your brothers,” However, a convert may judge his fellow convert,
llm_translation: A convert judges his fellow in matters of Torah, as it is stated: "You shall surely set a king over you, whom the Lord your God shall choose; one from among your brothers you shall set as king over you" (Deuteronomy 17:15). "Over you" is necessary to include "from among your brothers," but a convert judges his fellow as a convert.

hebrew_text: וְאִם הָיְתָה אִמּוֹ מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל — דָּן אֲפִילּוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל. וּלְעִנְיַן חֲלִיצָה עַד שֶׁיְּהֵא אָבִיו וְאִמּוֹ מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְנִקְרָא שְׁמוֹ בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל״.
human_translation: And if the mother was from Israel, he may even adjudicate Jew. But with regard to ḥalitza , unless both his father and his mother were from Israel as it is stated “And his name shall be called in Israel:
llm_translation: If his mother was from Israel - he is judged even as an Israelite. And regarding the matter of halitzah, until his father and mother are both from Israel, as it is stated: "And his name shall be called in Israel."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה אָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא אָמַר רַב: אִם יָבֹא אֵלִיָּהוּ וְיֹאמַר: ״חוֹלְצִין בְּמִנְעָל״ — שׁוֹמְעִין לוֹ. ״אֵין חוֹלְצִין בְּסַנְדָּל״ — אֵין שׁוֹמְעִין לוֹ, שֶׁכְּבָר נָהֲגוּ הָעָם בְּסַנְדָּל.
human_translation: Rabba said Rav Kahana said Rav said: If Elijah should come and say: One may perform ḥalitza using shoe, would listen to him. One may not perform ḥalitza using sandal, they would not listen to him, for the people already have the practice of using a sandal.
llm_translation: Rabba said, Rav Kahana said, Rav said: If Elijah should come and say, "One may remove the shoe," we listen to him. But if he should say, "One may not remove the sandal," we do not listen to him, because the people are already accustomed to wearing sandals.

hebrew_text: וְרַב יוֹסֵף אָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא אָמַר רַב: אִם יָבֹא אֵלִיָּהוּ וְיֹאמַר: ״אֵין חוֹלְצִין בְּמִנְעָל״ — שׁוֹמְעִין לוֹ. ״אֵין חוֹלְצִין בְּסַנְדָּל״ — אֵין שׁוֹמְעִין לוֹ, שֶׁכְּבָר נָהֲגוּ הָעָם בְּסַנְדָּל.
human_translation: And Rav Yosef said Rav Kahana said Rav If Elijah should come and say: One may not perform ḥalitza using shoe, they would listen to him. One may not perform ḥalitza using sandal, they would not listen to him, for the people already have the practice of using a sandal.
llm_translation: And Rav Yosef said, Rav Kahana said, Rav: If Elijah should come and say, "One does not remove shoes with a shoe," we listen to him. "One does not remove shoes with a sandal," we do not listen to him, for the people have already accustomed themselves to removing shoes with a sandal.

hebrew_text: מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ? אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ מִנְעָל לְכַתְּחִלָּה.
human_translation: What is difference between The between them shoe ab initio .
llm_translation: What is the difference between them? The difference between them is a sandal for the beginning.

hebrew_text: וּלְמַאן דְּאָמַר אֲפִילּוּ לְכַתְּחִלָּה, וְהָתְנַן: חָלְצָה בְּמִנְעָל — חֲלִיצָתָהּ כְּשֵׁרָה. דִּיעֲבַד אִין, לְכַתְּחִלָּה לָא!
human_translation: And according to the one who says even ab initio , didn’t we learn If she performed ḥalitza with shoe, her ḥalitza is valid, after the fact, yes, but it is not ab initio ?
llm_translation: And for the one who says even initially, and we learned: if she removed with a shoe - her removal is valid. If it happened, initially it is not valid!

hebrew_text: הוּא הַדִּין דַּאֲפִילּוּ לְכַתְּחִלָּה. וְאַיְּידֵי דְבָעֵי לְמִיתְנֵי סֵיפָא בְּאַנְפִּילְיָא חֲלִיצָתָהּ פְּסוּלָה, דַּאֲפִילּוּ דִּיעֲבַד, תְּנָא נָמֵי רֵישָׁא דִּיעֲבַד.
human_translation: The same is even ab initio , but since wished to teach in the latter clause an anpileya , her ḥalitza is disqualified even after the fact, he also taught the first clause after the fact,
llm_translation: It is the same as even at the outset. And since he wants to teach the latter part in a case where her redemption is invalid, even if it occurred, a Tanna similarly taught at the outset of its occurrence.

hebrew_text: וּמִנְעָל לְכַתְּחִלָּה תַּנָּאֵי הִיא. דְּתַנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: פַּעַם אַחַת הָלַכְתִּי לִנְצִיבִין, מָצָאתִי זָקֵן אֶחָד. אָמַרְתִּי לוֹ: כְּלוּם אַתָּה בָּקִי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בְּתֵירָא? אָמַר לִי: הֵן, וְעַל שׁוּלְחָנִי הוּא תָּדִיר. כְּלוּם רָאִיתָ שֶׁחָלַץ בִּיבָמָה?
human_translation: And shoe ab initio is tanna’im , as it is taught Rabbi Yosei said: One time I went to Netzivin I found a certain Elder. I said to him: Do you know Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira, He said to me: Yes, and he is frequent at my table. Have you ever seen if he the ḥalitza of a yevama ?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And a sandal initially it is. As it was taught: Rabbi Yosei said: Once I went to Nitzivin, I found an elderly man. I said to him: Are you perhaps knowledgeable in the teachings of Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira? He said to me: Yes, and he is often on my table. Have you seen him who performs chalitzah with a yevamah?

hebrew_text: אָמַר לִי: רָאִיתִי שֶׁחָלַץ הַרְבֵּה פְּעָמִים. בְּמִנְעָל אוֹ בְּסַנְדָּל? אָמַר לִי: וְכִי חוֹלְצִין בְּמִנְעָל?! (וְהַתּוֹרָה אָמְרָה ״נַעֲלוֹ״, וְלֹא מִנְעָלוֹ), אָמַרְתִּי לוֹ: אִם כֵּן, מָה רָאָה רַבִּי מֵאִיר לוֹמַר חָלְצָה בְּמִנְעָל חֲלִיצָתָהּ כְּשֵׁירָה?!
human_translation: He said to me: I saw that he ḥalitza many times. Using a shoe or a sandal? He said to me: Does anyone performing ḥalitza with a shoe? But the Torah said: “His shoe [ na’alo ]” and not: His shoe [ minalo ]. I said to him: If so, what did Rabbi Meir see that him say a woman performed ḥalitza using shoe her ḥalitza is valid?
llm_translation: He said to me: I saw that he removed many times. With a shoe or with a sandal? He said to me: Do we remove with a shoe?! (And the Torah said "his shoe," not "his shoe"). I said to him: If so, what did Rabbi Meir see to say that she may remove with a shoe, her removal is valid?!

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב אוֹמֵר מִשְּׁמוֹ: חוֹלְצִין בְּמִנְעָל לְכַתְּחִלָּה. וּמַאן דְּאָמַר לְכַתְּחִלָּה לָא, מַאי טַעְמָא?
human_translation: Rabbi Ya’akov says in the name One may perform ḥalitza using shoe ab initio . And for the one who said one may not shoe ab initio , what is the reason
llm_translation: Rabbi Yaakov says in his name: One may remove a shoe initially. And one who says not initially, what is the reason?

hebrew_text: אִילֵּימָא מִשּׁוּם דְּהָוְיָא פַּנְתָּא מֵעַל וְאַרְקְתָא מֵעַל דְּמֵעַל, וְהַתּוֹרָה אָמְרָה ״מֵעַל״, וְלֹא מֵעַל דְּמֵעַל — אִי הָכִי, אֲפִילּוּ דִּיעֲבַד נָמֵי לָא!
human_translation: If we say because the upper side of the shoe [ panta ] is on and the straps arketa are on top on top and the Torah says: from on but not from on that is on if so, even after the fact as well, not
llm_translation: The text reads: "I would say that because it is a corner above and a roof above, it is considered above, and the Torah says 'above,' not 'above of above' - if so, even if it happens by itself, it is not valid!"

hebrew_text: גְּזֵירָה מִשּׁוּם מִנְעָל מְרוּפָּט.
human_translation: a decree due to torn shoe,
llm_translation: Decree because of a loose sandal.

hebrew_text: אִי נָמֵי מִשּׁוּם חֲצִי מִנְעָל.
human_translation: Alternatively, due to a half shoe,
llm_translation: If you want a word-for-word translation, it would be: "If yes from the name of half of a shoe."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב: אִי לָאו דַּחֲמֵיתֵיהּ לְחַבִּיבִי דַּחֲלַץ בְּסַנְדָּל דְּאִית לֵהּ שִׁינְצִין, אֲנָא לָא הֲוַאי חָלֵיצְנָא אֶלָּא בְּסַנְדָּלָא דְטַיָּיעָא דְּמִיהַדַּק טְפֵי. וְהַאי דִּידַן, אַף עַל גַּב דְּאִית בֵּיהּ חוּמַרְתָּא, קָטְרִינַן בֵּיהּ מִיתְנָא, כִּי הֵיכִי דְּתֶהְוֵי חֲלִיצָתָהּ מְעַלַּיְיתָא.
human_translation: Rav said: If I had not seen my beloved conduct a ḥalitza using a sandal with laces, I would not have conducted ḥalitza with anything other than a sandal of Arabs, which is more tight fitting And this of ours, although it does have a ring [ ḥumrata ] we tie a strap to it so that her ḥalitza will be highest standard.
llm_translation: Rav said: If not for the fact that my esteemed colleague removes his sandal that has nails, I would not have removed mine except for a sandal of the type that is smooth. And as for us, even though it has a strap, we cut it off, so that her removal will be more dignified.

hebrew_text: סִימַן: הַתָּרַת יְבָמָה סַנְדָּל. אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: הַתָּרַת יְבָמָה לַשּׁוּק — בִּשְׁמִיטַת רוֹב הֶעָקֵב.
human_translation: a mnemonic Hatarat , yevama ; sandal . Rav Yehuda said Rav said: The release of a yevama to the public occurs when most of the heel is removed
llm_translation: Topic: The permission of the yevamah through a sandal. Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: The permission of the yevamah in the marketplace - through the removal of the shoe.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: הוּתְּרוּ רְצוּעוֹת מִנְעָל וְסַנְדָּל, אוֹ שֶׁשָּׁמַט רוֹב הָרֶגֶל — חֲלִיצָתָהּ פְּסוּלָה.
human_translation: raises an objection If the straps of or sandal were untied, or if removed most of his foot her ḥalitza is disqualified.
llm_translation: Challenger: They permitted straps from a shoe or sandal, or if most of the sole was removed - its removal is invalid.

hebrew_text: טַעְמָא דְּשָׁמַט הוּא, הָא שָׁמְטָה הִיא — חֲלִיצָתָהּ כְּשֵׁרָה. רוֹב הָרֶגֶל אִין, רוֹב הֶעָקֵב לָא!
human_translation: The reason is that he removed but had she removed her ḥalitza valid. yes, most of the foot most of the heel, not
llm_translation: The reason of the Sabbatical year it is, the Sabbatical year it is — its redemption is valid. The majority of the foot, no, the majority of the heel not!

hebrew_text: לֹא: הַיְינוּ רוֹב הָרֶגֶל, הַיְינוּ רוֹב הֶעָקֵב. וְאַמַּאי קָרוּ לֵיהּ רוֹב הָרֶגֶל — דְּכוּלָּא חֵיילָא דְכַרְעָא עֲלֵיהּ דְּחִיס.
human_translation: No, most of the foot is most of the heel, And why do they call it: Most of the foot? Because the whole weight of the leg puts pressure on
llm_translation: Not: this is not the majority of the foot, this is the majority of the heel. And why is it called the majority of the foot? Because the entire army leans on it when it is in danger.

hebrew_text: מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי יַנַּאי: דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יַנַּאי בֵּין שֶׁהִתִּיר הוּא וְשָׁמְטָה הִיא, בֵּין שֶׁהִתִּירָה הִיא וְשָׁמַט הוּא — חֲלִיצָתָהּ פְּסוּלָה, עַד שֶׁתַּתִּיר הִיא וְתַשְׁמִיט הִיא. בָּעֵי רַבִּי יַנַּאי: קְרָעַתְהוּ, מַהוּ? שְׂרָפַתְהוּ, מַהוּ? גַּלּוֹיֵי כַּרְעָא בָּעֵינַן, וְהָאִיכָּא? אוֹ דִלְמָא חֲלִיצָה בָּעֵינַן, וְלֵיכָּא? תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: This supports Rabbi Yannai, as Rabbi Yannai said: Whether he unties and she removes it, whether she unties it and he removes it, her ḥalitza is disqualified unless she both unties it and takes it off. Rabbi Yannai asked: If she ripped it what is If she burned it what is exposure of the foot that we require, which exists Or perhaps it is removal that we require, which is lacking shall stand
llm_translation: Assisting him to Rabbi Yannai: For Rabbi Yannai said: Whether he permitted and she released, or she permitted and he released - her halitzah is invalid until she both permits and releases. Rabbi Yannai asked: If he tore it, what is the law? If he burned it, what is the law? We require the revealing of the leg, and is there a case? Or perhaps we require halitzah, and there is none? The matter remains unresolved.

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ רַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה מֵרַבָּה: שְׁנֵי מִנְעָלִים זֶה עַל גַּב זֶה, מַהוּ? הֵיכִי דָמֵי: אִילֵּימָא דִּשְׁלַפְתֵּיהּ לְעִילַּאי וְקָאֵי תַּתַּאי — ״מֵעַל״ אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא, וְלֹא מֵעַל דְּמֵעַל. לָא צְרִיכָא: דִּקְרַעְתֵּיהּ לְעִילַּאי וּשְׁלַפְתֵּיהּ לְתַתַּאי, וְקָאֵי עִילַּאי, מַאי? חֲלִיצָה בָּעֵינַן, וְהָא אִיכָּא? אוֹ דִלְמָא גַּלּוֹיֵי כַּרְעָא בָּעֵינַן, וְלֵיכָּא?
human_translation: Rabbi Neḥemya asked Rabba two shoes, one on top of the other, what is What are the circumstances If we say she removed the outer shoe and the inner shoe remains in place, the Merciful One states “From on and not: From on that which is on No, it is necessary where she tore the outer shoe and took off the inner shoe, and the outer one still remains What removal we require, which we have Or perhaps exposing the foot we require, which is lacking
llm_translation: Requested text translation: Rabbi Nechemiah asked Rabba: Two shoes, one on top of the other, what is the ruling? How is it considered? If you say that he removed the upper one and the lower one remains - "from above" the Merciful One said, not from above of from above. It is not necessary, for if he tore the upper one and removed the lower one, and the upper one remains, what is the ruling? We require a removal, and is there not one here? Or perhaps we require the uncovering of the sole, and there is none?

hebrew_text: וּמִי אִיכָּא כִּי הַאי גַוְונָא? אִין, דְּחַזְיוּהּ רַבָּנַן לְרַב יְהוּדָה דִּנְפַק בְּחַמְשָׁא זוּזֵי מוֹקֵי לְשׁוּקָא.
human_translation: Is there really a case like this Yes, for the Sages saw Rav Yehuda, who went out to the market wearing five pairs of slippers,
llm_translation: And is there a case like this? No, for the Rabbis saw it fitting to Rav Yehuda who went out with five zuzim in his hand to the market.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: יְבָמָה שֶׁהִגְדִּילָה בֵּין הָאַחִין — מוּתֶּרֶת לִינָּשֵׂא לְאֶחָד מִן הָאַחִין, וְאֵין חוֹשְׁשִׁין שֶׁמָּא חָלְצָה סַנְדָּל לְאֶחָד מֵהֶן. טַעְמָא, דְּלָא חָזֵינַן, הָא חָזֵינַן — חָיְישִׁינַן.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Rav said: yevama who grew up among brothers is permitted to marry one of the brothers and we are not concerned that she removed a sandal from one of them, The reason is that we did not see but if we did see we are concerned
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: A yevamah who grew up among the brothers - she is permitted to marry one of the brothers, and we are not concerned that perhaps she removed a sandal for one of them. The reason is that we did not see it, but if we saw it - we would be concerned.

hebrew_text: וְהָא תַּנְיָא: בֵּין שֶׁנִּתְכַּוֵּון הוּא וְלֹא נִתְכַּוְּונָה הִיא, בֵּין שֶׁנִּתְכַּוְּונָה הִיא וְלֹא נִתְכַּוֵּון הוּא — חֲלִיצָתָהּ פְּסוּלָה, עַד שֶׁיִּתְכַּוְּונוּ שְׁנֵיהֶם כְּאֶחָד! הָכִי קָאָמַר: אַף עַל גַּב דַּחֲזֵינַן — אֵין חוֹשְׁשִׁין שֶׁמָּא כִּוְּונוּ.
human_translation: But isn’t it taught Whether he intended and she did not intend or whether she intended and he did not intend to, the ḥalitza is invalid, unless they both intended it as one This is what said: Even if we see we are not concerned that perhaps they intended to
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it was taught: Whether he intended and she did not intend, or she intended and he did not intend — her halitzah is invalid, until both of them intend together! This is what he is saying: Even though we see — we are not concerned that perhaps they intended.

hebrew_text: וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: טַעְמָא, דְּלָא חָזֵינַן, הָא חָזֵינַן — חוֹשְׁשִׁין. וּדְקָא תָנֵא בָּעֵי כַּוּוֹנָה — הָנֵי מִילֵּי לְאִישְׁתְּרוֹיֵי לְעָלְמָא, אֲבָל לְאַחִין מִיפַּסְלָא.
human_translation: And there are who say The reason is that we did not see But if we did see, we would be concerned And that which was taught that intention is required, this applies to permit her to marry a stranger. But disqualify her for the brothers,
llm_translation: And there are those who say: The reason we do not see it, is because we see it - we are concerned. And as it was taught: If intention is required - those words are for the benefit of the world, but for brothers, they are invalid.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: סַנְדָּל הַתָּפוּר בְּפִשְׁתָּן — אֵין חוֹלְצִין בּוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וָאֶנְעֲלֵךְ תָּחַשׁ״. וְאֵימָא: תַּחַשׁ — אִין, מִידֵּי אַחֲרִינָא — לָא! ״נַעַל״ ״נַעַל״ רִיבָּה.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Rav said: One may not perform ḥalitza using a sandal sewn with flax, as it is stated: “And I made you shoes of taḥash skin” let us say: taḥash skin, yes, anything else, no. “shoe” “shoe” amplifies
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: A sandal sewn with flax - one does not remove it, as it is stated: "And I shod you with fine leather." But why not say: fine leather - no, from another source - no! "Shod, shod" is a dispute.

hebrew_text: אִי ״נַעַל״ ״נַעַל״ רִיבָּה, אֲפִילּוּ כֹּל מִילֵּי נָמֵי! אִם כֵּן, ״תָּחַשׁ״ מַאי אַהֲנִי לֵיהּ?
human_translation: If “shoe” “shoe” amplifies, even any materials as well, If so, what purpose does “ taḥash ” serve,
llm_translation: If "na'al" "na'al" is repeated, even all the words are the same! If so, what does "tachash" contribute to it?

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר מֵרַב: הוּא שֶׁל עוֹר, וּתְרֵיסִיּוֹתָיו שֶׁל שֵׂעָר, מַהוּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִי לָא קָרֵינַן בֵּיהּ ״וָאֶנְעֲלֵךְ תָּחַשׁ״? אִי הָכִי, כּוּלּוֹ שֶׁל שֵׂעָר נָמֵי! הָהוּא קֻרְקָא מִקְּרֵי.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar asked Rav: it, is made of leather, and its straps [ tereisiyyot ] of hair, what is He said to him: Do we not refer to as: “And I made you shoes of taḥash ”? If that is so, entirely of hair it should also be That would be called a slipper,
llm_translation: Requested from him Rabbi Elazar from Rabbi: It is of skin, and its straps are of hair, what? He said to him: Who do we call in it "and I will clothe you with tachash"? If so, all of it is of hair! That sack is called.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב כָּהֲנָא לִשְׁמוּאֵל: מִמַּאי דְּהַאי ״וְחָלְצָה נַעֲלוֹ מֵעַל רַגְלוֹ״ מִישְׁלַף הוּא — דִּכְתִיב: ״וְחִלְּצוּ אֶת הָאֲבָנִים אֲשֶׁר בָּהֵן הַנָּגַע״.
human_translation: Rav Kahana said to Shmuel: From where is it known that this “And she shall remove [ ḥaltza ] his shoe from on his foot” means to remove? As it is written: and they shall take out [ ḥiltzu ] the stones in which the plague is”
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Kahana to Shmuel: From what source is it derived that "and his shoe shall be removed from his foot" is to be interpreted as being forcibly removed? — For it is written: "And they shall remove the stones in which the plague is."

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא זָרוֹזֵי הוּא, דִּכְתִיב: ״הֵחָלְצוּ מֵאִתְּכֶם אֲנָשִׁים לַצָּבָא״! הָתָם נָמֵי — שַׁלּוֹפֵי מִבֵּיתָא לִקְרָבָא.
human_translation: But say it is strengthening, as it is written: “Arm [ heḥaletzu ] men from among you for the army” There too, removing from their houses to go to war.
llm_translation: And why is he diligent? For it is written: "Let men be drafted from among you for the army!" There, they explained - those who are slack from home to the battlefront.

hebrew_text: וְהָכְתִיב: ״יְחַלֵּץ עָנִי בְעׇנְיוֹ״! בִּשְׂכַר עׇנְיוֹ, יְחַלְּצוֹ מִדִּינָהּ שֶׁל גֵּיהִנָּם.
human_translation: But isn’t it written: “He delivers [ yeḥaletz ] the afflicted by His affliction [ be’onyo ]” as reward for his affliction, He shall deliver him from the judgment of Gehenna,
llm_translation: And it is written: "He will deliver the needy who cry out"! In exchange for his affliction, he will deliver him from the judgment of Gehinnom.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא הָא דִּכְתִיב: ״חֹנֶה מַלְאַךְ ה׳ סָבִיב לִירֵאָיו וַיְחַלְּצֵם״! בִּשְׂכַר יְרֵאָיו יְחַלְּצֵם מִדִּינָהּ שֶׁל גֵּיהִנָּם.
human_translation: But that it is written: “The angel of the Lord encamps around those who fear Him and delivers them [ vayeḥaltzem ]” As a reward for those that fear Him, He shall deliver them from the judgment of Gehenna.
llm_translation: Rather, this that is written: "The angel of the Lord encamps around those who fear Him and delivers them"! In reward for those who fear Him, He delivers them from the judgment of Gehinnom.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא הָא דִּכְתִיב: ״וְעַצְמֹתֶיךָ יַחֲלִיץ״, וְאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: זוֹ מְעוּלָּה שֶׁבַּבְּרָכוֹת, וְאָמַר רָבָא: זָרוֹזֵי גַּרְמֵי! אִין, מַשְׁמַע הָכִי וּמַשְׁמַע הָכִי. דְּהָכָא, אִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ זָרוֹזֵי הוּא, אִם כֵּן, לִכְתּוֹב רַחֲמָנָא ״וְחָלְצָה נַעֲלוֹ בְּרַגְלוֹ״!
human_translation: But that which is written: and make your bones strong [ yaḥalitz ]” and Rabbi Elazar said This is the greatest of blessings, and Rava said Strengthening of bones. Yes, it has this connotation, and it has this connotation, But here, if it enters your mind connotes strengthening, then let the Merciful One write She shall strengthen [ ḥaletza ] his shoe on his foot [ beraglo ],
llm_translation: Rather, this that is written: "And your bones He will deliver," and Rabbi Elazar said: This is the excess in blessings, and Rava said: They are swift causes! No, it is heard thus and it is heard thus. For here, if it were your intention that they are swift causes, if so, it should have been written mercifully, "and His shoe shall be loosened from his foot"!

hebrew_text: אִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״בְּרַגְלוֹ״, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: ״בְּרַגְלוֹ״ — אִין, בְּשׁוֹקוֹ — לָא, כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״מֵעַל רַגְלוֹ״ דַּאֲפִילּוּ בְּשׁוֹקוֹ. אִם כֵּן, לִכְתּוֹב רַחֲמָנָא ״בְּמֵעַל רַגְלוֹ״. מַאי ״מֵעַל רַגְלוֹ״ — שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ מִישְׁלַף הוּא.
human_translation: If the Merciful One had written On his foot [ beraglo ], I would have said on his foot, yes, but on his calf, no; the Merciful One writes “From on his foot [ me’al raglo ],” even on his calf, If so, let the Merciful One write on the upper part of his foot [ beme’al raglo ], What is “from on his foot [ me’al raglo ],” Learn from here indicates removal,
llm_translation: If the Merciful One wrote "on his foot," I would say: "on his foot" - no, "in his market" - no. If the Merciful One wrote "above his foot," even in his market. If so, let the Merciful One write "on top of his foot." What is "above his foot" - it is understood from what is drawn out.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ הָהוּא מִינָא לְרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל: עַמָּא דַּחֲלַץ לֵיהּ מָרֵיהּ מִינֵּיהּ, דִּכְתִיב: ״בְּצֹאנָם וּבִבְקָרָם יֵלְכוּ לְבַקֵּשׁ אֶת ה׳ וְלֹא יִמְצָאוּ חָלַץ מֵהֶם״.
human_translation: A certain heretic said to Rabban Gamliel: a nation whose Master removed [ ḥalatz ] Himself from them, as it is written: “With their flocks and with their herds they shall go to seek the Lord, but they shall not find Him. He has removed [ ḥalatz ] Himself from them [ meihem ]”
llm_translation: He said to him that heretic to Rabbi Gamliel: The nation that his master took out from his people, as it is written: "In their flocks and in their herds they will go to seek the Lord, but they will not find Him; He has withdrawn from them."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: שׁוֹטֶה, מִי כְּתִיב ״חָלַץ לָהֶם״? ״חָלַץ מֵהֶם״ כְּתִיב, וְאִילּוּ יְבָמָה דְּחָלְצוּ לָהּ אַחִין — מִידֵּי מְשָׁשָׁא אִית בֵּיהּ?
human_translation: He, said to him: Imbecile, does it say: He performed ḥalitza to them [ lahem ]? it says “ ḥalatz from them [ meihem ],” But if a yevama had her shoe removed by her yevamin , does this have any significance?
llm_translation: He said to him: A fool, who is it written "he shall take off for them"? "He shall take off from them" is written, and if the yevamah of the brothers they took off for her - does it have any validity?

hebrew_text: בְּאַנְפִּילְיָא חֲלִיצָתָהּ פְּסוּלָה כּוּ׳. לְמֵימְרָא דְּאַנְפִּילְיָא לָאו מִנְעָל הוּא?
human_translation: a soft shoe [ anpileya ] her ḥalitza is invalid. That is to say that an anpileya is not a shoe.
llm_translation: In the case of a woman's miscarriage, her "chalitzah" is invalid. Is it to be said that a miscarriage is not a shoe?

hebrew_text: וּתְנַן נָמֵי: אֵין הַתּוֹרֵם נִכְנָס לֹא בְּפַרְגּוֹד חָפוּת וְלֹא בְּאַנְפִּילְיָא, וְאֵין צָרִיךְ לוֹמַר בְּמִנְעָל וְסַנְדָּל, לְפִי שֶׁאֵין נִכְנָסִין בְּמִנְעָל וְסַנְדָּל לָעֲזָרָה.
human_translation: And we also learned The one who collects the funds may not enter wearing a garment [ pargod ] that is cuffed [ ḥafut ], nor wearing an anpileya , and needless to say a shoe or a sandal, because one may not enter courtyard wearing a shoe or a sandal.
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: The one who separates the Terumah does not enter either with a shoe-covering or with a sandal, and needless to say, not with a shoe or sandal, because they do not enter with a shoe or sandal into the Temple courtyard.

hebrew_text: וּרְמִינְהוּ: אֶחָד מִנְעָל וְסַנְדָּל וְאַנְפִּילְיָא, לֹא יְטַיֵּיל בָּהֶן, לֹא מִבַּיִת לְבַיִת וְלֹא מִמִּטָּה לְמִטָּה!
human_translation: And raises a contradiction the same for a shoe, and a sandal, and an anpileya , as one may not walk in them from one house to another, nor from one bed to another
llm_translation: And they asked: One who has a shoe, sandal, and slipper, should not walk with them, neither from house to house nor from bed to bed!

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: דְּאִית בֵּיהּ כְּתִיתֵי, וּמִשּׁוּם תַּעֲנוּג. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא: וּמִשּׁוּם תַּעֲנוּג בְּלֹא מִנְעָל בְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים מִי אֲסִירִי? וְהָא רַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא כָּרֵיךְ סוּדָרָא אַכַּרְעֵיהּ וְנָפֵיק! אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: לָא קַשְׁיָא, כָּאן בְּאַנְפִּילְיָא שֶׁל עוֹר, כָּאן בְּאַנְפִּילְיָא שֶׁל בֶּגֶד.
human_translation: Abaye said: that has cushioning, and due to the pleasure Rava said to him: But that is not considered shoes forbidden on Yom Kippur due to pleasure But Rabba bar Rav Huna would wrap a scarf on his feet and go out Rather, Rava said: This not difficult. Here, an anpileya of leather. There, an anpileya of cloth.
llm_translation: Abaye said: Because it has linen in it, and for pleasure. Rava said to him: And for pleasure without shoes on Yom Kippur, who is prohibited? But Rabba bar Rav Huna wrapped a scarf around his head and went out! Rather, Rava said: It is not difficult - here it is a linen scarf, here it is a woolen scarf.

hebrew_text: הָכִי נָמֵי מִסְתַּבְּרָא, דְּאִי לָא תֵּימָא הָכִי, קַשְׁיָא יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים אַיּוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים. דְּתַנְיָא: לֹא יְטַיֵּיל אָדָם בְּקוֹרְדָּקֵיסִין בְּתוֹךְ בֵּיתוֹ, אֲבָל מְטַיֵּיל הוּא בְּאַנְפִּילִין בְּתוֹךְ בֵּיתוֹ! אֶלָּא לָאו שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: כָּאן בְּאַנְפִּילְיָא שֶׁל עוֹר, כָּאן בְּאַנְפִּילְיָא שֶׁל בֶּגֶד — שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: And so too, it is reasonable as, if you do not say so, it difficult Yom Kippur and Yom Kippur. As it is taught A person shall not walk slippers [ kordakisin ] within his house but he may walk an anpileya within his house. Rather, not conclude from here here, to an anpileya of leather, there, to an anpileya of cloth? learn from here
llm_translation: So it was explained: for if you do not say so, it is difficult, as the Day of Atonement is both the Day of Atonement. As it was taught: A person should not walk around in worn-out sandals in his house, but he may walk around in worn-out shoes in his house! Rather, is it not logical to conclude: here we are talking about shoes made of leather, here we are talking about shoes made of cloth — that is the logical conclusion.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרָבָא: חָלְצָה בְּמִנְעָל הַנִּפְרָם שֶׁחוֹפֶה אֶת רוֹב הָרֶגֶל, בְּסַנְדָּל הַנִּפְחָת שֶׁמְּקַבֵּל אֶת רוֹב הָרֶגֶל, בְּסַנְדָּל שֶׁל שַׁעַם וְשֶׁל סִיב, בְּקַב הַקִּיטֵּעַ, בְּמוּק, בִּסְמִיכַת הָרַגְלַיִם, בְּאַנְפִּילְיָא שֶׁל עוֹר, וְהַחוֹלֶצֶת מִן הַגָּדוֹל,
human_translation: is taught in accordance with of Rava: she performed ḥalitza using a shoe whose seams were opened up, which covered most of the foot; with a sandal was opened that held most of the foot; with a sandal of cork [ sha’am ], or of fibers with a prosthetic foot of an amputee; with a felt shoe [ muk ]; with a leg blanket with a leather anpileya ; and who performs ḥalitza adult man,
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Rava: If one removes a shoe with a shoe horn that covers most of the foot, with a sandal that receives most of the foot, with a sandal of reeds or of branches, with a wooden clog, with a sandal, with the joining of the feet, with a leather shoe, and she removes it from the greater foot,

hebrew_text: בֵּין עוֹמֵד, בֵּין יוֹשֵׁב, בֵּין מוּטֶּה, וְהַחוֹלֶצֶת מִן הַסּוֹמֵא — חֲלִיצָתָהּ כְּשֵׁרָה. אֲבָל בְּמִנְעָל הַנִּפְרָם שֶׁאֵין חוֹפֶה אֶת רוֹב הָרֶגֶל, בְּסַנְדָּל הַנִּפְחָת שֶׁאֵינוֹ מְקַבֵּל אֶת רוֹב הָרֶגֶל, וּבִסְמִיכַת הַיָּדַיִם, וּבְאַנְפִּילְיָא שֶׁל בֶּגֶד, וְחוֹלֶצֶת מִן הַקָּטָן — חֲלִיצָתָהּ פְּסוּלָה.
human_translation: whether standing or sitting or leaning; and who performs ḥalitza blind her ḥalitza is valid. But a shoe torn that it does not cover most of the foot; or using a broken sandal that does not hold most of the foot; or using a hand blanket or using a soft shoe [ anpileya ] of cloth; or who performs halitza with a minor; her ḥalitza is disqualified.
llm_translation: Whether standing, sitting, or lying down, and the removal from the hair - her removal is valid. But with a sandal that is torn and does not cover the majority of the foot, with a sandal that is dilapidated and does not accept the majority of the foot, and with the joining of the hands, and with a corner of a garment, and the removal from a minor - her removal is invalid.

hebrew_text: קַב הַקִּיטֵּעַ, מַנִּי — רַבִּי מֵאִיר הִיא, דִּתְנַן: הַקִּיטֵּעַ יוֹצֵא בְּקַב שֶׁלּוֹ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹסֵר.
human_translation: Who is an amputee’s prosthetic It is Rabbi Meir, as we learned One with an amputated leg may go out with his wooden leg, the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yosei, prohibits
llm_translation: Kav ha-kitteah, mani - Rabbi Meir hi, ditnan: ha-kitteah yotzei be-kav shelo, divrei Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yosei oser.

hebrew_text: בְּאַנְפִּילְיָא שֶׁל בֶּגֶד, אֲתָאן לְרַבָּנַן!
human_translation: with an anpileya of cloth, we come to the Rabbis,
llm_translation: In the Anpilya of the garment, the Rabbis came!

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: מִדְּסֵיפָא רַבָּנַן, רֵישָׁא נָמֵי רַבָּנַן. וְרֵישָׁא, בִּמְחוּפֶּה עוֹר.
human_translation: Abaye said: Since the latter clause is the Rabbis, the first clause is also the Rabbis. And the first clause, referring to covered in leather,
llm_translation: Abaye said: From the end, the Rabbis, the beginning is called Rabbis. And the beginning, in a circle of skin.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא: אֲבָל אֵין מְחוּפֶּה עוֹר, מַאי — פָּסוּל? אִי הָכִי, אַדְּתָנֵי סֵיפָא בְּאַנְפִּילְיָא שֶׁל בֶּגֶד, לִיפְלוֹג בְּדִידַהּ: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים: בִּמְחוּפֶּה עוֹר, אֲבָל אֵין מְחוּפֶּה עוֹר — פָּסוּל!
human_translation: Rava said to him: But not covered in leather, what unfit. If so, rather than teaching latter clause: Anpileya of cloth let distinguish within itself In what is this statement said? in covered in leather, but not covered in leather, it is unfit.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rava: But if it does not have a border of skin, what is the ruling? If so, the latter clause teaches about the hem of a garment, to distinguish it: In what case are these matters said? In the case of having a border of skin, but if it does not have a border of skin - it is invalid!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: מִדְּרֵישָׁא רַבִּי מֵאִיר, סֵיפָא נָמֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר: הַאי — מַגֵּין, וְהַאי — לָא מַגֵּין.
human_translation: Rather, Rava said Since the first clause Rabbi Meir, the latter clause is also Rabbi Meir This protects and that does not protect
llm_translation: Rava said: From the first part Rabbi Meir expounds, the latter part Rabbi Meir states: This one - protects, and this one - does not protect.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַמֵּימָר: הַאי מַאן דְּחָלֵיץ, צָרִיךְ לְמִדְחֲסֵיהּ לְכַרְעֵיהּ.
human_translation: Ameimar said: The one who performs ḥalitza must press his foot
llm_translation: Ammar Amemar: Hai man dechaleitz, tzarich lemidchaseih lechar'ei.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אָשֵׁי לְאַמֵּימָר, וְהָתַנְיָא: בֵּין עוֹמֵד, בֵּין יוֹשֵׁב, בֵּין מוּטֶּה! אֵימָא: וּלְעוֹלָם דְּדָחֵיס לְכַרְעֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said to Ameimar: But isn’t it taught whether he was standing or sitting or leaning? Say actually he presses his foot
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Ashe to Amemar, and it was taught: Whether standing, whether sitting, whether lying down! Say: And always he should press his legs together.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר אַמֵּימָר: הַאי מַאן דִּמְסַגֵּי עַל לִיחֲתָא דְּכַרְעֵיהּ, לָא חָלֵיץ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אָשֵׁי לְאַמֵּימָר, וְהָתַנְיָא: סְמִיכוּת הָרַגְלַיִם, לָאו דְּחָלֵיץ בַּהּ אִיהוּ? לָא, דְּיָהֵיב לֵיהּ לְאַחֵר וְחָלֵיץ.
human_translation: And Ameimar said Someone who walks on the backs of his feet, cannot perform ḥalitza . Rav Ashi said to Ameimar: But isn’t it taught Leg supports Does this not mean that performs ḥalitza using these No, he gave these supports to another and he performing ḥalitza ,
llm_translation: And Amemar said: One who places his foot on his fellow's heel does not exempt him. Rav Ashe said to Amemar, and it was taught: The leaning of the feet, does it not exempt him? No, for he can give it to another and exempt him.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: לְמַאי דְּקָאָמַר אַמֵּימָר, לָאו בַּר אוֹבָא חָלֵיץ, וְלָאו בַּר קִיפוֹף חָלֵיץ.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: According to what Ameimar said, bar Uva cannot perform ḥalitza and bar Kipof cannot perform ḥalitza ,
llm_translation: Rav Ashei said: For what is Amemar saying this? Not a son of a hyena is a redeemer, and not a son of a monkey is a redeemer.

hebrew_text: מִן הָאַרְכּוּבָּה וּלְמַטָּה כּוּ׳. וּרְמִינְהִי: רְגָלִים — פְּרָט לְבַעֲלֵי קַבִּין!
human_translation: from the knee down raises a contradiction Festivals [ regalim ] exclude people who have prostheses.
llm_translation: From the archuba and below, like so. And raise an objection: "Regalim" - a specification for Ba'alei Kabbin!

hebrew_text: שָׁאנֵי הָכָא, דִּכְתִיב: ״מֵעַל רַגְלוֹ״. אִי הָכִי, לְמַעְלָה מִן הָאַרְכּוּבָּה נָמֵי! ״מֵעַל״, וְלָא מֵעַל דְּמֵעַל.
human_translation: It is different here, as it is written: from on his foot [ me’al raglo ]” If that is so, from above the knee, also “From on but not: From on that which is on
llm_translation: The matter is different here, for it is written: "above his foot." If so, above the chariot as well! "Above," and not "from above."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ, הַאי אִיסְתָּוִירָא עַד אַרְעָא נָחֵית. דְּאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ מִיפְסָק פָּסֵיק, הָוֵה לֵיהּ אִיהוּ ״מֵעַל״, וְשׁוֹקָא מֵעַל דְּמֵעַל! אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא מִיפְסָק פָּסֵיק, כֹּל דְּבַהֲדֵי כַּרְעָא — כְּכַרְעָא דָּמֵי.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: Learn from here that the heel bone [ istavira ] reaches to the ground for if it enters your mind that it is separate and divided, then that is “from on and the calf From on that which is on Rav Ashi said: Even you say that it is separate and divided anything that is connected with the foot is considered like the foot,
llm_translation: Rav Pappa said: Hear from it, this calculation reaches until the earth. For if your mind were to cease, it would cease, it would be considered "from above," and the thigh is considered "from above"! Rav Ashe said: Even if you were to say that if it ceases, it ceases, anything that is together with the thigh is considered as the thigh.

hebrew_text: מִן הָאַרְכּוּבָּה וּלְמַעְלָה. מֵתִיב רַב כָּהֲנָא: ״וּבְשִׁלְיָתָהּ הַיּוֹצֵאת מִבֵּין רַגְלֶיהָ״! אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁכּוֹרַעַת לֵילֵד, נוֹעֶצֶת עֲקֵבֶיהָ בְּיַרְכוֹתֶיהָ וְיוֹלֶדֶת.
human_translation: from the knee and above, Rav Kahana raised an objection “And against her afterbirth that emerges from between her legs [ ragleha ]” Abaye said: when crouches to give birth, she pushes her heels into her thighs and she gives birth,
llm_translation: From the pelvis and upwards. Rav Kahana raises an objection: "And at her delivery, the baby that comes out between her legs!" Abaye said: At the moment she crouches to give birth, her heels are pressed against her buttocks and she gives birth.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: ״לֹא עָשָׂה רַגְלָיו וְלֹא עָשָׂה שְׂפָמוֹ״! לִישָּׁנָא מְעַלְּיָא. תָּא שְׁמַע: ״וַיָּבֹא שָׁאוּל לְהָסֵךְ אֶת רַגְלָיו״! לִישָּׁנָא מְעַלְּיָא.
human_translation: Come hear “He had neither dressed his feet [ raglav ], nor trimmed his beard” a euphemism. Come hear “And Saul went in to cover his feet [ raglav ]” a euphemism.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Come and hear: 'He did not make his feet, and he did not make his lips'! For a higher purpose. Come and hear: 'And Saul came to wash his feet'! For a higher purpose." English translation:

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: ״אַךְ מֵסִיךְ הוּא רַגְלָיו בַּחֲדַר הַמְּקֵרָה״! לִישָּׁנָא מְעַלְּיָא. ״בֵּין רַגְלֶיהָ כּוּ׳״! לִישָּׁנָא מְעַלְּיָא.
human_translation: Come hear “Surely he is covering his feet [ raglav ] in the cabinet of the cool chamber” a euphemism. “At her feet [ ragleha ] a euphemism.
llm_translation: "Come and hear: 'But he covers his feet in the meeting tent'! It is a euphemism. 'Between her feet'! It is a euphemism."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: שֶׁבַע בְּעִילוֹת בָּעַל אוֹתוֹ רָשָׁע בְּאוֹתוֹ הַיּוֹם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בֵּין רַגְלֶיהָ כָּרַע נָפַל שָׁכָב בֵּין רַגְלֶיהָ כָּרַע נָפָל בַּאֲשֶׁר כָּרַע שָׁם נָפַל שָׁדוּד״. וְהָא קָא מִתְהַנְיָא מֵעֲבֵירָה! אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַי: כׇּל טוֹבָתָן שֶׁל רְשָׁעִים —
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: That wicked had intercourse seven times that day, as it is stated: “At her feet he sunk, he fell, he lay; at her feet he sunk, he fell; where he sunk, there he fell down dead” But she derived pleasure from transgression Rabbi Yoḥanan said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai: Every benefit for the wicked
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: Seven cohabitations the husband of that wicked woman has on that day, as it is stated: "Between her legs he stumbled, he fell, he lay; between her legs he stumbled, he fell; where he stumbled, there he fell, destroyed." And is he deriving pleasure from a transgression? Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai: All the goodness of the wicked —

hebrew_text: רָעָה הִיא אֵצֶל צַדִּיקִים. שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הִשָּׁמֶר לְךָ פֶּן תְּדַבֵּר עִם יַעֲקֹב מִטּוֹב עַד רָע״, בִּשְׁלָמָא רַע — לְחַיֵּי, אֶלָּא טוֹב אַמַּאי לָא? אֶלָּא שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: טוֹבָתָן שֶׁל רְשָׁעִים — רָעָה הִיא אֵצֶל צַדִּיקִים.
human_translation: is a disadvantage for the righteous, As it is stated “Take heed to yourself that you speak not to Jacob either good or bad” Granted, bad; this is rightly so, But good? Why not? Rather, learn from here a benefit to the wicked is a disadvantage for the righteous.
llm_translation: Evil is it with the righteous. As it is stated: "Take heed to yourself, lest you speak with Jacob from good to evil." Now, if evil — for their benefit, then why not good? Rather, learn from it: the good of the wicked is evil with the righteous.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא הָתָם, דִּלְמָא מַדְכַּר לֵיהּ שְׁמָא דַּעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה. אֶלָּא הָכָא, מַאי רָעָה אִיכָּא?
human_translation: Granted, there, perhaps he will mention to him the name of idol worships But here, what disadvantage is there
llm_translation: In truth, there, perhaps he will remember the name of foreign worship. Rather here, what harm is there?

hebrew_text: דְּקָא שָׁדֵי בָּהּ זוּהֲמָא. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁבָּא נָחָשׁ עַל חַוָּה הֵטִיל בָּהּ זוּהֲמָא. יִשְׂרָאֵל, שֶׁעָמְדוּ עַל הַר סִינַי — פָּסְקָה זוּהֲמָתָן. גּוֹיִם, שֶׁלֹּא עָמְדוּ בְּהַר סִינַי — לֹא פָּסְקָה זוּהֲמָתָן.
human_translation: He implants filth in her As Rabbi Yoḥanan said, When the serpent came upon Eve, he infected her with contamination, Jewish people stood at Mount Sinai their contamination ceased, gentiles, who did not stand at Mount Sinai, their contamination never ceased.
llm_translation: The text states: "He threw into it impurity." As Rabbi Yochanan said: When the serpent came upon Eve, he cast impurity into her. The Israelites, who stood at Mount Sinai, their impurity ceased. The nations, who did not stand at Mount Sinai, their impurity did not cease.

hebrew_text: חָלְצָה בְּמִנְעָל שֶׁאֵינוֹ שֶׁלּוֹ וְכוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״נַעֲלוֹ״, אֵין לִי אֶלָּא נַעֲלוֹ. נַעַל שֶׁל כׇּל אָדָם, מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״נַעַל״ — נַעַל מִכׇּל מָקוֹם.
human_translation: if she performed ḥalitza using a shoe that was not his, The Sages taught: his shoe I have only “his shoe,” from where any person’s The verse states “shoe” “shoe” in any case
llm_translation: She removed with a sandal that is not his, etc. The Rabbis taught: "His sandal," I have only his sandal. A sandal of any man, from where? The Torah teaches: "sandal" - a sandal from any place.

hebrew_text: אִם כֵּן, מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״נַעֲלוֹ״? נַעֲלוֹ הָרָאוּי לוֹ. פְּרָט לְגָדוֹל שֶׁאֵין יָכוֹל לַהֲלוֹךְ בּוֹ, וּפְרָט לְקָטָן שֶׁאֵינוֹ חוֹפֶה רוֹב רַגְלוֹ, וּפְרָט לְסַנְדָּל הַמְסוּלְיָים שֶׁאֵין לוֹ עָקֵב.
human_translation: if so, what the verse states: “His shoe,” “his shoe,” fitting for him, excluding large that he is unable to walk in it, and excluding so small it does not cover most of his foot, and excluding a heelless sandal [ sandal hamesulyam ], that does not have a heel
llm_translation: If so, what does the Talmud mean by "his shoe"? His appropriate shoe. To exclude an adult who cannot walk in it, and to exclude a child whose foot does not cover most of it, and to exclude a sandal with loose straps that does not have a heel.

hebrew_text: אַבָּיֵי הֲוָה קָאֵי קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב יוֹסֵף, אֲתַאי יְבָמָה לַחְלוֹץ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הַב לֵיהּ סַנְדָּלָךְ, יְהַיב לֵיהּ סַנְדָּלָא דִשְׂמָאלָא, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֵימַר דַּאֲמוּר רַבָּנַן, דִּיעֲבַד, לְכַתְּחִלָּה מִי אֲמוּר?
human_translation: Abaye was standing before Rav Yosef and a yevama came to perform ḥalitza . said to Give your sandal He gave him his left sandal. said to him: say that the Sages said after the fact, did they say that ab initio ?
llm_translation: Abaye was standing before Rav Yosef, a yevamah came to perform chalitzah. He said to her: "Bring your sandal." He gave her the sandal of his left foot. He said to her: "Should we say the Rabbinic statement, that it should be done initially, who said it?"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִי הָכִי, סַנְדָּל שֶׁאֵין שֶׁלּוֹ נָמֵי: אֵימַר דַּאֲמוּר רַבָּנַן דִּיעֲבַד, לְכַתְּחִלָּה מִי אֲמוּר? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָכִי קָאָמֵינָא לָךְ: הַב לֵיהּ וְאַקְנִי לֵיהּ.
human_translation: He said to him: If so, also a sandal that does not belong to him, say that the Sages said after the fact; did they say ab initio ? said to This is what I was saying to you: Give him and transfer ownership to him
llm_translation: He said to him: If so, a sandal that does not have its strap: should we say that the Rabbis said it is valid, initially who said it? He said to him: This is what I am saying to you: bring it to him and acquire it for him.

hebrew_text: סַנְדָּל שֶׁל עֵץ. מַאן תַּנָּא? אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: רַבִּי מֵאִיר הִיא, דִּתְנַן: הַקִּיטֵּעַ יוֹצֵא בְּקַב שֶׁלּוֹ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹסֵר. אֲבוּהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל אוֹמֵר: בִּמְחוּפֶּה עוֹר, וְדִבְרֵי הַכֹּל.
human_translation: a wooden sandal Who is the tanna Shmuel said: It is Rabbi Meir, as we learned One with an amputated leg may go out with his wooden leg, the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yosei prohibits the father of Shmuel says: that is covered in leather, and all agree.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: A sandal of wood. Who is the Tanna? Shmuel said: It is Rabbi Meir, as we learned: One who cuts off a piece of leather is liable for his own kav, the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yosei prohibits. The father of Shmuel says: With a leather sole, and this is the opinion of all.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פַּפִּי מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרָבָא: סַנְדָּל הַמּוּסְגָּר — לֹא תַּחֲלוֹץ בּוֹ, וְאִם חָלְצָה — חֲלִיצָתָהּ כְּשֵׁרָה. סַנְדָּל הַמּוּחְלָט — לֹא תַּחֲלוֹץ בּוֹ, וְאִם חָלְצָה — חֲלִיצָתָהּ פְּסוּלָה.
human_translation: Rav Pappi said in the name of Rava: One should not perform ḥalitza a quarantined sandal, But if she did perform ḥalitza her ḥalitza is valid a confirmed sandal, one may not perform ḥalitza with it, and if she did perform ḥalitza her ḥalitza is disqualified.
llm_translation: Rav Pappi said in the name of Rava: A sandal that is sewn shut - do not untie it, and if one untied it - its untying is valid. A sandal that is laced - do not untie it, and if one untied it - its untying is invalid.

hebrew_text: רַב פָּפָּא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרָבָא אָמַר: אֶחָד סַנְדָּל הַמּוּסְגָּר וְאֶחָד סַנְדָּל הַמּוּחְלָט — לֹא תַּחֲלוֹץ בּוֹ, וְאִם חָלְצָה — חֲלִיצָתָהּ כְּשֵׁרָה.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said in the name of Rava: both a quarantined sandal and a confirmed sandal She may not perform ḥalitza with it but if she did perform ḥalitza her ḥalitza is valid.
llm_translation: Rav Papa from the name of Rava said: One sandal that is tied and one sandal that is untied - do not remove it, and if she removed it - her removal is valid.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: בַּיִת הַמּוּסְגָּר — מְטַמֵּא מִתּוֹכוֹ. מוּחְלָט — מִתּוֹכוֹ וּמֵאֲחוֹרָיו. וְזֶה וָזֶה מְטַמְּאִין בְּבִיאָה.
human_translation: raises an objection A quarantined house, renders ritually impure from within, confirmed from within, from behind, and this and that, impart ritual impurity through entering
llm_translation: Challenger: A sealed house - it defiles from within. A house with a cavity - it defiles from within and behind it. And both this and that defile through entry.

hebrew_text: וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ כְּדִמְכַתַּת דָּמֵי — וְהָא בָּעֵינַן: ״וְהַבָּא אֶל הַבַּיִת״, וְלֵיכָּא!
human_translation: And if it enters your mind that is considered as if it were crushed then we require “Moreover, one who enters the And this is not
llm_translation: And if it enters your mind like the dimkattat of blood - but we require: "And the one who comes to the house," and it is not there!

hebrew_text: שָׁאנֵי הָתָם, דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״וְנָתַץ אֶת הַבַּיִת״, אֲפִילּוּ בִּשְׁעַת נְתִיצָה קָרוּי בַּיִת.
human_translation: There it is different, as the verse states: “And he shall break down the house” even while it is being broken down it is called a house,
llm_translation: The matter is different there, as the verse states: "And he shall demolish the house," indicating that even at the time of demolition it is still called a house.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: מַטְלֵית שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ שָׁלֹשׁ עַל שָׁלֹשׁ, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ כְּזַיִת, כֵּיוָן שֶׁנִּכְנָס רוּבָּהּ לְבַיִת טָהוֹר — טִמְּאַתְהוּ. מַאי לָאו, מוּחְלֶטֶת? לָא, מוּסְגֶּרֶת.
human_translation: Come hear a rag that is three by three even if it does not contain an olive-bulk, once most enters a pure house it renders ritually impure. What, is it not confirmed No, quarantined
llm_translation: Come and hear: A cloth that is three by three handbreadths in size, even though it does not have the size of an olive in impurity, once the majority of it enters a pure house - it becomes impure. What is the reason? Is it because it is spread out? No, it is because it is wrapped around something.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, אֵימָא סֵיפָא: הָיוּ בָּהּ כַּמָּה זֵיתִים, כֵּיוָן שֶׁנִּכְנַס מִמֶּנָּה כְּזַיִת לְבַיִת טָהוֹר — טִמְּאַתְהוּ,
human_translation: If so, say the latter clause: If was the volume of several olives, when one olive-bulk of enters a ritually pure house, it renders ritually impure.
llm_translation: If so, say the latter part: If there were many olives in it, and once one olive entered from it into a pure house - it renders it impure.

hebrew_text: אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא מוּחְלֶטֶת, הַיְינוּ דְּאִיתַּקַּשׁ לְמֵת. אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ מוּסְגֶּרֶת, אַמַּאי אִיתַּקַּשׁ לְמֵת?
human_translation: Granted, if you say confirmed this is because juxtaposed with a dead person But if you say quarantined why should it be juxtaposed to a dead person?
llm_translation: If you say it is mixed, that is why it is difficult for the dead. But if you say it is sealed, why is it difficult for the dead?

hebrew_text: שָׁאנֵי הָתָם, דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״וְשָׂרַף אֶת הַבֶּגֶד״, אֲפִילּוּ בִּשְׁעַת שְׂרֵיפָה קָרוּי בֶּגֶד.
human_translation: There is different, as the verse states: “And he shall burn the garment” even when it is being burned, it is still called a garment.
llm_translation: The matter is different there, as the verse states: "And he shall burn the garment," indicating that even at the time of burning it is called a garment.

hebrew_text: וְלִיגְמַר מִינֵּיהּ! אִיסּוּר מִטּוּמְאָה לָא גָּמְרִינַן.
human_translation: let us learn from this We cannot derive a prohibition from ritual impurity,
llm_translation: And to conclude from it! The prohibition of impurity we do not conclude.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא, הִלְכְתָא: אֶחָד סַנְדָּל הַמּוּסְגָּר, וְאֶחָד סַנְדָּל הַמּוּחְלָט, וְאֶחָד סַנְדָּל שֶׁל עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה — לֹא תַּחְלוֹץ, וְאִם חָלְצָה — חֲלִיצָתָהּ כְּשֵׁרָה. שֶׁל תִּקְרוֹבֶת עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה,
human_translation: Rava said the halakha is the same for a quarantined sandal, a confirmed sandal, and a sandal of idolatrous worship, one should not perform ḥalitza and if she did perform ḥalitza her ḥalitza is valid. that an offering of idolatrous worship,
llm_translation: Rava said, it is a halacha: one sandal that is closed, and one sandal that is open, and one sandal of foreign worship - do not untie, and if she untied - her untying is valid. Regarding a sandal of nearness to foreign worship,

hebrew_text: וְשֶׁל עִיר הַנִּדַּחַת, וְשֶׁל זָקֵן הֶעָשׂוּי לִכְבוֹדוֹ — לֹא תַּחְלוֹץ, וְאִם חָלְצָה — חֲלִיצָתָהּ פְּסוּלָה.
human_translation: or belonging to an idolatrous city, and of an Elder made in accordance with his dignity may not perform ḥalitza And if she did perform ḥalitza , her ḥalitza is invalid
llm_translation: And of the city of the one who is expelled, and of the elder who is appointed for his honor - do not untie, and if one untied - its untying is invalid.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבִינָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: מַאי שְׁנָא זָקֵן הֶעָשׂוּי לִכְבוֹדוֹ — דְּלָאו לְהִילּוּכָא עֲבִיד, דְּבֵי דִּינָא נָמֵי — לָאו לְהִילּוּכָא עֲבִיד!
human_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: What is different an Elder that is made in accordance with his dignity because it was not made for walking, the court’s also was not made for walking,
llm_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: What is the difference between an elder who is appointed for his honor - who does not engage in walking, as the courts are also not engaged in walking!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִילּוּ מְסַגֵּי בֵּיהּ שְׁלוּחָא דְּבֵי דִּינָא, מִי קָפֵיד עֲלֵיהּ דַּיָּינָא?
human_translation: He said to him: If a messenger of the court had walked in would the judge reprimand him?
llm_translation: He said to him: If they reach the messenger of the court, who is responsible for it, the wine?

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ חָלְצָה בַּלַּיְלָה — חֲלִיצָתָהּ כְּשֵׁרָה, וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר פּוֹסֵל. בִּשְׂמֹאל — חֲלִיצָתָהּ פְּסוּלָה, וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר מַכְשִׁיר.
human_translation: performed ḥalitza at night, her ḥalitza is valid, but Rabbi Elazar invalidates it. on left foot, her ḥalitza is invalid, but Rabbi Elazar validates it.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If she performed ḥaliẓah at night - her ḥaliẓah is valid, and Rabbi Elazar disqualifies it. If she performed ḥaliẓah with her left foot - her ḥaliẓah is invalid, and Rabbi Elazar validates it.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ לֵימָא בְּהָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי: דְּמָר סָבַר מַקְּשִׁינַן רִיבִים לִנְגָעִים, וּמָר סָבַר לָא מַקְּשִׁינַן רִיבִים לִנְגָעִים?
human_translation: Let us say that they disagree about this Sage, holds that we compare disputes, with leprosy. And Sage, holds that we do not compare disputes with leprosy.
llm_translation: Gemara: Let us say in this case where they disagree: Mar holds that we consider boils as susceptible to impurity, and Mar holds that we do not consider boils as susceptible to impurity?

hebrew_text: לָא: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא מַקְּשִׁינַן רִיבִים לִנְגָעִים, דְּאִי מַקְּשִׁינַן — אֲפִילּוּ גְּמַר דִּין בַּלַּיְלָה נָמֵי לָא, וְהָכָא בְּהָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי: מָר סָבַר: חֲלִיצָה כִּתְחִלַּת דִּין דָּמְיָא, וּמָר סָבַר: חֲלִיצָה כִּגְמַר דִּין דָּמְיָא.
human_translation: No, everyone that we do not compare disputes with leprosy, for if we would compare even verdict case not at night, And here, they disagree about this Sage, holds ḥalitza is considered like the commencement of judgment and Sage, holds ḥalitza is considered like the verdict
llm_translation: Not all disputes in the world are regarding monetary matters, for if they were, even if one concludes the judgment at night, it is not valid.
