Here, however, they are arguing about this: One Master holds that redemption is like the beginning of the judgment of money, and the other Master holds that redemption is like the conclusion of the judgment of money.

hebrew_text: רַבָּה בַּר חִיָּיא קְטוֹסְפָאָה עֲבַד עוֹבָדָא בְּמוּק, וּבִיחִידִי, וּבַלַּיְלָה. אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: כַּמָּה רַב גּוּבְרֵיהּ דְּעָבֵיד כִּיחִידָאָה.
human_translation: Rabba bar Ḥiyya Ketosfa’a, conducted using a slipper and in private, and by night. Shmuel said How great is the power who follows an individual
llm_translation: Rabbah bar Ḥiyya of Kṭosfa'ah engaged in work during the day, individually, and at night. Shemu'el said: How great are his deeds like an individual's.

hebrew_text: מַאי קַשְׁיָא? אִי מוּק — סְתָמָא תַּנְיָא. אִי לַיְלָה — סְתָמָא תַּנְיָא.
human_translation: What is difficult If it was a slipper, an unattributed opinion is taught If it was night, an unattributed opinion is taught
llm_translation: What is the difficulty? If it is daytime - a simple Mishnah teaches. If it is nighttime - a simple Mishnah teaches.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא יְחִידִי קָא קַשְׁיָא לֵיהּ: הֵיכִי עָבֵיד בִּיחִידִי, דִּיחִידָאָה קָתָנֵי לַהּ. דִּתְנַן: חָלְצָה בִּשְׁנַיִם אוֹ בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה וְנִמְצָא אֶחָד מֵהֶן קָרוֹב אוֹ פָּסוּל — חֲלִיצָתָהּ פְּסוּלָה. וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן הַסַּנְדְּלָר מַכְשִׁירִים. וּמַעֲשֶׂה בְּאֶחָד שֶׁחָלַץ בֵּינוֹ לְבֵינָהּ בְּבֵית הָאֲסוּרִים, וּבָא מַעֲשֶׂה לִפְנֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא וְהִכְשִׁיר.
human_translation: Rather, it was difficult for him in private, How could he do so in private, as that is taught only in accordance with an individual as we learned If she performed ḥalitza before two or three and one of them is found to be a relative or disqualified, her ḥalitza is invalid. And Rabbi Shimon and Rabbi Yoḥanan the Cobbler validate And an incident involving one who performed ḥalitza between him and her in prison, and the incident came before Rabbi Akiva and he validated
llm_translation: Rather, a difficulty arises for him as an individual: how does he act as an individual, for the Mishnah teaches regarding an individual. As we learned: If she performed halitzah with two or with three and one of them is found to be a relative or disqualified - her halitzah is invalid. But Rabbi Shimon and Rabbi Yochanan the Sandal-maker deem it valid. And there was an incident with one who performed halitzah between him and her in the house of the prisoners, and the matter came before Rabbi Akiva and he deemed it valid.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף בַּר מִנְיוֹמֵי [אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן]: אֵין הֲלָכָה כְּאוֹתוֹ הַזּוּג. וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: כּוּלְּהוּ נָמֵי יְחִידָאָה קָתָנֵי לְהוּ. דְּתַנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי: אֲנִי רָאִיתִי אֶת רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בֶּן אֱלִישָׁע שֶׁחָלַץ בְּמוּק, בִּיחִידִי, וּבַלַּיְלָה.
human_translation: And Rav Yosef bar Minyumi said Rav Naḥman said: The halakha does not follow that pair, And if you wish, say all of these are taught by an individual As it is taught Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei, said: I saw that Rabbi Yishmael ben Elisha a ḥalitza using a slipper, in private, and at night.
llm_translation: And Rav Yosef bar Minyomei said Rav Nachman: The halakha is not like that pair. And if you wish, say: All of them agree to the same individual. As it was taught: Rabbi Yishmael son of Rabbi Yosei said: I saw Rabbi Yishmael ben Elisha removing a splinter on Shabbat, alone, and at night.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׂמֹאל חֲלִיצָתָהּ כּוּ׳. מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבָּנַן? אָמַר עוּלָּא: יָלְפִינַן ״רֶגֶל״ ״רֶגֶל״ מִמְּצוֹרָע. מָה לְהַלָּן דְּיָמִין, אַף כָּאן דְּיָמִין.
human_translation: using left foot, her ḥalitza What is the reason of the Rabbis’ Ulla said: We derive “foot” “foot” stated regarding the leper. Just as there, it is the right so too here, it is the right
llm_translation: On her left is her divorce document. What is the reason of the Rabbis? Ulla said: We derive "foot" "foot" from the leper. Just as there, it is the right foot, so too here, it is the right foot.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר לָא יָלֵיף ״רֶגֶל״ ״רֶגֶל״ מִמְּצוֹרָע? וְהָתַנְיָא, רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: מִנַּיִן לִרְצִיעָה שֶׁהִיא בְּאֹזֶן הַיְמָנִית? נֶאֱמַר כָּאן ״אֹזֶן״, וְנֶאֱמַר לְהַלָּן ״אֹזֶן״. מָה לְהַלָּן יָמִין, אַף כָּאן יָמִין!
human_translation: And Rabbi Elazar does not derive “foot” “foot” from the leper. But isn’t it taught Rabbi Elazar says: From where that piercing is done on the right ear? “Ear” is stated here and “ear” is stated there Just as there, it is the right so too here, it is the right
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar does not derive "foot" "foot" from a leper? And it was taught, Rabbi Elazar says: From where do we derive the tearing that is in the right ear? It is stated here "ear," and it is stated there "ear." Just as there it is the right, so too here it is the right!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יִצְחָק בַּר יוֹסֵף אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מוּחְלֶפֶת הַשִּׁיטָה.
human_translation: Rav Yitzḥak bar Yosef said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: The the opinions is reversed,
llm_translation: Said Rav Yitzchak son of Yosef said Rabbi Yochanan: Muḥeletet haShitta.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: לְעוֹלָם לָא תֵּיפוֹךְ, ״אֹזֶן״ ״אֹזֶן״ מוּפְנֵי, ״רֶגֶל״ ״רֶגֶל״ לָא מוּפְנֵי.
human_translation: Rava said: Actually, do not reverse “ear” “ear” are free “foot” “foot” are not free,
llm_translation: Rava said: Always do not turn, "ear" "ear" facing, "foot" "foot" not facing.

hebrew_text: וְכִי לָא מוּפְנֵי, מַאי פִּירְכָא אִיכָּא? אִיכָּא לְמִיפְרַךְ: מָה לִמְצוֹרָע, שֶׁכֵּן טָעוּן עֵץ אֶרֶז וְאֵזוֹב וּשְׁנִי תוֹלָעַת.
human_translation: And even if they are not free what refutation is there? can be refuted, as the leper he requires cedarwood, hyssop, and scarlet thread.
llm_translation: And if not turned, what is the difficulty? There is a difficulty to refute: Just as for the leper, so too is required cedarwood, hyssop, and crimson wool.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ חָלְצָה וְרָקְקָה, אֲבָל לֹא קָרְאָה — חֲלִיצָתָהּ כְּשֵׁרָה. קָרְאָה וְרָקְקָה, אֲבָל לֹא חָלְצָה — חֲלִיצָתָהּ פְּסוּלָה. חָלְצָה וְקָרְאָה, אֲבָל לֹא רָקְקָה — רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: חֲלִיצָתָהּ פְּסוּלָה, רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: חֲלִיצָתָהּ כְּשֵׁרָה.
human_translation: removed and spat but did not recite her ḥalitza is valid. she recited and spat but did not remove her ḥalitza is disqualified. she removed and recited but did not spit, Rabbi Elazar says: Her ḥalitza is disqualified, Rabbi Akiva says: Her ḥalitza is valid.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If she untied and spat, but did not read the bill of divorce — her untying is valid. If she read and spat, but did not untie — her untying is invalid. If she untied and read, but did not spit — Rabbi Eliezer says: her untying is invalid, Rabbi Akiva says: her untying is valid.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: ״כָּכָה יֵעָשֶׂה״ — כׇּל דָּבָר שֶׁהוּא מַעֲשֶׂה מְעַכֵּב. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: מִשָּׁם רְאָיָה? ״כָּכָה יֵעָשֶׂה לָאִישׁ״ — כׇּל דָּבָר שֶׁהוּא מַעֲשֶׂה בָּאִישׁ.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar said to him: “So shall it be done any term that constitutes an action is indispensable. Rabbi Akiva said to him: proof from there? “So shall it be done to the man” a term constituting an action toward the man,
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Eliezer: "So shall he do" - anything that involves action delays. Rabbi Akiva said to him: From there is it derived? "So shall he do to the man" - anything that involves action with a man.

hebrew_text: הַחֵרֵשׁ שֶׁנֶּחְלַץ, וְהַחֵרֶשֶׁת שֶׁחָלְצָה, וְחוֹלֶצֶת לְקָטָן — חֲלִיצָתָהּ פְּסוּלָה. קְטַנָּה שֶׁחָלְצָה — תַּחְלוֹץ מִשֶּׁתַּגְדִּיל, וְאִם לֹא חָלְצָה — חֲלִיצָתָהּ פְּסוּלָה. חָלְצָה בִּשְׁנַיִם אוֹ בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה, וְנִמְצָא אֶחָד מֵהֶן קָרוֹב אוֹ פָּסוּל — חֲלִיצָתָהּ פְּסוּלָה. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן הַסַּנְדְּלָר מַכְשִׁירִין. וּמַעֲשֶׂה בְּאֶחָד שֶׁחָלַץ בֵּינוֹ לְבֵינָהּ בְּבֵית הָאֲסוּרִים, וּבָא מַעֲשֶׂה לִפְנֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא וְהִכְשִׁיר.
human_translation: If a deaf-mute man underwent ḥalitza , or a deaf-mute woman performed ḥalitza , or if an woman performs ḥalitza with a male minor, her ḥalitza is invalid If a female minor performed ḥalitza , she must perform ḥalitza once she becomes an adult, and if she does not perform ḥalitza , her ḥalitza is invalid. If she performed ḥalitza before two or three and one of them is found to be a relative or disqualified her ḥalitza is invalid. Rabbi Shimon and Rabbi Yoḥanan the Cobbler validate And an incident involving a certain who performed ḥalitza between him and her alone in prison, and the case came before Rabbi Akiva and he validated
llm_translation: The deaf person who removed his wife's shoe, and the deaf-mute woman who removed her husband's shoe, and a minor who removed the shoe - her removal is invalid. If a minor removed the shoe - she must wait until she grows up, and if she did not remove the shoe - her removal is invalid. If she removed the shoe with two or three others, and it is found that one of them is a relative or disqualified - her removal is invalid. Rabbi Shimon and Rabbi Yochanan the Sandal-maker permit it. And there was an incident with someone who removed the shoe between him and her in the prison, and the matter came before Rabbi Akiva and he permitted it.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רָבָא: הַשְׁתָּא דְּאָמְרַתְּ קְרִיאָה לָא מְיעַכְּבָא, לְפִיכָךְ אִלֵּם וְאִלֶּמֶת שֶׁחָלְצוּ — חֲלִיצָתָן כְּשֵׁירָה.
human_translation: Rava said: Now that you have said recitation is not indispensable therefore a mute man or a mute woman performed ḥalitza , their ḥalitza is valid.
llm_translation: Gemara said Rava: The year that you said reading does not delay, therefore mute and deaf who divorced - their divorce is valid.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: חֵרֵשׁ שֶׁנֶּחְלַץ, וְהַחֵרֶשֶׁת שֶׁחָלְצָה, וְהַחוֹלֶצֶת מִן הַקָּטָן — חֲלִיצָתָהּ פְּסוּלָה. מַאי טַעְמָא — לָאו מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא בְּנֵי קְרִיָּיה נִינְהוּ! לָא, מִשּׁוּם דְּלָאו בְּנֵי דֵעָה נִינְהוּ.
human_translation: we learned If a deaf-mute man underwent ḥalitza , or a deaf-mute woman performed ḥalitza , or if a woman performs ḥalitza with a male minor, her ḥalitza is invalid. What is the reason Is it not because they are not competent to recite No, because they are not to have intellectual capacity,
llm_translation: We learned in the Mishnah: A deaf person who was removed from a forbidden marriage, and a deaf-mute woman who was removed, and a minor who was removed — her removal is invalid. What is the reason? Not because they are not considered capable of understanding! No, it is because they are not considered capable of knowledge.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, אִלֵּם וְאִלֶּמֶת נָמֵי! אָמַר רָבָא: אִלֵּם וְאִלֶּמֶת בְּנֵי דֵעָה נִינְהוּ, וּפוּמַּיְיהוּ הוּא דְּכָאֵיב לְהוּ.
human_translation: If that is so, also a mute man and woman Rava said: A mute man and woman do have intellectual capacity. it is their mouth that hurts them.
llm_translation: Thus, "Silent and dumb they are!" Rava said: "Silent and dumb are the sons of knowledge, and their mouths are the ones that cause pain to them."

hebrew_text: וְהָא אָמְרִי דְּבֵי רַבִּי יַנַּאי: לְפִי שֶׁאֵינוֹ בְּ״אָמַר״ ״וְאָמְרָה״! אֶלָּא, כִּי אִתְּמַר דְּרָבָא אַסֵּיפָא אִתְּמַר: חֵרֵשׁ שֶׁנֶּחְלַץ, וְהַחֵרֶשֶׁת שֶׁחָלְצָה, וְהַחוֹלֶצֶת מִן הַקָּטָן — חֲלִיצָתָהּ פְּסוּלָה.
human_translation: But didn’t house of Rabbi Yannai say because they cannot of “he says” and “she shall say” Rather, when that of Rava was said, it was stated the latter clause If a deaf-mute man underwent ḥalitza , or a deaf-mute woman performed ḥalitza , or if a woman performs ḥalitza on a male minor, her ḥalitza is invalid.
llm_translation: The House of Rabbi Yannai said: Because it is not stated "he said" or "she said"! Rather, when it was stated by Rava in the latter part: A deaf person who removed his wife's shoe, and a deaf-mute woman who removed her own shoe, and a minor who removed her own shoe — her removal is invalid.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: הַשְׁתָּא דְּאָמְרַתְּ קְרִיָּיה מְעַכְּבָא, לְפִיכָךְ אִלֵּם וְאִלֶּמֶת שֶׁחָלְצוּ — חֲלִיצָתָן פְּסוּלָה. וּמַתְנִיתִין כְּרַבִּי זֵירָא.
human_translation: Rava said: You have now said recitation is indispensable, Therefore, if a mute man or woman performed ḥalitza , their ḥalitza is invalid. the mishna, in accordance with Rabbi Zeira
llm_translation: Rava said: "This year, when you said that reading the Megillah is a hindrance, therefore, a mute man and a mute woman who read the Megillah - their reading is invalid." And the Mishnah is in accordance with Rabbi Zeira.

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: כׇּל הָרָאוּי לְבִילָּה — אֵין בִּילָּה מְעַכֶּבֶת בּוֹ. וְכֹל שֶׁאֵין רָאוּי לְבִילָּה — בִּילָּה מְעַכֶּבֶת.
human_translation: which Rabbi Zeira said: Whatever is fitting to be mixed, mixing is not indispensable to it, And whatever is not fit to be mixed, mixing is indispensable for it
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rabbi Zeira said: Anything fit for immersion - immersion does not impede it. And anything not fit for immersion - immersion impedes it.

hebrew_text: שְׁלַחוּ לֵיהּ לַאֲבוּהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל: יְבָמָה שֶׁרָקְקָה — תַּחְלוֹץ. מִכְּלָל דְּאִיפַּסְלָא לַהּ מֵאַחִין.
human_translation: They sent to the father of Shmuel: a yevama has spat she must perform ḥalitza By inference, that she is disqualified from the brothers,
llm_translation: Send it to his father-in-law of Shmuel: A yevamah who was only shaken - she shall perform chalitzah. From the inference that she is disqualified from brothers.

hebrew_text: מַנִּי? אִילֵימָא רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, הַשְׁתָּא וּמָה בִּמְקוֹם מִצְוָה, דְּאִיכָּא לְמֵימַר מִידֵּי דְּהָוֵה אַאֵימוּרִים, דְּכִי לֵיתַנְהוּ — לָא מְעַכְּבִי,
human_translation: whose is If we say it is Rabbi Akiva, Now if where there is a mitzva and one might say as it is with the portions that when they are not not indispensable
llm_translation: Who is the authority? Perhaps Rabbi Akiva. Now, what about in a place of commandment, where there is something to say from the hands of those who are trustworthy, for if they do not say it, it does not delay.

hebrew_text: וְכִי אִיתַנְהוּ — מְעַכְּבִי,
human_translation: But when are present indispensable,
llm_translation: And when they are present - they delay.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא לָא מְעַכְּבָא, מֵאַחִין אִיפַּסְלָא?
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva said not indispensable disqualify her from the brothers?
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva said: "It does not delay, from where do we derive this?"

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא לְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר —
human_translation: But rather, in accordance with Rabbi Elazar,
llm_translation: And rather it is attributed to Rabbi Elazar—

hebrew_text: וְהָא שְׁנֵי דְּבָרִים הַמַּתִּירִין נִינְהוּ, וּשְׁנֵי דְּבָרִים הַמַּתִּירִין — אֵין מַעֲלִין זֶה בְּלֹא זֶה.
human_translation: But are two permitting factors And there are two permitting factors one cannot elevate one without the other.
llm_translation: And this, two things that permit are they, and two things that permit are they - one does not ascend this without this.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא כְּרַבִּי. דְּתַנְיָא: כִּבְשֵׂי עֲצֶרֶת — אֵין מְקַדְּשִׁין הַלֶּחֶם אֶלָּא בִּשְׁחִיטָה.
human_translation: Rather, in accordance with Rabbi as it is taught The lambs of Assembly, consecrate the loaves only by slaughter,
llm_translation: Rather like Rabbi. For it was taught: "The lambs of the festival - one may only sanctify the bread through slaughter."

hebrew_text: כֵּיצַד? שְׁחָטָן לִשְׁמָן, וְזָרַק דָּמָן לִשְׁמָן — קָדַשׁ הַלֶּחֶם. שָׁחַט שֶׁלֹּא לִשְׁמָן, וְזָרַק לִשְׁמָן — לֹא קָדַשׁ הַלֶּחֶם. שְׁחָטָן לִשְׁמָן, וְזָרַק דָּמָן שֶׁלֹּא לִשְׁמָן — קָדוֹשׁ וְאֵינוֹ קָדוֹשׁ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי.
human_translation: How so? one slaughtered for their own sake, and sprinkled their blood for their own sake, the loaves are consecrated. one slaughtered not for their own sake, and sprinkled their blood for their own sake, the loaves are not consecrated, one slaughtered them for their own sake, and he sprinkled their blood not for their own sake, are consecrated but they are not consecrated This is the statement of Rabbi
llm_translation: How so? If one slaughters for its fat, and throws its blood for its fat - the bread is sanctified. If one slaughters not for its fat, and throws for its fat - the bread is not sanctified. If one slaughters for its fat, and throws its blood not for its fat - it is both sanctified and not sanctified, the words of Rabbi.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: לְעוֹלָם אֵינוֹ קָדוֹשׁ עַד שֶׁיִּשְׁחוֹט לִשְׁמָן וְיִזְרוֹק דָּמָן לִשְׁמָן.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, says: Actually, are consecrated only when one slaughters for their own sake and sprinkles their blood for their own sake,
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, says: Always not holy until he slaughters for their fat and throws their blood for their fat.

hebrew_text: וּמִי אָמַר רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא רְקִיקָה לָא פָּסְלָה? וְהָתַנְיָא: חָלְצָה וְלֹא
human_translation: But did Rabbi Akiva say that spitting does not disqualify But isn’t it taught If she removed but did not
llm_translation: And who said Rabbi Akiva that a thin pancake does not disqualify? And it was taught: If it peeled off but did not...

hebrew_text: רָקְקָה וְלֹא קָרְאָה — חֲלִיצָתָהּ כְּשֵׁירָה, רָקְקָה וְלֹא חָלְצָה וְלֹא קָרְאָה — חֲלִיצָתָהּ פְּסוּלָה. קָרְאָה וְלֹא רָקְקָה וְלֹא חָלְצָה — אֵין כָּאן בֵּית מֵיחוֹשׁ.
human_translation: spit and did not recite her ḥalitza is valid. If she spat but did not remove and did not recite her ḥalitza is disqualified. If she recited but did not spit or did not remove there is no doubt
llm_translation: Spit and did not declare - her halitzah is valid, spit and did not remove her shoe and did not declare - her halitzah is invalid. Declared and did not spit and did not remove her shoe - there is no house of suspicion here.

hebrew_text: מַנִּי? אִילֵימָא רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: חָלְצָה וְלֹא רָקְקָה וְלֹא קָרְאָה חֲלִיצָתָהּ כְּשֵׁירָה? וְהָא אָמַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: ״כָּכָה יֵעָשֶׂה״, דָּבָר שֶׁהוּא מַעֲשֵׂה מְעַכֵּב! אֶלָּא פְּשִׁיטָא רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, וְקָתָנֵי: רָקְקָה וְלֹא חָלְצָה וְלֹא קָרְאָה — חֲלִיצָתָהּ פְּסוּלָה. לְמַאן?
human_translation: Who is If we say Rabbi Eliezer, if she removed but did not spit or did not recite her ḥalitza is valid, But didn’t Rabbi Eliezer say: “so shall it be done” element that an action is indispensable; Rather, is obvious Rabbi Akiva, and he teaches if she spat but did not remove or did not recite her ḥalitza is disqualified. To whom
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Who is the Tanna? If you wish, say it is Rabbi Eliezer: If she removed the shoe but did not spit and did not call the act of removal "halitzah," is her halitzah valid? But didn't Rabbi Eliezer say, "This is how it should be done," a matter that delays the act? Rather, it is obvious that it is referring to Rabbi Akiva, and it is taught: If she spat but did not remove the shoe and did not call the act of spitting — her halitzah is invalid. According to whom?

hebrew_text: אִילֵימָא לְעָלְמָא, פְּשִׁיטָא! מִי הָוְיָא חֲלִיצָה דְּאִישְׁתַּרְיָא לְעָלְמָא? אֶלָּא לָאו לָאַחִין, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: If we say to everyone is obvious did any ḥalitza take place for her to be permitted to a stranger? Rather, is it not to the brothers? Learn from here
llm_translation: If you want to say "in general," it is obvious! Who would have thought that a garment found in the world is for the purpose of brothers? Rather, it is not for brothers, learn from it.

hebrew_text: וּלְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, מַאי שְׁנָא רְקִיקָה וּמַאי שְׁנָא קְרִיָּיה?
human_translation: But according to Rabbi Akiva’s what is different spitting and what is different recitation?
llm_translation: And for Rabbi Akiva, what is the difference between "rekikah" and "kriyah"?

hebrew_text: קְרִיָּיה, דְּאִיתַהּ בֵּין בַּתְּחִלָּה בֵּין בַּסּוֹף — לָא מִיחַלְּפָא לֵיהּ. רְקִיקָה, דְּבִתְחִלָּה לֵיתַהּ וְלִבְסוֹף אִיתַהּ — מִיחַלְּפָא לֵיהּ, וְאָתוּ לְמִישְׁרֵי חֲלוּצָה לָאַחִין.
human_translation: The recitation which takes place both at the beginning and at the end, will not cause him to be confused spitting, which not take place at the beginning but takes place at the end, he confuse they will come to permit a yevama who performed ḥalitza to the brothers
llm_translation: The reading, that it is present both at the beginning and at the end - it does not change. The thin pancake, that at the beginning it is not there and at the end it is there - it changes, and they do not come to the straightness of the obligation of brothers.

hebrew_text: וְאִיכָּא דְאָמְרִי, הָכִי שְׁלַחוּ לֵיהּ: יְבָמָהּ שֶׁרָקְקָה — תַּחְלוֹץ, וְאֵינָהּ צְרִיכָה לָרוֹק פַּעַם אַחֶרֶת. כִּי הַהִיא דַּאֲתַאי לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי אַמֵּי, הֲוָה יָתֵיב רַבִּי אַבָּא בַּר מֶמֶל קַמֵּיהּ. רְקַקָה מִקַּמֵּי דְּתַחְלוֹץ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי אַמֵּי: חֲלוֹץ לַהּ, וּשְׁרֵי לַהּ תִּיגְרָא.
human_translation: And there are who say this is what they sent to A yevama who spat shall remove and she is not required to spit another time. This is like where a certain woman came before Rabbi Ami and Rabbi Abba bar Memel sat before him She spat before she removed Rabbi Ami said to him: her to remove so dismiss her case
llm_translation: There are those who say, thus they sent to him: If his yevamah spat - she should perform chalitzah, and she does not need to spit again. For that one who came before Rabbi Ammi, Rabbi Abba bar Memel was sitting before him. She spat in front of chalitzah. Rabbi Ammi said to him: Perform chalitzah for her, and release her from the bond.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי אַבָּא: וְהָא בָּעֵינַן מֵירַק! הָא רְקַקָה לַהּ. וְתֵירוֹק, וּמָה בְּכָךְ? נָפֵיק מִינֵּיהּ חוּרְבָּא, דְּאִי אָמְרַתְּ תִּיהְדַּר וְתֵירוֹק, אָמְרִי: רְקִיקָה קַמַּיְיתָא לֵית בַּהּ מְשָׁשָׁא, וְאָתֵי לְמִישְׁרֵי חֲלוּצָה לָאַחִין.
human_translation: Rabbi Abba said to him: But we need her to spit. She spat. so let her spit again, and what with that? A disaster brought out from it, as, if you say she should spit again say: The first spitting has no significance and they will come to permit ḥalutza , to the brothers,
llm_translation: He said to him, Rabbi Abba: But we need saliva! This is saliva for it. And spit, and what of that? A sword comes out of it, for if you say "spit and saliva," they will say: Spit is not found in it, and it comes to straighten out the brothers.

hebrew_text: וְהָא בָּעֵינַן כְּסִדְרָן! כְּסִדְרָן לָא מְעַכְּבָא. הוּא סָבַר: דַּחוֹיֵי קָא מְדַחֵי לֵיהּ. נְפַק, דָּק וְאַשְׁכַּח, דְּתַנְיָא: בֵּין שֶׁהִקְדִּים חֲלִיצָה לִרְקִיקָה, בֵּין שֶׁהִקְדִּים רְקִיקָה לַחֲלִיצָה — מַה שֶּׁעָשָׂה עָשׂוּי.
human_translation: But we require the proper order, Their proper order is not indispensable. thought: He is pushing off he went out examined and discovered As it is taught Whether the removal preceded the spitting, or whether the spitting preceded the removal what he did is done,
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "And this, we require according to their order! According to their order does not delay. He holds: the rejected one is rejecting him. He went out, checked, and found, as it was taught: Whether one designated the redemption before the cake, or whether one designated the cake before the redemption - whatever he did is valid."

hebrew_text: לֵוִי נְפַק לְקִרְיָיתָא. בְּעוֹ מִינֵּהּ: גִּידֶּמֶת, מַהוּ שֶׁתַּחְלוֹץ? יְבָמָה שֶׁרָקְקָה דָּם, מַהוּ? ״אֲבָל אַגִּיד לְךָ אֶת הָרָשׁוּם בִּכְתָב אֱמֶת״ — מִכְּלָל דְּאִיכָּא כְּתָב שֶׁאֵינוֹ אֱמֶת?
human_translation: Levi went out to the villages They asked him what is an armless woman, may she perform ḥalitza what is a yevama spat blood “But I will declare to you that which is inscribed in the writing of truth” by inference, there is writing that is not truth.
llm_translation: Levi went out to the town of Kiryat. They asked him: What is the law regarding the sinew? If a yevamah spat blood, what is the ruling? "But I will tell you the written truth," — from which it is inferred that there is a written document that is not true?

hebrew_text: לָא הֲוָה בִּידֵיהּ. אֲתָא שַׁאֵיל בֵּי מִדְרְשָׁא, אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: מִי כְּתִיב ״וְחָלְצָה בַּיָּד״? וּמִי כְּתִיב ״וְיָרְקָה רוֹק״?
human_translation: He did not have at hand he came and asked the house of study. They said to him Does it say And she shall remove by hand? And does it say And she shall spit saliva?
llm_translation: He did not have it in his possession. He came and asked the scholars' house, they said to him: Who is it written "and she shall deliver in the hand"? And who is it written "and she spat in his face"?

hebrew_text: ״אֲבָל אַגִּיד לָךְ הָרָשׁוּם בִּכְתָב אֱמֶת״, וְכִי יֵשׁ כְּתָב שֶׁאֵינוֹ אֱמֶת?
human_translation: “But I will declare to you that which is inscribed in the writing of truth,” But is there writing that is not truth?
llm_translation: "But I will tell you, the written word is true," is there a writing that is not true?

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן בִּגְזַר דִּין שֶׁיֵּשׁ עִמּוֹ שְׁבוּעָה. כָּאן בִּגְזַר דִּין שֶׁאֵין עִמּוֹ שְׁבוּעָה.
human_translation: not difficult. Here, a sentence of judgment accompanied by an oath; There, a sentence of judgment that is not accompanied by an oath,
llm_translation: Not difficult: here in a decree of law that has an accompanying oath. Here in a decree of law that does not have an accompanying oath.

hebrew_text: כִּדְרַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר אַמֵּי. דְּאָמַר רַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר אַמֵּי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן: מִנַּיִן לִגְזַר דִּין שֶׁיֵּשׁ עִמּוֹ שְׁבוּעָה שֶׁאֵינוֹ מִתְקָרֵעַ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לָכֵן נִשְׁבַּעְתִּי לְבֵית עֵלִי אִם יִתְכַּפֵּר עֲוֹן בֵּית עֵלִי בְּזֶבַח וּבְמִנְחָה עַד עוֹלָם״.
human_translation: in accordance with the words of Rav Shmuel bar Ami, as Rav Shmuel bar Ami said Rabbi Yonatan said: From where that a sentence of judgment accompanied by an oath cannot be torn up? as it is stated: “Therefore I have sworn unto the house of Eli, that the iniquity of Eli’s house shall not be atoned for with sacrifice nor offering forever”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Like Rav Shmuel bar Ammi. For Rav Shmuel bar Ammi said in the name of Rabbi Yonatan: From where do we derive the decree of a judgment that has an accompanying oath that is not invalidated, as it is stated: "Therefore I have sworn to the house of Eli that the iniquity of the house of Eli shall not be atoned for by sacrifice or offering forever."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה: בְּזֶבַח וּבְמִנְחָה אֵינוֹ מִתְכַּפֵּר, אֲבָל מִתְכַּפֵּר הוּא בְּדִבְרֵי תוֹרָה. אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: בְּזֶבַח וּבְמִנְחָה אֵינוֹ מִתְכַּפֵּר, אֲבָל מִתְכַּפֵּר בִּגְמִילוּת חֲסָדִים. רַבָּה וְאַבָּיֵי מִדְּבֵית עֵלִי קָאָתוּ, רַבָּה דַּעֲסַק בַּתּוֹרָה — חֲיָה אַרְבְּעִין שְׁנִין, אַבָּיֵי דַּעֲסַק בְּתוֹרָה וּבִגְמִילוּת חֲסָדִים — חֲיָה שִׁיתִּין שְׁנִין.
human_translation: Rabba said With sacrifice and offering, will not be atoned for, but he may gain atonement through words of Torah Abaye said: Through sacrifice and offering he may not achieve atonement, but he may gain atonement through acts of kindness. Rabba and Abaye descended from the house of Eli. Rabba, who immersed himself in Torah lived forty years, while Abaye, who immersed himself in Torah and acts of kindness, lived sixty years.
llm_translation: Rabba said: In sacrifice and offering, atonement is not achieved, but atonement is achieved through the words of Torah. Abbaye said: In sacrifice and offering, atonement is not achieved, but atonement is achieved through acts of loving-kindness. Rabba and Abbaye both studied in the house of Eli, Rabba, who engaged in Torah study, lived forty years, while Abbaye, who engaged in Torah study and acts of loving-kindness, lived sixty-two years.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מִשְׁפָּחָה אַחַת הָיְתָה בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם שֶׁהָיוּ מֵתִים כְּבֶן שְׁמֹנֶה עֶשְׂרֵה שָׁנָה. בָּאוּ וְהוֹדִיעוּ אֶת רַבָּן יוֹחָנָן בֶּן זַכַּאי. אָמַר לָהֶם: שֶׁמָּא מִמִּשְׁפַּחַת עֵלִי אַתֶּם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְכׇל מַרְבִּית בֵּיתְךָ יָמוּתוּ אֲנָשִׁים״ — לְכוּ וְעִסְקוּ בַּתּוֹרָה וְתִחְיוּ. הָלְכוּ וְעָסְקוּ בַּתּוֹרָה וְחָיוּ, וְהָיוּ קוֹרִין אוֹתָן ״מִשְׁפַּחַת יוֹחָנָן״ עַל שְׁמוֹ.
human_translation: The Sages taught: There was a certain family in Jerusalem whose children were dying at around age eighteen. came and told Rabban Yoḥanan ben Zakkai He said to them: Perhaps you are from the house of Eli, as it is stated: “All the increase of your house shall die young men” go out and immerse yourselves in Torah, and live. They went and immersed themselves in Torah and lived and would call them: The family of Yoḥanan, after his name,
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: There was one family in Jerusalem where they were dying at the age of eighteen years. They came and informed Rabban Yochanan ben Zakkai. He said to them: Perhaps you are from the family of Eli, as it is stated: "And all the increase of your house shall die as men" (1 Samuel 2:32) — Go and engage in Torah study and you will live. They went and engaged in Torah study and they lived, and they were called "the family of Yochanan" after his name.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר אוּנְיָא אָמַר רַב: מִנַּיִן לִגְזַר דִּין שֶׁל צִבּוּר שֶׁאֵינוֹ נֶחְתָּם? אֵינוֹ נֶחְתָּם?! וְהָא כְּתִיב: ״כִּי אִם תְּכַבְּסִי בַּנֶּתֶר וְתַרְבִּי לָךְ בּוֹרִית נִכְתָּם עֲוֹנֵךְ לְפָנַי״!
human_translation: Rav Shmuel bar Unya said Rav said: From where that a sentence of judgment upon a community is never sealed? Is it not sealed? But isn’t it written: “For although you wash yourself with niter, and take much soap for yourself, yet your iniquity is marked before Me”
llm_translation: Said Rav Shmuel bar Unya said Rav: From where do we derive the decree of the community that is not sealed? Not sealed?! But isn't it written: "Though you wash yourself with lye and use much soap, the stain of your guilt is still before Me" (Jeremiah 2:22)!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: מִנַּיִן שֶׁאֲפִילּוּ נֶחְתַּם מִתְקָרֵעַ — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״מִי כַּה׳ אֱלֹהֵינוּ בְּכׇל קׇרְאֵנוּ אֵלָיו״, וְהָכְתִיב: ״דִּרְשׁוּ ה׳ בְּהִמָּצְאוֹ״! לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא בְּיָחִיד, הָא בְּצִיבּוּר.
human_translation: Rather, From where even when is sealed, it may be torn up as it is stated: “For what as the Lord our God is whenever we call upon Him?” But isn’t it written “Seek the Lord while He may be found, ” not difficult. This is concerning an individual That is concerning a community,
llm_translation: Rather: From where do we derive that even if the signature is torn, it is valid? As it is stated: "Who is like the Lord our God whenever we call to Him" (Deuteronomy 4:7), and it is written: "Seek the Lord when He can be found" (Isaiah 55:6)! This is not difficult: this is in the case of an individual, and this is in the case of a community.

hebrew_text: יָחִיד אֵימַת? אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ: אֵלּוּ עֲשָׂרָה יָמִים שֶׁבֵּין רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה לְיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים.
human_translation: when Rav Naḥman said Rabba bar Avuh said: These are the ten days that are between Rosh HaShana and Yom Kippur.
llm_translation: Individual, when? Said Rav Nachman said Rabba bar Avuh: These are ten days between Rosh Hashanah and Yom Kippur.

hebrew_text: שְׁלַחוּ לֵיהּ לַאֲבוּהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל: יְבָמָה שֶׁרָקְקָה דָּם — תַּחְלוֹץ, לְפִי שֶׁאִי אֶפְשָׁר לַדָּם בְּלֹא צִחְצוּחַ רוֹק.
human_translation: sent this to Shmuel’s father: A yevama who spat blood shall remove because it is not possible blood without any trace of saliva,
llm_translation: Send it to his father-in-law, whose name is Shmuel: A yevamah whose blood has clotted - she shall perform chalitzah, because it is impossible for the blood to come out without spitting.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: יָכוֹל יְהֵא דָּם הַיּוֹצֵא מִפִּיו וּמִפִּי הָאַמָּה טָמֵא — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״זוֹבוֹ טָמֵא״, וְאֵין דָּם הַיּוֹצֵא מִפִּיו וּמִפִּי הָאַמָּה טָמֵא, אֶלָּא טָהוֹר.
human_translation: raises an objection might that blood that issues from his mouth or from the opening of his genital organ should be ritually impure, the verse states: “His discharge is impure” but blood that issues from his mouth or from his genital organ is not impure, but it is pure.
llm_translation: Challenger: Can it be that the blood that comes out of his mouth and from the mouth of the animal is impure? - The Talmud teaches: "His discharge is impure," and the blood that comes out of his mouth and from the mouth of the animal is not impure, but rather pure.

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן בְּמוֹצֶצֶת, כָּאן בְּשׁוֹתֵת.
human_translation: not difficult. Here, to a woman who sucks There, it is referring to flowing
llm_translation: Not difficult: here in a nipple, here in a teat.

hebrew_text: חֵרֵשׁ שֶׁנֶּחְלַץ וְכוּ׳.
human_translation: if a deaf-mute man underwent ḥalitza
llm_translation: Deaf person who was removed, and so forth.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: זוֹ דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר, אֲבָל חֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֵין חֲלִיצַת קָטָן כְּלוּם.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Rav said: This the statement of Rabbi Meir, But the Rabbis say: The ḥalitza of a male minor isn’t anything,
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: This is the statement of Rabbi Meir, but the Sages say: The redemption of a minor is nothing.

hebrew_text: קְטַנָּה שֶׁחָלְצָה וְכוּ׳. אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: זוֹ דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר, דְּאָמַר: ״אִישׁ״ כָּתוּב בַּפָּרָשָׁה, וּמַקְּשִׁינַן אִשָּׁה לְאִישׁ.
human_translation: If a female minor performed ḥalitza , Rav Yehuda said Rav said: This is the statement of Rabbi Meir, who said: “Man” is written in the portion and we juxtapose a woman with a man,
llm_translation: A minor girl who was taken captive, etc. Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: This is the statement of Rabbi Meir, who said: "Man" is written in the verse, and we connect a woman to a man.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל חֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: ״אִישׁ״ כְּתִיב בַּפָּרָשָׁה. אִשָּׁה — בֵּין גְּדוֹלָה בֵּין קְטַנָּה.
human_translation: But the Rabbis say: “Man” is written in this portion, woman she may be either an adult or a female minor.
llm_translation: The sages, however, say: "Man" is written in the passage. "Woman" — whether an adult or a minor.

hebrew_text: מַאן חֲכָמִים? רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הִיא. דְּרַבִּי חִיָּיא וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בַּר רַבִּי הֲווֹ יָתְבִי. פְּתַח חַד מִינַּיְיהוּ וַאֲמַר: הַמִּתְפַּלֵּל, צָרִיךְ שֶׁיִּתֵּן עֵינָיו לְמַטָּה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְהָיוּ עֵינַי וְלִבִּי שָׁם כׇּל הַיָּמִים״.
human_translation: Who are these Rabbis It is Rabbi Yosei, As, Rabbi Ḥiyya and Rabbi Shimon bar Rabbi were sitting One of them began and said: One who prays must direct his gaze downward as it is stated “And My eyes and My heart shall be there perpetually”
llm_translation: Who are the sages? Rabbi Yosei is. For Rabbi Chiya and Rabbi Shimon bar Rabbi were sitting. One of them began and said: "One who prays must direct his eyes downward, as it is stated: 'And my eyes and my heart shall be there all the days.'"

hebrew_text: וְחַד אָמַר: עֵינָיו לְמַעְלָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״נִשָּׂא לְבָבֵנוּ אֶל כַּפָּיִם״. אַדְּהָכִי אֲתָא רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי לְגַבַּיְיהוּ. אֲמַר לְהוּ: בְּמַאי עָסְקִיתוּ? אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: בִּתְפִלָּה. אֲמַר לְהוּ: כָּךְ אָמַר אַבָּא: הַמִּתְפַּלֵּל צָרִיךְ שֶׁיִּתֵּן עֵינָיו לְמַטָּה וְלִבּוֹ לְמַעְלָה, כְּדֵי שֶׁיִּתְקַיְּימוּ שְׁנֵי מִקְרָאוֹת הַלָּלוּ.
human_translation: And one of them said his eyes upward, because it is stated: “Let us lift our hearts with our hands In the meantime, Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei, came beside them. He said to them: What are you dealing with? They said With prayer, He said to them: My father, said as follows: One who prays must direct his eyes downward and his heart upward, in order to fulfill both of these verses.
llm_translation: And one said: His eyes upwards, as it is said: "Our heart is lifted up to our hands." Meanwhile, Rabbi Yishmael son of Rabbi Yosei came before them. He said to them: With what were you occupied? They said to him: With prayer. He said to them: Thus said Abba: One who prays should direct his eyes downwards and his heart upwards, so that these two verses may be fulfilled.

hebrew_text: אַדְּהָכִי, אֲתָא רַבִּי לִמְתִיבְתָּא. אִינְהוּ דַּהֲווֹ קַלִּילֵי, יְתִיבוּ בְּדוּכְתַּיְיהוּ. רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי, אַגַּב יוּקְרֵיהּ הֲוָה מְפַסַּע וְאָזֵיל.
human_translation: In the meantime, Rabbi came to the house of study Those who were light-footed sat in their places. Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei, due to his being very heavy, was stepping and walking
llm_translation: So, Rabbi came to the study hall. Those who were light, sat on their heels. Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei, due to his honor, would walk in and go out.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּדָן: מִי הוּא זֶה שֶׁמְּפַסֵּעַ עַל רָאשֵׁי עַם קָדוֹשׁ! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֲנִי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי שֶׁבָּאתִי לִלְמוֹד תּוֹרָה מֵרַבִּי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: וְכִי אַתָּה הָגוּן לִלְמוֹד תּוֹרָה מֵרַבִּי?
human_translation: Abdon, said to him: Who is that individual stepping over the heads of a sacred people, He said to him: I am Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei, who came to learn Torah from Rabbi said to him: But are you fit to learn Torah from Rabbi
llm_translation: He said to him, Abadan: Who is this one who tramples on the heads of the holy people! He said to him: I am Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei, who came to learn Torah from Rabbi. He said to him: Are you fit to learn Torah from Rabbi?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: וְכִי מֹשֶׁה הָיָה הָגוּן לִלְמוֹד תּוֹרָה מִפִּי הַגְּבוּרָה? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: וְכִי מֹשֶׁה אַתָּה? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: וְכִי רַבְּךָ אֱלֹהִים הוּא? אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: שַׁקְלֵיהּ רַבִּי לְמַטְרַפְסֵיהּ — דְּקָאָמַר לֵיהּ: ״רַבְּךָ״ וְלָא ״רַבִּי״.
human_translation: said to him: Was Moses fit to learn Torah from the mouth of the Almighty? said to him: And are you Moses? said to him: And is your teacher God? Rav Yosef said Rabbi received his retribution mittarpesei When he said your teacher, and not my teacher,
llm_translation: He said to him: Was Moses prepared to learn Torah from the mouth of the Almighty? He said to him: Are you Moses? He said to him: Are you God your teacher? Rav Yosef said: Rabbi took his cloak off him, for he was saying to him, "Your teacher" and not "my teacher."

hebrew_text: אַדְּהָכִי אַתְיָא יְבָמָה לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי לְאַבָּדָן: פּוֹק בִּדְקַהּ. לְבָתַר דִּנְפַק, אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל, כָּךְ אָמַר אַבָּא: ״אִישׁ״ כָּתוּב בַּפָּרָשָׁה, אֲבָל אִשָּׁה — בֵּין גְּדוֹלָה בֵּין קְטַנָּה.
human_translation: In the meantime, a yevama came before Rabbi, Rabbi said to Abdon: Go and check After left, Rabbi Yishmael said to : My father, said as follows: “Man” is written in the portion but woman may be either an adult woman or a female minor.
llm_translation: So now, a yevamah came before Rabbi. Rabbi said to her: "Go and be examined." After she went out, Rabbi Yishmael said to him: "This is what Abba said: 'Man' is written in the Torah portion, but 'woman'—whether she is an adult or a minor.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: תָּא, לָא צְרִיכַתְּ, כְּבָר הוֹרָה זָקֵן. קָמְפַסַּע אַבָּדָן וְאָתֵי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי: מִי שֶׁצָּרִיךְ לוֹ עַם קָדוֹשׁ, יְפַסֵּעַ עַל רָאשֵׁי עַם קָדוֹשׁ. מִי שֶׁאֵין צָרִיךְ לוֹ עַם קָדוֹשׁ, הֵיאַךְ יְפַסֵּעַ עַל רָאשֵׁי עַם קָדוֹשׁ?
human_translation: Rabbi said to : Come You do not need the Elder, has already ruled Abdon was stepping and coming Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei, said to him: One upon whom a holy people depends may step over the heads of a holy people. But one upon whom a holy people does not depend, how can he step over the heads of a holy people?
llm_translation: He said to him: Come, you do not need, for the elder has already taught. Kamtsa came and he. Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei, said to him: One who needs a holy nation, should tread upon the heads of a holy nation. One who does not need a holy nation, how can he tread upon the heads of a holy nation?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי לְאַבָּדָן: קוּם בְּדוּכְתִּיךְ! תָּאנָא: בְּאוֹתָהּ שָׁעָה נִצְטָרַע אַבָּדָן, וְטָבְעוּ שְׁנֵי בָנָיו, וּמֵאֲנוּ שְׁתֵּי כַלּוֹתָיו. אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: בְּרִיךְ רַחֲמָנָא דְּכַסְּפֵיהּ לְאַבָּדָן בְּהַאי עָלְמָא.
human_translation: Rabbi said to Abdon: Stand in your place It was taught: At that moment Abdon was afflicted with leprosy two of his sons drowned, and his two daughters-in-law, made declarations of refusal Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: Blessed is the Merciful One, Who shames Abdon in this world,
llm_translation: He said to them, Rabbi to Avadan: Arise in your place! It was taught: At that moment Avadan contracted tzara'at, his two sons drowned, and his two daughters-in-law refused to marry again. Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: Blessed is the Merciful One who took pity on Avadan in this world.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אַמֵּי: מִדְּבָרָיו שֶׁל בְּרַבִּי נִלְמוֹד: קְטַנָּה חוֹלֶצֶת בִּפְעוּטוּת. רָבָא אָמַר: עַד שֶׁתַּגִּיעַ לְעוֹנַת נְדָרִים. וְהִלְכְתָא: עַד שֶׁתָּבִיא שְׁתֵּי שְׂעָרוֹת.
human_translation: Rabbi Ami said: From the words of the great man, let us learn: A female minor performs ḥalitza as a young child, Rava said: until she reaches the age of vows And the halakha is: until she has two hairs.
llm_translation: Rabbi Ammi said: From the words of Rabbi we learn: A minor undresses with a thread. Rava said: Until the age of vows. And the law is: Until she brings two pubic hairs.

hebrew_text: חָלְצָה בִּשְׁנַיִם וְכוּ׳. אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף בַּר מִנְיוֹמֵי אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: אֵין הֲלָכָה כְּאוֹתוֹ הַזּוּג. וְהָא אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן חֲדָא זִימְנָא. דְּאָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף בַּר מִנְיוֹמֵי אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: חֲלִיצָה בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה!
human_translation: If she performed ḥalitza before two Rav Yosef bar Minyumi said Rav Naḥman said: The halakha does not follow this pair But didn’t Rav Naḥman say this one time As Rav Yosef bar Minyumi said Rav Naḥman said: Ḥalitza must be before three
llm_translation: She is divorced by two and so on. Rav Yosef bar Minyumei said in the name of Rav Nachman: The halakha is not like that pair. But didn't Rav Nachman say once, as Rav Yosef bar Minyumei said in the name of Rav Nachman: Divorce is by three!

hebrew_text: צְרִיכִי, דְּאִי אִיתְּמַר הָךְ קַמַּיְיתָא, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: הָנֵי מִילֵּי לְכַתְּחִילָּה, אֲבָל דִּיעֲבַד — אֲפִילּוּ תְּרֵי, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן: אֵין הֲלָכָה כְּאוֹתוֹ הַזּוּג. וְאִי אַשְׁמוֹעִינַן אֵין הֲלָכָה כְּאוֹתוֹ הַזּוּג, אֶלָּא כְּתַנָּא קַמָּא, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: דִּיעֲבַד, אֲבָל לְכַתְּחִילָּה לִיבְעֵי חֲמִשָּׁה, צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: are necessary, for if only the were stated, I would say: This applies ab initio , but after the fact even two he teaches us that the halakha does not follow this pair If he would have told us only that the halakha does not follow this pair, but rather the first tanna , I would say after the fact, but they must require five ab initio , it is necessary
llm_translation: I need, for if it were stated thus before me, I would say: these matters initially, but in retrospect — even two, it is evident to us: the law is not like that pair. And if we were to hear that the law is not like that pair, but like the first Tanna, I would say: in retrospect, but initially it requires five.

hebrew_text: מַעֲשֶׂה שֶׁחָלְצוּ כּוּ׳. בֵּינוֹ לְבֵינָהּ מִי יָדַעְנָא? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: וְעֵדִים רוֹאִין אוֹתוֹ מִבַּחוּץ.
human_translation: A story is told an incident once performed ḥalitza How can we know what happened between him and her? Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: And there were witnesses who saw them from outside
llm_translation: The incident of the "Chalitzah shoe." Between him and her, who knows? Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: "And the witnesses shall see him from outside."

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: מַעֲשֶׂה שֶׁחָלְצוּ בֵּינוֹ לְבֵינָהּ אַבָּרַאי, וּבָא מַעֲשֶׂה לִפְנֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא בְּבֵית הָאֲסוּרִין, אוֹ דִלְמָא: מַעֲשֶׂה שֶׁחָלְצוּ בֵּינוֹ לְבֵינָהּ בְּבֵית הָאֲסוּרִין? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: בְּבֵית הָאֲסוּרִין הָיָה מַעֲשֶׂה, וּלְבֵית הָאֲסוּרִין בָּא מַעֲשֶׂה.
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before Did the incident in which they performed ḥalitza between him and her take place outside and the case came before Rabbi Akiva in prison? Or, perhaps the incident when they performed ḥalitza between him and her took place in prison, Rav Yehuda said Rav said: The incident took place in prison, and the case came in prison.
llm_translation: He asked them: A case where he designated a sacrifice between him and his wife, and the matter came before Rabbi Akiva in the prison, or perhaps a case where he designated a sacrifice between him and his wife in the prison? Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: The matter was in the prison, and the matter came to the prison.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: חֲלִיצָה מוּטְעֵת — כְּשֵׁרָה. אֵי זוֹ הִיא חֲלִיצָה מוּטְעֵת? אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: כֹּל שֶׁאוֹמְרִים לוֹ: חֲלוֹץ, וּבְכָךְ אַתָּה כּוֹנְסָהּ.
human_translation: The Sages taught: A mistaken ḥalitza is valid. What constitutes a mistaken ḥalitza ? Reish Lakish said: Any in which they say Let her remove and in doing so you will take her in
llm_translation: The sages taught: A divorced woman who is pregnant - she is valid. What is a pregnant divorcee? Reish Lakish said: Anyone they tell to divorce, and in this way you gather her.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, אֲנִי שׁוֹנֶה: בֵּין שֶׁנִּתְכַּוֵּון הוּא וְלֹא נִתְכַּוְּונָה הִיא, בֵּין שֶׁנִּתְכַּוְּונָה הִיא וְלֹא נִתְכַּוֵּון הוּא — חֲלִיצָתָהּ פְּסוּלָה, עַד שֶׁיִּתְכַּוְּונוּ שְׁנֵיהֶם כְּאֶחָד. וְאַתְּ אָמְרַתְּ חֲלִיצָתָהּ כְּשֵׁירָה?!
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said to him: I teach that whether he had intended and she did not intend, or whether she had intended and he did not intend, the ḥalitza is invalid, unless they both intend together as one And you say her ḥalitza valid?
llm_translation: He said to him Rabbi Yochanan, I differ: whether he intended and she did not intend, or she intended and he did not intend - her halitzah is invalid, until both of them intend together. And you say her halitzah is valid?!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא כֹּל שֶׁאוֹמְרִים לוֹ: ״חֲלוֹץ לָהּ עַל מְנָת שֶׁתִּתֵּן לְךָ מָאתַיִם זוּז״. תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: חֲלִיצָה מוּטְעֵת — כְּשֵׁירָה. אֵי זוֹ הִיא חֲלִיצָה מוּטְעֵת — כֹּל שֶׁאוֹמְרִים: חֲלוֹץ לָהּ עַל מְנָת שֶׁתִּתֵּן לְךָ מָאתַיִם זוּז.
human_translation: Rather, any in which they say to him: Let her perform ḥalitza on you, on the condition that she will give you two hundred dinars This also taught , A mistaken ḥalitza is valid. What constitutes a mistaken ḥalitza ? Any in which they say: Let her perform ḥalitza on condition that she will give you two hundred dinars.
llm_translation: Rather, all that they say to him: "Divorce her on condition that she gives you two hundred zuz." It was taught similarly: A coerced divorce - is valid. What is a coerced divorce? - Any case where they say to him: "Divorce her on condition that she gives you two hundred zuz."

hebrew_text: וּמַעֲשֶׂה בְּאִשָּׁה אַחַת שֶׁנָּפְלָה לִפְנֵי יָבָם שֶׁאֵין הָגוּן לָהּ, וְאָמְרוּ לוֹ: ״חֲלוֹץ לָהּ עַל מְנָת שֶׁתִּתֵּן לְךָ מָאתַיִם זוּז״, וּבָא מַעֲשֶׂה לִפְנֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא וְהִכְשִׁירָהּ.
human_translation: And an incident involving a certain woman, who happened before her yavam yet he was not suitable for her, and they, said to him: Let her perform ḥalitza on the condition that she will give you two hundred dinars. the incident came before Rabbi Ḥiyya and he validated that
llm_translation: And a case with a woman who fell before a yavam for whom it is not fitting, and they said to him: "Perform chalitzah for her on condition that she give you two hundred zuz," and the case came before Rabbi Chiya and he permitted her.

hebrew_text: הַהוּא דַּאֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא. אֲמַר לַהּ: בִּתִּי, עֲמוֹדִי! אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: אֵימָא יְשִׁיבָתָהּ זוֹ הִיא עֲמִידָתָהּ. אֲמַר לַהּ: יָדְעַתְּ לֵיהּ? אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: אִין, מָמוֹנָא הוּא דַּחֲזָא לַהּ וְקָבְעֵי לְמֵיכְלֵיהּ מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: One man came before Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said to her: My daughter, stand up, She said to him: Say that her sitting, is tantamount to her standing, said to her: do you know him She said to him: Yes, it is money that he saw in her, and he wants to consume it from her,
llm_translation: That one who came before Rabbi Chiya bar Abba. He said to her: My daughter, stand up! She said to him: Perhaps this sitting is her standing. He said to her: Do you know it? She said to him: No, it is money that she sees and establishes for her sustenance.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לַהּ: לָא נִיחָא לָךְ? אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: לָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: חֲלוֹץ לָהּ, וּבְכָךְ אַתָּה כּוֹנְסָהּ. לְבָתַר דַּחֲלַץ לַהּ, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הַשְׁתָּא, מִינָּךְ אִפַּסְלָא לַהּ, חֲלוֹץ לַהּ חֲלִיצָה מְעַלַּיְיתָא, כִּי הֵיכִי דְּתִישְׁתְּרֵי לְעָלְמָא.
human_translation: said to her: Is not amenable to you? She said to him: No, he said Let her remove and in doing so you will take her in After he allowed her to perform ḥalitza , said Now, she is disqualified for you to perform valid proper ḥalitza , so she will be permitted to others.
llm_translation: He said to her: "Is it not pleasing to you?" She said to him: "No." He said to her: "Divorce her, and in this way you will gather her." After he divorced her, he said to her: "Now, your status is disqualified, divorce her with a final divorce, so that you may be free for the world."

hebrew_text: בַּת חֲמוּהּ, דְּרַב פָּפָּא נָפְלָה לִפְנֵי יָבָם שֶׁאֵין הָגוּן לָהּ. אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּאַבָּיֵי, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: חֲלוֹץ לָהּ, וּבְכָךְ אַתָּה כּוֹנְסָהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב פָּפָּא: לָא סָבַר לַהּ מָר לְהָא דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן? וְאֶלָּא הֵיכִי אֵימָא לֵיהּ?
human_translation: The daughter of Rav Pappa’s father-in-law, happened before her yavam yet he was not suitable for her, came before Abaye. said to Let her remove and in doing so you will take her in Rav Pappa said to him: Does the Master, not accept what Rabbi Yoḥanan said, But what shall I say to him?
llm_translation: Daughter of Chamuah, of Rav Papa, fell before a yavam for whom she is not fitting. He came before Abbaye, he said to him: Release her, and in this way you are gathering her. Rav Papa said to him: Does the Master not hold like what Rabbi Yochanan said? Rather, how should I say to him?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: חֲלוֹץ לָהּ עַל מְנָת שֶׁתִּתֵּן לְךָ מָאתַיִם זוּז. לְבָתַר דַּחֲלַץ לַהּ, אֲמַר לַהּ: זִיל הַב לֵיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מְשַׁטָּה אֲנִי בָּךְ עֲבַדָה לֵיהּ.
human_translation: He said to Let her perform ḥalitza on the condition that she will give you two hundred dinars. After he let her perform ḥalitza , said to Go give him said I was fooling you, she did to him.
llm_translation: He said to her: "Divorce her in order that she may give you two hundred zuz." After he divorced her, he said to her: "Go bring it to him." She said to him: "I am disgusted with you; serve him yourself."

hebrew_text: מִי לָא תַּנְיָא: הֲרֵי שֶׁהָיָה בּוֹרֵחַ מִבֵּית הָאֲסוּרִין, וְהָיְתָה מַעְבּוֹרֶת לְפָנָיו, וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ: טוֹל דִּינָר וְהַעֲבִירֵנִי — אֵין לוֹ אֶלָּא שְׂכָרוֹ.
human_translation: Isn’t it taught One who was running away from prison upon a ferry. He said to Take a dinar, and take me across receives nothing other than his usual rate,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Who did not teach: Behold, he was fleeing from the prison, and there was a bridge before him, and he said to him: Take a dinar and let me pass - he has only his reward.

hebrew_text: אַלְמָא אָמַר לֵיהּ מְשַׁטֶּה אֲנִי בָּךְ — הָכָא נָמֵי, מְשַׁטָּה אֲנִי בָּךְ.
human_translation: Apparently, one said I was deceiving you Here too, I was fooling you,
llm_translation: He said to him, "I am joking with you." Here it is stated, "I am joking with you."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֲבוּךְ הֵיכָא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בְּמָתָא. אִימָּךְ הֵיכָא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בְּמָתָא. יְהַב בְּהוּ עֵינֵיהּ (וּשְׁכִיבָן).
human_translation: he said Where is your father? He said to him: in the city. Where is your mother? He said: In the city. set his gaze upon them, and both died.
llm_translation: He said to him: Where is your father? He said to him: In the city. Where is your mother? He said to him: In the city. He gave them his eyes (and they slept).

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: חֲלִיצָה מוּטְעֵת — כְּשֵׁרָה. גֵּט מוּטְעֶה — פָּסוּל. חֲלִיצָה מְעוּשֵּׂית — פְּסוּלָה. גֵּט מְעוּשֶּׂה — כָּשֵׁר. הֵיכִי דָּמֵי? אִי דְּאָמַר ״רוֹצֶה אֲנִי״ — אֲפִילּוּ חֲלִיצָה נָמֵי, וְאִי לָא אָמַר ״רוֹצֶה אֲנִי״ — גֵּט נָמֵי לָא.
human_translation: The Sages taught: A mistaken ḥalitza is valid, a mistaken bill of divorce is invalid. A coerced ḥalitza is invalid, a coerced bill of divorce is valid. What are the circumstances If he says: I want to then even ḥalitza also And if he did not say I want to even this bill of divorce also not
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: A voluntary divorcee — valid. A coerced divorce — invalid. A voluntary halitzah — invalid. A coerced halitzah — valid. How so? If he said, "I want," even for halitzah, and if he did not say, "I want," even for a divorce, it is not valid.

hebrew_text: הָכִי קָאָמַר: חֲלִיצָה מוּטְעֵת לְעוֹלָם כָּשֵׁר, וְגֵט מוּטְעֶה לְעוֹלָם פָּסוּל. חֲלִיצָה מְעוּשֵּׂית וְגֵט מְעוּשֶּׂה — זִימְנִין כָּשֵׁר וְזִימְנִין פָּסוּל. הָא דְּאָמַר ״רוֹצֶה אֲנִי״, הָא דְּלָא אָמַר ״רוֹצֶה אֲנִי״.
human_translation: this is what said: A mistaken ḥalitza is always valid, a mistaken bill of divorce is always invalid. A coerced ḥalitza and a coerced bill of divorce are sometimes valid and sometimes invalid. the one who says I want to the one who does not say: I want to
llm_translation: So it is stated: A voluntary offering is valid forever, and a divorce document that is voluntary is invalid forever. A forced offering and a forced divorce document - sometimes valid and sometimes invalid. This is like the case where one says, "I want," and this is not like the case where one says, "I want."

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: ״יַקְרִיב אוֹתוֹ״ — מְלַמֵּד שֶׁכּוֹפִין אוֹתוֹ. יָכוֹל בְּעַל כׇּרְחוֹ — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״לִרְצוֹנוֹ״. הָא כֵּיצַד? כּוֹפִין אוֹתוֹ עַד שֶׁיֹּאמַר ״רוֹצֶה אֲנִי״. וְכֵן אַתָּה מוֹצֵא בְּגִיטֵּי נָשִׁים, כּוֹפִין אוֹתוֹ עַד שֶׁיֹּאמַר ״רוֹצֶה אֲנִי״.
human_translation: As it is taught “He shall offer it” teaches that they may coerce him I might have thought this means against his will. Therefore, the verse states: “In accordance with his will” How these be They coerce him until he says: I want to. And similarly, you find the same with respect to bills of divorce for women, they coerce him until he says: I want to
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: "He shall bring it near" - teaches that they force him. Could it be against his will? The Torah teaches: "of his own will." How so? They force him until he says, "I desire." And similarly, you find in the bills of divorce of women, they force him until he says, "I desire."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא אָמַר רַב סְחוֹרָה אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: חוֹלְצִין אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין מַכִּירִין, מְמָאֲנִין אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין מַכִּירִין.
human_translation: Rava said Rav Seḥora said Rav Huna said: conduct ḥalitza even if do not recognize making declarations of refusal: even if do not recognize
llm_translation: Rava said, Rav Sechora said, Rav Huna said: We may remove the leaven even though we do not recognize it, and we may nullify it even though we do not recognize it.

hebrew_text: לְפִיכָךְ אֵין כּוֹתְבִין גֵּט חֲלִיצָה אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן מַכִּירִין, וְאֵין כּוֹתְבִין גֵּט מֵיאוּן אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן מַכִּירִין, דְּחָיְישִׁינַן לְבֵית דִּין טוֹעִין.
human_translation: Therefore, may not write a document of ḥalitza , unless they, recognize her. And may not write a document of a declaration of refusal, unless they, recognize as we are concerned of a mistaken court.
llm_translation: Therefore, one does not write a divorce document of halitzah unless they recognize, and one does not write a divorce document of refusal unless they recognize, for we are concerned about the court making errors.

hebrew_text: וְרָבָא דִּידֵיהּ אוֹמֵר: אֵין חוֹלְצִין אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן מַכִּירִין, וְאֵין מְמָאֲנִין אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן מַכִּירִין. לְפִיכָךְ כּוֹתְבִין גֵּט חֲלִיצָה אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין מַכִּירִין, וְכוֹתְבִין גֵּט מֵיאוּן אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין מַכִּירִין, וְלָא חָיְישִׁינַן לְבֵית דִּין טוֹעִין.
human_translation: And Rava himself said may not conduct ḥalitza unless they, recognize and may not convene a declaration of refusal unless they, recognize Therefore, may write a document of ḥalitza even if they do not recognize And may write a document of refusal even if they do not recognize And we need not be concerned about a mistaken court,
llm_translation: And Rava in his own name says: We do not remove a woman from her marriage unless we recognize the witnesses, and we do not refuse to accept testimony unless we recognize the witnesses. Therefore, we write a divorce document of release even though we do not recognize the witnesses, and we write a divorce document of refusal even though we do not recognize the witnesses, and we are not concerned about the court making a mistake.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מִצְוַת חֲלִיצָה: בָּא הוּא וִיבִמְתּוֹ לְבֵית דִּין, וְהֵן מַשִּׂיאִין לוֹ עֵצָה הַהוֹגֶנֶת לוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְקָרְאוּ לוֹ זִקְנֵי עִירוֹ וְדִבְּרוּ אֵלָיו״,
human_translation: The mitzva of ḥalitza He and his yevama come to the court, and give him advice appropriate for him, as it is stated: “And the Elders of his city shall call him and speak to him”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: The obligation of chalitzah: He comes and performs chalitzah before the court, and they appoint for him a wise council that will advise him, as it is stated: "And the elders of his city shall call him and speak to him" (Deuteronomy 25:9).

hebrew_text: וְהִיא אוֹמֶרֶת: ״מֵאֵן יְבָמִי לְהָקִים לְאָחִיו שֵׁם בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל לֹא אָבָה יַבְּמִי״, וְהוּא אוֹמֵר: ״לֹא חָפַצְתִּי לְקַחְתָּהּ״. וּבִלְשׁוֹן הַקֹּדֶשׁ הָיוּ אוֹמְרִים. ״וְנִגְּשָׁה יְבִמְתּוֹ אֵלָיו לְעֵינֵי הַזְּקֵנִים וְחָלְצָה נַעֲלוֹ מֵעַל רַגְלוֹ וְיָרְקָה בְּפָנָיו״, רוֹק הַנִּרְאֶה לַדַּיָּינִים. ״וְעָנְתָה וְאָמְרָה כָּכָה יֵעָשֶׂה לָאִישׁ אֲשֶׁר לֹא יִבְנֶה אֶת בֵּית אָחִיו״. עַד כָּאן הָיוּ מַקְרִין.
human_translation: she says: “My brother-in-law refused to establish a name for his brother in Israel, he did not wish to consummate the levirate marriage” and he says: “I do not wish to take her” And they would say in the sacred language “His yevama shall approach him, before the Elders, and remove his shoe from on his foot and spit before him” this spittle visible to the judges. “And respond and say: So shall it be done to the man who does not build his brother’s house” Up until this point would prompt to recite
llm_translation: The text reads: "And she says: 'From the one who refuses to establish a name in Israel for his brother, he shall perform the rite of refusal,' and he says: 'I did not desire to take her.' And in the holy tongue they would say: 'And his sister-in-law shall approach him in the presence of the elders, and she shall remove his shoe from his foot and spit before him,' the spitting that is visible to the judges. 'And she shall answer and say, "So shall be done to the man who will not build up his brother's house."' Up to this point they would read."

hebrew_text: וּכְשֶׁהִקְרָא רַבִּי הוּרְקָנוֹס תַּחַת הָאֵלָה בִּכְפַר עֵיטָם, וְגָמַר אֶת כׇּל הַפָּרָשָׁה, הוּחְזְקוּ לִהְיוֹת גּוֹמְרִין כׇּל הַפָּרָשָׁה. ״וְנִקְרָא שְׁמוֹ בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל בֵּית חֲלוּץ הַנָּעַל״. מִצְוָה בַּדַּיָּינִין, וְלֹא מִצְוָה בַּתַּלְמִידִים. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: מִצְוָה עַל כׇּל הָעוֹמְדִים שָׁם לוֹמַר ״חֲלוּץ הַנָּעַל״.
human_translation: And when Rabbi Hyrkanus once prompted under the ela tree in the village Eitam, he finish reciting the whole passage, they established the custom of completing the whole passage. “And his name shall be called in Israel: The house of he who had his shoe removed” This mitzva to the judges, but not to the students, Rabbi Yehuda says: It is a mitzva upon all those present to say: He who had his shoe removed.
llm_translation: When Rabbi Hurkanos read under the tree in the village of Ein Tamm, and completed the entire portion, they were confident to complete the entire portion. "And his name shall be called in Israel, the house of the one who had his shoe removed." It is a mitzvah for the judges, and not a mitzvah for the students. Rabbi Yehudah says: It is a mitzvah upon all those standing there to say, "The removal of the shoe."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה, מִצְוַת חֲלִיצָה: קוֹרְאָה וְקוֹרֵא, וְחוֹלֶצֶת וְרוֹקֶקֶת וְקוֹרְאָה. מַאי קָמַשְׁמַע לַן? מַתְנִיתִין הִיא! הָא קָמַשְׁמַע לַן מִצְוָה הָכִי, וְאִי אָפֵיךְ, לֵית לַן בַּהּ.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said: the mitzva of ḥalitza : She recites he recites she removes and spits, and recites: What is teaching us? This is the mishna. This teaches us the mitzva is like this, but if one switched the order, we have no with it,
llm_translation: Gemara: Rav Yehudah said, the mitzvah of chalitzah: she reads and he reads, and she removes and spits and reads. What is the reason for us? It is a Mishnah! This is the reason for us, a mitzvah like this, and if not, we do not have it.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: בֵּין שֶׁהִקְדִּים חֲלִיצָה לִרְקִיקָה, וּבֵין שֶׁהִקְדִּים רְקִיקָה לַחֲלִיצָה — מַה שֶּׁעָשָׂה עָשׂוּי.
human_translation: This is also taught Whether the removal of the shoe preceded the spitting, or whether the spitting preceded the removal of the shoe, what he did is done,
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Namai the Elder said: Whether one designated redemption before the cake offering, or whether one designated the cake offering before redemption - that which he did is valid.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: הַאי מַאן דְּמַקְרֵי גֵּט חֲלִיצָה, לָא לַיקְרֵי לְדִידַהּ ״לֹא״ לְחוֹדֵיהּ וְ״אָבָה יַבְּמִי״ לְחוֹדֵיהּ, דְּמַשְׁמַע: ״אָבָה יַבְּמִי״. אֶלָּא: ״לֹא אָבָה יַבְּמִי״.
human_translation: Abaye said The one who prompts to read bill of ḥalitza should not prompt her “He did not” by itself, and “wish to consummate the levirate marriage” by itself, because sounds like My yavam does wish to consummate the marriage. Rather, “He did not wish to consummate the levirate marriage”
llm_translation: Abaye said: The one who reads a divorce document as a declaration of refusal, should not read for himself "no" for its own sake and "he refuses to perform the duty of a husband's brother" for its own sake, for it implies "he refuses to perform the duty of a husband's brother." Rather, it should be read as "he does not refuse to perform the duty of a husband's brother."

hebrew_text: וְלָא לַיקְרֵי לְדִידֵיהּ ״לֹא״ לְחוֹדֵיהּ ״חָפַצְתִּי״ לְחוֹדֵיהּ, דְּמַשְׁמַע ״חָפַצְתִּי לְקַחְתָּהּ״, אֶלָּא ״לֹא חָפַצְתִּי לְקַחְתָּהּ״. רָבָא אָמַר: אַפְסוֹקֵי מִילְּתָא הִיא, וְאַפְסוֹקֵי מִילְּתָא לֵית לַן בַּהּ.
human_translation: And he should not read to the do not” by itself, “Wish to by itself, as it sounds like: I do wish to take her. Rather, “I do not wish to take her.” Rava said: It is a interruption in the matter. And we have no an interruption in the matter .
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And not to read it as "no" for its own sake, but to read it as "I desired" for its own sake, for it implies "I desired to take it," rather it is "I did not desire to take it." Rava said: It is an unresolved matter, and we have no resolution in it.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אַשְׁכְּחֵיהּ לְרַב כָּהֲנָא דְּקָמִצְטַעַר וּמַקְרֵי לַהּ ״לֹא אָבָה יַבְּמִי״, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא סָבַר לֵיהּ מָר לְהָא דְּרָבָא?
human_translation: Rav Ashi found Rav Kahana painstakingly trying to prompt “He did not wish to consummate the levirate marriage” said to him: Does the Master not hold that which Rava said,
llm_translation: Rav Ashi found Rav Kahana who was distressed and was calling out, "My yavam does not want." He said to him: Does our master not hold like that of Rava?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מוֹדֵה רָבָא בְּ״לֹא אָבָה יַבְּמִי״. אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: הַאי מַאן דְּכָתֵב גִּיטָּא דַּחֲלִיצְתָּא — לִיכְתּוֹב הָכִי: אַקְרֵינוּהָ לְדִידַהּ מִן ״מֵאֵן יְבָמִי״ עַד ״אָבָה יַבְּמִי״, וְאַקְרֵינוֹהִי לְדִידֵיהּ מִן ״לֹא״ עַד ״לְקַחְתָּהּ״, וְאַקְרֵינוּהָ לְדִידַהּ מִן ״כָּכָה״ וְעַד ״חֲלוּץ הַנָּעַל״.
human_translation: He said to him: Rava concedes concerning “He did not wish to consummate the levirate marriage,” Abaye said: One who writes a bill of ḥalitza must write as follows: We prompted her to recite from “My brother-in-law refused” until “he did not wish to consummate the levirate marriage” and we prompted him to recite from not” until “take her” And we prompted her to recite from “So shall” until “he who had his shoe removed”
llm_translation: He said to him: Rava concedes in the case of "Lo Avah Yabmi." Abaye said: The one who writes a bill of divorce for chalitza should write it thus: "I read it to her from 'from refusing Yabmi' until 'accepting her,' and I read it to her from 'no' until 'you shall remove it,' and I read it to her from 'like this' until 'removing the shoe.'"

hebrew_text: מָר זוּטְרָא מְשַׂרְטֵט וְכָתֵיב לְכוּלַּהּ פָּרָשָׁה. מַתְקֵיף לַהּ מָר בַּר אִידִי: וְהָא לֹא נִיתַּן לִיכָּתֵב! וְהִלְכְתָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּמָר זוּטְרָא.
human_translation: Mar Zutra would score and write the whole passage Mar bar Idi strongly objected to this: But it is unable to be written the halakha is in accordance with Mar Zutra,
llm_translation: Mar Zutra was drawing lines, and it is written for all the portion. Mar Bar Idi objected to him: But it is not given to be written! And the halakha is in accordance with the opinion of Mar Zutra.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: רָקְקָה וּקְלָטַתּוּ הָרוּחַ — לֹא עָשְׂתָה וְלֹא כְּלוּם. מַאי טַעְמָא — ״וְיָרְקָה בְּפָנָיו״ בָּעֵינַן. הִלְכָּךְ, הוּא אָרוֹךְ וְהִיא גּוּצָה, קְלָטַתְהוּ הָרוּחַ — אִיכָּא ״בְּפָנָיו״. הִיא אֲרוּכָּה וְהוּא גּוּץ — בָּעֵינַן עַד דְּמָטֵי לַהֲדֵי אַפֵּיהּ וַהֲדַר אָזֵיל.
human_translation: Abaye said: spat, but the wind seized she did nothing, What is the reason We require “she spit before him,” Therefore, if he is tall and she is short and the wind seized it, “before him” is satisfied, But if she is tall and he is short, we require that the saliva reach the space across from his face, and afterward it may go
llm_translation: Abaye said: If saliva and its spittle were blown by the wind - it did not do anything and it is not considered a problem. What is the reason? "And he shall spit in his face" - we require it. Therefore, if he is tall and she is short, and the wind blew the spittle - there is "in his face." If she is tall and he is short - we require until it reaches the end of his nose, then he may go.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: אֲכַלָה תּוּמָא וְרָקַת, אֲכַלָה גַּרְגִּישְׁתָּא וְרָקַתה — לֹא עָשְׂתָה וְלֹא כְּלוּם. מַאי טַעְמָא — ״וְיָרְקָה״ מֵעַצְמָהּ בָּעֵינַן, וְלֵיכָּא. וְאָמַר רָבָא: צְרִיכִי דַּיָּינֵי לְמִיחְזֵי רוּקָּא כִּי נָפֵיק מִפּוּמַּהּ דִּיבָמָה. דִּכְתִיב: ״לְעֵינֵי הַזְּקֵנִים ... וְיָרְקָה״.
human_translation: Rava said: she ate garlic and spat, she ate gargishta clay, and spat, she did nothing What is the reason We require that “she shall spit” on her own, and this is not And Rava said: The judges must see the spittle when it leaves the mouth of the yevama , as it is written: “Before the Elders…and spit,”
llm_translation: Rava said: If one ate garlic and leek, or if one ate turnip and leek - they have not done anything. What is the reason? We require "and he spat" by itself, and it is not there. And Rava said: I need the judges to see the spittle that comes out of the mouth of the levirate widow. As it is written: "Before the elders... and he spat."

hebrew_text: ״וְנִקְרָא שְׁמוֹ בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל בֵּית חֲלוּץ הַנָּעַל״ — מִצְוָה בַּדַּיָּינִין וְלֹא בַּתַּלְמִידִים. תַּנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: פַּעַם אַחַת הָיִינוּ יוֹשְׁבִים לִפְנֵי רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן, וּבָאתָה יְבָמָה לַחְלוֹץ, וְאָמַר לָנוּ, עָנוּ כּוּלְּכֶם: ״חֲלוּץ הַנָּעַל״, ״חֲלוּץ הַנָּעַל״, ״חֲלוּץ הַנָּעַל״.
human_translation: “And his name shall be called in Israel: The house of he who had his shoe removed,” there is a mitzva upon the judges to recite this but not for the students is taught Rabbi Yehuda says: Once we were sitting before Rabbi Tarfon and a yevama came to perform ḥalitza . He said to us: You must all answer: “He who had his shoe removed,” “He who had his shoe removed,” “He who had his shoe removed,”
llm_translation: "And his name shall be called in Israel, 'The house of the one who loosens the sandal' — a mitzvah for adults and not for students. It was taught: Rabbi Yehuda said: Once we were sitting before Rabbi Tarfon, and a yevamah came to perform chalitzah, and he said to us, 'All of you answer: 'The house of the one who loosens the sandal,' 'The house of the one who loosens the sandal,' 'The house of the one who loosens the sandal.'"

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ מִצְוַת חֲלִיצָה
llm_translation: We will return to you the commandment of chalitzah.

hebrew_text: בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: אֵין מְמָאֲנִין אֶלָּא אֲרוּסוֹת, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: אֲרוּסוֹת וּנְשׂוּאוֹת.
human_translation: Beit Shammai say: Only betrothed girls may refuse. But Beit Hillel say betrothed and fully married
llm_translation: House of Shammai say: Only betrothed women are refused, and House of Hillel say: Betrothed and married women.

hebrew_text: בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: בַּבַּעַל וְלֹא בַּיָּבָם, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: בַּבַּעַל וּבַיָּבָם.
human_translation: Beit Shammai say: at husband and not at yavam . But Beit Hillel say: at husband or yavam .
llm_translation: Beit Shammai say: with the husband and not with the levir, and Beit Hillel say: with the husband and with the levir.

hebrew_text: בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: בְּפָנָיו, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: בְּפָנָיו וְשֶׁלֹּא בְּפָנָיו. בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: בְּבֵית דִּין. וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: בְּבֵית דִּין וְשֶׁלֹּא בְּבֵית דִּין.
human_translation: Beit Shammai say: in the presence of But Beit Hillel say: either in his presence or in his absence. Beit Shammai say: in court. But Beit Hillel say: either in court, or not in court.
llm_translation: House of Shammai says: in his presence, and House of Hillel says: in his presence and not in his presence. House of Shammai says: in the court. And House of Hillel says: in the court and not in the court.

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ לָהֶם בֵּית הִלֵּל לְבֵית שַׁמַּאי: מְמָאֶנֶת וְהִיא קְטַנָּה, אֲפִילּוּ אַרְבַּע וְחָמֵשׁ פְּעָמִים. אָמְרוּ לָהֶם בֵּית שַׁמַּאי: אֵין בְּנוֹת יִשְׂרָאֵל הֶפְקֵר, אֶלָּא מְמָאֶנֶת וּמַמְתֶּנֶת עַד שֶׁתַּגְדִּיל, וּתְמָאֵן, וְתִנָּשֵׂא.
human_translation: Beit Hillel said to Beit Shammai: She may refuse as long as she is a minor, even four or five times Beit Shammai said to them: The daughters of Israel are not to be treated with disregard Rather, she refuses And she must wait until she reaches majority, and refuse, and marry.
llm_translation: They said to the House of Hillel to the House of Shammai: "She refuses and she is a minor, even four or five times." They said to the House of Shammai: "The daughters of Israel are not ownerless, rather she refuses and waits until she grows up, and consents, and is married."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּבֵית שַׁמַּאי — לְפִי שֶׁאֵין תְּנַאי בְּנִשּׂוּאִין. וְאִי נְשׂוּאָה תְּמָאֵן, אָתֵי לְמֵימַר יֵשׁ תְּנַאי בְּנִשּׂוּאִין.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: What is the reason of Beit Shammai because there are no conditions with regard to marriage. And if a married would refuse, they will come to say that there condition with regard to marriage.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara said, Rav Yehudah said Shmuel: What is the reason of Beit Shammai - because there is no dispute in marriage. And if there is no marriage, it comes to say there is a dispute in marriage.

hebrew_text: נִכְנְסָה לְחוּפָּה וְלֹא נִבְעֲלָה, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? לְפִי שֶׁאֵין תְּנַאי בְּחוּפָּה.
human_translation: But what is there to say if she entered the marriage canopy but did not engage in sexual intercourse? There are no conditions with regard to a wedding canopy,
llm_translation: She entered the courtyard and did not become betrothed, what can be said? Because there are no conditions in the courtyard.

hebrew_text: מָסַר הָאָב לִשְׁלוּחֵי הַבַּעַל, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? לָא פְּלוּג רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: But what is there to say if the father delivered his daughter to the agents of the husband The Sages did not distinguish
llm_translation: The father handed over to the messengers of the husband, what is there to say? The Rabbis do not disagree.

hebrew_text: וּבֵית הִלֵּל: מִידָּע יָדְעִי דְּנִישּׂוּאֵי קְטַנָּה דְּרַבָּנַן נִינְהוּ. רַבָּה וְרַב יוֹסֵף דְּאָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ: טַעְמָא דְּבֵית שַׁמַּאי, לְפִי שֶׁאֵין אָדָם עוֹשֶׂה בְּעִילָתוֹ בְּעִילַת זְנוּת.
human_translation: And Beit Hillel, It is known that marriage of a minor girl is by rabbinic Rabba and Rav Yosef both say: Beit Shammai’s reason is that a man would not readily render his sexual act licentious sexual intercourse.
llm_translation: House of Hillel: From the knowledge I know that the actions of the sages are considered insignificant. Rabbah and Rav Yosef who both said: The reason of Beit Shammai, because a person does not engage in marital relations for the sake of promiscuity.

hebrew_text: נִכְנְסָה לַחוּפָּה וְלֹא נִבְעֲלָה, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? לָא נִיחָא לֵיהּ דְּתִיהְוֵי חוּפָּה דְאִיסּוּרָא. מָסַר הָאָב לִשְׁלוּחֵי הַבַּעַל מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? לָא פְּלוּג רַבָּנַן. וּבֵית הִלֵּל, כֵּיוָן דְּאִיכָּא קִדּוּשִׁין וּכְתוּבָּה — לָא אָתוּ לְמֵימַר דִּבְעִילָתוֹ בְּעִילַת זְנוּת.
human_translation: What is there to say if she entered the marriage canopy but did not engage in sexual intercourse, It would not be satisfactory for him, if would be a forbidden marriage canopy, What is there to say if the father delivered his daughter to the agents of the husband? The Sages did not distinguish And Beit Hillel Since there is both betrothal and a marriage contract no one will come to say that his sexual act was licentious intercourse.
llm_translation: Entered into the wedding canopy and did not consummate, what can be said? It is not desirable for it to be a canopy of prohibition. If the father handed over to the emissaries of the husband, what can be said? The Rabbis do not disagree. And Beit Hillel, since there is betrothal and a marriage contract — they did not come to say that his intercourse is like the intercourse of promiscuity.

hebrew_text: רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר: טַעְמָא דְּבֵית שַׁמַּאי מִשּׁוּם פֵּירֵי, טַעְמָא דְּבֵית הִלֵּל מִשּׁוּם פֵּירֵי. טַעְמָא דְּבֵית שַׁמַּאי מִשּׁוּם פֵּירֵי — דְּאִי אָמְרַתְּ נְשׂוּאָה תְּמָאֵן, שָׁמֵיט וְאָכֵיל לְהוּ מִינַּהּ, דְּסוֹף סוֹף לְמִיפַּק קָיְימָא. וּבֵית הִלֵּל: אַדְּרַבָּה, כֵּיוָן דְּאָמְרַתְּ תְּמָאֵן — אַשְׁבּוֹחֵי מַשְׁבַּח לְהוּ. סָבַר דְּאִי לָא, עָיְיצִי לַהּ קְרוֹבֵיהּ, וּמַפְּקִי לַהּ מִינֵּיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: reasoning for Beit Shammai’s is because of profits and reasoning for Beit Hillel’s is because of profits reasoning for Beit Shammai’s is because of profits for if you say that a married may perform refusal, then the husband might seize from her and consume them, as ultimately she stands to leave And Beit Hillel On the contrary: Since you say she may refuse, he will improve He will think: if do not her relatives will advise her and they will take her from him.
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: The reason of Beit Shammai is due to the fruits, the reason of Beit Hillel is due to the fruits. The reason of Beit Shammai is due to the fruits - for if you say, let her adorn herself and then divorce her, ultimately he will be repulsed. And Beit Hillel: Increase, since if you say adorn herself, we praise them. He thought that if not, he will cause her to be repulsed, and he will separate from her.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: הַיְינוּ טַעְמָא דְּבֵית שַׁמַּאי — שֶׁאֵין אָדָם טוֹרֵחַ בִּסְעוּדָה וּמַפְסִידָהּ. וּבֵית הִלֵּל: תַּרְוַיְיהוּ נִיחָא לְהוּ, כְּדֵי דְּלִיפּוֹק עֲלַיְיהוּ קָלָא דְאִישׁוּת.
human_translation: Rava said: This is the reasoning of Beit Shammai: A man will not bother to make a marriage feast and lose it. And Beit Hillel The marriage is convenient for both of them so as to generate publicity about them that married.
llm_translation: Rava said: This is the reason of Beit Shammai - that a person does not exert himself in the meal and loses it. And Beit Hillel: Both of them are pleasing to them, so that a light yoke of ownership will come upon them.

hebrew_text: בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים בַּבַּעַל וְכוּ׳. אָמַר רַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא: מְמָאֶנֶת לְמַאֲמָרוֹ, וְאֵינָהּ מְמָאֶנֶת לְזִיקָּתוֹ. אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא? מַאֲמָר, דְּמִדַּעְתַּהּ — מָצְיָא עָקְרָא. זִיקָּה, דִּבְעַל כֻּרְחַהּ — לָא מָצְיָא עָקְרָא.
human_translation: Beit Shammai say: at husband Rabbi Oshaya said: may direct a refusal against a levirate betrothal but she may not direct a refusal against his bond. Rav Ḥisda said: What is the reasoning of Rabbi Oshaya? levirate betrothal, which is consensual, she can nullify bond, which against her will, she cannot nullify
llm_translation: Beit Shammai says "in the Baal, etc." Rabbi Oshaya said: She refuses his statement, but does not refuse his injury. Rav Hisda said: What is the reason for Rabbi Oshaya's statement? Saying, from her knowledge - she finds the root. Injury, from her husband's coercion - she does not find the root.

hebrew_text: וַהֲרֵי בִּיאָה, דִּבְעַל כֻּרְחַהּ,
human_translation: But consummation may be against her will
llm_translation: And behold, with regard to intercourse, it is like the act of a wild beast,

hebrew_text: וּמָצְיָא עָקְרָא! אֶלָּא: בִּיאָה וּמַאֲמָר, דְּהוּא קָעָבֵיד — מָצְיָא עָקְרָא. זִיקָּה, דְּרַחֲמָנָא רְמָא עֲלַהּ — לָא מָצְיָא עָקְרָא. עוּלָּא אָמַר: מְמָאֶנֶת אַף לְזִיקָּתוֹ. מַאי טַעְמָא — נִישּׂוּאֵי קַמָּאֵי קָא עָקְרָא.
human_translation: and she can nullify it, Rather, consummation and levirate betrothal, which he performs, she can nullify the bond, which the Merciful One imposes upon her cannot nullify Ulla said: She may direct her refusal even to his bond. What is the reason? nullifies the original marriage,
llm_translation: And he found a barren tree! Rather: through intercourse and speech, which is honored — he found a barren tree. A wound, for the Merciful One had mercy on it — it did not find a barren tree. Ula said: She even refuses his wound. What is the reason? — The removal of the first marriage is what caused the barrenness.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רָבָא לְעוּלָּא: כֹּל שֶׁיְּכוֹלָה לְמָאֵן וְלֹא מֵיאֲנָה — צָרָתָהּ חוֹלֶצֶת וְלֹא מִתְיַיבֶּמֶת. וְאַמַּאי? תְּמָאֵן הַשְׁתָּא וְתִעְקְרִינְהוּ לְנִישּׂוּאֵי קַמָּאֵי, וְתִתְיַיבֵּם צָרָתָהּ! צָרַת עֶרְוָה שָׁאנֵי. דְּתָנֵי רָמֵי בַּר יְחֶזְקֵאל: מֵיאֲנָה בַּבַּעַל — מוּתֶּרֶת לְאָבִיו. בַּיָּבָם — אֲסוּרָה לְאָבִיו.
human_translation: Rava raised an objection to Ulla. any could perform refusal but does not perform refusal, her rival wife performs ḥalitza and may not enter into levirate marriage. Why? Let her perform refusal now and nullify the first marriage and let her rival wife enter into levirate marriage. A rival wife of a forbidden relative is different, as Rami bar Yeḥezkel taught who refuses her husband is permitted to his father, a yavam is forbidden to his father.
llm_translation: Rava raised an objection to Ulla: Any woman who is able to marry and does not refuse - her affliction removes her from the obligation of levirate marriage, and she does not perform levirate marriage. And why is this so? Because she can now go and uproot them for marriage before the court, and her affliction will remove them! Affliction of nakedness is different. As Reimei bar Yehezkel taught: If she refuses the levirate marriage with the brother-in-law - she is permitted to her father. If she refuses it with the levir - she is forbidden to her father.

hebrew_text: אַלְמָא בִּשְׁעַת נְפִילָה נִרְאֵית כְּכַלָּתוֹ, הָכָא נָמֵי בִּשְׁעַת נְפִילָה נִרְאֵית כְּצָרַת בִּתּוֹ.
