human_translation: Evidently, at the time when she happens she appears to be his daughter-in-law. Here, too, at the time she happened she appears to be his daughter’s rival wife,
llm_translation: The Gemara: "Evidently, at the time of its fall, it appears like its bride, here, at the time of its fall, it appears like the pain of his daughter."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב: מֵיאֲנָה בָּזֶה — אֲסוּרָה לָזֶה, מִידֵּי דְּהָוֵה אַבַּעֲלַת הַגֵּט. בַּעֲלַת הַגֵּט, לָאו כֵּיוָן דְּאִיתַּסְרָא לַהּ לְחַד, אִיתַּסְרָא לְהוּ לְכוּלְּהוּ — הָכָא נָמֵי לָא שְׁנָא.
human_translation: Rav said: refuses this is forbidden to that just as it is concerning a who has a bill of divorce Is it not so that since who has a bill of divorce is forbidden to one of them, she is forbidden to all of them? Here too, it is no different.
llm_translation: Rav said: If she refuses him - she is forbidden to him, because she becomes a wife of a get. A wife of a get, since she is forbidden to one, she is forbidden to all - here it is not different.

hebrew_text: וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: מֵיאֲנָה בָּזֶה — מוּתֶּרֶת לָזֶה, וְלָא דָּמְיָא לְבַעֲלַת הַגֵּט. בַּעֲלַת הַגֵּט, הוּא דְּקָא עָבֵיד בַּהּ. הָכָא, הִיא קָעָבְדָא בֵּיהּ, דְּאָמְרָה: ״לָא רָעֵינָא בָּךְ, וְלָא צָבֵינָא בָּךְ״. בָּךְ הוּא דְּלָא רָעֵינָא, הָא בְּחַבְרָךְ רָעֵינָא.
human_translation: And Shmuel said: If she refused this she is permitted to that and it is not comparable to who has a bill of divorce. who has a bill of divorce, it is he who performed the act to her, Here, she is performing an act on him, as she says: I do not desire you and I do not want you, It is you whom I do not desire, but I may desire your fellow.
llm_translation: Samuel said: "If she refuses him in this, she is permitted to another, and it is not considered as if she is still married to the husband who gave her the bill of divorce. The husband who gave her the bill of divorce is the one who is acting upon her. Here, she despised him, as she said: 'I do not find favor in you, and I do not desire you.' It is you whom she does not find favor in, but with your companion she does find favor."

hebrew_text: רַב אַסִּי אָמַר: מֵיאֲנָה בָּזֶה — מוּתֶּרֶת אֲפִילּוּ לוֹ. לֵימָא כְּרַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא סְבִירָא לֵיהּ, דְּאָמַר: אֵינָהּ מְמָאֶנֶת לְזִיקָּתוֹ. בְּחַד יָבָם הָכִי נָמֵי דְּמָצְיָא עָקְרָא. הָכָא, בִּשְׁנֵי יְבָמִין עֲסִיקִינַן, דְּאֵין מֵיאוּן לַחֲצִי זִיקָּה.
human_translation: Rav Asi said: If she refuses this she is permitted even to him Shall we say that he holds in accordance with Rabbi Oshaya, who said: She cannot refuse his levirate bond, In the case of one yavam she can indeed nullify the bond. here, we are dealing with two yevamin , and there cannot be refusal of half a bond.
llm_translation: Rav Assi said: If she refuses him - she is permitted even to him. Let us say according to Rabbi Oshaya who holds that she does not refuse his injury. In the case of one yavam, it is thus established that he finds barrenness. Here, we are dealing with two yevamim, for they do not come to half injury.

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא רָבִין, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מֵיאֲנָה בָּזֶה — מוּתֶּרֶת לָאַחִין, וְלֹא הוֹדוּ לוֹ. מַאן לֹא הוֹדוּ לוֹ? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: רַב. רָבָא אָמַר: רַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא. וְאָמְרִי לַהּ רַב אַסִּי.
human_translation: When Ravin came he said Rabbi Yoḥanan refuses this is permitted to the brothers, and they did not agree with him. Who did not agree with him? Abaye said: Rav, Rava said: Rabbi Oshaya, And some say: Rav Asi
llm_translation: When Ravin came, Rabbi Yochanan said: If she refuses him - she is permitted to her brothers, and they did not thank him. Who did not thank him? Abaye said: Rav. Rava said: Rabbi Oshaya. And some say it was Rav Assi.

hebrew_text: בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: בְּפָנָיו וְכוּ׳. תַּנְיָא, אָמְרוּ לָהֶן בֵּית הִלֵּל לְבֵית שַׁמַּאי: וַהֲלֹא פִּישׁוֹן הַגַּמָּל מֵיאֲנָה אִשְׁתּוֹ שֶׁלֹּא בְּפָנָיו! אָמְרוּ לָהֶן בֵּית שַׁמַּאי לְבֵית הִלֵּל: פִּישׁוֹן הַגַּמָּל בְּמִדָּה כְּפוּשָׁה מָדַד, לְפִיכָךְ מָדְדוּ לוֹ בְּמִדָּה כְּפוּשָׁה.
human_translation: Beit Shammai say: in the presence of It is taught Beit Hillel said to Beit Shammai: But wife of Pishon the camel driver refuse in his absence? Beit Shammai said to Beit Hillel: Pishon the camel driver measured using a defective standard, and therefore the Sages measured him with a defective standard [ midda kefusha ].
llm_translation: House of Shammai says: "In its presence, etc." It was taught: The House of Hillel said to the House of Shammai: "But doesn't the camel's muzzle prevent its mate from being in its presence?" The House of Shammai said to the House of Hillel: "The camel's muzzle is measured with a loose measure, therefore they measured it with a loose measure."

hebrew_text: מִדְּקָא אָכֵיל פֵּירֵי, פְּשִׁיטָא נְשׂוּאָה הִיא. וְהָאָמְרִי בֵּית שַׁמַּאי נְשׂוּאָה לָא מְמָאֲנָה! תְּרֵי קִיטְרֵי עֲבַדוּ בֵּיהּ.
human_translation: Since he was consuming the profits it is obvious that she was married, But didn’t Beit Shammai say that a married cannot perform refusal? They tied him in two knots,
llm_translation: From when one eats fruits, it is obvious that it is a lifted object. And the House of Shammai said: A lifted object does not refuse! Two bundles they did with it.

hebrew_text: בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: בִּפְנֵי בֵּית דִּין וְכוּ׳. תְּנַן הָתָם: הַחֲלִיצָה וְהַמֵּיאוּנִין בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה. מַאן תַּנָּא? אָמַר רַבָּה: בֵּית שַׁמַּאי הִיא. אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא בֵּית הִלֵּל, עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמְרִי בֵּית הִלֵּל אֶלָּא דְּלָא בָּעֵינַן מוּמְחִין, אֲבָל שְׁלֹשָׁה בָּעֵינַן.
human_translation: Beit Shammai say: before a court, We learned elsewhere Ḥalitza and refusals in the presence of three Who taught this? Rabba said: It is Beit Shammai Abaye said: You even say Beit Hillel. Beit Hillel state only that we do not require expert judges but we do require three
llm_translation: House of Shammai says: "In the presence of the court, etc." We learned there: "Redemption and appraisals are with three." Who is the Tanna? Rabbah said: "It is the House of Shammai." Abbaye said: "Even if you say it is the House of Hillel, up to this point they did not say the House of Hillel, except that we do not require blemishes, but we require three."

hebrew_text: כִּדְתַנְיָא, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: בִּפְנֵי בֵּית דִּין, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: בִּפְנֵי בֵּית דִּין וְשֶׁלֹּא בִּפְנֵי בֵּית דִּין. וְאֵלּוּ וְאֵלּוּ מוֹדִים שֶׁצָּרִיךְ שְׁלֹשָׁה. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר יְהוּדָה וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן מַכְשִׁירִין בִּשְׁנַיִם. אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף בַּר מִנְיוֹמֵי אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: הֲלָכָה כְּאוֹתוֹ הַזּוּג.
human_translation: As it is taught Beit Shammai say: Before a court, and Beit Hillel say: before a court or not before a court, but both this and that concede that three are required. Rabbi Yosei bar Yehuda and Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, validate of two. Rav Yosef bar Manyumi said Rav Naḥman said: The halakha is in accordance with that pair.
llm_translation: As it was taught: Beit Shammai say: In the presence of the court, and Beit Hillel say: In the presence of the court and not in the presence of the court. And both these and those agree that three are required. Rabbi Yosei bar Yehuda and Rabbi Elazar bar Rabbi Shimon permit with two. Rav Yosef bar Minyomi said in the name of Rav Nachman: The halakha is in accordance with that pair.

hebrew_text: בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: תְּמָאֵן וְכוּ׳. וְהָא מֵיאֲנָה חֲדָא זִימְנָא! אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: עַד שֶׁתַּגְדִּיל וְתֹאמַר: ״רוֹצָה אֲנִי בַּמֵּיאוּנִים הָרִאשׁוֹנִים״.
human_translation: Beit Shammai say: She refuses And she must wait until she reaches majority, and refuse, and marry. Didn’t she refuse once? Shmuel said: until she reaches majority and says: I wish my initial refusal,
llm_translation: House of Shammai says: "Temaen etc." But she refused one time! Shmuel said: Until she grows up and says, "I want the firstborn rights."

hebrew_text: עוּלָּא אָמַר, תַּרְתֵּי קָתָנֵי: אוֹ שֶׁתְּמָאֵן וְתַגְדִּיל וְתֵיאָרֵס, אוֹ שֶׁתְּמָאֵן וְתִנָּשֵׂא לְאַלְתַּר.
human_translation: Ulla said: Two are taught Either she should refuse, and has matured should become betrothed; or she should refuse and marry immediately.
llm_translation: Ulai said, two Tannaim: either she refuses and grows and becomes beautiful, or she refuses and is married off immediately.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא עוּלָּא, הַיְינוּ דְּקָתָנֵי ״עַד שֶׁתַּגְדִּיל וְתִנָּשֵׂא״. אֶלָּא לִשְׁמוּאֵל ״עַד שֶׁתַּגְדִּיל וְתֹאמַר״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ! קַשְׁיָא.
human_translation: Granted, Ulla is that which is taught: Until she reaches majority and marries. But according to Shmuel, should have Until she reaches majority and says difficult
llm_translation: In truth, it is difficult. That is what is taught, "until you grow and are elevated." Rather, to Shmuel, "until you grow and say," does it require it? It is a difficulty.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אֵי זוֹ הִיא קְטַנָּה שֶׁצְּרִיכָה לְמָאֵן — כֹּל שֶׁהִשִּׂיאוּהָ אִמָּהּ וְאַחֶיהָ לְדַעְתָּהּ. הִשִּׂיאוּהָ שֶׁלֹּא לְדַעְתָּהּ — אֵינָהּ צְרִיכָה לְמָאֵן. רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בֶּן אַנְטִיגְנוֹס אוֹמֵר: כׇּל תִּינוֹקֶת שֶׁאֵינָהּ יְכוֹלָה לִשְׁמוֹר קִידּוּשֶׁיהָ — אֵינָהּ צְרִיכָה לְמָאֵן.
human_translation: Who is a minor girl who needs to perform refusal Any whose mother or brother married her off with her consent. If they married her off without her consent, she need not refuse Rabbi Ḥanina ben Antigonus says: Any girl who cannot keep her betrothal, safe does not need to refuse,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: What is the case of a minor girl who requires a guardian? Any girl whose mother and brothers have betrothed her according to her own knowledge requires a guardian. If they betrothed her without her knowledge, she does not require a guardian. Rabbi Chanina ben Antigonus says: Any infant girl who is unable to safeguard her ritual purity does not require a guardian.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: אֵין מַעֲשֵׂה קְטַנָּה כְּלוּם, אֶלָּא כִּמְפוּתָּה. בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל לְכֹהֵן — לֹא תֹּאכַל בִּתְרוּמָה, בַּת כֹּהֵן לְיִשְׂרָאֵל — תֹּאכַל בִּתְרוּמָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: The act of a minor girl is nothing, Rather, as though she were seduced daughter of a non-priest married to a priest may not eat teruma , the daughter of a priest married to an Israelite may eat teruma .
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: A small act is not insignificant, but rather significant. The daughter of Israel to a Kohen - she shall not eat from the Terumah, the daughter of a Kohen to an Israelite - she shall eat from the Terumah.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב אוֹמֵר: כׇּל עַכָּבָה שֶׁהִיא מִן הָאִישׁ — כְּאִילּוּ הִיא אִשְׁתּוֹ. כׇּל עַכָּבָה שֶׁאֵינָהּ מִן הָאִישׁ — כְּאִילּוּ אֵינָהּ אִשְׁתּוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov says any obstruction due to the man, it is as if she were his wife. any obstruction in the matter that is not due to the man, it is as if she were not his wife.
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov says: Any stain that is from the man - as if it is his wife. Any stain that is not from the man - as if she is not his wife.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ בְּמַתְנִיתָא תָּנָא: בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה הָיוּ כּוֹתְבִין גֵּט מֵיאוּן: ״לָא רָעֵינָא בֵּיהּ וְלָא צָבֵינָא בֵּיהּ וְלֵית אֲנָא בָּעֲיָא לְהִתְנַסְבָא לֵיהּ״. כֵּיוָן דַּחֲזוֹ דִּנְפִישׁ דִּיבּוּרָא, אָמְרִי:
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said, and some say it was taught in a baraita : At first, they would write a bill of refusal in this manner: I do not desire him, I do not want him, and I do not wish to be married to him. Once they saw that the text was too long, the said:
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara said, Rav Yehuda said, and some say in a Baraita: Initially they would write a divorce document with the following text: "I am not pleased with her, I am not satisfied with her, and I do not wish to live with her." Once they saw that this caused much talk, they said: English translation:

hebrew_text: אָתֵי לְאִיחַלּוֹפֵי בְּגִיטָּא. תַּקִּינוּ הָכִי: ״בְּיוֹם פְּלוֹנִי מֵיאֲנָה פְּלוֹנִית בַּת פְּלוֹנִי בְּאַנְפַּנָא״.
human_translation: may come to be confused with a bill of divorce they decreed as follows: On such and such a day, so-and-so, the daughter of so-and-so, performed refusal in our presence,
llm_translation: He came to the sages regarding a bill of divorce. They enacted thus: "On the day of so-and-so, so-and-so rejected the daughter of so-and-so in the presence of witnesses."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֵי זֶהוּ מֵיאוּן? אָמְרָה: ״אִי אֶפְשִׁי בִּפְלוֹנִי בַּעְלִי״, ״אִי אֶפְשִׁי בְּקִידּוּשִׁין שֶׁקִּידְּשׁוּנִי אִמִּי וְאַחַי״. יָתֵר עַל כֵּן אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: אֲפִילּוּ יוֹשֶׁבֶת בְּאַפִּרְיוֹן וְהוֹלֶכֶת מִבֵּית אָבִיהָ לְבֵית בַּעְלָהּ, וְאָמְרָה: ״אִי אֶפְשִׁי בִּפְלוֹנִי בַּעְלִי״ — זֶהוּ מֵיאוּן.
human_translation: The Sages taught: What a refusal? she said: I do not want so-and-so as my husband, I do not want the betrothal in which my mother and brothers had me betrothed, Rabbi Yehuda said more than that: Even if she is sitting in a bridal chair [ apiryon ] going from her father’s house to her husband’s house and said I do not want so-and-so as my husband, this a refusal.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: What is considered a refusal? She said, "If I would have relations with so-and-so, my husband," or "If I would have relations with the men who sanctified my mother and my brothers." Furthermore, Rabbi Yehuda said: Even if she is sitting in Aphriyon and walking from her father's house to her husband's house, and she says, "If I would have relations with so-and-so, my husband" — this is considered a refusal.

hebrew_text: יָתֵר עַל כֵּן אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: אֲפִילּוּ הָיוּ אוֹרְחִין מְסוּבִּין בְּבֵית בַּעְלָהּ וְהִיא עוֹמֶדֶת וּמַשְׁקָה עֲלֵיהֶם, וְאָמְרָה לָהֶם: ״אִי אֶפְשִׁי בִּפְלוֹנִי בַּעְלִי״ — הֲרֵי הוּא מֵיאוּן. יָתֵר עַל כֵּן אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר יְהוּדָה: אֲפִילּוּ שִׁיגְּרָהּ בַּעְלָהּ אֵצֶל חֶנְוָנִי לְהָבִיא לוֹ חֵפֶץ מִשֶּׁלּוֹ, וְאָמְרָה: ״אִי אֶפְשִׁי בִּפְלוֹנִי בַּעְלִי״ — אֵין לְךָ מֵיאוּן גָּדוֹל מִזֶּה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda said more than that: Even if guests are reclining at her husband’s house and she is standing and serving them drinks and said to them: I do not want so-and-so as my husband, this a refusal, Rabbi Yosei bar Yehuda said more than that: Even if her husband sent her to a shopkeeper to bring him an article of his and she said: I do not want so-and-so as my husband, there is no greater refusal than this.
llm_translation: "Moreover, Rabbi Yehudah said: Even if travelers were surrounded in the house of her husband and she stands and pours for them, and she says to them: 'I desire so-and-so, my husband' — this is considered repulsive. Furthermore, Rabbi Yosei bar Yehudah said: Even if her husband sent her to bring him something of his from the storehouse, and she says: 'I desire so-and-so, my husband' — there is no greater repulsiveness than this."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בֶּן אַנְטִיגְנוֹס אוֹמֵר: כׇּל תִּינוֹקֶת וְכוּ׳. אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא בֶּן אַנְטִיגְנוֹס. תָּנָא: קְטַנָּה שֶׁלֹּא מֵיאֲנָה, וְעָמְדָה וְנִשֵּׂאת, מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בְּתִירָה אָמְרוּ: נִישּׂוּאֶיהָ הֵן הֵן מֵיאוּנֶיהָ.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina ben Antigonus says: Any girl Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Ḥanina ben Antigonus. taught: a minor girl who did not refuse but who went and married it was said in the name of Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira: Her marriage constitutes her refusal,
llm_translation: Rabbi Chanina ben Antigonus says: "Every infant and so forth." Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Chanina ben Antigonus. It was taught: A young girl who has not reached the age of refusal, and she stood up and carried a burden, in the name of Rabbi Yehudah ben Beteira they said: Her carrying is indeed considered carrying, and her refusal is indeed considered refusal.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: נִתְקַדְּשָׁה, מַהוּ? תָּא שְׁמַע: קְטַנָּה שֶׁלֹּא מֵיאֲנָה וְעָמְדָה וְנִתְקַדְּשָׁה — מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בְּתִירָה אָמְרוּ: קִידּוּשֶׁיהָ הֵן הֵן מֵיאוּנֶיהָ.
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before What is if she was betrothed Come hear a minor girl did not refuse but went and became betrothed said in the name of Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira: Her betrothal constitutes her refusal.
llm_translation: He asked them: "If it became sanctified, what is the law?" Come and hear: "A small animal that did not refuse and stood and became sanctified - because Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira said: Its sanctifications are its refusals."

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: פְּלִיגִי רַבָּנַן עֲלֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בְּתִירָה אוֹ לָא? אִם תִּימְצֵי לוֹמַר פְּלִיגִי: בְּקִידּוּשִׁין, אוֹ אֲפִילּוּ בְּנִישּׂוּאִין? וְאִם תִּימְצֵי לוֹמַר פְּלִיגִי אֲפִילּוּ בְּנִישּׂוּאִין: הֲלָכָה כְּמוֹתוֹ אוֹ אֵין הֲלָכָה כְּמוֹתוֹ? וְאִם תִּימְצֵי לוֹמַר הֲלָכָה כְּמוֹתוֹ: בְּנִישּׂוּאִין אוֹ אֲפִילּוּ בְּקִידּוּשִׁין?
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before Do the Rabbis disagree with Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira or not? if you say they do disagree with regard to betrothal or also with regard to marriage? And if you say they disagree even with regard to marriage, is the halakha in accordance with his opinion or is the halakha not in accordance with his opinion? And if you say that the halakha is in accordance with his opinion, is with regard to marriage, or is even with regard to betrothal?
llm_translation: He asked them: Do the Rabbis disagree with Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira or not? If you want to say they disagree: in betrothals, or even in marriages? And if you want to say they disagree even in marriages: is the halakha like him or not? And if you want to say the halakha is like him: in marriages, or even in betrothals?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בְּתִירָה. הֲלָכָה — מִכְּלָל דִּפְלִיגִי.
human_translation: Come hear: Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: The halakha is in accordance with the opinion of Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira halakha , by inference disagree.
llm_translation: Come and hear, Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: The halakha is according to Rabbi Yehudah ben Betera. Halakha - from the general principle he diverged.

hebrew_text: וְאַכַּתִּי תִּיבְּעֵי לָךְ: דַּהֲוָה נְסִיבָא מֵעִיקָּרָא, אוֹ דִלְמָא מִיקַּדְּשָׁא? תָּא שְׁמַע: דְּכַלָּתֵיהּ דְּאַבָּדָן, אִימְּרוּד, שַׁדַּר רַבִּי זוּגֵי דְּרַבָּנַן לְמִיבְדְּקִינְהוּ. אָמְרִי לְהוּ נְשֵׁי: חֲזוּ גַּבְרַיְיכוּ דְּקָאָתוּ. אָמְרִי לְהוּ: נִיהְווֹ גַּבְרַיְיכוּ דִּידְכוּ.
human_translation: But still, you should raise the dilemma: when she had initially been married or perhaps was betrothed Come hear: The daughters-in-law of Abdan rebelled Rabbi sent a pair of Sages to examine them women said to See, it is your husbands that are coming. They said back to them: Let them be your husbands.
llm_translation: And once again, I will ask you: Was it a miracle from the beginning, or perhaps from the Sanctuary? Come and hear: all his disciples who were lost, they said, "Send Rabbi Zugei, the colleagues of the Rabbis, to examine them." They said to them, "See your husbands who are coming." They said to them, "They are your husbands."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי: אֵין לְךָ מֵיאוּן גָּדוֹל מִזֶּה. מַאי לָאו, דַּהֲוָה נְסִיבָא? לָא, דַּהֲוָה מִיקַּדְּשָׁא קִידּוּשֵׁי. וַהֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בְּתִירָה, וַאֲפִילּוּ בְּנִישּׂוּאִין דְּקַמָּא.
human_translation: Rabbi said: There is no greater refusal than this. What Is it not that they were married? No, they were merely betrothed, The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira even with regard to her marriage to the first
llm_translation: Rabbi said: You have no greater disgrace than this. What is it? That she was married? No, that she was betrothed. And the halakha is according to Rabbi Yehudah ben Beteira, even in the case of previous marriages.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר וְכוּ׳. אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: חוֹזְרַנִי עַל כׇּל צִדְדֵי חֲכָמִים וְלֹא מָצָאתִי אָדָם שֶׁהִשְׁוָה מִדּוֹתָיו בִּקְטַנָּה כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר. שֶׁעֲשָׂאָהּ רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר כִּמְטַיֶּילֶת עִמּוֹ בֶּחָצֵר, וְעוֹמֶדֶת מֵחֵיקוֹ וְטוֹבֶלֶת וְאוֹכֶלֶת בִּתְרוּמָה לָעֶרֶב.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: I reviewed all the opinions of the Sages and I did not find any person who applied a consistent standard with regard to a minor like Rabbi Elazar For Rabbi Elazar portrayed her as a girl walking with in a courtyard, who stands up from his bosom and immerses and partakes of teruma by evening
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar says, etc. Rabbi Yehuda said in the name of Shmuel: I have reviewed all the sides of the sages and have not found a person who equaled his character in humility to Rabbi Elazar. For Rabbi Elazar made his wife like a "metayeleit" with him in the courtyard, and she would stand from his lap, dip, and eat terumah in the evening.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: אֵין מַעֲשֵׂה קְטַנָּה כְּלוּם, וְאֵין בַּעְלָהּ זַכַּאי לֹא בִּמְצִיאָתָהּ, וְלֹא בְּמַעֲשֵׂה יָדֶיהָ, וְלֹא בַּהֲפָרַת נְדָרֶיהָ, וְאֵינוֹ יוֹרְשָׁהּ, וְאֵין מִיטַּמֵּא לָהּ. כְּלָלוֹ שֶׁל דָּבָר: אֵינָהּ כְּאִשְׁתּוֹ לְכׇל דָּבָר, אֶלָּא שֶׁצְּרִיכָה מֵיאוּן.
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Eliezer says: The act of a minor girl is nothing, And her husband has no rights to items she finds, nor to her earnings; nor to annul her vows; he does not inherit her and he may not become ritually impure on her account The principle is: his wife in any sense, except that she must perform refusal
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Eliezer says: A minor's act is of no consequence, and her husband is not entitled to it, neither in its finding, nor in her handiwork, nor in the annulment of her vows, and he does not inherit her, and he does not defile himself for her. The general principle of the matter is: She is not like his wife in all matters, except that she requires consent.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: בַּעְלָהּ זַכַּאי בִּמְצִיאָתָהּ, וּבְמַעֲשֵׂה יָדֶיהָ, וּבַהֲפָרַת נְדָרֶיהָ, וְיוֹרְשָׁהּ, וּמִיטַּמֵּא לָהּ. כְּלָלוֹ שֶׁל דָּבָר: הֲרֵי הִיא כְּאִשְׁתּוֹ לְכׇל דָּבָר, אֶלָּא שֶׁיּוֹצְאָה בְּמֵיאוּן.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua says: her husband has rights to items she finds, and to her earnings; and to annul her vows; and he inherits her and he must become ritually impure on her account The principle is: She is his wife in every sense, except that she can leave by refusal
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua says: Her husband merits in her finding, and in the work of her hands, and in the annulment of her vows, and he inherits her, and he defiles himself for her. The general principle of the matter: she is like his wife in all matters, except that she leaves with a document.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי: נִרְאִין דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר מִדִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ. שֶׁרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר הִשְׁוָה מִדּוֹתָיו בִּקְטַנָּה, וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ חָלַק. מַאי חָלַק? אִי אִשְׁתּוֹ הִיא — תִּיבְעֵי גֵּט.
human_translation: Rabbi said: The statement of Rabbi Eliezer appears than the statement of Rabbi Yehoshua, as Rabbi Eliezer applied a consistent standard with regard to a minor, while Rabbi Yehoshua applied an inconsistent standard. what inconsistent? If she is his wife, should require a bill of divorce
llm_translation: Rabbi said: The words of Rabbi Eliezer appear similar to the words of Rabbi Yehoshua. For Rabbi Eliezer was strict in his rulings, and Rabbi Yehoshua was lenient. What does it mean that he was lenient? If she is his wife, she should demand a divorce.

hebrew_text: לְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר נָמֵי: אִי לָאו אִשְׁתּוֹ הִיא — מֵיאוּן נָמֵי לָא תִּיבְעֵי! אֶלָּא בִּכְדִי תִּיפּוֹק?!
human_translation: According to Rabbi Eliezer too, if she is not his wife, she should not be required to perform refusal either. But shall she leave with no
llm_translation: To Rabbi Eliezer said: If she is not his wife - why should she not be believed! Rather, in order to resolve the matter?!

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב אוֹמֵר וְכוּ׳. הֵיכִי דָּמֵי עַכָּבָה שֶׁהִיא מִן הָאִישׁ וְעַכָּבָה שֶׁאֵינָהּ מִן הָאִישׁ? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: תְּבָעוּהָ לִינָּשֵׂא, וְאָמְרָה: ״מֵחֲמַת פְּלוֹנִי בַּעְלִי״ — זוֹ הִיא עַכָּבָה שֶׁהִיא מִן הָאִישׁ. ״מֵחֲמַת בְּנֵי אָדָם שֶׁאֵינָם מְהוּגָּנִין לִי״ — זוֹ הִיא עַכָּבָה שֶׁאֵינָהּ מִן הָאִישׁ.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov says: What are the circumstances of an obstruction due to the man, and an obstruction that is not due to the man? Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: proposed marriage to her and she said: on account of so-and-so, my husband, this is an obstruction that is due to the man. because the men are not suitable for me, this is an obstruction that is not due to the man,
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov says, etc. How are the damages of a goring ox that is from the owner and a goring ox that is not from the owner assessed? Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: Bring her to be married, and she says, "Due to so-and-so, my husband" — this is the goring ox that is from the owner. "Due to other people's sons who are not respected by me" — this is the goring ox that is not from the owner.

hebrew_text: אַבָּיֵי בַּר אָבִין וְרַב חֲנִינָא בַּר אָבִין דְאָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ: נָתַן לָהּ גֵּט — זוֹ הִיא עַכָּבָה שֶׁהִיא מִן הָאִישׁ, וְהוּא אָסוּר בִּקְרוֹבוֹתֶיהָ, וְהִיא אֲסוּרָה בִּקְרוֹבָיו, וּפְסָלָהּ מִן הַכְּהוּנָּה. מֵיאֲנָה בּוֹ — זוֹ הִיא עַכָּבָה שֶׁאֵינָהּ מִן הָאִישׁ, וְהוּא מוּתָּר בִּקְרוֹבוֹתֶיהָ, וְהִיא מוּתֶּרֶת בִּקְרוֹבָיו, וְלֹא פְּסָלָהּ מִן הַכְּהוּנָּה.
human_translation: Abaye bar Avin and Rav Ḥanina bar Avin both say: If gave her a bill of divorce, this is an obstruction due to the man, he is prohibited from her close relatives, and she is prohibited from his close relatives; and, she is disqualified from the priesthood. if she refuses him, this is an obstruction not due to the man. he is permitted to her close relatives, and she is permitted to his close relatives, and she is not disqualified from the priesthood,
llm_translation: Abbaye son of Avin and Rav Chanina son of Avin both say: If he gave her a bill of divorce - this is a case of a suspected adulteress who is from the man, and he is forbidden to her relatives, and she is forbidden to his relatives, and he disqualifies her from the priesthood. If he refrained from her - this is a case of a suspected adulteress who is not from the man, and he is permitted to her relatives, and she is permitted to his relatives, and he does not disqualify her from the priesthood.

hebrew_text: הָא קָתָנֵי לְקַמַּן: הַמְמָאֶנֶת בָּאִישׁ — הוּא מוּתָּר בִּקְרוֹבוֹתֶיהָ, וְהִיא מוּתֶּרֶת בִּקְרוֹבָיו, וְלֹא פְּסָלָהּ מִן הַכְּהוּנָּה. נָתַן לָהּ גֵּט — הוּא אָסוּר בִּקְרוֹבוֹתֶיהָ, וְהִיא אֲסוּרָה בִּקְרוֹבָיו, וּפְסָלָהּ מִן הַכְּהוּנָּה! פָּרוֹשֵׁי קָמְפָרֵשׁ.
human_translation: But it is taught below, refuses a man, he is permitted to her close relatives and she is permitted to his close relatives, and he has not disqualified her from the priesthood. If he gave her a bill of divorce, he is prohibited from her close relatives, and she is prohibited from his close relatives, and he has disqualified her from the priesthood. is explaining
llm_translation: The Gemara teaches further on: One who refuses to accept her husband — he is permitted to her relatives, and she is permitted to his relatives, and she does not become disqualified from the priesthood. If he gives her a bill of divorce — he is forbidden to her relatives, and she is forbidden to his relatives, and she becomes disqualified from the priesthood! The sages of Capernaum explained.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַמְמָאֶנֶת בָּאִישׁ — הוּא מוּתָּר בִּקְרוֹבוֹתֶיהָ, וְהִיא מוּתֶּרֶת בִּקְרוֹבָיו, וְלֹא פְּסָלָהּ מִן הַכְּהוּנָּה. נָתַן לָהּ גֵּט — הוּא אָסוּר בִּקְרוֹבוֹתֶיהָ, וְהִיא אֲסוּרָה בִּקְרוֹבָיו, וּפְסָלָהּ מִן הַכְּהוּנָּה.
human_translation: refuses a man, he is permitted to her close relatives, and she is permitted to his close relatives, and he has not disqualified her from the priesthood, he gave her a bill of divorce, he is prohibited from her close relatives, and she is prohibited from his close relatives, and he has disqualified her from the priesthood.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who refuses to accept her husband - he is permitted to her relatives, and she is permitted to his relatives, and she does not become disqualified from the priesthood. If he gives her a bill of divorce - he is forbidden to her relatives, and she is forbidden to his relatives, and she becomes disqualified from the priesthood.

hebrew_text: נָתַן לָהּ גֵּט וְהֶחְזִירָהּ, מֵיאֲנָה בּוֹ וְנִשֵּׂאת לְאַחֵר, וְנִתְאַרְמְלָה אוֹ נִתְגָּרְשָׁה — מוּתֶּרֶת לַחְזוֹר לוֹ. מֵיאֲנָה בּוֹ וְהֶחְזִירָהּ, נָתַן לָהּ גֵּט וְנִשֵּׂאת לְאַחֵר, וְנִתְאַרְמְלָה אוֹ נִתְגָּרְשָׁה — אֲסוּרָה לַחְזוֹר לוֹ.
human_translation: If he gave her a bill of divorce but remarried her, and refused him and married another and then she was widowed or divorced she is permitted to return to him. if she refused him and he remarried her, and he gave her a bill of divorce and she married another and she was widowed or divorced, she is forbidden to return to him,
llm_translation: He gave to her a bill of divorce and she returned it, she refused it and married another, and she was either widowed or divorced - she is permitted to return to him. She refused it and returned it, he gave to her a bill of divorce and she married another, and she was either widowed or divorced - she is forbidden to return to him.

hebrew_text: זֶה הַכְּלָל: גֵּט אַחַר מֵיאוּן — אֲסוּרָה לַחְזוֹר לוֹ, מֵיאוּן אַחַר גֵּט — מוּתֶּרֶת לַחְזוֹר לוֹ.
human_translation: This is the principle If the bill of divorce followed the refusal she is forbidden to return to him. If the refusal followed the bill of divorce, she is permitted to return to him.
llm_translation: This is the principle: A divorce after intercourse - forbidden to return to him, intercourse after divorce - permitted to return to him.

hebrew_text: הַמְמָאֶנֶת בָּאִישׁ וְנִשֵּׂאת לְאַחֵר וְגֵירְשָׁהּ, לְאַחֵר וּמֵיאֲנָה בּוֹ, לְאַחֵר וְגֵירְשָׁהּ, זֶה הַכְּלָל: כֹּל שֶׁיּוֹצְאָה הֵימֶנּוּ בְּגֵט — אֲסוּרָה לַחְזוֹר לוֹ, בְּמֵיאוּן — מוּתֶּרֶת לַחְזוֹר לוֹ.
human_translation: refuses man and marries another, and he divorces her, another and refuses him, and another and he divorces her, this is the principle anyone she leaves by means of a bill of divorce, it is prohibited for her to return to him. by means of refusal, she is permitted to return to him.
llm_translation: The one who refuses to marry a man and marries another, and he divorces her, marries another and refuses to marry him, and he divorces her, this is the principle: anyone who she leaves him with a divorce document — she is forbidden to return to him, with refusal — she is permitted to return to him.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אַלְמָא אָתֵי מֵיאוּן וּמְבַטֵּל גֵּט.
human_translation: Apparently, refusal comes and nullifies a bill of divorce.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "Gemar al'ma atei meiun u'mevatel get." English translation: "It is concluded that if water comes and nullifies a divorce document."

hebrew_text: וּרְמִינְהִי: הַמְמָאֶנֶת בָּאִישׁ וְנִשֵּׂאת לְאַחֵר וְגֵירְשָׁהּ, לְאַחֵר וּמֵיאֲנָה בּוֹ, לְאַחֵר וְגֵירְשָׁהּ, זֶה הַכְּלָל: כֹּל שֶׁיָּצְתָה הֵימֶנּוּ בְּגֵט — אֲסוּרָה לַחְזוֹר לוֹ, בְּמֵיאוּן — מוּתֶּרֶת לַחְזוֹר לוֹ. אַלְמָא לָא אָתֵי מֵיאוּן דְּחַבְרֵיהּ וּ[מְ]בַטֵּיל גִּיטָּא דִּידֵיהּ.
human_translation: raises a contradiction refuses man and marries another, and he divorces her, another and refuses him, and another and he divorces her, this is the principle: anyone she leaves by means of a bill of divorce, she is prohibited from returning to him. by means of refusal, she is permitted to return to him. Apparently, a refusal of another man does not come and nullify one’s bill of divorce.
llm_translation: And ask: one who refuses to live with her husband and marries another, and he divorces her, then she marries another and refuses to live with him, and he divorces her, this is the principle: anyone whom she was married to with a divorce document — she is forbidden to return to him, with a marriage contract — she is permitted to return to him. This implies that the marriage contract of her companion does not come and annul her own divorce document.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: תַּבְרַהּ, מִי שֶׁשָּׁנָה זוֹ לֹא שָׁנָה זוֹ.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: disjointed, he who taught this did not teach that
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: Tabrah, one who repeats this year did not repeat that year.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: וּמַאי קוּשְׁיָא? וְדִלְמָא: מֵיאוּן דִּידֵיהּ מְבַטֵּל גֵּט דִּידֵיהּ, מֵיאוּן דְּחַבְרֵיהּ לָא מְבַטֵּל גִּיטָּא דִידֵיהּ. וּמַאי שְׁנָא מֵיאוּן דְּחַבְרֵיהּ דְּלָא מְבַטֵּל גִּיטָּא דִידֵיהּ — אַיְּידֵי דְּמַכֶּרֶת בִּרְמִיזוֹתָיו וּקְרִיצוֹתָיו אָזֵל מְשַׁבֵּשׁ וּמַיְיתֵי לַהּ, מֵיאוּן דִידֵיהּ נָמֵי לָא לִיבַטֵּל גִּיטָּא דִידֵיהּ — דְּאַיְּידֵי דְּמַכֶּרֶת בִּרְמִיזוֹתָיו וּקְרִיצוֹתָיו אָזֵיל מְשַׁבֵּשׁ וּמַיְיתֵי לַהּ!
human_translation: Rava said: What is the difficulty Perhaps refusal of him nullifies his bill of divorce, while refusal of the other man does not nullify bill of divorce. what is refusal of the other man different, that it does not nullify his bill of divorce? because she is familiar with the intimations and gestures [ keritzotav ] he will lead her astray and bring her back the refusal against himself also should not nullify his bill of divorce, as, since she is familiar with his intimations and gestures, he will lead her astray and bring her back
llm_translation: Rava said: And what is the difficulty? Perhaps when he nullifies his own divorce document, his companions do not nullify his divorce document. And why is it different when his companions do not nullify his divorce document? Because he sells it with hints and winks, and he goes and nullifies it, and brings it to her. Perhaps even when he nullifies his own divorce document, she also does not nullify her divorce document - because he sells it with hints and winks, and he goes and nullifies it, and brings it to her!

hebrew_text: הָא כְּבָר שַׁבְּשַׁהּ וְלָא אִישְׁתַּבַּשָׁא.
human_translation: But he already tried to her astray and she was not astray.
llm_translation: This is how it was: "He has already returned, but she has not yet returned."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אִי קַשְׁיָא, דְּחַבְרֵיהּ אַדְּחַבְרֵיהּ קַשְׁיָא: מֵיאֲנָה בּוֹ וְהֶחְזִירָהּ, נָתַן לָהּ גֵּט וְנִשֵּׂאת לְאַחֵר, וְנִתְאַרְמְלָה אוֹ נִתְגָּרְשָׁה — אֲסוּרָה לַחְזוֹר לוֹ. טַעְמָא דְּנִתְאַרְמְלָה אוֹ נִתְגָּרְשָׁה. הָא מֵיאֲנָה — מוּתֶּרֶת לַחְזוֹר לוֹ, אַלְמָא אָתֵי מֵיאוּן דְּחַבְרֵיהּ וּמְבַטֵּל גִּיטָּא דִידֵיהּ.
human_translation: But if there is a difficulty, it is between another man and another man is difficult, If she refused him and he remarried her, and he gave her a bill of divorce and she married another and she was widowed or divorced, she is prohibited from returning to The reason is that she was widowed or divorced But if she had refused she would be permitted to return to Apparently, a refusal of the other man come and nullified his bill of divorce,
llm_translation: Rather, the difficulty is that his friend's friend is difficult: if he prevented her and returned her, he gave her a bill of divorce and she married another, and she either became widowed or was divorced — she is forbidden to return to him. The reason is that she either became widowed or was divorced. If he prevented her — she is permitted to return to him, which implies that the objection of his friend's friend comes and annuls his own bill of divorce.

hebrew_text: וּרְמִינְהִי: הַמְמָאֶנֶת בָּאִישׁ וְנִשֵּׂאת לְאַחֵר וְגֵירְשָׁהּ, לְאַחֵר וּמֵיאֲנָה בּוֹ, זֶה הַכְּלָל: כֹּל שֶׁיָּצְתָה מִמֶּנּוּ בְּגֵט — אֲסוּרָה לַחְזוֹר לוֹ, בְּמֵיאוּן — מוּתֶּרֶת לַחְזוֹר לוֹ. אַלְמָא לָא אָתֵי מֵיאוּן דְּחַבְרֵיהּ וּמְבַטֵּל גִּיטָּא דִידֵיהּ!
human_translation: raises a contradiction, refuses man and marries another and he divorces her, and another and refuses him, this is the principle: anyone she leaves by means of a bill of divorce, she is prohibited from returning to him. by means of refusal, she is permitted to return to him. Apparently, refusal of the other man cannot come and nullify his own bill of divorce.
llm_translation: And ask: one who refuses to live with a man and marries another, and he divorces her, then she marries another and refuses to live with him, this is the principle: anyone who has gone out from him with a divorce document — she is forbidden to return to him, with a marriage contract — she is permitted to return to him. This implies that the marriage contract of her companion does not come and annul her own divorce document!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: תִּבְרַהּ, מִי שֶׁשָּׁנָה זוֹ לֹא שָׁנָה זוֹ. עוּלָּא אָמַר: כְּגוֹן שֶׁשִּׁלְּשָׁה בְּגִיטִּין, דְּמִיחַזְּיָא כִּגְדוֹלָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: disjointed, who taught this did not teach that Ulla said: where she was divorced three times. Since she appears to be an adult,
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: It should be examined, one who repeats this year did not repeat that year. Ulla said: For example, when he issued three divorces, it appears as if he did it like a great person.

hebrew_text: מַאן תַּנָּא? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״מֵימֵינוּ בְּכֶסֶף שָׁתִינוּ עֵצֵינוּ בִּמְחִיר יָבֹאוּ״? בִּשְׁעַת הַסַּכָּנָה נִתְבַּקְּשָׁה הֲלָכָה זוֹ: הֲרֵי שֶׁיָּצְאָה מֵרִאשׁוֹן בְּגֵט וּמִשֵּׁנִי בְּמֵיאוּן, מַהוּ שֶׁתַּחֲזוֹר לָרִאשׁוֹן?
human_translation: who taught Rav Yehuda said Rav said: What is which is written: “We have drunk our water for money; our wood comes to us for a price” During the time of danger, this halakhic ruling was requested: If she, left her first husband by means of a bill of divorce and her second by refusal, what is with regard to her returning to the first?
llm_translation: Who taught it? Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav, what is the meaning of the verse: "From His right hand, a fiery law for them"? At the time of danger, this law was sought after: If she left from the first husband with a divorce document and from the second husband with money, what should she return to the first husband?

hebrew_text: שָׂכְרוּ אָדָם אֶחָד בְּאַרְבַּע מֵאוֹת זוּז, וְשָׁאֲלוּ אֶת רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא בְּבֵית הָאֲסוּרִין, וְאָסַר. אֶת רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בְּתִירָה בִּנְצִיבִין, וְאָסַר.
human_translation: hired one person for four hundred dinars and asked Rabbi Akiva, in prison and forbidden. They asked Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira in Netzivin, and forbidden.
llm_translation: One person hired for four hundred zuz, and they asked Rabbi Akiva in the prison, and he prohibited it. They asked Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira in Nitzivin, and he prohibited it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי: לְזוֹ לֹא הוּצְרַכְנוּ. לְאִיסּוּר כָּרֵת הִתַּרְתָּ, לְאִיסּוּר לָאו — לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן.
human_translation: Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei, said: This was unnecessary: If you permitted a prohibition excision from the World-to-Come [ karet ], not all the more so the prohibition
llm_translation: Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yosei, said: For this we did not require. For a prohibition of karet, you permitted, for a prohibition of lav - not to mention.

hebrew_text: בְּרַם כָּךְ שָׁאֲלוּ: הֲרֵי הָיְתָה אֵשֶׁת אֲחִי אִמּוֹ, שֶׁהִיא שְׁנִיָּיה לוֹ, וּנְשָׂאָהּ אָחִיו מֵאָבִיו וּמֵת, מַהוּ שֶׁתְּמָאֵן הַשְׁתָּא וְתִעְקְרִינְהוּ לְנִישּׂוּאִין קַמָּאֵי, וְתִתְיַיבֵּם (צָרָתַהּ). יֵשׁ מֵיאוּן לְאַחַר מִיתָה בִּמְקוֹם מִצְוָה, אוֹ לָא?
human_translation: Rather, this they asked: If was the wife of someone’s mother’s brother, a secondary to him and his paternal brother married her and died, what is May she refuse now and uproot the first marriage so that her rival wife may enter into levirate marriage? in a case a mitzva is refusal after death valid or not?
llm_translation: But thus they asked: If the wife of one's maternal brother, who is his second wife, and his brother married her from his father and died, may she now refuse and they will be removed for marriage before him, and she will perform the rite of levirate marriage. Is there repugnance after his death in a place of commandment, or not?

hebrew_text: שָׂכְרוּ שְׁנֵי בְּנֵי אָדָם בְּאַרְבַּע מֵאוֹת זוּז, וּבָאוּ וְשָׁאֲלוּ אֶת רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא בְּבֵית הָאֲסוּרִין, וְאָסַר. אֶת רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בְּתִירָה בִּנְצִיבִין, וְאָסַר.
human_translation: hired two people for four hundred dinars, and they came and asked Rabbi Akiva in prison and he prohibited. Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira in Netzivin and he prohibited.
llm_translation: They hired two men for four hundred zuz, and they came and asked Rabbi Akiva in the prison, and he prohibited it. Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira in Nitzivin, and he prohibited it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יִצְחָק בַּר אַשְׁיָאן: וּמוֹדֶה רַב, שֶׁמּוּתֶּרֶת לְאָחִיו שֶׁל זֶה שֶׁנֶּאֶסְרָה עָלָיו.
human_translation: Rav Yitzḥak bar Ashyan said: Rav concedes that she is permitted to the brother of the man to whom she is forbidden.
llm_translation: Rav Yitzchak bar Ashyahan said: And Rav concedes that it is permitted for the brother of this one who was forbidden upon him.

hebrew_text: פְּשִׁיטָא, הוּא נִיהוּ דְּמַכֶּרֶת בִּרְמִיזוֹתָיו וּקְרִיצוֹתָיו, אֲבָל אָחִיו לָא! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: לִיגְזַר הַאי אַטּוּ הַאי, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: obvious. is he, whose hints and gestures she recognizes, but not his brother, lest you say: Issue a decree this due to that he teaches us
llm_translation: The word-for-word translation of the Talmudic text is as follows: "Peshita, he is the one of selling in his hints and winks, but his brother not! What you may say: to decree this one and this one, it is heard to us."

hebrew_text: וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי, אָמַר רַב יִצְחָק בַּר אַשְׁיָאן: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁאֲסוּרָה לוֹ, כָּךְ אֲסוּרָה לָאַחִין. וְהָא אֵינָהּ מַכֶּרֶת בִּקְרִיצוֹתֵיהֶם וּרְמִיזוֹתֵיהֶם? גְּזֵירָה אָחִיו אַטּוּ הוּא.
human_translation: And there are who say Rav Yitzḥak bar Ashyan said: Just as she is forbidden to him, so is she forbidden to his brothers. But she is not familiar with their intimations and gestures. It is a decree concerning the brothers due to him,
llm_translation: And there are those who say, Rav Yitzchak bar Ashyaya said: Just as it is forbidden for him, so it is forbidden for his brothers. But is it not subject to excision in their limbs and hints? It is a decree that his brothers made.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַמְגָרֵשׁ אֶת הָאִשָּׁה וְהֶחְזִירָהּ — מוּתֶּרֶת לַיָּבָם.
human_translation: one who divorces a woman and remarries her is permitted to yavam ,
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: One who divorces his wife and then remarries her - she is permitted to the levir.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹסֵר. וְכֵן הַמְגָרֵשׁ אֶת הַיְּתוֹמָה וְהֶחְזִירָהּ — מוּתֶּרֶת לַיָּבָם. וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹסֵר. קְטַנָּה שֶׁהִשִּׂיאָהּ אָבִיהָ, וְנִתְגָּרְשָׁה — כִּיתוֹמָה בְּחַיֵּי הָאָב. וְהֶחְזִירָהּ — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל אֲסוּרָה לַיָּבָם.
human_translation: but Rabbi Elazar prohibits Likewise, one who divorces an orphaned girl and remarries her she is permitted to the yavam and Rabbi Elazar prohibits A minor girl whose father married her off, and who was divorced is like an orphan during the lifetime of father, And if remarries her everyone agrees she is forbidden to the yavam
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar prohibits. And so one who divorces the orphan and remarries her - she is permissible to the yavam. Rabbi Elazar prohibits. A minor who was betrothed by her father, and then she was divorced - she is considered an orphan during her father's lifetime. And if she is remarried - the words of all, she is forbidden to the yavam.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר עֵיפָה: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר — הוֹאִיל וְעָמְדָה עָלָיו שָׁעָה אַחַת בְּאִיסּוּרָא. אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ רַבָּנַן לְעֵיפָה: אִי הָכִי, חֲלִיצָה נָמֵי לָא תִּיבְעֵי!
human_translation: Eifa said: What is the reasoning of Rabbi Elazar, because she was forbidden to him at one time; The Sages said to Eifa: If that is so, she should also not require ḥalitza ,
llm_translation: Gemara said Eipha: What is the reason of Rabbi Elazar - since she stood upon him for one hour in prohibition. The Rabbis said to Eipha: If so, even chalitzah also should not be required!

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא: הָכִי נָמֵי, וְהָתַנְיָא, מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אָמְרוּ: חוֹלֶצֶת! אֶלָּא אָמַר עֵיפָה: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר לָא יָדַעְנָא מַאי טַעְמָא.
human_translation: And if you would say: Indeed, isn’t it taught It was said in the name of Rabbi Elazar she performs ḥalitza ? Rather, Eifa said: I do not know the reason for Rabbi Elazar.
llm_translation: And if you will say: thus indeed, and it was taught, in the name of Rabbi Elazar they said: she removes! Rather, Eipha said: Rabbi Elazar, we do not know the reason.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, הַיְינוּ טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: מְסַפְּקָא לֵיהּ אִי מִיתָה מַפֶּלֶת, אִי נִשּׂוּאִין הָרִאשׁוֹנִים מַפִּילִים. אִי מִיתָה מַפֶּלֶת — הָא רַמְיָא קַמֵּיהּ לְיִיבּוּם, אִי נִשּׂוּאִין הָרִאשׁוֹנִים מַפִּילִים — הָא עָמְדָה עָלָיו שָׁעָה אַחַת בְּאִיסּוּר.
human_translation: Abaye said: This is the reasoning of Rabbi Elazar: He is uncertain whether the death determines or the original marriage determines If death determines then she has happened before him for levirate marriage, If the original marriage determines then she was forbidden to him for a time
llm_translation: Abaye said, this is the reason of Rabbi Elazar: If the first husband died, they perform levirate marriage; if the first husbands were divorced, they do not perform levirate marriage. If the first husband died, this is a hint for levirate marriage; if the first husbands were divorced, this is a prohibition that stood upon him for one hour.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: לְעוֹלָם פְּשִׁיטָא לְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר דְּמִיתָה מַפֶּלֶת, וּמִיהוּ הַכֹּל בְּקִיאִין בְּגֵירוּשִׁין, וְאֵין הַכֹּל בְּקִיאִין בַּחֲזָרָה.
human_translation: Rava said: Actually, it is obvious to Rabbi Elazar that death determines However, everyone is well informed with regard to divorces. while not everyone is well informed with regard to remarriage,
llm_translation: Rava said: Always it is clear to Rabbi Elazar that death is a stumbling block, but nevertheless everyone is knowledgeable in divorces, and not everyone is knowledgeable in remarriage.

hebrew_text: אַדְּרַבָּה: חֲזָרָה, כֵּיוָן דְּיָתְבָא תּוּתֵיהּ, אִית לֵיהּ קָלָא! מִי לָא עָסְקִינַן דְּאַהְדְּרַהּ בְּאוּרְתָּא וּשְׁכֵיב בְּצַפְרָא.
human_translation: On the contrary, her return since she is living with him, generates publicity, Are we not dealing a case in which he remarried her in the evening and died in the morning?
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: Ad'rabbah: chazarah, keivan deyativah tuteih, eit leih kala! Mi la askeinan de'ahd'ra bah be'urtah ush'keiv be'tzafra.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: הַיְינוּ טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, דְּגָזַר הָנֵי מִשּׁוּם יְתוֹמָה בְּחַיֵּי הָאָב וְהֶחְזִירָהּ. הָכִי נָמֵי מִסְתַּבְּרָא, מִדְּקָתָנֵי סֵיפָא: קְטַנָּה שֶׁהִשִּׂיאָהּ אָבִיהָ וְנִתְגָּרְשָׁה, כִּיתוֹמָה בְּחַיֵּי הָאָב. וְהֶחְזִירָהּ — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל שֶׁאֲסוּרָה לַיָּבָם.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: This is the reasoning of Rabbi Elazar: He decreed these, due to an orphan in the lifetime of father, and he remarried her. So too, this is reasonable based on what was taught in the latter clause A minor girl whose father married her off and who was divorced is like an orphan during her father’s lifetime. And if remarries her everyone agrees that she is forbidden to the yavam
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: This is the reason of Rabbi Elazar, that he decreed those cases because of the orphan during the lifetime of the father and her the widow's return. So it is fittingly explained, from the end of the Mishnah: A minor girl whom her father betrothed and then divorced her, she is considered an orphan during the lifetime of the father. And her return - this is the opinion of all that she is forbidden to the brother-in-law.

hebrew_text: הַאי מַאי לְמֵימְרָא? פְּשִׁיטָא! אֶלָּא לָאו הָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן, טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר דְּגָזַר הָנָךְ מִשּׁוּם הַאי. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: What of stating It is obvious. Rather, is it not teaching us Rabbi Elazar’s reason for decreeing that these due to that Learn from here
llm_translation: This, what is it to say? Obvious! Rather, this is not what it is teaching us, but rather the reason of Rabbi Elazar who decreed there because of this. Learn from it.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַב אָשֵׁי: מוֹדִים חֲכָמִים לְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בִּקְטַנָּה שֶׁהִשִּׂיאָהּ אָבִיהָ וְנִתְגָּרְשָׁה — הֲרֵי הִיא כִּיתוֹמָה בְּחַיֵּי הָאָב, וְהֶחְזִירָהּ — שֶׁאֲסוּרָה לַיָּבָם, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁגֵּירוּשֶׁיהָ גֵּירוּשִׁין גְּמוּרִין, וְאֵין חֲזָרָתָהּ חֲזָרָה גְּמוּרָה.
human_translation: It is taught in accordance with Rav Ashi: The Rabbis concede to Rabbi Elazar concerning a minor girl whose father married her off and who was divorced, that she is like an orphan in the lifetime of father, and if remarried her, she is forbidden to the yavam , because her divorce was a full-fledged divorce while her remarriage was not a full-fledged remarriage,
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Rav Ashi: The Sages agree with Rabbi Elazar regarding a minor who was betrothed by her father and then divorced - she is considered an orphan during her father's lifetime. If she is remarried, she is forbidden to the levirate marriage, because her divorce is a complete divorce, and her remarriage is a complete remarriage.

hebrew_text: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — שֶׁגֵּירְשָׁהּ כְּשֶׁהִיא קְטַנָּה וְהֶחְזִירָהּ כְּשֶׁהִיא קְטַנָּה. אֲבָל גֵּירְשָׁהּ כְּשֶׁהִיא קְטַנָּה וְהֶחְזִירָהּ כְּשֶׁהִיא גְּדוֹלָה, אִי נָמֵי הֶחְזִירָהּ כְּשֶׁהִיא קְטַנָּה וְגָדְלָה אֶצְלוֹ וָמֵת — אוֹ חוֹלֶצֶת אוֹ מִתְיַיבֶּמֶת. מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אָמְרוּ: חוֹלֶצֶת וְלֹא מִתְיַיבֶּמֶת.
human_translation: In what is this statement said? where he divorced her while she was a minor and he remarried her while she was a minor. But if he divorced her while she was a minor and remarried her when she was an adult, or if he remarried her while she was a minor and she matured while with him, and he died, she may either perform ḥalitza or enter into levirate marriage. It was said in the name of Rabbi Elazar: She must perform ḥalitza and may not enter into levirate marriage,
llm_translation: In what case are these words said? — That he divorced her when she was young and he remarried her when she was young. But if he divorced her when she was young and he remarried her when she was older, or indeed if he remarried her when she was young and she grew up with him and he died — she either performs halitzah or undergoes levirate marriage. In the name of Rabbi Elazar they said: she performs halitzah but does not undergo levirate marriage.

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ רָבָא מֵרַב נַחְמָן: צָרָתָהּ, מַהוּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הִיא גּוּפַהּ גְּזֵירָה, וַאֲנַן נֵיקוּם וְנִיגְזוֹר גְּזֵירָה לִגְזֵירָה?
human_translation: Rava asked Rav Naḥman: What is the rival wife of rival wife He said to him: She herself is a rabbinic decree, And will we proceed to issue a decree to a decree? rival wife
llm_translation: Requested text: בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ רָבָא מֵרַב נַחְמָן: צָרָתָהּ, מַהוּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הִיא גּוּפַהּ גְּזֵירָה, וַאֲנַן נֵיקוּם וְנִיגְזוֹר גְּזֵירָה לִגְזֵירָה? English translation: Rava asked Rav Nachman: "Her affliction, what is it?" He said to him: "It is its own decree, and shall we take vengeance and decree a decree upon a decree?"

hebrew_text: וְהָא תַּנְיָא, מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אָמְרוּ: הִיא וְצָרָתָהּ חוֹלֶצֶת. הִיא וְצָרָתָהּ סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ?! אֶלָּא לָאו: אוֹ הִיא אוֹ צָרָתָהּ חוֹלֶצֶת? לָאו תָּרוֹצֵי קָמְתָרְצַתְּ, תָּרֵיץ הָכִי: הִיא — חוֹלֶצֶת, צָרָתָהּ — אוֹ חוֹלֶצֶת אוֹ מִתְיַיבֶּמֶת.
human_translation: Isn’t it taught It was said in the name of Rabbi Elazar: she and her rival wife must perform ḥalitza ? Would it enter your mind She and her rival wife? Rather, should it not Either she or her rival wife must perform ḥalitza , Are you not emending emend it as follows: She perform ḥalitza ; her rival wife may either perform ḥalitza or enter into levirate marriage.
llm_translation: The Gemara teaches in the name of Rabbi Elazar: She and her rival both perform chalitzah. She and her rival, is this your opinion? Rather, is it not the case that either she performs chalitzah or her rival performs chalitzah? If you wish, you may say: She performs chalitzah, her rival either performs chalitzah or performs levirate marriage.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ שְׁנֵי אַחִין נְשׂוּאִין לִשְׁתֵּי אֲחָיוֹת קְטַנּוֹת, וּמֵת בַּעְלָהּ שֶׁל אַחַת מֵהֶן — הַלֵּזוּ תֵּצֵא מִשּׁוּם אֲחוֹת אִשָּׁה. וְכֵן שְׁתֵּי חֵרְשׁוֹת. גְּדוֹלָה וּקְטַנָּה, מֵת בַּעְלָהּ שֶׁל קְטַנָּה — תֵּצֵא הַקְּטַנָּה מִשּׁוּם אֲחוֹת אִשָּׁה.
human_translation: two brothers are married to two minor sisters, and the husband of one of them dies this shall be exempt due to as sister his wife. The same two deaf-mute women, an adult and a minor, the husband of the minor dies, the minor shall leave due to sister a wife,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: Two brothers married to two younger sisters, and the husband of one of them dies - this one shall leave due to the sister-in-law relationship. Similarly, two deaf-mutes, one older and one younger, if the husband of the younger one dies - the younger one shall leave due to the sister-in-law relationship.

hebrew_text: מֵת בַּעְלָהּ שֶׁל גְּדוֹלָה, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: מְלַמְּדִין אֶת הַקְּטַנָּה שֶׁתְּמָאֵן בּוֹ.
human_translation: if the husband of the adult dies, Rabbi Eliezer says: We instruct the minor, to refuse him,
llm_translation: The husband of Gedolah died, Rabbi Eliezer says: We teach the minor that she may refuse him.

hebrew_text: רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: אִם מֵיאֲנָה — מֵיאֲנָה, וְאִם לָאו — תַּמְתִּין עַד שֶׁתַּגְדִּיל, וְתֵצֵא הַלֵּזוּ מִשּׁוּם אֲחוֹת אִשָּׁה.
human_translation: Rabban Gamliel says: If refuses her refusal is valid. And if not, she should wait until she reaches majority, and that shall be exempt due to sister a wife.
llm_translation: Rabban Gamliel says: If she refuses - she refuses, and if not - wait until she grows up, and this one will be exempt because of the sister of a wife.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: אִי לוֹ עַל אִשְׁתּוֹ, אִי לוֹ עַל אֵשֶׁת אָחִיו. מוֹצִיא אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ בְּגֵט — וְאֵשֶׁת אָחִיו בַּחֲלִיצָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua says: woe [ ee ] to him for his wife, woe to him for his brother’s wife. He must release his own wife with a bill of divorce his brother’s wife by ḥalitza .
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua says: Whether for him regarding his wife, or for him regarding his brother's wife. He divorces his wife with a bill of divorce - and his brother's wife with halitzah.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וּמִי שְׁרֵי? וְהָתָנֵי בַּר קַפָּרָא: לְעוֹלָם יִדְבַּק אָדָם בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה דְּבָרִים, וְיִתְרַחֵק מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה דְּבָרִים. יִדְבַּק בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה דְּבָרִים: בַּחֲלִיצָה, וּבַהֲבָאַת שָׁלוֹם, וּבַהֲפָרַת נְדָרִים. וְיִתְרַחֵק מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה דְּבָרִים: מִן הַמֵּיאוּן, וּמִן הַפִּקְדוֹנוֹת, וּמִן הָעֵרְבוֹנוֹת! מֵיאוּן דְּמִצְוָה שָׁאנֵי.
human_translation: Is it permitted Doesn’t bar Kappara teach: A person should always cling to three things and distance himself from three things. He should cling to three things: To ḥalitza to bringing about peace, and to the nullification of vows. And he should distance himself from three things: From refusal; and from deposits, and from serving as a guarantor. A refusal for a mitzva is different,
llm_translation: Gemara: And who is praiseworthy? And it was taught in the school of Rabbi Kapara: A person should always cleave to three things and distance himself from three things. He should cleave to three things: in the performance of ẖalitzah, in the bringing of peace, and in the annulment of vows. And he should distance himself from three things: from arrogance, from appointing oneself as a judge, and from taking security. The appointing of oneself as a judge in a matter of a mitzvah is different.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא. תָּנֵי בַּר קַפָּרָא: לְעוֹלָם יִדְבַּק אָדָם בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה דְּבָרִים: בַּחֲלִיצָה — כְּאַבָּא שָׁאוּל, דְּתַנְיָא, אַבָּא שָׁאוּל אוֹמֵר: הַכּוֹנֵס אֶת יְבִמְתּוֹ לְשֵׁם נוֹי, לְשֵׁם אִישׁוּת, לְשֵׁם דָּבָר אַחֵר — כְּאִילּוּ פּוֹגֵעַ בְּעֶרְוָה, וְקָרוֹב בְּעֵינַי לִהְיוֹת הַוָּלָד מַמְזֵר.
human_translation: the itself. Bar Kappara taught: A person should always cling to three things: To ḥalitza ; in accordance with Abba Shaul, as it is taught Abba Shaul said: One who marries his yevama for beauty, for the sake of matrimony or for some other reason, it is as if he is having intercourse with a woman forbidden to him, and in my eyes almost as if his offspring were a mamzer .
llm_translation: Body. It was taught in the school of Rabbi Kapara: A person should always adhere to three things: in halitzah - as Abba Shaul taught, for Abba Shaul says: one who gathers his yevamah for the sake of beauty, for the sake of marriage, or for some other reason - it is as if he has engaged in forbidden relations, and it is highly likely that the offspring will be a mamzer.

hebrew_text: בַּהֲבָאַת שָׁלוֹם, דִּכְתִיב: ״בַּקֵּשׁ שָׁלוֹם וְרׇדְפֵהוּ״,
human_translation: bringing about peace, as it is written “Seek peace and pursue it”
llm_translation: Upon the arrival of peace, as it is written: "Seek peace and pursue it."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: אָתְיָא ״רְדִיפָה״ ״רְדִיפָה״. כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״בַּקֵּשׁ שָׁלוֹם וְרׇדְפֵהוּ״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״רוֹדֵף צְדָקָה וָחָסֶד יִמְצָא חַיִּים צְדָקָה וְכָבוֹד״. בַּהֲפָרַת נְדָרִים, כְּרַבִּי נָתָן. דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי נָתָן אוֹמֵר: הַנּוֹדֵר — כְּאִילּוּ בָּנָה בָּמָה. וְהַמְקַיְּימוֹ — כְּאִילּוּ הִקְרִיב עָלֶיהָ קׇרְבָּן.
human_translation: And Rabbi Abbahu said: It is derived pursuit pursuit. It is written here: “Seek peace and pursue it” and it is written there: “He who pursues righteousness and mercy finds life, prosperity, and honor” for the nullification of vows, this is in accordance with Rabbi Natan, as it is taught Rabbi Natan says: one who vows, it is as if he built altar And one who fulfills that it is as if he sacrificed an offering on this
llm_translation: And Rabbi Avahu said: It is written "pursue, pursue." It is written here: "Seek peace and pursue it," and it is written there: "He who pursues righteousness and kindness will find life, righteousness, and honor." Regarding the annulment of vows, it is like Rabbi Natan. As it was taught, Rabbi Natan says: One who vows is as if he built an altar, and one who fulfills it is as if he offered a sacrifice upon it.

hebrew_text: וְיִתְרַחֵק מִשְּׁלֹשָׁה דְּבָרִים: מִן הַמֵּיאוּנִין — דִּלְמָא גָּדְלָה וּמִיחָרְטָא בָּהּ. מִן הַפִּקְדוֹנוֹת — בְּבַר מָתָא, דְּבַיְיתֵיהּ כִּי בַיְיתֵיהּ דָּמֵי. מִן הָעֵרָבוֹן — בַּעֲרָבֵי שַׁלְצִיּוֹן.
human_translation: And one should distance himself from three things: From refusals, perhaps she will grow up and regret From deposits by an inhabitant of the same city, as home as his home. From serving as a guarantor: This is referring to Sheltziyyon guarantees,
llm_translation: And distance oneself from three things: from the Me'unin - lest it grow and become engraved in it. From the Pikdunot - in a good pit, for his house is like his pit. From the Erevon - in the evenings of Shalziyon.

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״רַע יֵרוֹעַ כִּי עָרַב זָר״ — רָעָה אַחַר רָעָה תָּבֹא לִמְקַבְּלֵי גֵרִים, וְלַעֲרָבֵי שַׁלְצִיּוֹן, וּלְתוֹקֵעַ עַצְמוֹ לִדְבַר הֲלָכָה. מְקַבְּלֵי גֵרִים — כְּרַבִּי חֶלְבּוֹ. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי חֶלְבּוֹ: קָשִׁים גֵּרִים לְיִשְׂרָאֵל כְּסַפַּחַת בָּעוֹר.
human_translation: As Rabbi Yitzḥak said: What is which is written: “He who serves as a guarantor for a stranger shall suffer evil; Evil after evil will befall those who accept converts, and Sheltziyyon guarantors, and one who confounds himself in matters of halakha . those who accept converts: This is in accordance with Rabbi Ḥelbo. As Rabbi Ḥelbo says: Converts are difficult for the Jewish people like a leprous sore on the skin.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rabbi Yitzchak said: What is the meaning of what is written: "Evil will come upon evil; disaster upon disaster" (Ezekiel 7:26)? — One evil after another will come upon those who accept converts, and upon the inhabitants of the frontier towns, and upon those who engage in halachic disputes. Those who accept converts are like Rabbi Helbo, who said: Converts are as difficult for Israel as a scab on the skin.

hebrew_text: עֲרָבֵי שַׁלְצִיּוֹן — דְּעָבְדִי שְׁלוֹף דּוֹץ. תּוֹקֵעַ עַצְמוֹ לִדְבַר הֲלָכָה — דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: כׇּל הָאוֹמֵר אֵין לוֹ תּוֹרָה — אֵין לוֹ תּוֹרָה. פְּשִׁיטָא! אֶלָּא: כׇּל הָאוֹמֵר אֵין לוֹ אֶלָּא תּוֹרָה — אֵין לוֹ אֶלָּא תּוֹרָה.
human_translation: Sheltziyyon guarantors because they practice: Pull out, thrust in. one who confounds himself in matters of halakha , as it is taught Rabbi Yosei says: Anyone who says he has no Torah, has no Torah. obvious? Rather, anyone who says he has nothing other Torah, has nothing other Torah.
llm_translation: Aravei Shaltsiyon - de'avidy shlof dots. Toke'a atzmo lidvar halakha - detanya, Rabbi Yosei omer: Kol ha'omer ein lo Torah - ein lo Torah. Peshita! Ella: Kol ha'omer ein lo ela Torah - ein lo ela Torah.

hebrew_text: הָא נָמֵי פְּשִׁיטָא! אֶלָּא דַּאֲפִילּוּ תּוֹרָה אֵין לוֹ. מַאי טַעְמָא? אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא, אָמַר קְרָא: ״וְלִמַּדְתֶּם וַעֲשִׂיתֶם״ — כֹּל שֶׁיֶּשְׁנוֹ בַּעֲשִׂיָּה יֶשְׁנוֹ בִּלְמִידָה, כֹּל שֶׁאֵינוֹ בַּעֲשִׂיָּה אֵינוֹ בִּלְמִידָה.
human_translation: But isn’t also obvious? Rather, he does not even have Torah. What is the reason? Rav Pappa said: The verse states: That you may learn them and perform them, anyone who is engaged in performing is engaged in study, while anyone not engaged in performing is not engaged in study;
llm_translation: The Gemara asks: Is this not obvious? Rather, even if one does not have Torah. What is the reason? Rav Papa said, as it is stated in the verse: "And you shall learn and do" - anything that involves doing, also involves learning; anything that does not involve doing, does not involve learning.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא, לְעוֹלָם כִּדְאָמְרִיתוּ מֵעִיקָּרָא: כׇּל הָאוֹמֵר אֵין לוֹ אֶלָּא תּוֹרָה — אֵין לוֹ אֶלָּא תּוֹרָה, לָא צְרִיכָא דְּקָא מַגְמַר לְאַחֲרִינֵי וְאָזְלִי וְעָבְדִי. מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: אִית לֵיהּ אַגְרָא לְדִידֵיהּ, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: And if you wish, say: Actually, it is as you initially said: Anyone who says he has nothing other Torah has nothing other Torah. Rather, is necessary teaches others and they go and perform Lest you say that there is reward for him in it, teaches us
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: Always as you said from the beginning: Anyone who says he has only Torah - he has only Torah, it is not necessary that he finishes with others and then goes and does. What might you say: He has a reward for himself, he is listening to us.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא, תּוֹקֵעַ עַצְמוֹ לִדְבַר הֲלָכָה: בְּדַיָּינָא דְּאָתֵי דִּינָא לְקַמֵּיהּ, וְגָמַר הֲלָכָה וּמְדַמֵּי מִילְּתָא לְמִילְּתָא, וְאִית לֵיהּ רַבָּה וְלָא אָזֵיל מְשַׁאֵיל.
human_translation: And if you wish, say one who confounds himself in matters of halakha to a judge who had a case come before him, and he learned a ruling and he likens one matter to the other and he has a teacher but he does not go and ask
llm_translation: And if you will say, let him establish himself for a matter of halakha: in the court where the case comes before him, and he concludes the halakha and compares one matter to another, and he has Rabba with him and does not depart to ask.

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן: לְעוֹלָם יִרְאֶה דַּיָּין עַצְמוֹ כְּאִילּוּ חֶרֶב מוּנַּחַת לוֹ בֵּין יְרֵיכוֹתָיו, וְגֵיהִנָּם פְּתוּחָה לוֹ מִתַּחְתָּיו, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הִנֵּה מִטָּתוֹ שֶׁלִּשְׁלֹמֹה שִׁשִּׁים גִּבּוֹרִים סָבִיב לָהּ מִגִּבּוֹרֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל וְגוֹ׳ מִפַּחַד בַּלֵּילוֹת״, מִפַּחַד שֶׁל גֵּיהִנָּם שֶׁדּוֹמֶה לְלַיְלָה.
human_translation: As Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani said Rabbi Yonatan said: A judge should always view himself as if a sword were placed between his thighs, and as if Gehenna was open beneath him, as it is stated: “Behold, it is the bed of Solomon; sixty mighty men are around it, of the mighty men of Israel. because of dread in the night” because of the dread of Gehenna, which is similar to the night.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said in the name of Rabbi Yonatan: A judge should always see himself as if a sharp sword is placed between his thighs, and Gehinnom is open beneath him, as it is stated: "Behold, it is the bed of Solomon, surrounded by sixty mighty men of the mighty men of Israel, from the fear of the nights," from the fear of Gehinnom, which is likened to night.

hebrew_text: רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: אִם מֵיאֲנָה וְכוּ׳. בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר מֵרַב: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל — מִשּׁוּם דְּקָסָבַר קִידּוּשֵׁי קְטַנָּה מִיתְלָא תְּלוּ, וְכִי גָּדְלָה גָּדְלִי בַּהֲדַהּ, אַף עַל גַּב דְּלָא בְּעַל,
human_translation: Rabban Gamliel says: If refuses Rabbi Elazar raised a dilemma to Rav: What is Rabban Gamliel’s reasoning? because he holds that the betrothal of a minor girl is in suspension and when she reaches majority, the betrothal reaches majority, with her? even if he did not engage in intercourse
llm_translation: Rabban Gamliel says: "If she refuses, etc." Rabbi Elazar asked Rabbi: "What is the reason for Rabban Gamliel's statement?" - Because he holds that the betrothal of a minor is effective from the outset, and when she grows up, she grows up with it, even though she did not consent.

hebrew_text: אוֹ דִלְמָא מִשּׁוּם דְּקָסָבַר: הַמְקַדֵּשׁ אֲחוֹת יְבָמָה — נִפְטְרָה יְבָמָה וְהָלְכָה לָהּ, אִי בְּעַל — אִין, אִי לָא בְּעַל — לָא?
human_translation: Or perhaps, is it because he holds that betroths the sister of his yevama , the yevama is exempt and is released If he engaged in sexual intercourse with yes, if he did not engage in intercourse with his not exempt
llm_translation: Or perhaps because he holds: one who sanctifies the sister of his yevamah - the yevamah is exempt and the halakha goes to her, if he marries her - yes, if he does not marry her - no?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הַיְינוּ טַעְמָא דְּרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, מִשּׁוּם דְּקָסָבַר: הַמְקַדֵּשׁ אֲחוֹת יְבָמָה — נִפְטְרָה יְבָמָה וְהָלְכָה לָהּ, אִי בְּעַל — אִין, אִי לָא בְּעַל — לָא.
human_translation: Rav said to him: This is Rabban Gamliel’s reasoning: Because he holds that one who betroths the sister of his yevama , the yevama is exempt and is released, if he engaged in sexual intercourse yes, if he did not engage in intercourse not
llm_translation: He said to him: This is the reason of Rabban Gamliel, because he holds: One who betroths the sister of his yevamah - the yevamah is exempt and she may go free, whether he consummates the marriage or not.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: אָמֵינָא, כִּי נָיֵים וְשָׁכֵיב רַב, אֲמַר לְהָא שְׁמַעְתָּא. דְּתַנְיָא: הַמְקַדֵּשׁ אֶת הַקְּטַנָּה — קִידּוּשֶׁיהָ תְּלוּיִין. מַאי ״תְּלוּיִין״? לָאו כִּי גָּדְלָה גָּדְלִי בַּהֲדַהּ, וְאַף עַל גַּב דְּלָא בָּעַל?
human_translation: Rav Sheshet said: I say that Rav said this halakha when he was dozing and lying down, As it is taught one who betroths a minor girl, her betrothal is in suspension. What in suspension? Is it not that when she reaches majority, the betrothal reaches majority with her even if he did not have intercourse with her
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet said: I said, when Rav was dozing off, he said to that listener. As it was taught: One who sanctifies a minor - her sanctifications are dependent. What does "dependent" mean? Not that if she grows, she grows in her adornment, even though she did not consent.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבִין בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן: הָא מִילְּתָא דִקְטַנָּה, מִיתְלָא תַּלְיָא וְקָיְימָא, אִי בְּעַל — אִין, אִי לָא בְּעַל — לָא. דְּאָמְרָה: הוּא עָדִיף מִינַּאי, וַאֲנָא עֲדִיפְנָא מִינֵּיהּ.
human_translation: Ravin, son of Rav Naḥman, said to This matter, of a minor girl remains in suspension, If he has sexual intercourse yes, if he does not engage in intercourse not For she says He has an advantage over me and I have an advantage over him,
llm_translation: He said to him, Ravin son of Rav Nachman: This matter of a minor, it depends and stands, if with — yes, if not with — no. For she said: He is preferable to me, and I am preferable to him.

hebrew_text: וְסָבַר רַב: אִי בְּעַל — אִין, אִי לָא בְּעַל — לָא? וְהָא אִיתְּמַר: קְטַנָּה שֶׁלֹּא מֵיאֲנָה, וְהִגְדִּילָה, וְעָמְדָה וְנִשֵּׂאת, רַב אָמַר: אֵינָהּ צְרִיכָה גֵּט מִשֵּׁנִי, וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: צְרִיכָה גֵּט מִשֵּׁנִי.
human_translation: But does Rav think that if he has intercourse with her yes, her but if he did not engage in intercourse with her, no, Wasn’t it stated a minor who had not refused and reached majority, and went and married Rav said: She does not require a bill of divorce from the second And Shmuel said: She does require a bill of divorce from the second
llm_translation: And Rav thought: If she is married - no, if she is not married - no? But it was stated: A minor who did not refuse, and she grew up, stood and accepted, Rav said: She does not need a divorce document a second time, and Shmuel said: She needs a divorce document a second time.

hebrew_text: מַאי לָאו, דְּלָא בְּעַל? לָא, דִּבְעַל. אִי דִּבְעַל, מַאי טַעְמָא דִּשְׁמוּאֵל? קָסָבַר: כׇּל הַבּוֹעֵל — עַל דַּעַת קִדּוּשִׁין הָרִאשׁוֹנִים הוּא בּוֹעֵל.
human_translation: What, is it not where he did not have intercourse No, where he did have intercourse with her. If where he had intercourse with her, what is Shmuel’s reasoning? holds that anyone has sexual intercourse intention is that the intercourse the initial betrothal
llm_translation: What is the reason that it is not "ba'al"? Not "ba'al," but "bi'al." If it is "bi'al," what is the reason for Shmuel's opinion? He holds: Anyone who cohabits does so with the consent of the original sanctifiers.

hebrew_text: וְהָא פְּלִיגִי בַּהּ חֲדָא זִימְנָא, דְּאִיתְּמַר: קִדְּשָׁהּ עַל תְּנַאי, וּכְנָסָהּ סְתָם — רַב אָמַר: צְרִיכָה הֵימֶנּוּ גֵּט, וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: אֵינָהּ צְרִיכָה הֵימֶנּוּ גֵּט.
human_translation: But they already disagreed about this once, as it was stated betrothed on condition, and married her without mentioning Rav says: She requires a bill of divorce from him, and Shmuel says: She does not require a bill of divorce from him.
llm_translation: And this is where they argue about it one time, for it was said: she was consecrated according to the opinion of the Tanna, and he married her without specifying her status — Rav said: she requires a bill of divorce from him, and Shmuel said: she does not require a bill of divorce from him.

hebrew_text: רַב אָמַר צְרִיכָה הֵימֶנּוּ גֵּט — כֵּיוָן דְּנַסְבַהּ אַחוֹלֵי אַחֲלֵיהּ לִתְנָאֵיהּ. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: אֵינָהּ צְרִיכָה הֵימֶנּוּ גֵּט, כׇּל הַבּוֹעֵל, עַל דַּעַת קִדּוּשִׁין הָרִאשׁוֹנִים הוּא בּוֹעֵל!
human_translation: Rav says she requires a bill of divorce from him, since he married her, he retracted his condition, And Shmuel says: She does not require a bill of divorce from him, anyone who has sexual intercourse intention is that the intercourse the initial betrothal
llm_translation: Rav said: She requires from him a bill of divorce — since he engaged with her, he must fulfill his engagement to her teachers. And Shmuel said: She does not require from him a bill of divorce, anyone who cohabits, it is with the consent of the initial sanctifiers that he cohabits!

hebrew_text: צְרִיכָא, דְּאִי אִיתְּמַר הָהִיא, בְּהָהִיא קָאָמַר רַב, מִשּׁוּם דְּאִיכָּא תְּנָאָה, וְכֵיוָן דִּבְעַל, אַחֲלֵיהּ לִתְנָאֵיהּ. אֲבָל בְּהָא, אֵימָא מוֹדֶה לֵיהּ, לִשְׁמוּאֵל. וְאִי אִיתְּמַר בְּהָא: בְּהָךְ קָאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל, אֲבָל בְּהָךְ, אֵימָא מוֹדֶה לֵיהּ לְרַב, צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: necessary for if only that was stated, In this case Rav says since there is a condition but when he had intercourse he retracted the condition. But in this say that would concede to Shmuel And if only this was stated, Shmuel said that in this but in that say he would concede to Rav. necessary
llm_translation: The matter is, for if it was stated there, in that case Rav is saying it, because there is a Mishnah, and once he has acquired it, he should give it to his students. But in this case, say that Shmuel agrees with him, to Shmuel. And if it was stated in this case: in this case Shmuel is saying it, but in that case, say that he agrees with Rav, the matter is required.

hebrew_text: וּמִי אָמַר רַב כִּי בְּעַל — אִין, אִי לָא בְּעַל — לָא? הָא הָהִיא עוֹבָדָא דַּהֲוָה בְּנַרֶשׁ, וְאִיקַּדִּישָׁה כְּשֶׁהִיא קְטַנָּה, וְגָדְלָה, וְאוֹתְבַיהּ אַבֵּי כוּרְסְיָיא, וַאֲתָא אַחֲרִינָא וְחַטְפַהּ מִינֵּיהּ. וְרַב בְּרוֹנָא וְרַב חֲנַנְאֵל תַּלְמִידֵי דְרַב הֲווֹ הָתָם, וְלָא אַצְרְיכוּהָ גִּיטָּא מִבָּתְרָא!
human_translation: And did Rav say when he engaged in sexual intercourse with her, yes, and if he did not have intercourse with her, no, Wasn’t there an incident in Neresh where was betrothed when she was a minor, and she reached majority, and seated her in a bridal chair and another came and seized her from him And Rav Bruna and Rav Ḥananel, the students of Rav, were there and they did not require her a bill of divorce from the latter
llm_translation: And who said that if she is married - yes, if not she is not? There was a certain incident in Nareshe, where she was consecrated when she was young, and she grew up, and Abba Kursya married her, and another man came and snatched her from him. Rav Barona and Rav Chananel, disciples of Rav, were there, and they did not need a document of divorce afterwards!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: בְּנַרֶשׁ מִינְסַב נָסְיבִי, וַהֲדַר מוֹתְבִי אַבֵּי כוּרְסְיָיא. רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: הוּא עָשָׂה שֶׁלֹּא כַּהוֹגֶן, לְפִיכָךְ עָשׂוּ בּוֹ שֶׁלֹּא כַּהוֹגֶן, וְאַפְקְעִינְהוּ רַבָּנַן לְקִידּוּשֵׁי מִינֵּיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: in Neresh their marry and afterward they seat her in the bridal chair. Rav Ashi says: This acted improperly. Consequently, they treated him improperly and the Sages abrogated his betrothal.
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: With a non-Jewish woman I married, and then I married the daughter of the head of the baths. Rav Ashi said: He acted improperly, therefore they acted improperly towards him, and the Rabbis excommunicated him for consorting with heretics.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבִינָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: תִּינַח דְּקַדֵּישׁ בְּכַסְפָּא, קַדֵּישׁ בְּבִיאָה מַאי? שַׁוְּיוּהָ רַבָּנַן לִבְעִילָתוֹ בְּעִילַת זְנוּת. אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר. וְכֵן אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר.
human_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: works out well if betrothed her with money, If he betrothed her by means of intercourse, what The Sages rendered his sexual act a licentious sexual act, Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer, Likewise, Rabbi Elazar said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer.
llm_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: "If one sanctified with money, sanctified with intercourse, what is the law?" The Rabbis established it for his legitimate intercourse as illegitimate intercourse. Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: The halakha is according to Rabbi Eliezer. And similarly, Rabbi Elazar said: The halakha is according to Rabbi Eliezer.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מִי שֶׁהָיָה נָשׂוּי לִשְׁתֵּי יְתוֹמוֹת קְטַנּוֹת, וּמֵת — בִּיאָתָהּ אוֹ חֲלִיצָתָהּ שֶׁל אַחַת מֵהֶם פּוֹטֶרֶת צָרָתָהּ. וְכֵן שְׁתֵּי חֵרְשׁוֹת. קְטַנָּה וְחֵרֶשֶׁת — אֵין בִּיאַת אַחַת מֵהֶן פּוֹטֶרֶת צָרָתָהּ.
human_translation: a man was married to two orphaned minors and died, consummation or ḥalitza with one of them exempts her rival wife Likewise, two deaf-mutes minor and a deaf-mute, consummation with one of them does not exempt her rival wife.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who was married to two minor orphans, and one of them dies - the intercourse or the halitzah of one of them exempts his co-wife. Similarly, two deaf-mutes: a minor and a deaf-mute - the intercourse of one of them does not exempt his co-wife.

hebrew_text: פִּקַּחַת וְחֵרֶשֶׁת — בִּיאַת הַפִּקַּחַת פּוֹטֶרֶת הַחֵרֶשֶׁת, וְאֵין בִּיאַת הַחֵרֶשֶׁת פּוֹטֶרֶת אֶת הַפִּקַּחַת. גְּדוֹלָה וּקְטַנָּה — בִּיאַת הַגְּדוֹלָה פּוֹטֶרֶת הַקְּטַנָּה, וְאֵין בִּיאַת הַקְּטַנָּה פּוֹטֶרֶת הַגְּדוֹלָה.
human_translation: was competent and a deaf-mute, consummation with the competent exempts the deaf-mute, But consummation with the deaf-mute does not exempt the competent an adult woman and one a minor girl, consummation with the adult exempts the minor but consummation with the minor does not exempt the adult.
llm_translation: The opening and the closing — the opening exempts the closing, but the closing does not exempt the opening. The large and the small — the large exempts the small, but the small does not exempt the large.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וְחֵרֶשֶׁת בַּת חֲלִיצָה הִיא? וְהָתְנַן: חֵרֵשׁ שֶׁנֶּחְלַץ, וְחֵרֶשֶׁת שֶׁחָלְצָה, וְחוֹלֶצֶת מִן הַקָּטָן — חֲלִיצָתָהּ פְּסוּלָה!
human_translation: Can a deaf-mute perform ḥalitza ? Didn’t we learn a male deaf-mute performs ḥalitza , and a female deaf-mute performs ḥalitza , and performs ḥalitza on a minor boy, her ḥalitza is disqualified?
llm_translation: Gemar and Chereshet, daughter of Chalitza, she is? And we learned in a Mishnah: A Cheresh who performed Chalitza, and a Chereshet who performed Chalitza, and a Cherelzet from a minor - her Chalitza is invalid!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב גִּידֵּל אָמַר רַב: אַבִּיאָה. רָבָא אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא אַחֲלִיצָה — כָּאן בְּחֵרֶשֶׁת מֵעִיקָּרָא, כָּאן בְּפִקַּחַת וְאַחַר כָּךְ נִתְחָרְשָׁה.
human_translation: Rav Giddel said Rav said: to consummation Rava said: You even say it is referring to ḥalitza . Here, to a deaf-mute from the outset, there to competent and afterward became a deaf-mute.
llm_translation: Rav Giddel said in the name of Rav: Abbiyah. Rava said: Even if you say Ahalitzah - here with a pot from the outset, here with a hole, and afterwards it was sealed.

hebrew_text: חֵרֶשֶׁת מֵעִיקָּרָא, כִּי הֵיכִי דְּעָל — הָכִי נָפֵק, פִּקַּחַת וְאַחַר כָּךְ נִתְחָרְשָׁה — לָא, דִּמְעַכְּבָא בַּהּ קְרִיָּיה.
human_translation: a deaf-mute from the outset, just as she entered so she leaves one who was competent, and later became a deaf-mute, no, since recitation is indispensable for her
llm_translation: Deafness from the outset, for how so — thus it emerges, initially it was open, and afterwards it became closed off — no, for it does not impede its reading.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: וְחֵרֶשֶׁת מֵעִיקָּרָא בַּת חֲלִיצָה הִיא? וְהָתְנַן: שְׁנֵי אַחִין, אֶחָד פִּקֵּחַ וְאֶחָד חֵרֵשׁ, נְשׂוּאִין לִשְׁתֵּי נׇכְרִיּוֹת, אַחַת פִּקַּחַת וְאַחַת חֵרֶשֶׁת, מֵת חֵרֵשׁ בַּעַל חֵרֶשֶׁת, מָה יַעֲשֶׂה פִּקֵּחַ בַּעַל פִּקַּחַת? כּוֹנֵס. וְאִם רָצָה לְהוֹצִיא — יוֹצִיא.
human_translation: Abaye raised an objection to this: And is one who is a deaf-mute from the outset a candidate for ḥalitza ? Didn’t we learn Two brothers, one competent and one a deaf-mute, married two unrelated one competent and one deaf-mute. the male deaf-mute, the husband of the female deaf-mute, dies, what should the competent the husband of the competent woman, do? He may consummate And if he wants to divorce he may divorce her.
