llm_translation: He raised an objection to him, Abaye: Is a deaf-mute woman from the outset considered a halutzah? But we learned in a Mishnah: Two brothers, one is sighted and one is deaf-mute, married two non-Jewish women, one is sighted and one is deaf-mute. If the deaf-mute brother dies, leaving the deaf-mute wife, what should the sighted brother, the husband of the sighted wife, do? He performs chalitzah. And if he wishes to perform yibum - he may perform yibum.

hebrew_text: מֵת פִּקֵּחַ בַּעַל פִּקַּחַת, מָה יַעֲשֶׂה חֵרֵשׁ בַּעַל חֵרֶשֶׁת? כּוֹנֵס, וְאֵינוֹ מוֹצִיא לְעוֹלָם. מַאי לָאו, בְּחֵרֶשֶׁת מֵעִיקָּרָא, וְקָתָנֵי: כּוֹנֵס אִין,
human_translation: If the competent man, husband of the competent woman, dies, what should the deaf-mute, the husband of the female deaf-mute, do? He may consummate the but he may never divorce her, What, is it not a deaf-mute from the outset? And it is taught: Yes, he may consummate the levirate marriage,
llm_translation: A dead Pikach Ba'al Pikachet, what should a deaf person Ba'al Chereshet do? He gathers, but does not bring out to the world. What is the reason? In Chereshet from the outset, and it is taught: He gathers, no.

hebrew_text: חוֹלֵץ לָא! לָא, בְּפִקַּחַת וְאַחַר כָּךְ נִתְחָרְשָׁה.
human_translation: no, he may not perform ḥalitza . No, to a competent woman who later became a deaf-mute,
llm_translation: He does not remove! No, in the opening, and afterwards she became bald.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: שְׁנֵי אַחִין פִּקְחִין נְשׂוּאִין שְׁתֵּי נׇכְרִיּוֹת, אַחַת פִּקַּחַת וְאַחַת חֵרֶשֶׁת, מֵת פִּקֵּחַ בַּעַל הַחֵרֶשֶׁת, מָה יַעֲשֶׂה פִּקֵּחַ בַּעַל פִּקַּחַת? כּוֹנֵס, וְאִם רוֹצֶה לְהוֹצִיא יוֹצִיא. מֵת פִּקֵּחַ בַּעַל פִּקַּחַת, מָה יַעֲשֶׂה פִּקֵּחַ בַּעַל חֵרֶשֶׁת? אוֹ חוֹלֵץ אוֹ מְיַיבֵּם.
human_translation: Come hear Two competent brothers married two unrelated one who is competent and one deaf-mute. the competent man the husband of the female deaf-mute, dies, what should the competent man the husband of the competent woman do? He consummates and if wishes to divorce her, he may divorce But if the competent man the husband of the competent woman dies, what should the competent man the husband of the female deaf-mute do? He may either perform ḥalitza or consummate the levirate marriage.
llm_translation: Come and hear: Two brothers, both married to two non-Jewish women, one is sighted and one is blind. If the sighted one dies, the husband of the blind woman, what should the husband of the sighted woman do? He may gather her in, and if he wishes to divorce her, he may do so. If the sighted one dies, what should the husband of the blind woman do? He either performs chalitzah or performs levirate marriage.

hebrew_text: מַאי לָאו: מִדְּהוּא פִּקֵּחַ מֵעִיקָּרָא, הִיא נָמֵי חֵרֶשֶׁת מֵעִיקָּרָא, וְקָתָנֵי: כּוֹנֵס אִין, חוֹלֵץ לָא! מִידֵּי אִירְיָא? הָא כִּדְאִיתָא וְהָא כִּדְאִיתָא.
human_translation: What, is it not that since he is competent from the outset, she is a deaf-mute from the outset as well? And it is taught yes, he may consummate no, he may not perform ḥalitza Are the cases comparable? This as it is, and that as it is,
llm_translation: What is the reason? Because he is intelligent from the outset, she is truly deaf from the outset, and it teaches: If one gathers, he does not separate! Is this not obvious? This one is like this, and this one is like this.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ: שְׁנֵי אַחִין, אֶחָד פִּקֵּחַ וְאֶחָד חֵרֵשׁ, נְשׂוּאִין שְׁתֵּי אֲחָיוֹת, אַחַת פִּקַּחַת וְאַחַת חֵרֶשֶׁת. מֵת חֵרֵשׁ בַּעַל חֵרֶשֶׁת, מָה יַעֲשֶׂה פִּקֵּחַ בַּעַל פִּקַּחַת? תֵּצֵא מִשּׁוּם אֲחוֹת אִשָּׁה.
human_translation: raised an objection to this Two brothers, one competent and one deaf-mute, are married two sisters, one competent and one a deaf-mute. the male deaf-mute the husband of the female deaf-mute dies, what shall the competent the husband of the competent woman do? leaves due to the sister of one’s wife.
llm_translation: He raised an objection: Two brothers, one sighted and one deaf, married two sisters, one sighted and one deaf. If the deaf one dies, leaving the deaf wife, what should the sighted one, husband of the sighted wife, do? He should leave due to the sister-in-law relationship.

hebrew_text: מֵת פִּקֵּחַ בַּעַל פִּקַּחַת, מָה יַעֲשֶׂה חֵרֵשׁ בַּעַל חֵרֶשֶׁת? מוֹצִיא אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ בְּגֵט, וְאֵשֶׁת אָחִיו אֲסוּרָה לְעוֹלָם.
human_translation: If the competent man the husband of the competent woman dies, what should the male deaf-mute the husband of the female deaf-mute do? He releases his wife, with a bill of divorce, and his brother’s wife is forbidden forever
llm_translation: A dead Pikach marries a Pikachat, what should a deaf person married to a deaf woman do? He divorces his wife with a bill of divorce, and his brother's wife is forbidden to him forever.

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא הָכָא נָמֵי בְּפִקֵּחַ וְאַחַר כָּךְ נִתְחָרֵשׁ — מִי מָצֵי מַפֵּיק? וְהָתְנַן: נִתְחָרְשָׁה — יוֹצִיא, נִשְׁתַּטֵּית — לֹא יוֹצִיא. נִתְחָרֵשׁ הוּא אוֹ נִשְׁתַּטָּה — לֹא יוֹצִיא עוֹלָמִית.
human_translation: And if you would say: Here, too, to competent and later became a deaf-mute, can divorce Didn’t we learn became a deaf-mute, he may divorce her; if she became mentally incompetent, he may not divorce her, If he himself became a deaf-mute or became mentally incompetent, he may never divorce her.
llm_translation: And if you will say here we are dealing with a case of "Pike'ach" and afterwards he became "Cheresh" - who can exempt? And we learned in a Mishnah: If he became "Cheresh" - he may exempt, if he became "Shoteh" - he may not exempt. Whether he became "Cheresh" or "Shoteh" - he may not exempt permanently.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לָאו, בְּחֵרֵשׁ מֵעִיקָּרָא, וּמִדְּהוּא חֵרֵשׁ מֵעִיקָּרָא — הִיא נָמֵי חֵרֶשֶׁת מֵעִיקָּרָא. וּמִדַּאֲחָיוֹת חֵרְשׁוֹת מֵעִיקָּרָא — נׇכְרִיּוֹת נָמֵי חֵרְשׁוֹת מֵעִיקָּרָא, וּתְנַן גַּבֵּי נׇכְרִיּוֹת: כּוֹנֵס אִין, חוֹלֵץ לָא! אִישְׁתִּיק.
human_translation: Rather, is it not a male deaf-mute from the outset? And since he was a deaf-mute from the outset, she was also a deaf-mute from the outset. And since the sisters were deaf-mutes from the outset, then the unrelated women were also deaf-mutes from the outset, and we learned with regard to the unrelated women yes, he may consummate but no, he may not perform ḥalitza . was silent
llm_translation: Rather, no, from the outset, and from there deaf from the outset — it is considered a deaf person from the outset. And from his deaf relatives from the outset — non-Jewish deaf people are considered deaf from the outset, and we learned regarding non-Jewish deaf people: if he gathers, he is not liable to remove! He remains silent.

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב יוֹסֵף, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַאי טַעְמָא תּוֹתְבֵיהּ מֵהָא, דְּיָכֵול לְשַׁנּוֹיֵי לָךְ: אֲחָיוֹת — חֵרְשׁוֹת מֵעִיקָּרָא, נׇכְרִיּוֹת — פִּקְּחוֹת וְאַחַר כָּךְ נִתְחָרְשׁוּ.
human_translation: When came before Rav Yosef said to him: What is the reason that you raised an objection to him on this? For he could teach, to you, The sisters deaf-mutes at the outset, the unrelated women competent women who later became deaf-mutes.
llm_translation: When he came before Rav Yosef, he said to him: "What is the reason that you write it this way, that it could be changed for you: 'achayot' - originally deaf, 'nokhriyot' - originally hearing, and afterwards they became deaf."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אִיבְּעִי לָךְ לְאוֹתֹבֵיהּ מֵהָא: שְׁנֵי אַחִין חֵרְשִׁין נְשׂוּאִין שְׁתֵּי אֲחָיוֹת פִּקְּחוֹת, אוֹ שְׁתֵּי אֲחָיוֹת חֵרְשׁוֹת, אוֹ שְׁתֵּי אֲחָיוֹת אַחַת פִּקַּחַת וְאַחַת חֵרֶשֶׁת. וְכֵן שְׁתֵּי אֲחָיוֹת חֵרְשׁוֹת נְשׂוּאוֹת לִשְׁנֵי אַחִין פִּקְחִין, אוֹ לִשְׁנֵי אַחִין חֵרְשִׁין, אוֹ לִשְׁנֵי אַחִין אֶחָד פִּקֵּחַ וְאֶחָד חֵרֵשׁ — הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ פְּטוּרוֹת מִן הַחֲלִיצָה וּמִן הַיִּיבּוּם. וְאִם הָיוּ נׇכְרִיּוֹת — יִכְנוֹסוּ, וְאִם רָצוּ לְהוֹצִיא — יוֹצִיאוּ.
human_translation: Rather, you should have raised an objection to him from this of two deaf-mute brothers married two competent sisters or two deaf-mute sisters or two sisters, one competent and one a deaf-mute; and likewise, two deaf-mute sisters married to two competent brothers or to two deaf-mute brothers or to two brothers, one halakhically competent and one a deaf-mute, these are exempt from ḥalitza and from levirate marriage And if, were unrelated should consummate and if they wish to divorce they may divorce
llm_translation: Rather, it was asked of you from this: Two deaf brothers married two sisters who can hear, or two sisters who are deaf, or two sisters, one who can hear and one who is deaf. Similarly, two deaf sisters married to two brothers who can hear, or to two deaf brothers, or to two brothers, one who can hear and one who is deaf — these are exempt from halitzah and yibbum. And if they were non-Jewish women — they should convert, and if they wish to leave — they may leave.

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִילֵּימָא בְּפִקְחִים וּלְבַסּוֹף נִתְחָרְשׁוּ, מִי מָצֵי מַפְּקִי? וְהָתְנַן: נִשְׁתַּטֵּית — לֹא יוֹצִיא, נִתְחָרֵשׁ הוּא אוֹ נִשְׁתַּטָּה — לֹא יוֹצִיא עוֹלָמִית!
human_translation: What are the circumstances? If we say men who were competent and later became deaf-mutes, then can they release them? But didn’t we learn If she became mentally incompetent, he may not divorce her; if he became a deaf-mute or mentally incompetent, he may never divorce her?
llm_translation: "How are they similar? If you say that they are both perforated and ultimately sealed, who can extract the blood? But we learned: 'If it splattered - he may not remove it; whether it was sealed or splattered - he may not remove it permanently!'"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לָאו אַחֵרְשִׁין מֵעִיקָּרָא, וּמִדְּהֵן חֵרְשִׁין מֵעִיקָּרָא — אִינְהוּ נָמֵי חֵרְשׁוֹת מֵעִיקָּרָא, וְקָתָנֵי: אִם הָיוּ נׇכְרִיּוֹת — יִכְנוֹסוּ. יִכְנוֹסוּ — אִין, יַחְלֹצוּ — לָא! תְּיוּבְתָּא דְּרַבָּה תְּיוּבְתָּא.
human_translation: Rather, is it not men who were deaf-mutes at the outset? And since they were deaf-mutes at the outset, the women were also deaf-mutes at the outset, and it is taught If, they were unrelated should consummate Yes, they should consummate but no, they should not perform ḥalitza . the refutation of Rabba is a conclusive refutation.
llm_translation: Rather, not others from the outset, and from them others from the outset — they are also considered others from the outset, and it teaches: If they were foreign women — they should enter. They should enter — no, they should leave! A refutation of Rabba is a refutation.

hebrew_text: קְטַנָּה וְחֵרֶשֶׁת וְכוּ׳. אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: אַשְׁכַּחְתֵּיהּ לְרַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה וּלְרַב חָנָא חַתְנֵיהּ, דְּיָתְבִי וְקָמַקְווּ אַקְווֹתָא בְּשׁוּקָא דְּפוּמְבְּדִיתָא וְאָמְרִי, הָא דִּתְנַן: קְטַנָּה וְחֵרֶשֶׁת, אֵין בִּיאַת אַחַת מֵהֶן פּוֹטֶרֶת צָרָתָהּ, הָנֵי מִילֵּי דִּנְפַלָה לֵיהּ מֵאָחִיו פִּקֵּחַ, דְּלָא יָדְעִינַן אִי בִּקְטַנָּה נִיחָא לֵיהּ אִי בְּחֵרֶשֶׁת נִיחָא לֵיהּ
human_translation: minor and a deaf-mute, Rav Naḥman said: I found Rav Adda bar Ahava and Rav Ḥana his son-in-law sitting and posing challenges [ kamakvu akvata ] in the marketplace of Pumbedita, and saying That we learned that in the case of a minor and a deaf-mute, consummation with one of them does not exempt her rival wife, applies when she happened him of his competent brother. we do not know if the minor was preferable to or if the deaf-mute was preferable to him.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Ketanah ve-chereshet ve-ku'. Amar Rav Nachman: Ashkachtei le-Rav Adda bar Ahava ule-Rav Chana chatnei, de-yatvei ve-kamakvu akvata b'shuka de-pumbadita ve-amrei, ha di-tanan: Ketanah ve-chereshet, ein bi'at achad mehen poteret tzaratah, hanei milei di-nafalah lei me-achi pikach, de-la yadainan i be-ketanah nicha lei i be-chereshet nicha lei." English translation: "A minor and a deaf-mute, and the like. Rav Nachman said: I found it with Rav Adda bar Ahava and with Rav Chana his son-in-law, who were sitting and buying merchandise in the market of Pumbadita, and they said: as we learned: A minor and a deaf-mute, if one of them falls into her hands, she is exempt from her affliction, these are the words of one who is discerning, for we do not know whether he prefers a minor or a deaf-mute."

hebrew_text: אִי בִּקְטַנָּה נִיחָא לֵיהּ — דְּאָתְיָא לִכְלַל דֵּיעָה, אִי בְּחֵרֶשֶׁת נִיחָא — דִּגְדוֹלָה הִיא, וּבַת בִּיאָה הִיא. אֲבָל נָפְלָה מֵאָחִיו חֵרֵשׁ — וַדַּאי בְּחֵרֶשֶׁת נִיחָא לֵיהּ, דְּבַת בִּיאָה הִיא וּבַת מִינֵּיהּ הִיא.
human_translation: if the minor was preferable to him, since she would have come to full intellectual capacity or if the deaf-mute was preferable, since she is an adult and she is suitable sexual intercourse. However, if she happened his brother deaf-mute, certainly the female deaf-mute was preferable to him, as she was suitable for sexual intercourse and was of his kind,
llm_translation: If in a small vessel it is suitable for him - for it comes to include knowledge, if in a large vessel it is suitable - for it is great, and it is a daughter of understanding. But if a shard falls from its brother - surely in a large vessel it is suitable for him, for it is a daughter of understanding and a daughter of its kind.

hebrew_text: וְאָמֵינָא לְהוּ אֲנָא: אֲפִילּוּ נְפַלָה לֵיהּ מֵאָחִיו חֵרֵשׁ נָמֵי מְסַפְּקָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: And I, said to them: Even if she happened him of his brother deaf-mute, it is still uncertain,
llm_translation: And I would say to them: Even if a deaf-mute falls from his brother, he is still in doubt.

hebrew_text: כֵּיצַד תַּקָּנָתָן? אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא אָמַר רַב: כּוֹנֵס הַחֵרֶשֶׁת וּמוֹצִיאָהּ בְּגֵט, וּקְטַנָּה תַּמְתִּין עַד שֶׁתַּגְדִּיל, וְתַחְלוֹץ.
human_translation: How can their be rectified, Rav Ḥisda said that Rav said: He consummates the deaf-mute and releases her by means of a bill of divorce. The minor must wait until she reaches majority and then perform ḥalitza .
llm_translation: "How is their repair? Rav Ḥisdah said in the name of Rav: One gathers the potsherd and brings it out in a divorce document, and the minor waits until she grows up, and then she may remove it."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ, קָסָבַר רַב: חֵרֶשֶׁת קְנוּיָה וּמְשׁוּיֶּירֶת, קְטַנָּה קְנוּיָה וְאֵינָהּ קְנוּיָה. דְּאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ חֵרֶשֶׁת קְנוּיָה וְאֵינָהּ קְנוּיָה, קְטַנָּה קְנוּיָה וּמְשׁוּיֶּירֶת, חֵרֶשֶׁת אַמַּאי כּוֹנֵס וּמוֹצִיאָהּ בְּגֵט?
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: Learn from this that Rav holds a married deaf-mute is partially acquired, and a minor is either acquired or not acquired, For if it enters your mind that the deaf-mute is either acquired or not acquired, while the minor is partially acquired, then the deaf-mute why should he consummate and release her with a bill of divorce?
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: Hear from it, Rav holds: A deaf woman who is designated and divorced, a minor who is designated and is not designated. For if it were to enter your mind that a deaf woman who is designated is not designated, a minor who is designated and divorced, why does a deaf woman gather and divorce her with a bill of divorce?

hebrew_text: תִּיתֵּיב גַּבֵּיהּ מִמָּה נַפְשָׁךְ: אִי קְנוּיָה הִיא — הָא קְנוּיָה הִיא, וְאִי לָאו קְנוּיָה הִיא — הָא נׇכְרִית בְּעָלְמָא הִיא.
human_translation: Let her stay with him, whichever way you If she is acquired, then she is acquired; and if she is not acquired then she is merely an unrelated
llm_translation: He sat and asked him, "From what is your soul? If it is a purchase - it is a purchase, and if it is not a purchase - she is a foreigner in the world."

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא, קְטַנָּה אַמַּאי תַּמְתִּין עַד שֶׁתַּגְדִּיל וְתַחְלוֹץ? תִּיתֵּיב גַּבֵּיהּ, אִי קְנוּיָה הִיא — הָא קְנוּיָה הִיא, אִי לָאו קְנוּיָה הִיא — נוּכְרִיתָא בְּעָלְמָא הִיא! אִם כֵּן, חֵרֶשֶׁת בְּמָה תִּיפּוֹק.
human_translation: And if you would say Why should wait until she reaches majority and performs ḥalitza ? Let her stay with him: If she is acquired, then she is acquired; if she is not acquired then she is merely an unrelated if that is so, how shall the deaf-mute be released?
llm_translation: And if you will say, why does the mother wait until she grows up and becomes mature? He answered him, if she is a purchased maidservant - she is a purchased maidservant, if she is not a purchased maidservant - she is a foreigner in the world! If so, from where will the prohibition of a deaf-mute woman arise.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: הָכִי נָמֵי מִיסְתַּבְּרָא, כִּדְקָא מְתָרֵץ רַב חִסְדָּא אַלִּיבָּא דְרַב,
human_translation: Rav Sheshet said: Indeed, this too stands to reason, that Rav Ḥisda explained in accordance with of Rav
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet said: So it appears to me, as Rav Ḥisdah explained in the name of Rav.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: שְׁנֵי אַחִין נְשׂוּאִין שְׁתֵּי אֲחָיוֹת יְתוֹמוֹת, קְטַנָּה וְחֵרֶשֶׁת, מֵת בַּעְלָהּ שֶׁל קְטַנָּה — חֵרֶשֶׁת יוֹצְאָה בְּגֵט, וּקְטַנָּה תַּמְתִּין עַד שֶׁתַּגְדִּיל, וְתַחְלוֹץ.
human_translation: As it is taught Two brothers married two orphaned sisters, a minor and a deaf-mute. the husband of the minor dies the deaf-mute must be released by means of a bill of divorce and the minor must wait until she reaches majority and perform ḥalitza .
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Two brothers married two orphan sisters, one minor and one deaf-mute. If the husband of the minor sister dies, the deaf-mute sister is divorced with a bill of divorce, and the minor sister must wait until she grows up and then perform ḥalitzah.

hebrew_text: מֵת בַּעְלָהּ שֶׁל חֵרֶשֶׁת — קְטַנָּה יוֹצְאָה בְּגֵט, וְחֵרֶשֶׁת אֲסוּרָה לְעוֹלָם. וְאִם בָּא עַל הַחֵרֶשֶׁת — נוֹתֵן לָהּ גֵּט, וְהוּתְּרָה.
human_translation: If the deaf-mute’s husband dies, the minor must be released by means of a bill of divorce and the deaf-mute is forbidden forever. And if he consummates with the deaf-mute, he gives her a bill of divorce and she is released.
llm_translation: The husband of a deaf-mute woman - a minor can issue a divorce, and a deaf-mute woman is forbidden forever. And if one engages in relations with a deaf-mute woman - he gives her a divorce, and she is permitted.

hebrew_text: אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא חֵרֶשֶׁת קְנוּיָה וּמְשׁוּיֶּירֶת, קְטַנָּה קְנוּיָה וְאֵינָהּ קְנוּיָה — מִשּׁוּם הָכִי דְּכִי בָּא עַל הַחֵרֶשֶׁת נוֹתֵן לָהּ גֵּט וְהוּתְּרָה, דְּאָמְרַתְּ מִמָּה נַפְשָׁךְ: אִי קְטַנָּה קְנוּיָה הִיא — הָא נָפְקָא מִשּׁוּם אֲחוֹת אִשָּׁה, אִי לָאו קְנוּיָה — שַׁפִּיר מְיַבֵּם.
human_translation: Granted, if you say that the deaf-mute is partially acquired, the minor is either acquired or not acquired; it is due to that that if he consummates with the deaf-mute, he gives her a bill of divorce and she is released. You would say whichever way you If the minor is acquired then the deaf-mute is released due to the sister of his wife, And if the minor is not acquired at all, then he may rightly consummate the levirate marriage
llm_translation: If you say that a deaf-mute is considered legally acquired and a minor is not considered legally acquired - it is because when one comes to a deaf-mute, he gives her a bill of divorce and she is permitted, as you say, "from what is your soul." If she is a minor, it emerges due to the prohibition of marrying a woman's sister. If she is not legally acquired, it is proper to perform levirate marriage.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ חֵרֶשֶׁת קְנוּיָה וְאֵינָהּ קְנוּיָה, קְטַנָּה קְנוּיָה וּמְשׁוּיֶּירֶת, כִּי בָא עַל חֵרֶשֶׁת אַמַּאי נוֹתֵן גֵּט וְהוּתְּרָה? הָוְיָא לֵיהּ בִּיאָה פְּסוּלָה — וּבִיאָה פְּסוּלָה לָא פָּטְרָה.
human_translation: But if you say that the deaf-mute is either acquired or not acquired, while the minor is partially acquired, when he has intercourse with the deaf-mute, why should he give her a bill of divorce and be released? It is an invalid sexual act, And an invalid sexual act does not exempt her,
llm_translation: Rather, if you say that a deaf-mute is considered legally married but not legally married, a minor is considered legally married and is permitted, for when one comes upon a deaf-mute, why should he give a bill of divorce and she be permitted? Let him have forbidden intercourse with her - and forbidden intercourse does not exempt her.

hebrew_text: הָא מַנִּי — רַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה הִיא, דְּאָמַר: בִּיאָה פְּסוּלָה, פּוֹטֶרֶת מֵחֲלִיצָה.
human_translation: whose is this It is Rabbi Neḥemya, who said: An invalid sexual act exempts from ḥalitza .
llm_translation: This is a dispute — Rabbi Nechemiah holds, as he said: Invalid intercourse exempts from chalitzah.

hebrew_text: אִי רַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה, אֵימָא סֵיפָא: מִי שֶׁהָיָה נָשׂוּי שְׁתֵּי יְתוֹמוֹת, קְטַנָּה וְחֵרֶשֶׁת, וּמֵת. בָּא יָבָם עַל הַקְּטַנָּה, וְחָזַר וּבָא עַל הַחֵרֶשֶׁת, אוֹ שֶׁבָּא אָחִיו עַל הַחֵרֶשֶׁת — נֶאֶסְרוּ שְׁתֵּיהֶן עָלָיו. כֵּיצַד תַּקָּנָתָן? חֵרֶשֶׁת יוֹצֵאת בְּגֵט, וּקְטַנָּה תַּמְתִּין עַד שֶׁתַּגְדִּיל, וְתַחְלוֹץ.
human_translation: If this is Rabbi Neḥemya, say the latter clause one who was married two orphans, a minor and a deaf-mute, and he died. If the yavam had intercourse with the minor and then had intercourse with the deaf-mute, or if one of his brothers had intercourse with the deaf-mute they are both forbidden to How be rectified? The deaf-mute must be released with a bill of divorce, and the minor must wait until she reaches majority and perform ḥalitza .
llm_translation: If it is Rabbi Nechemiah, say the latter part: One who was married to two orphans, a minor and a deaf-mute, and he died. The yavam came to the minor, then returned and came to the deaf-mute, or if his brother came to the deaf-mute - both of them are forbidden to him. How is their resolution? The deaf-mute is divorced with a get, and the minor waits until she grows up, and then she performs chalitzah.

hebrew_text: אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא חֵרֶשֶׁת קְנוּיָה וּמְשׁוּיֶּירֶת, קְטַנָּה קְנוּיָה וְאֵינָהּ קְנוּיָה, וְרַבָּנַן הִיא — מִשּׁוּם הָכִי תַּמְתִּין עַד שֶׁתַּגְדִּיל, וְתַחְלוֹץ — דְּדִלְמָא קָדֵים וּבָעֵיל חֵרֶשֶׁת בְּרֵישָׁא, וְהָוְיָא לֵיהּ בִּיאָה דִקְטַנָּה בִּיאָה פְּסוּלָה.
human_translation: Granted, if you say a deaf-mute is partially acquired, a minor is either acquired or not acquired; and in accordance the Rabbis For these the minor must wait until she reaches majority and perform ḥalitza . as perhaps he may precipitately have intercourse with the deaf-mute first, so that the intercourse with the minor is considered an invalid sexual act,
llm_translation: If you say that a deaf-mute is considered legally married and capable of being divorced, a minor is considered legally married but not capable of being divorced, and the Rabbis say — therefore, they wait until she grows up and becomes mature, and then she may perform ḥalitzah — for perhaps she was first married to a deaf-mute, and the initial act of intercourse would render her subsequent marriage to a minor invalid.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ רַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה, הָא אָמַר בִּיאָה פְּסוּלָה פָּטְרָה!
human_translation: But if you say it is Rabbi Neḥemya, he said an invalid sexual act exempts her.
llm_translation: Rather, if you say Rabbi Nechemiah, this one said "a disqualified act of intercourse exempts."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ רַבָּנַן הִיא. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Rather, conclude from is the Rabbis. Learn from it.
llm_translation: Rather, hear from it, it is the opinion of the Rabbis. Hear from it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: מֵרֵישָׁא נָמֵי שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ דְּרַבָּנַן הִיא, דְּקָתָנֵי: אִם בָּא עַל הַחֵרֶשֶׁת — נוֹתֵן לָהּ גֵּט, וְהוּתְּרָה, וְלָא קָתָנֵי: אִם בָּא עַל הַקְּטַנָּה — נוֹתֵן לָהּ גֵּט וְהוּתְּרָה.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: One may learn also from the first clause that it is the Rabbis, as it teaches: If he consummates with the a deaf-mute, he gives her a bill of divorce and she is released. And it does not teach: If he consummates with the minor, he gives her a bill of divorce and she is released.
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said: From the beginning, it appears to be the opinion of the Sages, as it is taught: If one engages in relations with a deaf-mute woman - he gives her a bill of divorce, and she is permitted. And it does not teach: If one engages in relations with a minor - he gives her a bill of divorce and she is permitted.

hebrew_text: אִי מִשּׁוּם הָא לָא אִירְיָא: חֵרֶשֶׁת, דְּלֵית לַהּ תַּקַּנְתָּא דְהֶיתֵּירָא — קָתָנֵי תַּקַּנְתָּא דְאִיסּוּרָא. קְטַנָּה, דְּאִית לַהּ תַּקַּנְתָּא דְהֶיתֵּירָא — לָא תָּנֵי תַּקַּנְתָּא דְאִיסּוּרָא.
human_translation: If it is due to that there is no argument, the deaf-mute, whose has no rectification that is permitted teaches a prohibited rectification; the minor, whose has a permitted rectification, does not teach a prohibited rectification.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "If it is not for this, it is called: Chereshet, that does not have a remedy of leniency - it teaches the remedy of stringency. Ketanah, that has a remedy of leniency - it does not teach the remedy of stringency."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מִי שֶׁהָיָה נָשׂוּי לִשְׁתֵּי יְתוֹמוֹת קְטַנּוֹת, וּמֵת, וּבָא יָבָם עַל הָרִאשׁוֹנָה, וְחָזַר וּבָא עַל הַשְּׁנִיָּה, אוֹ שֶׁבָּא אָחִיו עַל הַשְּׁנִיָּה —
human_translation: a man was married to two minor orphans and he died, and a yavam engaged in intercourse with the first and then engaged in intercourse with the second, or if his brother engaged in intercourse with the second,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who was married to two minor orphans, and he died, and the first brother-in-law performed yibum with the older one, and then went and performed yibum with the younger one, or if his brother performed yibum with the younger one —

hebrew_text: לֹא פָּסַל אֶת הָרִאשׁוֹנָה, וְכֵן שְׁתֵּי חֵרְשׁוֹת.
human_translation: did not disqualify the first Likewise, two female deaf-mutes,
llm_translation: He did not disqualify the first one, and likewise two deaf-mutes.

hebrew_text: קְטַנָּה וְחֵרֶשֶׁת. בָּא יָבָם עַל הַקְּטַנָּה, וְחָזַר וּבָא עַל הַחֵרֶשֶׁת, אוֹ שֶׁבָּא אָחִיו עַל הַחֵרֶשֶׁת — פָּסַל אֶת הַקְּטַנָּה.
human_translation: a minor and a deaf-mute, the yavam engaged in intercourse with the minor and then engaged in intercourse with the deaf-mute, or if his brother engaged in intercourse with the deaf-mute, disqualified the minor
llm_translation: The text reads: "A minor and a deaf-mute. If the yavam came to the minor, then returned and came to the deaf-mute, or if his brother came to the deaf-mute - he disqualifies the minor."

hebrew_text: בָּא יָבָם עַל הַחֵרֶשֶׁת, וְחָזַר וּבָא עַל הַקְּטַנָּה, אוֹ שֶׁבָּא אָחִיו עַל הַקְּטַנָּה — פָּסַל אֶת הַחֵרֶשֶׁת.
human_translation: the yavam engaged in intercourse with the deaf-mute and then engaged in intercourse with the minor, or if his brother engaged in intercourse with the minor, disqualified the deaf-mute
llm_translation: A yavam came upon the deaf-mute, and then returned and came upon the minor, or if his brother came upon the minor - he disqualifies the deaf-mute.

hebrew_text: פִּקַּחַת וְחֵרֶשֶׁת. בָּא יָבָם עַל הַפִּקַּחַת, וְחָזַר וּבָא עַל הַחֵרֶשֶׁת, אוֹ שֶׁבָּא אָחִיו עַל הַחֵרֶשֶׁת — לֹא פָּסַל אֶת הַפִּקַּחַת.
human_translation: competent and a deaf-mute, the yavam engaged in intercourse with the competent woman and then engaged in intercourse with the deaf-mute, or his brother engaged in intercourse with the deaf-mute, did not disqualify the competent woman
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Pikachat and Chereshet. If the yavam came to the Pikachat, and then returned and came to the Chereshet, or if his brother came to the Chereshet - he does not disqualify the Pikachat."

hebrew_text: בָּא יָבָם עַל הַחֵרֶשֶׁת וְחָזַר וּבָא עַל הַפִּקַּחַת, אוֹ שֶׁבָּא אָחִיו עַל הַפִּקַּחַת — פָּסַל אֶת הַחֵרֶשֶׁת.
human_translation: the yavam engaged in intercourse with the deaf-mute and then engaged in intercourse with the competent woman, or if his brother engaged in intercourse with the competent woman, disqualified the deaf-mute
llm_translation: A yavam came to the deaf-mute woman, then returned and came to the sighted woman, or if his brother came to the sighted woman - he disqualifies the deaf-mute woman.

hebrew_text: גְּדוֹלָה וּקְטַנָּה. בָּא יָבָם עַל הַגְּדוֹלָה, וְחָזַר וּבָא עַל הַקְּטַנָּה, אוֹ שֶׁבָּא אָחִיו עַל הַקְּטַנָּה — לֹא פָּסַל אֶת הַגְּדוֹלָה. בָּא יָבָם עַל הַקְּטַנָּה, וְחָזַר וּבָא עַל הַגְּדוֹלָה, אוֹ שֶׁבָּא אָחִיו עַל הַגְּדוֹלָה — פָּסַל אֶת הַקְּטַנָּה. רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: מְלַמְּדִין הַקְּטַנָּה שֶׁתְּמָאֵן בּוֹ.
human_translation: an adult and a minor, the yavam engaged in sexual intercourse with the adult, then engaged in intercourse with the minor, or if his brother engaged in intercourse with the minor, did not disqualify the adult the yavam engaged in intercourse with the minor, and then engaged in intercourse with the adult, or if his brother engaged in intercourse with the adult, disqualified the minor Rabbi Elazar says: instructs the minor to refuse him
llm_translation: Great and small. If the yavam came to the older one, and then came to the younger one, or if his brother came to the younger one - he does not disqualify the older one. If the yavam came to the younger one, and then came to the older one, or if his brother came to the older one - he disqualifies the younger one. Rabbi Eliezer says: We teach the younger one that she is refusing him.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר. וְכֵן אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Elazar, and likewise Rabbi Elazar said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Elazar
llm_translation: Gemara: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Elazar. And similarly, Rabbi Elazar said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Elazar.

hebrew_text: וּצְרִיכָא, דְּאִי אִיתְּמַר בְּהָא קַמַּיְיתָא, בְּהָךְ קָאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר — מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא קַיֵּים מִצְוַת יִיבּוּם, אֲבָל בְּהָא, דְּאִיקַּיַּים מִצְוַת יִיבּוּם — אֵימָא תַּרְוַיְיהוּ לִפְּקוּ בְּגֵט,
human_translation: necessary For if this was stated only in that earlier It was in that that Shmuel stated the halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer, due to did not fulfill the mitzva of levirate marriage But for this where the mitzva of levirate marriage is fulfilled, say that they must both be released with a bill of divorce.
llm_translation: The matter is, for if it was stated in this case before you, in that case Shmuel said the halakha is like Rabbi Eliezer — because he does not fulfill the mitzvah of levirate marriage. But in this case, where he fulfills the mitzvah of levirate marriage — say they should both go out with a divorce document.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן בְּהָא, מִשּׁוּם דִּגְדוֹלָה רַמְיָא קַמֵּיהּ. אֲבָל אִידַּךְ — לָא. צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: if teaches us in this It is because the adult happened before him however, other not necessary
llm_translation: And if we were to hear in this, because a great height is before him. But the other one - no. It is necessary.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ יָבָם קָטָן, שֶׁבָּא עַל יְבָמָה קְטַנָּה — יִגְדְּלוּ זֶה עִם זֶה. בָּא עַל יְבָמָה גְּדוֹלָה — תְּגַדְּלֶנּוּ.
human_translation: a minor yavam engaged in sexual intercourse with a minor yevama , they should grow up together, If he engaged in sexual intercourse with an adult yevama , she should raise him,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If a minor yavam (levir) came to a minor yevamah (levirate widow) - they shall grow up together. If he came to an adult yevamah - she shall raise him.

hebrew_text: הַיְּבָמָה שֶׁאָמְרָה בְּתוֹךְ שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם ״לֹא נִבְעַלְתִּי״ — כּוֹפִין אוֹתוֹ שֶׁיַּחְלוֹץ לָהּ. לְאַחַר שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם — מְבַקְּשִׁין הֵימֶנּוּ שֶׁיַּחְלוֹץ לָהּ. וּבִזְמַן שֶׁהוּא מוֹדֶה — אֲפִילּוּ לְאַחַר שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ כּוֹפִין אוֹתוֹ שֶׁיַּחְלוֹץ לָהּ.
human_translation: yevama said within thirty days I have not engaged in sexual intercourse forces him to perform ḥalitza with her. after thirty days asks him to perform ḥalitza with her, And when he admits even after twelve months, forces him to perform ḥalitza with her.
llm_translation: The yevamah who said within thirty days "I have not been intimate" - they force him to divorce her. After thirty days - they request from him to divorce her. And at a time when he admits - even after twelve months, they force him to divorce her.

hebrew_text: הַנּוֹדֶרֶת הֲנָאָה מִיְּבָמָהּ, בְּחַיֵּי בַּעְלָהּ — כּוֹפִין אוֹתוֹ שֶׁיַּחְלוֹץ לָהּ. לְאַחַר מִיתַת בַּעְלָהּ — מְבַקְּשִׁין הֵימֶנּוּ שֶׁיַּחְלוֹץ לָהּ. וְאִם נִתְכַּוְּונָה לְכָךְ — אֲפִילּוּ בְּחַיֵּי בַעְלָהּ מְבַקְּשִׁין הֵימֶנּוּ שֶׁיַּחְלוֹץ לָהּ.
human_translation: vows during her husband’s lifetime benefit from her yavam , forces him to perform ḥalitza with her after the death of her husband asks him to perform ḥalitza with her. And if she intended to do so, even during her husband’s lifetime, asks him to perform ḥalitza with her.
llm_translation: The one who makes a vow to abstain from yibum, during the lifetime of her husband — they force him to release her. After the death of her husband — they seek from him that he release her. And if she intended for this — even during the lifetime of her husband they seek from him that he release her.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ לֵימָא מַתְנִיתִין דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר. דְּתַנְיָא: קָטָן וּקְטַנָּה לֹא חוֹלְצִין וְלֹא מִתְיַיבְּמִין, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר.
human_translation: Let us say that the mishna is not in accordance with Rabbi Meir as it is taught A minor and a minor may not perform ḥalitza and may not enter into levirate marriage. the statement of Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: Gemara: Let us say a Mishnah that is not like Rabbi Meir. As it was taught: A minor boy and a minor girl do not perform chalitzah nor do they perform levirate marriage, the words of Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבִּי מֵאִיר, כִּי אָמַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר, גְּדוֹלָה לְקָטָן וּקְטַנָּה לְגָדוֹל, דְּחַד מִינַּיְיהוּ בִּיאָה דְאִיסּוּרָא הוּא. אֲבָל קָטָן הַבָּא עַל הַקְּטַנָּה, דְּתַרְוַיְיהוּ כִּי הֲדָדֵי נִינְהוּ, לָא אָמַר.
human_translation: You even say Rabbi Meir. When Rabbi Meir said an adult with a minor or a minor with an adult because for one of them it would be a forbidden sexual act, But a minor who has sexual intercourse with a minor where they are both similar to one another,
llm_translation: Even if you say it is Rabbi Meir, when Rabbi Meir said, "Great for small and small for great, for one of them is a forbidden act." But if a minor engages with another minor, since they are equal, he did not say.

hebrew_text: וְהָא קָתָנֵי: בָּא עַל יְבָמָה גְּדוֹלָה — תְּגַדְּלֶנּוּ! אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא חוֹזָאָה: בָּא שָׁאנֵי. וְהָא תְּגַדְּלֶנּוּ קָאָמַר, דְּכׇל בִּיאָה וּבִיאָה דְאִיסּוּרָא הוּא! אֶלָּא מְחַוַּורְתָּא מַתְנִיתִין דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר.
human_translation: But it is taught If he, engaged in sexual intercourse with an adult yevama , she should raise him, Rabbi Ḥanina Ḥoza’a said: It is different engaged in intercourse But it says that she should raise him, even though each and every sexual act is forbidden Rather, it is clear that the mishna is not in accordance with Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: The Gemara teaches: "He came to a large yevamah - you shall magnify him!" Rabbi Chanina Chozai said: "He came to a different matter." And when it says "you shall magnify him," it means that every act of intercourse is an act of prohibition! Rather, it is a teaching of the school of Menachorta, not in accordance with Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: קְרִי כָּאן ״לְהָקִים לְאָחִיו שֵׁם״, וְהַאי לָאו בַּר הָכִי הוּא! אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, אָמַר קְרָא: ״יְבָמָהּ יָבֹא עָלֶיהָ״ — כָּל דְּהוּ.
human_translation: here reads: to establish a name for his brother and this is incapable of doing so, Abaye said the verse states: “Her brother-in-law will have intercourse with her anyone,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Keri here 'to establish a name for his brother,' but this is not so! Abaye said, Scripture says: 'Her yavam shall perform yibum with her' - whoever it may be."

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: בְּלָאו הָכִי נָמֵי לָא מָצֵית אָמְרַתְּ, מִי אִיכָּא מִידֵּי דְּהַשְׁתָּא אֲסִירָא לֵיהּ וּלְבָתַר שַׁעְתָּא שַׁרְיָא? וְהָא אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: כׇּל יְבָמָה שֶׁאֵין אֲנִי קוֹרֵא בִּשְׁעַת נְפִילָה ״יְבָמָהּ יָבֹא עָלֶיהָ״ — הֲרֵי הִיא כְּאֵשֶׁת אָח שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ בָּנִים, וַאֲסוּרָה.
human_translation: Rava said: without this you still could not say there a case where she is forbidden to him now, and after some time she becomes permitted? Didn’t Rav Yehuda say Rav said: Any yevama to whom I cannot apply the verse “Her brother-in-law will have intercourse with her” at the time she happens before him is considered as if she were the wife of a brother who has children, and she is forbidden
llm_translation: Rava said: Without this, it is as if you did not find it, you said, "Who has it from the time that the cup is forbidden to him, and after an hour it is permitted?" But Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: Any yevamah that I do not read at the time of her fall, "Her yavam shall come upon her" - she is like the wife of a brother who has children, and she is forbidden.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא הָכִי נָמֵי! אָמַר קְרָא: ״כִּי יֵשְׁבוּ אַחִים יַחְדָּו״, אֲפִילּוּ בֶּן יוֹם אֶחָד.
human_translation: And say, indeed, The verse states: “If brothers dwell together” even one day old.
llm_translation: And why not say so! The verse says: "When brothers dwell together," even a one-day-old son.

hebrew_text: יְבָמָה שֶׁאָמְרָה בְּתוֹךְ שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם וְכוּ׳. מַאן תַּנָּא דְּעַד תְּלָתִין יוֹמִין מוֹקֵים אִינִישׁ אַנַּפְשֵׁיהּ?
human_translation: a yevama said within thirty days Who taught that for up to thirty days a person restrain himself
llm_translation: Yevamah she'amra betoch shloshim v'chul. Man tana de'ad t'latin yomin mokeim inish anafsheih? Translation: A yevamah who said within thirty days, etc. Who is the Tanna that until thirty days a person establishes himself?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: רַבִּי מֵאִיר הִיא. דְּתַנְיָא: טַעֲנַת בְּתוּלִים — כׇּל שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: It is Rabbi Meir, as it is taught a claim concerning virginity, for thirty days the statement of Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yochanan: It is the opinion of Rabbi Meir. As it was taught: The claim of virgins - for all thirty days, these are the words of Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: נִסְתְּרָה — לְאַלְתַּר, לֹא נִסְתְּרָה — אַף לְאַחַר כַּמָּה שָׁנִים.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: If she was secluded a claim concerning virginity immediately. But if she was not secluded even several years later.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: If it was hidden - immediately; if it was not hidden - even after many years.

hebrew_text: רַבָּה אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבִּי יוֹסֵי. עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הָתָם אֶלָּא בַּאֲרוּסָתוֹ דְּגִיס בַּהּ. אֲבָל אֵשֶׁת אָחִיו —
human_translation: Rabba said: You even say that Rabbi Yosei. Rabbi Yosei states there only one’s betrothed, to whom he is accustomed, but with regard to his brother’s wife,
llm_translation: Rabba said: Even if you say it is Rabbi Yosei. Until here, Rabbi Yosei did not say there, but only in his betrothed one he was strict with her. But his brother's wife—

hebrew_text: מִיבְזָז בְּזִיז מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: he is embarrassed with her.
llm_translation: From Bizzaz, she was taken.

hebrew_text: עַד שֶׁכּוֹפִין אוֹתוֹ לַחְלוֹץ — נִיכְפֶּנּוּ לְיַיבֵּם! אָמַר רַב: בְּשֶׁגִּיטָּהּ יוֹצֵא מִתַּחַת יָדָהּ.
human_translation: Before he is forced to perform ḥalitza , let us force him to consummate the levirate marriage. Rav said: where her bill of divorce is to be found in her hand.
llm_translation: Until they force him to divorce - he is subjected to yibum! Rav said: With her get, he is removed from under her hand.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: יְבָמָה שֶׁאָמְרָה בְּתוֹךְ שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם ״לֹא נִבְעַלְתִּי״ — בֵּין שֶׁהוּא אוֹמֵר ״בָּעַלְתִּי״, בֵּין שֶׁהוּא אוֹמֵר ״לֹא בָּעַלְתִּי״, כּוֹפִין אוֹתוֹ שֶׁיַּחְלוֹץ לָהּ. לְאַחַר שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם — מְבַקְּשִׁין הֵימֶנּוּ שֶׁיַּחְלוֹץ לָהּ.
human_translation: raises an objection: If, within thirty days, a yevama said: I have not engaged in sexual intercourse with him, then whether he says: I did engage in intercourse, or whether he says: I did not engage in intercourse, forces him to perform ḥalitza . after thirty days asks him to perform ḥalitza .
llm_translation: Challenger: A yevamah who said within thirty days "I have not been married" - whether he says "I have married" or whether he says "I have not married," they force him to perform chalitzah for her. After thirty days - they seek from him to perform chalitzah for her.

hebrew_text: הִיא אוֹמֶרֶת ״נִבְעַלְתִּי״, וְהוּא אוֹמֵר ״לֹא בָּעַלְתִּי״ — הֲרֵי זֶה יוֹצִיא בְּגֵט. הוּא אוֹמֵר ״בָּעַלְתִּי״, וְהִיא אוֹמֶרֶת ״לֹא נִבְעַלְתִּי״ — אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁחָזַר וְאָמַר ״לֹא בָּעַלְתִּי״, צָרִיךְ גֵּט וַחֲלִיצָה.
human_translation: she says I engaged in sexual intercourse and he says: I did not engage in sexual intercourse then he releases with a bill of divorce, he says: I engaged in sexual intercourse and she says: I did not engage in sexual intercourse even if he retracted and said: I did not engage in sexual intercourse requires a bill of divorce and ḥalitza .
llm_translation: She says "I have been married," and he says "I have not married" - this one may issue a divorce. He says "I have married," and she says "I have not been married" - even though he retracts and says "I have not married," a divorce and a release are required.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אַמֵּי: צְרִיכָה חֲלִיצָה עִם גִּיטָּהּ. רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: הָתָם — גֵּט לְזִיקָּתוֹ, הָכָא — גֵּט לְבִיאָתוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Ami says: she requires ḥalitza with her bill of divorce Rav Ashi says: There, a bill of divorce for his levirate bond, Here, a bill of divorce for his consummation
llm_translation: Rabbi Ammi said: She requires halitzah with her get. Rav Ashi said: There — a get for his benefit, here — a get for her departure.

hebrew_text: הָנְהוּ שְׁנֵיהֶם מוֹדִים דַּאֲתוֹ לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרָבָא, אֲמַר לְהוּ רָבָא: חֲלוּצוּ לַהּ, וּשְׁרוֹ לַהּ תִּיגְרָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב שֵׁרֵבְיָא לְרָבָא: וְהָתַנְיָא צְרִיכָה גֵּט וַחֲלִיצָה! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִי תַּנְיָא — תַּנְיָא.
human_translation: A certain couple, who both admitted came before Rava. Rava said Arrange ḥalitza her, and resolve her case. Rav Sherevya said to Rava: But it is taught that she requires a bill of divorce and ḥalitza . He said to him: If this is taught, it is taught,
llm_translation: Behold, both of them admit that she came before Rava, Rava said to them: "Give her a bill of divorce, and release her from the bond." Rav She'revya said to Rava: "But doesn't it require both a bill of divorce and a declaration of release?" Rava said to him: "If it is taught, it is taught."

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ הוּן בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן מִדְּרַב נַחְמָן: צָרָתָהּ מַהוּ?
human_translation: Hon, son of Rav Naḥman, asked Rav Naḥman: What is her rival wife?
llm_translation: He asked his son, Hun, the son of Rav Nachman from Rav Nachman: What is its remedy?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: וְכִי מִפְּנֵי שֶׁאָנוּ כּוֹפִין וּמְבַקְּשִׁין, תֵּיאָסֵר צָרָה?
human_translation: He said to him: Just because we force or ask should the rival wife be forbidden
llm_translation: He said to him: And because we are forcing and demanding, should suffering be prohibited?

hebrew_text: הַנּוֹדֶרֶת הֲנָאָה וְכוּ׳. תְּנַן הָתָם, בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה הָיוּ אוֹמְרִים: שָׁלֹשׁ נָשִׁים יוֹצְאוֹת וְנוֹטְלוֹת כְּתוּבָּה.
human_translation: vows benefit We learned elsewhere At first they said: Three women are divorced and receive payment marriage contract.
llm_translation: The text reads: "The one who vows for pleasure, etc." We learned there: Initially, they used to say: Three women would go out and receive a bill of divorce.

hebrew_text: הָאוֹמֶרֶת ״טְמֵאָה אֲנִי לְךָ״, ״הַשָּׁמַיִם בֵּינִי לְבֵינָךְ״, ״נְטוּלָה אֲנִי מִן הַיְּהוּדִים״.
human_translation: who says: I am defiled to you. Heaven is between me and you, I am withdrawn from the Jews,
llm_translation: The one saying, "I am impure to you," "the heavens between me and you," "I am separated from the Jews."

hebrew_text: חָזְרוּ לוֹמַר, שֶׁלֹּא תְּהֵא אִשָּׁה נוֹתֶנֶת עֵינֶיהָ בְּאַחֵר וּמְקַלְקֶלֶת עַל בַּעְלָהּ. אֶלָּא: ״הָאוֹמֶרֶת טְמֵאָה אֲנִי לְךָ״ — תָּבִיא רְאָיָה לִדְבָרֶיהָ. ״הַשָּׁמַיִם בֵּינִי לְבֵינָךְ״ — יַעֲשׂוּ דֶּרֶךְ בַּקָּשָׁה.
human_translation: retracted and said that woman should not cast her eyes on another and, ruin with her husband Rather, who says I am defiled to you, must bring evidence for her statement Heaven is between me and you, deals by way of a request,
llm_translation: They returned to say, that a woman should not gaze at another man and belittle her husband. Rather: "She who says, 'I am impure to you' — let her bring proof for her words. 'May the heavens judge between me and you' — let them take the difficult path.

hebrew_text: ״נְטוּלָה אֲנִי מִן הַיְּהוּדִים״ — יָפֵר חֶלְקוֹ, וּמְשַׁמַּשְׁתּוֹ, וּתְהֵא נְטוּלָה מִן הַיְּהוּדִים.
human_translation: I am withdrawn from the Jews, must nullify his part and she may have relations with him. But she is withdrawn from Jews,
llm_translation: "I am separate from the Jews" - let his portion be beautiful, and let him serve, and let him be separate from the Jews.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: ״נְטוּלָה אֲנִי מִן הַיְּהוּדִים״ לַיָּבָם מַהוּ? מִי מַסְּקָה אַדַּעְתַּהּ דְּמָיֵית בַּעֲלָהּ וְנָפְלָה קַמֵּי יָבָם, אוֹ לָא.
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before I am withdrawn from the Jews what is with regard to the yavam does it enter her mind that her husband will die and she will happen before a yavam , or not?
llm_translation: He asked them: "If she says, 'I am removed from the Jews,' what is the law regarding the yavam? Who can establish her intent that she is comparing her husband and fell before the yavam, or not."

hebrew_text: רַב אָמַר: יָבָם אֵינוֹ כְּבַעַל, וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: יָבָם הֲרֵי הוּא כְּבַעַל. אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַב מִסְתַּבְּרָא, דִּתְנַן: הַנּוֹדֶרֶת הֲנָאָה מִיְּבָמָהּ בְּחַיֵּי בַעְלָהּ, כּוֹפִין אוֹתוֹ שֶׁיַּחְלוֹץ. וְאִם אִיתָא דְּמַסְּקָה אַדַּעְתַּהּ —
human_translation: Rav says: A yavam is not like a husband. And Shmuel says: A yavam is like a husband Abaye said: Ruling according to Rav’s stands to reason, as we learned vows during her husband’s lifetime benefit from her yavam , forces him to perform ḥalitza . And if it is that it enters her mind
llm_translation: Rav said: Yavam is not like a husband, and Shmuel said: Yavam is indeed like a husband. Abaye said: The reasoning of Rav is more plausible, as we learned: If a woman who is under a vow of abstinence from her yavam during the lifetime of her husband, they force him to divorce her. And if it is found that she has consented —

hebrew_text: ״מְבַקְּשִׁין״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ. הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן, בְּאִשָּׁה שֶׁיֵּשׁ לָהּ בָּנִים, דְּכוּלֵּי הַאי לָא מַסְּקָה אַדַּעְתַּהּ.
human_translation: should have said asks With what are we dealing here? With a woman who has children so that it did not enter her mind to the extent
llm_translation: "We inquire" - who is it that inquires? Here, with what are we dealing? With a woman who has children, for in all other cases her mind is not settled.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל אֵין לָהּ בָּנִים, מַאי — מְבַקְּשִׁין? אַדְּתָנֵי ״אִם נִתְכַּוְּונָה לְכָךְ, אֲפִילּוּ בְּחַיֵּי בַעְלָהּ מְבַקְּשִׁין מִמֶּנּוּ שֶׁיַּחְלוֹץ לָהּ״, לִיפְלוֹג וְלִיתְנֵי בְּדִידַהּ: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — בְּשֶׁיֵּשׁ לָהּ בָּנִים, אֲבָל אֵין לָהּ בָּנִים — מְבַקְּשִׁין!
human_translation: But if she has no children, what we ask instead of teaching if she intended to do so, even during her husband’s lifetime, asks him to perform ḥalitza with her, let distinguish and teach within itself, In what is this statement said? When she has children, but if she does not have children, asks
llm_translation: Talmudic text: But she has no children, what — do they seek? As it was taught: "If she intended for this, even in the lifetime of her husband they seek from him that he should divorce her," to distinguish and to say in her favor: In what case are these words said — when she has children, but if she has no children — they seek!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: לָא שְׁנָא יֵשׁ לָהּ בָּנִים, וְלָא שְׁנָא אֵין לָהּ בָּנִים — כּוֹפִין אוֹתוֹ כְּרַב, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Rather, learn from it there is no difference when she has children and when she does not have children. forces him in accordance with Rav, learn from it
llm_translation: Rather, hear the conclusion: whether she has sons or does not have sons - they force him like Rav, hear the conclusion.

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ בֵּית שַׁמַּאי
llm_translation: We will return to you, House of Shammai.

hebrew_text: חֵרֵשׁ שֶׁנָּשָׂא פִּקַּחַת וּפִקֵּחַ שֶׁנָּשָׂא חֵרֶשֶׁת, אִם רָצָה לְהוֹצִיא — יוֹצִיא, וְאִם רָצָה לְקַיֵּים — יְקַיֵּים. כְּשֵׁם שֶׁהוּא כּוֹנֵס בִּרְמִיזָה — כָּךְ הוּא מוֹצִיא בִּרְמִיזָה.
human_translation: a deaf-mute who married competent woman, and competent man who married a deaf-mute: If wants he may divorce and if he wants to maintain he may maintain just as he marries by intimation, so too, he divorces by intimation.
llm_translation: A deaf person who marries a woman who can hear, and a hearing person who marries a deaf woman, if he wishes to divorce - he may divorce, and if he wishes to fulfill his marital obligations - he may fulfill. Just as he gathers his thoughts through hints - so he may express his intentions through hints.

hebrew_text: פִּקֵּחַ שֶׁנָּשָׂא פִּקַּחַת וְנִתְחָרְשָׁה, אִם רָצָה — יוֹצִיא, וְאִם רָצָה — יְקַיֵּים. נִשְׁתַּטֵּית — לֹא יוֹצִיא. נִתְחָרֵשׁ הוּא אוֹ נִשְׁתַּטָּה — אֵינוֹ מוֹצִיאָהּ עוֹלָמִית.
human_translation: competent man who married a competent woman, and she became a deaf-mute: If he wants he may divorce and if he wants he may maintain If she became an imbecile, he may not divorce he became a deaf-mute or an imbecile he may never divorce her,
llm_translation: One who opens (the womb) and it was found to be opened, if he wishes - he may bring out, and if he wishes - he may uphold. If it was twisted - he may not bring out. If it was found to be opened or twisted - he does not bring it out forever.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן נוּרִי: מִפְּנֵי מָה הָאִשָּׁה שֶׁנִּתְחָרְשָׁה יוֹצְאָה, וְהָאִישׁ שֶׁנִּתְחָרֵשׁ אֵינוֹ מוֹצִיא? אָמְרוּ לוֹ: אֵינוֹ דּוֹמֶה הָאִישׁ הַמְגָרֵשׁ לָאִשָּׁה הַמִּתְגָּרֶשֶׁת, שֶׁהָאִשָּׁה יוֹצְאָה לִרְצוֹנָהּ וְשֶׁלֹּא לִרְצוֹנָהּ, וְהָאִישׁ אֵינוֹ מוֹצִיא אֶלָּא לִרְצוֹנוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Nuri said: For what the woman who becomes a deaf-mute, may divorce her, but the man who becomes a deaf-mute, he may not divorce They said to him: The man who divorces is not similar to the woman who is divorced, as the woman is divorced she is willing or unwilling. And, the man divorces only willingly,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan ben Nuri said: "Why is it that a woman who is divorced can leave, but a man who is divorced cannot? They said to him: A man who divorces is not comparable to a woman who is divorced, for the woman leaves willingly or unwillingly, but the man only divorces according to his will."

hebrew_text: הֵעִיד רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן גּוּדְגְּדָא עַל הַחֵרֶשֶׁת שֶׁהִשִּׂיאָהּ אָבִיהָ שֶׁהִיא יוֹצְאָה בְּגֵט. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: אַף זוֹ כַּיּוֹצֵא בָּהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Gudgada testified with regard to a female deaf-mute whose father married her off that she can be divorced with a bill of divorce They said to him: This too, a similar
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan ben Gudguda testified regarding the deaf-mute woman that her father married her off with a divorce document. They said to him: This is also considered as if she is divorced.

hebrew_text: שְׁנֵי אַחִין חֵרְשִׁין נְשׂוּאִין לִשְׁתֵּי אֲחָיוֹת חֵרְשׁוֹת, אוֹ לִשְׁתֵּי אֲחָיוֹת פִּקְּחוֹת, אוֹ לִשְׁתֵּי אֲחָיוֹת אַחַת חֵרֶשֶׁת וְאַחַת פִּקַּחַת. אוֹ שְׁתֵּי אֲחָיוֹת חֵרְשׁוֹת (נְשׂוּאִין) [נְשׂוּאוֹת] לִשְׁנֵי אַחִין פִּקְחִין, אוֹ לִשְׁנֵי אַחִין חֵרְשִׁין, אוֹ לִשְׁנֵי אַחִין אֶחָד חֵרֵשׁ וְאֶחָד פִּקֵּחַ — הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ פְּטוּרִין מִן הַחֲלִיצָה וּמִן הַיִּיבּוּם. וְאִם הָיוּ נׇכְרִיּוֹת — יִכְנוֹסוּ, וְאִם רָצוּ לְהוֹצִיא — יוֹצִיאוּ.
human_translation: two deaf-mute brothers married to two deaf-mute sisters or to two competent sisters, or to two sisters, one a deaf-mute and one competent; or two deaf-mute sisters married to two competent brothers or to two deaf-mute brothers or to two brothers, one a deaf-mute and one competent, these are exempt from ḥalitza and from levirate marriage. And if they were unrelated women, may marry and if they want to divorce they may divorce
llm_translation: Two deaf brothers are married to two deaf sisters, or to two hearing sisters, or to one deaf sister and one hearing sister. Or two deaf sisters are married to two hearing brothers, or to two deaf brothers, or to one deaf brother and one hearing brother — these are exempt from halitzah and yibbum. If they were non-Jewish women — they should convert, and if they wish to leave — they may leave.

hebrew_text: שְׁנֵי אַחִין, אֶחָד חֵרֵשׁ וְאֶחָד פִּקֵּחַ, נְשׂוּאִין לִשְׁתֵּי אֲחָיוֹת פִּקְּחוֹת. מֵת חֵרֵשׁ בַּעַל הַפִּקַּחַת, מָה יַעֲשֶׂה פִּקֵּחַ בַּעַל הַפִּקַּחַת — תֵּצֵא מִשּׁוּם אֲחוֹת אִשָּׁה.
human_translation: two brothers, one deaf-mute and one competent, married to two competent sisters, the deaf-mute married to the competent died, what should the competent married to the competent do? released due to a wife’s sister.
llm_translation: Two brothers, one deaf and one hearing, married to two sisters who can hear. If the deaf brother dies, the husband of the hearing sister, what should the hearing brother do? He should separate because of the sister-in-law.

hebrew_text: מֵת פִּקֵּחַ בַּעַל הַפִּקַּחַת, מָה יַעֲשֶׂה חֵרֵשׁ בַּעַל פִּקַּחַת — מוֹצִיא אִשְׁתּוֹ בְּגֵט, וְאֵשֶׁת אָחִיו אֲסוּרָה לְעוֹלָם.
human_translation: competent married to the competent died, what should the deaf-mute married to the competent do? He divorces his wife with a bill of divorce, And his brother’s wife is forbidden forever,
llm_translation: A dead Pikach Ba'al HaPikachat, what should a deaf Ba'al Pikachat do - he divorces his wife with a get, and his brother's wife is forbidden forever.

hebrew_text: שְׁנֵי אַחִין פִּקְחִין נְשׂוּאִין לִשְׁתֵּי אֲחָיוֹת, אַחַת חֵרֶשֶׁת וְאַחַת פִּקַּחַת. מֵת פִּקֵּחַ בַּעַל חֵרֶשֶׁת, מָה יַעֲשֶׂה פִּקֵּחַ בַּעַל פִּקַּחַת — תֵּצֵא מִשּׁוּם אֲחוֹת אִשָּׁה. מֵת פִּקֵּחַ בַּעַל פִּקַּחַת, מָה יַעֲשֶׂה פִּקֵּחַ בַּעַל הַחֵרֶשֶׁת — מוֹצִיא אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ בְּגֵט, וְאֶת אֵשֶׁת אָחִיו בַּחֲלִיצָה.
human_translation: two competent brothers married to two sisters, one a deaf-mute and one competent, and the competent married to the deaf-mute died, what should the competent married to the competent do? released due to a wife’s sister. the competent married to the competent died, what should the competent married to the deaf-mute do? He divorces his wife with a bill of divorce, And he his brother’s wife, by means of ḥalitza ,
llm_translation: Two brothers, one married to two sisters, one deaf and one hearing. If the husband of the deaf sister dies, what should the husband of the hearing sister do? He should divorce her because of the sister-in-law relationship. If the husband of the hearing sister dies, what should the husband of the deaf sister do? He should perform halitzah with his deceased brother's wife.

hebrew_text: שְׁנֵי אַחִין, אֶחָד חֵרֵשׁ וְאֶחָד פִּקֵּחַ, נְשׂוּאִין לִשְׁתֵּי אֲחָיוֹת, אַחַת חֵרֶשֶׁת וְאַחַת פִּקַּחַת. מֵת חֵרֵשׁ בַּעַל חֵרֶשֶׁת, מָה יַעֲשֶׂה פִּקֵּחַ בַּעַל פִּקַּחַת — תֵּצֵא מִשּׁוּם אֲחוֹת אִשָּׁה.
human_translation: two brothers, one a deaf-mute and one competent, married to two sisters, one a deaf-mute and one competent, and the deaf-mute married to the deaf-mute died, what should the competent married to the competent do? released due to a wife’s sister.
llm_translation: Two brothers, one deaf and one sighted, married two sisters, one deaf and one sighted. If the deaf brother dies, leaving the deaf sister as a widow, what should the sighted brother, the husband of the sighted sister, do? He should perform the act of chalitzah due to the relationship of his wife's sister.

hebrew_text: מֵת פִּקֵּחַ בַּעַל פִּקַּחַת, מָה יַעֲשֶׂה חֵרֵשׁ בַּעַל חֵרֶשֶׁת — מוֹצִיא אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ בְּגֵט, וְאֵשֶׁת אָחִיו אֲסוּרָה לְעוֹלָם.
human_translation: the competent married to the competent died, what should the deaf-mute married to the deaf-mute do? He divorces his wife with a bill of divorce, And his brother’s wife is forbidden forever.
llm_translation: A dead person who is married to a woman who can contract levirate marriage, what should a deaf man married to a deaf woman do? He divorces his wife with a bill of divorce, and the wife of his brother is forbidden to him forever.

hebrew_text: שְׁנֵי אַחִין, אֶחָד חֵרֵשׁ וְאֶחָד פִּקֵּחַ, נְשׂוּאִין לִשְׁתֵּי נׇכְרִיּוֹת פִּקְּחוֹת. מֵת חֵרֵשׁ בַּעַל פִּקַּחַת, מָה יַעֲשֶׂה פִּקֵּחַ בַּעַל פִּקַּחַת — אוֹ חוֹלֵץ אוֹ מְיַיבֵּם. מֵת פִּקֵּחַ בַּעַל פִּקַּחַת, מָה יַעֲשֶׂה חֵרֵשׁ בַּעַל פִּקַּחַת — כּוֹנֵס וְאֵינוֹ מוֹצִיא לְעוֹלָם.
human_translation: two brothers, one a deaf-mute and one competent, married to two unrelated, competent women, and the deaf-mute married to the competent woman died, what should the competent married to the competent woman do? either performs ḥalitza or enters into levirate marriage. the competent married to the competent woman died, what should the deaf-mute married to the competent woman do? he marries and he may never divorce
llm_translation: Two brothers, one deaf and one hearing, married two non-Jewish women who are hearing. If the deaf brother dies leaving the hearing wife, what should the hearing brother, the husband of the hearing wife, do — either perform chalitzah or perform levirate marriage. If the hearing brother dies leaving the hearing wife, what should the deaf brother, the husband of the hearing wife, do — he may have relations with her but does not perform levirate marriage.

hebrew_text: שְׁנֵי אַחִין פִּקְחִין נְשׂוּאִין לִשְׁתֵּי נׇכְרִיּוֹת, אַחַת פִּקַּחַת וְאַחַת חֵרֶשֶׁת. מֵת פִּקֵּחַ בַּעַל חֵרֶשֶׁת, מָה יַעֲשֶׂה פִּקֵּחַ בַּעַל פִּקַּחַת — כּוֹנֵס, וְאִם רָצָה לְהוֹצִיא — יוֹצִיא. מֵת פִּקֵּחַ בַּעַל פִּקַּחַת, מָה יַעֲשֶׂה פִּקֵּחַ בַּעַל חֵרֶשֶׁת — אוֹ חוֹלֵץ אוֹ מְיַיבֵּם.
human_translation: two competent brothers married to two unrelated women, one competent and one a deaf-mute, and the competent married to the deaf-mute died, what should the competent married to the competent woman do? he marries and if he wishes to divorce he may divorce the competent married to the competent sister died, what should the competent married to the deaf-mute do? Either he performs ḥalitza or he enters into levirate marriage.
llm_translation: Two brothers married to two non-Jewish women, one is sighted and one is deaf. If the sighted brother dies, what should the sighted brother do? If he wishes to gather her in, he may gather her in, and if he wishes to release her, he may release her. If the sighted brother dies, what should the deaf brother do? He either performs chalitzah or performs yibum.

hebrew_text: שְׁנֵי אַחִין, אֶחָד חֵרֵשׁ וְאֶחָד פִּקֵּחַ, נְשׂוּאִים לִשְׁתֵּי נׇכְרִיּוֹת, אַחַת חֵרֶשֶׁת וְאַחַת פִּקַּחַת. מֵת חֵרֵשׁ בַּעַל חֵרֶשֶׁת, מָה יַעֲשֶׂה פִּקֵּחַ בַּעַל פִּקַּחַת — כּוֹנֵס, וְאִם רָצָה לְהוֹצִיא — יוֹצִיא. מֵת פִּקֵּחַ בַּעַל פִּקַּחַת, מָה יַעֲשֶׂה חֵרֵשׁ בַּעַל חֵרֶשֶׁת — כּוֹנֵס וְאֵינוֹ מוֹצִיא לְעוֹלָם.
human_translation: two brothers, one a deaf-mute and one competent, married to two unrelated women, one a deaf-mute and one competent, and the deaf-mute married to the deaf-mute woman died, what should the competent married to the competent woman do? He may marry her and if he wishes to divorce he may divorce the competent married to the competent woman died, what should the deaf-mute married to the deaf-mute woman do? He marries and may never divorce her,
llm_translation: Two brothers, one deaf and one sighted, married two non-Jewish women, one deaf and one sighted. If the deaf husband dies, what should the sighted husband of the deaf woman do? He may gather her belongings, and if he wishes to divorce her, he may do so. If the sighted husband dies, what should the deaf husband of the deaf woman do? He may gather her belongings but he may never divorce her.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רָמֵי בַּר חָמָא: מַאי שְׁנָא חֵרֵשׁ וְחֵרֶשֶׁת דְּתַקִּינוּ לְהוּ רַבָּנַן נִשּׂוּאִין, וּמַאי שְׁנָא דְּשׁוֹטֶה וְשׁוֹטָה דְּלָא תַּקִּינוּ לְהוּ רַבָּנַן נִשּׂוּאִין? דְּתַנְיָא: שׁוֹטֶה וְקָטָן שֶׁנָּשְׂאוּ נָשִׁים וּמֵתוּ — נְשׁוֹתֵיהֶן פְּטוּרוֹת מִן הַחֲלִיצָה וּמִן הַיִּבּוּם!
human_translation: Rami bar Ḥama said: What is the difference a deaf-mute man and a deaf-mute woman, that the Sages enacted marriage for them and an imbecilic man and an imbecilic woman, that the Sages did not enact marriage for them? As it is taught an imbecilic man and a minor married women and died, their wives are exempt from ḥalitza and from levirate marriage.
llm_translation: Gemara: Ramei bar Ḥama said: What is the difference between a deaf man and a deaf woman for whom the Rabbis instituted marriage, and what is the difference between a fool and a foolish woman for whom the Rabbis did not institute marriage? As it was taught in a baraita: A fool and a minor who married women and then died— their wives are exempt from halitzah and from levirate marriage!

hebrew_text: חֵרֵשׁ וְחֵרֶשֶׁת, דְּקָיְימָא תַּקַּנְתָּא דְרַבָּנַן — תַּקִּינוּ לְהוּ רַבָּנַן נִשּׂוּאִין. שׁוֹטֶה וְשׁוֹטָה, דְּלָא קָיְימָא תַּקַּנְתָּא דְרַבָּנַן, דְּאֵין אָדָם דָּר עִם נָחָשׁ בִּכְפִיפָה אַחַת — לָא תַּקִּינוּ רַבָּנַן נִשּׂוּאִין.
human_translation: a deaf-mute man and a deaf-mute woman, where the ordinance of the Sages can be fulfilled, the Sages enacted marriage for them. an imbecilic man and an imbecilic woman, where the ordinance of the Sages cannot be fulfilled, as A person cannot reside in a basket, with a snake, the Sages did not enact marriage for them.
llm_translation: Deaf man and deaf woman, as the enactment of the Sages is upheld — the Sages enacted for them marriages. Foolish man and foolish woman, as the enactment of the Sages is not upheld, for a person does not dwell with a snake in one basket — the Sages did not enact marriages.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי שְׁנָא קָטָן דְּלָא תַּקִּינוּ רַבָּנַן נִשּׂוּאִין, וְחֵרֵשׁ תַּקִּינוּ לֵיה רַבָּנַן נִשּׂוּאִין? חֵרֵשׁ, דְּלָא אָתֵי לִכְלַל נִשּׂוּאִין — תַּקִּינוּ רַבָּנַן נִשּׂוּאִין, קָטָן, דְּאָתֵי לִכְלַל נִשּׂוּאִין — לָא תַּקִּינוּ רַבָּנַן נִשּׂוּאִין.
human_translation: And what is the difference a minor, that the Sages did not enact marriage and a deaf-mute, the Sages did enact marriage for him? a deaf-mute, as he will not reach the stage of marriage the Sages enacted marriage a minor, as he will reach the stage of marriage the Sages did not enact marriage
llm_translation: And what is the difference between a minor for whom the Rabbis did not institute marriage, and a deaf-mute for whom the Rabbis did institute marriage? A deaf-mute, because he cannot be included in marriage - the Rabbis instituted marriage for him. A minor, because he can be included in marriage - the Rabbis did not institute marriage for him.

hebrew_text: וַהֲרֵי קְטַנָּה, דְּאָתְיָא לִכְלַל נִשּׂוּאִין, וְתַקִּינוּ רַבָּנַן נִשּׂוּאִין! הָתָם — שֶׁלֹּא יִנְהֲגוּ [בָּהּ] מִנְהַג הֶפְקֵר.
human_translation: But a minor girl, who will reach the stage of marriage and the Sages enacted marriage There that not treat her in the manner of ownerless
llm_translation: And behold, a minor girl, who is included in marriage, and the Rabbis established marriage! There — so that they do not engage in the practice of hefker.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי שְׁנָא קְטַנָּה דִּמְמָאֲנָה, וּמַאי שְׁנָא חֵרֶשֶׁת דְּלָא מְמָאֲנָה? דְּאִם כֵּן,
human_translation: What is the difference a minor girl, that she may perform refusal, and a female deaf-mute, that she cannot perform refusal, that if so,
llm_translation: And what is the difference between a young girl who refuses, and a deaf-mute who does not refuse? For if so,

hebrew_text: מִימַּנְעִי וְלָא נָסְבִי לַהּ.
human_translation: would refrain from marrying her
llm_translation: From Minai and not married to her.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי שְׁנָא קְטַנָּה דְּאָכְלָה בִּתְרוּמָה, וּמַאי שְׁנָא חֵרֶשֶׁת דְּלָא אָכְלָה בִּתְרוּמָה? דִּתְנַן: הֵעִיד רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן גּוּדְגְּדָא עַל הַחֵרֶשֶׁת שֶׁהִשִּׂיאָהּ אָבִיהָ שֶׁיּוֹצְאָה בְּגֵט, וְעַל קְטַנָּה בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁנִּשֵּׂאת לְכֹהֵן שֶׁאוֹכֶלֶת בִּתְרוּמָה, וְאִילּוּ חֵרֶשֶׁת לָא אָכְלָה!
human_translation: What is the difference a minor girl, that she may partake of teruma and a deaf-mute woman, that she may not partake of teruma As we learned Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Gudgada testified with regard to a female deaf-mute whose father married her off, that she can be divorced with a bill of divorce. And with regard to a minor girl, daughter of an non-priest who was married to a priest, that she may partake of teruma , whereas a deaf-mute woman, may not partake
llm_translation: And what is the difference between a minor who ate terumah, and what is the difference between a deaf-mute who did not eat terumah? For it was taught: Rabbi Yochanan ben Gudgeda testified concerning a deaf-mute that her father married her off with a divorce document, and concerning a minor daughter of Israel who married a priest and ate terumah, but a deaf-mute did not eat!

hebrew_text: גְּזֵירָה שֶׁמָּא יַאֲכִיל חֵרֵשׁ בְּחֵרֶשֶׁת. וְלֵיכוֹל, קָטָן אוֹכֵל נְבֵלוֹת הוּא!
human_translation: decree lest a deaf-mute feed to deaf-mute And Let him feed he is a minor eats unslaughtered animals.
llm_translation: Decree lest a deaf person feed another with deafness. And to permit, a minor may eat carrion!

hebrew_text: גְּזֵירָה שֶׁמָּא יַאֲכִיל חֵרֵשׁ בְּפִקַּחַת. וְחֵרֵשׁ בְּפִקַּחַת נָמֵי לֵיכוֹל בִּתְרוּמָה דְּרַבָּנַן! גְּזֵירָה דִּלְמָא אָתֵי לְאוֹכֹלַהּ בִּתְרוּמָה דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא.
human_translation: decree lest a deaf-mute feed competent As well, a deaf-mute to competent let her partake of teruma by rabbinic decree, perhaps he will come to feed her teruma by Torah
llm_translation: Decree lest he feed a deaf-mute with discernment. And a deaf-mute with discernment, is it possible to eat in the Rabbinic tithe! Decree lest he come to eat it in the Biblical tithe.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי שְׁנָא קְטַנָּה דְּאִית לַהּ כְּתוּבָּה, וּמַאי שְׁנָא חֵרֶשֶׁת דְּלֵית לַהּ כְּתוּבָּה? דְּאִם כֵּן — מִימַּנְעִי וְלָא נָסְבִי לַהּ.
human_translation: And what is the difference a minor girl, that she has a marriage contract, and a deaf-mute woman, that she does not have a marriage contract? that if so, would refrain from marrying her
llm_translation: And what is the difference between a minor girl who has a document, and a deaf-mute who does not have a document? If so - withhold and do not give it to her.

hebrew_text: וּקְטַנָּה מְנָלַן דְּאִית לַהּ כְּתוּבָּה? דִּתְנַן: הַמְמָאֶנֶת, וְהַשְּׁנִיָּיה, וְאַיְילוֹנִית — אֵין לָהֶן כְּתוּבָּה. אֲבָל יוֹצְאָה בְּגֵט וּקְטַנָּה — יֵשׁ לָהּ כְּתוּבָּה.
human_translation: And a minor girl, from where do we she has a marriage contract? As we learned who refuses and secondary relative and a sexually underdeveloped woman have no marriage contract. However, divorced by a bill of divorce, and a minor girl, is entitled to a marriage contract.
llm_translation: "And a minor, from where do we know that she has a document? For it was taught: One who refuses, and a convert, and a freed slave woman - they do not have a document. But a minor who goes out with a divorce document - she has a document."

hebrew_text: וְחֵרֶשֶׁת מְנָלַן דְּלֵית לַהּ כְּתוּבָּה? דְּתַנְיָא: חֵרֵשׁ וְשׁוֹטֶה שֶׁנָּשְׂאוּ פִּקְּחוֹת, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁנִּתְפַּקֵּחַ הַחֵרֵשׁ, וְנִשְׁתַּפָּה הַשּׁוֹטֶה — אֵין לָהֶם עֲלֵיהֶם כְּלוּם. רָצוּ לְקַיְּימָן — יֵשׁ לָהֶם כְּתוּבָּה.
human_translation: And a deaf-mute woman, from where do we she has no marriage contract? As it is taught A deaf-mute and an imbecile who married competent women, even if the deaf-mute regained his senses, and the imbecile regained his competence, have no anything against them, if wish to maintain have a marriage contract
llm_translation: "And how do we know that a deaf-mute who cannot speak has no legal document? For it was taught: A deaf-mute and an imbecile who were married by competent persons, even though the deaf-mute regained his hearing and the imbecile regained his sanity — they have no legal document. If they wish to establish one, they have a legal document."

hebrew_text: וּפִקֵּחַ שֶׁנָּשָׂא חֵרֶשֶׁת אוֹ שׁוֹטָה, אֲפִילּוּ כָּתַב לָהּ מֵאָה מָנֶה — כְּתוּבָּתָהּ קַיֶּימֶת, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁרָצָה לִזּוֹק בִּנְכָסָיו. טַעְמָא דְּרָצָה, הָא לֹא רָצָה — אֵין לָהּ, דְּאִם כֵּן מִימַּנְעִי וְלָא נָסְבִי לַהּ.
human_translation: And a competent man who married a deaf-mute or an imbecile, even if he wrote for her one hundred dinars her marriage contract is valid, because he wanted to harm his property. The reason that he wanted he does not want she not have that if so, would refrain from marrying her.
llm_translation: And a trustee who appointed a deaf-mute or an imbecile, even if he wrote for her a hundred mana - her document is valid, because he wanted to protect his property. The reason is that if he wanted, then it is valid; if not, then it is not valid, for if not, he should have refrained and not appointed her.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, פִּקַּחַת לְחֵרֵשׁ לִיתַקֵּן לַהּ כְּתוּבָּה, דְּאִם כֵּן מִימַּנְעִי וְלָא מִינַּסְבִי! יוֹתֵר מִשֶּׁהָאִישׁ רוֹצֶה לִישָּׂא, אִשָּׁה רוֹצָה לְהִנָּשֵׂא.
human_translation: If so, a competent woman to a deaf-mute, let the Sages enact a marriage contract for her, for if so, would refrain from marrying More than the man wants to get married, a woman wants to be married.
llm_translation: If so, open to the deaf to fix for her a document, for if not, they will withhold and not marry! More than the man wants to marry, the woman wants to be married.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא חֵרֵשׁ דַּהֲוָה בְּשִׁבָבוּתֵיהּ דְּרַב מַלְכִּיּוֹ, אַנְסְבֵיהּ אִיתְּתָא וּכְתַב לַהּ אַרְבַּע מְאָה זוּזֵי מִנִּכְסֵיהּ. אָמַר רָבָא: מַאן חַכִּים כְּרַב מַלְכִּיּוֹ, דְּגַבְרָא רַבָּה הוּא. קָסָבַר: אִילּוּ רָצָה שִׁפְחָה לְשַׁמְּשׁוֹ מִי לָא זָבְנִינַן לֵיהּ? כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן הָכָא, דְּאִיכָּא תַּרְתֵּי.
human_translation: a certain deaf-mute who was in the neighborhood of Rav Malkiyyu. married him to a woman, and he wrote four-hundred dinars for her from the property Rava said: Who is as wise as Rav Malkiyyu, as he is a great man reasoned If wanted a maidservant to attend to him, would we not acquire one for him? All the more so here, as there are two
llm_translation: That deaf-mute who was in the service of Rav Malkiyo, he married a woman and wrote for her four hundred zuz from his property. Rava said: Who is as wise as Rav Malkiyo, for he is a great man. He thought: If a maidservant desires to serve him, should we not acquire her for him? All the more so here, where there are two.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִיָּיא בַּר אָשֵׁי אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: אֵשֶׁת חֵרֵשׁ — אֵין חַיָּיבִין עָלֶיהָ אָשָׁם תָּלוּי.
human_translation: Rav Ḥiyya bar Ashi said Shmuel said: the wife of a deaf-mute, he is not obligated to a guilt-offering for uncertainty on her account.
llm_translation: Rav Chiya bar Ashe said, Shmuel said: The wife of a deaf-mute - they are not liable for a hanging guilt-offering upon her.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ: חֲמִשָּׁה לֹא יִתְרוֹמוּ, וְאִם תָּרְמוּ — אֵין תְּרוּמָתָן תְּרוּמָה. וְאֵלּוּ הֵן: חֵרֵשׁ, שׁוֹטֶה, וְקָטָן, וְהַתּוֹרֵם אֶת שֶׁאֵינוֹ שֶׁלּוֹ, וְגוֹי שֶׁתָּרַם שֶׁל יִשְׂרָאֵל אֲפִילּוּ בִּרְשׁוּת יִשְׂרָאֵל — אֵין תְּרוּמָתוֹ תְּרוּמָה.
human_translation: Let us say that supports five may not separate teruma and if they separated teruma , their teruma is not teruma . They are: A deaf-mute, an imbecile, and a minor, and one who separates teruma that is not his, and a gentile who separated teruma of a Jew even with the Jew’s permission. his teruma is not considered teruma ,
llm_translation: Let us say it assists him: Five may not contribute, and if they contributed - their contribution is not a contribution. And these are they: a deaf person, an imbecile, a minor, one who contributes what is not his, and a gentile who contributed on behalf of an Israelite, even with the Israelite's permission - his contribution is not a contribution.

hebrew_text: הוּא דְּאָמַר כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר. דְּתַנְיָא: רַבִּי יִצְחָק אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: תְּרוּמַת חֵרֵשׁ לֹא תֵּצֵא לְחוּלִּין, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא סָפֵק. אִי סְבִירָא כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, אָשָׁם תָּלוּי נָמֵי לִיחַיַּיב!
human_translation: said in accordance with Rabbi Elazar. As it is taught Rabbi Yitzḥak said in the name of Rabbi Elazar: The teruma of a deaf-mute is not released into a non-sacred because it is uncertain. If maintains, in accordance with Rabbi Elazar, let him also obligate to a guilt-offering for uncertainty.
llm_translation: He who said as Rabbi Elazar. As it was taught: Rabbi Yitzchak says in the name of Rabbi Elazar: The terumah of a deaf-mute does not exempt from ordinary produce, because it is uncertain. If you agree with Rabbi Elazar, a guilt offering should be suspended before him to obligate him!

hebrew_text: בָּעֵינַן חֲתִיכָה מִשְׁתֵּי חֲתִיכוֹת.
human_translation: We require one piece from two pieces.
llm_translation: We require a piece from two pieces.

hebrew_text: וּמִי בָּעֵי רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר חֲתִיכָה מִשְׁתֵּי חֲתִיכוֹת? וְהָתַנְיָא, רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: כּוֹי — חַיָּיבִין עַל חֶלְבּוֹ אָשָׁם תָּלוּי.
human_translation: And does Rabbi Elazar need one piece from two pieces But isn’t it taught Rabbi Elazar says: a koy , one is obligated to a guilt-offering for uncertainty for its forbidden fat.
llm_translation: And who requires an offering according to Rabbi Elazar, a piece from two pieces? And it was taught: Rabbi Elazar says: "A puncture - one is liable for its fat, a guilt offering is dependent."

hebrew_text: שְׁמוּאֵל סָבַר כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בַּחֲדָא, וּפְלִיג עֲלֵיהּ בַּחֲדָא.
human_translation: Shmuel holds in accordance with Rabbi Elazar in one and disagrees with him in one matter,
llm_translation: Shmuel thought like Rabbi Elazar in one matter, and he disagreed with him in another matter.

hebrew_text: וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי, אָמַר רַב חִיָּיא בַּר אָשֵׁי אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: אֵשֶׁת חֵרֵשׁ חַיָּיבִין עָלֶיהָ אָשָׁם תָּלוּי. מֵיתִיבִי: חֲמִשָּׁה לֹא יִתְרוֹמוּ! סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר.
human_translation: And there are who say Rav Ḥiyya bar Ashi said Shmuel said: the wife of a deaf-mute, he is obligated to a guilt-offering for uncertainty on her account, raises an objection: Five may not separate teruma , maintains in accordance with Rabbi Elazar,
llm_translation: And there are those who say, Rav Ḥiyya bar Ashi said in the name of Shemu'el: A deaf man's wife, they are liable for a hanging guilt-offering because of her. It was raised: Five cases do not bring an elevation-offering! He thought to her like Rabbi El'azar.

hebrew_text: בְּעָא רַב אָשֵׁי: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר? מִיפְשָׁט פְּשִׁיטָא לֵיהּ דְּחֵרֵשׁ דַּעְתָּא קְלִישְׁתָּא הוּא, וּמִיהוּ מְסַפְּקָא לֵיהּ אִי דַּעְתָּא צִילּוּתָא
human_translation: Rav Ashi raised a dilemma: What is the reason for Rabbi Elazar? is obvious to him that the mind of a deaf-mute is weak. However, he is uncertain as to whether his mind is clear.
llm_translation: Rav Ashi asked: What is the reason for Rabbi Elazar's opinion? It is obvious to him that a deaf person is considered mentally incompetent, yet he is uncertain whether mental incompetence is considered a form of protection.

hebrew_text: אִי לָאו דַּעְתָּא צִילּוּתָא, וּלְעוֹלָם חֲדָא דַּעְתָּא הוּא. אוֹ דִלְמָא פְּשִׁיטָא לֵיהּ דְּדַעְתֵּיהּ קְלִישְׁתָּא וְלָאו דַּעְתָּא צִילּוּתָא הוּא, וְהָכָא הַיְינוּ טַעְמָא: כֵּיוָן דְּעִתִּים חָלִים וְעִתִּים שׁוֹטֶה.
human_translation: Or his mind is not clear, and he is always of one mind. Or perhaps is obvious to that the mind is weak and mind is unclear, but here, this is reasoning: Since he is at times competent and at times imbecilic,
llm_translation: If not for the fact of protection, and forever one is the fact. Or perhaps it is obvious to him that his intellect is feeble and not the fact of protection, and here is the reason: since intellects are healthy at times and at times foolish.

hebrew_text: לְמַאי נָפְקָא מִינַּהּ — לְהוֹצִיא אִשְׁתּוֹ בְּגֵט. אִי אָמְרַתְּ חֲדָא דַּעְתָּא הוּא — כְּקִדּוּשִׁין כָּךְ גֵּירוּשִׁין.
human_translation: What is the practical difference to divorcing his wife with a bill of divorce. If you say has one mind, his divorce is to his betrothal.
llm_translation: Regarding what does it come out? — To divorce his wife with a bill of divorce. If you say it is one opinion — Just as betrothals, so too divorces.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אָמְרַתְּ עִתִּים חָלִים וְעִתִּים שׁוֹטֶה — קַדּוֹשֵׁי מָצֵי מְקַדֵּשׁ, גָּרוֹשֵׁי לָא מָצֵי מְגָרֵשׁ. מַאי? תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: But if you say he is at times competent and at times imbecilic, he may betroth he cannot divorce her, what shall stand
llm_translation: And if you say sometimes he is healthy and sometimes he is insane - those who are holy are found to be sanctifying, those who are divorced are not found to be divorcing. What is the resolution? It shall stand unresolved.

hebrew_text: נִשְׁתַּטֵּית וְכוּ׳. אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: דְּבַר תּוֹרָה שׁוֹטָה מִתְגָּרֶשֶׁת, מִידֵּי דְּהָוֵה אַפִּקַּחַת בְּעַל כׇּרְחָהּ. וּמָה טַעַם אָמְרוּ אֵינָהּ מְגוֹרֶשֶׁת? שֶׁלֹּא יִנְהֲגוּ בָּהּ מִנְהַג הֶפְקֵר.
human_translation: became imbecilic Rabbi Yitzḥak said: By Torah law, an imbecilic woman may be divorced, just as it is a competent woman against her will. And what is reason said may not be divorced? that should not treat her in the manner of ownerless
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Nishtateit and so forth." Rabbi Yitzchak said: A foolish matter of Torah becomes divorced, because it becomes a matter of her own will. And why did they say that she is not divorced? So that people should not treat her as ownerless property.

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָּמֵי? אִילֵּימָא דְּיוֹדַעַת לִשְׁמוֹר גִּיטָּהּ וְיוֹדַעַת לִשְׁמוֹר עַצְמָהּ — מִי נָהֲגִי בָּהּ מִנְהַג הֶפְקֵר? אֶלָּא, דְּאֵין יוֹדַעַת לִשְׁמוֹר לֹא גִּיטָּהּ וְלֹא עַצְמָהּ.
human_translation: What are the circumstances If we say knows how to guard her bill of divorce, and knows how to take care of herself, would treat her in the manner of ownerless Rather, to a woman who does not know how to guard her bill of divorce, nor herself.
llm_translation: "How are the laws of the case? If we say that she knows how to safeguard her divorce document and knows how to safeguard herself - who would engage in her with the practice of hefker? Rather, it is because she does not know how to safeguard either her divorce document or herself."

hebrew_text: דְּבַר תּוֹרָה שׁוֹטָה מִתְגָּרֶשֶׁת? וְהָא אָמַר דְּבֵי רַבִּי יַנַּאי: ״וְנָתַן בְּיָדָהּ״, מִי שֶׁיֵּשׁ לָהּ יָד לְגָרֵשׁ עַצְמָהּ, יָצְתָה זוֹ, שֶׁאֵין לָהּ יָד לְגָרֵשׁ עַצְמָהּ.
human_translation: by Torah law an imbecilic woman may be divorced? But the school of Rabbi Yannai say, and give it into her hand” to who has a hand, to divorce herself. to exclude this who does not have a hand to divorce herself.
