llm_translation: Word of Torah foolishness divorces? And this said the house of Rabbi Yannai: "And he shall give in her hand," one who has a hand to divorce herself, she has gone out, one who does not have a hand to divorce herself.

hebrew_text: וְתָנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: ״וְשִׁלְּחָהּ מִבֵּיתוֹ״, מִי שֶׁמְּשַׁלְּחָהּ וְאֵינָהּ חוֹזֶרֶת, יָצְתָה זוֹ, שֶׁמְּשַׁלְּחָהּ וְחוֹזֶרֶת.
human_translation: And the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught “And send her out of his house” whom he will send away and she will not return. to exclude this he will send her away and she will return,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael: "And he shall send her out of his house," - whoever sends her out and she does not return, this one has divorced her; but if he sends her out and she returns.

hebrew_text: לָא צְרִיכָא, דְּיוֹדַעַת לִשְׁמוֹר גִּיטָּהּ וְאֵינָהּ יוֹדַעַת לִשְׁמוֹר עַצְמָהּ. דְּבַר תּוֹרָה שׁוֹטָה מִתְגָּרֶשֶׁת, דְּהָא יוֹדַעַת לִשְׁמוֹר גִּיטָּהּ. וַאֲמוּר רַבָּנַן לָא לַיפְּקַהּ, שֶׁלֹּא יִנְהֲגוּ בָּהּ מִנְהַג הֶפְקֵר.
human_translation: No, necessary of who knows how to guard her bill of divorce but does not know how to take care of herself. By Torah law imbecilic woman may be divorced, as she knows how to safeguard her bill of divorce, and the Sages said not divorce that should not treat her in the manner of ownerless
llm_translation: Not needed, for she knows how to safeguard her divorce document but does not know how to safeguard herself. A Torah matter that is foolish gets divorced, for she knows how to safeguard her divorce document. And the Rabbis said: Do not let her go out, so that people do not treat her with the custom of one who is ownerless.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: דַּיְקָא נָמֵי, דְּקָתָנֵי גַּבֵּי דִידַהּ ״נִשְׁתַּטֵּית לֹא יוֹצִיא״, וְגַבֵּי דִידֵיהּ ״לֹא יוֹצִיא עוֹלָמִית״. מַאי שְׁנָא הָכָא דְּקָתָנֵי ״עוֹלָמִית״ וּמַאי שְׁנָא הָתָם דְּלָא קָתָנֵי ״עוֹלָמִית״? אֶלָּא שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ, הָא — דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא, הָא — דְּרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: Abaye said: is also precise as it teaches with regard to this she became an imbecile he may not divorce and with regard to he may never divorce What is different here, that teaches Never, and what is different there, that does not teach: Never? Rather, learn from here that this by Torah this rabbinic
llm_translation: Abaye said: It is indeed precise, for it was taught in our Mishnah, "If she became disheveled, he may not divorce her," and in his Mishnah it is written, "He may not divorce her permanently." What is the difference here that it is taught "permanently," and what is the difference there that it is not taught "permanently"? Rather, learn from it that this one - is from the Torah, and that one - is from the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן נוּרִי וְכוּ׳. אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ? רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן נוּרִי, אִישׁ פְּשִׁיטָא לֵיהּ, וְאִשָּׁה קָמִיבַּעְיָא לֵיהּ. אוֹ דִלְמָא: אִשָּׁה פְּשִׁיטָא לֵיהּ, וְאִישׁ קָמִיבַּעְיָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Nuri said: A dilemma was raised before Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Nuri: obvious to him man and he raised dilemma a woman, Or perhaps, obvious to him woman, and he raised dilemma man,
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yochanan ben Nuri and the like. Did he ask them? Rabbi Yochanan ben Nuri, a man seeks him out, and a woman seeks him out. Or perhaps: a woman seeks him out, and a man seeks him out.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, מִדְּקָאָמְרוּ לֵיהּ: אֵינוֹ דּוֹמֶה הָאִישׁ הַמְגָרֵשׁ לָאִשָּׁה הַמִּתְגָּרֶשֶׁת, שֶׁהָאִשָּׁה יוֹצֵאת לִרְצוֹנָהּ וְשֶׁלֹּא לִרְצוֹנָהּ, וְהָאִישׁ אֵינוֹ מוֹצִיא אֶלָּא לִרְצוֹנוֹ — שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ אִישׁ קָמִיבַּעְיָא לֵיהּ. אַדְּרַבָּה, מִדְּקָאָמְרוּ לֵיהּ: אַף זוֹ כַּיּוֹצֵא בָּהּ — שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ אִשָּׁה קָמִיבַּעְיָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Come hear from what said to The man who divorces is not similar to the woman who is divorced, as the woman is divorced she is willing or unwilling, and the man divorces willingly. Learn from here raised dilemma man, On the contrary, from that the Rabbis said to him: This too, has a similar learn from here raised dilemma woman.
llm_translation: Come and hear, from when they said to him: A man who divorces a divorced woman is not comparable, because the woman leaves of her own will and against her will, while the man only divorces according to his will — hear from it, a man seeks her. On the contrary, from when they said to him: Even this is like the one who divorces her — hear from it, a woman seeks him.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן נוּרִי לְדִבְרֵיהֶם קָאָמַר לְהוּ: לְדִידִי, כִּי הֵיכִי דְּאִישׁ לָא מָצֵי מְגָרֵשׁ — אִשָּׁה נָמֵי לָא מִיגָּרְשָׁא, אֶלָּא לְדִידְכוּ, מַאי שְׁנָא אִשָּׁה וּמַאי שְׁנָא אִישׁ! אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: אֵינוֹ דּוֹמֶה הָאִישׁ הַמְגָרֵשׁ לָאִשָּׁה הַמִּתְגָּרֶשֶׁת.
human_translation: Rather, Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Nuri spoke to in accordance with their statement, According to my just as man cannot divorce so too woman cannot be divorced. However, according to your what is the difference woman and man? They said to him: The man who divorces is not similar to the woman who is divorced.
llm_translation: Rather, Rabbi Yochanan ben Nuri in accordance with their words said to them: According to my opinion, how is it that a man cannot divorce? A woman also cannot be divorced, but according to your opinion, what is the difference between a woman and a man! They said to him: A man who divorces is not comparable to a woman who is divorced.

hebrew_text: הֵעִיד רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן וְכוּ׳. אָמַר רָבָא: מֵעֵדוּתוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן גּוּדְגְּדָא, אָמַר לְעֵדִים: ״רְאוּ גֵּט זֶה שֶׁאֲנִי נוֹתֵן״, וְאָמַר לָהּ: ״כִּנְסִי שְׁטַר חוֹב זֶה״ — הֲרֵי זוֹ מְגוֹרֶשֶׁת.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan testified Rava said: From the testimony of Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Gudgada said to witnesses: See this bill of divorce that I am giving and he said to her: Take this promissory note, she is divorced,
llm_translation: The witness Rabbi Yochanan and so forth. Rava said: From the testimony of Rabbi Yochanan ben Gudgeda, he said to the witnesses, "See this bill of divorce that I am giving," and he said to her, "Take this promissory note of debt" - she is hereby divorced.

hebrew_text: מִי לָא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן גּוּדְגְּדָא לָא בָּעֵינַן דַּעְתַּהּ, הָכָא נָמֵי לָא בָּעֵינַן דַּעְתַּהּ. פְּשִׁיטָא?
human_translation: Didn’t Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Gudgada say we do not require her consent, Here, too, we do not require her consent, Isn’t obvious
llm_translation: Who did not say Rabbi Yochanan ben Gudguda, we do not need her opinion, here too we do not need her opinion. Obviously?

hebrew_text: מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: מִדַּאֲמַר לַהּ ״כִּנְסִי שְׁטַר חוֹב זֶה״ — בַּטּוֹלֵי בַּטְּלֵיהּ, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן. אִי אִיתָא דְּבַטְּלֵיהּ — לְעֵדִים הֲוָה קָאָמַר לְהוּ, וּמִדְּלָא אֲמַר לְעֵדִים — לָא בַּטְּלֵיהּ וְלָא מִידֵּי. וְהַאי דְּקָאָמַר הָכִי — מֵחֲמַת כִּיסּוּפָא הוּא דְּקָאָמַר לְהוּ.
human_translation: lest you say: From that said to her: Take this promissory note, he has nullified the bill of divorce. teaches us if it is he would have said to the witnesses. And from that he did not say to the witnesses, he did not nullify at all. And that said this, it was due to shame that he said this to her,
llm_translation: What is the reasoning: since he said to her, "Take this promissory note," - if she annulled it, it is understood to us. If he comes and annuls it - he was saying it to the witnesses, and since he did not say it to the witnesses - it is not annulled and not from him. And what he is saying like this - it is due to suspicion that he is saying to them.

hebrew_text: רַב יִצְחָק בַּר בִּיסְנָא אִירְכַסוּ לֵיהּ מַפְתְּחֵי דְּבֵי מִדְרְשָׁא בִּרְשׁוּת הָרַבִּים בְּשַׁבְּתָא, אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי פְּדָת. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: זִיל
human_translation: Rav Yitzḥak bar Bisna lost the keys to the study hall, into the public domain on Shabbat. He came before Rabbi Pedat said to him: Go
llm_translation: Rav Yitzchak bar Bisna's keys of the study hall were lost in the public domain on Shabbat. He came before Rabbi Pedat. He said to him: Go.

hebrew_text: דְּבַר טְלֵי וְטַלְיָא וְלִיטַיְּילוּ הָתָם, דְּאִי מַשְׁכְּחִי לְהוּ, מַיְיתֵי לְהוּ. אַלְמָא קָסָבַר: קָטָן אוֹכֵל נְבֵלוֹת — אֵין בֵּית דִּין מְצֻוִּוין לְהַפְרִישׁוֹ. לֵימָא מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ: לֹא יֹאמַר אָדָם לְתִינוֹק ״הָבֵא לִי מַפְתֵּחַ״, ״הָבֵא לִי חוֹתָם״, אֶלָּא מַנִּיחוֹ תּוֹלֵשׁ, מַנִּיחוֹ זוֹרֵק.
human_translation: and lead boys and girls and let them walk there and if they find the keys they will bring them Apparently, maintains a minor eats unslaughtered animals the court is not commanded to prevent him Let us say that supports his A person may not tell a child Bring me a key, or: Bring me seal However, he may allow detach allow him throw
llm_translation: Word of hanging and hanging and suspending there, for if they find, they bring to them. This implies: A minor eating nevelot - the court is not commanded to separate him. Let us say it supports him: A person should not say to a child, "Bring me a key," "Bring me a seal," rather he should place it, he should throw it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: ״תּוֹלֵשׁ״ — בְּעָצִיץ שֶׁאֵינוֹ נָקוּב, ״זוֹרֵק״ — בְּכַרְמְלִית דְּרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: Abaye said detaching to an unperforated flowerpot, Throw, in a karmelit by rabbinic
llm_translation: Abaye said: "Tolash" - in an unperforated flowerpot, "Zorek" - in a Rabbinically designated private domain.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: גּוֹי שֶׁבָּא לְכַבּוֹת — אֵין אוֹמְרִים לוֹ ״כַּבֵּה״ וְ״אַל תְּכַבֶּה״, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁאֵין שְׁבִיתָתוֹ עֲלֵיהֶם. קָטָן הַבָּא לְכַבּוֹת — אוֹמְרִים לוֹ ״אַל תְּכַבֶּה״, שֶׁשְּׁבִיתָתוֹ עֲלֵיהֶם.
human_translation: Come hear a gentile comes to extinguish one may not say to him: Extinguish, or: Do not extinguish, because his rest is not upon child comes to extinguish they do say to him: Do not extinguish, because his rest is upon
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Come and hear: A non-Jew who comes to extinguish — we do not say to him "extinguish" or "do not extinguish," because his rest is not upon them. A minor who comes to extinguish — we say to him "do not extinguish," because his rest is upon them.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: בְּעוֹשֶׂה עַל דַּעַת אָבִיו, דִּכְווֹתֵיהּ גַּבֵּי גּוֹי דְּעוֹשֶׂה עַל דַּעַת יִשְׂרָאֵל, מִי שְׁרֵי? גּוֹי אַדַּעְתָּא דְּנַפְשֵׁיהּ עָבֵיד.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: to who is acting with his father’s consent. same with regard to a gentile, that he acts with the Jew’s consent, is it permitted A gentile acts in accordance with his
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: One who acts with the consent of his father, his beating is upon a non-Jew. One who acts with the consent of Israel, is he permitted? A non-Jew acts according to his own understanding.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: בֶּן חָבֵר שֶׁרָגִיל לֵילֵךְ אֵצֶל אֲבִי אִמּוֹ עַם הָאָרֶץ — אֵין חוֹשְׁשִׁין שֶׁמָּא יַאֲכִילֶנּוּ דְּבָרִים שֶׁאֵינָם מְתוּקָּנִים. מָצָא בְּיָדוֹ פֵּירוֹת — אֵין זָקוּק לוֹ! אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: בִּדְמַאי הֵקֵילּוּ.
human_translation: Come hear: The son of a ḥaver , is accustomed to going to his mother’s father, an ignoramus not concerned lest feed him items that are not tithed. found fruit in hand, he is not bound Rabbi Yoḥanan said: were lenient with regard to doubtfully tithed produce [ demai ].
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Come and hear: The son of a neighbor who is accustomed to go to his mother's father, an am ha'aretz - we are not concerned lest he feed him things that are not properly prepared. If he found fruits in his hand - he is not obligated to separate tithes! Rabbi Yochanan said: They were lenient with regard to demai. English translation:

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא טַעְמָא דִּדְמַאי, הָא וַדַּאי בְּעָא לְעַשּׂוֹרֵי? וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: בְּעוֹשֶׂה עַל דַּעַת אָבִיו! אֶלָּא רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן סַפּוֹקֵי מְסַפְּקָא לֵיהּ, קָאֵי הָכָא מְדַחֵי, קָאֵי הָכָא מְדַחֵי.
human_translation: Rather, reason that demai , if it was definitely required to tithe But didn’t Rabbi Yoḥanan say that when he is acting with his father’s consent? Rather, Rabbi Yoḥanan is uncertain in this case he refutes in that case he refutes it.
llm_translation: Rather, the reason for the blood of idolatrous sacrifices being prohibited is this: Does he indeed want to make a loan? But didn't Rabbi Yochanan say: It is only permitted when done with the knowledge of his father! Rather, Rabbi Yochanan is in doubt, he stands here and pushes away the prohibition, he stands there and pushes away the prohibition.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: בֶּן חָבֵר כֹּהֵן שֶׁרָגִיל לֵילֵךְ אֵצֶל אֲבִי אִמּוֹ כֹּהֵן עַם הָאָרֶץ — אֵין חוֹשְׁשִׁין שֶׁמָּא יַאֲכִילֶנּוּ תְּרוּמָה טְמֵאָה, מָצָא בְּיָדוֹ פֵּירוֹת — אֵין זָקוּק לוֹ! בִּתְרוּמָה דְּרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: Come hear: the son of a ḥaver priest who is accustomed to going to his mother’s father, a priest an ignoramus, one not concerned lest feed him ritually impure teruma . found fruit in hand, he is not bound to teruma by rabbinic
llm_translation: Come and hear: The son of a fellow, a priest, who is accustomed to go to his mother's father, a priest of the common people — we are not concerned that perhaps he will feed him impure terumah. If he found fruits in his hand — they are not attached to him! In the terumah of the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: יוֹנֵק תִּינוֹק וְהוֹלֵךְ מִגּוֹיָה וּמִבְּהֵמָה טְמֵאָה, וְאֵין חוֹשְׁשִׁין בְּיוֹנֵק שֶׁקֶץ. וְלֹא יַאֲכִילֶנּוּ נְבֵלוֹת וּטְרֵפוֹת שְׁקָצִים וּרְמָשִׂים. וּמִכּוּלָּן יוֹנֵק מֵהֶם וַאֲפִילּוּ בַּשַּׁבָּת. וּבְגָדוֹל אָסוּר. אַבָּא שָׁאוּל אוֹמֵר: נוֹהֲגִין הָיִינוּ שֶׁיּוֹנְקִים מִבְּהֵמָה טְהוֹרָה בְּיוֹם טוֹב.
human_translation: Come hear: A child may regularly suckle from a gentile woman; and a non-kosher animal. And one not concerned that he suckles from a detestable creature. But one may not feed animal carcasses, or animals with wounds that will cause the animals to die within twelve months [ tereifot ], repugnant creatures, or creeping animals. may suckle from all these, even on Shabbat, but of an adult, prohibited Abba Shaul says: We were accustomed to suckle from a kosher animal on a Festival,
llm_translation: Come and hear: A baby bird that is still nursing and walks among non-kosher animals and beasts, and we are not concerned about the baby bird being a detestable creature. And one should not feed it carcasses, torn animals, detestable creatures, or creeping things. And from all of these, a baby bird is exempt, even on Shabbat. But with a grown bird, it is prohibited. Abba Shaul says: It was our custom that baby birds would be nursed by a kosher animal on a festival day.

hebrew_text: קָתָנֵי מִיהָא אֵין חוֹשְׁשִׁין בְּיוֹנֵק שֶׁקֶץ! הָתָם מִשּׁוּם סַכָּנָה. אִי הָכִי — גָּדוֹל נָמֵי!
human_translation: In any event, teaches one not concerned that he suckles from a detestable creature, There, due to a danger, If so, also an adult,
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: We are not concerned about a baby bird being a forbidden species! There, it is due to danger. If not so — it is a great principle!

hebrew_text: גָּדוֹל בָּעֵי אוּמְדָּנָא. קָטָן נָמֵי לִיבְעֵי אוּמְדָּנָא! אָמַר רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: סְתָם תִּינוֹק מְסוּכָּן אֵצֶל חָלָב.
human_translation: An adult requires consultation, A minor should also require consultation Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said: unspecified a child is in danger with regard to milk.
llm_translation: Great is the need for estimation. Small is the need for estimation! Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said: A sealed infant is in danger near milk.

hebrew_text: אַבָּא שָׁאוּל אוֹמֵר: נוֹהֲגִין הָיִינוּ שֶׁיּוֹנְקִים מִבְּהֵמָה טְהוֹרָה בְּיוֹם טוֹב. הֵיכִי דָּמֵי? אִי דְּאִיכָּא סַכָּנָה — אֲפִילּוּ בְּשַׁבָּת נָמֵי, וְאִי דְּלֵיכָּא סַכָּנָה — אֲפִילּוּ בְּיוֹם טוֹב אָסוּר! לָא צְרִיכָא דְּאִיכָּא צַעֲרָא.
human_translation: Abba Shaul says: We were accustomed to suckle from a kosher animal on a Festival. What are the circumstances? If there is danger even on Shabbat also And if there is no danger, even on a Festival prohibited. No, necessary where there is suffering,
llm_translation: Abba Shaul says: We are accustomed to suckling from a kosher animal on a festival day. How so? If there is danger - even on Shabbat it is permitted, and if there is no danger - even on a festival day it is prohibited! It is unnecessary when there is no pain.

hebrew_text: וְקָסָבַר מְפָרֵק כִּלְאַחַר יָד הוּא. שַׁבָּת דְּאִיסּוּר סְקִילָה — גְּזַרוּ רַבָּנַן, יוֹם טוֹב דְּאִיסּוּר לָאו — לָא גְּזַרוּ בֵּיהּ רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: And holds is extracting in an unusual manner. Shabbat, when a prohibition stoning, the Sages issued a decree a Festival, when negative prohibition the Sages did not issue a decree
llm_translation: And he holds that it is a case of "after the fact." Shabbat, which involves a prohibition of stoning — the Rabbis decreed, but Yom Tov, which does not involve a prohibition of stoning — the Rabbis did not decree upon it.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: ״לֹא תֹאכְלוּם כִּי שֶׁקֶץ הֵם״, לֹא תַּאֲכִילוּם — לְהַזְהִיר הַגְּדוֹלִים עַל הַקְּטַנִּים. מַאי לָאו, דְּאָמַר לְהוּ לֹא תֵּאכְלוּ! לָא, דְּלָא לִיסְפּוֹ לֵיהּ בְּיָדַיִם.
human_translation: Come hear: “You shall not eat them [ tokhlum ] for they are a detestable thing” ta’akhilum , do not feed them to warn adults concerning minors, What, is it not that say to Do not eat, No, that may not feed by action,
llm_translation: "Come and hear: 'You shall not eat them, for they are detestable,' do not feed them — to caution the adults regarding the children. What is the reason? That he should say to them, 'Do not eat!' No, so that they should not become accustomed to it."

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: ״כׇּל נֶפֶשׁ מִכֶּם לֹא תֹאכַל דָּם״, לְהַזְהִיר הַגְּדוֹלִים עַל הַקְּטַנִּים. מַאי לָאו, דְּאָמְרִי לְהוּ לֹא תֵּאכְלוּ! לָא, דְּלָא לִיסְפּוֹ לְהוּ בְּיָדַיִם.
human_translation: Come hear, “No soul of you shall eat blood” to warn adults concerning minors. What, is it not that say to Do not eat blood? No, that by action.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Come and hear: 'Any soul from you shall not eat blood,' to caution the adults regarding the minors. What is the reason? That they should say to them, 'You shall not eat!' No, so that they should not add to it with their own hands." English translation: "Come and hear: 'Any soul from you shall not eat blood,' to caution the adults regarding the minors. What is the reason? That they should say to them, 'You shall not eat!' No, so that they should not add to it with their own hands."

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: ״אֱמוֹר ... וְאָמַרְתָּ״, לְהַזְהִיר גְּדוֹלִים עַל הַקְּטַנִּים. מַאי לָאו, דְּאָמַר לְהוּ לָא תִּיטַּמּוֹ! לָא, דְּלָא לִיטַמּוֹ לְהוּ בְּיָדַיִם.
human_translation: Come hear, “Speak and say to warn adults concerning minors. What, is it not that say to Do not become impure? No, that not render impure by action.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Ta shema: 'Emor ... ve'amarta', lehazhir gedolim al haketanim. Mai lav, de'amar lehu la titamo! La, de'lo litamo lehu beyadayim." English translation: "Come and hear: 'Say ... and you shall say', to caution the elders regarding the young. What is the reason? That he said to them, 'Do not hide it!' No, that they should not hide it in their hands."

hebrew_text: וּצְרִיכִי: דְּאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן שְׁקָצִים —
human_translation: are necessary, As, taught us repugnant creatures,
llm_translation: And it is necessary: for if we were to hear "abominations" —

hebrew_text: מִשּׁוּם דְּאִיסּוּרָן בְּמַשֶּׁהוּ, אֲבָל דָּם — דְּעַד דְּאִיכָּא רְבִיעִית, אֵימָא לָא. וְאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן דָּם — מִשּׁוּם דְּאִיכָּא כָּרֵת, אֲבָל שְׁרָצִים, אֵימָא לָא.
human_translation: because they are prohibited by any amount, However, blood, which unless there is a quarter say no And taught us blood, because there is karet However, for creeping animals, say not
llm_translation: Because their prohibition is by measure, but blood — until there is a quarter of a log, say no. And if we hear blood — because there is karet, but with regard to creeping things, say no.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן הָנֵי תַּרְתֵּי — מִשּׁוּם דְּאִיסּוּרָן שָׁוֶה בַּכֹּל, אֲבָל טוּמְאָה, אֵימָא לָא. וְאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן טוּמְאָה — כֹּהֲנִים שָׁאנֵי, מִשּׁוּם דְּרִיבָּה בָּהֶן מִצְוֹת יְתֵרוֹת, אֲבָל הָנֵי, אֵימָא לָא, צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: And taught us these two because their prohibitions apply equally to all However, ritual impurity, say no And taught us ritual impurity, priests is different because includes for them. However, these say no necessary
llm_translation: And if we were to hear those two — because their prohibition is equal in all, but impurity, perhaps not. And if we were to hear impurity — the priests are different, because there are additional commandments incumbent upon them, but these, perhaps not, is necessary.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: שְׁנֵי אַחִין, אֶחָד פִּקֵּחַ וְאֶחָד חֵרֵשׁ, נְשׂוּאִין שְׁתֵּי אֲחָיוֹת פִּקְּחוֹת. מֵת חֵרֵשׁ בַּעַל פִּקַּחַת, מָה יַעֲשֶׂה פִּקֵּחַ בַּעַל פִּקַּחַת? תֵּצֵא מִשּׁוּם אֲחוֹת אִשָּׁה.
human_translation: Come hear: two brothers, one a deaf-mute and one competent, married to two competent sisters, and the deaf-mute married to the competent died, what should the competent married to the competent do? released due to a wife’s sister.
llm_translation: Come and hear: Two brothers, one sighted and one deaf, married two sisters who are sighted. If the deaf brother dies, leaving the sighted sister-in-law, what should the sighted brother-in-law do? He should perform the act of the levirate marriage because of the sister-in-law.

hebrew_text: מֵת פִּקֵּחַ בַּעַל פִּקַּחַת, מָה יַעֲשֶׂה חֵרֵשׁ בַּעַל פִּקַּחַת? מוֹצִיא אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ בְּגֵט, וְאֵשֶׁת אָחִיו אֲסוּרָה לְעוֹלָם.
human_translation: the competent married to the competent died, what should the deaf-mute married to the competent do? He divorces his wife with a bill of divorce, And his brother’s wife is forbidden forever.
llm_translation: A dead person who is married to a woman who is capable of marriage, what should a deaf man who is married to a woman who is capable of marriage do? He should divorce his wife with a bill of divorce, and the wife of his brother is forbidden forever.

hebrew_text: אַמַּאי מוֹצִיא אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ בְּגֵט? תִּיתִּיב גַּבֵּיהּ, קָטָן אוֹכֵל נְבֵלוֹת הוּא! מִשּׁוּם אִיסּוּרָא דִידַהּ.
human_translation: Why he divorce his wife with a bill of divorce? Let her live with him, is as a minor who eats unslaughtered animals, due to the prohibition her,
llm_translation: "Why does one divorce his wife with a get? His stomach answers, 'A minor eats neveilot!' Because of her prohibition."

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: שְׁנֵי אַחִין פִּקְחִין נְשׂוּאִין שְׁתֵּי אֲחָיוֹת, אַחַת פִּקַּחַת וְאַחַת חֵרֶשֶׁת. מֵת פִּקֵּחַ בַּעַל חֵרֶשֶׁת, מָה יַעֲשֶׂה פִּקֵּחַ בַּעַל פִּקַּחַת? תֵּצֵא מִשּׁוּם אֲחוֹת אִשָּׁה. מֵת פִּקֵּחַ בַּעַל פִּקַּחַת, מָה יַעֲשֶׂה פִּקֵּחַ בַּעַל חֵרֶשֶׁת? מוֹצִיא אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ בַּגֵּט, וְאֵשֶׁת אָחִיו בַּחֲלִיצָה.
human_translation: Come hear: two competent brothers married to two sisters, one a deaf-mute and one competent, and the competent married to the deaf-mute died, what should the competent married to the competent do? released due to a wife’s sister. the competent married to the competent died, what should the competent married to the deaf-mute do? He divorces his wife with a bill of divorce, And he his brother’s wife, by means of ḥalitza ,
llm_translation: Come and hear: Two brothers, one married to two sisters, one is sighted and one is blind. If the sighted brother dies, what should the blind brother, the husband of the blind sister, do? He should perform chalitzah because of the sister-in-law. If the blind brother dies, what should the sighted brother, the husband of the sighted sister, do? He should give a bill of divorce to his wife, and perform chalitzah with the wife of his brother.

hebrew_text: וְאַמַּאי מוֹצִיא אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ בְּגֵט? תִּיתֵּיב גַּבֵּיהּ, קָטָן אוֹכֵל נְבֵלוֹת הוּא! מִשּׁוּם אִיסּוּרָא דִּידֵיהּ.
human_translation: But why he divorce his wife with a bill of divorce? Let her live with him, is as a minor who eats unslaughtered animals. due to the prohibition him.
llm_translation: And why does he divorce his wife with a get? It was answered before him, "A minor eats his own nevelot! Because of his own prohibition."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא, תָּא שְׁמַע: שְׁנֵי אַחִין, אֶחָד חֵרֵשׁ וְאֶחָד פִּקֵּחַ נְשׂוּאִין לִשְׁתֵּי אֲחָיוֹת, אַחַת פִּקַּחַת וְאַחַת חֵרֶשֶׁת. מֵת חֵרֵשׁ בַּעַל חֵרֶשֶׁת, מָה יַעֲשֶׂה פִּקֵּחַ בַּעַל פִּקַּחַת? תֵּצֵא מִשּׁוּם אֲחוֹת אִשְׁתּוֹ. מֵת פִּקֵּחַ בַּעַל פִּקַּחַת, מָה יַעֲשֶׂה חֵרֵשׁ בַּעַל חֵרֶשֶׁת? מוֹצִיא אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ בְּגֵט, וְאֵשֶׁת אָחִיו אֲסוּרָה לְעוֹלָם.
human_translation: Rava said: Come hear: two brothers, one a deaf-mute and one competent, married to two sisters, one a deaf-mute and one competent, and the deaf-mute married to the deaf-mute died, what should the competent married to the competent do? released due to a wife’s sister. the competent married to the competent died, what should the deaf-mute married to the deaf-mute do? He divorces his wife with a bill of divorce, and his brother’s wife is forbidden forever.
llm_translation: Rava said, come and hear: Two brothers, one deaf and one hearing, married two sisters, one hearing and one deaf. If the deaf brother dies, what should the hearing husband of the deaf sister do? He should divorce his wife because of his sister-in-law. If the hearing brother dies, what should the deaf husband of the deaf sister do? He should divorce his wife with a bill of divorce, and the wife of his brother is forbidden to him forever.

hebrew_text: וְהָא הָכָא דְּלָאו אִיסּוּרָא דִידַהּ אִיכָּא, וְלָאו אִיסּוּרָא דִּידֵיהּ אִיכָּא, וְקָתָנֵי: מוֹצִיא אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ בְּגֵט! אָמַר רַב שְׁמַעְיָה: גְּזֵירָה מִשּׁוּם הַתָּרַת יְבָמָה לַשּׁוּק.
human_translation: But here where there is no prohibition her and there is no prohibition him, and is taught he divorces his wife with a bill of divorce. Rav Shemaya said: decree due to permitting a yevama to public.
llm_translation: And here, where her prohibition exists, and his prohibition does not exist, and it teaches: "He shall write her a bill of divorce." Rav Shemaya said: It is a decree due to the permission of yibum for the marketplace.

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ חֵרֵשׁ
llm_translation: We will return to you, Haran.

hebrew_text: הָאִשָּׁה שֶׁהָלְכָה הִיא וּבַעְלָהּ לִמְדִינַת הַיָּם. שָׁלוֹם בֵּינוֹ לְבֵינָהּ, וְשָׁלוֹם בָּעוֹלָם. וּבָאָה וְאָמְרָה: ״מֵת בַּעְלִי״ — תִּנָּשֵׂא. ״מֵת בַּעְלִי״ — תִּתְיַיבֵּם.
human_translation: a woman who went, she and her husband, overseas, peace between him and her, and peace in the world, and came and said: My husband died, she may marry My husband died, she may enter into levirate marriage.
llm_translation: The woman who went, she and her husband, to the province of the sea. Peace between him and her, and peace in the world. And she comes and says: "My husband has died" - she shall be married. "My husband has died" - she shall perform the rite of levirate marriage.

hebrew_text: שָׁלוֹם בֵּינוֹ לְבֵינָהּ, וּמִלְחָמָה בָּעוֹלָם. קְטָטָה בֵּינוֹ לְבֵינָהּ, וְשָׁלוֹם בָּעוֹלָם. וּבָאתָה וְאָמְרָה: ״מֵת בַּעְלִי״ — אֵינָהּ נֶאֱמֶנֶת. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: לְעוֹלָם אֵינָהּ נֶאֱמֶנֶת, אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן בָּאתָה בּוֹכָה, וּבְגָדֶיהָ קְרוּעִין. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: אַחַת זוֹ וְאַחַת זוֹ תִּנָּשֵׂא.
human_translation: peace between him and her but war in the world, a quarrel between him and her and peace in the world, and she came and said: My husband died, she is not deemed credible, Rabbi Yehuda says: She is never deemed credible unless she came crying and her clothing was torn, They said to him: both this and this may marry
llm_translation: Peace between him and her, and war in the world. Strife between him and her, and peace in the world. And she came and said: "My husband is dead" — she is not believed. Rabbi Yehuda says: She is never believed, unless she comes crying, and her garments torn. They said to him: One of these and one of these will be married.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תְּנָא ״שָׁלוֹם בֵּינוֹ לְבֵינָהּ״, מִשּׁוּם דְּקָבָעֵי לְמִיתְנֵי ״קְטָטָה בֵּינוֹ לְבֵינָהּ״. תְּנָא ״שָׁלוֹם בָּעוֹלָם״, מִשּׁוּם דְּקָבָעֵי לְמִיתְנֵי ״מִלְחָמָה בְּעוֹלָם״.
human_translation: taught Peace between him and her, because he wanted to teach A quarrel between him and her. he taught: Peace in the world, because he wanted to teach War in the world.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: The Tanna said, "Peace between him and her," because they established to teach "a wall between him and her." The Tanna said, "Peace in the world," because they established to teach "war in the world."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּמִלְחָמָה — מִשּׁוּם דְּאָמְרָה בִּדְדָמֵי: סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּא בְּכֹל הָנֵי דְּאִיקְּטוּל, הוּא פָּלֵיט? אִם תִּימְצָא לוֹמַר, כֵּיוָן דְּשָׁלוֹם בֵּינוֹ לְבֵינָהּ נָטְרָא עַד דְּחָזְיָא, זִימְנִין דְּמָחוּ לֵיהּ בְּגִירָא אוֹ בְּרוּמְחָא וְסָבְרָא וַדַּאי מֵת, וְאִיכָּא דְּעָבֵד סַמְתָּרִי וְחָיֵה.
human_translation: Rava said: What is the reason when war? because she says she imagines enter one’s mind among all these who were killed, is saved? If you say: Since there was peace between him and her, she guards herself until she sees at times that strike him with an arrow or spear and she thinks he is certainly dead and there are when prepares medicine [ samterei ] and he survives,
llm_translation: Rava said: What is the reason for war? Because she (Jerusalem) said with her blood: "Perhaps there is a thought in all these who are fighting, he is saved? If you can say, since peace is kept between him and her until he sees, sometimes they will kill him with a sword or with a spear, and he will surely die, and there are those who make peace and live."

hebrew_text: סָבַר רָבָא לְמֵימַר רְעָבוֹן אֵינוֹ כְּמִלְחָמָה, דְּלָא אָמְרָה בִּדְדָמֵי. הֲדַר אָמַר רָבָא: רְעָבוֹן הֲרֵי הוּא כְּמִלְחָמָה. דְּהָהִיא דַּאֲתָת לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרָבָא, אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: ״בַּעְלִי מֵת בָּרָעָב״. אֲמַר לַהּ: שַׁפִּיר עֲבַדְתְּ דְּשֵׁיזִבְתְּ נַפְשִׁיךְ? סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ דִּבְהָהוּא פּוּרְתָּא דִּנְפָפִיתָא דִּשְׁבַקְתְּ לֵיהּ הֲוָה חָיֵי? אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: מָר נָמֵי יָדַע דְּכִי הַאי גַוְונָא לָא חָיֵי.
human_translation: Rava thought to say famine is not like war, as she will not say she imagines Rava then said: Famine is like war. because a certain woman came before Rava, said to him: My husband died in a famine. said to her: you do well to save yourself, enter your mind that with that small amount of sifted flour that you left him he could have survived? She said to him: The Master also knows that in a case like this he could not survive.
llm_translation: Rava thought to say, hunger is not like war, as it does not involve shedding blood. Later, Rava said: Hunger is indeed like war. When she came before Rava, she said to him, "My husband died of hunger." He said to her, "Did you do well by endangering your life?" Is it not your opinion that the bread that you left for him was still fresh? She said to him, "Master, you know that in such a case, one does not live."

hebrew_text: הֲדַר אָמַר רָבָא: רְעָבוֹן גְּרִיעָה מִמִּלְחָמָה. דְּאִילּוּ מִלְחָמָה, כִּי אָמְרָה: ״מֵת בַּעְלִי בַּמִּלְחָמָה״ הוּא דְּלָא מְהֵימְנָא, הָא ״מֵת עַל מִטָּתוֹ״ — מְהֵימְנָא. וְאִילּוּ גַּבֵּי רְעָבוֹן, עַד דְּאָמְרָה: ״מֵת וּקְבַרְתִּיו״.
human_translation: Rava then said: Famine is worse than war As wartime, if she said: My husband died in the war, that she is not deemed credible. He died upon his bed, she is deemed credible, whereas with regard to a famine she if she says: He died and I buried him.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: Hadr amar Rava: Re'avon geri'ah mimilchamah. De'ilu milchamah, ki amra: "Met ba'ali bamilchamah" hu delo meheimna, ha "Met al mitato" — meheimna. Ve'ilu gabbei re'avon, ad de'amra: "Met u'kevartiv." English translation: Hadr said Rava: Hunger is more severe than war. For in war, when it is said, "My husband died in battle," it is not believed, but when it is said, "He died on his bed," it is believed. And regarding hunger, until it is said, "He died and I buried him."

hebrew_text: מַפּוֹלֶת — הֲרֵי הוּא כְּמִלְחָמָה, דְּאָמְרָה בִּדְדָמֵי. שִׁילּוּחַ נְחָשִׁים וְעַקְרַבִּים — הֲרֵי הֵן כְּמִלְחָמָה, דְּאָמְרָה בִּדְדָמֵי.
human_translation: a rockslide is like war, as she will say she imagines an outbreak of snakes and scorpions is like war, as she will say she imagines
llm_translation: "Mappolet - behold it is like a war, as it says in bloods. Sending snakes and scorpions - behold they are like a war, as it says in bloods."

hebrew_text: דֶּבֶר — אָמְרִי לַהּ הֲרֵי הוּא כְּמִלְחָמָה, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ אֵינוֹ כְּמִלְחָמָה. אָמְרִי לַהּ הֲרֵי הוּא כְּמִלְחָמָה, דְּאָמְרִי בִּדְדָמֵי. וְאָמְרִי לַהּ אֵינוֹ כְּמִלְחָמָה, דְּסָמְכִי אַדְּאָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי: שַׁב שְׁנִין הָוֵה מוֹתָנָא, וְאִינָשׁ בְּלָא שְׁנֵי לָא אָזֵיל.
human_translation: pestilence some say it is like war, and some say it is not like war. Some say it is like war, as she will say she imagines some say it is not like war, because we rely on that which people say seven years there was pestilence and not a person left, before his time.
llm_translation: Word-for-word translation: "Davar — amri la'h harei hu kemilchama, ve'amri la'h einu kemilchama. Amri la'h harei hu kemilchama, de'amri bid'damei. Ve'amri la'h einu kemilchama, desamchi ad'amrei inashei: shav shenin haveh motana, veinashe bela shnei la'azil." English translation: "Word — they said to it: 'Behold, it is like a war,' and they said to it: 'It is not like a war.' They said to it: 'Behold, it is like a war,' for they said with blood. And they said to it: 'It is not like a war,' for people rely on words: 'Two years we were dying, and a person without two does not go.'"

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: הֶחְזִיקָה הִיא מִלְחָמָה בָּעוֹלָם, מַהוּ? מִי אָמְרִינַן מָה לָהּ לְשַׁקֵּר,
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before she maintains a war in the world, what is Do we say: Why should she lie?
llm_translation: The question was asked to them: "Is holding a form of warfare in the world, what is it? Who said to her to lie,"

hebrew_text: דְּאִי בָּעֲיָא אָמְרָה: ״שָׁלוֹם בָּעוֹלָם״. אוֹ דִלְמָא: כֵּיוָן דְּאִיחַזְקָה — אָמְרָה בִּדְדָמֵי, וְלָא אָתֵי ״מָה לִי לְשַׁקֵּר״ וּמַרַע חֶזְקָתֵיהּ.
human_translation: Because if she wanted she said: peace in the world, Or perhaps Since she has maintained she will say she imagines and Why would I lie, does not come and undermine the presumption
llm_translation: If she wants, she says: "Peace in the world." Or perhaps, since she has become established, she says in her heart, "What do I need to lie?" and her evil inclination departs.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: ״עִישְּׁינוּ עָלֵינוּ בַּיִת״, ״עִישְּׁינוּ עָלֵינוּ מְעָרָה״, ״הוּא מֵת, וַאֲנִי נִצַּלְתִּי״ — אֵינָהּ נֶאֱמֶנֶת. שָׁאנֵי הָתָם, דְּאָמַר לָהּ: כִּי הֵיכִי דִּלְדִידָךְ אִיתְרְחִישׁ נִיסָּא, לְדִידֵיהּ נָמֵי אִיתְרְחִישׁ נִיסָּא.
human_translation: Come hear: They set our house smoke, They set our cave smoke died and I was saved, she is not deemed credible. There, it is different, as one says to her: Just as a miracle occurred for you likewise a miracle occurred for
llm_translation: "Come and hear: 'He made a house for us,' 'He made a cave for us,' 'He died, and I was saved' — it is not reliable. It is different there, for he said to her: 'In order that you should be aware of My miracles, for Me there are also miracles.'"

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: ״נָפְלוּ עָלֵינוּ גּוֹיִם״, ״נָפְלוּ עָלֵינוּ לִיסְטִים״, ״הוּא מֵת, וְנִצַּלְתִּי״ — נֶאֱמֶנֶת. הָתָם, כִּדְרַב אִידִי. דְּאָמַר רַב אִידִי: אִשָּׁה כְּלֵי זַיְינָהּ עָלֶיהָ.
human_translation: Come hear gentiles attacked us, of bandits attacked us, died and I was saved, she is deemed credible. There, in accordance with Rav Idi. As Rav Idi said: a woman, her weapons are upon her.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Come and hear: 'Nations have fallen upon us,' 'Bandits have fallen upon us,' 'He is dead, and I have been saved' — trustworthy. There, as Rav Idi said: A woman is like her container." English translation:

hebrew_text: הָהוּא גַּבְרָא דִּבְשִׁילְהֵי הִלּוּלֵיהּ אִיתְּלַי נוּרָא בֵּי (גנני) [גְּנָנֵיהּ]. אֲמַרָה לְהוּ דְּבֵיתְהוּ: ״חֲזוֹ גַּבְרַאי! חֲזוֹ גַּבְרַאי!״ אֲתוֹ, חֲזוֹ גַּבְרָא חָרוֹכָא דִּשְׁדֵי, וּפִסְּתָא דִּידָא דְּשַׁדְיָא.
human_translation: a certain man who At the end of his wedding a fire broke out in the bridal chamber, His wife said to them: Look at my husband, look at my husband! They went and saw burnt man fallen down, and a palm lying
llm_translation: That man of the town of Hillel had a fire in his garden. His wife said to him: "Look, my husband! Look, my husband!" He came, and he saw a large fire in the field, and a flaxen cord in his hand.

hebrew_text: סָבַר רַב חִיָּיא בַּר אָבִין לְמֵימַר: הַיְינוּ ״עִישְּׁינוּ עָלֵינוּ בַּיִת, עִישְּׁינוּ עָלֵינוּ מְעָרָה״. אָמַר רָבָא: מִי דָּמֵי? הָתָם לָא קָאָמְרָה ״חֲזוֹ גַּבְרַאי, חֲזוֹ גַּבְרַאי״. וְעוֹד, גַּבְרָא חָרוֹכָא דִּשְׁדֵי, וּפִסְּתָא דִּידָא דְּשַׁדְיָא.
human_translation: Rav Ḥiyya bar Avin thought to say: This is They set our house smoke, They set our cave smoke Rava said: Is comparable There she did not say: Look at my husband, look at my husband. And furthermore, a burnt man who has fallen down and a palm that is lying
llm_translation: Rav Chiya bar Avin thought to say: "This is like 'We have built a house upon us, we have dug a cave upon us.'" Rava said: Who is similar? There, it does not say, "Look at my husband, look at my husband." Furthermore, a man's hole is different, and the flax of our hand is different.

hebrew_text: וְרַב חִיָּיא בַּר אָבִין — גַּבְרָא חָרוֹכָא דִּשְׁדֵי, אֵימָא אִינִישׁ אַחֲרִינָא אֲתָא לְאַצּוֹלֵי, וַאֲכַילְתֵּיהּ נוּרָא. וּפִסְּתָא דִידָא דְּשַׁדְיָא — נוּרָא אִיתְּלַיא וְאִתְיְלִיד בֵּיהּ מוּמָא, וּמֵחֲמַת כִּיסּוּפָא אֲזַל וַעֲרַק לְעָלְמָא.
human_translation: And Rav Ḥiyya bar Avin a burnt man who has fallen down say: another person came to the rescue and the fire burned him. And the palm lying the fire burned him and caused a deformity and due to his embarrassment he went and ran away to in the world,
llm_translation: Rav Chiya bar Avin - a man of the village of Shdei, they said, another person came to rob him, and he fed him fire. And the flax of our field in Shdei - fire would come down and a blemish would be born in it, and due to suspicion it would go and disappear into the world.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: עֵד אֶחָד בַּמִּלְחָמָה מַהוּ? טַעְמָא דְּעֵד אֶחָד מְהֵימַן — מִשּׁוּם דְּמִילְּתָא דַּעֲבִידָא לְאִיגַּלּוֹיֵי הוּא לָא מְשַׁקַּר, הָכָא נָמֵי לָא מְשַׁקַּר. אוֹ דִלְמָא: טַעְמָא דְּעֵד אֶחָד מִשּׁוּם דְּהִיא גּוּפָא דָּיְיקָא וּמִינַּסְבָא, וְהָכָא [כֵּיוָן דְּזִימְנִין דְּסָנְיָא לֵיהּ], לָא דָּיְיקָא וּמִינַּסְבָא.
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before them: one witness during a war, what is The reason that one witness is deemed credible because is a matter that is likely to be revealed, not lie Here, too, not lie. Or perhaps the reason that one witness is because she herself is exacting marries And here, since sometimes hates him, she is not exacting marries
llm_translation: He asked them: What is the law regarding one witness in a battle? The reason that the testimony of one witness is trusted is because when a person does something for his own benefit, he does not lie. Here too, he is not lying. Or perhaps the reason that the testimony of one witness is trusted is because it concerns a matter that is precise and fleeting, and here since there are times when the enemy is pursuing him, it is not precise and fleeting.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָמֵי בַּר חָמָא: תָּא שְׁמַע, אָמַר רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: כְּשֶׁיָּרַדְתִּי לִנְהַרְדְּעָא לְעַבֵּר הַשָּׁנָה, מְצָאַנִי נְחֶמְיָה אִישׁ בֵּית דְּלִי, וְאָמַר לִי: שָׁמַעְתִּי שֶׁאֵין מַשִּׂיאִין אֶת הָאִשָּׁה בְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל עַל פִּי עֵד אֶחָד, אֶלָּא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בָּבָא. וְנַמְתִּי לוֹ: כֵּן הַדְּבָרִים. אָמַר לִי, אֱמוֹר לָהֶם מִשְּׁמִי: אַתֶּם יוֹדְעִים הַמְּדִינָה הַזּוֹ מְשׁוּבֶּשֶׁת בִּגְיָיסוֹת? כָּךְ מְקוּבְּלַנִי מֵרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל הַזָּקֵן, שֶׁמַּשִּׂיאִין הָאִשָּׁה עַל פִּי עֵד אֶחָד.
human_translation: Rami bar Ḥama said: Come hear Rabbi Akiva said: When I descended to Neharde’a to intercalate the year, I found Neḥemya of Beit D’li, and he said to me: I heard that do not a woman to marry in Eretz Yisrael based on one witness, apart from Rabbi Yehuda ben Bava, And I said [ namti ] to him: This is so. He said to me: Say to them in my name: you know that this country is riddled with troops? This is I received from Rabban Gamliel the Elder, that a woman to marry based on one witness.
llm_translation: Ramai Bar Hama said: Come and hear, Rabbi Akiva said: When I descended to Nahardea to cross the river, Nehemya, a man of the house of Deli, found me and said to me: I heard that they do not marry off a woman in the land of Israel based on the testimony of one witness, except for Rabbi Yehuda ben Bava. And I responded to him: So it is. He said to me, tell them in my name: Do you know that this province is in turmoil with its conscriptions? This is what I have received from Rabban Gamliel the Elder, that they marry off a woman based on the testimony of one witness.

hebrew_text: מַאי מְדִינָה מְשׁוּבֶּשֶׁת בִּגְיָיסוֹת? לָאו, אַף עַל גַּב דִּמְדִינָה זוֹ מְשׁוּבֶּשֶׁת, כָּךְ מְקוּבְּלַנִי שֶׁמַּשִּׂיאִין עַל פִּי עֵד אֶחָד. אַלְמָא עֵד אֶחָד מְהֵימַן.
human_translation: What country is riddled with troops? Isn’t Even though this country is riddled this is I received, that a woman to marry based on one witness, Apparently, one witness is deemed credible
llm_translation: What is a province that is mixed with conscripts? No, even though this province is mixed, it is accepted that they appoint based on the testimony of one witness. This implies that one witness is believed.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: אִי הָכִי, מַאי שְׁנָא ״מְדִינָה זוֹ״? ״כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁיֵּשׁ גְּיָיסוֹת״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ! אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא, הָכִי קָאָמַר: אַתֶּם יוֹדְעִים שֶׁמְּדִינָה זוֹ מְשׁוּבֶּשֶׁת בִּגְיָיסוֹת, וְלָא אֶפְשָׁר לִי לְמִשְׁבַּק אִינָשֵׁי בֵיתִי וּמֵייתֵי קַמֵּי רַבָּנַן. כָּךְ מְקוּבְּלַנִי מֵרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל שֶׁמַּשִּׂיאִין הָאִשָּׁה עַל פִּי עֵד אֶחָד.
human_translation: Rava said: If this is what is country different He should have Any place where there are troops. Rather, Rava said: This is what he said: You know that this country is riddled with troops, and I cannot leave the members of my household and come before the Sages, this is I received from Rabban Gamliel that a woman to marry based on one witness.
llm_translation: Rava said: If so, what is the difference with "this province"? "Any place where there are troops" he requires it! Rather Rava said, this is what he meant to say: You know that this province is troubled by troops, and it is not possible for me to dismiss people from my house and bring them before the Rabbis. This is what I have received from Rabban Gamliel, that they marry a woman based on the testimony of one witness.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: מַעֲשֶׂה בִּשְׁנֵי תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים שֶׁהָיוּ בָּאִין עִם אַבָּא יוֹסֵי בֶּן סִימַאי בִּסְפִינָה, וְטָבְעָה, וְהִשִּׂיא רַבִּי נְשׁוֹתֵיהֶן עַל פִּי נָשִׁים. וְהָא מַיִם כְּמִלְחָמָה דָּמוּ. וְנָשִׁים, אֲפִילּוּ מֵאָה — כְּעֵד אֶחָד דָּמוּ, וְקָתָנֵי: הִשִּׂיא!
human_translation: Come hear an incident involving two Torah scholars who were coming with Abba Yosei ben Simai by boat, and sank. And Rabbi their wives to marry based on women But Water, is like war And women, even one hundred are considered as one witness And taught: to marry,
llm_translation: Come and hear: There was an incident involving two disciples of sages who were traveling with Abba Yosei ben Simai on a ship, and it sank, and they caused their wives to be brought out according to the manner of women. And the water was like the blood of a battle. And the women, even a hundred of them - like one witness, their blood, and the Mishnah teaches: They caused them to be brought out!

hebrew_text: וְתִסְבְּרָא? מַיִם שֶׁאֵין לָהֶם סוֹף נִינְהוּ, וּמַיִם שֶׁאֵין לָהֶם סוֹף — אִשְׁתּוֹ אֲסוּרָה. אֶלָּא הֵיכִי דָּמֵי, דְּאָמְרִי: אַסְּקִינְהוּ קַמַּן
human_translation: And you understand and this is an endless body of water, And an endless body of water his wife is prohibited Rather, What are the circumstances? That said: Those were brought up before us
llm_translation: And was created? Water that has no end, they are, and water that has no end - his wife is forbidden. Rather, how so? As they said: Let us bring them before us.

hebrew_text: וַחֲזֵינְהוּ לְאַלְתַּר, וְקָאָמְרִי סִימָנִין. דְּלָאו עֲלַיְיהוּ סָמְכִינַן, אֶלָּא אַסִּימָנִים.
human_translation: and we saw them immediately and stated distinguishing marks As, we do not rely upon but the distinguishing marks.
llm_translation: And they saw him immediately, and they said signs. That we do not rely on them, but on signs.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא גַּבְרָא דְּאַפְקֵיד שׁוּמְשְׁמֵי גַּבֵּי חַבְרֵיהּ, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הַב לִי שׁוּמְשְׁמַי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: שְׁקַילְתִּינְהוּ: וְהָא כֵּן וְכֵן הָוַיִין, וּבְחָבִיתָא רַמְיִין. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: דִּידָךְ שְׁקַלְתִּינְהוּ, וְהָנֵי — אַחֲרִינֵי נִינְהוּ.
human_translation: a certain man who deposited sesame plants with his friend. he said to him: Give me the sesame plants. said to him: You took them. But they were such-and-such and placed in a barrel; said to him: You took your and these are other ones.
llm_translation: The man who entrusted candles to his friends, said to him: Bring me my candles. He said to him: I have taken them, and so it was, and they were placed in a barrel. He said to him: I have taken mine, and those — are for others.

hebrew_text: סְבַר רַב חִסְדָּא לְמֵימַר: הַיְינוּ שְׁנֵי תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים, וְלָא אָמְרִינַן: הָנָךְ אֲזַלוּ לְעָלְמָא, וְהָנֵי אַחֲרִינֵי נִינְהוּ.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda thought to say: This is two Torah scholars And we do not say Those went in the world, and these are different people.
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisdah thought to say: Are these two Torah scholars, and we do not say: These have gone to the World to Come, and those are left behind?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא: מִי דָּמֵי? הָתָם, קָאָמְרִי סִימָנִים. הָכָא, שׁוּמְשְׁמֵי מַאי סִימָנָא אִית לְהוּ? וּדְקָאָמַר ״כֵּן וְכֵן הָוַיִין״ — אֵימַר חוּשְׁבָּנָא אִיתְרְמִי.
human_translation: Rava said to Is it comparable? There they said distinguishing marks Here, sesame plants, what distinguishing marks might they have, And that which he said: They were such-and-such say it happened by chance was amount,
llm_translation: He said to him, Rava: Who is similar? There, they are saying signs. Here, what sign do they have? And he said, "So and so were." — Say, there is calculation.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ מָר קַשִּׁישָׁא בַּר רַב חִסְדָּא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: וּמִי חָיְישִׁינַן שֶׁמָּא פִּינָּן? וְהָתְנַן: מָצָא כְלִי וְכָתוּב עָלָיו קוֹף — קׇרְבָּן, מֵם — מַעֲשֵׂר, דָּלֶת — דִּמּוּעַ, טֵית — טֶבֶל, תָּיו — תְּרוּמָה. שֶׁבִּשְׁעַת הַסַּכָּנָה הָיוּ כּוֹתְבִין תָּיו תַּחַת תְּרוּמָה!
human_translation: Mar Kashisha, son of Rav Ḥisda, said to Rav Ashi: And are we concerned perhaps moved them But didn’t we learn found a vessel on which kuf was written, korban , mem ma’aser , dalet , dimua , tet , tevel , tav , teruma . As during a time of danger, they would write, tav instead of teruma .
llm_translation: He said to him, Master Kashisha, son of Rav Hisda, said to Rav Ashi: "Do we need to be concerned that perhaps we have turned it upside down?" And we learned in a Mishnah: If one finds a vessel with the letter Kuf written on it - it is designated for a Korban (offering), Mem - for Ma'aser (tithes), Dalet - for Demai (produce of uncertain tithing status), Tet - for Tevel (untithed produce), Tav - for Terumah (priestly portion). During times of danger, they used to write the letter Tav under the Tet!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבִינָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: וְלָא חָיְישִׁינַן שֶׁמָּא פִּינָּן? אֵימָא סֵיפָא, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: אֲפִילּוּ מָצָא חָבִית וְכָתוּב עָלֶיהָ תְּרוּמָה — הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ חוּלִּין, שֶׁאֲנִי אוֹמֵר: אֶשְׁתָּקַד הֲוָה מָלֵא תְּרוּמָה, וּפִינָּהּ!
human_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: And aren’t we concerned perhaps moved Say the latter clause Rabbi Yosei says: Even if found a barrel on which teruma was written, these are non-sacred. As I say: Last year it was full of teruma , and removed
llm_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: "But aren't we concerned that perhaps they were turned over?" Let us say the latter part: Rabbi Yosei says: Even if one finds a barrel with 'terumah' written on it - these are considered ordinary items, for I say: Assume it was full of 'terumah,' and turn it over!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא חָיְישִׁינַן שֶׁמָּא פִּינָּן, וְהָכָא בְּהָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי. מָר סָבַר: אִם אִיתָא דְּפִינָּהוּ — מִיכְפָּר הֲוָה כָּפַר. וְאִידַּךְ: אֵימַר אִישְׁתְּלוֹיֵי אִישְׁתְּלִי. אִי נָמֵי, לְפַנְחַיָּא שַׁבְקֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rather, Everyone we are concerned perhaps moved and here, they disagree about this The Sage holds if it is so, that he moved he would have erased And the other say he forgot Alternatively, he left the label to preserve [ panaḥya ]
llm_translation: Rather: all of the world we are concerned perhaps we will turn, and here in this case we are in disagreement. The Master thought: if it comes that they turned — atonement was made. And the other one: let one hang, let the other hang. If so, leave it to Panḥaiya.

hebrew_text: יִצְחָק רֵישׁ גָּלוּתָא, בַּר אֲחָתֵיהּ דְּרַב בִּיבִי, הֲוָה קָאָזֵיל מִקּוּרְטָבָא לְאַסְפַּמְיָא, וּשְׁכֵיב. שְׁלַחוּ מֵהָתָם: יִצְחָק רֵישׁ גָּלוּתָא, בַּר אֲחָתֵיהּ דְּרַב בִּיבִי, הֲוָה קָאָזֵיל מִקּוּרְטָבָא לְאַסְפַּמְיָא, וּשְׁכֵיב. מִי חָיְישִׁינַן לִתְרֵי יִצְחָק, אוֹ לָא? אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: חָיְישִׁינַן. רָבָא אָמַר: לָא חָיְישִׁינַן.
human_translation: Yitzḥak the Exilarch, son of the sister of Rav Beivai, was walking from Cortva to Spain and died They sent from Yitzḥak the Exilarch, son of the sister of Rav Beivai, was walking from Cortva to Spain and died. Are we concerned about two Yitzḥak or not? Abaye said: We are concerned Rava said: We are not concerned.
llm_translation: Isaac the head of the exile, son of one of the disciples of Rav Bibi, was walking from Qurtaba to Aspamya, and he lay down. They sent from there: Isaac the head of the exile, son of one of the disciples of Rav Bibi, was walking from Qurtaba to Aspamya, and he lay down. Are we concerned for two Isaacs or not? Abbaye said: We are concerned. Rava said: We are not concerned.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: מְנָא אָמֵינָא לַהּ, דְּהָהוּא גִּיטָּא דְּאִשְׁתְּכַח בִּנְהַרְדְּעָא וּכְתִיב: בְּצַד קְלוֹנְיָא מָתָא אֲנָא אַנְדְּרוֹלִינַאי נְהַרְדָּעָא פְּטַרִית וְתָרֵכִית יָת פְּלוֹנִית אִנְתְּתִי. וְשַׁלְחַהּ אֲבוּהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה נְשִׂיאָה. וּשְׁלַח לֵיהּ: תִּיבָּדֵק נְהַרְדְּעָא כּוּלָּהּ.
human_translation: Abaye said: From where do I say As a certain bill of divorce was found in Neharde’a, and written On the colonial [ kelonya ] side of the city, I, Androlinai of Neharde’a, excused, sent away, my wife so-and-so. And the father of Shmuel sent this before Rabbi Yehuda Nesia And sent to him: All of Neharde’a must be examined,
llm_translation: Abaye said: From where do I say to her, that that bill of divorce was found in Nehardea, and it is written: "On the side of the river Matta, I, Androlinai, the daughter of Pelonit, am your wife." And the father of Shmuel sent it before Rabbi Yehudah the Prince. And he sent to him: Let the entire Nehardea be examined.

hebrew_text: וְרָבָא אָמַר: אִם אִיתָא — ״יִבָּדֵק כׇּל הָעוֹלָם״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ?! אֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם כְּבוֹדוֹ דַּאֲבוּהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל הוּא דִּשְׁלַח הָכִי.
human_translation: And Rava said: If it is so, should have The entire world must be examined, Rather, it was due to respect for the father of Shmuel that he sent this
llm_translation: Rava said: If it comes - "Let the whole world be examined," what does he need it for?! Rather, it is because of the honor of the father of Shmuel that he sent thus.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: מְנָא אָמֵינָא לַהּ — דְּהָנְהוּ תְּרֵי שְׁטָרֵי דְּנָפְקִי בְּמָחוֹזָא וּכְתִיב בְּהוּ: חָבֵי בַּר נַנַּאי וְנַנַּאי בַּר חָבֵי, וְאַגְבִּי בְּהוּ רָבָא בַּר אֲבוּהּ זוּזֵי. וְהָא חָבֵי בַּר נַנַּאי וְנַנַּאי בַּר חָבֵי בְּמָחוֹזָא שְׁכִיחִי טוּבָא. וְאַבָּיֵי?
human_translation: Rava said: From where do I say As there were two notes produced in Meḥoza, and written on them: Ḥavai bar Nanai and Nanai bar Ḥavai, and Rava bar Avuh collected dinars with these And Ḥavai bar Nanai and Nanai bar Ḥavai are very common in Meḥoza, And Abaye,
llm_translation: Rava said: From where do I say this? — Because those two documents that were produced in the district, and it is written in them: "Havi bar Nanai and Nanai bar Havi, and Agbi in them, Rava bar Avuh Zuzai." And Havi bar Nanai and Nanai bar Havi are commonly found in the district. And Abaye?

hebrew_text: לְמַאי נֵיחוּשׁ לַהּ? אִי לִנְפִילָה — מִזְהָר זְהִיר בֵּיהּ. אִי לְפִקָּדוֹן — כֵּיוָן דִּשְׁמֵיהּ כִּשְׁמֵיהּ לָא מַפְקֵיד גַּבֵּיהּ.
human_translation: With regard to what be concerned If about falling, careful with it If about a deposit since his name is the same as the name would not deposit with him
llm_translation: For what is it necessary for her? If for falling - be cautious with it. If for counting - since his name is not like her name, he does not appoint himself.

hebrew_text: מַאי אָמְרַתְּ, דִּלְמָא מְסַר לֵיהּ? אוֹתִיּוֹת נִקְנוֹת בִּמְסִירָה.
human_translation: If you say perhaps passed, to this letters are acquired through passing.
llm_translation: What do you say, perhaps he handed it over? Signs are acquired through transfer.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא גִּיטָּא דְּאִשְׁתְּכַח בְּסוּרָא וּכְתִיב בֵּיהּ הָכִי: בְּסוּרָא מָתָא אֲנָא עָנָן בַּר חִיָּיא נְהַרְדָּעָא פְּטַרִית וְתָרֵכִית פְּלוֹנִית אִנְתְּתִי. וּבְדַקוּ רַבָּנַן מִסּוּרָא וְעַד נְהַרְדְּעָא, וְלָא הֲוָה עָנָן בַּר חִיָּיא אַחֲרִינָא לְבַר מֵעָנָן בַּר חִיָּיא מְחַגְּרָא דַּהֲוָה בִּנְהַרְדְּעָא. וַאֲתוֹ סָהֲדִי וֶאֱמוֹר דְּהָהוּא יוֹמָא כִּי אִיכְּתַב הָהוּא גִּיטָּא, עָנָן בַּר חִיָּיא מְחַגְּרָא גַּבַּן הֲוָה.
human_translation: a certain bill of divorce that was found in Sura and the following was written in it: In the city of Sura, I, Anan bar Ḥiyya Neharde’a, excused and sent away my wife, so-and-so. And the Sages examined from Sura to Neharde’a, and there was no other Anan bar Ḥiyya apart from an Anan bar Ḥiyya of Ḥagra who was in Neharde’a. And witnesses came and said that on that day, when that bill of divorce was written: Anan bar Ḥiyya of Ḥagra was with us
llm_translation: That bill of divorce that was found in Surah, and it is written in it thus: "In Surah, I, Anan son of Hiyya, of Nehardea, have released and divorced Plonit my wife." And the Rabbis examined from Surah to Nehardea, and there was no other Anan son of Hiyya after the son of Hiyya who was in Nehardea. And witnesses came and said that on that day when that bill of divorce was written, Anan son of Hiyya of Nehardea was ill.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: אַף לְדִידִי דְּאָמֵינָא חָיְישִׁינַן — הָכָא לָא חָיְישִׁינַן, דְּהָא קָאָמְרִי סָהֲדִי דְּבִנְהַרְדְּעָא הֲוָה, מַאי בְּעָא בְּסוּרָא.
human_translation: Abaye said: Even according to my which I say we are concerned here we are not concerned. that the witnesses say was in Neharde’a; what, is he doing in Sura?
llm_translation: Abaye said: Even according to my opinion that we are concerned - here we are not concerned, for they are saying that the witnesses of Bein HaArde'a were there, what does he need in Surah.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: אַף לְדִידִי דְּלָא חָיְישִׁינַן — הָכָא חָיְישִׁינַן, דִּלְמָא בְּגַמְלָא פָּרְחָא אֲזַל. אִי נָמֵי בִּקְפִיצָה. אִי נָמֵי מִילֵּי מְסַר.
human_translation: Rava said: Even according to my that we are not concerned here, we are concerned. perhaps he went by a flying camel, Alternatively, by shortcut. Alternatively, given verbal instructions
llm_translation: Rava said: Even according to me who do not concern ourselves - here we concern ourselves, perhaps he went to steal. Either through a leap or through words of tradition.

hebrew_text: כְּדַאֲמַר לְהוּ רַב לְסָפְרֵי, וְכֵן אֲמַר לְהוּ רַב הוּנָא לְסָפְרֵי: כִּי אִיתַנְכוּ בְּשִׁילֵי כְּתוּבוּ בְּשִׁילֵי, אַף עַל גַּב דְּמִימַּסְרָן מִילֵּי בְּהִינֵי. וְכִי אִיתַנְכוּ בְּהִינֵי כְּתוּבוּ בְּהִינֵי, אַף עַל גַּב דְּמִימַּסְרָן מִילֵּי בְּשִׁילֵי.
human_translation: as Rav said to the scribes, and likewise Rav Huna said to the scribes: When you are in Shili, write in Shili, even when the instructions are given in Hini. And when you are in Hini, write in Hini, even when the instructions are given in Shili.
llm_translation: As Rav said to the scribes, and so said Rav Huna to the scribes: "When they were given in writing, they were given in writing, even though the words were transmitted orally. And when they were given orally, they were given orally, even though the words were written."

hebrew_text: מַאי הֲוָה עֲלַיְיהוּ דְּשׁוּמְשְׁמֵי? רַב יֵימַר אָמַר: לָא חָיְישִׁינַן. רָבִינָא אָמַר: חָיְישִׁינַן. וְהִלְכְתָא: חָיְישִׁינַן.
human_translation: What was about this sesame plants? Rav Yeimar said: We are not concerned Ravina said: We are concerned. And halakha we are concerned
llm_translation: Talmudic text: What was the concern regarding the sun's setting? Rav Yeimar said: We are not concerned. Ravina said: We are concerned. And the halakha is: We are concerned.

hebrew_text: קְטָטָה בֵּינוֹ לְבֵינָהּ וְכוּ׳. הֵיכִי דָּמֵי קְטָטָה בֵּינוֹ לְבֵינָהּ, אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: בְּאוֹמֶרֶת לְבַעְלָהּ ״גָּרְשֵׁינִי״. כּוּלְּהוּ נָמֵי אָמְרוּ הָכִי! אֶלָּא בְּאוֹמֶרֶת לְבַעְלָהּ ״גֵּירַשְׁתַּנִי״.
human_translation: a quarrel between him and her, What are the circumstances quarrel between him and her? Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: where her say to her husband: Divorce me. All likewise say this Rather, when she says to her husband: You divorced me,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: A piece of paper between him and her, etc. How so? What is the case of a piece of paper between him and her? Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: By saying to her husband, "Divorce me." All of them also said this! Rather, by saying to her husband, "You have divorced me."

hebrew_text: וְלִיהֵמְנַהּ מִדְּרַב הַמְנוּנָא. דְּאָמַר רַב הַמְנוּנָא: אִשָּׁה שֶׁאָמְרָה לְבַעְלָהּ ״גֵּירַשְׁתַּנִי״ — נֶאֱמֶנֶת. חֲזָקָה אֵין אִשָּׁה מְעִיזָּה פָּנֶיהָ בִּפְנֵי בַּעְלָהּ!
human_translation: let us believe her in of Rav Hamnuna. As Rav Hamnuna said: A woman who said to her husband: You divorced me, is deemed credible. a presumption a woman would not dare in the presence of her husband
llm_translation: And they taught it from Rav Hamnuna. For Rav Hamnuna said: A woman who said to her husband, "I have divorced you" - she is believed. It is a presumption; a woman does not dare to confront her husband!

hebrew_text: בְּאוֹמֶרֶת ״גֵּירַשְׁתַּנִי בִּפְנֵי פְּלוֹנִי וּפְלוֹנִי״, וְשַׁאֵילְנָא וְאָמְרוּ: ״לֹא הָיוּ דְבָרִים מֵעוֹלָם״.
human_translation: when she says: You divorced me in the presence of so-and-so and so-and-so; and asked those and they said: This matter never happened.
llm_translation: In saying, "I divorced myself in the presence of so-and-so and so-and-so," and we asked and they said, "These words were never spoken."

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא דִּקְטָטָה? רַב חֲנִינָא אָמַר: מִשּׁוּם דִּמְשַׁקְּרָא. רַב שִׁימִי בַּר אָשֵׁי אָמַר: מִשּׁוּם דְּאָמְרָה בִּדְדָמֵי. מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ?
human_translation: What is the reason in a quarrel Rav Ḥanina said: Because she lies, Rav Shimi bar Ashi said: Because she says she imagines What is between
llm_translation: What is the reason for the cracking? Rav Chanina said: Because it is brittle. Rav Shimi bar Ashe said: Because it was said in blood. What is the difference between them?

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ דְּאַרְגֵּיל הוּא קְטָטָה.
human_translation: between them is where he initiated the quarrel.
llm_translation: There is a difference between them, for he is a "katata."

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: עֵד אֶחָד בִּקְטָטָה, מַהוּ? מַאי טַעְמָא דְּעֵד אֶחָד מְהֵימַן: מִשּׁוּם דְּמִילְּתָא דַּעֲבִידָא לְאִיגַּלּוֹיֵי לָא מְשַׁקַּר — הָכָא נָמֵי לָא מְשַׁקַּר, אוֹ דִלְמָא: טַעְמָא דְּעֵד אֶחָד מְהֵימַן מִשּׁוּם דְּהִיא דָּיְיקָא וּמִינַּסְבָא, וְהָכָא, כֵּיוָן דְּאִית לֵיהּ קְטָטָה, לָא דָּיְיקָא וּמִינַּסְבָא? תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before one witness in a quarrel what is What is the reason that one witness is deemed credible? because is a matter that is likely to be revealed, not lie Here too, not lie. Or perhaps the reason that one witness is deemed credible is because she is exacting marries And here, since there is a quarrel she is not exacting marries shall stand
llm_translation: He asked them: If there is one witness in a dispute, what is the reason that the testimony of one witness is believed: because a matter that leads to embarrassment is not easily fabricated — here too, it is not easily fabricated, or perhaps: the reason that the testimony of one witness is believed is because it is precise and consistent, but here, since there is a dispute, is it not precise and consistent? This matter remains unresolved.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר לְעוֹלָם אֵינָהּ וְכוּ׳. תַּנְיָא, אָמְרוּ לוֹ לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה: לִדְבָרֶיךָ, פִּקַּחַת — תִּנָּשֵׂא, שׁוֹטָה — לֹא תִּנָּשֵׂא?! אֶלָּא, אַחַת זוֹ וְאַחַת זוֹ תִּנָּשֵׂא.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says is never It is taught said to Rabbi Yehuda: According to your statement, a crafty woman will marry. a foolish woman will not marry. Rather, both this and that may marry.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: Always it is not, etc. It was taught: They said to Rabbi Yehuda, "According to your words, a wise woman should be married, but a fool should not be married?!" Rather, one like this and one like this should be married.

hebrew_text: הָהִיא דַּאֲתַאי לְבֵי דִינָא דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, אָמְרִי לַהּ: סִפְדִי בַּעְלִךְ, קְרַעִי מָאנִיךְ, סִתְרִי מַזְיִיךְ. אַלְּפוּהָ שִׁיקְרָא? אִינְהוּ כְּרַבָּנַן סְבִירָא לְהוּ, אָמְרִי: תַּעֲבֵיד הָכִי כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלִישְׁרְיֻהָ.
human_translation: a certain who came to the court of Rabbi Yehuda. said to her: Lament your husband, tear your clothing, unbind your hair, they instruct her to lie? They thought, in accordance with the Rabbis, they said she should do this, so that would permit her
llm_translation: That one who came to the court of Rabbi Yehuda, they said to her: Eulogize your husband, tear your garments, cover your head. Did they teach her falsehood? They are like the Rabbis who hold it proper, they said: Do this so that it will be done properly.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ בֵּית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: לֹא שָׁמַעְנוּ אֶלָּא בְּבָאָה מִן הַקָּצִיר, וּבְאוֹתָהּ מְדִינָה, וּכְמַעֲשֶׂה שֶׁהָיָה.
human_translation: Beit Hillel say: We heard only when she comes from the grain harvest, and in the same country and similar to the incident that occurred,
llm_translation: The House of Hillel teaches: We only heard with regard to the produce from the time of harvesting, and in that specific region, and in a manner similar to the way it was done.

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ לָהֶם בֵּית שַׁמַּאי: אַחַת הַבָּאָה מִן הַקָּצִיר, וְאַחַת הַבָּאָה מִן הַזֵּיתִים, וְאַחַת הַבָּאָה מִן הַבָּצִיר, וְאַחַת הַבָּאָה מִמְּדִינָה לִמְדִינָה. לֹא דִּבְּרוּ חֲכָמִים בַּקָּצִיר אֶלָּא בַּהוֹוֶה. חָזְרוּ בֵּית הִלֵּל לְהוֹרוֹת כְּבֵית שַׁמַּאי.
human_translation: Beit Shammai said to same who comes from the grain harvest, and one who comes from the olive and one who comes from the grape harvest, and one who comes from one country to country. the Sages spoke of the grain harvest only present Beit Hillel retracted to teach in accordance with Beit Shammai
llm_translation: They said to the House of Shammai: One woman who comes from the harvest, and one woman who comes from the olives, and one woman who comes from the grapes, and one woman who comes from province to province. The Sages spoke only regarding the present time in the harvest. The House of Hillel retracted to rule like the House of Shammai.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תַּנְיָא, אָמְרוּ לָהֶם בֵּית שַׁמַּאי לְבֵית הִלֵּל: לְדִבְרֵיכֶם, אֵין לִי אֶלָּא קְצִיר חִטִּים — קְצִיר שְׂעוֹרִים, מִנַּיִן? וְאֵין לִי אֶלָּא קוֹצֵר — בּוֹצֵר, מוֹסֵק, גּוֹדֵר, עוֹדֵר, מִנַּיִן?
human_translation: It is taught Beit Shammai said to Beit Hillel: According to your statement I have only the wheat harvest. From where the barley harvest? And I have only one who reaps From where someone who harvests or harvests or harvests or harvests
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemara, tanya, amru lahem Beit Shammai le'Beit Hillel: le'divrechem, ein li ela ketzir chitim - ketzir se'orim, minayin? Ve'ein li ela kotzer - botzer, mosek, goder, oder, minayin?" English translation: "A teaching was taught: Beit Shammai said to Beit Hillel: According to your words, I have only wheat harvesting - barley harvesting, from where? And I have only harvesting - reaping, gathering, binding, stacking, from where?"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מַעֲשֶׂה שֶׁהָיָה בַּקָּצִיר, וְהוּא הַדִּין לְכוּלְּהוּ. הָכָא נָמֵי: מַעֲשֶׂה שֶׁהָיָה בְּאוֹתָהּ מְדִינָה, וְהוּא הַדִּין לְכוּלְּהוּ.
human_translation: Rather, that incident which occurred during the grain harvest, and the same is true of all these Here too, the incident that occurred in that country, but the same is true of all these
llm_translation: Rather, a story that occurred during the harvest, and it is the same for all. Here it is stated: a story that occurred in that province, and it is the same for all.

hebrew_text: וּבֵית הִלֵּל: בְּאוֹתָהּ מְדִינָה דִּשְׁכִיחִי אִינָשֵׁי — מִירְתַת, מִמְּדִינָה לִמְדִינָה אַחֶרֶת, דְּלָא שְׁכִיחִי אִינָשֵׁי — לָא מִירְתַת. וּבֵית שַׁמַּאי: הָכָא נָמֵי שְׁכִיחִי שַׁיָּירָתָא.
human_translation: And Beit Hillel, In that same country, where people are found she is scared between one country and another country, where people are not found she is not scared, And Beit Shammai Here too caravans are found,
llm_translation: House of Hillel: In that province where people are diligent - from one province to another province, where people are not diligent - do not be diligent. And House of Shammai: Here it is said, the diligent will remain.

hebrew_text: מַאי מַעֲשֶׂה שֶׁהָיָה? דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: שִׁילְפֵי קָצִיר חִטִּין הָיוּ, וְהָלְכוּ עֲשָׂרָה בְּנֵי אָדָם לִקְצוֹר חִטִּין, נְשָׁכוֹ נָחָשׁ לְאֶחָד מֵהֶן וּמֵת, וּבָאת אִשְׁתּוֹ וְהוֹדִיעָה לְבֵית דִּין. וְשָׁלְחוּ וּמָצְאוּ כִּדְבָרֶיהָ. בְּאוֹתָהּ שָׁעָה אָמְרוּ: הָאִשָּׁה שֶׁאָמְרָה ״מֵת בַּעְלִי״ — תִּנָּשֵׂא, ״מֵת בַּעְלִי״ — תִּתְיַיבֵּם.
human_translation: What incident that occurred? As Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: It was at the end [ shilfei ] of the wheat harvest, and ten people went to harvest wheat. A snake bit one of them and he died, and his wife came and told the court And they sent discovered in accordance with her statement. At that time they said: The woman who says: My husband died, may marry My husband died she enters into levirate marriage.
llm_translation: What was the incident that occurred? For Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: There were bundles of wheat in the field, and ten men went to harvest the wheat. A snake bit one of them, and he died. His wife came and informed the court. They sent investigators and found it to be as she had said. At that moment they said: If a woman says, "My husband is dead" — she shall be married to his brother through levirate marriage, "My husband is dead" — she shall perform the ceremony of halitzah.

hebrew_text: נֵימָא רַבִּי חֲנַנְיָא בֶּן עֲקִיבָא וְרַבָּנַן בִּפְלוּגְתָּא דְּבֵית שַׁמַּאי וּבֵית הִלֵּל קָמִיפַּלְגִי? דְּתַנְיָא: לֹא יִשָּׂא אָדָם מֵי חַטָּאת וְאֵפֶר חַטָּאת וְיַעֲבִירֵם בַּיַּרְדֵּן וּבִסְפִינָה,
human_translation: Let us say Rabbi Ḥananya ben Akiva and the Rabbis, disagree with regard to the dispute between Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel. As it is taught A person may not carry the waters of purification, and the ashes of purification, and transport them on the Jordan And in a boat.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates as follows: "Nay, did Rabbi Hananiah ben Akiva and the sages dispute in the case of the division between Beit Shammai and Beit Hillel? For it was taught: One may not take the ashes of the sin-offering and the ashes of the red heifer and pass them over the Jordan and on a ship."

hebrew_text: וְלֹא יַעֲמוֹד בְּצַד זֶה וְיִזְרֹק לְצַד אַחֵר, וְלֹא יְשִׁיטֵם עַל פְּנֵי הַמַּיִם, וְלֹא יַרְכִּיבֵם לֹא עַל גַּבֵּי בְּהֵמָה וְלֹא עַל גַּבֵּי חֲבֵרוֹ, אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן הָיוּ רַגְלָיו נוֹגְעוֹת בַּקַּרְקַע. אֲבָל מַעֲבִירָם עַל הַגֶּשֶׁר, אֶחָד יַרְדֵּן וְאֶחָד שְׁאָר נְהָרוֹת. רַבִּי חֲנַנְיָא בֶּן עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: לֹא אָמְרוּ אֶלָּא יַרְדֵּן, וּבִסְפִינָה, וּכְמַעֲשֶׂה שֶׁהָיָה.
human_translation: And one may not stand on one side and throw to the other side, nor float them upon the water nor ride with them neither on the back of an animal nor on the back of another unless the legs were touching the ground. However, one may transport them over a bridge. both the Jordan and other rivers. Rabbi Ḥananya ben Akiva says: They said only the Jordan, and in a boat, and in to incident that occurred,
llm_translation: And not stand on this side and throw to the other side, and not throw them on the surface of the water, and not ride them neither on the back of an animal nor on the back of his fellow, unless his feet were touching the ground. But he may pass them over the bridge, one the Jordan and one the other rivers. Rabbi Chananya ben Akiva says: They only said the Jordan, and by boat, and as the incident that occurred.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא רַבָּנַן דְּאָמְרִי כְּבֵית שַׁמַּאי. וְרַבִּי חֲנַנְיָא בֶּן עֲקִיבָא דְּאָמַר כְּבֵית הִלֵּל.
human_translation: Let us say the Rabbis say in accordance with Beit Shammai, And Rabbi Ḥananya ben Akiva says in accordance with Beit Hillel,
llm_translation: Let us say the sages who say like Beit Shammai. And Rabbi Hananiah ben Akiva who says like Beit Hillel.

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי לָךְ רַבָּנַן: אֲנַן דְּאָמְרִינַן אַף כְּבֵית הִלֵּל, עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמַר בֵּית הִלֵּל הָתָם, אֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם דְּמִירַתְתָ[א]; בְּמָקוֹם קָרוֹב — מִירַתְתָ[א], בְּמָקוֹם רָחוֹק — לָא מִירַתְתָ[א]. הָכָא, מָה לִי יַרְדֵּן מָה לִי שְׁאָר נְהָרוֹת.
human_translation: The Rabbis say to you: We stated even in accordance with Beit Hillel, Beit Hillel state only there, because she is scared. In a nearby place she is scared in a distant place she is not scared. here, what to me the Jordan what to me other rivers?
llm_translation: The sages said to you: We who say like the House of Hillel, until here the House of Hillel did not say there, but because of the word; in a close place - because of the word, in a distant place - not because of the word. Here, what do I need the Jordan River for, what do I need the other rivers for.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי חֲנַנְיָא בֶּן עֲקִיבָא אָמַר לָךְ: אֲנָא דַּאֲמַרִי אַף לְבֵית שַׁמַּאי. עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמְרִי בֵּית שַׁמַּאי הָתָם, אֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם דְּאִיהִי דָּיְיקָא וּמִינַּסְבָא, מָה לִי מָקוֹם קָרוֹב מָה לִי מָקוֹם רָחוֹק. הָכָא, מִשּׁוּם מַעֲשֶׂה שֶׁהָיָה. בַּיַּרְדֵּן וּבִסְפִינָה דַּהֲוָה מַעֲשֶׂה — גְּזוּר רַבָּנַן, בִּשְׁאָר נְהָרוֹת דְּלָא הֲוָה מַעֲשֶׂה — לָא גְּזוּר רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥananya ben Akiva said to you: I stated even in accordance with Beit Shammai, Beit Shammai state only there, because she is exacting marries what to me the place is near, what to me the place is far? Here, due to incident that occurred. And the Sages issued decree with regard to the Jordan and in a boat, which incident occurred. the Sages did not issue decree with regard to other rivers, where the incident did not occur.
llm_translation: Rabbi Hananiah ben Akiva said to you: I, who said even to Beit Shammai. Until here, they did not say Beit Shammai there, but because it is precise and cautious, what do I care if it is a nearby place or a distant place. Here, because of an incident that occurred. In the Jordan and in a boat where there was an incident - the Rabbis decreed, in other rivers where there was no incident - the Rabbis did not decree.

hebrew_text: מַאי מַעֲשֶׂה שֶׁהָיָה? דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּאָדָם שֶׁהָיָה מַעֲבִיר מֵי חַטָּאת וְאֵפֶר חַטָּאת בַּיַּרְדֵּן וּבִסְפִינָה, וְנִמְצָא כְּזַיִת מִן הַמֵּת תָּחוּב בְּקַרְקָעִית שֶׁל סְפִינָה. בְּאוֹתָהּ שָׁעָה אָמְרוּ: לֹא יִשָּׂא אָדָם מֵי חַטָּאת וְאֵפֶר חַטָּאת וְיַעֲבִירֵם בַּיַּרְדֵּן וּבִסְפִינָה.
human_translation: What this incident that occurred, As Rav Yehuda said Rav said: An incident involving a person who was transporting waters of purification and ashes of purification on the Jordan and in a boat, and an olive-bulk of a corpse was found stuck to the bottom of the boat, At that time they said: A person may not carry waters of purification and ashes of purification and transport them on the Jordan and in a boat.
llm_translation: What was the incident that occurred? For Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: There was an incident involving a man who would transport the waters of purification and the ashes of the red heifer across the Jordan River and on a ship, and a small olive's worth of the dead was found stuck in the hull of the ship. At that moment they said: A person should not transport the waters of purification and the ashes of the red heifer and pass them across the Jordan River and on a ship.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: תִּנָּשֵׂא, וְתִטּוֹל כְּתוּבָּתָהּ. בֵּית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: תִּנָּשֵׂא, וְלֹא תִּטּוֹל כְּתוּבָּתָהּ. אָמְרוּ לָהֶם בֵּית שַׁמַּאי: הִתַּרְתֶּם עֶרְוָה חֲמוּרָה, וְלֹא נַתִּיר מָמוֹן הַקַּל?! אָמְרוּ לָהֶם בֵּית הִלֵּל: מָצִינוּ
human_translation: Beit Shammai say: may marry, and take her marriage contract. Beit Hillel say: She may marry, but she may not take her marriage contract, Beit Shammai said to them: you have permitted woman forbidden to him, which is stringent will we not permit a monetary matter, lenient, Beit Hillel said to them: we find
llm_translation: The Mishnah: Beit Shammai say: She may be divorced, and her marriage contract taken. Beit Hillel say: She may be divorced, but her marriage contract may not be taken. Beit Shammai said to Beit Hillel: You have permitted a severe matter of impropriety, and not allowed a minor matter of financial loss?! Beit Hillel said to Beit Shammai: We have found...

hebrew_text: שֶׁאֵין הָאַחִין נִכְנָסִין לַנַּחֲלָה עַל פִּיהָ!
human_translation: that the brothers do not come into inheritance based on her
llm_translation: The brothers do not enter the inheritance based on her!

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ לָהֶם בֵּית שַׁמַּאי: וַהֲלֹא מִסֵּפֶר כְּתוּבָּה נִלְמוֹד, שֶׁהוּא כּוֹתֵב לָהּ: שֶׁאִם תִּנָּשְׂאִי לְאַחֵר תִּטְּלִי מַה שֶּׁכָּתוּב לִיכִי. וְחָזְרוּ בֵּית הִלֵּל לְהוֹרוֹת כְּדִבְרֵי בֵּית שַׁמַּאי.
human_translation: Beit Shammai said to them: But we can learn this from the scroll of the marriage contract, as writes for her that: If you marry another take what is written for you And Beit Hillel retracted to teach in accordance with Beit Shammai.
llm_translation: They said to them, Beit Shammai: Is it not written in a written book, that he writes to her: that if you will be married to another, you shall remove what is written for you. And Beit Hillel returned to teach according to the words of Beit Shammai.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: נִתְיַיבְּמָה — יְבָמָהּ נִכְנָס לַנַּחֲלָה עַל פִּיהָ. הֵם דָּרְשׁוּ מִדְרַשׁ כְּתוּבָּה — אָנוּ לֹא נִדְרוֹשׁ מִדְרַשׁ תּוֹרָה?!
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: entered into levirate marriage her yavam comes into inheritance based on her taught by interpreting homiletically marriage contract, will we not teach by interpreting homiletically the Torah
llm_translation: Gemara said Rav Ḥisda: If she was married to a man who died childless, she enters into inheritance based on her own status as a yevamah. They interpreted a homiletical interpretation from a written verse - Are we not to interpret a Torah interpretation?!

hebrew_text: ״יָקוּם עַל שֵׁם אָחִיו״ אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא, וַהֲרֵי קָם.
human_translation: The Merciful One states “He shall succeed in the name of his brother” And did succeed
llm_translation: "Yakum al shem achiv" amar rachamana, veharei kam.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: בָּאת לְבֵית דִּין וְאָמְרָה ״מֵת בַּעְלִי, הַתִּירוּנִי לְהִנָּשֵׂא״ — מַתִּירִין אוֹתָהּ לְהִנָּשֵׂא וְנוֹתְנִין לָהּ כְּתוּבָּתָהּ. ״תְּנוּ לִי כְּתוּבָּתִי״ — אַף לְהִנָּשֵׂא אֵין מַתִּירִין אוֹתָהּ. מַאי טַעְמָא — אַדַּעְתָּא דִכְתוּבָּה אֲתַאי.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said: came to the court and said: My husband died; permit me to marry. they permit her to marry, and give her her marriage contract. Give me my marriage contract, they do not even permit her to marry. What is the reason? she came with marriage contract in mind,
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said: If she came to the court and said, "My husband has died, permit me to remarry," they permit her to remarry and give her her marriage document. If she says, "Give me my marriage document," they do not permit her to remarry. What is the reason? Because the knowledge of her marriage document comes to her.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: ״הַתִּירוּנִי לְהִנָּשֵׂא וּתְנוּ לִי כְּתוּבָּתִי״, מַהוּ? כֵּיוָן דְּאָמְרָה כְּתוּבְּתַהּ — אַדַּעְתָּא דִכְתוּבָּה אֲתַאי, אוֹ דִלְמָא: כֹּל מִילֵּי דְּאִית לֵיהּ לְאִינִישׁ אָמַר לְהוּ לְבֵי דִינָא. [וְאִם תִּמְצֵי לוֹמַר כֹּל מִילֵּי דְּאִית לֵיהּ לְאִינִישׁ, אָמַר לְהוּ לְבֵי דִינָא] ״תְּנוּ לִי כְּתוּבָּתִי וְהַתִּירוּנִי לְהִנָּשֵׂא״, מַהוּ?
human_translation: dilemma was raised before Permit me to marry and give me my marriage contract, what is Since she mentioned her marriage contract, she came with the marriage contract in mind. Or perhaps every matter a person has he say to the court, And if you say Every matter a person has he say to the court, Give me my marriage contract and permit me to marry, what is
llm_translation: He asked them: "Allow me to marry and give me my marriage contract," what is the law? Since she said her marriage contract - does the knowledge of her marriage contract come, or perhaps: any matter that a person has, he should say to the court. And if you might say any matter that a person has, he should say to the court "Give me my marriage contract and allow me to marry," what is the law?

hebrew_text: הָכָא וַדַּאי אַדַּעְתָּא דִכְתוּבָּה אֲתַאי, אוֹ דִּלְמָא: הוֹאִיל דְּלָא יָדְעָה בְּמַאי מִשְׁתַּרְיָא?! תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: Here she certainly came with the marriage contract in mind, Or perhaps since she does not know what will set her free. shall stand
llm_translation: Here certainly knowledge that is written comes, or perhaps since she does not know with what she is involved?! It is unresolved.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַכֹּל נֶאֱמָנִין לְהַעִידָהּ, חוּץ מֵחֲמוֹתָהּ, וּבַת חֲמוֹתָהּ, וְצָרָתָהּ, וִיבִמְתָּהּ, וּבַת בַּעֲלָהּ.
human_translation: All are deemed credible to give testimony with regard to apart from her mother-in-law, the daughter of her mother-in-law, her rival wife, the wife of her yavam , and her husband’s daughter,
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: All are fit to testify, except for her mother-in-law, and her daughter-in-law, and her rival, and her co-wife, and her husband's daughter.

hebrew_text: מָה בֵּין גֵּט לְמִיתָה — שֶׁהַכְּתָב מוֹכִיחַ.
human_translation: What, is the difference between a bill of divorce and death? that the writing proves
llm_translation: What is the difference between a divorce document (get) and death - that the writing proves.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: בַּת חָמִיהָ מַהוּ? טַעְמָא דְּבַת חֲמוֹתָהּ — מִשּׁוּם דְּאִיכָּא אִימָּא דְּסָנְיָא לַהּ, הִיא נָמֵי סָנְיָא לַהּ, וְהָכָא לֵיכָּא אִימָּא דְּסָנְיָא לַהּ.
