human_translation: A dilemma was raised before the daughter of her father-in-law, what is The reason that the daughter of her mother-in-law because she has a mother who hates also hates her. But here, there is no mother who hates her,
llm_translation: Gemara: He asked them: What is the status of one's daughter-in-law? The reason for the status of her mother-in-law - because if there is a mother-in-law who is hostile to her, she is also hostile to her, and here there is no mother-in-law who is hostile to her.

hebrew_text: אוֹ דִלְמָא טַעְמָא דְּבַת חֲמוֹתָהּ, דְּאָמְרָה: ״קָאָכְלָה לְגִירְסָנָא דְאִימָּא״, הָכָא נָמֵי קָאָמְרָה: ״אָכְלָה לְגִירְסָנָא דְּבֵי נָשַׁאי״.
human_translation: Or perhaps the reason that the daughter of her mother-in-law that she says: She eats the food [ girsena ] that mother Here too, she also says: She eats the food of my father’s house.
llm_translation: Or perhaps the reason is the taste of her mother-in-law, for she said, "She ate from her mother-in-law's plate." Here too, she is saying: "She ate from her husband's plate."

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: הַכֹּל נֶאֱמָנִין לְהַעִידָהּ חוּץ מֵחָמֵשׁ נָשִׁים. וְאִם אִיתָא, שֵׁית הָוְיָין! דִּלְמָא טַעְמָא דְּבַת חֲמוֹתָהּ, דְּאָמְרָה: ״קָאָכְלָה לְגִירְסָנָא דְּבֵי נָשַׁאי״, לָא שְׁנָא בַּת חֲמוֹתָהּ וְלָא שְׁנָא בַּת חָמִיהָ.
human_translation: Come hear All are deemed credible to testify with regard to her except for five women. And if it is so, there are six perhaps the reason that the daughter of her mother-in-law that she says: She eats the food of my father’s house, is no different her mother-in-law’s daughter and no different her father-in-law’s daughter.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Come and hear: All are believed to testify except for five women. And if it is said, there are six! Perhaps the reason is because of the daughter-in-law of her mother-in-law, who said, "She ate from the dish of the household of her husband," it makes no difference whether it is the daughter-in-law of her mother-in-law or the daughter-in-law of her father-in-law.

hebrew_text: וְהָאֲנַן תְּנַן: חוּץ מִשֶּׁבַע נָשִׁים! הָהִיא, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הִיא. דִּתְנַן: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה מוֹסִיף אַף אֵשֶׁת אָב וְהַכַּלָּה.
human_translation: But isn’t it taught Apart from seven women That is Rabbi Yehuda. As it was taught Rabbi Yehuda adds also a father’s wife, and a daughter-in-law,
llm_translation: And we learned in a Mishnah: Except for seven women! That one, it is Rabbi Yehuda. As we learned: Rabbi Yehuda adds even the wife of a father and the bride.

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ לוֹ: אֵשֶׁת אָב הֲרֵי הִיא בִּכְלַל בַּת הַבַּעַל, כַּלָּה הֲרֵי בִּכְלַל חֲמוֹתָהּ.
human_translation: said to A father’s wife is included in the husband’s daughter, a daughter-in-law included in her mother-in-law.
llm_translation: They said to him: The wife of the father is included in the category of the wife of the husband, the bride is included in the category of her mother-in-law.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, בִּשְׁלָמָא חֲמוֹתָהּ סָנְיָא לַהּ לְכַלָּה, דְּאָמְרָה: קָאָכְלָה לְגִירְסָנַי. אֶלָּא כַּלָּה מַאי טַעְמָא סָנְיָא לַחֲמוֹתָהּ? בִּשְׁלָמָא בַּת הַבַּעַל דְּסָנְיָא לְאֵשֶׁת הָאָב, דְּאָמְרָה: קָאָכְלָה לְגִירְסָנֵי דְאֵם. אֶלָּא אֵשֶׁת הָאָב, מַאי טַעְמָא סָנְיָא לְבַת הַבַּעַל?
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda, Granted her mother-in-law hates daughter-in-law, as she says: She eats the food I but a daughter-in-law, what is the reason she hates her mother-in-law? granted the husband’s daughter, that she hates father’s wife, as she says: eats the food that mother However, the father’s wife, what is the reason she hates her husband’s daughter?
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda, in that her mother-in-law gave her a gift to her daughter-in-law, for she said: "She ate for the Girsanei." But why did the daughter-in-law give a gift to her mother-in-law? In that the daughter of the husband of the mother-in-law gave a gift to the wife of the father, for she said: "She ate for the Girsanei of the mother." But why did the wife of the father give a gift to the daughter of the husband?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מַאי מוֹסִיף תַּרְתֵּי? אֶלָּא: כַּלָּה מַאי טַעְמָא סָנְיָא לַחֲמוֹתָהּ — דִּמְגַלָּה לִבְנָהּ כֹּל דְּעָבְדָה, אֵשֶׁת אָב נָמֵי סָנְיָא לְבַת הַבַּעַל — דִּמְגַלָּה לְאָבִיהָ כֹּל דְּעָבְדָה.
human_translation: Rather, what is adds two? Rather, a daughter-in-law, what is the reason she hates her mother-in-law? Because she reveals to her son everything does. a father’s wife also hates the husband’s daughter, because she reveals to her father everything she does.
llm_translation: Rather, what does adding two teach us? Rather: What is the reason that a bride dislikes her mother-in-law? Because she reveals all that she has done. Similarly, a man's wife dislikes her father-in-law, because she reveals all that she has done.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן: ״כַּמַּיִם הַפָּנִים לַפָּנִים כֵּן לֵב הָאָדָם לָאָדָם״. וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה: הָהִיא בְּדִבְרֵי תוֹרָה כְּתִיב.
human_translation: And the Rabbis, “As in water face answers to face, so the heart of man to man” And Rabbi Yehuda, That was written about matters of Torah.
llm_translation: The sages said: "As water reflects the face back to face, so one's heart reflects another's heart." And Rabbi Yehuda said: "That is written in matters of Torah."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אַחָא בַּר עַוְיָא, בָּעוּ בְּמַעְרְבָא: חֲמוֹתָהּ הַבָּאָה לְאַחַר מִיכֵּן מַהוּ? מִי מַסְּקָה אַדַּעְתַּהּ דְּמָיֵת בַּעַל וְנָפְלָה קַמֵּי יָבָם וְסָנְיָא לַהּ, אוֹ לָא?
human_translation: Rav Aḥa bar Avya says: They raise a dilemma in the West, her mother-in-law who comes afterward, what is Does it enter her mind that husband died, will happen before the yavam , and she hates her or not?
llm_translation: Rav Acha bar Avya said, they asked in Ma'arava: If her mother-in-law comes after that, what is the law? Who can say that her mind is at rest, that she resembles her husband and falls before the yavam, and he hates her, or not?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, אָמְרָה: ״מֵת בַּעְלִי וְאַחַר כָּךְ מֵת חָמִי״ — תִּנָּשֵׂא וְתִטּוֹל כְּתוּבָּה, וַחֲמוֹתָהּ אֲסוּרָה. מַאי טַעְמָא חֲמוֹתָהּ אֲסוּרָה? לָאו מִשּׁוּם דְּאָמְרִינַן לָא בַּעְלַהּ מִיית וְלָא חֲמוּהָ מִיית, וְהָא דְּקָאָמְרָה הָכִי — לְקַלְקוֹלַאּ לַחֲמוֹתָהּ הוּא דְּקָמִיכַּוְּונָא,
human_translation: Come hear she said: My husband died and afterward my father-in-law died, she may marry and take marriage contract, and her mother-in-law is prohibited What is the reason her mother-in-law is prohibited not because we say: her husband did not die, and her father-in-law did not die and that she says this is that she intends to ruin her mother-in-law?
llm_translation: "Come and hear: she said, 'My husband died, and afterwards my father-in-law died' — she may be married and divorced by a document, but her mother-in-law is forbidden. What is the reason her mother-in-law is forbidden? Not because we say neither her husband nor her mother-in-law died, but what she is saying is for the denigration of her mother-in-law."

hebrew_text: סָבְרָה: לְבָתַר שַׁעְתָּא לָא תֵּיתֵי (תִּצְטַעֲרַן).
human_translation: She reasons: Later, she will not come back and trouble me,
llm_translation: She thought: After a while, she will not come (they will be distressed).

hebrew_text: דִּלְמָא שָׁאנֵי הָתָם, דִּרְגִישׁ לַהּ צַעֲרָא.
human_translation: Perhaps is different there, as felt oppressed by her
llm_translation: Perhaps it is different there, for he feels her pain.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ עֵד אוֹמֵר ״מֵת״, וְנִשֵּׂאת, וּבָא אֶחָד וְאָמַר ״לֹא מֵת״ — הֲרֵי זוֹ לֹא תֵּצֵא. עֵד אוֹמֵר ״מֵת״, וּשְׁנַיִם אוֹמְרִים ״לֹא מֵת״ — אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁנִּשֵּׂאת, תֵּצֵא. שְׁנַיִם אוֹמְרִים ״מֵת״, וְעֵד אוֹמֵר ״לֹא מֵת״ — אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁלֹּא נִשֵּׂאת, תִּנָּשֵׂא.
human_translation: witness says: died, and married and one came and said: not die, she not leave witness says: died, and two say: not die, even though she married she must leave two say: He died, and witness says: not die, even though she did not marry, she may marry.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: An individual witness says, "He is dead," and she remarries, then another individual comes and says, "He is not dead" - she shall not leave. An individual witness says, "He is dead," and two witnesses say, "He is not dead" - even though she remarried, she shall leave. Two witnesses say, "He is dead," and an individual witness says, "He is not dead" - even though she did not remarry, she shall leave.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ טַעְמָא דְּנִשֵּׂאת, הָא לֹא נִשֵּׂאת — לֹא תִּנָּשֵׂא. וְהָאָמַר עוּלָּא: כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁהֶאֱמִינָה תּוֹרָה עֵד אֶחָד — הֲרֵי כָּאן שְׁנַיִם, וְאֵין דְּבָרָיו שֶׁל אֶחָד בִּמְקוֹם שְׁנַיִם.
human_translation: The reason is that she married; she did not marry she may not marry. But didn’t Ulla say: Wherever the Torah relies on one witness, there are two here? and the statement of one has no in a place where two
llm_translation: Gemara: The reason for the one who is believed, if she is not believed - she is not believed. And Ulla said: In any place where the Torah believed one witness - here there are two, and the words of one are not in the place of two.

hebrew_text: הָכִי קָאָמַר: עֵד אֶחָד אוֹמֵר ״מֵת״, וְהִתִּירוּהָ לְהִנָּשֵׂא, וּבָא אֶחָד וְאָמַר ״לֹא מֵת״ — לֹא תֵּצֵא מֵהֶיתֵּירָהּ הָרִאשׁוֹן.
human_translation: this is what said: one witness says: He died, and they permitted her to marry and one came and said: He did not die, she does not leave her initial, permitted
llm_translation: So it is stated: One witness says "he is dead," and they permitted her to remarry, and then another one came and said "he is not dead" - she does not leave the permission granted by the first one.

hebrew_text: עֵד אוֹמֵר ״מֵת״ — פְּשִׁיטָא, דְּאֵין דְּבָרָיו שֶׁל אֶחָד בִּמְקוֹם שְׁנַיִם! לָא צְרִיכָא, בִּפְסוּלֵי עֵדוּת, וְכִדְרַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה.
human_translation: witness says: He died, is obvious, as the statement of one has no in a place where two No, necessary of disqualified testimony. And in accordance with Rabbi Neḥemya.
llm_translation: Witness says "dead" - obvious, his words are not of one in the place of two! Not necessary, in disqualifications of testimony, as Rabbi Nechemiah.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה אוֹמֵר: כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁהֶאֱמִינָה תּוֹרָה עֵד אֶחָד — הַלֵּךְ אַחַר רוֹב דֵּעוֹת, וְעָשׂוּ שְׁתֵּי נָשִׁים בְּאִישׁ אֶחָד כִּשְׁנֵי אֲנָשִׁים בְּאִישׁ אֶחָד.
human_translation: As it is taught Rabbi Neḥemya says: Wherever the Torah relies on one witness, follow the majority of opinions, And established two women against one man like two men against one man,
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Nechemiah says: In any place where the Torah believed the testimony of one witness — follow the majority of opinions, and they made two women equal to one man, just as two men are equal to one man.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: כֹּל הֵיכָא דַּאֲתָא עֵד אֶחָד כָּשֵׁר מֵעִיקָּרָא — אֲפִילּוּ מֵאָה נָשִׁים כְּעֵד אֶחָד דָּמְיָין. אֶלָּא כְּגוֹן דַּאֲתַאי אִשָּׁה מֵעִיקָּרָא.
human_translation: And if you wish, say: Anywhere that a qualified witness came initially even one hundred women are considered like one witness, However, where a woman came initially
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: wherever one witness comes initially valid - even a hundred women are like one witness. Rather, for example, when a woman comes initially.

hebrew_text: וְתָרְצַהּ לִדְרַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה הָכִי, רַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה אוֹמֵר: כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁהֶאֱמִינָה תּוֹרָה עֵד אֶחָד — הַלֵּךְ אַחַר רוֹב דֵּעוֹת, וְעָשׂוּ שְׁתֵּי נָשִׁים בְּאִשָּׁה אַחַת כִּשְׁנֵי אֲנָשִׁים בְּאִישׁ אֶחָד. אֲבָל שְׁתֵּי נָשִׁים בְּאִישׁ אֶחָד — כְּפַלְגָא וּפַלְגָא דָּמֵי.
human_translation: And explain in accordance with Rabbi Neḥemya as follows: Rabbi Neḥemya says: Wherever the Torah relies on one witness, follow the majority of opinions, and they established two women against one woman like two men against one man. However, two women against one man, is like half against half,
llm_translation: And she wanted to argue with Rabbi Neḥemyah the Kohen, Rabbi Neḥemyah says: In any place where the Torah believed the testimony of one witness — follow the majority of opinions, and they made two women as one woman in marriage like two men in one man. But two women in one man — it is like half and half.

hebrew_text: שְׁנַיִם אוֹמְרִים ״מֵת״ וְכוּ׳. מַאי קָמַשְׁמַע לַן? בִּפְסוּלֵי עֵדוּת, וְכִדְרַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה, דְּאָזֵיל בָּתַר רוֹב דֵּעוֹת? הַיְינוּ הָךְ!
human_translation: two say: He died, What is teaching us? to disqualified testimony, and in accordance with Rabbi Neḥemya, who follows the majority of opinions, this is that
llm_translation: Two say "dead" etc. What is the implication for us? In cases of disqualification of witnesses, as Rabbi Nechemiah, who follows the majority of opinions, said? That is it!

hebrew_text: מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: כִּי אָזְלִינַן בָּתַר רוֹב דֵּעוֹת — לְחוּמְרָא, אֲבָל לְקוּלָּא — לָא, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: lest you say when we follow the majority of opinions, to a stringency, but to a leniency, not teaches us
llm_translation: What is the reasoning? When we go after the majority of opinions - for stringency, but for leniency - no, it does not teach us.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אַחַת אוֹמֶרֶת ״מֵת״ וְאַחַת אוֹמֶרֶת ״לֹא מֵת״. זוֹ שֶׁאוֹמֶרֶת ״מֵת״ — תִּנָּשֵׂא וְתִטּוֹל כְּתוּבָּתָהּ, וְזוֹ שֶׁאוֹמֶרֶת ״לֹא מֵת״ — לֹא תִּנָּשֵׂא וְלֹא תִּטּוֹל כְּתוּבָּתָהּ.
human_translation: one says died, and one says he did not die, the one who says he died may marry and she takes her marriage contract. And the one who said he did not die may not marry, and does not take her marriage contract.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One woman says "he died" and one woman says "he did not die." The one who says "he died" - her word is accepted and she may collect her written document. And the one who says "he did not die" - her word is not accepted and she may not collect her written document.

hebrew_text: אַחַת אוֹמֶרֶת ״מֵת״ וְאַחַת אוֹמֶרֶת ״נֶהֱרַג״, רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: הוֹאִיל וּמַכְחִישׁוֹת זוֹ אֶת זוֹ — הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ לֹא יִנָּשְׂאוּ. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמְרִים: הוֹאִיל וְזוֹ וָזוֹ מוֹדוֹת שֶׁאֵין קַיָּים — יִנָּשְׂאוּ. עֵד אוֹמֵר ״מֵת״ וְעֵד אוֹמֵר ״לֹא מֵת״,
human_translation: one says: He died and one says: He was killed, Rabbi Meir says: Since they contradict one another, these may not marry. Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Shimon say: Since they both agree that he is not alive they may marry, a witness says: He died, and a witness says: He did not die,
llm_translation: One says "dead" and one says "killed," Rabbi Meir says: Since they contradict each other, these cannot be accepted. Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Shimon say: Since both of them admit that they are not valid, they can be accepted. One witness says "dead" and one witness says "not dead,"

hebrew_text: אִשָּׁה אוֹמֶרֶת: ״מֵת״, וְאִשָּׁה אוֹמֶרֶת: ״לֹא מֵת״ — הֲרֵי זוֹ לֹא תִּנָּשֵׂא.
human_translation: woman says: He died, and woman says: He did not die, this may not marry.
llm_translation: A woman says: "he is dead," and a woman says: "he is not dead" - she is not to be married.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ טַעְמָא דְּאָמְרָה ״לֹא מֵת״, הָא אִישְׁתִּיקָא — תִּנָּשֵׂא? הָא אֵין צָרָה מְעִידָה לַחֲבֶרְתָּהּ!
human_translation: The reason is that said He did not die, she was silent she marry one rival wife may not testify on another,
llm_translation: The taste of what it says "he did not die", this remains silent - should it be elevated? This does not require her testimony for her friend!

hebrew_text: ״לֹא מֵת״ אִיצְטְרִיכָא לֵיהּ, סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: הָא מָיֵית, וְהָא דְּקָאָמְרָה ״לֹא מֵת״ — לְקַלְקוֹלַהּ לְצָרָה הִיא דְּקָמִיכַּוְּונָא, וְ״תָמוֹת נַפְשָׁהּ עִם פְּלִשְׁתִּים״ קָאָמְרָה, קָמַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: it was necessary for He did not die, enter your mind to say this die, and that she says: He did not die, she intends to ruin her rival wife. And she says: Let her die with the Philistines. teaches us
llm_translation: "Lo met" itztaricha leih, sakla da'tach ameina: Ha mayet, veha deka'amra "lo met" - lekal'kola le'tzara hi dekamichavuna, ve"tamot nafshah im Plishtim" ka'amra, kamashma lan.

hebrew_text: אַחַת אוֹמֶרֶת מֵת כּוּ׳. וְלִיפְלוֹג רַבִּי מֵאִיר בְּרֵישָׁא! אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: בְּמַחְלוֹקֶת שְׁנוּיָה, וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן הִיא. וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבִּי מֵאִיר, בְּהָא אֲפִילּוּ רַבִּי מֵאִיר מוֹדֶה דְּכֹל ״לֹא מֵת״ בְּעֵדוּת אִשָּׁה לָאו הַכְחָשָׁה הִיא.
human_translation: one says: He died, And let Rabbi Meir disagree in the first clause, Rabbi Elazar said: taught as dispute. and is Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Shimon. And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: You even say Rabbi Meir, as in this even Rabbi Meir concedes that any He did not die, with regard to testimony a woman is not contradictory.
llm_translation: One says "he is dead." And to dispute Rabbi Meir at the beginning! Rabbi Elazar said: In a disputed matter, and it is Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Shimon. And Rabbi Yochanan said: Even if you say Rabbi Meir, in this case even Rabbi Meir admits that "not dead" in the testimony of a woman is not a denial.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: עֵד אוֹמֵר ״מֵת״, וְעֵד אוֹמֵר ״לֹא מֵת״, אִשָּׁה אוֹמֶרֶת ״מֵת״ וְאִשָּׁה אוֹמֶרֶת ״לֹא מֵת״ — הֲרֵי זוֹ לֹא תִּנָּשֵׂא. בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר — סְתָמָא כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר, אֶלָּא לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן קַשְׁיָא! קַשְׁיָא.
human_translation: We learned witness says: He died, and witness says: He did not die, woman says: He died, and woman says: He did not die, she may not marry. Granted, according to Rabbi Elazar, the unattributed is in accordance with Rabbi Meir, However, according to Rabbi Yoḥanan, difficult. difficult.
llm_translation: We learned in the Mishnah: If one witness says, "He is dead," and another witness says, "He is not dead," if a woman says, "He is dead," and another woman says, "He is not dead," she is not to be married. According to Rabbi Eliezer, this is understandable, as he generally follows the opinion of Rabbi Meir. But according to Rabbi Yochanan, it is difficult! Difficult.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הָאִשָּׁה שֶׁהָלְכָה הִיא וּבַעְלָהּ לִמְדִינַת הַיָּם, וּבָאָה וְאָמְרָה ״מֵת בַּעְלִי״ — תִּנָּשֵׂא וְתִטּוֹל כְּתוּבָּתָהּ, וְצָרָתָהּ אֲסוּרָה. הָיְתָה בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל לְכֹהֵן — תֹּאכַל בִּתְרוּמָה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן.
human_translation: a woman who went, she and her husband, overseas, and she comes and says: My husband died, she may marry, and she takes her marriage contract And it prohibited for her rival wife was an Israelite woman to a priest, she may partake of teruma , the statement of Rabbi Tarfon.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: A woman who went with her husband to a coastal region, and she comes and says, "My husband has died" — she may marry and receive her marriage contract, and her rival wife is forbidden. If she was a daughter of Israel married to a priest — she may eat of the priestly portion. These are the words of Rabbi Tarfon.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: אֵין זוֹ דֶּרֶךְ מוֹצִיאָתוֹ מִידֵי עֲבֵירָה, עַד שֶׁתְּהֵא אֲסוּרָה לִינָּשֵׂא, וַאֲסוּרָה מִלֶּאֱכוֹל בִּתְרוּמָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: This is not way to spare from transgression. unless it is prohibited to marry, and it is prohibited to partake of teruma ,
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: It is not the way of leading him out from the hands of transgression, until it is forbidden to marry her, and forbidden to eat from the heave-offering.

hebrew_text: אָמְרָה: ״מֵת (לִי) בַּעְלִי, וְאַחַר כָּךְ מֵת חָמִי״ — תִּנָּשֵׂא וְתִטּוֹל כְּתוּבָּתָהּ, וַחֲמוֹתָהּ אֲסוּרָה. הָיְתָה בַּת יִשְׂרָאֵל לְכֹהֵן — תֹּאכַל בִּתְרוּמָה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: אֵין זוֹ דֶּרֶךְ מוֹצִיאָ[תָ]הּ מִידֵי עֲבֵירָה, עַד שֶׁתְּהֵא אֲסוּרָה לִינָּשֵׂא וַאֲסוּרָה מִלֶּאֱכוֹל בִּתְרוּמָה.
human_translation: said: My husband died and afterward my father-in-law died, she may marry and take her marriage contract, and it is prohibited her mother-in-law was the daughter of an Israelite married to a priest, she may partake of teruma ; the statement of Rabbi Tarfon. Rabbi Akiva says: This is not way to spare from transgression; unless it is prohibited to marry and prohibited to partake of teruma .
llm_translation: She said: "My husband died, and afterwards my father-in-law died" - her marriage contract is to be lifted, and her mother-in-law is forbidden. If she was a daughter of Israel married to a priest - she may eat of the heave-offering, the words of Rabbi Tarfon. Rabbi Akiva says: This is not the way to remove her from the status of transgression until she is forbidden to marry and forbidden to eat of the heave-offering.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וּצְרִיכָא, דְּאִי אִיתְּמַר הָךְ קַמַּיְיתָא — בְּהָא קָאָמַר רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן, מִשּׁוּם דְּצַעְרָא דְּגוּפַהּ. אֲבָל חֲמוֹת, דְּצַעְרָא מִילֵּי דְּעָלְמָא — אֵימָא מוֹדֵי לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא.
human_translation: necessary As, had stated this first in this Rabbi Tarfon said because the suffering is physical, However, her mother-in-law, where the suffering is merely verbal say he concedes to Rabbi Akiva,
llm_translation: Gemara and it is necessary, for if it was stated there before you - in this Rabbi Tarfon said, because of the pain of his body. But regarding a mother-in-law, because of the pain of worldly matters - I would say that Rabbi Akiva agrees with him.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אִיתְּמַר בְּהָא — בְּהָא קָאָמַר רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, אֲבָל בְּהָךְ — אֵימָא מוֹדֶה לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי טַרְפוֹן, צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: And Had stated in this in this Rabbi Akiva said but in this say he concedes to Rabbi Tarfon necessary
llm_translation: "And if it was stated in this case - in this case Rabbi Akiva said, but in that case - say that Rabbi Tarfon agrees, necessary."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי טַרְפוֹן. אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, אַף אֲנַן נָמֵי תְּנֵינָא: ״נִיתַּן לִי בֵּן בִּמְדִינַת הַיָּם. מֵת בְּנִי, וְאַחַר כָּךְ בַּעְלִי״ — נֶאֱמֶנֶת. ״בַּעְלִי, וְאַחַר כָּךְ בְּנִי״ — אֵינָהּ נֶאֱמֶנֶת.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Tarfon. Abaye said: we, too, learn A son was born to me overseas, my son died and afterward my husband she is deemed credible My husband and afterward my son she is not deemed credible.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Tarfon. Abbaye said, we also learned: "If my son is given to me in a maritime city, and then my son dies, followed by my husband" — she is believed. "My husband, and then my son" — she is not believed.

hebrew_text: וְחוֹשְׁשִׁין לִדְבָרֶיהָ, וְחוֹלֶצֶת וְלֹא מִתְיַיבֶּמֶת. לִדְבָרֶיהָ הוּא דְּחוֹשְׁשִׁין, הָא לְדִבְרֵי צָרָה — אֵין חוֹשְׁשִׁין. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: But concerned about her statement, and she must perform ḥalitza and she does not enter into levirate marriage. It is to her own statement that concerned. not concerned about the statement of rival wife Learn from here
llm_translation: And they are concerned for her words, and she performs ḥalitzah but does not perform yibum. Concerning her words they are concerned, but regarding the words of a rival wife - they are not concerned. Learn from this.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ קִידֵּשׁ אַחַת מֵחָמֵשׁ נָשִׁים, וְאֵין יוֹדֵעַ אֵי זוֹ קִידֵּשׁ, כׇּל אַחַת אוֹמֶרֶת: ״אוֹתִי קִידֵּשׁ״ — נוֹתֵן גֵּט לְכׇל אַחַת וְאַחַת, וּמַנִּיחַ כְּתוּבָּה בֵּינֵיהֶן, וּמִסְתַּלֵּק, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן.
human_translation: betrothed one of five women, and he does not know which he betrothed, each one says: He betrothed me, he gives a bill of divorce to each and every one And he leaves the marriage contract among them and departs. the statement of Rabbi Tarfon.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If a man betroths one of five women, and he does not know which one he betrothed, each one says, "He betrothed me." He must give a bill of divorce to each one, and he leaves a document among them and departs. This is the statement of Rabbi Tarfon.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: אֵין זוֹ דֶּרֶךְ מוֹצִיא מִידֵי עֲבֵירָה, עַד שֶׁיִּתֵּן גֵּט וּכְתוּבָּה לְכׇל אַחַת וְאַחַת. גָּזַל אֶחָד מֵחֲמִשָּׁה וְאֵין יוֹדֵעַ מֵאֵיזֶה גָּזַל, כׇּל אֶחָד אוֹמֵר ״אוֹתִי גָּזַל״ — מַנִּיחַ גְּזֵילָה בֵּינֵיהֶן וּמִסְתַּלֵּק, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: אֵין זוֹ דֶּרֶךְ מוֹצִיא מִידֵי עֲבֵירָה, עַד שֶׁיְּשַׁלֵּם לְכׇל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: This is not way to spare from transgression, unless he gives a bill of divorce and a marriage contract to each and every one. stole from one of five and does not know from which he stole, each one says: He stole from me, he leaves the stolen among them and departs, the statement of Rabbi Tarfon. Rabbi Akiva says: This is not way to spare from transgression; unless he pays each and every one of them.
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: It is not the way to absolve oneself from transgression until he gives a bill of divorce and a written document to each and every one. If one of five stole, and it is unknown from whom he stole, each one says, "He stole from me" — he leaves the stolen item between them and departs, the words of Rabbi Tarfon. Rabbi Akiva says: It is not the way to absolve oneself from transgression until he pays each and every one.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ ״קִידֵּשׁ״ — קָתָנֵי, ״בָּעַל״ — לָא קָתָנֵי. ״גָּזַל״ — קָתָנֵי, ״לָקַח״ — לָא קָתָנֵי. מַנִּי מַתְנִיתִין? לָא תַּנָּא קַמָּא וְלָא רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר!
human_translation: is taught he betrothed it is not taught he had sexual intercourse is taught he stole it is not taught he purchased whose the mishna? not the first tanna and not Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "G'mar 'kidash' — katanai, 'ba'al' — la katanai. 'Gazal' — katanai, 'lakach' — la katanai. Mani matnitin? La tana kama ve'la Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar!" English translation: "It was taught: 'He sanctified' — it is taught, 'he married' — it is not taught. 'He stole' — it is taught, 'he took' — it is not taught. Who is the Tanna? It was not taught in the first one, nor in Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar!"

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: לֹא נֶחְלְקוּ רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא עַל שֶׁקִּידֵּשׁ אַחַת מֵחָמֵשׁ נָשִׁים וְאֵינוֹ יוֹדֵעַ אֵיזוֹ קִידֵּשׁ, שֶׁמַּנִּיחַ כְּתוּבָּה בֵּינֵיהֶן וּמִסְתַּלֵּק. עַל מָה נֶחְלְקוּ — עַל שֶׁבָּעַל. רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן אוֹמֵר: מַנִּיחַ כְּתוּבָּה בֵּינֵיהֶן וּמִסְתַּלֵּק, רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: עַד שֶׁיְּשַׁלֵּם לְכׇל אַחַת וְאַחַת.
human_translation: As it is taught Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: Rabbi Tarfon and Rabbi Akiva did not dispute of who betrothed one of five women and he does not know which he betrothed, that he leaves the marriage contract among them and departs. With regard to what did they disagree? With regard to who had sexual intercourse Rabbi Tarfon says: He leaves the money among them and departs, Rabbi Akiva says: unless he pays each and every one of them.
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: Rabbi Tarfon and Rabbi Akiva did not disagree regarding a case where one consecrated one of five women and does not know which one he consecrated, that he should leave a document among them and depart. What did they disagree about? — About the husband. Rabbi Tarfon says: He should leave a document among them and depart, Rabbi Akiva says: Until he pays each one.

hebrew_text: לֹא נֶחְלְקוּ רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא עַל שֶׁלָּקַח מִקָּח מֵחֲמִשָּׁה בְּנֵי אָדָם וְאֵין יוֹדֵעַ מֵאֵיזֶה מֵהֶן לָקַח — שֶׁמַּנִּיחַ דְּמֵי מִקָּח בֵּינֵיהֶן וּמִסְתַּלֵּק. לֹא נֶחְלְקוּ אֶלָּא שֶׁגָּזַל מֵחֲמִשָּׁה, שֶׁאָמַר רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן: מַנִּיחַ גְּזֵילָה בֵּינֵיהֶם וּמִסְתַּלֵּק, וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: עַד שֶׁיְּשַׁלֵּם גְּזֵילָה לְכׇל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד.
human_translation: Rabbi Tarfon and Rabbi Akiva did not dispute of who purchased an item from five people and he does not know from which of them he purchased it. that he leaves the price of the purchase among them and departs. They disagree only with regard to who stole from five people, as Rabbi Tarfon says: He leaves the stolen among them and departs, and Rabbi Akiva says: unless he pays the stolen to each and every one
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Rabbi Tarfon and Rabbi Akiva did not disagree except regarding a case where one took a purchase from five people and does not know from which of them he took it - he leaves the value of the purchase among them and departs. They only disagreed in a case where one stole from five, for Rabbi Tarfon said: he leaves the stolen item among them and departs, and Rabbi Akiva said: until he pays back the stolen item to each and every one."

hebrew_text: מִדְּקָאָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר בְּ״קִידֵּשׁ״ וְ״לָקַח״ לָא פְּלִיגִי, מִכְּלָל דְּתַנָּא קַמָּא סָבַר פְּלִיגִי. מַנִּי?
human_translation: From that Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar said do not disagree with regard to betrothed and purchased, by inference that the first tanna , holds they do disagree who is
llm_translation: From where did Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar say "Kiddush" and "Lakach" do not disagree? From the fact that the first Tanna holds they do disagree. Who is it?

hebrew_text: אִי תַּנָּא קַמָּא — לִיתְנֵי ״קִידֵּשׁ״ וְ״לָקַח״. אִי רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר — לִיתְנֵי ״בָּעַל״ וְ״גָזַל״.
human_translation: If the first tanna , let it teach betrothed and purchased, If Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar, let it teach had sexual relations and stole.
llm_translation: If the first Tanna taught - he should teach "Kadesh" and "Lakach." If it is Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar - he should teach "Ba'al" and "Gazal."

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר, וּמַאי ״קִידֵּשׁ״ — קִידֵּשׁ בְּבִיאָה. תְּנָא ״קִידֵּשׁ״, לְהוֹדִיעֲךָ כֹּחוֹ דְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא,
human_translation: Actually, Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar, and what is Betrothed? he betrothed by sexual intercourse. taught betrothed to convey to you the far-reaching of Rabbi Akiva.
llm_translation: Forever Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar, and what is "kiddesh" - he sanctified through intercourse. It was taught: "kiddesh" - to inform you of the power of Rabbi Akiva.

hebrew_text: דְּאַף עַל גַּב דְּאִיסּוּרָא דְּרַבָּנַן עֲבַד, קָנֵיס! תְּנָא ״גָּזַל״, לְהוֹדִיעֲךָ כֹּחוֹ דְּרַבִּי טַרְפוֹן, דְּאַף עַל גַּב דְּאִיסּוּרָא דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא עֲבַד, לָא קָנֵיס.
human_translation: As, although performed a prohibition by rabbinic law, penalizes taught stole to convey to you the far-reaching of Rabbi Tarfon, as although he performed a prohibition by Torah law, he does not penalize
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Even though he performed an action that is prohibited by the Rabbis, he acquired! The Tanna teaches 'he stole,' to inform you of the strength of Rabbi Tarfon, that even though he performed an action that is prohibited by the Torah, he did not acquire."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הָאִשָּׁה שֶׁהָלְכָה הִיא וּבַעְלָהּ לִמְדִינַת הַיָּם וּבְנָהּ עִמָּהֶם, וּבָאת וְאָמְרָה: ״מֵת בַּעְלִי וְאַחַר כָּךְ מֵת בְּנִי״ — נֶאֱמֶנֶת. מֵת בְּנִי וְאַחַר כָּךְ מֵת בַּעְלִי״ — אֵינָהּ נֶאֱמֶנֶת. וְחוֹשְׁשִׁין לִדְבָרֶיהָ, וְחוֹלֶצֶת וְלֹא מִתְיַיבֶּמֶת.
human_translation: a woman who went, she and her husband, overseas, and her son with them, and she came and said: My husband died and afterward my son died, she is deemed credible. My son died and afterward my husband died, she is not deemed credible, And we are concerned to her statement, she performs ḥalitza and she does not enter into levirate marriage.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: A woman who went with her husband to a maritime province, and her son went with them, and she comes and says, "My husband died, and afterwards my son died" — she is believed. "My son died, and afterwards my husband died" — she is not believed. And we are concerned about her words, and she performs ḥalitzah but does not undergo levirate marriage.

hebrew_text: ״נִיתַּן לִי בֵּן בִּמְדִינַת הַיָּם״, וְאָמְרָה: ״מֵת בְּנִי, וְאַחַר כָּךְ מֵת בַּעְלִי״ — נֶאֱמֶנֶת. ״מֵת בַּעְלִי, וְאַחַר כָּךְ מֵת בְּנִי״ — אֵינָהּ נֶאֱמֶנֶת. וְחוֹשְׁשִׁין לִדְבָרֶיהָ, וְחוֹלֶצֶת וְלֹא מִתְיַיבֶּמֶת.
human_translation: A son was born to me overseas, and she said: My son died and afterward my husband died, she is deemed credible My husband died and afterward my son died, she is not deemed credible but concerned about her statement. And she must perform ḥalitza and she does not enter into levirate marriage.
llm_translation: "Given to me a son in the province of the sea," and she said: "My son died, and afterwards my husband died" — she is believed. "My husband died, and afterwards my son died" — she is not believed. And we are concerned about her words, and she performs ḥaliẓah and does not undergo levirate marriage.

hebrew_text: ״נִיתַּן לִי יָבָם בִּמְדִינַת הַיָּם״, אָמְרָה: ״מֵת בַּעְלִי וְאַחַר כָּךְ מֵת יְבָמִי״, ״יְבָמִי וְאַחַר כָּךְ בַּעְלִי״ — נֶאֱמֶנֶת.
human_translation: A yavam was born for me overseas, she said: My husband died and afterward my yavam died, My yavam and afterward my husband she is deemed credible.
llm_translation: "Given to me yavam in the province of the sea," she said: "My husband died and afterwards my yavam died," "my yavam and afterwards my husband" — she is believed.

hebrew_text: הָלְכָה הִיא וּבַעְלָהּ וִיבָמָהּ לִמְדִינַת הַיָּם, אָמְרָה: ״מֵת בַּעְלִי, וְאַחַר כָּךְ יְבָמִי״, ״יְבָמִי, וְאַחַר כָּךְ בַּעְלִי״ — אֵינָהּ נֶאֱמֶנֶת, שֶׁאֵין הָאִשָּׁה נֶאֱמֶנֶת לוֹמַר ״מֵת יְבָמִי״ שֶׁתִּנָּשֵׂא, וְלֹא ״מֵתָה אֲחוֹתָהּ״ שֶׁתִּכָּנֵס לְבֵיתוֹ, וְאֵין הָאִישׁ נֶאֱמָן לוֹמַר ״מֵת אָחִי״ שֶׁיְּיַבֵּם אִשְׁתּוֹ, וְלֹא ״מֵתָה אִשְׁתּוֹ״, שֶׁיִּשָּׂא אֲחוֹתָהּ.
human_translation: she went, she and her husband and her yavam , overseas, and said: My husband died and afterward my yavam My yavam and afterward my husband she is not deemed credible, as a woman is not deemed credible says: My yavam died, that she may marry And not her sister died, that she may enter the house And a man is not deemed credible says: My brother died, so that he may enter into levirate marriage with his wife, and not his wife died, that may marry sister.
llm_translation: It is a halacha, and her husband and her yavam in the province of the sea, she said: "My husband died, and afterwards my yavam," "my yavam, and afterwards my husband" — she is not believed, because a woman is not believed to say "my yavam died" in order to marry, and not "her sister died" in order to enter his house, and a man is not believed to say "my brother died" in order to perform yibum with his wife, and not "his wife died" in order to marry her sister.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ רָבָא מֵרַב נַחְמָן: הַמְזַכֶּה גֵּט לְאִשְׁתּוֹ בִּמְקוֹם יָבָם, מַהוּ? כֵּיוָן דְּסָנְיָא לֵיהּ — זְכוּת הוּא לָהּ, וְזָכִין לְאָדָם שֶׁלֹּא בְּפָנָיו. אוֹ דִלְמָא: כֵּיוָן דְּזִימְנִין דְּרָחֲמָא לֵיהּ, חוֹב הוּא לָהּ, וְאֵין חָבִין לָאָדָם שֶׁלֹּא בְּפָנָיו.
human_translation: Rava raised a dilemma before Rav Naḥman: who confers possession a bill of divorce to his wife, when yavam , what is since she hates for her benefit, and one may act in a person’s interest in his absence. Or perhaps, since she sometimes loves this is to her disadvantage, and one may not act against a person’s interest in his absence.
llm_translation: Gemara: Rava asked a question from Rav Nachman: If one validates a bill of divorce for his wife in place of her yavam, what is the law? Since the sages are favorable to her — it is a merit for her, and we can confer merit upon a person not in his presence. Or perhaps: Since the Merciful One has appointed a time for him, it is his obligation to her, and we do not obligate a person not in his presence.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ, תְּנֵינָא: וְחוֹשְׁשִׁין לִדְבָרֶיהָ, וְחוֹלֶצֶת וְלֹא מִתְיַיבֶּמֶת.
human_translation: said to we learned And we are concerned about her statement, and she perform ḥalitza and she does not enter into levirate marriage.
llm_translation: He said to him, we learn: "And we are concerned about her words, and she performs ḥaliẓah but does not undergo levirate marriage."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבִינָא לְרָבָא: הַמְזַכֶּה גֵּט לְאִשְׁתּוֹ בִּמְקוֹם קְטָטָה, מַהוּ? כֵּיוָן דְּאִית לַהּ קְטָטָה בַּהֲדֵיהּ — זְכוּת הוּא לָהּ. אוֹ דִּלְמָא, נְיָחָא דְּגוּפָא עֲדִיף לַהּ? תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּאָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: טָב לְמֵיתַב טַן דּוּ מִלְּמֵיתַב אַרְמְלוּ.
human_translation: Ravina said to Rava: who confers possession a bill of divorce to his wife when there was a quarrel what is Since she has a quarrel with him, for her benefit. Or perhaps, physical comfort is preferable to her, Come hear as Reish Lakish said: It is better to sit as two [ tan du ] than to sit widow,
llm_translation: Ravina said to Rava: One who delivers a bill of divorce to his wife in a place of dispute, what is the law? Since there is a dispute with her - it is a merit for her. Or perhaps, is it better for her to be left in her own domain? Come and hear, as Reish Lakish said: It is better to sit in the belly of a lion than to sit in the shadow of a fox.

hebrew_text: אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: דְּשׁוּמְשְׁמָנָא גַּבְרָא, כּוּרְסְיַהּ בֵּי חָרָתָא רָמוּ לַהּ. רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר: דְּנַפָּצָא גַּבְרָא, תִּיקְרֵי בְּסִיפֵּי בָבָא וְתִיתִּיב.
human_translation: Abaye said whose husband is as an ant, she places her seat among the noblewomen, Rav Pappa said whose husband is a wool comber [ naftza ], she calls him to sit at the entrance to the house,
llm_translation: Abaye said: The sun of a man, the house of the potter elevated it. Rav Papa said: The man was scattered, let him be called in the book of the coming and let him sit.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אוֹמֵר: דְּקוֹלְסָא גַּבְרָא, לָא בָּעֲיָא טְלָפְחֵי לְקִידְרָא. תָּנָא: וְכוּלָּן מְזַנּוֹת וְתוֹלוֹת בְּבַעְלֵיהֶן.
human_translation: Rav Ashi says: whose husband sells cabbage heads [ kulsa ] does not require lentils for her pot. taught: And all of these commit adultery and attribute to their husbands.
llm_translation: Rav Ashei says: A man of Kolsa does not need to bring a shovel to the kitchen. It was taught: And all of them are provided for and supported by their husbands.

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ הָאִשָּׁה שָׁלוֹם
llm_translation: We will return to you, the woman, peace.

hebrew_text: הָאִשָּׁה שֶׁהָלַךְ בַּעְלָהּ וְצָרָתָהּ לִמְדִינַת הַיָּם, וּבָאוּ וְאָמְרוּ לָהּ: ״מֵת בַּעְלִיךְ״ — לֹא תִּנָּשֵׂא, וְלֹא תִּתְיַיבֵּם עַד שֶׁתֵּדַע שֶׁמָּא מְעוּבֶּרֶת הִיא צָרָתָהּ.
human_translation: a woman whose husband and rival traveled to a country overseas, and came and told her: Your husband died, she shall not marry And she shall not enter into levirate marriage until she knows whether she, her rival wife, is pregnant.
llm_translation: The woman that her husband went and her rival to the province of the sea, and they came and said to her: "Your husband is dead" — she shall not marry, and she shall not perform levirate marriage until she knows whether she is pregnant from her rival.

hebrew_text: הָיְתָה לָהּ חָמוֹת — אֵינָהּ חוֹשֶׁשֶׁת. יָצְתָה מְלֵיאָה — חוֹשֶׁשֶׁת. רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: אֵינָהּ חוֹשֶׁשֶׁת.
human_translation: If she had a mother-in-law she need not be concerned departed pregnant, should be concerned Rabbi Yehoshua says: she need not be concerned
llm_translation: If she had a mother-in-law - she is not concerned. If she had a full womb - she is concerned. Rabbi Yehoshua says: she is not concerned.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי ״הִיא צָרָתָהּ״? הָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן: לְהָא צָרָה הוּא דְּחָיְישִׁינַן, אֲבָל לְצָרָה אַחֲרִיתִי לָא חָיְישִׁינַן.
human_translation: What is she, her rival wife, is teaches us this: We are concerned this rival wife but we are not concerned about another rival wife
llm_translation: Talmudic text: What is "her affliction"? This teaches us: We are concerned for this affliction, but for another affliction we are not concerned.

hebrew_text: לֹא תִּנָּשֵׂא וְלֹא תִּתְיַיבֵּם וְכוּ׳. בִּשְׁלָמָא יַבּוֹמֵי לָא, דְּדִלְמָא מִיעַבְּרָא, וְקָפָגְעָה בְּאֵשֶׁת אָח דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא. אֶלָּא לֹא תִּנָּשֵׂא, אַמַּאי? הַלֵּךְ אַחַר רוֹב נָשִׁים, וְרוֹב נָשִׁים מִתְעַבְּרוֹת וְיוֹלְדוֹת!
human_translation: She shall not marry and shall not enter into levirate marriage Granted, not enter into levirate marriage, because perhaps is pregnant, and would encounter the Torah a brother’s wife. But why not marry Follow the majority of women, and most women become pregnant and give birth,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Do not marry and do not perform levirate marriage, etc. If it is with regard to levirate marriage, it is understandable, for perhaps she is pregnant, and she might come into contact with the wife of her brother, which is a biblical prohibition. Rather, 'Do not marry,' why? Because he follows after the majority of women, and the majority of women are unfaithful and give birth!"

hebrew_text: לֵימָא רַבִּי מֵאִיר הִיא דְּחָיֵישׁ לְמִיעוּטָא?
human_translation: Shall we say Rabbi Meir, who is concerned about the minority?
llm_translation: Let us say, is it Rabbi Meir who is concerned about the minority?

hebrew_text: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבָּנַן, כִּי אָזְלִי רַבָּנַן בָּתַר רוּבָּא — רוּבָּא דְּאִיתֵיהּ קַמַּן, כְּגוֹן תֵּשַׁע חֲנוּיוֹת וְסַנְהֶדְרִי. אֲבָל רוּבָּא דְּלֵיתֵיהּ קַמַּן — לָא אָזְלִי רַבָּנַן בָּתַר רוּבָּא.
human_translation: You even say the Rabbis. When the Rabbis follow the majority, it is an evident majority, For example, nine stores And the Sanhedrin But a non-evident majority, the Rabbis do not follow the majority.
llm_translation: Even if you say the sages, when the sages go after the majority - a majority that has some of it in front, such as nine stores and a synagogue. But a majority that does not have some of it in front - the sages do not go after that majority.

hebrew_text: וַהֲרֵי קָטָן וּקְטַנָּה, דְּרוּבָּא דְּלֵיתָא קַמַּן הִיא, וְאָזְלִי רַבָּנַן בָּתַר רוּבָּא! דְּתַנְיָא: קָטָן וּקְטַנָּה לֹא חוֹלְצִין וְלֹא מְיַיבְּמִין, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. אָמְרוּ לוֹ לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר: יָפֶה אָמַרְתָּ שֶׁאֵין חוֹלְצִין. ״אִישׁ״ כְּתִיב בַּפָּרָשָׁה, וּמַקְּשִׁינַן אִשָּׁה לְאִישׁ. אֶלָּא מָה טַעַם אֵין מְיַיבְּמִין!
human_translation: But a minor boy or minor girl, is a non-evident majority, and the Rabbis follow the majority as it is taught A minor boy or minor girl may not perform ḥalitza and may not enter into levirate marriage; the statement of Rabbi Meir. said to Rabbi Meir: You have aptly stated that they may not perform ḥalitza , “man” is written in the section we employ juxtaposition the woman to the man But what is the reason that they may not enter into levirate marriage,
llm_translation: Behold, a minor and a minor girl, the majority of whom are not before us, and the Rabbis go after the majority! As it was taught: A minor and a minor girl do not perform chalitzah nor do they perform levirate marriage, the words of Rabbi Meir. They said to Rabbi Meir: You have said well that they do not perform chalitzah. "Man" is written in the portion, and we juxtapose a woman to a man. Rather, what is the reason they do not perform levirate marriage!

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָהֶם: קָטָן שֶׁמָּא יִמָּצֵא סָרִיס, קְטַנָּה שֶׁמָּא תִּמָּצֵא אַיְלוֹנִית, וְנִמְצְאוּ פּוֹגְעִים בְּעֶרְוָה. וְרַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: זִיל בָּתַר רוּבָּא דִּקְטַנִּים, וְרוֹב קְטַנִּים לָאו סָרִיסֵי נִינְהוּ. זִיל בָּתַר רוֹב קְטַנּוֹת, וְרוֹב קְטַנּוֹת לָאו אַיְלוֹנִית נִינְהוּ. אֶלָּא, מְחַוַּורְתָּא מַתְנִיתִין רַבִּי מֵאִיר הִיא.
human_translation: He said to them: the minor boy, lest he be confirmed as a sexually underdeveloped man the minor girl, lest she be confirmed as an aylonit , they would end up encountering a forbidden relative And the Rabbis hold: Follow the majority of minor boys, and most minor boys are not sexually underdeveloped follow the majority of minor girls, and most minor girls are not aylonit Rather, it is clear that the mishna is Rabbi Meir,
llm_translation: He said to them: A minor, lest he find a eunuch; a minor girl, lest she find a he-goat, and they will be found engaging in forbidden relations. And the Rabbis hold: Go after the majority of minors, and most minors are not eunuchs. Go after the majority of minor girls, and most minor girls are not he-goats. Rather, it is a teaching of Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי אוֹקֵימְתָּא כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר, אֵימָא סֵיפָא: הָיְתָה לָהּ חָמוֹת — אֵינָהּ חוֹשֶׁשֶׁת. אַמַּאי? הַלֵּךְ אַחַר רוֹב נָשִׁים, וְרוֹב נָשִׁים מִתְעַבְּרוֹת וְיוֹלְדוֹת, מִיעוּט מַפִּילוֹת, וְכׇל הַיּוֹלְדוֹת — מֶחֱצָה זְכָרִים וּמֶחֱצָה נְקֵבוֹת. סְמוֹךְ מִיעוּטָא דְמַפִּילוֹת לְמֶחֱצָה נְקֵבוֹת, וְהָווּ לֵיהּ זְכָרִים מִיעוּטָא — וְלֵיחוּשׁ!
human_translation: In what did you establish in accordance with Rabbi Meir. say the latter clause: If she had a mother-in-law she need not be concerned Why Follow the majority of women, and most women become pregnant and give birth. minority miscarry. And all women who give birth, half male and half female. join the minority who miscarry to the half females, and then the male children would be the minority. let him be concerned
llm_translation: In what does she establish herself like Rabbi Meir? Say the latter part: If she had a mother-in-law - she is not concerned. Why? She follows the majority of women, and most women conceive and give birth, few miscarry, and all who give birth - half males and half females. Close to the minority of miscarriages to half females, and there were to him few males - and no concern!

hebrew_text: דִּלְמָא כֵּיוָן דְּאִיחְזְקָה לַשּׁוּק, לָא חָיֵישׁ. רֵישָׁא דְּאִיחְזַק לְיִיבּוּם — תִּיַּיבַּם!
human_translation: Perhaps, since is presumed to public, is not concerned the first clause is presumed to levirate marriage, she should enter into levirate marriage
llm_translation: Perhaps since it has taken hold in the market, there is no concern. At the beginning, when it has taken hold for levirate marriage - let them perform levirate marriage!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ: רֵישָׁא דְּאִיסּוּר כָּרֵת — חָשְׁשׁוּ, סֵיפָא דְּאִיסּוּר לָאו — לֹא חָשְׁשׁוּ.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said Rabba bar Avuh said: the first clause which a prohibition karet , they were concerned the latter clause which an ordinary prohibition, they were not concerned
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said, Rabba bar Avuh said: The beginning of a prohibition that carries with it the penalty of excision - they were concerned, the end of a prohibition that does not - they were not concerned.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: מִכְּדֵי, הָא דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא וְהָא דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא — מָה לִי אִיסּוּר כָּרֵת מָה לִי אִיסּוּר לָאו?! אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא:
human_translation: Rava said Now since this is by Torah and that is by Torah what to me a prohibition karet what to me an ordinary prohibition? Rather, Rava said
llm_translation: Rava said: From where do we know this? This law that is from the Torah, and this law that is from the Torah - why do I need a prohibition of karet? Why do I need a prohibition of lav? Rather, Rava said:

hebrew_text: רֵישָׁא, חֲזָקָה לְיִיבּוּם, וְרוּבָּא לַשּׁוּק. וַחֲזָקָה לָא עֲדִיף כִּי רוּבָּא. וְאַיְיתִי מִיעוּטָא דְּמַפִּילוֹת סְמוֹךְ לַחֲזָקָה, וְהָוֵה לֵיהּ פַּלְגָא וּפַלְגָא — לֹא תִּנָּשֵׂא וְלֹא תִּתְיַיבֵּם.
human_translation: the first clause the presumption is to levirate marriage, but a majority to public, A presumption is not significant as a majority, But bring the minority who miscarry join to the presumption, and it becomes half and half. she shall not marry and she shall not enter into levirate marriage
llm_translation: Beginning, strong for levirate marriage, and majority for the market. And strong not preferable because of majority. And I bring a minority that falls near the strong, and it will be half and half - neither shall be married nor shall be levirate married.

hebrew_text: סֵיפָא, חֲזָקָה לַשּׁוּק, וְרוּבָּא לַשּׁוּק. וְהָוֵי לֵיהּ זְכָרִים מִיעוּטָא דְמִיעוּטָא, וּמִיעוּטָא דְמִיעוּטָא — לָא חָיֵישׁ רַבִּי מֵאִיר.
human_translation: the latter clause, the presumption is to public, And a majority to public. is a minority of a minority, and Rabbi Meir is not concerned about a minority of a minority.
llm_translation: The latter clause, it is common in the market, and the majority is for the market. And let him have males in a small amount of a small amount, and a small amount of a small amount - Rabbi Meir is not concerned.

hebrew_text: לֹא תִּנָּשֵׂא וְלֹא תִּתְיַיבֵּם וְכוּ׳. וּלְעוֹלָם!
human_translation: she shall not marry and shall not enter into levirate marriage But indefinitely?
llm_translation: "Do not marry and do not intermarry, etc." And forever!

hebrew_text: אָמַר זְעֵירִי: לְעַצְמָהּ — שְׁלֹשָׁה חֳדָשִׁים, לַחֲבֶרְתָּהּ — תִּשְׁעָה, וְחוֹלֶצֶת מִמָּה נַפְשָׁךְ.
human_translation: Ze’eiri said: for herself [ le’atzma ] three months for her fellow nine and she performs ḥalitza whichever way you
llm_translation: Zei'ri said: For itself - three months, for its companion - nine, and you shall be free from it.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי חֲנִינָא אָמַר: לְעַצְמָהּ — שְׁלֹשָׁה, לַחֲבֶרְתָּהּ — לְעוֹלָם. וְתַחְלוֹץ מִמָּה נַפְשָׁךְ!
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina said: For herself three for her fellow indefinitely, But let her perform ḥalitza whichever way you
llm_translation: Rabbi Chanina said: for herself - three, for her friend - forever. And what will you gain from her?

hebrew_text: אַבָּיֵי בַּר אָבִין וְרַבִּי חֲנִינָא בַּר אָבִין אָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ: גְּזֵירָה שֶׁמָּא יְהֵא וָלָד בֶּן קַיָּימָא, וְנִמְצָא אַתָּה מַצְרִיכָהּ כָּרוֹז לַכְּהוּנָּה.
human_translation: Abaye bar Avin and Rabbi Ḥanina bar Avin both say It is decree lest there be viable offspring and it transpires you necessitate an announcement her to the priesthood,
llm_translation: Abaye son of Avin and Rabbi Chanina son of Avin both said: A decree lest there be a viable child, and you will find yourself in need of a herald for the priesthood.

hebrew_text: וְלַיצְרְכַהּ? דִּלְמָא אִיכָּא דְּהָוֵי בַּחֲלִיצָה וְלָא הָוֵי בְּהַכְרָזָה, וְאָמְרִי: קָשָׁרוּ חֲלוּצָה לְכֹהֵן.
human_translation: And so let an announcement be necessary for her Perhaps there will be who were at the ḥalitza but were not at the announcement and they will say: They are permitting a ḥalutza to a priest.
llm_translation: And for what does he need it? Perhaps there is a case where it is considered a redemption but not a proclamation, and they said: "They tied the redemption to the priest."

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: ״נִיתַּן לִי בֵּן בִּמְדִינַת הַיָּם״, וְאָמְרָה: ״מֵת בְּנִי וְאַחַר כָּךְ בַּעְלִי״ — נֶאֱמֶנֶת. ״מֵת בַּעְלִי וְאַחַר כָּךְ בְּנִי״ — אֵינָהּ נֶאֱמֶנֶת, וְחוֹשְׁשִׁין לִדְבָרֶיהָ, וְחוֹלֶצֶת וְלֹא מִתְיַיבֶּמֶת.
human_translation: We learned A son was born to me in a country overseas, and she said: My son died, and then my husband died, she is deemed credible. My husband died and then my son died, she is not deemed credible but one be concerned about her statement she perform ḥalitza , but she may not enter into levirate marriage.
llm_translation: We learned: "He gave me a son in the land of the sea," and she said: "My son died and afterwards my husband" - she is believed. "My husband died and afterwards my son" - she is not believed, and we are concerned about her words, and she performs ḥaliẓah and does not undergo levirate marriage.

hebrew_text: וְלֵיחוּשׁ דִּלְמָא אָתוּ עֵדִים וְאָמְרִי כִּדְקָאָמְרָה, וְנִמְצָא אַתָּה מַצְרִיכָהּ כָּרוֹז לַכְּהוּנָּה! אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: בִּגְרוּשָׁה. רַב חִיָּיא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב הוּנָא אָמַר, בְּאָמְרָה: ״אֲנִי וָהוּא נֶחְבֵּאנוּ בִּמְעָרָה״.
human_translation: let us be concerned perhaps witnesses come and testify as she said, And it transpires you necessitate an announcement her to the priesthood, Rav Pappa said: to a divorced woman, Rav Ḥiyya, son of Rav Huna, said: where she said: He and I were hiding in a cave.
llm_translation: And perhaps lest witnesses come and say as she said, and you will find yourself needing to announce it in the proclamation of the priesthood! Rav Papa said: in the case of divorce. Rav Chiya, son of Rav Huna, said in the name of the verse: "I and he will hide ourselves in the cave."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ שְׁתֵּי יְבָמוֹת, זוֹ אוֹמֶרֶת: ״מֵת בַּעְלִי״, וְזוֹ אוֹמֶרֶת: ״מֵת בַּעְלִי״. זוֹ אֲסוּרָה מִפְּנֵי בַּעְלָהּ שֶׁל זוֹ, וְזוֹ אֲסוּרָה מִפְּנֵי בַּעְלָהּ שֶׁל זוֹ.
human_translation: two sisters-in-law this one says: My husband died, and that one says: My husband died, this one is prohibited due to the husband of that and that one is prohibited due to the husband of this
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: Two yevamot, this one says, "My husband died," and this one says, "My husband died." This one is prohibited because of the husband of that one, and that one is prohibited because of the husband of this one.

hebrew_text: לָזוֹ עֵדִים, וְלָזוֹ אֵין עֵדִים. אֶת שֶׁיֵּשׁ לָהּ עֵדִים — אֲסוּרָה, וְאֶת שֶׁאֵין לָהּ עֵדִים — מוּתֶּרֶת. לָזוֹ בָּנִים, וְלָזוֹ אֵין בָּנִים. אֶת שֶׁיֵּשׁ לָהּ בָּנִים — מוּתֶּרֶת, וְאֶת שֶׁאֵין לָהּ בָּנִים — אֲסוּרָה.
human_translation: this one has witnesses and that one does not have witnesses, the one who has witnesses is prohibited but the one who has no witnesses is permitted this one has children and that one has no children, the one with children is permitted But the one without children is prohibited
llm_translation: To this one there are witnesses, and to this one there are no witnesses. If she has witnesses - she is forbidden, and if she does not have witnesses - she is permitted. To this one there are children, and to this one there are no children. If she has children - she is permitted, and if she does not have children - she is forbidden.

hebrew_text: נִתְיַיבְּמוּ, וּמֵתוּ הַיְּבָמִין — אֲסוּרוֹת לְהִנָּשֵׂא. רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: הוֹאִיל וְהוּתְּרוּ לַיְּבָמִין — הוּתְּרוּ לְכׇל אָדָם.
human_translation: entered into levirate marriage, and the yevamin died are prohibited from marrying, Rabbi Elazar says: Since were permitted to the brothers-in-law, they are permitted, to any man
llm_translation: They performed levirate marriage, and the yevamim died - the yevamot are forbidden to marry. Rabbi Elazar says: Since they were permitted to the yevamim, they are permitted to all men.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנָא: לָזוֹ עֵדִים וּבָנִים, וְלָזוֹ לֹא עֵדִים וְלֹא בָּנִים — שְׁתֵּיהֶן מוּתָּרוֹת.
human_translation: taught this one has witnesses and children, and the other has neither witnesses nor children, they are both permitted
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemara: Tana: lazo eidim uvanim, v'lazo lo eidim v'lo vanim - shtehem mutarot." English translation: "Gemara: It was taught: for this one there are witnesses and children, and for this one there are neither witnesses nor children - both are permitted."

hebrew_text: נִתְיַיבְּמוּ וּמֵתוּ הַיְּבָמִין — אֲסוּרִין לְהִנָּשֵׂא. רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: הוֹאִיל וְהוּתְּרוּ לַיְּבָמִין — הוּתְּרוּ לְכׇל אָדָם.
human_translation: they entered into levirate marriage and the yevamin died, they are prohibited from marrying. Rabbi Elazar says: Since they were permitted to the yevamin , they are permitted to any man.
llm_translation: They performed yibum and the yevamim died - the yevamim are forbidden to marry. Rabbi Elazar says: Since they were permitted to the yevamim, they are permitted to everyone.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רָבָא: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר? מִשּׁוּם דְּקָסָבַר צָרָה מְעִידָה לַחֲבֶרְתָּהּ, אוֹ דִלְמָא מִשּׁוּם דְּהִיא לָא מְקַלְקְלָא נַפְשַׁהּ.
human_translation: Rava raised a dilemma: What is Rabbi Elazar’s reasoning? because he holds rival wife may testify for another Or perhaps because she would not cause herself injury.
llm_translation: Inquiries of Rava: What is the reason for Rabbi Elazar's opinion? Because he holds that a woman testifies on behalf of her companion, or perhaps because she does not degrade herself.

hebrew_text: לְמַאי נָפְקָא מִינַּהּ?
human_translation: What is the practical difference
llm_translation: For what does it come out from it?

hebrew_text: לְאַנְסוֹבֵי לְצָרָה מִקַּמֵּי דִּידַהּ: אִי אָמְרַתְּ צָרָה מְעִידָה לַחֲבֶרְתָּהּ, אַף עַל גַּב דְּלָא אִינְּסִיב — מַנְסְבִינַן לַהּ לְצָרָה. אִי אָמְרַתְּ מִשּׁוּם דְּהִיא לָא מְקַלְקְלָא נַפְשַׁהּ, אִינְּסִיב — מַנְסְבִינַן לַהּ לְצָרָה, אִי לָא אִינְּסִיב — לָא מַנְסְבִינַן לַהּ.
human_translation: to the rival wife to marry before herself, If you say that one rival wife may testify for another, although has not married, we rival wife to marry. if you say due to she would not cause herself injury, if she has married we may her rival wife to marry, if she has not married, we may not her to marry,
llm_translation: To Ansovai to Tsara from before of her: if you say Tsara testifies for her friend, even though she did not get married - we marry her to Tsara. If you say because she did not cause herself distress, we marry her to Tsara; if not, we do not marry her to Tsara.

hebrew_text: מַאי? תָּא שְׁמַע, רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: הוֹאִיל וְהוּתְּרוּ לַיְּבָמִין — הוּתְּרוּ לְכׇל אָדָם. אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא דְּהִיא לָא מְקַלְקְלָא נַפְשַׁהּ — הַיְינוּ דְּכִי אִינְּסִיב, מַנְסְבִינַן לַהּ,
human_translation: What Come hear Rabbi Elazar says: Since they were permitted to the brothers-in-law, they are permitted to any man. Granted, if you say that she would not cause herself injury, this is that if she has married, we may her to marry.
llm_translation: What? Come and hear, Rabbi Elazar says: Since they permitted her to the levirate marriage, they permitted her to any man. If you say, "Because she does not damage her soul," that is when she is not married, we marry her to him.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ מִשּׁוּם דְּצָרָה מְעִידָה לַחֲבֶרְתָּהּ — אַף עַל גַּב דְּלָא אִינְּסִיב נָמֵי! אֶלָּא שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר מִשּׁוּם דְּאִינְּסִיב הוּא, וְלָא מְקַלְקְלָא נַפְשַׁהּ.
human_translation: But if you say because one rival wife may testify for another, although she has not married, still Rather, conclude from this that Rabbi Elazar’s reason is because she has married, and she would not cause herself injury
llm_translation: Rather, if you say that because she causes distress to her friend she testifies, even though she did not marry, also! Rather, learn from it the reasoning of Rabbi Elazar because he did not marry, and did not harm herself.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר לְדִבְרֵיהֶם קָאָמַר לְהוּ: לְדִידִי, צָרָה מְעִידָה לַחֲבֶרְתָּהּ, וְאַף עַל גַּב דְּלָא אִינְּסִיב — מַנְסְבִינַן לַהּ. אֶלָּא לְדִידְכוּ, אוֹדוֹ לִי מִיהַת דְּהֵיכָא דְּאִינְּסִיב — מַנְסְבִינַן לַהּ, מִשּׁוּם דְּהִיא לָא מְקַלְקְלָא נַפְשַׁהּ. וְרַבָּנַן, ״תָּמוֹת נַפְשִׁי עִם פְּלִשְׁתִּים״ הוּא דְּקָעָבְדָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar stated to in accordance with their statement, According to my own one rival wife may testify for another, and although she, has not married, we may her to marry. But according to your own admit, in any event, that where she has married we may her to marry because she would not cause injury to herself. But the Rabbis, she acts upon “Let me die with the Philistines”
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar in their words is saying to them: According to my opinion, a woman testifies for her friend, even though she is not married - we marry her. But according to your opinion, if they admit to me from a place where she is not married - we marry her, because she does not degrade herself. And the Rabbis, "Let my soul die with the Philistines" is what she esteemed.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: הָאִשָּׁה שֶׁהָלְכָה הִיא וּבַעְלָהּ לִמְדִינַת הַיָּם, וּבָאָה וְאָמְרָה: ״מֵת בַּעְלִי״ — תִּנָּשֵׂא וְתִטּוֹל כְּתוּבָּתָהּ, וְצָרָתָהּ אֲסוּרָה. רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: הוֹאִיל וְהוּתְּרָה הִיא — הוּתְּרָה נָמֵי צָרָתָהּ. אֵימָא: הוֹאִיל וְהוּתְּרָה וְנִשֵּׂאת.
human_translation: Come hear a woman who went with her husband to a country overseas, and who came and said: My husband died, she is to marry and collect her marriage contract, but her rival wife is prohibited Rabbi Elazar says: Since she is permitted her rival wife is also permitted. Say Since she was permitted and has married.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Ta shema: ha'isha shehalcha hi u'ba'alah limdinat hayam, uva'ah ve'amra: 'met ba'ali' — tinas'e ve'titol ketubatah, v'tzaratah asurah. Rabbi Elazar omer: ho'il ve'hutrah hi — hutrah namei tzaratah. Eima: ho'il ve'hutrah ve'nisa'at." English translation: "Come and hear: a woman who went with her husband to the province of the sea, and she came and said: 'My husband has died' — she should be married and take her marriage contract, and her rival is forbidden. Rabbi Elazar says: Since she is permitted, her rival is also permitted. Perhaps: Since she is permitted, she should marry."

hebrew_text: וְלֵיחוּשׁ דִּלְמָא בְּגִיטָּא אֲתַאי, וְהַאי דְּקָאָמְרָה הָכִי — לְקַלְקוֹלַהּ לְצָרָה הִיא מִיכַּוְּונָה!
human_translation: Let us be concerned perhaps she, came with a bill of divorce And that she says this, is intended to injure her rival wife,
llm_translation: And to suspect perhaps in a get he comes, and this that she is saying thus — to her voice to trouble it is from her preparation!

hebrew_text: אִי דְּאִינְּסִיב לְיִשְׂרָאֵל — הָכִי נָמֵי. הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן, דְּאִינְּסִיב לְכֹהֵן.
human_translation: If she married an Israelite, indeed here we are dealing with she married a priest,
llm_translation: If one marries a Jewish woman - so it is stated. Here, what are we dealing with? That he married a Kohen.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אֵין מְעִידִין אֶלָּא עַל פַּרְצוּף פָּנִים עִם הַחוֹטֶם. אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁיֵּשׁ סִימָנִין בְּגוּפוֹ וּבְכֵלָיו — אֵין מְעִידִין אֶלָּא עַד שֶׁתֵּצֵא נַפְשׁוֹ. וַאֲפִילּוּ רָאוּהוּ מְגוּיָּיד וְצָלוּב וְהַחַיָּה אוֹכֶלֶת בּוֹ — אֵין מְעִידִין אֶלָּא עַד שְׁלֹשָׁה יָמִים.
human_translation: One may testify only about the countenance [ partzuf ] of face with the nose, Although there are distinguishing marks [ simanim ] on his body and his personal belongings, one may not testify until his soul departs. And even if one saw him cut open or crucified, or animal eating of him, one may testify only up to three days
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One may only testify based on the appearance of the face with the nose. Even though there are identifying marks on his body and limbs, one may only testify until his soul departs. And even if they saw him being strangled, stabbed, and a wild animal consuming him - one may only testify after three days.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בָּבָא אוֹמֵר: לֹא כׇּל הָאָדָם וְלֹא כׇּל הַמָּקוֹם וְלֹא כׇּל הַשָּׁעוֹת שָׁוִין.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda ben Bava says: not every person, nor every place, nor every hour is identical.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda ben Bava says: Not all the man and not all the place and not all the times are equal.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: פַּדַּחַת וְלֹא פַּרְצוּף פָּנִים, פַּרְצוּף פָּנִים וְלֹא פַּדַּחַת — אֵין מְעִידִין, עַד שֶׁיְּהוּ שְׁנֵיהֶם עִם הַחוֹטֶם. אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַב כָּהֲנָא: מַאי קְרָא — ״הַכָּרַת פְּנֵיהֶם עָנְתָה בָּם״.
human_translation: The Sages taught forehead but not the countenance of the face, the countenance of the face but not forehead, they may not testify until both of them with the nose. Abaye said, and some say Rav Kahana What is the verse “The show of their face does witness against them”
llm_translation: The sages taught: If there is a dent but no protrusion of the face, or a protrusion of the face but no dent - they do not testify until both are present. Abaye said, and some say it was Rav Kahana: What is the verse? "The carving of their faces testifies against them."

hebrew_text: אַבָּא בַּר מָרְתָא דְּהוּא אַבָּא בַּר מִנְיוֹמֵי הֲוָה מַסְּקִי בֵּיהּ דְּבֵי רֵישָׁא גָּלוּתָא זוּזֵי. אַיְיתִי קִירָא, דַּבֵּק בִּבְלִייתָא, דַּבֵּק בְּאַפּוּתֵיהּ. חֲלַף קַמַּיְיהוּ וְלָא בַּשְׁקְרוּהּ.
human_translation: Abba bar Marta, who is Abba bar Minyumi, had been loaned money by the Exilarch’s house. he brought wax [ kira ], stuck to worn-out fabric, stuck to his forehead He passed before them and they did not recognize him [ beshakru ].
llm_translation: Abba bar Marta, who is Abba bar Minyomei, was walking in the market of Reish Galuta. He brought a vine leaf that was attached to its stem, and it was attached to its branch. The sages passed by him, and they did not greet him falsely.

hebrew_text: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁיֵּשׁ סִימָנִין וְכוּ׳. לְמֵימְרָא דְּסִימָנִין לָאו דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא.
human_translation: although there are distinguishing marks Is this to say that distinguishing marks are not by Torah law,
llm_translation: Even though there are signs, etc. To say that signs are not from the Torah.

hebrew_text: וּרְמִינְהִי: מְצָאוֹ קָשׁוּר בְּכִיס וּבְאַרְנָקִי וּבְטַבַּעַת, אוֹ שֶׁנִּמְצָא בֵּין כֵּלָיו, אֲפִילּוּ לִזְמַן מְרוּבֶּה — כָּשֵׁר.
human_translation: But raises a contradiction, he found it tied to a purse, or a money bag [ arnekei ], or a ring, or if it was found among his personal belongings, even after a long time, it is valid,
llm_translation: And they asked: If it was found tied in a pocket, and in a purse, and in a ring, or if it was found between his garments, even to use it for a majority of the time - it is valid.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן מַהֲבַאי, הָא רַבָּנַן. דְּתַנְיָא: אֵין מְעִידִין עַל הַשּׁוּמָא. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן מַהֲבַאי אוֹמֵר: מְעִידִין. מַאי לָאו בְּהָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי, דְּמָר סָבַר סִימָנִין דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא, וּמָר סָבַר סִימָנִין דְּרַבָּנַן?
human_translation: Abaye said: not difficult. That is Rabbi Eliezer ben Mahavai, this is the Rabbis; as it is taught One may not testify based upon a mole Rabbi Eliezer ben Mahavai says: One may testify What, is it not about this that they disagree: Sage, holds that distinguishing marks are by Torah and Sage, holds that distinguishing marks are by rabbinic
llm_translation: Abaye said, it is not difficult: this is Rabbi Eliezer ben Mahavia, this is the Rabbis. As it was taught: one does not testify about hearsay. Rabbi Eliezer ben Mahavia says: they do testify. What is the reason they do not argue about this? One Master holds that signs are from the Torah, and the other Master holds that signs are from the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא סִימָנִין דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא. הָכָא, בְּשׁוּמָא מְצוּיָה בְּבֶן גִּילוֹ קָמִיפַּלְגִי. מָר סָבַר: שׁוּמָא מְצוּיָה בְּבֶן גִּילוֹ, וּמָר סָבַר: אֵינָהּ מְצוּיָה בְּבֶן גִּילוֹ.
human_translation: Rava said: that everyone distinguishing marks are by Torah here they are disagreeing about a mole is commonly found on his peer, Sage, holds a mole is commonly found on his peer And Sage, holds it is not commonly found on his peer
llm_translation: Rava said: In all the world, signs of the Torah. Here, because Shuma is found in Ben Gilo, he disagrees. One Master holds: Shuma is found in Ben Gilo, and one Master holds: It is not found in Ben Gilo.

hebrew_text: וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: הָכָא בְּשׁוּמָא הָעֲשׂוּיָה לְהִשְׁתַּנּוֹת לְאַחַר מִיתָה קָמִיפַּלְגִי. מָר סָבַר: עֲשׂוּיָה לְהִשְׁתַּנּוֹת לְאַחַר מִיתָה. וּמָר סָבַר: אֵינָהּ עֲשׂוּיָה לְהִשְׁתַּנּוֹת לְאַחַר מִיתָה.
human_translation: And there are who say Here they are disagreeing about a mole is likely to change after death. Sage, holds that it is likely to change after death. And Sage, holds that it is not likely to change after death
llm_translation: There are those who say: Here in Shuma, the vessel prepared to change after death, they disagree. One Master holds: It is prepared to change after death. And one Master holds: It is not prepared to change after death.

hebrew_text: וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי, אָמַר רָבָא: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא סִימָנִין דְּרַבָּנַן. וְהָכָא, בְּשׁוּמָא
human_translation: And there are who say Rava said: Everyone distinguishing marks by rabbinic And here, about a mole
llm_translation: And there are those who say, Rava said: All the people of the world are subject to the signs of the Rabbis. And here, in the name of.

hebrew_text: סִימָן מוּבְהָק קָא מִיפַּלְגִי. מָר סָבַר סִימָן מוּבְהָק, וּמָר סָבַר לָאו סִימָן מוּבְהָק.
human_translation: is an unambiguous distinguishing mark they disagree. Sage, holds is an unambiguous distinguishing mark And Sage, holds is not an unambiguous distinguishing mark.
llm_translation: The clear sign they are disputing. One Master holds it is a clear sign, and one Master holds it is not a clear sign.

hebrew_text: וּלְהַךְ לִישָּׁנָא דְּאָמַר רָבָא סִימָנִין דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא, הָא קָתָנֵי: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁיֵּשׁ סִימָנִין בְּגוּפוֹ וּבְכֵלָיו!
human_translation: According to the version, that Rava said distinguishing marks are by Torah Isn’t it taught Although there are distinguishing marks on his body and his personal belongings,
llm_translation: And to support the opinion of Rava who said signs of the Torah, this is what is taught: Even though there are signs in his body and in his vessels!

hebrew_text: גּוּפוֹ — דְּאָרוֹךְ וְגוּץ. כֵּלָיו — דְּחָיְישִׁינַן לִשְׁאֵלָה. וְאִי חָיְישִׁינַן לִשְׁאֵלָה, חֲמוֹר בְּסִימָנֵי אוּכָּף הֵיכִי מַהְדְּרִינַן?
human_translation: one’s body, that he was tall or short, personal belongings, as we are concerned about borrowing, But if we are concerned about borrowing, how can we return a donkey based upon distinguishing marks on the saddle?
llm_translation: His body — that is long and lean. His kidneys — that we are concerned for questioning. And if we are not concerned for questioning, how do we honor a donkey with the signs of a saddle?

hebrew_text: לָא שָׁיְילִי אִינָשֵׁי אוּכָּפָא, דִּמְסַקֵּיב לֵיהּ לַחֲמָרָא. מְצָאוֹ קָשׁוּר בְּכִיס וּבְאַרְנָקִי וּבְטַבַּעַת, הֵיכִי מַהְדְּרִינַן?
human_translation: People do not borrow a saddle because it bruises the donkey, If he found tied to a purse, or a money bag, or a ring, how can we return it
llm_translation: The people of Ukafah are not suitable, for they are accustomed to wine. If one finds it tied in a pocket, a purse, or a ring, how should we treat it?

hebrew_text: טַבַּעַת — חָיְישִׁי לְזַיּוֹפֵי. כִּיס וְאַרְנָקִי — מְנַחֲשִׁי אִינָשֵׁי וְלָא מוֹשְׁלִי. וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: כֵּלָיו, בְּחִיוָּרֵי וְסוּמָּקֵי.
human_translation: ring because he is concerned about forgery, a purse or a money bag, people consider it a bad omen and do not lend And if you wish, say his personal belongings white or red
llm_translation: Ring - suspicious for counterfeits. Purse and wallet - diviners of people, not rulers. And if you ask: kidneys, in black and red.

hebrew_text: וַאֲפִילּוּ רָאוּהוּ מְגוּיָּיד וְכוּ׳. לְמֵימְרָא דִּמְגוּיָּיד חָיֵי? וּרְמִינְהִי: אָדָם אֵינוֹ מְטַמֵּא עַד שֶׁתֵּצֵא נַפְשׁוֹ, אֲפִילּוּ מְגוּיָּיד, וַאֲפִילּוּ גּוֹסֵס. טַמּוֹיֵי לָא מְטַמֵּא, הָא מִיחְיָיא — לָא חָיֵי!
human_translation: And even if one saw him cut open [ meguyyad ] Is this to say that cut open is to live raises a contradiction person renders impure only when his soul departs, even if he is cut open and even if he is dying. he does not render ritually impure, but he is not to live
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Even if one sees him from a distance, etc. Is it to say that from a distance he is alive? And raise a contradiction: A person does not become impure until his soul departs, even if he is a distance away, and even if he is motionless. Impurity does not render impure, but if he is alive — he is not alive!

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר, הָא רַבָּנַן, דְּתַנְיָא: מְעִידִין עַל הַמְגוּיָּיד, וְאֵין מְעִידִין עַל הַצָּלוּב. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: אַף עַל הַמְגוּיָּיד אֵין מְעִידִין, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁיָּכוֹל לִכָּווֹת וְלִחְיוֹת.
human_translation: Abaye said: not difficult: This is Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar, that is the Rabbis, as it is taught One may testify about cut open, but one may not testify about a crucified person. Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: Even concerning cut open, one may not testify because can be scorched, and survive.
llm_translation: Abaye said, it is not difficult: this is Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar, this is the Rabbis, as it was taught: they testify regarding the one who was strangled, but they do not testify regarding the one who was crucified. Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: Even regarding the one who was strangled, they do not testify, because he could still be revived and live.

hebrew_text: וּמִי מָצֵית לְאוֹקוֹמֵי כְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר? וְהָא קָתָנֵי סֵיפָא: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּעַסְיָא בְּאֶחָד שֶׁשִּׁילְשְׁלוּהוּ לַיָּם, וְלֹא עָלְתָה בְּיָדָם אֶלָּא רַגְלוֹ, וְאָמְרוּ חֲכָמִים: מִן הָאַרְכּוּבָּה וּלְמַעְלָה — תִּנָּשֵׂא, מִן הָאַרְכּוּבָּה וּלְמַטָּה — לֹא תִּנָּשֵׂא.
human_translation: But can you establish in accordance with Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar? Isn’t it taught the latter clause An incident in Asya in which they lowered a certain into the sea and only his leg came up in their hands. The Sages said: from the knee and above, may marry, from the knee and below, she may not marry.
llm_translation: And who found a ruling to stand before Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar? And this is what is taught in the latter part: There was an incident in Asya where they threw him into the sea, and only his foot emerged in their hands, and the sages said: If the object emerges from the arkuba and upwards, it is considered lifted; if it emerges from the arkuba and downwards, it is not considered lifted.

hebrew_text: שָׁאנֵי מַיָּא דְּמַרְזוּ מַכָּה.
human_translation: Water is different, as it aggravates the wound.
llm_translation: The difference of water of Marzu Makah.

hebrew_text: וְהָאָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה: לְדִידִי חֲזֵי לִי הַהוּא טַיָּיעָא דְּשָׁקֵיל סַפְסִירָא וְגַיְּידֵיהּ לְגַמְלֵיהּ, וְלָא אַפְסֵיקְתַּיהּ לְנַעֲרוּתֵיהּ! אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: הָהִיא כְּחִישָׁא הַוְיָא.
human_translation: But didn’t Rabba bar bar Ḥanna say: I myself saw an Arab who took his sword [ safseira ] and cut open his camel, and could not cease its braying Abaye said: That was emaciated
llm_translation: The text reads: "And Rabba bar bar Ḥana said: According to my opinion, that certain Arab merchant who took a basket of sapphire and entrusted it to his camel, and did not lose it to the youth! Abaye said: That was like a miracle."

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: בְּסַכִּין מְלוּבֶּנֶת, וְדִבְרֵי הַכֹּל.
human_translation: Rava said with a white-hot knife, and everyone agrees
llm_translation: Rava said: with a double-edged sword, and the words of everyone.

hebrew_text: וְהַחַיָּה אוֹכֶלֶת וְכוּ׳. אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא מִמָּקוֹם שֶׁאֵין נַפְשׁוֹ יוֹצְאָה, אֲבָל מִמָּקוֹם שֶׁנַּפְשׁוֹ יוֹצְאָה — מְעִידִין.
human_translation: Or animal was eating Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: They taught only from a place that does not his soul to depart, But from a place that does his soul to depart, one may testify
llm_translation: "And the living creature eats, etc." Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: They only taught this in a case where its soul does not depart, but in a case where its soul departs, they testify.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: שָׁחַט בּוֹ שְׁנַיִם, אוֹ רוֹב שְׁנַיִם, וּבָרַח — מְעִידִין.
human_translation: And Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: If cut two or most of two and fled, one may testify
llm_translation: And Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: If he slaughtered it with two, or the majority of two, and fled - they are valid witnesses.

hebrew_text: אִינִי? וְהָאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: שָׁחַט בּוֹ שְׁנַיִם אוֹ רוֹב שְׁנַיִם, וְרָמַז וְאָמַר: ״כִּתְבוּ גֵּט לְאִשְׁתִּי״ — הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ יִכְתְּבוּ וְיִתְּנוּ. חַי הוּא, וְסוֹפוֹ לָמוּת.
human_translation: Is that so? But didn’t Rav Yehuda say Shmuel said: If cut two or most of two and gestured and communicated: Write a bill of divorce for my wife, then these should write and deliver He is alive but he will eventually die
llm_translation: I? And Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: If he slaughtered it twice or the majority of it, and hinted and said: "Write a bill of divorce for my wife" — behold, these should be written and given. He is alive, but his end is death.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, יְהֵא גּוֹלֶה עַל יָדוֹ. אַלְּמָה תַּנְיָא: שָׁחַט שְׁנַיִם אוֹ רוֹב שְׁנַיִם — הֲרֵי זֶה אֵינוֹ גּוֹלֶה! הָא אִיתְּמַר עֲלַהּ, אָמַר רַב הוֹשַׁעְיָא: חָיְישִׁינַן שֶׁמָּא הָרוּחַ בִּלְבְּלַתּוּ. אִי נָמֵי, שֶׁמָּא אִיהוּ
human_translation: If that is so, should be exiled on his account, Why is taught If cut two or most of the two, he is not exiled? But it was stated with regard to Rav Hoshaya said: We are concerned that perhaps the wind aggravated his Alternatively, perhaps he,
llm_translation: Rather, from now on, let it roll on his hand. Why is it taught: If one slaughters two or the majority of two - this one does not roll on! But it was stated about it, Rav Hoshaya said: We are concerned that perhaps the wind will confuse it. Or perhaps it is.

hebrew_text: קֵירַב מִיתָתוֹ. מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ?
human_translation: hastened his death. What is between these
llm_translation: "His death approached. What is the difference between them?"

hebrew_text: דְּשַׁחְטֵיהּ בְּבֵיתָא דְשֵׁישָׁא וּפַרְכֵּיס. אִי נָמֵי: דְּשַׁחְטֵיהּ בְּבָרָא וְלָא פַּרְכֵּיס.
human_translation: where one cut in a house of marble and convulsed. Alternatively, where one cut outside, and did not convulse
llm_translation: He slaughtered it in the house of Shesha and Parkeis. If you say: He slaughtered it in the pit and not Parkeis.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: לֹא כָּל וְכוּ׳. אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בָּבָא לְקוּלָּא פְּלִיג, אוֹ לְחוּמְרָא פְּלִיג.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: Not every A dilemma was raised before Did Rabbi Yehuda ben Bava disagree to leniently Or, did he disagree to stringently
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: Not all and so forth. It was asked of them: Does Rabbi Yehuda ben Bava argue for leniency, or does he argue for stringency.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: דְּהָהוּא גַּבְרָא דְּטָבַע בְּכַרְמֵי, וְאַסְּקוּהוּ אַבֵּי הֲדָיָא לְבָתַר תְּלָתָא יוֹמִין, וְאַנְסְבַהּ רַב דִּימִי מִנְּהַרְדְּעָא לִדְבֵיתְהוּ. וְתוּ: הָהוּא גַּבְרָא דִּאטְבַע בְּדִגְלַת, וְאַסְּקוּהוּ אַגִּישְׁרָא דְּשַׁבִּיסְתָּנָא, וְאַנְסְבַהּ רָבָא לִדְבֵיתְהוּ אַפּוּמָּא דְשׁוֹשְׁבִינֵי לְבָתַר חַמְשָׁה יוֹמֵי.
human_translation: Come hear A certain man drowned in Carmi, and they drew him out near Bei Hedya after three days, and Rav Dimi from Neharde’a allowed his wife to marry. And furthermore, a certain man drowned in the Tigris and they drew him out onto the Bridge of Shabistana, and Rava allowed his wife to marry based upon his friends’ testimony, five days after
llm_translation: Come and hear: There was a certain man who fell into a vineyard, and the members of the court of Hadai rescued him after three days, and Rav Dimi brought him from Nehardea to his house. And furthermore: There was a certain man who fell into a fishpond, and the members of the court of Shevistana rescued him, and Rava brought him to his house after five days.

hebrew_text: אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא לְקוּלָּא פְּלִיג, אִינְהוּ דַּעֲבוּד כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בָּבָא. אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ לְחוּמְרָא פְּלִיג, אִינְהוּ דַּעֲבוּד כְּמַאן? שָׁאנֵי מַיָּא, דְּצָמְתִי.
human_translation: Granted, if you say disagreed to leniently, these who acted in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda ben Bava. But if you say he disagreed to stringently, in accordance with whose act? Water is different, since it contracts
llm_translation: If you say it is in accordance with the lenient view, they are the ones who follow the practice of Rabbi Yehuda ben Bava. But if you say it is in accordance with the stringent view, who are they following? It is different with water, for it is cold.

hebrew_text: וְהָאָמְרַתְּ מַיָּא מַרְזוּ מַכָּה! הָנֵי מִילֵּי הֵיכָא דְּאִיכָּא מַכָּה, אֲבָל הֵיכָא דְּלֵיכָּא מַכָּה — מִיצְמָת צָמֵית. וְהָנֵי מִילֵּי דְּכִי אַסְּקֵיהּ חַזְיֵיהּ בְּשַׁעְתֵּיהּ. אֲבָל אִישְׁתַּהִי, מִיתְפָּח תָּפַח.
