human_translation: But didn’t you say water aggravates a wound This applies when there is a wound, but when there is no wound, the water contracts And this applies where they drew him out viewed him at that time. But was delayed will have become bloated,
llm_translation: And she said, "Water, bitter, wound!" Those words apply where there is a wound, but where there is no wound - she is a schemer. And those words, when he would go out, he would see her in her hour. But if it were his wife, he would puff and blow.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ נָפַל לְמַיִם, בֵּין שֶׁיֵּשׁ לָהֶן סוֹף, בֵּין שֶׁאֵין לָהֶן סוֹף — אִשְׁתּוֹ אֲסוּרָה. אָמַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּאֶחָד שֶׁנָּפַל לְבוֹר הַגָּדוֹל, וְעָלָה לְאַחַר שְׁלֹשָׁה יָמִים.
human_translation: fell into the water whether has end or does not have end, his wife is prohibited Rabbi Meir said: An incident involving a certain who fell into the Great Cistern and emerged after three days.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If one falls into water, whether they have an end (of the water) or they do not have an end - his wife is forbidden. Rabbi Meir said: There was an incident with someone who fell into a large pit, and he emerged after three days.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּסוֹמֵא שֶׁיָּרַד לִטְבּוֹל בִּמְעָרָה, וְיָרַד מוֹשְׁכוֹ אַחֲרָיו, וְשָׁהוּ כְּדֵי שֶׁתֵּצֵא נַפְשָׁם — וְהִשִּׂיאוּ אֶת נְשׁוֹתֵיהֶם. וְשׁוּב מַעֲשֶׂה בְּעַסְיָא, בְּאֶחָד שֶׁשִּׁלְשְׁלוּהוּ לַיָּם, וְלֹא עָלְתָה בְּיָדָם אֶלָּא רַגְלוֹ, אָמְרוּ חֲכָמִים: מִן הָאַרְכּוּבָּה וּלְמַעְלָה — תִּנָּשֵׂא. מִן הָאַרְכּוּבָּה וּלְמַטָּה — לֹא תִּנָּשֵׂא.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei said: An incident involving a blind man who descended to immerse in a cave, and his guide descended after him, and they remained there long enough for their souls to have departed, and permitted their wives to marry And another incident in Asya in which they lowered a certain into the sea and only his leg came up in their hands, The Sages said: from the knee and above, may marry, from the knee and below, she may not marry.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei said: There was an incident with a blind person who descended to immerse in a cave, and his companions followed him and delayed so that their souls would depart, causing them to marry their wives. Another incident occurred in Asya, where they pushed him into the sea, and only his foot emerged in their hands. The sages said: From the navel and above - it is considered as if he emerged. From the navel and below - it is not considered as if he emerged.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: נָפַל לַמַּיִם, בֵּין שֶׁיֵּשׁ לָהֶם סוֹף, בֵּין שֶׁאֵין לָהֶם סוֹף — אִשְׁתּוֹ אֲסוּרָה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: מַיִם שֶׁיֵּשׁ לָהֶם סוֹף — אִשְׁתּוֹ מוּתֶּרֶת, וְשֶׁאֵין לָהֶם סוֹף — אִשְׁתּוֹ אֲסוּרָה.
human_translation: The Sages taught: fell into the water, whether has end or does not have end, his wife is prohibited the statement of Rabbi Meir. And the Rabbis say: with end, his wife is permitted but with no end, his wife is prohibited
llm_translation: The Sages taught: If one falls into water, whether they have an end or do not have an end - his wife is forbidden, the words of Rabbi Meir. And the sages say: If the water has an end - his wife is permitted, and if it does not have an end - his wife is forbidden.

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָּמֵי מַיִם שֶׁיֵּשׁ לָהֶם סוֹף? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: כֹּל שֶׁעוֹמֵד וְרוֹאֶה מֵאַרְבַּע רוּחוֹתָיו.
human_translation: What are the circumstances water with end? Abaye said: Any where one stands and can see in four directions
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Heikhi damei mayim sheyesh lahem sof? Amar Abbayei: Kol she'omed ve'roeh me'arba ruḥotav." English translation: "How are the waters that have an end similar? Abbayei said: Anyone who stands and sees from his four directions."

hebrew_text: הָהוּא גַּבְרָא דִּטְבַע בְּאַגְמָא דְסַמְקֵי, אַנְסְבַהּ רַב שֵׁילָא לִדְבֵיתְהוּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב לִשְׁמוּאֵל, תָּא נְשַׁמְּתֵיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: נִשְׁלַח לֵיהּ בְּרֵישָׁא.
human_translation: a certain man who drowned in the lake in Samkei. Rav Sheila allowed his wife to marry Rav said to Shmuel: Come, let us excommunicate him said to him: Let us first send him
llm_translation: That man who fell into the swamp of Samkei, Rab Sheilah married him to his daughter. Rab said to Shmuel, "Come, let us smell him." He said to him, "He was sent to him at first."

hebrew_text: שְׁלַחוּ לֵיהּ: מַיִם שֶׁאֵין לָהֶם סוֹף, אִשְׁתּוֹ אֲסוּרָה אוֹ מוּתֶּרֶת? שְׁלַח לְהוּ: אִשְׁתּוֹ אֲסוּרָה. וְאַגְמָא דְסַמְקֵי — מַיִם שֶׁיֵּשׁ לָהֶם סוֹף, אוֹ מַיִם שֶׁאֵין לָהֶם סוֹף? שְׁלַח לְהוּ: מַיִם שֶׁאֵין לָהֶם סוֹף הוּא. וּמָר, מַאי טַעְמָא עֲבַד הָכִי?
human_translation: They sent him an endless body of water, is his wife a forbidden or a permitted He sent to them: His wife is forbidden. Is the lake of Samkei a body of water with end or an endless body of water? He sent to them: It is an endless body of water, what is the reason the Master, acted this way,
llm_translation: Send to him: Water that has no end, is its drinking permitted or forbidden? Send to them: Its drinking is forbidden. And the pond of Samkei - water that has an end, or water that has no end? Send to them: It is water that has no end. And Mar, what is the reason he acted in this way?

hebrew_text: מִיטְעָא טְעֵינָא, אֲנָא סְבַרִי כֵּיוָן דִּקְווּ וְקָיְימִי — כְּמַיִם שֶׁיֵּשׁ לָהֶם סוֹף דָּמֵי, וְלָא הִיא: כֵּיוָן דְּאִיכָּא גַּלֵּי — אֵימוֹר גַּלֵּי אַשְׁפְּלוּ[הּ].
human_translation: I erred I thought: Since the waters are gathered and stagnant they are considered as a body of water with end. But that is not so. Since there are waves say that the waves carried him
llm_translation: The text reads: "Mit'a t'eina, ana s'vari keiva d'kavu v'kayemi - k'mayim sheyesh lahem sof damei, v'lo hi: keiva d'eika galei - amor galei ashpeluh."

hebrew_text: קָרֵי שְׁמוּאֵל עֲלֵיהּ דְּרַב: ״לֹא יְאוּנֶּה לַצַּדִּיק כׇּל אָוֶן״. קָרֵי רַב עֲלֵיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל: ״וּתְשׁוּעָה בְּרוֹב יוֹעֵץ״.
human_translation: Shmuel recited about Rav: “No mischief shall befall the righteous” Rav recited about Shmuel: “But salvation in much counsel”
llm_translation: Samuel reads regarding Rav: "No harm shall befall the righteous." Rav reads regarding Samuel: "But deliverance is found in a multitude of counselors."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי: מַעֲשֶׂה בִּשְׁנֵי בְּנֵי אָדָם מְכַמְּרִין מִכְמוֹרִין בַּיַּרְדֵּן, וְנִכְנַס אֶחָד מֵהֶם לִמְחִילָּה שֶׁל דָּגִים, וְשָׁקְעָה חַמָּה וְלֹא רָאָה פִּתְחָהּ שֶׁל מְחִילָּה, וְשָׁהָה חֲבֵרוֹ כְּדֵי שֶׁתֵּצֵא נַפְשׁוֹ, וּבָא וְהוֹדִיעַ בְּתוֹךְ בֵּיתוֹ. לְמָחָר, זָרְחָה חַמָּה וְהִכִּיר פִּתְחָהּ שֶׁל מְחִילָּה, וּבָא וּמָצָא הֶסְפֵּד גָּדוֹל בְּתוֹךְ בֵּיתוֹ. אָמַר רַבִּי: כַּמָּה גְּדוֹלִים דִּבְרֵי חֲכָמִים, שֶׁאָמְרוּ: מַיִם שֶׁיֵּשׁ לָהֶם סוֹף — אִשְׁתּוֹ מוּתֶּרֶת, שֶׁאֵין לָהֶם סוֹף — אִשְׁתּוֹ אֲסוּרָה.
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi said: An incident involving two people were fishing with nets on the Jordan and one of them entered a cave containing a fish the sun set and could not see the cave’s opening His friend waited long enough for his soul to have departed and came and notified household The following day the sun rose, and recognized the opening of the cave And he came and found profuse eulogizing in his house. Rabbi said How great are the words of the Sages, who said: a body of water with end, his wife is permitted with no end, his wife is prohibited
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi said: There was an incident involving two people who were gathering olives in the Jordan River, and one of them entered a fish trap, and the sun set and he did not see the opening of the trap, and his friend waited for him until his soul departed, and he came and informed others in his house. The next day, the sun rose and he recognized the opening of the trap, and he found great mourning in his house. Rabbi said: How great are the words of the Sages who said: If water has an end, his wife is permitted to remarry, if it does not have an end, his wife is forbidden.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, מַיִם שֶׁיֵּשׁ לָהֶם סוֹף נָמֵי, לֵיחוּשׁ לִמְחִילָּה שֶׁל דָּגִים! בְּמַיִם שֶׁיֵּשׁ לָהֶם סוֹף מְחִילָּה שֶׁל דָּגִים לָא שְׁכִיחָא.
human_translation: If so, a body of water with end, let us also be concerned about a cave containing a fish. A cave containing a fish is not common in a body of water with end.
llm_translation: If so, water that has a final depth, should be concerned for the swimming of fish! In water that has a final swimming depth for fish, it is not common.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: הָא דַּאֲמַרוּ רַבָּנַן מַיִם שֶׁאֵין לָהֶם סוֹף אִשְׁתּוֹ אֲסוּרָה — הָנֵי מִילֵּי בְּאִינִישׁ דְּעָלְמָא, אֲבָל צוּרְבָּא מֵרַבָּנַן — לָא. אִי דִּסְלֵיק — קָלָא אִית לֵיהּ. וְלָא הִיא: לָא שְׁנָא אִינִישׁ דְּעָלְמָא, וְלָא שְׁנָא צוּרְבָּא מֵרַבָּנַן, דִּיעֲבַד — אִין, לְכַתְּחִלָּה — לָא.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: That which the Sages said, an endless body of water, his wife is prohibited applies to an ordinary person But not a Torah scholar, if he would emerge publicity would be That is not so. It is no different an ordinary man and it is no different a Torah scholar. After the fact, yes, not ab initio .
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said: This that the Rabbis said, "Water that has no end, its wife is forbidden" - those words are applicable in matters of the world, but in matters of Torah scholars - no. If he becomes wealthy - he has a voice. And it is not so: It is not different whether in matters of the world or in matters of Torah scholars, if it happens - no, initially - no.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, אָמַר רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל: פַּעַם אַחַת הָיִיתִי מְהַלֵּךְ בִּסְפִינָה, וְרָאִיתִי סְפִינָה אַחַת שֶׁנִּשְׁבְּרָה. וְהָיִיתִי מִצְטַעֵר עַל תַּלְמִיד חָכָם שֶׁבָּהּ, וּמַנּוּ — רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא. וּכְשֶׁעָלִיתִי בַּיַּבָּשָׁה, בָּא וְיָשַׁב וְדָן לְפָנַי בַּהֲלָכָה. אָמַרְתִּי לוֹ: בְּנִי, מִי הֶעֶלְךָ? אָמַר לִי: דַּף שֶׁל סְפִינָה נִזְדַּמֵּן לִי, וְכׇל גַּל וְגַל שֶׁבָּא עָלַי — נִעְנַעְתִּי לוֹ רֹאשִׁי.
human_translation: It is taught Rabban Gamliel said: Once I was traveling on a boat, and I saw a boat that shattered And I was grieved over the Torah scholar who was on board. And who was it? Rabbi Akiva. But when I disembarked onto dry land, he came, and sat, and deliberated before me about halakha . I said to him: My son, who brought you up He said to me: A plank from the boat came to me, and I bent my head before each and every wave that came toward me.
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabban Gamliel said, "Once I was walking on a ship, and I saw one ship that had broken. I was distressed for the Torah scholar who was on it, and who was he? Rabbi Akiva. And when I ascended onto dry land, he came and sat and discussed halakha before me. I said to him, 'My son, who brought you up?' He said to me, 'A plank of the ship came to me, and every wave that came upon me, I shook my head at it.'"

hebrew_text: מִכָּאן אָמְרוּ חֲכָמִים: אִם יָבוֹאוּ רְשָׁעִים עַל אָדָם — יְנַעְנֵעַ לוֹ רֹאשׁוֹ. אָמַרְתִּי בְּאוֹתָהּ שָׁעָה: כַּמָּה גְּדוֹלִים דִּבְרֵי חֲכָמִים, שֶׁאָמְרוּ: מַיִם שֶׁיֵּשׁ לָהֶם סוֹף — מוּתֶּרֶת, מַיִם שֶׁאֵין לָהֶם סוֹף — אֲסוּרָה.
human_translation: From here the Sages stated: If wicked people come upon a person, he should bend his head before them. I said at that moment: How great are the words of the Sages, who said: a body of water with end, is permitted an endless body of water, is prohibited
llm_translation: From here the sages said: If wicked people come upon a person - he should nod his head to them. I said at that time: How great are the words of the sages, that they said: Water that has an end - is permissible, water that has no end - is forbidden.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: פַּעַם אַחַת הָיִיתִי מְהַלֵּךְ בִּסְפִינָה, וְרָאִיתִי סְפִינָה אַחַת שֶׁמִּטָּרֶפֶת בַּיָּם, וְהָיִיתִי מִצְטַעֵר עַל תַּלְמִיד חָכָם שֶׁבָּהּ, וּמַנּוּ — רַבִּי מֵאִיר. כְּשֶׁעָלִיתִי לִמְדִינַת קַפּוֹטְקְיָא, בָּא וְיָשַׁב וְדָן לְפָנַי בַּהֲלָכָה. אָמַרְתִּי לוֹ: בְּנִי, מִי הֶעֶלְךָ? אָמַר לִי: גַּל טְרָדַנִי לַחֲבֵרוֹ, וַחֲבֵרוֹ לַחֲבֵרוֹ, עַד שֶׁהֱקִיאַנִי לַיַּבָּשָׁה. אָמַרְתִּי בְּאוֹתָהּ שָׁעָה: כַּמָּה גְּדוֹלִים דִּבְרֵי חֲכָמִים, שֶׁאָמְרוּ: מַיִם שֶׁיֵּשׁ לָהֶם סוֹף — אִשְׁתּוֹ מוּתֶּרֶת, מַיִם שֶׁאֵין לָהֶם סוֹף — אִשְׁתּוֹ אֲסוּרָה.
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Akiva said: Once I was traveling on a boat, and I saw a certain boat sinking at sea, and I was grieved over the Torah scholar who was on board. And who was it? Rabbi Meir. But when I disembarked at the province of Cappadocia, he came, and sat, and deliberated before me about halakha . I said to him: My son, who brought you up He said to me: wave carried me to another, and that other to another, until cast me up onto dry land. I said at that moment: How great are the words of the Sages, who said: a body of water with end, his wife is permitted an endless body of water, his wife is prohibited
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Akiva said: Once I was walking on a ship, and I saw one ship that was being torn apart in the sea, and I was distressed for the Torah scholar who was on it, and his name was Rabbi Meir. When I arrived in the city of Capotkia, he came and sat and judged a halachic matter before me. I said to him: My son, who brought you up? He said to me: A wave tossed me to his friend, and his friend to his friend, until they vomited me onto dry land. At that moment, I said: How great are the words of the sages who said: Water that has an end — his wife is permissible, water that has no end — his wife is forbidden.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: נָפַל לְגוֹב אֲרָיוֹת — אֵין מְעִידִין עָלָיו. לַחֲפוּרָה מְלֵאָה נְחָשִׁים וְעַקְרַבִּים — מְעִידִין עָלָיו. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בְּתֵירָא אוֹמֵר: אַף לַחֲפוּרָה מְלֵאָה נְחָשִׁים וְעַקְרַבִּים אֵין מְעִידִין עָלָיו, חָיְישִׁינַן
human_translation: The Sages taught: fell into a lion’s den, one may not testify about him into a pit filled with snakes and scorpions, one may testify Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira says: Even into a pit filled with snakes and scorpions, one may not testify about him we are concerned
llm_translation: The sages taught: If one falls into a den of lions - we do not testify against him. If one falls into a pit full of snakes and scorpions - we testify against him. Rabbi Yehuda ben Betera says: Even if one falls into a pit full of snakes and scorpions, we do not testify against him, we are concerned.

hebrew_text: שֶׁמָּא חַבָּר הוּא. וְתַנָּא קַמָּא, אַגַּב אִיצְצָא מַזְּקִי לֵיהּ.
human_translation: perhaps he is a charmer [ ḥabbar ] And the first tanna as, due to the pressure they will harm him,
llm_translation: Perhaps he is a colleague. And it was taught in the first Tanna, regarding the case of a splinter, he would heal it.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: נָפַל לְתוֹךְ כִּבְשַׁן הָאֵשׁ — מְעִידִין עָלָיו. לְיוֹרָה מְלֵאָה יַיִן וָשֶׁמֶן — מְעִידִין עָלָיו. מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי אַחָא אָמְרוּ: שֶׁל שֶׁמֶן — מְעִידִין עָלָיו, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא מַבְעִיר. שֶׁל יַיִן — אֵין מְעִידִין עָלָיו, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא מְכַבֶּה. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: תְּחִלָּתוֹ מְכַבֶּה וְסוֹפוֹ מַבְעִיר.
human_translation: The Sages taught: fell into a blazing furnace, one may testify about him into cauldron filled wine or oil, one may testify about him In the name of Rabbi Aḥa, they said: of oil, one may testify about him because this ignites of wine, one may not testify about him because it extinguishes They said to him: At first it extinguishes but eventually it ignites
llm_translation: The sages taught: If one falls into a fiery furnace - they testify against him. If he pours a full jug of wine or oil - they testify against him. In the name of Rabbi Akha they said: Regarding oil - they testify against him, because it ignites. Regarding wine - they do not testify against him, because it extinguishes. They said to him: Its beginning extinguishes and its end ignites.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּאֶחָד שֶׁנָּפַל לַבּוֹר הַגָּדוֹל וְכוּ׳. תַּנְיָא, אָמְרוּ לוֹ לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר: אֵין מַזְכִּירִין מַעֲשֵׂה נִסִּים. מַאי מַעֲשֵׂה נִסִּים? אִילֵּימָא דְּלָא אֲכַל וְלָא אִישְׁתִּי — וְהָכְתִיב: ״וְצוּמוּ עָלַי וְאַל תֹּאכְלוּ וְאַל תִּשְׁתּוּ״.
human_translation: Rabbi Meir said: An incident involving a certain who fell into the Great Cistern is taught They said to Rabbi Meir: One does not mention miraculous acts What miraculous acts? If we say that he did not eat or drink but isn’t it written: “Fast for me, and neither eat nor drink
llm_translation: Rabbi Meir said: There was an incident with someone who fell into a large pit, etc. It was taught: They said to Rabbi Meir, "We do not mention miracles." What is considered a miracle? If he did not eat or drink — and it is written: "Fast for me, do not eat or drink."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא דְּלָא נָיֵים. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: שְׁבוּעָה שֶׁלֹּא אִישַׁן שְׁלֹשָׁה יָמִים — מַלְקִין אוֹתוֹ, וְיִישַׁן לְאַלְתַּר.
human_translation: Rather, that he did not sleep as Rabbi Yoḥanan said: an oath that I will not sleep for three days, flogs him and he may sleep immediately
llm_translation: Rather, it is not pleasing. For Rabbi Yochanan said: A week that one does not sleep for three days - they flog him, and he should sleep immediately.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי מֵאִיר מַאי טַעְמָא? אָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא: כִּיפִּין עַל גַּב כִּיפִּין הֲווֹ. וְרַבָּנַן — דְּשֵׁישָׁא הֲווֹ. וְרַבִּי מֵאִיר: אִי אֶפְשָׁר דְּלָא מְסָרֵיךְ וְנָיֵים פּוּרְתָּא.
human_translation: And Rabbi Meir, what is the reason Rav Kahana said: There were arches on top of arches And the Rabbis they were of marble And Rabbi Meir it is inconceivable that he didn’t grasp and sleep a little,
llm_translation: Rabbi Meir, what is the reason? Rav Kahana said: "Like caps upon caps they were." And the Rabbis - they were of fine linen. And Rabbi Meir said: "It is impossible that they did not hand you over, and you slept soundly."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּבִתּוֹ שֶׁל נְחוּנְיָא חוֹפֵר שִׁיחִין שֶׁנָּפְלָה לְבוֹר הַגָּדוֹל, וּבָאוּ וְהוֹדִיעוּ לְרַבִּי חֲנִינָא בֶּן דּוֹסָא. שָׁעָה רִאשׁוֹנָה, אָמַר לָהֶם: שָׁלוֹם. שְׁנִיָּה, אָמַר לָהֶם: שָׁלוֹם. שְׁלִישִׁית, אָמַר לָהֶם: עָלְתָה.
human_translation: The Sages taught: An incident involving the daughter of Neḥunya the well digger, who fell into the Great Cistern, and they came and notified Rabbi Ḥanina ben Dosa the first hour, he said to them: peace the second he said to them: peace. the third he said to them: She has ascended
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: There was an incident involving the daughter of Nechunya who was digging pits when she fell into a large pit. They came and informed Rabbi Chanina ben Dosa. The first hour, he said to them: Peace. The second hour, he said to them: Peace. The third hour, he said to them: She has ascended.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָהּ: בִּתִּי, מִי הֶעֱלֵךְ? אָמְרָה לוֹ: זָכָר שֶׁל רְחֵלִים נִזְדַּמֵּן לִי, וְזָקֵן מַנְהִיגוֹ. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: נָבִיא אַתָּה? אָמַר לָהֶם: ״לֹא נָבִיא אָנֹכִי וְלֹא בֶּן נָבִיא אָנֹכִי״, אֶלָּא: דָּבָר שֶׁהַצַּדִּיק מִתְעַסֵּק בּוֹ — יִכָּשֵׁל בּוֹ זַרְעוֹ?
human_translation: he said to her: My daughter, who pulled you up She said to him: A male sheep, happened by me and an old man leading him They said Are you a prophet He said to them, “I am not a prophet, nor the son of a prophet am I” Rather, the endeavor that the righteous is engaged his offspring would stumble upon
llm_translation: He said to her: My daughter, who brought you up? She said to him: A male descendant of Rachel appeared to me, and an elderly man led him. They said to him: Are you a prophet? He said to them: "I am not a prophet, nor am I the son of a prophet," but rather: a matter in which the righteous engage, his seed will stumble in it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא: אַף עַל פִּי כֵן מֵת בְּנוֹ בַּצָּמָא, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּסְבִיבָיו נִשְׂעֲרָה מְאֹד״, מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא מְדַקְדֵּק עִם סְבִיבָיו כְּחוּט הַשַּׂעֲרָה. רַבִּי חֲנִינָא אָמַר, מֵהָכָא: ״אֵל נַעֲרָץ בְּסוֹד קְדוֹשִׁים רַבָּה וְנוֹרָא עַל כׇּל סְבִיבָיו״.
human_translation: Rabbi Abba said: Even so, the son died of thirst, as is stated: “And around Him it storms [ nisara ] mightily” which teaches that the Holy One, Blessed be He, is exacting with His surroundings, up to a hairsbreadth [ sa’ara ], Rabbi Ḥanina said: from here: “A God dreaded in the great council of the holy ones, and feared by all that are about Him”
llm_translation: Rabbi Abba said: Even so, his son died of thirst, as it is stated: "And all around him it is exceedingly clear," teaching that the Holy One, blessed be He, is meticulous with those around Him as with the hair of the head. Rabbi Chanina said from here: "God is greatly exalted in the council of the holy ones, awesome over all who surround Him."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אֲפִילּוּ שָׁמַע מִן הַנָּשִׁים אוֹמְרוֹת ״מֵת אִישׁ פְּלוֹנִי״ — דַּיּוֹ. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אֲפִילּוּ שָׁמַע מִן הַתִּינוֹקוֹת אוֹמְרִים ״הֲרֵי אָנוּ הוֹלְכִין לִסְפּוֹד וְלִקְבּוֹר אֶת אִישׁ פְּלוֹנִי״. בֵּין שֶׁהוּא מִתְכַּוֵּין, וּבֵין שֶׁאֵינוֹ מִתְכַּוֵּין.
human_translation: Even heard from the women, saying: So-and-so died, this is sufficient Rabbi Yehuda says: Even if one heard from the children, saying: We are going to eulogize and bury so-and-so, whether intends or whether he does not intend
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: Even if one hears from women saying, "So-and-so man has died," it is sufficient. Rabbi Yehuda says: Even if one hears from children saying, "Behold, we are going to mourn and bury so-and-so man." Whether he intends or does not intend.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בָּבָא אוֹמֵר: בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁהוּא מִתְכַּוֵּין, וּבְגוֹי אִם הָיָה מִתְכַּוֵּין — אֵין עֵדוּתוֹ עֵדוּת.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda ben Bava says: With regard to a Jew even if he intends with regard to a gentile, if he intended his testimony is not testimony.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda ben Bava says: In Israel, even though he intends, and in a gentile, if he intended - his testimony is not testimony.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וְדִלְמָא לָא אָזְלִי? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל, דְּקָאָמְרִי: ״הָרֵינוּ בָּאִין מִלִּסְפּוֹד וּמִלִּקְבּוֹר אֶת אִישׁ פְּלוֹנִי״.
human_translation: Perhaps they will not go; Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: where say: We are coming from eulogizing and burying so-and-so.
llm_translation: Gemara: And perhaps they did not go? Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel, as they say: "Behold, we are coming from measuring and burying a certain man."

hebrew_text: וְדִלְמָא קַמְצָא בְּעָלְמָא שְׁכֵיב לֵיהּ וְאַסִּיקוּ לֵיהּ עַל שְׁמֵיהּ! דְּקָאָמְרִי: כֵּן וְכֵן רַבָּנַן הֲווֹ הָתָם. כֵּן וְכֵן סַפְדָנֵי הֲווֹ הָתָם.
human_translation: perhaps it was merely a grasshopper that died, and they brought it out by name of where the children say: Such and such rabbis were there; such and such eulogizers were there,
llm_translation: And perhaps a mere straw in the world would lie upon him, and they would excommunicate him in his name! For they say: So too the Rabbis were there. So too the eulogizers were there.

hebrew_text: וּבְגוֹי, אִם הָיָה מִתְכַּוֵּין וְכוּ׳. אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא שֶׁנִּתְכַּוֵּין לְהַתִּיר, אֲבָל נִתְכַּוֵּין לְהָעִיד — עֵדוּתוֹ עֵדוּת. הֵיכִי יָדְעִינַן? אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: בָּא לְבֵית דִּין וְאָמַר: ״אִישׁ פְּלוֹנִי מֵת, הַשִּׂיאוּ אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ״ — זֶהוּ נִתְכַּוֵּין לְהַתִּיר. ״מֵת״ סְתָם — זֶהוּ נִתְכַּוֵּין לְעֵדוּת.
human_translation: With regard to a gentile, if he intended Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: They taught only where he intended to permit but he intended to testify his testimony is testimony. How do we know Rav Yosef said: he came to the court and said: So-and-so died, allow his wife to marry, this is intending to permit He died, this is intending to testify.
llm_translation: In a non-Jewish court, if he intended, etc. Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: They only taught this when he intended to permit, but if he intended to testify - his testimony is testimony. How do we know? Rav Yosef said: If he comes to the court and says, "So-and-so has died, bring his wife" - this is intending to permit. "He has died" without specification - this is intending to testify.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר נָמֵי, אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא שֶׁנִּתְכַּוֵּין לְהַתִּיר, אֲבָל נִתְכַּוֵּין לְהָעִיד — עֵדוּתוֹ עֵדוּת. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: לֹא כָּךְ הָיָה מַעֲשֶׂה בְּאוֹשַׁעְיָא בְּרַבִּי, שֶׁהִתִּירָם עִם שְׁמֹנִים וַחֲמִשָּׁה זְקֵנִים. אָמַר לָהֶם: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא שֶׁנִּתְכַּוֵּין לְהַתִּיר, אֲבָל נִתְכַּוֵּין לְהָעִיד — עֵדוּתוֹ עֵדוּת. וְלֹא הוֹדוּ לוֹ חֲכָמִים.
human_translation: was also stated Reish Lakish said: They taught only when one intended to permit but if he intended to testify his testimony is testimony. Rabbi Yoḥanan said to him: Didn’t such an incident occur involving Oshaya the Distinguished, who permitted with eighty-five Elders? He said to They taught only when he intended to permit but if he intended to testify his testimony is testimony. But the Rabbis did not concur with him
llm_translation: It was stated similarly, Reish Lakish said: They only taught that when one intends to permit, but if one intends to testify - his testimony is testimony. Rabbi Yochanan said to him: This was not the case with the incident in Osha'aya, the son of Rabbi, where he permitted them with eighty-five elders. He said to them: They only taught that when one intends to permit, but if one intends to testify - his testimony is testimony. And the Sages did not acknowledge him.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מַתְנִיתִין דְּקָתָנֵי: וּבְגוֹי, אִם הָיָה מִתְכַּוֵּין — אֵין עֵדוּתוֹ עֵדוּת, הֵיכִי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ? בְּמֵסִיחַ לְפִי תּוּמּוֹ. כִּי הָהוּא דַּהֲוָה קָאָמַר וְאָזֵיל: ״מַאן אִיכָּא בֵּי חִיוַּאי, מַאן אִיכָּא בֵּי חִיוַּאי, שְׁכֵיב חִיוַּאי״, וְאַנְסְבַהּ רַב יוֹסֵף לִדְבֵיתְהוּ. הָהוּא דַּהֲוָה קָאָמַר וְאָזֵיל: ״וַוי לֵיהּ לְפָרָשָׁא זְרִיזָא דַּהֲוָה בְּפוּמְבְּדִיתָא דִּשְׁכֵיב״, וְאַנְסְבַהּ רַב יוֹסֵף, וְאִיתֵּימָא רָבָא, לִדְבֵיתְהוּ.
human_translation: But, that is taught the mishna: With regard to a gentile, if he intended his testimony is not testimony, How can you find when he speaks offhandedly, Like that who was going around saying: Who is the house of Ḥivvai; who is the house of Ḥivvai? Ḥivvai has died. And Rav Yosef allowed wife to marry. a certain who was going around saying: Alas for the brave horseman who was in Pumbedita, for he is dead. And Rav Yosef, and some say Rava, allowed his wife to marry.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rather, it is taught in a Mishnah: And in the case of a gentile, if he intended — his testimony is not testimony, how can you find it? By way of his own words. For that one who was standing and going said: "Who is from the house of Chiyya, who is from the house of Chiyya, Chiyya is lying down," and Rav Yosef forced him to his house. That one who was standing and going said: "Woe to the swift horseman who is in the mouth of the lying one," and Rav Yosef forced him, and Rava agreed, to his house.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא דַּהֲוָה קָאָמַר וְאָזֵיל: ״מַאן אִיכָּא בֵּי חָסָא, טְבַע חָסָא״. אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: הָאֱלֹקִים! אֲכַלוּ כְּווֹרֵי לְחָסָא מִדִּיבּוּרֵיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן. אֲזַלָא דְּבֵיתְהוּ דְחָסָא וְאִינַּסְבָא, וְלָא אֲמַרוּ לָהּ וְלָא מִידֵּי. אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ, הָא דַּאֲמוּר רַבָּנַן מַיִם שֶׁאֵין לָהֶם סוֹף אִשְׁתּוֹ אֲסוּרָה, הָנֵי מִילֵּי לְכַתְּחִלָּה, אֲבָל אִי נָסֵיב — לָא מַפְּקִינַן לַהּ מִינֵּיהּ.
human_translation: a certain who was going around saying: Who is the house of Ḥasa? Ḥasa has drowned. Rav Naḥman said: By God! The fish have eaten Ḥasa. Due to Rav Naḥman’s statement, Ḥasa’s wife went and married, and no one said anything to her Rav Ashi said: Learn from this That which the Sages said, an endless body of water, his wife is prohibited this applies ab initio , but if married we do not take her away from him.
llm_translation: That one who was standing and going said: "Who is in the house of Hasa, immerse in Hasa." Rav Nachman said: "God! They fulfilled the words of Rav Nachman." The wife of Hasa went and became engaged, and they did not say to her and not from her. Rav Ashe said: Learn from this, that which the Rabbis said, water that has no end, its woman is forbidden, those words are initially, but if she gets married, we do not remove her from her kind.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי, אַנְסְבַהּ רַב נַחְמָן לִדְבֵיתְהוּ, אֲמַר: חָסָא גַּבְרָא רַבָּה אִיתֵיהּ, אִם אִיתָא דִּסְלֵיק — קָלָא אִית לֵיהּ לְמִילְּתָא. וְלָא הִיא: לָא שְׁנָא גַּבְרָא רַבָּה, לָא שְׁנָא לָאו גַּבְרָא רַבָּה — דִּיעֲבַד אִין, לְכַתְּחִלָּה לָא.
human_translation: There are who say Rav Naḥman allowed his wife to marry. He said: Ḥasa is a great man; if it was so that he emerged the incident would have generated publicity. That is not so. It is not different a great man is not different not a great man. after the fact, yes, not ab initio .
llm_translation: There are some who say, Rav Nachman married off his daughter, he said: A great man has come, if he is worthy to ascend - there is a voice for the matter. And it is not: whether a great man or not a great man - it will happen, but ideally not.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא גּוֹי דַּהֲוָה קָאָמַר לֵיהּ לְיִשְׂרָאֵל: קְטוֹל אַסְפַּסְתָּא וּשְׁדִי לְחֵיוָ[תַ]אי בְּשַׁבְּתָא, וְאִי לָא — קָטֵילְנָא לָךְ כְּדִקְטֵילְנָא לִפְלוֹנִי בַּר יִשְׂרָאֵל, דַּאֲמַרִי לֵיהּ: בַּשֵּׁיל לִי קְדֵירָה בְּשַׁבָּת, וְלָא בַּשֵּׁיל לִי, וּקְטֵילְתֵּיהּ. שְׁמַעָה דְּבֵיתְהוּ, וַאֲתַאי לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּאַבָּיֵי. (שְׁהֵיתָא)
human_translation: a certain gentile said to a Jew: Harvest the fodder and give it to my animals on Shabbat, and if not, I will kill you like I killed so-and-so the Jew, for I said to him: Cook me a pot on Shabbat, and he didn’t cook for me, so I killed him. The wife heard and came before Abaye He deferred her
llm_translation: That non-Jew who was saying to a Jew: "Cut the spleen and heal the liver of your animal on Shabbat, and if not - I will kill you as I would kill so-and-so son of Israel," for they say to him: "Cook a pot for me on Shabbat," and he did not cook for him, and he killed him. The news reached his household, and they came before Abaye. (Sheheta)

hebrew_text: תְּלָתָא רִיגְלֵי. אֲמַר לַהּ רַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה: זִיל לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב יוֹסֵף, דְּחָרִיף סַכִּינֵאּ.
human_translation: three Festivals, Rav Adda bar Ahava said to her: Go before Rav Yosef, whose knife is sharp,
llm_translation: Three feet. Rav Adda bar Ahava said to her: Go before Rav Yosef, who is sharp with his knife.

hebrew_text: אֲזַלָה קַמֵּיהּ. פְּשַׁט מֵהָא מַתְנִיתִין: גּוֹי שֶׁהָיָה מוֹכֵר פֵּירוֹת בַּשּׁוּק, וְאָמַר: ״פֵּירוֹת הַלָּלוּ שֶׁל עׇרְלָה הֵן״ ״שֶׁל עֲזֵיקָה הֵן״, ״שֶׁל נֶטַע רְבָעִי הֵן״ — לֹא אָמַר כְּלוּם, לֹא נִתְכַּוֵּון אֶלָּא לְהַשְׁבִּיחַ מִקָּחוֹ.
human_translation: She went before him he resolved based on this baraita : a gentile who was selling fruit at the market and said: These fruits are from the first three years of the tree’s growth [ orla ]; they are from Azeka, are fourth-year produce, he said nothing he intended only to enhance his goods,
llm_translation: He went before him. He explained from this Mishnah: A non-Jew who was selling his fruits in the market, and he said: "These fruits are from uncircumcised trees," "they are from a planted tree within three years," "they are from a fourth-year planting" — he did not say anything, he did not intend anything except to deceive with his sale.

hebrew_text: אַבָּא יוּדָן אִישׁ צַיְידָן אָמַר: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל וְגוֹי שֶׁהָלְכוּ בַּדֶּרֶךְ, וּבָא גּוֹי וְאָמַר: ״חֲבָל עַל יְהוּדִי שֶׁהָיָה עִמִּי בַּדֶּרֶךְ שֶׁמֵּת בַּדֶּרֶךְ, וּקְבַרְתִּיו״, וְהִשִּׂיאוּ אִשְׁתּוֹ.
human_translation: Abba Yudan of Sidon said: An incident involving a Jew and a gentile who traveled on the road, and the gentile came and said: Alas for the Jew who was with me on the road, for he died, and I buried him. And allowed his wife to marry.
llm_translation: Abba Yudan, a man from Tzaydan, said: There was an incident involving a Jew and a gentile who were traveling on the road, and a gentile came and said, "Woe to the Jew who was with me on the road and died on the road, and I buried him," and they brought his wife.

hebrew_text: וְשׁוּב מַעֲשֶׂה בְּקוֹלָר שֶׁל בְּנֵי אָדָם, שֶׁהָיוּ מְהַלְּכִין לְאַנְטוֹכְיָא, וּבָא גּוֹי אֶחָד וְאָמַר: ״חֲבָל עַל קוֹלָר שֶׁל בְּנֵי אָדָם שֶׁמֵּתוּ, וּקְבַרְתִּים״, וְהִשִּׂיאוּ אֶת נְשׁוֹתֵיהֶם. וְשׁוּב מַעֲשֶׂה בְּשִׁשִּׁים בְּנֵי אָדָם שֶׁהָיוּ מְהַלְּכִין לְכַרְכּוֹם בֵּיתֵּר, וּבָא גּוֹי וְאָמַר: ״חֲבָל עַל שִׁשִּׁים בְּנֵי אָדָם שֶׁהָיוּ מְהַלְּכִין בְּדֶרֶךְ בֵּיתֵּר שֶׁמֵּתוּ, וּקְבַרְתִּים״ וְהִשִּׂיאוּ אֶת נְשׁוֹתֵיהֶם.
human_translation: And another incident involving people who with a collar [ kolar ] were walking to Antokhya. And a certain gentile came and said: Alas for the collared people, for they died, and I buried them. And allowed their wives to marry. And another incident involving sixty people who were walking to the siege [ karkom ] of Beitar, and a gentile came and said: Alas for those sixty people who were walking on the road Beitar, for they died, and I buried them. And allowed their wives to marry.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And there was another incident involving the collar of human beings, who were walking to Antioch, and a gentile came and said, "Woe to the collar of human beings who have died, and I buried them," and he caused their wives to become forbidden to their husbands. And there was another incident involving sixty human beings who were walking to Karkom Beit Ter, and a gentile came and said, "Woe to the sixty human beings who were walking on the path of Beit Ter who have died, and I buried them," and he caused their wives to become forbidden to their husbands.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מְעִידִין לְאוֹר הַנֵּר וּלְאוֹר הַלְּבָנָה, וּמַשִּׂיאִין עַל פִּי בַּת קוֹל. מַעֲשֶׂה בְּאֶחָד שֶׁעָמַד עַל רֹאשׁ הָהָר וְאָמַר: ״אִישׁ פְּלוֹנִי בֶּן פְּלוֹנִי מִמָּקוֹם פְּלוֹנִי מֵת״. הָלְכוּ וְלֹא מָצְאוּ שָׁם אָדָם, וְהִשִּׂיאוּ אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ.
human_translation: may testify by candlelight or by moonlight. And may allow to marry based on a disembodied voice an incident with regard to a certain who stood at the top of a mountain and said: So-and-so, son of so-and-so, from such and such a place died. They went and found no person there, but they allowed the wife of to marry.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: We testify regarding the light of the candle and the light of the moon, and we raise an objection based on a heavenly voice. There was an incident involving someone who stood on top of a mountain and declared: "So-and-so, son of so-and-so, from such-and-such a place, has died." They went but did not find anyone there, and they brought his wife.

hebrew_text: וְשׁוּב מַעֲשֶׂה בְּצַלְמוֹן, בְּאֶחָד שֶׁאָמַר: ״אֲנִי אִישׁ פְּלוֹנִי בֶּן אִישׁ פְּלוֹנִי, נְשָׁכַנִי נָחָשׁ וַהֲרֵי אֲנִי מֵת״. וְהָלְכוּ וְלֹא הִכִּירוּהוּ, וְהָלְכוּ וְהִשִּׂיאוּ אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ.
human_translation: another incident in Tzalmon, where a particular said: I am so-and-so, son of so-and-so. A snake bit me and I am dying. And they went but could not recognize him, they went and allowed his wife to marry
llm_translation: And there was an incident in Tzalmon, where one said: "I am so-and-so, son of so-and-so, a snake bit me and behold, I am dead." And they went and did not recognize him, and they went and married his wife.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר שְׁמוּאֵל: תָּנָא, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: אֵין מַשִּׂיאִין עַל פִּי בַּת קוֹל. וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: מַשִּׂיאִין עַל פִּי בַּת קוֹל. מַאי קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן, מַתְנִיתִין הִיא! הָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּאִי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ סְתָמָא דְּאֵין מַשִּׂיאִין — בֵּית שַׁמַּאי הִיא.
human_translation: Rabba bar Shmuel said: taught Beit Shammai say: may not allow to marry based on a disembodied voice; And Beit Hillel say: may allow to marry based on a disembodied voice. What is teaching us This is our mishna, teaches us this: That if an anonymous is found that may not allow to marry it is Beit Shammai,
llm_translation: Gemara: Rabba bar Shmuel said: It was taught: Beit Shammai say: We do not rely on a heavenly voice. And Beit Hillel say: We do rely on a heavenly voice. What does this teach us? It is a Mishnah! This teaches us that if you forget the conclusion, that we do not rely on a heavenly voice - it is Beit Shammai.

hebrew_text: וְהָלְכוּ וְלֹא מָצְאוּ. וְדִלְמָא שֵׁד הֲוָה? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: שֶׁרָאוּ לוֹ דְּמוּת אָדָם. אִינְהוּ נָמֵי דָּמוּ! דַּחֲזוֹ לֵיהּ בָּבוּאָה.
human_translation: they went and found no Perhaps it was a demon. Rav Yehuda said Rav said: They saw that he had the form of a person, They, also appear similar They saw that he had a shadow.
llm_translation: They went and did not find. And perhaps it was a demon? Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: They saw that it had the form of a man. They are also like his blood! They saw it in the entrance.

hebrew_text: וְאִינְהוּ נָמֵי אִית לְהוּ בָּבוּאָה! דַּחֲזוֹ לֵיהּ בָּבוּאָה דְבָבוּאָה. וְדִלְמָא לְדִידְהוּ אִית לְהוּ בָּבוּאָה דְבָבוּאָה. אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא, אָמַר לִי יוֹנָתָן שֵׁידָא: בָּבוּאָה — אִית לְהוּ, בָּבוּאָה דְבָבוּאָה — לֵית לְהוּ.
human_translation: But they also have a shadow. where they saw that he had a shadow of a shadow. But perhaps they also have a shadow of a shadow? Rabbi Ḥanina said: Yonatan the demon said to me: They have a shadow, they do not have a shadow of a shadow.
llm_translation: They indeed have a gate! They saw for it a gate of a gate. And perhaps for themselves they have a gate of a gate. Rabbi Chanina said, Yonatan the demon told me: a gate - they have, a gate of a gate - they do not have.

hebrew_text: וְדִלְמָא צָרָה הֲוַאי? תָּנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: בִּשְׁעַת הַסַּכָּנָה כּוֹתְבִין וְנוֹתְנִין, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין מַכִּירִין.
human_translation: And perhaps it was a rival The school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: During a period of danger, one may write and give although do not know
llm_translation: "And perhaps it is a danger? It was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael: During a time of danger, one may write and give a document, even though they do not recognize the signatures."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אָמַר רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: כְּשֶׁיָּרַדְתִּי לִנְהַרְדְּעָא לְעַבֵּר הַשָּׁנָה, מְצָאַנִי נְחֶמְיָה אִישׁ בֵּית דְּלִי, אָמַר לִי: שָׁמַעְתִּי שֶׁאֵין מַשִּׂיאִין אֶת הָאִשָּׁה בְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל עַל פִּי עֵד אֶחָד אֶלָּא יְהוּדָה בֶּן בָּבָא. וְנוּמֵּיתִי לוֹ: כֵּן הַדְּבָרִים. אָמַר לִי, אֱמוֹר לָהֶם מִשְּׁמִי: אַתֶּם יוֹדְעִים שֶׁהַמְּדִינָה מְשׁוּבֶּשֶׁת בִּגְיָיסוֹת, מְקוּבְּלַנִי מֵרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל הַזָּקֵן שֶׁמַּשִּׂיאִין אֶת הָאִשָּׁה עַל פִּי עֵד אֶחָד.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva said: When I descended to Neharde’a, to intercalate the year, I found Neḥemya of Beit D’li. He said to me: I heard that in Eretz Yisrael do not allow a woman to remarry based on a single witness, except for Yehuda ben Bava. And I told him: That is so. He said to me: Tell in my name: You know that the country is confounded by troops, I received this tradition from Rabban Gamliel the Elder, that may allow a woman to remarry based on a single witness.
llm_translation: The Mishnah: Rabbi Akiva said: When I descended to Nehardea to cross over for the New Year, Nehemiah the man of Beit Dili found me. He said to me: I heard that they do not marry off a woman in the land of Israel based on the testimony of just one witness, except for Judah ben Bava. And I confirmed to him: So it is. He said to me, "Tell them in my name: You know that the government is corrupt with its decrees. I have received this tradition from Rabban Gamliel the Elder, that they marry off a woman based on the testimony of just one witness."

hebrew_text: וּכְשֶׁבָּאתִי וְהִרְצֵיתִי הַדְּבָרִים לִפְנֵי רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, שָׂמַח לִדְבָרַי, וְאָמַר: מָצָאנוּ חָבֵר לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בָּבָא.
human_translation: And when I came and presented the matter before Rabban Gamliel he rejoiced at my words and said: We have found a companion with Rabbi Yehuda ben Bava,
llm_translation: And when I came and presented the matter before Rabban Gamliel, he was pleased with my words, and he said: "We have found a colleague for Rabbi Yehuda ben Bava."

hebrew_text: מִתּוֹךְ הַדָּבָר, נִזְכַּר רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל שֶׁנֶּהֶרְגוּ הֲרוּגִים בְּתֵל אַרְזָא, וְהִשִּׂיא רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל נְשׁוֹתֵיהֶן עַל פִּי עֵד אֶחָד. וְהוּחְזְקוּ לִהְיוֹת מַשִּׂיאִין עֵד מִפִּי עֵד, מִפִּי עֶבֶד, מִפִּי אִשָּׁה, מִפִּי שִׁפְחָה. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמְרִים: אֵין מַשִּׂיאִין אֶת הָאִשָּׁה עַל פִּי עֵד אֶחָד. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: לֹא עַל פִּי אִשָּׁה, וְלֹא עַל פִּי עֶבֶד, וְלֹא עַל פִּי שִׁפְחָה, וְלֹא עַל פִּי קְרוֹבִים.
human_translation: As a result of this event, Rabban Gamliel remembered that people were murdered in Tel Arza, and Rabban Gamliel allowed their wives to remarry based on one witness. And they established to allow to remarry based on hearsay testimony, a slave’s testimony, a woman’s testimony, a maidservant’s testimony. Rabbi Eliezer and Rabbi Yehoshua say: may not allow a woman to remarry based on one witness. Rabbi Akiva says: not based on a woman, nor based on a slave, nor based on a maidservant, nor based on close relatives.
llm_translation: In the midst of the matter, Rabban Gamliel was mentioned, whose wives were taken to be married based on the testimony of one witness. And they were deemed fit to be married based on the testimony of one witness, whether it be the testimony of a man, a slave, a woman, or a maidservant. Rabbi Eliezer and Rabbi Yehoshua say: A woman should not be taken to be married based on the testimony of one witness. Rabbi Akiva says: Not based on the testimony of a woman, not based on the testimony of a slave, not based on the testimony of a maidservant, and not based on the testimony of relatives.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וְסָבַר רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא עַל פִּי אִשָּׁה לָא? וְהָתַנְיָא, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: אִשָּׁה נֶאֱמֶנֶת לְהָבִיא גִּיטָּהּ מִקַּל וָחוֹמֶר; וּמָה נָשִׁים שֶׁאָמְרוּ חֲכָמִים אֵין נֶאֱמָנוֹת לוֹמַר ״מֵת בַּעְלָהּ״ — נֶאֱמָנוֹת לְהָבִיא גִּיטֵּיהֶן, זוֹ שֶׁנֶּאֱמֶנֶת לוֹמַר ״מֵת בַּעְלָהּ״ — אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁנֶּאֱמֶנֶת לְהָבִיא גִּיטָּהּ.
human_translation: Does Rabbi Akiva hold not based on woman’s testimony? But isn’t it taught Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says in the name of Rabbi Akiva: A woman is trusted to bring her bill of divorce based on a fortiori If women, whom the Sages said are not deemed credible to say husband died, are trusted to bring bills of divorce, is it not logical that this who is deemed credible to say her husband died, should be trusted to bring her bill of divorce?
llm_translation: Gemara: And Rabbi Akiva holds according to the opinion of a woman not? And it was taught, Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says in the name of Rabbi Akiva: A woman is believed to bring her divorce from a minor matter to a stringent matter; and what is the case with women that the Sages said they are not believed to say "her husband is dead" - they are believed to bring their divorces, this is the case of a woman who is believed to say "her husband is dead" - it is not the law that she is believed to bring her divorce.

hebrew_text: נָשִׁים שֶׁאָמְרוּ חֲכָמִים הוּא דְּלָא מְהֵימְנִי, אִשָּׁה בְּעָלְמָא — מְהֵימְנָא. לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן קוֹדֶם שֶׁהֶחֱזִיקוּ, כָּאן לְאַחַר שֶׁהֶחֱזִיקוּ.
human_translation: it is the women who the Sages mentioned who are not deemed credible. In general, a woman is deemed credible, This not difficult. Here, before they established There, after they established
llm_translation: Women who the sages said are not believed, a regular woman - she is believed. It is not difficult: here before they held, here after they held.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אָמְרוּ לוֹ: מַעֲשֶׂה בִּבְנֵי לֵוִי שֶׁהָלְכוּ לְצוֹעַר עִיר הַתְּמָרִים, וְחָלָה אֶחָד מֵהֶם, וֶהֱבִיאוּהוּ בְּפוּנְדָּק. וּבַחֲזָרָתָם אָמְרוּ לַפּוּנְדָּקִית: ״אַיֵּה חֲבֵרֵנוּ?״ נוּמֵּית לָהֶם: ״מֵת, וּקְבַרְתִּיו״, וְהִשִּׂיאוּ אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ. וְלֹא תְּהֵא כֹּהֶנֶת כְּפוּנְדָּקִית?
human_translation: They said to an incident occurred involving Levites who traveled to Tzoar, the city of date palms. And one of them became ill, and they brought him to an inn [ pundak ] Upon their return they said to the innkeeper, Where is our friend? She told them: He died, and I buried him. And they allowed his wife to remarry. And shouldn’t a priestess, be as an innkeeper?
llm_translation: They taught: They said to him: There was an incident with the sons of Levi who went to Tzoar, a city of palm trees, and one of them fell ill, and they brought him to Pundak. And upon their return, they said to the innkeeper, "Where is our companion?" She replied to them, "He died, and I buried him," and they brought his wife. And a priest's wife should not be like an innkeeper's wife.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהוּ: לִכְשֶׁתְּהֵא כְּפוּנְדָּקִית — נֶאֱמֶנֶת. הַפּוּנְדָּקִית הוֹצִיאָה לָהֶם מַקְלוֹ וְתַרְמִילוֹ וְסֵפֶר תּוֹרָה שֶׁהָיָה בְּיָדוֹ.
human_translation: said to them: When will be as the innkeeper, she shall be deemed credible. The innkeeper brought them his staff, and his bag, and the Torah scroll that was in his possession,
llm_translation: He said to them: When she is like a pundakita - she is trustworthy. The pundakita brought out for them his staff, bag, and Torah scroll that was in his hand.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי גְּרִיעוּתָא דְּפוּנְדָּקִית? אָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא: פּוּנְדָּקִית — גּוֹיָה הָיְתָה, וּמְסִיחָה לְפִי תּוּמָּה הָיְתָה: ״זֶה מַקְלוֹ, וְזֶה תַּרְמִילוֹ, וְזֶה קֶבֶר שֶׁקְּבַרְתִּיו בּוֹ״. וְכֵן תָּנֵי אַבָּא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב מִנְיוֹמֵי בַּר חִיָּיא: פּוּנְדָּקִית גּוֹיָה הָיְתָה, וּמְסִיחָה לְפִי תּוּמָּה הָיְתָה: ״זֶה מַקְלוֹ, וְזֶה תַּרְמִילוֹ, וְזֶה קֶבֶר שֶׁקְּבַרְתִּיו בּוֹ״.
human_translation: What unfavorable innkeeper Rav Kahana said: She was a gentile innkeeper, and she was speaking offhandedly this is his staff, and this is his bag, and this is the grave in which I buried him. And similarly, Abba, son of Rav Minyumi, son of Ḥiyya, taught: She was a gentile innkeeper, and she was speaking offhandedly, this is his staff, and this is his bag, and this is the grave in which I buried him.
llm_translation: Gemara: What is the significance of the term "Pundakita"? Rav Kahana said: Pundakita - she was a non-Jewish woman, and she would divert attention with her mouth. "This is his staff, and this is his pouch, and this is the grave in which I buried him." And similarly, Abba, son of Rav Minyomi Bar Chiya, taught: Pundakita was a non-Jewish woman, and she would divert attention with her mouth. "This is his staff, and this is his pouch, and this is the grave in which I buried him."

hebrew_text: וְהָא ״אַיֵּה חֲבֵרֵנוּ״ קָאָמְרִי לָהּ? כֵּיוָן דַּחֲזֵיתִינְהוּ, בָּכְיָא. אָמְרוּ לָהּ: ״אַיֵּה חֲבֵרֵנוּ?״ אָמְרָה לָהֶם: ״מֵת וּקְבַרְתִּיו״.
human_translation: But didn’t they say to her: Where is our friend? Once she saw them, she cried. They said to her: Where is our friend? she said to them: He died, and I buried him.
llm_translation: "And here 'Where is our friend' they were saying to her? Once they saw him, they wept. They said to her: 'Where is our friend?' She said to them: 'He is dead and buried.'"

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּאָדָם אֶחָד שֶׁבָּא לְהָעִיד עַל הָאִשָּׁה לִפְנֵי רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן. אָמַר לוֹ: ״בְּנִי, הֵיאַךְ אַתָּה יוֹדֵעַ בְּעֵדוּת אִשָּׁה זוֹ?״ אָמַר: ״אֲנִי וָהוּא הָיִינוּ הוֹלְכִים בַּדֶּרֶךְ, וְרָדַף אַחֲרֵינוּ גַּיִיס, וְנִתְלָה בְּיִיחוּר שֶׁל זַיִת וּפְשָׁחוֹ, וְהֶחְזִיר אֶת הַגַּיִיס לַאֲחוֹרָיו״.
human_translation: The Sages taught: An incident involving a certain who came to testify before Rabbi Tarfon with regard to a woman He said to him: My son, how do you come to know testimony this woman He said: He and I were traveling on the road and a troop chased after us. He hung onto an olive branch, and tore it off and forced the troop to withdraw.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: There was an incident involving a certain man who came to testify about a woman before Rabbi Tarfon. He said to him, "My son, how do you know the testimony of this woman?" He replied, "He and I were walking on the road, and a bandit pursued us, and he hid behind a rock of olives and revealed himself, and he returned the bandit behind him."

hebrew_text: ״אָמַרְתִּי לוֹ: ׳אַרְיֵה! יִישַׁר כֹּחֲךָ׳. אָמַר לִי: ׳מִנַּיִן אַתָּה יוֹדֵעַ שֶׁאַרְיֵה שְׁמִי? כָּךְ קוֹרִין אוֹתִי בְּעִירִי: יוֹחָנָן בְּרַבִּי יְהוֹנָתָן, אַרְיֵה דְּמִכְּפַר שִׁיחְיָא׳. לְיָמִים חָלָה וּמֵת.״ וְהִשִּׂיא רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ.
human_translation: I said to him, Lion [ arye ], may your strength continue to be firm. He said to me: From where do you know that my name is Arye? That is what they call me in my city: Yoḥanan, son of Rabbi Yehonatan, the lion from the village Shiḥayya. After a while, he fell sick and died, And Rabbi Tarfon allowed his wife to marry
llm_translation: I said to him: 'Aryeh! Your strength is upright.' He said to me: 'From where do you know that Aryeh is my name? Thus they call me in my city: Yochanan son of Rabbi Yehonatan, Aryeh from the village of Shichya.' After some days he fell ill and died." And Rabbi Tarfon married his wife.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי טַרְפוֹן לָא בָּעֵי דְּרִישָׁה וַחֲקִירָה? וְהָתַנְיָא: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּאָדָם אֶחָד שֶׁבָּא לִפְנֵי רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן לְהָעִיד עֵדוּת אִשָּׁה. אָמַר לוֹ: ״בְּנִי, הֵיאַךְ אַתָּה יוֹדֵעַ עֵדוּת זוֹ?״ אָמַר לוֹ: ״אֲנִי וָהוּא הָיִינוּ הוֹלְכִין בַּדֶּרֶךְ, וְרָדַף אַחֲרֵינוּ גַּיִיס, וְנִתְלָה בְּיִיחוּר תְּאֵנָה וּפְשָׁחוֹ. וְהֶחְזִיר אֶת הַגַּיִיס לַאֲחוֹרָיו. אָמַרְתִּי לוֹ: ׳יִישַׁר כֹּחֲךָ אַרְיֵה!׳ אָמַר לִי: ׳יָפֶה כִּוַּונְתָּ לִשְׁמִי, שֶׁכָּךְ קוֹרִין אוֹתִי בְּעִירִי: יוֹחָנָן בֶּן יוֹנָתָן אַרְיֵה דְּמִכְּפַר שִׁיחְיָא׳. לְיָמִים חָלָה וּמֵת״.
human_translation: But didn’t Rabbi Tarfon require inquiry and interrogation Isn’t it taught An incident involving a certain person who came before Rabbi Tarfon to present testimony a woman’s He said to him: My son, how do you know this testimony? He told him: He and I were traveling on the road and a troop chased after us. He hung onto a fig branch, and tore it off, and forced the troop to withdraw I said to him: May your strength continue to be firm, lion. He said to me: You have intuited my name well, for that is what they call me in my city: Yoḥanan, son of Yonatan, the lion from the village Shiḥayya. After a while, he fell sick and died.
llm_translation: Rabbi Tarfon does not require investigation and examination? And it was taught: There was an incident with a certain man who came before Rabbi Tarfon to testify as a witness for a woman. He said to him: "My son, how do you know this testimony?" He said to him: "I and he were walking on the road, and a bandit pursued us, and he hid in a fig tree and was pierced. And he returned the bandit behind him. I said to him: 'May your strength be straight like a lion!' He said to me: 'You have well intended for my name, for this is how they call me in my city: Yochanan ben Yonatan the lion from Kfar Shichya.' After some days he fell ill and died."

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ: ״לֹא כָּךְ אָמְרַתְּ לִי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן יוֹנָתָן דְּמִכְּפַר שִׁיחְיָא אַרְיֵה?״ אֲמַר לֵיהּ: ״לֹא, אֶלָּא כָּךְ אָמַרְתִּי לָךְ: יוֹחָנָן בֶּן יוֹנָתָן אַרְיֵה דְּמִכְּפַר שִׁיחְיָא״. וְדִקְדֵּק עָלָיו שְׁנַיִם וּשְׁלֹשָׁה פְּעָמִים, וְכִיוֵּן אֶת דְּבָרָיו, וְהִשִּׂיא רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ.
human_translation: said to him, Did you not tell me Yoḥanan, son of Yonatan, from the village Shiḥayya, Lion? He replied to him: No. Rather, this is what I told you: Yoḥanan, son of Yonatan, the lion from the village Shiḥayya. Then cross-examined him two or three times, and kept his statements consistent, so Rabbi Tarfon allowed his wife to marry.
llm_translation: He said to him: "Did you not say to me, Yochanan ben Yonatan from Kefar Shichya is a lion?" He said to him: "No, rather I said to you: Yochanan ben Yonatan is a lion from Kefar Shichya." And he repeated it two or three times, and clarified his words, and Rabbi Tarfon divorced his wife.

hebrew_text: תַּנָּאֵי הִיא. דְּתַנְיָא: אֵין בּוֹדְקִין עֵדֵי נָשִׁים בִּדְרִישָׁה וַחֲקִירָה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא. רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן אוֹמֵר: בּוֹדְקִין.
human_translation: This is tanna’im , as it is taught does not examine witnesses of women by means of inquiry and interrogation; the statement of Rabbi Akiva. Rabbi Tarfon says: examine
llm_translation: It is taught in a Baraita: One does not examine the witnesses of women through questioning and cross-examination, the words of Rabbi Akiva. Rabbi Tarfon says: One examines.

hebrew_text: וְקָמִיפַּלְגִי בִּדְרַבִּי חֲנִינָא. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: דְּבַר תּוֹרָה, אֶחָד דִּינֵי מָמוֹנוֹת וְאֶחָד דִּינֵי נְפָשׁוֹת בִּדְרִישָׁה וַחֲקִירָה. שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״מִשְׁפַּט אֶחָד יִהְיֶה לָכֶם״.
human_translation: And they disagree about Rabbi Ḥanina, as Rabbi Ḥanina said: By Torah law, both monetary law and capital law by means of inquiry and interrogation as is stated: “You shall have one law”
llm_translation: And there was a disagreement between Rabbi Chanina. For Rabbi Chanina said: Regarding a matter of Torah, whether it involves monetary matters or matters of life, the interpretation is through inquiry and investigation. As it is stated: "One law shall be for you."

hebrew_text: וּמָה טַעַם אָמְרוּ דִּינֵי מָמוֹנוֹת אֵין צְרִיכִין דְּרִישָׁה וַחֲקִירָה — שֶׁלֹּא תִּנְעוֹל דֶּלֶת בִּפְנֵי לֹוִין.
human_translation: And what reason did the Sages say that monetary law do not require inquiry and interrogation So as not to lock the door in the face of borrowers.
llm_translation: And what is the reason they said that monetary cases do not require investigation and inquiry? So that the door should not be locked before those who are in need.

hebrew_text: וּבְמַאי קָמִיפַּלְגִי — מָר סָבַר: כֵּיוָן דְּאִיכָּא כְּתוּבָּה לְמִשְׁקַל — כְּדִינֵי מָמוֹנוֹת דָּמֵי, וּמָר סָבַר: כֵּיוָן דְּקָא שָׁרֵינַן אֵשֶׁת אִישׁ לְעָלְמָא — כְּדִינֵי נְפָשׁוֹת דָּמֵי.
human_translation: And with regard to what do they disagree Sage, holds since there is the marriage contract to take it is considered like cases of monetary law And Sage, holds since, we permit married woman to the world, it is considered like capital law,
llm_translation: And with what do they argue? Master A thinks: since there is a written document to weigh - it is like the laws of monetary matters. And Master B thinks: since we permit a man's wife to the world - it is like the laws of life.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים מַרְבִּים שָׁלוֹם בָּעוֹלָם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְכׇל בָּנַיִךְ לִמּוּדֵי ה׳ וְרַב שְׁלוֹם בָּנָיִךְ״.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar said Rabbi Ḥanina said: Torah scholars increase peace in the world, as it is stated: “And all your children shall be taught of the Lord, and great shall be the peace of your children”
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said Rabbi Chanina: The students of the sages increase peace in the world, as it is stated: "And all your children shall be taught of the Lord, and great shall be the peace of your children."

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ הָאִשָּׁה בָּתְרָא וּסְלִיקָא לַהּ מַסֶּכֶת יְבָמוֹת
llm_translation: We will return to you, woman, later, and we will bring up for her Tractate Yevamot.
